description:
Mitchell's is probably my favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco. Note that every time I do go the line is always long af, but it is so worth the wait!

I've tried a lot of their flavors but my go tos are always grasshopper pie, halo halo, tropical four, and coconut pineapple. But honestly, all their flavors are hella good! The consistency of their ice cream is always perfect, soft and creamy and doesn't melt right away when you step outside!

Also, if you don't want to wait, they have pre packed half gallons (in the most popular flavors) ready for purchase. 

Parking in the area is kind of difficult if you don't get a spot in their back parking lot. I've always been lucky, but I've known people who have circled for a bit before getting a spot. 

I highly recommend Mitchell's if you're in the area craving ice cream or if it's you're first time visiting SF and need to get a dessert.
author: Stacey Y.

description:
Quick take: Unique flavors on the menu

Wow! Mitchell's has been around for 65 years!!! So awesome. We went on a random Thursday night after dinner. There is a small crowd. But it wasn't packed. A lot of people coming in and buying ice cream by the buckets.

Grab a number and wait your turn. I kept myself busy by purusing the menu and looking at the buckets of ice cream.

Horchata caught my attention immediately. Thai tea and pistachio. They let you sample stuff so don't be shy. All the ice cream is delicious. It's so hard to decide.

So good. Drop by and eat some yummy ice cream.
author: Nancy H.

description:
At 65 years young, Mitchell's Ice Cream is an SF institution and I came here for an after dinner treat.  From the outside, you'll see a lot of people standing around but don't get discouraged - the service is really fast. Get a number and you'll be served in no time. 

They have a ton of flavors available and I ordered a double in a cup. I had the "halo-halo" (Filipino shaved ice with tropical fruits) and horchata (Mexican rice drink) as my scoops. The ice cream was excellent.  They also offer pints as well as ice cream cake. Highly recommended!!!
author: Andrew S.

description:
I was told by my dear little brother about this ice cream parlor they frequent each time they are visiting the bay area.  He said I need to just go and try for myself. 

A small little spot with no sitting area inside and only two tables out front, exists this ice cream heaven in the city.   

I was told they make their ice cream in house and you will get more for your mulah if you buy by the quart or liter.  But we all wanted different flavors once we were able to sample everything we wanted to sample

We walked away with ube, mango, and strawberry  at $4 for a single scoop.  Not bad for the size.  Very smooth and rich with flavor.   I loved it!

A great snack before dinner or dessert after dinner.  I will definitely make this spot a must do now each time I am in the bay area!

Free parking at the back.  Can't wait to return!  Thanks lil bro!
author: Chel R.

description:
None of this is going to happen but, here's my wish list:

1. More places to sit down to enjoy the ice cream. 
2. Bigger parking lot. 
3. Cleaner surrounding area. 
4.  Soft serve options. 
5. No more price increases. 

My favorite is their dye-free pistachio. 
$4.15 for a single scoop. 
It was gone way too soon as I sat propped up against the building on a small brick window sill trying to avoid traffic coming out of the parking lot, and dealing with the elbow to elbow throngs of people clamoring for one of the two benches on a dirty sidewalk. 
Welcome to SF. 
Seriously good ice cream though. 
Worth the hassle?
author: Thomas D.

description:
Just plain I'll good ice cream. Be prepared to wait in line. There is always a line here. Through the years they have added more flavors and more after years of not coming here also have ventured into "different" flavors like one I tried : avacado.

Maybe they wanted to cash in on the Tom Brady diet. I did and I'm glad I did. While not an amazing flavor it is quite good.
author: David S.

description:
Mitchell's is one of the ice cream shops I was able to cross off my bucket list. Wait, don't you have a bucket list of ice cream shops?

Like most places in SF, parking is always an adventure. We must have circled the block half a dozen times til we found a semi-questionable parking space. Just be willing to walk for your dessert bc you likely won't be parking anywhere close to the shop. Heck, maybe make this a walking/Uber tour of ice cream shops in SF!

Now for the cream ;), for such a relatively small shop, Mitchell's has quite the selection of flavors. What I like about Mitchell's is they have standard flavors but they also have great tasting seasonal flavors. Mitchell's isn't crazy with those flavors either. It's not a hipster ice cream shops so you won't have a moss and bark flavored option. Rather you'll get options like cantaloupe (summer) and ginger spice (winter). With that I went with the Kahlua Mocha Cream (Kahlua liqueur, Colombian coffee and cocoa) and the French Custard Vanilla. Overall the rich smoothness made my stomach grumble in all the right ways.

So when you're completing your walking/Uber tour of San Francisco ice cream places, be sure to include Mitchell's. It's well worth the steps.
author: Stan W.

description:
So they don't really have a giant sign that tells you (or I missed it), but you have to actually go inside and grab a number to get your spot in line, not wait in the crowds of people seemingly just standing around outside and inside the shop.

I had the halo halo ice cream, and while I enjoy halo halo, the ice cream version of it wasn't all that special. The ice cream isn't really well made, and it tastes like the standard stuff that goes into most ice creams. The texture was kind of boring, the flavors were too straightforward, and overall I feel this place doesn't quite live up to its hype, especially with the line.
author: Tyler T.

description:
How have I never wrote a review about this place before?! This place is a staple if you have a sweet tooth and find yourself in the city! My family has been coming here long before I was born and I've been coming to this place for as long as I can remember. There are a variety of ice cream flavors and some are seasonal. Some flavors you just can't find anywhere such as cantaloupe (which is seasonal during the summer), ube (a Filipino dessert), and thai tea. They even do ice cream cakes, all of which can be custom made with any flavor of their ice creams. All the workers are friendly and efficient. Of course you can sample flavors of the ice cream before you commit to a scoop as well! 

PRO TIP: upon entering the facility go through the doors and to your immediate left you will need to pull a ticket in order to get a number and place in line. Once your number is called you and your party can be serviced. If you don't feel like waiting in line for single scoops of ice cream you can buy a half gallon tub and go to a separate side line on the right hand side and pay and go.
author: Franchesca B.

description: Stopped by on a Saturday afternoon, and thankfully the wait wasn't bad. I read that the line can take up to 15 minutes, but they move very fast- you take a number and once it's called out they take your order, make sure you're ready before they call you! Small shop, lots of cool flavors, it was hard to choose. I tried the coconut pineapple and my husband had the buko (baby coconut), both were delicious :)
author: Stephanie F.

description:
I love this place.  In a nice night expect a 15-30 minute wait for your number to be called.

I recommend any tropical flavor - my favorites are the purple Japanese yam and the mango.  Yum!!!!
author: Alison V.

description:
This place has been here since before Elvis was singing on stage. 
 Amazing. Delish. Vintage.  Love to reflect on the history while tasting some truly great ice cream.  They have crazy flavors, but I prefer standards like Strawberry, and it did not disappoint.
author: Matt G.

description:
Mitchell's has the feel of a hometown creamery. With always people around and plenty of workers behind the counter! Grab a number and you'll quickly be called. Try a few samples or stick with the basics. 

I like Mitchell's because of the traditional flavors but also the special ones sprinkled in. They bring out new flavors now and then and try to source with local ingredients. The ice cream is smooth and very creamy. Some of the flavors are subtle and not very overpowering which is nice though watch out if you like to pair flavors up as one could over power the other. Feel free to grab a half gallon to go and savor your ice cream at home. I definitely get the feel of this being more of a family oriented place (not that other ice cream joints aren't) because of the easy short term parking in front to allow parents to grab some ice cream on the go. 

While not a "hipster" place, the ube and Halo Halo flavors are certainly Instagram ready. =P
author: Liza X.

description: My cousin recommended that we go here before I left San Francisco, and it did not disappoint! One of the best chocolate ice creams I've ever had. Parking was easy and the line moved fast. 10/10 recommend if you're in the area!
author: Natalie S.

description:
Pull a number and wait or walk around instead of lining up. Line goes by fast. 
Try the flavors before committing to a cone or cup! 
Lots of fun flavors!
author: Christina T.

description: One of my favorite ice cream places in the area! I love how they have a variety of flavors and unique ones too. I enjoy sorbets and fruity flavors so if you do too, this is the spot for you! I have tried the pear sorbet and the cantaloupe ice cream and samples of the mango-guava sorbet and caramel praline. All were very good and unique! My favorite flavor here so far is the pear sorbet. It is super refreshing and yummy! I will definitely be back to try more of their flavors and hoping to try their ice cream cakes as well. Lines are alwaysss long, so be prepared to wait! They have a ticketing system which is nice, so you don't have to stand in line the whole time, but make sure you listen for your number! Parking is ok, they have a small parking lot, but wish it was bigger since they always have so many customers!
author: Bailey L.

description: This place serves so goood ice cream ! Must to go place now if I visit SF again.  Halo Halo ice cream and Ube flavor are so yummy ! The flavor is rich and you can really taste the fruits and ingredients. I had to get number and wait in line for 45 mins.  . It was worth it  !
author: Kelly L.

description:
OKAY BUT HOW CAN YOU NOT LOVE MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM?!

They let you try as many flavors as you want. There are so many delicious ones like the buko (baby coconut), their new flavor hazel dough, horchata, etc. Such a large array- and I'm always so excited here; like a kid in a candy store! But........ Ube is always the way to go for me!

Anyways- remember to get a number when you get here and wait to be called!
author: Melody W.

description: I like this spot.   Yea it's always crowded yea they're slow to fulfill your need for some delicious extra calories but , they're also the best ice cream around.   Good quality stuff.
author: Chris N.

description:
I hopped in here with high high high (did I say high) expectations. I had Mitchell's at other venues that carry their brand.

I ended up going with Hazel Dough and Grasshopper pie. They were decent but not amazing. I also tried the the Halo-halo and Ube.


So many good ice cream spots in the city. Here is my ranking but they are all pretty darn good.

Who doesn't love Chocolate and Ice Cream? (If you're raising your hand you can stop here ) 

I like making lists what can I say. I have lists for Ramen, Steakhouse/Brazilian , Milk Tea, Egg Tarts, Chicken & Waffles (super random list right). Give my profile a follow if you like them. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. Check out my latest reviews for my latest up to date Rankings. 

Rod's San Francisco Chocolate and Ice Cream shop Rankings: 
1 Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous
2 Marco Polo Gelato
3 Dandelion Chocolate
4 Polly Ann Ice Cream
5 salt and straw
6 Chocolate Covered
7 Smitten Ice Cream
8 Teuscher Chocolate 
9 Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream
10 Over the Moon
11 The Ice Cream Bar
12 Coletta Gelato
13 Cako Creamery
14 Bi-Rite Creamery
15 San Francisco's Hometown Creamery 
16 Miyako Old Fashioned Ice Cream
17 Mitchells Ice cream
18 St. Francis Fountain
19 Z Cioccolato
20 Joe's Ice Cream
21 Christopher Elbow Artisanal Chocolate
22 The Baked Bear- Custom Ice Cream Sandwiches
23 Recchiuti Confections 
24 Poco Dolce Chocolates
author: Rod M.

description: They use plastic spoons for sampling. Out of all the ice cream shops I've visited in the West Coast, Mitchell's was the first one that didn't have metal spoons for sampling. I am not a fan of plastic consumption and am disappointed in their lack of concern for the environment. That sets off my ice cream experience to a bad start and makes the ice cream taste bad.
author: Korrie K.

description:
I'm getting the sense that Mitchell's is one of those San Francisco Must-Visit ice cream places. I was told by my roommate to come here when I first moved in, and I definitely didn't regret it!

As everyone will tell you, they have tons of unique flavors, and they do flavors that are unique even amongst the unique ice cream shops (say like SFHC or Poly Ann). I'm a glutton, so I got the banana split with the Mexican chocolate ice cream. Man, was it good. You really can't go wrong with a banana split, but this was definitely the best banana split I've had in SF. 

The only reason why it's not 5 stars is that I think it gets a little too crowded and some of the clientele can be kind of annoying (think loud high schoolers that reek of weed). I also think that, due to how crowded it gets, it's debatable whether or not it's worth braving the hoards of obnoxious high schoolers to get that amazing ice cream. That'll be up to you to decide.
author: Claire C.

description: Remember to take a number when you come in! It was my first time here and at first we had no idea how to order but I realized when you walk in there's a number machine on the left. Take a number and once your number is called you can sample all the flavors you want. Definitely a small spot for the amount of customers they get. I'll be back to try their other unique flavors!!
author: Kim L.

description: My parents took her to this place back in the sixties in the seventies this ice cream is above and beyond one of the top 10 best I think I've ever had in my life enjoy a nice scoop of ice cream!
author: Karen B.

description:
I probably don't have the most accurate read on Mitchell's since I ordered the Ube ice cream and didn't try their other flavors since we spent so much time waiting and it was late.

There's often lines out the door, so you'll need to grab a number and wait to be called on. Some interesting flavors include Avocado, Grasshopper Pie, Baby Coconut, Thai Tea, etc. We waited around 15-20 min for our turn, but I'm pretty sure we could've just bought a pint and enjoyed it at home.

The Ube had a good flavor but was a little sugary for my liking. I had a junior size which they claim is the "size of a golf ball" but it came out more like a tennis ball so they're pretty generous with portions. It was $3~ so pretty reasonable. 

It's a great place to hang out with friends or take your date on a warm evening in Noe.
author: Chelsea W.

description: Finally, I was able to find this spot. Cute little ice cream shop. Ic creams samples were so good and I ended up with Horchata ice cream while my cousins had Thai Tea. Definitely will have to stop again and try their Ube, Halo-halo, Mango etc...
author: Fem C.

description:
Wow, i used to have field trips to Mitchells when i was in day care around here. Its been 20+years and this place has turned into an sf hot spot with all sorts of ppl lining up for almost an hr. 
This place is great. I've noticed that although the line gets long af, the workers never stress out and still take the time to get you your flavor testers. I like that they have an express line for prepackaged items, i like that they also allow 1 scoop purchases along with your packaged item. I dont like how one woman was taking adavantage of that and trying to order a sundae along with her prepackaged item....
Anyways. Was about an hr for my scoop of ice cream, and this time i got the Butterscotch Marble, ugh, delicious, not too sweet and everything is well balanced. I love the toffee and the scooping person heard me say that and literally scooped up all the toffee on the top for me. Gotta tip these ppl! 
Great place for ice cream... but i gotta be more strategic in the times i come for it
author: Amiee C.

description:
Mitchell's has been a favorite of my Filipino family for years! We love coming down here to pick up their Ube and Langka flavors to make the traditional Filipino dessert: Halo Halo! Yes...they do make Halo Halo at Mitchell's but we like to put it together ourselves as a fun interactive experience at home.

But my ALL TIME favorite flavors here are Kahlua and Chocolate Caramel Crunch. Mmmm *drools* The texture of the ice cream is smooth and the flavors are very rich. 

Prices have definitely gone up over time. But I think it's still worth buying. If you're coming on a sunny day, prepare to wait.They have a few parking spaces in the back and the street parking out front has a green curb so cars are in and out. In terms of seating, they have 2 benches outside that are always quickly taken. The service here is fast. They get you in and out so they can get to every customer. Which is something I don't mind. Don't want to waste any time conversating with the risk of the goods melting lol.
author: Mary R.

description:
Lives up to its name! Only difficult part about it is choosing a flavor! 

I got the avocado flavor and I thought it tasted more like the pistachio ice cream. My bf got the halo halo (Filipino dessert). Not too sure what the original tastes like but it was good too! Very interesting blend of flavors (jelly beans, jelly, corn crisps, and some other stuff). All came out to $10.
author: Monica L.

description: I LOVE Mitchell's Ice cream! My boyfriend lives just 2 blocks away from Mitchell's so I go pretty often for late night sugar cravings. They have so many different flavors and they are all good. It's hard to choose just 1 or 2 flavors at a time. I usually try at least 3-4 including new flavors but still haven't tried all of their flavors yet, partly because I always get the same flavors. To list a few, my favorite flavors are: grasshopper's pie, strawberries and cream, kalua mocha, cantaloupe. I even bought a 1/2 gallon box of cantaloupe flavor and had for weeks. Not a good idea if you are on a diet. There's always a long line with wait #s but they go by pretty quickly so not a big deal. Try as many flavors as possible! They always come up with new flavors too. It's right around the time for some pumpkin spice flavor, maybe I should visit soon.
author: Adel A.

description:
Understaff as hell. The gf wanted to go here. I waited for 30mins for ice cream. This is ridiculous. It's like a DMV in here. Maybe they should start utilizing that number machine and have everyone pick a number and wait to be serve.

Edit: oh snap, I'm waiting in the car, gf just confirmed that there is really a number machine. This is horse crap crazy
author: Nam V.

description: There's so many ice cream places that I've tried but I think Mitchell's Ice Cream is my favorite! My favorite flavors would be the Ube, Mexican Chocolate, Thai Tea. Only downside to this place is that the line to get scoops are always long so I end up having to buy the half gallon.
author: Deej I.

description:
I went here when they were having an anniversary thing going on, so it was really crowded.  So, I was stuck waiting for my number to be called for 35-40 minutes.
Although, since it is very well known there is usually still a line especially on weekends, events, and when it happens to be warm in SF.  I just happened to hit the double whammy by going during their anniversary on the weekend.  However, if you want to just get a tub of ice cream then go to the express line.  Also, the place is small for its popularity.  They have a small parking area, but it fills up fast.  
As for the ice cream, they range from traditional flavors like Strawberry and Coffee to more tropical flavors like Ube and Avacado.  These flavors don't often change.  I happened to get Ube and Tropical Four.  The Ube had the sweet and rich taste of Ube, but wasn't too sweet.  Tropical Four was really refreshing with the combination of the banana, guava, mango, and pineapple.  These are really good flavors that I would try and have tried again on multiple occassions, but I have had better.
author: Arianna C.

description: We can go again and again and enjoy different flavors including exotic flavors which are hard to find. Don't give up on back side parking because people always leaving every 5mins. Also long lines shouldn't scare you once you get your number it will go fast. All I am saying it's worth waiting above all. Highly recommended take your friends and family because it's a San Francisco treat. Ready to go again. O my favorite flavor is Ube.
author: Annie A.

description:
Always my go to for comfort ice cream! I know I know we got Salt n Straw and all the legit ice cream spots. Not hating on those- just saying Mitchell's is holding it down out here with the tropical flavors and my traditional faves- including chocolate and rocky road! They do it best, in my opinion and I've have lots of Rocky roads in my foodie life time! 
Come by this quaint traditional ice cream parlor and try some flavors that will blow your mind. 

Yeah. This place = SUPER SF. 

My fav. My go-to. Satisfied all the ti
author: Ruth Awit S.

description: By all means, if you love ice cream then you got to find your way to "Mitchell's Ice Cream" in Noe Valley, South San Francisco. Ice cream is made fresh daily, and they keep selling until 11 p.m. during summer. Selections are divided between traditional flavors (Chocolate Chip, Butterscotch Marble, Oreo Cookie, Pistachio), tropical flavors (Buko Baby Coconut, Avocado, Lucuma, Yam), and sorbets (apricot mango, passion fruit, mango). What you got to tell yourself is it's a lot of calories, but it's lighter than air! "Mitchell's" is the lightest, and creamiest I've had in ages. They have been around seventy years, and their summer lines are out the door, but they're much faster to service the line than their big competitor in South San Francisco, "Bi-Rite Creamery." If I had to choose one over the other? Let's put it this way: Anytime I'm eating "Henry Hunan Chinese" for dinner up on Church Street, that means, I'll be walking down two blocks for now on down on 29th Street to San Jose Avenue where "Mitchell's" is at afterwards. I think I'll be making that my own tradition. All ice cream believably tastes like it was churned just hours ago, no freezer tub work. "Mitchell's" has been around for nearly seventy years, and they may have been god-sent. #godswitness
author: Sean C.

description:
We all know the ice cream is good... So I'm here to let everyone know about Mitchell's awesome ice cream cakes! We ordered a 1/4 sheet ice cream cake ($54) and it could not have been a more perfect experience from easy ordering to amazing taste!!

The ordering process is SO easy to complete online. There is a large selection of designs for all sorts of occasions. There are also example pictures for the visualizers such as myself. I saw the perfect cake to order but wanted to customize the colors of the frosting and the type of sprinkles. There was a section where I could list special instructions. I initially thought my instructions would be confusing and was worried it would not turn out the way I wanted --- I was wrong! The talented team at Mitchells was able to turn my vision into reality. It was exactly how I pictured the cake to be!! 

It is great to have Mitchell's ice cream but having it in cake form is also the cherry on top! We ordered the halo halo ice cream cake and it was a hit at our party! For the price, I can not recommend a better option. You are in good hands for your next party if you go through Mitchell's!
author: Tina O.

description:
Amazing variety of flavors and colors, and huge scoops! The place was packed at 3 pm on a Saturday, but we still got served just 10 minutes after taking a number. 

I LOVED the Macapuno (sweet coconut) flavor. We also bought Grasshopper Pie (mint with chocolate chunks and Oreos), rum raisin, and Halo Halo. Only Halo Halo kind of disappointed me, the Ube flavor wasn't very pronounced and the added toppings were a bit grainy. 

The consistency of Mitchell's is a little different from other gourmet ice cream places, it's more fluffy/less dense and less cold. Eat quickly or else it'll melt everywhere!
author: Katy Y.

description:
I have to admit, I'm not the biggest fan of ice cream, but I was pleasantly surprised by the flavor offerings and deliciousness that is Mitchell's! I can see why there is always a line and fortunately, that was mostly avoided on a lovely sunny, sunday afternoon! 

I love that they offer both traditional flavors (like cookies and creme) and exotic, creative ones too like (halo halo, avocado, and lucuma). While I could probably snack on the avocado flavor all day, every day - I think the winner for me was the lucuma (peruvian fruit), which actually wasn't fruity too much at all - it profiled like espresso and maybe caramel even! It was a really nice wrap up from the brunch I just consumed at the Front Porch! (Oh did I mention Mitchell's is like a block away from this popular brunch spot?). I would recommend this duo together! 

I've actually been craving Mitchell's the last few days after trying it, so all signs of a great neighborhood ice cream shop, comparable to Garden Creamery, another favorite in SF!
author: Deanna S.

description:
TLDR; Expect a wait if you're not buying pre-packaged items. They have a wide variety of ice cream flavors that are creamy, refreshing, and delicious. It comes at a hefty price, but it's worth it.

Getting in and out:
My family and I went to Mitchell's on a Sunday night after dinner time. I'm Filipino, so it was a must that we come here to try their Filipino flavors. Upon arriving we immediately saw there was a line going out the door. There was difficulty finding parking. My Dad had dropped my Mom and I off to get in line, only to find out that it wasn't a line; it was clumps of people waiting outside. They have a numbering system. First, you grab a number inside. Once they call your number you're allowed to go inside where someone will take your order. We didn't feel like standing in the crowd, so my family opted to buy 2 half-gallon tubs of their pre-packaged ice cream. They had a separate check-out area for customers buying pre-packaged items, so we didn't need to wait long to buy our ice cream and leave.

Menu and cost:
Mitchell's offers a wide variety of flavors from classic (e.g. vanilla, oreo, coffee) to adventurous (e.g. avocado, ginger spice, rum raisin) to ethnic (e.g. ube, buko, lychee). We bought one tub of langka (jackfruit) and one tub of halo-halo (a filipino dessert). The total came to $21.98 [for those that eat Magnolia ice cream here's a rough comparison: Mitchells = $21.98/gal; Magnolia(estimated $7/1.5qt) = ~$18.67/gal]. Even though it's expensive, you get your bang for your buck here. 

The ice cream:
The consistency for both flavors was nice and creamy, as expected. I found myself searching for more flavor in the langka ice cream, but I blame that on the jackfruit itself. Langka doesn't have a powerful flavor. Nonetheless, it was a light, delectable dessert. Once in a while you'll find a small piece of langka in your bite and the jackfruit flavor really kicks in. On the other hand, the halo-halo ice cream knocked me off my feet! They have the milky taste of halo-halo down to a tee. The ratio of ice cream to the various mix-ins typically found in halo-halo (red bean, buko, langka, kaong, etc.) was spot on. With each bite you get an ingredient you would expect in halo-halo. The ice cream isn't too rich, so I found each bite to be refreshing and delicious.

Overall, I wouldn't mind waiting around to get a scoop if I had the time and energy. If you don't feel like waiting, their pre-packaged tubs are worth it. I'd highly recommend coming here and I'll definitely be coming back to try the different flavors Mitchell's Ice Cream has to offer.
author: Lauren P.

description:
I've been searching for which SF ice cream place I should try next after Bi-Rite. I finally decided on Mitchell's because I wanted to try the Ube ice cream. 

So first time to Mitchell's and it was a Monday around 4 pm. There was a lot of people but not so much that there was a line. I was pretty happy about that, and it wasn't even a hot day either, pretty cold actually.

There were just SO MANY flavors that I just had to ask to try like 5 flavors(honestly I wanted to ask to try more, but I refrained myself). The man was nice and gave me the samples, but he never really smiled...wish he would smile a bit, he looked like he was frowning. 

I decided to get a double, a scoop of Ube and a scoop of Espresso Toffee Chip. I also got a waffle cone with that, which is +50 cents. A Double is $5.85 and a Single $3.85. So mine including the waffle cone was $6.35.

I think the prices are reasonable for the portions and quality of the ice cream. It wasn't too creamy or icy, it was the best consistency of ice cream ever. It was slightly sticky too. The Ube flavor was on point too, not too sweet and it has an aftertaste of the Ube, it even seemed to have tiny pieces of the yam in the ice cream.

In my opinion Ube is the best flavor. I think Mitchell's ice cream and Bi-Rite Creamery is about the same, but if you want more unique flavors, then Mitchell's is the place to go. Definitely recommend to try the Ube.

Coming back next time we visit SF :)
author: Rachel L.

description:
SO many great flavors!!!! I really love that this place has both traditional and also some tropical flavors thrown into the mix! They have buko pandan, ube, coconut pineapple, and so many other flavors that I am happy to see! 

Parking // street parking and I definitely would not want to park in front of this ice cream shop, since there are so many people in line even at 10pm. 

Process // You need to go to the front and get a number in which they will call out when it is time for you and your party to be served. It took about 30 minutes we were called. 

Ice cream service // Service is friendly and they let you try samples of ice cream. I tried the Macapuno and Lucuma (peruvian fruit). I like the macapuno a LOT, so I ended up going with that one. 

Ice cream choice // My bf and I decided to split a double (5.85)- Macapuno and Halo halo ice cream in a waffle bowl which is 0.75 cents more. It's worth it if you like a crispy and delcious waffle cone to compliment your ice cream. 

Overall, I LOVE their ice cream here! So creamy and there are so many options that cater to all types of tastes and cravings. It's also pretty affordable compared to a few other places I've been to. I would highly recommend giving this place a try...just keep in mind that this place usually has a wait at night, so definitely don't come here if you are in a rush or have to use the restroom.....
author: Emily T.

description: This Bay Area staple is worth the long lines during pleasant weather. This was one of my grandpa's favorite places to go to when he moved to this country, so needless to say, we were born to love Mitchell's Ice Cream. They make the best cookies and cream ice cream I've ever had. I often find myself biting into large chunks of cookie!! I've been to other ice cream shops, which are good by their own account, but when I think about home, the Bay Area, San Francisco, or family, Mitchell's is always the first to come to mind.  Been going here for decades and we've never been mistreated by any of the staff... The impatient customers, however...yikes. Mitchell's, we love you!!!!
author: Christine A.

description:
It is with regret that I write this review with a 2-star rating.  With 3,500+ reviews, it's not going to do much, but I just had to release some frustration.  Up until my latest visit, Mitchell's had been one of my fave ice cream shops in SF.  I had tried the Halo Halo cup before (with all the misc stuff under the ice cream; not ice cream on a cone) and it was so tasty!  However, in my most recent experience, I got a scoop of Halo Halo ice cream on a chocolate-dipped waffle cone (+$).  

All was good until, as I kept eating the ice cream, I bite into some paper!  It was definitely a wtf-moment as I realized there was paper lined along the INTERIOR of my cone.  Its normal to have paper in between the chocolate-dipped cone to separate them, so I tried to justify it for them for a sec, but as I thought about it some more...I kept thinking how its pretty impossible not to notice bright white lining all over the inside of the cone as you scoop ice cream onto it...so I feel like this was a result of pure laziness.  The result of this was an extremely frustrating ice cream eating experience (first world problem, I know hah).  

1.) eat all my ice cream
2.) get fingers all sticky from getting ice-cream soaked interior paper lining out of cone
3.) angrily eat cone by itself

To be honest, the ice cream is good, with my favorite being Ube.  But that last experience was terrible, and the girl that served me wasn't very warm or friendly during the transaction either.  They have a tiny parking lot in the back; otherwise, you'll need to find street parking.
author: Jeff T.

description:
You know you love ice cream when you venture to SF for some in cold weather! I can eat ice cream on any given day.  This is the place to go for some good old fashioned ice cream.  Ingredients taste fresh, and If asked to describe it, I would say "solid".  And amazing.  I played it safe and got rocky road in a cup and it legit tasted like they made it from real chocolate.  The BF got a shake that he customized (which I didn't know you could do!) but he asked for 1 scoop of banana and 1 scoop of chocolate caramel crackle.  He's super picky with his ice cream and he loved it.  

Here's a tip.  Grab a number when you get there, it's on the left side on the wall (behind the sea of people waiting).  There's also a very tiny lot behind the shop that has a few parking spaces.  Most likely always full, but maybe you'll get lucky.  

Feel free to ask for any samples.  They give you a decent sized taste on a spoon.  I tried halo halo flavor and it was pretty darn good.  Some honorable mentions are grasshopper pie, mango, avocado... it's so hard for an indecisive person like me to decide!
author: Quynh D.

description: Best ice cream! The mango was amazing, and so was the strawberry cheesecake. Wish I had added the Thai tea flavored ice cream too. Love at first bite! Or lick lol
author: Alissa T.

description:
Now this is my type of ice cream shop, there are so many flavors!  Grab a ticket & wait for your number to get called.

They have the original, go to flavors.  & they also have a variety of unique cultural flavors such as Ube-Macapuno, Mexican Chocolate, Lulucuma, & more.  & we cannot forget about the sorbets too.  

You can make a sundae, order an ice cream cake, or simply order a scoop, or 5.

Macapuno:  Creamy, lightly sweet, & they are very generous with their scoops!
author: Saleen D.

description:
JOHN NEEDS A RAISE. 

I had the best experience in this shop. It was my first time, and I was so overwhelmed with the flavor selection (we've all been there) but felt bad asking to try more than a couple flavors (also.... we've all been there) but I asked to try a couple anyway. John was helping me and joked "I'll give you a sample of every flavor if you want". 

What started as a joke turned into a very real thing. He powered down the line and HAPPILY sampled every flavor to me and said it made his day. WOW. 

The ice cream was amazing but the happiness radiating from those who work here made it that much better. 

10/10 would recommend to anyone. PS I got the thai tea and it was the best ever.
author: Cody J.

description:
One of the more popular and local ice cream shops in SF and I finally had the chance to check it out. Here was our experience on a cold Friday evening.

AMBIANCE:
Parking: It's near a pretty busy neighborhood. I guess there's parking behind the store, street parking, and short term parking in front.

Seating: Not really. There's a bench outside.

Feels: It's a neighborhood area, there's a laundromat adjacent to it. The vibes inside is very small ma and pa feel. The calm yet vibrant walls is decorated with awards and goods to sell. The background music is lite rock setting pretty nice vibes. Great for tourists, foodie adventure, or a local date night.

FOOD:
Eggnog (Recommend)
Creamy and rich. A pleasant pungent taste of eggnog, nothing filtered.

Grasshopper Pie (Recommend)
It has everything I wanted. ^_^ Chocolate, fudge, mint, oreos, win. Sweet, cros[y and creamy.

CUSTOMER SERVICE: 
Excellent. They were helpful, patient, and quick.

TL; DR OVERALL:
Excellent. Affordable prices, great selections, and good vibes. I'm generally not the one to wait on food longer than 15 minutes or so, I'd wait a little bit more but if it's 30 minutes or beyond there are other places (unless there's a one of a kind flavor). Still something worth checking out. A taste of Mitchell's is a taste of SF (Bernal Heights).

TIPS:
* Don't be shy to sample
* Pull a number next to the door.
author: Leland S.

description:
Traditional ice cream shop located in Bernal heights. I liked that it was open until 11pm for a late night ice cream run. 

Unique flavors such as:
grasshopper pie-mint chocolate chip with press and fudge swirl
Biko-fresh coconut
Macaroni-young coconut (a little on the sweet side)
Halo halo: a purple ice cream with a coconut and other tropical fruits
author: Betty C.

description:
Mitchell's is a top notch ice cream store. They have a large variety of funky and classic flavors. The ice cream has a nice creamy taste and is not too icy. 
My only reason for 4 stars is the service. We arrived on a chilly Friday night after dinner and the place was packed! The store could barely fit everyone waiting for ice cream. We grabbed a ticket immediately, but it still took us a while of waiting to get our ice cream. The ice cream is definitely worth the wait, but be prepared to get a little squished.
author: Emitom H.

description: Favorite ice cream since childhood! Mango is my go to. Hot fudge sunday if you go to the store. Usually a little wait, but always worth it. Many flavors you can only find here. A must visit if you are from out of town.
author: Manny R.

description:
Some very interesting flavors here! Well worth our long walk from the Mission District.

Both of my recent trips I've walked by Bi-Rite Creamery, and both times I've chosen to try different ice cream places instead. I think the draw of more Asian-influenced flavors is just too hard to ignore. 

I enjoyed their Halo Halo and Tropical Four (four different tropical fruits blended together). 

NOTE: When you walk in, take a number from the ticketing machine to the left of the entrance (a la grocery meat counter). We were initially confused for the first minute or so because we couldn't figure out where the line was for ordering.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Good ice creams and some good vegan options as well.
The ice cream is cheap compared to SF prices, which s a bonus. My favorite is the coffee ice cream.

Pro Tip: Get a ticket first thing when you enter- they call out ticket numbers and you get to taste and order ice cream at your turn. You don't need the ticket if you are buying pints or buckets.
author: Namrata J.

description:
Man I love Mitchell's, they have all my favorite filipino flavors, like Ube, and even sometimes the cheese flavor yummm.

The employee's let me sample as much as I want until I get the right flavor combo I want.

To be honest, it is cheaper to get a pre-packed quart. I see some people bring in a freezer bag to transport their ice cream far from this place. This place is BUSY at night on weekends and Friday's especially sometimes hard to find parking.

Come during the week on a weekday.
author: Elijah B.

description:
It's hard to go wrong with ice cream in my book. Mitchell's is where I go to for typical flavors at a decent price. Their ice cream is not outrageously priced, and they have several solid choices. The only thing is that families know this and so the lines are out the wazhoo here, but get a number and get in line.

I like the tropical 4, the ube, and the mango. When I don't feel like lining up, I'll get a quart and eat it at home, it's practically the same thing.
author: Eva C.

description:
#44 (2017)

I guess you can't really give an ice cream joint anything lower than a five star rating if you really love ice cream. 

There may be certain instances, but there was nothing if the sort here. 

So literally the last spot we ended up in SF before heading home was Mitchell's. 

I first walked in and stared thrown the menu and noticed all the interesting flavors. Now when I say interesting it seems like this is a Filipino ice cream joint. A lot of the flavors are similar to something you would see in a Filipino dessert joint. I ended up trying so many flavors and sadly I can't remember everyone but the quality, creaminess, tastiness oh boy(oh girl) it was just impeccable!!!

Don't be like me though and sit and stare and wait. Lol the first thing you gotta do is PICK A NUMBA!!!

I went on a good day at a god time because I was in a mind out in a jiffy!!!

As y'all may know I'm a chocolate lova! Shoot im chocolate myself so if any of y'all want some chocolate ;) (lol) jk. And I usually pass on them fruity Flavas ya dig!

Tings I tried!

-Horchata: it was yummy, but it didn't quite do it for me. Idk what it was maybe just not enough cinnamon flavor to it. 
-Mango: it took me back to PI and taste just like Mango SHAKES!!! 
Idk the other flavors I sampled 

My girl landed on the Grasshoppers flavor and I didn't really like it at all!
I had the Chocolate Caramel Crackle and YUM YUM YUM SO GOOD!

Btw I figured it out y'all. Instead of buying two single scoops, I got one double scoop and we saved some money on dat

Y'all needs to get to Mitchell's like Yesterday!
author: Nik E.

description:
This place is a real neighborhood gem, and the ice cream itself is to die for. Pro tip: when you get there, get a ticket. I didn't realize, and I waited around for awhile before someone told me this. 

I've tried a couple of their ice cream flavors, and I love their tropical flavors, the ice cream is smooth and tastes like real fruit instead of the fake stuff. It's amazing. 

I will say that all the flavors I've tried are quite sweet, if that's not something you like, you might not enjoy it. Overall, I'm def coming back over and over again
author: Sophie W.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream is nothing fancy, but it is great quality. My favorite is strawberry but I always like to try something new. I tried the coffee flavor recently and it had a very pungent coffee flavor. Not bitter at all or overly sweet.

Parking here can be a hassle because their lot is so tiny for the 50 people waiting for their ice cream. Just make a couple rounds on the street and I'm sure you can find it. 

Service here is good. The gentleman that helped me and my friend had a lot of patience. We both tasted two flavors and he didn't rush us at all!
author: Joyce S.

description:
FIRST, go past the line and the crowd outside into the store and grab a ticket. 

Okay, now you can either wait inside or outside and ponder what flavors you want to try. If you wait inside, be prepared to dodge people ordering and people buying the gallon take home containers. No need to wait for your number to be called if you opt for the ready to go containers. You can maybe even sneak in a scoop or two in the process.  

After waiting about 15 minutes, my number was finally called. I wasn't in the mood for something too rich but wanted to try a bunch of the flavors. There are so many! I am always astounded by the plethora of tropical flavors. Some of these fruits I've never even heard of, and thus my enthusiasm to try them all.     

Tropical Four - This flavor was really creamy and rich. It tasted strongly of bananas. 
Cantaloupe - I like cantaloupe as a fruit and melons in general. I especially like the deep, penetrative sweetness of cantaloupe. The ice cream version was not too sweet but very refreshing. 
Cherimoya Tango - Marked as a new flavor, this one had something about its taste that was very interesting. It has this twist like the name suggests that is hard to describe.
Halo Halo - I like the chunks and combination of flavors.
Pear - I had a difficult time tasting any pear. 

I ended up getting a scoop of the CANTALOUPE. I have to say the service is superb. My server was very patient with me and considerate. (I was dying of thirst and he gave me a big cup full of water.) The scoop I had started out fine. Sadly, the more I ate the more the flavor seem to fade. Something I would like to see are compost bins for the bowls and spoons which are compostable but there were none in sight.

The overall eating experience isn't the best here. The downside about Mitchell's (beside the huge crowds) is there is no seating. I was left juggling my ice cream, the cup of water, my jacket, and my phone.There's nowhere in the neighborhood to sit down either. And it's not located in a really clean part of the city. All the amazing ice cream flavors still make this place a favorite of mine.
author: Lauren H.

description:
TL;DR adventurous flavors, unbeatable quality, unbeatable line

Grab your number and wait for them to call your number (it might take 30 mins+). They have many many flavors for you to choose them and you can get many many samples. 

I'm more of a chocolate over fruity ice cream person. Here's my breakdown: 

-toffee espresso (5/)5: bold, crunch, caffeine 
-almond(5/5): perfect subtleness, crunch
-ube(3/5): perfect shade of purple, not a good taste
-halo halo(3/5$: a wild mix of flavors 
-horchata(4/)5: adventurous, cinnamon sweet
-Thai tea(2/5): the drink tastes better than the ice cream
author: Sophia L.

description:
Comparing A) toasted almond, B) caramel praline, C) rocky road, D) grasshopper pie, and E) Mexican chocolate. My favorite = E and B, though many people liked A. 

Generally great ice cream. Some excellent flavors including some really unique ones like avocado and purple yams. The Horchata was very good at getting the rice and cinnamon flavors right and I would definitely recommend it.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Mother nature always has the best of me.  When she visits, people around me know; you will feel my wrath. You will see me cry. You will hear my crazy thoughts out loud.  It's no bueno for anyone involved so if you sense it, either run the other way or bear with me.  Fortunately for me, I have homies who like me enough to put up with it.  

Halo Halo - I've never had the actual dessert so I can't compare it to the real thing but it was very light and the toppings (beans and jelly) are common in other Asian desserts
Ube (sample) - rich in color, subtle flavor 
Peach (sample) - peachy, right amount of sweetness
Coconut - tastes like the Hawaiian pineapple cookies
Tropical 4 (sample) - very tropical 

Soo many flavors to try but soo many people in line that it would've made me feel guilty standing there sampling all the flavors.  Everything I tried was on point and it wasn't too heavy.

Me: when mother nature visits, I shouldn't surround myself with people and just be alone
Homie: but who's going to take you out for ice cream and make you feel better?
 
=)
author: Linda N.

description:
LOVE the tropical flavors on the menu. The halo halo was delicious and the buka (young coconut) was on point! taste just like those frozen coconut cups at the Asian markets.  

It's missing a bit of that magic something that makes super delicious ice cream, but it's so close! Take a number to the left and line up- it's worth the wait! I'll definitely be back to try other flavors.
author: Jen P.

description:
This place is an institution. You can tell, by the set-up on the inside that they have the whole ice-cream shop thing down pat. 

I love the selection of flavors. I was especially intrigued by the variety of  flavors from the Phillipines, and even flavors featuring fruit from South America--not exactly what you would expect from a place that has been around for over 60 years. Although I was interested by these exotic sounding flavors, I decided to get a scoop of Rocky Road instead. 

The ice cream was good. It was not pretentious, and best of all, it actually tasted like Rocky Road. That is all a girl can really hope for in some ice cream.
author: Annika S.

description:
My aunt got three pints for us to try at home: 

Ube: bland
Cantoloupe: refreshing 
Mango: my favorite!!
author: Jenny L.

description:
It's taken me like almost forever to finally write a review for Mitchell's Ice Cream.  Mainly because I don't always go out for ice cream and it's a bit out of my way from where I live.  I finally had the chance to stop by when I went with my co-workers after having lunch nearby.  

The ordering process is simple and straightforward.  You go in, pick a number, wait for it, get your ice cream and enjoy!  Just like other popular ice cream joint in SF, you're probably going to end up waiting a while for your turn, but it'll be worth the wait.  So many flavors to choose from ranging from the classics like chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, to exotics like blood orange, green tea, mango, kalamansi, durian, and ube.  And you can have them on cups, cones, sundaes, or other specialties.  

During my visit with my co-workers I got a cup with two scoops, one mango-guava sorbet and one lychee ice cream.  It was refreshingly delicious!!  Now I know what I've been missing out on.

Mitchell's Ice Cream is a sacred ice cream institution in SF.  They may not be fancy or hip like Bi-Rite or Smitten, but they're not trying to be and that's fine by me.  I'm just glad they're sticking to being an old school ice cream joint with great quality ice cream.
author: Rodney H.

description:
OMG OBSSESED!!! 
This ice cream shop is so freaking good! The lines get crazy, so grab a number and wait people, because trust me it is worth it. The workers are so kind and let you try literally everything! Their sizes are very generous! I thought I would need a double scoop but a single scoop is just fine honestly! There are so many random flavors, but also some many standard ice cream flavors! I was just so blown away by the service and the taste! It was way better than  normal ice cream !!!! UGHHHHHH COME TO SOCAL!!!!!!!
Shouts Outs to Nestor (I really hope that is your name he was a the shift leader working 6/16/17 at 10:45PM) amazing customer service !!!!!
author: Sara S.

description:
A classic San Francisco ice cream parlor! Be prepared to wait in line for the good stuff, but it'll all be worth it in the end. Each flavor starts with a  high-quality base of cream and eggs and the other added flavors are all done with precision and balance.

They've got traditional ice cream flavors here which are still top-notch, but I'd highly recommend one of their more exotic offerings (my absolutely favorites are the avocado ice cream and the ube ice cream).
author: Joey S.

description:
Came here after 9 on July 4. This place came highly recommended. This is the first stop on our San Francisco ice cream tour! Next stop is Coldstone!

They have a number taking system, but they don't seem to consistently apply it. It didn't matter because they still serviced people in the order they arrived. There were a lot of people here, but the the customers were taken care of very efficiently. Nate really took care of us. He took pride in his job, made recommendations, and allowed me to sample multiple flavors. 

One of the flavors that I decided on was grasshopper pie. You might immediately be turned off because you got a picture of little bits of green legs mixed with pie crust. However, the name of the ice cream is actually deceiving. Instead, it consisted of mint ice cream,  fudge chocolate chips,  and Oreos. 

The other flavor that I chose was Espresso toffee crunch. It consisted of espresso ice cream with espresso flakes and chocolate covered toffee. Coffee lovers will adore this one! I don't even drink coffee, and I loved it.  

If you're an ice cream lover this is the place for you. They open late too, which makes it perfect for coming here after a concert, movie, or a really bad dinner like we had tonight.
author: Sean A.

description:
I Scream, You Scream, We All Scream for Ice Cream!  One of my favorite places. It brings back memories when I lived in San Francisco. 
Always a must stop if I'm ever in the area no matter the weather. Be prepared because Parking won't be easy. Its difficult at times and most of the times this place you'll find it busy. you'll  have to wait in line so make sure you get your ticket to wait your turn. Mitchell's Ice Cream   its worth the wait. Until next time.  Chao!
author: Glenda C.

description:
My friends and I did an ice cream contest among the top ice cream places in SF, and Mitchell's came in the top pick for 4 out of 6 of us, and the other two voted Mitchell's as second.

Got the baby coconut in the pint, but also tried the grasshopper pie as a scoop - and THAT was delicious. (I've been thinking about the grasshopper pie ever since!!). The baby coconut had small chewy chunks of (baby) coconut in the ice cream.

The other contestants in the pint contest included Bi-Rite (salted caramel), Three Twins (mexican chocolate), Humphrey Slocombe (blue bottle vietnamese coffee) and Salt & Straw (almond brittle w/ salted ganache).

We were all very pleasantly surprised by Mitchell's baby coconut. Thought it might've been overpowered by some of the other stronger flavors in the mix, but everyone loved it. Can't wait to go back and try more flavors!!
author: Cal C.

description:
Three words: Awesome Ice Cream.

Mitchell's has been one of my favorite ice cream parlors of all time and now I finally give credit to where credit is due.

Mitchell's is a fun ice cream store that has a ton of unique flavors, great service, and good portions all at a fair price.

I came with a group of friends on a Friday Night, which is arguably the busiest day of the week at around 9pm.

How Mitchell's works is: You grab a number, and then you wait patiently AND anxiously until your number is called.

Once my number was called, the person who helped me was very nice and cheerful and let me try all the flavors that I wanted. I try to get a different flavor every time I go to Mitchell's, so this time I got Mitchell's Halo-halo. Halo-halo is mongo beans and sweet beans, buko, langka, ube, pineapple, kaong (palm fruit), evaporated milk, shaved ice, with their ice cream. They only serve this from Spring - Fall, so really, this means that it's an awesome summer flavor. My server also gave me a giant scoop, so shout outs to him!

I personally really liked the Halo-Halo, It was a nice level of sweet and I enjoyed every bit of the different toppings such as the sweet beans, pineapple, etc. I try not to get the same flavor I've had before but Halo-Halo might change my mind.

Mitchell's is an awesome ice cream store, and I would honestly recommend it to anyone and everyone.
author: Anthony Y.

description: This place is ok. I've turned food snob as I got older and I now realized that the ice cream here is mediocre in terms of quality and taste.for example their cherry are the ones that come in jars for cocktails (forgot the name)? I also get the big sizes at my local 99 which is so much more worth it. If you want big portions and aren't a food snob come here!!
author: Em F.

description: Great ice cream! I tired the Lucuma Peruvian ice cream and it was delicious. They have a number system because it gets very busy there. The tubs you can buy are a GREAT price! They accept credit cards too!
author: Robby T.

description:
This happens to be one of the best ice cream shops I've ever encountered.  It's a tiny shop with people waiting in line for there number to be called to order, so make sure you grab a ticket with a number and don't just stand in line.  There's no seating inside with a couple benches outside the store.  The thing that made me love this place is all the flavors of ice cream from traditional flavors to their tropical flavors.  I tried a couple samples before I ordered and I really like the ube ice cream which is a purple yam Popular in the Filipino culture. And the Buko ice cream which is a coconut ice cream.  If your San Francisco you gotta check this place out!!!!             
 BELIEVE THE HYPE!!
author: Elvin D.

description:
Omg I so love this ice cream. My first time here and I'm in love. I ordered the Java Toffee Sunday and I love it. The Kahlua Mocha ice cream is bomb. THe strawberry shake and the New York Cherry shake is bomb. I will be coming back a lot.

Try it
author: VERONICA B.

description: My sister recommended this place, so we went, there was a wait but it was well worth it! They have so many flavors I wanted to try, that were not in all the ice cream places you see in my shopping areas. The big cheese was amazing! And Mexican Chocolate was delicious and I want to go back and get some more!
author: Emily L.

description:
Be prepared to wait in a very long line for Mitchell, no matter when you come :p 
First off,  you can order your ice cream in single, double, or triple scoops. There are so many rotating flavors that it becomes hard to decide what to order! The employees here are so nice and lets you take your time trying out the flavors. I went with a couple of scoops of the Ube and Mexican Chocolate in an cup. Very nice and it didn't taste artificial at all. The price weren't too bad and they had a couple of outdoor seats to eat the good stuff at.

Overall, I can't recommend Mitchell enough and I hope everyone gives this place a try at some point in their lifetimes!
author: Lin L.

description:
As a self-declared ice-cream fanatic, I've failed myself by taking YEARS to finally make my way over to Mitchell's after knowing about them for nearly a decade. In my defense, I moved out of the state for half of that decade.

I'm a fan of their flavor selection--they've been on top of that tropical flavor game well before many of the newer shops, and their usual ones that I sampled are quite tasty too! My brother and I settled on the double scoop (2 flavors) of buko (sweet coconut) and ube (purple yam) in a cup for somewhere around $7. While tasty, they were a bit too sweet and more than a bit too soft for me. It's all personal preference though!

I definitely think their number ordering system could be improved upon, there was a family waiting 15+ minutes to put in their order for a cake. Remember to grab a number right away, and they've got a lot if you circle around the back!
author: Christine L.

description:
I used to live in SOMA earlier and Mitchell's was a bit of a drive, imagine my delight when I moved to Bernal and Mitchell's is a 2 min drive -- what that means is that I can want chocolate ice cream at 10:50 pm and be able to get it WOHOOO

I really have to control the number of trips i make to here..but they have parking too - what's going to stop me!

Get there, grab a number asap, ogle at all the flavors and then order a chocolate ice cream.


My husband will usually try 3 different flavors before he choses and he always like whatever he tries be it avocado or pistachio (loaded with nuts) or caramel..

10 Stars!
author: Anju J.

description:
Just get one of these flavors.  They are my favorites:

Peanut Butter Indulgence
Grasshopper Pie
Buko
Coconut PIneapple
author: Sanket K.

description:
Mitchell's is a long-time SF institution for a good reason! Their ice cream continues to be amazing, year after year after year. They have all the standard flavors, plus more unusual ones like Yuba.  If you like coconut, the Makapuno (young coconut) is not to be missed! 

They always have seasonal flavors as well.  Peach ice cream with fresh peaches is incredibly delicious, and I am also a big fan of the Pumpkin in the Fall. (Like pumpkin pie and ice cream had a very delicious baby)

There is a small parking lot out back and prices are slightly cheaper than places like Birite - what's not to love?

They use a ticket system for taking orders - grab a number just inside the door when you know what you want.
author: Rachel R.

description:
How this place works: grab a ticket on the left side of the entrance, and wait for your number to be called to taste test/get your ice cream. 
I tried the grasshopper flavor. It was creamy and sweet. The portions of the chocolate/ brownie it's are also generous. 

I would say that this place has less depth than the 'hip' places like Salt and Straw, Bi-Rite creamery, but it has classic flavors (along with weird ones like jackfruit) and the ice cream also tastes more retro and old fashioned for some reason. But of course it still has that happiness that comes with every scoop of ice cream.
author: Julia C.

description:
Awww. Love!  Miss their green tea ice cream cuz we moved away :(
Sometimes we'd go right before closing bc I'd crave their green tea!
author: Keriena T.

description:
The long line standing patiently outside should alert a potential customer that this is a popular joint.  They also serve unusual ice creams, many based on recipes from the Philippines

They were serving #52 when we arrived and our number was #74, so we had a bit to wait, but eventually we got our ice cream.

Caroline had Thai Iced Tea flavor and baby coconut;  I had "ube," made from purple sweet potatoes from the Philippines and avocado ice cream, which I'd never had.  Walt had coconut ginger and something called "tropical 4" with four different flavors  It was all wonderful.

The shop itself is tiny and there are no tables or chairs and only two benches outside, so most people stand around eating their ice cream, which is my only negative.

It's a long schlelp from Davis, but if we are in San Francisco and craving ice cream, this is a go-to place.
author: Beverly S.

description: HUGE LINE!!! Be prepared to wait, but I think the wait was honestly worth it. Got the Mango ice cream and it was amazing. Would come again. TIP: YOU NEED TO GET A HELPED; theres also a second line if you buy their pre-packaged ice cream. Theres no wait if you just wanna stop by and pick up a half gallon of ice cream.
author: Quoc K.

description: There are some creative flavors. The person who took my order was patient with me sampling quite some of the flavors before I could decide which one I wanted. The ice cream that I got was pleasantly smooth and flavorful. Worth the price, which was also reasonable!
author: Joy C.

description:
Amazing ice cream! One of the best I have ever had BUT, the wait is ridiculously long!!! 

Also, outside is kinda smelly..
author: Dullina E.

description:
Ube Ice Cream is my favorite! Mitchell's Ice Cream has the creamiest and tastiest around! The lines can get pretty long here. I came around 8:30 at night and it took us about 20 mins before we were able to order. 

I tried the Ube and the Macapuno. Me and my fiance shared the 2 scoops. Good thing we didn't order one for each of us, because Mitchell's is very generous with their portion sizes! You can really taste the quality in their ice cream. Not only that, but they have unique flavors!

No matter how long the lines are, the customer service is fantastic!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Mitchell's is one of my favorite ice cream places and probably the best in San Francisco. Don't take my word for it though. You ask anyone that either lives or frequently visits the city and they will tell you that their favorite places to go are either Bi-Rite, Smitten, or Mitchell's. At any point in the day, you will find up to 50 people waiting outside for their number to be called. I've seen people wait outside in the pouring rain just to get a scoop of their favorite ice creams here, and I've seen people hold up traffic just to pull up around and find parking for this place. Absolutely nuts!

Regardless, it's all justified. You'll find that Mitchell's serves up very interesting flavors that you wouldn't think go into traditional ice creams. I've been here a handful of times and never got around to reviewing this place because I never thought it needed a good review. All the people can vouch for it anyway, so it would just be a waste of time telling you that this place is awesome.

There are so many options to choose from that I wouldn't really be able to recommend anything. If you're willing to try something exotic like the Halo Halo or the Ube flavor, I would at least take advantage of the free samples to see what you like. Chances are if you're here and you waited this long for your number, you might as well!
author: Steve N.

description: Can't go wrong with ice cream, honestly. This place has so many daring and some questionable flavors. Like ginger. Whoa there! I decided to play it safe and go with their strawberry, which did not disappoint. I'll save the more adventurous flavors for next time!
author: Melinda T.

description: My friend and I were in the city for the day and we really wanted some ice cream. We decided to try this place out. There was a lot of people but it wasn't too stuffed (the place is kind of small). But they have a ticket where you take a ticket and they call your number. So by the time we grabbed a number and checked out what they had, we made our decisions. My friend got the mango and I got the buko. The buko was sooo light and delicious. It wasn't overly sweet; it was iust right. My friend loved her mango ice cream too! If we're ever in the area again, I would stop by to try more flavors!
author: Misty T.

description:
So many flavors! Heard the line can get *quite* long, but we came in between 8 and 9PM, and we weren't lonely, but also got served in a a few minutes, before we even had a chance to finish perusing their expansive options of flavors. 

They give you a very large sample each time (like a whole heaping spoonful), which is awesome! They have super unique flavors like ube (like taro, a purple yam) and some other fancy tropical fruit flavors. We had such a blast getting scoops of all the flavors we wanted to try, and we weren't disappointed at all. I'm a HUGE fan of coffee ice cream, and they had an enormous selection of coffee flavors. I really, really liked their matcha green tea ice cream as well. Tea flavor is fragrant and refreshing. Highly recommend!
author: Ke C.

description: Mitchell knows what's up! The ice cream here is so rich and smooth. They've got a fun assortment of flavors including Thai tea, Mexican chocolate, Ube and avocado. Yes, that's right, AVOCADO. The staff is friendly and encourages you to try the flavors you're interested in before committing to one. I'll definitely be coming back regularly.
author: Rima H.

description:
I use to experience wt ube in other ice cream place but here can make me feel good wt Ube again, thanks to Mitchell lol. I would love to try my fav flavor  "Rocky road "  in every new ice cream places i visited and here i was good, the chocolate was not too sweet and you can taste a walnut and mash mellow in every single bite! Avocado was good , it was overrated. I never thought i could love this kind of veggie flavor lol 

Young coconut, you can taste the real young coconut ,but actually i like it in Thai style more
author: Tiratiwan L.

description: The best of the best icecreams in the country :) mango, halo-halo and coconut are my favorite flavors and they are absolutely delicious :)
author: Hari N.

description: Mitchell's Ice Cream should be added as a San Francisco treat, just as riding the famous cable cars are! Mitchell's offers all flavors, and you can avoid hour long waits in line, if you buy a pint, vs a cone. You can go Mitchell's at any time of day, and there will be a line tourists. The wait is worth it! I normally like to do sundae with 2 scoops of pistachio.
author: Zeynep D.

description:
wanted a quick ice cream break from SFO sight seeing, we were close by this place and reviews were good enough to give it a shot. 
So let me first start with the parking situation as SFO is tough on it, while we were trying to squeeze our car into a spot we came to know that they have private parking at the back of the shop, so save some time/effort and park at the luxury of private space. 
Now comes the ice-cream part, they have really good varieties and quantity given is also nice. They have some exotic fruit flavors and trust me you wont be disappointed.
Stop by if you are near by and enjoy the ice-cream :).
author: A K.

description: Great ice cream as always. Their well executed Filipino flavors always make them special in the Bay Area establishments. Highly recommend the halo halo flavor!
author: Xinyu L.

description:
Just the absolute BEST ice cream in the city for me since I was kid. The flavors are everything I would want as they range from chocolate decadence to tropical fruit flavors. I will always be loyal to Mitchell's as I feel it has always been there for the folks growing up and living in the city. To me it's a San Francisco institution.

It has a small parking lot so my advice is to keep your eyes peeled for any street parking if you're within a 2-3 block radius. Make sure you take a number, look at your choices, sample if you have to but please make up your mind quick as there are plenty of hungry ice cream patrons behind you still. 

I gravitate towards the Filipino dessert and ice cream flavors. On this latest visit back home, I went with halo-halo and buko. Halo-halo is a popular shave ice dessert that comes with flavored jellies, flan, condensed milk, coconut strings and usually itself topped with ube ice cream. Buko is Filipino coconut. The ice cream flavors were great. The halo-halo was everything in one scoop, all the flavors that make it a favorite Filipino dessert. The buko was creamy coconut goodness. The tastes were so good and always so evident that it's homemade. Mitchell's always takes me back to growing up in the city and getting that ice cream treat with my parents. 

Kyle helped us on this trip to Mitchell's on a cold busy night. I think he might be one of the assistant managers. Mitchell's is always busy so bring your patience and enjoy...
author: Chuck D.

description:
Not a very big ice cream fan! Except for mint choco chip :)
Well, i came here after a friend suggested this place, and the flavors blew my mind. A lot of innovative ice cream flavors they have got here. They have arrangements to pack the ice cream in various sizes!

I had choco chip mint fudge and pistachio and i cannot wait to try more! It closes at 11 PM sharp, so make sure you are in much ahead of time, otherwise they may ask you to leave as soon as it strikes 11.
author: Subha J.

description: Pistacho ice cream always my favorite. I always ask my friend to take me for a cone of pistacho ice cream, he said too much calories. I ended up buying a bucket by myself and enjoy at home
author: Carmen L.

description:
This is a great, San Francisco iconic creamery located in the outer mission. The shakes, sundaes and ice cream  is the best. 

Well worth trip from any district of the city
author: Jeffry S.

description:
Amid so many amazing ice cream shops popping up in San Francisco, historic Mitchell's still holds its own and you'll usually find a line out the door during any time of the day and during any kind of weather. 

I remember coming here as a child on those rare, warm SF nights when the line would be out the door and around the block. (Before hipsters, people didn't line up for just anything back then.) It was great having a dessert shop open so late and FREE PARKING.
If you went to a party and brought a tub of Mitchell's, you were a hero. And for weddings, the only ice cream fit for the occasion was 5 gallons of Mitchell's. 

What makes this place special? Their creamy, dreamy tropical flavors from exotic places like Peru and the Philippines which make unique flavors like ube, lucuma, and makapuno. 
It gets better... after you decide on a flavor, ask to have your cone dipped in chocolate!

So as much as I like the new bougie ice cream shops popping up around the city, Mitchell's will always be my first love 

Pints and gallons available to go. 
Limited free parking.
No seating.
Open late.
author: Mitzi G.

description:
This is by far my favorite ice cream place in all of San Francisco. They've been around forever and their ice cream flavors are a unique blend of classic flavors with artisan styles. 

Parking isn't easy around the neighborhood, but they have a small parking lot in the back. If you're lucky you'll find a spot. On hot days expect to wait for a very long time but the way it works is you grab a number and then they'll call out your number. So you can hang out outside. 

My favorite flavor is the peanut butter flavor. I forget what it's called. The prices are reasonable and the store also sells delicious treats that mostly look they are imported
author: Mohammad A.

description: Best ice cream around!! From Sac to Bay, can't get any better!! Tropical four is my fav, ube is pretty good too. Creamy and smooth and flavors that knock your socks off. The best ice cream around. It's a must stop. Cones are never stale and the ice cream is absolutely that best. The lines are long and always a crowd. Grab your number and wait patiently. It helps if you know what flavors you want. But you can always sample a few before hand. Can say enough about how great the ice cream is here.
author: Jeanette T.

description:
One of the best icecream places I have been to in a while. 

They almost always have a line but it's totally worth the wait - give you a chance to meet or talk to new people whether they are tourist or just local people or people visiting sf from nearby cities. 

One of the few icecream places that serves chocolate shell with the icecream.
author: Rupa S.

description:
With 3k+ reviews and acclaimed as one of the best ice cream shops in SF, the ice cream lover in me made sure we went out of our way (25 minute drive from our dinner restaurant) just so I can experience Mitchell's. Before arriving, I was a little worried that it'll be super packed with lines wrapping around the block as it was prime after dinner dessert time - luckily, the crowd waiting wasn't too bad as there were only a dozen people before me! FYI they service you based on your number so immediately upon arrival, make sure you head inside and grab a number from the ticketing machine. Yes, I'm sure you're probably wondering that they're a little extra making you wait for ice cream this way, but trust me, it's so worth it. Also, make sure you stay inside the store because the employees plow through announcing numbers very quickly, so if you're not paying attention / walk away, they will skip you. So be prepared to wave your hand in the air like a maniac when called! Plus, standing inside allows you to stare immensely at the menu as it's huge - the wait time didn't help me as I just wanted to sample everything. 

Fortunately, they're super generous with samples, portion wise and quantity wise. Indecisive me asked for 4 samples - halo halo, the acclaimed ube, chocolate salted caramel to name the 3 I remembered. Ultimately I went with the halo halo and chocolate salted caramel as the ube didn't impress me at all - a little shocked this is the fan favorite. I easily think the halo halo is so much better as there's more flavors, but none overpowered the other, making each distinct flavor in there their own star. And the chocolate salted caramel is chocolate - need I say more? 

Definitely a must when in SF!
author: Wendy L.

description: Their Mango ice cream is so bomb!!! But just be prepared to wait in line!!! They have a number system; when we got there, they had just called #11 and we were #41 and it took about 30 mins. But they were quick and helpful.
author: Michelle P.

description: Love their mango ice cream :) its got real mango and i swear i can smell it too while eating. they have plentiful of variety when it comes to ingredients and flavors. A small place and the staff is very cheerful even though the small place is choc a block with customers. They have to-go icecream cartons as well.
author: Lohit S.

description:
By far my most favorite ice cream parlor EVER. I make it a point to come here every time I visit SF, even if it means having ice cream at 10 PM. None of their flavors has ever disappointed me. My go-to order is coffee on a deliciously pungent waffle cone. Their flavors pack a punch without being too sweet (which is what I find with Bi-Rite & Marianne's). I can't wait to try their espresso toffee crunch (per their website is a summer specialty only). 

You have to grab a ticket upon entering to get in line (which is the first I ever heard of this for ice cream). When we first arrived, there was a line out the door even though it was close to 9 PM. We were thinking...this better be worth it considering it was freezing outside. And it sure was. Each subsequent visit, the line has gotten longer and longer, even though we keep going later and later. This place is a MUST if you're ever in SF!!
author: Charlene P.

description: This place was delicious! The line always seems to be long so good luck. Don't forget to grab a ticket! I tried their pistachio ice cream and it was to die for! I'm starting to crave it now... check it out! They don't have a parking lot, so try to find street parking! I suggest bringing a friend and dropping them off to grab a ticket while finding parking. It can take awhile to find parking in that area.
author: Brennen D.

description:
Horribly overpriced, overhyped ice cream. Seriously, wtf is wrong with people. Is there some special ingredients in the ice cream and fruity ice cream products that brainwash people because let me tell you, it doesn't work on me. 

Over $15 for a mediocre cookies n' cream milkshake served in a ghetto cup, and a pint of not-so-great ice cream. My friend and I were never impressed during the entire experience from walking into the shop all the way to finishing the ice cream. 

The ice cream is honestly the same quality and texture you find in grocery stores or even those liquor stores that have ice cream bins, so I'm not sure why everyone keeps raving about Mitchell's. While the flavor names seem to have originality, the product itself is just...bleh. There's no wow factor. There was Mexican Chocolate paired with Thin Mint for the pint, and while the Thin Mint was acceptable, the Mexican Chocolate was not Mexican enough for me! I also sampled the regular chocolate they had, and it's overhyped.
