The texture is off, the flavor lacks that chocolate punch you're supposed to get, and quite honestly Ben & Jerry's in the stores is even better than Mitchell's chocolate. 

Experience: As other reviews have said, you have to take a number when arriving, so don't look confused when you see a bunch of people just randomly standing around outside  with nothing in their hands but apparently waiting for something lmao. This shop needs more organization. Oh, beware of the INCREDIBLY ANNOYING Mitchell's culture of people cheering and clapping every time a number is finally called. I seriously just cannot. Btw why are there so many kids out late at night standing in these long lines with their parents just for boring ice cream? I thought kids were impatient LOL.

I'll be sticking to Humphry Slocombe, and even Smitten.
author: Marquis A.

description:
The unique flavors of ice cream available at Mitchell's is worth the visit alone. Pumpkin, Cherry Vanilla, mocha, Mexican Hot Chocolate, Horchata! 
Don't forget to grab a number ticket! There's a line for a number, then they'll call our numbers in order. We arrived at 30 and were number 54. We waited about 15 minutes to order. Not bad at all in my opinion. 
Simply put, the ice cream was great!
author: Mark W.

description:
You have to grab a ticket and wait for your number to be called so make sure you do that right when you arrive. Don't wait in a nonexistent line for a couple minutes like me. 

The wait is way too long for ice cream. Maybe you have to go at the right time of day. I went around the time people get off from work or school so maybe that's why it was a bit of a wait.

I got three scoops: mango, ube, and macapuno (young coconut) all tasted yummy but the price was over the top for some ice cream. 

I like that most of their special flavors are all Filipino related. 

I grew up having Mitchell's in the freezer so I've always loved their stuff but I didn't think a visit in person to one of their actual locations was this much of a hassle. I think I'll stick to buying their ice cream from the Filipino/Asian  markets.
author: Madelynn A.

description: SHOOK: this was our first time and we were so happy with the outcome. We got helped by Shook, whom was amazingly patient with us and let us try a million flavors and even gave us some of his own favorites. we ended up getting a single scoop of banana and a single sundae of chocolate and it was so creamy and so amazingly amazing that we couldn't help ourself but devour it. Shook should get a raise he was so helpful and nice and patient and overall had a great attitude.
author: Ariana E.

description:
What better way to soothe my throat after screaming at a concert than good ol' ice cream? My friend suggested Mitchell's after a concert at the Warfield and I'm so glad she did!

The line was long even on a late rainy evening. We had to take a ticket number and wait to be called. It took about 20 minutes to get to us. There are many flavors that I never heard of before, so I did quite a few samplings before I decided what to get. The guys working there were patient and friendly. In the end, I chose Lucuma, a Peruvian fruit. It is hard for me to describe the taste, but it has a slightly roasted caramel/butterscotch flavor to it, but not too sweet either. You just have to try it!
author: Michelle L.

description: The buy rite + Dolores park combo is a cool way to treat yourself on a Sunday, but if you want the best, head to Mitchell's. My favorite is the avocado ice cream or the ube (purple yam). Try some tropical and weird flavors not offered elsewhere. It's worth the wait, I promise! If you can't wait forever, grab a pint to go!
author: Michael M.

description:
There was a line going into this place at around 1pm on a Sunday, and you'll know it based on the crowd of people outside. You've got to grab a number and wait to get called, so don't uselessly stand in line! 

Finally got to try the ube ice cream on a waffle cone. The best part is that the scoops are huge, so I got to enjoy a beautiful heap of purple deliciousness. Their tropical flavors are supposed to be the best part about this place, so I will have to come back to try some more!
author: Sophie W.

description: This is one of the oldest and most original ice cream's that exist in San Francisco. I've known this place since I was in grade school where I even had the opportunity to learn how to make it, which was and continues to be the original formula for this great ice cream parlor.My favorite has been banana net reason room as tradition goes, but new flavors have come up and are as delicious as every other flavor they have at this point. Yes the lines are long and you can always see a crowd outside place, but the wait is worth it if you want something special. But if you know the flavor you want there's a express lane that can you can pick up your tub of ice cream and be in and out in less than five minutes.
author: Salvador G.

description: Great ice cream, terrible queuing process... They have a pull number system and so many people swarm the counter when it's not their turn and it just slows the whole process down. People also bring up an entire party of maybe 6 people and each have several samples which also drags it out. I think if their was a line people would have some sense of urgency and not just take their time. It would also be more orderly. Expect to wait at least 30 minutes, if not an hour for your turn. BUT beside that... the ice cream is great! There are so many unique flavors and staff are incredibly patient and attentive!
author: Annie N.

description:
Ending 2016 on a positive note! With the plethora of ice cream places in SF, we knew we wanted to try a new ice cream place during this past visit. Mitchell's is different from most ice cream places for the unique flavors they produce such as ube and spumoni, but they also have original flavors as well. 

Storefront is pretty big for an ice cream shop in SF. They even have a tiny parking lot in the back, although you're probably better off looking for street parking a block or two away. Remember that the minute you walk in, grab a ticket from the machine so that you're able to get your ice cream as soon as possible. Once they call your number, a worker will serve your entire party. Workers are extremely nice and patient, allowing you to sample multiple flavors. 

There are a variety of ice cream choices such as shakes or ice cream in tubs to-go, but we stuck with the basic ice cream in cones/cups. Scoops can be junior sized, single, double or triple. Junior is about $2.50 or so, and is definitely enough if you just want a small treat. 

Flavors: 
-Strawberry: very basic and original. Exactly how I expected this to taste. Solid flavor if you want to stick to something original. 

-Mango: reminiscent of the Asian melona melon bars. Loved the light and refreshing taste of the mango. Not too heavy and could really taste the mango flavor. 

-Toasted coconut: my dad really liked this favor, but I thought it wasn't sweet enough. Could really taste the coconut though.

-Ube: a big fan of this flavor! After trying it out, I knew I had to get it for myself. Very subtly purple yam flavor with just the right amount of sweetness. Would order this again!

All scoops can be in a cup or waffle/sugar cone. Sugar cone was amazing - could taste the subtle almond flavor of the crispy cone. 

tl;dr - should really try to come to Mitchell's if you're into ice cream and haven't tried this place yet. Really recommend the ube or mango!
author: Tiffany C.

description: Mitchell's is a San Francisco landmark. They have seasonal flavors including pumpkin, rum raisin and thin mint. The line is always out the door and Mitchell's always exceeds our expectations when it comes flavors, consistency and service. Be sure to grab a number at the door upon arriving too. They call out numbers to get served and I missed the red number machine the first time I visited Mitchell's. Service is always friendly and helpful. Also be sure to ask for a taste or sample of your favorite flavors or seasonal temptations. Tonight we ordered 3 milkshakes, one triple scoop waffle cone, one two scoop waffle cone and one water- the price came to around $30. Not a bad price for this quality of ice cream in my opinion.
author: Bernice G.

description: This place is a San Francisco institution. They offer more flavors that I can comprehend. And I love the exotic offerings and tropical flavors. My absolute favorite is the grasshopper pie dipped in chocolate. I must say that it almost change my life. I'll go on record saying I am a huge fan of Swensons sticky chewy chocolate. But I love this place for what it offers and it's unique selections.There's almost always a line so please be patient. It's definitely worth the wait. The ice cream is delicious and a nice treat once in a while.
author: Robert C.

description:
I don't know. The ice cream is good, but it for me it didn't live up to the hype. On the Monday after Christmas this year, the HYPE WAS REAL. I think we waited about 40 minutes. The lines were insane at around 9pm and it was 40 degrees!

Bae and I shared the chocolate caramel crackle and the kahlua cream. Both good, but not sweet enough for my taste. I mean, ice cream is supposed to be sweet right? I think I have to try some of their specialty flavors to appreciate this as much as everyone else is. 

Glad I tried an SF staple!
author: Priti K.

description: Great ice cream. Came here for Valentine's Day and enjoyed it. Friendly employees and lots of options. Love the local Pacifica cookies but I wish they warmed them up! And I wish they had more seating inside. There's none :/ the single scoop in a sugar cone for $3.15 is perfectly adorable and satisfying. I didn't have to get a huge one. I would come back if I was the area
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Listen up haters!!! It's yoona and I'm back with a new hot Yelp review for my fellow friends n foes. First of all, let me hit u with a warning - did u know that when you go in you should take a number??? Bc I did not and we waited for like 2 minutes without taking a number until I was like is that a number ticket machine??? And Andrew was like "take a number" but I thought to myself "you can't tell me what to do" as I took a number. And that friends, is why a caged bird sings. 

Anyway back to the lingo - this is an ice cream store. If u know this then you have surpassed many who have come before u. I had avocado flavor and wowza it tastes just like a real ass avocado!!! But before I carry on - I also had pistachio. I have a really big standard with pistachio ice cream. If it's green color I won't eat it because if you mash up a real pistachio, is it actually green??? I don't know bc I've never done it but I don't feel like it's natural for a natural girl like me (I like to keep my eyebrows as thick as they're going to grow on a Korean girl like me for the best natural girl look). The ice cream was white color. I ate it and it was yummo like ooooo!!!!!

I put a picture.
author: Yoona C.

description:
Pretty good ice cream. 

They open late so this was the perfect choice for dessert for us.

We got here 30 mins before closed, and we asked to try some samples. The thing I liked most was that, the Hispanic guy (forgot his name) who served us samples was super friendly and gave us super big chunks of samples, about 3 times as big as other ice cream shops. So definitely a PLUS. In fact, I just raised the review from 4 to 5 stars because of this alone.

Now onto the ice cream, they had both traditional and unique flavors here (ex. Purple Yam, Macapuno, Lucuma (what?) flavors)

All our samples were pretty tasty (the purple yam tasted a bit powdery), but the avocado flavor stood out the most, so I ordered it in a banana split, and another cone of butter pecan. 

The avocado ice cream tasted just like fresh avocado, and the avocado flavor was pretty distinct, so it was really good. Overall, good ice cream!
author: Tung D.

description:
I came here on Wednesday morning before the shop open. There are some people waiting there already. I bought Green Tea ice cream for 1/2 gallon (no sample). Some flavor like Lychee do not sell today. So call to ask your special flavor before. Anyway, there are many flavored of ice cream.
I bought 1/2 gallons for 4 flavores and it can keep for 3 weeks.
author: Katthy W.

description:
I finally had an opportunity to try Mitchell's Ice Cream and boy did it hit the spot perfectly.  After working on a Saturday, we needed some type of reward for our efforts.  Spent a bit of time looking for a parking space and we lucked-out and found a spot only two blocks away.  There was a line, so we grabbed a number and waited our turn.  

I ordered a double scoop of Grasshopper Pie and Pumpkin, one friend ordered a double scoop of Tropical 4 and Ube and another friend ordered a double scoop of Grasshopper Pie and Coffee on a waffle cone.  

The first thing I noticed was the size of their scoops.  They definitely don't skimp.  Secondly, the creamy texture of their ice cream was amazing.  Lastly, the flavors were on-point.  The Grasshopper pie was the perfect blend of Peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, Oreo cookies and chocolate swirled all around.  The Pumpkin tasted like eating Pumpkin Pie.

They had so many flavors to choose from that I had trouble deciding on what to order.  Luckily, we had to wait for our number to be called, which allowed me time to decide.  Once we got our ice cream, we along with other people stood outside enjoying our delicious treats.
author: Lon H.

description:
As a native of San Francisco, I have never tried this place until I was in my 30's. When I got here I didn't realize it was a number ticket system like the slowly dreadful DMV. Anyways, long story short, I grabbed a number and chit chatted outside because it was super busy. I think I was so engaged in my conversation on the phone that I didn't realize my number was skipped because when I looked back, my number had passed. (Completely my fault, I know).

  I walked up to one of the employees, who's name was Nestor, and told him my situation. He then provided me with excellent customer service and helped me right away. Because I thought maybe I might have had to grab another number and wait all over again. And while he was helping me, he was chatting it up with me and I learned he's a native as well because there's not many of us around anymore. He also let me sample a few flavors and I loved the coconut buco? (Spelling error) So that's the flavor I got. Thank you very much to Nestor and Mitchell's ice cream for the awesome service and delicious sweet ice cream!
author: Pudgy G.

description:
When I was looking up spots to try while in San Francisco, Mitchell's was a recurring name so I made it a point to pay a visit. If you're not from around the area (like we were), it might be easy to pass by the place if there's no line. We really only noticed it because of the small crowd gathered by the shop. Find some street parking OR park in the small lot around the corner. 

Somehow I missed the memo about getting a number. (I know, I know, everyone talks about it on Yelp - how did I miss it?!) I really think they should put a sign up front to get a number to minimize confusion when it's busy. We came on a Sunday after lunch so we waited probably like 10 min to be called. The reason why I knocked my rating down to 4 stars (3.5 but rounded up) is because of the craziness and lack of order. People cram into the little shop when their number is no where near to being called. People try to look at the actual ice cream containers instead of looking up to see the flavors. And people trying to pay for their ice cream all at the same time. Why?! WHY HAVENT THEY FIGURED OUT A BETTER SYSTEM? Also - idk, the service could've been better. You're serving ice cream, so would it kill you to smile and try to hide the annoyance you have?

But with that said, I actually loved the ice cream. I didn't try a lot (mostly because I was annoyed with the crowd), but the flavors I did try were satisfying. I love that they have an array of flavors. Especially love the Filipino flavors - macapuno ftw! I ended up going with horchata because I'm a San Diegan who can't imagine a world without good Mexican food. So good! Not too sweet. 

The ice cream itself was really the saving grace for this place. The fact that you can get unique and tasty flavors is really the one reason why I'd ever come back.
author: Carmina C.

description: This place is still by far one of my favorite ice cream shops! There's so many flavors, the prices are fabulous, and the portion is great. I absolutely love the buko flavor. I've tried many of their fruit flavors and they're stellar!!
author: Valerie N.

description:
Mitchell's is a real crowd pleaser indeed.  Don't be surprised when you expect yourself to wait a while to finally get your turn! Remember to grab a paper number to get in the queue!  AND it's cash only.

Mitchell's has a huge variety of ice creams. Seriously, a huge HUGE variety.  Whether you just want the plain standard flavors, go for a tropical/ethnic flavor, try a seasonal/holiday flavor, or you may want to explore your options and get one with a whole bunch of different toppings in it, that's cool too! I love that they have so different options- the only problem is not knowing which one to pick. 
You're welcome to sample flavors, the employees don't rush you when it's your turn.  I think they understand since you waited so long to get your number called, that they should spend a great amount of time with you if you want to try multiple flavors, have a big order, etc.  

Mind that there are a lot of families that visit Mitchell's, and it's just 1 long counter of display for their flavors.  So expect to say "excuse me" a lot to try to not be in any ones way and maneuver through the crowd.  

My favorite flavor of all time has to be grasshopper pie.  Seriously.  I think I have a thing for mint oreo ice cream though, so I might be biased. BUT Mitchell's is where I discovered that flavor first before anywhere else!  Definitely try out Mitchell's if you're in the area and love ice cream as much as me, you won't regret it at all! #noregrets
author: Tiffany Z.

description:
I finally tried this place out after bookmarking this 6 years ago. lol

We came around 9:15pm and this place was packed.  The tiny parking in the back was full and a few people were double parked in front.  My friend dropped us off while he searched for parking which he found about a block away.  We pulled a number to be called and waited about 45 minutes before our number was called.  However, we got lucky since this woman gave us her number since she and her kids gave up on waiting.  Her number was 15 and our original one was 28.  Our original number was around 45-50 minutes since they skipped a bunch in the 20s because people probably gave up waiting.

There were a lot of flavors to choose from but the Grasshopper Pie flavor sounded interesting.  I ordered a waffle bowl with 2 scoops (Grasshopper Pie and French Custard Vanilla) which was $6.60.  One of my friends ordered the the junior single cone with Egg Nog ($3.05) and my other friend ordered 2 scoops for his sundae which came out to $7.40.

The Grasshopper Pie was delicious as it was Oreo cookie (my favorite) and mint ice cream.  The Egg Nog tasted good as well and it wasn't super seat or anything like that.  I didn't try my friend's sundae so I won't comment on the taste but it looked good.

Good ice cream!
author: Daniel H.

description: Best ice cream place ever ... we had to wait 20 minutes but it's was worth it !!! Tropical flavors and Lucuma are the best !!!
author: German T.

description: I freaking love this place!! Their ice cream is creamy and affordable and they have a very wide selection of flavors!! Though they have a long line and little parking available, I believe this place lives up to it's hype. This is one of those places that you have to try when traveling from out of town andaybe buy a gallon of your favorite ice cream. They also have apparel for those who are real ice cream lovers!!! Love this place !!!
author: Freddie L.

description:
This is definitely one of the better ice cream places I've been to. There's constantly a line whenever I come here. 

What makes this place really great is the MASSIVE selection of flavors to choose from. Just a few of the favorites I've had include Mango, Ube, and Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup. Their fruit flavors, like the mango, taste surprisingly close to the real fruit. From what I can tell, you can pick and flavor and you won't go wrong. I'm a big fan of waffle cones, so that's my go-to, but sometimes you need more. That's when I'll grab a gallon - yes, not a pint, A GALLON OF ICE CREAM. They're huge.

Despite the long line, the wait is never bad, as they move pretty quickly. 

Their prices are pretty reasonable as well.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Expect long lines, so I recommend going on work hours.

Parking: street? We walked.

Price: About $5 for 2 scoops.

Food:
We got the peanut butter chocolate which I would not recommend
Coconut I would recommend. It tastes more fresh and good.

Service:  Poor, i don't know if it was just the employee who served us ice cream, but he was very inattentive and was not good at giving recommendations.
author: Krystle T.

description:
I love his place! 

It's busy so what you do is grab a ticket number off the wall and wait for your number to be called. 

So many options here! 

I really wanted to get the halo halo dessert here, but I didn't want to be disappointed cuz my favorite all time halo halo is located in Kauai, HI. 

I wanted to remember that flavor, but next time I will try that just to see if it's up to my standard. 

I ended up getting the Thai tea and the halo halo ice cream ( see I kinda compromised and tried it in an ice cream form) now that was cool and very unique. I've never had it in ice cream form and that was sure yummy! 

I enjoyed my ice cream and my service was very nice and let me try some samples. 

I can't wait to come back here and try their halo halo next time.
author: Chan T.

description: I grew up going to Mitchell's as a kid for a special treat,... and 25+ years later, I'm taking my family here now on special occasions.  Even with all the hipster ice cream concepts coming out, Mitchell's is consistently impressing with solid flavors and their tropical fruit twists.  I'll choose them every time.  And, the number-ordering system is awesome. Just grab a number and walk around; no need to be stuck in a line.  Hope we can enjoy it for decades to come.
author: Ky P.

description:
Too sweet... tooo toooo sweet for me!
The store is fine, ppl are fine, ice cream wayyyy too sweet.
author: Mary N.

description: The ice cream here is amazing! Very rich and creamy and tastes homemade.There are lots of unique and classic flavors to choose from. My favorites are the sweet coconut, pineapple coconut and banana. This place seems to be a busy tourist spot and for the size it gets rather crowded. They do have a number system so when you walk in you take a number from the machine on the left and wait your turn. People seems to crowd the cases to look even though all of the flavors are listed up top on the menu, so that is pretty frustrating. I recommend grabbing a number and stepping back until your number is called so that people can get assistance in a timely manner. Staff was helpful and friendly despite the rowdy crowd. I would definitely recommend trying this spot if you are in the area.
author: Ali M.

description:
I've been getting Mitchell's ice cream ever since I can remember.  My dad would frequently come home with a half gallon on Avocado ice cream which is one of my favorite flavors!  I've tried other brands like Dryers, Magnolia, etc. and they don't taste as good as Mitchell's.  The quality of their ice cream is spectacular: very creamy, not fluffy with air.

My other favorites are (in no particular order):
Ube
Langka (jackfruit)
Coconut Pineapple
Halo Halo
Cantaloupe 
Mango
Tropical 4
Green Tea
Coffee
Kahlua Mocha
Thin Mint

As you can see, pretty much their whole menu is delicious!  :)  I like eating the tropical flavors with rice crispies!!! It's a nice crunchy compliment to the sweet and flavorful cream! 

If you decide to buy half a gallon at the store, you don't have to take a number, just go ahead   on to the express lane to the right side of the store when you enter, someone will help you right away!
author: Acelyne P.

description: Come on! This is a no-brainer! No joke! This is the best ice cream I have ever had! Seriously! Chocolate Carmel crackle is CRACK!
author: Marcus S.

description: I always love Mitchell's... however the day I went it was 1030pm and it was crowded as usual. I brought my dog with me and we were waiting outside, I think his name was Nestor or Nelson the employee  was so sweet and brought my dog some dog treats. He literally went up and and out of his way to come and say hi and give us the treats. He also helped me out with getting my dessert...he was just so nice and helpful! I really appreciate it and even though they were getting ready to close he was still so nice!
author: sara c.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is the only place where I can find really good Rum Raising flavored ice cream. I usually just drive to the city to get a few half gallons of delicious ice cream! But be sure to try all their yummy flavors!

Line can get long though so if you want a scoop or two, you might gave to wait but its worth it!!!
author: Ara A.

description:
DEFINITELY lived up to the hype. After trying about five different flavors - each one being absolutely delicious - I decided to go for the ube ice cream. The texture of this ice cream was incredibly creamy and smooth, bursting with flavor after every bite that I took. The best part about the ube ice cream was that it tasted very fresh. I could tell that they used actual ube to make the ice cream. Even though I got the single scoop, the portion was quite generous. 

Even the service here was great. As you walk in, make sure to take a ticket asap. Each employee helps one customer at a time in order of ticket number, so as to ensure quick and efficient service. The employee who helped me out was extremely kind, as he encouraged me to "sample as many flavors as you'd like!" 

Overall, Mitchell's makes for a fantastic dessert, and was a great end to my day.
author: Alicia P.

description:
Slightly long lines, however it did not change my mind about how I felt towards their ice cream. After a long day of eating and drinking bubble tea, I thought I was done with eating for the day. The saying, "there's always more room for dessert" truly applied in my case!

My boyfriend and I shared the macapuno and ube ice cream on a waffle cone. Mitchell's ube was the best I've ever had, creamy and oh so addictive! It was definitely difficult to prevent myself from eating the whole thing. Still reminiscing about coming back for their ice cream, can't wait to try out their other flavors!
author: Kimberly T.

description:
This is one of those San Francisco staples. They have A LOT of flavors to choose from, maybe even too many. I only say that because you can't try more of them even with a big group. 

From Mexican flavors like dulce de leche and horchata to tropical flavors like mango and coconut to traditional rocky road and the more adventurous avocado. They have it all. In cones, bowls, shakes, smoothies, sundaes. This is definitely heaven. 

This place is so good, even when it's cold outside the line wraps around the street. You have to get a number and wait, but the plus side is that the attendants are quick. They also have two lines. One is for quick orders like pints and gallons. 

The only downside is they only have one card reader and it's bolted down the in the middle of the counter so it can get pretty crowded in that one area.
author: Sanz E.

description: Been coming since I was a kid and the ice cream has been amazing since I was a kid and has not changed at all. Lines get crazy in warm days but totally worth it.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Despite the long lines and horrid parking, Mitchells is a gem. I came in for the first time and had to get a ticket number...a freaken ticket number at an ice cream shop!! That was a first for me. I tried many of the flavors and they were all good. HUGE selection so you will for sure satisfy your taste buds. 

FUN FACT: Many dessert places or cafes tend to serve Mitchell's ice cream at their stores, which is how I knew about it. So you're likely to find Mitchells ice cream throughout the city!
author: Mary L.

description:
The husband was craving ice cream before we left the city so he had me search Yelp for one of the most popular ice cream shops in SF! Mitchell's came up and so we decided to head out there! It was around 6:00 pm and the lines were out the door and circled around the street corner! We were doubtful if we actually wanted to stay and wait in line cause not only was it cold outside for our little one to wait an expected 45 minute, but also was doubtful if it was even worth it! So we came up with the idea to have my older son and husband wait in line while my younger son and I waited in the car! It was literally a 30 minute wait to order 3 scoops of ice cream and what seemed to be another 30 minute to get our order! Really is this place that good?

As far as the ice cream goes we ordered the Halo-Halo, Mango and Grasshopper scoop which the lady in the counter recommended as the 3 top flavors! Halo halo ice cream had a taste of the traditional Filipino dessert, Halo Halo which includes buko, langka, ube, pineapple, mongo beans, sweet beans and palm fruit bits. It was definitely yummy since I do love the traditional Halo halo and wasn't overwhelmed with all the different flavors mixed in! The grasshopper pie ice cream had Peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, Oreo cookies and fudge swirls. Im not a fan of peppermint so to me it was just okay! Mango ice cream was just the traditional mango flavor like the one you can by at the stores! I don't even know why my husband wanted that flavor when its all some what taste the same! 

I wish i would have been the one to choose the flavors instead of my husband! Im sure I wouldve like the quality and flavors of the ice cream here! But i probably wouldnt want to waste an hour here just waiting around!
author: Charmaine D.

description:
Good but not great ice cream.
Not worth the drive and wait time.
Service was just okay.
author: G L.

description:
I had been dying to try this place for some time now. I remember the first time I came here, I gave up waiting in line and handed my number to someone else. Then I came here after dinner one evening with Nina Y. and we had so much time to spare because we had just eaten, and we were procrastinating on work. Of course.

Luckily it was a decently nice evening outside, so we just chilled as we waited for our number to be called. The service here is quite speedy, and I like how unforgiving with numbers they are. If you're not ready to be called, they will skip over you. Yes!!! This is how it should be done. We waited about 30 to 40 minutes on a Sunday evening for our number to be called, enough time for our dinner to somewhat digest.

There's lots of ice cream flavors on the menu and different types of desserts to order. I really wanted a banana split, but there's no way I could have eaten that. Instead I settled for a Cookie Monster milkshake, which was probably just as much ice cream. It was quite tasty, but I should have gotten a single scoop of Oreo ice cream instead. Oh well. It was a great experience, and I would definitely want to come back to try more of the popular ice cream flavors!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Hands down to their ice creams. So many flavors to choose from. I recommend the mango and macapuno the most. A must stop when you're visiting SF. Wished they make it bigger though. No seats inside but overall our experience was five stars.
author: Arlene S.

description:
Old school ice cream shop that has been kept in the family for a generation already. I was lucky enough to meet the brother/sister owner combo, and they were just a joyful delight in discussing the different flavors available, and how they've kept the shop in their family since their father, Mr. Mitchell, founded the store himself. 

Maybe it's because this ice cream shop is located in the heart of one of the most diverse cities in the country, but there are a lot of different flavors you may expect to see in more niche local shop. Everything from Polynesian ube (purple yam) to lucuma (Peruvian fruit). And what's more, each flavor is well above average in terms of creaminess, and flavor profile. The different options available are all freshly made, and taste like they're made with portions of the real ingredient that host their namesake. Not like some other shops that use more artificial flavoring. 

Only downside is (much like any place in SF) the lack of parking. Of course, this is an issue for any place in the entire city, and the fact that this is the biggest downside (and not price like many of the issues of silicon valley), is actually pretty commendable.

So keep on keeping on, and I hope your shop stays open for many more generations to come.
author: Daniel Z.

description: Mitchell's has to be a San Francisco staple. Shoutout to them for having flavors like Ube and Halo Halo!
author: Joshua H.

description:
Am I the only odd one out? I didn't quite understand what was so amazing about this ice cream shop. For being one of SF's top places, I guess I was expecting a wow factor to be delivered among my palette, but to no avail. After dinner, my girlfriend and I had walked on over. The small shop was crowded. We grabbed a number and waited for ours to be called. We sampled a number of things and not many completely sold me. I went with the grasshopper and butterscotch marble and my gf went with ube - both our choices were things we normally love elsewhere so it helped that they happen to be some of the most popular flavors here. 

The grasshopper was super minty but chocolately which I liked a lot! There's something about the refreshing and coolness of mint along with indulging in chocolate all at once that just makes an amazing combo. The butterscotch marble however was way too vanilla and not enough butterscotch. The real crime here was the ube. It didn't even deserve to be called ube! It had zero flavor to it and it definitely has no trace of ube to it either. It literally just felt like it was just unflavored ice. So disappointing!
author: Maleah M.

description:
I think the ice cream lives up to the hype, but a lot of the experience is spent in line and there really is no space to eat your ice cream. I know that wait time for a popular place is to be expected, however, I feel that the owners should try to do something to accommodate - we literally waited 45 minutes to get 2 ice cream cones. 

Also, I'm not sure if it is just me, but range of ice cream quality isn't too large. Their ice cream tastes great, but next time I would have to find a really good reason to wait 45 minutes to get something that I could get at a Baskin Robins in 5 minutes
author: Jackie C.

description:
I don't see why this place gets less than a 5 star review. Their ice cream is close to "to die for" category.

No matter how COLD it is outside.  As long as I have time in SF, I will come to visit.  My usual scoop - 3 scoops of Ube (Purple Yam).

Long line, I wish they have one closer to the city but anyhow, I guess I will keep continue to take J train to pay visit here follow by an Uber/Taxi ride back to hotel.
author: Ken H.

description: I loooove ice cream in general but Mitchell's has always been apart of my life. There's always a lot of flavors to choose from and even seasonal flavors like peach! Honestly I've seen some weird ones like avocado and pistachio BUT whatever floats your boat. There is also a very diverse menu and even gallons of ice cream you can take home! Very limited seating and ALWAYS a long line but it's definitely worth it. Definitely a San Francisco classic.
author: Bobbi A.

description:
the best ice-cream around!... always fresh and tasty!

shannon
author: Shannon L.

description:
They got me. They got me GOOD! I don't know what it is about this place, but I'm stuck on coming here regularly now. I kept hearing my partner and others refer to this as their go-to ice cream place growing up, but just didn't get it. Well, now I do, and now they've got me!

Situated in cute little Bernal Heights area and right off Guerrero, this place is a little gem. For those brave hearts who like to drive, there's a very small lot in the back for customers. Otherwise, you must brave the world of parallel parking if you choose to venture here by car. 

So here's how it goes: you come in and take a number as soon as possible. No one really tells you to do this, but you just infer by the others who are taking/glancing at their sheets of paper, anxiously awaiting their turn to devour this delicious dairy (and non-dairy) treats. By the time your number is called, hopefully you have used your time wisely to scope out all the flavors you would like to try (because, why not?) Finally, your number is called and you get to try all the delicious flavors that have made your mouth melt (since you have been checking out everyone else's treats- which is great use of your time). And you get to try all the mouth watering frozen goodies you like before choosing your selection. I've been able to try several different flavors that I probably never would have tried before. My favorites though are the Mexican chocolate, vanilla custard, ube, Lucuma, and the Butterscotch. But you honestly can't go wrong with any ice cream from here. And don't forget about the cones! They even have some that have been dipped in chocolate (and are Devine!)

I would be remiss if I didn't mention the excellent customer service! Seriously top notch and friendly and overall great. They really provide ice cream with a side of smile. 

So for those wanting to know: yes, it's totally worth it (line and all), and you definitely won't regret it!
author: Tracy T.

description: Mitchell's Ice cream is easily the best in SF. Think of a New York style classic deli, where you have to walk in and take a number, but with the best ice cream ever. My personal favorites are either the Mango or the Ube. But you also can't go wrong with  the pistachio. By the way, this is no hole in the wall, unknown shop, everyone knows about it so the line goes out the door and across the street. It's quite intimidating on weekends and on any summer day. About the only days you'll miss a line - either cold winter days or rainy days. But it's worth it, unlike lines at Disney land. Get the Ube; trust me! Cheers and have a sweet visit.
author: Chris O.

description: This is my all time favorite ice cream shop in San Francisco! I've been going here ever since I was a little girl and been a family tradition to go here every time we visit SF. Price is affordable with generous portions and customer service is great and efficient. Every time I go here, there's about a 30 minute wait but it's definitely worth it! My favorite flavors are mango, ube, avocado, cantaloupe (available in summer), and grasshopper pie!
author: Therese V.

description: UBE purple ice cream is a must.  We bought a tub and finished it very quickly.  Highly recommended.
author: Y O.

description: ICE CREAM!!!!! I usually get the sundae of the month or the milkshakes...they have so many flavors,definitely have a taste or two lol...there halo halo is also good
author: jonathan h.

description: I have been here twice now and both times were fantastic. the first time I ordered a shake (which isn't what they are most popular for) and it was super good. The second time I ordered a few of the tropical flavors. The service was great. I tried probably 15 different flavors before I settled on the ones that I wanted. The fruit flavors are light but taste like the real fruit rather than sherbet or artificial candies. There is almost always a line so make sure you grab a number as soon as you get there rather than trying to wait behind someone thinking you will order soon. Parking can also be pretty tough so plan accordingly!
author: Jill R.

description: Let me start off by saying I actually don't like ice cream lol, I'm more of a dairy free frozen yogurt typa gal. But my sis and her two kids were in sf and everyone voted on ice cream so we came out here. I decided to try to tropical flavored ice cream (I forget what it was called) in the kiddie size cause I usually can't eat too much ice cream, but boy did I regret getting the smaller size later  it had wonderful tropical fruit flavored, didn't taste too creamy, and wasn't overly sweetened. I plan on returning to try out other flavors  cause no one wanted to share their ice creams that day
author: Zainab J.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream is the go to place if I ever want ice cream. I'm not a huge ice cream fan but this place is good. They have tons of flavors and they are always busy. I usually go at a good time, but shortly after they get packed. They are dog friendly, there was a myth that was told to me that you can ask for a "doggy cone" in which its a cone with vanilla ice cream for your dog, but I have not tried it for my dog. 

I always try to get different flavors, but ultimate flavors I seen bought is the grasshopper pie . They sell the pint sized ice cream to go home, and their ice cream cakes are pretty good.  They do have decent parking in the back, but its always filled up with the people who go there.  

All in all the ice cream made is pretty good out of most places I've been. Most places I've been the ice cream is too soft to my liking. The serving size is just right for me. The flavors are great as well. They do samples if you decide you don't know what you want , you can ask for a sample.

Overall service is great and quick, you get a number and they go through it pretty quick and easy.  If your in the neighborhood I would def try this place out.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
I mean, sorry to be just one of the million people who think the same, but Mitchell's ice cream is the best! We have tried pretty much all famous ice cream place in the Bay Area by now, but we always end up going here, Probably as often as by weekly hehe. 

I am hooked on tropical four. A perfect blend of mango, banana, guava, and pineapple that creates instant happiness in your brain! Nothing can top this. 

Well done Mitchell's . Please don't ever change!
author: Cartman P.

description: Always the best to go in San Francisco especially on heat days! Lines are always extremely long regardless the weather but that just means it's really good ice cream. If you want fast service get pints & go to the quick service line. Staff are always friendly & fast!
author: Lori. S.

description: Grasshopper pie, ube, buko, and avocado are my favorites here. Getting a tub of ice cream is the best thing to share for a holiday or when watching Netflix. You can find tubs of Mitchell's around supermarkets in the bay. Mitchell's is iconic in the ice cream sphere of SF. Their recipe is one that works and they have a loyal following. It's not the most accessible place. So, many times, I had to make a quick turn with someone tailgating me.
author: Jaime F.

description:
I love going to Mitchell's after work with friends. They're a good old fashion ice cream shop with some more unique flavors such as avocado (yum!) and ube. If you're in a hurry (or just want more for later), they sell their ice cream in pre packaged containers so you can get in and out quickly. They also sell packaged candy & snacks in the store, but I rarely look at them.

One of the few flavors I've tried and didn't like at Mitchell's was their peppermint ice cream which included giant chunks of peppermint ice cream in it (who wants to eat hard candy with their ice cream!?). If you're in the area and in need of a sweet treat, make sure to stop by Mitchell's!
author: Christine L.

description: Prepare for a wait, but the wait will be absolutely worth it. My friend and I came on a Sunday night and were greeted by a small-ish line outside the storefront. As the minutes passed, I agonized over the dozens of unique and delectable flavors to choose from. When our number finally got called, I tried the Ube and Mango which were both refreshing, but I wanted something a little more heavy. I ended up getting the Mascarpone Mango which was a perfect marriage of refreshing mango sorbet and Italian cream cheese ice cream. Ice cream at Mitchell's was the perfect ending to my weekend in SF.
author: Diane M.

description:
Well we had driving by last night, and at around 8pm it was packed. So we thought we would give it a chance after our dinner. Since it has open until 11pm we went there around 10ish. It was even more busy then.

I never have seen a ice-cream place where you have to pick a number! But i see why you have to. This place is crowded and you better bring some time to shop.

Hand down the ice-cream is good, coming from europe we know some pretty good places.
They are not to fancy and made a pretty good and delicious ice.

Would love to get some more crazy stuff, but from what i saw yesterday they are changing the flavours and we will be back - and i am sure that they will deserve the last star then.
author: Martin W.

description: Went here on Friday night for the first time ever. My friends were visiting the Bay Area for a wedding, and two of my friends used to live in the area and knew about this place as did I. Another friend had a craving for ice cream, and we decided to go here; however, there is a catch. They close at 11:00 every night, and at 10:40 we were on the other side of town. Luckily, my friend knew some shortcuts and we got there in 10 minutes. When we got there, the line was out the door and there were still more people coming in behind us. When it was time for my friends to order, they each got a sundae. As for myself, I wanted a shake, and decided to get a Oreo Cookie Shake and it was one of the best shakes I have ever had in my life.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Tiny little spot, flavors from all over the world. Not bad of the line when I went. Everything from I've to Mexican chocolate, along with classics like cookies and cream done better then I've ever seen.
author: Adrien M.

description: First ice cream stop from the east coast.  I'm a game of Ube and unfortunately the east coast lacks in Philippino flavors.
author: Imanah G.

description: Whenever I come back to tell Bay Area I make it a point to come here and have some "REAL" ice cream! I live in Vegas but no place in the 702 compares to Mitchell's in the 415!!!
author: J M.

description:
Rated top 10 ice cream joints in SF. Homemade ice cream since 1953. 

Tried a bunch of flavors and I finally got their #1 seller "mango". The flavors I did try was pretty good as well but mango got me at "hello". And honestly if you follow my reviews mango is never my go to flavor so it's pretty telling just how delicious Mitchell's mango is. 

How it works: go in and grab a number. Don't be fooled by the long unorganized line outside the shop. There's an overhead where they will call your number. Once they call it then go in quick status to purchase their deliciousness. 

There will be a line but it does seem to go pretty fast. What I also noticed during my visit is ppl tend to grab the numbers and leave. Which makes it even faster. But if you decide to stay and wait then make sure you pay attention to your number. Common courtesy for others who are waiting and for the staff. Overall I would totally recommend Mitchell. Besides the wait the ice cream was very good. The right amount of firmness, good texture, it's homemade, reasonable price, fair scoop size, and great flavor bang in each ice cream flavor option. A solid 2 stars!!

Tips: 
street parking. 
Cash and credit card accepted. 
Sells pints to go. 
Limited benches outside. No dine in option. 
No restroom. 
Free samples.
Charges for toppings. 
Makes cakes.
author: Lisa D.

description: We got a birthday ice cream cake for our daughter and it was very good. I got coffee ice cream today, and it was rich coffee flavor, which I like. I'm a big fan of coffee ice cream and still miss coffee ice cream at Quincy creamery, MA(They get ice cream from the local farm). It was the BEST coffee ice cream ever, but now I'm glad I found one at Mitchell's ice cream.
author: Jeanne W.

description:
I almost wish they weren't as generous with their samples, because by the time I was done trying everything, I was pretty full. But of COURSE I still got a double scoop since I'm a fatty. 

The ice cream is very rich and creamy, almost sticky in texture. The flavors range from sweet and decadent to light and fruity. I enjoyed the young coconut and ube very much, but wanted something more indulgent this time, so I picked the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream, oreos, fudge, chocolate chips) and toasted almond. They have pre-packaged half gals to go, which is TOTALLY worth it for the price/value. 

Shout out to the spectacular service. I am extremely indecisive when it comes to desserts, because I have a strong case of FOMO and sometimes regret not getting something else. My server was so patient and offered samples of flavors he liked that I didn't even ask for. I've worked in an ice cream shop myself, and I was NEVER that nice about it when people took their sweet time, so props to him.
author: Karen S.

description: Make sure you pull a number! Love the Pistachio and Roasted Almond. Grab either in the shake form if you're on the go and want to savor just a bit longer. Love Mitchell's. SF Institution for sure!
author: Justin Y.

description: Tried this weekend when it was quite hot. Mango + New York Cherry. I was pleasantly surprised with the Mango. Tasted like it was made from mangoes from India. the cherry ice cream was good too. After Salt N Straw, this is my fav ice cream place in SF.
author: Pramod G.

description:
I will dedicate my 800th review to a longtime SF institution and family-owned for decades.  I love how this tradition continues with my kids; they crave Mitchell's when we're in the Mission.  Did you think I was going to say Bi-Rite?

It's nostalgic to walk into Mitchell's Ice Cream!  Parking is horrific though, but it's all worth it after circling the blocks.  Their back lot is usually full and quite tricky of an angle to get into, especially with oversized vehicles.  We avoid coming on weekends or super hot days aka Indian Summer in SF (late September & early October).  

Irish Coffee is my favorite post-meal dessert and satisfies my craving.  I told our son after he gets his tonsils removed, he can have all the ice cream he wants LOL!  I also love buying their 1/2 gallons to take home for later.  With so many delicious flavors, I want them all.  I'm craving Irish Coffee, Ube, and Avocado as I type this =)

'Til we meet again ~ see you on Yelp (SYOY)!
author: Christine R.

description:
The best ice cream in the country. I've moved cross country and still dream of Mitchell's every time I eat ice cream.

Unique (and millions of) flavors, friendly service.
author: Kailey C.

description:
How have I never reviewed them? Unbelievable ice cream. Me, I go for all of the Filipino flavors, and the South American lucuma, every time.

But super duper lucky for me, an Hispanic ice cream shop literally up the street from me sports Mitchell's,& they do have lucuma!

Parking is a bear, and a def turnoff for me. I've usually read or watched Netflix, because folks, the line here has got to rival Berthillon's!!
author: Jana C.

description: Mitchell's BEST BEST ice cream hands down! Grasshopper pie is my favorite! Any day is a GREAT day for ice cream check them out!
author: Lupe G.

description:
There is no organized line so make sure you grab a number when you walk in the door! Fortunately, my boyfriend and I came late on a Monday night so there were only a couple people in front of us. You're supposed to wait for your number to be called to approach the counter. Regardless, they were pretty nice about it! 

Ask for samples if you can't decide! During this visit, the boyfriend and I shared a double scoop of Thai tea and grasshopper pie. I thought both were really flavorful and creamy, though a little too sweet for me. We couldn't decide on a cone or cup, so the guy just stuck our scoops in a cone, and stuck the whole thing in a cup for us. Best of both worlds! :p They also sell in gallons, as well as ice cream cakes. 

There is a tiny lot in the back. I've driven by when there was a line wrapped around the corner, so you're probably better off finding street parking if you see a large line. As this place is near my house, I can see myself visiting when I highly crave ice cream!
author: Kristi T.

description:
Probably one of my favorite ice creams evaaaaaa, YES, BETTER THAN BI RITES!, even though I like that place too...

ANYWHO, there is just something in Mitchell's ice cream that makes it just extremely creamy while at the same time soooo delicious!      I enjoy every bite or lick...

They have way more flavor selections than bi-rite  and you can also buy a tub of your favorite flavor to take home.  I LOVE their mango ice cream AND their Kalua Mocha flavor is to DIE.  You gotta try!  They have a lot of Filipino tropical flavors but got your traditional flavors as well.

The only thing about this place, and I'm not docking any stars just because it's understandable, is that it gets super PACKED and I mean literally PACKED. It's very small, like bi-rite but wider, and when you go at a super busy time, people just pack themselves in there since it's soo cold outside....its SF so yennoe.  Speaking of SF, of course parking is scarce, however, they do have a SMALL parking lot in the back, fits less than 10 cars.  The workers there are fast though so you won't have to wait that long and there's always a crowd of them working.  They are all very helpful and sweet as well.

It's absolutely WORTH IT and you gotta try to see what I mean!
author: Precious Ethel P.

description: Yup...i live 4 blocks from here. There is always a line. Worst of all is Sunday afternoon when all of San Francisco heads here for ice cream. It is a small store without anywhere to sit that looks like the type of place that outgrew its venue. My boyfriend is obsessed with this place because they have Lucuma ice cream. I got the chocolate and pistachio. The ice cream is super creamy and thick. The flavor choices are impressive. The only downside of this place is that there is no where to sit and enjoy!
author: Anne S.

description: When I'm far from home, I put on my Ruby slippers, click my heels together and repeat, "There's no place like Mitchell's, there's no place like Mitchell's, there's no place like Mitchell's." I can't tell you how I much I wish this worked. It doesn't, but it does remind me to get back here quickly when I get home. Mitchell's has The Best Ice Cream in San Francisco. No one else comes close.
author: David K.

description: Great Ice Cream! Even better Milkshakes! Amazing customer service despite it being very busy and having a long line out the door and around the corner ... very limited parking.
author: Raul A.

description:
Mitchell's does things a bit differently than your typical ice cream shop. Instead of having a long line, you take a number and wait for yours to be called. Beware that it's definitely hard to find parking in this area and although Mitchell's does have a parking lot behind it that you could check out, it's on the smaller side and we weren't able to find any available spots.

On the Saturday night that I dropped by, Mitchell's was at about number 30 and the number I got was 80. Luckily, a kind soul had to leave and gave me his number so I ended up getting served at 60 but these 30 numbers took about 30-45 minutes. Keep in mind that not everyone who takes a number stays around to wait so it can be hit or miss with how long it'll take you to get served. There's a little counter on the wall that tells you what number they're currently on. 

When it was my turn, I tried the grasshopper pie, avocado, mango and passionfruit! Although the flavors are good (but not phenomenal), what really shone through about Mitchell's for me was the fluffiness and creaminess of the ice cream. It's really melt-in-your-mouth delicious!
author: Nancy T.

description:
Mitchell's is SO GOOOOOOOD!!! Their selection is amazing that actually has me picking different flavors each time I visit. I do have my go-tos - Mexican Chocolate and Toasted Almond *DROOOOOOOL - but really there are so many good options that I am never disappointed to rotate my order selection. Just the other night I had Peanut Butter Indulgence - yum!!! My favorite seasonal flavor is cantaloupe. 

You can have the ice cream served in a couple of different ways  - in a cup, in a cup or waffle cone, cookie sandwich, sundae, or milkshake. They also have Filipino flavors and sell packs of ice cream as well. If you get your single scoop order in a cone, it's a large serving! 

Overall, very good. Also - when you get there, don't forget to pull a number. The place can get really crowded, especially in the summer. Otherwise, ENJOY!!!
author: Stella T.

description: Yummy Ice cream ! Always busy busy  and long wait line . But their ice cream are good and lots of variety
author: Gret C.

description: Best Ice cream ever!. I'm local and loved this place . Ice cream is creamy and soft with variety of flavors. If you're in SF must step by this place .Be patient waiting 'cause it would worth it - 10 - 15 approx you might going to see a lot of people but the staff moves fast.  Paking in the back is very convenience.
author: Morena M.

description:
Mitchell's is amazing. Luckily, it's close to where I live so I can drop by when it's less busy. Pro tip: come on a weekday to avoid long lines. Otherwise you'll have to wait 30-60 minutes by taking a number. 

The special thing about Mitchell's is that they not only have a large variety of flavors, but also their flavors are quite unique (Mexican chocolate, cantaloupe, grasshopper pie etc.) and they are generous with serving BIG portions. I have never found the texture of ice cream to be different from other shop's but in my mind it's definitely the portions and flavor options that deem it a 5.
author: Lucy G.

description: Always yummy, always packed! Got the pineapple coconut on a waffle cone and it was bomb!  I sampled halo halo and loved it.  There is also another coconut ice cream with a unique name that I cannot recall.  All 3 were delicious...if you want something tropical, you won't go wrong with either.  Staff is friendly.
author: Celina A.

description: So many flavors to choose from! They have ube (purple yam) ice cream that was interesting and avocado flavor one as well. I personally like the macapuno (sweet coconut) as it tastes like coconut and has legit coconut meat in it. We went about 30 min before closing and there were still about 15 people standing in line to order. You can sample as many flavors as you want before ordering.
author: Jessica Y.

description:
This is a SF Institution - an old school, mom and pop ice cream shop. They really don't make them like they used to. Please know that Mitchell's is the REAL deal. . 

What can I say that hasn't already been mentioned before.
- Parking is limited, so be prepared to circle the block(s) a few times
- Get your number to the left of the front door
- Long lines, so bring your patience
- Amazing flavors from old standbys like Vanilla, Chocolate, as well as the more fun/bold flavors like Tropical 4 or Ginger. Side note, this was one of the first ice cream spots in the Bay Area to have the exotic Philippine flavors (like Mango, Ube, Macapuno).
- Hardworking and friendly staff (so tip them accordingly)
- Other international goodies and sweets (like Philippine dried mangoes and barquillos; and Pocky flavors galore, etc.,)
- Limited seating indoors and one bench outdoors, so you may need to walk and eat or sit on the sidewalk to enjoy your frozen treat

It doesn't matter if it's a cold and foggy SF wintery night in  December OR a warm Indian summer day in October, there's always a good time for Mitchell's! 
Go on and get your Mitchell's scoop on!

Cheers!
author: Gill C.

description: I came to San Francisco and looked around for dessert places. I saw the pictures and reviews for this place and decided to give it a try. It's a small ice cream place that offers a lot of difference ice cream flavors. There was a lot of people meaning there was a long line but I was helped relatively quick. The only reason why I'm giving this a 4 star is because they were out of a lot of flavors. I asked for my fiirst two choices, didn't have it; ended up going for my 6th choice and I hated how I had to hold up the line since there were a lot of people waiting. Other than that, everything went great! Customer service was good.
author: Abby S.

description: I had their new flavor hazel dough soooo good. I can't wait to come back and try their different flavors. You can tell the ice cream is great by how much people came
author: Melissa P.

description:
Best ice cream in bernal heights. Better than birite? Not sure, each have their own unique flavours. I got the grasshopper pie. Very good.

Parking: They have a very small parking lot in the back, if it's full you will need to find street parking.

Pro-Tip: just walk in and grab a number, you don't need to stand in line. Also come on a week night. We waited less than 15 minutes.
author: Tom P.

description: so good! Got the toffee crunch espresso. I love their waiting system. No lines just a token system. My friend got the cherimoya which was amazing too. My favorite however was the coconut pineapple. SO delicious!
author: Ashmita V.

description:
Mitchell's is the [ice] cream of the crop! It's my go-to ice cream shop when I'm in SF for a multitude of reasons: they have an expansive selection of flavors, the portions are generous, they use quality ingredients, the service is top-notch, and prices are super affordable.  

Although there are some businesses in SF that actually carry Mitchell's, as well as specialty grocery stores that sell their products by the pint, I still prefer coming to their dedicated store location for the freshest ice cream.  I love how the staff isn't stingy about allowing customers samples because they totally understand that narrowing down your order is serious business and people need to make educated decisions.

I've noticed they carry a lot of more "exotic" flavors such as ube, coconut, jackfruit, avocado, halo halo, etc. which are all made with ingredients imported from the Philippines. Although I can't speak to the ube/halo halo which seem to be pretty popular, the others are all fantastic, particularly the creamy avocado.  My default order, however, is the chocolate caramel crackle.  I normally prefer vanilla to chocolate based ice cream but the choc. caramel crackle reminds me of a better version of Ben & Jerry's phish food and the only way you can be the judge is if you try it for yourself!
author: Virginia T.

description: Mitchell's ice cream was on the next level. Seriously this ice cream will make your day better. They have really unique flavors. Highly suggest checking them out!
author: Joe P.

description: Super duper yummy flavors and as a first timer, I may be making a mistake but I went with a milkshake vs. scoops of ice cream. Horchata was the chosen flavor and is super delectable! Tip: make sure you grab a number or you'll be waiting forever bc that's how they start the line process! Very very satisfied.
author: Alex W.

description: This review is for the quality of the take home buckets. I purchased a half gallon of the vanilla custard. It was so creamy and luscious. It held up well in the freezer as well not that it lasted long  make sure when you get there you don't just start waiting in line walk up to door and grab your number we didn't know that and wasted some time.
author: Daisy O.

description: This place is simply the best ice cream I've ever had in my life. I'm so lucky to have grown up in San Francisco and have the opportunity to eat this whenever I'm craving it. They make it from scratch all the time in the back in the ice cream is super tasty and fresh. You can't beat it!
author: Robyn M.

description:
Grab a number ticket.

Decide what you wanna get. 

Wait until they call you.

Get your ice cream.

Pay.

Eat.



The flavors are too exotic for me. Classic is the way to go.
author: Evan W.

description:
Come on now. SF Natives and newcomers alike can agree that Mitchell's is one of a kind.  Their customer service and selection can't be beat.  From classics to tropical flavors, there's something for everybody.  

Downfalls might be parking or crowds, but it's San Francisco, it's expected.  

If you're new to Mitchell's or wanting to try something new, I'd recommend the Grasshopper Pie; if you enjoy mint ice cream (BEST mint ice cream I've ever had). Ube; if you want to try something purple... (and the best flavor God has ever bestowed on this planet, go for it).  And if you're a peanut butter cup kinda gal or fella try the Peanut Butter Indulgence.  

You don't have to take my word for it, they'll gladly let you sample anything your heart desires.
author: Antonette S.

description: My favorite ice cream spot in the city for the past 10 years! Love the texture, perfect amount of creaminess, and vibrant flavors of their ice cream. Don't come here expecting frou-frou flavors like many of the new creameries you see in SF now. Mitchell's offers a solid selection--some fun flavor profiles (check out their tropical flavors!) along with the basics. I prefer fruity flavors and they have a great selection here. If you're in the mood for something boozy, their rum raisin is pretty great too. Depending on what time/day you come, there could be no line at all or the line could be out the door. Parking can be difficult but the ice cream is so yummy and so worth it!
author: Tina H.

description:
If I'm craving for undisputed creamy fruity flavors, Mitchells is the place to go.  Avocado, cantaloupe, young coconut, mango are some of my personal faves.

If you're adventurous craving for flavors like sea salt caramel sashimi ice cream with unicorn pebbles, this isn't the place for you.
author: Herissa C.

description: Probably one of my favorite ice cream places in SF! The flavors there are very unique and taste awesome. The atmosphere makes you feel like you are a kid again because there are just so many choices! My favorite I would have to say is the Thai Tea (which is seasonal) or the Halo-Halo (Filipino Dessert and they usually have it all year long).
author: Kailah M.

description: My family has been going to Mitchell's ice cream for decades. Best Ice Cream in town! My favorite is their Mango Ice Cream and their Rocky Road. The Ube (purple yam) ice cream is also very good. You have to be patient here. The lines can be very long especially on hot days. There's a small parking lot out back but your best bet is to find parking along Dolores Street. Enjoy!
author: Mel V.

description: Excellent flavors especially the fruits! Excellent staff especially Leland! He really took care of all our ice cream needs! Thanks!
author: Ma R.

description: One of the best ice cream places in San Francisco. I had the single cup Oreo Cookie ice cream with a caramel topping. Since I'm usually used to having not a lot of caramel on my ice cream when I asked for a caramel topping, I thought Mitchell's would only give me a little bit. Pleasantly surprised that they gave me much more than I expected, a lot actually! Great ice cream and really good customer service, highly recommended!
author: Kangaroo K.

description: I've been to Mitchell's a few times now and I give them major props for having such a wide variety of flavors. My favorite is definitely the grasshopper pie because that's a flavor you probably won't find anywhere else. For the most part, all their ice cream flavors are very creamy and rich in flavor. Service is great, but watch out cause there's almost always a line and they close at 11pm! There is also pretty limited parking too (only street parking in the front and maybe like 6-7 spots of parking the back).  It's worth giving this place a try!
author: Amy L.

description:
Pretty good ice cream, but with so many superior choices in SF, it's hard to recommend Mitchell's above the others.

Go instead to Smitten, Salt & Straw, or Swensens.
author: Justin J.

description: If you are craving for an ice cream in SF, this is a place to try. Whether you want a scoop or two... gotta try them. They have a lot if flavors to choose from. They are not cheap but I guess that is the normal cost of any ice cream place. At times, line can be long but I don't mind. It just bothers me if I have to wait in line outside when it's cold and windy!  I do buy the pint since I love pistachio and it's hard to find in my local grocery.
author: Jen C.

description: John, is the MAN. He deserves the biggest raise ever. I was waiting on my 30th birthday and John offered to give me a taste of whatever I wanted. Of all thw wonderful things that happened on my birthday John made my day. Thanks again Mitchell's!
author: Christina G.

description: I always have a blast every time I come to this place when I go get some ice cream, ice cream is the best the wonderful feeling because it taste so good
author: Nina R.

description:
I have loved this place for its unique flavors since I was a kid.  This yummy flavored store was well before BI-Rite and other gourmet ice cream stores.  
One downside is the long lines and parking since sometimes I don't have time to wait with 2 toddlers as we head back to the Peninsula.  
Mitchell's you have always provided great service and quality ice cream!  I wish I could have you more often.
author: Karen E.

description: This tends to be a neighborhood favorite but a little overrated if you ask me... the lines are ridiculously long and there's nowhere to sit to enjoy your ice cream, not to mention parking is hard to find. You'll be driving in circles for quite some time. The ice cream is good but not anything different than the next place... least to me... I recently tried their Dub Nation float and oh my... never again. It was extremely sweet, talk about a sugar rush! I couldn't get passed three/four spoonfuls. Money down the drain.
author: Dee G.

description: Yesssss. Historic gem of San Francisco. I loved all my life here and finally got to taste Mitchell's. I know I'm horrible. But man o man. This place is amazing. Fresh and so clean. I loved my experience so much that I brought home two half gallons.
author: Summer M.

description:
Good old fashioned style ice cream, rich and thick consistency.

There were so many flavors I wanted to try, but already having had tacos in the Mission and a scoop at Humphrey Slocombe, I only had so much room left. We ended up getting two flavors:

- Peanut Butter Indulgence: chocolate ice cream with gobs of PB and peanut butter cups. I wanted this to be more peanut buttery.
- Grasshopper Pie: one of their most popular flavors so I felt I had to try it; so glad I did.

PS First timers, don't be intimidated by the crowd of people flowing out the door. Grab a number, figure out what you want to order, and wait to be called. When I was there the scoopers were pretty fast.
author: Lindsey C.

description: One one my favorite places to eat ice cream except my favorite flavor is only available during the summer.. Cantaloupe ice cream is my favorite... yummy.
author: S C.

description:
A classic San Francisco ice cream place. Mitchell's has great quality ice cream that's made on-site and they have 5 bajillion flavors roughly. 

I try something new every time, but some of my favorites include: the grasshopper pie, mocha fudge, pumpkin, thin mint, and their vanilla bean. And I tend to top it off with hot fudge because it is amazing and that's never a bad idea.

Honestly, you cannot go wrong with any flavor here. They have flavors other places usually don't have, like ube (purple yam), lychee, langka (jackfruit), and countless others if you're feeling like something different. 

There is always a line and it does get cramped in the small space, but time passes fairly quickly with efficient workers and the promise of delicious ice cream awaiting you. 

$, they have a private lot but it's always full and street parking is meh but be patient and circle the block a couple of times. Must try!
author: Stefanie S.

description:
In my opinion, the key strengths here are the variety of flavors, particularly Asian-inspired ones, as well as the cheap prices and huge portions. The prices are even cheaper on special occasions like National Ice Cream Day.

Overall, the ice cream is enjoyable. Not necessarily as mind-blowing in overall taste or consistency as what I've gotten from Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe, but still perfectly acceptable in its own right. 

Definitely recommend as a neighborhood favorite or as part of an ice cream foodie tour of the West Bay and Bay Area. Added bonus: they're open fairly late every day.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Grasshopper pie!  We stopped in after some ramen and I wanted something sweet.  After reading the reviews I went with the grasshopper pie recommendation.  It was very good.  Mint ice cream and crushed Oreos in a waffle cone.  The only way to have it!

Tip: you need to get a number to get in the queue.
author: Nyla K.

description:
Grab a number like in the old butcher shop days and wait for your number to be called to order! 

They have a good variety of flavors here from the classics to unique new flavors, some with an islander influence 
---grasshopper pie: mint ice cream with Oreos?! Yes please! Never had this combo before and I am a fan. Although the ice cream texture itself was pretty standard 

NOTE: a waffle cone is just 50 cents extra!
author: Jenny S.

description:
A San Francisco classic! Nothing compares to the classic taste of Mitchell's ice cream. I've had Mitchell's for as long as I can remember, and if you decide to have a scoop or two from the store expect a wait. But, the wait is well worth it as you can taste the unique ingredients and the care put into making all of their ice creams. If you don't have time to wait, taking a tub home is also a great idea. 

My favorite flavors have to be their Buko, Mango, Coffee, Ube, and Toasted Almond. The Buko is young coconut that isn't overly sweet with little pieces of fresh coconut mixed inside. The Mango is on the sweeter side but not overly sweet, more of a natural sweet. If you like strong coffee flavor, their Coffee ice cream is a must for you it's very delicious. 

Overall, if you have a chance, you must make time for this San Francisco treat. Whatever flavor you choose, you'll be satisfied for sure!
author: Jenna B.

description:
We went on a Saturday night after dinner and it was crowded as expected. We waited about 10-15 minutes before they called our number. 

Ended up getting mango, strawberry and Ube. The strawberry was the best!!!! One of the best strawberry ice creams I've had. Mango was tasty as well. Ube was interesting and I saw a lot of people getting this flavor. 

They have so many flavors to choose from - want to come back and try the others!
author: Fatima S.

description: Their ube ice cream is AMAZING! Didn't know what to expect- I've never had it before.. it was creamy and not too sweet.. so good.. I am a fan!! I also tried the Kahlua flavor which was delicious! Will definitely be stopping by again to try more flavors! Grasshopper Pie is next on my list..
author: Christine S.

description: I've been told that this ice cream shop has been around for a very long time. Have a scoop and you'll know why. They have so many interesting flavors that make it difficult to decide which to choose. I've been here over 2 dozen times since we moved to SF. The cantaloupe, mango, red bean and ube are amongst some of my favorites. Staff is great, friendly, fast and good at what they do. It's also very clean inside. They have a parking lot in back but there are only a few spaces. Street parking can be difficult but the wait for ice cream is harder to endure than finding a space in the neighborhood.
author: An N.

description:
Long lines.. Take a number and you're called maybe 20-30 numbers later. We're visiting from SoCal, and loved it. The mango is like you're eating a fresh Manila mango. The ube is like the kind you taste from the street vendors in the Philippines. The Avocado is my favorite:) 

Worth the wait, I'd say! Get a double in a waffle cone;)
author: Anna K. S.

description:
Now THAT is ice cream. Yes, I'm looking at you, all you Smitten's and Slocombe's of SF with your ridiculously overpriced, small ice cream portions. Mitchell's gonna give it to ya. 

Over 40+ home made flavors, catered to the ice cream specialist, not the hipster with the open wallet. My favorites - Rum Raison with a hint of rum, and the New York Cherry deliver every single time. Creamy, not too rich (although you can certainly turn your 200 calorie cone into something double on the cal count with extras like chocolate or sprinkle toppings).

Want to bring it home? Mitchell's has 1/2 gallon jars, reasonably priced ($10), and so are their scoops ($3).

I got only two words for you, my friend. 

Go. Here.

~3500 reviews, nearly 5 stars. I'm not the only one thinking that this is the real deal.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Been coming here since I was 5 years old with my dad 
Mitchell's is a staple anytime you're in the city! 
Best ice cream and variety around
author: Tyson P.

description: Love Mitchell's! As a native San Franciscan who grew up in the area, I have many fond memories of this place and the ice-cream. I still remember dropping a cone right out in front when I was 5yo, and someone came out and handed me another. The quality is impeccable, and the flavors they offer are divine. I always go for my childhood faves of mango or ube - and it's always as good as I remember. Their popularity has certainly grown - good for them that the business is thriving, but sad for us locals whose best kept SF secret is out.
author: Joanne F.

description: Is this what heaven tastes like? The grasshopper pie ice cream was so delicious, chocolatey, and minty. Words can't  describe the full extent of its deliciousness
author: Jade L.

description:
Creamy, just the right amount of sweetness, affordable pricing/quantity of ice cream given. No giant line ups like Humphrey's in the ferry building of SF. 
The store has some character- the very first ice cream shop in SF! 
If you come to SF must stop by :)
author: Lakshitha S.

description: Best ice cream in the city and the best price in my opinion. It isn't cheap but compare to salt and straw and smitten, it is the best price.
author: Tina L.

description: The ice cream is very creamy and they have a ton of flavors. I think it is a little over-priced and the lines are too long. Two scoops on a cone is $6.
author: Ben C.

description:
