Came again with Stef C. since we didn't want to grab dessert at the place we went to dinner at. But she wanted to try this place and I hadn't been in a while so we walked down towards it. 

I ended up ordering the grasshopper. Yum! Mint and Oreo chunks. Delicious! 

Pro tip: get a number and try some flavors. It's popular but the line does tend to move fast.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Came here on Labor Day, first of  all it was A hot day. (100) with that said there was a huge line. We got our ticket and waited, we got I30 , they  where at H70. So if you've been here before you know what I mean. If you haven't. Well let's just say each letter of the alphabet goes to 100. And then restarts at the next letter , example: H99, I00, I01 ... so fort 
Anyway , because of this some of my fiends almost didn't get ice cream,  for some reason the guy calling the numbers kept insisting they were on H , when everyone inside and in the line had I numbers. So , finally after solving this mystery, , we got to order. 
Need I say how much time I waited??? Nah... lol
I ordered the Kahula mocha cream. 
Delicious!
Cons: seems a bit hectic when ordering. 
But they friendly . And well if there's no mishaps you pay and get your ice cream in 5 min, or less. 
Be prepared to wait but once it's your turn you'll be glad you stuck around !
author: Sonia A.

description: Michelle's ice cream is busy place but the ice cream is worth the wait.  The ice cream made in store and the quality is excellent.  During the warm weather days, the line can be crazy but when you take first bite of ice cream, your taste buds will thank you.  My favorites flavors are Macapuno (coconut & Pineapple?) and mango with chocolate dip.  Yummy! Parking free but limited,
author: Liz B.

description:
UBE and Coconut Pineapple is my favorite here. And guess what? They have the best of both worlds, its called the Ube-Macapuno its Purple yam blended with sweet, meaty coconut. Normally its not on the menu but you can get a half gallon home for $10. Steal! I think this is the only ice cream shop in SF that has so many different flavors. Hard to even choose if you are unsure. WOW! 

You take a number and when your number is called, you get your ice cream. You can try flavors if you are unsure of just want to taste something new. Its far from where I live but if I'm the area, I'm coming to Mitchell's!
author: Sandy B.

description: While the ice cream is definitely above average, the service leaves something to be desired. Make sure to grab a ticket and be prepared to wait ~30 minutes on a busy Saturday evening to get your fix.
author: Dain M.

description: I went here specifically to try the avocado ice cream. The line moved quickly and the shop is cute. The ice cream is sweet but not overly sweet. There is a mild avocado flavor that I liked but didn't love. I would like to go back and try other flavors.
author: Erin J.

description:
Gave Mitchell's a 4-stars because even though the ice cream is amazing, the lines are crazy long. Not to mention, the establishment is tiny so you really have no choice but to eat your ice cream standing outside. But let's move on to the positives. 

Mitchell's offers a variety of unique flavors. Some of my personal favorites are Mexican chocolate and ube. My cousin and I shared a triple scoop this time. We chose butterscotch, rum raisin, and Mexican chocolate (weird combo, I know). I'm a chocolate person, so the bottom scoop was clearly mine. It was delicious, of course. Rum raisin would probably be the next best tasting flavor out of the triple scoop that we got (IMO). You can taste a "splash" of rum. The butterscotch was okay. Not something I would get again as I don't really care of butterscotch. 

I'd love to come back to try the other flavors the next time I'm back in SF.
author: Courtney N.

description: There is always a long wait no matter what day of the week you come. But it is well worth the wait! Love the ice cream selection here. Wonderful flavors!
author: Margot K.

description:
This really is as good as ice cream gets.  I didn't think I would find anything I would enjoy more than Bi-Rite and while this ice cream lacks the complete creamy elegance of the Bi-Rite ice creams you just can't beat Mitchell's on flavor!  Wow I was blown away.

We tried the Chocolate Caramel Crackle and the Ginger Snap.  The Chocolate Caramel Crackle was sweet and decadent with the perfect blend of a darker chocolate and a bright caramel.  The crackle pieces added a nice crunchy texture to round out the ice cream.  But the ginger snap stole the show.  Holy Cinnamon! Good thing it was a cheat day because I ate that thing like there was no tomorrow.

Good selection of cones as well.  We went chocolate dipped with sprinkles.  Lastly they had other confection items so my son was able to get a Kinder Egg.
author: Tarek S.

description: First things first you will notice a huge line if you can get off and take a number before you find parking, this is a very popular joint and it's very small so it can get crowded very easily. One scoop of your favorite ice cream is more than enough they have large portions they also have ice cream cakes, cookies and other types of goodies. The staff is friendly as well they'll let you taste pretty much every flavor they have. Great spot for families, dates or if you just want to treat yourself you can come here alone too.
author: Adrianna T.

description:
When in San Francisco, you've got to go to Mitchell's. It's a beloved favorite with years and years of ice cream making for its customers. And, even on a windy day in San Francisco, you can always expect there to be a line out the door.

I've only heard of friends and family growing up in the area (I myself come from the suburbs in the East Bay), and Mitchell's Ice Cream is simply a favorite. It's creamy, milky, nice and whippy (not sure if that made sense) and serves up all your traditional flavors with some neat combinations and even your favorite Asian-influenced tropical flavors (props to my local Filipin@s).

First things first, do NOT let the line out the door fool you. It's only because the shop is small and everyone has nowhere to wait. Grab a ticket number by the door and they'll call you soon (a 15-20 minute wait for my Saturday night visit). I used that time to scour the flavor board to see what I wanted... The Grasshopper (mint chocolate Oreo lovers), Espresso Toffee Crunch, Avocado, Ube, Coconut, Mango, Halo Halo (traditional Filipino delicacy of ube, coconut, pandan, mongo beans, etc.)... You will definitely find something just for what you're craving.

They work quick and everyone's whipping out ice creams and pints and shakes out the door. The scoops are pretty generous and thick and I found myself being very full after just a double scoop--one or two should be fine. The double was $5.35 I believe, but it's worth it for the flavor, visit and wait.

When you are in the mood for ice cream, Mitchell's doesn't disappoint. Nothing extravagant, nothing new or contemporary or modern. It's simple ice cream with great flavors and a flooding customer fan base out the door. I don't tend to indulge as much as I should, but I let the guilt slide with this one!
author: Rachel Ann C.

description:
This is our go to ice cream place in San Francisco. When you enter you need to get a number just inside on the left. 
Their ice cream is consistently good and creamy. Some of our favorites: coconut, mango, vanilla, mocha chip. Service is pretty friendly but it can get a little crazy if they're busy.
author: Goku U.

description: I'm a San Francisco Native but that doesn't mean I've had every flavor at Mitchell's. So..last week I discovered 2 new flavors that I will add to my list of delishiousness!! New York Cherry and Grashopper Pie. Sooo good!
author: Monica O.

description: Make sure to grab a number when you walk in. There are many unique flavors, some fruits that I have never heard of before too. Purple yam, lucuma, horchata, Thai tea, green tea, and halo halo were some of the unique flavors. There's parking behind the building. It would be nice if there were seating, but it is a small place.
author: Paloma P.

description:
The ice cream here is a bit pricey, but I definitely enjoyed all the flavors I sampled. As mentioned in other reviews, the line is a bit long, but the wait is well worth it!

I sampled the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with oreos & fudge), lucuma, and halo-halo.  I ended up getting the halo-halo with the tropical four. Both flavors were extremely refreshing! :-)

Looking forward to coming back again and trying different flavors!
author: Vu P.

description: Favorite Ice cream spot in the city! Rain or shine there's always a line, go figure. If you hate the line i recommend get a tub and cutting the line and go straight home to eat =) Favorite flavor UBE to die for.
author: Sam T.

description:
I always find myself at Mitchell's because the line at Bi-Rite is outrageous. I get pretty lucky here because parking has never been an issue. There's street parking and also a tiny parking lot (literally 8 spots max) behind the shop. 

You grab a number and they'll call it out when they're ready, which is quite quick. However, some of the scoopers are kinda slow. 

The flavors are amazing. I love the toasted almond, coconut, + horchata. Do you see a pattern here. Lol 

Tip: Don't shy to sample as many flavors as you wish! They're all amazing and worth a try!!! :)
author: Kath N.

description: Truly the best ice cream around! I have to stop at Mitchell's every time I drive by. They have a great variety of flavors and amazing service.
author: Will J.

description: Always the delight to go to. And made ice cream always taste the best. Keep up the good work Mitchell's. But on a hot summer day you will be waiting for a while......but well worth the wait.
author: Tarek N.

description:
The wait was insanely long and frankly I didn't find the wait time to balance out the goodness of the ice cream. Their ice cream, especially ube for example, tastes almost exactly the same as one you can get from the store for a pint. 

I think you're better off going to a market to find these flavors, more bang for your buck.
author: Lili L.

description:
Loved their halo halo and ube. Operationally inefficient tho; the number system is not working out.

Slightly overrated but I'm a fan of their unique flavors.
author: Juliana P.

description:
I like this place.  Over the last few years I have been eating there the taste of ice cream has stayed the same and good.  Always like going there.

But this last time (few days ago) I got one of the worst Sundae with banana ever.  Attached will be the image as well.

Not sure how to rate now.  The ice cream is good but the service and the product provided this time was one of the worst.  Rating 1-Star only for this visit experience only.
author: Sohail Z.

description:
I just found out that Mitchell's makes egg nog. I normally don't care much for the holiday season but this is truly something to look forward to. 

I have only once been able to order something aside from Grasshopper pie and it was the peach ice cream. Totally good but I still regretted not getting grasshopper pie. The vanilla custard was really good when I had a tester of it recently but I still couldn't resist my old standby. 

I love this place and that's saying a lot considering I really don't like ice cream and I'm lactose intolerant. It's totally worth spending he rest of the night with the porcelain throne :)
author: Emma H.

description: Fresh ice cream.  I cannot resist it.  So many choices here...  I went with my go to flavors.  Vanilla had a deep rich cream base and bright vanilla flavor.  Mango had a fruity mango flavor and was like eating a creamy frozen mango.  I wished I lived in San Francisco as it's only $16/half gallon.  Ice cream is so good here!
author: Soo H.

description: What a wait, but the hot fudge sundae I bought made up for it. Super duper delicate and smooth. Warm and cold. Give it a try!
author: Kimberly M.

description:
Grasshopper pie! 5 stars!! The most consistent Ice cream parlor in the 7x7. 
Located In the Noe Valley/ Bernal heights intersection.
author: Angel V.

description: Best ice cream I've ever had hands down! It was delicious, homemade. There are tons on flavors. Gotta go back
author: Missi B.

description:
Went on a Tuesday night thinking I would be clever and dodge the long lines I had heard about. How bad could it be on a Tuesday at 10PM, right? Wrong. Pulled up to this place and immediately saw the line out the door and huge mob of people standing outside. PROTIP: make sure to grab a number inside. I actually waited in what looked like a line for a little bit before someone told me to go grab a number. The line moves surprisingly fast and I ended up waiting for around 15-20 minutes before ordering and it was absolutely worth it. 

Not only is this place considered to be an SF staple, but it also carries a couple of flavors you don't usually find in other places like avocado, ube, halo-halo, and lucuma. I tried a couple of flavors out and the staff were really helpful in explaining what each flavor was. I was drawn to the ube and halo halo and got one scoop of each. Definitely recommend.  The halo halo is apparently a mix of different things and had chunks of fruit in it that were really good. I've been told the avocado ice cream is really good so i'll have to go back for that. 

After my first experience at Mitchell's I can understand why they have such long lines. Everything tastes great and you can tell it is a neighborhood gem.
author: Thielson D.

description:
This is one of my favorite ice cream places in the city. Don't get me wrong, I love Smitten and Bi-Rite, but if you want a large variety of flavors and are tired of paying $5 for a teeny scoop of ice cream, then you may want to add Mitchell's into your SF ice cream rotation.

Usually the line is long, and you could be waiting 30 min for ice cream, but don't be discouraged when you get there and there seem to be 30 numbers ahead of you when they are calling out numbers. Sometimes people will come in a group of 2-3 people and then everyone takes a number, but then they all order together.

They have a ton of flavors that it may make your head spin. But that just means you'll have to make several trips here to try them all. They seem to have a lot of the classic flavors that you can't get at a lot of the specialty ice cream places, but then a lot of unique flavors via their seasonal or tropical flavors. They change out some of their flavors, but for the most part have about 40 to choose from, so you should be able to find something that you like. Some examples:

Standard Flavors: Mint Chocolate Chip, Mocha Fudge, Peanut Butter Indulgence (Dark Chocolate with peanut butter swirls and chocolate covered peanut butter cups), Rocky Road, Strawberry, Thin Mint

Seasonal Flavors: Peppermint, Eggnog, Pumpkin

Tropical Flavors: Triple 4 (Mango, Guava, Banana and Pineapple), Ube (Purple Yam), Lychee, Macapuno (coconut), Lucuma (Peruvian fruit), Langka (Jackfruit), Halo Halo (based on a traditional Filipino dessert), Avocado

My favorites are the Mint Chocolate Chip, Peanut Butter Indulgence, and Lucuma. This is the only place in the city that I've found with Lucuma ice cream, and it's one of my favorites. You can't go wrong with any of them.

You can get ice cream to take home too in 1/2 gallons (in a freezer, already pre-packed, or they will hand-pack a quart, pint, 1/2 pint, or 1/2 gallon. They have sundaes and milkshakes, and you can get it cones or cups.

Come here and be prepared to wait, most of the time outside since it's a small place, so dress accordingly with jackets. Listen up for your number so that you don't make the line even longer!
author: Christina L.

description: Been going here for the last 15 years with the faimly. The mango and pistachio ice creams are out favorite.
author: Shaun I.

description:
Ice cream from Mitchell's is delicious! The staff were extremely patient with me even though I keep asking for more samples. 

Food: The ice cream was creamy and flavorful. There were over 20 flavors to choose from! I ordered the ube (purple yam) and buko (young coconut) in a waffle bowl. I was not a fan of the waffle bowl; the waffle bowls were the ones from the packages (-0.5). The ube flavor here is prominent, unlike other ice cream places, and the buko ice cream have real coconut inside. Mitchell's serves quality ice cream because it was really smooth and had no ice crystals. I subtracted another 0.5 because I feel like although they had a lot of flavors, I feel like a lot of the flavors didn't appeal to me. Only the flavors from the tropical section seems interesting to me. 4/5 

Customer Service: Customer service was great! I was greeted with a big smile once my number was called. The person that help me was glad to give me a variety of samples when I couldn't decide on the flavor. 5/5

Overall, I would give this place a 4.5/5 stars because of the waffle and the flavor options. I really enjoy a good waffle cone/bowl with my ice cream and I tend to choose flavors that are more toward the eastern. But, I do really liked this place and I will definitely come again for the ube!
author: Helen H.

description:
Mitchell's is amazing! I don't know what my favorite ice cream place in the East Bay is anymore... My taste buds are just tingling with happiness! Ehehe

I really like how they have so many different options, but that makes it harder for me to choose. Haha. Since they have so many flavors, there will be a flavor here for everyone!

The guy serving me was super nice, and explained the process to me since it was my first time. You're supposed to get a number when you walk in, and when your number gets called, they will help you.

Since there was no line when I went, my server kindly helped me and let me try all the flavors I wanted to! They were all so delicious, especially the mango. In the end, I got the grasshopper, which was minty and sweet and heavenly.

Ice cream was delicious, and the server was nice. I was feeling generous, so I tipped. :)
author: Tiffany H.

description: Best ice cream in town.  Features Ethnic flavors along with traditional.  Servings are generous.  Always a Family favorite.
author: Frances B.

description:
The ice cream here is soooo good, actually good is an understatement.. it's more like amazing!

Let me start off with, YOU NEED TO GRAB A NUMBER. I literally waited outside for like 5 minutes, even after hearing them call numbers over and over, did I realize we needed to grab a number in order to be helped.

The ice cream is definitely worth the wait, if I was a lot closer to this place I'd probably come weekly, and that should tell you what kind of person I am lol. 

I give 4 stars instead of 5 because, although it was in nobody's fault but my own (and my group of friends) for coming about 20 minutes before closing, they close the doors once it hits closing time. So mind you there's about 30 people inside and 15-20 outside and the associate goes "i'm going to need everyone to come inside, if the doors close and you aren't inside you will not be helped"  I'm sure you can picture over 50+ people crammed into the small store. The line went pretty quickly from there though, it wasn't long before what was shoulder to shoulder space became almost empty.

I am soon going to return!
author: Marissa G.

description: I get it, they've been around for a while, have a variety of flavors, has a neighborhood feel, but it just doesn't live up to the hype.
author: Abdul C.

description:
This is one of my favorite ice cream spots in San Francisco. The parking lot is SMALL, so parking can be tough depending on what time you go. But it is worth it!! It gets busy, so they're organized by having each person take a number which makes it's less hectic when ordering. 

Favorite flavors: mocha almond fudge, chocolate, and mint chip. Yes basic flavors, but they are delicious! You must get your ice cream on a sugar cone.
author: Jennifer J.

description: AMAAAAAZING. Love love love LOVE their creamy ice cream. Even their Filipino halo halo tatses authentic.
author: Finau F.

description: How have I not reviewed this place I've been here a dozen times have had about twice as many flavors and they always satisfy. My favorite right now is french vanilla. So good and so creamy. Among the best ever.
author: Will D.

description: As a biased SF native, this is the best ice cream in the city.  I've tried almost every single flavor and they're ALL good.  The tropical flavors are superior to any other brands that you'll find at an Asian supermarket.  Parking can be difficult and the line usually looks super long, even in cold or rainy weather.  Turnover is fast and the ice cream is super worth the effort.  If you're not familiar with the waiting process, make sure to make a beeline to the take-a-number machine.
author: Yolanda C.

description:
Talk about FLAVOR PERFECTION!!!!

You know when there are certain flavors out there and you would have an assumption of how it would actually taste like... You would hope it would taste like the actual thing and it is a huge bonus that it will end up tasting really good??!!!!

Man Mitchell's Ice cream captured my heart and taste buds on this one!

I have never been here before, neither have I ever heard of it before. 

My uncle brought me here coz they love their Ice cream so much they buy their ice cream by the GALLONS. not gallon, gallons okay.

And they have every reason to do rightfully so.

They have some cool flavors which I love ranging from ube , macapuno (Filipinos would know), Cantaloupe, avocado, dulce de leche and many more...

I sampled their avocado and they nailed it but I didn't like it as much. My favorite that I bought? Cantaloupe.

Taking a small bite with just the right sweetness of a spoonful of cantaloupe ice cream with cantaloupe bits as the flavor just take a delightful nap on your happy tongue even on a cold sunny day. Gosh was it awesome.

I kid you not, they have perfected flavor transformation into ice cream. I would call them the ice cream people.

Plus, it's a delightful store with friendly employees and a huge plus, FAMILY OWNED. No wonder it tastes so good.

I HIGHLY recommend going here. Heard it's a hotspot as well for families.

Won't hesitate coming back here!!!
author: Krizia L.

description:
There's always usually a long wait every time I come here, which means it's gotta say something good about the ice cream. They just have so many different flavors and also exotic and interesting ones. I'm very adventurous with my flavors and tend to sample different ones every time. 

This time I got avocado and the brown sugar ice cream. The avocado was good because it reminded me of an avocado smoothie. The brown sugar one was new and when I sampled it, I thought it was delicious but when I got it, I felt as if it was too sweet for me. There were sugared almonds in there too which I pleasantly enjoyed. The ice cream flavor kind of reminded me of a churro. 

Although this time I should've chose a different flavor, this will always be one of my favorite ice cream joints. I don't think anyone can ever be displeased with the ice cream that they serve here.
author: Annie H.

description:
OK, this is my latest on my great SF ice cream hunt, and I gotta say I'm very impressed! Taking the J train all the way down to 30th & Dolores, this quaint ice cream parlor is just down the block from the Muni stop and is bustling with people all admiring the delicious flavors inside the glass display while the scoopers calmly and kindly serve each person by the number. 

Once you come in, take a number and decide which flavor(s) you want because you'll want to make the hard decision quickly as they service goes fast! I know I had that dilemma when I couldn't decide which of their uniquely tropical flavors to go with. The store itself is quite small inside, but fortunately their menu board is big enough to read from even outside the door. There are also a few seats outside for you to sit down and enjoy, or you can take it over to Billy Goat Hill!

While they do offer classic flavors, I recommend going for a non-traditional tropical flavor such as their creamy and vibrantly purple Ube, their subtly sweet Macapuno (young coconut), or their tart Kalamansi sorbet, all of which are familiar flavor staples to the Philippines!

They even offer Halo-Halo! A traditional special Filipino ice cream dessert with all the sweet fixings! 

Whether you go with a trusted classic flavor or an enticingly different tropical flavor, you can't go wrong either way! :)
author: Kyrie S.

description: Mighty Mitchell's Ice Cream was very good. Good consistency and flavor. You can definitely taste the home made difference and flavor. You will wait but after the first bite or lick you will understand why. The customer service was great. The parking wasn't much of a challenge in this area. I give it second place to Bi-Rite. Go forth and do good things.
author: Edward M.

description:
This is definitely some of the best ice cream I've ever had. Like, ever.

OK, so logistics-wise: there's pretty much always a line and you'll need to take a number from the dispenser by the door to be served. Once it's your turn, you can try as many flavors as you'd like. Staff are efficient, friendly and helpful. Prices are very reasonable, especially for the quality. Scoops are HUGE. 

The Grasshopper Pie and Horchata flavors were standouts for me: natural, fresh-tasting ingredients and an awesome ratio of mix-ins to ice cream (I hate places that skimp!). Everything else we tasted was delicious and high-quality, too. We also got chocolate-dipped waffle cones which had better-than-average chocolate on them. Will definitely be back!
author: Christine G.

description:
Heavenly ice cream flavors that your stomach will thank you for!! 

FOOD: I got a double with chocolate crackle caramel & rum raisin on a waffle cone. And MAN! The scopes were huge. I really liked both flavors - I really liked the generous amount of melting caramel and also oreo in the chocolate crackle, and I could actually taste the rum in the rum raisin!! The waffle cone was not the best I've had. I was a little disappointed when I reached the end of the cone and found no chocolate. ;( I've been spoiled. 

SERVICE: The server was helpful and patient. There were 4 of us and he let us try many flavors before we ordered. 

PRICE: For double on waffle cone, I paid $6.15, which is a lot and the most that I've paid for ice cream. But it was very worth it. I really liked both flavors I got and am also satisfied with the amount. 

SETTING: The shop is located on a big street in Petro Hill. There isn't anything much going on in the neighborhood other than the Billy Goat Hill, which is 10-minutes walk away. There is NO seats/tables inside of the shop and only one small bench outside. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: It's too bad that the shop is located in an isolated part of the city. Otherwise I would come here often to try out their other awesome flavors!
author: Wendy F.

description: So so so soooooo good it's just alwaysssss busy so parking is hard but the ice cream is worth it
author: Michelle D.

description:
The mango ice cream here is my favorite, but Mitchell's also has many more unique flavors. While this place is always packed, it's worth waiting for. You have to grab a number from next to the door because it gets way too crowded inside.

Again, worth the wait.
author: Vinnie W.

description:
I've been fortunate enough to say that I grew up eating Mitchell's Ice Cream. I've never ventured elsewhere because they're simply the best. Yes, the wait can be long and yes, service isn't always overly-friendly as people would prefer it be- but this is SF. This is common stuff so the entitled people complaining about attitude shouldn't be listened to. 
Give it a try. 
Also try the mango, ube, pistachio and so on.
author: Gabby G.

description: This is my favorite ice cream place im SF hands down!!! My go to is pitacho ice cream there is real whole nuts in the ice cream, not to sweet and very rich
author: Liset O.

description:
Kind of hard to find parking in this area and when you enter, you gotta pull a number like you're at the dmv LOL cause it's that popular D:

Must try the halo halo, it's amazing. It's a lot to handle because there are so many ingredients, but it looks and tastes delicious. I've also tried a few other flavors, but most recently the coconut definitely won the prize.
author: Mel T.

description:
Hands down : The BEST ice-cream in SF. I just can`t get enough of this place. Totally understand why there is always a line here. They have tons of unique flavors and excellent service in spite of the ever busy crowds. Some of my favorites are the Yuba, Halo Halo, Buko( Coconut) and Ube, in no particular order. I always get a double scoop even if I`m super full ( thats how good this place is).

I can`t really compare this with the more famous Bi-Rite since obth are good in their own respects. But, Bi-Rite always seems to have incredible and annoying wait times. And Mitchell`s seems to be a better option for the Mission residents. 

I really envy my friends who stay just a block from this place. If you`re around the Mission or Bernal Heights neighbourhoods, do check this place out.
author: Pranav B.

description:
Love this place (: My fiancé has lived in Noe Valley his whole life and says they ALWAYS have a line out the door! It's that good. Even when it's raining or cloudy or cold, they have customers waiting for ICE cream!!
I love their buko - it's light and creamy and and sweet but not too sweet. Unique flavor that I can't find anywhere else. I also had their French Vanilla most recently - I always thought "ugh why would I get a boring flavor" but there's something to be said about a really good classic flavor, and Mitchell's has definitely achieved that.
author: Mio W.

description:
Happened to come with my friends, I tried several flavor and ordered  Dulce de leche ! Dulce de leche starts with sweet caramel and milk taste , but ends light and not a burden to your tastebuds. Like it!

The toasted almond is also pretty good.
Purple yam was ok, can't taste the flavor.
Grasshopper pie is the flavor for kids, especially with Oreo in it.
author: H Y.

description: Ice cream is amazing. Can get very busy, but is worth the wait! Is a little pricey, but for San Fran it's not bad
author: Grayson Z.

description:
No matter what time of the day you go, there always seems to be a massive queue. Everything is well organised so that you never have to wait more than 10 minutes, the times that I have been. They do a wide range of flavours but I always favour the vanilla because I'm boring when it comes to ice cream. 

They sell huge tubs of ice cream too, which if I lived in San Francisco would reside in my freezer. Well worth the visit!
author: Matt B.

description:
This is definitely a solid creamery. I came here in the fall and I'm pretty sure I was being basic and got pumpkin ice cream and/or salted caramel ice cream. It's what I expected from getting ice cream: cold, creamy, sweet, and satisfying. However, nothing made this place memorable to me except that I didn't realize there was a ticket number I had to take in order to be served, since the place was so crowded when I came in. Definitely grab a number first before doing anything! 

Without a doubt it's good ice cream, but nothing so amazing that I have to say, "YES DEFINITELY COME HERE ALL THE TIME". But Mitchell's, you're good in my book.
author: Charisse S.

description: Really, really good ice cream. I'm not sure what it is: the texture, the perfect balance of mix-ins to creamy ice cream base, or the flavor profile, but I walked away very happily from this quaint ice cream shop. The Oreo, coffee, and strawberries and cream were simple, classic, and delicious. Would definitely go again.
author: Evelyn L.

description:
My favorite ice cream in San Francisco. They have tons of flavors and a great banana split. 

Even though lines are a bit long, it's totally worth it.

*Remember! If there's a ton of people, don't forget to grab a number ticket or you'll end up waiting longer!!
author: Terisha M.

description: Chocolate dipped Ube ice cream...yumsters!  After giving up ice cream for Lent, I had my first taste of ice cream today at Mitchell's...omg.
author: Theresa M.

description:
I came here on national ice cream day. I love that they have parking out back. They have a huge selection of flavors. I wanted to try a lot of them and I felt bad about it.

I think I ended up ordering the pistachio. Mitchell's ice cream is a little more old fashion which correlates to a more creamy ice cream. I think ice cream quality is dependent on a person's preference so this place is for people who like the creamy ice cream. 

For me, there are other ice cream places I prefer, but Mitchell's is a great option.
author: Lydia H.

description: I sampled a few flavors and all were great. Their mango ice cream is delicious.Be prepared for a long wait.
author: Shalini C.

description:
5 stars says it all. I'm not even going into detail.

BEST DAMN ICE CREAM IN SF. 

It can be a long wait, but it's worth it. Do yourself a flavor, eat it.
author: Edward L.

description: The best ice cream in sf.  My favorite is the pistachio.  How pistachios and ice cream can become one? I dunno but it is really good.  The Oreo cookie is among the best I have had as well. Worth the wait... take some Togo as well.
author: David S.

description: Don't be like me and just stand there thinking there's a line, you need to get a number from the inside. This is my first time here so I assumed there was a line till I realized they were calling out numbers like you were at the hospital waiting to see the doctors to get your ice cream fix haha. It was really cool to experience something different like other ice cream parlors. Waited around fifteen minutes I think but it wasn't too bad since this place gets so packed. I got the single scoop in a cup of UBE flavor which is also known as purple yams. This flavor is beyond popular here as well as in SoCal. Their ice cream is so creamy and good it makes you licking for more.
author: Lisa W.

description: Best ice cream in the bay I love Mitchell I grew up in the city and all my life have I been going there amazing flavors tons to choose from place is clean always crowed but def worth the wait  they've got ice cream to go too  quarts of ice cream. The banana splits are bomb. Man my mouth is watery lol it's kinda like Pokémon you gotta try them all  staff is friendly please leave tips it's rude not too! You get good service they sure deserve a tip!
author: Eve G.

description:
5 stars for the milkshakes - which are not only incredibly delicious but also very unique. Try one of their specialty shakes like the Cookie Monster or better yet ask for their Grasshopper Pie ice cream as a milkshake (mint ice cream, chocolate chips, fudge, and oreo...whoa). High-Level. 

Other than that, there's not too much else to see here. Come for the ice cream, leave with the happiest brain freeze of your life. 

---
Note: Almost subtracted a star for the absolutely outrageous line, which will cost you 45 minutes (!) on a Sunday afternoon. That long of a wait is just too rich for my taste, frankly. But given that a sunny weekend afternoon is probably the single worst possible time to come, I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt...at least for now.
author: Brian S.

description: I love their ice cream! I usually opt for more tropical or fruity flavor ice cream, but most ice cream shops tend to have fruity flavors in sorbet form. What's great about this place was that all of the ice cream is creamy and flavorful. I recommend the ube, Thai tea, and guava flavor!
author: Grace Z.

description:
Came here as my last stop in SF for the day because how do you end a day trip to SF without ice cream?

When we got here, the line was pretty long. I think we were like #94 on our ticket and the # was @ 70. It was about a 30-40min wait. I can see why since there are so many flavors and people want to taste them all before getting just own or a couple.

I got the lacuma which is a Peruvian fruit. it's super unique and I've never heard of it until that day. I tried a couple of other flavors like the espresso toffee crunch which was really good, but the other flavors I tried like avocado, tropical 4, macupino were all sub-par. 

Not sure if i would wait in line for ice cream from here. Maybe if I was craving lacuma, but I think I'd prefer another ice cream joint.
author: Jenny L.

description: Wow! This place is amazing. The wait is ridiculous, but worth it. You take a number and wait for them to call it which is so much better than having to stand in line the whole time. I told the guy it was my first time there and everyone was shocked. He says they are known for their mango so I must have a taste test. It was super good and tasted natural but since my husband isn't too wild on mango I opted for horchata and the tropical four which I highly do recommend both! The guy serving up the ice cream was generous with the samples which I appreciated because my gosh there were so many amazing unique flavors I couldn't possibly just buy blindly without trying!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Probably the best ice cream you can find in San Francisco (along with Bi-Rite). It's been a local staple since the 50s, but not many of the new tech people that have come into the city have tried it because of its location away from Downtown in Bernal Heights.

The wait is quite long and peak hours usually occur in the evening (it's open late until 11 PM). Don't be confused by the unorganized group of people outside the door. You need to go inside and take a number that gets called out when it's your turn to order. When I went at 9 PM, my number was 30 above the current number being called. People leave and that makes the line go faster, but I still had to wait about 35 minutes during the peak hour.

The ice cream is definitely worth it, though. The texture is more firm and feels more like a true ice cream compared to the other SF shops which go for novelty instead of tradition. The flavor selection is wonderful and Mitchell's also offers Filipino-flavored ice creams, which are quite difficult to find in the rest of the city. They also offer pints and ice cream cakes to take home.

If you are willing to wait in line for half an hour in the evenings, you will be rewarded with the best ice cream San Francisco has to offer.
author: Ramon Miguel F.

description:
This isn't the first time I've had to wait an extremely long time for critically acclaimed food. But this is the first time I've ever waited so long for a product so unbelievably mediocre. This is a classic example of a place where the reputation outdoes the venue; Mitchell's is completely overrated.

The ice cream is far too gummy and sticky, and consequently, much of the flavor gets lost in this texture. It was an interesting academic experience, I guess, because I've never had ice cream like that, but I didn't particularly enjoy it.

Put it like this -- even if I didn't have to wait behind that ungodly line, I wouldn't come back again. The ice cream just isn't that good.
author: Zi-on C.

description:
Sometimes I think...ice cream is amazing so how can I rate if one ice cream shop is better than another?! But it's possible...Mitchell's is SUPER amazing! I only got one scoop of the strawberries & cream so I can't comment on trying a bunch of different flavors. I tend to go toward the more classic flavors. It was delicious! Perfect blend of real strawberries with vanilla creamy flavor. My family got the coffee, grasshopper pie, and (baby) coconut...everyone raved about their flavors. You can't go wrong. I taste tested my mom's coconut and it's the best coconut ice cream I've ever had!! (And I'm not a huge coconut ice cream fan really). 

Super long line as the other reviewers mention...you take a number and then wait for it to be called. We got there and pulled #1 when they were just calling #40 something...but it moved really fast! Didn't seem like that long and it was totally worth the wait. They will still let you sample flavors when you get up there without a rush. Everyone was super friendly. How can you not be in a great mood eating great ice cream??
author: Christina C.

description: who hasn't tried Mitchell's? seriously, its an iconic ice cream place in SF. you have to try it even just once. I love their seasonal flavors, especially the  horchata ice cream they came out with. you can never go wrong with this place, its packed 24/7. the staff are amazing, the guys are super accommodating and they don't make you feel rushed even though there are 30 more people behind you. they open late and even on the late nights, it gets super busy.
author: Khaye S.

description:
Mitchell's has the sweetest staff! Major shoutout to the guy who happily handed me six sample spoons to try tonight.

There were exactly 72 people in front of me waiting for ice cream tonight at Mitchell's. This was not a fun wait, and it probably has at least a little something to do with why I took off one star. The nice thing is you don't have to wait in a physical line, so if you want to walk around for a bit to feel better about all the ice cream you're about to eat, feel free.

Mitchell's has some really interesting and unique flavors; ube is very popular, and it's cool to see people walking out of the store carrying giant purple ice cream cones. They've also got flavors like Thai tea, cantaloupe, and coconut pineapple, which is pretty unique. I ended up settling on the cantaloupe and mango, and while the flavors were good, I thought the texture was a little too icy.

If you get a double scoop, definitely ask for a cup even if you want to stick a cone on top as well. Mine was really unstable, and I had to scarf my ice cream down at the speed of light!
author: Kelly R.

description: Great ice creams! Tried hot fudge sundae with a scoop of rocky road, pistachio, whipped cream, & nuts. Worth it!
author: Naresh A.

description: Is the BEST of SF !!! the lines and parking isn't great.. Be patience people !! For every yummy  lickly lick is so so worth it ...
author: Crisy G.

description:
Even on a rainy Sunday night, Mitchell's Ice Cream is still pretty much poppin. So much so that you must take a number in order to be served. In our case, our number was 21 and they just called 3. 

If you don't wanna wait to be served, your best bet is to purchase the prepacked 1/2 gallon ice cream tubs for $10.60. It doesn't give the proper ice cream shop experience but it beats waiting the long line. 

Also, a top fave is the Kahlua Mocha Cream! Check it out!
author: Jezza Mei O.

description:
THE BEST!!! My dad has been taking me here since I was a kid and now I'm 24 and the place still holds up! 

I have never left unsatisfied ever. They have a really good variety and the flavors always taste true, and natural. Nothing artificial about them. You can also take a tub of your favorite flavor home with you.

If your not in the mood for ice cream, then why not a milkshake? Bottom line, all the hype is true, and if you haven't checked this place out then you need to pronto. You can thank me later.
author: Iris L.

description: What can you say? Great ice cream with so many choices! Friendly staff! Open late! When busy, make sure to grab a number. Waits aren't too long just make sure to get in fast when they call your number. If you're outside you may get missed since they call the numbers quickly. The trick is to start making your way inside when you are about 5 numbers away. Has always worked for me.
author: Kirk K.

description:
Who would come to an ice cream store in the middle of nowhere on late Wednesday night ?  Well, I did and so did a great number of people. 
  I was surprise to find this place packed with people at this time of night ( at this location). But I came here before and their ice cream is truly amazing. I drove all the way from the other side of the city ... that good.
author: Dom G.

description:
UBE UBE UBE, give me more!!! 

Every time I visit SF, I set aside time to stop-by this friendly neighborhood ice cream shop and grab a cup/cone!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This is our favourite ice-cream maker in San Francisco, a long-established place that serves both traditional and unusual flavours, many types and with a strong emphasis on flavours from the Philippines and the SE Asian region such as Halo Halo, coconut and pineapple, as well as others like Lucuma from South America.

Texture is excellent, rich and creamy.

A downside is the fact that it lacks a nice seating area.
author: Wulfstan C.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

People complain about the parking and the wait time, but I love this ice cream parlor so much that these things don't phase me at all. I usually just wait for someone to leave the back parking lot and have someone else grab a number since the wait is long anyway. 

They have many options for ice cream such as chocolate, tropicals, sundaes, etc. My favorite flavor is espresso toffee crunch, but beware, they only have this flavor available in the summer. Even though they may not always have my favorite flavor, I can always go for the grasshopper pie or avocado.
author: Veronica S.

description: I came here for the first time on my birthday weekend and now I can see what all the rave is about.  It was super busy when we came here and we had to take a number and then wait outside.  I believe we waited about 20-30 minutes to actually get served.  I got the ube and also the pecan praline and my fiancé got the coffee and buko flavors.  The texture of the ice cream was very creamy and not too sweet.  I'm glad we came here and checked it out. I can't wait to come back and try the other flavors they have here.
author: Christina M.

description: Best Damn Ice Cream in the City. Pile it on high. Grasshopper Pie is my all time fav.
author: Tamara R.

description: Very gummy, full of colour - doesn't look or taste natural, or even good. With so many great ice cream shops around the Mission, why eat this stuff?!
author: Mick J.

description: Caramel praline and ube are stars in my eyes . Hubby and I favorite place to spoil our bellies on the weekends. Big lines at times but well worth the wait.
author: Manjeet M.

description: Awesome ice cream. My favorites are: AVOCADO & BABY COCONUT. You would save more if you buy their half gallon bucket for like $10.60. The taste is really good. Someday you will have to wait in a long line. Make sure you grab the number next to the door. Parking sometimes can be difficult since their packing in the back can only hold maybe 10 cars or less but trust me its worth it.
author: Bao N.

description: The macapuno (young coconut) and guava sorbet combo are amaziiiing! The place was packed and it took over twenty minutes to order, but it was worth it! They have so many flavors I wanted to try, so I will definitely be back.
author: Shizuka L.

description: Ice cream.  Awesome.  Many flavors.  Interesting flavors to try.  Creamy and delicious.  No place to sit.  Expensive.
author: Ronny T.

description:
It's good, but not as good as Birite ;). The price is certainly more economical, especially if you buy a carton. I think they have gallon cartons that are huge while Birite has tiny pint size cartons.

My favorite flavor is Ube (basically taro) It's pretty damn good. Note that when you go in you have to get a ticket. (Kind of like when you go to deli) They'll call you based on the number on the ticket. It's definitely a smart way to get around lining up. The shop isn't very big.
author: Sherica L.

description:
Best ice cream in SF! 

A trip to Mitchell's will always present a line, but it is well worth the wait. This San Francisco landmark ice cream shop has plenty to choose from both in ready to take home pints and gallons, as well as scoops. They have traditional flavors, as well as unique ones. They even have Avocado ice cream (I have yet to try that one)! 

My most recent visit was on Valentines Day, after an amazing day spent in SF hiking and picnicing with my love. The line was out the door per usual, but it went fairly quickly. Michell's uses the "take a number" system, so be advised of that. The employees are always nice, and will always let you try a sample or two (in my case three). 

Make a trip to Michell's to satisfy your sweet tooth with a scoop of heaven in a cup (or cone), and take some home for later!
author: Alexandra F.

description: Great variety of flavors and genuine good stuff. For first timers, get in past the crowds and to the left get a NUMBER! The counter moves at a decent pace but remember to get your number first. The mango, buko (young coconut, with actual coconut flakes), and pistachio were all yummy.
author: Sameet S.

description: This place is awesome!!! So many different flavors to choose them and they're all unique ones. They also have milkshakes too which look really good. First time today and I had the chocolate caramel crackle ice cream. Melted in my mouth! It was so creamy and tasty to the point where I kept wanting to order more. Can't wait to go again!
author: Kanella G.

description:
Living in the bay, I couldn't believe that I haven't been here till recently. This is like a small quaint icecream shop and it is heaven! This place is so popular that you'll have to grab a number to be served. Yeah, don't forget to grab a number. Mitchell's provide a wide variety of ice cream. Expect a wait, however, it is definitely worth it! It is the experience trying out small ice parlors and supporting local businesses.

 I'd say this is great date spot to grab dessert. My go to spot :)
author: Alliver V.

description: Always fun to come to Mitchell's for yummy ice cream. I have always just had their scoops but the sundaes look wonderful.
author: Lisa F.

description: Got an ice cream cake for my husband's birthday. It was so delicious and you could tell they really took their time with it. My husband loved it. I want to start a new tradition of only getting Mitchell's ice cream cakes for our bdays!
author: Maya G.

description: John is the man! He needs a raise.  The customer service he provides is out of this work!
author: Amber G.

description:
There's almost always a wait, so don't forget to get your number!

The longest I've waited was probably over an hour on a warm summer night. It didn't bother me too much though cause I was still full from dinner lol. Also, the wait makes the ice cream that much yummier!

I love getting their grasshopper pie!!! I usually get it in a waffle cone and it is so perfect... The ice cream isn't too minty where it feels like you're eating toothpaste and the Oreo bits give it a nice little surprise.

My boyfriend got an Oreo milkshake, which he really enjoyed. I'm not a big fan of milkshakes, so I can't really speak on it.
author: Angela L.

description:
Mitchell's has a small lot in the back and limited street parking all around. It seems that there is almost always a line here. Take a number right away and then survey the many options available here. No need to bring a razor you will not grow a beard waiting for your turn this line moves rather quickly.
. 
The servers are helpful, informative and patient. Once it is your turn they will give you their undivided attention. Ask for as many sample tastes necessary to make an informed decision and they will gladly provide them.
.
There are many, cup, cone and pre-made half-gallon options as well as Ice cream Cakes ready to go. I believe there is something here for every pallet.
author: Caesar A.

description:
Mitchell's will always be one of my favorite ice cream establishments! While their prices have steadily risen over the years, their flavors are still on point and fairly unique. They basically service one side of the city while Polly Ann's covers the other as far as "Asian" flavors go for ice cream. 

My favorite is still Ube and Macapuno. I always go for one or the other....or both when I visit Mitchell's. Why mess with perfection?
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Ordering ice cream from Mitchell's reminds me of ordering meat at some delis, since Mitchell's uses a take-a-number ticketing system to queue up customers. Instead of having a line wrapping around the block, you end up with patches of people waiting to be called. I like this system since it gives you some flexibility to roam around the neighborhood especially if Mitchell's is packed, but at the same time it adds some complexity because the consumer needs to wait for their number to be called. The queue moves pretty fast so this isn't really an issue. It'd be cool if Mitchell's upgraded their ticketing system to a wireless buzzer/queueing system, but that'd probably not be worth it for an ice cream shop.

Mitchell's has a wide array of flavors from something more simple like vanilla or strawberry to something more adventurous like horchata, buko(baby cocunut), lucuma(peruvian fruit), ube(phillipino purple yam dessert). I ordered the Grasshopper Pie  and Thai Tea. The Thai Tea tasted exactly like Thai Tea in a creamier form. The Grasshopper Pie is essentially a mashup of Cookies & Cream and Mint Chocolate Chip. The ingredients are mint ice cream with fudge, chocolate chip, and oreos. If you have large sweet tooth, you can always buy tubs of ice cream to take home.

There's still a lot of interesting flavors for me to try out and it's great to see that Mitchell's continues to innovate by introducing new flavors like horchata. I hope to be back again soon.
author: Anthony S.

description: The ice cream is worth the wait, and I don't like waiting.
author: Timothy H.

description:
I love their ice cream and the fact that this local business has been around for decades and that their existence is bringing people in to this neighborhood. But I am really hating the lack, nay, the absence! of parking spaces!!

 I come to SF to visit family and it is hard to come here in a group. Which is a shame coz what could be cooler than buying ice cream cones for a group of children and watching their faces light up when you say so? I'm afraid this might be our last venture here unless more parking spaces miraculously appear with a wave of my pixie dust generating wand. Yeah, I highly doubt it too.

In the meantime, had the following and it was awesome!!!!

Banana Split with Kahlua Mocha and Toasted Almonds and Hot Fudge, Whipped Cream Peanuts and Cherries
author: Kislev A.

description: Gotta love Mitchell's ice cream. Our favorite is the Oreo Cookie ice cream, so creamy and delicious! I normally love waffle cones, but here they have a lot of almond extract so the cone tends to overpower the ice cream flavors. So, we usually run in and grab a half gallon for $10.99 and skip the line!
author: Kendra N.

description: Definitely a staple on my "bring tourists here" list. I love Mitchell's. Amazing customer service even when the line is out the door and absolutely delicious ice cream. Plus tons of variety. I always say I will try something new but end up getting the grasshopper pie ice cream sandwiches between two chocolate chip cookies. It's easy to tell why everyone in the San Francisco/Daly city area knows about Mitchell's, it's just that wonderful!
author: Angela D.

description: Tried the Brown Sugar & Spice, it was sooooo good. Very holiday-ish flavor! I have heard a lot about Mitchell's and while in SF, finally had a chance to stop in. It's a very small place, we came here on a weekday late afternoon, so we only waited maybe 5 minutes, which I've heard is pretty good for this place. Summer evenings especially are packed. There are a few benches out front to sit on. Would definitely come here again when in the area to try some of their other flavors!
author: Courtney K.

description:
First time trying Mitchell's ice cream and it was yummy! My sister had the Ube and I had the coffee. Both were not overly sweet and had a nice creamy texture. I usually prefer hard ice cream, but this one was perfectly soften. The true flavors came through. 

The servers were also very nice and patience with all the sample tasting.
author: Tamy N.

description: Ube ice cream.  Haven't had it?  You should.  The other flavors are equally as awesome.  GO NOW!  Get delicious ice cream.
author: Tom T.

description:
There's a reason why everyone loves this place. The ice cream here is amazing and perfectly creamy! I love the unique flavors they have like Buko (young coconut) and halo halo (Filipino dessert). 

I got a junior scoop ($2.60) of Ube (purple yam). It wasn't a huge scoop but enough to satisfy my craving. If you haven't tried this yet it's definitely worth getting a sample of Ube here. It's my favorite flavor!
author: Linda X.

description:
Definitely a memorable spot during my time in SF. Mitchell's is an ice cream shop with mostly Filipino-inspired flavors such as baby coconut and halo-halo but also a variety of different shakes, malts and sundaes.

After having my number called and trying a few flavors, I ordered the halo-halo and was 100% satisfied. 

*Halo halo is a Filipino dessert usually with crushed ice, condensed milk, red bean, jackfruit, various flavored jellies and a purple yam (ube) or jackfruit ice cream on top.* 

The ice cream flavor definitely hit all these flavors without me having to deal with the  messiness of the actual dessert. It was creamy, not too sweet but still have a few fun textures within it. I don't usually finish ice cream but I inhaled my generous one scoop in a waffle cone!
author: Mallery O.

description: This is one of San Francisco's must-go-to ice cream spots. There are so many flavors to pick from. I suggest ube ice cream. On the other hand, the milkshakes are another thing to try. The consistency from having the milkshake too heavy or liquidy is just right. Do not get Mitchell's milkshakes at other places that carry Mitchell's ice cream. I had a very bad stomach ache when my strawberry milkshake was made at other flagship stores. Don't waste your time, just go to the original Mitchell's. Whenever I come into Mitchell's, go to Brian. Brian knows how to make a milkshake and can offer good combinations of milkshakes that go well together. I'm a returning customer for sure.
author: M L.

description: Mitchell's Ice Cream does not disappoint! (Though I usually say that about a lot of the ice cream joints in San Francisco :) ) Make sure to grab a ticket number to your left as you enter and get ready to try a whole galore of flavors when they call your number. They are pretty generous with their samples and you're definitely going to find something you want a couple of scoops of. And add the $0.50 for the waffle cone- it's delicious and totally worth it. Tropical 4 was creamy and fresh if you are looking for something fruity. They even sell half gallons at $10.50 to take home. This place is awesome- stop by if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Grace L.

description: Mitchell's is without a doubt my favorite ice cream in the Bay Area. I've been coming here since I was a kid, it's a perfect no matter what time of the year- you'll see lines even when it's pouring out. Some popular flavors (which happen to be my favorites) are the mango, and grasshopper pie. This San Francisco gem is worthy of all its praise!
author: Jesus L.

description:
GRASSHOPPER PIE. Ermygerd. So good.

Really, you've got to try this stuff. Fantastic mint ice cream (not too spearminty and not too pepperminty), with gobs and globs of hot fudge indiscriminately added in and HUGE chunks of soft Oreo cookies. This is everything I love about grasshopper pie and none of the things I don't (bad whipped cream, chips in the ice cream.) They really nailed the chunkiness level. I'm so glad I don't live near here or I'd be eating a couple pints of this a week.

For those of you who are adventurous or want seasonal flavors, Mitchell's is your place. They have Filipino flavors, some fantastic mango ice cream, and rotating options like pumpkin. It's all good, and they pack in the flavor. I could get a scoop of any flavor and be happy. But since I had a taste of that grasshopper pie, I just can't settle for anything else.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I will forever love Mitchell's ice cream No other ice cream  can steal my heart!!!! My family and I have been supporting our favorite ice cream shop for decades  and will continue to!!!!!! BEST ICECREAM IN SAN FRANCISCO!!!!!
author: Shazanna T.

description: Variety is the spice of life...! Have you ever got bored of eating the same old, routine, flavors?? I hear you because I go through that dilemma every time i crave for ice cream. Mitchell's ice cream place is one among my favorites now. I am already high on calories since I have been there because they have so many options and I can't resist trying them all . My favorite till now was mango n pistachio but now I have one more on the list that is "coconut pineapple". I just loved it . Must try guys. I recommend this place to all the ice cream lovers.
author: Namisha G.

description: One of my local favs bc of the flavors. Top fav are mango and lychee. In the past I've ordered my hubby's bday cakes from here with both flavors but unfortunately they don't do lychee for cakes anymore. We tried banana this year instead. It was good but still missing my lychee!
author: Musetta S.

description:
I love food but I've never had a sweet tooth. Despite the cold weather, I wanted to be agreeable to my date's request to go to Mitchell's. We lucked out and were given an earlier number by someone who was walking out of Mitchell's which saved us 5-10 minutes of waiting time out in the elements.

I still had plenty of time to browse the flavor board and the longer I looked, the more confused I got. When we were finally called, I sampled Ube (purple yam) and Macapuno (sweet coconut) and settled on one scoop of Macapuno.

Mitchell's is a SF institution; it's not trendy or hipster but it is creative and delicious. I'm not sure I'd wait more than 15 minutes for this ice cream (or any ice cream for that matter),
author: Yi Z.

description:
Ice cream!!!

Private parking lot. Service was good but moved kind of slow. Do not forget to get a number right when you walk in.

Pistachio - $3.60 - The single scoop was pretty big. Good pistachio flavor with pistachios throughout. The ice cream itself was very creamy. 

They offer a few samples so you can try a few different flavors. I enjoyed my scoop.
author: Kevin W.

description:
Great as always, but the crowd is getting more upscale and really snooty.

In the 70's, while in line here, it never failed that someone or other would come around taking pictures of the "Mitchell Brothers" or asking where the strippers were. 

Those were the days!
author: George T.

description:
Definitely one of the best ice cream places in SF to go to! Rain or shine there's always a crowd out the door 90% of the time I pass by here! There's the usual flavors you would find at chain supermarkets like Mango, Buko, Lychee, Macapuno, Orange Sherbert,  and Vanilla. When you come here, you'll be glad you did because they got so many other flavors that aren't offered in stores and there are special ones that are seasonal(Pumpkin, Spumoni, eggnog, Peppermint Candy and more...) also!

Each time I come me here, the service from the cashiers has always been good no matter how crowded the place gets. Off the top of my head, my personal favorite flavors are Thin mint, Grasshopper pie, Mexican Chocolate, eggnog, horchata, rum raisin, and Spumoni. 

Sometimes they even have new flavors that aren't even listed on their website, so there's always something new I want to try out when I go there!  The only thing that deters me from visiting here is the parking that's hard to find...
author: Eric T.

description: Ube ice cream is to die for! Not much parking spots so you gotta find street parking. Shop is small so you take a number and wait for it to get called. It goes by faster than you think! Their Halo Halo is top notch too!!!
author: Jacquie S.

description:
Brought here by sister and it's busy. They have their own parking lot but it's competitive to have a spot but parking around is not bad. Only took a few minutes for me to find a spot.
I got the cookie n cream with pistachio and it was amazing. The texture and the right amount of flavor and real pistachios was incredible. Definitely coming back when have time.
author: Susan L.

description: Yum! This place was still packed 15min before close. This stuff is worth the wait--super creamy and full of flavor. We got chocolate chunk (I think) and macapuno. I was in SF on vacation and I miss this ice cream. Don't forget to grab a ticket! They call by number like a deli counter.
author: Joanne W.

description: Great ice cream with many different flavors why don't they franchise ? No place to enjoy the ice cream inside but good things are meant to be shared elsewhere.
author: Juan V.

description: Great original flavors and really smooth but not too rich icecream. Awesome stuff, deff going back!
author: Morgan P.

description:
"Where's the line" My first thought when I came here for my first time. People were nice enough to let me know that I had to grab a number on the left side of the entrance. It's like grabbing/ripping a number at the fish market waiting for my number to get called. That's pretty cool! Beware: super packed on a Saturday but the service is pretty quick! 

I got a pint of ube ice cream. It tasted really flavorful, like a strong taro flavor. I tried so many samples and the guy who helped me out was patient and gave us big scoops of samples, so nice. I would recommend the chocolate caramel crackle ice cream as well. This place is worth trying and I would want to come back every weekend to get different flavors.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
***sigh*** I missed you Mitchell's

Ice cream shops are kind of institutions around SF and this is one of the neighborhood faves.

Luckily, one Sunday Fatday afternoon the line wasn't out the door (for once) and we jumped out the car to grab a ticket/number. As soon as we did, wouldn't you know that a line formed behind us.

I got the cantaloupe while the BF got the ube, and another friend got the halo halo.  They satisfied the craving on our last day in SF!
author: Laurie V.

description: I've been coming here since I was 2 years old. Grew up in the mission before it got gentrified and all the hipsters and techies took over.. still glad it's still around and hasn't changed. This was even the ice cream I had when I got my tonsils removed when I was 5. This is a staple of San Francisco. I'm not a big ice cream fan but I'll always make an exception for this place. Don't think twice. Best ice cream in all SF!!!
author: Charmi E.

description:
This ice cream is delicious. 

I've had the mango and rocky road, both awesome.

Lines are out the door here, there's no public bathrooms, but it's still worth it. 

If you get a prepackaged tub of ice cream, you can skip the line and go to the front right for a separate line. 

If you're dying for a bathroom, the front porch is right around the corner.
author: Chhaya N.

description: so awesome. so wonderful. so classic. I've been going here since in utero! Their ice cream is simply the best.....and there is always, always, always a line.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I've been coming here since I was in high school. 

A group of us would drive out of the Richmond (which seemed so far back then) and grab some grasshopper pie here. One of my favorite flavors in the past, but I just can't handle the sweetness anymore.

Nowadays, you'll find me with a scoop of coconut (either flavor but more often buko). I usually opt for a kids size too. Gotta watch this lady figure!

With that said, I no longer drive out here specifically for ice cream. If I'm in the area, I'll stop by. There are plenty of closer creameries. 

Pro tip:
Drop off someone in your group to grab a number. 

TLDR:
You can't lose here.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The Ice Cream Bar in Cole Valley makes my favorite ice cream in SF but Mitchell's makes my favorite flavors. So much so that I rarely come here to order a scoop--I'm here to stock up on my half gallons like it's nobody's business! Please tell me where else in the city I could get legit halo-halo or buko (young coconut) or lucuma or langka (jackfruit)? 

But as much as I love me some Southeast Asian tropical goodness and the delicious combo of beans, jellies, and fruit in the Halo-Halo, my #1 favorite flavor is the Grasshopper Pie. I'm a complete sucker for anything chocolate + mint and nobody seems to be doing it better than Mitchell's (and that includes the Ice Cream Bar). Mitchell's Thin Mint is damn good too but the ribbons of fudge and chunks of Oreo bits in their signature Grasshopper Pie makes it famous for a reason. Just writing about it now makes me want some even though it's freezing today.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
Love Mitchell's! With over 3,000 reviews, I don't think there's much else to say that hasn't been said yet. When in SF, you must go!! Ice cream flavors range from traditional rocky road or strawberry, to less conventional flavors like dulce de lece or ube (very popular). At the moment i'm loving butterscotch marble! :P

This place is usually crowded (especially on a hot day... beware!), but the line moves very fast. Make sure to take a number, they're on the left wall right after you walk in the doorway! The workers are nice and give you free samples when you ask.

They also have containers (I think pints and quarts) for sale in freezers on the left. You can skip the line and buy these pre-packaged at a cashier on the right!

Parking is meh.. Depends on if you get lucky in their small parking lot! Street parking isn't too bad though.

Mitchell's is a staple ice cream place in the city. Creamy, delicious ice cream, with flavor options for everyone's cravings! Give it a try if you haven't!
author: Tara A.

description: I absolutely love this place. It will always have a place in my heart and memories. I've been coming here since I moved to SF at the age of three, and it always satisfies my ice cream and nostalgia cravings. This place is as consistent as a Swiss watch and never disappoints. My favorite ice cream 1-2 combo is the rum raisin and coconut pineapple on a waffle cone. I hope I can continue to come here for the rest of my life :-)
author: Oscar G.

description:
They have some exotic ice cream flavours here. I chose the ube since it was a popular choice. The staff there mentioned they did not use artificial flavouring in their ice creams. You can definitely taste the yam flavour. I got my single scoop on a waffle cone but there are many other alternatives.

Make sure to pick up a ticket because there is no formal line.
author: James S.

description: Really good Ice Cream, really good customer service,and really friendly Turkish cashier. 10/10 would yum again.
author: Nestor S.

description:
Growing up, Mitchell's was the first ice cream parlor I've ever visited and where we go after every dentist appointment. What can I say, our family LOVES Mitchell's!?! This "crazy" family tradition was created to remove the fluoride taste out of our mouths & boy did it work! Even our Dentist would shake his head while laughing & say, "Off to Mitchell's now!?!" When my parents moved out of SF, our tradition evolved, I now deliver Mitchell's ice cream to them at least once a month! :) 

According to my Dad, Mitchell's Tropical Flavors were introduced through a Filipino employee..and that's how Mango, Ube, Macapuno, Avocado, Halo Halo flavors were created. I have yet to confirm this as fact! (I should have asked when I saw the daughter (who currently runs Mitchell's) eating lunch at Fresca (Noe Valley location) with her Dad (one of the original brothers/owners). But what I do know, what is true to my ice cream loving core is-Mitchell's has the best ice cream everrrrr! Yup, I said it!!!

Here are my top favorites:
Chocolate (eating this since day 1! No one tops their version!)
Grasshopper Pie
Mango
Claire's Pie (seasonal & maybe discontinued! tears of sadness)
Thai Ice Tea 
Macapuno (coconut)
Vanilla dipped in chocolate
Avocado
Pumpkin (seasonal)
Oreo ice cream shakes 

Their ice cream cakes are great, too! Some are pre-made in the freezer, but custom cakes are easy to order & great! You can order custom cakes 2-4 days before your event (smaller cakes 2 days, larger cakes 4 days). They even let me bring a edible photo to place on one of my custom orders :)

After all these years and with all the new ice cream shops popping up left & right in SF, Mitchell's IS STILL MY FAVORITE!! You scream for ice cream, I scream for Mitchell's!!!!
author: Geraldine R.

description:
Step #1: When you walk into Mitchell's (after dodging the dozens of people milling around), don't do anything else until you've grabbed a number. They're on the wall immediately to your left. 

Step #2: You wait.

Step #3: Keep waiting.

Step #4: Get a little excited when they call a group of numbers to come wait inside the store, and your number is included. Stand around like a sardine waiting your turn, and watch jealously as other parties erupt in cheers and applause when their number is called. It's like winning the lottery or something.

Step #5: Scope out all those flavors while you wait...

Step #6: Hear those blessed words--your number, being called out, and raise your hand before they skip you over. Your turn has finally arrived.

I recently stopped by Mitchell's on my way out of town, at about 9:00 on a Saturday night. It was jam packed (of course). I grabbed number 77 just in time to hear them call 23. No big deal...only took 39 minutes for them to get to 77!

They've got lots of unusual flavors, with a Filipino influence, which is fun--buko (baby coconut), ube, mango, and halo halo, which is the mother load of all that stuff--buko, langka, and ube with mongo beans and sugar palm. I ate my ice cream in the dark in the car driving home, and it was like a box of chocolates...I was never quite sure what I'd get in the next bite. Tasty, and fun to try something different, but I wasn't blown away.

Their ice cream has a lot of additives (guar gum, locust bean gum, soy lecithin, etc.). Not exactly artisinal quality, but you aren't exactly paying artisinal prices, either, on the upside.

Fun to try, but not my jam.
author: Dara M.

description: Totally forgot what we got but it was okay ice cream, not the best I had but they did have a lot of cool flavors that you wouldn't find elsewhere like halo halo...good thing is that this place opens up late, you get pretty big scoops of ice cream
author: Arcadian B.

description:
Love the friendly and welcoming staffs. 

Love that they are open late.

Love the ICE CREAM!!

You must try their Ube, Halo-Halo, Citrus Cocktails, and Yuzu on a waffle cone. Treat yo self!!!
author: Owie N.

description: I've only bought their pre-made ice cream cake -- it's amazing! The cakes are beautifully done, the ice cream is the perfect consistency (just slightly soft for the cakes) and the cake itself holds up after a while in the freezer. The reason I'm giving 4 stars and not 5 though was the service I received the last time I was there. Some of the smallest available pre-made cakes run ~$40, and I had a note written on the top that was done very poorly. They understood and were kind enough to redo it, but it was still not great. I'll definitely continue to go back, but I may order ahead of time next time and see if that helps. It may seem like a small thing, but the handwriting on top definitely affected the presentation.
author: Alexa M.

description:
I honestly think that Mitchell's is not worth the wait. The ube was meh and so was the macapuno. I thought that the grasshopper was good, but very overpowering and once you taste the grasshopper, then you pretty much have to get that flavor. 

French vanilla custard sounded SO good, but I thought it was very bland. I just expected so much more from Mitchell's since it's crazy packed all the time.

I would go to Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous over Mitchell's any day :)
author: Jennifer T.

description:
All I can say is that I am lactose intolerant and I opted for 2 big scoops of ice cream. 
Grasshopper and cinnamon. 

Luckily it was a rain day and there was no one there.
So I bugged the poor man to let me sample multiple flavors of ice cream.

There is also a private lot but probably not sufficient on a busy day.


P.S. Lactaid is present made from heaven.
author: Eunice K.

description:
If you're going to go to Mitchell's and live in SF or are on your way home, I highly recommend you just go in and buy a 1/2 gallon for $9.85.

Even on a cold night, there's lines with dozens and dozens of people waiting (go inside and 'get a number") to get served.  Remember, get that number, don't stand outside waiting only to invest time before realizing there's a "system" you need to adhere to.

They have so many flavors, many are unique, making this a cool boutique ice cream parlor.  Many restaurants and stores even tout "we serve Mitchell's ice cream" so you know it's good if it's branded in that fashion.

The favorite flavor I have here is called "Tropical 4" which is a blend of: Banana, Mango, Pineapple and Guava ice cream all in one.

They used to (maybe still do) make Ice Cream Cakes too.

It's a nice location on San Jose Avenue, easy to get to, sometimes difficult for parking (since the place is rather small yet very popular anytime of the day, regardless of weather).

Kids love this place too of course!
author: Rick S.

description:
Large variety of ice cream flavors, basic (vanilla), creative (peanut butter indulgence) and cultural (halo halo, avocado). Available on a cone, sundae, boat or float.
A few sherbet picks and a nice selection of toppings.
A must when visiting San Francisco. Mitchell's is one of the few original locally owned businesses left in SF.
author: Dee Q.

description:
There's so many reasons why I like this place, not only is this where my GF grew up getting her ice cream fix after school, but just the time spent with her and my cousin whom I haven't seen in years made the experience that much more enjoyable.

There is a small parking lot in the back (if you're lucky enough to find a spot) and street parking, but it is rare and if you see an open spot, DO NOT hesitate to take it.

I was surprised at the Filipino flavored ice cream that they make in house (I believe) as I'm used to only seeing the big corporate food companies supply it. There was langka (Jack Fruit), Ube (purple yam), mango (mango, duh), and many others that slip my mind at the moment.

I was being "boring" and chose a regular caramel with a chocolate dipped and nuts waffle cone. 

We enjoyed our ice cream on the bench just outside and it got busy/packed really quickly and it seemed like the staff was able to handle the rush with no problem. I do see this place is busy even at night, so be prepared to wait, lucky for us, we found parking, no wait, and was able to enjoy our treat.
author: Wes S.

description: From LA but used to visit SF often and this spot def brings back some nostalgia!  Mexican Chocolate is the way to go :)
author: Christian R.

description:
