After all of these years, I finally got around to trying Mitchell's Ice Cream. I swear I've had it before, but just not in the store.

Upon entering, I was overwhelmed by the HUGE selection of ice cream flavors, but was warmly greeted by one of the staff members who was more than willing to give me samples of every flavor, if that's what my heart desired. It felt like I must have tried more than a half dozen flavors before I decided to take a pint of Halo-Halo ice cream home and a scoop of Mango for the road. All of the flavors that I tried (ube, avocado, pumpkin, macapuno, buco...) halo halo and mango seemed like the best. I didn't venture into trying the more ordinary flavors, as I felt like the novelty of Mitchell's are all of their atypical (or are they now typical) flavors.

Can't wait to share the pint of Halo Halo with my family!
author: Audrey C.

description: there is no competition. mitchell's has the best ice cream in the city. mitchell's is where the natives go for ice cream. the lines are long but it's worth the wait.
author: Fina B.

description:
Would rate 6 stars if possible, both for the ice cream and the service. We were lucky enough to have our number called by Nestor, who I believe was the supervisor on duty on a Sunday night. This dude was on his A game with the way he treated us. Some lunatic in our group said he wanted a chocolate dipped cone AND a shake, but couldn't decide. So naturally, we asked if Nestor could make the shake, and dip the cup (of the shake) in chocolate, so the lunatic could lick the cup.

This sounds ridiculous, but Nestor laughed and told us he'd see what he could do. Not only did he offer to fulfill such a ridiculous request, he came through with flying colors. This thing was literally perfect. The cup filled with milkshake was perfectly dipped in a chocolate shell - Nestor wasn't sure what to call it, so the lunatic in the group named it "The Boomer".

Aside from a bit of a wait, the experience was fantastic. Couldn't have asked for better ice cream, or better service. Will definitely be back here again, and hopefully will be lucky enough to be served by Nestor.
author: Nick S.

description: Some of the best ice cream I've ever had! Very creamy and not overly sweet. Had the pistachio and it was delicious with real pistachio nuts in it and no artificial taste. I will definitely be coming more often!
author: Seema B.

description:
Yay! I finally get to check out the hype of this place after eating dinner at The Front Porch across the street. 

Their line system is really weird. You grab a number and then crowd around the counter until your number is called. The might as well just have it be an organized line. I lost about 5 minutes because I didn't know I was suppose to grab a number.

Anyways, the have an extensive selection of ice cream. A huge assortment of classic flavors, and also a lot tropical flavors. I got one of their newest flavors - limon con galletas which was lemon flavored ice cream with crushed up vanilla oreos. It was pretty good, though I thought it melted kind of fast. 

Overall, I think the line experience could have been better, but the ice cream was still good.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
Very rude manager on duty! I came around 9pm last night with my family of 10. We got our ticket and proceeded to wait. My mom saw that there was an express line if you purchase packaged goods so she proceeded to buy wafers and get a cup of ice cream sooner for my uncle visiting from New York. 

Right before our number was called the staff became increasingly IMPATIENT and began calling the numbers quickly without waiting for customers to walk into the store from outside! I couldn't believe it!! They called our number hastily and the manager on duty comes up to us RUDELY refusing service because one of the other staff kindly gave my mom an extra scoop of ice cream in the express line. Why create an issue with paying customers? We were about to buy 10 more orders!!! I was very disappointed by the experience this man gave us. If you cannot handle the large amount of people in your store maybe you should run to the back and destress with a pint of ice cream...
author: Sharleen R.

description: Mitchell's is an SF classic. It's more of a classic flavor selection than other ice cream shops that are popular that have more unique and (I think) enticing offerings. That being said they do classics well. I like to try a new flavor every time I'm there and the only reason I give it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I really only think one flavor is to die for: the Grasshopper. Most of the other flavors I have tried were just okay. They definitely have a unique assortment of tropical flavors. Line is always out the door. Staff is friendly.
author: theresa v.

description:
Mitchell's seems to be carried and touted by a lot of local stores in the city. Given that, I felt I had to try it while I was in the area. Their storefront is down near bernal heights and it does attract quite a crowd.

Comparatively, they offer the largest variety of flavors of all of the big name ice cream shops in the city. Most of them are run of the mill but they do have a couple of very unique flavors which makes them stand out. I wasn't very impressed with the grasshopper flavor which everyone seems to rave about, but I was very impressed with all of the tropical fruit options they had. 

I tried the mango, which was good, but I decided to go with the buka (baby coconut) and the macapuna (sweet coconut). These were both delicious and reminded me a lot of haupia flavor which you find in Hawaii. 

Overall, I think they have good, but not great ice cream. Their topping selection is very limited as well. If you like rare tropical flavors like cantaloupe, halo halo or avacado, give this place a shot.
author: Mark O.

description: Doesn't get much better then Mitchell's in Valley Stream. Been to many diners and have to say again....doesn't get much better then Mitchell's.    Soups are amazing. Burgers-- big,moist and tasty.quisedellas-- great steak.chicken over salad-- moist,tasty. Fries-- okay,but I'm not a French fry lover.  Wait staff not all the same-- some better then others. Take out guy was on the ball--didn't miss anything and he deserved a good tip.This place is always busy and we are always well satisfied with the food and service from  Mitchell's.  If you have to park 2 blocks away then park 2 blocks away,just get there.
author: John C.

description:
There's already 3,000+ reviews so I won't trouble you with review fluff.

Here's what you need to know:
1. Long lines, this is a popular location and also small, go figure
2. Small parking lot, it's san francisco, if you have the guts, park at the safeway
3. Expensive, for 2 scoops it's around $6. I could get a whole gallon bucket at wal mart!(ok, it's the not the same quality but hey, it's still ice cream right?
4. $10 for a quart of their take home ice cream, really? Is there gold flakes in the ice cream or something?
author: Da X.

description: Best classic ice cream in the Bay Area.
author: Al G.

description:
Tastes like stuff you can buy out of the freezer section at the grocery store.  The NORMAL grocery store.  No frills stuff.  

Not exciting.  Just a lot of flavors.  And a lot of hype.  

Texture is like sherbet.  EW.  Macapuno like salted caramel, isn't it a FRUIT!?!
Tropical Four looked better on the menu then in my mouth.  Pineapple Coconut, normal, I can get the same quality at Loard's.  

Take a number and wait, not too long and cheap cheap, but worth the calories?  No.

I don't get it.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
Toasted almond and Ube are my favorite from this place! BEST toasted almond! I personally went to Mitchell's to buy a tube of Toasted almond to bring back to Fremont ( that's a 15 minutes uber ride back to work, 5 minutes from work to bart, 50 minutes bart ride, and 10 minutes drive home). It miraculously survived!!!

However, there is always a wait, but it's worth it! Don't forget to pull a number because they call you by number!
author: Josie H.

description:
I don't usually review a place immediately after I've tried it, but when I do, you know it's hella amazing.

To be honest, I was a bit skeptical when my friend told me there was a place in SF that rivaled Bi-Rite. I mean how can there be a place that's better than the one and only?

But after looking at the reviews of Mitchell's I knew I had to check it out. 

Ironically, this ice cream parlor is located not far from Bi rite. You can get there with a 5 min drive down dalores. It's a small shop in San Jose avenue and you will definitely not miss it with the line of people outside.

Luckily I came at a good time around 2 when people barely started to trickle in. The first impression I got of Mitchell's was: this really does feel like an ice cream parlor. Kids were running around, there were decorations on the wall, etc. but the sickest part was probably their ticket system! You don't have to wait in line.

The one thing that did turn me off though was the vibe I got from the service. Not sure if it was an odd day, but I didn't really feel like the employees were happily engaging with customers. I wanted to take my time deciding on a flavor but I was a bit scared to test their patience. I definitely was afraid to ask to sample. Nevertheless I settled on UBE.

UBE IS NOW LIFE! That's how great it tasted. Who knew that purple yam in ice cream form could taste so legit. Gone was any hesitation about this place. Mitchell's is legit and I'll probably come back soon to try other items.

All in all, this place is equally comparable to bi rite from a first experience. The UBE was simple yet orgasmic and I can't wait to try their other stuff. What I like about bi rite however is their interesting assortment of flavors and their welcoming atmosphere- something I couldn't find here. But I will nevertheless keep coming back!

Dessert well and prosper,
author: Bryan W.

description:
Wow! 5 stars no doubt!

To be honest, when it comes to nice ice cream place in SF I only hear about Bi-Rite most of the time. I'm not a person who likes to follow the nom, so after I moved to SF I have been asking around people what's their favorite ice cream store is. The name Mitchell comes up once in a while, so decided to give it a try.

Mitchell is located on San Jose avenue; from yelp review I was afraid that I would see a super long line the day I went but it turned out only 2 people were ahead of me. I guess I was lucky then. It was a pretty chilling Monday night around 7:30pm though.

So what you need to do first is to grab a number (machine on your left next to the door when you walk into the shop) and wait for your number to be called. There were a lot of flavors displayed in the fridge, and I swear I tried like 6 flavors; I said sorry to the guy who was helping me and he's all cool with it.

So I ended up choosing Ube and Halo-halo.

-) Ube: A. That was great! Ube means (or at least it's made of) purple yam, and according to their website it's imported from Philippines. It is sweet, but not artificial sugar type of sweet, it's a deep kind of sweet that you will only feel it at the back of your throat. Some may wonder this is similar to taro but they are completely different. Ube flavor that Mitchell serves is so much fresher. 

-) Halo-halo: A. So this is actually the name of a famous Filipino dessert, and is a mixture of jackfruit, sweet potato, pineapple, lychee, ube (info from the staff there) plus some beans and other stuff, and Mitchell makes a flavor out of it. Personally I have never tried Halo-halo dessert alone, but I can just say the flavor taste so good. The fact that halo-halo does have Ube in it may confuse you when you eat them together; but halo-halo has got a lot more interesting tastes to it since it's made up of so many different ingredients. I would say it's around 80% sweet and 20% sour, and it's unlike any other ice-cream flavors I have tasted before. Highly recommend this flavor.

Man, there are so many different flavors to choose from and I can't wait to go back and try each single one of them already. But the Ube and Halo-halo are so good that I'm not sure if I can skip these next time!
author: Simon C.

description:
I have never seen lines like this line! Thank God a woman leaving gave us her ticket or else we would have waited another 20-25 minutes on top of the 20 minutes we waited. There have must been at least 50 people waiting in line for a freakin' ice cream! 

It was my first time here and didnt know what to get, so I got a safe choice, the peanut butter indulgence and a new crazy flavor, the Kahlua mocha. The peanut butter wasn't wait I was expecting, it was chocolate ice cream with pieces of mini reese's. It was good but I thought it would be just peanut butter. But the Kahlua was absolutely my favorite! The waffle cone was one of the best I've tasted. 

It's a really really good ice cream but is it worth the minimum 25-30 min wait? Not for me!
author: Tamara S.

description: I haven't been here in nearly 20 years. It didn't disappoint. I wasn't looking forward to the line but they guys behind the counter know what they are doing. Called out their numbers and addressed each patron with their own personalized customer service. The line moved quickly despite the crowd. It did help being a weeknight.
author: E B.

description:
Yes.  Ice cream perfection lives here.  The ice cream is fantastic.  

They have whatever you want...
Ice cream straight up.
Sundaes.
Milkshakes.
Ice cream sandwiches.
Freezes.
They even do dips!

Flavors?
All the traditional flavors you know & love...
Plus some very different flavors like ube (purple yam), & avocado.

But that's not all.

The Mitchell's service.

Last night I requested a stop here after we left the Giants game.

Evidently, so did a lot of other people.

We got there at 10:40.  They close at 11:00.  It was completely packed inside, w an additional 20 plus people outside.

I took a number.  It was #24.
 
They were on #92.  

Yeah, 32 people were ahead of us, w only 20 minutes (barely) left before closing time.

The crowd was chill & happy.  Around 10:50 they announced they were about to close, & so, please, would anyone still waiting to be called come inside.  Everyone squeezed in, then they closed the door.

When we were finally up, it was 11:00.  The ice cream man that helped us was very courteous, & didn't rush us even when I asked for a sample.  I promptly ordered & he took his time to do a good job.  It was now after closing & it was kind of a mad house.  But all the employees were unfazed & still smiling.

When I went to walk out, another employee opened the door for me, & said "Thank you, miss.  Have a good night."

Ok.  All this creamy, dreamy, perfect ice cream, & I get referred to as "miss" too?!  

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
I would say 5 for myself,
The ice cream is delicious, and has many tropical flavors. I loved the UBe and Grasshopper which was a combo of mint ice cream with Oreos and chocolate. For someone who can not eat any ice cream and does have a dairy allergy, or lactose intolerant, would only have 3 flavors to choose from which are pink lemonade, grapefruit, and pear. I would recommend them creating a traditional flavor with almond milk, such as vanilla, coconut, etc something not so acidic or tangy. Pictures coming !
author: Jessica M.

description:
It's 40 degrees outside and there's a line for this place! Okay, let's check it out.  

Cool service. There were a ton of people inside but you just Take a number and when it's your turn to be served, they focus on you. I like that. You don't feel rushed when trying out flavors. 

All the flavors we tried were pretty good. Ginger was super strong. It will clear your senses! We ended up going with cinnamon snaps, grasshopper pie, and peppermint for the kids. All were pretty decent. If I get a chance to come back again, I'd go for the Buko (young coconut). It had some awesome coconut flavor when I tried it, unfortunately the wife and kids don't like coconut and I had to share on this occasion. But next time... That baby coconut is mine!
author: Jeremy L.

description: Expect a long wait of 30-40 mins to get your ice cream. Several flavors to choose from, I got the rum and raisin which was excellent and got a scoop of the pistachio which was also good. We also tried the Mexican chocolate which also good. They lost 1 star for the wait time.
author: A M.

description: This place is a really great place, love the ice cream, I will recommend to anyone, old or younger.
author: Fifi W.

description: Mitchell's office large Portions and delicious flavors. I had a thin mint Sunday and was totally impressed. The place is so popular that they don't even have a place to sit down you just order the dessert and walk away. Definitely Old Fashioned Ice Cream great service a true San Francisco gem. Cash is best for this place.  5 stars and more.
author: Gavin M.

description:
Along with the Bi-Rite creamery, Mitchells Ice-Cream is one of Bay Area's best ice cream stops! This place has all the flavors, but my favorite are the Ube and Horchata flavors.

If you have $5 on hand and you're looking for a wonderful, delicious ice-cream cone, look no further- Mitchell's has your back! :)
author: Anders Z.

description: I say this is the best ice cream in The City.  Like Bi-Rite, a good selection and quality without the annoying pretentious hipster BS.  But I think Mitchell's flavors and texture are slightly better.
author: Greg B.

description: There's a reason this place has a line... why it's been here for years... it's delicious and they are very friendly!!  They have so many flavors I found it hard to narrow it down.  I'm glad I live no where near them, otherwise, I'd be tempted to "treat yo self" way too often.
author: Chloe M.

description: I should have written a review long time ago.  A staple to the neighborhood. If they ever close, we be doomed!  It all depends what is favorite flavor is. But once you are there, you don"t know what to order. All the classics flavors are available along with other exotics one.  Ube, tres leche, rum raisin and so on.  The rum raisin is to die for.  On busy days you have to take a number, but it's worth it.
author: Hum V.

description: My most favorite ice cream place in the bay... got every flavor you would want! Just trued the cantalope for the first time.. So yummy and refreshing!!!
author: Rio O.

description: Avocado Ice Cream is all you need.
author: Brian C.

description:
Oh, the flavors! I loved all the tropical flavor options!

Grab a number and try to make up your mind between all the delicious flavors while you wait to be called...

I wish I lived nearby so I could buy one of the to-go tubs and have this deliciousness in my freezer! Instead, we settled on multiple flavors to share so we could enjoy all the variety! I love passion fruit and was so excited to be able to order it here. All the flavors we had were delicious, but nothing stood out as much as the delicious passion fruit. It was a bit tart for the wife, but I loved it!

Lots of great stuff going on here including:
+They sell halo halo (Filipino dessert)
+Lots of gluten free flavors
+Dairy free sorbet flavors like blood orange, guava, kalamansi, passion fruit, and mango
+They are open until 11pm
+They sell ice cream cakes

Their products are available for sale in some grocery stores in the SF area, but I wish they would expand and sell in So Cal!
author: Andrea V.

description:
The wait time is often 30min+ if you go there around 9 
But it is totally worth to wait.
My fav flavors are Strawberry&Cream, Lucuma, Dolce&Leche, Grasshopper and Pineapple&Coconuts.
Also Halohalo is heavenly good.
author: Tory T.

description:
Seriously so good! I was going to mark this place 4 stars just because there was a huge line when my boyfriend and I came here at around 10 or 9:30, and we didn't know to take numbers and there was no direction saying to do so. But honestly, when we figured out to take a number to wait, the wait time wasn't even that bad! It gives you time to think about what to get, see what other people are getting, explore the toppings and the tubs of ice cream that they sell too. 

I got the ube ice cream and it was so delicious! At first it kind of just tasted like vanilla to me, but when I started eating it more, I could detect the potato-ish taste. It's not as offsetting as it sounds though! It was really good and it made it a not toooooooo sweet dessert, which was perfect since I got Oreos on the ice cream as well.

The presentation is nice too! One scoop gives you a lot! They give you a huge scoop and then round it out with another tiny dollop on top. 

The people are SO friendly too! They were all very happy and they kept the mood up, which was nice because it was freezing outside and there were a ton of people inside. They take their time with the customers, but also realize they have others to help. They let you try as many flavors as you want too and give you recommendations.
author: Hana B.

description:
Avocado, Mango, Halo-Halo, and Ube (Taro) are a few of the amaaaaaaazing flavors this joint has to offer. Coming to Mitchell's is like going back to my childhood. I grew up with these flavors and man, they nailed it here...probably even better!

So first thing's first, walk in those doors and take a number to your left. They have a pretty good system here. Once your number is called, you go up front and you will have your own ice cream attendant to assist you. Taste whatever you want to taste and ask away as many questions as you want. Place your order then pay and you're good to go. Easy as 1, 2, 3! Being the popular ice cream parlor that they are, prepare to wait for your turn. I assure you, it's worth it! 

Credit cards accepted and there's a private lot for parking in the back. Otherwise, do street parking. 

I'm definitely coming back for more!!!
author: Marissa S.

description:
I think I had really high expectations coming here since I've heard so many positive things and it has 4.5 stars. Overall, the ice cream was good and it's a nice place to go to and try different exotic flavors.

I ordered the Mascapone and Ube Ice Cream. Both flavors were tasty and complimented each other really well. Our scooper was also really nice and literally let me try 5 different flavors before deciding what to get. One star for Customer Service here!

I can see why people like this place but in all honesty, it wouldn't be my first choice to get ice cream. Bi-Rite's Salted Caramel Ice Cream still wins my heart.
author: MyTien P.

description: Great ice cream spot not too far away from where I live.  My father used to deliver their ice cream ingredients to them and whatnot a longgggggggggg time ago.  They have a good variety of ice cream flavors and i've tried a lot of them but i usually just get vanilla.  its a good flavor even though it sounds like its a boring flavor.  ITS NOT!
author: Ben Z.

description:
One of the best ice cream places in SF!

They have lots of flavors to choose from and you have your classic choices and different ones. Feeling adventurous? They have flavors like ube, egg nog, and horchata.

It's very easy to get addicted to their ice cream. Very flavorful and creamy.

Don't be afraid to ask for samples! The staff's very friendly and very willing to give you tastings.

It's a small ice cream shop, so it can get crowded and the line can get long. They don't have much seating either. 

I got my ice cream in a cup, but you can get it with your typical sugar cones or with a waffle cone (can never go wrong with that).

They also have sundaes and they do cakes too! Also another hint, you can take it home! They will pack you their ice cream from a 1/2 pint to a gallon!

They have a little parking lot in the back, FYI or else your stuck with street parking if it's full.
author: Stephanie L.

description: I love this place. I'm not sure why it's so popular, but there's always a line. I enjoy this place a lot. You can get 1/2 a gallon of ice cream for 10.50 or about 2.90 for a junior scoop. There's limited parking in the area, so try the back first, then around the block to find some parking. There's quite a few flavors that I love here, one is the ginger snap ice cream which is cinnamon ice cream with gingersnap cookie mixed in. Next the oreo is great, and also the chocolate chip. You can also order sundaes, milk shakes etc. But the most worthy one is definitely the 1/2 gallon. My boyfriend and I enjoy late night dates here to grab dessert!
author: Amy Y.

description: It was a cold windy evening in sf. What's more appropriate then ice cream !?   Mitchell's Ice Cream!   When we drove by we saw the crowd waiting outside. Good sign . And good thing the owners of Mitchell's had the goods sense to use a numbering system , so you don't have to queue up in a horrible line !  Anyway our number was 21... They were calling out number 82 ...! It took about 30 minutes  before we were served . The wait actually didn't feel long because we weren't In a hurry and everyone else Waiting around were pretty cool and friendly.  It gave me time to really study the menu to figure out what what samples I wanted to try and order. They didn't have crazy out of universe flavors, however they did have a good number of tropical flavors to go along with the more traditional ones . I ended up sampling the mango , avocado , tropical four, and ube. All were very good . I settled on my Mexican chocolate single scoop on a sugar cone. It was so delicious !! I could really taste the cinnamon and rich dark cocoa ! Yum !   Quality, fresh ingredients, friendly service , and a simple back in the day feel . Gotta love Mitchell's :)
author: Brenda B.

description: Most favorite ice cream place ever!!! The parking sucks but from time to time you get lucky. Great service always! Never have had any of the workers be rude or impatient with me or my family.
author: Marilu G.

description: This is the best ice cream I ever had. A scoop of mango and Horchata and a banana split for my partner.  will come here again and again.
author: Neelima M.

description:
Stopped here on the way back from an event. The line was out the door; and it was really cold!? I like Ice Cream and figured the crowd on a night like last night (cold) must mean it's really good.

I was right. We had to wait about 30 minutes or so buts it was worth it. I had Oreo Cookie and Strawberries and Cream in a waffle cone; best ever!! They had a lot of exotic flavors so I'm gonna make it a point to drop in next time I'm in the city.
author: Fas S.

description:
This place never disappoints. Roomie and I decided to come here spontaneously last night. It was her first time at Mitchell's! She's from LA, so it was so new to her to have alot of filipino flavors around. I got Caramel Praline & Ube & my roomie got Ube & Cookies and Cream! Both were so delicious!!! I appreciate that this place closes pretty late since the ice cream places around where I live close around 9. We came at around 10pm and the line was not too bad but it definitely had people waiting outside.

Their system is that you get a number and pretty much wait until you get called. Just like a super market when buying fish. Lol. I grew up eating Mitchell's so theres never a bad encounter. Plus the workers are super friendly and let you have more than 1 sample. 

They sell Mitchell's ice cream at my nearest super market but i'd rather come here tbh.
author: Michelle T.

description:
The green tea ice cream and the sesame here is really good!! Usually other sesame ice creams are not as strong as the one here. You can really taste that strong sesame taste!
The green tea is good... Not GREAT, but it is better than a lot of other places.
I love how they have really strange flavors, I had a great time sampling the durian. But I wasn't brave enough to actually get the durian as the smell is too strong for me.
author: Ariunaa B.

description:
Dang it - disappointing :(

PARKING: They have a small parking lot in the back.  If you pass Mitchell's on the right hand side and turn right and then the immediate right is the entrance to the lot.  There are probably about 10 spaces.  We went on a cold and dreary monday afternoon and there were plenty of spaces and no line.

ATMOSPHERE: It reminded me of a rite-aid ice cream place with those old menu boards and the ice cream in tubs for you to choose from.  No seating inside and only two benches outside so you better go on a day where it's warm enough to sit outside or enjoy it in your car.

WAIT: Went on a Monday afternoon and there was no wait.  It was kind of weird because I wasn't sure who was supposed to help me and started talking to another guy who said he couldn't help me.  Waited and then another guy came and took my order.

FOOD:

The single scoop $3.20 is pretty small if you're used to big scoops.  It was just enough for me but I can imagine if you really like the flavors and ice cream you'd go for the double scoop.  

GRASSHOPPER PIE - It's mint ice cream with chocolate chips and oreo cookies and fudge swirls.  The ice cream was on the creamy side, which was already a negative for me.  Also, the mint didn't have that refreshing and fresh mint taste like Coolhaus or other places has.  The oreo bits were too chunky and not spread enough.  It was OK mint chocolate chip ice cream with a random oreo bit here and there.  I think I like my ice cream to be icy and refreshing like at scoops - but I didn't feel that after eating this one.

Overall - I realized that everyone has different ice cream they like, so I don't think my review should dissuade those of you who like creamy ice cream or want flavors like Ube, because 4.5 stars can't be wrong.  It just wasn't the ice cream for me.
author: Brittany T.

description:
Picked up a couple 1/2 pints of ube for a dinner party, and I was happy to see that there is a separate (read: faster) line for prepackaged items. They were also nice enough to put a pint of Thai tea together for us as well. They have a lot of Asian/Filipino flavors, and the ube was better than expected for me. I don't know why I wasn't expecting much, but I'd never had ube flavored anything before, and yam didn't sound that appealing. But, it was good! The ice cream itself is really good, but I am more enticed by the flavors at Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe.

They've got a small parking lot that fits about 5-10 cars but during peak hours, you'll have to drive around for parking. As others have suggested, if you have more than 1 person in your group, drop someone off to get in line and get a number to save time. We first drove by around 2-2:30pm and there weren't that many people, but after going to get groceries first and then coming back, the line was out the door! So I'm not really sure when their busy times are, but you can assume weekends and nights will be the busiest.
author: Kathy L.

description:
Went to Mitchell's tonight for dessert. This was our first time ever here.

We all enjoyed the ice cream. Good taste, good texture, and some interesting flavors that you can't get just anywhere.

But on the other hand, it took 45 minutes from the time we arrived to the time we had ice cream. This place is clearly super popular, but it wasn't so amazing that I can justify anything close to that kind of wait (never mind the time to find parking.)
author: Jason G.

description: This was a childhood pastime, was always a treat when my parents took me and my siblings here. Now, after 20 years, being able to take my own kids here and watch them pick their favorite flavors ... it's great memories.
author: Jamie G.

description:
This place is packed every single time I come! As soon as you get there, go inside and immediately to your left is a ticket machine. Sometimes the kind-hearted-Mitchells-lovers accidentally pull 2 tickets and leave one on the counter space behind the machine. This is especially helpful if you get there and pull ticket #54, but there is a #45 mysteriously waiting for you on the counter. Be a kind soul and pay it forward. 

Employees here are nice but clearly tired by 9pm. I always feel a teeeny bit bad when I can't make a decision and want to try just one more flavor. Grasshopper pie is delicious, but I also love all the different coffee flavor versions they have.

Probably most famous for their different Filipino flavors (ube, halo-halo); you can even buy a half-gallon already prepackaged.

There's a tiny parking lot in the back but it's always full. I always manage to find street parking within 1 or 2 blocks though.

It's in kind of a weird location off San Jose and there's really only residential housing on this street, so it's kind of a walk if you're going to get back to the main drag (aka Mission).
author: Steph D.

description:
This is one tiny but busy ice cream shop!

What you need to do first is go inside a grab a number. There's a machine next to the door on the left. Then you wait patiently on the curb for your number to be called while lovers canoodle and a million unattended children run around you. Joyous. 

I recommend getting the Ube. It's purple yam and taste like magic.
author: Sara L.

description: Best ice cream ever! Staff was very friendly and helpful. So many flavors to choose from.
author: Patricia M.

description: Pricey and parking situation is tricky but high quality ice cream! They have a lot of exotic flavors and one of my favorite is Ube. I love the Ube in their halo halo, insanely good.
author: Natalie L.

description: Finally got around to going here after seeing it ranked so well on Hoodline's ranking of top ice cream joints in the country. As good as advertised. Maybe better. I got the Mexican chocolate with caramel topping and almonds. Devine!
author: Graig N.

description:
My brain spins from all the flavor options as well as the chaotic crowd. 

You have to get a number. Most likely you are 20 numbers after the current number being called. The crowd is spilling onto the streets. It is madness which kind of makes it more exciting. Don't be the dbag that wants to try every flavor before you decide. I can guarantee that you will like whatever you think you would like.

The wait is all worth it in the end. Or if you don't want to wait, you can grab one of their pre-packaged ice creams and skip the line.
author: Denise L.

description: Great service by jorge v, its no wonder hes been employee of the month! Im sure they like everyone else want to leave at the end if the day but he was great. Didnt rush us at all and let my niece sample hella flavors with a smile on his face the whole time. Thanks for the great customer service!!
author: Diana M.

description: Awesome place to visit. Hard to decide what to eat. Mostly crowded in evenings so plan accordingly
author: Naresh K.

description: This was some good icecream though i expected more based on the queues before we got to the icecream. Had avocado and toasted almod. Good but not very string flavours. Will go back and try their tropical stuff next time.
author: Roadtrip T.

description:
Is 5 stars the highest I can go? 

I was a bit skeptical about coming to Mitchell's but after one lick of my Grasshopper Pie, I was a believer. It's everything that ice cream should be. I also could not stop sneaking bites of my friend's Chocolate Cherry cone dipped in chocolate. I've decided that every cone I get from here on out needs to be dipped in chocolate; there's just no other way. 

I came on a Friday night around 9PM and the line was out the door. Mad props to the staff for knowing how to manage such large masses of sugar-hungry customers. Our wait was about 20 minutes but needless to say, I'd wait until the end of the world for you, Mitchell.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Good quality ice cream from a small shop in Mission! The mango ice cream is delicious! They have so many options to choose from, so if you're hesitant you can always ask for a sample Remember to grab a ticket when you walk in, its not a place where you wait in a physical line.
author: Larissa L.

description:
The place to go for exotic, Asian inspired ice cream. If you want the basic flavors, they have them. But, open your horizons and try something different. You won't be disappointed!

The only caveat is their Mint Chip ice cream. It tastes like medicine.
author: Gene D.

description:
A sweet ice cream shop in San Francisco.
Small, but mighty!
So many flavors to choose from, including a lot of tropical flavors.
I settled on the Grasshopper Pie, and I was not disappointed. Creamy mint ice cream with chocolate chunks, brownie pieces, and chocolate fudge marble. It's pretty much an awesome sundae in a scoop
My partner chose chocolate raspberry. Soooo good. Tasted like a chocolate raspberry truffle.
I found the store to be a tad bit confusing. With just a small group in the store when we arrived, I wasn't sure where to stand, and where to pay. It seems like when there is a long line the place would be better organized.
Parking is all street. Come during off hours and snag a place in front like we did
I can't wait to go back for more ice cream!!!
author: Kat R.

description: The best ice cream in the world. I would definitely suggest to come around the evening, so it won't be as congested as it normally would be.
author: Aymen A.

description: This is one of my favorite ice cream place in all SF. So many flavors to choose from and all of them really good!
author: Kira B.

description: Best Ice Cream I've ever had thus far.  We were skeptical getting to the shop due to all the residential homes.  We thought where are we? Until but we arrived to the mass amount of people.  They were busy but well organized.  Just don't forget to take a number.
author: Art E.

description:
Returning to Mitchell's is like taking a step back in time.  It hasn't changed, it hasn't "modernized", and it works fine just the way it is.  Great choices, some new, some ethnic, but all solid, perfectly made premium ice cream.
We don't get here often enough, but always glad, even happy, when our travels take us this way.  This place is a gem!
author: Linda T.

description:
Love comes in many different shapes and sizes and here Love comes in form of ice cream.

Mitchells has quite a great variety of flavors. From sweet and savory, tangy and fruity, to plain and nutty.

Not only is the ice cream amazing, but so is the ambiance.  Its as if we all tranform to our 7 year old self's the minute we walk in. Sugar cones, waffle cones, sprinkles, cake,banana splits etc. There is no going wrong when youre at Mitchells. Bar none, best ice cream ever! Dont cheat yourself of the experience of flavorful ice cream cascading down your throat. A must try!
author: Leli C.

description: This is one of the must try ice-cream places in San Francisco. Established in 1953, they have gamut of ice-cream flavors from simple Vanilla to exotic tropical fruits. Staff are friendly and patient, they don't mind giving any number of flavors to try. We ended up trying more than 10 types! Ube is their most popular one and must try. Avocado and Lucuma were good too. They use token system to serve customers and also have limited parking backside. Overall it was a great experience and I would definitely visit this place again!
author: Anusha K.

description:
Every time I come here I've had to wait at least 15 minutes to order but it's always worth it.

Pros: best ice cream ever 
Cons: slightly expensive, long wait, parking can be a hassle
author: Fatima K.

description:
Mitchell's has a really unique selection of ice cream from a lot of the other places around the City. From what I've seen today, they specialize in Mexican and Filipino dessert flavors. 

We came in during the afternoon, and I was ecstatic to see that they provide parking in the back of the store (REALLY HAPPY seeing that SF = no parking).

What you do when you get in is take a ticket and wait until your ticket is called. When I first walked in I got really confused because there was no line since everyone's just standing around until their number gets called.

When our ticket was called, I think I annoyed the crap out of the guy serving us because we asked to try like 6-8 flavors lol. But to me, I thought that a lot of the flavors didn't stand out as much, but the one I liked the most was Halo Halo (Filipino Dessert).

I absolutely loved it-- it was creamy, had that Ube flavor, and had little bits of the Halo Halo ingredients stashed inside each bite. There was multicolored jellies and red bean in each bite. 

I'm really satisfied with what I got. But I wish there were more flavors that I could talk about that were just as phenomenal.
author: Grace H.

description:
I've been to both bi-rite and humphry slocombe and according to everyone had to go to Mitchell's to complete my ice cream endeavors. 

Even though there wasn't a line, it was sort of crazy with people rushing to the front and asking to try all the flavors. We grabbed a number and waited for them to call our number, which was in a few minutes. We tried a few flavors: ube (purple yam), halo halo, buko (young coconut), macapuno (sweet coconut), avocado, egg nog, and pumpkin. Everything we tried was so good (though my fiance felt the halo halo was a bit too much and the macapuno was too sweet for him, but he liked everything else). All the ice cream we tried had so much flavor and was so creamy.

In the end, I ended up getting a single cone of ube and my fiance got pumpkin. We were definitely happy. I bought a 1/2 gallon of ube to bring home :)

I think if you want some good ole ice cream and nothing super fancy then this is the place to go! If you want something unique and interesting, then I'd go to humphry slocombe.
author: Kristina L.

description:
Awesome ice cream!!! The best I have ever had!!!! The Oreo chocolate chip is the best!!

Pros: the fast  service, the great customer service even if they are EXTREMELY busy!!!!

Cons:  finding parking!!
author: Rosa R.

description:
Can never go wrong with Mitchell's Ice Cream!!
Been a fan since I was 5 year old !!
Yes, It gets busy throughout friday, saturday and sunday night. 
Basically, every night!!
My recommended flavor to try is their BUKO COCONUT (young coconut) flavor,
Thai TEA Flavor, and MANGO flavor !!! 
All of them taste great and it's not overpowered by sweetness.
If you are up for a little treat , this might be your best place yet.
On the way home, buy yourself half galloon of your favorite flavor :) !!
author: Anney T.

description:
Finally tried Mitchell's after all these years.  Bf & I found parking after circling twice (the parking lot was full).  Didn't know we had to pick a number; thought we just had to wait in line.  Finally got called after 7 minutes or so.  He decided on mango and I got the Tropical 4 (banana, mango, pineapple and guava).  Both were single size ($3.20).  I asked how big the junior size was and they said the size of a golf ball probably..why don't they just call it baby size or something, cuz that's small!  

I enjoyed my Tropical 4, though, I think I tasted more mango and banana.  His mango was what you'd expect.  I like how they have traditional flavors and tropical flavors available here.  They can't compete with Bi-Rite, but I'd give them a 3.5ish.  Good portion for the price, $9 minimum for card, moves a little slower than Bi-Rite, but easier parking than the Mission!
author: Cat C.

description:
You scream, I scream,we all scream for ICE CREAM! I'm not much of a dessert person and when I do have a sweet tooth I'll only take a couple bites. Ice cream is a different story, however. I'll go for ice cream anywhere, anytime and any place!

Mitchell's has really unique flavors! My favorites are :
Ube (purple yam)
Buko pandan (young coconut)
Grasshopper pie
Kahlua mocha cream
Thai tea

For a business with lines out the door almost every hour of the day, their system is pretty efficient. You take a number and wait to be served when your number is called. I haven't waited more than 15min even on their busier days. & if it's your first time or are in the mood to try somethin new, they let you sample their flavors

Always a treat when coming here!

Till next time, LIVE.LAUGH.LOVE.EAT.REPEAT
author: Joelle P.

description:
Warning: great tasting ice cream comes with a long wait, however, it's so worth it!

My top pick: Rum Raisin! They do not skimp out on the raisins and what else do you need? Their staff is super friendly and so accommodating. I've seen people order tubs and tubs of ice cream or be super picky with their orders and they do the best they can to get the line moving. 

Parking can also be tough in this area so I would recommend trying their parking lot behind the shop first because people come and leave all the time. So be patient and you won't have to walk blocks to get your delicious tasting ice cream!
author: Eva O.

description:
Had to put this place to the test since we have heard so much about MITCHELL's

Tiny little shop, so it gets pretty crowded quickly. I wouldn't recommend this spot if you are even the slightest bit CLAUSTROPHOBIC. 
Since it gets so busy, there were About 4 people scooping, packing, and ringing up customers behind the counter. 

Make sure you come in and grab a number ticket. They call out the numbers one by one and you step up and place your order. There was a number of choices to choose from and we wanted to sample a few flavors but because of the crowd and the sense of "hurry the heck up" we opted to skip. 

We walked away with a triple chocolate chip cookie sandwich filled with Ube ice cream and a cranberry raspberry sorbet in a waffle cone. 
 
All in all, it was nice to check this place off of our list of places to visit, but I won't go out of my way to come back. The ice cream wasn't anything out of the ordinary or super spectacular. Ube was great but is pass on the sorbet.
author: Ter L.

description: Personally i love different/wild flavors and they had the basics. It was also just really expensive but if that your cup of tea then go right ahead.
author: Tatiana M.

description:
Yummy yummy yummy! So many interesting flavors to try!

Parking is tricky, even though they have their own small lot in back.
author: N. F.

description:
Returning to the Bay Area, I wanted to hit up Mitchell's since it had rave Yelp reviews, been on TV and in the magazines, and has been a San Francisco landmark since 1953. We pulled up and around the back to an empty lot and NO LINES....wooohoooo! 

Perused the whole case, asked what the popular flavors were and sampled them all...Ube, Buko, Mango, Macapuno, Avocado, Claire's Pie, Lucuma, Halo-Halo.....I tried to find a flavor I liked, and all I could think of after trying all of these were Magnolia brand Ice creams because they also have those Asian flavors and taste exactly the same IMO.
some of the flavors tasted off and artificial, and some flavors had the texture of ice cream that had melted and was re-frozen.

Wifey ordered the Grasshopper Pie and I went with a scoop of Halo-Halo and a scoop of  their new flavor, Blueberry Cobbler. Halo-Halo was okay and they need to change the name to Blueberry Cheesecake because that's what it tasted like...not a cobbler.
Guess my expectations were too high, I REALLY REALLY wanted to like Mitchell's, but in the end, it was just A-OK....We will see if Bi-Rite lives up to the hype when I return to the Bay Area....ALOHA!!!
author: Nelson Q.

description:
Good: 
- Tons and tons of unique flavors. Only place in the entire bay area that has Lucuma ice cream, if you never tried it then you are missing one of the most magical flavors in existence. 
- Waffle cone add-on for just 50 cents? woah, that pretty fair.
- They just serve ice cream and they have a parking lot! in San Francisco! no matter how small it is that is still impressive.

Not so good:
- That place is so good and popular that you will have to wait at least 15 mins for your ice cream even if it is the coldest night in SF.
author: H C.

description: Are you looking for a good ice cream, well try here, they are the best in San Francisco. All flavors are tasteful, but better if you buy the galoon of ice cream  instead a small ice cream you will spend almost the same, I did not understand that. There are not many pleases were to seat and enjoy your ice cream but you won't regret to go there.
author: Eduardo S.

description:
What's rich, creamy, and drizzles all over your face? Mitchell's Ice Cream of course. Hanging out with some Mission peeps on their stoop, we were having a small debate about which ice cream is the best around town. The SF locals told us that Mitchell's is the legit one out of them all. There was only one way to find out, by going there ourselves of course.

Mitchell's has an oldskool ice cream parlor aura to it. It has that "home" feel to it. Don't be intimidated by the all people waiting around. Go inside, grab a ticket, and wait for your number to be called. It doesn't really take too long. Besides, this is an in-out type joint. While you wait, check out their extensive and elaborate menu of ice cream flavors. They have all the classic flavors of course and many other which derive from South East Asian countries and Islands. 

It's quite warm inside Mitchell's store. I don't get how the workers can stand being in there all day with all those people huddled up like caged chickens. Props to them for doing what they do. There are really no frills at Mitchell's, just good old fashion ice cream. The hardest part is trying to figure out which flavors to order. There's just too many to options that one visit isn't sufficient. This family owned business has been around since 1953 for a good reason.
author: Smitcha B.

description: Ice cream is very yummy, but nothing that special to me that worth being 70min in line to get a scoop. (I think I'm okay about getting  Ben&Jerry next time instead...)
author: Svetlana K.

description:
2013 marks the 60th anniversary for Mitchell's. Other than a new photo of the aging owners family with staff, it's been another uneventful anniversary year. I really thought that they'd do something special for their Diamond anniversary. But I guess they probably keep the celebrating as an internal party.

I bought some ice cream during the weekend. Love this place! Although I wish parking wasn't so difficult to find. Tip: It's easier to get a spot in the tiny back lot on weekdays, when everyone else is working.
author: Luis C.

description:
Good ice cream, wide variety of yummy flavors, and economical.
We tried the Mexican chocolate (really good) grasshopper pie (my cousin loved it) and the pistachio (which was so-so apparently).
author: Bhavya K.

description: Stooped by for something sweet after eating at Fumi just down the street (try that place as well).They had a very large selection of flavors but ultimately decided to go with the grasshopper which was basically a mint Oreo.  It was rich and creamy, as were the other flavors I sampled such as Thai Tea and avocado (which I normally don't like). Luckily there was no line when we got there, then again it was mid-day during the week.
author: Ritz D.

description:
Busy since it was a nice day in sf...had to get a number so had to wait a while (maybe 10 minutes for them to call my number). They got a big menu board for you to look at to choose which flavor you want while you wait for your number to be call. Got 1 scoop of ube(purple yam) in a waffle cone. Waffle cone cost extra .75 cent. Got the junior scoop which cost about $2.20 so the price was decent. The ube flavor was good. It was creamy and has right amount of flavor/wasn't overpower of sweetness. Even though it didnt take like purple yam, the flavor itself was still good. 
They have Friendly staff and its a Clean place.
author: Julie N.

description:
Mitchell has a shorter line and cheaper prices than bi-rite. It still is pretty good. You take a number and get called in, so if you are trying to find parking send a friend to get a number so you save time on waiting. The staff were kind of rude though, I understand you have a billion customers but you don't have to be rude.

Got the Thai ice cream and it was good!
author: Justin L.

description:
Hands down to the best ice cream I've ever had, and this is after trying Strauss, Bi-rite, Tara's, and Ici's. One drawback: it's not organic. 

The line is ~15 to 20-minute long so come with someone to keep you company :). Another tip: always sample before you choose a flavor.
author: Lam L.

description:
The process is pretty straight forward 
1.Take a number (left hand side of the door you enter from) 
2. Wait till your number is called. 
3. Request what you want 
4. Enjoy! 

Can get pretty crowded so don't come here if you are in a rush (maybe it is better at non peak hours?!) 

They accept credit cards so that's nice! 

The only minor complaint was that I wish things could move faster. It got stuffy in there while we were waiting our turn and had to step out to breathe but there is a loudspeaker so you won't miss your number being called.
author: Louisa D.

description: This is my family's favorite place to go for ice cream.  My kids will tell their kids stories of how it was a treat to be taken to Mitchell's ice cream by their parents.  We love the strawberry, grasshopper pie and toasted almond.  We come from the Central Valley to enjoy this special place and ice cream.
author: David C.

description: I went there because of a referral. Honestly I didn't find the ice creams any special than most ice cream places I've been to and the wait alone having to take a ticket number doesn't want to have me go through the hassle for an ice cream again there. Having to see the long line I was curious but seriously it was a joke. You can go to a lot of ice cream shops in SF and find the same quality if not better and not wait so long. Not saying this place has bad ice cream, it's decent, not fantastic and not worth the wait time unless you have nothing else to do but to kill time.  I tried the Lychee ice cream and I definitely had MUCH better. It tasted more like vanilla lychee than Lychee ice cream. Had the Ube and it was OK.
author: Bobby O.

description: Ice cream was pretty standard but I feel like there must be a more efficient to conduct an ice cream business. To get ice cream, you had to get a number (like at a deli) and they would call numbers out rather than having a single file line. Tried the peanut butter cup and thai tea but wasn't really a fan of either so I got rocky road instead. It was good but not-out-of-this-world amazing. Pretty comparable to Edy's rocky road.
author: Jenny B.

description: Mitchell's is a San Francisco classic and offers some delicious ice cream. My friends and I came here on a Sunday night and there was a huge crowd waiting outside--uniquely, this ice cream shop offers "take-a-number" service, and customers are called to the counter in sequence. We ended up waiting a good 30-40 minutes, and I got to sample a couple different selections. The most unique flavors here are definitely the tropical ones (mango, ube, banana, halo-halo), and I would certainly recommend them. I chose to have the tropical four (combination of banana, guava, mango, and pineapple) and got the junior size (the smallest they have), which was actually more ice cream than I expected to get for the $2.85 price tag! The ice cream was very good and reminded me of my childhood, when my parents brought tubs of Mitchell's mango ice cream home for me. However, I wouldn't rate this as the best ice cream I've had in the Bay Area, and it probably wouldn't have been worth the very long wait if I weren't with a big group of friends.
author: David K.

description: Yes.  Yes. Yes.  Creamy and delicious.  We had 3 cones. Vanilla, butterscotch marble and coffee. And 1 chocolate milkshake. Everyone left happy.  There is a ticket system - so grab one when you get there.  Line moved really fast and there was a small parking lot behind the place with a fast turnover.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
Over priced, over hyped, over rated. This is quality ice cream with a wide variety of flavours but it's not "great". They also have messed up making me a rootbeer freeze more times than I can count. Hint: If it's a freeze with rootbeer in it, do not put in vanilla ice cream and add sparking water. That's gross.

Long lines for what it is. Seriously. I'd rather wait at Bi-Rite. Their ice cream is creamier anyway.
author: A J.

description:
If you learn one word today, let it be BUKO. Not Macapuno, not grasshopper.. but Buko. If someone gives you a choice between baby coconut and sweet coconut, always choose the baby. Remember... always choose the baby. Because babies are always sweet. But sweet isn't always a baby. Got it?

Mitchell's is the Graeters of SF. I am giving 4 stars because I am mean and greedy and I have yet to try ALL their amazing flavors!
author: Bhavi A.

description:
Came into Mitchell's expecting completely over hyped and average ice-cream. Left begging for more. I got a double with chocolate chip and oreos and cream. The chocolate was easily some of the best I've ever tasted, the chips, which were spread generously tasted crisp, fresh and amazing. Don't get me started on when I reached the bottom of the chocolate chip iceberg and hit the creamy Oreo treasure below. The cream tasted like none other I've had before, the slight hint of a dough gave it superb texture and that melt-in-your-mouth feel.

Was there an absolutely huge ass line even on Monday at 10pm? Yes! Would I go stand in that line for an hour again? Without the slightest hesitation. Seriously, literally the only downside to Mitchell's is a testament to how good it is, the number of people who want it.
author: Ammar A.

description:
What's not to love about this place? Great ice cream flavors esp the famous Ube. 

Parking is challenging to find on the street but there's a tiny lot behind Mitchell's where you can park. 

The line wasn't bad at all when we went on a Saturday afternoon. Even though it wasn't as busy, you still take a number and wait to be called. They need something to indicate what number has already been called because sometimes they'd call the same number twice. 

Love their ice cream!
author: Jenna T.

description:
I JUST REALLY LOVE TROPICAL/ORIENTAL FLAVORS. Ube, macapuno, langka, halo halo... It's endless among a bunch of other classic flavors. 

Don't be deterred by long lines-- it's worth! Definitely in my top 3 places for ice cream in the city
author: Erika L.

description:
* There is always a line.
* It is definitely worth waiting for.

This is hands-down the best ice cream in San Francisco.
author: Justin S.

description:
I didn't want a cone or waffle bowl to interfere with my ice cream so I went with a triple scoop of Strawberry, French Custard Vanilla, and Banana in a cup. Every flavor was rich and true to its name. Of these three, I enjoyed Strawberry and Banana the most. 

My sister got a sugar cone with Toasted Almond and Claire's Pie (coffee ice cream with fudge, almonds, chocolate chips, and graham crunch pieces) and thoroughly enjoyed it. My cousin got a waffle cone with White Pistachio and Toasted Almond. A fan of pistachios, she felt the ice cream did pistachios justice!

We heard a lot of good things about the Ube (purple yam) flavor so we got a single scoop. The taste of their Ube is subtle and can be overpowered by stronger flavors, so cleanse your palate before diving into this unique flavor. 

They use a deli-style waiting system: you grab a numbered ticket when you come in and are served when your number is called. Even if you come in close to closing time, as long as you grab a ticket, you will be served -- so don't fret!

My first taste of Mitchell's was very enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to returning to explore more of the 40+ flavors they offer.
author: Mark C.

description:
This place defines the term crowded. But it is worth it. If the line is too long then just buy a quart and take it home. The ice cream is luscious and rich. And it has all the ambiance of an old time parlor. Plus the party atmosphere if everyone waiting is great. 

They have a large variety flavors. Way too many to list.
author: Rich T.

description:
If you don't like the fancy ice cream places around SF and you're just looking for a nice scoop of your favorite flavor? Come to Mitchell's. They have flavors from Vanilla to my childhood favorite...UBE! The magical filipino purple yam that has a nickname pronounced "YUBE", but it's okay to call it whatever you want because you'll love it and soon learn how to say it correctly.

Yes there's a line, yes you have to grab a number, and yes there isn't much space to linger or wait. But that's okay, enjoy the moment of waiting for ice cream and then finally taking your first lick. Go with a group of friends or with a date, nobody ever leaves Mitchell's with a frown. It's my go-to place to bring people when visiting SF.
author: Rae Dawne G.

description: Great ice cream and good service!! My boyfriend got the Cookie Monster shake and he's loving it while I write this. I got the toasted almond and it's delicious.
author: Selene C.

description:
The avocado ice cream was good. I also liked the buko (young coconut). Their Thai tea wasn't too overwhelming either.
But a lot of their flavors are quite rich. Sometimes too rich that all you really taste is cream.
author: Heejin L.

description: This is the place to go for ice cream.  Had been wanting to go, but the line always made us not stop. Finally made it and was totally worth the wait! Once you her there take a number and wait to be called.  The line goes by fairly quick. We waited about 20 minutes.  There is a wide assortment of flavors to choose from. Flavors range from traditional, to tropical, and seasonal.  Many flavers are gluten-free. Some of the flavors include strawberries and cream, eggnog, halo halo ginger, mango, avocado, coconut pineapple, ube, rocky road, cinnamon, and many more.  I chose the toasted almond (amazing!!!) and macapuno/sweet coconut (soooo good). Mitchell's offers cones, cups, sundaes, milkshakes, malts, and cakes. There is also pre packaged ice cream and other sweet treats ready to go.  You can grab and pay without the wait.  I highly recommend and will definitely be back.
author: Brigette B.

description: Came here on a Friday night with my friends after dinner. There was good amount of people waiting inside and out, grabbed a number (remember to get a number inside) and waited about 20 mins before our turn. This place is always packed rain or shine. I've been coming here since I was little with my moms S sister, it is one of our favorite places in San Francisco. Absolutely love the Halo-Halo ice cream! The halo halo dessert is also very good. I got a single scoop of halo halo and their tropical four (banana, guava, pineapple and mango) on a sugar cone. Love this place!
author: Vanessa M.

description: Life changingly good. I learned on this trip that the exotic flavors on the right side of the case are all Filipino flavors. Be sure to try the avocado if you're feeling adventurous. Mexican Chocolate is one of my favorites. It's basically chocolate and cinnamon.
author: Peter H.

description:
FINALLY had a chance to try Mitchell's ice cream last night with my family. When we announced that we were moving to San Francisco, every single person told us that we had to go to Mitchell's. And after 5 months, we made it happen! 

We've been to Bi-Rite once (which is closer to our apartment) and the line is just absolutely ridiculous. We got on line for the soft-serve ice cream/window line once so this won't be an apples to apples comparison....or scoop to scoop, rather ;) 

We went on a random Thursday night at around 9pm (thank you, Mitchell's, for closing at 11pm!). To my surprise, there was still a bit of a line! We grabbed a number and they announced it fairly quickly, despite the line (less than ten minutes). Efficiency--I like it. I'm sure it's way more crowded on the weekends, so duh, plan accordingly. I see a lot of people have complained about the wait. But hellooooo when the product is good, shouldn't you expect crowds?

Thank goodness for the little wait once we arrived, because my husband was panicking while making a decision! Mango? Mexican hot chocolate? Banana split? Peach (seasonal for summer only)? They even serve halo halo!! OH THE DRAMA! I tried the macapuno and got one scoop in a cup. My husband tried one scoop of the ube. Both flavors were awesome (my macapuno definitely won though--real coconut pieces? WINNING). Wish we tried more flavors but we were just too excited to get our ice cream. 

We will probably be back this weekend for more (I have my eye on that Mexican hot chocolate and secretly wish my husband chose that)...and then bring back half a gallon of a pre-packed macapuno :)
author: Monica T.

description: im a milk tea fanatic and this place had my favorite flavor earl grey. Soooooooo goood. its cremey and im coming here every time i get munchies for dessert in sf - plus its right next to dolores park so very nice to take the ice cream there and chillax
author: Kevin L.

description: Absolutely amazing tasting ice cream and the service is equally as great!
author: Alexis G.

description:
I went in for a kiddy cone and left with three pints of ice cream.  They let me taste as many flavored as I wanted and it was so good... I could not help myself. Tried the thin mint, peanut butter indulgence and horchata. I basically had to stop before I left with more than three pints.  

I now put a spoonful of horchata in my coffee ever morning. Best way to wake up.
author: Shirley V.

description:
Family-oriented. Simple. Dedicated to quality. Sweet. Eager to please.

Seems like I have a lot in common with Mitchell's Ice Cream...

I lucked out and came when there was no line, but I've heard it gets crazy crowded on most days/nights. So grab a number and patiently wait for a little scoop of heaven. All of the ice cream is handmade daily. This isn't a fancy schmancy type of ice cream store. Although their ice cream is more simple (making you feel nostalgic), they do have a huge variety of standard, seasonal, and sorbet flavors to chose from. 

A scoop is around $3.50. Like Tom and Donna say on Parks and Rec, Treat Yo Self!
author: Christine S.

description:
Originally we wanted to try Bi-Rite, but they closed early so we went to Mitchell's and I'm so glad we did!! Be warned this is not your average Rite-Aid/Dreyer's/Haagen Dazs ice cream. Your mind will be blown.

We came after dinner so arrived around 10:30pm and there was a long line out the door which was a good sign! First thing when you walk in, make sure u grab a # since there is no single file line order thing goin on. One of the workers will call your # and be your personal ice cream scooper servant. We literally sampled every flavor there was until past closing and STILL didn't know what flavors we wanted 'cause all of them were so damn good!!

The ice cream here tastes so rich and yummy, I believe their 16% butterfat base is the key to the deliciousness. It sounds so unhealthy, but tasted so good. I'd list every flavor we tried and describe how amazing each was, but it'd be too long. I ended up getting a scoop of grasshopper pie and a scoop of halo halo in a cup. We got the Macapuno & Rocky road in a waffle cone.

I'm a big mint chip fan so I LOVED grasshopper pie (peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, Oreo Cookies and fudge swirls). There were plenty of pieces of oreo cookies in every bite. Such a great mixture. The Halo Halo was really good as well. You'll definitely taste the ube & red bean in it along w/ the buko (coconut).

The macapuno (sweet coconut) was good, but a little to sweet for me. I prefer buko (coconut, but less sweet) so that you could taste more of a coconut flavor. The rocky road was one of the best we've had and believe me my boy knows his rocky road! Loads of fresh marshmallows with walnuts

Highly recommend the above flavors for your first visit. The ube (full of taro flavor) , Kahlua mocha (best coffee flavored ice cream I've ever tried) , and toasted almond (MUST TRY, sweet vanilla/almondy) were also just as good.

My big tip is don't be like us and try every flavor even though it's so tempting because at the end we pretty much were full from sampling so many flavors and had sugar overload which was not a good feeling. If only I was able to buy pints of their ice cream and bring them home on the plane :( I guess it's safe to say we got ice cream wasted!
author: Tracie L.

description: It is really hectic and disordered in there.  You need to make sure you grab a number and if there are more than 20 ahead of you just wait outside.  However be ready to push people over the second you hear your order or it could be too late.  The ice cream and milkshakes were good but the rushed nature of the entire process made it not worth it.  I give the ice cream 4/5 but the store 2/5.
author: Abraham C.

description: Every time I come here make it a point to try a different flavor. I always get two scoops. My staple ice cream is the pistachio and then I switch up with flavors, I am never disappointed no matter what flavor it may be.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Thank you For the best chocolate cake topping strawberry cream ice cream today. Our team was extra pleased with the delicious moist chocolate cake under topping with creamy fruity strawberry ice cream. Design lady Connie who printed out such a beautiful job for the transfer of our team picture. Connie you did a fantastic job with the editing of the transfer. Our team was super happy. #cakerme is awesome! Thank you !
author: ckt p.

description: Best ice cream in the Bay Area !  The kids love the peppermint flavor at Christmas . It's all good all the time ! Always a line in the summertime! It's most definitely worth the wait !!!
author: Theresa M.

description:
I fucking LOVE Mitchell's!! My family lives somewhat nearby and we've been coming here for years. Even with all my ice cream adventure I can confidently say that they are definitely one of my favorite ice cream shops in the whole bay! I don't care if parking can be a bitch, or I might have to wait in a long ass line... it is worth it!

They are a solid old school creamery (not soda fountain eat in type, just mean style of ice cream), really rich, creamy and they definitely deliver on flavor! They have the best ube ice cream I've ever tasted and is something I have to get everytime I come here. Their other flavors are good too but I prefer the more "Asian" fruity flavors that you generally don't see at most ice cream shops... and when you do they are never up to par (=

Also a side note for myself.... 100th review! =p
author: Melissa C.

description:
This is my 2nd time here at the store.  It was in the evening and the place was packed.  We picked up the ticket as we go in to be called to get served.  My ticket was 99, and the current number was 66.  Suddenly this woman just get in and her number was 21.  As the employee come out to refill, she suddenly went out to talk to him.  She somehow got helped immediately with 2 Double scoop cones.  

Why didn't the employee follow the queing system? How did the woman get served with after a few chat.  If someone can just cut in line, why should we have the queuing system at all? Maybe there werer related? This just proves how unprofessional Mitchell employee can be.

Normally I would give the ice cream quality 5 stars; but the with this type of service, I dont know if it's worth 5 stars anymore.
author: Orange S.

description:
I came to Mitchells because I thought they had halo halo still, but they don't make em anymore. But I ordered ube, mango and young coconut. The young coconut is to die for!!! I think all their fruit flavors are amazing and so refreshing. 

You get a number and they call out your number to order. This place is very busy and crowded, but the wait wasn't that long. They also let you sample a bunch of flavors til you find the right one! Definitely will be coming back!
author: Vy T.

description:
This is one of the best ice cream places in San Francisco, which is why they always have a huge line.  First thing you have to do is grab a ticket, and then try to look at their flavors for the day while you wait.  They have such unique flavors, ones that you would never even imagine.  I personally love their lychee and avocado flavors.  So good!  You can also buy ice cream by the pints here, and that's a much faster line. 

If you're a dog person, I recommend bringing your 4-legged friend.  There always seems to be other doggies for your dog to meet & play with.  Our dog seems to love this place and ice cream just as much as us!
author: Eric L.

description:
Most important thing about this place is parking. The trick? Just wait a little while in the lot until someone comes out. It'll take about 5 minutes or so, but people even create their own parking spot! But you don't want to end up with a ticket or your car towed so I don't suggest you do that.

Main purpose for our visit besides for ice cream? Ube (Purple Yam) - 100 things you must try before you die. 

Number system. Pull a number, it's high up right on your left right when you walk in on the side up against the wall. Your number will be called and you order from a staff member, who are super friendly I might add.

Friend and I ordered the junior size of the ice cream ($2.20 each). Yums! Grasshopper (Oreo, chocolate fudge, chocolate chips, mint ice cream) was absolutely delicious! Must get the grasshopper! It was so flavorful and strong tasting that I couldn't even taste the Ube ice cream. Haha, but that one was pretty good as well with little bits of yam in it too!
author: Tina N.

description:
**TIPS** 
- Grab a number once you walk in! 
- They have a small parking lot that may fill up easily -- the official address is on San Jose Avenue but the parking lot entrance is just around the corner on 29th Street.
- Bring cash! $10 minimum for credit cards.
- Try the more unconventional flavors! The traditional ones are good but nothing too spectacular.
- If you like the cone but are either a) incredibly slow at eating ice cream, or b) incredibly messy like me, then ask for the ice cream in a cup with a cone on top :-) best of both worlds! 

Yay Mitchell's! I'd heard about this place so many times from friends and thought it would be completely overhyped, but I was very satisfied with my experience. 

I came here at 8pm on a cold rainy night so there were only a couple other customers there. If you're the type of person who craves ice cream at all times of the day, then pick an unpopular time to come in so you don't have to wait in line! They have a $10 minimum for credit cards, and I didn't have cash with me, so my friend and I had to each order two scoops. The service was great, and the servers were incredibly friendly! They never rushed me or made me feel like I was taking too much time (I am not the most decisive person in the world). 

For my order, I ended up getting the Thin Mint (a little underwhelming -- it was pretty much mint chocolate chip, but admittedly very delicious!) and Peanut Butter Indulgence (I think I actually closed my eyes and saw stars, the combination was so heavenly). I'm planning on coming here again and trying the more unconventional flavors (Ube, Halo Halo, etc.) since they seem to be really popular.
author: Christine L.

description: I don't mind waiting in line for Mitchell's ice cream.  It is a SF gem!  Although, ice cream is not my favorite dessert, if it is Mitchell's ice cream, I'm all in!  Ever since I discovered they served Lúcuma ice cream, I only get that flavor on a sugar or waffle cone, of course!  Delicious!
author: Pamela D.

description:
Due to egg allergies- we are always hunting for vegan/ egg-less ice cream places.
Mitchell's is a gem! We have been here couple of times late on weekend evenings and there is always a wait time. They have a coupon system so you have to wait till your number is called in. 
Amazing tropical flavors. Menu is flooded with variety of ice creams and ice-cream Sunday options. My favorite so far is mango, baby coconut, pineapple. with a WAFFLE CONE of course!
author: Sayalee P.

description:
Best tropical ice cream flavors in the Bay Area, they are actually creamy instead of being icy or having a sorbet consistency. Their Mango is my absolute fave, along with their tropical flavor that consists of mango, guava, and banana. 
Also very reasonably priced.
author: Zara A.

description:
The 3k reviews is probably a giveaway this place is good. So, here's simple instructions..

1. Grab a ticket. Don't be a noob waiting in line without one.
2. Wait as patiently as possible, fighting the urge to plow people over to see the many flavors.
3. Order toasted almost. Say again, Toasted Almond!
4. Attempt to savor the ice cream as it disappears into your stomach in seconds.
author: Charlton Y.

description:
I actually wanted to try another ice cream shop, but that one closed earlier. Mitchell's is open til 11, so we stopped by here instead. 

The store itself doesn't look like much - it's a no frills kind of place. But they have a ton of flavors and a ton of people crowding around them. 

So to make things move efficiently, you have to grab a number, and they'll call your number when they're ready. When they called us up, I tried a handful of samples. I wasn't a fan of the halo halo and the frozen fruit inside of it. I liked the white pistachio, but ultimately, my friend and I decided to get the ube (purple yam) and kahlua mocha cream. 

Not quite sure if that combo worked well, but each ice cream on its own is pretty yummy. The kahlua mocha cream is a delicious coffee flavored ice cream, and even the worker was excited for me to try it! Hands down, the best coffee ice cream, he said. The ube was sweet with a subtle roasted flavor. 

I liked Bi-Rite better, but Mitchell's holds its own with its unique rich and creamy flavors!

P.S. They have parking in the back!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Best ice cream ever AND it's homemade; Mitchell's is my new favorite!!! As a native San Franciscan, I'm embarrassed to say that I haven't tried this place out before. My boyfriend told me this place was POPULAR and boy, he wasn't kidding when there was a long line on a Wednesday night. You literally had to take a number and wait for your number to be called! 

I ordered the ube (purple yam) ice cream with a waffle cone and it was perfect. I savored every lick of it. My boyfriend ordered the halo halo and it was just as good. (Though I'd have to argue that mine was better haha.) I have nothing bad to say about this place, I even tried out a few samples since it was my first time. I would definitely come back here again, no doubt!
author: Abby C.

description:
When you come in you'll just see a crowd of people. Don't feel confused, go grab a ticket next to the door. This place gets great reviews and for good reason. 

We tried a couple of flavor a before we settled on ours. The two we liked were cinnamon snap and cookies and cream.

The cinnamon snap is really delicious, it's unique and flavorful. The cookies and cream has really nice Oreos mixed just right into the ice cream. The only not so great part is that their sugar cone is kind of not sweet and kind of plain. However their ice cream is so good that their sugar cone doesn't have to be great.

Would definitely come back again! They also have ice cream sandwiches and ice cream cakes too.
