Only sucky part is that it's hard to find parking and you have to go into some residential areas to grab a spot.
author: Derrick C.

description:
How can one think about SF ice cream without mentioning Mitchell's?! This place has been around for ages, and it makes some of the best ice cream around. It honestly makes me pretty happy when I see restaurants all over the city proudly serving Mitchell's ice cream. It's definitely a clear testament to the great tasting ice cream this place has to offer.

The line can appear pretty long at times (especially at night on weekends), but don't be too afraid because it actually moves pretty fast. Just grab a number and wait until you hear it called! While waiting, be sure to look at all the 40+ flavors available. Good luck deciding on what to get...everything's good. Some of my favorites include Grasshopper Pie, Mango, Toasted Almond, and Banana. 

Mitchell's is definitely one of the "must try" spots in San Francisco. It has a rich history in addition to rich tasting ice cream. It's a great spot to bring kids, out-of-town visitors, dates, or even just old friends!
author: Aaron W.

description:
In six months of sampling the ice creams of this fine city, this ice cream is the finest I can find.  

That line though......  
  
I think it's kind of ingenious that all their freezer pre-packs are half gallons @ 10-11 dollars. What a way to make a quick upsell. And I promise you, you'll definitely eat it all. Grasshopper pie shakes, grasshopper pie ice cream pie, grasshopper pie with a fork from the mother-tub when you're too tired to do all the dishes, your roomie is too and you're generally defeated by life. There is no time, that is not a good time, for grasshopper pie!   

This is also one of the few places outside of south american countries where I've managed to get lucuma ice cream. How about some cherimoya next? A girl can dream.  

I love this place!
author: Liss T.

description: I'm not from the bay so places like this really amuses me..a mom and pop ice cream shop that serves exotic ice cream flavors. I got macapuno ice cream it's like coconut and something else it was so good that I'm still dreaming about it lol.line was pretty long on a chill Sunday afternoon, take a number by the wall. Some Filipino gangster kids was also hanging out in the corner eating ice cream. That was cute wish we have that in Vegas.
author: Emeri Q.

description:
I'm not too great of differentiating the top notch ice cream from the average, but I definitely know when my taste buds are happy with the ice cream I'm eating!

Grab a number from the number machine and wait in line! Make sure to listen for your number being called out, or you'll miss it! Seriously. Be quick about it! Haha! My friend and I missed our number being called out the first time because we were too busy taking pictures of the cute place... sigh. Please do not judge us tourists! Anywhoo, my friend and I ended getting the junior size of the Toasted Almond and the Black Walnut. Props for creating intriguing flavors! I LOVED IT! One bite of the toasted almond, and I was like GODDAMN that's good shiz! Most definitely an I scream you scream we all scream for Mitchell's Ice Cream joint! YUMMM! My friend also really enjoyed her Black Walnut ice cream as well. 

Service was friendly though it was busy, and they have a private lot for parking! Wahoo! Was definitely a nice way to top off our night last night!
author: Kim N.

description:
Good stuff. Bernal Heights area ice creamery that's super popular with the neighborhood! Everytime I drove and walked passed Mitchell's it  was packed! We had it the other night and the lines moved quick (we were number 38 and when we walked in it was currently number 16). We waited about 15 minutes in the sea of people.

Michell's has tons of traditional flavors but has a fresh and extensive "tropical" selection of ice cream (Ube, halo halo, young coconut, etc.). I had the halo halo and tropical 4 double scoops on a waffle cone! Awesome! 

Good times, be patient with the wait, Michell's is worth the wait on a warm frisco day!Parking in the back and also street parking.
author: Ticha B.

description:
I've been to Mitchell's many times in the past and wasn't too impressed until.. last weekend when I came to visit SF.  

I had the thai tea flavored ice cream and it was so amaze.  It really tastes like thai tea, haha.  So weird but anyway, you definitely have to give this place a try.. it's an absolute MUST!
author: Criselle O.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is perhaps the very best made ice cream in San Francisco.

Many flavors are unique and do
Not exist in any other company that produces ice cream.

It's well worth a visit and check out the extensive ice cream menu!
author: Alexander M.

description: I come here at least once a year (mostly bc I never make it a point to come out to SF generally) but I keep coming back because Mitchell's carries a wide variety of flavors at an affordable cost. The place is ALWAYS bustling with eager customers so remember to grab a number and wait your turn. The staff is always kind and patient regardless of the amount of people present and the place is always neat and tidy.
author: Maryam A.

description:
- Mango was the stand-out. I was get this one next time I return.
- Service was kind and friendly. I went during a non-crowded time and had a chance to sample 7 flavors.

Cons:
- Overrated 
- Flavors were so-so.
- Ice cream was dense and the flavors didn't quite pop.
- I will not go again unless friends demanded it for some reason.

I've reviewed other ice cream destinations and you can read those to see what I recommend.
author: Lovina H.

description:
Five stars for the delicious, DELICIOUS, DELICIOUS!! mango ice cream. I'm obsessed with their mango ice cream and literally could eat it forever. 

I had one scoop of it on a cone and then decided to just go ahead and take two quarts home. I dont come here as often as I should, mostly because I don't venture into the city as often as I should.
author: Alba C.

description: OMG so yes the lines are long. But I can promise you one thing. The best wait EVER!!  I check it out on Yelp and seen all the great feed back. So I had to see what the "HYPE" was about. And Let me Tell you the Best Ice Cream So far. That Chocolate Carmel Crackle Bomb.com. Butterscotch was Fire  I give you guy 5 for Taste and line move quickly so not too shabby on that part. The
author: Carletta L.

description:
I've tried a number of flavors at Mitchell's and they are all pretty delicious! I love how smooth their ice cream is and how flavorful they are. It is also pretty affordable to buy the 1/2 gallon for $10!

Yesterday I bought a 1/2 gallon of thin mint and we almost killed the whole bucket in a few minutes. Yummy! I'm still waiting to try the prized "grasshopper pie" but the lines are always so long and the 1/2 gallons sold out.
author: Stanley C.

description:
Cute ice cream shop with a plethora of flavors to pick from. 

A bit of a cluster- but what ice cream shop in San Francisco isn't?

Take a number and be prepared to wait... And make sure you are paying attention because if you miss your number being called you may have to take a new number and end up at the back of the line. 

The banana ice cream is bananas! Soo good!
author: Shannon H.

description:
Aside from the 45 - 60 minute wait JUST for some ice cream, this place wasn't too bad. Their parking lot is VERY small and it's pretty hard to find parking in the residential streets especially during a weekend. Thankfully, we got lucky and found one.

I heard about this place from word of mouth and thought I'd try it for once. I tried their new flavor, "Limon con Galletas" or Lemon Cookie ice cream. Soooo frickin' good! The staff there were incredibly attentive and fairly quick to serve the dozens of people outside waiting for their number to be called. I came in and had number 89 and they were at number 40 something when I first arrived there. If you go on the weekend, be prepared to wait awhile. Wouldn't mind coming back, but probably on a week day instead :-p ;-)
author: Bria S.

description: The line was SSOOOOOO LOOONGGG, but worth the wait. It is the city so be prepared for cold weather, not a lot of room inside to wait, so be prepared to be in the cold. It is a number system, so you take a number and wait. But the Ice cream is really good and totally worth the wait. I got the grasshopper shake and man was it delicious.
author: Andrew M.

description: This place has really good and creamy ice cream. I ordered pistachio and they actually have pistachio nuts in the ice cream. I enjoyed that very much! I actually finished my entire cone and that's pretty rare for me especially when I don't even like sweets. So this is how the place works. You have to take the number near the front door and wait for your number to be called. This way, it will be much more efficient so customers don't have to fight over each other, and be so cramped up in the store(pretty small). Anyway, customer service was a bit slow as the store were filled with more and more people but that was as expected.
author: Tilia L.

description: Wow!
author: James S.

description:
Came here awhile back with my friend Christine on our ice cream adventure. This was our second stop after Humphrey's. What I liked about Humphrey's is that they only have few flavors to select from since they make them daily. Mitchell's on the other hand is similar to Baskin Robin as they have a lot of flavors available, except the ice cream is x10000 better.

This place does get packed, so beware. I waited about 15 minutes, and tried a handful of flavors. The ice cream is really creamy and a little bit on the sweet side for me. I really enjoyed the pear sorbet as it was refreshing and very light. I tried other flavors such as the green tea, but opted out since it wasn't anything special.
author: Kevin Q.

description: Their ice cream are AWESOMELY DELICIOUS! I bought a half gallon of Halo Halo, and Chocolate Chip ice cream!
author: Michael L.

description:
Three stars? Well, let me break it down:

Taste: 4
Service: 2

They must have a cult following because it was packed when we arrived after 8PM. The weather was perfect ice cream that everyone was inside grabbing a ticket and anxiously waiting for their number to be called. Just for kicks, I decided to time our wait to see how long it would take for that first delicious bite.

Since there isn't must to see or do while waiting, I observed the service and the types flavors the enthusiastic customers were ordering. There were three scoopers and two of them were clearly exhausted and didn't show any pride in their products. They also were very frugal in the size of their scoops compared to the other more eager server. 

Finally after 35 minutes, my number was called and I ordered a single scoop of pumpkin from one of the more grumpy staff.  My scoop was definitely not the generous size that I've been expecting when you pay for premium prices for this type of ice cream. The pumpkin was unbelievably true to flavor and was worth the wait. By the time the four of us were ready to pay, I was about done and somewhat disappointed of the portion size.

I can't knock Mitchell's for the high quality ice cream, the private parking lot in the back and the take a number system but the amount of ice cream and customer service needs to be improved and more consistent.
author: Santi T.

description:
This place is the next best thing to Bi-Rite.

The whole numbering system is a pain.

The ice cream is the kind of afterlife I want.
author: Tania S.

description:
**CASH ONLY**

Five Stars for the eggnog they have during the holidays! It is so delicious. It's possibly the best eggnog I've ever had.

I don't go to Mitchell's as often as I should. Mainly because it's a pain to get into that area and find parking. But if you've never been, I definitely say try it at least once! They have so many flavors of ice cream and other off the wall flavors I've never heard of. Recommended!
author: Melissa S.

description:
I consider Mitchell's to be the asian version of Bi-Rite Creamery. They have so many delicious flavors but I was drawn to their asian flavors.

What we ordered:
Ube, Jackfruit, Avocado, Halo Halo. All of them were FANTASTIC! I wish Mitchell's would open up in Hawaii! 

Don't forget to grab a number when you walk inside. It's THAT busy. 
I love that the workers are nice and patient AND they let you try multiple flavors. 
There's a parking lot behind the ice cream shop. So convenient!
author: Denise H.

description: I know I'm a few days late but my son and I came there 20 mins before it was closing. I had #58 and they were calling #48 I believe. One of the worker came out and did last call and for people to come inside. But I was in crutches wanted to stay sitting on the bench since it was really packed inside. And I believe the worker was the manager? Not too sure but he had bumped me up the line so I can get served due to me being in disabled at the moment. And I really appreciate him for that, although it was a bit hard walking out in crutches and trying to hold my ice cream and he offered to help me I said that it was okay and I can do it but I was a bit embarrassed struggling but who isn't? Other than that my son really enjoyed his ice cream. To who ever you are thank you for having really great customer service.
author: Mae L.

description:
My favorite ice place so far :D

I love love love the Mexican chocolate! It's decadent with a hint of cinnamon kick. I know usually Chinese ppl don't really like cinnamon, but that's why I'm not that Chinese. Haha I'm more white. Some of my friends have called me a banana. ;P

Then I tried the Ube for the first time a couple of wks ago & loved it! It's creamy & not too sweet plus I love the color too! 

I know there's usually a long line, but the last time I went was in the early afternoon before the lil kids get out of class so no wait for me. Yay! 

Their other flavors are great as well: NY cherry, Pineapple something. and I really love the waffle cone!
author: Amy C.

description:
Best. Ice cream. I've ever had in the Bay Area. This establishment has inventive flavors as well as the classics if you're not feeling adventurous. The ice cream is smooth, creamy, and full of flavor. 

They have sundaes, ice cream sandwiches, floats, and more. Pretty much anything your heart desires. 

Service is great too! What more can you ask for?
author: Elena R.

description: I love Mitchell's.. a little pricey but the quality of the ice cream is great! Small place that gets busy and parking can be hard. But worth it. Many different flavors and they have some preset sundaes and specials too. I love the milk shakes!!!!
author: Daisy S.

description:
I FINALLY had the opportunity to try this place last Sunday with a couple friends. This is a very popular place among us filipinos so there have been so many times where I have been scolded for not coming here, lol.

Anyways, they have a VERY large range of ice cream selections.. their fruity tropical flavors have got to be the best though. We sampled the ube, of course, and it was delicious. I actually settled on getting the tropical four and it was delicious! This is definitely a treat if you're willing to drive a little outside of SF and can manage to find parking.
author: Eleanor E.

description: This is the best place to get ice cream in SF hands down! I've been coming here since I was a little kid, and I've had so many different kinds of ice cream, and Mitchell's always comes out on top.  There's usually a line out the door, but the wait is definitely worth it! The ice cream is super creamy and just the right amount of sweet! There are so many flavors to choose from, and the staff is always friendly.  Every time I go I end up buying a half-gallon to take home!
author: Kaela C.

description: What was had cannot be untasted.  I was in downright bad mood late Friday night and I came to the conclusion that the only way to cheer me up was an adventure to an ice cream place.  Having had Humphrey Slocombe a few weeks ago, and not in the mood to brave Bi-Rite, Mitchell's was exactly what the situation called for.  I had heard about the ube ice cream here, but had to ask myself, "With all the other flavor options, is this really what I want?" Yes. Yes it is. The beautiful purple-y shade of their ube ice cream is part of what makes this such an awesome treat! At the same time, I can't help but notice that the rest of their flavor offerings look just as delicious, so naturally, coming back here is an absolute must.  There's no frills about ice cream - it's just so damn good! Since there seems to always be a crowd, their numbering system is fairly effective (and efficient), and even allow for sampling.  Service was quick and friendly, so I will absolutely be back to try more of they have on the menu!
author: Lisa I.

description:
UMPH... I'm done, like completely done! No way I could go back to my supermarket and buy that freezer burn ice cream crap. 

This place gets crowded and parking is a tad difficult, but you seriously have to come here to try their tropical flavors (ube & macapuno), its deliciously creamy! Looks like they have a solid grip on their traditional flavors too. I can't wait to come back and try out more flavors. 

Don't miss out on this! Add some extra calories to your diet, trust me.. your body will love you.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Okay, everyone knows this place is as good as it gets. So quick recommendations:

- To all you nut-lovers: get the Toasted Almond on a waffle cone. Trust me, get it.
- Grasshopper (mint ice cream with oreo, fudge, and chocolate chips) is their most popular ice cream.
- Go on a weekday, around 6 PM = no line. Not ideal since it's prime-time dinner-time, but I always enjoy a little dessert before my meal once in a while ;)
author: Jenny C.

description:
Came here upon recommendation of a friend who is a SF local and who raves about this place! There were so many yummy-looking flavors but I decided to try the Grasshopper, and I was not disappointed! It was a long wait but very much worth it!

I'm looking forward to coming back and trying out the other flavors.
author: Kristy C.

description:
All good things must come to an end- when you finish your ice cream and you crave more, but don't want to go back in and get another one for fear you may look like a fatty.

Mitchell's is actually quite easy to get to, even for me who is afraid of driving to San Francisco. Once you get off on San Jose Ave, just keep going straight and eventually you're gonna see Mitchell's on your left side so you'll do a U-turn and begin finding parking. Now fortunately, the parking lot does have 7-8 parking spaces, but because Mitchell's is quite popular, it may be hard for you to get parking. I usually just go straight to finding street parking to avoid waiting for someone to get out and take their car out of the parking lot.

Once you're inside, you may notice that it can get quite crowded in there especially since it's a small shop. Just remember: GRAB A NUMBER. They call out numbers so don't just stand there and wait for someone to notice you. 

What's good? Grasshopper pie. It's like thin mint ice cream with added cookie pieces and it is just amazing. Seriously, at least try a small sample of it. 

The people here try to work as fast as possible so just try to have some patience.
author: Venus L.

description:
The key to a successful diet is having cheat days. One of my favorite cheats on a cold day is a scoop of ice cream. Since it's a cheat, it has to be a special scoop of ice cream. There are many excellent ice cream shops in the city, but my stand by is usually Mitchell's.

Mitchell's had many things going for it:
1) Quick moving line - but be sure to grab a number
2) Properly chilled ice cream that will not melt on the drive home (unlike a certain other popular shop)
3) A mix of flavors that range from childhood favorites (strawberry) to sophisticated grown up choices (pistachio) to specialized harder to find choices (ube)
4) Super patient employees. 

Insider tip for the sugar addict:
1) Get the sugar cone
2) They will dip your cone in chocolate. Do this. It's delicious.
3) The caramel sauce is perfection. You can ask a cup of this on the side if you're taking ice cream to go. 
4) If you love chocolate, the chocolate crackle is an excellent choice.
author: Shoole S.

description: Every flavor of the ice creams I have tried are really good! Parking on the other hand is hard to find. But worth the challenge. Hope you enjoy it as much as I have
author: Christine A.

description:
Really amazing and authentic ice cream place near Mission in San Francisco.

Super great flavors, friendly and efficient staff and an old-school take-a-number aesthetic is good for kids and adults alike.  Choose a traditional, sugar or waffle cone - even chocolate dipped or with sprinkles - and enjoy some real ice cream goodness.

Only issue is it's on a pretty busy street and only a couple of benches out front for seating (nothing inside)...  other than that, a perfect neighborhood spot.
author: Bob K.

description:
Overall
I actually wasn't that impressed. I thought the ice cream flavors were very unique and different. However the ice cream lacked any special umph that would make it extremely unique in my mind to warrant its fame

My flavors
I got the purple yams or ube and tried the grasshopper pie. Both were very unique flavors and definitely yummy. I just don't know if I would go out of my way to go back again.

Service
The service took a while. There were lots of people waiting, but they were also very efficient with each customer taking a number. I applaud their service given the crowdedness.
author: Lina H.

description:
Fresh Cantaloupe Ice Cream!  When it's in season, that's all I get!

From milkshakes to single scoops to 1/2 gallon tubs, we've had them all.  The flavors are plentiful and all awesome.  If Cantaloupe is out of season, I usually end up with coffee or ube ice cream.  My kids are always trying something new, and have yet to be disappointed.

The lines could be a bit long, but just hanging out and soaking up the SF vibe makes the experience worthwhile.  Go there.  Go there often.
author: Arnel L.

description:
No shame, but I came here after getting a cavity filled.... my reward for enduring pain, right? ha.

Anyway, upon arrival, don't be scared about the long line, as it passes quickly. Be sure to grab a number right when you get there. Strategy #1 - have a friend drop you off and grab two numbers!

The ice cream is on the pricier side... worth every cent and calorie. I don't think you can go wrong with any flavor, but after much debate, I settled over the ube and grasshopper ice cream. Make sure you eat the more mild flavor first, then the heavier one... partway through I started eating the grasshopper ice cream, which overpowered the ube one.

I've only come here once, but I can see myself begging my friends to come with me to Mitchell's. I can't wait to try all the flavors and get the grasshopper one again! Mmm... luscious heaven in every bite...

Creamiest goodness, ever. Worth the wait!!
author: Janet H.

description:
A classic for me and my family! I love the mango!!! Be prepared to wait a little but wait with a smile because you will not be disappointed.

Everyone raves about bi-rite and mr and mrs miscellaneous but...let me just say, they have nothing on Mitchell's!!!

THE BEST OF THE BAY!
author: Carina M.

description: Mitchell's is my favorite ice cream spot in SF. The Grasshopper Pie is so amazing. Mint ice cream, oreo, and chocolate fudge altogether for an amazing experience. My apartment happens to be within walking distance so I have to constantly control myself from going there everyday and eating that delicious ice cream. The line tends to be pretty long, but I think it's worth the wait.
author: Radhika G.

description: Mitchell's is a popular ice cream stop in San Francisco for its many unique and tropical flavor varieties. I came here on a Friday night after dinner and it was fairly busy with some people waiting outdoors. Unlike most ice cream places, you grab a ticket with a number on it and wait to be called instead of waiting in a line. I've always had Mitchell's ice cream in their half gallon containers which were bought from supermarkets such as 99 Ranch and they've always been a solid choice for their mango, ube, and other fruity flavors. I found the ice cream at their shop to be just as good as I sampled multiple flavors and settled on their tropical four flavor which is a combination of guava, mango, banana, and pineapple. The consistency of the ice cream tastes less dense and creamy yet more heavy than other popular ice cream spots in the bay area. All in all, I enjoyed the ice cream very much and would recommend Mitchell's to those who love fruity and tropical flavors.
author: Joshua M.

description:
Been coming here for years and is still the best ice cream shop in the city! A bona fide landmark in San Francisco, it's a must go for their delicious flavors of ice cream. 
One of their new flavors, nutty cocoa was simply refreshing! What's different about this ice cream is that it has smoked almonds! So when you get a good spoon full or a big lick of the ice cream it takes on a smokey taste that you wouldn't normally get in an ice cream. It's very good.
author: Roger P.

description:
This ice cream shop is always packed, and rightfully so.  Such an assortment of decadent choices and flavors.  If you have a more traditional palette they have flavors like chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, cookies and cream, rocky road and others.  Now, if you are in the opposite end of that spectrum, dive right in.  They have exotic flavors like Thai tea, halo halo- translates to mix mix, a traditional Filipino dessert consisting of sweetened beans, garbanzos, young coconut & mung beans mixed in with ube (a purple sweet potato) ice cream.  They have horchata, mango and avocado.  I highly recommend this spot if you are visiting San Francisco.  It's out of the way from tourist spots, but well worth checking it out.  They have a large selection of pre-packed half-gallon tubs that you can also purchase.  They can also pack containers for you if they don't have what you want pre-packed.  

Service- the servers are just so wonderful.  They always make us feel like we are the only customer in the store they are assisting at that moment.  Not to say that they take their sweet ol' time and ignore other guests.  They are efficient, friendly and don't rush you to make you feel like you are taking too long.  This is especially important for me because my son has severe nut allergies so we always have to be careful and make specific requests about his order.  Check em' out next time you are in the area.  My only gripe is that I wish they opened up a shop in the South Bay, although I don't think my waistline would like it if they did.
author: Kristine F.

description:
As a Filipina girl -- growing up in Daly City, it was always cold so indulging in traditional influenced desserts like Mango ice cream and Ube ice cream while it was 55* outside isn't too far fetched.
BUT -- the only exception to eat ice cream on a cold day is if it is Mitchell's ice cream ONLY. Mango, Ube, Macapuno exceptionally BOMB. This does not take away from the quality of the traditional flavors either. Strawberry ice cream is as bold and fresh as it can get. I promise you'll order a cone of your favorite flavor and leave with a tub of it too.
There is a reason people line up around the block and wait outside while its in the low 50's, this place is an absolute treasure and the best ice cream treat in the Peninsula.
author: Alexis A.

description:
Came to the city with my hubby on a foodie excursion and this was one of our spots to hit up by popular demand. 

We came on a weekend and this place was crowded (not super packed) where we had to grab a number by the entrance and wait for our number to be called. Something new to me since I'm used to "waiting in line" - but I guess this works out as well. What amazes me is the drive-thru service offered behind the building. Considering Mitchell's is located on a busy street, I don't think the drive-thru would be your safest bet. If there is wait, your car can possibly be intersecting a busy street where you can get hit! 

I ordered their coconut ice cream and my hubby had their mint chocolate chip. It's creamy, it's sweet - but definitely nothing spectacular. I'm not sure if I didn't order their "special" flavor that makes this place a hit, but I probably will find myself back here again if I'm ever in the area. 

That purple ice cream looks weird, but I think I shall try it the next time around....
author: Mei W.

description:
Being a tourist in San Francisco we looked up desserts on yelp and found that Mitchells was very close from our dinner. With soo many reviews and all this hype I really wanted to see what was soo good about it. 

That night it was pretty cold while walking towards Mitchells I was wondering if it would be busy or dead. When we got to the location I was shocked with how many people were standing outside of the store and inside the store. It was like waiting in line for a club or a party. Don't forget to grab a little ticket so when they call your number you will be able to order. It is almost like those places for deli's. 

While waiting in the cold I looked up at the menu to see what I wanted to try. Soo many different flavors but I just wanted to pick only one since I was pretty full from dinner. 

As our number got called we tried a few samples of different ice creams and I have to say all had such unique flavors and interesting textures. I loved them all!! If you are in SF you need to stop by here and hopefully be able to eat more than a scoop of ice cream because now I soo want to just drive up to SF and get some more ice cream! Yum! :)
author: Francine L.

description:
Of all the famous ice cream joints that stick out in my mind, Mitchell's gets me the most giddy.  When I worked in the restaurant business, we used to buy our buko (baby coconut) ice cream from Mitchell's and it's subtle flavors quickly became one of my favorites.  I didn't know they had a retail front and when my girlfriend spotted it as we drove by, I knew we had to stop.

After finally getting to the front of the line, we decided to get two scoops of the grasshopper pie and buko to share.  Both flavors were amazing, but beware, they are serious calorie bombs!  The textures were fantastic and they have so many flavors I want to try, especially their ever changing exotic and tropical flavors.  I'll be back for sure.

The line was crazy long but I do like that they use a number system.  That said, it can be kind of disorganized.  Prices are definitely higher than most other ice cream places but the scoops are also enormous.  There's no skimping on scoop sizes here for sure.  Service was friendly and patient as we tried a few flavors.  You'll be growing your Buddha belly here!

Food: 10/10

Service: 8/10

Price: $

Atmosphere: 9/10
author: Joe M.

description:
You'll probably like their ice cream if you're into something creamier. After trying a couple of flavors, I decided to go with an Oreo Sundae. Huge mistake. Of course the hot fudge melted all the ice cream before I got it.  I'm not exaggerating either. It was gross. 

While I was (not) enjoying my puddle of fudge and ice cream I saw that they charged for a double scoop sundae instead of a single scoop. It was a pain to ask them to fix the issue because they're so busy. While processing my refund they also mentioned that the prices on the menu aren't updated. Which doesn't make any sense.  Does this bother anyone else?


If you come here:
Don't get the hot fudge
Count your change
Pull a number and prepare to wait
author: Irene C.

description: Loads of options in the city for artisanal ice cream.  Mitchell's is top notch.  Why people but Swensen's when there is Mitchell's quality to be had baffles me.  Parking is tough unless I missed a secret lot round back.
author: M M.

description:
My cousins brought us here after dinner. The parking lot is tiny, and parking takes longer than getting the ice cream. Inside, it is PACKED with people. You take a ticket and wait for your number to be called. They have unique tropical flavors as well as other creative mixtures.

I enjoyed the kalhua mocha cream flavor. My husband said he couldn't taste the kalhua, but I thought it was tasty just the same.
author: Dani P.

description:
I must have gotten lucky cause i came here on a Sunday at 8 pm and i waited about 30 seconds for someone to help me. I did drive by with my friend on a Saturday night and see the line out the door a good 30 people. This isn't BART accessible but it is a block of two away from 30th and Mission and a couple of the Muni's that head down to Balboa. 

I got one scoop of mint chip in a sugar cone and it was like $3.50 and the scoop was more like 2 scoops at other places. They have a $9 minimum i believe, i was shore $1-$2 but the guy was cool and just charged the $7 or so.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: I love you Mitchells. Friendly customer service, not overly expensive ice cream, and sooo many flavors to choose from!!
author: Kayla O.

description: Depending on when you go there might be a line, but it is worth the wait. I love all the flavors and I only wish they add this everywhere. They have a small parking lot in the back and some street parking in the front. It does get crazy and packed, so expect a wait when you go.
author: Devika B.

description:
Ya girl Crys did it again! 

http://www.formerlyprint.com/sf/a-taste-of-classic-san-francisco-ice-cream/
author: Crystal C.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream!!! First off go grab a number inside because that big bunch of people outside is not the line, I stood there for a few minutes before I realized I needed to get a number. The line idea is pretty nice because they only call a few people into the shop, making it feel less chaotic to pick from a plethora of flavors! 

I had strawberries and cream and my sister got cookies and cream. Both flavors were rich and creamy not to mention not over sweet. Mitchell's I will be back for more!!
author: Julie C.

description:
Go to shop for my fav dessert... ice cream!  Great selection of american and pinoy flavors.  If you like asian favors, try the Ube or Macapuno.  Halo Halo is pretty good too.  The banana ice cream is so addictive.  I usually bypass the long wait times for scoops and go for a gallon out of the freezer.  I only wish they carry cheese corn ice cream like Magnolia brand.  Cheese corn ice cream?  It's a Filipino thing.

Pricey but worth it.
author: Angelique B.

description: Probably some of the best ice cream I've ever had. I love the BR praline & cream ice cream so I had to get the caramel praline here in a waffle cone. It tasted fresh, delicious and very creamy! I only got the single scoop but it came out with a lot more than I expected! The waffle cone was crisp, crunchy, and not too overly sweet. I def will have to come back again when I am in town.
author: Mindy H.

description:
The lure of a place like Mitchell's, (similar to institutions like Smuggler's Cove), emerges with it proving its mettle to me with half a dozen casual and singularly mouthwatering experiences, and then subtly nudging me, with every reminder of her majestic menu, that she has many more delights to offer, each as pleasurable as the last, if I but pledge fidelity to her.

Marco Polo still holds top spot in my Bay Area list of frozen dessert establishments as the quality of their ice-cream stands out like a [cliche of some tall plant vs. shorter plants], but I frequent Mitchell's as it is simply more accessible post-dinner, being located near the Mission.  That explains the long lines but as you already know, just grab a ticket and patiently wait your turn while tiptoeing to get a glimpse of the cavalcade of choices on display through the glass.


- - - STANDARD FLAVOURS - - -

Avocado:  3.5 stars
Mitchell's churns these fat fruit into its usual creamy perfection as we might expect, but perhaps in committing to avocadic authenticity, this flavour treads a too-familiar circuit on our tastebuds and cannot shake its vegetal roots long enough to convince me that it has reformed itself entirely into a trifling sweet.

Buko:  5 stars
I prefer this young coconut flavour to Macapuno (sweet coconut) as its appeal endures throughout a full scoop.

Caramel Praline:  4.5 stars
*Rolls eyes heavenward*

Chocolate Caramel Crackle:  3.5 stars
I have no particular love for chocolate-based flavours, and this one did not wow me.

Grasshopper Pie:  5 stars
Perfect creamy mint flavour with hearty chunks of chocolate and Oreo cookies in it. Most of my non-Asian friends beeline for this one.

Halo-Halo:  4.5 stars
The granddaddy of Mitchell's flavours, sitting atop as the durian (king of fruit) of its tropical selection.  A purple ube base bursts with a rainbow of chewy goodies - sweet beans, coconut chunks, and rubbery palm fruit (attap-chee), all of whose forebears have graced the decks of the shaved-ice ship that have melted down many a Southeast Asian's dripping hot days.

Langka (Jackfruit): 5 stars
Surprisingly, this tastes very creamy and vanilla-y and only carries a smooth undercurrent (and a few tiny chunks) of the bright-tasting tropical jackfruit. But that may be for the best, because Mitchell's has styled their jackfruit flavour as a timeless classic, a universal favourite, absolutely brilliant. It's a little black dress of ice cream flavours; it's the new strawberry; pairing well with any other flavour.
I bought a half-gallon--because prepacked is the only form you can get this flavour in--and was assuming I would have to donate most of it to my office, but now I can (frighteningly) see myself finishing the whole thing... and it will be worth it.

Mango:  4.5 stars
If you only like one tropical flavour, it's probably this one.


---- SPECIAL FLAVOURS ----

Keke's Krunch: 3.5 stars
This one is new in 2015, big chunks of delicious toffee in caramel ice-cream. A bit too much candy for me though.

Peach (Summer): 3.5 stars
Not bad, but something was a little off. Peach is a difficult flavour to translate well to a dairy dessert, I think.


---- CONES AND OTHER SIDE CONCERNS ----

Their waffle cones are superb, crisply cradling their precious cargo up to me in a most pleasing sacrifice.



I'll have to come back soon for the Horchata, Lychee, French Custard Vanilla, Rum and Raisin, and ice cream sandwiches...  for starters.
author: Letitia L.

description:
Absolutely Amazing Ice -Cream ... Service is so good .. Since it was my first time at their shop .. I tried a lot of Flavors and all of them were amazing .. I have always tried their 1/2 galon ice cream. Since I am fruit lover .. Tropical flavors will always be my preference and yes you can try them all as samples of course. 


Make sure to check the photo I have posted so that u can understand how significant role u'll b playing if you have ice cream from Mitchell's.. Enjoy
author: Nash J.

description: Came in with girlfriend, tried about 8 flavors in total (4 each, obviously). The portion size is outta control and the parking is very small.
author: Vijay K.

description:
I tried Mitchell's Ice Cream for the first time when I was a lot younger and I remember not liking what I ordered. when I saw it listen on the Bay Area's Best Ice Cream, I had to give it another chance.

According to InstaGram, Yelp, and the Bay Area's Best Ice Cream 2014 list, I knew going in that I was going to order the Ube. I love Ube, so I wanted to see if this was as good as everyone says. IT WAS! The ice cream itself has great texture, very creamy. The Ube flavor was also very delicious without being too strong or sweet. To make it interesting, I thought it would be good to mix in a flavor. I decided to do a scoop of the Kahlua Mocha Cream on top of my scoop of Ube. This flavor combination was absolutely delicious! I know, I know.. you may be thinking that this combination may be too sweet but strangely they balanced each other out very well and the sweetness level was perfect. Next time, I think I will do Ube with a scoop of pistachio. 

Mitchell's not only has 5 star ice cream, but they also have 5 star customer service. First of all, do not let the long line scare you away. This place is always packed but the service is so quick that it did not take more than 10 minutes to be helped. Everyone working is also extremely nice and friendly. They offer to sample as many flavors as you want and when you finally pick which one you want, they serve you with a smile. 

I cannot wait to come back and try the different tropical flavors and their specialty combinations. 

Note: Parking can be difficult. There is a small lot in the back that fits about 10 cars max. If that lot is full, hopefully you will get lucky with street parking.
author: Kristen N.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is the ice cream heaven!..... 

A few of my favorite flavors are Coffee, Avocado, Mango, Coffee, Ube Macapuno (Purple Yam w/ Coconut), Mocha, Coffee, Tropical 4, & Kahlua Mocha Cream.... oh and Coffee!
author: J N.

description:
I came here with my boys.  This spot was easily my go to place as a kid.  Since I grew up in Daly City and my mom worked in San Francisco, she would take me to work and as a treat for dealing with her crazy customers (she was a DMV examiner in San Francisco, don't judge me if she failed you during your driver's test), she would take me to Michell's to get some fabulous ice cream.  Growing up I didn't frequent this place as often but I knew it still existed.  Now, as an adult with kids, I wanted to share a piece of my childhood with them.  My kids loved it.  They loved being able to order the ice cream they liked instead of flavors they didn't like, even the crazy flavors.  I ordered my favorite Avocado ice cream and tried to get a tub of it but we weren't heading home after our trip here so I didn't want to risk it not making it through our car ride to our next destination.

The staff was still friendly and the lines are still long.  Parking is ridiculous still but what can you expect for the area.  You just deal with it and go on your merry way.  The patrons are still nice even though the lines are long.  You won't be waiting very long.  Just admire the ice cream people are walking by you with and decide you want what they chose or you will stick to your original plan of what you were going to order.  Either way, you won't be disappointed.

Tradition is tradition and I'm happy that this place is still around so that I could share a little bit of my childhood with my kids.
author: Mia D.

description: This is one of those places that's so good you're likely to see a long line on a rainy day.  It's so good, we plan most of our family San Francisco trips around a visit to Mitchell's. It's the only business I regularly mention to my college students, humorously saying, "I predict many of you will return to thank me, for introducing you to Mitchell's if nothing else."  I don't know the secret to their recipes. I suspect they use high quality (and quiet fatty) ingredients.  I'm awed by every flavor I've tried; but I especially love their tropical flavors. If the parking is difficult and the line long, be patient. Customers flow through quickly.
author: Michael A.

description: It was packed at 8:45pm on Sunday.  You have to get a number and wait for it to be called.  I went with a friend who was joking about me being his wife to one of the attendants.  When my friend walked out to wait for me, I ordered, but he said that I needed to have my own number since I was paying separately.  He was a total dick about it.  I waited 1 hour before being served.  It was good, but no better than Ben n Jerry's.  It's not worth the wait.
author: Teresa M.

description:
The ice cream here DEFINITELY gets a 5. The overall experience is a 4, due to the long wait in a disorganized space with no seating. The employees also didn't seem quite as friendly or willing to let you sample as some other spots... but damnnnn, their ice cream is goooooooood.

I would say the main difference between a place like Bi-Rite and Mitchell's is Bi-Rite has more 'interesting' flavors, but Mitchell's crushes it on the classics. Simple flavors like strawberries and cream (made with fresh strawberries) and dulce de leche (full of caramel swirls) have filled my dreams since I stopped in. And their grasshopper pie?! Holy cow, we're talking full oreos and fudgy bits with creamy, mint ice cream... the white pistachio tastes more fresh than any other I've tried, and the salty pistachios add just the right balance to the sweet ice cream. Bonus points for the crazy sundae concoctions and other featured specials. 

I didn't think the tropical flavors (like the purple ube) were quite all they were cracked up to be - but maybe it's just my taste, or maybe it was impossible to live up to the hype that Yelp's created...

Grab a number, and take a friend. You'll have plenty of time to catch-up while you decide.
author: Catie F.

description: Mitchell's is always great! Sometimes it's a long wait but if you're with good company time flies. All flavors that I have tried are really good. They give big scoops. And all the employees are really nice.
author: Michael A.

description:
This is some of the best ice cream I've had, and I've had a lot of ice cream. It may be better than Bi-Rite Creamery and Humphrey Slocombe (two of the other major popular ice cream shops in San Francisco).

Don't bother wasting yourself on the Ube flavor (don't listen to all of these reviewers brainwashed by the 7x7 guide, in this rare miss on their part). Sure it tastes good, but the other flavors they offer are way better. Just get a sample of it to satisfy your curiosity and to be able to say you tried it.

We tried the Caramel Praline and Peanut Butter Indulgence flavors, which were both amazing. There was so much gooey caramel in that single scoop that it was almost like eating a sundae on a cone. The Peanut Butter Indulgence was great, but a bit misleading from the name. It was not peanut buttery enough - it was more like a chocolate ice cream with peanut butter  cups in it. But still great.

The wait wasn't too bad, but then again it was probably way longer than it should have been on a Tuesday night at 10:30 PM. I could imagine it getting pretty annoying during peak weekend hours.

Definitely make sure you try this place along with the other major ice cream shops in town.
author: Mike C.

description: Amazing ice cream and amazing service. You have to wait to get your fix but the number system is great and you get the full attention of your server once you get in. The best part is you can get your hand scooped ice cream DIPPED IN CHOCOLATE. I've never had this on anything but soft serve and it is AMAZING with the real cream. Sweet coconut ice cream dipped in chocolate on a waffle cone. Divinity defined.
author: Sean S.

description:
Lord Almighty, what great ice cream! This place is so busy! allthe ice cream flavors we tried were amazing, but the Mango was so good, we bought a half gallon and an ice pak to drive it back to LA for my pops! 

Seriously. And now i'm thinking, why didn't i buy more ice cream. Everyone who likes mango needs to try this ice cream. It is outstanding!
author: Farwah N.

description:
Rum Raisin, hands down my favorite ice cream at Mitchell's.

I have tried other flavors ranging from the tropical and the famous grasshopper. But I always go back to Rum Raisin. There's a hint of rum and small bits of raisins in the ice cream. The raisins surprisingly are not harden by the ice cream. The ice cream is creamy and just delicious. 

Mitchell's ice cream is best during any type of weather! To avoid the long lines and to find parking, go when the weather is cold and when it is close to closing time!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
I. Love. Ice cream.

Mitchell's is one of my favorites, only because they do some flavors really well! It's similar to Swenson's, but I prefer Mitchell's because they have more unique flavors like, Espresso Toffee Crunch, Purple Potato (Ube), Avocado, and Yacuma. My favorite in the city is still probably Mr and Mrs. Miscellaneous, I'm kinda glad it's hard for me to get to because otherwise I would be 20lbs heavier.

TIPS
- Grab a number when you arrive! The lines are insane at night even on weekdays.
- You can order a double junior scoop if you want to try two flavors.
- You can order a Pacific Cookie Company from Santa Cruz on the side ($1). It's kinda cakey/bready, I prefer the ones at Specialty's.

Flavors in order of preference:
* Oreo
* Butterscotch Marble 
* Dulce de Leche: Good but very sweet
* Peanut butter Indulgence - Tastes like pure peanut butter.
* Chocolate Caramel Crackle - Good but super sweet!

Pass
* Mocha Fudge / Coffee: Not a fan of the coffee flavor, has a strange taste.
* Vanilla: Have had better
* Ube: Tastes weirdly sour
* Avocado: Tastes weirdly sour
* Yacuma: Tastes odd
author: Jess C.

description: Ordered a single scoop of grasshopper pie dipped in chocolate. The grasshopper was creamy and delicious except it was too sweet, probably because I choose to dip sugar in even more sugar.. Haha. The worker who took care of us actually dropped my entire scoop of ice cream into the hot chocolate tub so it had extra extra chocolate. Don't know if that was a good or bad thing but it was literally drenched and covered with napkins everywhere. The ube flavored was much lighter, not too sweet and very tasty! Great afternoon snack.
author: Kimberly H.

description: You can never go wrong with this place. Theres a flavor for everyone. If you like chocolate, the Chocolate Caramel Crackle is a must to try!
author: Sarina A.

description:
With so many fancy/exotic flavors, it took us a while to decide on our order. I'm so glad we took our time, because your mood will def influence the flavor you would want. The staff is super sweet and we were able to try out all the flavors that called our names. 

Our winners: buko (baby coconut) and lucuma (tropical fruit from Peru).
author: Amanda L.

description:
I had the honor of tasting this companys delightful products today. The staff on my ward threw me a going away party, and one of the ladies brought a couple tubs of ice cream for us all.  One was coconut flavored, and the other was yam.  Delicious!!!! Although im not a fan of actual yams, this flavor was on point.  The coconut was fantastic too-- there were tons of pieces of coconut meat within the ice cream, which i thoroughly enjoyed.

Majority of the staff were surprised id never heard of mitchells.  Perhaps im not from the area, or maybe because i was just never into ice cream much. ... Who knows. But mitchells is definitely up there in comparison to what ive had in the past. Im looking forward to visiting their shop and tasting their other flavors when i get the chance. Great first impression. ..
author: Abby Q.

description:
The best Ice Cream anywhere.  I been going there since i was a kid. The coconut and strawberry and cream.  Delicious.  Its in the Mission. Not Bernal Heights.  But i guess saying Bernal. Heights it sounds more lucrative. 
Anyway....Best Ice Cream.
author: Patty G.

description:
A classic place to come to eat ice cream in San Francisco. 

The ice cream here is very flavorful, definitely worth your money and the wait. The wait may seem to take forever, but they're pretty fast workers. I give them props. Always super crowded every time I come and it is always worth it and brings a smile upon my face. 

If you don't want to wait in the humongous crowd, you can always buy the tubs which are about $10-$11. 

Tip: always a line, regardless of the weather most of the time.
author: Vernice T.

description:
Some of the best ice cream I have ever had and with the abundance of different flavors I'll definitely be frequenting Mitchell's in the future. I had the Oreo cookie flavor so that's one down, like 100 to go! I like the ticketing system where we take a number instead of having to wait in line because it means we can step outside and wander around on especially busy days. 

The only thing that can potentially be improved is that the store itself can get a bit cramped with so many people waiting for their ice cream. 

All in all the staff were friendly, the ice cream was great and the experience was top notch!
author: Pavi S.

description: GREAT ice cream! A ton of flavors -- typical and unusual. Everything I tried was awesome. The pumpkin tasted like I was eating a slice of pumpkin pie. The cinnamon ginger snap tasted like a gingerbread man. Really great treat in SF!
author: Jen G.

description:
Tasty ice cream! I'm always skeptical of premium ice cream places, but this is definitely legit. I came here in early October when PUMPKIN SEASON was just beginning. I love almost everything pumpkin so naturally I had to have a scoop of that, but it became a little overwhelming/ too rich toward the end. I also tried a scoop of avocado that was the perfect blend of creaminess and refreshing. I'd probably return only for the avocado flavor, as Bi Rite still tops the chart for ice cream for me.

The wait was about 20 minutes (take a number!!)  on a weekday mid-afternoon, so I'd hate to see it during peak times!
author: Angela L.

description:
I can see why this place has such high ratings as they offer flavors you don't normally find at other ice cream shops. I ordered the double scoop on a waffle cone - one scoop baby coconut and one scoop grasshopper pie. Of the two, I preferred the baby coconut. The grasshopper pie was basically mint ice cream with crushed oreos and it got wayyy too sweet towards the last few bites. Overall, the ice cream was pretty creamy and well made, but lacked a wow factor that would make me want to come back. It's worth a try but I didn't feel the satisfaction I was hoping for.

I came here on a Sunday around 5 in the evening and the wait wasn't too bad. No more than 20 minutes. Unfortunately, the guy taking my order wasn't very friendly and could not speak up. At one point, he was handing me my cone and mouthing something about it but I couldn't hear. I apologized and asked him to repeat, but he still couldn't speak up. Normally, such an incident wouldn't bother me much but in a crowded and cramped space, it can be quite frustrating. 

Within an hour, I had the worst stomachache and had to rush to the restroom. I can't say for sure Mitchell's should be held accountable, but since I didn't eat anything out of the ordinary prior to the ice cream, I thought it was still something important to mention.
author: Lena L.

description:
yuumy hand made ice cream

only tried thin mint and rocky road.  i heard the tropical flavors are amazing like mango and ube.

would have to come back to try other flavors
author: Dee M.

description:
UH... Why have I not come here sooner?!!?!?!

Yesterday was my first time coming to the famous Mitchell's... I've driven pass this place a couple of times but I've been way too lazy to look for parking to make the effort to come by, but my friends said I HAVE to try it and they'd be honor to bring me to my first experience here!

Parking is a little bit difficult to find... You pretty much gotta get lucky with the outside parking which my friend did (first timer's luck maybe?!). My friend immediately grabbed a number ticket on the left side of the entrance as you walk in. There were sooo many flavors and people that I was like so shocked and thought we'd have to wait forever but it actually wasn't that bad of a wait (10 minutes with 10 numbers in front of us)! My friends had told me that their fruity flavors are what they're known for so I ordered the Halo-Halo ice cream and I was so shocked to how close it ACTUALLY tasted like Halo-Halo! o___o It made me want to order the real drink which you totally can here. I'm pretty much mind blown... I definitely have to go back here and try the rest of the flavors. I also heard that they make their own whip cream here, that's tighttttt. AND they'll dip your ice cream in chocolate for you so its just bomb.com.
author: Nicole C.

description:
"Mango! Mango! Mango!" is one word for ice-cream at Mitchell's which is worth the hike up to San Francisco, and the wait for a good 30 minutes. 
Th mango ice-cream is full of fresh flavor, rich yellow color, and creamy texture.  It is a clear favorite at the store. In fact I was so impressed that I landed up buying the half gallon tub of mango ice-cream before leaving this place. Truly Delicious!
author: Ninad S.

description: If I ever say let's go get ice cream and I am in the city of San Francisco I really mean let's get Mitchell's Ice Cream. I can't even say what's my favorite flavor when every single option is of the highest quality in ice cream. I more so have modes and fazes when it comes to the Holy Grail of Ice Creams. Parking is always an issue in that area even given the parking lot that Mitchell's has. I would recommend you drop someone off to grab a order number to cut out more waiting time. Even during the holiday season I am not welcome in my own home if I don't have Mitchell's egg nog! You absolutely cannot go wrong with Mitchell's right now my mood is Cookies & Creme in a waffle bowl try it out!
author: Rubin S.

description:
Working our way through a list of the city's best ice cream shops, my boyfriend and I found ourselves taking a walk to Mitchell's on a Sunday afternoon.

In spite of the line, the staff member took his time with us, offering several tastings before we settled on our order. 

I combined a scoop of the oft-mentioned ube (purple yam) and a scoop of cinnamon-laced Mexican chocolate. The balance of flavors was perfect. A little more "elastic" than a lot of small batch ice creams, the texture was still wonderfully creamy.
author: Christopher W.

description: The best hot tea and deserts in Bay Area. I m living in San Jose, but travel there to drink a tea after I tasted it only one day ago. and tasted cheese borek, kunefe and kadayif. I saw every people buying ice cream but I m sure they have not tasted tea and deserts in there. If they did, they will spend all their time in there. and thanks to Merve and others for their kindness.
author: Jalal A.

description: Rain shine storm there is always a line at this place there's the famous for their ice cream you haven't been here then you been under a rock you need to come by they hv difference great flavors. flavors you never thought they would make.
author: Lizzie G.

description:
In SF for a couple of days and stayed in an AirBnB near by. It was conveniently located near big lots, Walgreens and only a mile down the street. I also figured bi rite would be even more packed and I just don't like long lines. 

Wait time: was helped within 2 minutes ! Came on a Tuesday at 1:30 PM. I'm assuming lunch time and any time around 4 and later would be crowded. If there's people, grab a number right by the entrance. (I was a noob and failed to see it. I was looking for it at front like where delis would usually have em) 

Service: super friendly. A nice young man said I can try as many flavors as I wanted. After telling him it was my first time, he attempted to help and answered my questions with what's popular. 

SAMPLED: 
Ube- a sweet purple yam. Super popular in the Filipino culture. I never tired and always wanted to. It was sweet, creamy, smooth. Probably needed more than one sample to really get how it tasted like considering it was my first time. 

Ginger spiced- not get it if you're expecting flavors similar to gingerbread, or holiday ginger cookies. This sampling made me acknowledge how they use real ingredients and its definitely fresh made. It tastes like real ginger (yknow, the ones used in cooking) sweetened. You feel the grated ginger in the consistency of the ice cream. I don't like the taste of ginger on its own really, so I passed. 

Grasshopper pie- the famous order, according to Yelp. I LOVE mint ice cream, but I'm not a fan of super chocolatey things. (Ben&jerrys mint cookie is amazing) but I gave it a try anyways. I see why people who love do like the chocolate aspect would enjoy this. The chocolate fudge mixed in there is in thick chunks, but still smooth and rich. The ice cream itself was creamy and not overly minty. 

Toasted almonds- nice clean flavor. The real almond flavor really come through--not the intense almond extract flavor you often experience in a boba Almond Milk Tea or the Yellow Asian almond cookies. But if you snacked on almonds as Regular as me, it's probably nothing too special. 

Burbon swirl- meh. A spin on vanilla . 

What I got! - banana!!! It's SO good. It's perfect. It's creamy, sweet, but not like super ripened banana with massive amounts of black dots everywhere. It tastes so natural . The milk/vanilla (?) really balanced it out . You SEE the tiny banana pieces pureed in the ice cream, and you can feel the tiny specs  of bananas. 

I got it on a sugar cone ^_^ cause The best part of eating ice cream is licking it off of a cone.
author: Debby T.

description:
I scream. You scream. We all scream for Mitchell's ice cream. 

On a time crunch? Then keep on walking, buddy. Mitchell's is not friendly for the time constrained. The one and only ice cream shoppe I have ever had to take a queue ticket and wait to be called. It's like a hungrier version of the crowd you would find at the DMV, except I'm still debating whether the impatient, clock-watching mob awaiting to resolve their vehicular needs is more angsty or the pacing, toe-tapping mob awaiting to resolve their hanger issues. Unlike the DMV, there is no (questionably) organized line. Just a hungry mosh pit. And a fight to the death for the single bench outside its store front. 

If your patience has not yet run out by the time your number is called, you will then take on Challenge 2 in Survivor: Mitchell's Edition as you push your way through the sea of human bodies to the front of the glass case to be faced with an impossibly long array of different buckets of scoops. Mitchell's claim to fame would have to be their ridiculously long list of flavors offered. Their gamut includes more unique ones like Avocado (I tried. I approve.), Ube, Halo Halo, Horchata, etc. Yes, you are allowed to sample as many as flavors as you can name. Yes, the number of death glares received from the people waiting beside you is directly proportional to the number of sample spoons that enter your mouth. 

If you manage to survive the entire process, you will be rewarded with some pretty damn good ice cream. 

Other local ice cream stores comparable to the quality would include Bi-Rite Creamery (get the Green Tea or Balsamic Strawberry) and Humphrys Slocombe (get the Oolong or Secret Breakfast)
author: Jenni H.

description:
DELICIOUS!  Per the recommendation of my friend, my husband and I ordered the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with chocolate chunks, oreos, and hot fudge swirls).  Out of this world - best ice cream I've ever had.  Very excited to try their other flavor offerings.  Though not much of a "fruit" ice cream fan, I may need to try the mango, as it comes highly recommended by my girlfriend.

Best decision we made - ordering the half gallon so we can indulge for many evenings to come :)
author: Rachael S.

description:
No matter how full I am, there is always room for ice cream! Since the weather has been warmer I find myself coming here a little more than usual. This place can get busy. When you get there you need to take a number and wait til your are called. Despite the large crowds, I felt that the workers were very efficient and patient since almost everyone tries all the flavors. I tried Cantaloupe flavor for the first time and it was amazing. I am really sad it is seasonal so stock up and buy a pint while you can! It is hard to say what flavors are the best because everything is really delicious and you can always sample flavors to find what you like =) 


**you only need a # if you want something scooped or made for you. If you're buying a pint or snack, you can grab it and pay right away**
author: Brigitte M.

description:
I've been to Mitchell's twice in my life but I've had the flavors that were sold in other stores too. I've never been disappointed.

If you're going in the actual shop, don't forget to grab a number. I forget a lot because I get so stoked about deciding which flavor to get.

They have so many good flavors (tropical and familiar alike), I have a hard time deciding each time. They let you sample as much as you want but there's usually a lot of people in there so don't piss people off and take your damn ass time.

I tried a few flavors and ended up getting a single size of the grasshopper pie. If I had been less full from dinner, I would have tried to get more but the one scoop was a lot already (big scoops). I love that this grasshopper pie had huge chunks of chocolate sandwich cookies in it. Oh man. 

There is something about Mitchell's ice cream that is very comforting. Even the more unfamiliar flavors have that homey cozy feel. Worth getting.

Don't be afraid of the tropical flavors. The tropical flavors they have are kind of the more typical flavors in certain countries. I personally adore the ube flavor. 

Recommend.
author: Sofia R.

description:
Mitchell's is a tiny shop located in the southern part of the Mission and it is a MUST if you're in the area.  They have a multitude of flavors ranging from your regular vanilla and chocolate to much more specialty flavors like their Ube (Purple Yam).  I always come and get the Thin Mint because it's a delicious, Girl Scout spin on my favorite flavor, mint chip.  The scoops are well portioned and the creamy consistency with its original flavors makes you wanting more! 

Be careful because parking is practically non-existent and the shop is quite small so you might be waiting outside.  Don't forget to grab a number from the inside and I promise it will be worth the wait!

**TIP** If you're looking to just buy a pre-packaged half-gallon, then there is a separate line near the right side that you can order from to avoid the lines.
author: Robert T.

description: I'll always love this place! We were so happy to see that it was open. We have been getting Mitchell's ever since I was a little kid. Our favorites are the rum raisin, chocolate caramel crackle, chocolate, and mango. There is always a long line so remember to grab a number! Got the chocolate caramel crackle sundae. So delicious creamy and still some crackle to give it a bit more texture. I love how dense the chocolate flavor is. You can also buy half gallon sizes of some of the flavors.
author: Natalie M.

description:
Loved the ube ice-cream, it taste like a very light taro plus sweet potato, very mild but so yummy. Plus the freshly made waffle cone, and no line (3PM on a weekday) to get the ice cream, you just can't have it better. 

I prefer flavors like Halo-halo and coconut but don't care so much for fruit flavors like jackfruit, but again it's a personal preference. But with waffle cone you definitely want something creamy :)

My mouth is watering now...
author: Maggie L.

description:
This place is always busy. I always buy ice-cream in half gallons. There's an express lane for that. You grab a number if you want scoops of ice cream.There's express lane for that. 

Cons: Parking sucks!
author: Chan Z.

description:
I don't even know why they have a junior scoop option on the menu. 
It is IMPOSSIBLE to only want a puny scoop of ice cream after tasting their 2 best flavors (imo).

Grasshopper: Tastes like you're eating a CREAM ice cream sandwich, some oreos in there, mint chocolate ice cream and fudge. yum.
Mexican chocolate: Chocolatey and smooth, no explanation necessary.

Be ready for a ~20min wait though! It's always packed.
author: Sean S.

description: This is my favorite ice cream place in the entire world. This is a must in SF, so much better than Bi-Rite!! My favorite flavor is Ube
author: Katelyn K.

description: Love the extensive selection of flavors available!! They also offer select flavors in gallon size from their fridges. Long lines during the weekends, but worth the wait.
author: Angel G.

description:
Even if you're spending $50 on a birthday cake and your toddler is doing a dance, about to pee in her pants, waiting for them to write her name on the cake, they have a "strict policy" against letting anyone use the restroom. They suggested we try Safeway, as the nearest open establishment (that we weren't patronizing and hadn't driven across town for). I apologize to the other patrons for the urine smell in the parking lot. You can thank Mr. Mitchell for that. She didn't make it to the car, let alone Safeway. 

We've been long time patrons of Mitchell's.  Will we be back? 

Not in this lifetime.
author: Debra H.

description:
3.5

Stop #3 of 3 on our ice cream crawl and the only place we hit a line (on the 4th of July).  It wasn't a bad wait though.  They have a number system like the DMV (you take a number and come up to the counter when your number is called and flashes on the monitor) but I'm not sure that made the line less chaotic.

I really thought I'd love this place and there were about 10 zillion flavors I wanted to try, but I felt like I had to limit myself to 3 because of the lines (no one working there told me there was a limit, but they all seemed frazzled).  I tried the chocolate caramel crackle (good chocolate ice cream, but I didn't get a lot of caramel flavor), kahlua mocha fudge (weird texture and kind of flavorless) and espresso toffee chip (coffee ice cream with espresso chips).  I had a scoop of the espresso toffee.  It was pretty good and the coffee + toffee combo is one of my favorites, but I've had better variations of it.  I would go back but am not super inclined to wait in line again.

$2.60 for a single scoop was by far the cheapest we saw on our ice cream crawl (or for that matter, pretty much anywhere in the bay area), but they were on the small side.
author: A M.

description:
Literally Creme de la Creme when it comes to ice cream!! I'm pretty critical toward ice cream since most of them are purely artificial flavor, but Mitchell has opened a whole new world to me! Love their mango, anything chocolate, purple yam, avocado ice cream. 
Once you try Mitchell, you'll never go back!
author: Anh H.

description: Homemade and unique. I can be busy and crowded at times. The have different, unusual, tropical and unique flavors. The even serve halo-halo (Filipino dessert), halo-halo ice cream flavor, ube, macapuno. They have tons of flavor. Even its cold and windy in San Francisco, nothing would stop people from coming here, it's a staple for every one who lives around here.
author: Ruth R.

description: Great selection of different flavors.  This place is always crowded.  I love the fact that it's open late so I can head right on over when I have late night craving.
author: Yisel F.

description:
Came here on a Friday night after dinner.

Unlike SF's other overpriced ice cream joints, Mitchell's is affordable and super delicious! The menu is vast- milkshakes, sundaes, ice cream cakes, pints, waffle cones, waffle bowls, floats, etc. and SO MANY FLAVORS! What's most unique is that they have Asian flavors. The line can get long, but they have a numbers system so it moves quickly! 

My go-to is a junior scoop of buko (young coconut) and a junior scoop of rocky road in a sundae cup!
author: Erica L.

description:
Many unique flavors among the classic ice cream flavors. My favorite is the Macapuno but the lucuma is also good.  The texture seems thicker and creamier than other ice creams, but that might be the coconut cream from the coconut cream.  They have junior scoops which is fantastic when you don't want too much ice cream.

They also have shakes. I tried the shake with halo halo, ube, and macapuno. It was ok but I think I will just stick with the scoops
author: vanessa t.

description:
Old-fashioned super premium ice cream in a way that's simultaneously obsolete and totally awesomely nostalgic. 

Every single, "can we try...?" Was met with a "sure thing!" Which, given that I was going to try 73 things anyway, was encouraging. 

Limon con galletas, coffee chocolate almond misc., and caramel praline were our top picks. Go for the thick, fluffy indulgence, but not the Baskin-Robin vibes. You gotta bring the party with you.
author: Rachel R.

description:
We tried Mexican chocolate and one of their ice cream cookie sandwiches. Cookies were soft, ice cream was creamy, cool flavors. This place is good, but nothing especially stands out to me. They have a parking lot in the back so it's convenient! 
It's kinda weird bc when you go in you have to get a ticket at the door, and when they call your number, you go up and order.. 
I think there's a lot of good ice cream places in SF, 4 stars and up, but they really need service to bump them up and make them stand out.
author: Jacquelyn W.

description: Best Ice cream in SF!!! Macapuno and Ube were my favorite! The grasshopper was really good too. Friendly staff. The only downside was the parking, but what do expect around this city?
author: Kimberly K.

description:
Very, very ordinary ice cream. Not sure what the hype is at all with this place. Lines out the door on a rainy night. The ice cream isn't cheap and the service is just okay. I don't get the amazing, glowing reviews. Dreyers or Haagen Daaz would be much better. Do yourself a favor and buy store bought over this. 

I don't want to use the word so it doesn't show up in yet again more review highlights, but a place with the initials b-r c blows Mitchell's out of the water. No comparison whatsoever in any way, shape or form.
author: Faith C.

description:
Going for a concise review due to the thousands of other reviews.

Solid ice cream, a few unique Asian flavors, and great service. Some flavor differentiators include halo halo, ube, lucuma, and coconut. Ice cream is creamy and doesn't overly coat the tongue like Humphrey Slocumbe. Taste is not as clean as Bi-Rite. Generous samples. Take a number out front to get into the queue. 

There is parking in the back! Customer turnover high enough so that the wait for parking isn't very long. Very family oriented place.
author: Dianna D.

description:
Delicious ice cream! We decided to end an adventurous day in San Francisco with some ice cream from Mitchell's and they did not disappoint. Between the three of us we had the following flavored: peanut butter chocolate (it had a fancier name), grasshopper pie (wow!), Mexican chocolate, espresso something or other and dulce de leche. We opted for two junior scoops each and that really worked out for us. 
The line to be served was rough, it was actually the only draw back. When we arrived, they had just called 42 and our ticket was 76. It took a good while but we really didn't mind waiting. When we finally were called, we had the pleasure of being served by Brian. What a wonderful young man... He was patient, polite and had a sense of humor... Really, what more can a person ask for? If you go to Mitchell's I hope you are lucky enough to be served by Brian!
author: Margie G.

description: Line goes quickly and they except credit card.  First time to Mitchell's and it was a nice treat.  Flavors are unique and will return in the future.
author: SHELBIE R.

description:
FINALLY!!!!!! I have been to SF twice before and each time I failed to make it here. I guess third times a charm. 

From all the reviews it sounded like ube and grasshopper pie was the way to go. However, I really did not like ube and grasshopper was nothing special. Just tasted like mint cookies and cream. Instead I got buko (young coconut) and mango. These were very yummy! 

So when you arrive you don't just wait in line you have to grab a number. It's like the DOL except the line goes rather quickly. Thank goodness! 

Small place so not a lot of room to wait inside. I got the double junior because people's reviews said one scoop was pretty large. Glad I did because I was the perfect size. 

Sunny day with a cup of ice cream. Can't get much better than that!
author: Eva C.

description:
Hi, I'm Greg, and I was a Mitchell's virgin.

Yes, WAS. Not anymore!

I know this place is popular, but at 9:30pm on a cold windy night? What did I expect, right? Mitchell's has always been deemed the best, so I was stoked to finally try them out.

The wait is actually a good thing, for it allows you plenty of time to digest the huge list of flavors and form a game plan. I picked a couple flavors to try and also got a chance to see what everyone else was ordering. 

In the end I decided on their tropical ice cream choices, which are outstanding and as unique as you'll see at any ice cream spot. The Avocado rocks my world, and the Ube was a delicious as well as beautifully aesthetic choice to pair it with. I put them atop a waffle cone, which seemed like the popular thing to do. And boy oh boy what a treat!

A big shout out to Maria who rounded out the whole experience by being so friendly and helpful. 

Next stop...de-virginizing myself at Bi-Rite!
author: Greg S.

description: Oooh, I love their dark chocolate peanut butter indulgence.  YUMMY!
author: Liz D.

description:
I *may have had a meltdown here the other night (pun intended).

I was driving down San Juan according to Siri's instructions, and then my sister decided to chime in as well. I decided I didn't like either of their tones. Then my sister told me to turn into the exit of the parking lot, and I nearly ran smack into someone's mini van. I circled the block and then drove right into the exit again, which caused me to park the vehicle like Ray Charles. My once-excellent parking karma is now officially destroyed, I'm pretty sure. If I had been in a better mood, I would have simply been pleased that there was a parking lot at all.  I mean, have you ever tried to park around the Swensen's in Russian Hill on a Saturday evening? 

When we exited the vehicle, I was, um, not happy. It was 10:00 p.m. It was freezing outside. Yet, there was a line so long at Mitchell's, you'd think they were giving ice cream away. I had not been to Mitchell's before, so I didn't know about the ticket system. Therefore, I stood in the line winding outside the door waiting to get inside the door. I love my sister to death, and you know this, but I asked her about 4 times how this system worked because there appeared to be two lines (one for pre-packed and one for dine-in), but she did not answer the question. Then this lady comes up right behind me, reaches over my shoulder, and snatches a ticket, and then proceeds to play stupid about it. 

You know, I realize that people are inclined to behave like jackasses sometimes, but I find this particular breed of conduct especially reprehensible. And she looked like one of those ladies that, you know, has a "coexist" sticker on her car and attends city arts and lectures.  Are you really going to cut in line? Because that is all that is, plain and simple. And playing stupid doesn't excuse it. This also happens quite a bit at Genova in Oakland. I hope she knows that her ticket karma is ruined due to her snatching and cutting. She is lucky I didn't go Sonny Corleone on her.
