Anyhow, when it was finally our turn, I realized I *may have been overreacting, as our wait was the total of 5 minutes. I ordered the grasshopper flavor, my sister ordered some caramel flavor, and her daughter ordered the strawberries and cream. This ice cream is damn fine quality. I must say, however, that the strawberries and cream was the best flavor out of those we collectively ordered. The grasshopper was the least greatest choice, but that's okay, because I was clearly not behaving anyway. 

Three individual scoops were under $10. Don't forget to tip. And don't cut in line, because what if I'm behind you?
author: Sunny S.

description:
It's a pretty cramped and packed place, but the wait is so worth it. That Mexican Chocolate was heavenly I can still remember it years later. 

I got their half gallons and I was so sad when I finished them all. The green tea was the most potent one I've had in an ice cream, tasted high quality. Ube was real fresh too.
author: Eulla S.

description: One of the best ice cream places in the whole Bay Area!
author: Nigel J.

description:
7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die 2012

#96 Ube Ice Cream at Mitchell's

Super creamy, rich ice cream base sets the stage for the star of the dish, UBE! My friend thought the Ube flavor was good but not as strong as other places that she has tried but she still enjoyed Mitchell's version. I thought it was great!

I decided to try the Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream. Definitely tasted the spices  of cinnamon and etc in the chocolate but wasn't overpowering by any means. 

Side note, my wonderful brother and sister got us all Halo Halos from them a few nights ago. It was my first time trying their version and I have to say its pretty darng good! First, they let you pick any flavor you want to go on top which is a great touch.

Stick to the fruity flavors is a better choice but hey if you want chocolate halo halo go for it, they won't stop you.

The halo halos are packed with toppings that add a great variety of textures to the dessert

Overall thoughts

Consistently good, even after 3 years...well done Mitchell's
author: Eddie W.

description: This is it.  This is the institution.  This is where you stop for a little scoop any time of day or night in any weather.  Yes there's all these new hip ice cream places now around the city, but this is still my favorite classic old school SF.  Walk in, grab a number, get in line, and enjoy!
author: David S.

description: I love this ice cream store! No tables, not much parking, but the ice cream is heavenly. I always try to bring out-of-town visitors here. My favorite flavor is only available during the holidays, but the variety of flavors is great, and they offer both pre-packed and hand scooped/packed, in addition to cones and cups. Great place.
author: Cherry S.

description:
I LOVE ice cream, so whenever I travel I try to get my hands on any ice cream place i can! I was not disappointed with Mitchell's, I was lucky enough to find parking right in front and came right before a huge rush of people arrived.
I sampled a variety of flavors such as Baby Coconut, Mexican Chocolate, which all tasted amazing and I finally decided on the Grasshopper Pie ice cream with a chocolate covered waffle cone. It was so delicious and the pie part in the ice cream was rich and flavorful and went well with the mint. So good!
author: Karen C.

description:
They've got some pretty interesting flavors .. I tried the Spumoni partly because the name sounds so wicked cool. 
Spumoni : (Madagascar Bourbon Vanilla blend and chocolate ice cream (see Chocolate, above) with natural rum flavoring, roasted California almonds, raisins, cherries and other dried fruit)

I must say that this was not their most unique flavour but it was great ! 
If i could get a do over , i'd try one of their coconut based flavors or Ube
author: Vasini G.

description:
After trying the peanut butter indulgence (good but more choc than peanut butter) and the horchata (very cinnamon-y) first, decided to go with grasshopper pie.  Good, though the flavor was dom-"mint"-ated by the mint ice cream but you could still taste the fudge and Oreo bits. Forgot to grab a number but luckily it was 55 degrees outside so the wait was relatively short.  

They also have cookies and other sweet snacks, the madelines are not Sugar Bowl good but close. One complaint - the waffle cones are on the small side, only slightly larger than a sugar cone, better off with waffle bowl instead.
author: Sal M.

description:
definitely a local gem :)

Recently collaborated with them for a school fundraiser. They were very professional and helpful! Reasonable prices for visitors and fundraisers!
author: Kerry K.

description:
My favorite --

Macapuno ice cream on a waffle cone, chocolate dipped with almonds.

You won't be disappointed. Seriously. It's like my favorite ice-cream related thing ever.
author: Ben D.

description:
UBE UBE UBE FLAVOR! 

Had a ice cream cake UBE flavor. Cheap prices and very delicious. The lines can be long, but worth the wait! 

I am obsessed!
author: Adam J.

description:
First things first - GET A NUMBER!!!

As soon as you get there, on the left side of the entrance, get a number before someone else does! Then be prepared to wait. Nights and weekends are always busy, especially in their parking lot that has about 8 spaces. It's always best to come with someone else so they can drive around in circles while you wait for the goods. 

Personally, my favorite is the Grasshopper - basically mint chocolate chip + oreos. You can't really go wrong there. But they have tons of crazy flavors that you definitely won't get at Cold Stone or Baskin.
author: Leina K.

description:
I really appreciate how friendly the staff is despite how busy it gets! Don't forget to tip for their hard work! 

I had the horchata and passionfruit sorbet. Both were so good and perfect to enjoy while walking around the area. Will definitely be back! :)
author: Cindy B.

description:
I've heard a lot of good things about this place. Today I just happened to be in the city and it was a pretty warm day out so what Better day to try it! 

I read reviews about long lines and hard to find parking but we didn't really have a problem with either! Although I could see how parking could be a problem.

Staff was friendly and icecream choices were not your typical flavors. My boyfriend being his picky self stuck to getting just vanilla. I was more daring and tried 3 flavors! (Fatty I know!) 

I got orange sherbet which from reviewers here on yelp said was really good. To me it was just okay, but the boyfriend really liked it and ended up eating mine! Hahah

I also got ube and avocado which was soo good! Great on this warm day in the city!
author: Carisa B.

description: Get a double junior rather than a double double. It's about a dollar cheaper but the amount of ice cream you get is about the same. I tried the halo halo, Ube, Oreo and peanut butter indulgence. Of the four I liked Ube the best. It had a fragrant Ube flavor and wasn't overly sweet. They had a lot lf unique flavors as well as traditional flavors. I liked that there was a parking lot out back. It's also organized because of their ticket numbering system. It is not my favorite ice cream spot in the city but it's great because it offers some pretty unique flavors.
author: Brenda L.

description: The staff was beyond kind and welcoming. I had a sundae with their homemade fudge and scrumptious ice cream! The place was immaculate! Thanks!
author: DiMee M.

description:
Hard to say something that hasn't already been said about this place. 

Great quality ice cream with a family business flavor. They are open late and will treat your right. It's really hard to write a review when almost everything is near perfection. 

Thumbs up. Way up. Now go get some ice cream!
author: Benny H.

description:
I might never understand San Francisco and it's relationship with ice cream. I mean, this place is cold and foggy and y'all want ice cream, like, 24/7. WHAT IS THAT ABOUT? No, seriously. What is that about?

Here's the thing...Mitchell's Ice Cream is so good, I can see why y'all go there in all kinds of weather and take a number and stand in line. That is how good Mitchell's is. 

I personally recommend the Grasshopper and Mexican chocolate. In combination. Because, if you are gonna wait in line and experience the torture that is smelling those waffle cones, you better double up. TWO SCOOPS, Y'ALL. Two scoops.

PRO TIP: If you are coming to Mitchell's by car, I suggest you go in a pair and one person should jump out at the curb and run and grab a number. The other person can begin the soul-numbing task of finding parking.
author: Tara H.

description:
Love this place! As a chocolate lover Grasshopper Pie is my favorite! I recently tried Toffee Espresso Crunch and it was delicious. 
My bf got the horchata flavor and it was a bit too sweet in my opinion, it tasted more like arroz con leche. And as for the guava sorbet, it tasted just like guava. 

My customer service experience has been well. It may be awhile till you get served but it is worth the wait.
author: Alejandra B.

description: Love this place! Closes late and although it usually has a line... It's well worth the wait. I usually play safe and order chocolate or cookies n cream or vanilla here. And my go to flavor is green tea since they had it on hand for a limited time only. Many people have recommended the Ube flavored ice cream so I decided to venture out and try it against my norm. Absolutely delicious and you will not be disappointed. Very light and creamy. Hit the spot for a rainy day last night mmmmmmm delish!
author: Linda L.

description: I tried their cinnamon ice cream with horchata, I was not impressed with the flavor and there is a significant lack of seating and parking, no thank you.
author: Frances H.

description:
Came here for a nice, post lunch treat. The staff is super friendly despite the mad crowd pushing the small store to its seams. Parking is limited (small lot in the back). Once you are called for your number, you get to try as many flavors as you please, and the staff never seems to rush you. My favorite flavor is grasshopper pie! It's mint ice cream, fudge, and Oreo. So creamy, smooth, and refreshing! We bought a half gallon for home. :) 

Tip: Grab a number right when you walk in to reserve your spot in line! Also, if you are just going to be buying a pint or more, you can go to the right side of the store for the express line.
author: Hurnan V.

description:
Mitchell's I love you!!!!!
I've been a fan of Mitchell's for over three decades, (i know i'm old) and will always be a fan. MITCHELL's for LIFE! :)
author: Christie H.

description:
"How have you not been here?" 

Notes: The line goes really fast. When you get there you can grab a ticket and they go through about 10 numbers every 3-5 minutes. Honestly they called my number before I had picked a flavor but the guy was really chill and asked me to pick some flavors to try. THE GRASSHOPPER was 20/10. I'll be returning just to get it again. I also chose the Mexican Chocolate (cinnamon infused chocolate) and it was a 10/10 as well...very smooth and tasty. I'll be returning to try the other flavors soon.
author: Joshua F.

description: The best! Sure when we arrived there was already a line stretched around the block. We drew #23 and they call....."NUMBER 82!!....NUMBER 82!!"  43 numbers later...ahhhh sweet sweet victory!!!!! I tried the Halo Halo...omg it was very very good! So different so amazingly different. We also shared a banana split, milk shakes etc. everything was fantastic. The BEST! My favorite ice cream shop ever
author: Taj M.

description: Its good but I guess I am Bi-rite gal. The workers are great and super friendly! Loved the coffee flavor!
author: Nicole C.

description: Amazing. Flavors aren't as interesting as Bi-Rite's but the tastiness is just as good or more than Bi-Rite. While Mitchell's isn't in as attractive of a neighborhood, it is a must-try! I tried a couple flavors but ultimately went with two. The ube (purple yam) flavor ice cream here is to die for. And, the grasshopper pie IS GOD'S GIFT TO THE WORLD, which is peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, oreo cookies and fudge swirls. I'm not even a big fan of mint ice cream and this flavor is bomb. The seasonal cinnamon snap flavor is also really great. If you're into fall flavors, you're going to love the ginger snap cookie notes in this one! Come and sample them all if you can handle waiting in line. They have tickets though so you don't have to guard your spot and the line isn't that long, especially not compared to Bi-Rite's. No place to sit and enjoy though, especially since outside is kinda ratch.
author: Lucy C.

description:
Please open a thousand more locations.  They let you taste every single flavor if you want. More choices than Bi-Rite.....and less touristy.  Friendly service.  Somewhat easy to find parking (they have a private lot behind the building). Awesome flavors.  I always find something new here that I love. 

Caramel chocolate crunch!!!  

I will choose Mitchell's over Bi-Rite any day!
author: Justin P.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream spot in SF. It has a local parlor look & feel, unique flavors, and is very affordable when you buy the gallon size. 

I highly recommend the grasshopper pie!
author: Drew M.

description: I really love the avocado and purple yam ice cream, even every time when I go there is a long line waiting but it's worthy to wait, it's local, fresh, creamy and tasty in general.
author: Pyrena H.

description:
Mitchell's is worth the it's wait in gold - yes I did spell "wait" correctly.

We came at 10:45 on a Friday, it was low 60s, and there were 20 parties ahead of us when we took our number 93.

I ordered a hand-packed pint of the Seasonal Pumpkin Ice Cream. My friend (who lives round the block) tried chocolate (the standard to judge creameries) and a butter scotch marble.

Mitchell's has been making ice cream since 1954. People are probably still lining up for their traditional and tropical flavors. For me the signature point of difference is the creamy texture of Mitchell's ice cream. It has a distinctive mouth feel and melt factor.

Mitchell's is worth the it's wait in gold - yes I did spell "wait" correctly.

We came at 10:45 on a Friday, it was low 60s, and there were 20 parties ahead of us when we took our number 93.

I ordered a hand-packed pint of the Seasonal Pumpkin Ice Cream. My friend (who lives round the block) tried chocolate (the standard to judge creameries) and a butter scotch marble.

Mitchell's has been making ice cream since 1954. People are probably still lining up for their traditional and tropical flavors. For me the signature point of difference is the creamy texture of Mitchell's ice cream. It has a distinctive mouth feel and melt factor.
author: Bryan W.

description:
A local favorite!  Mitchell's serves the BEST ice cream ever!  They serve a variety of flavors and their ice creams are simply fresh and yummy.  I personally enjoy their tropical flavors and look forward to trying out their seasonal ones.    

What are the secret ingredients, you ask?  Dedication, quality, friendly service, and LOTS and lots of butterfat.  

Mmmm, mmmm, mmmm!
author: Carlota C.

description:
Only in San Francisco will you see a line for ice cream in the dead of winter.

Mitchell's had dozens of fine flavors, along with some shakes, sundaes, and cookies. You can't go wrong with their selection, but the fruity flavors (New York Cherry) stand out a lot more than their chocolate-based ones (Mexican Chocolate). Order accordingly!
author: Casey S.

description:
Yes there's always a line, it's out of the way, etc. etc. But...

Peanut Butter Indulgence: creamy real chocolate ice cream with chunks of peanut butter.

I'm just sayin' - another argument for six or even ten -star Yelp ratings.

When in SF run, don't walk, to Mitchell's Ice Cream...
author: Arthur S.

description:
Hard to find a place that serves my favorite purple taro ice cream. this place at least serves purple yam (ube) ice cream. it's not sweet at all and i totally love it. i don't usually eat cold stuff because it makes my stomach sick, but today i ate so much! 

their pistachio ice cream uses real pistachio too! i also recommend it! compared to Bi-Rite creamery, this place's ice cream is less sweet, so i think it's better :) i actually got a salted caramel from bi-rite first and then did food hopping to get ube here :)
author: Ashley C.

description:
Product: Specialty ice cream (esp Filipino tropical flavored) - I absolutely love every ice cream flavor at this place!  When you think San Francisco ice cream = Mitchell's is definitely one that will go to the top of your list!  YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!

Service:  My boyfriend and I went when the store was close to closing time.  Staff was average, scoop one serve two, and go, understandable it's just ice cream.  My ice cream specialist with the braces was very generous with his portions and a really nice guy.  They are a very busy store but it doesn't mean you can't smile and address customers more with an inviting tone, clothing department stores are quite busy as well but you don't see Nordstrom employees not try and build a rapport with their clients. 

Ambiance: bright, clean, very crowded, but they have a good system to tend to as much customers as they can.  All just seems quite rushed, but again, this is just an ice cream parlor in the middle of the night and people just want their ice cream and leave! 

Recommendation:  customer service, it's a bleh for me.  Wudda been 5stars for me but just couldn't find myself to get there
author: Edgar I.

description:
What sets this ice cream shop apart from others in SF is that it's been around for 61 years! WOW. Bi-Rite has only been around since 2006. Other places are popping up like weeds but Mitchell's has been grandfathered in.

Another reason why Mitchell's is different is the double cream they put in their ice cream. It tastes good, and that's because it's so creamy! I would have to say Mitchell's is the classic place to get your chocolate ice cream. They're not going to have the Salted Caramel or Honey Lavender that hip, trendy ice cream places seem to have these days. But you can always count on your vanilla here! Any flavor is good here!

The service is great. I've been coming here for years, and the staff hasn't changed. This means they treat their employees well, which makes me happy.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Came across this place on Yelp to check out, sure glad I did! Coolest and most interesting selection of flavors. Excellent service in terms of friendliness and fast, parking can be a little tough but hey trust me it's worth it.
author: Ariana C.

description: Simply the best ice cream in the world.... I always want to try something new here but the grasshopper pie is so amazing I just can't. Get it chocolate dipped too. I wish this place was closer to where I lived, I'd go so much more often. Only complaint is, I feel like their scoop size has become smaller since the many times I've gone before.
author: Jessie A.

description:
My favorite ice cream place in san francisco. Their ice cream is very delicious. I think the winner for them is the exotic flavors they offer such as Ube, mango, avocado and macapuno. They are all very rich in flavor and every bite taken is a party in your mouth. Customer service is outstanding and always willing to give samples if you have a hard time deciding what to order. 

They go by the ticket numbering system so be sure to pull a ticket when you enter and while waiting, marvel at all the yummy flavors they offer. There is a small parking lot in the back, entrance on 29th street, but at their peak hours is usually filled.
author: Bernadette S.

description: I've been going here since I was like 7, this place never disappoints! On a nice warm day in SF this place is definitely packed, even on cold days sometimes.  No doubt their Filipino flavors are good! But my personal favorites here are Avocado, grasshopper pie, & strawberry!
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description: This was the first ice cream store I tired in San Francisco. Back in 2009 my friend busted me to try this new ice cream spot she had found. We walked up and the line was wrapped around the corner! So we decided to join the line, boy am I glad we did. I ended up trying cantaloupe and mango! Those were my choices for years,Ha! Now I'm all about trying all of them, even the mint green(-yuck). This spot is always over crowded on a nice sunny Francisco day. Parking is ridiculous! I usually make my friends stand in line so I can find parking. Make sure you are not in a rush because you want to make sure to try everything and get what you really want! And the customer are not rude either! They know that your enjoying yourself and that their will be more ice cream after you and them are long gone.
author: Monee C.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream places to go to for Classic flavors. They have a great range of flavors to choose from and they also allow you to try multiple flavors first! They have many fruit flavors (popular ones are ube and mango) and non fruit flavors (cookies and cream is my favorite!) What's extra special about Mitchell's is their extensive menu and the ability to get waffle cones, shakes, sundaes, etc! Definitely a great place to bring family and friends and enjoy a nice night out getting dessert. The many options they have make it a desirable dessert place for a large party!

There is a personal parking lot for the ice cream shop but is very small so you might have to find parking elsewhere nearby. Parking can be difficult at times during night and on weekends but it is definitely worth the trip! There always is a line outside so better to come earlier to avoid the crowd!
author: Wendy Z.

description: There is definitely nothing wrong with Mitchell's, but they aren't my first choice in the San Fransisco area. Something they do offer that the other shops don't is PARKING which is awesome and LOTs and LOTs of prepackaged options.
author: Brittney M.

description:
Would've been nice to know I was supposed to grab a number as soon as I walk in. Didn't realized I was supposed to do that until I saw other people doing it. The wait took awhile and I noticed two little girls grabbing a number and immediately ordering cause they're "regulars". Not trying to be a prude about it, but no wonder it takes so long for the numbers to go by.

I ordered the halo halo and it was delicious.  Too much crushed ice in the beginning, but as it begin to melt into the jellies at the bottom it balances it out. The avocado ice cream was good too. I'll definitely want to try more of their ice cream!
author: Renee Y.

description:
My favorite here is macapuno. Coconut mmmmmmmmmm..

Love the ice cream, cake, not so much. Had a premade cake for my birthday. Nice decor. Ice cream was good (strawberry). Not a heavy strawberry taste as I would have preferred. Cake was SUPER hard. Had to bust out super human strength to cut it. Probably not going to order a cake from here again.

At 9pm on a Sat... this place was PACKIN'. At 2pm, on a Sat, PACKIN'!! I think they need a bigger shop to accommodate all these lovely ppl.
author: Benita M.

description: Best ice cream ever! Long lines though but it is well worth the wait for it! The ice cream  is nice and creamy and delicious always craving for more.
author: Alyssa C.

description:
Ube!!!

the workers here are friendly and they're open late. The price is also very reasonable for the quality of ice cream you get. It's like 8 bucks for an entire gallon. i definitely recommend the ube flavor and pistachio flavor (although i'm not a huge fan of the actual nuts in it)
author: Andy H.

description:
Superb quality ice cream that exceeds franchises, like Baskin-Robbins. 

My favorite flavors of theirs are peach and coffee, which taste splendid!
author: Anna B.

description:
Loved their Ube flavor!  They have so many different unique flavors that I want to try.  

I actually enjoyed Mitchell's more than Bi-Rite.  When it comes to ice cream, I like the fruity flavors and Bi-Rite just doesn't have that many options.  They are typically busy, but the lines moves very fast.  They have a number system and about 3 workers helping at the same time.  I highly suggest Mitchell's as a must go if you love ice cream.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Ice cream is great. 
I have been impressed with all of the flavors I've tried.The fruit flavors are excellent as well, and aren't icy at all but smooth and creamy.
They have a huge  variety of flavors, so you can use the time you spend waiting for them to call  your number to decide what you want.

You will probably have  to wait and there's no seating besides a bench outside, I would recommend heading inside as they  get close to your number as they move  onto the next number pretty quickly if you don't appear quickly.
author: Claire C.

description:
OMG!  This place is awesome.  It's in the middle of freaking nowhere, but it has its own parking lot in the back.  We came here mid-bars on Friday night and it was packed.  We had to take a number and wait about 15-20 minutes.  During that time, I ogled all the flavors and made a mental list of the ones I wanted to try.  After the 10th number was called, it was our turn!  I think I tried the horchata, ube, mango, avocado, grasshopper pie, coconut, chocolate crackle something, strawberry and a couple of others.  I opted for one junior scoop of grasshopper pie (mint and oreo cookie) and another junior scoop on horchata (seasonal!).  I got a sugar cone with whipped cream and nuts on top.  NOM NOM NOM.  

Sometimes I wonder why my dates can't take me to better places than my friends.  WHY?  It's not about the restaurants with ambiance necessarily, but you can't ignore the ice cream portion especially when there are so many good places in SF to try!  So don't be lazy and order the dessert off the menu at the restaurant, do part deux here at Mitchell's!
author: Chris L.

description: Grew up on Mitchell's Ice Cream and besides an It's It nothing reminds me of my youth like Mitchell's. When I was born in the 80s the week of Thanksgiving, my father took a Pumpkin Pie Flavor to SF General for my mom so this loyalty runs in my veins!
author: R P.

description:
How can you go wrong at Mitchell's? I've compared it to Bi-Rite and I must say they are hands down way better.

Pros:
-unique flavors, and a huge variety of it
-friendly service
-they have the best cookies and cream ice cream! Literally chock full chunks of Oreos in every single bite
-cheap and so affordable!
-they sell huge tubs of their ice cream flavors for you to enjoy at home
-they have Filipino flavored ice cream (for the parents)
-they have won many awards for their ice cream 
-every flavor is so creamy and delicious, you feel bad not being able to try all of them before you leave.
- if only purchasing tubs you get in and out quickly.

Cons:
-parking is hard to find, they have a small lot in the back and it only has about 5-6 spots. Turnover is ok but since there are always long lines at this place you're better off driving around and getting street parking.
-long lines
-crowded

I love this ice creams shop! It's the best in SF!
author: leanne s.

description: Needed to reward myself after a very trying and stressful day in the city and decided to stop by Mitchell's for a chocolate dipped in chocolate cone. This is my Mitchell's favorite order since childhood. As usual, the line was way too long....but I noticed they had an express line for prepackaged icecream.  Hmmmm would it make back still frozen all the way to petaluma on a hot day? Well isn't that what air conditioning is for? So I bought a half gallon, stuck it on the passenger seat and cranked up the A/C.  When I arrived home, I rushed my coveted passenger into the house and grabbed a spoon to taste my reward. Velvet on the tongue! Still my most favorite ice cream in the world, nothing else even comes close. I swear I could eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner, and want for nothing more!
author: Mary V.

description:
This is a staple San Francisco ice cream shop that has been around probs before you were born. They've got the best and most unique flavors you'll ever taste. Like this orange scoop of Thai Tea on top of Grasshopper Pie (peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, oreo cookies and fudge swirls).

Tip: Grab a ticket and wait for your number to be called. They also have a parking lot in the back!

http://cyneats.com/best-desserts-in-san-francisco/
author: Cynthia L.

description: Hands down- the BEST ice cream in San Fran.  There is a reason it is open until 10pm even in the winter.  Check this place out- the staff are also super nice and knowledgable.
author: Melissa L.

description:
We decided to come here after seeing this place featured on one of the food travel channels and also a review we stumbled upon in a magazine. 

I have to say I have never had to sample so much ice cream anywhere in order to decide for a scoop of something so that was my first clue on how this would end but I finally decided for the grasshopper flavor, which was basically mint base with Oreo cookies and chocolate swirls. Unfortunately for me this seemed to taste better on the tasting spoon or maybe I just tried really hard to want to like something. I took 2 small spoon bites and finally threw it out. It seemed artificially flavored and had the consistency of when ice cream melts and is then frozen again.

I guess their regular patrons are just used to what they're used to because the ones taking quarts to go including the flavor I chose from were raving about their product. As for me I felt as if I had cheated on Humphry Slocombe...also located nearby in the city.
author: Sylvia Q.

description: Brian made my first experience great! Though it was busy when coming in, he was able to give me several samples before choosing the Ube flavor his personal favorite. I would not only come back for the ice cream but for Brian's superb service.
author: Pirelli P.

description: Yummy! I'm from Southern California and my wife's family lives in Daly City. Every time we come to visit I always try to stop by Mitchell's either in person or by door dash. I love their variety of ice cream that they have available. I've tried different flavors and have never been disappointed.
author: Eric C.

description:
What is the one thing that is certain in life besides death and taxes?  Lines attract people, and make lines even longer.  This holds true especially for Mitchell's Ice Cream.  There is always a horde of people every single night.  I pass by here quite often on my way to work, and it never ceases to amaze me how people love ice cream.  

I once purchased an ice cream cake from here, and it was quite good.  The thing that is unique about this place is that they have a ticketing system in order to figure out who orders next (like at a meat shop you see in movies).  I find that this is more efficient because otherwise it would be chaos in forming a uniform line to place an order.  I ordered a single scoop of cantaloupe in a waffle cone.  A regular cone costs no extra, but waffle cones and sugar cones cost extra.  I would consider sampling flavors first before committing yourself to one flavor.  The cantaloupe was tasty, and had bits of real fruit mixed in with the ice cream.  

All in all, Mitchell's serves up some good tasting ice cream.  However, the line is quite ridiculous.  Lines at Bi-Rite, Humphrey's, and Smitten are not even as bad as here.  Then again, Mitchell's serves more conventional ice cream.  They sell "normal" ice cream flavors.  The others are more for hipsters, with their unique (weird)  flavors such as curry and bourbon.
author: Victor L.

description: Love love the ice cream! Definitely expect a wait! Got here and was #70 and they were just on #10. Definitely gotta wait the ice cream is the bomb.com!!
author: Margaret L.

description:
Only in SF do people think standing outside in slightly chilly, windy weather, wearing a jacket, and waiting for ice cream sounds like a fun idea. But it is! Parking is kind of annoying, but not worse than anywhere else in SF. There's a good mix of flavors, so everyone should be able to find something they like, and this place definitely has cred among my friends who are actually from the area. Prices are reasonable, too, so you should feel free to try something new, and ask to try a couple of flavors. I love the Thai Tea flavor, personally. 

Word of advice, though: Go in expecting to wait, and every once in a while  you'll get pleasantly surprised by a large group leaving because that one person forgot their jacket and JUST. CAN'T WAIT. ANYMORE. Also, sometimes people pull like 10 numbers at once by accident, so all of a sudden they'll just call through them when you thought you were 10 customers away from deliciousness. Next, please!
author: Aaron S.

description: It's almost impossible to have a negative experience here, even with the expected long lines! Customer service is always great, ice cream is always good, and being a San Francisco native, you learn when to go and not to go!
author: Andrea E.

description:
This is hands down my favorite ice cream place. I've never been disappointed! The flavors are always so bold and consistent.

Long lines or not, it's worth the experience.
author: Melonie G.

description:
I've tried a majority of the good ice cream spots in SF and this place tops the list. So many different flavors to choose from. You have your standard flavors plus a good selection of tropical/fruity stuff. Coconut pineapple is a must try!! Creamy, but yet has consistent density and flavor.

There is no seating inside; just a few small benches in front. Most people take it to go or just stand. Will definitely be back for more flavors!
author: Josh L.

description:
THE ICE-CREAM AT MITCHELL'S IS SO GOOD I FORGOT TO TAKE A PICTURE!

Yep... it was that good. I came in on a random weekday night.. around 9 pm. The brick and mortar was packed with folks coming in left and right. This is probably the first ice cream shop in which I had to grab a ticket and wait for my number to be called. I felt a bit helpless in deciding on which flavors to settle upon. I was totally in the mood for a warm and decadent brownie fudge sundae. But to my dismay, they didn't have that on the menu. I also didn't want to continuously sample every flavour in the bin. So I made the brave decision and settled upon the toasted almond ice cream and the espresso toffee ice cream. I felt a bit rebellious in choosing a caffeinated flavored ice cream at night - but it was totally worth it. Being a chocoholic, I asked for hot fudge to be smothered on my ice cream. I was given two large scoops of ice cream that was swimming in hot fudge sauce. Oh my gosh, totally worth every bite! Mitchell's ice cream is super fluffy, creamy, and fresh. I ate every bite possible in my cup. So glad to have ventured down here in the Mission and try Mitchell's. The best ice cream spot in San Francisco! You'll be hooked like a sugar hooker. Give it a try!
author: Sara I.

description:
I really don't know what the point of writing a review for a place that has almost 3000 already is, but here goes. 

I love ice cream. I love treats in general. I used to be really fat so that little kid in me jumps out every now and then and demands treats. Mitchell's is an above average place to satisfy that urge. 

The ice cream here is good, maybe even great, but nothing mind blowing. The are plenty. Coconut and PB Indulgence are my favorites. 

People are never really talking about how absurd the prices are at this place. I'm usually paying for myself and my gal and two cups come out over $10. A half gallon is only $9... Next time we are planning on buying one of those and not waiting in line for 45 minutes. 

Overall, you can't really go wrong with Mitchell's. It will satisfy a sweet tooth, but you're going to wait no matter time of day and the price is a little steep for 5 minutes of fat kid gratification.
author: Anthony G.

description: I love neighborhood spots like this.  You can tell there are tons of regulars.  The flavors here are great, especially the tropical (mango, buko, halo-halo etc).  The half gallons seem like amazing value! Wish I lived closer so I could take one home... pretty happy with my avocado shake though :)
author: Candice W.

description: This ice cream was REALLY GOOD. I usually don't stray away from Loard's ice cream but my friend wanted to try this place out. Street parking is an option but they have their own private little parking lot in the back of their building. It's a one-way drive through parking lot that you access from the side of the building (not right next to the front entrance, that's the exit only). You have to grab a number once you walk in (located to the left of the entrance) and wait until your number is called. They have a variety of unique ice cream flavors like horchata, Mexican chocolate (that tastes like abuelita's hot chocolate), the Tropical 4 that's a combo of pineapple, banana, guava and mango, Thin Mint, and Lucuma (a Peruvian fruit). After the worker kindly let me try a variety of like 5 flavors since I couldn't decide, I finally chose 2 scoops in a waffle cone- one of Horchata and another of Tropical 4. Really flavorful and you get your money's worth. They also have a variety of sizes of tubs of ice cream you can take home and ice cream cakes. I will definitely return & recommend!
author: Vanessa G.

description: We walked in at 10:58 and they still served us! The ice cream is absolutely amazing and the customer service is on point. I got the pecan praline! Must have!
author: Hemza S.

description: Best ice cream in SF. No question about it. Pricey, but they give you large scoops of ice cream. Sure, you may not get a lot of the artisanal flavors you may get at other places, but you you can get some unique flavors like ube, macapuno, and halo halo that you won't get anywhere else in the city.
author: Isabel C.

description:
I love UBE ice cream. I can tell there is a big filipino influence here. Go to the front porch for a meal and to Mitchell's after. Sample as many ice cream flavors as you want!

No seating, but ice cream taste even better standing up! :)
author: Joey N.

description:
I am not much of a ice cream person but whenever I feel like having some Mitchell's is the place to go to.
Their selection is almost a little too complicated for me, but in a good way, it seems like they are considerate and thoughtful as the diverse population in the area and they have some pretty traditional flavors original from some countries. ( ube, kalua etc) 
They of course also have the traditional flavors like vanilla, strawberry etc   
Parking can be difficult to find as the establishment has a back parking lot that is almost always full, also Upon arrival you must pick up a number to indicate the order you ll be called to place your order. Place is small but always busy, well worth the drive and the wait for me.
author: Imelda G.

description:
UBE!!! enough said! haha

I never understand why people go to this place and order: vanilla, rocky road, cookies and cream etc.

You don't go to a sushi restaurant and ask for a burger, right?! hahaha exactly!!!

I recommend: Buko, Langka, Durian and my love, UBE!!!
author: Jan R.

description: This is my favorite ice cream place. Everytime i come, i always get the mango flavor, and it always satisfies me! Staff are fast and friendly. It's always crowded, but with the fast service, the wait is not bad. Only bummer is the small parking. Other than that, this is a great business and i wish they have more locations especially in downtown SF!
author: Maria U.

description:
Mitchell's is the old school alternative to Bi-Rite and all of the other trendy ice cream shops. 

Ice cream is obviously great - interesting flavors like taro - though I typically stick to my favorite flavors, strawberry and salted caramel (but not together). The big winner here are the cakes and pies - we've gotten the salted caramel pie which is heavenly. I've always felt as though the cake in ice cream cakes gets dry from being frozen so the perfect solution is to eliminate the cake and throw that tasty frozen treat into a pie shell and cover it in whipped cream and caramel. Yum.

The layout of the store reminds me of my local ice cream shop from growing up (except for the numbered tickets) - classic ice cream shop where you can look into the giant buckets of ice cream.

As expected lines can be very long...surprisingly, sometimes even on cold days.
author: Wendy L.

description:
As cool as a lot of the flavors sound, most were way too sweet and artificial tasting! I have NO idea why there is a crazy wait here. The only flavor that was decent was Mexican chocolate.

Texture-wise on the richer, creamier side, almost like Three Twins. But they just aren't up to the hype on their flavors.

* Mexican chocolate - a slight cinnamon kick makes this pretty unique. However, it was SO subtle that I couldn't taste it anymore after the first bite.

* Purple yam, Black walnut, White pistachio, Coconut Pineapple - ALL were way too sweet and did not taste authentic at all.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I've never had anything as delicious as the Mango ice cream before! I crave it all the time and look forward to getting some the next time I'm in San Fran! 
Although the lines are always long, they always move super fast.
author: Deia S.

description:
To be quite frank, I just wasn't impressed...

My friend and I came to Mitchell's on a Sunday evening and there was a humongous crowd outside. With the huge crowds, you can imagine how terrible parking was; especially when it was limited to street parking and a tiny one-way parking lot with less than ten spots. Huge drag!

Once we found parking, we walked towards the store and it did not take much time for us to realize that people were holding numbered tickets. We slithered our way through the crowd and towards the door. The "Take A Number" dispenser was immediately to the left as we walked in. As we grabbed 175, we heard 132 being called over the intercom and I thought, wow...FML!

There were a lot of employees working and so customers were being serviced as quickly as possible. I personally thought that a line outside would have been less hectic than the number system, because everyone was waiting everywhere. There were people standing inside, shoulder-to-shoulder, and as people's numbers were called, they'd try to push through the crowd. Our wait was a little over 35 minutes.

I went with two scoops of their ube ice cream on a sugar cone (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mitchells-ice-cream-san-francisco?select=dlHQE_3RlGo2NzFPANVhzg#dlHQE_3RlGo2NzFPANVhzg) and my friend went with a scoop of coconut pineapple and a scoop of avocado on a regular cone (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mitchells-ice-cream-san-francisco?select=Kf5o367G3_zJRgQ_HKR0aw#PmE5ty6Saea-u7fE3UFEgA). I really liked that they had tropical flavors, including the popular Filipino dessert, halo-halo; however, my ube was not very fresh. It had that "old" ice cream taste--as though it had been refrigerated for quite some time. The consistency was also very heavy and dense. I had a few bites (or licks) of my friends avocado and coconut pineapple and those flavors were much more pleasant. I've never had avocado ice cream before and it was surprisingly very rich, buttery, and good. 

Mitchell's is one of those places that I can say that I've tried, but I genuinely would not come back. Other than their tropical flavors, I don't feel like they have anything else to offer. The wait is surely not worth it either.
author: Lien T.

description: Awww Mitchell's.  My high school club volleyball coach is Filipino American and used to take me here all the time after practice.  The wait has gotten a bit over-the-top, but if you're willing to wait, then you are in for one heck of a scoop (or two) of ice cream.  I've always gotten the Buko and Macapuno, so I can't comment on anything else (why are the coconut flavors so bomb here??), but I've always left with that pleasant contentedness that follows a visit to an old school, homey ice cream shop, cone in hand, ice cream melting all over the place.  This is definitely an old neighborhood favorite.
author: Tracey L.

description: I love the ice creams here!  Stopped by during a visit to S.F. with my hubbie.  We got the Oreo and Ube.  Both were deliciously smooth and not overly sweet.  I prefer it over bite-rite since it's less sweet and the prices are very reasonable too.  Can't wait to go back to try the other unique flavors the next time we are in S.F!
author: Evelyn C.

description:
Over-rated! The hype did not live up this time!! Mitchell's was on my yelp-marked for years. Most likely, I won't go out of my way to get Mitchell's, but if I am in the area, why not?  

I really wanted to try the grasshopper, but when we arrived around 3pm on Sunday, they sold out!

I tried the following:

1) Halo halo: 3/5 eh, not that great
2) Ube: 3/5 NOTHING too special--you can get Ube at Asian grocery stores and it will taste the same
3) Mango: 3.5/5: delish!
4) Black walnut: 3.5/5: yum! 
5) Vanilla custard: 4/5: wow..the vanilla was extra fragrant and flavorful
author: Jen H.

description:
I'm really happy this place exists. Two ice creams, one topping, and a bag of Pepperidge Farm cookies only set me back $10.69 - this is miraculous in the city, right? 

I like the wide variety of flavors, including a lot of chocolate features, as well as the lovely Filipino-centric flavors, like sweet bean, coconut, tropical fruits. They make ice cream cakes and they're beautiful. 

The private parking lot is a really nice feature.
author: Austin J. A.

description:
If you've never had Mitchell's, you've never lived! Where else in the city do you see a crowd of people waiting for ice cream whether it's hot, cold, rainy or foggy?

This is my family's favorite ice cream spot. My dad would take us here when we were little and I've never stopped coming here since then. I love everything from their sundaes to their cones. Nothing beats good ol' fashioned Mitchell's ice cream! 

What sets this place apart from other ice cream parlors are the tropical and Filipino flavors that they have such as Ube and Halo-Halo. They even have Peruvian lucuma! I mean c'mon!

My personal favorites are: Tropical 4, Mango, Avocado, Pistachio, Strawberry, Ube, Pineapple, and Rocky Road of course.

It's great that they sell half gallons of Mitchell's at places like Pacific Super, but nothing's better than coming here to get a lot more variety. You won't be disappointed! Just take a number and you'll satisfy your ice cream craving in no time!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I wish Mitchell's is closer to home!

I love Mitchell's! The employees are all nice and will not hesitate to let you sample their flavors before purchase!

They have plenty of flavors to choose from, so there's something that'll catch your taste! I also noticed they have many Filipino flavored ice cream offerings like ube, macapuno, young coconut (buko), and etc. They even have halo-halo here! I ended up getting their young coconut flavored ice cream which was REALLY good! I also sampled their tropical flavor before purchase and it was good also!

I can't wait to return and try other flavors here! 

You will not be disappointed!

5/5 RECOMMENDED
author: Glenn L.

description: Love the light, mildly sweet, milky ice cream here. NY cherry is to die for, literally. I actually dream of rolling around naked in it, that's how alluringly good it is. It reminds me of brite rite roasted banana ice cream. Lines are long and people take forever to order and pay. Please review their flavors before your number is called on.  It will really help the speediness to get to your heavenly dessert and get away from the drooling subsequent patrons breathing heavily down your neck!
author: Ella H.

description:
First thing's first, parking sucks here. Best advice, go with someone, have them drop you off so you can grab a number, while they find street parking somewhere nearby. Just to give you an idea of what the wait is, for example, I grabbed number 11, they were only on 4.

But... They have multiple servers so the numbers go by at a reasonable pace AND, the ice cream is soooo good here it makes the wait worth it!

My two favorite flavors...

Mexican Chocolate:
Now, not being a big fan of chocolate (womp, womp hate me later) I still would get this time and time again. It's Chocolate with cinnamon, not too rich so it's purrrfect.

Pistachio:
Actually has Pistachio nuts in it.
author: Sammie T.

description:
Three simple steps:
1. Grab a number and wait
2. Order Ube and Mango in a waffle cone
3. Take home a bucket of ice cream
author: Linda L.

description:
"Have any of you ever heard that when you eat ice cream on a cold day it actually warms your body?" That's actually the line my boyfriend fed me as we walked to one of the benches right outside Mitchell's Ice Cream shop with our double scoops in hand. My boyfriend and I decided we needed something sweet to clean our palate after some salty hot pot earlier that evening and found Mitchell's on yelp. With the many and very helpful reviews we didn't even think twice on whether or not we should try it out. As we were driving I didn't even need google maps to tell us we had arrived to our destination. Even on a Tuesday night there was people huddled all around a building across the street from residential homes. As we turned the corner we noticed a sign notifying Mitchell's Ice Cream shop customers of backside parking and luckily found one empty spot! Experiencing a multitude of good vibes so far, we quickly made our way to the entrance. Thanks to helpful tips and reviews we learned to first make our stop to the ticket machine to grab a number. My boyfriend kindly asked the couple in front of us whether or not they grabbed a ticket as well. Best to spread the yelp tips that were spread to me right?!? 

Once we were able to squeeze in the shop, we quickly laid eyes upon the menu. I didn't know exactly what I wanted so by the time our number was called (which an employee does via microphone so customers can definitely hear) I asked for two samples. I finally decided on a double scoop of ube (purple yam) and kahlua mocha cream on a waffle cone. My boyfriend went with a double scoop of chocolate caramel crackle and butterscotch marble. All flavors were rightfully named as they mimicked perfectly their original product flavors. Loved all four flavors and can't wait to try the others in the future! Like I mentioned at the beginning of this post, we ate our ice cream on a bench outside the shop, theres a total of two. On the window next to us, the store's quality inspection dates/scores for this year and the previous year were visible for the public, which I thought was very cool to see. Last year Mitchell's received a score of 96, and this year that score bumped to whopping 100%. This comes to show that the business cares about taste, quality, AND cleanliness, definitely a plus for me. Also on the window was a sign with a couple facts regarding local businesses. It was actually very very intriguing because i learned alot just by eating at an ice cream shop. 

Located inside the store is also three different freezers: two freezers have pre-scooped tubs of the different flavors available for purchase and one freezer has cakes available with a sign of the breakdown costs. Besides icecream, customers are also offered different other snacks to purchase.

Anyway bottom line, the reviews and ratings do not like for this place. Inside there even is a shadowbox of numerous awards this local ice cream shop has received over the years. Mitchell's Ice Cream just added 2 more loyal customers. Definitely will be returning!
author: Charlene B.

description:
I would stand in line forever for Mitchell's, and this girl does NOT stand in lines... haha. Super amazing, and always crowded. Once you arrive you walk up to the counter and grab a number and wait your turn, unless you want something that's prepackaged, then you can just grab it and pay at the register on the side. The slap a "paid" sticker on your item and you can leave. 

I have yet to try a flavor at Mitchell's that wasn't amazing. My favorite is Ube, Mango, and Buko (young coconut). Whenever you ask them to hand pack something they spend lots of time packing and packing more and more ice cream in the container, you will always get your money's worth! 

If you decide to get a cone, remember you can even get the cone chocolate dipped!!! And for all you people out there that love peanut butter but hate chocolate, they have a peanut butter ice cream without chocolate! I love chocolate and can never understand that, but I do have a few friends that fall into that category. 

Again again again!!!
author: Mindy T.

description: If you like mint chocolate chip like my friends do, opt for the Grasshopper Pie in a waffle cone. It's taking mint chocolate chip to a whole new level.
author: Jeff M.

description: Boku aka young coconut is the closet thing to Roselani Haupia or Daves from Oahu! Great flavors.
author: Scott R.

description:
Born and raised in the City since 1986. Been going to this place since I was a kid and hands down the best ice cream ever! I usually get my gallon and walk over to the pre-packed pay line which is wayyyyyyyyyyyyy quicker. It is always packed but a must in the City.  

Parking is always tough...unless you know the trick :)
author: Justin W.

description:
Bring back your earl grey and lemon cookie! 

Ube and halo halo is amazing! they're always really nice, but you have to come in atleast 5-10 before they close or else the door will be locked on you! 

luckily for me i'm staying down the st from them in noe valley, so i can come here as much as a i want haha. so please bring back the above flavors!
author: Vi Vi V.

description:
This is hands down my favorite ice cream place in the city (for ice cream, not for frozen yogurt though!). Their Oreo cookie ice cream is really tasty and you can buy them by the talon for $10.35 (2015) which is a pretty good deal when you know that they will charge you almost $8 for two scoops. 
Be aware that this place always has a line and you might have to wait 30 minutes in a busy day to get you ice cream fix... Unless you decide to buy one of their Ice cream to go!
author: Cedric L.

description: It's ok. Had better ice cream elsewhere. I know it's ice cream but the butter pecan was extremely sweet. The Oreo didn't really taste like Oreo and didn't have much chunks in it. Had the strawberry before. Quite standard. Not worth the wait when it's spilling out the door.
author: Julie L.

description:
There's nothing here I can say that hasn't already been said.

But I'm gonna say it anyway.

Delicious.  Ordering system by number is genius--I wish more busy places with counter order would do this instead of just a long-ass line.

Get the Thai Tea.
author: Shannon H.

description: I am a die-hard Mitchells fan ever since I was a kid and had my first scoop of their Ube iced cream. I've traveled across many a bridge to make sure that I could get myself some of their tasty original flavors that I've not had replicated anywhere else. Not only that they are still in the same location that they've been in for the past 50+ years it feels like. I still trek across the bridges and make my way over here for a special treat when the occasion calls for it. I can only hope that my youngin's will do the same for theirs when (or if) they get the chance to do it.
author: Kira G.

description: This was hands down the best ice cream I have ever had. Exceeded my expectations. Worth the wait, in fact the wait feels like part of the experience. A rare Jem in this day in age.
author: Julia M.

description:
Tried Mitchell's ice cream for the first time this past Friday night. Before you try to run up to the register and make an order for ice cream, grab a number which is located inside the shop by the door.

I sampled the Ube, Dulce le leche, and mojito but ultimately went with the dulce in a regular cone.

Ube is purple yam for those that don't know and it's actually not bad, it tastes just like the purple yams I like. Mojito was a bit sour or tart rather. Next time I come I think I'll try the grasshopper pie.

Service was okay, mostly quiet and not even a slight smile.
author: Mabel Y.

description: What can I say?  As a native San Franciscan, this place is as good as it gets.  Locally made, excellent service, delicious ice cream!
author: Alacrity I.

description:
I only have 3 things to say about Mitchell's.

#1 Best ice cream in San Francisco.

#2 Get the Lucuma

#3 It's worth the wait in line, or even outside in the cold. Sounds crazy, but it's really that good.
author: Black Frankenstien ..

description:
Bottom line at the top: overrated! This is just gummy ice cream with unique flavors. Skip.
--
Mitchell's was a letdown for me but a hit with the friends. Grab a number, sample a couple of things, CASH ONLY and walk around the neighborhood. 

In terms of classic SF ice cream spots I'd definitely pick smitten or Humphry Slocombe over this.
author: Dahlia S.

description: Long lines = great product. Grab a number and prepare to hang out. Great flavors will make the choice very difficult for you and your friends. This place is worth the wait any time of year.
author: Betsy B.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream and all its flavors are definitely worth the wait. Go inside and make sure you grab a number! Don't just stand there!

Once your number has been called, you can ask to try some flavors. They have sooo many flavors from more tropical ones: coconut, young coconut, ube, etc or more traditional ones like chocolate. They also have other kinds like mexican chocolate, grasshopper. All are very yummy!
author: Carmen C.

description:
- Horrible, horrible customer service with rude, arrogant, obnoxious staff who can't even be bothered to spend 30 seconds to give your sick friend a cup of tap water so she can feel better

- Insane crowds to bring out the claustrophobe in everyone and a take-a-number policy that is utterly useless as you could stand there for hours and still never get noticed, while assholes stroll in from the street and get served right away because they don't bother to follow the rules

- Boring, ordinary flavors you could find at Baskin Robbins

- Boring, ordinary textures you could find at Baskin Robbins

- Out-of-the-way location that is difficult to get to unless you live in the Mission or Bernal Heights
author: Josephine L.

description:
This place may have been in SF since 53, but as an 80 year old, born in SF in 1936, have been to better run places. Ice cream is good and expensive. Nice Philipine flavors. Magnolia brand is tastier and less expensive. 
Went there last night with 5 people visiting from overseas, my son, and daughter. It was crowded and it would have been nice if the owner actually cared about his customer somewhat more than making a huge profit. To start with there should have been a sign above the door telling us you had to take a number. Parking is inadequate. Since the store is small, we all froze standing outside. Most stores offer the customers a taste before buying. Not here. Help was inadequate and it took forever in the windy evening. Not the helps fault. Obviously owner does not want to hire a few more people at minimum wage.
I will leave my name and phone number on this complaint, bet the owner does not call me.
Clifford R. Den Otter, 805-835-9811
author: Clifford D.

description:
There are 3 or 4 awesome places in SF to get ice cream, and people debate the pros and cons of each.....My fave, hands down, is Mitchell's!  The exotic flavors, and traditional favorites make this place a must visit when I hit SF! (with an insulated bag to bring some home)
If you haven't tried it, get on out and have a scoop!
author: Jim P.

description:
The longest line I had ever waited in for ice cream. If you can, drop off your partner at the curb and have them run in to grab a ticket. it's located on the left side as you enter the door. 

There's a small one way parking lot right behind the shop if you're lucky you'll pull in as someone is leaving.

All the servers are very friendly and are willing to give you as many samples as you need to find the perfect flavor for you. They may even give you suggested flavors based on the ones you're trying. I'm not a fan of the exotic flavors because I tend to get tired of eating it after a few bites. I tend to lean towards the creamier types of flavors.
author: Michael S.

description:
Love their ice cream... We got an ice cream cake, and multiple scoops of ice cream. They were busy but the line moved fast. It is always crazy busy but it's worth it. 

I love the thin mint ice cream and the toasted almond ice cream!
author: Tasha S.

description: Yumm!! Their Mango ice cream is soo awesome!!! I
author: Anum F.

description:
So having grown up in San Francisco, people look at me like I'm insane when I tell them I have never been here. Well, that changed some months ago when I stopped by during my errand runs in the city. I was pleasantly surprised when I got into their empty parking lot and happened to enter during the slow hour.

I guess you're supposed to grab a ticket and wait for your number to be called like the DMV, but since it was slow, they took my order right away. It was nice that they were able to mix flavors when I ordered a pint of ice cream. I ended up getting the Espesso coffee crunch and the Ube flavors per recommendation by one of the workers. The staffing was really friendly and helpful in coming up with a decision since I'm one of the most indecisive people out there.

Any who, just before I left, the parking lot filled up fast and people were double parking everywhere so I guess it was just my luck that I got here during the down time. When I finally got a chance to try it, I must say, this place really lives up to it's hype! 

The consistency? PERFECT. 
Flavors? Absolutely astonishing.

It really was some of the best ice cream I've ever tried and wouldn't hesitate to stop by again when I have some free time!
author: Ced C.

description: Amazing!!! We are visiting from L.A and our family treated us to a mango sundae! DeLICIOuS.. now I'm sad that I have to drive 5 hours to have another one.  I had a scoop of vanilla and one of mango with  mangos and whipped cream
author: Ambar D.

description:
So many flavors!!

Never been here and it was lil around 9ish and it was packed...surprising!
They have so many interesting flavors!  Some originals but some interesting mix

Price is a little high for ice cream but its well worth it.  You can try different samples
I tried the avocado and i loved it!  It's very creamy and its doesnt get runny as quickly!
Soft but yet has a nice bite!!

Definitely coming back!
author: Laurie W.

description: One of my all-time favorite old school spots! The ice cream is delicious, but the best part is the experience of taking a ticket and waiting in line with the classic SF crowd.  Mexican Chocolate (cinnamon) and egg nog are some of my faves!
author: Alison Finnegan E.

description: I love this place but there is always long line. The ice cream cake is great. Mango cake is quite well .
author: Sam G.

description:
It's a tiny store: grab a number and hover within hearing distance of the door. The servers work quick though, so we only waited for 5-10 minutes. 

I tasted the Thai Iced Tea: it was very creamy and milky. The tea flavor wasn't as strong and it didn't have that condensed milk-type creamy I was looking for. Tasted the young coconut and if you like light, coconut flavors this is a star. My tiny little spoonful for tasting had a big chunk of tender young coconut. It's so light, I wouldn't recommend getting a stronger flavor with it; it would be easily overwhelmed. 

I ended up with the spring flavors: choco raspberry and irish coffee. THEY ROCKED MY SOCKS OFF OK. Have any of you ever been lucky enough to have Godiva's dark chocolate raspberry ice cream before they discontinued it? Mitchell's choco raspberry is BETTER. With every lick and bite, you're just blasted with raspberry, it's not that sour, artificial crap you get in the grocery store. There's bit of seed and so much syrup my scoop was dripping even though the ice cream wasn't melting. They use their year-round chocolate, so this flavor is like a two-for-one special. 

The Irish Coffee is so creamy, it's like a latte with a solid cup of cream, but then they add the "Irish" and it's this sweet, almost tangy flavor that just defies words. But I can't recommend it enough. If you like coffee with cream, you mustmust try this flavor. 

I paid about $6 for two scoops, but these are huge scoops; none of those lame half-domes--the servers pack you perfect spheres. Worth every penny. Oh, and their freshly made waffle cones! They have that soft crunch that only fresh ones have. Worth the 50 cents. 

Go, go get them before spring is over. I'm so tempted to pack a cooler with ice so I can store a couple quarts at home.
author: Josephine T.

description:
HOW TO SKIP THE LINE
=================
I thought I'd share this since I personally witness this last Sunday around 3:45PM. The place was completely packed. My group went in and grabbed a number, 99, while they call 60 something. 
An blond Asian lady wearing a black top, lacy in the back walked in and picked up a half a gallon ice cream for $10.50 and headed to the pre-packed express line. While paying I noticed she also placed an order for 2 scoops in a cup and a double scoop on a cone.  
While my group is waiting for our turn to order our scoops, I actually wanted to buy pre-packed ice cream for later. Had I've known this trick, it would have easily saved us at least 20 mins.  Nobody blinked at this maneuver, so I thought I'd ask the counter. 
They told me that they allow you to buy a scoop per half a gallon. I pointed out that the lady in front of me bought at least 4 scoops to one half gallon.  They said that it should have not been allowed but I think it depends on how cute you are. ;-)
They have wonderful ice cream as always. I'm knocking down 2 stars because of the in justice to the majority as they allow people to jump the line. 
Nevertheless, they do allow, one scoop per half gallon in the express line, no waiting required. 
Hope this help.
author: Maria G.

description:
Super yummy ice cream.  I like their numbering system although it can take a while. We all got different flavors and they were all delicious. 
I got a junior scoop of dark chocolate raspberry and toasted almond in a waffle bowl 
It was so delicious! I like that the flavors weren't super sweet and I was able to enjoy and distinguish both flavors. 
My friends enjoyed the purivian fruit, peach and vanilla custard. All good. 
Come here if you don't want to stand in the long line at Bi-Rite. Easier parking as well.
author: Lanny N.

description:
A SF Must. It's been around forever and every time I am guaranteed an ice cream served with a smile. Even in the winter, there is a wait. They always let you sample flavors and wait patiently while you make your choice. 

Each bite is worth the creamy calories and you won't regret it.
author: Eve C.

description: Of course Murphy's Law would have it and we happen to come by on National Ice Cream Day.  It would've been great to get scoops on the cheap but the massive line of what seemed like 100 people waiting meant we just grabbed a 1/2 gallon of the seasonal fresh cantaloupe ice cream to go once it took us 15 min to squeeze through and then find out the one we wanted was at the other side of the store.  Not sure if we got a discount for National Ice Cream Day or not but it came out to under $10 which is a great price!!  If you can get it or have time, it is worth the wait!!
author: Joyce Z.

description: This place is super popular. It sucks to find parking at times. You might get lucky at their tiny little parking lot in the back. This place is a go to. They are always fast, nice, and welcoming. There's always a line and is packed at night as well. My favorite is the grasshopper pie. It's like a minty version of cookies and cream. So delicious! I can't really find this flavor anywhere else. 5 stars!
author: Josie W.

description: Mitchell's fun flavors, rich and creamy textured ice cream, and friendly staff is guaranteed to please. You're going to become close friends with your dentist.
author: Monte H.

description:
Usually I never write reviews. I'm not usually that person. But after this experience I felt obliged. Not only were the employees so rude but their number system is bogus. Regardless of my attempts to be seen and be served they passed me over. 

I managed to get one mans attention at one time and he sneered at me. I was trying to get his attention because someone before me  was trying to tell him the guy got his order wrong. So then he got mad that he had to remake the order because he wasn't paying attention.

But beyond their service, I was completely grossed out. If they got an order wrong they just dumped the ice cream back in! What about allergies etc? Completely disgusting, bad device and an overall horrible experience. There are tons of other ice cream places in the city. I suggest avoiding this place.
author: Stormie P.

description:
Everyone loves Mitchell's ice cream.  Yesterday when I checked in on yelp, I received four messages of my friend's favorite flavors and how they have been going there for years. 

In one of his songs,  the R&B artist Robin Thicke asked in the first line of the first verse: 

"Why do people smile when no one's smiling?"

Hey Robin, It's cause their thinking of Mitchell's ice cream.

People love their funky fresh flavors, from Pineapple Coconut to Ube.  I'm a classic man myself, I like the silky smooth strawberry.  Mitchell's is smooth and delicious.  How does Mitchell's ice cream charge over $9 for a half gallon and people wait in lines that remind me of Disneyland?  It's because it's that good.  

So Mr. Thicke, I hate to tell you, but  here in the Bay Area, here in San Francisco, at Mitchell's ice cream.  "I got the sweetest love, there ain't nothing sweeter".
author: Michael L.

description:
I love Mitchell's because their ice cream is super creamy! That's what other ice cream places don't have... That creamy smooth texture. I always get Mexican chocolate and i was never disappointed. Husband always buko and loves it every time as well! 

I've tried bi-rite and it's yummy but it lacks something and I get very annoyed with stupid arrogant hipsters... Mitchell's feels more home like and more old school San Francisco.

The wait can be long but it is soooo worth it! I have friends who don't have patience for this kind of waiting but it's their loss! My number 1 spot for ice cream!
author: Reese E.

description:
I love Mitchell's! It is a great place to get ice cram in the city. I love coming here for all of their tropical flavors like mango, avocado, halo halo, and ube (yay for Filipino flavors!). You can't get tropical flavors as good as Mitchell's anywhere else in the city. If you have space in your freezer, it's better if you come in and buy the half gallon tubs than wait in line for a couple of scoops. There is almost always a line regardless of how cold it is outside.

The only thing for me is that the ice cream is very airy, so it melts pretty fast. I like my ice cream to be a little more dense, but I'm okay with it because the tropical flavors are great.
author: Breniel L.

description: Great egg free ice-cream. In fact one of the best ice-creams period!
author: Manoj Y.

description:
Mitchell's is definitely a childhood thing that remind me of home every time I come here. Living in Texas for 8 years, there's nothing like Mitchell's that tastes remotely close. Every flavor is DELICIOUS. They're all creamy and really good quality. However, my top fave is the macapuno. It has real coconut shavings and it's creamy (like I said). 

The only con is the long lines and the parking.
author: Shannen C.

description: I love this place I only come here for the Lucuma ice cream or sundae. So recommend! Their ice cream is super creamy!
author: Gina B.

description: Pretty Bomb if you are willing to wait.  You go up and grab a number, similar to waiting in the line at the deli.  My favorite is Mexican chocolate and Horchata.  Yummy!  The prices are pretty steep, but the ingredients are fresh and high end.  Overall, a great stop for dessert.
author: Jessica H.

description:
I don't really understand why people wait 50 minutes for ice cream-- something I did very recently on a Sunday night. If the ice cream is mind-blowingly good, like the line seem to suggest, then alright I will wait (I've waited 2 hours for Mama's brunch before, I can wait). But the fact of the matter is, the ice cream is very mediocre. And it's not even cheap, which is the only other reason it may be considered reasonable to spend your time waiting for.

Do me a favor and just skip this place, trust me, an hour later in the cold and after you get your ice cream and you're underwhelmed, don't say I didn't tell you so. 

Sure, I heard this place has been open for 50+ years, which is great, but it still doesn't justify the wait.

(Also, the servers skip numbers and they're unapologetic about it, I don't care how long this store has been open for but that's just annoying-- one minute the number is at 67 and the next it's at 75. If you've waited so long and you stop glancing at the number display religiously like I did, then you'd be upset too when they're serving a family of 10 whose number is after you just because you stopped paying attention for a minute).
author: Jessica Y.

description:
Quaint and unassuming from the outside, you may only know you've found Mitchell's by the line down the side walk. Worth the wait, Mitchell's boasts some of the richest, creamiest ice cream I have ever tasted!
How they maintain order, is you grab a number and when your number is called, you may walk up to the counter and taste as many flavors as you like. They were very friendly and accommodating, especially since we were buying 2 gallons of ice cream and needed it packed with the dry ice we purchased ahead of time. FYI 20 lbs of dry ice kept the ice cream completely frozen for over 24 hours!
I ordered the plain chocolate, and my boyfriend ordered the peanut butter indulgence, a flavor we later bought a gallon of, if that tells you anything. One of the best attributes of Mitchell's are the scores of unique flavors! Avacado? Mango? Peppermint candy? To name a few. Aaaah! just read someone else's review and found out that Ube is actually Taro! Would have bought a car load of that flavor! At any rate, we ended up buying the peanut butter indulgence and the Grasshopper Pie. Ten bucks for a half gallon? Compared to LA, I call that a steal!
Even with so many fantastic places to eat in the city, this is a must! Totally worth the wait!
author: Rachel A.

description:
Ever since my trip to Irvine/LA last weekend, my boyfriend and I have been craving thai tea ice cream. We literally had the BEST sample of thai tea ice cream from Strickland's that we still dream about. So when I heard that Mitchell's had thai tea ice cream here from the reviews, we made sure to stop here before we left SF yesterday.

We arrived around 5pm and the place was pretty packed. Parking was such a pain in the ass here but we luckily found a spot really quick in their miniature parking lot (HAZAH!) 

Their system of taking peoples orders was like Marianne's ice cream where you grab a ticket and wait for your number to be called. While waiting for my number to be called, I browsed around the tightly packed place looking at the tubs of ice cream that they sell individually there along with the flavors I wanted to try.

Finally they called number 29! I stepped up and asked to try the ube (purple yam) and tropical 4(mango, guava, banana and pineapple fruit) which I loved instantly! I decided to get a double scoop in a waffle cone since I'm such a fatty with a big sweettoof D; The consistency of the ice cream was extremely creamy! The flavors of the ice cream stood out but at the same time wasn't too overpowering. The best part was that the ice cream wasn't overly sweet like I would have at Marianne's in Santa Cruz.

Though I was bummed that they didn't have thai tea flavor at the time, I was still satisfied with what I got because it was such a nice day in SF!

Hopefully I'll come back and they'll have the ice cream flavor of my dreams available :B

PS: the ice cream melts extremely fast so learn how to eat all of it quick!
author: Anna H.

description:
- Gluttony Expedition - 
Chocolate caramel crunch: I'm not a fan of chocolate but this ice cream wasn't bad! I like the occasional crunchiness. Good.

Spmoni: Very rich and creamy Spmoni ice cream I've ever tried. I'm not this fan.

Pear sorbe: Very subtle. Meh. 

Pink grapefruit sorbe: Not so sweet - tart yet good flavor. Good. 


- Conqueror's Deduction - 
If you liked rich, creamy & bold flavors with tons of varieties included exotic Asian flavors, you'll like here more than "Bi-Rite". "Bi-Rite" has very refined and sophisticated sweetness and flavors. I still prefer "Bi-Rite" to here for my personal preference, yet "Mitchell's" do offer good quality.
author: Akiko I.

description:
Warning: can get really crowded! 

Creamy ice cream and flavors you'd think you'd only see from Philippine brand Magnolia ice cream!  Ube and Halo Halo? My mom was in heaven from their selection of fruity flavors.

There's limited parking behind the shop and if you don't score one, you'll have to find one on the street.  

Next time we'll have to remember to pick up a packed half gallon to bring home!
author: Janina M.

description: So many great flavors! As a Filipina I loved and appreciate all of the tropical options so naturally I had a scoop of halo halo. It was spot on with chunks of palm jelly, coconut, and other sugary jems. Can't wait to come back and try some of the other flavors. Please open an east bay location!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Long time favorite for ice cream. Lots of unique flavors and use quality ingredients. Always in the mood for Mitchell when I'm in SF. 

Favorites are mango, cantaloupe, and grasshopper.
author: Felicia S.

description:
...What happened?  After having the pleasure of experiencing numerous mouthgasms at Humphrey Slocombe and Bi-Rite, Mitchell's fell flat on its face in the process of my completing SF's ice cream triumvirate.

I had a bad feeling after sampling the famed Ube.  Generic sugary sweetness with hardly any flavor of purple yam to be found.  Likewise, the Grasshopper and Mexican Chocolate tasted like store-bought ice cream at best.  Thankfully, Halo Halo and Tropical 4 saved the night to an extent with fresh fruit flavors.  I ultimately went with some Lucuma and would recommend it for its unique flavors of caramel and maple that I've never come across in any other fruit.

Glad that I was able to finally come here, but I wouldn't return.
author: Eric F.

description:
Yes! I will go back, for sure. Love it, I would recommend it 100%. It gets quite busy, but worth the wait. 
Always get 1 scoop and dipped in chocolate! YUM!
