author: Lydie A.

description: Great ice cream! Also the price really fair! I ate the chocolate peanut butter, oreo and banana , all of them were great!
author: Shiri S.

description:
Easily the greatest ice cream I've ever tasted... Utter amazeballs. In order of preference 
Oreo 10/10 my number 1 
Grasshopper pie 9/10
Rum and raisin 9/10 
Banana 8/10
Choc mocha 8/10 
Vanilla 8/10
author: Jack O.

description:
Review #700 

Way before the unique and funkdafied Humphrey Slocombe flavors like Secret Breakfast (cornflakes and bourbon) and Thai Chili Lime, and even wayyyy before BiRite's instant classic of Salted Caramel, there was Mitchell's ice cream. 

If you're a native San Franciscan, you already know about Mitchell's.
You know about the long lines, numbering system, you've already  designated a person to "jump" out of the car to grab a number while circling around the block looking for parking. Having been born at St Luke's down the block and being taken to Mitchell's as an after Dr./Dentist appoint treat by my mom, I learned these tricks of the trade at a young age. Mitchell's is as much San Francisco as the word "hella". http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/76smcUUGRvq3k1MVPUXbnA?select=9TrEDExFYmX7U5ZKRZVePQ

IMO, the best flavor at this SF food institution is their ube flavor. 

Mitchell's is THE ice creamery that put this creamy, purple-y, mildly sweet, a little earthy flavor sweet yam on the SF ice cream flavor map. It's because of Mitchell's that non-Filipinos know what ube, which is more of a Filipino dessert thing, is.

SF Cold summers, waiting for your number to be called in line, Mitchell's ube ice cream in a cone. Started doing it back in the 80's and still doing it today.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/76smcUUGRvq3k1MVPUXbnA?select=i723ppMVSkypDh_Af02Ppw
author: Earl G.

description:
Somewhere in there is a Filipino genius! I know it! With flavors like macapuno, übe, halo-halo, avocado, cantaloupe and mango? Here's a brief history of mitchell's ice cream..

http://m.sfgate.com//article/John-Jack-Mitchell-maker-of-ice-cream-2586728.php

The two Mr. Mitchell(s) had their finger on the community pulse since 1953. "It was especially popular with the influx of immigrants who had moved into the Mission," Larry Mitchell recalled. He was right! Those Filipinos (including myself) loved themselves some kick-ass ice cream. No wonder they imported fruits and ingredients that would remind the 2nd largest Asian  group in the US of home. Not only were the Mitchell brothers incredible at their craft but they were also smart business men!

They carry the straight forward flavors like chocolate, vanilla and such, however they also have the grasshopper pie and old school flavors.  Whether you're Filipino or part or by relations (winky wink) or none, you owe it to yourself to taste Bay area's own Mitchell's ice cream!
author: Michelle B.

description:
I would describe the ambiance as organized chaos. I like that they do numbers and are open late on a Sunday! They have a lot of flavors and not too many of the weird ones which I noticed is common at creameries in the city. They have a LOT of creative flavors that make sense. I really liked the pumpkin and the grasshopper pie! If you like mint and chocolate you HAVE to have the grasshopper pie!!! it is delicious!!

i also like that they have a phillipino twist and tropical flavors -- my mom had the "tropical four" which tasted like creamy juice!!! it was delicious.

I also like all the creative things you can do with the ice cream---cookie sandwiches, sundaes (With toppings like mango!) and milkshakes, floats, and much much more!

Overall this place is AWESOME!!! :) Great service, great ambiance, great ice cream.
author: Anila Y.

description:
Overrated. Came here because the Yelp reviews are fantastic and it's on a list of top eateries in SF. It's a pretty tiny place, but one of the few places that actually offers parking which I thought was wonderful :)

Anyways, I tried the mango and cheesecake flavors which were decent, but ended up buying a scoop of coffee. I like to rate my ice cream based upon the actual quality of the ice cream as opposed to the add ons. Ice cream itself was nothing bad, but nothing mindblowingly special. When I rate ice cream, though some of the crazy flavors can somethings persuade me to believe that the ice cream is phenomenal, it always comes down to how good their basic flavors are. 

Decently cheap though actually, so that was nice. But I dunno, I just don't see why this place is THAT special. There are a lot of good ice cream places throughout the Bay. 

tldr; don't make the pilgrimage just for this place, it's decent, but nothing mindblowing
author: Jasmine X.

description:
I've never been here without any line no matter the day or time.  

The mango is still my favorite.  So smooth and simply delicious.  

Parking is horrible but it is a norm in SF.
author: Dodo K.

description:
My ice cream was melty the second I got it and the wait was around 30 minutes. 

Maybe I needed to try one of the more crazy favors or specialties but wasn't impressed with any of the ice cream flavors we tried. 

Personally prefer it's it or buy rite over this.
author: A C.

description:
Mitchell's is an exciting place for ice cream if you're into tropical flavors. And when I say tropical, I mean actual, close-to-the-equator, tropical. Think: exotic fruit names (ever heard of lucuma?), international desserts (halo-halo), and not one but TWO different types of coconut!? For a tropical fruit lover like me, there were an overwhelming number of options. FYI, the lucuma resembled a mix between a sweet potato and maple syrup, though I felt like it might taste better paired with another flavor rather than on its own. I finally settled on the halo-halo, which numerous others have raved about: it's a pretty, pastel purple blend with a subtle sweetness from coconut, pineapple, and sweet beans. Keep in mind that the cones you get are those wafer ones, so if you want a sugar/waffle you have to pay 0.20 extra.

But perhaps the best part about my experience at Mitchell's was the excellent customer service we received. We arrived at a slow time of day, close to opening. Upon seeing how indecisive we were, one smiling employee graciously offered us sample after sample of flavors he thought might be up our alley! I know this kind of service is rare and way over and above what should be expected, but the mere fact that Mitchell's employs people like this makes my support for this business even greater. I'll for certain be back to tell if I can distinguish between those macapuno and buko coconuts!
author: Clarice W.

description:
Within every great city, there always tends to be that one famous ice cream shop that is known for it's amazing flavors and quality of cool confections. Mitchell's Ice Cream is that famous shop in San Francisco. 

Besides having heavenly tasting ice cream, Mitchell's is equally as famous for having a variety of weird flavors on their menu at all times. I was kind of a wimp and didn't get an exotic flavor... I know, I fail at life. I got a banana split with two scoops of chocolate, strawberries, hot fudge, and whipped cream. My favorite.

So how was it? Uh, I had already eaten mine outside on the bench by the time my friend had ordered and received hers.... which was around five minutes. Yeah, it was that good. I LOVE banana splits and this one was top notch all the way. If I could eat a banana split from Mitchell's everyday and not get fat, I would. 

Next time I get here I think I'll just have to bite the bullet and try the purple flavored ice cream.
author: Leslie D.

description: I'm obsessed with ice cream and SO glad I've found Mitchell's. Even though it's always busy, it still feels like it's a hidden gem. You hear people talk about other trendy ice cream shops but when it comes down to plain good homestyle ice cream, Mitchell's truly is #1 - at least in my book. My trick to beating the lines - buy a pre-packed half gallon and pay at the express counter. Wham, bam, thank you ma'am!  :)
author: Jamie S.

description:
"There's always room for dessert" 

After a full lunch, there is no better place to satisfy your craving for crazy good ice cream. Mitchell's Ice Cream is one of the best ice cream spots in the world, period! You might not kill for some, but you might do something pretty sinister =P 

On a serious note, this place is popular for the their Ube (purple yam) ice cream and it sure does deliver. Oh so rich, creamy and purple! Add to it my other favorite Grasshopper Pie and you thought you died and went to heaven. Forget vanilla when you can eat grasshopper and freakin' purple yam. 

I've gone as far as bringing a cooler full of ice to transport the prepacked tubs home, and indulge in the goodness in the privacy of home.

'My name is Mike and I am a closet Mitchell's Ice Cream addict'
author: Mike L.

description:
My family's FAVORITE ICE CREAM.  We've been coming here for years and we never leave disappointed.   The ice cream here is flavorful and ridiculously creamy and there's really no comparison.  They have a unique variety of flavors here, many of which you can't find anywhere else.  My personal favorites are Macapuno (young coconut ice cream with soft chunks of coconut throughout) and coffee which has a strong coffee flavor. The workers are efficient and friendly despite the huge crowds.  While there are sometimes long lines, for us, it's worth the wait.  However, don't let the big crowd fool you...many times the wait is quicker than you'd think.  And on occasion, if you get there early, you'll get lucky and there will be almost no line at all!  If you want a simple, no frills, creamy scoop of ice cream, Mitchell's is THE place to go.  While everyone continues to hype over Bi-Rite, and all those other places throughout the city, we continue to stay true to our favorite little spot.  
 
Tips: -DO NOT forget to grab a number, there isn't an organized line so make sure to grab a number and wait to be called 
-try a few flavors that you've never had before, they have so many unique flavors to choose from that you may not see anywhere else
-you can grab a tub from one of their freezers, but if it's your first time I'd recommend getting a scoop(or two)!  

PROS: -delicious ice cream! (no other reasons necessary) 

CONS: -parking can be difficult 
-long waits depending on the time of day
author: Papu T.

description:
This is THE ice cream shop in San Francisco!  The ice cream quality is top-notch with 40+ flavors, including several "island" flavors.  I'm more of a purist, and like my mint-chocolate chip, grasshopper, carmel pecan, etc., and they deliver in spades! 
The downside of a great ice cream spot is huge lines on a hot day, or even a relatively mild days in San Francisco...  
I've waited 90 minutes for my number to be called on mild summer nights.  My advice:pickup your favorite 1/2 gallon from the take-out freezer, go to the express take-out line, and smile at all the people waiting in line.
author: Andy S.

description:
Only in SF do you see crazy lines for ice cream at 10pm at night.

My friend took me here after craving something sweet! I was surprised on the craziness of this place. Especially after driving around the block for parking 10X. It gets pretty crazy in here! 

Pumpkin ice cream- Couldn't ask for punkin in any other way! sooo GOOOOODDD!! 

Grasshopper pie- at first I was like WTF....but once I took a bite from my friends cone..not bad, I dare you to try this one!
author: Kristina L.

description: I just came here two weeks for the first time after hearing good reviews from people I know. And I was not disappointed at all. The line was long and we had to park about 3 blocks away because their parking area is small but it was worth it. I had the Halo-Halo ice cream, which was really good. It tasted different from other Halo-Halo I've had. Also, tried their Avocado ice cream and  it was also good but I liked the Halo-Halo better. They also have ice cream cakes and shakes.  Will definitely come back.
author: Nacine B.

description: Delicious ube ice cream and Kahlúa mocha ice cream. Must try and when you're in the city stop by it's a great place to sweet your tooth.
author: Manuel L.

description: Love this ice cream spot - great selection of flavours and they even have prepackaged pints/quarts if you're in a hurry and don't want to wait in line! This place is really popular, especially on the weekends, but definitely worth checking out.
author: Katarina D.

description: Legit! Bi-rite and Smitten have nothing on this gem. The ice cream Sunday is packed and delicious.
author: Justin R.

description: I love this ice cream shop. Everything I visit SF this is my main stop.  There are so many kind of flavors that you will never find at any other ice cream shop.  Every flavors is so tasteful and makes your mouth filled with excitement. My favorite of all is the halo halo, I never knew what it was until I had it here. Really good and it's a must try.
author: Samantha T.

description:
I made it tradition that on every San Francisco trip, I would visit Bi-Rite ice cream, but on this particular visit, something else drew me here to Mitchell's. And after trying this for the first time I have to admit that this place is very comparable, if not better than Bi-Rite.

It was so good I even got 2 buckets that were already pre-made.

Here's a few more reasons why this place may be better than Bi-Rites...

there's a dedicated parking lot for customers.
the convenience of getting pre-made ice cream right there when you walk in.
the no lines when it is raining outside.

So I guess I have a new tradition when I'm up in SF. Also, credit cards are ok here, with a $9 minimum purchase.
author: Mike C.

description: I'm 41 yrs old and I've been coming here since I was born and raised in SF! mango is the best!
author: Teena H.

description: The ice cream here is absolutely excellent! I came to visit San Francisco a couple of weeks ago and cannot stop thinking about this place. The Ube ice cream is out of this world. I can't quite explain it but the cookies and cream ice cream is like nothing I've had before. I've never had cookies and cream ice cream that the Oreo cookies are still crunchy. My sister and I loved this place so much that we came second time before we left. This time I had scoop of Ube and Grasshopper Pie it was an absolute hit this time around again. I just want to plan a trip to San Francisco to make a stop at this place!
author: Oriana G.

description:
Grab a ticket and wait your number
for some delicious ice cream before you slumber!

Pineapple Coconut ice cream was delicious with mini chunks of pineapple inside the ice cream. I tried the avocado ice cream but was disappointed as it wasn't sweetened (don't expect it to taste like viet avocado smoothies).
author: Emily C.

description:
I've been here a handful of times, and each time there has always been a line out the door. My last experience here reminded me that it's not totally worth going out of your way to get some dessert here. 

But if you find yourself at Mitchell's, take note:
+ Go inside and grab a ticket at the entrance. This is how they manage their lines by calling out your number.
+ The Filipino side of me says that Mitchell's is best known for their Tropical flavors (ie. Ube (purple yam), halo-halo, buko (coconut), avocado). I enjoy these. But if they have Claire's Pie I'd get that too.
+ Plenty of ice cream selections and the quality is good - soft and creamy.
+ Takes card ($9 minimum)

What I couldn't help but notice the last time I came here was attitude. Sunday night around 8 - the line wasn't too long but I still felt like they were rushing everyone to get in and get out. Not as cheery as I'd picture but it didn't add well to the experience. I'd still prefer Bi-Rite & Miyako's ice cream and service over this place.
author: Loriel L.

description:
Ohhh lots of fun new flavors they have here! The drive is out of the way and it's freezing out here but well worth it. It gets pretty crowded and it's fun to sample all these unique flavors to finally decide on one that you really like. You grab a number here so they help you out from there. 

They had a grasshopper flavor, ube, young coconut and a bunch of other different ones. I had the halo halo. It was nice and dense. The texture was real nice. I really liked being able to taste ice cream flavors that you can't find in your supermarket or baskin robbins. Great place to try!

Recommedation : Halo halo
author: Andy N.

description:
It's 50 degrees outside at 10:30pm, and there's a line out the door. 

Everyone is dressed in their North Face or SuperDry jackets, huddling together to keep warm, and yet.... everyone wants ice cream? That should tell you something. 

While it seems hectic because of the crowd, Mitchell's is very organized. You grab a number and wait for them to call you. It will probably take a while, but at least in the meantime, you can narrow down the flavors that you would like to sample.

I ended up with the: White Pistachio & Kahlua Mocha Cream. They don't allow you two split a "small" scoop into two different flavors, so I got two "junior" scoops. 

Both of the flavors were creamy and delicious. I was satisfied with my choices and would definitely recommend it to anyone with a dessert craving.

What sets Mitchell's apart from other ice cream spots is that they offer "exotic" fruit flavored ice creams like ube, buko (coconut from the Philippines), halo halo, and lychee.
author: Jacqueline V.

description: I first tried Mitchell's when I was visiting SF for the first time. I have never forgotten how amazing the ube was. It was the taste of SF that never left my mouth. When I finally moved here 2 years ago after college, I came back to a nearly impossible but even better tasting halo halo. Mitchell's IS the standard for ice cream. It IS San Francisco. Truly amazing ice cream. As a designated tour guide for many groups of friends who visit SF, I always take friends here knowing that they will leave SF remembering that orgasmic experience they had at Mitchell's.  Consistently good, always improving, and local as you can go.
author: Vy T.

description: There is usually a line out the door but it goes by quickly and definitely worth the wait! Pistachio is my favorite but all the flavors are delicious!
author: Paulette M.

description: Love this ice cream shop, been going since I was a kid. Highest butter fat content, but it's all worth it
author: Destiny T.

description:
I have been wanting to go to Mitchell's for such a long time! I would have given a 3.5 rating, but since I can't do halves, I am going with the benefit of the doubt and giving Mjtchell's a 4. 

Pros: Accepts credit card, sample spoons, generous scoops
Cons: $9 minimum credit card charge, slightly slow service, a bunch of add on prices if you want sugar or waffle cones, and if you want your cone dipped, toppings, etc.
 
Made my way over with my friend on NYE 2014 nonetheless and there was barely any line when we arrived around 1 pm in the afternoon. My friend and I took some time upon walking in to just inspect the many flavors that were offered. I picked up a number, #82, when they were just serving #79, so I thought the wait wouldn't be so bad. As I continued looking around, I saw the plentiful half gallon tubs of ice cream in their freezers, the wall of packaged ice cream cones, and the many sweet toppings for sale in the store and was instantly overwhelmed. I just stuck to deciding on which flavor I was going to sample and eventually buy. 

The numbers went by a little slow....especially since it looked like there was only one ice cream scooper at the front. Thankfully, another scooper came out, and right when our number was up. I tried: Grasshopper Pie, Ube, and New York Cherry. Frankly, I only would consider the NY Cherry and maybe the Grasshopper pie but definitely not the Ube. The Ube was totally tasteless in my opinion and the NY Cherry was good but very sweet. Despite this, I just got a scoop of Pistachio and Toasted almond. The flavors were okay, nothing to make me crave more. 

For $5.20, you get two scoops and it's not a bad deal considering how big the scoops that were given. I would definitely go back if Green Tea is involved~ but until then, I can get cheaper, tastier, unhealthy, but more convenient ice cream somewhere else. 


B/B+
author: Alex T.

description:
Just stumbled upon this place by luck. Seems like the type of place to always have a line. BUT there are plenty enough people staffed and line moves quickly.

 ICE CREAM was delicious, I can almost describe it as fluffy. I recommend the mango! Plenty of flavors plus shakes, sundaes, and more! Would come back and recommend to others!
author: Mo E.

description:
Excellent ice cream, great flavors, hard working and great staff. All around one of my favorite SF places!

Honestly, if you hate Mitchell's, you're probably not a real SFer and a total asshole as well. Seriously.
author: Michael D.

description:
So Mitchell's is definitley a must when you're in the SF area.  The entrance is always crowded, but don't fret much because they make you take a number.   The wait isn't long and if you're with good people, you won't really notice it.  If you're there to pick up a gallon or a pint just walk right in, get your favorite flavor, and bring it to the cashier.

They have so many flavors to choose from.  It ranges from Halo Halo to good ol' fashioned chocolate.  They give you huge scoops, so you're getting your money's worth.
author: Amanda N.

description:
It's Ice Cream! 
I wouldn't go out of my way for this ice cream.  Don't get me wrong...it's good! But, It's not worth craving for.  I had the mint with chocolate chips and caramel.  It has it's own name but I forget what it is.  It's  a small shop. No chairs or tables to sit in but they do put two benches in the front, outside, of the store.  
I do like that it's not located in a touristy/busy area of town.
It's always busy in there so you have to grab a number.  The service is quick - thanks to the number machine!!!  
I would come back if I was in the area.
author: Marie T.

description:
This review's been long over due for sure. First time I came here was probably about 2 years ago, and I got two scoops- one of ube and the other kahlua mocha. Man oh man, since that first visit.. That kahlua mocha got me hooked, it's almost mandatory to buy a half gallon of it to take home! I haven't encouraged myself enough to get out of my comfort zone and explore my other options though, maybe my next visit I'll try something different.

As far as the wait goes...
The line's always long regardless of what day you go, at least every single time I've went, and I've gone during random days at random times. However, the staff members do try their best to tend to each customer's order as quickly as possible, so it isn't like you'll be waiting forever. I think the longest I've waited for my number to be called was 20 minutes.

Despite the fact that I live half an hour out, I'm always down for a drive out to Mitchell's! So worth it (:
author: Rae M.

description:
I've never seen so many flavors! Halo-halo was great, as was the lucuma (peruvian fruit that makes for a ochre orange ice cream), but I ultimately opted for the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with chocolate chunks and fudge). 

Nice big scoops and there's even some seating outside.

The number system is efficient and I'll be back for ice cream cake!
author: Kevin L.

description:
Not to be confused with the Mitchell Brothers strip club, Mitchell's Ice Cream is the "other famous Mitchell" in San Francisco. Mitchell's ice cream offers "mounds" of ice cream with "sensuous" flavors. Whet your tongue with the standard flavors, or take an escape on the wild side by tasting the delectable "seasonal flavors".  My favorite flavor is "Buko" a Philippine flavor, not to be confused with the Japanese word "Bukaki"

Make sure to try the "Ube Macapuno", another Philippine flavor that offers purple yam with sweet meaty coconut. Get your mind out of the gutter, it's not the same word as "punany" Okay, I'm having too much fun with the Mitchell Brothers and Mitchell's Ice Cream.  

If you don't want to stand in line a Bi-Rite only to pay an arm and a leg, come to Mitchell's, and you'll definitely leave with a happier ending!
author: E. K.

description:
I went here for some late night ice cream. They have a lot of flavors of ice cream to choose from. I got the Ube and thin mint ice cream on a sugar cone. The ice cream is nice and creamy and has very good flavor. The Ube flavor was not overpowering. The thin mint was cool and minty with nice chunks of chocolate in it. The scoops size is large.  

This place can get super packed and it can be hard to get parking in their small parking lot. You will probably have to find street parking around in the area.
author: Alexander L.

description: I enjoyed the halo halo and ube in a waffle cone, but it wasn't enough to overcompensate for the atrocious service. We had only sampled a few flavors before the guy behind the counter barked, "This will be your last one!" HOW RUDE! Who DOESN'T taste ice cream before deciding which one to buy? Humphry Slocombe has never expressed qualms about me trying their flavors - Mitchell's needs to take a customer service course from them.
author: Suany W.

description:
Jackfruit Ice cream!!!

aka Langka is sooooo yummy, creamy, and flavorful! I loved every single bite that went into my mouth. In fact, I loved every little sample I had: macapuno (sweet coconut), lilikoi mango swirl, & Mexican chocolate. 

Service here is super top notch, especially from the manager/supervisor Juan who was there. He offered me most of those samples without my asking which was really nice of him. 

And just for a tip: Mitchell's has a parking area in the back!! But I bet it gets packed quick on hot days.
author: Marthie D.

description:
It was packed!! There was barely any room to move around inside and it was 10:40pm.. 

First of all, make sure you get a ticket number. If you don't, you'll never get to order :P Luckily my bf has been here before so we didn't make that mistake. Once they call your number, you can sample flavors and place your order. 

I got a single scoop of Ube on a waffle cone. They are very generous with their scoops! The single was definitely enough ice cream for me and it wasn't too expensive. The taste and texture of the ice cream was good but I didn't think it was amazing. My bf got a single scoop of the Grasshopper Pie (mint ice cream with oreos) on a waffle cone dipped in chocolate and nuts.. omg it was delicious. Maybe I've been deprived of oreos for too long but his ice cream tasted so much better. The waffle cones were also yummy and crunchy :) We also ordered a junior scoop of the Halo Halo since I've never had it before. Can't say I'm a big fan of it though. A lot of customers seemed to be buying cartons to take home which seems like a great way to be able to eat your favorite flavors all the time at home. 

Overall, the ice cream is yummy, there's lots of cool flavors, and the price is cheap! Definitely would come back :)
author: Sandra N.

description:
Hands down, THEE best place to get Ice Cream no matter what time of the day it is! I used to live in San Francisco (and more specifically in the Glen Park Neighborhood) so my family and I used to come here all the time after having dinner somewhere else! This is THE SPOT for those late night cravings and awesome dates. I am a firm believer of this place and will not betray my allegiance with this place. I have very fond memories and will plan to make more at Mitchell's. 

I do recommend trying everything at least once but my all time favorites are their Rocky Road, Grasshopper Pie, and Buko! Be sure to check out the fridges in the front of the store and pick up your favorite flavor by the gallon! And be sure to watch out for their seasonal flavors! Pumpkin and Egg Nog are phenomenal (and the serve Egg Nog as a drink as well)!

One Negative side of this place are the lines. On some nights, the place gets packed and the queue waiting time could take up to 15 minutes. Be sure to get a ticket as soon as you enter the store (on your left hand side) and just be patient and wait it out. They have an intercom so you won't miss hearing your number. BUT that still doesn't knock down any stars. In my humble opinion, well worth the wait. 

I will be coming here until the day I die! 

Happy Yelping!
author: Carlos K.

description: This is my favorite ice cream in SF. So creamy and classic flavors plus some more interesting ones. Avocado and ube and great. The grasshopper fudge/pie ( i can't remember the name) is delicious. This is not a fancy pants sort of place (not the Humphrey Slocombe vibe), just a wonderful neighborhood ice cream spot!
author: Jane V.

description:
Warning: Watch where you lick!
I have never been here before and I found a disgusting black piece of hair midway in my ice cream cone. I have dirty blonde hair (long)....how does this happen?

The guy let me sample a lot of the flavors that I wanted to try. I had the banana and Thai ice cream in a waffle cone. The wait goes fast as I thought we would be standing there for an hr or so.

P.S. They do take debit cards.
author: Star S.

description: Amazing amazing amazing!! Especially if you're lucky enough to go on a day when there is No Line. Yes people, this really does happen. I love their ice cream enough to wait an hour in the winter for it. The ice cream cake is not the best though, so go for the ice cream. Been going here for over 10 years.
author: Xae C.

description:
As someone who grew up eating a bowl of ice cream a night, I don't mess around when it comes to dessert. Neither does Mitchel's Ice Cream

This may be the best ice cream I've ever had in my life!!!

The flavors are out of this world. Anything that I have been hesitant to try has proven me wrong. The staff here is always cheerful and will always allow you to sample before deciding on your flavors. You can mix and match, no problem. I particularly enjoy the Oatmeal Cookie Dough and Thai Iced Cream, but the PB&J is my favorite. The swirls of jelly are not frozen and somehow maintain its gooey consistency.

IF YOU'RE IN THE AREA, YOU HAVE TO TRY IT!!!
author: Simon C.

description:
CURB APPEAL:
Great little ice cream shop in the middle of a busy street. 5 stalls in the back that are always taken. Always always always crowded, which is a good thing.

SERVICE:
Great service, relatively quick turnover. Hard working employees.

FOOD:
What can I say, the family loves ice cream...always on the look out for great ice cream.  I've tried many flavors, but am still far from trying it all. Spumoni, ube, macapuno, and pishtachio are my favorites. And here's a tip, get a cone flipped upside down in a cup. Best of both worlds. 

RESTROOMS:
None.

VALUE:
Can't complain!

OTHER:
Without a doubt, our #1 go to place for ice cream in the COUNTRY. I've waited for 40 minutes one night, in 45 degree rainy weather just to eat this stuff. I wish people with ticket numbers that are nowhere close to the current number can wait outside.
author: Kris P.

description: Strongly recommend their mango flavor - reminds me of mangos (and mango ice cream) from Pakistan (which are what mangos are supposed to be). Chocolate is a close second favorite.
author: Omer A.

description:
*shifts eyes left and right to check if coast is clear*
Sigh... i will probably get jumped for this..... but... FREEDOM OF SPEECH!

Unfortunately, I did not have a GREAT EXCITING AMAZING experience here as I expected to have. I tried the Grasshopper Pie (mint chocolate chip with oreo), Dulce de Leche, and Halo Halo. I was only excited about the dulce de leche which is what I got for my one scoop- $3.20, which I think was kind of pricey. Compared to Bi-Rite I got 3 big scoops for $6.25. My friend got the Ube (purple yam)... and after a couple bites she literally threw her entire ice cream... on the floor... LOL.... she said she really didnt like the texture of it. I definitely think it's best to sample before getting your ice cream so you dont have to run into the same unique situation as my friend :p Furthermore, the person who was assisting me was NOT enthusiastic at all and looked really bored and unfriendly. He was annoyed when I politely asked for 2 samples, which I do feel bad for, but I am new and I feel like I should have the right to find the right flavor! Came on Sunday around 9pm and the wait was about 20 minutes which was not bad. You just take a number and you go up to order when they call your number. Kuddos to Mitchells for opening late and NO TAX (??)!

SORRY MITCHELL's FANS PLEASE DONT ASSASSINATE ME!!
I will definitely give it another try because this visit did not give it justice hearing from all your reviews!

Ube Flavor: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mitchells-ice-cream-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#BdT4WOAc8pr9-d8EVjMSQg
Grasshopper Pie Waffle Cone: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mitchells-ice-cream-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#wlubMyeSnVMum83C6nEJgA
Ube, Grasshopper, Dulce de Leche: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/mitchells-ice-cream-san-francisco?userid=sd4E5iKUZotDEeiF3cC81Q#gyVPkuBAj0EeFeJJH-isbA
author: Chena N.

description:
I seriously LOVED Mexican chocolate. Didn't expect it and the guy was super nice and let me try a bunch of the flavors too :).... I usually would be a mint grasshopper flavor person but meh not this time.

Also, bring cash! They have like a 10/5 dollar limit for credit. And don't forget to come prepared with crazy parking and hella crowds because obviously everyone else wants to have a piece of this place.
author: Tiffanie T.

description:
Absolutely my very FAVORITE Ice Cream, Mitchell's......

My go-to flavor?   None other than Butterscotch Marble.

Love Love Love this place!!!!
author: Janet T.

description:
HANDS DOWN, BEST MANGO ICE CREAM!!! 

Mmm, if you know me, you know my ice cream flavor defaults are usually Mango and Ube. 

Variety: There are so many flavors to choose from! Everything from Mexican Chocolate to Kahlua Mocha to Halo Halo to Avocado etc.

Taste: Delicious and not that artificial flavor that some places pack on

Wait time: It was cracking on Valentine's Day. We were lucky enough that one party had an extra number ticket; that significantly cut down our wait.

Procedure: 
1. Grab a number ticket (once they call your number, then you get to order)
2. Order your dessert
3. Pay

It's easy as that!

Parking: Street Parking--can be difficult. It's a tight squeeze too, so be wary of that.

Nonetheless, Mitchel's Ice Cream is DEFINITELY WORTH IT. 

HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: Jash P.

description:
From when i was a kid, my parents used to buy a tub of Mitchell's icecream from the supermarket. When I grew older, I finally realized it was an actual creamery. My heart definitely melted when I went here for the first time. It was a random night and they were about to close. My girl friend and I were able to sample every flavor they had. The people working were super friendly and super nice. Every flavor was super delicious. But like most people, I fell in love with the grasshopper pie. 

Definitely a great place to go to for some ice cream!
author: Josephine C.

description: Stumbled on this place after getting dinner in Bernal Heights. What a great find. Got some amazing sweet coconut ice cream. Can't wait to back and try the other tropical fruit flavors.
author: Craig S.

description: Great ice cream. But still love bi-rite better!
author: Snowdrops C.

description: I won't go any other place... I go rain or shine, hands down my favorite ice cream parlor!
author: Veronica A.

description:
Probably one of my top favorites to get ice cream in the SF area. My goal is to try every flavor, but I don't think that'll happen in the near future because there are THAT many. 

So, let's walk through a normal trip to Mitchell's. I drive there, and sometimes get lucky enough to get a parking spot in the back - which there are about 5-6 of. If not, I loop around the street and have a relatively easy time finding parking - yay!

Then when I walk in- I grab a number, woohoo organization @ mitchell's. I usually end up waiting a few minutes if they are slow or about 15 if it's a crazy busy night for them, which does happen. Then I tell myself, Christine, don't tell yourself it's okay to get 3 flavors - then of course I do. My favorites are: Ube - Taro, grasshopper (mint chip variation), Jackfruit - aka langka I believe, Cocconut, and new york cherry. Before I order my cone, I help myself to a few samples and the workers are so sweet about it :) I get my ice cream and unfortunately there's only one bench to sit and eat it on, but if I end up standing around and eating it, it doesn't take long for the ice cream to disappear!

So - in summary, a great family owned establishment in SF with great service, exquisite selection of flavors, and great ice cream texture (more heavy and creamy vs. icey).
author: Christine B.

description: I have been going here since I was small, rain or shine regardless of the weather it's always been worth the wait .. From mango to ube, and any other flavor under the sun it's all good...there is no flavor I don't like.. Just had the special of the month coco-banana sundae. Delicious
author: Lynnelle E.

description:
Came here for ice cream after most nights the Giants won a game in the World Series. 

Can't beat celebratory ice cream! 

Though the line was massive, the wait wasn't bad at all. You get a number ticket and they call your number when it's your turn. They even let you try as many different flavors until you finally make your grueling decision. I thought I was in love with grasshopper pie... Until I tried Ube. Not only is the shade of the color lovely, it tastes even better!
author: Iris Z.

description: Great ice cream! I've had halo halo (with ube in it but a bit too sweet for me), cookies and cream which is super creamy and the cookie to ice cream ratio is great, and the ube (purple yam) which reminds me of taro which made me like it a lot. There is parking out bad and the lines haven't been too insanely lately.
author: Lily P.

description: Seriously, once you've tried Mitchell's, all other ice creams taste like sh*t.
author: Mara B.

description:
Definitely a place to go if you're ever in San Francisco!  Try the tropical flavors: Ube (Purple Yam), Halo-Halo, Mango, Avocado, and Lucuma!  
Everytime we're in San Francisco, we have to stop by this place at least 2 to 3 times!
author: Jun L.

description: It was freeeeeziinngg cold and Mitchell's still had a crazy long line  so worth it though. Just remember to grab a number as soon as you walk in. This place is bomb  best ice cream and malt shake I've ever had.
author: Brittany N.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream shop ever! 

Best flavors:

Coconut
pistachio
Cantaloupe(seasonal)

The ice cream is not overly sweet and you can actually taste the actual flavor of the ice cream. So many places load their ice cream with sugar that all you taste is sweetness. It's creamy and silky but yet light. I can easily eat 2-3 scoops in one sitting. Other places are so rich I can barely finish 1 scoop.
author: Ted V.

description: I've been a born Mitchell's Ice Cream lover!  They have all types of flavors and options. Sorbets, sundaes, shakes, root bear floats, cookie ice cream sandwiches,   ready to pick up ice cream cakes (several flavors and sizes avaliable) & gallons of ice cream varieties (coconut,  rocky road, grasshopper pie, peanut butter indulgence, Lucama,  Mexican chocolate, French Vanilla, ube, mango and much more). Yes, there (may) be a crazy, long wait (the longest i waited - 30 minutes)... but that's not going to hurt this rating!  The best part of Mitchell's is the quality of their ice cream... my bf and I have gone to bi-rite creamery and CREAM... they don't compare to Mitchell's. My favorite ice cream PERIOD: Peanut Butter indulgence.  Lucama (chocolate dipped), French Vanilla sundae.
author: Regina R.

description: Best Ice Cream place I've been to so far. There's so much variety and the all the flavors I've tasted are good. my favorite is the Lucuma which is a Peruvian fruit flavor. Prices are decent and even though there can be long lines on warm/hot days it's worth the wait!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Whether it's pizza in New York, seafood in Portland, BBQ in Texas, or Dim Sum in Vancouver, there is always a local debate for what is considered the very best. When it comes to ice cream in San Francisco, it's either Bi-Rite (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bi-rite-creamery-san-francisco) or this joint. I won't make a venture as to who trumps who, but I can attest to the awesomeness that is Mitchell's.

On any given night there could be as little as 10 and as much as 30 people waiting just to put in an order for some ice cream. On their busier nights, take a number, wait it out, and choose from their abundant variety of flavors, which are enough to appease all tastes.

What sorts of flavors are there beyond the traditional vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry? The Thai Iced Tea flavor is a fun one to start off with as it boasts hints of syrup, tea, and condensed milk - it's a great palate pleaser. How about Horchata as a flavor or Grasshopper Pie? The White Pistacchio is highly underrated, as is the Toasted Almond.

Their most popular flavor also happens to be my favorite: Ube. This purple yam flavored chunk of dairy goodness is beyond fantastic. Filipinos are geniuses for making Ube what it is. It's a killer dessert on its own, but even better in ice cream form. Same goes for their Halo Halo and Macapuno, both of which are definitely show stoppers in the ice cream world.

Thankfully, Mitchell's also happens to offer gallon sized containers for their best selling flavors. There are also Filipino snacks, candies, and lots of other stuff in the store. If Mitchell's isn't the best ice cream spot in San Francisco, it's at the very least among the finest ice cream in the bay.
author: Jando S.

description:
This is a San Francisco institution. Drawing folks from all corners of the City and from afar. So many enticing ice cream flavors ranging from your traditional to the exotic fruits. What flavor to order? As with all ice cream shops, you can ask for a taste prior to making a final choice.  

Grab a number from the dispenser and wait your turn.

I went with the espresso caramel toffee.  Small scoop in a cup please. Smooth and creamy.  Both benches out front were occupied so we ate in the car.  As we sat having our delightful dairy product, hubby and I couldn't help but to comment at the walk in and drive up traffic into the ice cream shop.  Then looking at each other and saying how lucky we were to score a front door parking space on a Monday at 1pm.
author: Shirley N.

description:
:) Mmm! My first time here! Went during a weekday and it wasn't too packed, some parking in the back of the restaurant during that time.

Tried the Lucuma ice cream which I usually can only get at Peruvian restaurants, so yummy! 

My mom stated that their Halo-Halo was the best shes's ever had here in America, and knowing her love of this delicacy... it's got to be good. 

Can't wait to come back and try more flavors.
author: Tracy Joy K.

description: I thought only magnolia made ube, Buko & Thai tea ice cream. Soooooo happy my cousin introduced me to Mitchell's. Best ube ice cream period!!!
author: Mary M.

description: You can't go wrong with Ube ice cream. You most likely will have a short wait to enjoy this deliciousness but totally worth it. I've tried a few other flavors but Ube is my favorite.
author: Sandra S.

description: There was such a variety of flavors and I wish I could try them all. But I'd say my favorite would be Ube, purple yam. I came here with my parents spontaneously. I found this place by InfatuationSF. It has parking in the back and ordering your ice cream is efficient. I'd love to come back again.
author: Emily N.

description: Mitchells ice cream is THE best ice cream EVER! it can be snowing and there is a line out the door.. for good reason!
author: Shannon R.

description: Awesome ice cream .... Rum raisin, toasted almond, grasshopper pie and plain chocolate ...all good...will definitely come here again!
author: Saumya A.

description: I belong at  Mitchell's.
author: Sarah S.

description:
I love going here.  

Don't let the long line deter you.  It goes really quickly and the ice-cream is amazing!
author: Sarah H.

description:
Second ever visit - surprising, yep - was after a big burger and shared-appetizers dinner. Even on a full stomach, and a colder night than that first visit, the $4.15 "Lilikoi Mango Swirl" single-scoop sundae with a $0.25 mango topping was finished. Well mostly, as had to help other yelpers with their "New York Cherry" and "Ube" ice creams. On this Wednesday night around 10pm, the line was seven minutes long.

First visit was after a dinner hosted by MartiL and DanielL. Thanks for the Mitchell's gift card (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/76smcUUGRvq3k1MVPUXbnA?select=n3nZGR7W3Gc-nsQGCC-Vkg)! Even on that cold night, $4.85 for two decent-sized scoops of "Strawberry" and "Tropical Four"=(banana, guava, mango, pineapple) ice creams were finished, and rather quickly. That Tuesday night at 9:30pm, the line looked like it would have been a long wait, even without us two dozen yelpers showing up at once (from the first yelper ordering to last, it was between 40-60mins).

I can see myself stopping by here, an easy to get to location, whenever friends ask to go. Hence, five stars (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fwjXgskUN50).
author: Peter L.

description:
I found heaven in a hopeless place! No, I'm not Rihanna, BUT after not being able to find parking on Castro to get to a cookie place I was leaving the city of SF a little bit disheartened. But little did I know this place would be along the way out of the city, so I stopped found parking in thier miniature parking lot and got my sweet food fix.

I sampled the French Vanilla Custard and Dulce de Leche and OMG days after I still want it. I ended having a two scoop waffle cone of one scoop of each. The Dulce de Leche was yummy, sweet and carmel-y. FREAKING AWESOME! The French Vailla Custard is what I had been looking for my whole life... long story short a co-worked of mine lives in Wisconsin and frozen custard is big there so I've been wanting to try it for a while now. I've had one very failed attempt. I think this is the closest I can get to frozen custard in California and OH MY! It's so rich, thick and custardy. Plain vanilla ice cream will just be bland now. 

I'm so glad this is far, far from my where I live cuase it really would not be healthy to live near Mitchell's. I can't wait to come back and pair French Vanilla Custard with another ice cream cause that one is not leaving ever!
author: Navjot K.

description:
Amazing!!  We were at the Zoo in the morning, and SIL suggested we stop here for a treat....am I glad!!

Fun ride down the hill with amazing views all the way!

We managed to park in back, and it a scant 15 minutes 'til bliss!

I had a Espresso Toffee, and I tried DD's Peanut Butter Chocolate....both were amazing.  Best coffee flavor ever, and the peanut butter was salty...OMG! The ice cream itself was rich and creamy.

Sheer pleasure!!
author: Katherine F.

description: SO GOOD. I thoroughly enjoyed my ice cream cone and am now actually craving their ice cream writing this review. Grasshopper Pie was amazing. We came close to closing and they were still extremely busy...Don't forget to take a number when you walk in the door!
author: Kelly W.

description:
OMG OMG OMG OMG OMG

I just added one of many things I need, MUST, feel OBLIGATED to return to San Francisco.

*****LOVE AT FIRST TASTE*****
All four of us went to Mitchell and fell in love with their ice cream.

I believe thousands of reviews have probably covered about their ice cream taste and texture. So, I keep it short by listing our favorite flavors:

Ube (purple yam aka taro)
Avocado
Jackfruit
Pineapple coconut

Tips: Take a ticket on the left right at the door as you enter the store and wait to be called.
author: Chau V.

description:
Items experienced:
Samples - Halo Halo, Lacuma, Ube, Mango, Horchatta, Rum Raisin, Peach, Black Walnut, Dulce De Leche, Kahlua Mocha Cream, Toasted Almond
Butterscotch Marble on Chocolate Chip
Chocolate Caramel Crackle on Double Chocolate Cookies

Perhaps not as 'artisan' as Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe but likely the most iconic eating destination in San Francisco aside from Tadich and some sourdough it was largely the southerly location of Mitchell's original scoop shop that had prevented visits on previous Bay Area vacations but with my mind finally set to the task after breakfast at Griddle Fresh my seminal visit was timely to say the least - a wide open store allowing for several samples just before a tourist group of over sixty arrived.  Largely a known commodity given the commercialization of the product over the years but offering several unique Asian options along with both classics and seasonal novelties in-store it was with the nutty Lacuma that I began and progressing to Purple Yam, Mango, and Halo Halo I was duly impressed...though single bites were enough when the more "American" options came calling as the perfect complement to cookies from Pacific Cookie Company.  Rather wowed by both Toasted Almond and Kahlua Mocha Cream while Horchatta, Peach, and Rum Raisin proved slightly bland it was only after a dozen small bites that I finally settled on a duo of 'sandwiches' and with both styles of cookie proving soft, buttery, and well crafted while hefty scoops overflowed the edges creating a proper mess I'd be hard pressed to say which was best - the answer likely residing in just how much you enjoy chocolate as the later was an intense blend of cookie, dark chocolate chips, and rich ice cream occasionally punctuated by crunchy pockets of sweet - a steal of a dessert at $3.25 each.
author: Michael U.

description: Came here on a Saturday - After circling Mitchell's Ice Cream's surroundings about 5 different times, we finally found a place to park. (One of the employees had parked in the parking lot behind Mitchell's, which I thought wasn't fair to the customers). Despite the huge crowd outside, our number got called rather quickly. The employees are friendly and accommodating to their customers. I sampled at least 5 different ice creams before making my decision. I went with Thin Mint but I believe they gave me Mint Chip... Gah! None the less, it was delicious. Just don't know if it even compares to other ice cream parlors I've been to.
author: Michelle G.

description: My favorites are the grasshopper pie and Mexican chocolate! This place is so popular there's usually a wait but the line moves quickly and like all good things it's definitely worth the wait!
author: MissChelle C.

description:
Tried the halo-halo and was not disappointed! Definitely enjoyed trying a flavor I will NOT find anywhere else.

Pro Tip: Make sure you go in and grab a number! The employees use a microphone to call the next number, so hearing them isn't a problem.
author: Leah Y.

description: I love this place. We stop here whenever we have a sweet tooth in the mission. The shakes are the BOMB!!
author: Emiliano O.

description: The purple yam ice cream was the best thing ever! Woohoo! As good as it gets!
author: Wendy C.

description: Every bit as wonderful as everybody else says. I loved the grasshopper pie and rum raisin.
author: Ida D.

description:
I wasn't planning on indulging in some Mitchell's today, but I ended up in the neighborhood and couldn't pass it up. The inside was a throwback to old soda fountains (not that I'm old enough to fully appreciate it, but you get the point). Friendly service, quick service and very reasonable prices. I would have liked to try more flavors (and buy more flavors), but I sampled the Mocha Fudge and the Caramel Pecan Praline (or something like that). 

I enjoyed them both and went with the second one. Nice crunchy pecans, creamy caramel and a solid vanilla ice cream base. The other one calling my name was Mexican Chocolate and I believe that's for my next visit. 

I've spoiled lately by really good gelato, so ice cream doesn't quite taste as smooth to me as it used to.
author: David B.

description:
We recently went to Mitchell's to grab an ice-cream. As this was our first time at Mitchell's, we had no clue what to do. We waited outside for a couple of minutes when a fellow patron said that we had to pick up a ticket and that we will be called by our ticket #. 

Luckily the lines are not as long as the lines for BiRite (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bi-rite-creamery-san-francisco#hrid:Amba_KtkJ2HuLbOl4fl7GA). Likewise, parking in this neighborhood wasn't as tough as finding parking near BiRite.

Within 15min, our ticket # was called and we ordered a Banana Split with 2 scoops - Mocha and Caramel Praline. I asked the waiter for a sample of Caramel Praline and ended up buying a pint of this flavor. It was so damn delicious. Totally relished our banana split as well.

Definitely returning to try out more of their flavors.
author: Anu M.

description: By far, this is one of the best places for ice cream in the City.  So they don't have exotic crazy flavors like some of the other places, but what they do have are really good quality ice cream.  No hype.  I was there just today and happy to see their health rating remains 100 percent good. Mitchell's Ice Cream will continue to have a place in my heart.
author: Susan K.

description: I have enjoyed going here every since I was a kid. Now in my upper 40's I'm so glad to know the Mitchell's still have that home made goodness. Its very much worth the wait (lines have a tendency to be long) Tonight I went and didn't hear my number called. I went up to the counter with my ticket and even though my number was passes, they still served me. I really appreciate that!
author: Lex C.

description:
Murican' flavors.  Strike that.  Great Murican' flavors.

I like Mitchell's because it focuses on rich, decadent ice cream.  Basic (read: traditional flavors) done well. On my most recent trip, I loaded up on two scoops of oreos and cookies and grasshopper pie (Peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, Oreo cookies and fudge swirls).  So yeah, I double loaded on Oreos.  It was glorious.  

There are other exotic/different flavors (Ube, Horchata, Halo Halo, etc) for those with a lighter palette.  But I really want you to try the Grassshopper.
author: Huy D.

description: The selection is def amazing, asked a worker for a sample and he told me he was currently helping someone and I look to my left and they were not ready yet. It takes 2 seconds to grab a sample. I used to work at an ice cream shop and so I patiently wait there until he comes back to me at which he proceeds to grab samples for a diff group. Finally just ordered what I normally get from a diff employee. Learn to multi task at you're age.
author: Marlon R.

description: Local establishment. Rivals Bi-Rite. We had the halo halo with waffle cone. Great, unique flavors. As you can see from the amount of reviews, this place speaks for itself. A must for any out (or in)-of-towners!
author: Jimmy D.

description: Bow down to Mitchell's! Best ice cream in SF, hands down! My faves are ube, mango, macapuno, and the best seasonal summer treat cantaloupe! I like the tropical flavors in case you couldn't tell. Yes, San Francisco has plenty of delicious options when it comes to ice cream. But if you want something classic without all the stuffy fancy ice cream parlor ambiance, go to Mitchell's! :)
author: Krizia M.

description: The Grasshopper pie, or Oreo are the two best i've ever had. Tons of cookies in the mix.
author: Tommy A.

description:
WORTH THE WAIT, YO. 

I die for their horchata and red fire (chocolate, cinnamon, and chipotle) ice cream, but you cannot go wrong with any of the flavors.

Even my parents, who have something to gripe about everywhere I take them, didn't say a word while we were there because they were so focused on stuffing as much ice cream into their face holes as quickly as humanly possible. Yep.
author: Kathleen N.

description:
I was craving some ice cream and decided to see what was around me at the time and it was between this and Bi-Rite. I decided to come here because the pictures looked more appetizing (I know, never judge pictures) but it was totally worth it! Note: We came here on a Sunday afternoon on Labor Day weekend, so a crowd was to be expected.

Parking: Free street parking (that is, if you can find any). We got lucky and found one right in front of the store but it's ridiculous how many cars are double parked. It was that busy! I thought bunches of people in front of the store were all in line but I noticed that it wasn't really crammed inside so I went in to look at the flavors and on the wall I noticed the "Now Serving" sign and the "Get a Number" sign. SO DEFINITELY DO THAT ASAP! They were serving number 10 when I got there and I got number 49. Don't wait inside the store, PLEASE. It's honestly not worth it because you'll get your turn. We waited outside and listened to them call numbers and it went by pretty quickly. Also because many people grab more than one number for some reason, so don't get too freaked out by how many people are ahead of you.

Once we got called in I just decided to order. I didn't even want to bother trying the flavors because the young lady helping me seemed irritated. I get it, there's a lot of people and you're probably tired but a little enthusiasm, PLEASE. I got a single scoop coffee and my boyfriend got a junior scoop of vanilla. The ice cream was definitely good and I would probably wait again just so I could try more flavors next time, hopefully with someone who's more excited about working there.

While waiting I overheard, and saw, many people get sundaes so I'm guessing those are pretty popular. They also have prepackaged ones that you can go in, get and buy without waiting in the line.

tl;dr street parking, grab a number when you first get in, don't wait inside, try the flavors, service could've been better
author: Jenn L.

description:
I'm not kidding when I say that there was a crowd outside Mitchell's. (See photo)

I was praying in my head that our wait wouldn't be too long. The ice cream guys behind the counter were quick with their service, so we only waited 10 mins for our turn. Our guy was generous with samples and didn't get annoyed when we asked to sample flavor after flavor. (can I try the tropical four? how about Claire's pie? oh and the ube? of course, the langka too!)

I always seem to be in the mood for tropical flavors whenever I'm here and Saturday night was no exception. I had the junior scoop ($1.80) of the langka, mom had the tropical four (guava, banana, mango, pineapple) and bf had the usual thin mint. Although he prefers Bi-Rite's version of thin mint ice cream, the tropical flavors at Mitchell's are true classics, I don't even miss Magnolia. (a Filipino ice cream brand)

We also bought a half gallon ($9.50) of Halo-Halo ice cream for our Easter dinner and it was all gone even before you can say "Easter Bunny." The homemade cupcakes and TJ's cheesecake looked like orphans on the dinner table as nobody even touched them.

I'll continue coming back to Mitchell's for their delectable ice cream selection. No doubt this SF tradition is here to stay.
author: Janice C.

description:
For all those who do not like to read paragraphs of reviews, let me summarize all 2000+ reviews in 9 words: GET OFF YOUR ASS AND GET A FU _ KING SCOOP!

WARNING: Unless your blood sugars are under control and have consulted with your physician, it is not recommended for those with Type I or Type II Diabetes Mellitus because the addictive deliciousness of their creamy ice cream will put a person with uncontrolled diabetes instantly in a coma...and I don't mean food coma.
author: Roland F.

description:
I used to go here all the time growing up in the Bay. I'm sad I don't get to partake in the goodness that is Mitchells, but I try to get here as often as I can when I visit the city. I usually buy 2 half gallons to take home so the magic will last just a little bit longer :) It's a perfect place for an after dinner dessert, or a long day showing your inlaws around the city. 

Mango and Macapuno are my favorites hands down. Mint choco chip and Halo Halo are good too. i love their Avocado too. Not for everyone, but if you're curious, I strongly suggest you try it. Super creamy, slightly icy....simply delicious. Expect a sizeable line when you arrive. Parking can be a little tricky as well, but totally worth it. 

Check out this San Francisco institution soon!
author: Mel L.

description:
Creamy, creamy, creamy Ice Creamy!

Drive near the shop; find parking; plow through the crowd outside; get in the doorway; look left and slightly up; take a numbah!

Now scout the menu; pick your flavors; choose your cone type or cup; wait for your numbah to be called!

Bring  your entire gang in with you; try to remember what you wanted; tell the person behind the counter what you want; get tasting samples if you're not sure; 

Pass the cups, cones, shakes, sundaes, whatever to whoever in your group ordered it; pay for your order; grab extra napkins; go outside and  enjoy!
author: Dexter D.

description: Mitchell's is always a delight. But since I haven't been in a while but went last week I think I don't need 2 scoops and chocolate dipped anymore. But my go-to flavors are Ube, buko, and macapuno. A simple cup will do the job next time.
author: Roxane P.

description: So good! There were so many flavors to choose from! And the staff was so kind and helpful! Will definitely be back next time I visit!
author: Dash K.

description:
Grab a number.

Super busy and after looking at the flavors on the board, I seriously couldn't decide what to get. I felt like a pain in the you know what for asking to sample so many different flavors!

I ended up with Mango (because he said it was the most popular tropical flavor) but sort of kind of regret it! The guava sorbet was BOMB but wished the texture was a little smoother.

TRY THE UBE (Yam). Definately gonna order that next time!

Crowded. Awesome. Will be back!
author: Lauren K.

description:
Good ube, coconut flavor had yummy little chunks of real coconut in it wow!
Good ube, coconut flavor had yummy little chunks of real coconut in it wow!
author: Jingo Django J.

description: I love ice cream!! I was pretty disappointed with Mitchell's Ice Cream.  It was prettying much average. I came here on a super hot day and the wait was about 20 minutes. You have to get a number and wait to be called. We tried numerous flavors which included ube (purple yam), lucuma (a Peruvian fruit), and grasshopper pie. None of the flavors were really impressive or stood out. We decided to settle for the fruity flavors with which you can't go wrong. The junior size is about $2.60 which is not a bad deal. There was plenty of street parking but I probably won't be coming back soon.  Go down to bi-rite instead!!!
author: Vivian N.

description: This is my second time here. I had the halo halo and the ube and both are better than each other! I hate the long wait but it's definitely worth it!!!
author: Revan N.

description: I have been to Mitchell's a few times and they make great ice cream. Just be prepared to wait, although they do have an express line for pre packed ice cream. I have tried their thin mint, vanilla and peanut butter indulgence. Each flavor was fantastic.
author: Paul D.

description:
I'm a HUGE ice cream fan. Huge as in the night I tried Mitchell's was the night I had stuffed my face with all you can eat Korean BBQ and could barely breathe/move, but I still wanted ice cream for dessert. 

We came here on a Saturday night around 8, and the place was packed! We also got extremely lucky with parking right across the street. You grab a number and wait until you're called. We were number 57, and we started waiting around 16. At first I was horrified at the 41 customers to be called before my group, but my boyfriend estimated it to be only about 20 minutes or so! Please be courteous and decide on what you want by the time your number is called, or at least narrow it down to a couple flavors! Nobody likes waiting longer than they have to for ice cream :(

My friend and I both got grasshopper pie, and my boyfriend got banana. They were sad that I got a more generous scoop... haha. Both flavors were amazing, but I definitely preferred banana to my grasshopper pie, and my boyfriend agreed that a flavor switch would have been appropriate, haha. I'm still not sure if I like Bi Rite or Mitchell's better... can't I just love both?!
author: Daisy T.

description: Best Ice-cream on the planet!!! I love the Grasshopper. Mint and oreo. You also grab a ticket and then wait in line, but it is way worth it.
author: Bailey H.

description:
The review count is only in the 2 thousands?  Well then I obviously need to put in my 2 cents to help up the count.  Poor guys.

I've been going here since I was little. My dad would take us here on a nice day, or after a Niner win (along w/a stop to Pizza & Pipes). I remember one time, I was probably 6 or 7 - holding my older sister's hand amidst a bunch of people ordering ice cream. An older man next to me, not necessarily looking down at my face, hands down a double scoop cone of strawberry and chocolate chip ice cream to me. The fat kid in me of course, takes it without hesitation. Lick. Looks up at sister, lifts up cone - wansom? She looks at me, puzzled. Where'd you get that?? Meanwhile, a girl about my age is asking her Dad where her ice cream is. Woops.

If you were to ask me what my favorite ice cream is EVAR - (that one is for you, John M., D-Co), it would be Avocado, no contest. Before I ever tried it in ice cream form, we would make our own version of a Filipino avocado dessert at home - crushed ice, sugar, milk, and semi-squashed up diced avocado served in a glass or a bowl. When I tasted Mitchell's Avocado Ice Cream for the first time, I looked at my mom like she was on crack and yelled at her the only way I knew how at the age of 6 - "um Ma, why we're breaking ice w/a meat pounder thing for our a-CA-vado dessert?? They have it in ICE CREAM form!!!!!!!!"

Without a doubt, if for some wild reason Avocado isn't available (has never happened but let's speak hypothetically here) or if I'm feeling Patti LaBelle a la New Attitude, Buko (baby coconut) will always be my second choice, followed by Ube (purple yam),  then Tropical Four (a mix of Banana, Guava, Mango & Pineapple), then Mango.

If you've never been, they go by a ticket system. Go inside, grab a numbered ticket, and wait to be called. I have always had good service here. I never feel rushed, and they always offer samples and suggestions. They accept cards, so that's a huge plus.

If you found this page because you were originally looking for Mitchell Brothers O'Farrell Theatre- welcome. Save some of those dollar bills and make it rain at Mitchell's Ice Cream instead. You perv.
author: Rho T.

description:
Favorites!!!

Peruvian Fruit (lacuma) subtle flavor but really good.
Grasshopper (tastes like andes mints)

There are a lot of flavors here.  Don't worry... you get to try as many as you like and the workers are super friendly.

TIP: 
1.  Remember to get a number as you walk in. 
2.  If you already know what flavor you want and you're willing to buy a half gallon, you don't need to wait in line.  They have a separate line for half gallon purchases.  This is great if you have a group of friends that want the same flavor!

Pro:
1.  Great flavors
2.  Super friendly workers.

Cons:
1. Parking can be tough
2.  Can be crowded but... hey it's good.  Line is still reasonable considering it'll take you awhile to review the selections available.  Actually this is probably more of a Pro.
author: Jensen L.

description: I have lived in San Francisco my whole life. As long as I can remember there have always been a line out the door at Mitchell's ice cream. However, the ice cream is not that great. It's too sweet and creamy. I feel that the flavors don't pop. There are way better ice cream shops in SF that don't require you to wait in long lines and look disparately for parking.
author: Ivania M.

description:
59 Years of Family Ownership + 16% Butterfat + Countless Awards + 1 Omnipresent Line +

1 Obligatory Taste of Purple Ube + 1 Pint of Old Favorite Grasshopper Pie (Mint Ice Cream + Chocolate Chips + Oreo Cookie Chunks + Fudge Swirls) + 1 Pint of New Favorite Cinnamon Gingersnap  +

2 Freshly Made Waffle Cones + $14 = 

A MEA CULPA FOR CHEATING ON BI-RITE CREAMERY
author: Amy C.

description:
The folks in SF love their ice cream. Came to Mitchells after dinner and it was packed! A fantastic selection of exotic flavors - many catering to the Asian palate. I had the Kahlua Mocha Cream dipped in chocolate on a waffle cup ( I had Ube-Purple Yam the day before at my uncle's house)  It was a pretty cold night in the City but I didn't mind it - the ice cream is that good - so creamy and smooth.

Don't want to wait? buy the prepack half gallon and move to the head of the line!

Next time? One of the milk shakes - maybe Buko (Baby Coconut).
author: Eddie C.

description: Oh sweet Mitchell's Ice Cream... This is the original place in San Francisco where the public lines up for ice cream. For me, I have to time my visits to get the cream just right. I don't like lines and parking can be a chore. There is a small parking lot but there is usually a line to park. Make sure you get a ticket number because the workers are calling out numbers from the queue. I have so many favorites and I love that you can ask for samples of flavors that are new or unfamiliar.
author: Infodiva B.

description: Yummy!  Came here one night after having dinner at Foreign Cinema.  Got the peppermint ice cream which was delicious!  I was pleasantly surprised that they also sold frozen bananas which I alwayz got when going to theme parks as a child!  5 in my book!
author: Elena N.

description:
I have been a fan since 1980 when I was boarding a airplane and the plane staff was putting 
in storage three large containers telling me every time they are in SF their friends and relatives
make sure they bring back some of the unusual flavored ice cream. So I went and the Mexican 
Chocolate is the BOMB!!! I can honestly say I am  here at least once a week, rain or shine. And
I always try something different, except when it is peppermint candy season!!!
author: Peter F.

description:
Espresso with chocolate chips and Mango. Tetelestai. It is finished. If you read in the Bible, that is what John 19:30 says. Mitchell's ice cream is no where near comparison to the gravity of what Jesus came to do. 

However, this place is SOOOOOOO GOOD. I went to another ice cream place before this called Bi-rite. I don't know if i'm allowed to do this, but GO TO BOTH places. I rarely go to SF and the few spots are go for sure are these two ice cream spots. Honestly, I can't say which is better because it's comparing Miami Heat and San Antonio Spurs in 2014 NBA Finals. One team, Spurs, has better team chemistry, but Miami Heat has lowercase king James, a solid player. 

Bi-rite and Mitchells are really good in different ways. If you like the fruity flavors and more solid ice cream, come on over to Mitchell's. Solid i mean, it has more density and creamy. I'm done talking, I miss this place already, but I miss the people I went here with. Shoutouts to my church. If you are still reading, you are making a mistake, find a way to get to SF and eat here!! and quickly!
author: Paul K.

description:
Safe to say Mitchell's is a SF institution. It was a cold August Friday night and this place was still packed. Good thing they now have a service ticket system now.

Okay, I've come to the conclusion that their ube isn't the ube that you'd expect (i.e., ube halaya).  Don't believe I'd be getting that again.  Also bummed that they aren't serving langka (only available in tub size in the freezer section).  At least the last two times we went there.  Still, the other tropical flavors are great and a draw for us.  The buko is very good as well as the Tropical 4 when you cannot decide on just one.  Can't wait to have the horchata and thin mint but....

Mitchell's, put langka back in case, I can't take bucket of it home with me!  Please!!
author: Leni A.

description:
Ice cream parlor not too shaby, however like another yelper mentioned , the ice cream DOES lack that rich creaminess most of us have become accustomed to and that quite frankly expect from icecream 

I tried the black and white, WAY TOO SWEET! My friend got the chocolate chip cookie one, also too sweet
author: cristina s.

description:
Before physically going into Mitchell's, my friend had some lucuma ice cream in her  freezer. I LOVE lucuma ice cream. I remember having lucuma ice cream at a Peruvian food place and a pint was already $10! For those who don't know, lucuma is a tropical fruit native to Peru... which is probably why the first time I tried it it was so expensive! I don't know how Mitchell's makes their ice cream, but I have only tried their lucuma flavor because it's THAT good. And for a 1/2 gallon for under $10, oh man what a steal!

I haven't tried all the hot ice cream spots in SF... however, I like the ice cream parlor shop vibe I got from Mitchell's. It's got that old school cozy feel to it. Be ready for a line... but it's totally worth it. Next time I'm in the area, I'll grab a 1/2 gallon, put it in an igloo ice chest, and speed my way back to San Jose. Maybe I should grab two 1/2 gallons. They can keep themselves cold by being next to each other.... hmmmm!!
author: Kathy Y.

description:
Really enjoyed the eclectic offerings - like ube and halo halo! Cash only within $10 so unless you're ordering a lot or for a few people, make sure to bring cash!

when you arrive, take a ticket... because I wasted a few min in a fake line until I realized that people were all grabbing tickets and getting their order placed that way. whoops!
author: Kevin M.

description:
Hot damn. Or cold, creamy damn? Take your pick.

I was in SF with a friend and this was our last stop before bouncing out of the city, a mighty fine stop if I do say so myself. A small shop on the corner (I'm starting to notice a trend here...), Mitchell's already hosted a decent crowd when we arrived. There we about twenty people ahead of us, but they got through those folks all within a short ten minutes.

I ordered their coconut and mango ice cream (I heard their tropical flavors were favored here) and I'll be damned if that wasn't some of the finest iced creams I've ever had. The coconut was incredible, with an excellent addition of fresh coconut medallions for texture and authenticity, and the mango was second to none. 

Well done Mitchell's, now I must eat your ice cream whenever I'm in SF, ignoring my lactose intolerance. Cheers.
author: Nicolai D.

description:
They are amaazingggggggggggg! Not only they serve the best ice cream in the whole wide world... They are the nicest and most amazing people with the coolest staff!!! 
Try it... You will get HooKed
author: Afsaneh J.

description:
So, I'll preface this by saying that I made the mistake of not trying their tropical flavors, as recommended by fellow Yelpers (don't blame me, I didn't have a smart phone on me), and instead ended up getting their Mexican chocolate and coffee. Perhaps this is why I was not wowed then, especially when comparing both flavor and texture against places like Bi-rite and Humphry Slocombe, so I suspect that I will eventually make my way out here again to properly sample their popular flavors.

That said, the crowd here is quite interesting. That is, to say, there were massive clusters of people outside, all waiting for their numbers to be called (it's a first come first serve ticketing system, so make sure you get your number), which lends to a lot of casual chatting among strangers. Pretty fun actually, if you're the sociable type - I mean, heck, I met my first real witch ever here! A Wiccan, with a custom pointy hooded cape and everything. Easily the best part of my visit to Mitchell's.
author: Johnny W.

description: Bombay ice cream. Yes there can be a long line so either wait like everybody or just be a chubber and buy a few gallons of the already packed flavors. The ice cream cakes will put Baskin and Robins to shame, better graphics and the ice cream is buttery, more creamier and fattier. You only live once, you mine as well eat the good stuff.
author: Livia K.

description:
After finishing a wonderful dinner just a short walk away over on Mission, our server asked if we were interested in any dessert. Poor fellow. I'm sure your desserts are quite lovely, but don't you realize that Mitchell's Ice Cream is nearby? We politely declined.

It was a very cold night for the City, possibly close to freezing. It mattered not. Chilly, Winter temperatures would not keep the girlfriend & I away from creamy Mitchell's deliciousness. Mexican Chocolate & White Pistachio, are you kidding me? This stuff is dangerous good.

No, really, maybe it could be dangerous. It was seriously cold out & there we were eating ice cream. Our fingers went numb from handling our irresistible frozen concoctions on a freezing cold night. Next comes frostbite, then gangrene & next thing you know, all your fingers are being amputated.

Hey, I'm just saying, be careful with this stuff. Mitchell's Ice Cream is good, dangerous good.
author: John M.

description:
Overrated! I don't think Mitchell's ice cream is good to the point where I have to grab a ticket and wait in line for. A lot of people must look at the big flavor board and think: "Wow, look at all those tropical flavors. Mitchell's does some pretty strange flavors!" Wrong! If you are Asian, these flavors are pretty commonplace. You can find most of these flavors and more at Polly Ann's. If you do think these flavors are unique, chances are you are probably white. 

I tried the ube (purple yam) and didn't think anything of it. It was like taro, but less flavorful. I also tried the grasshopper pie and got a big chunk of cookie. I settled with the coconut pineapple because it was my favorite of the three. It ended up being on par with Baskin-Robbins' Nutty Coconut (replace pineapple chunks with roasted almonds, buttered pecans, and walnut pieces). I also tried some of the Tropical Four, which was pretty good - you can taste all the fruit individually and it was scented as if you were eating a flower. 

In the end, Mitchell's is just a good neighborhood ice cream place to keep you cool during the hot summer months - nothing more, nothing less. It's not really worth the drive to try it and definitely not worth the wait after the drive to try it. My list for best ice cream places remains the same with Bi-Rite on top for quality ice cream, followed by Humphry Slocombe for their bold flavor oddities, and Polly Ann's to round out the top three.
author: Bailey Z.

description: Decent ice cream, but not sure I understand all the hype.  I prefer the other known SF ice cream stops a lot more.
author: Patricia K.
