description: Miguel was super helpful with my large order and helped me pick out a new flavor of ice cream  wish I could rate higher!
author: John R.

description:
It's been the first time in a long time I've enjoyed the sweet treat, and it instantaneously brought me back to the simpler (and arguably more fulfilling) days of my youth. My childhood fridge was stocked with uniquely Asian equivalents of fudge bars and popsicles: green tea mochi, red bean bars, mysterious black sesame concoctions, and my personal favorite - the sweet and oddly colored ice cream made from purple yam.

Even for a nippy mid-February night (measuring in at 60 degrees Farenheit, which is positively balmy for some city natives), there was a healthy line of a dozen and a half sweet-starved customers blissfully sampling flavors from over 20 of their featured offerings. Mitchell's boasts a wide variety of "tropical" flavors made from fruit imported straight from the Phillipines: jackfruit, mango, young coconut, and the odd avocado (unfortunately, or maybe very fortunately, no durian for those with a partiality to the taste of old socks).

The consistency, as expected of these high-end ice cream shops scattered across the city) was perfect - a smooth blend of sugar, cream, and guilt with a satiny finish. It takes something monumental for me to forgo a new episode of Top Chef, but this ice cream managed to keep me rooted in the middle of a sparsely populated city block until the other side of 10:30pm.
author: Priscilla W.

description: I have to say this is SF's version of Loards & Fentons Ice Cream in Oakland but giving Mitchell's the slight edge. Only reason why I say this is the variety of flavors both establishments presents. Fentons does have food, but this is strictly about the ice cream. What other place serves Ube Ice cream? Last time I was here, I had the Grass Hopper Pie which is Peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, Oreo cookies and fudge swirls. This was an orgasm in my mouth. The flavors blended well together. Just like all their ice cream. You can't go wrong. All their ice cream is made fresh daily which is a must when you want quality. The other flavor that's awesome is the Dulce de Leche. Mmmmmmmmm. Give me some!
author: Steven O.

description:
This is one of my favorite ice cream parlors!! I thought Bi-Rite was my favorite but Mitchell's is even better!!!!

My favorite was definitely the AVOCADO! It had a very smooth, soft texture and tasted delicious! I loved how the avocado flavor was subtle and not too strong. I could eat this flavor everyday and not get sick of it.

UBE (purple yam) was also really yummy! This was also a very subtle flavor with the perfect amount of sweetness and the toasty-roasty ("go-so-hae") flavor of yam was amazing! Reminded me of an autumn day.

GRASSHOPPER PIE was also pretty good! This was mint ice cream with fudge, chocolate chips, and oreos. It was basically mint chocolate chip ice cream but done excellently. Get this if you're a mint fan!

WHITE PISTACHIO was a little too "pistachio-ey" for me but my other friends who are total pistachio fans loved it. 

This is a must-try if you're in the area!!
author: Diana I.

description:
Lisa T. scores a hat trick!
Now that I've sampled the holy trinity of Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe and Mitchell's I can authoritatively rank them in order of excellence: 1) Bi-Rite, 2) Mitchell's and 3) HS.
Here at Mitchell's, we had chocolate ice cream, chocolate peanut butter ice cream, and rocky road ice cream ... are you picking up a theme here? Chocolate. 
So if you want salted caramel or honey lavender, go to Bi-Rite, if you want fantastic rich chocolate come here, and if you want something else (she said diplomatically) go to HS. 
Not too eloquent but there you go.
author: Lisa T.

description: I have grown up on Mitchell's and I've yet to taste better ice cream, especially in San Francisco. My favorite flavors are Grasshopper Pie, Chocolate Carmel Crackle, and Peppermint (when it's in season).
author: Bailey A.

description:
I love the mexican chocolate ice cream. It taste so rich. I usually get it as a milk shake   I love that Mitchell's ice cream closes late. It 
It comes in handy during those late night sweet tooth attacks. 
The only down side is it gets really packed especially during weekends.
author: Yasuko R.

description:
Good stuff. Born and raised in San Francisco Bernal Heights area this  ice cream shop on San Jose Blvd is by far the best creamery and that's super popular with the neighborhood! 
After over 30 years I decided to come back this time with my own family/kids. I drove from Santa Clara CA for ice cream call it weird but it is worth the drive.  I found it hasn't changed a bit long lines and a new system in place. You have to get a ticket to be served. We waited about 15 minutes in the sea of people because I wasn't aware of the ticket process and of course people in San Francisco the mindset changes from people from the valley they will not assist if you don't ask duh!!  lol!!

Michell's has tons of traditional flavors but has a fresh and extensive "tropical" selection of ice cream (Ube, halo halo, young coconut, etc.). I had the Macapuno and  my wife and kids had some unique flavors that interest their liking. Awesome! 

Good times, be patient with the wait, Michell's is worth the wait on a warm frisco day!Parking in the back and also street parking.  Lastly, I bought a Mitchell Ice Cream shirt just for keepsake from past time...
author: Michael G.

description:
Had the Strawberry and cream ice cream.  It was very good!  Would return if in neighborhood.

Note - they have a load speaker to call out numbers so you can wait outside and still here if they call you.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
It seems that if you go asking for ice cream recommendations around SF Mitchell's will be touted time and time again.  I'm told the shop is always bustling no matter what time you go, and this held true at around 5:30 or so on a Sunday evening. 

I went in to buy two half-gallons, so I was able to skip the line of people waiting to order cones and sundaes which I much appreciated.  (I do like that they use a number system for ordering much like at a deli so you're not stuck in line at least). 

Mitchell's has so many amazing flavors to choose from that I had trouble deciding what to get.  I wish I could try them all, so I guess I just need to come back the next time I'm in SF.  I did however wish they sold smaller containers than half-gallons so I could have bought more flavors to sample.

I went with the Butterscotch Marble and the Tropical 4.  The Butterscotch Marble was tasty, but I felt is could have used more marbling.  Many of my scoops were plain vanilla sans the decadent butterscotch.  Luckily I am also a fan of plain vanilla ice cream, and their rich vanilla did not disappoint.  As for the Tropical 4, I was a little nervous that it would be super-sweet like a sorbet, so I was pleasantly surprised when the fruit flavors were light and not too overpowering - a nice mix of flavors that I thoroughly enjoyed.

I already have my eye on some of the more exotic flavors for the next time I visit.  Be warned, I am likely to be that annoying girl in line asking to sample a bunch of flavors before deciding because they all sound so good!
author: Elizabeth W.

description: I drove by Mitchell's so many times.  Always a bunch of people but you don't wait that long.  I didn't know the process when I got there.  You need to get a number. I ended up ordering this kahlua coffee type of ice cream.  It was good.  I feel like they are popular for their other flavors.  They have some filipino flavors like halo halo and ube ice cream.  I've had the halo halo one time when my coworkers bought me some.  The ice cream is good but it isn't amazing.
author: Chrissie O.

description: My lactose intolerance has gotten worse. Luckily their sorbet is excellent.
author: Misha T.

description:
Worth every single minute of the wait. Which wasn't too bad our number was 11 and they were in the 70s when we got there. If you already know what flavors you like it is A LOT FASTER to just buy a gallon instead of waiting for scoops.

Since it was my first time I waited for scoops, plus I wanted to sample some. I sampled the Grasshopper & Mango. Holy shit I didn't think ice cream could taste any better. It definitely has. LOL

We ended up getting Ube & Halo Halo.

SUPER BOMB. Next time I come to visit I'm coming here and getting the Mango. Very refreshing!! MUST COME HERE if you're visiting. Then go to Anthony's Cookies for the best cookies in town. It's right down the street!
author: April B.

description: I love the texture and creaminess of the ice cream here, but I have to say that in the end, I like places like Bi-Rite and Sweet Rose Creamery (LA) better because of the flavors they offer and the quality of ingredients. I've tried Irish coffee, toasted almond, and strawberries and cream, and I wasn't wowed by any of them. The texture of the ice cream is spot on though! I do wish the workers were friendlier. They always look so annoyed even though they have the best jobs in the world (ie: bringing happiness and joy, served cold!).
author: Rachel L.

description:
I love ice cream and this place has received some worthy praise. 

This shop is notorious for its line that usually runs down the block, but today I walked right up and ordered. Woo hoo! It's freezing out here on a Wednesday night in December. 

Aside from the tropical flavors like halo halo, mango, and jackfruit, the flavors are more traditional than Bi-rite (which is down the street) but they're done well. I ordered the chocolate chip in a sugar cone. The ice cream was buttery and perfectly creamy with good size chunks of chocolate. The cone was crunchy and not too sweet. The way it should be. 

Delicious!  Parking is in the back. Hopefully it isn't crowded otherwise you'll either be circling or walking a few blocks.
author: Lloyd B.

description: I had Mitchell's for the 1st time on National Ice Cream day. I am officially addicted. I went back the next day to get a 1/2 gallon. This ice cream is AWESOME!!! The wait is worth it. This will be apart of my grocery list from now on.
author: Samaki B.

description:
Hands down a San Francisco Classic. You aint been to the best San Francisco ice cream shop unless you have at least know about Mitchells.

If you're into tropical/Filipino flavors such as Mango, Ube, Halo Halo, then this is the place to go.

Maybe I'm a little bias[ok, a lot] because this is a place from my childhood that is still up and running. I've been to numerous of other ice cream shops throughout the city [Joes in the richmond and Bi-Rite on 16th street] and beyond [Walnut Creek, Berkeley] and I still have to compare all those spots to here. 

Dont be timid if you drive by and see a wave of people just waiting outside. They offer a number system and it goes by pretty quickly. 

on a hot sunny day. Mitchells comes thru in the clutch...
author: Jeff C.

description: Ahhh....still some of the best ice cream in the city.  Seriously,  so delish.   Chocolate Carmel Krackle is my favorite,  but their ice cream cakes are pretty fantastic too.
author: Karen F.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM EVER! 

MY favorite flavor which is seasonal is CANTALOUPE. The line can get pretty crazy, especially during warm days/night in SF.
author: Rose P.

description:
If it's your first time visit, make sure you go inside the store and get a number.  Don't wait outside assuming there is a line. 

The staff are very nice and patient. They have many flavors, quite a few unique ones. I recommend the black walnut if you prefer mind sweet. My husband got the Kahlua Mocha Cream which was also amazing. We definitely will come back.
author: YJ L.

description: On my trip to San fran I wanted to try this place out but it was closed due to renovation so I came the next day and this place is worth that one day wait my group had to do. Very creative flavors and very affordable.
author: Sean P.

description: Amazing Banana ice cream!!!!! Whenever I'm in California I make it an absolute must to come and get some delicious ice cream!!!! I just wish they were in Texas!!!
author: Private I.

description:
Mitchell's has more ice cream flavors than Baskin Robbins, four cases worth, over 40 flavors from traditional (chocolate, rocky road, strawberry, vanilla), their famous tropical flavors (halo halo, ube, macapuno), sorbets and sherbet. Plus there have smoothies, sundaes, milkshakes, ice cream sandwiches, ice cream cakes, and more.

Junior ($1.80)/ Single ($2.80)/ Double ($4.85)/ Triple ($7.05)

* Buko - has small pieces of young coconut and it tastes like coconut milk, too sticky and sweet 
* Lucuma - lucuma is a Peruvian fruit and the ice cream tastes like caramel, interesting
* Ginger snap - it has bits of ginger, strong flavor but not smooth 

The ice cream texture was creamy but not firm enough for me.
author: Lolia S.

description: Comparing price with any other ice cream shop I can say this place is average. I love pistachio and their pistachio ice cream blended with real pistachio. And don't forgot to get the number before you get in line :)
author: bahri d.

description:
My friends told me this place has some really
bomb ice cream and I was dang right excited to check this place out! I came here around 10ish at night and this place was still popping. Good thing thing the wait wasn't too long. The wait was definitely worth it. I love how they have a ticket/call number system because it's dang right efficient. 

Anywho..they have so many flavors to choose from! You can get like the basic, typical ice cream flavors or be spontaneous and try something different compared to normal ice cream shops. They have halo halo, ube, cantaloupe, buko (baby coconu) , Peruvian fruit, etc. I had a hard time deciding on what ice cream flavor I wanted. Since I have always wanted to try halo halo and they usually don't have this in Sac..why not? Halo halo ice cream was creamy and not too sweet. It also had some pineapple bits and other bitty goodness. I should've gotten a full single scoop instead of a junior scoop. Regrets oh regrets :( As for their pricing, it's pretty decent and reasonable. Not too expensive or cheap. A junior scoop is $2.60 and a single scoop is $3.60. Don't get their junior scoop cause it'll leave you wanting more lol. Next time I wanna try all of their flavors when I'm back in SF again. Looking forward to trying their toasted almond, avocado, and ube next time (let's see if it lives up to the reviews..probably ^.^) oh yeah and there was this cute work dude lol
author: Kathleen N.

description:
Mitchell's came highly recommended and did not disappoint.

Ten bucks is more than I wanted to spend on two cones of ice cream, but after just a few licks I was not longer concerned. Their ice cream is smooth and rich in ways that grocery-store ice cream can only dream about. They have many different kinds, all of which are very flavourful--from tropical fruits to thick chocolate concoctions to unexpected offbeat treats like horchata.

The one drawback of Mitchell's is the lineup. If you come during prime ice-cream time on a hot day you should expect to wait upwards of 20 minutes before being served. Don't forget to take a number (just on the left as you enter the door) and listen carefully for them to call it: they'll skip over your number pretty quickly if you're not there.

There is some free parking out back and some on the street in front of the shop, but during busy times finding a spot may be impossible.
author: Daniel P.

description:
The best ice cream EVER!!!

You'll understand why there's always a crowd outside. The employees do a great job in keeping the lines moving. Make sure to get a number first and then decide on what you want to get. 

My go-to flavor is rocky road. So creamy and tasty!! I LOVE how they use walnuts instead of almonds. Kinda reminds me of brownies. =)

Whatever flavor you chose, you won't be disappointed!!!
author: Mimie L.

description: My first trip to SF and my coworker told me we had to go to his favorite ice cream shop, Mitchell's.  This was just like how he described, homemade, fresh, great selection, and a good amount.  I had to get their avocado since you don't usually see that kind.  It was great!  I want some now!
author: Greg O.

description:
First thought, wow!

This place is quite nice for an ice-cream space! It's a little small and the parking lot is a trap, so I wouldn't park there. However, if you happen to find parking nearby in the residential areas, be in for a treat after a brief line. There's always a line here apparently and they go by a number system. I was waiting with two friends for about thirty minutes. 

Look at all of the flavors and try the ones you want! Don't be shy to get the sweet ones versus tropical ones. All are good. I ended up getting a waffle cone of tropical four, while I also got a chance to try the grasshopper from a friend.

The ice cream has great consistency, the right amount of slow-churned goodness, and is richly flavored. It melts perfectly and is sweet enough.

I highly recommend just grabbing your ice cream and going to enjoy it outside with everyone else. It's a great ambience where everyone's clearly smiling.
author: Davinci L.

description:
Without a doubt this is the best ice cream in San Francisco. You're not going to lose weight at this place with their decadent double cream offerings but it is a worthwhile guilty pleasure.

They have a more ice cream flavored than baskin robbins including a few unusual ones like taro. My favorite is coconut. They also have Mexican chocolate which is chocolate with cinnamon. If you are worried about the pounds, they have non fat options too, but you'll be missing out on the main reason for coming here.

Be prepared to wait in line on a hot summer night. If you want to purchase prepacked ice cream you can avoid the lines
author: Sara A.

description: I've been coming to Mitchell's my entire life and you can't get anything better than this! My all time favorite is the Mango, that flavor is so good and I can't seem to try anything else. I have tried other flavors of course and the Horchata is also very tasty. No matter if it's pouring outside or if it's super hot, there's always a little wait. That goes to show how good it is here.
author: Irma R.

description: All San Franciscans love this place!!!   Peruvian fruit.  Coco banana sundae and mitchells pre packaged is awesome.   Try them all and enjoy even if its cold
author: Manny S.

description: YUM!!! I was looking forward to have their halo-halo dessert topped with ube ice cream, but was disappointed when they told me that it's only available in the summer. But guess what?! they have halo-halo in ice cream form!!! So now I don't feel like i'm missing out! I built my own halo-halo by getting a scoop of halo-halo ice cream and topped that with another scoop of ube! and YUMMY!!! I love their ice cream consistency and exotic/creative flavors. I wish I could come here all the time, but I don't live in SF :( SF, don't take this for granted!!!!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Despite the crowds, Mitchell's always has great tasting ice cream. Definitely my favorite ice cream shop!
author: Alexis C.

description: so good I could cry. Been stopping by here for years now.  We've gotten cones and packed 1/2 gallons mostly. Fresh ice cream that's not a bad price $11 for the pre packed 1/2 gallons. Last batch I got was canteloupe. Mmmmm oops brain freeze. If your in SF you have to go here and bi-rite. Mitchell sells bulk at a friendlier price. Bi rite is good by the scoop/cup, a little more pricey.
author: Rebecca A.

description:
Very average ice cream in my opinion. It definitely was good, but I couldn't taste the difference between this place and say, Baskin Robbins. The ice cream is softer/meltier than what I would prefer. The flavor selection is also very normal, nothing that really piqued my interest. The cone was also not very good, just the average cone that you can buy in boxes at a grocery store. 

I think Mitchell's is the kind of classic ice cream joint that people grow up coming to and love, but I don't think I would go out of my way to come here when there are definitely other more unique and interesting ice cream places in SF.

Also, CASH ONLY (for purchases under $9)!
author: Christina L.

description:
They make the ice cream right on site with none of the garbage (diabetes-causing high fructose corn syrup, etc.) that you find in the store brands like Dreyers, Breyers, and other ice creams you thought were real UNTIL you looked at the ingredient labels.

Mitchell's makes their ice cream with real sugar and cream. I have tried others such as Cold Stone, Ben and Jerry's, Double Rainbow and Baskin Robins, and they don't hold a candle to Mitchell's, who even when giving you a single scoop will not just put the ice cream on top and leave empty air inside the cone, but will cram the cone full of ice cream before giving you the scoop on top!  Not a chain. Locally run and owned. The people you see standing in the line that goes out the door even on a cold, rainy day know that Mitchell's isn't just ice cream: It's BETTER than ice cream.

CORRECTION:  The address I entered for this is wrong.  I have it down as on Guererro St.  The real address is 688 San Jose Ave
San Francisco, CA 94110
author: Pablo J.

description: Coconut ice cream - really, really good!!  Establishment was very clean, there is a huge selection, and the counter help were friendly!
author: Maureen O.

description:
Great tasting ice cream. 
My first time having this kind of ice cream and I loved it. The Ube is one of my favorites along with the young coconut. Overall this is the best ice cream!
author: Juan C.

description: The owner contacted me about my experience and sent me a gift card as an apology. Now, THAT'S awesome customer service!!!! Thank you!
author: Rosa P.

description: Mitchell's is a San Francisco tradition.  Fresh, made from scratch and a wide array of flavors.  You can buy a cone or purchase prepacked 1/2 gallon tubs.  Depending on the time of day and time of year, the wait time can be long, but take a number and you won't be let down.  If you're in a hurray, buy the 1/2 Gallon tub and go to checkout for quicker entry/exit.  There's parking in the rear of the store, but you might have to wait for a spot to clear.
author: Frank D.

description: DOOD.  people are waiting at this place when they open at 11am.  Itz datttt good, but seriously.  Ice cream at 11am is pretty hilarious but people like this place so much.  It's a super tiny place so it behooves you to come early to avoid the rush.  I got to sample a few flavors that I haven't committed to in half-gallon form - mango, strawberry and maybe one other.  Everyone is really nice working there and they give LIBERAL scoops. My favorite ice cream evahhhh
author: Kyle I.

description:
Parking can be a hassle if it were busy, but we lucked out on parking like always. This was our 3rd to last stop on our SF Ice Cream tour. They have a lot of ice cream available and for first timers like us they were very nice to let us sample as much as we wanted. I was already sold on my first choice, which was the Halo Halo ice cream. I've had many versions before but this one nailed it. The consistency of the ice cream is well put together as well. I can only imagine this place one a busy day. 

I would try and sample as much as you can until you get sick of it, but who can get sick of ice cream?? I sure can't! Especially if it's that good.
author: Aryan O.

description:
Yes, there's food coloring and "natural flavors," but if you NEED ice cream and bi-rite is closed, this is a great place.  Giant waffle cone. towering ice cream, friendly ice cream scoopers.  They also have interesting tropical-type flavors that people seem to love, but I've never quite ventured that far.  

Take a number when you walk in the door (it's on your left as you walk in)!
author: Amy M.

description: The purple yam is really yummy! Its color is also very bright and although the taste of the yam was not as strong as I had expected, it went down really well. And they give HUGE scoops! They also have a huge variety of flavors, much more than possibly any ice cream store in San Francisco. I tried the Thai iced tea and avocado ice cream as well. The avocado was a little too creamy for my liking and slightly on the heavy side - one teaspoon was ok but I doubt I would have been able to stomach a full cone. The Thai iced tea was pretty normal like what you would expect.
author: Annie Z.

description: This is the old-fashioned stuff, not gelato-style, and no bizarre flavors. When you're craving Bi-Rite but just can't hang with the long line, you'll find a tasty and satisfying alternative here. Differrent style than Bi-Rite, but we were treated like gold, even sampled nearly a dozen flavors, all presented in metal spoons that won't end up in a landfill anytime soon.
author: John H.

description: I found the Avocado ice cream interesting but the French Vanilla Custard ice cream was extremely pleasing to my soul (and I'm generally not a vanilla fan).....the staff was very accommodating with my request to sample various flavors, I appreciate that as I was undecided when I walked in.  I'll come back just for the Vanilla Custard!
author: Blake J.

description: Ice cream tastes so good! Try their Halo-Halo with ube ice cream its to die for! Open late but parking is challenging.  They have a small parking area in the back of the building however they have so many customers! Just goes to show how good the ice cream is.
author: Maria D.

description: There's always a huge line, but it's totally worth it.. I love their mango, ube and Kahlua mocha cream ice creams!!
author: Juvy M.

description: My favorite ice cream spot! So many delicious and unique flavors that I usually end up getting two
author: libby a.

description:
It's been a little over 20 years and I'm still a fan of the quality and flavor of Mitchell's ice cream.  I may have made myself sound a little older there.. But that's just to emphasize that I'm only 24 and I've been spoiled with good ice cream my whole life.

My favorite flavor is Ube (Purple Yam).  I can get a little selfish when it comes to my half gallon of Ube ice cream in the freezer.  Their other flavors are really good too.

Word of caution:  it can get really crowded here.  There's a small parking lot that can accommodate about 10 cars or so.  If you plan to drop by toward the afternoon (weekday or weekend) and are in a rush, it would be better to bring someone along to stay in the car while getting ice cream.  Also, they call out to waiting customers on a number system.  There's a separate line for people who are just picking up prepackaged ice cream to save them time.

One last thought:  It's worth noting that Mitchell's Ice Cream was voted #1 by Lonely Planet.  Their awards hang all over their store.
http://www.lonelyplanet.com/usa/san-francisco/restaurants/ice-cream/mitchell-ice-cream
author: Krystal Nina L.

description:
My husband and I left there about 10 minutes ago with nothing in hand. The reason being is that he ordered a sundae that actually comes as a shake flavor. He just wanted the ice cream with the toppings. They said no problem but they wouldn't put the graham crackers on it. Well, if you can put them in a shake then why not a sundae?

We go there weekly and love the place but will no longer visit or buy their products. Maybe $100-$150 a month loss in business won't hurt them but we believe in customer service and will not frequent  any place that does not provide it.
author: michelle b.

description:
Favorite ice cream joint ever! I used to only order the Lucuma (Peruvian fruit) but one time i decided to try the LangKa (Jackfruit) flavor. HOLY MOLY, HOLY MOLY again, it was so crisp and refreshing. Hands down my new fav.  The ice cream texture at Mitchell's is firmer than, say, Rick's in Palo Alto or Smitten's, and that's a GREAT thing. I should totally splurge and buy a half gallon next time I get to go.

The location is kind of out there and parking's usually impossible to find, but somehow people find a way to get their hands on the deliciousness.
author: Jackie L.

description:
We thought we'd try exotic so we went for the Lucuma, a subtropical fruit native to the Andean valleys of Peru - -it was pretty good. I like the texture of their ice cream, slightly more so than Bi Rite.

We also tried the avocado, which was meh, so so. We should have stuck with the basics.

The service here was very nice and friendly -- we didn't experience the rudeness and attitude that other Yelpers speak of. But it is true that it gets really crowded but things move quickly and they seem pretty organized.

We can't wait to come back!
author: Randy S.

description:
If there was any extremely over hyped ice cream parlor in San Francisco, Mitchell's would be on that list. The lines are long, classic flavors don't stand out from the rest and to top it all of, the price can get hefty.

At all times of the day, even before closing, this place has people crawling from all over to grab a quick scoop. Luckily, there's a number ticket system so there bit actually a line per say. Servers are nice and accommodating.

I decided to get a cookie and cream with a chocolate scoop on top. The chocolate was a bit bitter which was nice, but was lacking the nice creaminess from chocolate that I wanted. The cookie and cream tasted alright, but I've had better elsewhere.

There's a parking lot outside which tend to be full most of the time, so street parking or double park if you've got a buddy to gran a quick one. Minimum for cards is 9 bucks.
author: George Z.

description: Stopped here after dinner at Lavish.  A little bit of a wait but that was OK.  Tried a few different flavors and finally settled on what we wanted, yum!!!!  There was never any pressure to hurry up and make a decision.  The young man that helped us acted like we were the only person in the store.  Great product and even better customer service!!!!
author: Samantha H.

description:
I died. Revived myself some how, took another bite, and died again. Please sit before taking your first lick.

The Horchata Ice cream tastes like an ooey-gooey cinnamon bun! And no, I don't mean the flavor recalls cinnamon bun-esque tastes... I mean if the texture wasn't iced creamy heaven, you wouldn't know it wasn't an ACTUAL, PERFECT, cinnamon bun within your clenches. 
Same goes for the Cantaloupe. Man... Please sit before eating... I cant stress this enough. It tasted like you grabbed a super ripe, sweet, refreshing cantaloupe, waved a magic wand over it, and changed its composition to ice cream. It was just everything.

While there, I taste-tested 29.5 flavors, lol so I could go on about their utter and total epicness, but I'll just say, 
DON'T WALK, RUN. Get there!!
author: Awesomeness S.

description: Ordered the chocolate chip cookie sandwich with horchata Ice Cream. It was delicious. The ordering system is a bit weird though, pick a number, wait to be called,then when the next person is called your packed like sardines.
author: Kam H.

description: Been going there for years. I love that it is still family owned and I hope it stays forever. I love all their flavors but my favorite is strawberries and cream. AWESOMENESS
author: Mercedes M.

description:
Excellent quality ice cream makes me absolutely ecstatic. And Mitchell's provides just that. 16% butterfat base? Yes, please. My most recent encounter with this fat-tastic dessert was actually in the form of a gift from one of Jon A.'s friends. She thoughtfully brought over a half gallon bucket of cantaloupe ice cream as a housewarming gift. It may not have warmed up the house, but I savored every cold bite with a big smile on my face. In fact, before I started on a several-month diet, I stuffed my face with as much of the contents of this half-gallon bucket as possible lest I be caught cheating on my diet after I started.

The verdict: I must return to try their other offerings (e.g., ice cream sandwiches). Mitchell's, you have won my heart although I grew up in Texas with some pretty darn good Blue Bell.
author: Tiff T.

description:
AN INCOMPARABLE SAN FRANCISCO INSTITUTION!!!  Rich, delicious, hand-crafted ice cream, as well as sundaes, splits, and ice cream cakes. An incredible array of flavors, too.

Downsides?  Kinda pricey, but quality always is. And, of course, the place is always jammed, with a line going out the door.  Parking SUCKS, too.  So don't expect to just get in and get out fast unless MAYBE if you are buying prepacked ice cream from the freezer, which is also a great idea too!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
author: Samuel B.

description: I love coming here for ice cream! They have a wide variety of flavors. They also offer shakes and ice cream sandwiches. The prices are fairly reasonable, just a little expensive since it is in San Francisco. But definitely worth it. The line can get really long and a nice day. But the line goes by pretty quick. DONT FORGET TO GRAB A NUMBER! I always order the Kahlua Mocha Cream dipped in chocolate and topped with almonds on a waffle cone. DELICIOUS!
author: Jadelann J.

description: Not too shabby. Its not the cheapest nor the fanciest, but its the ice cream that we all get as nostalgia of true SF natives. The junior scoop (smallest) is $2.20 and mine was a tropical four flavor. I don't suggest this place if you are on a diet as Dr. Atkins may rise up from his tomb and strangle you.
author: R C.

description: This is my favorite place to grab a milkshake. The staff is very friendly and helpful when it comes to choosing a flavor of ice cream for the milkshake. It is always crowded, so there may be a wait, but it is definitely worth it. I suggest the grasshopper pie milkshake because it is to die for. Despite the crowds of people, the staff members always take the time to make the milkshake the perfect consistency. I have never had a bad experience in the 27282 times I've been here. The only downside is finding parking, but hey it's SF. Hands down best ice cream flavors and milkshakes ever.
author: Miranda W.

description:
My favorite ice cream place. 
Lychee, Rum, Chessecake & Purple yum are all good

Make sure you ask for other flavors to try. 

Wish they have more branches. Its kind of far from where I work. 

You will want to eat their ice cream no matter is summer and winter.
author: Che K.

description: by far the best ice cream in San Francisco until this day. I can still taste the fresh oreo cookies in my mouth with the silky rich ice cream vanilla flavor. I recommend this place to anyone visiting SF. Hot or Cold this ice cream will put a smile on your face.
author: Ceverino R.

description:
-.5 star for its popularity/the long wait - unfair, I know, and -.5 for the fact that I was given the wrong ice cream but didn't realize it until after we left.

Otherwise this place is great and really fun. Typical old school ice cream shop. For all the noobs out there - TAKE A NUMBER when you get there. Also, if you somehow find a lower number either - leave it, OR, do not give it to people who JUST arrived...this happened to us, a couple found a lower number somehow, and gave it to two people who had gotten there waaaaaaaay after my husband and I did. They were in and out in like, 5 minutes. Though, I can't say I wouldn't accept if I were them. Just annoying.

Grasshopper pie 4ever.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Quick question, if an ice cream shop has been around in San Francisco for 60 years it must be mind blowing, right? Well since you're most likely a logical person you would probably respond wit ha resounding, YES. Then you may start reminiscing of fond childhood memories chasing your neighborhood's ice cream truck, and telling yourself that they have the most delicious ice cream in the world would be absolutely the furthest from the truth. Unlike that naive and innocent opinion you once held for your local ice cream cone, I'm happy to tell you Mitchell's does in fact lovingly make and serve goose bump inducing, bliss filled ice cream. You know, the way ice cream was made generations ago. Made with 16% butterfat cream unlike the reduced fat, low fat, lightly whipped stuff that litters your grocery store's ice cream section. This makes for an extremely rich, buttery, and decadent ice cream that slowly and almost sensually coats your tongue and slides down with a grace and sweetness you probably have never experienced with another brand of ice cream.
On this typical SF evening(chilly with fog rolling in), I had the sincere privilege of tasting their popular Ube(Yam), Buko(baby coconut), Kahlua and Coffee flavors; And you can bet that precious rare coin or comic book you once guarded with your life, that I will be back for more "I scream, you scream, we all scream for(Mitchell's) ice cream."
author: Dennis W.

description:
Came here last night, on Christmas Eve about an hour before they closed.

Pistachio ice cream is amazingly amazinggggggggggggggg. 

I tried some of the Ube ice cream too and that was super yummy - very light and fluffy and creamy. Delicious.

The best thing about this place is the ticket system - you grab a number and they call you up to order. No need to really get in line.

And they have a separate line for buying half gallon sizes of their ice cream. Even better.

I wish they would serve green tea as an ice cream option - it's only an option for the half gallon size so it can be quite a turn off for this place. 

There IS a lot located behind this place - definitely take a look around for parking.
author: Susan Y.

description:
A lot of people like Mitchell's ice cream, but I am not a fan because it is:

1 star off: too rich
1 star off: too sweet
1 star off: too crowded

They do have some very unique flavors like purple yam (ube), (jackfruit (langka), and 3 different types of coconut (regular coconut, buko, macapuno).  Really?  There are 3 different types of coconut?  They all taste the same to me: rich, sweet, and crowded.
author: Ally W.

description:
If you have to pull a number like you're at the meat market to get ice cream you know this place is good. 

If you are number 73 and they are only at number 25 you know that you have to wait because it's worth it. 

If it's raining and it's more crowded than usual you know this is the best place to get ice cream in San Francisco. 

I only have one check in because i always forget to check in because I'm to busy drooling over all the flavors. 
Enough said!!!!
author: Ann C.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is the best for one ice cream: UBE. If you all don't know, ube is a type of purple yam that is popular in the Philippines and when put into ice cream, it is VERY delicious. I come back to this place during breaks to get a tub of ube ice cream because my entire family loves it! However, it is worth noting that this place can get very busy on certain times of the day. Fortunately, the line goes super fast and there is an express line for customers to purchase pre-packaged tubs of ice cream. 

For other flavors, I tried the New York Cherry, Lucuma, Avocado, and Mexican Chocolate. I personally liked all of these flavors, but my personal favorite is still ube. I also tried the Halo-Halo in a cup, which I personally have mixed feeling about. The mix of different texture is great, but I personally didn't like the jellies and nuts that I had to chew on while eating the ice and ube ice cream. Maybe I will try it again and give another review, but for now, Halo-Halo is not my thing.

Overall, amazing ice cream!! Highly recommended!! ^_^
author: Nathan C.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said..., so just go and check it out if you haven't already. This is almost a SF landmark. Unique flavors and quality ice cream. My only suggestion is to remember to get it chocolate dipped!

Go off the diet and enjoy!
author: Alex A.

description:
Mitchell's is awesome ice cream. No air in it. It's delicious, creamy, and the flavors are wonderful. 

For newbies: Okay here is the rule of Mitchell's. If your number is 60 and they are on 34 wait your ass outside. Quit blocking the counter. Move and let the rest of us, who been here 20 mins already, get up there. Damn. IJS

It you are coming to town definitely make this one of your stops.
author: Bethtina W.

description: Love Mitchell's ice cream especially their Pinoy flavors such as halo halo, macapuno, and ube.  I'm glad they sell it at the grocery stores but if you're in the area, it's worth it to stop by their store and try other flavors.
author: Carmen M.

description:
OREO E O E OOOOO
And mint. Oh glorious mint.
What angel in heaven dreamt this wonderful combination!?
Sound the trumpets I've died and entered the pearly gates.
author: Naomi S.

description:
If you are offended easily by lewd comments, abstain from reading this review.   I have heard about Mitchell's, Bi Rite and Humphrey Slocombe as being the ice cream trifecta in the Bay Area.  I have tried Bi Rite, line and all, and thought it tasted like ice cream, definitely wouldn't stand in line for it again.  I tried Humphrey Slocombe and really enjoyed the creativity of flavors.  Tonight, I drove by Mitchell's and stopped because there was a very short line.  

And...I had a tongue-gasm. I don't know if I was just "in the mood" or if it was as good as it felt, but if I had testicles, they would have been trying to pole vault into my mouth to see what all the fuss was about.  

My flavors.  I had two junior scoops, one of a chocolate, caramel crunch and the other avocado, all in a scrumptious chocolate dipped sprinkle waffle cone.  I wasn't sure about the flavor combination at first, but here was the experience.  On top, a chocolatey sin of rich and creamy, yet playfully textured bliss.  As I lapped up the first scoop, I soon began to experience a new flavor, which somehow enhanced the chocolate/caramel extravaganza.  The avocado actually had a flavor of fresh flour, water, butter and sugar, eg. homemade cookie dough, and it went fantastic with the chocolate.  Before long, the chocolate had completely disappeared and I was left with the subtle, yet decadent avocado all by itself.  Very soon after, the entire ice-cream-waffle-cone orgy was resting contentedly in my belly. 

I may drive back tomorrow to see if this was all just really good timing, or if Mitchell's is that good.

And by the way, I got 2 junior scoops in waffle cone, as mentioned, and my husband got a single scoop of pistachio.  I asked him how his was and he ignored me.  I guess he was mesmerized as well.  Altogether, the cost was $9.
author: Tyler B.

description:
Wow this place is popular! We were lucky enough to snag a space right in front of the small store. I think the fact they use a number system is incredibly efficient and makes the crowds a lot less daunting. False sense of order I guess, haha. They have a great mix of classic and different flavors including Filipino ones! (Say what?) The scoops are pretty big and the prices reasonable. 

Mexican chocolate - believe the hype, it's Yummmm
Kahlua - pass. Very light mocha flavor that was it
author: Stephie D.

description: What can I say.... I've been coming here since I could remember.  My folks and all 5 of us siblings would always come here after a drive in movie at Geneva Drive in, yup that long ago.  We would also come here for any birthday party celebration.  Two 1/2 gallons of Ube and Mango, or Langka and Macupuno.  Always a different combo but every time always excellent.  Now both my parents have passed and I've been taking my daughter here as a tradition as well.  I would never stop coming here and I pray they never go away.
author: Kathy C.

description:
Its alrightttttt....

Finally had a chance to try this place out and I wasn't that impressed to be honest. Maybe I have to try other flavors but I had the Mocha Crunch or something and it had not crunch.....at all. =( We came on a Saturday afternoon, beautiful day and not that busy. I hope to give it another try and maybe try their UBE. Sighhh. I love ice-cream.
author: Chantal Noelle T.

description: If i wasn't on a diet (yes I cheated for Mitchell's Ice Cream), I would come here all the time. My girl brought me to this place and it was crazy good. We both had the coconut pineapple scoop. Dayyyyyummm!  So good. I'll be back. No question.
author: Steve J.

description:
8/15/12
Nobody does ice-cream like Mitchell. Always creamy and delicious. I come here for their tropical flavors, especially the buko (baby coconut) and mango on a waffle cone. You can taste slivers of coconut in that ice cream. 

Tips: Take a number. Be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes if you come on weekends.
author: Matt Y.

description: It's our favorite neighborhood spot. The ice cream is deliciously creamy and their milkshakes are massive. Favorite flavors include: banana, Oreo, black walnut, rocky road, mocha espresso and chocolate Carmel crackle.
author: Sheryl W.

description:
I've only actually been to Mitchell's once in 2006, and I can tell you that their ice cream is good... Really good. It's nice to see that even in these days of gentrification and $4000 efficiency studios a local institution can still not only survive, but thrive. Recently, however, I've moved in down the street, so now I can tell you a good deal more about them.

Regardless of time of day or weather conditions, there are always between 35 and 60 people milling about on the sidewalk outside of Mitchell's. I've come to the conclusion that Mitchell's must pay these people salaries because there is no way that all of these people can possibly always want ice cream.

Numbered among the constant Mitchell's congregation are roughly 20 to 50 seemingly unattended children, leading me to another theory that Mitchell's is secretly a front for research on tiny, sugar-addled zombies. These children are generally dripping with the exact color of ice cream that will indelibly stain whatever clothes you're wearing when they run into you since their parents are nowhere to be found and it's not like they're watching where they're going (...or are they??). Passers-by should avoid confronting this mob at all costs by crossing to the other side of San Jose Avenue well in advance. If you're actually going here, don't wear anything you don't want coated in child-drool ice cream, because that shit won't come out.

Mitchell's DOES technically have a parking lot, which is nice if you're into that sort of thing. This, coupled with its close proximity to freeway access attracts hordes of people from not-San-Francisco who don't actually know how to drive their hulking SUV-yachts in the City.

"Parking lot" might be somewhat misleading, as it's really only two or three parking spaces (it's hard to tell, since suburban SUVs don't tend to recognize the sovereignty of parking lines and routinely take up 2-5 spaces each). 

There is ALWAYS a traffic fuckup on the streets outside. Drivers will line up 10-deep to wait for a spot. They unpredictably shift lanes. They stop unexpectedly for no actual reason. They will resent you for honking to let them know they're driving like stoned assholes. They will make you upset if you're driving and actually have somewhere to be.

Mitchell's is much more than an ice cream shop. It's a laboratory of failed urban planning. It's a demonstration of how chaos theory applies to groups of people. It's a writhing hub of humanity. It's admittedly really fucking good.

Seriously, though... don't come here unless you've got an hour and a half to wait for a scoop and have all of your shots, and if you do, please don't drive.
author: Nick S.

description:
Came here for the Ube Ice Cream featured on the 7x7 Big Eats. http://www.7x7.com/big-eat-2012-photos#/91

Honestly, what is the hype around this place?! It's so hard to find parking, and when you finally park, you're greeted by a huge line to get served.

We got the Tropical Four (mango, guava, banana and pineapple) and the Ube (purple yam). The flavors were too creamy and not pungent enough. I ended up throwing it away because I couldn't eat it.

Maybe I tried the wrong flavors, but they're supposed to be known for their Ube!
author: Ava S.

description:
I love me some ice cream, so I was like a five year old coming into the store, all antsy and excited for some creamy goodness!

The FIRST thing you must do when you enter the store is to grab a number. I waited about 30 minutes for my turn (it was a weeknight too!), but I utilized my idle time wisely by checking out all the flavors. The flavors are listed on the board behind the ice cream, but I also had time to checked out the ice cream itself in the freezer. By the time my number was called, I knew exactly which flavors I wanted to try out to make things more efficient.

They let me try three different flavors, and I ended up getting the langka. I mean, when am I EVER going to get Jackfruit for an ice cream flavor ever again?? The ice cream was very creamy -- it reminded me of Fenton's ice cream. The jackfruit was a nice subtle flavor that intensified the more I ate it. There's even little cubes of jackfruit imbedded in the ice cream!

Although langka is a unique flavor, I didn't feel like the ice cream itself was that impressive. 

Was it smooth? Yes. 
Was it creamy? Yes. 
But was it so special to be in line for 30 minutes? No. 

My friend got the grasshopper pie (peppermint ice cream with chocolate chips, Oreos, and fudge) and caramel praline. I liked how the peppermint didn't taste like Colgate and wasn't overly minty, but there was too much fudge and made everything very sticky and gooey.

All the ice cream felt like ice cream I can get at any other creamery/diner, and the rest of the flavors weren't too original that I can't find anywhere else.

Tips:
- Again, first get a number when you step into the store!
- There is about only 10 parking spots behind Mitchell's, so look into street parking!
author: Evelyn S.

description:
So many unique flavors my favorite and my family is Tropical 4 good combination , creamy ,tropical good to have it at any time, any day. 
Best ice cream in San Francisco , awesome customers service. 
Come early to avoid waiting but I'm telling you if you have to wait is worth it.
author: Sandra Z.

description: Not sure what else to say other than what has previously been said, so I won't even bother. All I know is that two scoops with grasshopper pie and claire's pie is the most heavenly combination. Definitely took advantage of the samples with the lady so I totally experienced many of the flavors that everyone is talking about. Yes there was a tad bit of a wait, but what else do you expect at an amazing ice cream shop in SF on 420? Anyways, the ice cream is so delicious to the very last drop, so totally worth every minute waiting in line.
author: Cristal C.

description: Really awesome flavors! A lot of them are Filipino inspired flavors. The only downside to this place is that it is kind of small. There is no big seating area to chill, just a bench outside the small shop.
author: Tami N.

description: Crazy line 40min before closing! The counter was at 00 and I was number 23. We actually didn't have to wait too long and the ice cream was bomb!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Even if the line is out the door, they're pretty fast & WELL worth it.  
Love all the different flavors.  Love that they trey to stay seasonal. GREAT prices, especially in the city.  Love this place.  
Do wish they had a better selection of non dairy options
author: Kathie C.

description: They have so many flavors to choose from. I would love to go back and try their ice cream sandwiches and seasonal flavors, looks delish!
author: Ashlie A.

description:
Hands down, Mitchell's Ice Cream has the best mango ice cream on the planet!  Their ice cream combines the perfect mango flavor along with a delicious creaminess.  With that said, all of Mitchell's tropical flavors are amazing including their ube and macapuno!

Mitchell's sells everything from waffle sundaes to ice cream cakes to take-home pints of ice cream sitting in their freezer cases.  

As previous yelpers have mentioned, parking here sucks and lines are often long but regardless, Mitchell's is a must try ice cream shop that will have you coming back for more!
author: Maya S.

description:
I know I say this a lot...but I think I found my new husband...and he comes in the form of French Vanilla ice cream with fresh mangoes in the summer (I can't have a summertime only hubby?) This place is an SF staple, local favorite, and definitely well worth the wait.  

We went around 4pm on a Sunday afternoon and it wasn't that bad. I was with my Mini-me so we tend to react the same way to certain things. As we waited in line, we got even more excited as the numbers started getting closer to us. Finally when they called our number, it's like we won the lottery. 

The ice cream men there were super nice. They completely understood our first-time enthusiasm and let us try many flavors. They have a lot of tropical flavors like Ube and halo halo. I swear I think they get the mangoes from the Philippines. They also have gallons of ice cream to purchase and you don't have to wait in the long line. 

If you're a plain Jane like me when it comes to your ice cream, then you'll love the french vanilla with fresh mangoes. Oh man...orgasmic!
author: Leena B.

description:
I think Mitchell's gets all of its customers from their eclectic flavors.

It's true, they're exotic and special but I would rather they compact down the flavors and really perfect each one to its taste. The ice cream is good but nothing is spectacular, nothing is crazy delicious and not entirely worth the insane parking and lines if you hit this place up at the wrong time.

All in all, I would try this San Franciscan favorite but you'll know why I'm sharing with you that it's mostly hype once you're there.
author: Winè C.

description:
Ben helped us out and he was very very nice. We didn't know what to get so we kinda spent a lot of time just looking and tasting a few. When the store became busy he calmly maintained our spot.

Aside from that, the ice cream is very very delicious.
author: Ken L.

description:
Ah, has the ghost of Ronald Reagan been here? Gee, does anybody remember his classic line in Berlin back at the bitter end of the Cold War ..."Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!" Well, I think he's been to Mitchell's Ice Cream as I just discovered that they removed their bulletproof glass, as much a signature for them as their ice cream. Now it looks more like a neighborhood parlor, but I was kinda wondering if the young scoopers were feeling just a tad more vulnerable. After all, you never know when an angry woman, the object of ridicule at Weight Watchers, will lunge at them for not having enough jimmies on her sundae. 

I have to admit I haven't been to Mitchell's in a while since I have been carrying on with adulterous one-cup stands at Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe. But you can go home again and be forgiven, right Mitchell's? It was as crowded as ever despite the nippiness in the air (and I'm not talking about me being the nip either). Jamie W. and I waited about twenty minutes before we could get our respective $2.65 double-junior cones. I went for my old standby, Macapuno (sweet coconut), simply because I've missed that tropical flavor in my life, and a new flavor, Sweet 'n Salty Peanut. Not quite the savory sensation that Bi-Rite's Salted Caramel is but a nice try. 

ICE CREAM - 4 stars...still good stuff for the old-fashioned parlor-style kind 
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...much better without the foreboding barrier..."Mr. Mitchell, tear down this bulletproof glass!" 
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...the lack of glass makes the scooper more accessible 
TOTAL - 4 stars...still a solid four when it comes to getting a creamy dairy fix
author: Ed U.

description:
I'm a born and bred City girl and am just getting around to trying out Mitchell's now??  Oh, what I've been missing all these years!

I stopped by in the late afternoon and found open parking spaces in their small lot in back!  Woo hoo!  If you know the area, you know this is a small victory.  There was a small line, but this really nice woman decides not to use her numbered ticket and hands it to me.  I look at the ticket and notice that it says "48".  They are on customer "46".  Life is good!  There is only one small problem - I needed more time to peruse the menu!   Of course, my number gets called right away and I'm trying to stall but the pressure is on.  There are people waiting in line!  

I end up ordering two scoops, the buko (baby coconut) and the lilikoi mango swirl.  Just for kicks I ask for a sample of the ube (who can resist bright purple ice cream!).  What can I say, I miss the flavors of Hawaii.  The ice cream is smooth and creamy without being overly dense or sweet.  The flavors of the various fruits are quite pronounced.  It's quite apparent that quality ingredients are used.  No gimmicks, no shortcuts.

The team of scoopers work hard and work fast, all with smiles on their faces. 

These folks have been in business for a really long time and are a San Francisco institution.  After all these years, there is still a long line out the door.  Much praise to them for developing unique and unusual flavors that appeal to the various ethnic groups that make up the melting pot that is SF.
author: Melissa L.

description: Their ice cream is good and the price is great. Ive been here once and got a cookie and cream flavor. The shop has a serving structure pretty cool.
author: Linh C.

description: Just went for my first time a out two weeks ago.  It was so delicious!!  I tried the coconut pineapple ice cream and the coconut lychee sorbet!  So refreshing and tasty..  I must go back to try more flavors!
author: Nicole R.

description:
You know a place is popping when the line goes way out the door. Personally, I hate waiting in line even if it is THAT good. To avoid congestion inside the small shop, you pick up a number and wait till you are called. They have a ton of flavors, many of which are super unique.

I ended up getting a small scoop of Ube. Apparently it's pretty popular but to be honest, I wasn't super wowed by it. Texture was creamy and delicious like most ice cream should be.

I love the oreo milkshake! You can tell it's very tedious to make because they kept filling it up with more oreos and ice cream and crushing it down to make it super compact. If you get a milk shake, please give your server a tip. It's hard work yo.
author: Desmond T.

description:
BEWARE AND CHECK YOUR RECEIPT BEFORE YOU LEAVE. My mistake was that I didn't. My cashier, Mike, overcharged me $2 for what I ordered. I had a junior scoop of toasted almond, junior scoop of avocado on a cone, and single scoop of Grasshopper Pie on a waffle cone with a chocolate dipping. He charged me respectively $3.60, $3.80, and $4.80. I was upset because I got two TEENSY TINY JUNIOR SCOOPS and was charged for SINGLE SCOOPS. My total was only supposed to be $10.20. I was about to tip them, but thankfully I didn't. 

But on a side note, the ice cream itself is pretty yummy and unique. My favorites are the Kahlua Mocha Cream, Avocado, and Grasshopper Pie.
author: Terri H.

description:
In a city with so many food options, there isn't enough time in the world to visit places more than once, since there are always new places to try.  However, Mitchell's is one of those places that warrant multiple visits.

My favorite flavors are 1.) peanut butter indulgence and 2.) banana.  I usually get the scoop in a sugar cone.  When I feel like being particularly decadent, I get waffle cone .  If I'm feeling gluttonous, I get a double scoop, waffle cone, dipped in chocolate.

As mentioned in other reviews, you will be in for a long wait, but this is a place that should be tried once.  Then remember to sample the flavors you think you'll like, because it would be a shame to get a flavor you don't like after waiting so long for your ice cream.

So go, be happy, and be gluttonous!
author: Nadeem A.

description:
Rocky road ice cream from a San Francisco classic. 

Posted here in front of the store waiting for it to open since I'm in the neighborhood. 

Worth the wait.. Only 7 more minutes. :D

Since it is breakfast time, had to take in a scoop of Tropical 4 Flavor with a waffle cone. Forget the syrup... 

Next up.. Coffee!
author: Chris D.

description:
I previously gave Mitchell's a 5-star rating but after my trip last night I must subtract a star.  

Here are their latest prices:
Junior: $2.20
Single: $3.20
Double: $5.20
Triple: $7.20

+$0.20 for sugar cone
+$0.50 for waffle cone

You are only allowed to get one flavor if you order a Single, so if you want 2 flavors you are forced into paying for a Double, which is 2 heaping scoops.  At most places in SF a Double costs more like $4-4.25 and although their scoops are smaller, these portions are perfect for most people who simply want dessert after a meal.  I am saddened by the fact that Mitchell's intentionally takes advantage of the fact that their customers want variety and charges a whopping $5.20 for it.  And it doesn't make up for it if, for that price, you give me more ice cream than I can comfortably eat.  

So bottom line, Mitchell's Junior and Single scoops are is great if you are OK with only one flavor, however beware, because the Double is their way of purposefully ripping you off.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Omg I cannot recommend the French vanilla custard enough!!! Run here. Their flavors are delicious!
author: Lynda T.

description:
Vanilla ice cream with swirls of passion fruit and mango sorbet sandwiched between 2 chewy lemon sugar cookies- 
H E L L O - I ' L L  H A V E  A N O T H E R - S O  Y U M M Y ! ! ! !
author: Ursula U.

description: Started coming to Mitchell's when I was 5 years old and always loved it.  The best ice cream ever!  Now in my mid-40s and with all the gentrification, the ambiance and quality just isn't the same.  Still best ice cream spot that I know of.  Mango and toasted almond are my faves and can't beat the chocolate dip!
author: Imelda H.

description: Halo-halo and ube!!!! Long lines but worth it. Come in mid afternoon during the week and there's no line. Cookie Monster looks good too.
author: Ben L.

description:
Really great ice cream. Very unique flavors, and they're also PACKED with goodness. Their grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with fudge and oreos) has a TON of oreos, unlike a lot of other ice cream places that skimp out on them.
Every flavor I tried has been good, and the prices are really reasonable, in my opinion. About 4 dollars each!
author: Azinda M.

description:
Came here on Sunday evening, it's pretty busy as usual. Been coming here for years it is the BEST ice cream, lots of variety in flavors my two fave are Buko (baby coconut) and Avocado. Please do get a sample of both. 

I'd also like to give a shout out to NESTOR M. He has exceptional customer service, super friendly, and greets you with a smile! I know it's a number system but you will b so lucky to get served by him. He is the true meaning of Excellent customer service.
author: Vee N.

description:
A SF Institution!
I love the Grasshopper Pie.
Also, service is great here. We came after closing and they still let us in!
author: Angela D.

description:
Went to here before going to a friend's place with my girlfriend and another friend. This place has a really small lot for parking so you may have to park down a side street (shop is on a main street) and walk. What I like about this shop is that you grab a number and you can browse till they call you. You don't have to stay in a line. My girlfriend got the mango ice cream and I got a mango smoothie (mango ice cream with mango juice and mango chunks all blended). I must say this is one of the best ice cream places I've had. I am very happy with the service here. Clean and very professional staff. 

Must try? YES
Try again? ALWAYS!
author: Thomas N.

description: My favorite ice cream shop since I was knee high. I used to love coming here as a kid and almost always had a tub at home sitting in my freezer. My favorite flavor is definitely their mocha fudge but I personally get it w a scoop of oreo cookie dipped in chocolate in a waffle cone. Their portions are pretty generous so opt for the junior size if you're unsure about finishing. The line's usually the worst on weekend nights but they don't do too bad during the day unless we get one of those rare burning hot days in the city. Overall, good service, good quality ice cream and I never get tired of coming back :-)
author: Marice L.

description:
Home made ice cream. Made FRESH daily. I've been going licking their ice cream for over 30 years. The MANGO is the Bomb my favorite. 
But wait during the Holiday season they bust out with the EGG NOG ...to die for!
The milk shakes are thick and humi 
On a hot day or cold day its ON!
author: Roberto H.

description:
Out of sheer pricipality, I HAVE to write this review. 

#1) This review is YEARS over due as I've been eating Mitchell's since I was a kid
#2) I'm Filipino-American and this place straight up caters to my pallet with flavors such as Ube (OMG!!!), Halo-Halo (OMG runner up), and Macapuno (coconut) and Mango, Lanka,  Avocado (!!!!) and well you get the point even if you have no idea what I'm talking about.

Mitchells is so good coz they don't skimp on ingredients and they don't change the recipe. This is the CREAMIEST, DREAMIEST place I've ever had ice cream. Yeah, I live in Hawaii so of course I gotta get my fix somewhere else, but nothing compares to Mitchells. Period. 

Pros:
-Quality ingrediants; no fat free fake cream or corn fructose here!
-Dang everything here is friggin good.
-Pre-packaged cashier line so you can just run in an run out with a gallon or two or five (for reals)
-Avocado milk shake....sigh....i miss you

Cons:
-The lines can get super long no matter what time of day.
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Won't you take me to... YUMMY TOWN! Please take me to.... Mitchell's Now! (in the tune of funky town.. Duh! :)) 

Go! just stop reading and go! The best ice cream I have ever tasted! Therefore it MUST be the best! 

I loved the Espresso and the Thin Mint. But no seriously stop reading and go get in line son! take a number and get ready to have your tastebuds blown away! 


WARNING: Side affects include...and are limited to crying tears of joy, laughing hysterically, some have experienced extreme euphoria and should not operate heavy machinery while trying to eat this creamy sweet cold treat. You WILL become addicted and no other ice cream will compare. 

I'm jealous right now because I live in Portland Oregon and can't go just get in line like you can right now! So have an extra scoop for me would ya! :) I got my eye on Grasshopper Pie (Oreo in thin mint with brownies) i or something amazing like that.

ENJOY the little scoops of heaven! 

Here is a link to there flavors http://www.mitchellsicecream.com/mitchells_icflavors.html
author: Fiona W.

description: As an ice cream lover, I thoroughly enjoyed this place. Interesting diversity of flavors, especially tropical (including Halo Halo, which was amazing). Good prices. They have milkshakes and sell tubs of ice cream as well. It was quite crowded when I was there but that just goes to show how good it is.
author: Kevin H.

description:
This place is by far the best in flavored ice cream and not to mention the high standards they have in cleanliness.  You can't really get the local and freshness experience like you can get at Mitchells.  Not only do they offer two of my favorite flavored ice cream; peach and mango but the environment they promote is great for anyone from a child to elders.   My favorite part of Mitchell's Ice Cream is the fact that they work very hard to every single day to give you the fresh-ess made ice cream in San Francisco.   With Mitchells you are guaranteed fresh bites of ice cream every single time.

You MUST try!!!
author: Jo T.

description:
Im looking for ice cream around.
I ask some people around for good place without too many people they tell me about this place.

Ok there are a lot of people here but the employees work very very fast!!

And the taste, wowwwww
I take 5 flavors, one of them was the Oreo cookies one of them pistachio and they are the best..

A+++
author: Rose N.

description: Yum! Had Oreo cookie today, but the red fire flavor is also interesting and delicious! Hope to be back.
author: Erin Y.

description: Best halo halo. Today i tried the grasshoppet pie. Which is mint ice cream and oreo cookies with mint chocolate chip. Every flavor is so good. Give it a try. And enjoy!
author: Wynn N.

description:
Wow. 

Their ice cream is super rich and creamy.
Although I like lighter ice creams, this one was def. really good.
There weren't too many people, but I was lucky to get a number from a random person in line, so my number #21, became #11. :D heehee!! 
Unlike other reviewers, I did NOT like UBE. But there are so many flavors you can choose from, so i didn't mind. 
Ended up getting something cherry and was so good!
author: Sora B.

description:
Being one of those native San Franciscans, I grew up going to Mitchell's. 

It reminds me of the good ol' days of going there with my grandpa, ordering the Mango flavor on a sugar cone, dipped in the chocolate shell (because that's how he liked it and now how the whole family does) and sitting on the side of the building, because we couldn't wait to get home and it was much too messy for the car. 

I just can't wait to make sure that my nephew has the same experience and memories to last the rest of his life.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
We finally made it to Mitchell's. When we grab dinner at the Front Porch, we are always to full for dessert.

Today, we stopped in after a light brunch. The ice cream was perfectly creamy and rich. 

Can't wait to try more!
author: Marit S.

description: THE MACAPUNO IS THE BEST ICE CREAM EVER. This place is awesome. Takes a little ways to get out there from where I live in the city but totally worth it. Always seem to get the Macapuno (young coconut). All their ice cream is great though. I'll take this place over bi-rite anyday. Best hidden secret in the city.
author: Daniel F.

description:
YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!

if i didn't come here with sf natives, i wouldn't have known what to do. it was so crowded and i felt so awkward, but apparently you need to grab a number. 

i tried pistacchio and mexican chocolate. both were so delicious.  it was a bit of a wait, and the place was crowded with college kids but it was so worth it! will definitely go back next time i'm in sf.
author: Kristen N.

description:
Cantaloupe is my favorite flavor here. Too bad it's seasonal. It should be year round!

I went here for dessert with my mom, on a cold night. Yes, there was still a wait. It wasn't too bad, I had time to decide what to get.

I ended up getting Rocky Road and Green Tea. The green tea is seasonal also. It was really good, to my surprise. It didn't taste as grainy as others (you know like the ones you get at Asian restaurants at the end of your meals?) so my mom and I were satisfied. 

I'm an ice cream fiend and I know I will be back again, hopefully soon. Like tonight.
author: Jenna R.

description:
Excellent ice cream with a plethora of flavor options. There is truly something for everyone here!

// HOW TO //
     + Meat market style. You grab a number from the machine and wait for them to call your number or display it on the digital display on the wall. This place gets crowded, but they are very efficient with serving everyone. 

// FOOD // 
     + Coconut Ice Cream: Bits of baby coconut are strewn throughout the creamy ice cream for some wonderful texture
     + Cookies and Cream: Classic and delish 
     + Taro Ice Cream: Bright purple, fun, and tasty. Not too sweet.
author: Pauline P.

description:
I wish I could sleep inside their ice cream fridge!!!
Absolutely heaven in a cone.
author: Erik C.

description:
Ice cream - no one else does it like Mitchell's!

I'm surprised I haven't developed a permanent gut from all the enormous milkshakes I've eaten here. Along with milkshakes, they have halo halo and other specialty desserts. Yum.

The ice cream itself has several unique flavors. I love grasshopper pie, ube, and peanut butter indulgence. Unlike other ice cream establishments, you don't have to wait in a long line - instead you grab a number. I prefer this method because then I can just hang out in the vicinity (or even go for a walk and come back if the line's long). With reasonable prices, yeah, I'm definitely a Mitchell's convert and delighted ice cream addict.
author: Denise B.

description:
Love ice cream!

I like their ube, mango, grasshopper, etc.

But! this is not my all time favorite place to go. I only come here when it's convienient. No where to really eat the ice cream, the areas pretty cold and windy all the time...
author: Erica L.

description:
This is an absolute must go if you are in SF and want ice cream. My parents have been going here for the past 27 years and of course they would bring my sister and I about every month. They have a vast amount of flavors for just about anyone's liking. They always have summer flavors (mango, peach) and winter specials. 

You will ALWAYS see a line, no matter what time of day or night. 

Cons: Crappy Parking

Hint: Grab a number ticket it is on the left as you enter above the door! 

My all time favorite combo? 1 scoop of Strawberry, 1 scoop Chocolate Chip dipped on a waffle cone dipped in chocolate covering.
author: Melissa M.

description:
I'm a fan of their Mexican chocolate ice cream.

Rich, creamy, and BOLD. I like that they're not afraid to go heavy on the spice and chili. I respect that.

With all the wonderful, famous ice cream shops that San Francisco has to offer, Mitchell's is certainly a strong contender!
author: Emily T.

description:
I came here with a couple friends thinking "oh! We don't have this in my area, let's try it!" I walked in. 
First of all, I didn't know you had to get a number, it's next to the door but that doesn't mean it's obvious because personally, I just looked at the menu. It didn't say I had to pick a number. 
Secondly, the man who was calling out the numbers did it so fast he skipped my number and a rude customer who had a number after me went. The man who was working didn't even acknowledge the fact I was already angry. Like how dare that person cut me, and how dare he not care that I was angry! Why was he even reading the numbers so fast?! So i had to WAIT. 
Finally I ordered my ice cream. He scooped the wrong one for me, so I complained. Seriously, the guys that were working here looked like they fucking hated, Haaaaated their job. It made me even more angry. 
Poor customer service made the ice cream taste bad. How sad.
author: D T.

description:
Came here as the first stop on a LOOOONG day of ice cream tasting. I had never had any of SF's iconic ice cream, despite living here all my life, so I had to try everything!

Mitchell's is definitely a local favorite, and for good reason. They have a large variety of flavors, especially asian-based ones, such as halo-halo or jackfruit. I got the strawberries and cream, which reminded me of the strawberry cakes from Safeway, which I love. The texture was nice and creamy.

The servers were very friendly, and had suggestions on what to try/what was good. They let me try many samples (I felt kind of bad) without any judgement. Mitchell's admittedly wasn't the most outstanding place of my ice cream day, but it was a good solid place to get my fix. I'll probably be coming here a lot more often, since parking was easy, and it is a short 10 min drive from my house!
author: Denise C.

description:
Mitchell's! Hot damn! You can't go wrong with Mitchell's. In a city so obsessed with crazy ice cream flavors like salted caramel or balsamic strawberry, a person might just want a simple strawberry or cookies and cream ice cream. Mitchell's is great because they do all their flavors, simple and complex, very well. Plus, they're open later than most of those other ice cream shops. 

On my most recent visit, I had the pear sorbet and the orange sherbet. The pear sorbet was perfection. It's like biting into a crisp, juicy pear, except...it's a sorbet. A must for anyone looking for something fruity. The orange sherbet was a blast of tang and citrus in every bite. It was a huge hit with all my fellow ice cream-loving compatriots. 

Don't be a loser. Make sure you grab a number from the plastic red dispenser on the left when you enter the door. A good way to introduce some order to a chaotic crowd of young San Franciscans and tourists itching for Mitchell's.
author: Dan K.

description:
Finally popped my Mitchell's Ice Cream cherry!

They had plenty of flavors to choose from and their ice cream is very flavorful. I settled for the Toasted Almond in an ice cream sandwich and enjoyed every minute of it that I felt like a 5 year old with ice cream all over my face and hands. I also got to try the mint chocolate chip and mocha and like I said having just the small  bite had a burst of flavor.

I hear the line gets long and you need to take a number to get serviced. We were helped between 5-10 minutes after we arrived and the employees were very friendly. 

Too bad this place is too far from me, I'd love to come back and try their other flavors.
author: Kat S.

description: I would be the duke if I actually checked in every time I came here. My daughter loves this place. I can eat ice cream here on a rainy day it doesn't matter. I try to keep it simple with my rocky road but do get the grasshopper pie sometimes. Love the history behind Mitchells. (On the door)
author: JJ S.

description: Really I'm just repeating what the other 3000 some odd reviewers have said. The ice cream is excellent. My future in-laws have dragged this from SF to Sacramento for several holiday occasions and I've never been disappointed. This was my first time actually going into the shop though. It was as much of a zoo as I had been warned about. Very busy. Next to no parking (didn't even bother trying the lot) and a little on the pricey side (but just a little and insignificant when you taste how good it is). More unique flavors than you can comprehend. Very worth the effort.
author: Kevin L.

description: This place is SO popular. Out of all the ice cream spots in SF, this is the only one that ALWAYS has a long wait, but if you're really craving some good ice cream, it's worth it! Remember to grab your ticket once you get there because they use a number system, which I think is pretty efficient for the most part. My favorite flavors are mango and GRASSHOPPER! If you like mint & chocolate, definitely go for that one! They are well-known for the tropical flavors though-- ube, buko, halo halo, mango. The mexican chocolate is also amazing; I love the hint of cinnamon it has! The service has been really friendly every time I've come and they never acted impatient or annoyed when I sampled more than half of their flavors before ordering. It's definitely worth it to try, but be prepared to wait!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
