Walked in and got greeted immediately. Tons of friendly staff...made the place that much better. I also thought it was so cute how they had dog's treats for those customers like myself and knowing that places like these doesn't allow any pets. 
If you're unsure of a flavor, ask to try! 
Rec. flavors: avocado, ube, pistachio, halo-halo, tropical 4
Pass: peach, most of the chocolate flavors just bc you can buy them anywhere else.

Went here an hour after it opened so not a huge line but avoid in the afternoon or late at night. Save you some trouble if you're an impatient person
author: Bup N.

description: I came here for the ube ice cream (#96 in the 2012 Big Eat List).  It tasted pretty good, and not artificial. I'll be back to try more flavors.
author: Kien M.

description:
#96 on the 7x7 List: Baby-coconut ice cream

-Tasty?  The Buko flavor is coconut with little bits of coconut - not shreds, mind you.

-Service:  They have a number system, which is great for everyone waiting around because it gets especially packed near closing time!

-Ambiance:  lil' ice cream shop

-Worth the trip/try?  I think everyone should do a Bi-Rite / Mitchell's comparison to see whose style and flavors they like better.  Both have a great variety of flavors but their respective textures and mouth feel are a bit different
author: Winnie L.

description:
Was looking for some sweet noms to make me feel better, and a coworker suggested trying Mitchells - hella hit the spot!

Mitchell's has really good flavors. Felt like being adventurous so I got Claire's Pie, which is like jamoca almond fudge with graham crackers. And to make myself feel even better (it was a long day at work, okay!?), I got a sundae. I like how they mount on the whip cream :D

Thank you to the very nice employee who accepted my credit card even though they only accept card for a $9 minimum purchase (and my sundae was of course under $9)!

It's in a neighborhood so parking is okay... And didn't realize it could get so busy that you need a number.
author: Kris I.

description:
My brother-in-law is crazy about ice cream, so while we were in the city celebrating his birthday we decided to stop by Mitchell's. It was pretty crowded but the line moved really fast. 

We had a party of 8, but we went in the shop in groups of four. I ordered the grasshopper pie milkshake & it was bomb. Smooth enough to drink out of a straw no prob, but still thick. The oreo cookie monster was to DIE for as well. SO much oreo cookie goodness in a cup. That will definitely be my next order along with my next visit. :) 

The wait was a bit long for the milkshakes, but seeing how tedious it was to make one, it didn't upset me at all. Also, it was worth the wait anyways.

Mitchell's is a great place for a more old fashion type of ice cream with an emphasis on more tropical flavors. Definitely worth a try! :D
author: Priscilla O.

description:
Visited SF and this place was just around the corner from my friend's place in Noe Valley.   Actually went there two nights in a row.  First night, tried the Mexican Chocolate.  It's so flavorful and smooth with that great cinnamon flavor.  I don't think I've seen this anywhere in L.A.... very good and worth trying again.  Maybe mixing it with a darker chocolate flavor would make it insanely good.  

Went back the next night to try the Halo Halo (not their ice creambut the real thing).  I've seen it a couple times in places around Carson down here in L.A but never tried it.  Lol this was so big;  it was all placed in one of those big 16oz cups, and it was overflowing.  Felt sorry for the server girl as she had to keep mixing/squishing all of the various ingredients in the cup to make the Halo-Halo (took her like 10 minutes to make).  Finally she added 2 scoops of Ube ice cream to the top; lol it was a race to drink the milk & eat the Ube as it was slowing melting and overflowing the big cup.  I don't know if I like all of the ingredients (some of the sweetened beans had a odd artificial flavor) but it was definitely worth trying.

The line was long both nights (about 20) but it goes by quick, esp if you're trying to figure out what you want from their gigantic menu.

Next time in SF I'll come back and try the Mex chocolate with some other of their flavors.
author: Neil Y.

description:
I'll be honest, I wasn't that impressed. The Ube ice cream is on the 7x7 big eats list, so we  had to come try it. 

The numbering system for waiting in line DOES NOT WORK! When we got there, they were only on 37, and we were 73. We waited half an hour, until someone graciously gave us their number to use because they already had a friend waiting. I feel like the numbering system makes everything slower. Why can't they just make people stand in line like a Bi-Rite? 

The Ube itself, wasn't my thing either. It was too sweet, and aside from the appealing beautiful purple it radiated, it doesn't make me want to go back to wait in that line, and try other flavors. 

My friend got grasshopper pie, which she loved. It's mint ice cream with oreos in it which was decent but nothing special. Sorry! Too much hype for me on this place, I know it's an SF staple, but once to try was enough. I won't be back.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Yeeaa...iono what the hype is about.  I've been here a good number of times and I always left feeling like it was good ice cream, but not great and definitely not something I'd want to wait around in line for.  There's nothing particularly extraordinary about the ice cream that makes me want to eat it by the pintful; that's my measure for good ice cream.

Memorable flavors: coconut pineapple, ube and Mexican chocolate are yums
author: Thi D.

description:
I will say, this place gives the biggest portions of any ice cream place in SF, with the exception of possibly Swensen's. As someone who is mildly lactose intolerant, it's always a very conflicting emotion seeing the large scoops.

Most recently, I came looking for the horchata flavor, which was mentioned in 7x7 as one of the "most San Franciscan flavors". The article even mentioned that the flavor is scooped year round, but when we got there, they didn't have it! Not Mitchell's fault, of course, but it does mean I'll have to come back again for that one.

The flavors that I *have* tried have mostly been pretty good. My friends talk about the ube one, but I can't really get into it. I tend to go for the more boring flavors like chocolate chip or peanut butter. Can't go wrong, really.
author: jon y.

description:
Came here the other night with a friend after watching a movie. It was a little after 10pm and this place was still PACKED! Fortunately however, Mitchell's has their own parking lot right behind their shop and I was able to snag a spot from a car just pulling out. 

Never having come here before, I was a little confused as to where the line started. Fortunately, a friendly patron who was in front of us turned around and explained to us the ticket system and where we could get our own (non-golden) tickets. We grabbed # 44 & 45 and at the time, they were still calling #34. I guess that wasn't too bad all things considered. And a good 15-20mins later, it was finally our turn to get our own creamy goodness. Despite having all that time to decide, there was so many options here at Mitchell's that I was STILL uncertain what to get by the time my turn came up. I wound up getting a scoop of Mango sorbet while my friend got some weird concoction in a cup that I don't even remember the name of. 

While the ice cream was pretty good, I'm not sure if it really would be considered anything to write home about. And I'm still unsure if it really is worth the drive all the way out there just to get ice cream. However the late hours + friendly staff definitely makes this place a must go if you happen to be in the neighborhood!
author: Alex C.

description:
I have to go there often. They are very addicting. My most fav thing there is Ube!
It is just perfect mix. If you want to go really sweet try their rocky road. 
I always buy big box and enjoy it during move. 
My stress release food!
author: H A.

description:
Yummmmmm - I've heard about Mitchell's so much, and me being quite an ice cream fanatic, decided I HAD to make it out here. It's a bit out of the way from other things, but there's still always a line whenever I go. Be sure to grab a number on the inside! The first time I went, my friend and I were pretty clueless and just stood around for a few minutes before a kind soul told us we had to get a number to eventually get service. Thank god that person told us - it would have really soured my experience if we waited for 15 min THEN figured that out!

I loved the feel of the store - it felt very old school! Like one of those ice cream parlors you'd go to. Very unassuming, bright colors, old school ice cream freezer-carts where they had giant to-go tubs. I've always resisted the temptation to bring home a tub but one of these days, I'm going to cave in. 

The workers here are super friendly too, and most importantly, they're super nice about samples, even if you're overindulgent in trying to narrow down the number of flavors to try. AND YOU SHOULD TRY THEM! Gosh, there are SOOOO many flavors and they all sounds so good!!!!

And of course, most importantly, how does it actually taste? It tastes AWESOME. Talk about food-gasm. Very rich and creamy in texture! Each bite packs flavor - if you don't like that in your ice cream, then maybe stay away. When they say 'mango,' there's definitely no mistaking that flavor for anything else. None of this 'light' or 'low fat' or whatever ridiculousness. It's ice cream, people!! Indulge and be happy!!!
author: Lena Y.

description:
The ice cream here is fantastic, but the experience waiting for it is truly miserable. It's the "take a number" system, followed by the "take our sweet ass time putting your order together" system that really takes the line around the block.

Let's face it, you're already on your way there anyways so get those expectations in check and get ready to enjoy the ice cream. Truly, the ice cream is fantastic.

Don't forget to grab that number.
author: Marcus C.

description: Theres always a long line when you drop by..But they had a fast service. Be sure to get your ticket number for your turn and wait for your number to be called when you arrived at the door. Worth the wait all along! 5stars for their icecreamsss
author: Begz B.

description:
Today was one of those days that nothing seemed to go right.  So, the only thing I could think of to improve it was to have some yummy ice cream.

I usually order the grasshopper pie but for some reason, the chocolate with peanut butter decadence was calling my name.  I had one scoop with the chocolate dip.  I anxiously waited to get my scoop and basically sprinted to the car to eat it.  The chocolate was thick and creamy with tons of mini peanut butter cups.  Also, the chocolate dip gave the exterior a nice, crunchy texture. Sigh...

Thank you Mitchell's for making my day a little better.
author: Deborah N.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream will always have a special place in my heart! In my opinion, it's one of the yummiest spots for ice cream in the San Francisco area. Loads of amazing flavors, many with an Asian influence. This place is always packed with people, and there's usually a line out the door. Make sure to grab a ticket when you arrive, as they call people by ticket number. The place isn't that big, and they have loads of staff to accommodate all the customers!

My favorites are the Halo Halo and the Tropical Four. So many yummy fruits and sweets packed into each scoop - I'm always left wanting more! With these flavors, you essentially get a bit of everything, so it always makes decisions easy!

Definitely a fan for life! Also convenient that it's not too far from the 24th st./Mission BART! :)
author: Kevin J.

description:
Last week, I was feeling down, so my honey decided to brighten my mood with none other than ICE CREAM!!!

Of course!

He drove all the way from SF to me in San Jose, and back to SF again, all for Mitchell's!
And later, all the way back to San Jose, to take me home!

You'd think upon arrival, he'd be exhausted, but instead he was exhilarated!

I warned him I'd want to try every flavor, to make the drive worth while, so once our number was called he tipped our server, and the taste test began!
Long story short, I'm no longer feeling down, and to top it off.... I've had the best ice cream I've ever had in my life!

Big thanks you know who, and an equally big thanks to the staff of Mitchell's that stayed patient through the whole ordeal, and even kept serving us after the official "store closing" time. 

INFINITE STARS for having kick ass tropical flavors like Macapuno, Purple Yam, Stinky Fruit, Lychee, Mango, Ube, Mexican Chocolate, Toasted Almond, White Pistachio(not to be confused with regular Pistachio) !!!!
author: Jasmine P.

description:
00o0oh weee...it was a hot day in Frisco...  and you know what that means. Ice CREAAAAM :) Yes folks... one of my cousins friends wanted to hit up Mitchell's Ice Cream Shop. They all tell me it's one of the finest ice cream shops ever in the BAAAY. I was thinking..."whats the big deal?" it's just ice cream. I've had it plenty of times before.

But dannng, when we pulled up, the line was sooo long that I thought we were at Magic Mountain waiting for a ride.  To top that we had to grab a number, wow that serious for ice cream. I know it's hot and all...but still! There was an eclectic variety of people waiting...from the young to the old...gangstas, locals, and tourists. It was awesome. I loved the energy.

By the time our number was called, the sun went down. About an hour wait for ice cream.  I asked my bf to surprise me and order anything, he did and it was a great yummy surprise.  It was the Kahlua Mocha Cream. Everyone else ordered something as well and I knew they thought it was worth the wait.

Overall, the menu of flavors even has filipino desserts like HALO-HALO and the owners are not filipino...awesome huh? haha, the prices were inexpensive, the atmosphere was great.  Delicious ice cream!

Till next time-- I just don't know if i could wait another hour for ice cream.
author: Einna S.

description:
Long wait time grab a ticket you might get passed pay attention!!!

The ice cream very creamy 
Very nice overall
Melts too quickly only fault
author: Abbi B.

description: Insanely good, this place without a shout of a doubt has the best ice cream around San Francisco. My favorite ice cream is the Lucuma (Peruvian Fruit), deep in chocolate is the best. My wife loves the Rocky road flavor it is insanetly good. The service is top notch whenever I have been there. Thanks for your incredible ice cream and your great customer service.
author: Harold M.

description:
OK so our ice cream tastes are in the minority...

Context: Sunday night at 9pm on a drizzly night

Atmosphere: packed sidewalk and inside. Place is super small and you can barely squeeze in to look at the cases of frozen ice cream. We were number 32 and they were at number 11, so we waited almost an hour. Ypu take a number, then wait until they call it. Earlier in the evening we walked by about 6:30 and there was no line so maybe that's a better time to go.

Service: friendly, pleasant and efficient service once you get called

Ice cream: it was fine but nothing special. We had the peanut butter special and the chocolate chip.  We also tried the mocha fudge. The two scoop was enough for two of us to share. I liked it but wouldn't wait in line for it.
author: Vivek V.

description: SOOOOOO MANY OPTIONS!! What to pick... what to pick... This place is good and the fact that they make their own ice cream is a total bonus.  They have so many unique flavors like horchata, avocado, ube, halo halo and so much more.  I wished I could've tried more flavors before I committed to one but the guy didn't really look like he had the patience and was possibly hating life.  I tried 2 and didn't want to bother him anymore.  I got the french vanilla custard.  The horchata was flavorful but I knew I would've gotten tired of it fast because it was so sweet.  I'm never a plain vanilla girl... EVER!! But it was perfectly sweet and so rich and creamy.  I tried everyone else's flavors too and that creamy, rich note is at the end of each flavor.  NOMS! Definitely coming back.
author: Kenitha Y.

description: Awesome neighborhood ice cream shop:) Varieties of flavors, so you can eat different flavors of ice cream everyday haha:) Ice cream cake is also so attractive!
author: Maitai N.

description: Geez, Louise. Finally. Today was the day! What can I say, but that my companion said I was moaning with every bite. Whatever. Had the Mexican chocolate AND the sweet coconut. Well, tell ya what... I shall return, and I shall be having the avocado, if you can believe it.
author: Elizabeth Q.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM EVER OMG
I have been coming here ever since I was little! The ice cream is always so good! 
My favorite here is getting the Banana Split which is around $9-$10. They add what kind of toppings you want and everything!

They have so many different flavors! You could honestly ask for a random flavor and they probably have it! I think I saw a guacamole one. LOL yeah, it's THAT random. 

There is always a long line everytime I come here! The only thing I wish they had was seats! You just have to get your ice cream and go eat it in your car or standing.
author: Mayra A.

description:
It's so dangerous having Mitchell's located so close to my house... 

Mitchell's is all about quality and they have a large spectrum of flavors and colors to satisfy everyone's ice cream craving. My favorite flavors are White Pistachio, Ube, and Pumpkin. I love love love the pumpkin pie sundae they have during halloween/fall season.  Whatever time of day it may be, you will always see a crowd of people gathered in front of Mitchell's. Just grab a number and be patient, this ice cream is worth waiting for!
author: Elaine N.

description: Five stars for the ice cream, but one star off for the lines and cramped space (Not that this is any fault of a very successful business, but detracts from the experience for sure). This is my favorite local ice cream, maybe my favorite ice cream of all! It is the only ice cream that does not freeze rock hard after months in my freezer, perhaps because they use real cream? I don't know, but what I do know is that the ice cream is delicious. I love all of the flavors, the more conventional to the more novel. I tend to gravitate towards the mint chocolate chip, and my partner likes the mango. The price is also just right. A lot of hipster type of ice cream shops have sprung up in the city lately charging lots while preparing the ice cream from scratch on liquid nitrogen, but none can really hold a candle to this place. I am glad that many grocery stores carry their ice cream so I can buy a quart quickly and enjoy it at home.
author: 和子

description: Waited 45 mins to eat ice cream that had the consistency of a Laffy Taffy. No thanks. I was also really disappointed that they don't offer anything super chocolately like dark chocolate or triple brownie fudge (I'm just making up this flavor). I will say that Mitchell's Ice Cream does have some really interesting flavors that I've never seen anywhere else before. This might be the only reason I'd ever come back, but 45 mins for an ice cream cone is just outrageous.
author: Betty W.

description:
I am really glad I don't live near this place as I would be gaining a lot of weight.  This place is the real deal.  Yes, you may have to wait 15 minutes to have your number called, but it is worth it.  Had a double scoop of Grasshopper and Claire's Pie.  Pretty much inhaled it on my walk back to the BART station.  This goes into my "must visit again when I am in the city" list.  Also nice that it isn't in a high touristy area.  Not too far from the 24th St. BART and really close to the J Church line.    

If you are an ice cream fan and live in the Bay Area, you must go here.  Be aware it is like a $10 minimum to use a debit/credit card.
author: Matt R.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM IN SF.

boom, that is all you need to know.
(and yes, it is waaaay better than Bi-Rite)

*grasshopper pie is a killah -- so good, as good as it looks, and way better than it sounds
*kahlua mocha cream -- as rich and creamy as it sounds, really rich flavor
*chocolate caramel crackle -- a personal fav, it delivers in every aspect of the name, without anything being over powering or too rich

mitchell's is just amazing.
worth the wait.
worth the stressful parking situation.
just go here. you won't regret it.
author: Riana C.

description:
Waited 40 minutes at 9PM just to order - you have to get a number first and then loiter around outside waiting for them to call your number. I'm unsure how these ice cream places in SF are all so inefficiently slow at scooping ice cream, getting money, and giving you change back, caus I've seen workers at zillions of other icecream/gelato stores scoop extremely quickly.

They have really great service though - I came for the Ube ice cream, and the guy taking my order was really worried that I wouldn't like the flavor, so he brought a sample back for me to try before he would make my scoop. The last time I had this flavor, I was in elementary school, so I'm not sure if it is truly fantastic. It tasted kind of plain to me, kind of like a duller, creamier vanilla, but maybe it's better than all the other ube flavors out there. I got a really big scoop for the ~$3 I paid, so that was nice!
author: Melody L.

description:
Mitchells has gotten cheap on their portions. Your better off buying a gallon if you have a family of 3+!! Gelateria in northbeach is $.75 more for a regular size however they provide huge double scoops as their standard and its GELATO! Worth the drive and cheaper.

Choose your servers wisely. The "cool" ones serve bigger scoops than the "disgruntled" employees! Get you $3.20 worth!!!

Eating out Claire's Pie!
author: Cee B.

description:
Hopped of the plane at SFO, one BART ride later, and the second I got picked up from the station, we were off to Mitchell's before they closed! It's a classic ice cream joint that has a generous selection of flavors; my mouth is watering thinking about them. 

Make sure you grab a number or you'll be waiting for awhile in the sea of people. Some of the memorable flavors:

-grasshopper pie (a delicious mix of mint ad chocolate) 
-claire's pie 
-halo halo 
-horchata 
-Mexican chocolate

After a few tast tests, I went for the coconut pineapple-- SO rich and creamy! I like that this place is not gimmicky or trying to be cool; the ice cream speaks for itself. :)

They also have mini Giant's helmets to serve ice cream sundaes in. AWESOME
author: Leslie T.

description:
How this DOESN'T have five stars, I will never understand. 
Best ice cream in the bay.
Greatest little shop.
Now if only there were more around the bay... *sigh* a girl can dream.
author: Haley D.

description:
Love coming here to get some deeelish ice cream! I love the fact that its fam owned and that the ice cream is made on site! Only downside is that it gets very packed and crowded which can be annoyingggg! Gotta be patient for a scoop of ice cream people =/

Overall, i love this place!
author: Shanitte N.

description: This place is Amazing!!! Wonderfully soft, smooth, satisfying, melt in your mouth ice cream. Best thing about this place? They stay open until wee hours of the night in Bernal Heights. And yes, I am sure they have calorie free ice cream on certain days, just do it!!!
author: Maya A.

description:
Mitchell's is my favorite ice cream joint. Ever. That exists on this earth. If it were snowing on a day I was visiting SF, I would fashion a sled, hire some huskies, and mush my way over to San Jose Avenue. Cold be damned, I can't miss Mitchell's.

I've been coming to Mitchell's since I heard about it on the Food Network, about years ago now. So, so, soooo worth the journey. 

Most amazing ice cream ever. Thick, creamy, everything ice cream should be. 

You can expect your regular ice cream choices: vanilla, chocolate, coffee. Then you've got your slightly more interesting choices: white pistachio, mocha fudge, seasonal eggnog and pumpkin. YUM. But what brings me back over and over again is Mitchell's Tropical flavors.

OH HELL. 

A few highlights:

Ube: (Purple Yam)  was my first love. Consistently amazing. Bright purple, WAY more delicious than  you might think yam ice cream could be.
Avocado: om nom nom. Subtle sweetness and deliciousness.
Buko: (Baby Coconut) I'm not a huge coconut fan, but this is awesome.
Halo Halo: very popular... my best friend's fav. It's Buko, Langka, (jackfruit) Ube, Pineapple, Mango & Sweet Beans. Whew!
Lukuma: (Peruvian Fruit) just tried this one... surprisingly nutty. SO GOOD. 
 
When you go to Mitchell's, there's a few things you might wanna know beforehand:
* There's a tiny parking lot around back; try that if you can't find street parking.
* There are no sit-down and eat tables. there's a bench outside, and the street curb. That's about it. Mitchell's is a take it and go kinda place. 
* They get BUSY. You will normally have to take a number and wait your turn, partner. 

Verdict: GO. GO NOW.
author: Sara B.

description: Ah, Mitchell's. As a SF native, you will always hold a special place in my heart, even after that time when your employees didn't wash your spoons properly, and I went into mild anaphylactic shock from a peanut allergy. You know exactly what you're getting at Mitchell's. There will be no "secret breakfasts" or sea salt anything. It's down-to-earth ice cream. They do a shakes and floats as well, but you're really here for the ice cream. One of the best halo halo flavors in town. Arguably the best chocolate ice cream you can get from a SF creamery. And, definitely one of the better ube flavors. It's not going to cost you a bunch for a single scoop ($3.50+), and you can get a waffle cone for another 50 cents. Grab a ticket on the left hand side of the store, and stand around for a few deciding what you want to get. You can't go wrong with any of their flavors. I hate cantaloupe, and even their cantaloupe flavor tasted like a really fresh bite of the real thing. You can grab a pint of whatever on your way out. Standing room only, people. Be warned. There are two benches outside, but they're almost always full, and homeless people like to loiter in the area. They did open a little parklet across the way, but again, homeless people.
author: Danny C.

description:
M y, my, my...what a wonderful place
I ce cream doesn't get better than this
T he consistency of Mitchell's ice cream is unmatched
C reamy AND thick -- the way it should be
H uge variety of flavors, and they're all made well
E xcellent Ube -- the best I've had anywhere
L oved the Mexican Chocolate, Halo-halo, and Rum Raisin, too
L ook for parking at their lot in the back
S eats are only outside, so wear extra warm clothes
author: Anthony N.

description:
went there the first  time
honestly   ,  i got luck i guess,   was ni line,  i heard  some times they have a  huge line,   if they  do had a line, i will place 3-4 stars only ,  i  hate stay on line.   i know  why they  would have a huge line  ,  that  ice cream  is simply the best.     i mean,  i  don't think i ever in a  36 years old,  had any  better ice cream,    its  wow.    i will go  there lot  , i love ice crew
author: Li H.

description: I go here so often that I could probably help they fund a new larger parking lot. That said, I love their baby coconut ice cream. It's also my go to place when I'm babysitting children or adults from out of town. This is my favorite ice cream spot. Rain or shine, cold or hot, it always cheers me up....it's like morphine in a cup. Ok, not quite, but close.
author: Jack R.

description:
Mitchell's is my top choice for ice cream. Saying that is like listing the reasons how you know that you love someone...

First, parking is shit. But I'll wait in the back lot, while people try to gauge how slowly they can enjoy ice cream in the car. NOT COOL! Yet, I will admit that the overall vibe is a lot more friendly than the outside of other popular places because you grab a number (HEY NEWBIES! GRAB A NUMBER!) and can chill. When compared to forming that infamous solid line, where people are so stiff for fear that they have to defend their spot like it's a kingdom, Mitchell's is way better-- if people accidentally grab an extra number, they'll casually slip it to a stranger. Now that's very cool.

Second, the flavors are straight-forward, with the perfect thick creaminess (the kind that you can bite). Although they have flavors like Ube, Sweet Coconut, Avocado, or Thai Iced Tea, they also have classics like Chocolate or Mocha.  Plus, since they keep the same flavors, don't they all just become classic flavors anyway?

Third, they can fancy up your scoops the good ol' fashioned way: lots of whipped cream, loads of sprinkles, and that pretty cherry. NO HAUTE CREAMERY HERE. 

Favorite flavors: Grasshopper, Tropical Four, Sweet Coconut.
author: Diane N.

description:
Why doesn't Seattle have a place like this??
There's definitely always a line but you just have to be patient. I go here for a pilgrimage of sorts whenever I visit my family in the Bay Area and the wait has never stopped me! This is some of the best ice cream I've ever had. Although, I must admit, I miiiight be kind of partial to the place because the "tropical" flavors they have are Filipino ice cream flavors... so they're right up my alley.
My bias aside, they do things well and they do them right. I've had those flavors of ice cream both in the Philippines and here in the US (they sell Filipino ice cream that is typically made in... Southern California I wanna say?) and none of them beat Mitchell's. You can just taste that it's made RIGHT THERE and with the best ingredients they can find. And if you're a little less adventurous, they do have plenty of non-tropical flavor options.
author: Felisa D.

description:
I get so excited whenever I go to this place. The staff are super friendly and on too of everything even though there's always 20+ people waiting for ice cream! 

The wait is so worth it! Ice cream is super creamy, full of flavor and so so so so delicious! 

I always get the Ube, purple yam ice cream! I even bought a half gallon. Although that was like $10 it was so worth it. 

I can't wait to try the other flavors!
author: Teal M.

description:
Like I've said... Get in, wait your turn, order, get the fuck out. 
They're limited on space.

Butter Nut Munch is my current favorite - butterscotch ice cream with candied almonds!!!!
author: Susy C.

description:
Oh Mitchell's my greatest childhood memories are with you!

Great ice cream the banana flavor is my favorite (i know i'm weird) anyways sooo creamy hits the spot all the time!

Down side on a hot day make sure you want to wait for ever!

on a rainy day you might wait 10-15min max but all worth it people!!!
author: Bessy O.

description:
The line here is pretty long no matter what time of day it is...

Ube and Mango was really good and they give a large portion. I was really surprised that this place had filipino ice cream. My boy never tried filipino ice cream so when we stopped by here one night I got it for him. We both really liked it but didnt realize that the large was really big. We still ended up eating all of it though. They also have Halo-halo seasonally so if your into that come during the summer. 

The customer service wasn't the best but this place is packed so I feel it was understandable... 

Just don't mind the lines and you'll end up liking this place.. I can't wait until the next time I come back here.
author: Christopher G.

description: DELICIOUS! People are not kidding when they say SF has some of the best ice cream shops around. Homemade, quality ingredients, & fun flavors are the key components of good ice cream - & Mitchell's has it all. I especially like all of their tropical flavors because that's not something you see every day. Don't be afraid to try something new, like the purple Yam, it's insanely good. A single scoop is around $3.50 & it's massive! But with ice cream this good, you gotta get two scoops & pay an extra $0.50 for the waffle cone!
author: Lori N.

description: Lol don't forget your ticket I stood in line for 20 minutes and  I didn't go anywhere.. don't forget to come to Texas we have blue bell :) my two flavors was pistachio and black walnut black walnut taste very similar to butter pecan yummy,
author: Patterson N.

description: This place is amazing! I love the handmade ice cream here. Please & warning: GET A TICKET WHEN YOU ARRIVE!!!!! This place definitely draws a crowd. Everything is delish! Try the coconut or I've (purple yam) flavors
author: Yaya L.

description:
You haven't tasted REAL ice cream unless you've made a stop at Mitchell's. This is hands down, my favorite favorite ice cream shop! I have even told my BF that in my version of heaven, I would like my very own Mitchell's Ice Cream there...yeaaaah, it's THAT good.

It's old-fashioned, quality ice cream with a spin. They have the usual suspects (Chocolate Chip, Mocha Fudge, Rum Raisin, Strawberry) with some downright fun & delicious flavors (Mexican Chocolate, Grasshopper Pie, Pumpkin, Banana and Thin Mint). But by far, my favorite flavors have got to be their Tropical ones! My visit here isn't complete without a scoop (each) of their Filipino specialties, Ube & Macapuno! And I can never resist some other faves like Mango & Cantaloupe, which is why whenever I'm in the Bay, I HAVE to make multiple stops at Mitchell's!! 

I can go on and on and on for my love for Mitchell's but I'll basically tell you right now, they are the best. They have been around for over 50 years and I admire how much Mitchell's has remained the same. My boyfriend and his family have been coming here since he was a kid and it's just like how he remembers it. Every single experience I have had here has been golden. Hardly any wait, awesome service & easy to find parking! Who knows, maybe the ice cream Gods are always on our side when I choose to visit but all I know is that I am deeply in love with Mitchell's.

The ice cream is full of flavor, is melt in your mouth creamy & is ALWAYS piled high. No joke, the portions here are so big I could make a meal out of it. But I am NOT complaining ;) Do you get how much I love Mitchell's? Because I do...A LOT! I'm all for the new specialty/gourmet/novelty ice cream shoppes that are popping up everywhere, but when I get a craving for delicious ice cream I immediately think of Mitchell's. Do yourself a favor and BOOKMARK this place now if you haven't already! 

***Some helpful tips:
-They accept cash & credit :)
-As soon as you enter, grab a ticket from the dispenser next to the door. Pay attention for your number to be called!
-There' s a tiny parking lot in the back that fits about 6 (??) cars, but there is plenty of street parking available.
-They offer seasonal flavors and even have Halo-Halo (a Filipino dessert) in the summer.
-Open late! Definite plus +++
-Waffle cones. No ice cream experience is the same without it :)
author: Faye G.

description:
As always, Mitchell's is incredible.

They have a new special sundae:  "Mammoth Mint" - Grasshopper Pie scoop, Chocolate scoop, crushed Andes Mints, Hot Fudge, Whipped Cream, 2 Chocolate-Filled Pirouettes, Chocolate Sprinkles and a Cherry.

YUM!
author: Ken G.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco. Long lines in the summer, but hearing your number being called out and being rewarded with those big scoops of your favorite frozen treat...it's worth it.
author: Katherine M.

description:
Going to Mitchell's always reminds me of when my dad used to take me there as a little kid.  I think it's great that 25 years later, I now take my daughter here...kind of like a family tradition...but no special occassion needed...

They have so many flavors to choose from!  My all-time favorite is Kahlua Mocha Cream and my husband & daughter love Ube.  They also have great seasonal flavors such as cantaloupe, avocado and pumpkin.

The ice cream still tastes the same after all these years.  I love that it is always fresh & creamy.  Great quality!  Great price.  Really one of THE BEST ice cream shops ever!  I have always loved Mitchell's and I bet I always will.
author: Rose A.

description:
The taste of their ice cream outweighs the long weight. The wait is well worth it!

I came here a few times this past summer with some friends. I tried the grasshopper, mexican chocolate and another flavor I forgot. But overall the flavors were awesome, I wish this could replace one of the baskin robins by my house. 

I've always just got a two scoop in a waffle cone, I don't think I could finish anything bigger than that. The scoops are a good size scoop! 

I would love to stop by this place again but its been too cold for some ice cream :(
author: Kim L.

description: I don't think this place Needs anymore 5 star reviews than it already has, but wow! This place is AMAZING!
author: Rene I.

description: Just got my Mitchell's ice cream fix today since like last year.. Ohhhh myyy godddd.. This place brings back memories from when I was a child growing up.. My mother used to take me here a lot.. And I will definitely introduce this place to my next generation.. My favorite is the Mango ice cream and the pepperidge farm pirouettes
author: kevin m.

description:
We've been going to Mitchell's since the 80s. Dad would take us after picking us up from school for a cone when it was a buck fifty. New flavors, newly remodeled shop, and prices have increased since... we spent a little over twelve bucks for two waffle cones w/ one flavor each. What hasn't changed is the creamy outstanding flavors that is Mitchell's, like ube, halo-halo, and langka (jack-fruit). They also scoop up their standard rocky road, Mexican chocolate, and pistachio (all my faves =p ) FANTABOLOUS =D Grab a number, get it in a waffle cone, and why not ... dip it in some chocolate. ;p Their cakes and pies are just as delish!
Even on a cold night, ice cream lovers of all ages, will be lined up outside their shop on San Jose Ave. =D We love it here always... that doesn't change.
author: Aga O.

description:
I'm originally from the Bay Area and have lived in NYC for 7 years. I have yet to find an ice cream place as good as Mitchell's. $3 bucks for a HELLA good ice cream I mean you can't beat it. There is always a lot of people but don't worry they are organized, you pick a number and wait till they call you most I've waited is 20mins. They also have an express line if you just want to pick up quart or half gallon etc...

I always have to go in with an idea of what flavor I want... if not I will be overwhelmed with all the options and default to my favorite, Mango. You will never find a milkier, creamer or thicker mango ice cream than Mitchell's. Mouth is watering just thinking about it. I always make it a point to make it to Mitchell's when I'm in town. 

Also, a favorite is banana ice cream dipped in chocolate. 

Have fun!
author: Mel G.

description:
Let me put it this way. 

We took our parents = my in-laws, my dad, my mom on separate visits.

And every one of them bought "us" a quart of ice cream and talk about Mitchell's more than their granddaughter -- who is ridiculously cute. 

It's that good.

Current favs:

Chocolate
Toasted Almond
Grasshopper Pie
Cinnamon and Ginger combined or French Vanilla Custard
Pistachio
Horchata
...

I don't know whether to damn them or not for being so close to where we live!
author: Michelle D.

description: The ice cream here is reasonably priced; they gave me 2 big scoops for the single $3.60! The flavor selection is also an interesting mix of flavors! (ube, halo halo, thai tea, avocado, etcetc...) The guy was patient with me while I tried hard to make a decision from their massive selection and tried out a couple of samples) I ended up getting pistachio, which had SO MUCH pistachio nuts in it it was awesome :)
author: Claire S.

description: My favorite ice cream place! Their milkshake is great! The line is long on the weekend and on the hot days, 70-80ish for SF. But it is worth the line! If you buy a big size pint, or cake, you can use the fast lane. I have bought multiple cakes from here, they are always great tastes and fresh. My favorite flavore is vanilla, but you can try and tastes all others if you want. It is reasonable priced. $5-7 for a milkshake. Dont get me wrong, i like bi-rite too, but i felt like its a bit over priced...
author: Nataly S.

description: Always busy. Grab a number and wait! But their ice cream is hella good. Their halo halo dessert is pretty good too but a little pricey for a halo halo. They do put plenty of halo halo mix
author: Nikki D.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said?  Miss Cherie wanted to go here so we did.  Unfortunately, it took us a few trips to finally make it up there.  

Here's some tips! They'll probably hate me for this.

Go sample nuts!!! They have so many flavors and you are only one person so sample the hell out of this place! I'm sure that you can handle a teaspoon of the sweet/salty concoctions.  Some of you are probably more used to it than other.

Some of the flavors are ONLY in the half gallon.  If I knew this, I'd have brought an ice chest.  

There's a parking lot in the back!!! w00t!  That wasn't too much an issue for us seeing how it was raining and cold so we got parking in the 10 minute spots in front.  

It's delicious. That's all.  Delicious and rich.  YUM!  Some of the best ice cream I've ever had!
author: Eric L.

description:
Latest discovery...Grasshopper Pie! I love mint, I love oreos...and the collision is just magic!  On a hot day...perfect!  

Ahem ahem, kind friends who make FREE ice cream possible are luved :)
author: Pam S.

description: Who doesn't love this place? Been coming here for years and am a happy camper each time. Thanks Mitchell's for having my back. It's crowded,but there's a reason. You take a number but it goes pretty quickly. You can buy prepackaged ice cream too. Tons of flavors and Filipino ice cream flavors too! WE ALL SCREAM FOR ICE CREAM!!
author: Marie P.

description: After completing an ice cream tour with stops at Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe, we arrived here. Unfortunately, the ice cream was average. While there were some unique flavors, most were not too exciting. I had the ube, and other people in my group sampled other flavors. All of the flavors were too sweet and bland for our tastes.
author: Katie B.

description:
I only get the tropical flavors from here: mango, ube, avocado, and tropical 4.

I don't get flavors you can get in stores cuz why would I? I'll go here for flavors that aren't topical :)
author: Althea D.

description: Do not trust anyone who does not give this place 5 stars. Though I haven't been there when it was crazy packed, luckily I live in the city. Mitchell's is the best ice cream I've ever had. Creamy, taste is on point, and it's not overbearingly sweet (the best part). I complain about wanting Mitchell's everyday that I don't have it. If I ever go I'll buy enough half-gal to fit my freezer!! (6) seriously though you have to try their ice cream. Go, now.
author: Jewelle B.

description: They don't always have it, but the Red Fire (chocolate, cinnamon, and chile (?)) is the best ice cream flavor I've ever had. Awesome ice cream spot.
author: Josh L.

description:
# 800

This is a childhood favorite of mine. We came here a lot when we were kids but I think we came here more frequently when my mom worked at a nearby hospital. This was the introduction of Filipino flavors at a scoop shop: Avocado (it sounds weird, but it's a Filipino thing; I don't like it though), Macapuno (young coconut string), Mango, Ube (purple yam)- creamy selections, otherwise, it would be regular flavors (non- Filipino, that is) at Thrifty or Swenson's (or even a McDonald's vanilla cone).  

If I could make any comparison, it is much like Luv-It Custard is to Las Vegas, that Mitchell's is to San Francisco (well known, celebrated, voted best of, on the travelocity list, etc.). I have not had Bi-Rite but I know about it since I am a subscriber to VIA Magazine (AAA members). When I introduced my husband to it, a few years ago, he became a fan (he happens to love Ube, btw). 

I love ice cream like my husband loves chocolate. But if you've been following me, you probably noticed that, since I've reviewed many ice cream shops, since become a Yelper. I'll give up other foods before I give up ice cream.
author: Margret C.

description:
Mitchell's is certainly an institution. Consistently drawing crowds long before Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe stormed onto the SF ice cream scene, it's in many ways the Fentons of San Francisco. Popularity aside, the two places have more in common: extensive flavor selections, ice cream that's sweet but not that creamy, and, not so fortunately, ice cream that just isn't as memorable as their younger competitors'.

Don't get me wrong, the ice cream here is solid. But none of the flavors had the wow factor of Birite's Salted Caramel or Slocombe's Secret Breakfast. The Ube (Purple Yam) was good, but it lacked that evolving note that takes you by surprise.

I've brought many people here on multiple occasions and the consensus has always been that Mitchell's is good. But I've never gotten the stunned reaction I get when I bring them to Birite. On the plus side, I've never had trouble finding parking in their back lot and have not had to wait more than 10 minutes. But then again, I only come here right before closing.
author: Pierre B.

description: I always find myself stopping by here on my way home from SF. Even though I barely make it before they close there's always a long line. My favorite would have to be the Halo Halo. Tried many others flavors like Green Tea, Coconut Pineapple, Grasshopper Pie, Peanut Butter... etc. This place is good for some old fashion ice cream. If you like creamy ice cream this is the place to get it.
author: Nguyen L.

description:
OH THE HEAVENLY GOODNESS!!!

So I'd driven by this place a couple times while visiting S.F. My boyfriend RAVED about this place. It was a cold night but I was craving something sweet and suddenly ice cream came to mind. I asked my boyfriend if he felt like ice cream on such a cold evening...

Before I knew it, we were driving to Mitchell's! I walked inside this cute ice cream shop and took a number. I was so excited to try ALL of the flavors and considered asking if i could do a take home 1/2 gallon with a scoop of as many different kinds of ice cream as they could fit. They were generous with samples and I absolutely could not figure out what I wanted. 

I ended up choosing avocado (which sounded weird but it was similar to pistachio), the praline flavor, and the coffee crunch flavor. YESSS I WAS A FATTIE and got THREE scoops!!! But it was SO AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS!!!

Another reason this place was so good was because it was not just another ice cream place like baskin robbins or ben and jerry's. They have their own style, unique flavors, and great pricing!

CANT WAIT TO GO BACK!!
author: Lana P.

description:
This place is pretty good.  I guess I'd be more of a fan if i liked Filipino flavors because they offer it.  I'm Filipino but ugh, I just abhor those flavors, like Ube...

Anyway, it's good here but I still like Bi-Rite way better.
author: Elaine C.

description: Been coming here since we moved to the city 18 years ago. The place and ice cream hasn't changed much which is great because when something's good why change; except the price keeps going up for the half gallon sadly.  Love the grasshopper but they stopped making this chocolate crunch or truffle that was seasonal.
author: Becca D.

description:
My FAVORITE ice cream place---not just in SF but out of all the ice cream places I've visited.  I'm a sucker for uniquely-flavored ice creams and Mitchell's has many.

The ice creams I've enjoyed at Mitchell's include avocado (reminds me of Vietnamese avocado shake), dulce de leche, egg nog, ginger, green tea, halo halo, horchata, rum raisin, ube, and white pistachio.  There are many other flavors that I'm sure I taste-tested with their little spoons but the names escape me.  Overall, the ice creams are just amazing.
author: Yolanda V.

description:
Mitchell's!
I haven't had it for awhile but I must say it really doesn't compete with what it once was years ago. Mitchell's used to be so amazing that every time i go to SF i had to get Mitchell's ice cream! All seriousness though, mitchell's fruit flavors are truly delicious back in the days. If you do go to Mitchell's I totally recommend the mango ice cream. The natural fruit flavor is truly there so must try it if you're in the area! Fruit flavors recommended by me!

OH i would probably rate it 4 back in the days due to the long ass wait every time you come here. No matter what time, Afternoon or Night, make sure you are ready to waitttttttt! There is no way you won't wait if you come to mitchell's!
author: Ernest Y.

description:
Halllelujaaahhh!! ube ice cream!! You'd be a fool to not select the seasonal / tropical flavors. This is what makes Mitchell's a unique ice cream shop. 

I like how the employees are patient and offer time for you to taste. So when you come here, step out of your comfort zone and try something new. 

Ice cream cakes!? Yes yes something to devour your sweet tooth... It's not your birthday? You can get your cake and eat it too ;D
author: Christine F.

description:
This is the first time I've had Mitchells at the storefront instead of the carton.  I almost forgot how it tasted until I got me some scoops.  The flavor selection is big enough to consider having multiple trips back just to try more.

I had a double with orange sherbet and mango.  The scoops were HUGE.  I remember now why so many people loved Mitchell's: the ice cream is of a firm, substantial creaminess. Especially the mango I had. The tropical flavors are a must try--some of the flavors, like the ube, have added texture that brings a nice touch to the ice cream.

My only gripe is that it's a bit pricey. However, if you are willing to make the trip and satisfy your ice cream cravings on a sunny day, you won't be disappointed.
author: M. N.

description:
While it's the least sophisticated of the 6 ice cream joints we tasted in SF (including Swenson's)--and if you're super into texture, they don't use Straus's milk like the big 3 (Bi-rite, Humphry, and Mr. and Mrs Misc)--this is the shop that captured my heart.  Mostly because there are some really nice flavors, including halo halo, young (and old) coconut, as well as other "ethnic" flavors that are more familiar in Filipino or Mexican ice cream joints, such as horchata.  

The quality of the ice cream is more baskin robbins than haute, but  the diverse set of distinctive flavors, the relatively low price, and the friendly staff means that this is the kind of place I'd return to to try new flavors.  Yeah it's not as brilliant in the pure flavors as some of the other boutique joints, but for the foundational ice cream place, do not pass up Mitchell's.  

Also, for those who think it's more like Edy's or Dreyer's because Mitchell's is in the freezer aisle in pretty boring flavors, visit the store, it's a totally different experience.
author: Jay C.

description:
Matt scream!

Yelp scream!

We all scream for Mitchell's Ice Cream.... and Matt's 600th review!

Matt has a day-off from work and the other three also have a three day holiday weekend from school. The four of us prepared and delivered lunch to wife at her office. Since her boss started her 3-day Labor Day weekend prematurely, wife was allowed an extended lunch-break

After spending time at her cubicle eating her lunch, we decided to enjoy the nice weather and step out for an afternoon "sweet" treat. With the recent warm weather and 600th review, do many of you think that choosing Mitchell's  Ice Cream is appropriate?

It was a good thing that Wife had an extended lunch break, because the line was so damn long with 20 people ahead of us. While waiting in line, we were debating on what to eat. There are at least 30 homemade flavors to choose from. We were thinking of getting one scope of each and build a ginormous sundae and put them in a wok. Don't laugh, because we might do that one day with the 5 of us.

Waiting patiently for 10 minutes, finally it was our turn. Matt ordered a 20oz cup of Thin-Mint Milkshake. The $5.15 mint-flavored milkshake was very thick, but towards the end, a ton of chocolate chunks was leftover at the bottom of the cup. It's a lot better than having a ton of ice leftover for a drink that you don't have to wait until St. Patrick's Day. 

(They can customize milkshakes from any available flavored ice cream.)

Niece joined uncle and ordered a French Custard Vanilla Milkshake. She got the smaller size (16 oz). For $4.45, the Vanilla milkshake was very creamy and better than any other place that she can think of.

Kids each ordered a single-scoop of Toasted-Almond and Peanut-Butter Indulgence. For $2.25, every lick and loud slurped they've done have put a huge smile on each their faces.

Wife ordered the special, which is the Oreo Explosion (pictured on the main review). The $5.85 loaded sundae comprised 3 scoops of Oreo Ice Cream drenched with a warm Hot-fudge, mountain high whipped-cream topping, two Oreo cookies on the side and a cute maraschino cherry on top. Her picture-perfect treat made her feel like a kid again.

We all enjoyed our treat in the dirty parking-lot behind the shop. Wife and Matt decided to check the place one more time and oddly there were nobody there. So we ordered a half-gallon pre-packaged Banana-Nut Ice cream for our treat for our Holiday weekend. Matt decided to purchased and carry the frozen treat, because wife is capable of melting the ice cream, because she is so damn, "HOT"!
author: Matt G.

description: Long wait, but it's worth it! Don't forget to grab a number and just wait for your number to be called. I suggest trying the tropical flavor ice cream and eat it fast! The ice cream melts quickly on a hot summer weather!
author: Michael D.

description:
Came here last year during a Christmas weekend trip to sf! We got the ube, grasshopper, mango, avocado, and pistachio. 

Ube was really good!  Usually I don't like taro or ube because there's a really heavy coconutty buttery-ness to it that I apparently can't put into words.  Well this one was light and very enjoyable. My new fav flavor at this joint. 

Grasshopper was the one my niece got and she really enjoyed it since it's mint chip with oreos.

Mango was more of a sherbet type of flavor than a rich creamy mango. 

The avocado was apparently really good but I was too afraid to try it.  Lol maybe after I try my first avocado shake? 

The pistachio had a playdo like aftertaste that I ended up not minding so much after a while. 

Overall a 5 because it was a unnique icecream parlor and because their ube icecream is amazing. 

Tldr; try the ube!
author: Eunice K.

description:
Exquisite little mom and pop atmosphere. You can tell real preparation and effort went into making every tub of ice cream. Your always sure to get your moneys worth.
The only knock (if you can even call it that) is theres almost never parking and it takes forever to actually order due to what's seems like a never ending line
author: Tre G.

description:
Came here last night after we were craving for some good ice cream. Although my kid's idea of good ice cream is Baskin & Robbins, I have to properly educate them.

I usually order the Ube but I wanted something different. As usual, the place was packed, the temperature was about 50 degrees factor in the wind chill effect and it was like 40 degrees out. But it didn't deter us from getting our cold, yummy treats.

I noticed a new flavor under their Tropical section and decided to try that. I asked for a sample of Lucuma, a fruit from Peru. The taste is almost nutty with a hint of Thai Tea. I know...sounds crazy but it was good. I had one scoop but the wifey particularly devoured it. I also noticed they had Calamansi under the Sorbet section. Another sample and it was a homerun. It was sweet and tangy...just like a Calamansi should taste like. For those who don't know, Calamansi is the Filipino version of Lemon Lime...only better.

However, my kids picked Oreo Cookie, Strawberries N' Cream, Chocolate Chip and Vanilla. Two waffle cones and dipped in chocolate they say. Their education has not been completed as I told them they can get those flavors at Baskin & Robbins. And they coldly replied, "We know." Trust me folks, there is plenty of time to convert them. 

But my favorite flavor right now is the Tropical Four. Sounds generic you say? Well, it's a combination of Guava, Banana, Mango and Pineapple. I like it so much I asked for a milkshake. But I soo wanted more and got the half gallon to go. Overall, the total came to about $ 35.00. It's a pretty penny for some ice cream but it was all worth it.

They also make Halo Halo now too. No...not the ice cream flavor but the actual Halo Halo dessert. Gotta try it next time.
author: John G.

description: Great creative flavors, and so many options of how you want your ice cream. I'd eat this over Bi-Rite, but would still prefer Smitten.
author: Andrew O.

description: This place always feels so "right" I love the ice cream and even with all the other delicious ice cream choices around the line here can get long but it moves very quicky. I always make sure to get a scoop of cookies and cream, and a tub of coconut ice cream for later.
author: Meredith L.

description: I had never been to Mitchell's ice cream after living in the Bay Area for 14 years.  I've had their Ube ice cream before but had never actually been to the store.  Of course, I get the Ube and it didn't disappoint.  How could I not love this spot with the Filipino flavors?
author: Jen S.

description:
My sis lives a few blocks away from Mitchell's now, so we decided to give it a try last weekend when I was visiting.

When you get inside, you need to get a number & someone at the counter will call you up to order.

I think I tried like three flavors before I finally decided on Pumpkin.  Both my sis & my bf got the espresso toffee ice cream, so that one must have been pretty good too.  I am now obsessed with pumpkin ice cream.

Prices are reasonable & portions are generous.
author: Grace C.

description: Always great to come here ! Really the only place I know that has Lucama flavored ice cream ! Great price. One tips is probably don't part in their parking... Park elsewhere because Mitchell's is always busy !
author: Giselle J.

description: Mitchell's has been my MAIN ice cream spot for the past 6 years! I love that I live 3 minutes awayWhen I was pregnant it was one of my main cravings, my daughter is made of half Mitchell's! Mango, Caramel Praline, and Cantaloupe are my favorites! Be prepared to wait a Disneyland line .. Rain or shine but it's worth it! The workers are nice and efficient so it'll go by fast! Enjoy!
author: mimay M.

description:
1. Grab a number
2. Peruse the menu and decide what you're going to taste
3. Go for the ube, because it's delicious and vow to return for the grasshopper pie
4. Remember that there is a $9 min for credit card (visa/mc)
5. Pay and leave the shoop
6. Get into car and try to drive off, but can't because there are a two cars double parked in front of your car without anyone inside...because those folks are in line at Mitchell's.
7. Finish ice cream in your own car, as you wait for someone to finally move their car out of the way. 
8. Surprisingly not that annoyed by the previously mentioned car situation, as the ube was damn good.
author: Pauline S.

description:
Doesn't live up to hype. Texture and taste not the greatest. Selection of flavors is either your normal things or exotic fruity things, which isnt up my alley. Sorry! I personally think bi-rite is miles better, as well as Ici in berkeley. I hope I dont get hate mail/death threats for going against the masses here. I mean it was ok? 

I like my ice cream less melted and more firm
author: Phillip W.

description: This place reminds me a ice cream shops back in the east coast.  It's a little shop with a crowd and you can choose from a bunch of different ice creams.  We got a bunch of 1/2 pints to bring home and try out.  It was pretty dang good ice cream
author: christopher h.

description: I just adore this place! The variety of ice cream is huge, so everyone can chose one. I love the Grasshopper (which is minty chocolate, not too sweet) and Lukuma (with just a hint of maple syrup taste), though Pistachio and Ube aren't special at all. They are always friendly, but on weekend it gets soooo crowdy, so it's better to drop in in the morning.
author: Anna G.

description:
I don't live in San Francisco, so whenever I'm in the neighborhood, I have to stop by Mitchell's Ice Cream.  Even today, when it was very rainy in the City by the Bay, I had to stop and get a cone.  Today, I got a single scoop of espresso toffee crunch in a chocolate-dipped waffle cone with nuts:  just a touch of deliciousness!  Usually, I get a double scoop, but since I had to eat while driving, the single scoop had to suffice.

Mitchell's also has a lot of tropical flavors, like avocado, halo halo, and macapuno (sweet coconut).  If I stop by on the way home, I usually get a pre-packed half gallon (or 2).  I prefer mango or green tea, while my wife loves the Mexican chocolate.

The only bad thing about this place is the small parking lot and the huge lines.  If you have the time or inclination, do what I do:  go to Mitchell's when it's cold and rainy.  Even then, there's a line, but just not as long!
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
It's ice cream.  It's ice cream that you have to wait outside in line for 30 minutes to get.

I'll go ahead and say that it's pretty much impossible to screw up ice cream...so all ice cream shops probably start out at a 4 or 5 star rating.  

Unfortunately there was nothing mind blowing about the product that warranted the 30 minute line...so next time I'll just be going to Coldstone or the grocery store.   Sure..the ice cream was good.  Was it better than I'd ever had before?  No.  It was just....ice cream.  

I don't even know that I'd pick this place over a Baskin' Robbins if neither had a line and they were both convenient.

There also is no parking nearby.
author: Lauren D.

description:
A San Francisco classic. I put Mitchell's in a different category than the uber-chic Bi-Rite's and Humphrey Slocombe's of the world. They're old school, and in a class all their own.

Mitchells tugs at my heart strings because I have so many childhood memories tied to this place. My dad used to carry me on his shoulders all the way from our apartment near Dolores just to get some Mango and Macapuno from Mitchell's on a warm Saturday afternoon. Mitchell's hasn't changed much since then. I admire that they've remained a steady pillar of SF, operating in the same place for over 50 years. And that's a rarity in a city where businesses open and close like the seasons come and go. 

The parking lot seems almost laughable now with its handful of parking spaces, but I'm sure it made alot more sense in the 50's when the city wasn't crawling with cars. So be prepared to circle the block a few times, or take the bus.

Also be prepared to wait (no surprise). They're even crowded on cold weeknights! But at least they have a take-a-number system, so you don't have to stand in a ridiculously long line (a la Bi-Rite) to get your ice cream fix. 

Their selection is somewhat more traditional, although they have introduced some new and interesting flavors over the past few years. My new favorite is Chai Tea! I also love Ube. But Mango and Macupuno will always be my favorites.

I think that "The San Francisco Treat" title should be taken from Rice a Roni and given to Mitchell's. Who the hell thinks of instant rice as a treat? But not only is Mitchell's a real treat, they are the epitome of classic San Francisco - so, it makes perfect sense.

Mitchell's, you'll always have a piece of my heart...and my tastebuds :)
author: Mariela D.

description: Never experienced customer service this bad till today. I come out here often from across the bay for their delicious ice cream. We had flavors in mind that we wanted and they were sold out so we decided to try out other flavors. My girlfriend tried 2 flavors, after that  the guy says somthing not in this context. People who comes to mitchells know what they want and if you don't see anything you like, you can leave because we have a line. WTF!! I understand that you have a line. We got a ticket and we waited patiently like any other guest. We came here with the intent of buying a few half gallon tubs and for you to try and rush/kick us out is just not right. We left with a few half gallons still only because we love the ice cream. We had great customer service in the past visits but this time really pissed me off. It was embarrassing to be spoken to like that in front of all these people. We was not here to sample ice cream and leave, we came here to purchase. For people who are planning to come here, the ice cream are delicious but the service we received tonight was horrible. Word of advice, please treat your customers with respect. Maybe you had a bad day or somthing but do not take it out on us. Us customers, are who keeps you employed.
author: Jay S.

description:
Their tropical ice cream flavors are the best. Why would you buy your run of the mill ice cream flavors from Mitchell's when there's a Safeway across the street? I absolutely love their lúcuma flavor, a fruit from Peru. I've also tried the mango, ube, avocado, green tea, Dulce de Leche, and Kahlua Mocha Cream. They're all so rich in flavor, and it's fun to mix and match. 

I went here on a Wednesday night at around 9:30 at night and the place was packed! You already know that the ice cream is going to be delicious. There's hardly any parking though, so you'll have to drive around the neighborhood a few times to find a spot. Be prepared to walk a short distance and wait in line a little bit for your ice cream. Trust me, it's worth it.
author: Jo Anne L.

description:
While it doesn't get the same attention as Humphrey Slobome, Bi-Rite, Mr&Mrs Misc, etc, I think the ice cream here is on par with that of the others. If you feel like more traditional flavors*, it's easier to go here, but I also find the line even more unmanageable and the shop a bit more out of the way (for me) than the others, so it ends up being a pretty infrequent trip.

*or the tropical ones! While they're not always my favorites (except mango), they're great options, and who doesn't want the ube from time to time.
author: Lisa K.

description: We arrived at Mitchell's for ice cream after 10pm on a Monday and were surprised to see the place completely packed. After waiting for a bit we got to sample some ice cream and one of the supervisors gave us a free scoop of halo halo! I got the Ube and Thai Tea, both of which were mild flavors, and the serving was huge! One scoop is plenty for one person but there are so many flavors that it's hard to just choose one. Everyone in my party was very satisfied with their choices so many thanks to the hardworking and generous crew at the shop.
author: Mel L.

description: Why can't there be 6 stars?! The best ice cream on the planet. On rainy days there is a line down the street. That says it all. The only problem with this place is how do you chose? I like the Rum Raisin.
author: Julia R.

description:
Just a 5 minute walk from some good Bernal Heights restaurants on Mission Street like The Blue Plate (http://www.yelp.com/biz/rxY7canIJeXtICb6lprUcQ?hrid=D5YgAEW77mVApYpiconWDg) and Goood Frikin' Chicken (http://www.yelp.com/biz/8TSk-heAZkXC2vO0yV0CQg?hrid=kquG1fDeyKZiAFFbtcSiQA&fsid=SxSuYKZdKhmPnhFxl_LiVg), keep Mitchell's in mind as an excellent dessert option.  Scoops are not as cheap as Dairy Queen, but much more economical compared to eating $10 desserts at a restaurant.  Don't come here expecting trendy decor or gelatos --- this is an old school classic American ice cream shop.  No seating inside, so you'll need to hangout in the sidewalk to enjoy their creations, because you never want a bunch of friends (or children) with ice cream cones in your vehicle.  That's a big NO-NO.  

As you approach Mitchell's you'll see a crowd of people waiting outside.  Don't just stand behind them thinking that's the line, go inside and grab a number from the dispenser on the left as you enter the shop.  You'll see Safeway Deli style number on the wall behind the workers.  Don't worry, the line will go quick and the quality of the ice cream is worth the wait.

I'll have to come here several more times before I could give it 5 stars.
author: トモ T.

description:
Mitchell should be a must-stop for frozen dessert fanatics in San Francisco. They offer a wide range of flavors, some are commonly seen flavors whereas others are exotic and original. When I eat or make ice cream, I look for 3 qualities: texture, originality and taste, all of which are superb at Mitchell!

I tried Ube (Japanese purple yam), Grasshopper Pie (mint/chocoloate with fudge) and Macapuno (special, more fleshy coconut). All of them were interesting and delicious. YUM! The consistency of the ice cream was nice and creamy. Ube, one of Mitchell's famous flavors, was my favorite. Don't let any of the names distract you from being adventurous. Most people are pleasantly surprised after they taste-test them. I would say that Mitchell is better than bi-rite and comparable to Humphry Slocombe. I definitely recommend!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
San Francisco is teeming with Ice Cream shops that all have their distinct personalities like Mitchell's Ice Cream that offers a huge selection of flavors and forms to eat them in (milkshakes, waffle cones, etc..)

The line was long as was expected even though it was a cold weekday evening. They operate on a number system and call you when it's your turn. Lucky for us, half of the numbers called were for people who didn't have the patience to wait 20 minutes to get their treat. Poor saps.

My review stands really for only a couple flavors, notably their Kahlua Mocha Cream and their Lucuma. I've tried a couple others but they were less memorable. They have a plethora of unique flavors that would take some constant dedication (and patience) to try but hey, at least it'll never get old. On the side they sell buckets of flavors too so you can share the love back at home.

I'd go back and I'm lactose intolerant so that's got to say something.
author: Frank W.

description: If you want the real deal Mitchells will take care of all your ice cream cravings. they have old school values that's hard to find this place is a gem. don't waste your time with other brands. Give your business to a family business that puts TLC in what they do.
author: Bill K.

description:
Good ice cream.  I had the Mexican chocolate and Grasshopper.  Both were good and it was a fairly good combination in a cup.  I rode my bike here which was a nice option because parking sucks!  It was my first time here and I found the customers and staff very unhelpful. Here's the low down...

1)  There will always be a line, so just get use to it.  They do have a parking lot, but dont plan on parking there because its always full.

2)  Push your way inside and grab a number if you want to get scoops, sundaes, etc.  The number thing is right to the left of the door as you enter.  You also have the option of ordering 1/2 gallons to go which are pre-scooped...you dont need a number for this, just grab it from the freezer inside and precede to the special line.

3)  Take time to look at the menu and decide what you want or look on yelp to see whats currently popular.  Dont wait until your number is called to decide!!

4)  When they are about 5 numbers away from yours go inside and wait.  They call numbers really quick sometimes and you dont want to get passed up.

5)  They accept credit cards.  Enjoy :)

What I didnt enjoy about Mitchells was first the rude staff and customers and too many kids!!  Sorry, but I live in the castro and am not use to seeing so many families.  I can tell you that 9 times out of 10 kids dont care how good there ice cream is... ice cream is ice cream to them, and they dont want to wait 20 minutes to get it.  So in the meantime everyone else gets to enjoy them running around, crying, running into you, blocking the sidewalk, while they are forced to wait for their ice cream.
author: Alan H.

description:
As my grandpa's, dad's, and my favorite, Mitchell's ice cream is sure to one day be my kids' too. There's not one flavor that I don't like; even at tender age of five, when taste buds are strongly averse to alcohol, I couldn't help but finish my dad's Rum Raisin. 

Childhood fav: Grasshopper Pie. Cookies and cream meets mint chip plus fudge. What more to say? 

All Time Winner: Chocolate. If you're a real chocolate lover, look no further. Mitchell's chocolate is simple and intense, creamy and rich, and your gateway to heaven. No artificial, corn syrupy, chocolate-flavored nonsense here. 

When I'm not getting either of the above, I'll go with Young Coconut. One lick and you'll find yourself on a remote island, swaying back and forth in a multi-colored hammock... But really, it's like eating straight out of a freshly cracked coconut.
author: Desiree C.

description: Great choices of ice cream, ice cream sandwiches, and smoothies. Be prepared to order when your number is called - it's a ticket system, be sure to grab a ticket near the door when you walk in. The place moves fast and gets really crowded, but the quality and selection of ice cream is definitely worth it!
author: E M.

description: Went here recently for the first time in 5+ years and the great news is that this place has not changed! Still great ice cream and fast service. We went on a weekend evening and they were serving #33 when we arrived. In about 10 minutes they reached our number, which was 43. We enjoyed Coconut, Mint Chip, and Kahlua Mocha Creme flavors. Only $10 for three huge scoops.
author: Molly A.

description:
Cute shop, cool people, good ice cream
 
You need to think about the simple pleasures in the day. I wanted some good dessert and my friends raves about Mitchell's. I was mostly attracted to the old style of the place. I'm a sucker for that. The place was bright, clean and very cheery.

+Ube
+Thin Mint
+Banana
+Butterscotch Marble
+Espresso Toffee Crunch
+Mango (IC and sorbet)
+Peach (IC and sorbet)
= Passion Fruit, Guava (sorbet)

.....okay, basically, I'm saying to go time and time again to try all that you can. Recommend the flavors you want to try to your friends when you go together so you can try even more! haha. 
It's a great place and it was a great way to end my night.

Add this to the places you've been.
 I'm lactose and every single bite and horrific consequence was worth it.
author: Jennifer V.

description: Yummy I've been wanting to come here and few times now but one time it was around midnight. Awesome selection and yummy
author: .Jennifer G.

description: I haven't had a horrible flavor yet! I  this place! There is always a line. If you don't want to wait in line,  you can get a pre-packaged flavor and pay up front.
author: Josey M.

description: Absolutely incredible, and totally underrated/under-hyped. Bi-Rite is great, but I say skip the lines and head to Mitchell's - the flavors may be slightly less gourmet, but they're equally interesting, and they're all good. I got a chocolate dipped scoop on a cone which was fun and reasonably priced and just what I needed on a hot afternoon. There was a short line and we were helped and served quickly. Fantastic place - can't wait to go back.
author: Chris M.

description:
Ako ay isang Canadian-Pilipino na tinatawag din na Cana-pino.Nangangahulugan ito na dapat tikman ng anumang bagay na lumalaki sa ilalim ng lupa.Nagustuhan ko ang Buko, Macapuno at Ube lasa ice cream.Tatlong scoops (mga $ 7) at sa tingin ko hindi ako kumain para sa susunod na tatlong araw. Ang ice cream ay masyadong mayaman, at lactose intolerante, tingin ko ay i maging sakit masyadong mabilis.Mahal ko ito, na sa paglaon ng araw, ako ay upang bisitahin ang isa pang oras upang bumili ng dalawang 1/2 gallons ng higit pang mga tropikal na lasa para sa karagdagang pagkonsumo - mas Ube at Lanka

I have not been here in yeaaaars.....and I think I over did it today. OK, there's a fairly big line up there normally, and morons in line don't help (more on this later). OK, I OD'd on the tropical flavors. Being ethnically Canadian-Filipino makes me a Cana-pino that should taste anything that has a husk, grows underground or has a stalk...I went ape for the Buko, Macapuno and Ube. 3-scoops please (about $7) and I think I will be bouncing off the walls at work for the next three days. However, the ice cream was very rich, and being lactose intolerant, I think I will need blood transfusion quickly. I loved it so much, that later in the day, I had to swing by one more time (pre-packaged purchase does not require these little queue tickets), and I went for the jugular and bought two 1/2 gallons of more tropical flavors for further consumption-- more Ube and Lanka. I live in Silicon Valley, so please send ERTs down in two days.

Yes, the line-up is bad, and yes their hours are until 11pm, but that doesn't mean customers have all day to wait behind ill-mannered customers. So, why do arrogant beazies have to taste every single flavor of ice cream there is known to man-kind and back up the queue all the way out into San Jose Ave and 29th? The five-foot-nothing with 4 inch stilettos, Asian cheekahs,born and raised near Gunn PA but somehow speak like Ebonics was their native tongue (OK, I was eaves dropping), that now work on some high-techie firm, with needy urges to be cool--  are not born with tropical-fruit-flavor-icecream entitlement. I'm glad the guy behind the counter went Soup Nazi on them and did the right thing and moved them along.

Nuff ranting. It was still worth the wait.
author: Reyz A.

description: Excellent ice cream joint. Most well known in SF. Try something different .. Come to Mitchell's!
author: Michael S.

description:
I've been going for a couple of years now and whenever I'm in the City, I stop by for a 1/2 gallon, hand packed, Grasshopper.   Best mint base ice cream anywhere.  
I am amazed by the folks who say its not that good... they may have a conflict of interest because they usually name another Ice Cream place they like better.
People don't like long lines.... It's San Francisco, get use to it.
author: David M.

description:
I eat ice cream like there's no fat in them.  But I hate to be a party pooper. I really wanted to give this place 5 stars, but just couldn't. 

My rank for those top dog ice cream places in SF:
1.  Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream: sorry for straying, you are my numba one. 
2. Bi-Rite
3. Mitchell's Ice cream

I always take my family on mini food adventures when I'm back in the bay.  Since we were running on limited time, I brought them here right before our 3 course French meal at Chapeau!
