That's how the fam bam rolls, ice cream before dinner.  We got lucky with parking literally right in front of Mitchell's and grabbed a number.  We waited about 10-15 minutes as my sweet tooth was building up with excitement.  

When our number got called, I felt so rushed to try different flavors.  They definitely have a lot of fruity, exotic flavors along with standard ice cream flavors.  We tried the Ube, Halo-Halo, Jackfruit, Tropical Four (banana, guava, mango & pineapple), and cookies and cream.  

Ube had a very distinctive and acquired taste.  If you like them purple yams, then you will love this.  It reminded me a little of the taro flavor.   Halo Halo was creamy with delicious little bits in it.  Yummers.  But it wasn't anything unusually different than what I've had before. Same with the cookes & cream, nothing too special.  Same fat...same chemicals...same taste.  The jackfruit was exotic, but it didn't really taste like jackfruit.  The Tropical Four was pretty good, very fruity and had a refreshing taste.  My entire family concluded they preferred Humphry.

I got two scoops of Ube and Halo Halo and licked it down.  The cone was fresh and crispy which made it more delicious.  Mama Cheng exclaimed "you got two scoops?! Before dinner?"  My response: "uh....chyes?"  Yea, I got a few fatty stares.  

Then she proceeded to "help" me eat mine...

Overall, it's a solid ice cream place that has great texture and consistency.  But it's too safe and mainstream.  I like me some dangerous flavors! Bold and innovative names like Jesus Juice. Ha.

Sticking to the fine dime queen of ice cream in SF: Humphry Slocombe for now.
author: Cam C.

description:
I've been eating Mitchell's Ice Cream since I was inutero! My mom would tell me stories about how my dad and uncle would come home to find their wives missing...worried, they would take to the streets, searching for their missing pregnant ones. Inevitably they would find my mother and aunt Annie sitting curbside, eating their macapuno ice-creams in front of Mitchell's. 

This place is the best! They have all of my favorite tropical fruit flavors. Things like Ube, Mango, Macapuno, Lichi...they also make a mean Lemon Chiffon. It's creamy and yet also lemony. Such a divine contrast!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Eh.  Oh listen, I'm an ice cream fanatic and although Mitchell's has won awards galore I just think it's ordinary every-day ice cream that can be compared to store-bought.  Their ice cream is good and the flavors are certainly unrepeated elsewhere but the line is what gets me every time.  It's funny that we live in a city that get's to the low 50's/40s at night and people are still in line for hours waiting for their number to be called to grab their favorite Mitchell's flavor. I'd just rather wait in line at a different shoppe.

On the other hand - their milkshakes are heaven! One tip - Mitchell's has a lot of air added to their ice cream so grab a milkshake and it'll be one of the best you've ever had.
author: Kevin J.

description:
I love ice cream. SO MUCH, in fact, that I take home two pints a week. There's just something about the way fresh scoops or hand-packed pints taste right from the store. Maybe its the hot fudge on top. Maybe its the wait you have to get through before its your turn for grasshopper pie. With fudge. 

This place always has a line, so be prepared to wait about 15 minutes before your number is called. It is totalllly worth the wait.
author: Jenny C.

description:
Visiting Mitchell's Ice Cream Parlor is like stepping back in time
I have been missing out for way too long

I went with a friend on a Saturday afternoon in Mid-Summer
the wait wasn't very long maybe 10 minutes or so
I tried about 10 flavors before deciding on the coconut-pineapple
A must see if you are visiting SF
author: Max P.

description:
Just back from Mitchell's ice cream.  It's good for tropical fruit flavors & standard flavors.

Get your number inside on the Left from the ticket machine.  Then wait for your number to be called.

I asked how many I could sample & the guy said 10.  I only tried 5 though.  Peach, mango, Lucuma: a fruit flavor from Peru, blood orange, and the flavor of the month: dulce de leche.  I liked them ok.  Mango is their weakest flavor so skip it. Pumpkin in the winter months is suppose to be really good.

I ended up getting Cantaloupe in a regular cake cone for $2.65 - so no tax.  It's as written: $2.65 for Single Scoop.

You can use your credit/ATM card w/ purchase over $9.

No public bathrooms here!
author: Ann L.

description: Aside from the long wait on a Saturday night, the ice cream was amazing.  Mango or Tropical 4 is my go-to for sure, and sometimes I even pick up the ice cream to bring home that they have in the freezers.  Of course, like most ice cream places these days, one scoop takes you to almost $4, so the large gallon for $10 is considered reasonable.  Overall, I really enjoy all the flavors I've tried and always make a point to stop by whenever I'm around the area.
author: Stephanie F.

description: Waited on a sunday for about 20 mins for ice cream. Figured it was worth the wait since they had a handful of people outside waiting. Definetly some good quality ice cream. Got the rocky road on waffle cone. And I must come back for their banana split sundae!
author: Desi B.

description:
Spontaneous family outing to get ice cream after soccer practice?  This is exactly the kind of place that comes to mind.  It's like your local ice creamery with friendly people and excellent ice cream.  

Their flavors are more traditional in comparison to bi-rite/smitten/trendier shops, so if you're sick of "interesting" and prefer a more classic vanilla, strawberry, or mint chocolate chip selection, this is the place for you.  Of course, they do offer unique flavors like grasshopper pie and ube for those looking for a change.

Of the two flavors I tried (banana and grasshopper pie) -- both were good, but if I were to change one thing, I'd ease up a bit on the sugar.  I'd still come back for the grasshopper pie though.

What won me over was the general attitude of the people working there.  It was 10 minutes to closing, but I didn't feel rushed at all.  There was a $9 minimum to use a credit card, so when the person helping us found out the two of us were struggling to order enough to meet that minimum (and that we weren't actually eating for 4), he waived the rule for us.  I thought the least I could do was leave a nice review for the nice gesture.
author: Christine C.

description:
A SAN FRANCISCO MUST! My favorite ice cream

Worth the line every time. UBE and HaloHalo are beyond delicious. Makes me smike just thinking about it. Such a great value
author: Andrew V.

description: I have FIVE half-gallons of their ice cream in my freezer right now...
author: Jennifer L.

description: I tried green tea, mexican chocolate and ube. All were so good!! Their scoops are big. I got full off of 1 scoop.
author: Mela A.

description:
Macaouno!! Yummy creamy coconut ice cream! 

This is a popular place and it's worth the wait in line. Once your number gets called, don't be shy to ask for samples of any flavors you want to try and there are several exotic flavors. I had a difficult time choosing just one flavor but being a huge fan of coconut- I couldn't pass up Macaouno! Enjoy!!
author: Luci N.

description:
One word: WOW.

Good quality ice cream AND they have a large selection of flavors. Came here this evening and I was expecting to be in line for at least 30-1hr since previous yelpers say it gets THAT busy. Well I must've had real good luck for my first time going there because first of all, I didn't hit traffic coming from the east bay, didn't have a hard time finding the place, scored parking in their parking lot behind the building, and beat the large crowd that soon followed after my number was called. Wooooohoooooo! (Mind you, I got there around 7ish on a Friday night and I was expecting a long line out the door but when I got there there was only 2 people ahead of me). 

The awesome part is that once your number is called, the person helping you stays helping you the whole time. I really give the employees credit for their patience because my family and I were in there for a while deciding which ice creams we were going to get for my baby shower. The woman helping us was really patient and we didn't feel rushed at all despite of the other customers waiting. 

I sampled the grasshopper pie and let me telllllllllllll you. I am not a fan of anything mint (unless its gum or tooth paste). But their grasshopper pie ice cream is DELICIOUS! I wish I got a double scoop because I devoured that single scoop in literally 5 minutes. Before paying I was gonna get a pre packed 1/2 gallon of their grasshopper pie but this guy beat me to it! *sad face* it's okay, it gives me another reason to go back.

If you want good quality ice cream that's not TOO sweet and a thick and creamy consistency, Mitchell's is the place to go! I will def have to make a trip back before my baby is born :)
author: Angela G.

description:
3 stars for great taste and 2 stars for unique and variation of flavors!

I still remember the first time I had Mitchell's was when my mom bought me a Mango ice cream cake for one of my birthday's. The cake wasn't that great, a bit on the dry side. However, the ice cream was rich in flavor and super creamy. It wasn't overwhelmingly sweet! I love that Mitchell's has a ton of varieties in flavor. In the summer, they come out with a Canteloupe flavor. It's super refreshing and I love that there are real cantaloupe pieces in almost every bite. Like Rachel Ray says, "YUM-O!"
author: Candice H.

description:
Yum. This was a tasty little treat after my spicy dinner at SO in the Soma district. Mitchell's is unlike any other ice creamery I've ever been to, allow me to share...

I've heard lots of praise about Mitchell's in the past, but haven't had a chance to go until last week. Surprisingly, the place was hustling and bustling even at 10:30 pm. I guess it gets so busy here that they had to install a number ticket thingamajig. There's only one place I see those things, and that's at the damn pharmacy!

All I wanted was something quick and something chocolate. I decided on a double scoop on a sugar cone. The first scoop: Mexican chocolate, which had a very faint hint of cinnamon to it, hella creamy! The second scoop was halo halo flavor, which is a Filipino desert. I know!!! This was the first time I've ever seen Filipino ice cream on a menu, I was so elated. 

Thank you, Mitchell's for giving me enough sweetness to hit the spot, and for having halo halo flavored ice cream on hand for us Filipinos. I think I've fallen in love...
author: Tricia A.

description:
How much of the praise for this shop is momentum from years of childhood memories or "me-too" hype?

Or how much of my quite poor recent experience was a result of choosing the wrong time to visit and the wrong item to order?

On that night, around 9pm, the line was out the door.  Actually, "line" is a poor choice of words - any of these would be better: mob, scrum, gaggle, ... However you label it, it was an unpleasant experience.

Waited probably a half hour for my turn, maybe longer.  They prominently advertise that any flavor can be turned into a milkshake.  Letting my imagination run wild, it seemed like grasshopper pie, as a shake, would be incredible.  A sort of minty, chocolatey liquid with little chunks of crunchy cookie.

It was disgusting.  Really, really gross.  The predominant flavor was "greasy".  Greasy ice cream sludge.  I barely made it through the whole thing - but at the price they charged, you can be sure I was going to finish every drop.

10 minutes later, I was violently ill.

Ugh.

Out of fairness, my brain me wants to try them out again - something simple, like a cup of vanilla ice cream with nothing on it.  And then my stomach reminds me of just how terrible the last visit was and how many other excellent dessert options are in this city.

So far, stomach is winning.
author: Mike B.

description:
A little wait line and had to take a number. It was really hyped but didn't taste that good. Tasted the tropical four so they called it and thought it had a little flavor in there so I gave it a chance for the order, but it turned out completely flavorless on a small cheap cone of theirs.

The mint chip was bland to the core.

Waste of money; wasn't that cheap.
author: M A.

description:
Marthie D. and I barely beat the after-dinner rush when we came here. Once we asked for our respective scoops of ice cream, it seemed like 20 people walked in!

Lucky for us there was still FREE PARKING in the back when we got there, which was almost as big of a treat as the ice cream!

I got the Oreo cookie ice cream and it was PERFECT.  They put a good amount of Oreos in the ice cream--I hate it when ice cream makers skimp and use scraps.  There were whole cookies in there!  Also, the junior size cup (smallest) was a good price and the perfect amount after a fatty mac and cheese + meatloaf dinner.

Next time I'll be sure to try some of the more exotic flavors :)
author: Kristy S.

description:
OMG LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!

My favorite is Mexican Chocolate! Which is basically chocolate with a cinnamon kick to it! I actually always buy a 1/2 Gallon for home! The minute I am running low I start to hyperventilate!

My other favorite is Buko (baby coconut) and like to match it with Ube (purple taro)! 
(I would buy them for home too but bf doesn't like taro and coconut! Utter sadness...)

Anyway Love love LOVE IT!!!

Whenever I go there the line is never that long. Oh, when you go there remember to grab a ticket number as that's how they call you up to get your order. You can taste test too! =)

Mitchell's is by far my #1 ice cream place to go to in San Francisco!

And also this ice cream texture is not like the soft serve type, its actually solid-ish round ball type of ice cream and kind of has a marshmallow feel texture to it as it melts!
author: Michelle L.

description:
Mitchell's is ice cream heaven! No other ice cream shop can top the cold, soft, creamy, delightful, savory, and mouthwatering ice cream flavors they offer. 

I try to explore different flavors with each visit. I've yet to try Avocado and Mexican Chocolate, but I hear they're hella (yes hella) good. 

-I've had the standards: Grasshopper Pie & Butterscotch Marble 
-In addition to their tropics: Mango, Tropical Four, Ube, Buko and Macapuno (all seriously better than Filipino store bought ice cream brands). 
They're ALL good.
-My favorite 2 scoop combo: Tropical Four and Buko. 

Tips: Don't forget to grab a number! Unfortunately the wait can get VERY long, but it's worth it. Stick around and try not to wander off because there's usually a good chance someone will give up their number to you, so you'll be the next 10 instead of the next 20. Parking sucks too, but trust me when I say it's worth spending the time to find parking. 

If you're curious about flavors, ask for samples. 

For an ice cream shop to be successful 365 days, year after year, for 50+ years, you know it can't get any better than Mitchell's.
author: Sylvia O.

description:
A lot of people keep telling me that I have to go to Mitchell's. 
I have to. I will LOVE it. 
It is perfect for me. Whatever...I will choose what is perfect for me.
Dontneedanyonetelling 
Me...what I like. 
Mitchell's this. Mitchell's that. Oh, you have to try Mitchell's, there is nothing like Mitchell's.
Oh, you have never been to Mitchell's? It is the best.
Mitchell's, Mitchell's, Mitchell's....blah blah blah

So my dumb ass goes and checks out what all the talk is about. 
As I am walking up...I realize,
I have been here before. This isn't something new, exotic, unique... 
It is an ice cream shop. Nothing special...
**Looks at flavors- Eyes widen.

As I feign disinterest, I notice:
there is a line. I hate lines. F' this.
**stands in line...

AND I have to take a number? UGH... Who stands in line and takes a number for a simple ice cream scoop?
**takes a number...

So after several visits, I found out.
It is good. Is it amazing? The be all, end all? I can't say. 
But it is interesting enough 
that I will try to stop by again when I am in town.
**prettymuchanychanceIget. 

**F' this.
I like it.
I do.
The masses were right; it is something special and better than just ok.
Just hate taking numbers and waiting in lines
author: Rossi H.

description:
Im a sucker for ice cream on cold days!
I've heard a lot about this place so I begged my friends to drive me there at 1030pm. I hoped that it would be empty but I was wrong. This place was so busy even when it was half an hour before closing. We ran in and quickly grabbed a number. There were 2 people ahead of us and we just spent our time walking back and forth looking at the flavors they had. I tried the:

Mexican Chocolate - chocolate with cinnamon - pretty good!

Claires Pie - eh.

Ube - YUM! (I bought half a gallon to bring home to my family @$9.25)

Caramel Praline - too sweet for me!

I ended up getting the grasshopper pie which was mint ice cream with orea cookies and chocolate chips. The first couple bites were good but then it just got too sweet.. I gave the rest to my brother hahaha. Then I couldn't choose (and the guy that served us was waiting and I felt SOO bad) so I just randomly chose Strawberrys N Cream which tasted just like strawberry cheesecake, YUM! I definitely did not regret it. 

People started piling in AFTER we got our orders.. thank goodness!
author: Linda K.

description:
Just love this place!

Always take my guests (who enjoys good ice cream) there on their visit to beautiful San Francisco!

A lot to choose from.

Excellent service.

And even the line doesn't annoy you that much, it's kinda cool to be a part of all these people yarning to get the first bite!

My favourite one is pineapple coconut in a simple cone with chocolate dip! YAAAMMMM!

Tip: line is not as huge in day time (sometimes, even no line), so plan your trip accordingly, if you think u don't want to wait much.

ENJOY!
author: Anastasia B.

description:
Ok, I think I'm gonna have to call it. I think Mitchell's is actually my favorite ice cream place in the city. Yep, it's a hard decision to make but I think I'm ready to take that plunge.

Mitchell's seriously bucks the trend when it comes to SF ice cream places because it's just so... unpretentious. And yet it's still delicious! Unlike the other places in SF that have a quirky little twist with little chalkboards (see Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous) or strange flavors and weird designs (see Humphrey Slocombe), Mitchell's looks more like a Baskin Robbins with its fluorescent lighting and number tags at the door. But don't be fooled! The ice cream is every bit as legit as the others, perhaps even more so. 

There are sooo many choices here, which I love and appreciate! I hate that Mitchell's is so out of the way but I suppose that's good... keeping it a hidden secret for the residents. I got ube the last time I was here and it's PURPLE and FABULOUS just like our lovely city :) (ok SF isn't really purple, but just go with it). They let my friend and me try so many samples and everything I tried was freaking amazing. I love this place and I can't wait to go back!!
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Pumpkin - delicious, reminds me of Thanksgiving!
Mexican chocolate - super dense, perfect for any chocolate lover
Avocado - meh, don't think avocados and ice cream get along
Ube - looked prettier than it tasted
Grasshopper pie - excellent! can't go wrong with mint & oreos
author: Cindy T.

description:
Bi-Rite is closer in proximity to me, but I loved Mitchell's Ice Cream!

It has been here forever, true story--they have pictures of the buildings they are have been in since the 1920s or something. A true San Francisco establishment!

And it is so rich in flavor, and has fun flavor combinations.  They also sell pints to take home too :)
author: Lyndsey L.

description:
Ever since I came back from Cancun I've been slacking on my reviews! MY BAD...

Mitchell's has been my favorite ice cream spot in the bay area since I was a little kid.  Last week, my fiancé & I were in SF for our 1st tasting w/the wedding caterer.  As if we hadn't indulged enough, we decided to swing by Mitchell's for my favorite Avocado shake after the tasting. 

Upon arrival it was just as we had expected - no parking, long line, and plenty of people outside waiting to get in. Luckily we scored a spot in the back lot.  I immediately went inside to get a number.  There were 17 people ahead of me!  Considering the large # of people ahead of me the 25-minute wait wasn't bad.  

I anxiously waited for my # to be called.  However, when the time finally came and I ordered my shake I was crushed to hear they were out of Avocado ice cream!!!! OH NO!!!!!!!! =(  I decided to get a large Mocha Fudge shake instead.  It tasted much like a coffee shake.  I also ordered a waffle bowl with 2 scoops - Ube and Mango.  Not a total loss but still quite disappointing!  I guess this means I need to return to get my Avocado-fix! =P

* Credit Cards are accepted for charges over $9.50
author: Nikki C.

description:
You wait for about half an hour (it doesn't always have to be on a sunny day) for a few scoops of ice cream on a waffle cone and dipped in chocolate, but it's really worth the wait. 

My favorites would have to be:
-Tropical 4
-Coconut
-Ube
-MANGO (Amaaazing!)

Last year, I tried their homemade eggnog during the holidays, and it's REALLY creamy and deelish! I think I'm gonna drop by this Christmas for some egg nog :)

My parents and I would drive by to see all the people waiting outside the shop, and we would try to hunt down an empty parking space. After finding a parking space, we make our way through everyone patiently waiting to get some ice cream, and we grab a ticket. Once our ticket # gets called, then we're off to enjoy some really amazing ice cream :) Typical Mitchell's day.
author: Kristina B.

description: How is it that SF has so many good ice cream places? The new gen of Bi Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, and Ice Cream Shop sure are busy these days but Mitchell's has always been like that. Dare I say a good portion of Vanilla is still one of the simplest, creamiest options around?
author: Kim N.

description:
Love the super unique Filipino flavors!

The Halo Halo actually tastes like the drink itself and the mango is so smooth and intense.

These flavors are defiantly on the "lighter" more refreshing side to me but for indulgence Bi-Rite is still my pick.
author: Allison T.

description:
I've been going to Mitchell's ever since I can remember.  This place always brings back the carefree memories of my childhood when my dad would surprise my brother, sister and I for an afterschool treat.  I remember coming here when there weren't herds of people in line.  Now with all the ice cream and cupcake craze on the rise, the lines are now endless.  

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Mitchell's!  My favorite flavors are Ube, Mango & Strawberry.  In my opinion, they have the best strawberry.  I have yet to taste strawberry as good as theirs.  Mitchell's will always be the #1 ice cream shop to me.  

I need to try the Grasshopper flavor soon!  That sounds yummy!! :)
author: Sheila M.

description:
This place is amazing.

My friend brought me here a couple months ago, and at first I was skeptical. To me, ice cream is simply ice cream. Nothing incredibly special. But after coming to Mitchell's and having the grasshopper ice cream definitely made me fall in love with GOOD ice cream.

I'm looking forward my next trip out to SF
author: Karma B.

description:
The Mission has so many great ice cream places (Humphry Slocombe, Bi-Rite, etc), but this one is my favorite!  Great flavors (esp the tropical ones!), good prices, and parking is not nearly as bad as the aforementioned places.

Yesterday I got to try the lilikoi mango swirl and it was pure, tropical goodness!  I loved how the tanginess of the swirl complimented the creaminess of the ice cream...   mmm!  I've also tried the ube, peanut butter indulgence, and chocolate orange infusion and have loved them all.  Mitchell's, you're the best!
author: Jeff C.

description: Mitchell's avocado ice cream will always be one of my highlights of my SF trip. I was determined to try Bi-Rite one night but didn't make it before closing so my friends took me to Mitchell's instead. Mitchell's is a cute little ice cream shop where you have to pull a number and wait to be called. I was fascinated that there were so many exotic flavors! Many of them being asian flavors such as lychee, green tea, and halo halo. I ordered the avocado and the caramel praline. The caramel was so sweet (in a good way) where the avocado was so creamy and well.. avocado-y! I loved how you're allowed to try the flavors at Mitchells. Btw, my friends were raving about the grasshopper mint pie. Too bad I'm not a mint lover!
author: Marika T.

description:
Decent place!

Got some ice cream with some friends and everyone seemed to enjoy their dessert.

Nothing else special to write about
author: T. V.

description: There are a lot of flavors to choose from! Most importantly though their coffee ice cream is really good. It's strong but not overly strong. They also have rare flavors like ube and Thai ice tea. Overall, very satisfied and would definitely go back!
author: Venessa D.

description:
One of the best ice cream shops I have ever been too.
I was here on a Sunday morning at 10:50am, they open at 11am, and there is already a line forming outside!
As soon as they opened, people went in and headed for the freezer and grabbed the big buckets of ice cream!crazy.
I sampled 4 flavors: avocado, ube, halo halo, & lucuma.
Avocado has a funny after taste, ube was lightly sweet (love the color), lucuma ws really good, but halo halo was my favorite.
I got a single scoop of halo halo on a waffle cone, and the only thing I regret is not making a double scoop.
The workers here were really nice and friendly too.
If you like different tasting different flavors and love food, I highly recommend this place.
For sure I will come back if I am ever in the city!
author: Cindy E.

description: Love it! Get d slip, wait in line, choose ur flavor for both for here and to go. Text your friends what to bring coz they will tell u tfdi otherwise :) Got 4 tropical flavors but the junkier, the better it is, haha.
author: Heather S.

description:
It's been awhile since I had the pleasure of visiting Mitchell's Ice Cream in San Francisco.  Like years, almost a decade or two.  After soccer practice at 23rd and Folsom park I'd remember making occasional trips to the "Ice Cream Parlor". Not that I realized it back then, but Mitchell's was the place to be. 

Given the fact that I was kid I liked Mitchell's Ice Cream but I didn't appreciate the quality of Mitchell's.  Being a kid I just thought it was like any other ice cream. (With the exception of the Ice Cream man's Ice Cream). But as I got older and had endless trips to the grocery store with many trips including ice cream on the to get list. From Dreyers, Breyers, Sunnyside, Safeway, Safeway Select,  Ben & Jerry's, Hagen Daz, etc etc etc. They all cannot compare to the beautiful, exquisite, creative, unique, delicious concoctions that Mitchell's offers. In a league of their own in the Ice Cream game. I'm sure the Safeway across the street has horrible Ice Cream sales. Probably the worst in the district. Hahaha. Thank Mitchell's for that. 

In conclusion, you don't need to take my word that Mitchell's has one of a kind ice cream. Just read 1 of the 2300+ reviews.  Sorry Mitch, had to knock a star off for getting sticky hands and not having any hand sanitizer or wipes for ya boy or customers. I had a triple scoop on a sunny day? Lets see you accomplish that feat with no spillage. haha.  Also, an offer of a sample would have been nice.
author: Alastair G.

description:
Mitchell's currently serves the best pumpkin ice cream ever! 

I also love the eggnog ice cream during Christmastime.

Green tea is a good choice too. 

Get the half gallon. Trust me
author: Diana B.

description:
Worth the long wait. I try a few samples each trip. Ube + young coconut combo is still my favorite. Must try the halo halo on my next visit. If you can't wait, just grab the ready tubs in the freezer and they're just as good. 
Overall satisfying every trip.
author: Nelle L.

description:
Amongst all the gourmet hyped-up ice cream spots other city, Mitchell's still holds their own.  Lines still abound from one of the original gourmet/specialty ice cream parlors.  Take a number and wait for your number to be called (which I prefer over the long lines from the others).

I have had their ice creams featured at cafes, and even sold in gallons at specialty markets, but this was the first time I had ever been at the original spot that started it all.  They have plenty of flavors to choose from, but I am a sucker for their tropical flavors (ube - purple yam, buko - young coconut, jack fruit, and sweet coconut to name a few).

You get your choice of cones (regular, sugar, waffle), and can even get the ice cream chocolate dipped!  Service was good as they do not rush you after you have stood in line for 15 minutes.  I also agreed with my wife that this place is probably a better spot for kids, since they probably don't have the pallet for salted caramel, and secret breakfast...  For example, my son was perfectly satisfied with banana, and my daughter with pumpkin.  I had the buko (nice shuttle flavor with good texture from young coconut slivers), and my wife had the coconut pineapple chocolate dipped.

Loved the experience, and will be back!
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Silly me, I just realized that I haven't reviewed Mitchell's yet.  I've always really liked Mitchell's, though it's not my favorite tropical ice cream and they tend to stick to safe and mainstream tropical flavors.

I agree with Daniel for the most part when he observed that Mitchell's is unmatched for its variety, selection, price, and taste.  Compared to regular ice cream shops, Mitchell's is awesome and unique.  But compared to the wide variety of tropical flavors, I can still think of a few that I prefer (like Selecta and Magnolia for certain flavors).  Cheese with corn ice cream anyone?  Yep, delicious - don't knock it till you try it.  

That said, I had Jackfruit and Ube flavors in my recent trip...really really good.  Fortunately for us, they sell Mitchell's ice cream at Seafood City, so we won't always have to make it out to the city to get our fix.
author: Angel S.

description: The ice cream is truly worth the wait. They offer the conventional flavors to be expected at any creamery in addition to the tropical and exotic flavors they offer. I got Claire's pie and Grasshopper pie. Claire's pie was unique from any other flavors I've ever had before. It was creamy, had a variation of textures, and had a good balance of flavors between the bitterness of the Coffee and the sweetness of the toffee. The Grasshopper pie on the other hand was a minty and a touch too sweet for my liking. Fortunately, the line wasn't too long when my friend and I came in, but the store was still full of customers eager to get their filling of the delicious confections.
author: Geraldine C.

description: I scream. You scream. We all screamed when we had our first taste of Mitchell's ice cream. The line looks crazier than it really is and with the whole take-a-number system it went by pretty fast. I tasted almost EVERY flavor and to choose only 1 was probably one of the most difficult decisions of my life. So I decided on Halo-Halo with avocado ice cream and I was in Heaven. If you're in the vicinity of Mitchell's then I HIGHLY a stop over.
author: Pia N.

description:
I came back this weekend since I was in town and love love love this place!

I had the Cantaloupe flavored ice cream - it was tasty, refreshing, and made me happy all at once.  I've never had a bad experience in all my visits here because they have amazing flavors to offer.  There's an assortment of the timeless flavors and then the seasonal ones which keep me coming back.  I cannot wait for my next visit!
author: Julie C.

description:
super crowded!

Lanka, Halo Halo, Ube flavors are just awesome. Vanilla, Chocolate is rich! Some restaurants in the South Bay actually use Mitchell Halo Halo for their dessert.

I often get half-gallon to stock up (it can help to bring up to the express order line).
author: Khoa N.

description:
This is one of my favorite local ice cream shops. They have everything i'm looking for in my scoops of ice cream. Great flavors, creamy texture, and rich mouth feel. 

My must try recs are Toasted Almond and the Hawaiian mocha! YUM YUM.
author: Linda W.

description:
Thank you, Mitchell's, for understanding that people want ice cream at night, too.

It was 10:05pm, and all the other ice creameries around had closed up shop. Mitchell's, however, stood strong.

We headed over after dinner and parked in the back. Without a ridiculous line, we walked in, grabbed a number, and tried a few flavors. I ended up with a scoop of Claire's Pie (oh, her delicious, delicious pie: Colombian coffee ice cream with fudge swirls, almonds, chocolate chips, and graham crunch pieces) and another scoop of coffee (because, really, you can never have too much coffee ice cream).

The boy got a large Butterscotch Marble shake and finished it in under 10 minutes. I should note that this was after a large Italian meal. 

Yeah, he's awesome, I know. 

It was less than $5 for a double scoop, and with a menu that includes avocado, yuzu, and jackfruit, you can bet your sweet toosh I'll be back to sample more.
author: Adena B.

description: Great ice cream - the place is so popular! Even have to get a number from those old timey machines lol. Mitchells has lots of classic flavours like strawberry and vanilla, as well as more exotic and tropical flavours like halo halo and peruvian fruit. Price was reasonable. Ice cream served in cup or cone (regular, sugar, waffle). There's also some ice cream sold in tubs and other candy and goodies.
author: Bianca C.

description:
WHO RUNS THIS PLACE??? A DRUNKEN CLOWN???  

2.5 stars

Very good ice cream but not better than hundreds of other places in the city.  Take a number and wait while these very disorganized fools get to you (Last time it took 10 mins) Then eat it standing in the street surrounded by noisy smelly people who look like they have eaten waaaay to much ice cream in their lives.  

Also look at the colors, FOOD COLORING, not natural!
author: Senor T.

description: Have you tried these ice cream flavors, if you have not done that, it is time to do it, I think that there are too many places around the city but here is just great, kids and adults come here to taste these products, you will enjoy it. I just have one one recommendation, try to get people served in less time, usually it will take 15 to 20 minutes to get your ice cream.
author: Albert S.

description: My friend introduced me to Mitchell's and I will forever love him for it. Ice cream is my weakness and this place for sure hits the spot! Came around 7 pm and only had to wait about 10 mins for our number to be called. There's so many flavors that it gets pretty overwhelming. I didn't get to try all of the ones I wanted to try since I felt bad for the person that was helping us. My favorite flavors so far though are cantaloupe, halo halo, ube, and thai tea. I just can't believe I've never heard of this place before. I've been missing out! I'll have to grab those gallons of ice cream next time.
author: Micah Anne M.

description:
I had a super fun date, that set up all these games to play at different places. I can't share all of them here but you can read my other reviews to find out which places those were :-)

I love Mitchell's and have been here probably a dozen times but this time, my date challenged me to an ice cream tasting showdown.   Basically, it's how many tastings can you ask for before either 1) they cut you off or 2) you feel too guilty to ask for any more.    THIS should not be done on a super busy night for them and we actually lucked out and went at a time when it was fairly slow.  Normally on a week day when they first open is best.  And you always have to buy something.   It's rude to do a tasting and not get something ;-(   My date only got to 12 before they cut him off but I actually made it to 15 before I started feeling guilty.   HA! I still won... however I also had to still eat a serving of ice cream and feeling super guilty I ordered a waffle bowl sundae.  

The ice cream of course is very rich and so fresh, it really tastes like they made it that day.   I LOVED all the flavors, there's no way I can pick a favorite but I did get the Kahlua Mocha Cream.  

This review is for the servers there because they were entirely helpful, super sweet and VERY patient.   Even when they cut my date off, they were very nice about it and when he asked why they didn't cut me off, they told him I had a pretty smile :-)   That's a 10 star answer :-)
author: Deena B.

description: All time fav ice cream spot! We come here either warm or cold days SF weather for the BEST ice cream ever! Their parking sucks, aways has a long line but definitely it is WORTH the wait!
author: Bhonz Z.

description: grasshopper, enough said
author: Long C.

description:
Quick tip - come on cold days to avoid long lines.

Mitchells is the definition of ice cream. No fancy soft serve version, no crazy flavors like olive oil or bacon. Just plain ol' flavors like chocolate or vanilla. The texture and consistency is perfect. Does not taste like its been sitting in the freezer for weeks. It taste soft and fresh. 

I recommend the Ube flavor. The Ube is actually imported from the Philippines and is made fresh daily. They have tons of flavors to choose from and they do have their seasonal originals to choose from if you are feeling spontaneous.
author: Ryan R.

description: I love their ice cream. They have the traditional Filipino Ice Cream flavors plus a lot of variety.  Their ice cream is the best I had so far.  Long Lines.
author: lai c.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. 
I've had the ube and grasshopper pie 2-scoop combo and they were both delicious. The prices are pretty alright for the bigs scoops. To be honest, the price doesn't really matter to me because this place is delicious. 
Considering that this is a pretty popular place, there is usually a long wait. 
The people inside are really nice though and they're always willing to help you out if you're new to the place or forgot how the whole system works.
author: Ilah Kristel M.

description:
GRASSHOPPER PIE?!? Mint ice cream, oreos, fudge sauce, and chocolate chips. Good game, Mitchell's wins.

Kind of expensive though for a milkshake. But judging by the line OUT THE DOOR, I don't think people care very much. grab a number cuz youll be waiting 10-15 minutes on a Saturday afternoon.

my girlfriend got a junior scoop of ume (purple yam) ice cream on a cake cone with a chocolate shell dip. it came out lopsided and warped atop the cone, one lick and it almost toppled over to the ground. 

while a junior scoop was only $1.80 (without the choco dip), the small milkshake was $5, and it was on the liqui-dy side, needed more ice cream.

Also,
Chocolate shell is a must.
Milk shake uses whole milk.
Too many flavors.
$9 minimum for plastic.
a few storefront 10 minute parking spots.
author: Aron L.

description:
It's just ice cream. I don't understand the line or the prices. We totally got jipped on our junior scoops. A toddler came out after me with a junior scoop twice the size of mine. I was tempted to grab her ice cream and run, but her mom looked like she could totally take me down...

Next time I'll just get a whole tub of ice cream from the grocery and still have some change left to get some ice cream cones!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
Credit cards are accepted, with a minimum $9 purchase, which isn't hard between two people and double scoops! :-)

SOOOOO many AMAZING unique flavors. Some of my favorite seasonals: mango sorbet (the best mango ice cream/sorbet i've EVER had), nocciolo biscotti (hazelnut cookie), egg nog! (get the REAL EGG NOG when it's winter season, it's served warm!) passion fruit sorbet, peppermint candy, Chocolate orange Infusion.

As for this place compared to Bi-Rite, parking here is a teeny bit easier, and the ice cream is, in my opinion, creamier and greater in variety. You can also purchase a pre-packaged tub cheaper than you can other at that other place. One other thing that Mitchell's has over Bi-Rite is the wait. Instead of waiting in line like the unemployment line, you take a number and then relax outside with your friends, or in your car, until your number is called. The place is tiny, so not having to wait in line and potentially walk about to stay warm is HUGE PERK!!

Go love some Mitchell's!
author: Larry B.

description:
Getting to Mitchell's is a journey in itself, especially if you are from out of town.  Usually when I visit new creamery's I try any variation of their chocolate.  At Mitchell's, I tried their rocky road.  After all the raves I had heard about this place, I was actually quite disappointed. They do give you a very generous scoop.  However, the ice cream was just average for my taste.  Nothing spectacular that screamed out to me, visit me again!  Or grab another bite!  

Would I make the trip back out to Mitchell's?  Only if I was nearby.
author: Joyce B.

description:
absolutely excellent place

my only problem with this place is queue.  

but lots of good varieties. I like thin Mint and Mexican Cholocate. 
My wife likes Oreo cookie one. 

Great service. and consistent service. Their ice creams are not very sugary.  really great place

parking is an issue.
author: Jim A.

description:
First time here and I tried one of their new flavors, Blueberry Cobbler.
It looked like it was popular by the emptiness of the bin. 

The ice cream itself, without taking into account the flavors added, was rich and creamy. The blueberry flavors & shortbread throughout just added to the sweet delight.

I'm a fan and i'll definitely be back to try some of their other flaves.
author: Tera S.

description:
Whoa.  This place is overwhelming and PACKED.  I liked the different versions of ice cream that I couldn't find anywhere (I think I had the sea anemone or something like that - all I know that it was purple and tasty).  

Be prepared to jam into people, but also be prepared to have tasty ice cream and a lot of it.
author: Susan L.

description: Well good afternoon folks I come here often to get ice cream but I love coffee parking is a little hard but it's not terrible um shop owner everybody is nice and you can sit outside is nice sunny day but little cold but it's alright weekend's almost here try to enjoy it
author: Miko A.

description:
Tried the purple yam and the avocado. Purple yam I couldn't really taste anything distinct. The avocado I liked because it's so different. It has a really creamy light avocado flavor. 

Get is ticket with a number near the door. There's no line system.
author: B B.

description:
READ THIS MORE LIKE A 4.5*

This place is by far the best ice-cream place in the entire bay area. I have visited so many of the other ones, I just love this place. My entire family is almost addicted to this place.

My favorite flavors:
1) Chocolate Caramel Crackle
2) Dulce De Leche
3) Butterscotch Marble
4) Caramel Praline
5) Avocado

One Tip: If you want to pack some for home, dont get the pre-packaged ones. Wait in line and have them pack one for you. For some reason the one they pack tastes so much better. 

The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star is because (a) not much parking and (b) there is always a huge line..

Btw, the only other places I really like besides this is Gelato Classico (in Mountain View, Castro Street).
author: P R.

description:
My school sometimes does something right. 

Like ordering us Mitchell's ice cream for "Make Your Own Sundae Day."  Enjoyed the strawberry sorbert as a vegan, and all the other flavors as a regular omnivore. 

Seriously good ice cream.
author: Emily D.

description:
Love this place.. and always will.
Good ice cream.. long waits.. and so many flavors to choose from too!
author: Tiff C.

description:
THE BEST EVER and being an SF Native I grew up on this stuff. Being Filipino I grew up with a 1/2 gallon of Ube (purple yam & yummy), Mango (my favorite), Macapuno or Langka (yum) in the freezer at all times! This might be cause there's always a line and it was always easier to just grab a pre-pack and pay, rather then grabbing a number and waiting about 15 mins to an hour for a scoop of ice cream. 

Other then the yummy tropical flavors, I love the Grasshopper Pie (mint ice cream, chocolate shavings, Oreo cookies and fudge), Chocolate Caramel Crackle, Caramel Praline and the list goes on. There's also seasonal flavors such as Cantaloupe and Peach. The Kahlua Mocha Cream and Mexican Chocolate flavors make for a great tasting milkshake. Sooo hurry up, grab a number, park and plan out your cone, sundae or shake- either way you won't regret it!!!
author: S Y.

description:
My friends and I stumbled upon this place after our failed trip to Fentons. We searched up Ice cream places on Yelp and this place was rated 4 & a half. I could see why now.

The place is small but it is a definitely a gem in SF. There were plenty of ice cream flavors to choose from. Flavors like Halo halo, Horchata, and etc. There are way more varieties than most Ice cream places.

The service was excellent. The workers were really friendly and helpful. After their service and tasting their ice cream, you really can't help but tip them well! 

My boyfriend got the Butterscotch Caramel and it was sooo good. The mango shake was good as well, it wasn't too much mango but just enough. Their coffee was a bit bitter so if you're more of a sweet person, try getting the mocha one. 

They are known for their mango flavor ice cream but I gotta say..all their flavors were delicious!
author: Uyen L.

description:
- Wide variety of flavors all of which have unique mix-ins and clever names
- thick and creamy, a little too creamy - because heavy cream takes away from the flavor 
- is not frozen too well - it melts quick, so would recommend getting a cup or a cup with a cone on top of the ice cream
- flavor is no where near as strong as BI-RITE

As a former ice cream shop employee, i am picky about my ice cream.  This place could definetly pack in more flavor and cut some of the cream content of their ice creams.  i love the fact that all the flavors are all so unique, however it could be better.   

Mitchell's is good
Bi-Rite is BETTER
author: Tina A.

description: Rich, creamy ice cream..but I'm not a HUGE fan. I got the Ube and that was pretty decent, but since I'm from Los Angeles, I feel like I've tasted better ice cream. I would def give it another try with another flavor next time though!
author: Emily H.

description:
Mitchell o Mitchell, how you never disappoint me when I want to cheat my diet Now, Mitchells is my favorite ice cream shop in SF. Why? Their fruity tuitti flavors are fruitfully fruittastic! My all time favorites are the ube, cantaloupe, and banana flavors. 

They are very famous for their ube here and for good reason! This purple glob is full of real chunks of ube puree mixed with a light airy ice cream thats thick and creamy. The cantaloupe is fresh and tastes like actual cantaloupe. Banana is just amazing as they use fresh bananas as well. They have two giant freezers with pre packed ice cream so make sure to get a half gallon before you head out! I guarantee that you will be craving it the next day. 

Parking here is near impossible at all hours of the day. You would think noone would be here on a random wednesday afternoon with gloomy weather. NOPE! These people must be playing hooky with work but its still crowded, As a result, you might have to park far away, meaning a few blocks far and walk to the store. Its a very huge hassle because once you get there, you have to get a number and wait for it to be called. However, once you do manage to find impossible parking and live through the horrendously difficult wait, you are rewarded with the most rich and rewarding ice cream money can buy in San Francisco. Try it and better yet, conclude your date night here ;]
author: Shawn S.

description:
MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM - WHY ARE YOU ALWAYS CROWDED WHEN I COME! 
I don't want to wait in line to get your delicious tasty sweet oreo-cookies and cream sundaes! But seriously though, the wait is worth it. Parking in the area is a headache - it's like us adults wanting to go to the ice cream store are kids. We want to be first in line. 

Their flavors are good, I also enjoyed the Taro which is called "Ube" for some reason. I think it's Filipino for the samething? I like how Mitchell's has their own individual buckets of Ice Cream they sell. I wish I could buy it but I have to resist. Too much Mitchell's is not too good for my diet and future health! So I'd rather do the traveling there to get it once in awhile instead of having a stash in my home. Better to use your energy and strength to go out right?
author: David C.

description:
After reading such great reviews, and getting a personal rec from a friend that lives in the neighborhood (and RAVES about it), we finally went to check this place out. 

I rarely eat full fat ice cream, and was happy to be able to get a kiddie size scoop. I had the Grasshopper pie, and LOVED it! 

On the Sat. night we were there, it was a bit of a mob scene. They have a number system, (like a deli counter) but we wouldn't have known about it if it hadn't been for a the nice lady in front of us. 

As busy as they were, the line moved at a decent pace, and we got to taste a few flavors without feeling rushed. 

I've read up on this place, and it is truly a mom&pop/family run business. 
To have thrived for as long as they have, they must be doing something right! 

I appreciate that they're open late, since the time I'm most likely to get ice cream is after dinner. 

I look forward to returning:)
author: Amanda G.

description:
I love Mitchell's!  Of course my review could be biased because my dad used to take me here when I was a kid.  I just think that the ice cream here is just great!  Where they are strongest in my opinion is with their tropical flavors.  The avocado is great!  And the halo halo, which is based on a popular Filipino desert, is fantastic!

But they also have great standard flavors.  If you are into peanut butter, the peanut butter indulgence is really rich and tasty!  I also love the white pistachio and caramel praline flavors.  The one thing I miss though is the banana nut ice cream that they used to sell.  I used to get this with my dad all the time.  And now that he's gone, it was something that reminded me of him.

So definitely give Mitchell's a try if you haven't.  It's definitely worth the wait, and believe me you will be waiting during those hot sunny days.
author: Jesus R.

description:
The only thing wrong with this place is they do not have more locations as the lines can be insane. At least you can go the express route and buy the prepackaged tubs if you need a half a gallon in one of the more generic flavors. 
I love the green tea and the mocha almond fudge.
author: Darren W.

description: Been coming here since I was in my mommy's tummy!  I love their mango ice cream in a waffle cone dipped in chocolate. Their rum raisin is pretty good too. If you are coming here on a weekend or a hot weekday, be prepared to wait for a while and make sure you grab a number of you want something from behind the counter. If you just want to grab some prepacked ice cream to go, you can just walk up to the counter and pay. Great way to avoid the line. If you are an ice cream lover you definitely need to check this spot out, if you haven't already.
author: Gisele M.

description:
Don't be intimidated by the mob. The use of force is authorized. Enter the building, look immediately to your left, grab a paper number, and then retreat from the crowd. Turn your attention to countdown clock on the left wall. 25 numbers means about 20 minutes to wait. Once you're within 3 numbers, mobilize the troops. When you're 2 away, you should be stationed within shouting distance. Now set your sights on storming the counter. Reach into your pocket and draw your wallet. Number minus one: CHARGE! When they call your number, you will have 3 seconds to enter your order before your ticket self-destructs. 

This is my all-time favorite ice cream shop. In case you can't see the menu, it's half Philipino (bottom menu) and half American (top menu). From the top, I recommend grasshopper pie--single best mint creation of all time. Mexican chocolate is equally popular. From the bottom, the top choices are halo halo (based in purple ice cream called ube, pronounced "eww-bay"), baby coconut (if you're into eating babies), and jackfruit. One scoop is plenty. They have traditional desserts like regular halo halo, which is one of the best in the area. They also sell gallon containers in expedited fashion.
author: Lou S.

description:
mmmm mitchell's ice cream is so good.  Got there and there was a huge wait, but well worth it.  For once a place with unique flavors that actually taste good.  This isn't a salted caramel/jesus juice type of ice cream shop (slocombe).   Slocombe's ice creams are more like a mix of ingredients made into an ice cream, wine and coke, salt and pepper. Mitchell's ice creams are straightforward, u have jackfruit, ube, strawberry, etc. etc. there's very unique flavors i just cant think of them right now.

I had the jackfruit ice cream - pretty on point.  It tasted just like jackfruit, rich, flavorful, and sweet.  My sister got the peruvian fruit, I forget what it's called, but that was delish too.  I'm not sure how to explain it, but was a must try. =]

I sampled alot of different flavors and they were all pretty much good. Great place for some good ice cream.
author: Christine N.

description:
Was driving back to San Jose with my friend this evening and we passed by Mitchell's because of the crazy crowd packed outside. Hilariously enough, we had both JUST been talking about how full we were from brunch earlier that morning. The second we saw the name Mitchell's I knew we had to stop though. We both looked at each other and were like "LETS GO." Waited in line for ~10 minutes and was in awe to start trying flavors. Each was better than the next. I loved how friendly the staff was; even amidst a busy day they were so attentive and didn't rush us at all. They let me try 5 flavors with no hesitation. At one point I thought I was being annoying so I just asked the girl, "Wait but what do you think is better.. X or Y?" and she's like "Let me just give you another sample so you can decide for yourself." Haha. So glad we did because I loved everything I tried. I got 1 scoop of the peanut butter indulgence (basically chocolate and PB cups) and 1 scoop of the grasshopper pie. Ironically enough, I'm not a mint chocolate person whatsoever but this mint was so subtle -- combined with the fudge and Oreo pieces I was totally sold. 

Loved this more than any ice cream I've tried in the city so far (but to be fair, Bi-Rite is next on my list so who knows but I'm guessing they're pretty similar!). Thanks Mitchell's :)
author: Naseem K.

description:
Plain and simple, I'm an Oreo Cookie ice cream and milkshake fanatic. I will do anything to make sure I get the BEST ice cream or milkshake in town. ENTER MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM. 

Before 2009, I rarely traveled beyond Mission and 24th street, never thought anything appealing was past these boundaries. When I became mobile and began cruising the streets of San Francisco in the Chevy Impala, me and my girlfriend stumbled upon this location, a place she mentioned she's gone to but I've never heard of before.

At first glimpse, there was a good amount of people occupying the place and the outside, a minus when I have to be patient and wait my turn. Luckily, due to their fame and recognition, they have an effective numbering system to provide the fastest and fairest service to it's customers with 4 employees manning their stations.

When it comes to being your number, your faced with choosing from over 20+ flavors of deliciously, freshly made Ice Cream. As usual at most shops, you can have it in an ice cream cone (sugar, waffle, or regular). You can also build your own ice cream sandwich from any choice of ice cream (be it grasshopper pie, Mexican chocolate, coffee, etc) the combinations are endless, but the cookies deliver with their fresh taste. In addition, they make ice cream cakes in case your in need of a birthday cake or purely craving it!

If your like me and you crave a milkshake, OREO CRAZE it is! Large! For only $6, you have a monster milkshake with at least two scoops of Oreo cookie ice cream mixed in with milk and perfectly blended topped off with whip cream and Oreo cookie fragments. Without a doubt, Mitchell's prepares the BEST Oreo cookie milkshake in SAN FRANCISCO! 

With it's affordable prices, convenient parking spaces(sometimes full, but parking around), close proximity to delicious restaurants in the mission, and only a walking distance from Safeway, Mitchell's is the place to be. They close at 11pm, so keep and eye on the time if you plan to satisfy your craving for some tasty delectable ice cream!
author: Jesus A.

description:
I've been here twice now, and I think this place is overrated.

They have a good selection of ice cream, but the flavors don't scream gourmet and aren't worthy of their price tag or long wait.

There are so many ice cream places in San Francisco that I need to try that it isn't worth going back to Mitchell's.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
Their selection of ice cream will leave me standing their confused all day just wiggling my fingers in anticipation to what I really want. Do I want Filipino variety or do I want traditional flavors or how crazy do I want to go with my choosing. They are slightly organized but with the taste you'll get, you know why the lines are streaming outside of this micro store. 

Recommended? Yes
Too touristy? No
Worth your time? Definitely yes.
author: Jamie L.

description: This ice cream shop was just ok to me. The flavors didn't really wow me as I thought they would. I ordered the infamous ube ice cream on a waffle cone and it was alright. It looked nice when I took a picture of it on my phone but other than that, the flavor wasn't as sweet and creamy as I thought it would be. Call me weird but ice cream taste the same everywhere to me.
author: Ann P.

description:
How have I never written a review on Mitchell's Ice Cream?! 

It is just my opinion, but while I do love the other ice cream joints, this one is still the best. It's your straight up, good ol', "hey-let's-go-get-some-ice-cream!" place. They have all your classic flavors, but they also have tropical flavors which the island girl in me can really appreciate. Over the years I've had mango, ube, macapuno, and my latest love, avocado --which I have yet to break free from. 

Classic flavors are yum. Mint chip is really good. We got a half gallon of that stuff to go one night when we were too tired to wait our turn at the counter. The pre-packed stuff is just as good. I recommend it if you know what you want and they carry it in your flavor... and if you can wait till you get home to eat it. (It's also cheaper this way! Cheap and good is a phenomenal combination). 

Mitchell's "long line" consists of lots of people in the little shop waiting for their number to be called.  They are open pretty late, and even at 10pm, this place gets busy.  It moves pretty quickly though. Hooray for Mitchell's Ice Cream!
author: Lani S.

description: Outstandingly, high-quality homemade ice cream is available here! Suffering indecision stress over whether to order my favorite, coffee, or try the Kaluhua Mocha Cream ice cream, the scooper offered tastes of both, noting that the KMC was his favorite. He was right! I ordered a hot fudge sundae with the KMC and toasted almond. The fresh whipped cream and nuts were the perfect toppings. My companion, also sold on the KMC, loved the waffle cone. The clean, friendly environment is welcoming and the ice cream, deserving of all the awards on the wall! No wonder you have to take a number and sometimes, wait in line at this Heights gem!
author: Catherine S.

description: Number 52, but they are only calling 25.  Great!  I have time to narrow my choice down.  Someone walks out with chocolate coated Chocolate Caramel Crackle and another talked about the Mexican chocolate.  The sign for chocolate raspberry seems to be popping out of the signage, saying "take me, take me."  I chose the name that intrigued me.  Chocolate, and thick, gooey melted caramel, with chocolate flat bits, a bit sweet, but if you taste all the flavors, it is good.  Tried the Peruvian fruit: Lucuma.  interesting, but not a fan.  I spotted the Mud Pie that looked mighty tempting!  1/2 gallon ice creams are around $9.85?
author: Helen L.

description:
Sad, but true, it's my first time here. 

I like the # system where they call you by number so no one can cut in front of you. I like how they have junior scoop, so it's not too much and peach flavor is awesome!!!
author: Karen H.

description:
Pros
- Really good ice cream!
- Buko
- Halo halo

Cons 
- Not that much parking around? 

Came here last weekend. It's a pretty small place (larger than bi-rite though). You grab a number and just wait for them to call you up. The line moved pretty quickly. When our number was called, we asked for samples of the Mango, Halo Halo, Buko, and Macapuno. I think you can ask for more samples but we decided 2/person was enough. The Buko, Halo Halo, and Mango weren't overly sweet, which is great for people like me, who aren't crazy about sweet stuff. Macapuno was really good too but I don't think I'd be able to eat a whole cup of that. I recommend getting the junior sized scoop if you're not that hungry and a single if you're feeling ambitious. Parking was a little hard to find and we happened to roll up as someone else was leaving (score!). 

Tips: As other people have mentioned, if you get a pre-packaged half-gallon, you can skip the line. Stick with the tropical flavors!
author: Andrew S.

description:
This was the second to our last stop of the day after a good freaking day. Even though the Giants lost today, what better way to up your mood than eating it away with ice cream? 

It coincidentally was Ice Cream Day and they had specials for the day. The place was jam packed but with our luck, we found parking right outside as someone was leaving. To top off our luck even more, one of the customers had an extra number and gave it to us to use, allowing us to cut a few people. (*Don't forget to grab a number to the left of the entrance!)

We skimmed through the menu and when it was finally our turn (about 10 minutes after arriving....) I sampled the Tropical Four, which consists of Banana, pineapple, guava, and another flavor I can't quite remember :X. It was very good and refreshing. I love guava and wish it was a a bit more prominent. I tasted more banana and pineapple than guava. I also had the Claire's Pie, which include coffee, fudge, graham, and chocolate chips. My double was $3.50. 

They also offer pre packaged pints and you've already noticed from pictures. There's a parking lot behind the store but good luck finding space as its packed all the time.
author: Connie C.

description:
Great Ice cream place!!! Love their tropical ice creams :)
Parking can be a bit chaotic at times but all worth it.
author: L S.

description: LOVE this place. Tons of flavors to try, and super creamy.
author: Dimple B.

description:
Mitchell's deserves 5 stars. It's been around for years & it's still going strong! It's old-school & I love that. 

Grab a ticket & wait for your number to be called. 

I came here 2 weeks ago with my sister-in-law, nephew, & niece. It was crowded, but not super bad. We were #24, but they were on #11. Didn't take too long for them to call our number.

I went in while we were waiting for our number to be called to pick my flavor since I'd have to wait with the kids outside (too many people inside for a stroller & I luckily got the bench!). I was so sad that they didn't have Claire's Pie & Grasshopper Pie. I was craving one of those :( I ended up getting Mocha Fudge. Although not my first choice flavor, it was still very good & it hit the spot :) 

They do have their own private lot in back, but it gets filled real quick when it's busy/a really nice day. There's residential parking around; you just have to walk..but it's worth the walk! Haha.
author: Jessica A.

description: Simply the best ice cream in the bay area. The rum raisin is to die for. I travel over 50 miles to get it
author: Rob J.

description:
This place has ruined all other ice cream for me. Seriously. Your common or garden brands cannot compare at all after you've had a taste of Mitchell's stuff. I wasn't too big on ice cream before, but now I'm a believer.

very chaotic when you walk in, and it would be good to know about the ticketing/serving thing.  As a first timer it was difficult to try and decide on what to get, partly because of the variety (good thing) and said chaos (bad thing). Finally decided on a shake (chocolate crunch thing) and a pint of ice cream (dulche de leche). Service is a bit...meh...

As I said, not too into the whole ice cream thing. However, I had a taste of the shake...oh my giddy aunt.... I'm in love. Have since had miniscule bites of the ice cream to make it last as long as possible. Just thinking about it now is having a Pavlovian dog effect on me. Already planning my next visit.
author: Sazza R.

description:
Most of their ice cream flavors are good, but I favor their mango. It's not too sweet, slightly fluffy, yet creamy at the same time. Since I'm not that close to Mitchell's (but if I were, I'd probably gain a lot of weight, so it might not be a bad thing) I usually crave the Mango which prevents me from trying one of their other flavors. 

Their number ticketing system allows me to not have to stand in line and the workers are pretty quick in getting everyone in and out the door.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Mexican chocolate & avocado ice cream are the bomb!!!  Will definitely come back for more!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
How can I give anything less than four stars to an ice cream place? My friends and I stopped by here after dinner on a Wednesday night. Despite the chilly SF weather, there was still a line! I'm glad there are people out there as insane as I am to get ice cream on a cold night. 

Parking was a breeze as we all found parking right outside/a block away (but also keep in mind, this was a Wednesday night). 

Once you arrive, you grab a number from the ticket dispenser on the left near the entrance. They will serve you when your number is called (genius idea to avoid line cutters!)

There were so many flavors to choose from that eventually I stuck with what I knew best - Cookies N' Cream (Oreo Cookie, as Mitchell's calls it). I love huge cookie chunks in my cookies n' cream, so this one did not disappoint! All in all, I was quite satisfied with my dessert, but it wasn't mind-blowing or unique (hence the 4 stars instead of 5)

From reading all the other reviews, I definitely need to try their ube the next time I come back. 

And for credit card users, they only accept it with a $9 minimum (which is about 2-3 cones)
author: Gelene V.

description:
This review is solely for the Mexican chocolate flavor.

The texture is wonderful, and the flavor balance is perfect (not too sweet, not too spicy, dense with chocolate.)

Yum.
author: Adriana V.

description: This place is heaven. I like the Asian flavors that they have here. Out of all the flavors I would say my favorite would be the Mexican chocolate. The lines here are super long though.
author: John W.

description: This place doesn't need my review, but I'll write one anyways.  The sheer number of reviews sort of speak for themselves.  Just great ice cream, plain and simple.  I really like their texture consistency - a bit stretchy and chewy.  I personally like spumoni, but unfortunately it's seasonal.
author: Leland H.

description:
Man, if you love pumpkin as I do, then you'll need to try their (seasonal) pumpkin ice-cream, made with real pumpkin, nutmeg and spice. 

This place is great, which is one of the reasons it gets crazy busy. 

So many different types with many kinds among each, there are enough options to satisfy even the most finnicky.

Grab your number and decide while you wait. 

Very limited parking.

There is a lot of hype about this place. I think it lives up to it; but I am no connoisseur of ice-cream, smoothies, and so forth. ( Beer, that I know.) I imagine, however, that even Mitchell's at its worst is still better than most at their best.
author: S B.

description: I love this place! There's always a long line out the door so make sure you grab a ticket inside by the door. The ice cream here is absolutely delicious and is always worth the wait. I usually get Green tea, Chocolate, Kahlua mocha cream, Ube, Mango. Their customer service is excellent! Their staff are quick and efficient so make sure you give 'em a good tip! :)
author: Iris V.

description: Dropped by when they opened one Sunday morning (was only the second person in line).  I was with my aunt who hadn't been to Mitchells in over thirty years. Got a scoop of my favorite Mexican Chocolate, she got a scoop of Macapuno (coconut).  Love the flavor selections at this place. Service is always friendly and efficient.  Establishment is very clean. By the time we left there was a long line out the door -- not hard to do since the place is so tiny!
author: A O.

description: This place is definitely popular! There was a line out the door, and as I was eyeing the number dispenser, someone grabbed a number ahead of me. All the workers were men who looked a little harried. I was disappointed in the size cup I got for $3.20, and the Peanut Butter Indulgence had no "swirls of peanut butter," just a few mini peanut butter cups. The chocolate part was dark and creamy. Maybe San Franciscans don't have much ice cream to compare it to!
author: Liz S.

description: Not the first time in here, but definitely one of the best ice cream places in San Francisco. The ice cream cakes are ridiculously expensive, as are just a regular ice cream cones.   But you cannot deny the quality of this place as evidenced by the long lines outside every day.
author: Min C.

description: Lastnight was maybe my 10th trip here and I tried my first peanut butter blitz. It was sooooo yummy. There is alot going on in it but I really liked it. I sub'd one of the peanut butter indulgence scoops for espresso toffee crunch.. Took me an hour to eat it, but it was worth it. I swear their ice cream is like liquid gold! Thanks guys!
author: J B.

description:
I've driven by here on cold nights and there were people STILL lined up out the door, so you know the ice cream has got to be good! 

Mitchell's is a San Francisco staple. They've got an extensive amount of flavors (especially tropical fruits) and I can honestly say that I've never been disappointed with what I've ordered here.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Take my advice: drop one person off to get a number while the other scrounges for parking. The number machine is hidden directly to  the left of the door, way above eye level for shorties. When you get there, you'll see why you'll wanna thank me for this. You're welcome.

Mitchells is creamier than Bi-Rite. Ergo, better ice cream.
Ube (7x7 Big Eat) - a LOT like Taro
Ube Macapuno - Don't really taste the coconut, tastes a lot like Ube
Halo Halo - ice creams version of fruit cake, but exotic fruit, non-nasty but really sweet
Pistachio - very pistachio-ey, clean
Avocado - tastes like light avocado
Pumpkin - tastes like cold pumpkin pie
Caramel praline - big chunks of caramel, rich and classic
Grasshopper -  like mint choco chip and oreo had a love baby, yummy
Mexican Chocolate - the best Mexican choco ice cream I've had - my go to flavor here
Cinnamon Snap - like a ginger snap, awesome
Horchata - Best horchata ice cream anywhere

You know its good when its packed late at night with kids, old people, families, yuppies, hipsters, and gangsters alike. All seeking ice cream when its about 50 degrees outside.
author: Snuffles B.

description:
Even though the Bay Area is known for its vibrant ice cream culture that keeps everyone entertained all year round, there are no other ice cream places that matches Mitchell's for its variety, selection, price, taste, and the way they pack their cones. I had the pleasure of taking a walk to Mitchell's with fellow Yelpers Darryl P, Danny L, David B, Jason G, Jonathan W, Karen Y, Michael M, Phillip W, Peter L, Hannah C, East Bay CM Ligaya T, May C, Dorothy C and her husband Peter, Rinky N and her husband Mike, Stephanie J and her friend Linh, Tom R, Manabu M, Tammy C, Hen A, Marti L and her boyfriend Sam, Yelp's co-founder Russ S, and others for an ice cream social after a fabulous Latin American dinner at Mi Lindo Peru.

Earlier in the day I had warned Mitchell's that more than 25 ice cream fans were coming to stampede their store all at once, but their counter supervisor can only look at me in disbelief once he saw us busting through their door, clogging the entrance, and taking over their sidewalk. It was Yelp Country as far as I'm concerned, and I jumped at the chance of trying a giant scoop of their purple-grey-ish Halo Halo ice cream ($2.95) which had plenty of sexy on it and nicely packed all the way to the bottom of my crispy sugar cone. My humongous scoop was consistently creamy as all of their other flavors, and was filled with pieces of buko, langka, ube, pineapple, mango, and sweet beans for a delicious mix of tropical flavors and texture. Halo Halo was one of the Yelpers' preferred flavors of the night along with Buko, New York Cherry, Ube, Tropical Four, Chocolate Caramel Crackle, and many others. It was delicious to the core and one of the most bombass Yelp ice cream socials since my last visit to Mitchell's.

Although some of their employees understandably looked fatigued by this time of the night, they were extremely patient and personable as we only make up half of the people who were also there. Overall, it was worth the travel as I think it's hard to beat Bay Area's ice cream culture and Mitchell's is one that clearly stands out as one of the very best.
author: Daniel L.

description:
WOOO THEY HAVE HALO HALO HERE! 

No, not the xbox Halo game with the Spartan Master Chief, but the Filipino dessert of sweet beans, buko, langka, ube, pineapple, palm fruit, condensed milk, shaved ice and a scoop of your choice of ice cream! I had purple yam because it was deliciously awesome! 

On a super hot day, lines here are out the door and wrapping around the block! On a good Thursday to Sunday night, the lines are still hectic! o.o
author: Jason C. J.

description: Great ice cream with a wide variety of international flavors that are next to impossible to elsewhere. The ice cream is smooth, just sweet enough, and generally delicious.
author: Kevin U.

description:
For all the hype of the various "trendy" ice-cream options in SF (I'm looking at you Smitten, Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe), sometimes you just want a classic ice-cream. One that is creamy and makes you happy and comes in flavors like chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla...as well as ube and guava. 

Mitchell's is an institution for a reason and minus the 10-15 minute wait (walk in, get a number near the door, wait for your number) it's a place for solid, feel good ice-cream. Frequented by families and couples alike.
author: Madeline N.

description:
I just had to check out the hype.  Yes, the hype.

The ice cream is good, but I can't see myself standing in line for that long for a taste of one of the best scoops in the Bay Area.  I guess it's part of the social experience.

Have the halo-halo, ube, or macapuno, which are their signature flavors.  Note to two of the people I was with...if you're going to just have rocky road or coffee, save your time and gas and just buy a half gallon from the grocery store.
author: Ron L.

description:
I haven't been to Mitchell's since I was a student at Cal  (Mezoic Era) and I'm not sure why that is.  I loved it then and I'm happy to say I love it now.

After a perfect UYE at Mi Lindo Peru all 30 of us headed to Mitchell's.
Daniel L, who has got to be the sweetest and most generous Yelper, gave us each a gift card for a scoop of ice cream.  This must have been a monumental task in itself, buying all those cards in advance!

Dorothy and I walked to Mitchell's using our gift cards like diving rods.
(Both of our hubbys (ies?) were pretending like they didn't know us.
I was overjoyed to learn that once again I've found even more common ground with my kindred spirit........we discovered at our first face-to-face that both of us were married at SF City Hall.

Ligaya and R walked with us and we all were eagerly anticipating ICE CREAM!  Luckily Ligaya assured me that Mitchell's has REAL ice cream flavors not overly exotic like the trendy ones I avoid.  I say, "Give me chocolate or give me Death!"   I don't really say this but just to get my point across.

There were people lined up (besides us Yelpers) but they have a number machine so people could remain civil.  Actually I'm glad we had to wait because it gave me time to read over their menu sign over and over and over.  Of course I knew I was going to order the Chocolate Caramel Crunch.  There are about 20 or so flavors and at least three sorbet (non-dairy) flavors (which made my Vegan hubby so happy).

So I will be back soon.  That Chocolate Caramel Crunch was beyond divine!   The best ice cream I've had-----really!  Dorothy kept teasing my hubby since he got some wine flavored sorbet.  Little does she know his behavior is always like that not because of the alcohol content of the sorbet.

Okay, I seemed to have written a "stream of consciousness" review....again.  Ice cream does that to me even 36 hours after I've consumed it.  I always think that someday I am going to outgrow this wackiness............hmmmmm   not gonna happen.
author: Rinky N.

description: Mitchell's is a popular ice cream joint as evidenced by the multitude of cars that pull up front and in the back of the restaurant.  Like most places in SF, parking spots can be hard to come by, but Mitchell's actually has a decent sized parking lot (relatively speaking) in the back for its customers.  My group ordered some sundaes, green grasshopper and baby coconut flavored, and some strawberries and cream ice cream.  Pretty good stuff and it's reasonably priced.  The menu is expansive and there are many unique flavors, such as the tropical flavors, so be sure to ask your server for several samples.  I plan to get the "halo halo" flavor next time I come.  If the store is busy, be sure to grab a numbered ticket on your way in before you do anything else.  Finally, there is a $9.00 minimum if you want to use a credit card.
author: Daniel B.

description:
