This is a great ice cream place.  On sunny weekends, be prepared to wait in a crowded area.  However, the line will move fairly fast.  I love the huge variety of flavors this place has.  I'm always up for trying different flavors like ube and lucuma (both some of my favorites).  

Grab a couple of scoops and go for a walk.
author: Nerick M.

description:
Yum!! As an avid ice-creamaholic Mitchell's is definitely in my top five in the city. I had their caramel-praline in a junior cup last night and was delighted.

My other top ice cream picks are here:
http://www.yelp.com/list/best-ice-cream-in-san-francisco-san-francisco
author: Clara N.

description:
First time coming in, it was quite busy at 10pm on a Wed night. Parking may be annoying, so circle around a couple blocks rather than getting one in the lot.

When you go in, make sure you get a ticket for you number. I didn't know that they had a numbering system, so we stood there figuring out where the line started. 

I got the Biscotti Nocciole, which is hazelnut flavor with biscotti bits. Other friends had the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with fudge...yummy and a lot of flavors going on), espresso coffee, and coconut. 

Friendly and patient service!
author: Mandy D.

description: Best ice cream I have ever had! A local took me here during my stay in SF and I have always made a point to come back to Mitchell's when I come back. Delicious ice cream and flavor choices are definitely unique and exciting!!
author: Yasmeen G.

description: This is what you call the best of the best for Ice Cream. 3x better then Cream in every way. Have too many good unique flavors to die for. But before you go in to get your ice cream be warned there is a extremely long wait in line but well worth the wait. They have simple scoops of ice cream to cone or big fancy desserts to buy. The service is very nice and you can have as many samples as you like.I can't express how good there Ice Cream flavors are. Please give it a try I just wish I lived closer to here,  I'd say this place is even better then Ben & Jerrys and Ghirardellis.
author: Danny F.

description:
After a disappointing dinner which we cut short, we looked forward to a stop on the way back at Mitchell's for some Ice Cream to make it "all better".

We've been here a few times, but if it's your first visit, don't forget to grab a number, which we didn't know the first time we visited.  Since the number dispenser is not at the counter, but kind of around the corner when you walk in you could easily miss it.

I had a double scoop of Peanut Butter Decadence and Avocado.  Those two flavors really balanced each other out and I would highly recommend them together!
author: Liz K.

description:
I love picking up a tub of ice cream from this place, mainly so I don't have to stand in line. The prices for a tub are also a lot more affordable than at Bi-rite. 

My favorite flavor has to be UBE (Purple Yam). However, Buko (Young coconut) is growing on me. 

Will be back again soon!
author: Winny F.

description: Ok, I finally got here...even in the rain...yeah, travelled and walked through the rain without an umbrella. How bad do we want it?...Just to get some Mitchells! There's been a long standing debate over Mitchells and Bi-rite. I have to check this out myself in order for me to make a decision of which I prefer. Take me to Mitchells to see if I would love it! Hands down! Thumbs up! Mitchells; the ice cream was rich, creamy, and absolutely decadent. I stood outside near the bench while the rain kept falling as I licked, and took bites of my oreo cookie ice cream in a cone...I'm in a blissful state!  Me, freezing in the cold, and getting wet, it's OK,  Mitchells is here to save the day. The milkshakes are pretty tasty too and we headed back towards the car in the rain while I just had scrumptious moments crunching on the cone with my ice cream :)  I will be back Mitchells! I will be back!
author: Jennifer G.H. W.

description:
One of my top 3 ice cream places!  I grew up on Mitchells.  This place is a must to get your Tropical flavors: Mango, Ube, Langka. Delicious! If you think Magnolia Ice Cream is good, you have been fooled. 

The texture of all their ice cream is creamy and it's not too sweet where you need a cup of water to wash it all down afterwards.
author: Nikki Z.

description: So delicious! Creamy and flavorful, definitely recommend grasshopper pie and the chocolate caramel crackle. You'll be happy with a stop at this famous ice cream shop!
author: Leah G.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream, what a fantastic neighborhood spot. Been coming here multiple times and have tried a variety of flavors

What I recommend: TROPICAL FLAVORS!! Don't be afraid to ask for multiple samples before deciding on which flavor. Hehe the servers know to be patient, especially for the massive amount of kids that come in every weekend (or everyday)
I love Macapuno (the coconut flavor packs a PUNCH and there's also coconut bits in it too! -- much flavorful than Buka the other coconut flavor)
Lacuma tastes like a mild coffee and fruity flavor. 
Mango!! and lastly, UBE! 

Ube is purple yam and it's also very mild. In general, the ice cream at Mitchell's is not exactly sugary or strong in flavor. It's a nice medium of cream and flavor ..which can be good or bad depending on what you like. 

my other favorites that have chunky stuff in it, claire's pie and grasshopper pie. YUM YUM 

junior scoops $2.20, I normally recommend getting double junior scoops to maximize the flavors you get!
author: Sandra L.

description: I just love the ice cream here so much. Took a bunch of friends here for my birthday and they loved it as well! I've been twice and tried different flavors, but I always end up getting the strawberry n cream with the waffle cone. First time I came was at 10:45 pm on a Saturday night and the line was out the door! Second time was at 1 pm on a sunny Saturday and the line was more manageable. My family loves this place as well  highly recommended--this is coming from an ice cream lover.
author: Christina P.

description:
I can't believe it. I finally hit the jackpot when it comes to ice cream.

It was a beautiful mild Sunday afternoon and what better than to have ice cream.  I have been itching to try Mitchell's ice cream for sometimes but never really got the opportunity to be this part of the town.  

Effortlessly to say, I did just that.  We yelped the address and low and behold we got there.  Parking is not fun.  There was a mob in front of the place.  It is always busy so you had to take a number.  I didn't know that.  Thank goodness I opened my mouth and said "is this the line?"  Someone responded "No, you need to get a number and wait to be called".  

We waited for at least a good 20 minutes before being called.  When I think back it was well worth the wait.  Their ice creams are heaven.  I had the baby coconut called Baku.  It is absolutely one of the best flavored ice cream flavor I had in recent memories.  I also tried the irish coffee.  So so good.  

I am so coming back for more.  It is an absolute treat to still have ice cream at this day and age that is still homemade with their finest ingredients.
author: Angela L.

description:
Boom. Best ice cream in San Francisco. There, I said it. Screw you Bi-Rite.

Go late at night and the crowds thin out. Get your ice cream in a waffle cone (cake cones are for no one). Get more than one flavor. Buy a bucket to take home.

Kahlua mocha cream - you are my new favorite :)
author: Priscilla T.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is mediocre in my book. It is extremely chaotic in the store. You have to get a number to be served. There isn't a line so much as there is a crowd of people all waiting to be helped. Parking is not as bad as there is a small lot adjacent to the store and there are a couple of street spots right in front of the store. 

We went around 930 in the evening on a Saturday night and there was a crowd of people in and outside of the store. We were lucky enough to nab a spot right in front of the store. Service can be kind of slow but that's because you are trying to maneuver around a sea of people to be helped. Nothing incredibly memorable about this ice cream experiment but you must try the caramel pecan.
author: A D.

description: I love going here whenever the hubby and I visit my sister and brother in law! Try the ube/macapuno! Delish!
author: Rachell N.

description:
We tried three flavors: Claire's Pie, Halo Halo, and the "boring" flavor banana.

As I've said before, I'm all about trying exotic and new flavors and foods, and Mitchell's is in no shortage of fun flavors to try, from fruity ones like the Peruvian lucuma to lots of cake and chocolate lusciousness. 

Claire's Pie was very rich and had swirls of chocolate and cookie bits that were just yummy. 

Halo Halo was a hodgepodge of sorts--it was purple and had a buttload of goodies in every bite. I'm not even sure what I was eating. A green gummy? I dunno. I was kinda hoping it would be fruitier, but it was creamy. I can't quite put my finger on the flavor of the ice cream....almost taro-like.

Banana was somewhat of a disappointment. Didn't have much of a banana flavor.

I don't really like trendy ice cream places, and inside I was soon feeling quite claustrophobic from everyone trying to pay, waiting around for their call (grab a number!), and climbing over each other to see the ice cream in the case.

I applaud Mitchell's for staying true to its humble beginnings and not branching out--try looking up "locations" on their website--and, while the prices may seem questionably high at first, the scoops are pretty generous. But I think I'll only be eating here when I have out-of-towners visiting.
author: Kym M.

description:
Most of my coworkers are SF natives, and I am a recent transplant (been in the bay now for almost 2 years). When they'd talk about ice cream, this place came up consistently, and of course, it makes a girl wonder why. So one night after work, my coworkers invited me to join them at Mitchells. While I'm not usually much for sweets, I figured I'd see what the hype was all about.

I couldn't believe there was a line out the door. It was night. It was cold (mid 40s maybe) and the shop was full of people. Now is where I start to think this may be more than your standard cream. I goggled over the menu awhile and spied Banana (a particular favorite of mine in general) and Kahlua...oh no. I can't choose between the two...so I got a scoop of each, in a bowl because I am boring and don't like doing the whole "chase the drips with your tongue" thing. Got the BF a pint of peanut butter indulgence, because I am a nice girlfriend, the coworkers got black walnut and something else...I do not remember. I just know that this ice cream was amazing.

Typically I do not finish a bowl of ice cream. If my BF and I go out for ice cream or gelato, three out of five times he's finishing up a quarter or a half of my serving. I ate both scoops and felt pleasantly sugar buzzed. The flavor didn't get boring (as can sometimes happen). It's out of the way of my normal haunts, but hey, now I know what the hype's all about.
author: Jamie B.

description: The best ice cream in town. No matter how cool it gets, this place is always busy and packed.
author: May M.

description:
If it were solely on the flavors of the ice cream, I'd give it a five - hands down!  The ube is an interesting flavor, just like taro, and I like the tropical choices they offer. The flavors, especially the Mexican Chocolate and the Grasshopper Pie, are pretty much all to die for, which makes it a little more bearable to wait in such a long line. 

However, the line is why I took off a star. You have to wait... and wait... and wait. I like that you get a number and wait your turn, but wow. I guess some people really have to sample everything.
author: Amanda D.

description: Very good ice cream and appreciate the variety of flavors. The coconut pineapple was great....the mint chocolate  chip was ok, have had better.  My son even liked and ordered the yam ice cream.   Was worth the wait. Waffle cones 50 cents extra so get one!!!!
author: heather j.

description:
Wow! If you want to be bad.....Mitchell's is the place to go!

Once again, another line full of people out the door obviously waiting to experience something good! Being the brave warrior I am, I will wait for good things.

I took my number and waited and while I waited, I pondered over all the incredible flavors I wanted to try...My number was up and I had a few samples. First of the Ube Wow! My taste buds were star struck immediately- sweet and wonderful, definitely a winner! Then the French Custard Vanilla (I am truly a sucker for custard, It's my weakness) which upon trying, made my knees week...It was everything I imagined and more- a rich heavenly custard dream! I had one more sample of a caramel taffy one which was ok, though I was sold on the Ube and French Vanilla Custard...So being I hadn't had Ice cream in a while, not only was I going to be bad..I was going to be real bad, I ordered a small waffle cone with one scoop of Ube and one scoop of the Vanilla Custard dipped in Chocolate....Yes I know, I went all the way( Thank god I have a treadmill at home) 

Upon receiving it, it was much larger than I had expected and was only able to finish less than half, which nearly made me pass out. 

Sweet goodness this is literally some of the best Ice cream around!! Real, old fashioned, rich creamy Ice Cream, I will definitely be back!
author: Shannon H.

description:
read this article:

http://blogs.kqed.org/pop/2013/07/02/san-francisco-ice-cream-wars-what-your-allegiance-says-about-you/

i'm not a big ice cream person, but glad I've always been a Mitchell's fan over those other pretentious ice creameries! Ube and macapuno! YEAH BUDDY!
author: Wilson L.

description:
when it comes down to dessert, i am there especially ice cream!
my boyfriend has been taking me to the most popular ice cream parlors and this is one of them. 
when he told me to ube flavor (taro or purple yam) of course im there (Actually this has a lot of filipino desserts. if you're into the whole halo halo and all that other flavor stuff)
i got the double scoop of ube & buko (baby coconut) 
their ice cream is really creamy and thick & very rich on the flavor, which i like a lot from ice cream shops.
Ryan got the Cookie Monster shake and that was super delish. real oreos and creamy icecream blended in. 

I AM DEFINITELY COMING BACK =)
author: Stacey P.

description:
After 2200 reviews what more can I add?

Amazing ice cream...with all that butterfat it's soooo creamy and rich.  The best tropical flavors anywhere, sorry Magnolia.

I'm a huge Cinnamon fan.  I love their Cinnamon Gingersnap (thanks Amy C) and Mexican Chocolate.
author: Kim A.

description:
I start twitching every time I think back to the ice cream that I had at Mitchell's. Man...what a sugar rush!

Disclaimer: if given a choice between salty or sweet I would choose salty any time, spicy or sweet I would choose spicy. I'm not really a sweets guy but I still found Mitchell's to be one delicious treat! I have friends from LA who, whenever they come over to the Bay Area, buy dry ice and completely raid Mitchell's for friends and family back home. Last time they bought twenty-four of the half gallon ice cream. Yahhh... crazy! But that shows how good Mitchell's is...

They have a strong Filipino influence and you'll find flavors like buko, ginger, halo halo, langka, macapuno, ube and ube-macapuno well represented. Gahhh... let me detox from this sugar high from Mitchell's...
author: Don D.

description: The line is so long most days, but I like to drive over just for this ice cream. It's nice to find a place that serves Filipino ice cream flavors like macapuno(young coconut) and ube(purple yam). Plus, fresh halohalo is always a treat. In the end, if you're not willing to wait, there are several other places to go, but if you do, grab a pint to go so you can have some of their ice cream at home.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
I can't believe I haven't given five stars to MItchell's yet!  Maybe because we've been coming here for so long.

Once you go, you'll never want to go anywhere else.  the place is always packed so bring a friend to get out and get in line while you circle for parking (the parking in the back is deceptive, since it's usually full) but TOTALLY worth any wait.

PS: THEY HAVE ICE CREAM CAKES...and yes, if you loved Mint Chocolate Chip from Baskin Robins as a kid, you'll be blown away by Mitchell's version.  (sorry BR, you are just out of your league).
author: Mike V.

description:
Mitchell's was the only dessert place in walking distance from where we had brunch.  It was a nice Sunday afternoon and we weren't the only ones thinking ice cream was a good idea.  If there was a line it would be chaotic so they go by the ticket number system which you can grab on the left side after entering the room.

There were 4 of us,  two junior scoops and two milkshakes.  The junior scoops were TINY!  I've had my fair share of ice cream and I ALWAYS get the their junior version because there's always too much.  This little girl who also got a junior size walked away with this huge scoop of ice cream definitely twice of what we got.  What?  Do we look fat and this is their way of regulating American's waistline? haha

3 stars because I enjoyed the ice cream.
author: Rosalind S.

description:
I remember when the mere threat of taking away our Mitchelle's privilages was enough to scare us kids straight. "You hit your cousin! You don't get to go to Mitchell's!" or "You didn't do your homework! You don't get to go to Mitchell's!" Of course, all we had to do was whine enough & we'd be allowed to go to Mitchell's. Afterall, my mom & auntie weren't *that* cruel. 

Half a dozen kids & two over worked, fed up mothers (with ringing eardrums from the screaming) would pile up in the trusty station wagon & drive the few blocks over to *our* ice cream shop. And since San Francisco weather was always predictably decent, we never had to wait for summer for our cold treat.

This week was the first time I've set foot in Mitchell's in years. It looks the same. The only difference is instead of bumpin' 80's Michael Jackson on our way there, now we bump something from his more recent albums. 

I had two scoops: one of their chocolate caramel crackle & one of their coffee flavor;  Extra creamy & served to you with a smile & a million chaotic but fun childhood memories. The rest of the fam bam had:
avocado
langka (jackfruit)
mexican chocolate (super cinnemonny.)
Total: $11.25 (not including tip.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: my 3 year old says "dam this is good" and she's right. Bestest creamiest ice cream around!
author: Ezzie B.

description:
Single scoop of Egg Nog on a sugar cone, super yum!  It's a seasonal flavor, but hopefully they made enough to last until the spring. 

How do they make their ice cream sooooo creamy????
author: Mel P.

description:
Despite the big crowd and lack of parking, it didn't take long thanks to a patron that gave me their old number :) *note I passed mines onto someone else

They have lots of great flavors that are all pretty good. I tried a few and settled on the espresso toffee crunch and toasted almond. My favorite ice cream is toasted almond but I definitely prefer The Old San Francisco Creamery's in Walnut Creek. I got a sundae because I'm gluttonous haha. The hot fudge was just ok and the caramel didn't really pop like other places that I have had.

To be honest, it was just ok. I'd much rather get Bi-Rite because their flavors are little bit more unique. I do give them kudos for having Ube and other Filipino flavors.
author: Daniel D.

description:
Mexican chocolate Ice cream sandwich

I need to order the hand scooped ice cream because that's what everyone raves about. 

So for now 3 stars and next time I'll give it another try.
author: Eli T.

description: I find the lines to be obnoxious here and the ice cream low quality when compared to other great specialty ice cream places in the city.
author: Alexis T.

description: I went to this place right before leaving San Fran. I had the Mango Ice cream, and my husband had the Mexican Ice Cream. Both were hits, the flavors are right on. The really good thing about their ice cream is it has a pop factor when you taste it. The flavors are very relevant and bold! This is a great place to try if you enjoy homemade ice cream.
author: Hanan Q.

description:
You're too creamy. And melt-y. There, I said it.

Some of my friends are FAN-atics of this place but I never really got it. The ice cream always melts after a few bites, whether I buy it here or elsewhere. I've tried chocolate, fruit, tropical flavors, ice cream and sorbets: melty, melty, melty. Maybe it's due to being in a carton that's constantly scooped out for hours in a store.  Nope, I purchased a half gallon once and it melts straight out of the freezer too.

There is a parking lot but you may as well park blocks away on busy days though; it'll be quicker than waiting for an open spot. The usual line out the doors is exponentially longer on hot days. One hot September night, we were #59 while they were serving #22.

Since it's a San Francisco institution, I take out-of-town friends here but I'm not really a fan. If you're able to choose a single flavor to share, buy the prepacked ice cream. You can take and pay right away.
author: Yan E.

description:
How did an ice-cream store ever get THIS GOOD?

Mitchell's can boast of  a slew of exciting ice-cream flavors but their Kahlua Mocha ice-cream is one that I would gladly get intoxicated on.

I could blather on and on about how awesome this place is with their daily- made fresh ice-creams of every flavor conceivable and how they are always packed with patrons...but I won't.

My review won't do it justice...so just experience it for yourself.

It's on a busy street, so parking might be limited.

Quick-tip: They do offer all their flavors in to-go packs. So go ahead and grab one and save yourself a ton of time if you don't want to wait in line. You won't regret having some extra Mitchell's ice-cream in your freezer to savour for later.
author: Meghna S.

description:
Mitchell's is now an institution, a touch stone for ice cream / sorbet  fans.

The pear sorbet  - fresh tasting, bits of pear in the sorbet concoction. is a dream desert as are Buko (Baby Coconut), Ube (Purple Yam).  While becoming a cult gathering spot (like Tartines), it remains true to form and always great. 

Cones &  quarts to go are what I have had. 

Quality, local, old school ( a good thing ) ice cream joint. 

On a hot day ( in SF .... hmmmm count them on one hand) lines can be LONG !
author: Matsuo U.

description:
Great, traditional ice cream shop, without the hoity toity attitude that all the new spots in town seem to encompass. They make some fun and creative flavors (Ube, Horchata, Jackfruit) but are really all about the traditional ice cream shop experience.

My favorites are coconut-pineapple and the Oreo cookies and cream. The grasshopper pie is highly regarded by a few of my friends that I went with last time. 

I wish you would open up a shop in a more central location! I only get to go here when my car friends take me :(
author: Raina B.

description:
You want some salty nuts in your mouth?? Give me some salty nuts on a crunchy sugar cone please!! 

I don't know what propelled me to get salty nuts ice cream on this particular chilly SF night, but it was delicious and totally hit the sweet and salty spots. 

Get yourself a number and be prepared to wait amist a crowd drooling over their ice cream, but just know the wait is TOTALLY WORTH IT.  The wait is nothing compared to the feelings of sweet satisfaction you'll experience afterwards.

Lick, lick, lick. MMM.. thick and creamy. Rich but not too rich. Lick some more. Damn, theres still more!! I feel like I've done a lot of licking already. Man, this is a whole lotta salty nuts for one scoop! That's okay though, I like that. You sure get a lot of bang for your buck!

"Good old American flavors" with some exotic tropical asian flavors like ube, macapuno, avocado, green tea and mango and seasonal flavors like grasshopper pie and pumpkin. This is straight ice cream at it finest, no pretensions, no hipster flavors. I love the feel and look of the shop too, traditional, warm, bright and inviting, inducing a sense of childhood nostalgia.  They've had award-winning ice cream since 1953 so you know they'll do you right. They also have a variety of cookie, ice cream cones, pre-packaged containers and even chocolate-dipped bananas in a freezer if thats your cup of tea. 

The perfect SF treat on a perfectly chilly night. =)
author: Angela W.

description:
A great variety of flavors and nice texture.  Just wish the line wasn't so long.
Love the peanut buttercup.
author: Sheila L.

description:
If you have to check yelp to find out if Mitchell's is where it's at, well friend, you have been missing out.

Childhood staple. What little kid doesn't want a delicious sundae served in a giants helmet? Always worth the wait. Some of the best ice cream in the city  (up there with Swensen's). (hands down choose the old time staples over new hipster balsamic ice cream joints).  I stick with ube or pistachio, but you can never really go wrong. 

Mitchell's made growing up in the outer mission a very tasty experience!
author: Molly C.

description: An institution for a reason. While the crowd can look daunting, it moves quickly and I love the people watching. Every type of person is here and it never fails to make my heart full to see the happy kids with their ice creams. Mexican chocolate is one of the best things to ever happen to me.
author: Ge O.

description: I love this place... Ever since I was a kid I can remember my Dad and Grandpa bringing my brothers and I here! Every time my Husband and I come to the city and it is a nice day we have to come and get some ice cream! Mango is my favorite but their Übe is also pretty awesome! Just be mindful you will have to get a number and wait! So be patient! Also, if your it alone it is easier if you drop someone off get and number and have the driver look for parking! It isn't the easiest place to get too but it is worth the wait!
author: Karina S.

description:
My friend & I were driving back home from Guerneville (some little touristy town about 1.5 hours north of SF) and he INSISTED we go here.  To be honest, I was butt tired and just wanted to get home and rest but I gave in anyway.  He told me about how everyone he's brought has loved this place and he also told me about the many times when he's come and the wait was incredibly long. 

IT WAS SO GOOD!  It was actually not too busy on the day that we went even though the weather was nice and sunny.  We concluded that it was probably because the gay pride parade was going on!  Just our luck!!!

I had Thai Tea ice cream on a sugar cone ($2.10) and it was one of the best I've ever had.  The consistency of the ice cream was so smooth that it was almost like yogurt but not quite there.  The flavor was incredible.  Of course since I haven't had this flavor anywhere else, I can't compare  it but all I know is that I loved it.   It wasn't that strong but it stil tasted just like Thai Ice Tea!!!  

Before choosing this flavor, I tried the jackfruit and this will be good for jackfruit lovers because it's strong.  They also have a lot of other exotic flavors that I eventually want to try like purple yam, guava, passionfruit, and also a combination of those fruits.  You can also get any flavor they have in a half gallon for $8.50.  If it's not already pre-packed, they'll do it for you.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I've been here several times and I do enjoy the selection, quality, and flavor. I went there yesterday and I got an ubi ice cream (sweet purple yam flavor), and it was delicious, it's very mild and perfectly sweet.  Most of the flavors they have are delicious, however, horchata was horrible. The sample tasted good, I guess it was because of the small portion, but when you order the scoop it was extremely sweet and just tasted off.
Overall this is a fun play to go to for ice cream; they have so much to choose. I enjoy coming here.
author: Diana L.

description: Ice cream alert!  Irish Coffee is available at Mitchell's.  Coffee ice cream with mint.  They have thin mint ice cream too if you already finished your Girl Scout cookie supply.  Don't just sit there - run to Mitchell's!  NOW!
author: Maria S.

description:
I really enjoyed the pumpkin ice cream.

However, in the end I am not a big fan of the place in spite of all the hype.  It is located oddly with nothing interesting around it, meaning if I need to head out there solely for the ice cream.  I guess I'm also not really a fan of their foreign flavors.  So in the end, this place just isn't for me.(Obviously it is still far better than chains like Baskin Robbins or Coldstone)

 I prefer Bi-rite  and Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous
author: Jason S.

description:
Mitchell, you've been so good to me all these years, but I have a secret to tell you, I've been going to Humphry's and Bi-Rite... all the time. It doesn't mean I don't love you anymore, I still do, really I do!

Bad joke aside, Mitchell's offer the best pricing and biggest portion (compared to Humphry's and Bi-Rite). I rotate between the coconut pineapple and peach flavors here, but coconut pineapple is the best flavor hands down! Not to mention I usually get a 1/2 gal to go for the hot summer days and every other night ;)
author: Ming S.

description: We came here on a rainy Friday night around 9pm. Lots of people waiting around, but luckily, the "Take a number" system was in place which made it so much more pleasant. We ordered a double, a scoop of horchata and a scoop of caramel praline, both of which were fantastic. Parking around the area was easy peasy. We're hopeful to come back on a sunny day!
author: T K.

description:
server were very pleasant, we ask to try a couple of exotic ice cream. There ice cream are so good but totally creamy. I would definitely take some friends here.

It was so crowded and it took along time at least 30mins but all worth the wait.
author: ML A.

description:
Rich and creamy ice-cream. Had two scoops vanilla-choco chip with hot fudge. The fudge tastes really good too. Stands up to the hype created on yelp. Now, I am a fan of Mitchell's. 
Do not forget to pick the token as soon as you walk in. Stand in the queue if you wish to...only after picking a token. This thing is no so evident if there is a long queue and you are standing outside until you get in.
author: Mighty D.

description: The mexican hot chocolate ice cream was bold on the chocolate, subtle on the spices- awesome. The grasshopper flavor was great too. The staff was also awesome and gave us lots of samples and recommendations. Definitely recommend this shop.
author: Isaac R.

description:
This is my favorite ice cream place in SF. And I love ice cream. I like Bi-Rite, and I think Humphrey Slocombe is fine. But Mitchell's is the best of the best. 

Their "normal" flavors are the best versions of those normal flavors. Mexican chocolate? Cinnamony and delicious. Egg nog? Super rich and well-spiced. The crazy tropical flavors are awesome. Mix some chocolate with the mapuno (sweet coconut -- hope I got that right) and your mind will explode. 

Tip: Get a pint to split with a friend. You can get more than one flavor. The pricing structure also doesn't make much sense (e.g., two scoops costs almost as much as a pint), so this will help you economize. 

But for me, the best, the absolute BEST thing about Mitchell's is the staff/crowd. There's nary a hipster in sight. This is the real San Francisco. Which, in my humble opinion, is the real reason Mitchell's is so much better than Bi-Rite or HS.
author: Tom P.

description:
ONE OF MY FAVORITE ICE CREAM PLACES!

ANOTHER GO-TO PLACES WHEN I'M IN THE BAY AREA...

Grasshopper Pie. enough.said. 
its mint ice cream with caramel and oreo cookies...
i dont know ... i usually HATE mint ice cream but this is delicious. 

their other ice cream is fab. 
the texture of the ice cream is the type that stays cold... kind of sticky... doesnt melt into a cold puddle of a mess... 
great for cones. great for licking. like when you were 5. . . or 25.
author: Soo N.

description:
There are so many awesome ice cream spots in San Francisco and Mitchell's is my fave for one reason and one reason only....UBE ice cream! 

Ube is the stuff. I get it in a cone and dip the scoop in chocolate. Done deal!!

The line at Mitchell's goes by waaaay faster than at Bi-Rite (my #2 in SF) and really doesn't take as long as it looks like it would. I was there the other day and they were on number 43 and i was number 67. I thought "geeeeez" but it really only took about 10 mins before it was my turn to order. not bad at all! plus, the person behind the counter took our order with a smile. 

Can't ever ever ever go wrong with ordering ube at Mitchell's. :)

P.S. Ube is pronounced "Oo-Beh" :)
author: Krystle I.

description: Creamy and delicious. Bombdigidy ice cream! A huge variety of flavors!
author: Najiha A.

description:
I love ice cream. Any time of day. Especially on a warm, sunny day. I walked in and it was quiet, no other customers so I felt comfortable taking my time to survey the different flavors du jour. Once others rolled around, I didn't like feeling rushed to choose a flavor. I sampled the Ginger Spice, which was a modest replica of a doughy gingersnap. However, I realized an entire scoop of that would be a bit boring, so I opted for the Mexican chocolate, with a hint of cinnamon.
Great choice, as a junior scoop is enough for an afternoon snack. I have to say the prices are a little higher than Humphrey Slocombe, not sure why.

BONUS: parking (modest) in the back!
author: Alyssa G.

description:
Okay, I've tried all the new "gourmet" upstarts that have recently become popular in the city - i.e. the Bi-Rites, the Humphrey Slocombe's, etc...- and still nothing beats the old hometown favorite. 

Three words - sixteen percent butterfat. Dainty, floral flavors just don't come close; although, don't get me wrong - I like those too. 

But nothing compares to the creeeeeeeeeeeamy, chocolate-y richness of a scoop of Mitchell's Rocky Road in a waffle cone. Or a half-gallon of Ube ice cream stashed in your freezer, waiting for a sunny San Francisco day.

Okay, so they refuse to move from their original store and parking and waiting is a pain. Deal with it. I think their loyalty to the neighborhood (and probably their bottom line) says a lot more about the store than words ever could. 

My tip: make sure you take a number or just take the plunge and buy a half-gallon so you skip the line. Trust me, a cone is not enough :)
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
I am getting too excited here just thinking about their grasshopper ice cream.  So delicious and they have huge chunks of Oreo.  They do not skimp of the extras the way Coldstone does.  I drive after work to get ice cream after a bad day and it just melts my stresses away and takes me back to being a kid and being able to do whatever you want after you get home from school.  

They have other great flavors like Caramel Praline and Claire's Pie.  The only flavor I am not a fan if is the thin mint.  If you are going to serve thin mint, at least make it with thin mint cookies or something similar since that's the way it's supposed to be made.  I did some research and the thin mint ice cream flavor was introduced AFTER the Girl Scout cookies became popular.  This shaved chocolate stuff is ridiculous.  Using anything but thin mint cookies is absurd and imitation.  

Lines get pretty long though because servers are slow and people ask for sample after sample.  Best time to go is between 4-6 on a weekday and PLEASE only ask for a sample if you have never had this flavor and tasting it would make or break the purchase.  For those of you that are chronic samplers, please refer to Curb Your Enthusiasm Season 6, Episode 53, titled, "The Ida Funkhouser Roadside Memorial.

http://www.hbo.com/curb-your-enthusiasm/episodes/6/53-the-ida-funkhouser-roadside-memorial/synopsis.html
author: Victoria C.

description:
Haters are gonna hate, but my favorite here is Buko (Baby Coconut)!  There are slivers of fresh coconut pieces in every other bite and it's the thought of finding another sliver that stops me from putting my pint down- it's like a treasure hunt!

I've tried the Macapuno, and although it is supposed to be a customer favorite, I just don't think it's really meant for coconut fans since it's sweeten.

Mitchell's can be a wait, and there were 30 customers ahead of me when I last came here (for my coconut ice cream!), but it only took 30-40 mins for the line to abate and for my entrance to coconut heaven. :)

Pints are about $6 and they generously pack in the ice-cream until it's overflowing. You can also do half &half either vertically or horizontally along the container. Ube & Buko were a good mix.

In short, I go to Mitchell's for the coconut and the tropical flavors, Bi Rite for the salty caramel, Icy (in berkeley) for their asian &experimental flavors + chocolate cones, & Frenton's (in Oakland) for the crazy portions.
author: Lucia C.

description: I had the best sundae of my life here. It was called the Paradise sundae. It was coconut ice cream, ube ice cream, jackruit & mango puree, and whipped cream. They topped this masterpiece with crunchy coconut pieces and a ube wafer. I shared it with my auntie and I could not stop eating it. All that sugar gave me a tummy ache but it was worth it. I docked a star not because of my tummy ache but because this concoction was a monthly special. So the next time i visited sf a month later, this sundae was not on the menu. I was tempted to dock another star from that disappointing visit but I left it as props to creating my favorite dessert. MITCHELLS BRING IT BACK! thank you in advance!
author: Melissa P.

description:
Yum. A perfect place to visit on one of those rare hot SF weathers. 

I finally visited this place personally since my bf's brother always seem to bring home their mint chocolate chip  and I loved it a lot. (coming from someone who usually hates mint chocolate icecream from generic brands)

I ordered the mango smoothie which includes mango ice cream, mango juice and mango fruits. Overload of mangoes which is PERFECT for me. I was in mango heaven when I took my first sip of that smoothie. lol ;9 delish!

My bf ordered the Halo Halo and I thought that was only okay, didn't really suit my taste, but I think my bf enjoyed it.

Can't wait to  come back for another amazing mango smoothie :9
author: Harriet W.

description:
Who doesn't love ice cream?  I had the Buko and chocolate together in a cone.  WOW! the buko tastes of young coconut and not too sweet.  It was creamy and smooth.  The chocolate tasted rich and decadent.  I'm a fan.  

As expected it was crowded on a Saturday afternoon.  Take a number a soon as you walk into the place.  We didn't even mind the wait we were just engrossed at the number of flavors - exotic and traditional.  Be ready it's crowded.
author: Rox P.

description:
You just really can't beat the neighborhood joint like Mitchell's.  It's no wonder that all around San Francisco, you see "We Serve Mitchell's" signs in a lot of restaurants, even some famous dessert places use Mitchell's as an integral part of their desserts.

Location is pretty convenient off the freeway, parking is street parking which can get annoying but they also have a couple spots behind their building if you get lucky.  When try to enter, hang a quick left and see a classic ticket machine like at a Supermarket and grab a number.  Listen to your number and run for that server quick, jk, they are actually pretty good about being respectful especially if they are busy.  

Their flavors range from the normal to the unique, some of their flavors have a very Asian tilt to it which is appreciated.  No mater what you get, you can't go wrong.  Find a tiny corner to huddle up and eat your ice cream or enjoy on the benches outside on the rare beautiful days in SF.  

Mitchell's is quintissential SF.  Try it.
author: Brian C.

description:
With a random craving for some famous ice cream, my friend and I ventured out to Bi-Rite...only to find out they were CLOSED!  How could you be closed on a Tuesday night at 10:15?!?  Suddenly disappointed, we took solace in knowing that Mitchell's was only a short drive away.

After driving by twice to make sure that they were still open, we were pleasantly surprised to find that they had their own private parking lot.  Awesome!  Doubley awesome?  NO LINE.  Sweet!

Walked in and was wowed by their huge menu board and all of the "take home" ice creams you could pick up.  And don't forget all the condiments to go too!  I guess that certainly comes in hand when you get stuck in line and get tempted to just step out and get the goods to go.

The ice cream though, is real smooth and creamy...probably one of the best I've had.  It's not super firm, nor milky either; just watching them use the little plastic sample spoons to scoop samples was a good indicator.  No force, no snapping...just a firm yet still soft consistency.  And flavor?  Terrific.  Definitely on the sweet side, but who wouldn't give in to a little indulgence every now and again (and again)??

All in all, certainly superior to most other ice cream places I've been to...no brainer that I would come back for another go round.  That said, based on the stories of how long the lines can get, not sure I would drive out just to get some ice cream from there knowing I would have to wait that long; might just opt to pick some up and bring it home (they have an express line for the "take home" packages.  But, if I'm in the area, or luck into no line...I'm there.
author: Mike L.

description:
d*mn delicious ALL flavors of ICE CREAM!! :D 
especially the "avocado"... 

*REAL taste-flavors
*great staff (even their tired they kept smiling) 
*fast service 


super highly recommend.. lol :)
I'll be back for sure...
author: Ien F.

description:
Prior to actually visiting the shop, I had no idea that Mitchell's is a Filipino ice cream shop. With a misnomer name, I assumed it was just good ole American ice cream shop that served no other than vanilla. And maybe, my seasonal favorites of pumpkin ice cream and peppermint ice cream. 

Upon stepping foot into the shop, I was surprised to find my once-thought-to-be-seasonal ice cream of pumpkin being sold. Moreover, I was uber excited to see all the unique flavors it offers. For example, avocado, buko buko, coconut, and ube! 

For the cherry on top, the teenaged server boy was very patient and kind. As I excused myself for being indecisive, he allowed me to take ample time and even offered me samples. 

Overall, I am just jubilant to find my favorite fall time pumpkin ice cream being sold year round! On that note, I need to text my college roomie ASAP about the good news and to plan a visit to Mitchell's.
author: Mabel Y.

description:
I was born and raised in Noe Valley but my 6th grade teacher was the first person I can remember that introduced me to Mitchell's UBE ice cream, it's the perfect mix of creamy and sweet! 

As an adult the white pistachio and coconut pineapple are my new favs but whenever I'm in town and in the mood for ice cream I swing by Mitchell's, wait patiently in the line that seems to be present even on the brisk SF days and try a new flavor...one day maybe I will have tried them all!
author: Cianni E.

description:
I'm new in town, but guess what lives right around the corner from my place...yup that's right THE MOST AMAZING ICE CREAM PARLOR IN THE WORLD!

If you go during the weekend lets say on a Sunday afternoon, be prepared to wait in line FOREVER. However once you get your scoop of that magic frozen milk, all your worries and frustrations will melt away. 

Coconut and Pistachio are my faves although I'm sure all the flavors are amazing. My husband ordered the dazzler horn looking thing, and everyone looked at him with hungry jealous eyes, so if you want to make people mad (those waiting in line) order the Dulce de Leche Sunday Dazzler  thingofaboppy =).
author: Lannette G.

description:
When you're done with all the bougie, gourmet-styled ice cream snobberies in San Francisco, make a stop at Mitchell's. 

It's heavy. It's fat (16% BUTTERFAT, Y'ALL). Thick and creamy--the definition of homegrown, unpretentious frozen custard. Yet they have a HUGE following, and for good reason. Another Yelper mentioned that it's the "San Francisco version of Fenton's," and I completely agree. 

Some of my personal favorites are the Grasshopper Pie, Peanut Butter Indulgence, Mocha Fudge, and Oreo Cookie. I really have tried to be more adventurous, but usually find myself coming back to these staples. 

I was not a huge fan of the Ube, which bummed me out completely. But it seems like Cantaloupe is the next promising fruit flavor to try out? And with Herman Cain's recommendation, I might eventually try the Black Walnut. They let you try out different flavors before you buy!
author: Rachel F.

description:
There are few things in this world that get me excited and one of them is ICE CREAM!!!  If you don't believe me, just remember (or YouTube) Eddie Murphy's ice cream bit from Raw and you'll get a taste of what I'm talking about.

So since I've lived here for more than 2 minutes, I've had the opportunity to try the three major Mission-based ice cream joints, Bi-Rite, H. Slocombe, and Mitchell's.  Now I happen to really enjoy all three but I do think that Mitchell's has the other two beaten in terms of texture and consistancy.  If you are looking for a really rich, decadent ice cream that's creamy creamtastically creamalicious??  Look no further because Mitchell's has you covered.  

(You) But I heard they don't have a good flavor selection!  (Me) Dood, they have all the basics and a great selection of tropical flavors if you are into that sort of thing (which I am).  You can't go wrong with Jackfruit in my opinion.  But if you are looking for a Mr. Fancy Pants, Hoity-Toity, Eat My Ice Cream with My Pinky in the Air kind of ice cream flavor selection, then I would say Bi-Rite is your place.  I do say, their sundae with the orange flavored olive oil and sea salt is a bit ridiculous (in a very positive way).

(You) But I heard it takes forever to get your ice cream... (Me) Sometimes it does but trust me it's worth it!  Plus, if you come during the off hours you can get a pint to go pretty quickly and enjoy deliciousness in the comfort of your own PJs. 

(You) But it's not in the hip part of the Mission...it's in the boring Noe Valley-ish part.  (Me) So you can't get a $20 gourmet pizza on the same block.  How about walking off that $20 gourmet pizza on your way to Mitchell's?  Afterwards you can hit up a divey bar off Mission St and stumble your way back up to 18th St. Yum!
author: Alex A.

description:
This has to be the most overrated ice cream along with Fenton's.  I waited a hour in line for this?  Seriously?  I got the tropical flavor with pineapple, guava, and some other fruit and it was really bland didn't taste any of the flavors.  Too sweet and too creamy, not my cup of tea.  Also seems to be a lot of air in it. Basically tastes like cheap grocery store ice cream sold in those plastic gallon buckets. There wasn't even bits of fruit in it  I would take Gelato or frozen yogurt over it anyday.  Even Bi-Rite which is a couple of blocks away is better than this.

 Ok, I thought maybe I chose the wrong flavor, so I tried my wife's flavor salted caramel same thing really bland.  It all tasted like.sweet cream with no hint of any flavor.  This places sucks!  Honestly, I would rather have Ben and Jerry's in a carton than this!  Not sure why people like this place.  I don't get it.
author: Ethan C.

description:
They have the best damn ice cream EVER. I've sampled most of the flavors, but each time, I always get the grasshopper pie. It's this amazing mint ice cream with chocolate and waffle cone and lord knows what other goodness. One bite and I swear your tastebuds have died and gone to heaven, a minty chocolatey heaven. SO AMAZING. I've yet to try the tropical flavors, but I know someone who's a huge fan of the mango flavor. :p

I think as far as service goes, it's great because they have a ticket machine and they call out numbers. Pity on the poor shorties who have to wave their number from the back when their number gets called though. LOL.
author: Stacy X.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream has been a regular stop for me for the past 10+ yrs

I have 3 go-to flavors & just can't seem to get away from them to try anything new.....also can't seem to stick w/ a scoop or 2 - aka, tasting;  but instead, usually stock up on pints - aka, single serving containers

Macapuno - sweet coconut base w/ tender, chewy coconut

Mexican Chocolate - cinnamonny & chocolaty but not too sweet

Pumpkin - extremely pumpkinny w/ real pumpkin, nutmeg & all-spice .  This seasonal treat is a MUST have for Fall & Winter.... as much as you can possibly eat - you'll thank me!!

Sis swears by their Pecan Praline & their Buko (which is a lesser sweet version of the Macapuno)

Get there early to avoid the long wait - or grab your number & spend the time going through all the multitude of flavor combos you can possibly get

Or better yet, just buy a 1/2 gallon & walk right up to the window & you'll have lots to enjoy over & over again

Cash Only!
author: Adrienne G.

description: There is always a line for a reason. It's worth the effort. So many great flavors to choose from.
author: Dilly M.

description:
y u m m y  !

What more can I say about Mitchell's that hasn't been said a thousand times before me?  Not much more.  

After missing a UYE dinner with a few fellow Yelpers this evening at Esperpento due to work, I was able to meet up for dessert with Daniel L, Maybelline C, Paul K,  Brendan H, and Amy C to name some.  There's nothing better than enjoying ice cream on a chilly San Francisco night with laughs and great company.  So thanks you guys!

Skeptical of ordering something new here at Mitchell's, as I'm so in love with their Banana flavor, I took Daniel's advice and ordered the Pumpkin flavor in celebration of the Holidays among us.   Y U M M Y!  Loved pumpkin, absolutely had great flavor and tasted like it was fresh pumpkin pie.  

It's seasonal, so definitely try to make it over soon to try pumpkin. They also have other seasonal holiday flavors like Cinnamon, Peppermint, and Egg Nog flavors.   

$2.85 for a single scope on a sugar cone! Can't ask for a better deal!

Great company and   y u m m y   ice cream was the perfect end to my long work day.
author: Cass J.

description:
My first exposure to Mitchell's was when it was featured on a Food Network program, but that was when I was but a child -- unable to drive out and experience my own food adventures. Nowadays, my only problem is that I'm too nervous to drive in SF. Needless to say, I've been wanting to try this place for years! 

I finally had a taste of Mitchell's on my birthday! Being the fatty...er, food enthusiast that I am, I always wanted to have a food filled day trip in SF. My lovely friend brilliantly suggested we do it on my birthday and took it upon herself to be the driver.

After gorging ourselves on Ike's tasty sandwiches, we headed to Mitchell's for dessert. I decided on a scoop of Ube and a scoop of Espresso Toffee Crunch. Both were deliciously creamy. The first I didn't have to try. I'm Filipina, I know what that stuff is and it's almost always good. In this case, the Ube was quite possibly the best I've had. It tastes like ube cake in ice cream form! The Espresso Toffee Crunch was delicious as well! If you're a fan of coffee ice cream and Heath bar anything, you'll love this. It's a lot like Double Rainbow's, another award winning SF based ice cream company, Cappuccino Chocolate Crunch. My friends also enjoyed their selections, which were Halo-Halo, Mango Sorbet, and Tropical Four.

Service was okay, nothing particularly special or warm about the people working that day, but what evs. Also, the number system was off. They kept calling numbers that people didn't have. Minor "issues", if you can even call them that, so no loss of stars here. The ice cream was delish!
author: Vanessa U.

description: Family ice cream shop that imports ingredients from the Philippines! They have ube and halo halo... and all the normal flavors too. Small parking lot in back and was open late, huge crowd at like 9pm on a weeknight. It's kinda in the middle of nowhere and cash only though.
author: Vivian H.

description:
They are ALL THE BEST!!! The staff is amazing, I don't know how they can still be so nice, patient and pleasent even with a line around the block. Love their seasonal FLAVORS, 
I can't say I've had a bad flavor.... The Macapuno, green tea, pumpkin pie, grasshopper are my faves for now.....
author: Nana W.

description:
I'm a SoCal girl who would gladly move to NorCal if it meant being able to rendezvous with Mitchell whenever I pleased.

Ube, Mango, and Halo-halo. Every Filipino's ice cream dream come true.

*sigh it's a nightmare living in SoCal while the love of my life is in NorCal. Long distance relationships suck. I love you, Mitchell! Wait for me!
author: Geraldine S.

description:
Damn... It's Tuesday afternoon... 4 pm... Cut out of work early to go out to Mitchell's to get cantaloupe ice cream for my girl cause she's sick. Rode muni like an hour to get there... Walk in to buy my pint of cantaloupe and they're sold out... Place is empty, but they're sold out?? I mean it's not like it's Sunday and 90 degrees out. It's Tuesday and it's cold. 

What kind of old bull ish is that??? 

Mitchell's, your manager needs to learn how to handle stocking correctly... The ish is not hard! 

Going to bi-rite... And not coming back ya batches!
author: John S.

description: Best ice cream I have ever had! The banana ice cream is on point. I have never had a banana ice cream taste like that before and by that I mean actually taste like a banana. It is smooth and creamy. Perfection in each spoon. I also get the rocky road ice cream by the tub for about $10 which isn't bad for quality ice cream!
author: Brian Y.

description:
Mitchell's was packed on a Sat night at 10:15pm (they close at 11pm), so I was really impressed . . . 

I tried Buko (young coconut) - I didn't love it but all my other friends did and it's a very popular flavor apparently . . . 

I liked the Purple Yam (tastes like Taro) but I'd imagine it to be more rich, so I gave this place a 4 star instead of 5
author: Crystal L.

description:
Mitchell's packs their ice cream pints like nobody's business.
the bottom of the pint was on the verge of ripping off, and packed so densly all the way up to half an inch ABOVE the rim. it couldn't even close all the way!

It is AWESOME that they pack so much in it. 

it ends up being practically double the amount of ice cream you'd get from Humphry Slocombe's for less $.

they push the limits of the pint container...
author: Grilled O.

description: i will always love Mitchell's. Grew up eating it, still lovin it. Large variety of flavors and line moves rather quickly. There is always a line - rain or shine. i wish they opened later for those nights when I crave ice cream at like random times during the day. I usually get the Asian fruity flavors where i cant seem to get anywhere else but at Polly Anns. But this time i decided to try the grasshopper pie because the server was saying how it was pretty popular. It tasted like a those thin mint girl scout cookies, yum - but a bit heavy for what i was looking for. as always, i will be back
author: Kristina L.

description:
We came for the Mango ice cream, and we left disappointed.  On the other hand, the Langka flavor was awesome!!!  That's why Mitchell's gets 3 stars instead of just 1 star.  We were only half satisfied with the experience.

Since we've only been there just that one time, we will have to go back to give them more chances.  I look forward to trying other flavors that they have.  Til then though, it's only a 3 star grading.
author: PatrickJ T.

description:
Dear Mitchell's,

You ain't got nothin' to worry about with your competition, Bi-Rite. 
They can't compare and they can only stare at your longer lines and incredible menu.
I will always love you and I've recruited my aunt/uncles to your place. Now, they don't even grab a number. They strategize a drive-by...hazard lights on at the corner curb, dash into the express line, and exit with 2 gallons of Chocolate and Cookies N' Cream....PER VISIT! (they got a big family)

You're awesome and you ROCK! Thank you for existing!!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Alas, my dears. Alas.

First of all, let me just say that the employees were super-friendly, and patient, and the line was intimidating but it did move along at a steady clip. The parlor itself was brightly lit and seemed clean, so all of that is fine.

But the ice cream itself? No.

Admittedly, I am a foodie, a food snob, an ice cream snob--whatever labels you want to throw at me. I'm particular. I want ice cream to be: (a) creamy and smooth in texture, (b) absolutely natural in its ingredients, and (c) balanced--properly weighted--in flavor.

Mitchell's fails on all three counts. 

The texture is light, not creamy; it feels insubstantial. Ice cream must feel luxurious and indulgent. This wasn't it.

Now let's talk about the ingredients: there has to be food coloring in some of those ice creams. The avocado ice cream? I'm a California food snob. I know the colors of avocados. That bright, almost-lime green? Not it. 

And then, most importantly, the flavors. The 12 or so flavors we tried fell flat. They were not full. Have you had hard candies with orange or lemon flavoring? You know how those flavors aren't *really* what an orange or lemon tastes like? Yeah. That. The flavors reminded me of not-good candies.

Then there's the matter of balance. Do you drink wine? Have you had that experience where the taste of the wine on your tongue is fleeting? I hate that. I feel like the wine has no presence, no weight. There might be lovely notes up top, but no solid foundation. That's how I felt about this ice cream. The flavors were fleeting. 

I recognize that there's a lot of love for Mitchell's and they've been around forever. That's fine. And I recognize that they have these cool tropical flavors that are hard to find elsewhere. But that doesn't make their ice cream worth eating.

I ordered a small coffee ice cream because I felt guilty about not buying anything; my friends ordered some other stuff. I went outside and tried to eat it. After a couple of bites, I gave up, walked away and threw it discreetly into a trashcan.

Reader, I am an ice cream fiend. So this is saying something. As my friends and I headed back to wherever we were going, I found myself saying that Haagen Dazs was infinitely better. And it is. Even the regular line, rather than the "Five" line.

I do like Bi-Rite Creamery; I'm sort of enh-it's-all-right with Humphrey Slocombe. I really like Three Twins ice cream. And Jeni's Splendid Ice Creams is the stuff of my dreams. Just to give you an idea of what my tastes are.

If you do like their ice cream, excellent, because they have so many flavor options, and the ice cream is relatively inexpensive. (Jeni's is $12 a pint and worth every penny...)
author: Neha B.

description:
I'll take anything coffee.  I need to go back and try all the other flavors people keep talking and yelping about.  But I have a weakness for coffee flavors.  BUT I did try the lemon custard.  That was YUMMY!  If I could eat ice cream every day, I would! 

Ice cream makes me happy and so does Mitchell's.  And I discovered it being sold in my nearest liquor store.  DANGEROUS I tell ya!
author: Michelle B.

description: Been a San Franciscan forever and only came here for the first time recently?? Good. ice cream. Tried a couple flavors but I think my favorite thus far is the caramel praline even though it was from tasting a friend's cone and not from officially ordering the flavor. I like that they have a bigger selection of flavors than other hipster-ish ice cream places and also offer some pretty unique asian flavors.
author: Queena T.

description: Very long lines on weekends, and when it's hot out, which in San Francisco is not usually.  There's a lot of cool flavors like lychee, dulce de leche, and grasshopper pie.  I had the filipino flavors, buko and ube on a waffle cone for $5.75, and they're really generous with the scoops.
author: Justin M.

description:
Insect pie.

Sound good? Perhaps not.

How about Grasshopper Pie? That's what Mitchell's calls ice cream with fudge swirls, chocolate chips and Oreo pieces.

Sound better? It's one of the best desserts you'll ever have.
author: Jason B.

description:
My boyfriend is lactose intolerant and anything milk gives him horrible gas, stomach pains and sometimes even explosive diarrhea, but for Mitchell's ice cream, he will sacrifice because it is that good.

Came here one evening because the boyfriend was raving about this place. The setup was very homely. They have a process in which you take a ticket number and wait for your ticket to be called, very much like a Deli of sorts. We waited for about a good 20 minutes before our number was called. My boyfriend said 20 minutes was extremely fast service because on usual days the lines ran out the door, down the street and around the corner.

The associates were patient in my trying of practically every flavor before settling on one, which I don't remember because my boyfriend had the better flavor (Pralines). The ice cream is VERY very rich. Its amazingly creamy. I definitely recommend getting more than just a cone or cup because we had a pint each and I was sad after we finished them. 

Although the ice cream was rich it wasn't overly sweet. It was just the right amount of sweetness to make you wanna eat more.
It was an amazing experience! If in the neighborhood, you gotta have a try!
author: Jeff L.

description:
i love ice cream samples because you can try everything and then get full.. but of course i got a scoop, make that 1/4 pintt for myself that i barely made a dent into.  I ended up getting the mango which was refreshing and delicious.  after a big meal i didn't have room for anything creamy but it was all so yummy.  I tried avocado.. it was definitely interesting and tasted like avocado, but I couldn't bring myself to eat more than my sample.

 Bi rite is still my first ice cream love, but Mitchells you were delicious too!

w h a t   i   d i g 

sampling! what i do not dig?  choosing!
author: Anita I.

description:
Nothing I can add here, except for how awesome this place is. I make a stop every single time I'm in the city: rain or freezing winds at 11pm would do little to deter me from this heavenly gem. 
Lucuma is the word! I personally transport 3 tubs back to SJ each time. Ask them for the frozen solid ones they have in the back for 1+hr trips. 
The Ube, Halo halo, mango, and seasonal flavors are awesome. 

And the melon? I've stopped eating it until I can share a scoop with my darling mother who LOVES melon ice-cream. And I can tell you I'm buying a ticket for mommy so I can have a few scoops...umm...so I can see her,.. :S
author: Tried This B.

description:
I stayed in the Bay Area for a week and ate this about half the time I was there. My relatives based in the area love it and always have a gallon in their freezer. They took me to the shop and we all had ice cream for dinner. Now that is a vacation.

The tropical/Filipino flavors are my favorite, so I can't say anything about the standard ones, but the flavor is spot on, not cloying and the texture is smooth. I am partial to ube (purple yam) and buko (young coconut). However, I also love pandan, avocado and langka (jackfruit). Definitely better than Magnolia brand or Selecta brand (these are two major Filipino ice cream brands that are available worldwide). The service is also nice and cheerful. 

Can't wait to go back!
author: Theresa S.

description: This place just makes me happy...  I dont care if I have to wait hours in line in the freezing cold... or look like a dork when I'm asking to try every flavor... because they have millions of different flavors... MILLIONS lol... I think I've had everything here... get the banana split!!! great for sharing... bec lets be honest... who goes to get ice cream alone... and even if you are being a fatty and going on a solo mission to get ice cream... *shrugs* who ever said no to more ice cream :)
author: Mish L.

description: They have a LOT of flavors!! Make sure to take a number by the door before you check the place out, it could be a while before you get helped! I liked the texture of the ice cream, very chewy and gooey-ish but a little softer than id like it to be. -I like my ice cream firm. Still very good though. They have a lot of Asian and other ethnic flavors which is a nice change but doesnt make the selection process any easier!
author: Alyssa O.

description:
The number of reviews and stars really do speak for themselves.  

Mitchell's is wonderful.  Despite the rain drizzling outside, we waited 20 minutes before it was our turn to order.  This place is nothing like Bi-Rite Creamery in the Mission or Smitten in Hayes Valley -- on the ice cream spectrum, it's closer to Swensons in Nob Hill, Fentons in Oakland and Leatherbys in Sacramento (though I'd say this is a creamier, sweeter, and overall more satisfying experience).    I got a junior double scoop of chocolate and carmel praline on a waffle cone. It was huge; I felt like a kid again; it was pretty much perfect. 

Go get yourself a cone and enjoy :)
author: Kimya P.

description: Pumpkin ice cream, Thai ice cream, ube ice cream are amazing!!!! A must try definitely has to be the horchata it's the best & it's only available occasionally. There's always a wait but it goes by fast. Definitely worth it.
author: Veronica L.

description: Come after 8pm, there's parking in the back and it is not crowded. $9.95 for a tub of ice cream. My favorites are Ube and Halo Halo. I have yet to try the green tea. The pumpkin and thin mint is also good, but doesn't stand out to me as much as Ube and Halo Halo does. Always crowded during the day, so expect to wait.
author: Amanda C.

description:
My parents named me, Michelle, after Mitchell's Ice Cream. 

I think that is ALL i have to say to give this a 5 star review :D 

Tropical 4 is my favorite.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Perfect late night dessert spot! So many wonderful flavors! Ube ice cream and vanilla french custard! Such a good combination! Open till 11 and always consistent with their ice cream. Long line but they serve so fast it goes through quickly. Love this place and will be returning. 

Parking is a little tough. Just be patient. You wont be disappointed
author: Joseph G.

description:
Don't be fooled by the line out the door. It goes fast. 
Once you're able to find a parking space make sure to grab a ticket on the left side of the door. There is no need to form a line your number will be called in do time. I would suggest if you know what you want to wait outside and allow others to make there selection. If you're having a hard time decided which ice cream you want they do give out free samples. I haven't been able to try all of them but here are my top five:
Kahlúa mocha cream
Horchata
Pistachio
Avocado
Pumpkin (seasonal)
If you're on the go I would recommend there ice cream sandwiches (so yummy)

Bonus:  This place is dog friendly. If you have your furry friend with you make sure to grab some complimentary doggies biscuits located right in the middle of the counter. My dog loves 'em
author: Dorii X.

description:
Oh man, it might be a good thing that Mitchells is not anywhere near where I live.  My fiancee and I would easily both be overweight again!

Their ice cream is the creamiest I've ever had, ever!  And I love their assortment of tropical flavors too!  So stinkin' good!
author: Jaime P.

description: Was in the neighborhood for just a couple days, but had to hit this place repeatedly. The sweet coconut and mexican chocolate ice creams made me happy.
author: Peter K.

description: I still think Swenson's and Bi-Rite are better but Mitchell's is still a really good place for ice cream. The grasshopper pie was really good but rich. The Mexican chocolate is also good. It basically tastes like a cinnamon chocolate.
author: Collin W.

description: No one is answering the phone... :(  Does anyone know if they have maple walnut ice cream in stock right now?  Appreciate any feedback from the store or recent visitors.  Thanks!
author: Maria L.

description:
I've been coming here for ice cream since I was a kid. 
And if you were to ask me is there any other shop where they have better ice cream, I'd say the answer is no.
Their ice cream sandwiches are the best thing ever. 
Sorry It's It's...
This place is always packed for a reason.
author: Linnea H.

description: The best ice cream in the bay area. Cheaper, tastier, and has a shorter line than birite. The ube flavour is unique with perfect creamiest and a complex caramel flavour with subtle earthy tones. The mango ice cream is phenomenal.
author: John S.

description:
The "Grasshopper Pie" was the sh*t! I was hesitant but Im glad I got it. Great service even at 10:30 at night, the employees were kind and happy. I enjoyed it so much I went back 5 minutes later and bought a half gallon to take home.

Well worth the visit, dont forget to grab a number on the way in!
Oh and if you are buying prepackaged items, head straight to the right side under a sign that says "express line" - you dont need a number.
author: Mario M.

description: Love the green tea ice cream!! A must whenever in SF. Usually crowded and limited parking.
author: Falcon J.

description: Try the egg nog ice cream before the Holidays are over.. Delish!!!
author: Mae D.

description: For true, straightforward and fresh fruit flavored ice creams, there is no better place than Mitchell's in San Francisco. I've found myself driving all the way from San Jose to San Francisco at 9 in the night just to have an ice cream here. Apart from the standard flavors like Mango, New York Cherry, Rum 'n' Raisin, Lichee, etc. they have a bunch of unique tropical fruit flavors some of which you might never have heard of - Ube, Langka, Makapuno, Buko, Avocado, Halo Halo etc. My favorites are New York Cherry, Mango and Rum 'n' Raisin. If you like Cinnamon in your Chocolate ice cream, Mexican Chocolate is the flavor you want. Anytime during the day or night, be prepared to pick a number and wait anywhere from 10 - 40 minutes to grab your ice cream.
author: Naoshad M.

description:
This place is amazing. You get served rather quickly, although it's a given you do have to wait since a lot of people come here even late in the night. I had the halo halo and it was fantastic. The combination was perfect. I hated the rice krispies cereal that was sprinkled on top, but it wasnt too much of an issue. The gelatin and ube ice cream were really complimenting to each other. 
Would definitely come here again.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Just finished Bi-Rite's Ricanelas (Cinnamon with Snicker doodles) & Cookie's and Cream and I had to try Mitchell's to compare the differences.

I must admit, after looking at all the flavors that they had to offer, I was a little bit overwhelmed. Why order a scoop or two when you can just try them all right??? A little bit here and there will add up..  Hahaha.. jk!

Lucky me, it was raining and there were only a few people there. Like Bi-Rite Creamery, there's generally a line on sunny and warmer days. So if you're looking for more of an ice cream texture, come here.

The first flavor that caught my eyes was Rocky Road!!! My favorite flavor!!! The marshmallow was soft and the almond was cool, but I just thought the chocolate was way too sweet for me. I was sadly disappointed.

The next one I tried was Chocolate Caramel Crackel and yummy! It was delicious! The chocolate wasn't as chocolatey as the Rocky Road, the caramel nicely coated the chocolate and the every other bite, you get a crackel. How cool is that?

The next flavor I tried was Mango and it didn't taste much like mango.

Then I tried the Grasshopper but I didn't like too much fudge. It was good but too sweet for me.

I tried a few other flavors but I couldn't remember them all. I walked away with one scoop of the Chocolate Caramel Crackel.

Maybe I'll come back and give this place another try... we'll see...
author: Kaycie Y.

description: Mitchell's is definitely one of the better ice cram shops in the bay area.  They have everything from chocolate chip and spumoni to ube and halo halo.  I taste tested several and was not disappointed with any of the flavors, which made deciding more than a little difficult.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I've been here so many times in a span of so many years, and I can't believe I never reviewed this on Yelp. I enjoy it here every time I visit. Mitchell's is one of my favorite ice cream places in the city, if not my most favorite. Even if I've visited this place so much with friends and family, I still haven't tried every flavor they have. I commend them for concocting and serving authentic tropical flavors too! One of the reasons why I like this place. And this is also rare with ice cream shops in the city. I have many memories of this place. Even the vibe of the place emanates a sort of mom and pop shop / retro ice cream parlor feel to it. I do hope they stay open forever!
author: Cindy S.

description: Pretty decent tasting ice cream, good texture, creamy. Unfortunately, it was 5 dollars for 2 scoops of ice cream and extra for a sugar cone. The halo halo WAS good as per your recommendations but the ube was only ok.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
After I picked up the girls from school they were craving for some ice cream. Without hesitation, we headed to Mitchell's Ice Cream. 

This place has been around since 1953 serving up some of the best ice cream delights in the city.

There were only a few people ahead of us when we got there so we quickly picked our flavors. A line can build up pretty fast so I suggest you take a number.

Lots of flavors you can choose from. They even have milkshakes, sundaes, ice cream cakes & pies and pre-packed half gallons for take home. 

I got one scoop of Mango and Ube (Purple Yam/Taro) on a waffle cone, the girls got the single scoop of Ube.

We all sat on a bench outside and enjoyed the creamy, yummy, and wonderful goodness until it was time to go.

Thanks again my fellow Yelpers!
author: Gary E.

description:
I love Mitchell's Halo  Halo ice cream! The other favorites are the Horchata and Mexican Hot Chocolate! 

Anytime I'm around the area, I have to make it a point to visit the ice cream shop. There's always a long line, so when you get there, make sure to choose a number (yes, they help people by using the number system). 

If you don't have time to wait for a cone or a cup of ice cream, you can grab quarts to go! The ice cream holds up well, so even if you have a far drive home, it won't melt. I've driven all the way back to Sunnyvale with a quart or two, and it was just fine when I got home. 

Some people may think this place is overrated, but this place is really a San Francisco ice cream staple. You must try it!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
Delicious ice cream. But be prepared for a wait. There was a line out the door and apparently it's like that everytime you go.

There are so many different flavors to try. Will definitely be checking it out again the next time I'm in sf.
author: Heather J.

description: The place seems always busy and many shops in the city sell their ice cream.. Decided to give it a try.. I had something chocolaty with peanut butter in it.. Was soo good.. I'll definitely gonna go back.. Having went to Bi-Rite the day before, I can say I liked Mitchell's better
author: Marc-Andre L.

description:
Hands down, my favorite ice cream place in the City so far. Got a double scoop of Ginger Spice and Pumpkin. Great combination.  Has a really old school feel and decidedly less hipster vibe than the heart-of-the-Mission places (imagine that). The flavors are a nice mix of traditional flavors, seasonal flavors, and a few interesting tropical ones. On the balance, the flavors never get too far out there (see: Humphry Slocombe). The flavors are strong, but still maintain a bit of subtlety. They never get too sharp or up in your face (again, see: Humphry Slocombe).

The texture is what really does it for me. It is much thicker and perhaps even a bit "chewier" than most other places in the City. Just a perfect old school feel ot it.

Definitely coming back.

Edit:

Got another double scoop of the macopuno (sweet coconut) and Mexican chocolate (chocolate and cinnamon). Friend got ube (a purple tuber, similar to taro) and pistachio. Ube is a little meal-y for me and Mexican chocolate gave me a bit of cotton mouth with the cinnamon, but still quite tasty. Cemented itself as my favorite spot.
author: David C.

description: Can't go wrong with Rum Raisin! Lines are long but it goes by fast.
author: Christina R.

description:
As a matter of tradition, on nice days, we stop in after the Giants win a game.  I love my ice cream, and some days, I get a cone and a half gallon to take home!  We recently stopped by and there was no line!  I think that had to have been the first time 
ever.  

I prefer the fruit flavors - cantaloupe, peach, strawberry - the normal stuff.  Sandra tends to try everything and get something different each time as an ice cream sandwich.  We always have gotten Robert fruit flavors, and he loves them!  

The ice cream cakes they make are amazing as well.  You know how ice cream cakes from Coldstone and Baskin Robbins need to be thawed a bit before serving to avoid breaking knives?  Mitchell's ice cream cakes are expertly formulated to avoid freezing into rock hard bricks.  The whipped cream stays creamy, the cake stays cake-y; it's the best ice cream cake I've ever had!  We tend to order one for any occasion we can find an excuse for - birthdays, baptisms, Sundays, sister coming home, sister leaving for school, warm day and there's a line, etc.  

The cookies they use for the ice cream sandwiches are the best, too!  They got me addicted to the Pacific Cookie Company.  

If I lived above Mitchell's, I've be here every single day.
author: ROB L.

description:
Langka, langka, langka!!!!! This is my favorite ice cream flavor here (and possibly of all time). Their waffle cones are big and crunchy fresh! There are plenty of awesome flavors here so take the time to ask for a taste test. I'm most attracted to the tropical flavors since there aren't many ice cream places around that serve langka (jackfruit), ube (purple yam), macupuno (baby coconut) or canteloupe. 

I've also ordered ice cream cake a few times and they're always a hit!! Depending on the size of the cake, you need to place your order at least 2-4 days ahead. Note: They only accept orders by phone or in person.
