Mitchell's usually gets packed so take a number and stand in line. If you're just buying pre-packed tubs, you can use the separate line instead of getting a number and waiting. I must say parking can sometimes be a pain, especially in the tiny lot behind the store. Probably best to find parking on the street.
author: Jamie C.

description:
It's nice that you can find their tropical flavors at most Asian supermarket chains now, but it's still worth checking out the original store in SF. 

Regular traditional flavors aren't bad, but I'd go for the more unique ones like ube (beautiful purple color) and though cliche, green tea. Macapuno, mango, and buko are other popular tropical ones.  If you want something more traditionally Filipino, get some halo halo (sweet beans, fruit, shaved ice, syrup, ice cream, evaporated milk) - it's huge (but not available in winter).

If only they had black sesame...
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Quality ice cream + large selection = 5 stars.

I actually dont mind waiting to be served here.  Just watching people in and out is a lot fun.  The servers are pretty cool with letting you try the flavors too.

Grab a number...and wait to eat a scoop of heaven...hahaha
author: Thien N.

description: Wow, great ice cream. I had rum raisin, and others in my group had mint chip and coffee. I think it's the best ice cream in the bay area. It's not inexpensive but a good value for the great ice cream quality.
author: Karen J.

description: Outstanding unique ice cream experience. I had a double cup of obe and buko. Obe was off the hook. I'll be back to try some of the other exotic flavors.
author: David O.

description:
Long line but what's new with "it" places in SF right? This place is cool, good flavors, decent prices, a bench to sit on. I still prefer Bi-Rite to this place, probably because of the flavors but still, this is worth a try at least once. 

They have a small parking lot but it was full when we went (Friday night around 9pm) so just grab parking on the street.
author: Pam M.

description:
I love how everyone compares Mitchell's to Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe.  Truth is, Mitchell's been killin' the "micro-creamery" scene before it even began. As a native San Franciscan (omg! I know! they exist!), Mitchell's was our go to ice cream shop because they catered to the "tropical" palette. No basic vanilla, chocolate, strawberry and everything in between those three flavors here. They branched out to try the Filipino desert flavors (halo-halo, ube, langka) and were extremely successful. 

If you want to support local businesses in San Francisco and truly be proud of the history of the city, go to Mitchell's and make sure you tell your friends. Again, I remember when it was way cheaper to get ice cream from here, but I'm always glad to see the lines are still long here and that business is strong. My favorite flavor? Mango, always.
author: Jamie P.

description:
Classic, traditional and nostalgic is how I would describe Mitchell's.  They've been around the block and they still adhere to a classic look and feel in both their shop and ice creams.  I tend to think that Mitchell's is the San Francisco version of Fentons.  While the two are very different, they both give me a feeling of nostalgia that I can't quite shake off upon walking in. 

I enjoyed the horchata and the mango sorbet.  If you're looking for traditional flavors, look no further.  Mitchell's offers a wide variety of heavier and heartier dessert options.  I can't compare it to the newer specialty creameries because the differences are just too drastic, but it is definitely a place that I can appreciate.
author: David O.

description:
Not going to go for the long-winded review this time.  I don't think I can add to what 2000+ reviews have already said about this place.

Ube ice-cream. Single scoop.  If you haven't had it, you're missing out http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/76smcUUGRvq3k1MVPUXbnA?select=fPFGEVDaCTl7Iudy52CGpQ
author: Ange L.

description:
Really people?!
Holy hoopla.

This place is way over hyped.
It seems like a chain ice cream shop to me.
Totally average.
People wait 30 minutes for this? wow... 
Luckily there was no wait when we stopped in on Monday night.

This place is bright and clean and fun, but the ice cream is so average.
People working were not very friendly and they do not offer to let you sample the flavors. 
Not worth a trip if you are visiting SF on vacation.
Go to Bi Rite Creamery instead... it is much better!
author: Tim W.

description:
I love their Ice Cream!
I have been going to Mitchell's since I was a kid and still can't get enough of it.

They recently re-did the inside of shop and it looks so good.

I ALWAYS get the pineapple-coconut  and mango flavors because I love how tropical and fresh they taste. 

They have fun flavors so I suggest trying a few before making your final decision. 
They always have seasonal flavors as well which are exciting to look forward to like pumpkin for fall or eggnog for winter.
author: Thea M.

description:
4.5 STARS. My number one is still Bi-Rite! Got the Grasshopper Pie & Avocado! The Grashopper Pie consists of mint ice cream w/ a whole lot of chocolate-y goodness in the form of cookies, candy, and more. I was very pleased that their Avocado tastes like avocado and not some sugar-filled mimic! Apparently their Egg Nog is back, but I haven't tried it before. 

Months ago during our P2 year, a classmate bought a whole tub of Coffee and brought it to campus and stored it in the freezer. I've always wanted to come to the homeland of this tub of ice cream and now I have :)
author: Yumi H.

description: Rarely a line, but still a great ice cream place.  I highly recommend the Kahlua ice cream flavor
author: Danny N.

description:
When is it not right to eat ice cream? Never.

I consider myself to be an avid ice cream eater, and came here on a Saturday night at about 10pm. The first time I came here was back in '04. There was a giant crowd inside already, and the wait looked like it was going to take forever. Took a number (right when you enter it is to your left) and the numbers kept getting called quickly, either because people left or haven't decided. 

When it was our turn (bf +2), we were really indecisive because everything looked so delicious! Aldo, our ice cream scooper-er(?) was really patient as we tried many flavors. I ended up getting a scoop of grasshopper pie (mint ice cream, fudge and some other deliciousness) with white pistachio (has whole pistachio nuts in the ice cream). The scoops were like they were on steroids, at least the size of 1 and a half a standard ice cream scoop. 3 of 4 of us had grasshopper pie, 2 had white pistachio, amongst, Claire's pie, custard vanilla, and Mexican chocolate. Yeah, we all got 2 scoops each after dinner, who's to judge?

It was about 50 degrees and my teeth were chattering as I ate it. But hell, it's San Francisco! The experience took nothing away from how delicious Mitchell's is. 

Parking can be a pain, they have a little lot but it most likely is full. But be patient because Mitchell's really is THAT good!
author: Ada T.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream has the old school, 'mom and pop' ice cream shop vibe and the comforting ice cream to back it up. They ice cream just makes you feel like a kid again, enjoying ice cream around your parents picked you up from school. However! They throw in this twist with awesome tropical flavors! Mango, coconut and lycee are all available, and they are all awesome.

While all the flavors are on point, you have to try to Ube (Taro) ice cream. It is the most unique flavor and color. If you're a fan of taro, you'll be pleased as the ice cream represents it well. Subtle with its sweetness and icier than cream, the ube ice cream is the star of Mitchell's in my mind.
author: Billy T.

description: You get a relatively generous portion for an inexpensive price. Ube (purple yam) is awesome! Crazy long lines but well worth the wait. If you don't want to wait in line, you can purchase the prepackaged 1/2 tubs for $10. There is a separate express line for that
author: Dani P.

description:
Mitchell's never gets old. At 10 at night its the place to be even when its storming. 

My aunt just broke her shoulder on muni :( and wanted to indulge in  a Ice Cream cake. where oh where do i go? 

SO  I wanted to put something really funny on the cake but nothing came to me. I explained to the guy at the counter and he had it right on cue, even went the extra mile and did the Muni logo. ( check out the pic in the Photos). 

Dude your awesome!
author: Miray V.

description:
After ice creaming at the fancier (and hipper) joints I've been to in the past few months, I guess I was underwhelmed by Mitchell's. Maybe it's because the hyper-efficient atmosphere made me feel uncomfortable asking for samples or taking any longer than absolutely necessary. Maybe it's because I didn't try the right things - I got the grasshopper pie and it was good, but not great. Maybe it's because I felt like it was a little expensive for the quality and experience compared to the other places I've been.

Whatever it was, it gets 3 stars for being ice cream, which is pretty much always good, but I'm not sure it's "that place" that I'd always want to go when I want ice cream.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Grab a number!!! I was just in from the airport, then BART, then muni so I was understandably a little absent and stood around for a fair ten minutes before I realized I needed to have a number in hand. Silly me. Luckily I pulled number 59 shortly after number 43 was called. Geez... only 16 customers to go.

The wait was much shorter than I anticipated. About 15 minutes. Since the place was packed and the guy taking my order had a face like this ( : |  I didn't feel it was a good idea to sample too many flavors. I wanted to try EVERYTHING; I tried cantaloupe and espresso toffee crunch. The cantaloupe was so good and I couldn't believe how creamy it was. The espresso was also good and creamy with some yummy espresso beans inside. In a panic I got a scoop of that and walked out. 

There was very little (read: zero) toffee in my espresso scoop and that was a bit of a bummer because that would have really rounded out the flavor. Instead it was just espresso. Delicious, creamy espresso but I was a bit disappointed. And a few bites in I wished I had gotten the cantaloupe. Next time if I'm waiting 20 minutes for ice cream I'm going to be a little more assertive and allow myself some time to think. 

I'm looking forward to trying some of their tropical flavors. Ube and coconut here I come!
author: Tai F.

description: Above average. Tin pot creamy in Palo Alto has much better ice cream.
author: Siruo Z.

description:
Ice cream at it's finest (almost...with the exception of Ici in Berkeley and Bi-Rite in SF).

After hearing all my friends rave about this place, I finally came here and tried the ube (purple yam) ice cream.  Yes it was good, but....I'd give it a 3/5.  It's a little on the heavier side, but of a stranger heavy side.  No the usually heavy chocolate or cream flavoring...Not sure what the craze is about though...  The great thing about this place, however, is the multitude of flavors!  I also tried the (forget the name...) one with caramel swirls in a vanilla ice cream.. OMG that was 5/5 BOMB.
author: Liz W.

description:
I get it, everyone loves Mitchell's but in my opinion it's a tad overrated.

Good ice cream, lots of flavors, good service but....it's just not THAT great.  It's certainly worth stopping by to try but honestly, there is better ice cream out there without the crazy long wait.
author: Mark J.

description: Have driven past but not gone in due to long lines. But decided to brave it last night. Wait was not too long (15min). But totally worth it! Their Halo-Halo ice cream is my new most fav ice cream. Fresh, creamy and totally out of this world taste. Rest of the family had rum-n-raisin, chocolate & vanilla - all of which were outstanding. Customer service was good too. Guys behind the counter were smiling and giving ample time to each customer inspite of the large queue. A definitely gem in SF!
author: Manish V.

description: Good quality ice cream, fast service, and a parking lot. Pretty good for city ice cream. The only downside is that there is no where to sit to enjoy it. Can't wait to try all the flavors. I got dulce de leche with my hot fudge sundae mmmm. My bf got halo halo flavor- tasted like a halo halo.
author: Jamie B.

description: Wow! Just wow! Awesome place to treat yourself to a little ice cream. I am obsessed with the coconut and their waffle cones are totally worth the extra calories!
author: Allison N.

description: This is the first time that we have been here that there wasn't a line.  It may have had to do a bit with it being a week day during work hours.  Had the mango and the jackfruit.  Just fantastic.  Have to have the ube and coconut next time!
author: Scott P.

description:
God I love Mitchell's.
You can ask for as many samples as you need and they have such a great selection!! All of their fruity flavors are amazing and exotic! My personal favorites are the mexican chocolate and the kalua mocha! The consistency is so creamy and its so delicious! It's not a bad walk from the 24th and Mission Bart station either. If you're in The City and are craving ice cream, definitely check out Mitchell's!
author: Supreet B.

description: My family and I have been going to Michell's for years and I love Mitchell's, it is my favorite soooo I think trying the ice cream flavors help. Try them!! The workers are great, some slow, but I cannot blame them because they are in a busy neighborhood ( Bernal Heights)  tip is good karma :)
author: Shan M.

description:
Great ice cream.
Always get the banana split with the gf. Lacuma, avocado, and ube
We kill it all the time.
Friendly staff, great little shop.
Waiting for the weather to get warmer so we can go back.
author: Andi I.

description:
Good: 
The Tropical 4 = YUMZ :) 

Bad: 
everything was Small...Parking area and the inside. 

Long wait and I've never been to an Ice Cream Spot that had a Ticket 4 Number in Line!!! 

Kinda Pricey for a Standard Size Scoop.


Glad I got 2 experience Mitchell's since I've heard everyone raving about their Ice-Cream all the time.
author: Leah B.

description: Long lines, nice patrons waiting like me. It is a well known brand in the area with tons on choices and unique flavors but I wouldn't recommend the ice cream sandwich.  Cookies are hard while the ice cream soft so it just smooches the ice cream out of all sides, dripping melting over everything.  It would be better if the cookies were soft.
author: Jessica M.

description: Wow grasshopper mint ice cream blew my mind. so smooth and minty. this place lives up to they hype.
author: Amit P.

description:
A lot of people, a crowded store but the wait goes fast and the service is pretty quick.  

This place is mainly for homemade ice cream.  I thought it was good.  It's different than Bi-rite or Smitten because it's not artisan ice cream.  You can't compare the two but for homemade creamy ice cream, this would be the choice.  

Banana and Toasted Almond is what I had and tasted great!  They have a lot of unique tropical flavors but I didn't want to take up the guy's time with sampling everything.  It's so crowded that you feel like you have to order and just get out.  That was the only bad part.
author: Stephanie H.

description: The first time I met ube (purple yam) ice cream was at Mitchell's and it was love at first taste. So rich and creamy with a brilliant purple hue. I can't find a comparison in my city. Oh ube I miss you so!
author: Jen W.

description:
Please don't ask me why I waited soooo long to try the Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream. Holy *&%!. It is soooo good. 
If you like chocolate, you have to try it. The chocolate is just right with the great hint of Cinnamon. It really reminds me of cold mornings when my mom used to make us Mexican hot chocolate. I don't know how you did it Mitchell's but you really nailed it....Maybe I'll venture out and try the avocado!
author: Carla F.

description:
My One Word: Crowded.

Fact #1: Best flavor: GRASSHOPPER (oreo, mint chocolate ice cream, chocolate fudge)! It is extremely creamy.

Fact #2: There is always a line no matter what... even 10 minutes before they close.

Fact #3: They have a parking spot in the back, but it is always full. Good luck finding a parking spot.
author: Calvin T.

description: love this place for good ol ice cream! I haven't had to wait more than 5 min for ice cream (then again I go on a weekday usually) I've only had the french vanilla custard with drizzled caramel and I totally dig it! can't go wrong with a classic. can't wait to try ube and macopuno since I'm filipino duh. =]
author: Nicolette P.

description:
You can call us ice cream connoisseurs! Well, not really - but we're gonna get there. MMM. 

MITCHELL's is my quick fix for ice cream if bi-rite gets too crazy or too far for that matter. Their wide variety of flavors will make you hold the line, just like i did! Haha. Make sure you know what you want to get before falling in line, its a small spot  so give way!!
author: Ferricci R.

description:
Came here for the ube ice cream, but left the store in love with the buko. Each spoonful took me back to the Philippines. Both flavors reminded me of Magnolia ice cream but wayyyy better. I guess Mitchell is Magnolia's mistiso cousin.

Make sure you take a number if you're ordering scoops of ice cream. Otherwise, grab a pint and skip the line.
author: J C.

description: Be ready to wait! And take your number to order but god this will change your life!
author: David L.

description:
mmm, i think I like Mitchell's better than Bi-Rite! gasp

+ very standard flavors, no funky weird flavors like Humphrey's
+$1.70/junior cup and $2.50/single scoop; waffle cone is $0.50 extra
+went in with no line and unlimited samples
+EVERY FLAVOR was so rich, creamy and spot on
+friendly and patient service
+cash only ($10 minimum)

favs: Mint Chocolate chip, Caramel Praline (GET THIS!), and Oreo

$9.45/half gallon is pretty steep compared to grocery store $3.50/half gallon

-Hungry Hungry Pongy
author: Sangita A.

description: had the grasshoper, vanilla custard and strawberry...it was off the hinges!  best ice cream I've ever had.  unbelievable!  there was a line even when it was raining.  grasshoper made me hop to the bop.  will I be back?  of course
author: Abe N.

description:
Coming to Mitchell's I was thinking how much better can this ice cream be over any other ice cream i've had before? the answer was a WHOLE LOT BETTER. 

they have a broad selection of flavors which will appease any ice cream palette. the thing that really stood out was its supreme creamy-ness.

bi-rite and mitchell's are awesome in their own ways, but in the end i guess i'm just a Mitchell's kinda guy. 

Long live Mitchell's
author: Ant C.

description:
Oh Mitchell's...

I didn't really get to try any other flavors but the tropical fruit flavors because they were so damn good. I most especially love the Ube, Mango and Young Coconut. MMM.....

Miss you Mitchell... miss you.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Fresh cantaloupe ice cream is delish! Taste almost like their mango ice cream, but with real cantaloupe pieces!

This day I tried their halo-halo - not the ice cream, but the real Filipino dessert. They definitely fill it with all the authentic ingredients - various sweet beans, jackfruit, kaong (sugar palm fruit), and more topped with shaved ice, pinipig (rice with Rice Krispies texture), a splash of evaporated milk and ube ice cream! The ice cream is your choice, but if you want to do it right get mango or ube - the others won't do this dessert justice.

I overheard a little girl ask her mom to try a sample of ube ice cream =) I guess the purple color attracted this girl's eye rather than make her look away. I love non-picky and adventurous eaters!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Last Sunday, we met my husband's aunt and uncle for brunch in the City at Cheesecake Factory and after lunch Kevin, Ilana and I drove around a while since it was such a gorgeous day. 

My family knows I have a huge love of ice cream. This is not something I have had until I developed some gastrointestinal issues and sometimes have a hard time with "real food", but I digress. I had wanted to try either Bi-Rite or Mitchell's since long hearing about both institutions and never having had either. 

In all honesty, we drove by Bi-Rite first, and couldn't find any parking anywhere around-again, gorgeous day out and it is close to Delores Park. Thanks to the GPS we were at Mitchell's fairly easily and we were lucky enough to snag a spot in their tiny lot. Yes, tiny and yes, it will go on my "ass lot" list. 

We walked into Mitchell's and took a number. It was hard to see the flavors in the case since there was quite a crowd, but the line moved quickly and we did have a little time to plan our attack prior to our number being called. Kevin had a 2 scoop banana split choosing his favorite parts of the split-the vanilla and strawberry ice cream with the pineapple and strawberry toppings. I did have a bite, and I agreed with him, the pineapple topping is way better than Fenton's. Ilana had a waffle cone with a couple of scoops(sadly I can't remember as I was so focused on my own) and I had a 2 scoop sundae with coffee ice cream and cookies and cream.I had a bit of hot fudge AND hot caramel, skip the whipped cream and add chopped almonds. The ice cream was fabulous but so rich that I couldn't finish my scoops (and they are not the ginormous Fenton's kind). Both my husband and daughter were shocked as I threw away at least 1/3 of my dessert but I was full. 

They had a million flavors I would have loved to try including peach but it was too crowded for me to want to do anything more than order and get the heck out of dodge. I would have liked to have had a little table outside to sit an eat our ice creams but alas, there was no such comfort available. 

I am glad we came here and indulged and someday, I will come back. Great customer service and love the history of this place for sure.
author: Tam F.

description:
Before there was Bi-Rite...
Before there was Humphry Slocombe...
Before there was Mr. & Mrs. Miscellaneous...
Basically, before ice-cream was trendy...

There was Mitchell's. 

And after Salted Caramel melts away...
After people get full of Secret Breakfast...
After people get tired of Burnt Sugar
Basically, after people get tired of trendy ice cream flavors...

Ube ice cream will still be Mitchell's most famous ice cream flavor (and my favorite ice cream flavor of all-time) and non-Filipinos will still be asking "What the heck is Ube?"
author: Monelle A.

description: PROTIP: instead of waiting in the massive line, go ahead and buy a half-gallon, which costs the same ($9.99) as two decent sized cups. You and your new best friend can share heaven in ice cream form. You will not regret getting so much. Oreo Cookie is a long-time favorite!
author: Irene C.

description: If you can handle the inevitable crowds, they have the best pistachio ice cream ice ever had.
author: Ryan T.

description: Long wait but worth it. Delicious ice cream. Always busy and lively even at late hours. Their ice cream sundaes are AMAZING!
author: Jackie H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday afternoon and oh boy......was there a crowd!  Make sure you go inside and grab a number.....

I tried the Grasshopper Pie and Tropical 4.....on two separate sugar cones.....

the Grasshopper Pie was YUMMY.....very rich and decadent =]

the Tropical 4 was good but not as yummy at the Grasshopper Pie.....
author: Lisa H.

description:
YUMMMM! 

My coworker and I came here after a long lunch because we wanted dessert and I had a massive craving for ice cream. Heard about this place from tons of people and so definitely on my list of things to try.

LOVED their ice cream. The texture is very very creamy and heavy. But they do their ice cream well. You can try all the different flavours you want so I tried their mango, some of their sweet ones but I wasn't adventurous for the ube ice cream. Ultimately I went with the mocha fudge (classic flavour) with a waffle cone. Their scoops are HUGE so a single scoop was enough to make me feel incredibly full.

Wide variety of flavours for everyone, huge portions, delicious, great texture - definitely another go to place for me now.
author: Angela K.

description:
Traditional and tropical flavors served in a small, unpretentious and typically crowded, shop. 

When you get there and see a line, get a ticket and start eyeballing the selection of flavors while you wait.
author: Solitaire M.

description: My gf and I bought a pistachio ice cream sandwich on chocolate chip cookies. While the concept of putting ice cream between two cookies sounds very appealing on paper, it did not work in reality. The cookies were too hard and upon squeezing the cookies on the ice cream, the ice cream melted and started to drip from the bottom. Thus, it was very hard (pun intended) to enjoy the cookies and the ice cream as a whole. We resorted to eating them separately, which defeated the purpose of an ice cream sandwich. The cookies should be made softer to accommodate the softness of the ice cream.
author: Steven C.

description:
It doesn't matter if it's early morning. It doesn't matter if it's late at night. It doesn't matter if it's the middle of the afternoon. There is always a line.

It doesn't matter if it's hot and sunny. It doesn't matter if it's cold and raining. Yes, I said raining. There is always a line.

It doesn't matter if there is a line. I am willing to wait in it.

*Overall

Buko (baby coconut) = Heaven on Earth. If you're not into that, my fiancé's favorites are grasshopper pie and peanut butter. If it's your first time, try some samples. The staff is always nice. If you already know what you like and want a lot of it then just grab a half gallon out of the freezers and head to the express counter to skip the line. =)

Rating: 5
author: Jennifer L.

description: I had always heard about this place from my friends born and raised in the Bay Area and had yet to try it. That is, until recently. Being from SoCal, I was use to having Thrifty's if not 31 Flavors so my thought was that Mitchell's might be the same. I was so wrong! Mitchell's is absolutely delicious and you most definitely get good quality ice cream that's worthwhile! Their ice cream is just more creamier and refined other places cannot compare! That aside, the establishment is rather busy given its popularity but that doesn't mean they lack in customer service. Their employees are professional and don't rush you when ordering despite the overlapping voices and chaos. With that in mind, I can't wait to go back!
author: Shaniah M.

description:
Must visit for exotic tropical fruity flavors (halo halo, coconut, mango, ube/taro, and my favorite lucuma...among so many more options listed on their website).

Parking is difficult and the only place to sit is a bench right outside the window. 

They only sell individual cones so if you're bringing home a pint or 1/2 gallon, then walk down 2 blocks to the Safeway for a box of cones.
author: Jayme N.

description:
Came here today after lunch with my aunt and grandpa and so glad I did! 
I don't know what everyone is talking about, there's a parking lot for customers right behind the building! 

I tried the ube (purple yam) and the peruvian jackfruit (forgot the name) and ended up getting a scoop each of the ube and toasted almond. Man, the scoops were huge and the price is cheaper here than Bi-Rite. The toasted almond was really good and they don't skimp on the almond. Yumm! 

My aunt got a scoop of the peanut butter indulgence and my grandpa got a scoop of the buko (young coconut) on a cone. I tried the peanut butter indulgence and although I love chocolate and peanut butter cups, I wasn't really into the peanut butter indulgence, but my aunt enjoyed it. I also bought a 1/2 gallon of the ube to take home and a 1/2 gallon of mango for my aunt.  

This place has unique flavors and their ice cream is really smooth, plus the price won't break your bank!
author: Tracy Y.

description:
i have no reason to give this place less than 5 stars

looked crowded from the outside because people were just standing around eating in groups, but the process was really fast.  

ice cream was creamy and amazing... none of this fro yo bull shit.

i would come here more often if i lived closer!!  i just parked in the safeway parking lot
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Old fashioned ice cream shop, that'll never get old. I've actually had most of my Mitchell's in my life served at another restaurant. But, coming to the actual Mitchell's is a whole different experience. My eyes are overwhelmed by the amount of flavors that are offered and I begin to sample one after another. After about six, I had to stop myself before I get full from just sampling. All the flavors are good and it's really hard to choose, so I'll definitely be returning. They are known for their ube flavor and it lives up to it's hype. I also like the banana, it tasted just like fresh bananas.

Mitchell's I'll be back, especially since you have a parking area behind the store, albeit a small one.
author: Helen Z.

description:
Since I've never officially reviewed them...

Been here plenty.
I love ice cream.
Awesome friendly staff.  (Especially since the last time I went with a group of 8, they actually pulled out a piece of paper and took sample tasting orders... now how awesome is that!  Two thumbs up).

5 stars for you!
author: Clifford C.

description:
Tasty ice cream. VERY LONG LINE. 
To be honest I've had better Ice Cream, but this is still pretty darn good. I'd say it's on par with Fentons Creamery (http://www.yelp.com/biz/fentons-oakland-2) here in the East Bay. 

My all time favorite ice cream has to be "MILK" (http://www.yelp.com/biz/milk-los-angeles-5) in LA - but that's a bit of a drive from Emeryville!
author: Kate M.

description:
Definitely one of the top ice cream spots in san francisco. Get the grasshopper pie. Best thing here.

Parking can be a challenge and it gets busy with the after dinner crowd.
author: James T.

description:
MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM hits the spot. haha yes. hands down, my favorite ice cream brand. I usually get MACAPUNO (sweet coconut)- a junior scoop on a waffle cone. 

You know it's the best when you see 30+ people waiting outside the ice cream parlor in the cold sf weather just for some ice cream. 

Note: It's also really cool that Mitchell's has a FILIPINO twist. The tropical flavors offered were due to MR.MITCHELL having a great influence for the PHILIPPINE ISLANDS' FRUITS.
author: Briana H.

description:
4.5 stars with 1,200 reviews can't steer me wrong.

It's a perfect place to stroll after dinner in Noe or the Mission.  They're usually packed, and have numbers to pull from a machine and call out (kind of like the post office).

The buko ice cream is so worth the wait.
author: Jenny L.

description:
By far, the best ICE CREAM shop in the bay area!  It's been here for too long; it's a historical landmark for San Francisco. They have one-of-kind flavors!  

If you're a visitor to bay area and want a sweet treat, go to Mitchell's!!!
author: Diana M.

description:
I LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!


Now, for the shit. And this is totally not the fault of Mitchell's. It's the fault of those that come here and buy their ice cream. FUCK YOU, person that can't find parking and is trying to make life miserable to those that are trying to look for it, FUCK YOU to the people that are freaking standing around inside even though this place is running on a TAKE A FUCKING NUMBER SYSTEM!!! And to those that HAVE A FUCKING NUMBER, FUCK OFF AND WAIT FOR YOUR NUMBER TO BE CALLED!!! Also, FUCK YOU to the snotty people that think they are hot shit because they are wearing expensive looking clothes and think they are above everyone else. GET IN LINE LIKE EVERYONE ELSE!!!


And finally, FUCK ALL Y'ALL THAT THINK THE EXPRESS LINE THAT ISN'T FOR THOSE, like myself, THAT ONLY WANT PRE-PACKED HALF GALLONS EVEN THOUGH THE FUCKING SIGN SAYS EXPRESS LINE FOR PRE-PACKED ITEMS!!!!! Fucking morons thinking I cut in front of you. If you people learned how to FUCKING READ, we wouldn't be having this cuss fest!



I love LOVE LOVE Mitchell's! I am passionate about good food and this place is a great place for great ice cream. If you know me and how big I am, you know I love food. Like they say, never trust a skinny chef! Again, this is not against the establishment, just the MORONS that cock block me from my ice cream. That is all. Good day!
author: Anthony L.

description:
LUCUMA is my favorite!! its a famous peruvian fruit! According to a close peruvian friend, the fruit is powdery and the only thing people eat it as is ice cream!! How can u not like a fruit that's its sole purpose  is to be eaten in ice cream form??? and it kinda taste like butta! haha. or like a cookie dough flavor. super creamy. In a regular cone of course, hitting the bottom cup filled with lucuma never tasted so complete!

I like this place because it has that old school and home-y feeling.  Not that expensive either, they don't rip you off like baskin robins because you are actually paying for quality. EWW baskin robins, gross.  Their 1 scoop is legit! only 1 for me, 2 is dtm (doin too much).

The service is great! They call you by number and you can try as many flavors as you want. Try to not annoy them like we did. haha.  I tried the cantaloupe too and its sooo good and not too sweet.  There's lot of variety, especially for you Filipinos out there that miss your halo-halo!  I heard it gets pretty busy so watch it! Ice cream on a cold san francisco summer day is one best things ever.
author: Sunanda P.

description: An SF institution! So much so that I came on a recommendation by locals! There is almost always a line but it moves fairly quickly, and the variety is endless. I had the mango ice cream and I loved it! There's not much else I need to say; everyone screams for ice cream at Mitchell's!
author: Allison S.

description: I love Mitchell's! There is usually a large crowd waiting outside so make sure you go into the store to get a ticket with a number because they use this system in lieu of waiting in a long line. The ice cream here is so delicious and the flavor options are great. My favorite is the Ube but any flavor of ice cream from here would make me a happy camper! They also sell ice cream cookie sandwiches here. I usually come at nighttime and there is still a wait every time but it is definitely worth it.
author: Beca P.

description:
Exhibit A in my argument for the existence of God: 2 scoops of Mitchell's ube ice cream in a waffle bowl with a chocolate shell.

Ice cream here is really good. They have "ethnic" flavors but are still making them in thier Mitchell's style, so its nice and creamy.
author: Ben T.

description: The BEST ice cream of your LIFE. Bi-Rite? Nothinggggg on Mitchell's. Be prepared for a long wait at any given hour. Definitely worth it
author: JL o.

description: Great place to get Ice Cream. Always busy especially at nights. Young Coconuts ice cream is awesome (even though the lady behind the counter called it Baby Coconuts and I was very tempted to ask for very old and aged coconuts ice creams .. LOL)
author: Bruce L.

description: It's been yeeeeears since I've come into Mitchell's.  Why did I wait so long to come back?  So I'm watching what I eat, and I get a scoop of the coconut lychee sorbet.  Wow...so good, and no sourness.  Whenever I get any kind of sorbet it always seems to have a sour edge to it, which is good, but after having their coconut lychee sorbet it's a hook in for me.  I won't ever take a long while to get back to this place again.  See you soon Mitchell's!
author: Emy B.

description:
I really don't wanna give Mitchell's a bad rating since they carry one of my favorite ice cream flavors but I must.

I came here on a Thursday night right before they closed. I was craving a halo halo all day but didn't get the chance to get it due to work so this was the only place I knew that sold it late. I finished my halo halo and my tummy started to hurt right before I slept. Right when I woke up, I started getting major cramps and later on realized I got food poisoning. Yes, food poisoning! I couldn't believe it either. I know I'm not lactose intolerance because I got their halo halo many times before. I had a feeling maybe the milk was bad or the jelly was expired, I'm just not sure. I'm still recovering but man, I don't think I can eat halo halo ever again. I'm Filipino and halo halo is in my blood LOL. This is seriously one of my favorite desserts from my culture and now it just killed it for me. I mean their halo halo here wasn't that good cause I didn't really taste the evaporated milk and it wasn't even sweet but it fulfilled my craving of halo halo at the time. Never again though!
author: Janice V.

description: This is a must stop place for desert if youre ever visiting the city. The lines are long but it's definitely worth the wait
author: Carlo J.

description:
Of the ice cream joints in SF, Mitchells has to be the most simple. They focus on classic flavors as well as a couple tropical flavors. But nothing out of the ordinary, nothing too daring. Basically, everything is pretty much delicious and definitely wont have u questioning whether or not this should be an ice cream flavor.

In short, show up and Mitchells. They have a tiny lot, but it's usually full, so I applaud you if you can get a spot. I never have.

Right by the door there is a ticket machine, grab a number. The thingy that displays what number they are on is on the side of the wall, but we usually get out number and wait outside. The inside is sometimes too crowded.

Last time I got the avocado, which I thought was delicious. Though a friend said it had a weird after taste. D got horchada, which was delicious and grasshopper pie, which was pretty good as well. I've also tried mango and pear, and the pear tasted just like an asian pear, while mango is a favorite.

But anyways, Mitchell's is delish and you really can't go wrong with anything.

Btws, the scoops are a bit more expensive that usual places, but they're a lot bigger!
author: Jessica H.

description: My 11yo old son LOVES this ice cream. He is super picky (actually he is a supertaster) so if he likes it, it has to be great. My whole family loves it too. It's a mile away from their Dad's apartment and they beg to walk there every day when we visit :).
author: Niki A.

description:
I've never had better icecream before in my life. The Halo Halo, Mango and Vanilla were phenomenal. The Halo Halo has a unique taste which is confusing at first, but you quickly adapt to it's flavor. The mango is just plain delicious if you love fruits. It tastes natural, with no too much sugar and not too little either. The Vanilla is just perfect. Something about the texture of these icecream makes it so much more enjoyable. It's soft, tasty, brilliant. 

Word of advice: the line is definitely worth the wait.
author: Elly C.

description: Love this Ice Cream shop so much. their chocolate ice cream rocks. Only gave it four stars because this location has no bathrooms and this is the only Mitchell's in San Francisco.
author: Isaac H.

description: They are good and you can tell by the line out the door late into the night. However, for my taste this ice cream is a little too cream. You know that MacDonald's McFlurry? Yeah, it has that texture. Not that it's not good. The taste is good. It's just, I feel guilty after eating a scoop. That scoop got some weight. I think I would only come here if I need a big time sweet tooth fix.
author: Julie V.

description:
Love this place for their ice cream and how they still do the "pull a number" line. You just pull down one of those cool numbers, which I use to love to do when I was a kid and still love to do, and you patiently wait for your number to be called. You can grab a half gallon while you wait or some cones or whatever your sweet tooth craves.

The one thing I always get at Mitchell's is their mocha fudge.. whether its in a cone or in a milkshake. I love their milkshakes though! 

They recently remodeled and Ill always miss their glass wall that use to separate the customers and the workers. I also remember behind that glass were the condiments you could add to your ice cream too. The new style looks a lot better though. Also, the place has a SMALL parking lot in the back but street parking is always available.

This is my childhood ice cream spot my parents use to treat me to every so often. Love this place.
author: Tim M.

description: I am absolutely in love with this place! There is always a wait, but it goes by fast and is always worth it. Full flavored homemade ice cream at great prices. We got 2 kids size ice creams for under $5. I got the black and white and he got New York Cherry. I don't know if you could go wrong with any of the flavors. I love ice cream and this little stop is a must go anytime I'm in the San Fran area.
author: Michelle M.

description: Finally got a chance to visit after 20+ years and I must say......it blew my mind all over again. Best ice cream in the bay area hands down. Took my girlfriend here for her first time and now she wants to go every weekend. A definate must when visiting the City.
author: Jerome P.

description:
Yes, my friends and i drove 45 mins for Mitchell's Ice Cream..Was it worth it? YEP! Parking is horrible, your lucky if you get parking as soon as you arrive. I would suggest finding parking elsewhere and walking to the ice cream shop. As soon as you get there, grab a ticket! Favorite flavors--TOASTED ALMOND AND WHITE PISTACHIO!!! :) I've had most of their flavors but those stuck out the most. Their ice creams are rich, creamy and delicious!  It would be great if they provided some chairs and tables but sadly there's only a few benches :/ 

Flavors I also love--Dulce de Leche, Espresso Toffee,Thin Mint, Kahlua Mocha Cream, and Mocha Fudge. 

Prices are decent, just be prepared to wait in line and find parking!
author: Shirley N.

description: Never had a bad experience here. The only gripe I have for this place is the log line and wait but it's worth it for the ice cream and milkshakes!
author: Mike T.

description:
The only Ice Cream I've ever had since my childhood.  A scoop of Mango, Avocado and Mango toppings in a Waffle cone....

Once inside grab a number!!!
author: Neil P.

description:
Mmm, I had high expectations for this place considering the reviews. I finally tried their ice cream today and well, the two flavors that many have raved about - Mexican Chocolate and Ube (the latter being on the 7x7 list) - didn't please me all that much.

To be honest, I really loved the texture of their ice cream. It was thick, creamy and didn't melt within minutes - good ol' traditional ice cream. In fact, it's one of the best textures I've had.

Ube - umm, it was kind of flavorless....it felt like I was eating vanilla ice cream after a few bites.
Mexican Chocolate - I guess I was expecting spicy chocolate, not just chocolate with cinnamon. It was good - don't get me wrong - but it wasn't as orgasmic as some people made it sound. 

I guess what I'm trying to say is....the ube doesn't quite deserve to be on the 7x7 list because the taste was not that extraordinary and memorable. However, I sampled the plain chocolate (my favorite ice cream flavor and the one I use to judge all ice cream joints) and thought it was one of the better chocolate ice creams in the Bay Area.

Mom got the sweet coconut and mango and she said they were good; there was coconut meat in the sweet coconut ice cream.

Needless to say, it's still way better than your typical chain/big brand stores (Baskin Robbins, Cold Stone, Ben & Jerry's, Dreyers, etc.) However, Mitchell's (for me at least) shadows behind local ice cream compadres like Fentons, Humphry Slocombe, Bi-Rite and Ici.  

No funky flavors here - pure, traditional ice cream. You have to get a ticket before you order and it was pretty crowded when I went, despite the heavy rain all day.

The staff/service? Not good enough to praise, not bad enough to complain. Lukewarm. 

HUGE scoops. Too...huge.
author: Grace C.

description: One of the few top ice cream places in the city. You have to try their amazing flavored ice creams and you keep going back for more!
author: Haleh H.

description:
If you live in San Francisco and you don't know about Mitchell's than I feel sorry for you... 
you should consider moving to another city for the shame you brought yourself! 
Mitchell's is to ice cream as a 69' Camaro is to muscle cars... a timeless classic that never goes out of style.

What can I say about Mitchell's that you don't already know???

The answer is NOTHING! 1,975 reviews, 4.5 stars, and the long ass line (even on a cold & foggy day!) should tell you all you need to know...
author: Brian L.

description:
After constantly raving about Bi-Rite, my friend insisted to take me to Mitchell's to try. First of all, I think Bi-Rite and Mitchell's are different - the ice cream at Mitchell's is your classic tasting and textured ice cream. Till this day, Bi-Rite to me is more unique with their textures, not really your traditional scoop of ice cream, but delicious nonetheless.

I really like Mitchell's old school vibe - you can definitely feel that it's been around for awhile and has a strong following/years worth of being around to make it a successful business. 

During my visit, I tried the Strawberries N Cream, which was absolutely delicious. My favorite combo when it comes to ice cream is vanilla ice cream with strawberry topping, and they made it into one flavor here at Mitchell's. The texture of the ice cream is so creamy and rich, and flavor is awesome.
author: Tiffany K.

description: Best ice cream ever! If you are a chocolate lover, try the mexican chocolate flavor!!
author: Adriana H.

description:
I took my husband here earlier this week for his first visit.  We  were a little frustrated in trying to find a parking space.  But after circling the store four times, we lucked out and got a space right in front of the store!
We grabbed a number and I tried to show the various flavors which wasn't easy with all the people crowded into the little store.  But the four servers worked quickly and our number soon came up.
I was torn in making a choice but the strawberries and cream called to me so I ordered a single cup.  My husband chose the vanilla bean in a waffle cone.  Needless to say, we finished our ice cream before we got home.
Now my husband wants to go back on Saturday and try the cantaloupe ice cream.  My Lord, I think I've created a monster!
author: Philip C.

description:
You know you are in a good ice cream parlor, when it's cold and rainy outside and there is still a line out the door!

I took a number just in case, even though they have an express line if you're buying the pre-packaged stuff. 

I chose two flavors - praline and some caramel, chocolate  crispy flavor. They were both FANTASTIC and super creamy.

I can only imagine how yummy their ice cream must be on a warm day!
author: Bernadette W.

description: Yum! I tried about 10 different flavors and they were all different and all really good. I take one star away because this ice cream didn't feel as "fresh" as Bi-Rite. I don't think they claim to be fresh, but after having had Bi-Rite, I can taste the difference.
author: Mansi P.

description: Great SF ice cream destination with small parking lot. I love the pistachio ice cream which actually has pistachio's in it! Sounds crazy but Baskin Robin's pistachio has pistachio flavored ice cream and ALMONDS.... no pistachios in pistachio ice cream. Crazy??? I know!!
author: Phillip W.

description:
Like your health, your significant other, and clean underwear, Mitchell's is something you should never take for granted. Years ago I used to live walking distance from Mitchell's, and would pick up a quart for special occasions. After leaving the neighborhood about 15 years ago, I've never gone back. What an idiot.

This weekend I took my wife and sons to Mitchell's; it was their first visit. They own the sweet teeth in the family, and I was curious to hear their opinions; is Mitchell's as kick-ass as I remember? I received a resounding "yes." We had:

Pumpkin
Egg Nog
Vanilla Custard
Chocolate Caramel Crunch

Somewhat pedestrian choices, considering how exotic some of their flavors are.

I like ice cream but normally have trouble delineating between the good and the truly great, however this visit confirmed that Mitchell's is great. The flavors were all very intense and fresh; you could tell that no extracts are used, only fresh ingredients. I wish I could find a pumpkin ale as good as their pumpkin ice cream.  And although there was a decent-sized line in front of us (they use the number system), we didn't have to wait long at all. 

So although that neighborhood is a bit worse then I remember, my stellar memories of Mitchell's remain untarnished. I wish I still lived walking distance from them.
author: Jeff R.

description: Even on a cold day, Mitchell's ice cream always hits the spot! Some of my must try's here are the buko, halo halo, banana, ube and horchata!
author: amelia g.

description:
mmmmm...ice cream....I want some right now...

Was introduced to this ice cream joint. Favorite flavors was Thai tea.

The last time I went, there wasn't Thai tea ice cream,  I was bawling in the inside.

I want to try the bright purple, ube ice cream.

Bring me again!
author: Winnie L.

description:
THEE best ice cream around town. BAR NONE. The fact that it is 44 degrees and there is a line around the building speaks volumes. 

Overhype my ass, this is worth the wait.

I have been going since I was a little girl... I love it!


Get the coffee flavor, with fudge YUMMMM
author: Vanessa B.

description: Yum.  Great cookies and cream ice cream (my favorite flavor of all time).  The system is a little confusing at Mitchell's; a fellow patron informed Joe and me that we needed to grab a number and that one of the staff would then call your name so you could be served.  Our number was called, and then we weren't helped right away, so it made the number system feel a little confusing/inefficient.  With all of that aside, it was good ice cream and certainly ranks up there with SF's best.
author: Mel G.

description:
I love San Francisco for its wide array of foods, the ability to get different takes on the same cuisines all within one city's limits.  My inaugural trip to BiRite Creamery was fantastic, so I chose Mitchell's as my next place for ice cream.

It has a small parking lot which is an amazing luxury in San Francisco, and it also rests in a less busy area of the city.  It's got a warm and welcoming feel, and there are many employees on hand even at 9:30 PM.  To get service, you have to take a number, though you can walk right up and ask to sample flavors.

By reviewer suggestions and photos, I ended up with the ube (yam similar to taro) and macupuno (sweet coconut).  My brother had the mango, while my friend had the coffee.  The scoops were enormous; I was afraid it'd melt, but we were eating in the cold, so I was safe. The ice cream itself was good, very rich and creamy, though I felt that it was a little too creamy.  The mango could have stood to be a little more tart.  In my last trip to Bi-Rite my brothers and I were ready to go back for seconds, whereas this place left us prepared to trek back home.

I'll stick to Bi-Rite, but, hey, this place is a hidden gem to some.
author: Tri P.

description:
I love Ice cream... and SF has a few great places. One of them being Mitchell's Ice cream. Everytime I've passed by, there is always a line... but dont be put off by that as the staff there make quick work of orders. Great flavors. I few times I have gone it has always been down the chocolate or caramel line.. but I picked up a smoothie this last time and it was great.

Price is great.
Staff and Service is great.
parking not so great, either in back or around the area.
author: Roger A.

description:
Two flavors you need to order: Avocado and New York Cherry!  They also don't mind if you want to sample the flavors.  

Remember: If it's busy inside, do not forget to grab a number from the machine near the door or else you won't get served!
author: Pat S.

description:
Woah!

*head spin*

SO MANY FLAVORS! SO MANY CHOICES! WHAT DO I GET?!

I grabbed a ticket and patiently scope out the competition of people trying to get into this cramped popular ice cream spot.

The selection is crazy!  Solid tropical flavors like jackfruit, ube, macapuno, halo halo, pineapple, mango, buko, and so many more I can't even remember!

I've only managed to visit this place twice, but each time I leave with a smile on my face.  What is more cheerful than a scoop of delicious ice cream?

Creamy and smooth like a baby's bottom, (not that I know what that feels like)  I stuck to mostly the fruit flavors since I'm justifying that its better for you.  I managed to try quite a few of the tropical fruity flavors and I really enjoyed the pineapple, macapuno, halo halo, ube, and the lychee!  

I really enjoyed the creamy even consistency, and almost every single flavor I tried blew me away.  The ice cream doesn't rely on the sugar or cream to make it delicious, its not overly sweet.  It's straight punch of true flavor from solid ingredients.

Another trip to SF and yet there are still so many more places to visit!  I think i'll be the size of a blimp by the time I'm done.
author: Anthony N.

description:
OMG Becky look @ that line!!!!  These were my first thoughts when I got parking right in front of Bi-Rite Creamery and the line was stretching almost around the corner. What did I expect on a beautiful New Year's Eve Day?! 

None the less I didn't want to deal with it and had some time restraints of my own, so sadly I moved on BYE Bi-Rite. On my way to the meat market I came across Mitchell's Ice Cream with a parking place right in front (..BOOOM) and NO line (..double BOOOM). Was this a sign from the ice cream Gods?!

All of a sudden I had a weird deja vu sequence, remembering different stories of the great Mitchell's Ice Cream.  GREAT?! Hmmm I'll put that to the test. I crap you NOT! ...as soon as I got in this place I reverted to being 10 yrs old but luckily enough with access to a 30 something's bank account ....YEAH BOY!!!! I didn't know what to order there were so many wonderful flavors to choose from & as soon as I figured it out a mob of people came in and there was a line going outside of Mitchell's. WTF...is it Ice Cream Day and I didn't get the memo.

I got Chocolate Caramel Crackle, Coconut-Pineapple and Dulce de Leche. They weren't great they were more like FANTASTI-BOMB-DERFUL-GREAT!. Yeah that's not a word but there is no word to describe the taste, texture and overall creamy experience of Mitchell's Ice Cream.

The only problem I have now is I'm stuck in this ice creamery love triangle between Mitchell's and Bi-Rite. Actually that's not a problem and it's pretty sweet!!!
author: Troy R.

description:
There are two schools of thought on San Francisco ice cream: old school and trendy. Mitchell's is firmly in the first camp and thank god. Chocolate is a simple dose of heavenly classicness, it is not fall until I've had Mitchell's pumpkin I've cream, and the off the beaten path flavors like avocado and ube (purple yam) are also delightful. Swing by, take a number, and get in line (bc there always is one, even when it is 10:45 pm and foggy and freezing, but it goes quick and is totally worth it).

Consider it a blessing from the gods if you're able to park in the teeny lot behind the place.
author: Irina Z.

description:
Not sure what the all the hype is about.  After getting my expectations up, and after taking a number to be served, as if I was at the post-office, I found the ice cream, in particular the tropical flavors, no better than the good ole' Magnolia ice cream you could get at your local grocery store, and nowhere near as delicious as what you could get at Lappert's in Hawaii for example.  I was hoping to be like that food critic in "Ratatouille" who experienced a flashback to a childhood moment of tasting a flavor for the first time.  Instead I was still on a crowded sidewalk watching rush hour traffic in San Francisco.

With that said, I do appreciate the successful effort to popularize Filipino dessert flavors.  Being Filipino, I am saddened at how Filipinos have been unsuccessful overall in getting their cuisine into the mainstream compared to every other East Asian culture.  To this day, the average person only seems to only recognize lumpia.
author: Jed S.

description:
So, I thought taking a number at an ice cream place was weird, but I quickly found out that some sort of order is needed at Mitchells. This place is hella (appropriate for a joint in SF) packed!! Lines out the door, people huddled inside - totally worth it!

I waited 30 minutes and ordered one of their "tropical" flavors, avocado. It was creamy, sweet and had a subtle taste of avocado. I also tried Buko, baby coconut. It was super addicting! It's the kind that has coconut slivers hiding out - so GOOD.

Prices are high. It's def not Rite Aid, so be prepared. A single scoop averages $2.50 (if I remember correctly), and I saw a ready made cake for $45!

The adventure of getting a scoop of the Famous Mitchell's Ice cream was definitely worth it! I recommend checking it out!
author: Tanya S.

description: This place gets crazy busy - especially late weekend evenings. You grab a ticket and wait for them to call you. While you wait, you should probably be strategizing what you will be ordering. Be prepared because while the servers are super patient, the crowd may be not as sympathetic. My friends and I ordered a banana split with 3 ice cream flavors: Grasshopper Pie, Vanilla Custard, and Ube. Grasshopper Pie was a definite hit, especially with bananas, hot fudge, and whipped cream! Custard was delicious too. The ube flavor was masked by the rest of the toppings and ice cream flavors that it didn't taste like much to me. I would definitely order another banana split again and try more flavors!
author: Yi-Fang T.

description:
I've been coming to Mitchell's since I was a little yelper! Since before 1989... but even to this day the flavors of those ice creams still taste the EXACT way it did when I first started devouring those amazing desserts. Although the neighborhood still looks as rough as it did back then, I love how Mitchell's has always kept its family home style quality. 

My favorites have always been MANGO. my mom was always UBE or LANGKA (misspell) or BUKO. I know they've added different items over the years but I can't ever get over how delicious that mango ice cream is. It's worth running 2 days worth i love it that much. Plus where else can you find a mom and pop shop that has FILIPINO flavored creations besides Goldilocks? The line is worth it just to get a simple cone. 

The one thing I'm happy to say still exists at the store is the rainbow ice cream cone halogen lamp sign that's been hanging up on the window for almost 20 years. Every time I see it, I know "It's MITCHELL TIME" nom nom nom!
author: Sheryl G.

description:
San Francisco's hot spot. 

I love the Ube ice cream. The selection of flavor is wide. It's a busy place with a ticket system to be served. 

My secret tip to everyone is get the 1/2 gallon in your favorite favor to go and skip the long wait for scoops. You save money and time, plus there's plenty of leftover.
author: Linda C.

description: Lines can get long even on rainy days... Best time to come is mid afternoon ... The flavors are extraordinary and constantly changing which makes it hard to get tired of. This place is timeless, I've been coming since I was 5 and now bring my 4 year old here there's no other ice cream shop like it.
author: Mimi W.

description:
We had Mexican chocolate + caramel praline & chocolate chip + roasted almond. The flavors are authentic The Mexican chocolate was heavenly. 
The car parking in the back is a huge plus. Take a number as soon as you enter.
author: Wasfito W.

description: This place is right by my house awesome and quick place Togo for some great ice cream.  This is one of my favorite night places to go for ice cream with my girlfriend since they do open pretty late and the service is quick too since they go by a number system
author: Danny C.

description:
I had the ube, pistachio and mango in a cup. The mango was creamy and tastefull, but It did taste more like canned mango rather than fresh mango. The pistachio ice cream had a fair amount of whole pistachios, but it is not realy pistachio ice cream. It is more like pistachios and ice cream put together in a cup without mixing it. The ube ice cream was excellent, no remarks on that one.
Overall the ice cream is heavy, but that's okay if you like it, just a heads up.
So bottomline, good quality ice cream, but pricey and overrated.
author: Elias V.

description:
PEANUT BUTTER INDULGENCE - rich chocolate ice cream with peanut butter swirl, AND mini peanut butter cups. Are you drooling yet? That's the one flavour I ALWAYS get every time I come; it's the epitome of sweet and salty food pairings.

Mitchell's has a HUGE selection of flavours (including "exotic" ones like halo halo, ube, jackfruit, lucuma, and avocado). I habitually sample ~4 other flavours before I order (they're all usually really tasty too), but I've found none so far that can compare with my beloved PBI :)

Just remember to take a number when there's a line, or you'll never your delicious ice cream.

Tip: If you want to get 2 flavours but still want to stand a chance of fitting into your skinny jeans, get 2 kid scoops instead of a double scoop!
author: Steph L.

description: I got the Lucuma (Peruvian) flavored ice cream. It tasted pretty mild when it comes to fruits which was perfect for my taste palette at that time. Ice cream wise, Bi-Rite is still better :).
author: Thomas C.

description:
Mitchell's is one of the few ice cream shops in San Francisco not dominated by skinny jeans and thick-rimmed glasses.  Instead, families, couples, and groups of friends of all ages pack the shop.

When you enter Mitchell's, make sure to grab a number - do not be left confused and wondering how to get your cone.  Grab two numbers if you are often in your own world daydreaming, in case you miss when they call out your first number!

I've sampled many of the flavors, but am always drawn back to the UBE.  Something about ube's rich purple color and sweet creamy yam flavor makes it irresistible - after getting other flavored cones, I have often craved ube upon finishing.  Ube has become a no-brainer, so I can save myself any second-guessing.

Note: If Lolia S.'s review from 11/12/2011 provided accurate prices on that day, "Junior ($1.80)/ Single ($2.80)/ Double ($4.85)/ Triple ($7.05)," Mitchell's has raised their prices on the single scoop by 40 cents in the past 3 days.
author: Andrew M.

description: Once again, Mitchell's has delivered on the perfect birthday cake. Great range of options, excellent customer service, close attention to details, and the best-tasting ice cream in town! Why would you go anywhere else?
author: Kathleen W.

description: I have been going to Mitchell's since I was a kid. It's never failed me!! Cold days, warm days or rainy days, it doesn't matter, its' always Mitchell Ice Cream time!! My favs are coffee, mojito sorbet, macapuno with a hard shell chocolate, cantaloupe (seasonal) and rocky road. Go get yourself some ice cream!!!
author: Karina V.

description: I grew up with Mitchell's Ice Cream and it is still in the same location from when i was little. I'm lucky to have it so close by. They have multiple types of flavors to choose from. Brought 2 guests from Seattle and never had Mitchell's and they loved it. Especially since it is filipino owned ice cream, that makes it even better.
author: M M.

description: Can't believe this was my first time coming over to Mitchell's after close to 10yrs of living in SF. . .  Yea, the lines were long and we waited about 10-12min until our numbers were called, and we had to practically yell out our orders since there were so many folks inside (as well as outside), but in the end, I thought it was worth it since it was so creamy and good!!!  I ordered a single scoop of the Strawberry in a waffle cone and although I probably wouldn't come back here on a regular basis (mainly due to the crowds and the long lines), I'll for sure say that this is easily one of, if not THE BEST ice cream I've had in SF and I would love to try their other flavors one day!
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
Line is shorter than bi rite and ice cream is more rich and creamier
Ubn is a must try flavor
Mango and Jack fruit are unique and great second choices. 
Happy Eating!
author: Hasham Y.

description:
Went to Mitchell's for the first time today. I don't know what all the hubabaloo is about. It was good, but not extraordinary.

I give them props for having some unique flavors, but if you want even more ridiculous flavors head out to Polly-Anne's in the Sunset.

Maybe it was a bad day and the weather inside wasn't great, but my vanilla was a bit on the icy side, not as smooth as one would like. It may as well have been from the grocery store. Not very vanilla-y, either.

The chocolate was pretty intense but still nothing to write home about. I live in the outer Richmond and this place is certainly not worth the trip. Places that are worth the trip from the outer lands:

Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous, worth the trip from anywhere.
Bi-Rite.
Three Twins.
author: Matt J.

description:
#1 ice cream in the San Francisco Bay Area. Always a crowd and have to get a number. It's well worth the wait!! 
We Love the Grasshopper Pie and Mango ice cream. Also, the chocolate covered banana's...
author: Ayana K.

description: 1 word: SUPERB.....try the coconut ice cream.
author: Erica M.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco! Love that Grasshopper Pie!
author: Ashly M.

description:
KAHLUA MOCHA CREAM.  My fave flavor!  Tastes a bit like chocolate, a bit like coffee.  Perfection.

I also tried the Thai Iced Tea flavor. That was pretty good too. 

The Junior Size scoop is about $2.20. +$1 if you want it in a waffle cone!
author: Jennifer C.

description:
NOM NOM NOM

White pistachio + mexican chocolate = best combination!

Normally, I stick to frozen yogurt because ice cream can be too heavy, but I had to try the infamous Mitchell's once. Fortunately, I came on a very empty day and had no trouble finding parking in the back lot.

I loved the white pistachio so much, I bought a pint for me and my dad to share!
author: Surge C.

description:
4 and half, half a star taken off for the horrible parking around this area.

I love the ube, the coconut, and the grasshopper pie shake!

They really know how to capture the true fruitiness in the ice cream and bring it to life.  It is a delicious treat and don't get scared by the line outside, you can usually order pretty quickly.  The staff are very nice too.
Quick tip, even though they open till 10 or 11pm, try to come a little earlier because they do run out of flavors you may want some times.
author: Steph Q.

description:
I know a lot of people, I get around. I'm totally kidding, but with thousands of acquaintances, I can't name one that had anything bad to say about Mitchell's. Not about the ice cream, the parking, nothing about the service and not even the long line that is inevitable to endure (people flock and surround the vicinity lol, EVEN DURING THE RAIN, GEEZ MITCHELL'S YOU SURE ARE POPULAR for good reason too). Besides, they have this efficient 'Take a Number' system that seems to make things go swift and smooth ;)

I think the thing that makes Mitchell's superior to other ice cream franchises is their variety. So many wonderful flavors to choose from. I sometimes wish I could buy 4 each time I visit because I'm dying to have the Ube and the Macapuno (filipino flavors [: ube is a purple sweet yam and macapuno is young coconut) but I also want some Grasshopper Pie and mango or something like that, so I'm almost thankful the wait is long. I as a libra can be incredibly indecisive. 

The only time I've been somewhere that offered your own customized ice cream sandwiches was in LA and it was amazing! A chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich that deviates from the ice cream bars in the frozen foods section at Safeway? Hell yes! Imagine my glee when I read on their menu that Mitchell's has them too! ($2.50)

You have to be a real bitch to not like anything here because they offer almost everything. It's like this conversation I overheard. This guy was telling his friend "I have 1001 songs on my ipod, you're a real bitch if you don't like at least one"

I say this because they have milkshakes, smoothies, sorbet, ice cream sandwiches, pints or gallons, cookies and... random ass things. (I hella spelled gallons wrong but geez, Yelp tells me little things like if i forget the space; ice cream is misspelled but writing "galloons" isn't?). ANYWAY. The ice cream is great, it tasted like home made good and wholesome organic ice cream, texture is smooth, the ice cream has the consistency of gelato (more dense)  but it's packed with flavor and actually tastes the way you'd imagine the name of the ice cream to taste. I hope you know what I'm talking about, like when you take a lick of cookies and cream and it's actually just 'french vanilla', yeah that won't happen here mmkay. 

The cashiers are friendly and super cute. I love my loverman very much and think he's the hottest guy in the world, so I mean this platonically lawl. You might want to be mindful of how busy it is and limit your number of free samples. Just trust that whatever you get will be fantastic even in the circumstance it's not the flavor you're craving. 

Luckily if you just want a pint or anything else they offer like (syrups and cookies) there is an express line for those items so you won't have to take a number or wait :d

The architect must have known Mitchell's would be high in demand as they have their own parking lot and there's always parking despite the long line outside. HOW THE HELL. 

MITCHELL'S = MIRACLES.

credit card has a minimum, which worked in my favor at least because it allowed me to not have to make that hard decision between the three that I wanted LOL
author: Olivia Vanessa R.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco the menu is good but the grasshopper and mango are my favorite try the ube too.
author: Sam F.

description:
The line in this place! My god, you know this place is good when the line is out the door and there is pure chaos in there. Except somehow you find order in it all. Thanks to machines that give out numbers and a team of mitchell's employees who are efficient and quick.

There are numerous flavors to choose from. Numerous. Probably around 30-40. It's pretty crazy. And it makes choosing a nightmarish experience especially with so many people around you. However, I went with their what they're known for (ube) and my roommate went for more fruity flavors - peach, strawberry, and something else I cannot remember. What I do remember however, is liking her combination much more than my ube. Definitely give ube a try before getting it - doubt its everybody's scoop of ice cream.

However, the place is pretty amazing. The fruity ice creams were delicious and we went through the pint incredibly fast. Made the wait worth it.
author: Aditi R.

description: Doesn't anyone give generous scoops of ice cream anymore??    I drove out to Mitchell's from Concord and I was so excited to try this place out.  I ordered 2 half gallons of ice cream to make my trip worth it.  I bought toasted almond and white pistachio.  I then ordered a 2 scoop sundae and I was disappointed in their servings.  Again, this place would get 5 stars if their scoops compared to San Francisco Creamery in WC.  It seems like you taste more of the hot fudge than you do the ice cream since the scoops or so pathetic.
author: Rachel L.

description: One word: Horchata. It's very sweet and very worth it. Purple Yam is over hyped.
author: Jim G.

description:
love this place!
their mango shake is awesome.
always crowded, parking sucks but it's worth it.

Haven't found any ice cream place in the bay area that's even close to being as great as this place.
author: Learnee L.

description: So lucky to have Mitchell's in the neighborhood. It is an institution. Classic ice cream flavors with basic toppings offered here. No frills; no pretension, just really fine ice cream. I love the young coconut with purple yam on a waffle cone dipped In chocolate. That's how I do it! Yum. Line is always long so take a number as soon as your arrive, then peruse the flavor offerings.
author: Alice T.

description: Mitchelle's flavours are not necessarily the most crazy inventive; you won't find cornflakes & bourbon, cheese & apple, or tandoori chicken and yoghurt in this store but they have some seasonal ones that are really interesting. I've recently tried Lucuma, which is a Peruvian fruit that's almost like a cross between sweet potato and maple and it is amazing. Not to mention, they have ube (purple yam), macapuno (coconut), halo halo and other Southeast Asian flavours that is reminiscent of home for me. And it's all locally made! Love how late it opens but I don't like the location though. Kinda far for peeps who don't have a car.
author: Kwoky L.

description:
Halo-halo ice cream!!!  

Visited for the first time a couple weeks ago, mid-week.  Parked right on San Jose a few cars over from the front door.  This also meant a short wait.  

This ice cream ain't cheap, but actually there isn't really cheap ice cream anymore.

Really yummy, of course halo-halo ice cream is yummy... can't wait to go back and try something else.  Maybe horchata.
author: Jon C.

description:
halo halo is fun to eat.. a little piece of Hawaii (via PI) right in SF. The pineapple coconut along with bi-rites lavender honey, are the tastiest ice creams in town-hands down.  Also notable, chocolate dipped pistachio, mexican hot chocolate, macapuno, thai tea, avocado, jackfruit...well pretty much every flavor.

The pineapple coconut and waiting in line on a hot summer night while other people are already eating an array of mysterious flavors dripping down their fingers will always bring back memories of growing up in SF.
author: Lily G.

description: I've heard about Mitchell's, finally got a chance to try it.  Had the children's size of the French Vanilla Bean and tried my girlfriend's Ube.  Both were excellent, not a huge fan of sweets but Mitchell's was satisfying, not overly sweet, but just right.
author: Calvin T.

description: This ice cream is the best and locals know it. My husband grew up in the Mission District and his grandfather used to take him to Mitchell's for a special treat. He would always get the orange sherbet and still does to this day! Even though we live in Oakland, we still make special trips across the bay to get this delectable treat OR if we're in the city, for whatever reason, we know we have to make a stop at Mitchell's. I get a cone with one scoop of Chocolate Peanut Butter Indulgence and a second scoop of something new whenever I go there. Recently, I picked up a 1/2 gallon of their Ube (Filipino purple yam) flavor and took it home. Make sure you let it soften a bit before taking a bite to ensure you get the full flavor of this delicate ice cream. Like tasting a fine white wine, you don't want it to be so cold that you freeze your taste buds. They also have a lot of other exotic fruit flavors that you are sure to love!!! Mitchell's is a San Francisco institution.
author: Julie B.

description: I had this ice cream from San Francisco city delivered to me in San Jose city. I'm so blessed to have this special unusual connection! They have my favorite flavors-green tea, mango, and purple yam with coconut. The taste is superb and real gourmet texture that taste natural.
author: Ada C.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream tastes so creamy and thick--the consistency is almost gummy-like. It has me working on their ice cream in silence and in happiness. 

It is always so exciting to see the variety of wonderful flavors they have. Aside from the Il Laboratorio del Gelato in New York, I've never seen such an elaborate menu of ice cream flavors before. UGH, I DIE. They carry unique, tropical/seasonal flavors, your standard flavors, and sorbets. I have pretty much tried every single flavor and I love each one (except the Egg Nog--not my thing). Let's just say that each ice cream flavor tastes like the real thing (i.e. Pumpkin = eating pumpkin pie with a little more sugar). And to be sure, I was never a big fan of mint-flavored ice cream before trying Mitchell's but it should be noted that I was converted by Mitchell. Damn.

Favorite flavors: Mango, Thin Mint, Toasted Almond, Caramel Praline, Oreo Cookie, Green Tea, Pumpkin, Langka (jackfruit), Mandarin Orange, and Peppermint Candy.

Mitchell's is YUMMY. There's nothing else I can say that others haven't already but that the wait is worth it.

**Accepts credit cards, yeaaaa!
**Long wait; "take a number" ticket stub system
author: Jenny O.

description:
Great people , very good service and excellent ice cream.
I recommend it !!
Thanks mitchell......
author: Marcio S.

description:
i'm not a fan of mint chocolate chip ice cream.. but i do love mint chocolate cookie ice cream!!!

hello, Grasshopper ice cream!
author: Milli F.

description:
If you happen to be by San Jose Ave, between 29th St and Valley St, and you notice a bunch of cars parked with people sitting inside, to those who don't know this is not, I repeat, is not a make out spot. This area is a nearby spot to one of the greatest Ice Cream joint in San Francisco. Mitchell's Ice Cream is a little tiny ice cream shop with an enormous group of loyal followers and it is growing every day. Almost every minute of every hour Mitchell's Ice Cream is open for business, there is always a line of people out the door of this joint, waiting to get a taste of this wonderfully delicious ice cream as they bring it out to their cars and enjoy Mitchell's vast selection of frozen treat. Here are just some of the few I will highlight: 

Ube (Purple Yam) - It made the SF 7x7 list of "100 Things to Try Before You Die". Being a Filipino I grew up on Ube Ice Cream (Magnolia) so I'm a little bias towards the Magnolia version, but Mitchell's Ube has its own distinct taste that's worth trying. 

Mexican Chocolate - Chocolate with cinnamon, my personal favorite and what I think should have been on the "100 Things to Try Before You Die" list. Rain or shine this is the ultimate treat. 

White Pistachio - I'm a little hooked on Pistachios right now so anything with Pistachios I'm getting. Certainly not the best in my list, but worth trying. 

Kahlua Mocha Cream - The closes to Lappert's Kauai Pie, my all time favorite. Not quite as good as Lappert's but close (or maybe I like Lappert's because I only get it when I'm in Hawaii, that adds to the taste, don't you think?!?).
