These are just some of the few I've tried, I'm sure you will have your own personal favorite. Like I said in the beginning, the lines are long so get your money on hand and be very decisive to keep the line moving quickly. I'm probably behind you right now ready to try a new flavor, so keep it moving folks, keep it moving.
author: Mel B.

description:
I've been here lots of times when I lived in Noe, and a definite fan. Today after hanging in the Mission I thought I'd take my gal here. She's a lot more astute than me and noticed that the servers were entirely different. One had the greatest smile. Another gave generously large scoops and samples. The lone boy was a grumpy ass with meager scoops. As they trudged thru the numbers we kept praying we wouldnt get grumpy ass, but as it turned out, grumpy ass called a string of numbers all of whom were missing, and then called our number.

You should have seen the look on his grump ass face when my gal, who was keenly interested in many flavors and had never been here before, ask to try a sample.  His grumpy ass sagged even more. Gal didn't miss a beat and asked to try a few more samples. Unfortunately, we seriously weren't tasting anything that was inspiring us, when grumpy ass said he could no longer take our order.

We walked out.  I've always enjoyed their ice cream, but they need consistent service.
author: Henry Y.

description: My favorite Ice Cream in SF. I'm a simple man with simple needs, and all i want is plain chocolate ice cream. They have the best original flavors hands down. I can come here everyday.  The store is tiny, parking it hard to go by, and the lines are usually long; and that is rain or shine. But if you have the opportunity to enjoy original greatness, come to Mitchell's Ice Cream.
author: Arlito C. L.

description:
If you looked up the definition of an ice cream shop being in the middle of nowhere, Mitchell's would be right there as an e.g. Look, there are no stores around that place! How I found it? I followed the glowing chatter of happy ice cream eaters or grumpy waiters. 

Instructions:
1. Make your way around the rest of the ice cream waiters. 
2. Go to the door of the ice cream shop.
3. Turn left. 
4. Grab ticket. (Destroy anyone who wants to get a ticket before you.) 
5. Wait for your turn. 
6. Look at all the ice cream enviously. 
7. Wait for your turn. 
8. Order your ice cream.
9. Enjoy it like you are 5 with overalls, it's summer or you just got laid 5x. 

I got the sweet coconut flavor (not to be confused with baby coconut) on a sugar cone. YES! YES! YES! It tasted like fresh cocunut met liquid nitrogen. Pieces of coconut made their way onto my tongue and into my tummy. The creamy, white goodness made me happy (yea, in that way). 

Come here for the coconut, but be prepared to wait.
author: Stacy T.

description:
This review is directed toward the service not the quality of the ice cream. I've had it many times, love it and wanted a cake today but I got the shaft.  If you call ahead to make sure they have something may I suggest asking for the name of the person you speak with. I called yesterday, asked if they had this specific item. He said yes they had a bunch just come in. Got there today. They didn't have it. Been out of stock for awhile because of the holidays. Spoke to the owner, he seemed a little out of it, he agreed they didn't have the size but they did have the flavor. We agreed to the larger size because we really wanted the flavor. The employee heads back for 10 minutes. Appears with two options. Neither the one we wanted. 

We asked for a mint chocolate chip pie/cake. They came out with vanilla ice cream cake with thin mints shaped like a cake. Bait and switch.  The food is good but the service killed any possibility of ever going back.
author: Hutton M.

description:
It was my son's birthday and he didn't want a regular cake, so I asked him, "do you want an ice cream cake?"  He gave me a big smile.

He was very happy that day = mom was happy too.
and the night of his birthday he said "thank you, it was my best birthday"

hmm I guess I should get again Mitchell's Ice cream cake next year. :p
author: Lena N.

description:
My beloved Mitchell's...every time I come back, I always leave wanting MORE. My love for Mitchell's began as a young child and my adoration for this establishment has never wavered. I recently went with my big sis (hello! I am finally yelping!) to end our double date on a good note, food wise. I was surprised to see the change in decor but was instantly comforted by the fact that the ice cream was still the same. 

I ordered buko ice cream on a waffle cone. It was sweet and creamy, with generous pieces of young coconut, just as I remembered it as a child. I would have died happy.

My TOP favorites though would have to be lychee and mango ice cream. Those two flavors are the loves of my lives. I can easily polish off a 1/2 gallon of each...no lies...but doing so would compromise my health. I love how Mitchell's is never stingy with the amount of fruit they put into the lychee and mango ice cream and always packing in the ice cream to give you more to enjoy. Mitchell's has always delivered quality ice cream and I will be bringing my kids (in the future) here because I want them to experience the way ice cream SHOULD taste.

My suggestion? Stick to the tropical/exotic flavors they have to offer because that's what they specialize in. The "regular" flavors are good, but not heavenly, in my opinion.

 I am daydreaming about it right now...
author: Christine L.

description:
Fresh, in-store made ice cream in so many different flavors, you're bound to find something just for you.

I personally love their Ube ice cream because:
1. I'm Filipino, if you're Filipino and don't like Ube.. there's something terribly wrong with you.
2. It's delicious
3. It's purple!!!

Mitchell's is obviously doing something right because there are lines out the doors on a cold and foggy (sometimes rainy) day.

Whether you're a local or a tourist, this place has to be on your list of things to try during your stay in SF.

TIP for newcomers: Walk in past the crowd to grab yourself a number (located on the left side of the entrance) and wait outside to listen for someone to call you. Otherwise, you'll be standing around looking like a fool :)

ANOTHER TIP: Parking is a b-word!! Ask someone in your car to step out and grab a number while you circle the block about 10 times to find parking. 

p.s. If you're one of those calorie-conscious people, just ask for your favorite flavor in a junior-sized cup of cone...the cone would cost you 40 calories though. But it's totally worth it!!!
author: Juliette R.

description:
god, i hate mitchells!!
if i didn't work a block away from them, i swear i'd be 20 lbs lighter!
it's like they call my name, when i walk by there.
i need to work on my will power......
author: Anett R.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is *to*die*for* I'm not even a huge ice cream fan, yet we needed a little post dinner dessert and stopped by Mitchell's. I can only imagine how heavenly it would be on a hot summer day. 

I thought it was pretty novel that they had their own parking lot in the back. Even though the lot was already full, we were able to find street parking pretty easily. The shop was packed when we arrived so we took a number and started pondering on what flavors to order. I opted for the Biscotti Nocciole in a waffle cone (I'm a sucker for hazelnut) which was delish. 


Tip: They accept credit cards with a $9 order.
author: H T.

description: Came here the other night and was reminded of why I keep coming here and why Mitchell's is a San Francisco staple...Baby coconut is amazing and so refreshing! Especially on those rare, warm nights...
author: Stephanie C.

description:
What I like about Mitchell's:
You are not stuck with the same old chocolate chip or mint chip ice cream sandwich.  You can have any flavor you want in the middle.  Plus the semi-soft large cookies are just plain good.

They have Filipino flavored...wait that sounds like Filipino is a flavor.  Well I know our skins can be a delicious chocolate brown, but I bet we Filipinos would either taste like adobo or dinuguan. Tropical flavored ice cream from the P.I.  Ehh little better.  Anyways I think it is great thy hav those flavors.  Helps the nanays, tatays, lolos, and lolas feel at home.

What I don't like about Mitchell's

The parking.
author: Sunshine S.

description:
Just do it. Worth the long line. Every lick of that Ube Ice Cream will make you forget the line.

Even if it's cold out. DO IT.
author: J-nine I.

description: I haven't been here in a while due to BiRite opening up closer to us and we can eat only *so* much ice cream. I went back here yesterday and found that I still love the flavors here, like Buko (baby coconut), which is the best coconut that i have ever tasted, and avocado. I hope to come back here more often now that my child is no longer a baby and now can sneak away for father/daughter ice cream time.
author: Benjamin T.

description:
Overrated.

Line for this is ridiculous! Over an hour for some ice cream? The ice cream was delicious, but I think I could have bought some at the Safeway right across the street and been just as happy. I think everyone raves about the baby coconut, but you can serioulsy hit up one of the nearby Asian markets, save yourself some time a money and get it there. 

Picks: 
Taro flavored 
Coffee flavored
Buko - Baby coconut
Halo Halo
author: Erin M.

description:
My favorite ice creams: 

Peach
Grasshopper pie
Mango
Strawberries n cream
Cookies n cream

Small spot
Cashiers need a lesson in service with a smile.
Can be crowded
author: Jay M.

description:
i love everything about mitchell's

a super down to earth shop. take-a-number system so you can go wherever you want during the (totally worth it) 30 minute wait and come back as soon as you're next. a wide selection of standard, tropical, and rotational flavors. rich ass, thick, gooey, milky, smooth, highly concentrated cream that will make anyone love life. gallons of the most popular flavors for sale. among the most amazing...

grasshopper pie...mint ice cream oozing chocolate fudge everywhere but also softly crunchy and crumbly at the same time from the chocolate chips and chunks of oreos. extremely rich and sweet yet very cool and refreshing. it is incredible.

cinnamon snap...cinnamon ice cream packed with soft ginger snap cookie bits. ginger snaps!

ube...creamy and dense, and vanilla-y...will convert anyone who is wary of exotic flavors, into an exotic flavor lover. ANYONE

butternut munch...butterscotch ice cream with candied almonds. don't underestimate this flavor! you probably only need one scoop because of its intensity and sweetness.

strawberry ice cream. mitchell's has an unbeatable version of this classic flavor.

and very importantly...the scoop sizes...ENORMOUS. one scoop at mitchell's = two scoops at bi-rite. and then i just love how the workers at mitchell's top off each already huge scoop with another small "after-scoop." that's it, mitchell's...you've won my heart!
author: Jessica C.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream is superior to the other ice cream operations in S.F.

I've tried them all....no contest. 

Creamy....rich....tasty....decent size servings.....chocolate carmel crunch....how I love thee. 

A must go whenever I'm in the city.
author: Walter M.

description:
I came here on an adventure to get a halo halo as I was feeling a strong craving for it, and this was a lot closer than driving hours to my hometown for one.

Heard the ice cream here is top notch and people rave about it all the time. It's a cute shop and the ice cream looks and is generally creamy but I don't get the hype. It's good ice cream and comparable to Rite Aid (which is good, don't hate) I love all the unique but basic flavors they have but none of them blew me away. The ube everyone raves about was smooth but didn't even stand out. Personal favorite was the coconut which is hard for me to not like.

My halo halo was good but after a few bites I threw it away. As an ice cream lover there are many other places I'd rather go first.
author: Sam H.

description: My first time here and won't be my last. I don't like anything too sweet so with that being said, the ice cream here is very creamy with just the right amount of sweetness. Love that this place has tropical flavors like ube. Can't wait to try other flavors!
author: Cindy T.

description: I wouldn't say the best ice cream in the world but definitely a very family oriented spot. I like how the lines go super fast and all of the staff members know exactly what they're doing. I also like the fact that even though they don't let your pets in side they do have treats for them while they wait outside. The energy that this place gives out makes you keep coming back for more. I wouldn't eat ice cream anywhere else!
author: Richard A.

description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream! One of the last stops my friends and I went to on our food adventure weekend. Mitchells decor is like any other ice cream shop but with the neighborhood old school ice cream shop feel. I got the dulce de leche and the pistachio. Dulce de leche was yummy but after awhile it got to sweet for my taste buds so I just scooped it off my cone to enjoy my pistachio. Pistachio was yummers, not to sweet vanilla with pieces of pistachio throughout. All in all. A great way to end our sf food adventure weekend!
author: Di L.

description:
I don't eat ice cream much, but I'll never pass up a stop at Mitchell's when I'm in the area.  definitely the best ice cream in the city - no comparison.  the place got renovated in recent years but the ice cream quality stays the same.  always crowded but always worth the wait.  if you've got extra cash to burn, you can also pick up a half gallon to go but it's quite pricey

parking sucks.  only place to eat is standing on the sidewalk.  prices are so-so.  always cold in that part of the 'hood.  but I'll always come back for more!
author: JL G.

description: Amazing ice cream, great staff. Always busy but the line moves quick- don't forget to grab a number from the "Take a number" deli style thingy on the wall to the left of the doorway.
author: Kajal G.

description:
Mitchell's is a SF treasure. The texture is always so smooth and the tropical flavors are one of a kind.  Ube (purple yam) is my date's favorite, but mine is Buko (baby coconut).  Buko takes all the nuttiness of the coconut without over powering you with sweetness.  I've tried to avoid ice cream made from gums to keep them more consistent, but Mitchell's is irresistible.

Be prepared for a line, though here is a trick:  bypass the line by simply getting a half gallon from the freezer.  No waiting in line if you're picking up the pre-packed half gallons and don't need a tasting!
author: Zack S.

description: Third time I've been here and I'm still amazed with how friendly and sufficient the workers are. They service you on a first come, first serve basis which is kept in line via ticket numbers and an electronic sign followed by a loud speaker to make sure one does not get skipped. The portions here are perfect, the taste is always up to par and the free dog treats are an added bonus.
author: Shilo B.

description: I will drive into the city just to eat this ice cream. Must try the Grasshopper pie sundae!
author: Kristina D.

description:
Summary: Good cold stuff!

(Prelude) I'm not so much of an ice cream snob, more of an apathetic ice cream patron- it's either too sweet after 2 bites, too bad for my healthy or "too" something- the list goes on forever as to how little I care for cream/milk/salt combo.   Albeit, I did fall in love with Berthillion in Paris!

Mitchells does it right for someone that scowls at the thought of taking a bite of blue bells.   It's not to heavy on the cream, tastes like fresh milk, and the flavor is just right- not too over powering or sweet so it allows you to lick your bowl/cone dry without feeling guilty!

I ordered the chocolate which tastes more like dark chocolate- double plus for me as I am unfornately a dark chocolate snob.

Venue: crowded but the customers were all friendly; no one pushing or shoving.  Remember to take a number (left side of the door when you first walk in) and wait in line!
author: Wendy H.

description: The ultimate of all ice cream joints around the Country. Ube - get the Ube - it is heaven on a plate.  Nothing more to add except this is one awesome stop.
author: MJ J.

description:
Haagen Daaz: cream, sugar, eggs, fruit, honey, etc.
Mitchell's: ...what's with all the scientific mumble jumble on the label?

I really don't think I've ever wanted to boycott any kind of ice cream. The keyword is EVER. Although I have made many visits to Mitchell's I haven't really found the beauty in what many reviews rave it to be one of San Francisco's gems. SIgh. I would rather make the trip to Humphrey or Bi-Rite because I know it's good quality stuff that's either made fresh or at least the flavors are rotated. It's ok...hate on me if you will, but ice cream isn't just  something on a cone. It's a scoop of happiness for me and if I'm not happy then I ain't coming back (unless a friend drags me here).

Afterthought: And what's with the number ticket system??
author: Carol L.

description:
My name is Lady Gaga and I go gaga for ube ice cream.

No, but seriously though - the ube flavored ice cream is pretty legit. What is ube anyway? Well, they claim it's purple yam but to me, it tastes like something really similar to taro. (You'll know what I mean if you ever had taro ice cream or frozen yogurt.)

Upon arriving here, I was already anticipating a wait. But what I did know was that I was going to walk out of the store with a 1/2 gallon tub of ube ice cream ($9.50) in my hands. Shout out to Benson for treating me and a friend :D Before happily leaving this place, I was able to get a sample of the Mexican chocolate flavored ice cream. It was pretty good. I wish I have gotten a sample of the Halo Halo and the white pistachio flavor as well, but I didn't wanna seem like a sampling brat that was on a sugar high. Well until next time, there's still a tub of ube ice cream sitting in the freezer!
author: Annie S.

description:
I give Mitchell thumbs up for their selection of tropical flavors.

Mitchells reminds me of Marianne's Ice Cream in Santa Cruz, except the servers here actually smile and are not depressed hipster kids.
author: F. M.

description:
While you might have to wait in line for your number to be called for a ridiculously long amount of time in the cold San Francisco evening, the ice cream you will receive at the end of your quest is well worth it!  It reminds me of the local farm creameries I used to go to back on the East Coast - thick, rich, full of flavor, and a freshness that you can't find in any grocery store or Ben & Jerry's location!

My favorite flavors are the Kahlua Mocha Cream and Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup - the latter has actual mini-peanut-butter-cups in the ice cream, making it lovely to bite down on as well as extra-flavorful.

I also enjoy their Avocado ice cream, and agree with my partner that they make a good Thai Iced Tea flavor as well.

While the parking lot is generally full, at least they help you out by having a few spaces up for grabs in an otherwise-difficult-to-park neighborhood.  If you drive around enough times, you'll find a spot...and better to blinker, hop out and grab your number, THEN park, since the average wait time I've experienced here is a half hour!

Prices = Average
Taste = Mind-bogglingly delicious
Try = Kahlua Mocha Cream, Chocolate Peanut Butter Cup

Kid-friendly, wheelchair access, and you can also get tubs of ice cream to go without the wait!
author: Amy L.

description: Their Grasshopper pie icecream is DELICIOUS-mint chip icecream with fudge and oreos!  Not to mention their cantaloupe icecream actually tastes like cantaloupe.  Skip some of the weird flavors you find at other places and get a carton of this!
author: Aly A.

description: The Mitchell's was fantastic! Today was my first time and it was amazing! I sampled a few flavors, all really good but the ube was my favorite! If you're looking for some good ice cream on a super hot or cold day, I highly recommend this place!
author: Aaron O.

description:
after all these yrs that i've bookmarked mitchell's i FINALLY got to try it!!! so good! i love how rich the ice cream are and all those flavors to choose from, i was like a kid in a candy store! 

i really like their halo halo flavor and the eggnog was surprisingly good. But i ended up getting their ube flavor ice cream - it was just delicious! 

i wish i can go back and get a scoop of their black walnut - that was delicious too!
author: Cherie T.

description:
Ube? Mhm....that was my order. One lovely scoop of purple yam made  it worth taking a lactose pill, for sure!!!

It is my mission to tast every single one of the tropical flavors before summer ends (and become a serious jogger, to balance this feat).

So far, I can take Halo Halo and Tropical Four off of my list (I stole spoonfuls from my friends), but many more flavors remain to be tasted!!
author: Hilda Z.

description:
Mitchell's is a family favorite.

We used to come to Mitchell's for a treat growing up.  When my grandfather died, it became our family tradition to stop by Mitchell's on the way to the cemetery (maybe to have a little sweetness to dull out the sadness of what we were doing).

What is so beautiful about Mitchell's is that it is iconic to San Francisco.  San Francisco is a melting pot of different cultures, and Mitchell's blends all of these cultures to an american favorite treat.

You have exotic fruits from Asia like langka, tropical 4, buko, macapuno, avocado, lychee - things you don't normally see at your ordinary baskin robbins.  You have Kahlua, dulce de leche, lucuma, and mexican chocolate from our latin neighbors.  They have seasonal treats like eggnog for Christmas or pumpkin for November.

There is always a line at Mitchell's rain or shine - hot or cold!

Forget rice-a-roni....Mitchell's is the San Francisco treat!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Randomly craving ice cream late night  a few months back and stumbled upon this place. My girlie friend (Chrisitan) and I arrived at the door 5 mins til closing. It was perfect timing. We tried a few flavors and then we were sold. I indulged and got a double scoop.:P Craving totally satisfied :)
author: Crystal G.

description: The best way to end a so so day...Mitchell's ice cream!!! Just had the Lucuma...Peruvian fruit. It tasted like a cross between pumpkin and thai tea ice cream??? It was super yummy...I'll be heading back this weekend for another scoop. The guy who scooped our cone was super hilarious..great way to end the night!!
author: hac h.

description:
MMM an old, tried-and-true San Francisco fave! With more butterfat than other SF companies (and trust, I love me some Bi-Rite), this ice cream is truly indulgent and delicious!!!!!! 

I loooove how rich their ice cream is and how efficient their service is, considering the popularity of the place! With a numbered line system, you don't have to wait an eternity and you can make your decision while you wait for your number to be called so the line keeps moving (I'm looking at you Humphrey Slocombe)!!! 
There's many flavors unique to Mitchell's, and I ended up with a scoop of Mexican Chocolate with my sister taking a scoop of Lilikoi Mango. Both were delicious in totally different ways.

I hadn't been to Mitchell's in a while and no I have no clue why!! Definitely will be back for another scoop soon!
author: Rayna L.

description:
Buy ice cream here!  It's delicious!  This is my favorite ice cream store, second in line to Fenton's in Oakland.  The only reason why I gave 4 stars is because of their of taking orders.  We had to wait for our number to be called.  I though it was inefficient.  They only have one door to enter and exit so it's a little uncomfortable maneuvering in and out when it's packed.

As for the ice cream selection, there was something for everyone.  It was the kind of menu in which I could blindly pick one and I would love it!
author: Sharon C.

description:
Ube is so creamy and YUMMY! I love their ice creams because they are not as sweet as other places. Just the right amount of sugar. The yuzu wasn't too good, it tasted like tangerine peel. 

For first timers: remember to take a number at your left  when you enter. They call you by the number
author: Amy Y.

description:
I am boggled as to why this place has such a strong following.  I love ice cream and (okay fine I'll admit) I do have a tendency to have a snobby palate.  

Good quality ice cream isn't just getting the flavors right, its also getting the body and texture of the ice cream right.  For me, really good quality ice cream or gelato must have very little air pumped into it, clear flavor, and a smooth texture that is not gummy.

I didn't find it here at Mitchell's.  I was very excited about the UBE/TARO ice cream but the flavor just wasn't right.  I've had it in Taiwan before and it doesn't even begin to compare.  The texture of all the flavors I tried were off, they were all creamy but too close to gummy for me.  

BOTTOM LINE: I wouldn't come visit this place again.  I will say, they do have unique flavors you would not be able to find elsewhere...like UBE and JACKFRUIT.
author: Sunny W.

description: Good to have friends who are locals, and have (sweet!) cars to boot. We drove out here for some dessert after a great Ethiopian meal. After trying samples of the sweet coconut and eggnog, I decided to go with the cinnamon snap. It was delicious! A good balance between the spice of the cinnamon and the squishy get crunchy gingersnap cookie. Mmmmm. Wonder how long it would be to get here on the bus???
author: Deb G.

description: Mitchell's is good, but is honestly just as good as most ice cream spots. I'd still recommend it for those who have never tried it.
author: Jose G.

description:
Damn talk about creamy goodness! This is really what sets Mitchell's apart...their ice cream is just so creamy and decadent.

Lucuma - okay weird name, but totally delicious. I really don't know how to describe it, but perhaps a caramel custard...this is seriously a fruit?

Ube - yes it's purple and yes it's made from a yam. I really don't know how to describe the taste other than it's unique but good!

Pumpkin - come Autumn, be on the lookout for this orange-ish concoction. It reminds me of pumpkin to the n-th power.

Green Tea - hands down the best green tea ice cream I've ever had. In fact I have a 1/2 gallon in the freezer that I'll dig into now :)
author: David H.

description:
Sweet mother of all ice cream shops, this place was amazing. We saw the huge line out the door of Mitchell's and figured we'd ought to join the crowd as well. With so many people waiting, it had to be good right? 

And thank god we waited, this place was better than Ici and Bi-Rite. I had the grasshopper pie (mint, chocolate chips, fudge, and oreos!!) and the espresso toffee crunch ice cream. Two scoops was too much as the flavors were on the heavier side, but hey I got greedy after waiting an hour for my cone. 

I'll definitely be coming back. Prepare yourself for something definitely worth waiting for :)
author: Patricia Q.

description:
I was a true Bi-Rite devotee for years, three to be exact, and I was the kind of guy that would make sure every trip into the city ended with one or four scoops of their highly esteemed ice cream. I thought I'd seen the light...

Well I had, sort of, I just hadn't seen the other light, the brighter one, just a little ways away, in a different part of the same city...Mitchell's Ice Cream. The flavor, the texture, the flavor, the texture...not sure what other terms I should use, besides the only two meaningful ice cream descriptors in my vocabulary. I've been back five weeks in a row, since my initial visit, and I haven't been disappointed with a single flavor I've tasted (I'm about 85% through sampling everything). 

I'm not one of those people that's going to talk your ear off about the amazing selection of tropical flavors not found in most ice cream shops, or even tell you that those flavors are my favorites -- I've tried them and they're pretty darn good. What I will tell you, is that I'm just short of addicted to their Caramel Praline, Macapuno, and Oreo cookie flavors. Talk about a holy trinity. Wow. 

Part of me wishes that they used toppings other than the usual store-bought Smucker's variety, but another part of me likes the fact that this very issue gives more of an incentive not to mask their masterpiece ice cream with anything. 

Cheers, Mitchell's. Keep doing what you've been doing for oh, so long.
author: Josh P.

description: Definitely a WIN! Good prices and delicious ice cream! I wanted to try something new, so I went for the Rum Raisin. I am so glad I did, I enjoyed it so much! I tried my friends Grasshopper and Tropical Four, both were amazing, especially the Tropical Four. My other friend got Vanilla Custard with something else, but he sure enjoyed it. Anyway, this place was still packed and it was about 45 minutes or so before closing. You have to pick a number to order, which I absolutely don't mind since it was hectic in there. Service was fast, and good. Parking can be difficult to find, I noticed that they had their own parking lot, but we ended up parking on the street since I heard their parking lot was small.
author: Jennifer W.

description: This is the Best place for ice cream especially the chocolate covered mango ice cream on a plain cone... This place is the best bar none.
author: George E.

description:
I LOVE Mitchell's! I usually get two scoops of mango in a sugar cone and I am good to go! When you get in, you pull a number and wait until your number is called. It is pretty efficient because it prevents people from cutting in line and such. My boyfriend & mom loves the taro ice cream and if my mom likes the ice cream, it has to be good.

Too bad Mitchell's is kind of out of the way compared to other ice cream places. MUST TRY!!!
author: Syd T.

description: A little too much sugar for me. I had higher expectations on quality, but there are plenty of flavors!
author: Taylor M.

description: Really excellent.  Quite a wait, but it was worth it.  And who wouldn't want to wait in a classic ice-cream shop.  The texture really sets it apart.
author: Marc M.

description:
If Mitchell's had an ice cream truck, it's musical melodies would lure the sweet-toothed citizens of S.F. to its' storefront like the Pied Piper.

sad to say that i've only tried ONE flavor as of yet, but happy to tell you all that the Cantaloupe ice cream flavor has me dreaming of summer days.
author: Bernice C.

description:
Way too crowded and disorganized in this store. Not very professional staff either.

The ice cream itself is way to thick for my taste.
author: Jafar Amir Hanovic Ismailov M.

description:
I mean with 2000+ reviews and an overall 4.5 stars...does this place even need a review? With the hectic crowd the service is always amazing and of course...the ICE CREAM IS DELISH! Love Mitchell's...only thing that would make it better...VEGAN ICE CREAM!!! 

...I can only wish...and hope...and pray.

But, o how I love their grasshopper pie ice cream!
author: Crystal V.

description:
another great ice cream joint in SF.  Flavors like ube, mango, cookie& cream all do some amazing things in your mouth...and in your belly...

super refreshing, great textures and flavors that aren't so overpowering yet hits the spot, Mitchell's is a great place to go all throughout the summer.

families, young working class, cool, nerdy, young and old, white, asian, Hispanic or confused, Mitchell's reach of all demographics is truly mind-blowing and something to be respected.
author: Jang David K.

description:
A twist on a classic small-town ice cream shop. It looks like a quaint traditional place that's been around forever (because it has), but don't come expecting entirely traditional flavors. They have those too, which is what this girl prefers, but there's also lots of tropical ones you won't find anywhere else. And there's some smack dab in the middle, like cantaloupe. It's a familiar fruit in sorbet, but a first for me in ice cream. Interesting.

To date, in my ice cream foraging, I think I'm going to have to say that Mitchell's ties Bi-Rite, both of which slightly edge out Humphrey Slocombe.
author: Amanda S.

description: Ube & Lucuma ice creams for the win!
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description:
My husband and I are new to the city and we absolutely love to complain about San Francisco. But one very good thing about this city is Mitchell's and we are lucky to be graced by this wonderful wonderful place. Ever since our first visit a few months back, we always have Mitchell's ice cream in the freezer. Usually ube and/or buko. They are sublime, especially together. We usually forego the insane line up (well worth it) and grab a couple pre-packed containers in the freezer. You're in and out!

Honest, REALLY GOOD, fantastic ice cream. Don't miss it.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Decent.  Big big portions, so you get hella bang for your buck.  But nothing that makes me want to go back again and again.  The ticketing system is really smart because there are always tons of people lining up. 

Ube ice cream is good, but there's this sickening after effect once you eat too much of it.  So sharing is caring!
author: Anna T.

description:
I intentionally scheduled lunch in the area, so we can head over here after! 

BOYYIEE, i miss this place!! Pear sorbet, mMmm... chunks of pear, tasted soo fresh and yummy! What a treat!!

Young coconut ice cream... nice, creamy, smooth texture... 

I want MORE! even if its ice cold, raining, or snowing outside.. LOL
author: Tramy V.

description:
I first had Mitchell's at 3 years old because we lived in Noe Valley

I still feel like a 3 year old when I indulge at Mitchell's

YUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMY
author: Athena S.

description: The line is always ridiculously long but it's worth the wait. The service is great and the selection of flavors is unmatched. Love going here with my friends :-)
author: Christopher S.

description:
Pretzel ice cream cone???!?! 

Foodies rejoice! It was literally a religious food experience. It changed my life, and I will never eat a regular cone AGAIN. ever. It was perfectly crispy. Just enough crunch. Salt perfectly hugging the outside... I'm salivating just typing this. The only sad part was the last bite ;) haha I didn't want it to end! I'll admit it, I think I shed a tear. I will be back pretzel cone. I. will. be. back!
author: maria K.

description: Great quality ice cream. Lot's of unique flavors. Had the Mocha Chocolate and Peanut butter and they where really delicious.
author: K M.

description: The staff there are patient especially when you ask to sample something. I love their Mexican Chocolate!! I like how they have so many distinct flavors to offer here for everyone. It was busy when I went, but it was worth the wait.
author: LM D.

description:
One the best ice cream place ever! I always come at night, so it's crowded, but waiting time goes by fast.

Parking can be a hassle to find, but it's worth it. 

Definitely love the avocado ice cream and if you're a pistachio fan, the white pistachio is filled with pistachio nuts!
author: Diana T.

description:
So many flavors, so many choices. Hmm I don't know what to pick! Before deciding what to order, make sure you get a ticket number. People will stand all over the place and you will assume that you are 'in-line'. The menu is right above the wall. I like the regular flavors but give yourself a twist and try something from the tropical and seasonal sections.

All of the flavors I've tried are great. I need to come here more often!
Buko
Coffee
Coconut Pineapple
Mango
Strawberry
Tropical Four 

Parking is really tough around this area. Don't count on sitting, count on eating while you head back to your car.
author: Eric E.

description: This is how you know an ice cream place is good: One time I came here on a rainy night and still had to wait for nearly 10 minutes to get some creamy delights.  This is San Francisco tradition, right here! The candy cane flavor during Christmas is SO GOOD.
author: Britt B.

description: This is hands down the best ice cream in San Francisco! My family's been coming here for over 40 years. I had wonderful memories coming here as a child and am now creating new great memories here with my children. The flavors are delicious with fresh ingredients. The ice cream is rich and creamy, never icy and very moderately priced. Our favorite flavors are: mango, mocha fudge, dulce de leche, vanilla, cookies and cream, toasted almond, coconut, grasshopper and kahlua. I hope one day they make mocha fudge with Oreos (hint hint). They even have many traditional Filipino and tropical flavors which reflect the diversity of the neighborhood and adds to the unique qualities of this great ice cream parlor.
author: Natalia B.

description: My fav ice cream place in sf!! I love this place! I love their espresso toffee crunch ice cream flavor which is only available during summer :-( but I also love their traditional flavors as well, few of my favorite are coffee, dulce de leche, Thai ice and mocha almond fudge.. Today I got my mocha almond fudge in a waffle cone!! It was a very nice night in sf, and after my terrible food experience I needed something to change my mood and what better way to do that than to have my ice cream? :-)
author: Rikki S.

description:
The World According to Noelle
~Allergic Girl's Guide to Life~
Issue 213

                                                       Noe in the Noe Valley 

                                                        A NOE FAVORITE : )

                                                          5 YELP STARS!


Mitchell's is a San Francisco institution among local ice cream followers. Mitchell's Dairy Farm was established in 1891 in San Francisco. In the summer of 1953 on the 6th of June, brothers Larry and Jack Mitchell opened Mitchell's Ice Cream shop at San Jose Avenue and 29th Street. Its still family owned and operated by Larry Mitchell (see website- there is a photo of Larry, his wife Linda and son Brian). I love that they make their ice cream daily- so you know its fresh. The also import fruit from the Philippines to make their tropical flavor ice cream. 

Tropical Flavors
Avocado, Buko (Baby Coconut), Coconut Pineapple, *Ginger (November through April), Green Tea, Halo Halo (Buko, Langka, Ube, Pineapple, Mongo & Sweet Beans), Langka (also known as Jackfruit, a relative of the Fig), Lychee, Macapuno (Sweet Coconut), Mango, Thai Tea, Tropical Four (Banana, Guava, Mango & Pineapple), Ube (Purple Yam).

*Seasonal

After dinner he asked if I wanted to get a scoop of my beloved Salted Caramel or Honey Lavender from the Bi-Rite Creamery. I smiled and said I wanted to try something different tonight. So we headed to Mitchell's. He had the Macapuno and Ube. I had the Salted Praline and Peppermint. The ice cream was heavenly- rich, creamy and delicious. Originally he wanted the Halo-Halo ice cream but they ran out. The shop is cozy- no where to eat inside. If you want to sit outside there are benches in front of the ice cream shop. We took our ice cream to go as it was too chilly to eat ice cream outside tonight. The balmy California nights are gone and chilly fall nights are here! After a delicious dinner and now dessert, I was officially in food coma.

Noelle's Notes
Allergy Friendly, Noelle Approved.
Helpful and friendly staff.
Delightfully decadent ice cream!

Noelle's Post Secret
Mmmm, Macapuno ice cream- love at first lick!
author: Noelle J.

description: Family owned! Killer bulk containers  (strawberries and cream is my favorite). Don't miss the egg nog drink at the holidays!
author: Harold H.

description: Simply the best Ice cream in San Francisco, I recommend you stop bye this summer and treat yourselves you will not be disappointed.
author: marcus l.

description:
I love ice-cream! I'm always craving something sweet after dinner. That's why my boyfriend and I decided to come here on a Friday night. 

We came at a perfect time (around 7:30PM) because there were a lot of parking spaces available in the back of the shop. When we came back out 15 minutes later the lot was full of cars. 

Because there were not too many people there, we decided to try a few flavors. We already knew that we wanted a 1/2 gallon of Grasshopper Pie (mint ice-cream with lots of fudge, oreo cookies and chocolate chunks). The staff was really nice and let us try a lot of flavors. Usually ice-cream shops will frown upon that sort of practice. 

Flavors that I have tried:

* Grasshopper Pie - as described above. This is one of my favorite ice-cream flavors ever! I actually enjoy it more than the Ben & Jerry's version because Mitchell's actually puts a LOT of fudge, huge oreo cookies, and chocolate chunks so you never run out. 

* Chocolate Caramel Crackle - my new discovery! It's really chocolate-y with caramel swirls and Crunch-type of chocolate 

* Avocado - eh. I don't really like weird-flavored ice-cream.

* French Vanilla Custard - a really creamy version of French vanilla. I enjoyed it. 

*Tropical 4 - a mixture of guava, mango, pineapple & banana. You could actually really taste all four flavors, but not at once. As my boyfriend described it, "You taste the guava first and then all of a sudden the mango comes out of no where. And then the pineapple hits you and you taste remanents of banana here and there"

Overall, a great ice-cream shop that has non-traditional flavors. I only mark it down my one more star because they don't have CRAZY, original flavors that Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe might. I wish they would come up with a Jasmine Tea ice-cream or sorbet. Yum!!
author: Stephanie L.

description: While I was visiting SF, went there at the suggestion of friends. Quite good, but does not compare favorably to Bi-Rite.  Its more dense/less "airy" than Bi-Rite ice cream, and the flavors are also not as interesting.
author: Ayan R.

description:
Mmmm...I love Mitchell's. I love it so much I always let Mitchell Buko in my mouth.

Buko = Baby Coconut, you sickos.

On the real, this place is definitely worth the time. Just grab a ticket and hang out by their freezers with the pre-packed 1/2 gallons. But be careful, if you wait too long by these freezers you will end up getting suckered into going home with a double scoop of ice cream AND a 1/2 gallon of Buko...like I did...
author: Lisa T.

description:
YUM.  i love that mitchell's has so many flavors and some of them are more ethnic and delicious.  i especially love the filipino flavors- the ube is awesome but i think the real star is the buko ice cream.  YUM.  

They also let you sample stuff first so i tried a lot of their flavors and they were all really good.  i ended up getting the chocolate crackle and really liked it.

prices are good and service is friendly.  definitely coming back here.
author: Lisa C.

description:
Sorry guys. Did not like the icecream. I felt like eating a boxed ice cream at home.

Here are reasons why.
1) The ice cream is very hard. (May be because of the rush, you had to replace icecream very frequently and it is not the perfect temperature to serve it)
Take a look at cold stone creamery. It serves a perfect texture of hardness.

2) The Almond topping is very dry. Would have liked if there was hot chocolate fudge topping
author: Kumar G.

description:
Lucuma. One of the few places in SF that serve my favorite lucuma ice cream. I was too full otherwise I would have gotten the Ube (which they're also famous for) also. The lucuma was so delish though. Perfect amount of texture from the fruit with it's naturally nutty maple-like flavor. LOVES. 

Next time: Ube!
author: Constance C.

description:
The ice cream wars of the Bay Area can result in some heated arguments. In fact, they can create invisible lines between the fam bam and I. My SF and DC cousins swear by Mitchell's, I am true to Tucker's being from the East Bay and when we invited my cousin's new bf to Mitchell's he jokingly said, "I know a better place in the East Bay: Ici". I busted out laughing. That warranted an immediate fist bump. I remembered my review from a few years ago. I had called Ici the Louis Vuitton of ice cream parlors.

But Mitchell's it was going to be for the evening. I had passed on a prix fixe meal and dessert at Blue Plate in order to accommodate Mitchell's. We talked about what flavors we were going to get. A year ago I had tried the Ube. It was, in fact, the best Ube flavored ice cream I had ever tasted. Mitchell's ice cream tastes incredibly fresh and they get their ingredients straight from the PI. That night I wanted Mexican Chocolate as well but the pairing just didn't fit. My brother promised that we would return again. I had been looking forward to Mexican Chocolate all year and all week long. Of course when I arrived at Mitchell's this time, it all changed. There was a menu of all new flavors and after listening to my cousins boast about Grasshopper, Chocolate Caramel Crackle and Kahlua Mocha Cream, I kind of wanted it all. But I stuck to my guns and limited myself to tasting just two flavors. Between Mexican Chocolate and Cinnamon Snap, Cinnamon Snap had won. The Mexican Chocolate is good but wasn't spicy enough for me. While the Mexican Chocolate has hints and undertones of cinnamon, the Cinnamon Snap was cinnamon all the way and the ginger snap cookies really gave it a bite and sharp flavor. It was great.

I like Mitchell's but i can't give it five stars in comparison to the other ice cream parlors out there. I dream about Bi-Rite, my face lights up when I hear about Tucker's, I take all my best friends to Cones in NY, I bow down to Ici, Humphry Slocombe is my one day ice cream parlor, and Mitchell's? It's good, maybe one of the best, but not my best.
author: Rachel A.

description: Delicious flavory i love to but my ice cream from here!! Coconut and black walnut are yummy
author: Elizabeth A.

description: I've been going here since I can remember, I love Mitchell's. This place has incredible ice cream! For whatever reason San Franciscan's disregard the weather and get ice cream on freezing cold days, and it's perfectly natural to see huge lines out the door on rainy days. Their Mexican Chocolate ice cream is to die for! This place deserves 6 stars.
author: Julian S.

description:
Friday October 8, 2010, around 10 pm, standing outside of Mitchell's Ice Cream shop 
Loud outdoor speaker - "Number 58. Now serving number 58." 
Me- "Hey man, what number are we?" 
BF- "Um......86" 
Me- "Holy Sh*t" 

I couldn't believe the amount of people that were standing out in front Mitchell's on such a cold, windy night. The sidewalk was so crowded that it looked like there was an outdoor concert going on. And what was even more surprising was all the families that were present. Even though it was ten o'clock at night there were kids of all ages patiently waiting for a scoop of Mitchell's famous ice cream. 

Mitchell's is one of the biggest ice cream parlors I have ever been too. Right when you walk in you come face to face with a gigantic display case where their ice creams are housed. Above that is a big sign listing that days flavors. I have never been to an ice cream shop that has as many daily favors as Mitchell's. I swear that they have over 40 flavors of ice cream and sorbets daily. They also have smaller display cases off to the side that contain pre-packaged quarts of many of their homemade flavors. I had driven by this place many times in my past visits to the bay area but the huge crowds always scared me away. Well, on my latest trip to SF I was determined to finally face the long wait and try some of Mitchell's famous homemade ice cream. After waiting about 30 minutes, the loud speaker finally called our number. Since it was my first visit to Mitchell's I decided to try a bunch of their flavors before I made my decision. 

This is what I sampled: 
Caramel Praline ,Rocky Road, Toasted Almond, White Pistachio, Buko (Baby Coconut), Avocado, Thai Tea, Tropical Four (Banana, Guava, Mango & Pineapple) and Pumpkin 

Every flavor I sampled was amazing. Each flavor was super creamy and really sweet but the one that stood out the most was the pumpkin. Mitchell's pumpkin ice cream is by far the best pumpkin ice cream I have ever tried. It tasted identical to a slice of pumpkin pie. 
In the end I ended up ordering a tropical sundae and a scoop of pumpkin ice cream. The tropical sundae was served in a waffle bowl and contained a scoop of Buko (baby coconut) ice cream and a scoop of their Tropical Four ice cream. Then they topped off this sundae with fresh pineapples, whipped cream, chopped nuts and a cherry. This sundae was fantastic. It was fruity, creamy and super sweet all at the time. 

The prices here are very reasonable. For my sundae and my scoop of pumpkin ice cream it only set me back around 8 or 9 dollars. 
Even though we had to wait a long time, the service was still great. At 10 o'clock at night Mitchell's had at least 8 employees working. Once it was our turn the guy who helped us was more than happy to let us sample as many flavors as we wanted. He even gave us suggestions on what to try since it was our first time there. 

If you have never been to Mitchell's than I highly recommend you do so. Their ice creams are totally worth the long waits.
author: Craig R.

description: Yumm!! My first time here today and it was delish!!! I got toasted almond and dulce de leche and OMG the two were like perfect together!! But uhh, the place is a pretty cool little spot. I like the number system thing they have going on too. Except it get's so packed and people aren't always able to get through. I LOVE all the different flavors. Ube? Halo halo? Yumm!! Oh and their staff is pretty cool too. Maybe they could smile some more... But then again the scoop ice cream for a living and they have to deal with whiney kids all day and a bunch of annoying people trying samples and yelling orders at them... Other than all of that, it was a delicious experience :)
author: Melysa T.

description:
For me, Mitchell's is more than just damn good homemade ice cream. It is reliving the hot summer days when my brother and I would take turns manually shaving ice to make halo-halo. Or remembering the excitement of those special occassions when my dad would come home with gallons of Magnolia brand ice cream (usually the mais, ube, or macapuno) after a trip out to the Filipino store in Chicago. It is absolutely MINDBLOWING to me that there's an ice cream shop located in a popular SF neighborhood, not ghettoized in a Filipino enclave...that they have flavors of the Philippines available for the masses...

...Langka/Jackfruit

...Macapuno/Coconut

...Avocado (very common Filipino ice cream flavor, it's great!)

...Buko/YOUNG Coconut (I guess the young really are the tastiest?)

....Ube/Purple Yam (my FAVORITE Filipino ice cream flavor b/c it's not too sweet and has a little savory taste to it)

...and of course, there's Halo-Halo! A shaved ice sensation, with a mixture of your choice ice cream (I say go w/ ube), various sweetened beans and jellies, evaporated milk, and crunchies! (A minor suggestion for improvement, I wish they'd shave their ice more finely).

Their other run-of-the mill pootie flavors are pretty damn good too. 

Okay, so yeah there are long lines, parking sucks...

WAH...WAH...WAH!

I say: SHUT YER TRAP, you spoiled people! Do you have any idea how much I would kill for some of that scrumptious, super creamy Filipino ice cream right now? I think if I brought this up to someone in Mpls, they'd probably be surprised that Filipinos eat ice cream.
author: Steph P.

description: This place is awesome. If you're craving Ice Cream, and you're in the area, it's a must-visit. They're famous for their tropical flavors, but the classic ones are great too. Don't sweat the line, it moves pretty quick.
author: Jonah H.

description: Yum yum! I honestly had not had an ice cream cone since I was a kid. I ordered a two scoop cone with banana and chocolate caramel crackle. The banana was so good!!! There are so many flavors to choose from. Hopefully next time I'll be a bit braver and order something more daring.
author: Sasha S.

description: This was my 1st time here. The ice cream was great. I had a double kid's scoop - cantaloupe, & Mexican chocolate, and booth were good. The service was fast. They allowed me to try several flavors. The line was minimal, as opposed to Bi-Rite, which is too long. Most flavors are eggless.
author: Mihir M.

description:
Why does Mitchell's have some many reviews?  Cause it's so stinking good!  

This city is full of fancy pants ice cream: Bi-Rite, Humphrey Slocombe, Mr. & Mrs. Misc.  They all have their fancy, hipster, more-ironic-than-thou flavors.  And all of them are really good. But Mitchell's keeps right up there with them without ever bending to trendy.

Mitchell's specialty is fruit flavored ice creams but, their regular flavors are also great.  Try Tropical Four flavor with a chocolate dip.  It's the bomb.

Oh... do you also like lines?  Cause Mitchell's has them.  From 11 AM to 11 PM every day.  Get a ticket and stand around... it's worth it.
author: Ivan L.

description: Love the ice cream.  Hate the long line.
author: Subrosa I.

description:
I SCREAM for Ice Cream!!!

#1 Favorite ~ Pistachio (Pistachio ice cream with California pistachios) ice cream

#2' Favorites
New York Cherry (Cherry ice cream with Maraschino cherries)
Dulce de Leche (Caramel ice cream with caramel swirls)

Yes, I live in the East Bay and drive here for Ice Cream always taking home a half-gallon (smile).

Customer service is Great ~ friendly and fast!!!
author: Margot S.

description: BEST ice cream! Love going here. Worth the wait and money. WORSE parking ever but still 5 stars bc ice cream is yummmmy!
author: Kimberly H.

description: Pretty darn good! Now I know why there is a line out the door! I had the grasshopper pie & some coffee ice cream pie (I forgot what it was called) & they were both delicious! The coffee ice cream had a nice strong flavor. My friend took me there for the first time or so I thought...come to find out my Mom had taken me there when I was little. Love at first bite!
author: Alessandra G.

description:
Yesterday was the 2nd time going since their renovation and I really like it! The renovation that is. The ice cream, I LOVE IT! The renovation allows you to actually SEE the ice cream now. They lowered the counters and got rid of those phony "windows". The line was out the door as usual but it moved quickly. My tried and true flavor is mango but I ventured yesterday and had langka (jackfruit) YUM!!

While we were sitting in the parking lot finishing our ice creams and enjoying the lovely spring weather my mom said our family has been coming here since the 60s. Like WHOAH, thats even before I entered this world. No wonder we love it so much!
author: Dina V.

description: Mitchell's mango and ube ice cream were such treats growing up.  I took my daughter here recently.  All she could say was, "best ice cream ever!"  She LOVED the banana ice cream, and paired it with the peanut butter indulgence in a waffle cone.  It was as big as she was!  Ok, not really but it was A LOT of ice cream and oh so YUM!  I had my favorite: halo halo.  Only Mitchell's knows how to do halo halo right. We heart Mitchell's!!
author: Claudine D.

description: I highly recommend their ice cream to anyone, Just thinking about this place gets me hungry for dessert. They have a ton of exotic flavors to choose from, not to mention that their ice cream sandwich is amazing at $3.00. It almost better to just get the ice cream in the cookie.Its cheaper that way for those working with cream's budget of $2.50.
author: Phoebe B.

description:
S W E E T     D R E A M S


My sweetie and I met up later on Sunday after I had been been out at Pacifica enjoying the warm black sand against my legs and supervising the puparoo digging holes along the beach.  Since we were not up for dessert on Friday evening and had bypassed my earlier inclinations for Ti Couz and their super yummy Nutella and Bananas Crepe (my personal fave) an ice cream date now seemed the right thing to do.

We alighted upon the revered place of iced dairy dreams and whimsical wishes to find it surrounded by an impenetrable horde of people (think the scene at Helm's Deep with all the Urukai and helmeted goblins in mass at the entrance) and one of the bystanders pointed out that we had to pick a number tag located inside.  Ah, thank you for order!

#36 (or something around here)

They were on # 70-something or another.  Which meant they had several to hit before hitting the #100 before starting all over again. But when one has to wait while the other someone is giving them a back massage, I will not complain about waiting in line.  And it helps when you get to lean into them for support  ;o)

The same gentleman who had pointed out the order number tag out to us came and whispered to us:

"I'll give you my number," he motioned to his tag, which housed the awesome full house equivalent = 15.  "I've got a closer number, so I'll give you mine."

Wow.  Talk about luck and pure kindness.  We thanked him and probably cut our waiting time by another 15 minutes.

They have a variety of flavors ranging from classic Vanilla and Chocolate and Strawberry to more interesting such as Strawberry Basil and Avocado and Ube (purple yam root), Jackfruit, Lychee and Halo Halo (they fly in their fruits from the Philippines). Since I'm classic with a twist, I ordered the White Pistachio with a scoop of Strawberry.  I like the twist of pure creamy Vanilla indulgence with the gourmet nuts of pistachio dotted heavily throughout, made lighter with something fruity (they were out of the Red Raspberry Sorbet).  Added these two scoops on top of a waffle cone and I was in high heaven.

The ice cream here has an intensely high dairy content, which means every lick will afford you potential danger of spiking sugar and cream levels in your body while your diastolic/systolic levels attempt to level themselves out.  My White Pistachio scoop had whole pistachio nuts dotted through out, no little chunks or slivers..a floating paradise of dense roasted nut Vanilla base.  My Strawberry was a fruity cream experience, except that I did not come across any of the fruit hanging around.  Maybe I ordered it naked.  Regardless, it was smooth, creamy......and walking around the area, flashing waiting cars at the lights with my two scoops of indulgence, lavishing indeed.

Two scoops = $4.82 or something of that nature.  Add on another 50 cents for the waffle cone (highly recommendable!)

I'm bad with numbers today.  My head hurts from ice cream hangover.
author: Miika M.

description: LUCUMA ice cream! This is the only ice cream place that sells the delicious Peruvian ice cream. My mom and I bought a tub to bring home to the family. Best part was we didn't have to wait. My grandparents finally got to relive their childhood that night:)
author: Catherine S.

description:
It was sunny today, and I'm still recovering from being sick. I drop my mom off in the Mission and take San Jose to get home. 

As I'm driving, I'm like. WAIT! Mitchells is around here! I hope theres not a line (it was 11am). I parked in their mini lot, walked in, and there was no one! Yes! Bought an oreo cookie ice cream cone with sprinkles. 

I wish I remembered to take a picture! Darn, next time I guess. It was so awesome!
author: Sophia G.

description:
Recently stopped by on my 2nd visit to Mitchell's in the past 6 months... as always, a 30 minute wait for a scoop of ice cream. It's a bit insane the wait time. At least this time around I was with a group of 6, so it seemed more worth the wait.

While waiting, we were surveying what others were enjoying. It required my boyfriend asking, but we found a new winner!!! 

2 scoops on a waffle cone: Toasted Almond & Macapuno (sweet coconut)...... wait for it.... wait for it.... dipped in chocolate!!!!

Wow!!! Glad we asked, because that man had a winning combination. I don't normally consider myself to be a huge fan of coconut ice cream, but this was rich and had good texture... I want to say it was almost like a frozen Mounds bar (or Almond Joy I guess, if you consider the Toasted Almond!).
author: Katy S.

description:
Mitchell's is truly a San Francisco landmark. I've been going here for years but I am always discovering a delicious new flavor. I've always had a soft spot for Toasted Almond and Caramel Praline. Now, I'm onto the tropical flavors like Lucuma (a Peruvian fruit which I must try fresh one day) and Halo Halo (I was hesitant with the purple coloring at first but was delightfully surprised how tasty it was).
 
Be prepared to wait when you come here, especially on a Friday/Saturday night. It's packed like a nightclub on the weekends. I usually just go in and get a pre-packed half gallon of ice cream. There's an express line for those orders so you can bypass the long line and get in and out within 5 minutes.
author: Chi N.

description:
Mitchell's is reminiscent of a post office, or a DMV (ahhh the terror!), only about a hundred times more fun! Like at government buildings, there is a very long "line" (more like a herd) of people of various demographics. Once you enter, you grab a number and wait for someone to call it from one of the several service windows. There is even a little flashing light that reads, "Now servicing [insert number]."

This is probably the most spiffy ice cream parlor I've been to. Watching the numbers get closer and closer to mine really just built up my excitement. There were a lottt of flavors, including a separate list of Tropical Filipino flavors (Ube, Halo-halo, Macapuno, etc). Honestly, I wanted to sample everything, but limited it to Thai Tea, Ube, and the Flavor of the Month--Cantaloupe. All were delicious and service was very friendly. 

One scoop is almost $3, and two scoops is nearly $5. I asked if I could combine flavors in a scoop, but alas--it is not possible. Instead though, she gave me "baby scoops" of the flavors I wanted, Ube and Thai Tea. This turned out to be a very satisfying amount of ice cream. Not sure how much it costs as my Dessert-Devouring Darling treated me. Mitchell's Ice Cream is on the rich side--quite dense and incredibly creamy. The Thai Tea is a must try--it has the most exquisite taste--like tea combined with a splash of rum, which is excellent for me because I happen to love rum ice cream.

As for parking, Mitchell's has a little parking lot in the back...another option would be to buy something at the nearby Safeway and walk over to Mitchell's! Minus points for the long wait (15 minutes on a Saturday afternoon, perhaps?) and for the extremely limited seating (a bench)...but definitely a must-try!
author: K W.

description:
When asking someone who knows SF about  Mitchell's, you get one of two answers: ice cream or strip joint.  This review is obviously about the former.  The latter is reserved for later.

Flavors are exotic and delicious.

Parking can get really interesting on a hot day.

Sometimes there's a line out the door, but it moves quickly.

A must visit for locals and tourists.
author: Dan B.

description:
Oh BUKO BUKO BUKO!!! 
Whether coconut is a fruit, nut, seed, or all of the above, it does not matter!  Delicious is what it is and BUKO is one of the best coconut ice cream I ever had! Lick lick
author: Diana N.

description:
For me, this is by far, the best ice cream evaaaar!

Love the Ube (purple yam) and Mango flavors.  I still wish they have cheese flavored ice cream.
author: Eralyn S.

description:
Definitely a fan!!!
Come in, grab a number, and expect to wait quite awhile before they call you. While, youre waiting, check out their wide array of ice cream and cookie treats. Many people get pints and extra to bring home. Trust me, you won't be disappointed with whichever choice you choose. 

I got a pistachio cone while the boyfriend got a sundae. I think the total was about $11.
author: CHI H.

description:
Hail Noe Valley. 

If you want the best, no need to hit up those new trendy gentrified mission ice creameries. Get that old school Mitchell's. I can't even pick my favorite flavor because I love them all. I like to rotate between anything with chocolate, namely rocky road, cantelope, and green tea!!

When I think of Mitchell's I think of SF. I should hope most SF natives have some good childhood memories of this place as well. 

If you come on a warm day/night, be prepared to find no parking in the tiny lot, and to wait for a while in line. Don't worry, it's so worth it!! So bi-rite has got some fancy schmancy stuff going on...well, they ain't classic like Mitchell's is. 

My Grandpa still goes here. If it's good enough for him, it's good enough for you!

btw ( This is my 50th review! AWOOOO!)
author: Nicole K.

description: The best ice cream in the world!  Their tropical fruit flavors are especially good. The wait in line is well worth the reward of their rich
author: Brian M.

description:
No question - Mitchell's has the best ice cream in the city! It is a must-do for anyone new to SF or visiting from out of town. That said, the lines can get a bit unruly so be prepared to wait...and wait...The staff is really friendly, which is great, but I sometimes think patrons take advantage of this. They'll let you try as many flavors as you want, which is great when you're getting served, but annoying when your still 15 numbers from being called. Granted, I'm not the most patient person, but someone should do a better job of moving things along (servers or patrons)...

The ice cream is truly divine. Cookies n Cream, Rocky Road, Dulce de Leche, Mexican Chocoate, Butterscotch something and Praline something are all heavenly. I don't even have a sweet tooth, but on the rare occasion I do want a sweet, I can never go wrong with Mitchell's. Oh and the seasonal Pumpkin flavored ice cream makes me wish it were Halloween all year round!
author: Paul S.

description: Whatever flavor you get, you NEED to get it in a cone with the magical dipped chocolate shell. This ice cream is stellar and the shell puts it over the top. Also: I recommend visiting on a weekday. The line is often out the door but we went on a weekday afternoon and walked right up to the counter!
author: Chelsey C.

description:
I wasn't sure what to expect when I came here.  The boyfriend and I just moved here from Seattle and there's this ice cream shop that everyone in Seattle loves and we don't understand the hype at all.  We were expecting that with Mitchells as well.  We heard the same thing we heard about the Seattle place "omg, you have to try it.  It's the best ice cream EVER."

We happened to be in the neighborhood and longing for a dessert, so we decided to give it a go and see if it was really good.  We got there and we saw a line and thought, "great, another line like that place in Seattle, and it'll probably not be worth it."  Then we realized you're actually getting a number and just waiting for your number to be called...way more streamlined than making us wait in a line like at that other place.  +1 for Mitchells.  It was finally our turn to order and I got the chocolate crinkle crunch and the boyfriend got the grasshopper mint.  +2 for Mitchells.

Ok, Mitchells, let me join the bandwagon and tell everyone how great you are.  You've thoroughly proved me wrong that you can have a popular ice cream shop somewhere and be more than just the hype.
author: Quynh-An P.

description: Mitchell's ice cream is the place to go whether it's hot or cold. Seriously it is amazing and everybody must try it!! There's a lot of flavors but you can always ask for samples before you go ahead and chose one. My only recommendation is that they either open another Mitchell's or find a larger space because it gets really busy! Props to all the staff there!!
author: Marlo M.

description: They have tons of flavors, but the Mexican Chocolate is my favorite--so delicious and rich.  Take a number as soon as you get there, and if it is too crowded inside, you can wait outside and they will call your number over the loud speaker. My only complaint is that in all the times I have been here--which is a ton since I used to live a block away--the service is never warm and friendly, instead usually slow, distracted, and blah.  Would be nice to see someone smile who works there!
author: Natalia K.

description: Love the ice creams here. The line can be long. Worst case just get the gallon of Mango ice cream - you won't go wrong with that!
author: Anwar H.

description:
Mitchell's is one of my earliest memories of San Francisco. Always inventive flavors keep me coming back. Love the mango. And while there are few hots days on which to patronize this lovely shop, the stuff's so good you'd be willing to bundle up just to go get their ice cream.

My favorite thing to get is the ice cream sandwich- any flavor between two chocolate chip cookies. Divine!
author: Miriam W.

description:
until I tried the ube flavor, I didn't know why this shop was packed and lined up all the time.  Ever since my ube ice cream experience, I'm convinced that this one is the best in town.  

Now, I feel really safe to explore all the exotic tastes :)
author: E P.

description: If you wanna go tropical & experience heavenly flavors from the islands try Ube, halo halo.  Oh better yet, ube macapuno! Its rich, distinct ube taste w/ bits of sweef chunks of soft coconut.  Unlike any other ice cream place.
author: Liza Q.

description:
I love ice cream! I had cookies n' cream and the bf had claire's pie.

Cookie n' cream wasn't too special. Tasted like many other one's I've had. His claire's pie was very coffee-flavored, strong but good. I would say that the flavors we had weren't must-try's. I guess we should have gotten more unique flavors. But overall, I wasn't too excited about the ice cream here. Parking was also horrible; their small parking lot in the back and very little street parking available.
author: Katherine L.

description: Im not a huge vanilla guy but there vanilla custard is OUT OF THIS WORLD. If you were to ask me if this place was better than bi-rite I would not hesitate to say YES.
author: augustine x.

description:
I rarely give out ratings of 5 stars but this place definitely deserves it. Their ice cream is so good, and they have fun flavors. 

My two all time favorites if I absolutely had to choose would be toasted almond and white pistachio. Both are so rich and creamy and they come in the big tub. hehe. 
If you're about to head home after visiting Mitchell's, I suggest shelling a few extra and just bring the big tub of ice cream home instead of waiting for your number to be called. It's a lot more worth it, and you can enjoy it in the comfort of your own home. 

I've only ordered a scoop once because there was nobody there as it was a Tuesday evening right before they were closing. I ordered a scoop of toasted almond and the girl gave me a lot more than a scoop. Can't complain about extra ice cream. Also, this ice cream doesn't melt as quickly as others. Usually when I have ice cream, by the time I get close to the bottom, a lot will have already melted. But it was not the case this time. Or maybe it was just really cold outside and that's why it didn't melt as quickly. 

One downside is parking can be a pain when it's a hot summer night, or just one of those busier weekends. They have a lot, but it's fairly small. If you're coming on a warmer evening, be prepared to possibly have to circle around the block a couple times to look for parking. But this place is definitely worth the extra circling.
author: Annie W.

description: The best ice cream in San Francisco! I hate waiting in line though... and you WILL wait in line. It's worth it though.
author: Chase L.

description: Had the grasshopper pie flavor - really yummy. This is probably one of my favorite ice cream shops for unique, creative flavors.
author: S T.

description: This place may look really crazy from the outside when you see the long lines but it actually moves pretty fast. A useful tip for those who never been here before, you have to get a number and they call out your number when it's your turn to order. Lucky I went with a friend who's been here before because among the crowd, I would never know you had to get a number! So I finally got to try the ice cream without having to buy a whole tub at the supermarket and I got the tropical flavor and it's super creamy and delicious. I would definitely come here again to try the other flavors.
author: Nancy L.

description: YUM. Came back up to SF for the weekend and went ice cream shop hopping with my friends. This is one of the best. So many flavors! Will be back to try the rest!
author: Sophie P.

description:
Listen yo- The Prince of Taiwan is lactose intolerant, like most of his people. That means whenever I eat anything with dairy in it, my stomach is more upset than a broke man at a strip joint. But the ice cream Gods were calling, and I had to follow them into the light.

Went here on a hot friday night, and hole moley all the SF Hipsters were out in full force. Waited 30 minutes until my number was called. I ordered the Mex chocolate and the Toasted Almond, popped my lactaid pills, and devoured the treat. Damn it was good. Wont be back for a little bit, as my stomach,even with the lactaid support, could barely handle it. But like my crazy japanese friends who eat Blowfish, this is my danger zone baby!!!
author: Jerry C.

description:
Been coming here since I arrived in the US in 1969.  The place hasn't changed much since I first started coming here. It's still in the same old location and there's always a line out the door.

I love their tropical flavors Mango, Macapuno, Buko, Lychee, Avocado, etc.  Sure there are other brands that offer similar flavors but none of them make it as creamy and flavorful as Mitchell's.

Next time it rains in town....go see for yourself...there will be aline out the door!

Enjoy the ice cream!  Remember the good times, create new good times!
author: Ashley C.

description: The first thing that comes to mind when I come to Mitchell's is: Thank God I'm not at Bi-Rite. I just want some good old-fashioned ice cream without foodies and pretentious ice cream snobs talking about how fresh shit is and how they flew in the honey from Tahiti and crap like that. Ok, this review should be about Mitchell's and not a diss on Bi-rite. I love their sundaes and love the fact that they have fresh fruit toppings on hand (pineapple and mango). The line usually isn't insane and while a bit on the pricey side $5/$6 I never think twice about it because it's what ice cream should be. Conveniently located a block away from Mission. This is the best ice cream in San Francisco.
author: Carlos A.

description:
It's not bad, but there is nothing exceptional about it either. They have lots of flavors, but really nothing out of the ordinary considering we are in the Bay Area. 

Would rather go to Bi-Rite or Marco Polo.
author: July N.

description: Grab a number and get in line!  Can't believe it was my first time here just this year.  There is a small parking lot in the back (but of course it was backed up b/c this place was packed).  The baby coconut is so yummy!  Ended up buying a pint (which is almost the same price as buying two scoops of ice cream).  Best idea ever!  Then I can have Mitchell's whenever I want :)
author: Chantal T.

description:
Mexican Chocolate, is all I have to say! That and long lines! Long lines in the warm months (anytime but May, June or July, when it's cooold outside!).

Mitchell's is the best ice cream in the city. It's also not bad for parking since it's in outer Mission (at 29th and San Jose, which is what Guerrero turns into way down there!). I got a gift card to Mitchell's for my birthday one year, and it was the best birthday present ever.
author: Heather S.

description:
I wanted to check out all the craze over Mitchell's Ice Cream, so I decided to venture out from the Richmond district.

The ice cream was pretty good - I can see why it's so crowded and busy. We got the butterscotch marble, Claire's Pie, and cookies&cream. We weren't particularly wow'ed by any of these flavors, so maybe perhaps we might try something more "exotic" next time we're in the area - I really don't think it's worth the long drive out and the crazy street-parking... 

They have a call-number system, so I guess the advantage to that is that you're able to look at the menu and decide what you want while waiting for your number to be called. Don't let the crowd intimidation get to you! The wait isn't too long, unless you're unfortunate enough to come at an exact moment where they're serving people who want a bajillion samples and can't decide what they want...

Note: they only accept credit card for orders $9.00 and up.
author: Charmian W.

description:
It's deemed the best ice cream in the city, and it is because of the vast selection of flavors! The first time I went I was so mesmerized by how many flavors they offered. They have great tropical and fruity flavors on one side and more rich flavors on the other.  I just had their crunchy coffee and it was probably the best coffee ice cream i have ever had. 

I would say the quality is not the best ice cream ( birite still wins in my book), but the best selection for sure!
author: Katie D.

description:
I stopped by Mitchell's Ice Cream on a rainy winter day, and it was still packed with people.  Upon arrival, we promptly grabbed a number and got in line.  It was at least 20 minutes before we were called to the front, but it gave us ample time to decide which of rich and creamy flavors we wanted.

Before leaving, we also grabbed 1/2 gallon of Green Tea flavor.  My wife finished that in 3 days, haha. 

Tips:
 - Be sure to get a number, there seems to be a line in front of the counter, but that doesn't count.  

 - If you just want to get 1/2 gallon, there is an express line for that.  We don't have get a number for that.

 - 1/2 gallon is generally a better deal.

Overall:
 - I will definitely go back!  It's probably the best ice cream I've ever had in the Bay Area!  The price point is very reasonable for the quality of ice cream.
author: Johnny G.

description:
Close to 900 reviews and averaging 4.5 stars!!!!!

You've got to take it into consideration that this place ROCKS! Their Ice Cream is so good, it tastes creamy and homemade. My mouth is watering just thinking about it. 

We all got the following: Macapuno, Mango and Ube! The mango is terrific!

PS you'll need to take a number, it's that busy!
author: Irma E.

description:
hey everyone,

if you like delicious ice cream, visit mitchell's you will never go anywhere else , thats how good it is, if the line is always long and is always packed.
author: Jorge M.

description:
YUMMY, CREAMY, GOODNESS!!

GRASSHOPPER PIE IS TO DIE FOR!

Came here around 12AM on a Friday because Bi-Rite was closed BUT i'm soooo glad I did! There was still quite a few people during midnight, surprisingly. Everything looked so good!
