If only I was in the city more often and didn't live ~50 miles away, i'd totally come back and try the other flavors. I'm craving ice cream as we speak!! Oh man..I'm definitely coming back when I am in SF again!

Only downside is the price. Kind of equivalent to Baskin Robbins though. I'd choose this place over BR anyday!!! $_$
author: Jenny Y.

description: Absolutely wonderful ice cream!!!  My hubby got the young coconut and it was creamy & sweet! I got the horchata flavor which was super yummy!  Their ice cream is so creamy and they have fun flavors.  I want to go back one more time before we leave SF.
author: Hilary L.

description: I didn't know what ice cream was until I had my first trip to heaven on earth: Mitchell's Ice Cream.  My absolute favorites are Macapuno (baby coconut) and Mexican Chocolate.  Now when you go, don't be shy--the trick is to shimmy your way inside (and it's *always* packed) and get yourself a deli number.  Then sit back, and ponder your selection, there's plenty to choose from.  They're so fast, by the time you finally decide, it'll be your turn.  And don't for a second believe anyone who gives Mitchell's less than five stars--must be something wrong with their taste buds!
author: Cassidy P.

description:
I am not the kind of guy who eats ice cream on a regular basis since it doesn't meet my fitness goals to do so but that  actually makes me an even more discerning critic of ice cream. Mitchell's Ice Cream is, in a word, awesome!
I will not waste calories on inferior ice cream and Mitchell's never lets me down.
I am a chocolate fanatic and the Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream is absolutely perfect.
My family has enjoyed a wide variety of the flavors and everyone agrees that the tropical flavors are unique and bursting with surprising flavor.
Just give yourself a bit more time to choose from a great menu and probably to wait in line.
It IS worth it
author: Zo D.

description: This place has as nice old fashion set up to it. You take a number and you wait your turn for someone to serve you. The ice cream here tastes more of an old fashion style than something like Bi-rite. It really depends what you are in the mood for when picking between those two places in SF. I personally prefer Bi-rite over Mitchell's but that does not mean I would be opposed to going here.
author: Spencer E.

description:
I know it seems like I only write 5 star reviews, but I only go to places that are highly rated on Yelp! 

Once again, another gem from SF. Purple Yam, Young Coconut, Mexican Chocolate (cinnamon!), Thin Mint - this place is heaven. 

Don't forget to take a number as soon as you get in (to the left of the door), because you'll quickly become absorbed in picking the perfect two flavor waffle cone to realize that people keep coming in, but you're not getting served! 

Come hungry and come often. Thats all I have to say.

P.S. THEY HAVE PARKING!
author: Lindsay J.

description:
Get a ticket and prepare to wait. 

Although Mitchell's has decent hits with the typical ice cream flavors, it's the exotic tropical flavors that bring a more diverse crowd to their doors. Flavors are simple and they don't need to jump through hoops to attract the crowd. 

One tip is that their small milkshake is more than enough for one person.

Their ice cream is creamy and not icy like what you would get from cheap quality or poor refrigeration. 

There is parking lot is located in the back and can get packed quickly. Evening hours typically mean parking a few blocks away and walking unless you're lucky. 

There is an express line for those who want to pick up prepackage items for those in a hurry to bring home some ice cream.
author: Casey L.

description:
Unlike a certain self entitled FOODIE, Néné B., I don't pride myself in being a snobby pretentious waste of space.

Ok. This place has been a family haunt for as far as I remember. Best Ice cream I have ever tried, It's It being in Second place. Mango flavor tho!

Go try for yourself, just don't yelp how your tastes are far superior than others. You are nobody.
author: Amadeo S.

description:
So.... the Buko (young coconut) and the Spumoni are wonderful.  The Buko, is special and delish.  It's milky and creamy, coconutty in the perfect subtle way.  It's the perfect coconut ice cream.  I love Spumoni, and Mitchell's has a classic Spumoni. 

I have to say... that I think Mitchell's is the best ice cream shop in the city... if you haven't had the chance to go, you definitely should!!!!
author: Lani N.

description:
One of the best ice spots in the city. If you are a purist when it comes to ice cream, Mitchell's is the place for you. The have a few different flavors that branch out of the traditional flavors but overall it is most of the typical flavors you expect from an ice cream shop. The line for here can get pretty busy which is why they have their own parking lot and supermarket ticket number to figure out the line. 

I have tried many different types of flavors here and the ice cream cakes. Have not been disappointed yet! They actually make the ice cream there, and it is good!
author: Elliot T.

description:
If you want magic, mood-boosting deliciousness, go to Mitchell's Ice Cream, but be prepared to take number, wait your turn, and plunk down a small fortune.

My friend and I were really lucky because we got there right before a HUGE rush of people showed up.  There were so many choices between the scoops, cones, and shakes, let alone all the ice creams. They have unusual flavors like Purple Yam and Jackfruit.  They're great about giving samples, so I tried the Young Coconut and Halo Halo. Their ice cream is delicious - rich, creamy, flavorful and with great texture!

As soon as I got my order, I greedily dove into my 2 generous scoops of Coconut Pineapple ice cream ($4.85) and now I'm sad that it's all gone. I would've licked the bowl if there were anything left since I scraped it all up using my biodegradable spoon.  Next time, I'll get a gallon because that way, I could get into the express line.  Although, this ice cream is worth it's wait / weight.  Pardon the pun.
author: vira k.

description: I am a local San Franciscan and have been coming here since I was allowed to eat ice cream aka 23 years! I love Mitchell's. They recently started playing music and I think it's awesome! Def helps when you're waiting forever for the best ice cream ever! (Especially since sometimes you wait a while!)
author: Olivia R.

description:
I'm Filipino. I love Ube and Halo Halo. I mean... come on, now! It's a huge staple in the Filipino culture! With that said, Mitchell's Ice Cream is ridiculously good. I tried multiple flavors and they were all amazing! 

Ube was A+
Mango was delicious
Halo Halo was flavorful
White Pistachio was nutty
Peach was fruity!

One star off for their Halo Halo, not their Halo Halo ice cream. I've had better and the ice was too chunky.

There was a line when I went but it went by fairly fast. I waited ~20-25 minutes and ordered 3-4 cones... definitely worth the wait.
author: Kathleen R.

description: I have been going to Mitchell's since the first day it opened in 1953. I was just a kid then but I watched Mitchell's get better and better until recently.  Had always been my favorite place for ice-cream. The last few times the ice cream in the cone was too soft. The ice creme starts dripping on your hand immediately . I keep hoping that it will change. It hasn't. No more Mitchell's for me or my friends after 61 years of going there.
author: Fleming, A.

description:
Mitchell's Mitchell's Mitchell's...

So growing up in So Cal, this kind of brings back memories when I'm going to Seafood City and grabbing a pint of Mango Ice Cream, Ube Ice Cream, Macapuno Ice Cream, whatever Ice Cream your heart desires and then your traditional ice cream of choice, but what I'm a sucker for and always get is the Ice Cream Cookie Sandwich...

2 cookies and ice cream in the center to satisfy my sugar tooth.

Thank you Mitchell's Ice Cream.... Mahal Na Mahal Kita.
author: Edrian D.

description:
Best Ice Cream in the city.
Great selection of flavors, including tasty originals that don't have to get gimmicky.

Ube (purple yam) is so good. You must try it.
It can get crowded, but don't let that discourage you. Just try to avoid peak hours.
author: Dan S.

description: No matter what time of day you go to Mitchell's, there could be a line out the door. But the wait is definitely worth it. The servers are friendly and efficient, which is great given the fact that you often my have to wait to order. There is a large variety of flavors and as much as I would like to eventually try them all, I usually end up with one of my go-to favorites: avocado or dulce de leche. The ice cream is fresh, creamy, smooth and delicious - all wonderful attributes that keep me coming back again and again.
author: Japs C.

description:
I scream for Ice creammmmmm!

Tucked away in a quaint neighborhood of SF, Mitchell's is like a needle in a haystack.  Being Filipino-American, I grew up with atypical ice cream flavors like ube (taro), buko (coconut), and langka (jackfruit).  I felt right at home at this local creamery.  All bias set aside, I enjoyed my first experience because the wait was not ridiculously long for a Saturday afternoon.  Not to mention, the prices are reasonable and service was fast.

The one distinct flavor I liked is their tropical fruit, which is an amalgam of guava, pineapple, banana, and mango.  Sample their flavors if you must.  You won't find many of these flavors at most ice cream shops.

After you get your ice cream, stroll through the neighborhood as you revel in the happiness of your ice cream.

Also, they have a private parking lot in the back.  Otherwise, you'll have to find street parking.
author: Albert A.

description: Best tropical favorites I ever tasted.  Been coming here for the last 5 years.  The staff is always friendly and courteous. If you don't have time to wait in line, try buying pre pack half gallon.
author: Sam W.

description:
Some of the best ice cream I've ever had.  

I got a pint (half & half) of the Cookies and Cream and Mango.  Only lasted less than a week in my fridge, but tasted great until the very last spoonful - no freezer burn or hardness at all.

I put it neck and neck with Bi-Rite in terms of taste and quality, with a better price-point for pints.
author: Sam K.

description:
Come early, come often... but be prepared to wait in line. 

Don't be afraid of the line. It moves quickly.
Don't forget to pick up a number... otherwise, the line will not move very quickly for you... 
Sample flavors if you wish - but you can't go wrong.
DO NOT double park outside of the shop - you will block the cars trying to exist the parking lot.
author: Lisa L.

description:
12 Step Program for Mitchell's...

1. Illegally double park your car in front
2. Grab a number from the machine by the doorway
3. Wait patiently for your number to be called
4. Sample as many flavors as you want (must try Ube, YUCK!)
5. Settle for the TROPICAL FOUR because that's Heidi C.'s fave
6. Get it in a cup, cone, whatever. Waffle cone FTW!
7. Pay
8. Dash out of Mitchell's
9. Pray to God that you don't have a parking ticket
10. Hop in your car
11. Enjoy your ice cream
12. Drive off.
author: Heidi C.

description: It's good and okay. It's usually crowded and you have to wait. I think they're popular because they are the only ice cream store in the neighborhood and/or because of a few 'exotic' flavors they offer such as Mexican Chocolate (delicious) and Lacuma. Actually, I do appreciate it for the latter however I'm not a fan of standing in line for anything...just not my style.
author: Roya D.

description: A friend of mine brought me here when I was visiting the bay. The line was super long but it was a beautiful day out so I didn't mind. It was worth the wait. I got the salted caramel. I highly recommend giving this place a try!
author: Tina B.

description: The people are great and it's exciting that they have such rare flavors. The ube was a bit disappointing... I'm wavering between 3 and 4 stars because I've had better, but the lucuma and the young coconut were great. Considering there aren't many other options, I'd say this is a go-to place for tropical ice cream flavors.
author: Neftalí J.

description: !Yummmmmmmmm!! Avocado: yum. Pineapple coconut: yum. Mango: yum. Purple yam: yum. I came after a late dinner one night while visiting SF and the line was decent (indoor capacity) so no issues with waiting. While I enjoyed the flavors and would come again (and again, and again), I would not wait in a horrendous line. I didn't make the visit with my husband, but about two weeks ago, he found similar flavors in the freezer isle of our market in San Diego and this was his reaction: "omg (excited and higher pitched tone), they have this here? This is like my favorite ice cream from when I was a child. Can we get it?!" Of course we got it (~2 pints), so you might have it at your local market, but if not or you're not risky enough to buy a larger serving at the store just to try, this place is perfect and reasonably priced.
author: Lisa M.

description:
In my extensive research of frozen delicacies, I've compared various locations to hone in on ice cream's benefits. Compared to others, Mitchell's ice cream excels in its tropic flavors. Ube, a filipino taro-like tuber, is a staple flavor. On the other hand, if you are feeling a need for chocolate speed, go for grasshopper. Lastly for fruit lovers, I would brave the cold to get a refreshing scoop of peach.

Tip: Not really a sit down place, so enjoy the ice cream in your car or huddled in a close circle with your friends. :)
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Finally!!!  Almost 30 and this is my first visit to Mitchell's.  This past Sunday was a perfect, warm day for delicious ice-cream.  We arrived around 4 PM and had to wait about 15 minutes. 

I had the single scoop vanilla with swirls of lilikoi and mango.  My friend had a junior scoop of coffee, which was also delish!  And my bf had a double scoop of french custard and halo halo.  All the flavors were perfectly creamy and each lick was just pure heaven in my mouth.  Ranks among the best ice-cream I've had in my life so far, and I can't wait to come back and try all the flavors.  

FYI - Minimum charge of $9.00 to use your debit/credit card.

YAY for review #1700!!
author: Cynthia H.

description:
Oh my lord, this place takes the cake as far as icecream is concerned.  There is one HUGE problem... if you go around 8-11pm, when the whole world wants to get icecream after dinner, you may have to circle around and around looking for parking ( you may have to give up and just not get icecream as I once had to do), and once you park, you wait in a frackin line for half an hour clutching your number.  At any rate, they have some outrageous flavors, my favorites being the asian inspired ones like Ube, lychee, avocado, baby coconut, jackfruit, and thai iced tea.

They also have the Halo Halo, which is made of shaved ice, fruit, sweet beans, condensed milk, and ube icecream on top.  ahhh!  I also adore Bi-Right Icecream, but I would say I love them equally for different reasons, Bi-right for awesome American flavors, and Mitchell's for awesome Asian flavors and their seasonal pumpkin flavor.
author: Terry K.

description: Lots of interesting flavors ! And the good part is that on crowded days, you can easily pick up half a gallon through the express line. Love their mango flavor !
author: Jisha A.

description:
Despite the maddening wait for a taste of Mitchell's Ice Cream, I do enjoy coming here after devouring dinner at Front Porch (it's a cajun/creole restaurant less than a block away, but I digress). 

They have a pretty good selection of flavors; from Rocky Road to Green Tea, French Custard, Coffee, Ube, Black Walnut, Cantaloupe ... you'll have plenty of choices once you get here. 

If you've never been here and have zero clue where the line starts -- pick a number. Grab a ticket number to your left once you enter the door. Wait is usually around 10-20 minutes depending how busy it is, but it's worth it.
author: Vincent B.

description: I like ice cream on rainy days. Come to think of it, I like ice cream on any day. Rain or shine. It was raining on the day I came here and it was also a mission. I told my friend I wanted to try this particular flavor called OOB. He laughed at me and asked, "What did you just say?" I told him I wanted some OOB ice cream. He goes "Do you mean Ube (oo-beh)?" Apparently, I pronounced it wrong. Shame on me. I'm such a nOOB :( Get it? Get it?! Okay, it wasn't that funny. Don't judge me! I still get made fun of 'cause of that 'til this day. The flavors I tried were Avocado, Mexican Chocolate, Halo-halo, Jackfruit, and of course, Ube. They did mess up the order, but eh, wasn't a big deal. I was also a bit buzzed before this so everything was pretttttty tasty!
author: Vicky N.

description:
I need to write an update to my review because of the experience I had at mitchell's yesterday.  I already have mad amounts of love for this place.  Not only for the quality of ice cream but for the nostalgia that it brings me.

However I bought these discount cards on SFGate for some sundaes, and as luck would have it, I didn't notice they expire and i had only used one sundae on each card (each one had 5).  Turns out the cards totally expired.  Yes, I know it was my bad.  I should have been more diligent about seeing the expiration date but ANYWAY....

We went to Mitchell's and the guy was super nice--told me they no longer honored the card BUT they gave me the remaining cash value for what I paid for the card on a gift card--for not only one of the cards but both of them.

And this my friends is how someone keeps the love alive for many many years.

I love you Mitchell's and I think I always will. 

P.S. Oh and for the record they have a new flavor called butter nut munch...it's lovely.  but don't fall for the dipped cone--not as tasty as it looks--it distracts from the yummy ice cream!
author: Lu E.

description:
Purple yam ice cream? Young coconut ice cream?

I like that they carry the obscure tropical stuff. That's why I love me the Indian flavors at Real Ice Cream in Santa Clara so much. However, I've come here a couple times after hearing how certain flavors shouldn't be missed, and I've walked away wishing I'd ordered something else.

The first time was the ube, or purple yam. The next it was sweet coconut, which I admit was really good. I just wished I'd succumbed to German chocolate cake ice cream instead. Because as much as I like the obscure tropical flavors, sometimes I needs me chocolate.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
When I came the line was out the door!  Had to wait in line for a good 30 minutes to get our ice cream, but so did everyone else... I guess that's how "worth it" they think this place is.  You walk in and the first thing to do is grab a number, then you wait.  As for me - I would never wait 30 minutes for ice cream... it's not THAT mindblowing.

The cool thing about this place is its variety of flavors - they have tropical ones like Ube (taro/purple yam), the tropical 4, baby coconut, etc.  They also have rum raisin, vanilla custard, pumpkin, Mexican chocolate, and lychee to name a few others.

I would never go out of my way to come here, but I have to admit it's a pretty good ice cream place.  Really creamy and smooth.
author: Angela C.

description: Perfect capper to a good Mexican meal in the Mission.  I just got a junior chocolate, $2.20, and it was a nice amount since I was almost full from lunch.  The chocolate is darker and more sticky consistency that most you will find, so a small amount is good.  Nice fat content.  Lots of great flavors I plan to try another time.  With all the hipster ice cream places and their crazy concoctions, sometimes old-fashioned is the way to go.
author: Marc S.

description: OMG! I love this place! I go there once in a while because I live in Pittsburg (45 mins away) last time I was there it was on a Sunday (6/29/14), i got there 11:01pm (they close at 11 o'clock) and they were already closed with some people still inside I asked the guy that was at the door if he could please let us in, he said he was sorry but they were closed... =( I explained him that I drove all the way from Pittsburg and he was very nice, he said he could help us but not let us in so we told him what we wanted and gave him the money, he brought the ice cream, the receipt and change and asked us to come back a little earlier next time, Miguel is a very nice and his excellent customer service makes him the best! I'm definitely coming back next time a little earlier of course! =)
author: Alessia C.

description:
Finally came here when there was NO line - probably due to the Giants game at the time, but who cares? NO LINE! :)

Welcome back, pumpkin ice cream! Yummy and seasonal. I know Mitchell's is very famous for their Ube ice cream, however I wasn't feeling too adventurous that night. Next time!

I hear that there's always a LONG line, but this time there was NO line. Amazing. The workers are also very helpful when you have no idea what flavor to get. The texture of the ice cream is very smooth, and thick. If you like it creamy, Mitchell's is definitely for you.

Next time, I'll probably get cantolope (SOO FRESH) or the kahlua coffee flavor. Both were very good. 

Menu is very extensive and definitely has something for everyone! Some wacky flavors you find in many other ice cream places include Jackfruit, halo-halo, etc. Prices are wallet-friendly (one scoop for $2.80). Oh yeah, credit card is accepted, but only when you spend a minimum of $9.
author: Julia K.

description:
Great place for ice cream.

Associates are nice.

Not so great when there's a crowd, remember to grab a number if you are a first timer.

There's a parking lot in the back, so parking is usually not a problem. I usually come at odd hours, so the 10 min zone in front is usually free.

Great flavors. The purple yam was visually a bit interesting, but still tasty. Bi-rite has more unique flavors. and Swensons & Baskin Robbins has the standard flavors. Poly Ann's quality has been dropping even though they have unique flavors, so I started enjoying Mitchell's more. I LOVE Fenton's in Oakland, but they're across the bay. Mitchell's will have to do.

Neighborhood gem.
author: Shelley L.

description:
Best macapuno ice cream I've had! Be prepared to wait in line, it can be long - even in the cold and in the rain! You can always get it to go!

**Also, they sell their ice cream at Draeger's Market in San Mateo if you can't make the trek out to San Francisco.
author: Cristina D.

description:
It was a choice between Bi-Rite's seasonal Earl Grey ice cream or Mitchell's Thai iced tea ice cream. Chose Mitchell's because I haven't had it yet (and this was my fourth time visiting the SF area). Of course they didn't have Thai iced tea flavor but they had a ton of other cool flavors. I had a brief difficult time deciding between Halo Halo (Buko, Langka, Ube, Pineapple, Mongo & Sweet Beans), Tropical Four (Banana, Guava, Mango & Pineapple), and Lucuma (peruvian fruit). I chose Lucuma, then I saw the avocado after I recieved my loaded cup (thus "d'oh" moment). 

Lucuma flavor was DELISH. I've never heard of it before. It wasn't too sweet or weird tasting. I wish this was a common flavor choice. It was chilly at the time so I imagine this was the reason why I didn't have to grab a number (not too busy). The staff was very friendly. The man who helped us let me taste avocado even after I received my order (for some reason I feel like I wouldn't be allowed to do this) and he asked me if I wanted to try anything else. So nice! Love Mitchell's!
author: Geraldine T.

description:
Mitchell's has become a safety hazard for the neighborhood. The parking lot is not only inadequate it is dangerous to pull out of during busy hours. It is a common sight to see cars blocking the crosswalk while waiting. St. Luke's hospital is on this walk path. This people waiting for their cone could care less about the safety hazard to others. The ice cream is ok, but not worth the angst. Do you really think they could tell the difference between Mitchell's and Safeway Premium, which is 1/4 the price and less of a wait.
Tony C.
author: Anthony C.

description: We dined at the new Peruvian restaurant Mistura on Piedmont Ave. Not only is the food delicious but the ice cream dessert is really yummy! It's Mitchell's Lucuma flavor. After googling Lucuma, we found it is a fruit that grows in Peru and Ecuador and when in ice cream tastes nothing like a tropical fruit. The flavor is indescribable and worth saving room for!
author: Marianne F.

description:
Fresh, Unique, Creamy and Deelish!

My friend and I always make it a point to stop by here when we are in the city, I suggest you do the same!
author: Remy-Anne V.

description:
If you love ice cream and want to keep it classic or old school, go here, NOW! If its a nice day, be prepared and committed to get that ice cream  because it will take time. They are open till late and have a numbering system. I am not entirely sold that this is a good system, but oh well.

I personally loved the Mango (so creamy, so mango-esque) and Mexican chocolate. Its been a while since i have been back so cant remember all the other flavors that we enjoyed. There is no room to sit or linger around here, which is sort of a negative and it was hard to get a cab back out of here. 

I need to go back soon! There are some unique flavor choices too, though i personally have not tried any of them (yet)!
author: Sapna E.

description:
TOO GOOD!

The line is long, the parking can be a beezy, but it's all worth it when your number gets called!

The ice cream is delicious, fresh and unique in flavor.  Definitely not a sit down place but it beats Ben & Jerry's any day!
author: Amanda L.

description:
Grew up with Mitchell's; it's got to be the creamiest and smoothest ice cream around. Yummmm! My favorite flavors are avocado (served in the fall), mango and chocolate. They don't skimp on the fruits and all flavors are sweetened just right. The chocolate fudge used at the ice cream shop is also good; buttery and not too sweet. 

The one star deduction is mainly because they have such a tiny ice cream shop. It's so hard to find parking around and it would really be nice to expand their shop to allow customers to hang out and enjoy their ice cream on-site.
author: Yan S.

description:
What can you add when everyone has said it all?
Awesome quality and variety, reasonably priced, and pretty quick service despite the incredibly long lines.
Where else can you get flavors like Macapuno?
Note to parents - bring baby wipes, you'll need them!
author: dan s.

description:
Good ice cream--very creamy, perfectly sweet, and sinfully unhealthy.  Who could do it wrong?!  

I'm a vanilla girl...so my favorite here is the vanilla custard.  I take home the gallon, and it lasts for a few weeks.  I like to sneak in a pint of coffee too...sigh.  :-)

Their menu of flavors is just huge, and they're nice about giving you samples too!

The only minus is...always a line, and generally, take a number before standing in the lines!  Parking is a pain as they have a very small private lot, and street parking in the area can be tricky.  

Luckily for me, I can purchase their ice cream at cafes and other such places sometimes. :-)
author: Fannie S.

description:
So many flavors! All good. enjoyed the mango and ube. Prepare for a long wait. 

can get paaaacked on a hot day. Some parking in back.
author: Veranna N.

description:
Their ice cream is super creamy and decadent...you really can't go wrong with whatever flavor you choose, but their tropical ones (mango, lychee, etc.) are especially addicting.  I'm not sure which I like better...Mitchell's or Bi-rite...guess I'll have to do some more taste testing next time I'm in the YAY area!

Minus one star for the LONGGG wait!
author: Susan W.

description:
The wait on a Sunday night ~8pm was much longer than expected... with no sign of dying down. Damn Mitchell's is popular.

Mitchell's ice cream has a very creamy texture and is moderately fluffy. I felt like all the flavors I tried were borderline too sweet, and many tasted very similar (ie: mostly a cream base flavor and not a very intense whatever flavor was being advertised).

I chose a junior cone ($2.20) of Peanut Butter Indulgence. MMM. I love pb+chocolate. Sadly for Mitchell's I felt like the ice cream tasted the same as Baskin Robbins' Peanut Butter Chocolate, only fluffier/creamier and with the addition of mini pb choc cups. 

I wouldn't say no to ice cream from Mitchell's, but I doubt I'll be back.
author: Susanna W.

description: Take a number, wait either in the small store or outside on one of two benches or stand around on the sidewalk.  Ok.  Staff ok, teetering on bad customer service the day I went.  Got a junior scoop on a cone that was melted and sloppy.  The junior scoop in a cup looked better.  Taste was just ok for the caramel praline and the thin mint was good. Probably will not return. Same price at Baskin Robbins buys a generous scoop, better flavor.
author: René T.

description:
Ain't nothing like a cold December evening in the Bay and indulging in a fine selection of Ice Cream at Mitchell's.

From the many times I've visited family and friends, I've never gone until this past December.

Grasshopper Pie was actually delicious! We got another flavor but that Grasshopper Pie was good! Although I was tempted to get the Filipino favorites such as Ube and Mango and all that as well as my usual rocky road, cookies 'n cream, and other chocolate inspired flavors, but that's for another journey.  Perhaps purchase several pints and a large ice chest filled with dry ice to make sure the ice cream makes it back to southern California.

Until then, Thrifty's/Rite Aid ice cream will have to do.
author: Michael M.

description:
I can't believe I was born and raised in San Francisco and yet, I've never had Mitchell's Ice Cream...until TONIGHT. As much of a foodie that I am, I must have only been a poser until tonight, when I finally had my first taste of Mitchell's. And it was Fantastic to the maximum. 

From Halo Halo to Ube to Peanut Butter Indulgence, no flavor at Mitchell's will disappoint. Came here on a Saturday night and crowds of people packed the store (as expected). Because it is so crowded, you actually have to pick up a number and they'll call your number when they're ready to serve you; this makes the process more organized instead of people waiting impatiently in long lines.

When they called out number "37," I rushed up to the counter like a kid and immediately called out random flavors I wanted to try. Ube! Rocky Road! Grasshopper Pie PLEASE! In the end...I eventually tapped out to my weakness and settled with the Peanut Butter Indulgence. I can't say no to Peanut Butter anywhere, but the tropical flavors they have there are killer good (and unique to the tongue). 

The one bad thing about Mitchell's (other than the wait) is that parking blows there. Good luck trying to find a parking spot (nearby), you'll go in circles forever trying to find a spot during times. 

I've found my new ice cream place in San Francisco : Mitchell's.
author: David W.

description:
Ooooh, yes! This place is amazing.

I came here with a few of my friends who came to visit, and boy were we happy to be here! They have tons of flavours! (The Grasshopper Pie is AMAZING!) MMM, and the prices are reasonable as well.

PLEASE NOTE that there's a $9 minimum when paying with a card. It was my first time there, but the guy was nice enough to ring it up for me anyways. Just needa bring cash next time.

Not to mention the nice who was serving us was great! We were talking about music, and it was fun.

Definitely coming back here! Best place for ice cream in the city..
author: Mimi N.

description: Mitchell's is just meh compared to Bi-Rite. Their flavors arent as creative even though they do carry more options. Bi-Rite is a specialty ice creamery. I feel like Mitchell's is just another average ice cream parlor.
author: Grace H.

description:
A surprisingly warm night landed me at Mitchell's earlier this month. The weather must have caught everyone off guard because there was no line! I came ready to fight the crowd too. Dang. How (not so) disappointing.

Well I dunno about you but short lines magically make grasshopper pie taste better (: Prices are fair, there are 1,000+ good reviews, and there isn't much else to say. YUM!
author: La De Da C.

description:
I hate giving an ice cream place 3 stars, but I just can't bring myself to give it 4! I'm a huge fan of BiRite, and to a slightly lesser extent, Humphrey Slocombe as well. I had huge expectations for this place because of all the hype, but it just can't compare with BiRite or Humphrey Slocombe.

First, there was no parking anywhere on a Sunday night so I had to hop out and wait in line while my bf circled the block. Second, there is no line....you take a number and wait to get called. This seemed inefficient since they spent half their time calling numbers and waiting for customers to maneuver through one another to get to the counter. 

Most importantly, the flavors weren't up to par. I loved all the unique ideas they had and was so excited to try a bunch of flavors like ube and cinnamon apple butter...but they all tasted so bland and similar to one another. The ice cream was creamy, I'll give it that much, but could've easily been drugstore ice cream in my opinion. I did like they give you huge samples of whatever flavor you want to try. Still, I'd much rather go to birite for some basil or honey lavender ice cream, or even Ici in berkeley.
author: Kate Y.

description:
THE ICE CREAM GODS HAVE SPOKEN..
AHHHHHHH!

if you havent been to Mitchells YOU HAVE TO GO! especially during holiday seasons because the PUMPKIN ICE CREAM IS TO DIIIIIE FOR YUM, which coincidentally im yelping and its october which means they have it! mmmmmmm! its usually super packed, but believe me its worth the wait! The bfs familys restaurant has Mitchells Ice Cream delivered to the restaurant because their ice cream is JUST THAT AWESOME. mmhmm. so please, stop by if you ever have the chance!
author: Rosh E.

description:
The best ice cream in San Francisco. I love their assortment of flavors and good thing it's not in a foggy part of the city because otherwise it probably wouldn't get the patronage that it gets now if it were. 

I love all of their "tropical" flavors which is basically another way of saying "we cater to Filipino tastebuds too". 

My favorite flavors are the Ube and the Avocado. I also like their Cookies-n-Cream and Butter Pecan. 

Beware of the long lines (even during the winter). Also, parking is limited so just be aware of that.
author: Rylan C.

description:
Sooo now that I have actually moved into SF and am no longer B&T Trash (or so my friend says - RUDE), I was inducted into the secrect society that know's about Mitchell's.  

Sooo, I am not generally a sweets person and the only ice cream I have ever craved was the Chocolate Malted Cruch from Thrifty's (don't even know if they still exist, but you can still get it at some CVS's).  Any who, so Mitchell's makes me crave ice cream!  I am in love with their biscotti, toasted almond, and french vanilla custard.  It is like heaven in a bowl.  I can almost feel it molding to form a muffin top on my tummy and ASK ME IF I CARE?  Cuz i don't!  The creamy goodness that is their ice cream is like nothing i have ever tasted!  I will say that once my bf and I broke up, the first thing I thought about was Mitchell's.   I almost wanted to call him and tell him Mitchell was my NEW boyfriend, so THERE!!!  lol... 

Anyways, you should try it!  I don't know if I've mentioned it, but it's life changing!!!  :)
author: Brandy B.

description:
Two things:

1- they have tropical ice creams like LUCUMA!!!

2- PRETZEL CONES

Also, they are very unpretentious.
author: Anton S.

description: Please come to Orange County!!!!! Enough said! Best ice cream joint EVER!!!
author: LoveFood2Much N.

description: I make it a point to come here when i go to the city. My favorite is their pistachio icecream TO DIE FOR! Their toasted almond flavor is absolutely delicious! The staff is very friendly as well and despite the long lines at times the wait is worth it! I was just there last week 2 times!!
author: Grecia M.

description: A match made in heaven: chocolate and cinnamon! Go try the Mexican chocolate.. Ecstasy in a cone.
author: Joe M.

description: Above-average ice-cream. Neighborly pricing. Friendly staff. Short to moderate line. Overall a low-hassle shop to pick up a scoop or two in the neighborhood for when the mood strikes.
author: Dawn L.

description:
Jesus, Buddha, Shiva, and Allah all eat here.
I grew up right around the corner.
After over 30 years it smells spot on the same every time I walk in.
Phuck I love that smell.
It is the Shietza of ice cream in San Pancho.
author: G R.

description:
What the.. how the.. huuuhwhaaat?! Why has no one told me about Mitchell's before? Everytime I visit the Bay, it's always Bi-Rite, Bi-Rite, Bi-Rite! And don't get me wrong because I love me some earl grey or coffee toffee (best ever) at Bi-Rite, but sometimes you want some of that hoo-hah and culture that Mitchell's seem to do so well.

Uber ethnic. Seated in the Mission - next to hipsters I've been told (thank god I brought my b and boat shoes). So many flavors (I sampled 7 - I tipped so shut it). I didn't even bother looking at everything else + condiments because I was so focused on ice cream - I did see there was a pretzel cone (somebody get it and tell me). 

So they have regular flavors and then the Filipino flavors. I went exotic, because you know, wild Scorpio. I thought their espresso toffee was really strong - impactful choco chips if you dig that (I don't). I got...

Langka (Jackfruit) - true to the fruit flavor, creamy but light, fragrant but not domineering. It's a good, mild for those easing their way into something non-vanilla.

Halo-halo - Nice mix of everything + texture! They've got beans, jellies, and gummies in it. There were hints of young coconut but then also ube but then pineapple. I've never had a real Halo-halo but I imagined this creamy combo 1-2 punch.

So with that... I've had my share of tubs of ice cream at random Filipino UFC fight parties and potlucks, and I can't say I was that impressed with the ube or avocado. I don't think it was strong or fragrant enough - something very modest about these flavors. I think for avocado ice cream (or milkshakes) to be really successful, they need to have almost equal parts condensed milk like the Vietnamese do... 

Aside those 2, I really liked the variety, most flavors I tried, and their risk factor. I'll be back as often as the Fast and the Furious sequels! (sadly).

PS. Getting ice cream at speciality shops on rainy days is really the best idea because you avoid lines that everybody Yelps about!
author: Jenny C.

description: 3.5 to be honest. The ice cream is very good, but not the best that I have tried. I got the orange sherbert and the toffee/cappuchino and they were both very good, but nothing out of the ordinary ice cream.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Me: BUKO BUKO??

Friend: .... ???

Me: Spumoni!? Buko langka ube halo halo langka, HAHAHAHAHA!! Lucuma, macapuno kalamansi lychee yuzu.

Friend: Omg... what language are you speaking??

Me: Mitchell's.
author: Jenny K.

description: How can you not love this place? Sure parking is hard to find and it does get a little crowded, but this place has all the amazing flavors you are looking for. I'm not going to list them all here, but my favorite is caramel crackle! It was fun chilling in front and sitting down on the benches with my kids. Customer service is A+
author: Stephen D.

description: Good regular ice cream shop plus a few interesting flavors. Bonus: open later than the rest!
author: Heather R.

description:
I would give it 4.5 if I could. 

I tried the ube (purple yam) ice cream and it was surprisingly good. But I ended up getting something they call Grasshopper Pie flavor, which is basically mint, fudge, and oreos... YUM. I liked it better than the stuff they had at Bi-Rite, but that's just me.
author: Jenna L.

description:
I've been told that this is a must see in SF, which I agree that you must try, but I would not say it's my favorite.

At first i thought i had been tricked, i walk into a tiny store that was HOT & humid, tiny & cramped with bulletproof-like windows split in two for serving two parties at once, no seating, and when we squished in to grab a number we were 100 (yes, ONE HUNDRED) tickets behind the next person's number to be called. But a million people were lined up outside ---- so it has to be good right? 

Prior to this in-person experience, i've only had their prepackaged mango ice cream. They do have a lot of flavors on the menu and I was not sure what to order, but after waiting 45min-1hr, I really did not care what I ordered. 

A few notable things to try: the grasshopper pie sundae, mexican chocolate ice cream, mango ice cream, buko (baby coconut), and strawberry (because you must at every ice cream shop).

Their ice cream was just ok to me. I just refuse to wait that long for ice cream ever again, so maybe next time we'll have to get the prepacked.
author: Stella C.

description:
Hands down best ice cream in SF!!!

Yes there are tons of places that make home-made ice cream, but for some reason, Mitchell's has been cranking out good tasty flavors for over 50+ years and counting. If you don't take my word for it, take the words of all the people that are waiting outside for their opportunity to get some sweet goodness. 

Tons of flavors are offered here in addition to their selection of sorbets. From month to month there are flavors that rotate as "Flavor of the Month" Sometimes these flavors are seasonal depending on the time of year you go and sometimes they are just unique flavors that can only stay on for so long because they need to keep making the other goodness. Anyhow, grab some friends and wait in line together. If you want to sample flavors, Mitchell's is kind enough to assist you in that.

Recommended flavors:
ALL
author: Michael J.

description:
YUMM!! Your go to place for tropical flavors: Mango, Ube (purple yam), Thai Tea, Cantalope, and many many more.

Parking sucks, but its well worth the drive around ( =
author: Jenn V.

description: Great classic place for some ice cream with the family.  I had the avacado and wife had the chocolate.  Parking is limited behind store, and I hear the line gets super long during the summer.  Took about 5 minutes to order my ice cream. Will come back.
author: Dan M.

description:
Things I Would Give Up for the Power to Shrink Myself in Order to Live in a Tub of Mitchell's Chocolate Caramel Krackle:

- thumb
- ability to wink 
- almighty internaut
- 2-ply TP
- proportional arm length
- cupcakes
- sun
author: Dawn K.

description:
Whoa Mitchell's when did you get all spiffed up and remodeled?

Anyways I came here a couple of weeks ago and to my surprise they remodeled the place. It's more spacious, and they painted the walls into colors that I can only describe as Easter colors. There's no more windows, just straight up coutner top, with windows that give you a peak at their yummy goodness in which they call Mitchell's Ice Cream.

I still love this place to the max. My ultimate favorite ice cream shop for sure. I tried a new flavor called "Blood Orange Sorbet" all for my love Edward Cullen. haha But It was delish! I love it. I'll still never turn my back on my orange sherbet. But overall I don't think there's a flavor at Mitchell's that I've tried that I hated. Seriously they even make gross flavors like pistachio good. 

I love this place. I love their ice cream. and I love how people from all over the world can gather here and unite for our love of ice cream! ALL HAIL MITCHELL'S!

I love Mitchell's. I love Mitchell's. I love Mitchell's. Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!
author: Mellani L.

description: Awesome friendly service!  My hubby and I were looking for half gallon green tea flavored ice-cream and couldn't find it in their freezers.  Gave up and ready to buy some other flavored ice-cream. Well, Hablo found the 1/2 gallon green tea flavor we wanted for us from the freezer. Thank you Hablo!
author: K. L.

description:
Peruvian fruit ice cream with baby coconut!!  Yeah baby!
Seriously in love with this spot.  Its been around since my mom was born and it just got a new remodel and is going stronger than ever.  They even have a take a number system so you can grab a number and wait to be called outside.

I even tried the Ube.. but they didn't have any Taro ice cream that wasn't prepacked.  Sometimes they have my two favorite flavors available - Thai Iced Tea and Mexican Hot Chocolate.

This is the spot to go if you want some great ice cream in hard to find flavors island and Filipino flavors.

The parking lot is tiny and street parking maybe no existent.. but who cares when your eating this creamy goodness?
author: Alicia A.

description: If you visit San Francisco,  you must go here at least once to try their ice creams. This is my second time and I always try something new. They have some of the best flavors. My favorites so far are Mexican ice cream, Ube, Pistachio, Mocha Fudge, and Grasshopper!  This place is usually busy with a long  line of people but it's worth the wait! :)
author: Cher D.

description:
After going to Bi-Rite and overhearing the guy in line talk about Mitchell's as a competitor, I had to try it! Their Ube ice cream was also listed in the 7x7 list of things to try. 

My bf and I stopped by here on Saturday and found parking right in front-yay! We were confused at first and then figured out we had to take a number to order. We had the mango swirl and the much raved about Ube ice cream. Surprisingly, I did not enjoy the Ube ice cream as much as the mango swirl! I think maybe its because I couldn't figure out the taste of the Ube ice cream(it definitely tastes exotic!). I loooooved the mango swirl and could NOT get enough of it. It seemed like they mashed up real chunks of mango into their ice cream. YUMMMMMMM! 

I can't wait to come back and get another scoop of their mango ice cream!
author: Vikki K.

description:
Thick and creamy, mhmmm .... get your mind out of the gutter! I'm talking about ice cream! Famous SF ice cream didn't disappoint. They had some crazy unique flavors like purple yam (Ube) and jackfruit. They also had a ton of regular flavors that were phenomenal. I felt bad for standing there and taking sample after sample but it was all so good!

Everyone talks about the mexican chocolate, but I really didnt like it. I loved the Peanut Butter Indulgence, the Grasshopper Pie (Mint Chocolate Chip), and their Tropical Four (guava, mango, ube, and jackfruit).
author: Kevin L.

description:
If people are willing to wait in line outside in the nipple-biting cold to get some ICE CREAM, you know a business is doing something right.  There were 20 people ahead of us the last time my friends and I came here and the line just got longer, even at 9pm on a Saturday.

Hands down, my favorite flavor here is mango.  It's got a light mango sweetness to it that coats your whole tongue. The consistency is so smooth and creamy and even. For whatever reason, this flavor is often available it at local Asian grocery stores.  My second favorite is a tie between ube and pecans praline.

I use Mitchell's as part of a date routine.  1) Take girl to Mi Lindo Peru down the street on Mission St,  2) Walk to Mitchell's and talk about how much history there is to the city, 3) Eat cold ice cream and comment on how crazy we are for eating ice cream in the cold but it's so worth it,  4) Drive lady home,  5) Kiss and comment on how her lips taste like [insert ice cream flavor here]

If you go with a group of people, you might as well use the same ticket.  This is handy when you have need cash and your friends have some.  It's like an ATM withdrawal without the fee.
author: John C.

description: it's good. a more traditional type of ice cream parlor with somewhat traditional flavors. The flavors are all there, I just wasn't wowed by them. in other words, i didnt find it to be anything special other than the fact that they've been around for a long time. Worth a try if you're just craving ice cream.
author: Minnow N.

description: The ube (taro) and buko (baby coconut) are nice flavors although I don't really like this style of ice cream. They use more butterfat than other ice cream places to make their ice cream more creamy and heavier but I don't find the taste to be that rich. I prefer Bi-Rite or Humphrey's which is lighter but with a stronger taste.
author: Eric S.

description: Best Ice Cream in the city! Love their specialty Peanut butter and Chocolate shake!
author: Zachary R.

description:
The real test of an ice cream is not the flavor combinations, but the quality of the basic ice cream.  Lots of places try to pass by impressing with their flashy flavors and clever names, but that's only to cover up the fact that the ice cream isn't quality stuff.  However, if you like ice cream made the home-made way with lots of custard and heavy cream, then Mitchell's is your guy.

But even the flavored ice cream is made with real care.  I like the whole pistachios to crunch on instead of the usual itty bitty bits.  And the fruity flavors taste like real (versus imagined) fruit.

On a cool Monday night (cold enough to numb my toes in their sandals) there were two dozen people milling about inside and outside the store.
author: Jean K.

description:
Supremely wonderful. How have I missed writing a review until now? How do I love Mitchell's, let me count the ways...

1. Buko
2. Macapuno
3. Mexican Chocolate
4. Buko with Mexican Chocolate
5. Thai Ice Tea
6. Ume
7. Mango Ice Cream Pie

And I see they have soupsop (guanabana) sorbet - OMG - are they open on Memorial Day??? I have to have that now.
author: Marco M.

description:
This is one of my fav. places for ice cream, only problem is they are always so packed you will have a nice long wait for anything you buy, and they are not cheap. Free samples and good sweets, I highly recommend going in the daytime when it is not so packed, and please, avoid weekends, it is total madness!

P.S. My fav ice cream is the Avocado...it is amazing!
author: Bella B.

description:
Yummy! I had a cookie sandwich with chocolate chip ice cream. I liked their ice cream, it was sweet but not too rich. I'd definitely like to try some of their other flavors in the future...the grasshopper sounds good!

Service is pretty fast. Our group only had to wait around 5 minutes after we pulled a number.
author: Miss H K.

description: This is what ice cream is supposed to be, or at least, what chocolate and caramel ice cream is supposed to be: gooey, sugary, decadence, with no pretense to fancy pants foodie status.  My sister claimed to have ordered me a small, but it was large enough to be a dinner substitute.  My official favorite purveyor of chocolate caramel ice cream.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Every time I'm in the Mission it's like a battle.  I really don't know which ice cream shop to choose from : Bi-rite or Mitchell's (Humphrey's good also).  It's a 40/60 and Bi-rtie usually wins because I'm basically in love with their salted caramel.  But I have a love affair with New York Cherry from Mitchell's. And it also helps that I know somebody who works there haha! I die for their cantaloupe during the summer time. Peach is hella good as well. Mexican Hot Chocolate is chocolate ice cream with a zing of cinnamon.  I can go on and on, but you really have to go and try for yourself.  

To put it out there: you guys HAVE to try the Green Tea ice cream here! It's seriously the best; but unfortunately they don't sell it by the scoop, you have to buy the half gallon, which I do not mind at all :) .
author: Betty C.

description: I've been here several times and have tried many different flavors, but my favorite is the Tropical Four:  Mango, Pineapple, Guava and Banana.   When you arrive, you will come up to a crowd waiting, but they get through it fast.  Be sure to pick your number when you arrive.  It's not obvious to those that are new to Mitchell's.  It's the perfect spot to be on a nice summer day!
author: Angela D.

description:
I have not found another Ice cream place that comes close to mitchell's!! I can honestly say that I feel very lucky to be able to go a place like this when ever I feel like it! not to mention they are open late.. gotta love it. 

Here is what my GF and I always order: 2 scoop Rum Rasin Sundae! with extra hot fudge! trust me this combo its a must!
author: Omar H.

description:
**Updated for new flavors**

Mitchell's is the best ice cream I have had in SF so far. Better than Bi-Rite and definitely better than Humphrey Slocombe. 

GOOD:

CHOCOLATE ORANGE INFUSION - They use plenty of orange zest and the orange flavor is very fresh and crisp, not overly sweet like orange syrup. This is a must try for any chocolate lover. Sadly, they seemed to have moved it out of the rotation as of 6/5/2010 or hopefully it was just a temporary change.

BLACK WALNUT - This is a very nutty ice cream (think hazelnut cream) but with walnuts instead. It is not super sweet and a very good flavor if you like walnuts.

MEXICAN CHOCOLATE - Nice cinnamon and chocolate combo. Similar to the Mayan Chocolate Haagen Dazs flavor (which sadly was discontinued).

MACAPUNO - Not too sweet and had nice yummy tender pieces of coconut instead of the typical shavings used in coconut ice cream.

GRASSHOPPER PIE - Very chocolately and minty. A bit too heavy on the chocolate in my opinion.

BUKO - Similar to Macapuno. I think it is a tad less sweet. I thought the Macapuno was better.

GINGER SPICE - This is not like ginger snaps or ginger bread. This ice cream is loaded with chunks of ginger giving it a nice kick, while not being too sweet at the same time.

LUCUMA - This Peruvian fruit flavor tastes kind of like sweet potato or pumpkin. The taste is somewhat subtle but good if you like the aforementioned flavors.

LANGKA - I love jackfruit (don't confuse it with durian!) and this flavor hit it right on the head. Not too creamy and not too sweet, but creamy enough to not taste like a sorbet. Jackfruit tastes like Juicy Fruit gum but a little less sweet.

JUST OK:

FIG - This is a new flavor that I first noticed on 6/5/2010. It was not there a few weeks earlier. Basically it is candied figs mixed with caramel ice cream. Sadly, the caramel ice cream overpowers the fig and I would have much rather have preferred a pure fig ice cream, rather than a caramel-fig one.

TROPICAL FOUR - It basically tastes how you would imagine if you mixed banana, guava, mango &  pineapple pieces and juices with vanilla ice cream. It isn't bad or anything but it didn't surprise me or seem all that special.

UBE - The purple color makes this flavor look awesome but it really is a very subtle flavor and tastes like a nutty vanilla in my opinion. It looks better than it tastes.

WHITE PISTACHIO - I was hoping for a strong pistachio flavor but this flavor was heavy on the creamy side and not so much on the pistachio. It wasn't bad or anything, I just wish they put more pistachio in it.

AVOCADO - Imagine an avocado, milk, and sugar in a blender and that is exactly what this flavor tastes like. I would rate this flavor good if I liked eating avocado as dessert but I personally prefer them as a salty dish rather than a sweet one.

GREEN TEA - I have never seen this flavor in the store by the scoop. I only tried it out of the pre-packed half-gallon tub. I like my green tea ice cream with a strong tea flavor, not overwhelmed by the cream and not too sweet. Mitchell's isn't as good as the Maeda-en Japanese branded one but it is certainly much better than the Häagen-Dazs one that you find by the pint in the freezer section, which is way too creamy, and lacking with the green tea flavor.

BAD:

CHOCOLATE - It was a surprise that such a basic flavor could be so blah. Their chocolate was very uninspiring and tasted no better than the chocolate out of a carton of Dreyer's.

CONCLUSION: If you are an ice cream purist and care about freshness, texture and consistency, this is the place to go. Mitchell's might not have better flavors than Bi-Rite or Humphrey Slocombe, but they have better ice cream.
author: Alex P.

description:
Best ice cream shop I've ever been to. Their ice cream is so creamy and the variety is awesome. Ube, Claire's Pie, coffee,...I love them all. My wife's fav is the Mexican Chocolate. Skepitcal at first but highly addictave after the first lick! 

Parking in the rear. Also, there's virtually no sitting area (with the exception of 2 benches in the front), but they have to-go containers so all good:)  When it comes down to it, you want ice cream and theirs really is the best.
author: Justin H.

description:
Everytime I come here, I don't even bother with most of their tropical flavors (ie. Ube, halo-halo, langka, mango, macapuno, etc).  I can just buy that stuff at Pacific Super! But one tropical flavor caught my eye. LUCUMA! 
What is lucuma? Well according to Mitchell's description, its a Peruvian fruit. I remembered Daniel L's review and decided to try it. OMFG, it was soooo delicious!! Not sweet at all. It had a very subtle flavor and its very hard to describe. First it reminded me of mocha, then caramel, then coffee, then something nutty, then.... I dunno how to describe it but it just had a very unique flavor. According to Wikipedia, "The lucuma has particularly dry flesh which possesses a unique flavor of maple and sweet potato." Okay, MAPLE is the word I'm looking for! Highly recommended! Don't forget to sample it if you're ever at Mitchells.

My friends and I came on a good day. It wasn't too crowded and we only waited for about 5 minutes. No line at all! If you don't feel like waiting for your number to be called, you can buy a half gallon for $9.25. If you don't feel like driving out to the Mission, then go to Mollie Stones or Pacific Super. They also sell Mitchell's ice cream. Just sayin. 

I think I love you Lucuma ice cream. I should have bought a gallon of you while I was there...til next time...
author: B B.

description:
Damn you, Mitchell's for forever ruining my ice cream experience elsewhere.  

I wanted to try to the Mexican Chocolate, but they ran out.  I went with the Chocolate.  I usually hate plain Chocolate ice cream.  Mitchell's Chocolate is absolutely divine.  Not too sweet, not too creamy.  It was heaven.
author: liza m.

description: Banana ice cream dipped in chocolate all day!!!
author: Josh E.

description:
UBE UBE UBE UBE UBE UBE!!!

That's really all that was going through my mind while I was waiting in line. I usually don't have a sweet tooth and don't finish more than one scoop of ice cream, but since I wanted two flavors I was obligated to get a double...I ate everything!!  I love their ube, so creamy and delicious.  Had their white pistachio and that was also pretty delicious!  

I should just buy the big tub of ube next time....
author: Jane N.

description: The best, old-school, down to earth ice cream spot in San Francisco! My favorite is the avocado ice cream.
author: J C.

description:
This place offers some serious flavor offerings! From, This place offers not only your traditional ice cream flavors, but also sorbet, sherbet, tropical flavors, and a variety of cones, shakes, and cakes as well. 

I give it 5 stars, not only because of the excellent variety of choices, but also that those choices actually tasted great! Although, I wasn't daring enough to try the avocado-flavored ice cream, I ended up with an Oreo Craze milkshake that was absolutely delicious. I would recommend getting the small though, because the large was WAY to big for me, especially for a post-dinner dessert. 

If you haven't been here, go. If you have been here, you will come back.
author: Thomas A.

description:
I think I've found the perfect ice cream.  Yes, BiRite & Humphry Slocombe have unique flavors... but Mitchell's Ice Cream has perfected the simple flavors, and then some. 

Their Ube ice cream is a must try, but it's not for everyone.  I really liked Claire's pie! But alas, the BF decided on Ube & custard based off a fellow Yelper's review (not a bad decision... but next time I want my Claire's pie!)

What makes Mitchell's so good? The texture of the ice cream is how I believe ice cream should be.  Creamy and thick and doesn't melt 10seconds after purchase. lol.  We got a double scoop, and that was more than enough ice cream for the both of us.

I like their system of taking a number and just hanging out (not in line!)  until your number is called.

They also have a small private lot behind the shoppe, so if you're lucky enough to grab a spot like we were, congrats!
author: Roxanne K.

description:
Four score and seventy minutes ago, I (forefathers optional for spicing up the story if you'd like) went to Mitchell's Ice Cream for the very first of times. Twas a lovely San Franciscan eve, and the parlour was hopping. I took a number, and waited as they called numbers over some new-fangled voice projector. 

As my number neared, I felt unsure of which, among the many conventional and unusual flavors, to choose. After testing some strange yet delicious mix of tropical items and well as a sample of 'purple yam,' I settled upon my old stand-by peanut butter chocolate (which I used to eat as a snack after walking home uphill from school in the freezing cold, accompanied by none other than my faithful sheep dog Earl.) 

Twas delicious, as was the Mexican Chocolate of my friend. The gentilhommes attending to the counter were a pleasure to chat with, and we shared a tete-a-tete about Ninja Turtles. 

To top it off - the theoretical cherry if you will - the dessert was quite reasonable. I will save my remaining tuppence to return for more ice cream.

And so, I have founded a mission, based on the principles of liberty, justice, and deliciousness, to return to Mitchell's, to return their often, and to try their most delicious-looking, choose-your-own-flavor cookie sandwiches.
author: Hannah R.

description:
Mitchell's is okay. A bit overhyped, but alright. 

For starters, their ice cream is HEAVY-Y-Y. I read in an article that Mitchell's uses the most amount of butterfat than any other ice cream place in the city. Mitchell's at 16%, Humphry Slocombe and Bi-rite, who use milk from Marin's Strauss Family Creamery, is at 14%, and Three Twins, who make their own, also at 14%. So be prepared to feel the full effects of food coma/sugar overload. 

What I love about Mitchell's though, is their selection of tropical and Asian flavors. Either I haven't explored far enough into the Sunset, or it just plain doesn't exist, I don't know of anywhere else in the city, I can find Ube, Halo Halo, Lucuma, or Jackfruit flavored ice cream. So, props to variety! Also, you get larger scoops here than any of the aforementioned ice cream places in the city. So, double props to cost and portions!

Still though, maybe it's just me, since a large majority of reviewers absolutely love this place, I'm just not sold. I'll probably get some heat for this, but bring it on! I didn't like how heavy or overly sweet the ice cream was, or the fact that I had to take a number before I ordered, like I was ordering a piece of meat from the butcher. Their menu is largely, very traditional, and unimaginative. For me, I like the trend where ice cream places like Humphry Slocombe, Bi-rite, and Three Twins, are going in, with their unique ice cream flavors, and I'd rather go to any of these three places over Mitchell's any day.
author: Ray W.

description:
i have read before that the ube ice cream here was the "one to get", "the best"...well, without tasting it, i took home a pint of it along with a scoop of avocado on a cake cone (if you didn't know what my background is, i laid it out there with the simple choice of these two flavors). the avocado was okay - i'm no avocado ice cream connosuer, but i have to say that the milk was definitely more present than the avocado flavor. the ube is the cause of my star rating, which did not live up to the hype - i think it was a combination of the high expectations i had from the raving reviews i read and the fact that i grew up on this ice cream, so i have a taste for this flavor and know what makes it so good.

overall, mitchell's is a san francisco staple, which i can respect and am proud to have in our city, but i would not say they have THE best ice cream, at least not for these flavors.
author: Marjie T.

description:
The ice cream is so smooth and creamy.  I tried a flavor I'd never had before: Lucuma.  It's my new favorite...

even though I'm lactose sensitive and shouldn't be eating ice cream to begin with.
author: Hester B.

description:
How can you NOT love this place?? It's my all time favorite for good solid ice cream. Creamy, great consistenty with bursting flavors! Sure there's the other hot spots like bi-rite and Humphrey slocombe but this place is my default and cannot get tired of it! Always a line even on a cold foggy day in sf! My all time favorite is Avocado. I generally don't like the real thing except in guacamole and ice cream!
I've grown up with mitchells. My dad turned me onto the avocado and ube when I was young and have LOVED 
it ever since!
author: MiSa S.

description: Mitchell's has become the default post-dinner venue to go whenever my friends from out of town visit. They have so many unique flavors. My favorite is definitely ube. When I first discovered ube, I bought a half gallon and ate it every night for a month (and this is during winter). Avocado, Halo-halo and Buko are pretty good too. Langka is another good one but they don't sell it a-la-carte anymore. Mitchell's!! Please bring back Langka!!
author: Wayne T.

description:
In the never-ending dilemma between going to class and going to Mitchell's, ice cream always seems to trump academics/grade/the future. 

Yeah, that's right. I cut class to get my daily dose of grasshopper pie.
author: Annie L.

description:
Avacado Rocks!
Macapuno is Yummy!
Halo-Halo is excellent!

Lines get long even on rainy days! Don't forget to get your number!!
author: Erika G.

description:
Eh.  The ice cream is frankly, too thick and too gooey (probably as a consequence of all the random gums and additives), and the flavor we had (Mexican Chocolate) was nothing special.  

Yes, I know we should have had one of the tropical flavors, but the line was so long we just bought a pre-packed package and got out fast.  And frankly, it was sufficiently disappointing that we never mustered up the urge to go back, despite living around the corner.
author: William B.

description:
I'm in love.... Wow Mitchell's Ice Cream is the best. Don't let the line out the door scare you because it is definitely worth the wait plus the wait isn't that long. You can just tell the ice cream is made with passion and love. The first taste is utter happiness the way ice cream should taste. Mitchell's has so many flavors and toppings and best of all... It is so inexpensive!

I highly recommend getting your ticket stub the moment you get there. My group and I assumed there was a line and you just waited so we lost about 10 minutes. But when they call your number you feel like you just won the golden ticket.
author: Stacy O.

description: Lemme just say there's a reason this place is full almost 24/7 from closing to opening. Firstly the ice cream selection is amazing. You'll be hard pressed to find more kinds of ice cream anywhere else in SF. Secondly, the quality of the ice cream itself is sooooo good. Heck, the ice cream is good period. It's a little out of the way, but in San Francisco it's become as good as a restaurant where you can take your family out in the car for some Mitchell's ice cream. I only wish they expanded the building to hire more employees to meet with the huge demand. Usually the room is mondo full. It's a little small for its needs. Other than that, I wish I could give this place 10 stars.
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
My husband and I have been here a few times. We enjoy Mitchell's, but it's not our favorite place for ice cream in the city.

Pros:

*It does have its share of unique flavors, and it has a greater number of standard flavors than the more hipster places in the city.

*If you like ice cream that's sweet and extremely creamy, then this is your place!

Cons:

*After eating about half of a small serving, I feel like I've had a sugar and cream overdose--it ends up being a little too much for me (and I love ice cream).

But it's good until that point.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Dulce de Leche, Thin-mint, and Ube. Soooo great! In a cup or a cone--you can't go wrong! You have to check this place out! 'Nough said.
author: Kevin H.

description:
If I had more thumbs, I'd give it a million ups!!

Soooo, I couldn't decide whether to get Fro-yo or Ice Cream for dessert.  I think it took me about an hour to figure it out.  Shoot, ice cream it is!!!!

Every time I go here, this place is ALWAYS ALWAYS Cracka-lackin-dingdong--even on a freakin' cold ass night!  Gaaah, I thought I was crazy!  NO ONE CAN RESIST!!!!  What do they put in their ingredients!??!!  Hmm, one must wonder!  Sooooo delish!

Decided to hit up the Thai Tea Ice Cream.  My favorite--two in one!!  Ally-oop!!!!  

I'll probably stop by here even in a thunder storm or an earthquake!  No weather or natural disaster can keep me away from this place!
author: MaryGrace V.

description: Mitchell's is thee best ice cream in San Francisco. I have been coming here since I was a kid and can't wait to take my kids one day.
author: Daisy D.

description:
So far, the best ice cream I've had in SF.

Be sure to 'dip it'!
author: Oren F.

description:
Mitchell's rocks my socks! I especially like the mango ice cream.

The best part? When you take your ice cream out of the freezer it's always ready to scoop. Super smooth. The perfect consistency. Never breaks your wrist like other brands!

Note: You can skip the long line if you buy one of their pre-packaged ice creams (I usually get the half-gallon, but I assume they have gallon cartons?)
author: Jennifer P.

description:
I think I was drunk on ice cream before ordering...just note that pricing is PER scoop! Found out about the fact that my double scoop halo halo with sugar cone was $5 after ordering :-/. 

Very delicious though! The biscotte ice cream was very good too. I love that they have tons of prepacked ice cream ready to go with a separate prepacked line. 

The take-a-numbering system works, especially for friends who are coming later which you can take numbers for them ahead of time. 

Dating secret: One can pick up a number and give it to a beautiful/kind lady who deserves it when she least expects it, especially if you have #30 when the current ticket is up to #65!
author: Kenny L.

description: I grew up eating Mitchell's! I wouldn't really understand what was going on when my dad packed us in his '78 Thunderbird (yeah, with the vinyl top) and we'd head over to pick up a 1/2 gallon. A must for all you craving the Filipino flavors! Good family times! I even remember taking some dates here too... haha...
author: Christine P.

description: i LOOOOOOVE YOU MITCHELLS! you are the ice cream that fills my desert-ridden dreams! My favorites are the fruit ice creams. They taste so fresh and homemade YUM. I love the ube, coconut (young and old), and banana! The parking here really sucks though. I've always had to park a block away which is a small price to pay. There's nowhere to sit down and really eat either (they have one table inside the store and 2 benches outside). Once you get there, you have to get a number so don't be a dummy and just stand there waiting for your turn . Grab a number!!
author: Sarah N.

description:
Update 2/3/11:  Have been back for Mexican Chocolate a few times.  Decided tonight to go with a basic flavor, Chocolate Chip.  It's hard to get disappointed with pretty much anything Mitchell's does, but I was mildly disappointed in this flavor.  Wonderful vanilla, and tasty chocolate chips -- there just weren't enough of them.  This was Vanilla with a Few Chocolate Chips.  Next time: Biscotti.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update 1/12/11:  Espresso Toffee Crunch:  another AWESOME flavor!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
And I thought the only places to go for ice cream in SF were Bi-Rite and Humphry Slocombe -- no!  My dear friend from San Rafael told me about this place called Mitchell's.  Wha...?!  I lived here '89-'91, and have now been back for the past year and I had never heard of them!  Where did I go wrong?  Well, gotta tell ya, folks -- this place is all WIN for me, and that includes being superior over the other two I mentioned above.  I guess I'm the kind of guy who doesn't necessarily want the basic chocolate or vanilla, but also doesn't want the other extreme of funky flavors that the two others offer.  Mitchell's is in between, with SANE, clever flavors and absolutely delicious ice cream.  It's only been Mexican Chocolate so far, which is AMAZING (creamy dark chocolate & lots of cinnamon -- what a concept!), but I will definitely be trying lots of others.
author: Merrick W.

description: I like the Ice Cream here. Not the best I've ever had but up there. I had the Taro/Ube flavor, whatever you call it. It was creamy and delicious. You walk in and have to take a number like at the DMV and they call your number to serve you. Sat on the bench outside and ate and chilled. Good stuff. Unique flavors is always a plus for me. Something new to try.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
We make it a point to come here when we're out and about with the family in SF!
From classic flavors to tropical and everything in between they have it. 
My favorite is the Ube(purple yam) ice cream.  My wife loves their Peanut Butter Indulgence(pb/choco).  They also make Ice Cream sandwiches with Cookies(a la It's It) and Shakes!
i already know what I'm having next time.....Mexican Chocolate!
Long lines at times, but it's worth the wait.
author: Dave M.

description: This Ice cream rivals that of Bi-Rite in the city. Since it is located slightly farther in Noe Valley, this place is great when you find it on a random street. They operate on a first come first serve ticket system so get your ticket early because there will always be a line. The flavors and texture of the ice cream are maximized to the fullest enriching your mouth and taste buds with a full on satisfied thick tasting ice cream. I highly recommend the lavender and young coconut flavors. Also the purple yam flavored ice cream may look intimidating but it is in fact a delightful surprise of goodness.
author: Patrick W.

description:
Can't say that I had to wait 45 minutes in line for some ice cream before. On a weeknight I would like to add. Luckily that wait was with some pretty cool Yelpers. 

I got a gift card good for a scoop of ice cream and picked the toasted almond. It was pretty good alhough I'm still a bigger fan of Fenton's back on my side of the bay. 

Pretty good ice cream overall and it was good to check out one of my bookmarks.
author: Darryl P.

description:
The ice cream here is so good, I once bought a foam cooler and ice from the Safeway down the street, grabbed three 1/2 gallons, and drove em down to LA with me.  So what if they didn't make it down completely frozen? That's Mitchell's love, baby. 

We have to pass by here every time we're up in the area.  The ube, taro and mango: To. Die. For.

Forget whatever diet you're on.  Come here, order to your heart's content, and let your taste buds go.
author: Jimmy N.

description:
I once had a goal to eat every flavor at Mitchell's.  I determined that, if I went every night and got my usual double scoop on a waffle cone, it would only take me about 20 days.

And then I decided that perhaps baggy pajama pants weren't fashionable enough for daytime, so I stopped coming here every night.  Damn you, skinny jeans.

I love the simplicity of Mitchell's and the friendly, kind, unhurried people who work here and happily let you sample to your hearts content.  I love the old fashioned feel and the variety of flavors (Italian Fig, Jackfruit, two kinds of coconut!).  I haven't had a flavor I didn't like and their waffle cones are delish.  Mitchell's has a real neighborhood feel and the crowd of folks that joyfully gather are a multi-national quilt of many colors.  I love that.

Their ice cream cakes are also to die for.  I got one for my daughter's birthday and it was a hit.
author: Amanda R.

description: Visiting with my wife in SF and she recommended this place. All I can say is ... OH. MY. GOD.
author: Danny S.

description:
My favorite ice cream place!  I can't believe I didn't write a review sooner!  I've been coming here since I was a little girl and the quality hasn't changed.  I don't understand what the big hype is on Bi-rite; I would choose Mitchell's ice cream any day.  I love the variety of flavors and how it's richer and creamier than other ice creams.  It's absolutely delicious!  

If you live in the bay area and haven't been here yet or you are visiting San Francisco, you should definitely stop by and get a scoop, or an ice cream sandwich, or a hand-packed pint...or be a fatty like me and get all three.
author: Sandy J.

description:
Love the grasshopper ice cream!! best mint ice cream ever --- oreos, choc fudge and chips.

also love how much variety they have here. 

Also like that they have a number system like a deli! So you can walk around or stand outside while you wait for your number to be called.
author: Shivani S.

description: long lines but goes fast enough. On any of those really rare hot days, prepare to wait. Or, skip the wait and just go to any grocery store and pick up a tub! It's delicious - no regrets!
author: Cecilia B.

description:
Mitchell's slogan should be "Rain, sleet or snow - there will always be a line."  And with good reason, there are so many options, it takes me the full half hour wait to figure out what flavors to get on my double scoop sugar cone.  More often than not, I go for buko and ube.  The Buko is baby coconut with gelatinous strips of baby coconut.  The ube has nice bits of purple yum for texture.  The ice creams are on the sweet side but well worth the wait.  

Little known fact:  Mitchell's was started by a former SF firefighter.  My dream man.
author: Monica L.

description:
Really great old-fashioned ice cream.  Super-duper creamalicious texture with each bite packed with intense flavor.  All-Time greats include Rum Raisin, Mexican Chocolate and Sweet Coconut.

Mitchell's...Out-of-this world classic-style ice cream with the down-to-earth price. Checkity-check it out.
author: Justin L.

description:
So the ice cream here is really good! The only flavors I wouldn't go for are for the minty ice creams, because they taste kind of like listerine, but then again most minty ice creams ice creams do.
