Most of the people that work there give a decent portion, but once in awhile there will be that one person that will give you a ridiculously small amount. 
If youre in the mood for something light and fruity, I suggest the pear sorbet when they have it. It's refreshing and has bits of actual pear.
One more thing, if you're craving an ice cream on a cold day, I say this is the best place to go because there is no line unlike most other days, when it's crazy full
author: Viviana M.

description:
I had the Ube and sweet coconut, Ube was good and different taste at the same time, I actually like the texture of the Ube better then the sweet coconut ,I tried the Grasshopper and that was really good and seemed to have a better texture.....I would probably get that next time. 
Overall it was honestly a little to creamy and melted really fast.
author: Michael S.

description:
SERIOUSLY, heed the reviews and go here. 

My date took me here and I gave him about a thousand brownie points for this one. Line was HUMONGOUS on Saturday evening around 8ish, which was kind of ridiculous...but it was oh so worth it. 

Sweet, decadent ice cream at the perfect temperature of coolness with the perfect creamy consistency. It was SO GOOD. SO SO SO GOOD. Although I don't know what it was called, our ice cream had a caramel swirl (amazing) and candied walnuts. I am a SUCKER for candied walnuts. Those things damn well got me. Seriously, I was crying tears of joy as I ate it. It was just that good.

Now, I don't live in San Francisco, so now I'm going to have to go back just to eat ice cream. FML.

As my date said..."Oops, now we've ruined regular ice cream for you..."
author: M K.

description:
After our little detour to Benkyodo (http://www.yelp.com/biz/benkyodo-co-san-francisco#hrid:y3_n-BGh6V0JidhMt4u8eA/src:self), we made our way to San Francisco's famous Mitchell's (no not the other "famous" Mitchell's on Larkin and O'Farrell).

Even on a cool and windy afternoon, this place still attracts a crowd, though not as crowded as in the Summer.  Along with the original Swensen's Ice Cream location on Union St and Hyde St., and St. Francis Fountain in Potrero Hill, Mitchell's is San Francisco ice cream landmark, known for their variety of flavors, especially the tropical ones.  I can't count the many times I've been here while growing up in San Francisco.  Yes, one can buy a half gallon of their ice cream in some of the local supermarkets, but there's nothing like enjoying a scoop on location.

We ordered:
-Chocolate Chip:  Kid scoop for the youngest
-Strawberries and Cream: regular scoop for the oldest
-Caramel Praline: regular scoop for the SO
-Rum Raisin and Tropical Four (pineapple, mango, banana, and guava): double scoop in a waffle cone for yours truly.

Even with a crowd, the servers are efficient, and the wait for your number is short.  Not much I can add from 1400 other Yelpers, but the ice cream is as good as always.

When it comes to ice cream, candies, and cookies, the kids know, Daddy knows best (http://static3.px.yelpcdn.com/photo/uvnRC-oW3Kow_w9K9RFUcQ/l).
author: Steve L.

description: I was passing through the city and had a craving for some ice cream. I heard great things about this place so I decided to go with my husband. It was fantastic ice cream. Great tasting flavors and a nice staff. I suggest people go and try this place.
author: Rikki N.

description:
No matter what time it is, no matter what the weather, there are always people in this ice cream shop. There aren't any seats - In fact, there isn't much room inside at all. The only seating consists of two small benches outside. But there are always people here!

I like their tropical flavors. Avocado is great! It might sound disgusting but I assure you it's a surprisingly nice treat. JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Got my ice cream fix when I was meeting up with some people for dinner in the city and I must say, this place is quite popular with kids and adults alike! Mitchell's has a wide variety of flavors ranging from traditional to fruity to exotic and the workers are super nice about letting you try the different flavors.  For me,  I love fruit based ice cream and the young coconut and lanka ice cream here totally hit the spot. Friendly service and delicious ice cream all at an affordable price?! You can bet your money I'll be back the next time I'm in the area!
author: Joanna Q.

description:
Halo Halo = insanity (the good kind)

True, our beloved bay area has so many DELICIOUS soy, vegan, etc. options in icy desserts, but OHHHH,
OHHHH. A couple bites of real, fatty, creamy, ice cream is the simplest form of heaven.

Real halo-halo is better, but they do a great job on all flavors.
author: Randy Y.

description: I stand in a long line for the mexican chocolate ice cream.  I've tried at least half of the flavors and IMO the mexican chocolate is the only flavor worth a wait.  Mexican choco rates 5 stars on its own but the non-memorable taste of other flavors brings the final score to 3 stars.
author: Lola D.

description:
What's left to say about this place that everybody else hasn't mentioned!??!  Mitchell's is an all-time local favorite!  It's been around forever, and is now finally getting the recognition that it has so long deserved.  Long line of people, fog or even rainy weather, under construction, parking problems... none of these deterrents have prevented customers, near OR far, from still coming to the store for their tropical flavored ice creams.  They have all different types of flavors to please even the most finicky.  

My favorite is coconut pineapple and canteloupe.  Canteloupe is a seasonal flavor, so I make sure to visit more often when it is in season.  If you prefer not to wait in line, you can buy a gallon of their most ordered flavors at their Express Checkout line.  

Regarding the wait in line, my suggestion is to drive by, pick up a number, look for parking, then head back to the shop so you can kill plenty of time before your number is called!  

I love Mitchell's!!!! :)
author: Joy A.

description:
Holy mother of all ice creams, I have found a place worthy for my 200th review!

My two favorites fused into one--ice cream, and exotic fruit flavors! Mitchell's serves a variety of flavors from the typical vanilla and chocolate and even then they have their own spin on classic flavors...but forget that. I'm here for the avocado flavored ice cream! I am also happy to say that on a quiet week day afternoon, the crowd wasn't bad at all. There was a small line, but it only took a few minutes to get our ice cream. AND THEY HAVE A PARKING LOT! Yes, it may be small..but it's something! Way better than a crowded street in mission district or something.

We sampled a few flavors and the two it came down to were avocado and dulce de leche. The two surprisingly complimented each other very well too. The avocado was rich and creamy, but not too sweet. Very reminiscent of vietnamese avocado smoothies...dare I say tastier. Junior scoops are $1.80 and single scoops are $2.50 which I find a steal! My single scoop looked more like a double scoop. Will definitely come back for more!
author: Stine H.

description:
Says the USPS on mail: "Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds".

Says Valerie, on an ice cream run: "Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night stays I from the swift consumption of Mitchells ice cream." 

I mean, seriously. If theres a perpetual line outside an ice cream shop--in mild-weathered San Francisco, nonetheless--then you know its worth braving the elements for!
author: Valerie C.

description: Best ice cream i've ever had. HANDS DOWN. It's creamy, flavorful and absolutely delicious! My favorites are the oreo cookie, caramel praline, cinnamon snap (seasonal), macapuno, pumpkin (seasonal) and peanut butter indulgence. It's worth the wait...ask to try them all when they call your number! The cinnamon snap/pumpkin combo is the best fall treat!
author: Karmen H.

description:
Love this place, opens late, great selection of flavors, maybe the 5 stars i give it are from my love of sweets...

a VERY small private lot that you enter from the side, but street parking is usually plentiful without much searching.

lines can be a bit long, but grab a number! and choose your ice cream, by the time you're done thinking about it, it'll be your turn to order in no time.
author: Calvin T.

description: Be prepared to wait in line, for a while. I'm not exactly sure why this place is so popular. They have a pretty good selection of exotic flavors, but I didn't think they were particularly well crafted. I had the halo halo with the beans, jellies, etc added in. It was a bit too sweet for me and I didn't like it all that much. I would give it another chance and try their other flavors, since they offer so many options.
author: Alice W.

description:
Mitchell's is hella good! LMAO Couldn't think of a word that fit more perfectly! =) Its creamy, smooth, perfectly flavored and umm umm good.
I've enjoyed toasted almond and caramel parline (I think thats how you spell it idk =p) and have yet to be disappointed! I like the 1 scoop sundae trade peanuts for almonds, caramel, whipped cream and a cherry on top! Now your talking ice cream, just make sure they dont over do it with caramel or any topping, taking away from the flavorful perfectly blended ice cream..! In SF a must try, parking can be a chore.
author: Rae W.

description:
Lots of standard flavors like vanilla, chocolate, strawberry....I like the not-so-standard like Peruvian fruit, and it's pretty good, not too sweet just how I like my ice cream..  

Small parking lot in the back, we got lucky to find a parking right away.  This place is packed even late at night.   It's cool how customers are asked to grab a number, and then they call you up by number.  You can take all the time you want to sample and pick out the flavors, so everyone is served without much rush, and there's no one standing behind you in line trying to hurry your way through.

Mitchellize your refrigerator by purchasing their ice cream tub or cakes.  Go ahead and indulge...  it's gooooood....
author: Tadaa T.

description:
3 Scoop Banana Splits, $8.95!
This is a bigass banana splits.
It looked really good.
I was watching that there was a girl ordered it right front of me.
I wasn't watching the girl.
I was watching the bigass banana splits.
I am not a pervert But I might look it.

I was watching the bigass banana splits.
She got a small ass.
Checked.

2 Scoop Banana Splits, $6.95!
Ummmmm.

1 scoop, 2 girls?

This is hard.

Purple Yam?

Single on a plain cone, $2.60
I had to try purple yam because I've never had that before.
yummy yam! 
It was really good.
it made my mouth and tongue very purple.
I looked like the Joker.

I'll be back for the bigass banana splits.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Great selection of ice creams and frozen delicacies. 

The best thing about Mitchell's is having to take a number and wait in line along with everyone else anticipating.

Check out the Mexican Chocolate flavor - loaded with cinnamon.
author: J T.

description:
Definitely a hot spot for San Franciscan locals, before Mitchells existed, there was actually a Dairy Farm built on that property O_o strange huh? 

Well, I like to come here with friends or family for a nice after dinner/party treat. There is so much variety in the ice cream flavors! I love getting the Ube and Halo-Halo flavor (taste comes close to the original Filipino treats :-)) All ice cream lovers should have the opportunity to check this place out! I would like to also add that this place is a tiny shack (so consider this if you're claustrophobic).

The only negative thing that I observe is that the workers always seem to be in a bad mood, as if they hate their jobs. I mean what's there to hate? You're in ice cream land...I'd be happy as hell. But thinking realistically, I guess scooping ice cream for hours will not always be butterflies and unicorns :(. Oh well haha!
author: Clementine D.

description: The best ice cream shop. Yes, the line is long but it's worth it mostly b/c it keeps me from going everyday which I would if there were no line. So in my eyes the line is a blessing lol. Skip the line and buy a gallon of grasshopper pie. Or stay in line and try a bunch of different flavors. My faves Claire's pie, halo halo, mango, ube, Mexican chocolate, Kahula, Mocha, seasonal flavors like pumpkin. Basically anything. Delish and quintessential SF.
author: Cheryl C.

description:
Couldn't resist their ice-cream...i had to do a second round and it hasn't even a week yet...

I was fighting my urge not to get my White Pistachio...i HAVE to try other flavors...

Tropical Four (Banana, Guava, Mango, Pineapple): YUMS! Strong flavors of banana and mango...I can even smell it! Not so much of guava and pineapple though... don't care for the pineapple too much but wish I can actually tasted the guava. There were bits of fruit pieces in it...I believe it was mango...I liked it. 5 stars. 

Strawberries n Cream: It was OK. It tasted like what it exactly is. Strawberry and Vanilla ice-cream together with chunks of frozen strawberries. It reminded me of McD's strawberry sundae. I only ordered this one as a backup in case I didn't like my adventurous choice of the Tropical Four. 4 stars.

Halo Halo (Buko aka Baby Coconut, Langka aka Jackfruit, Ube aka Sweet Yam, Pineapple, Mango & Sweet Beans): This one was interesting. It's got some of the purple exotic color from the Ube. The taste was not really explainable, but it's totally good. 5 stars.

Mango: I like this one. Definitely a tropical fruit flavor. It was total sweetness! It tasted as if I was eating a fresh mango from the Philippines! 5 stars. 

Oreo Cookie: This was really creamy, definitely got lotsa oreo flavor to it. It's not too sweet like how most places would make it. Chunks and bits of oreo cookie in almost every spoonful. Yums. 4 star.

Kahlua Mocha Cream: Very coffee-like flavor...aroma of it was delish. Not very sweet due to the kahlua part of it, but you can definitely taste a bit of mocha component in it as well. 4 stars. 

Thin Mint: Very similar to most mint chocolate chip ice-creams. VERY minty...not too mcuh chocolate chips though. It's rich and creamy as like the rest of the flavors are, but I still prefer this flavor from Baskin Robbins more. 4 stars.

There are plenty more flavors to try...I'm sure I'll update again! :)
author: Winnie L.

description: Hard to find parking grab number and then park so yoy don't have to wait very long
author: Kimberly B.

description:
Yum Yum. 

There's little to add to the voluminous reviews, other than the fact that: 

1. Mitchell's is worth the enormously long waits; 
2. I didn't hear a single complaint from the 100+ people that were served before me; and
3. The Grasshopper Pie is delicious. 

Be prepared for exceedingly long waits and delicious flavors.
author: Tom A.

description: I would love to give this place a 5 because the ice cream I had (mexican chocolate) was delicious - sandwiched between two chocolate chocolate-chip cookies.  However, minus one star for the service withOUT a smile from the woman who called my number, didn't hear me amongst the din, went on to the next number and then grimaced at me when she realized I was still there.  I'm pretty sure she would have spit in my ice cream if I weren't standing right there.
author: B. Y.

description: My favorite Ice cream!!! get waffle cone- dipped in chocolate!!! Line moves pretty fast too - def worth the wait!
author: Julie R.

description: I've always been a fan of Mitchell's.  It's funny when you mention Mitchell's Ice Cream everyone has there own specific flavor.  i love the ice cream here.  It's so good & truly worth the wait in line.  Pick a number or it'll take forever!  Grasshopper Pie is so yum! I'd wait 10 minutes if I have too for ice cream!
author: Angel G.

description: Tried their halo halo and that was amazing even for a cold day in the city.  I was able to sample a few of their ice cream but it was the halo halo that I fell in love with.  This place gets crazy packed!
author: Ryan L.

description: Horchata ice cream was awesome! They have tons of other unique flavors as well. Too bad this is so far from San Jose, or else this would probably be my go to ice cream stop.
author: Justin N.

description:
There's always room for ice cream!

Not that this place needs another review, so I just wanted to say that my favorite flavor here is banana ice cream dipped in chocolate. OH YES.

Tips: Not that close to a Bart station. But hey, the walk will relieve the guilt.
author: Dave L.

description:
I love their frozen custard. It reminds me of some I got in Florida a few years ago. Super creamy and kind of gooey. YUM!
The other flavors are great too.
author: Leigh S.

description: I grew up on this ice cream shop everything here is magnificient especially the pralines and cream.
author: Chris M.

description: If your from SF you have to know that mitchells is one of the best ice creams in the city! Its well worth the wait. I love their seasonal flavors like egg nog and pumpkin.
author: Michael W.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for Filipino Ice Cream!  I'm all about Ube Macapuno & Avocado Ice Cream.

Gotta patronize mom and pop spots like this.  The delicious ice cream is just a plus!

I was happy to see this joint on the foodnetwork too.
author: Earlene C.

description: As much as I love all the fancy ice cream here in SF, Mitchells is old school ice cream at it's finest. I want to give it five stars for that alone, but sometimes it can be hit or miss. Some of their flavors are amazing, but there are definitely some that do not make the grade. Just get samples and find what you like! My favorite is definitely the Horchata, and they make a killer milkshake.
author: Joshua B.

description: They don't have an allergen list available, and the staff didn't know how to answer allergen questions. However, my friends tell me that their ice cream is high quality.
author: Hailey W.

description:
Yum! The ice cream at Mitchell's is so creamy. Whenever I come here, I'm always tempted to buy a larger size to go for when I'm at home, but my guilty conscience always says NO, so I settle for a pint. I wish they had a location on the peninsula, because then I'd be here all the time. Er, maybe it's good they don't have a location on the peninsula, because then I'd see the pounds start to pile on. 

5
10
15 
20 

:P
author: Amy D.

description:
We hit Mitchell's first in the Ice Cream Walk of the Damned

Ice Cream Texture : 5/5.  Tons of milkfat, lovely creamy texture, not watery at all.
Flavor Variety : 5/5.  Many flavors, almost all good (perhaps 10% are not stellar?).  The monthly flavors can be hit or miss.  The tropical fruit flavors are all delicious, and even the standards like vanilla are well done. 
Customers : A mix of people from all walks of life, heavy on Filipinos and latino families.
Strengths :  Tropical flavors, high butterfat content, not overly sweet.
Cons: Long lines, but worth it.
author: Dave S.

description: Delicious. The ice cream isn't too sweet and is perfectly creamy. The grasshopper is so delicious, and the chocolate chip is perfectly proportioned. When my friends and I ordered, we though the pistachios were ground and mixed in with the ice cream. But it wasn't. I personally think that the cold and wetness of the ice cream take the crunch and crispiness of the pistachios away. But I'm sure there will be people who disagree.
author: Stacy C.

description: This is my mam and dad's frozen delight Disneyland. They drive to and fro the central valley - with cooler and dry ice in tow - to get tubs of ube, mango, and langka ice cream. So yes, they have an extra freezer at home just for their Mitchell's treats.
author: Aurora A.

description:
Mitchells is currently offering (as of today, 3/25/10) an AMAZING new flavor: Chocolate Orange Swirl. You MUST order this flavor. Smooth chocolate ice cream swirled with deliciously sweet candied orange.

This tastes like one of those Chocolate oranges that are pre-cut into wedges. I think they sell them at Cost Plus.

Regardless, TRY this flavor!
author: Sara D.

description: Mango ice cream FTW!
author: Mika D.

description:
I was hecka craving salted caramel from bi rite...but had no idea they were closed...I was so disappointed...but thank god for Mitchell's!

We stopped by and I got a scoop of banana ice cream on a sugar cone...it was so creamy and delicious and not overly sweet....

that was one damn good ice cream cone!
author: Jade B.

description:
Purple yam, mango, coconut--fucking yum!
A+
Need to go again so I can try more flavors
author: Du D.

description: My first yelp review!  I only had a scoop of black walnut and it was unforgettable!  It was perfectly sweet and nutty and will definitely be back for more next time. My friend had Oreo cookie and she kept thinking about it next day too.
author: mle K.

description:
I have been going here for 20+ years and this has to be my favorite icecream joint.  Rain or shine you can always count in waiting in line with the exception of purchasing already made half gallon of your choice of flavor)  Mitchell's sticks with what works- you got your typical flavors, mint, choc, straw, mix of tropical flavors especially Filipino likings, (ube, lanka, and MANGO)!!!

Mango is the original flavor and makes what MItchell's is today.  So flavorful, not too creamy, and just taste oh so fantastic.  

Come during the fall season and try their Pumpkin flavor.  It's delish!
author: Victoria M.

description: Really nice creamy ice creams with unapologetic, in your face flavors without all the foofy fancy add ons other places have.  And you know what?  They don't need all that froofy stuff.  I love their handling of fruity flavors (the cantaloupe really did tasted like a fresh cantaloupe in my mouth), in particular the citrusy yuzu.  Personally, I stray towards fruitier flavors and away from more decadent flavors, so I'd judge the fruity ones more harshly since I know a good fruit ice cream.  This place does fruity ice creams well, they seem to use real fruit (if they didn't I'd be surprised).  They're very gracious, willing to let you sample as much as needed until you are confident enough to order.  Also, I love the usage of traditional Asian (particularily Filipino) flavors in their ice creams.  Very unique and definitely a wake up call for your taste buds in what good ice cream should be.
author: Christine W.

description: I love ice cream! But I don't understand why people wait close to an hour for ice cream that is mediocre at best.
author: Rich_kids_of_yelp Z.

description: Umm, YUM. I love this place!! I live right next to birite yet I venture out to Mitchell's. well, firstly, they serve different taste buds. Birite is for he adventurous folk who want to try a new experimental flavor and love following New York Time and Michelin ratings. Mitchell's is your corner icecream store, with a humongous line with hundreds of exquisite flavors and no place to stand. Grasshopper pie is definitely my favorite. Ask for the waffle cone. Tip well!! I'm a chocolate and coffee fan so this place works wonders for me. And mango when I'm feeling fruity!
author: Aabhas S.

description:
You still have to take a number even when it's cold outside, so you know it's good!
Mexican Chocolate flavor, Cheesecake flavor,and Sundaes are an excellent way to gain weight and feel good about it ;)
"Beef C." is right, they've got a special window for the quart purchases so you can bypass the line, that is, if you're okay with the fact that you'll eat a quart.
author: Nikki M.

description:
I've never had too much trouble finding parking at Mitchell's or had to wait more than 5 minutes at Mitchell's : )

I'm always overwhelmed by the variety of flavors.... I'm an In-N-Out/Hot Dog on a Stick menu kinda gal.....but Mitchell's had me at pumpkin, avocado, thai tea, mexican chocolate and white pistachio!
author: Lori K.

description:
How many ways are there to say YUM!!! 
Even on a cold rainy night and full from the Front Porch there is still room for ice cream.
Take a number and wait your turn or for faster service grab a quart of ice cream and take it to go.
My choice is to get a single scoop in a cup and a sugar cone on top. Love the stuff but don't want it on me.
author: Lawrence T.

description:
Awesome ice cream.  Super good.  I like the puno and macapuno flavors the best.  Yummy Phillipino and American flavor ice creams.  Fruity flavors as well as classics.  I don't give ice cream places five stars easily, but this location clearly deserves it.  

I met one (I think it was in 1995 or 96) of the Mitchell family, Linda, and she is really nice.  She used to come to the photolab I worked at on Mission St. to get her photos printed.  I guess I would be happy if I worked at an awesome ice cream shop too.  The same family has owned this business for all these years, and that's so cool.  My family used to have a business in SF, but it failed, lol.

The employees are always nice too.  Sometimes it gets crowded here, but it's worth the wait.  I actually enjoy the wait and seeing happy faces just talking with their numbers in their hands.

If you go to the Mitchell's Ice Cream Website you can see some old photos.  Very cool.  I love photos of old San Francisco.  If you are in San Francisco and want ice cream, you should come here.  And that is a plain, simple, yet delicious fact.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
I tried Mitchell's for the first time today although I've heard so much about it from various people before.  Bottom Line: AM NOT IMPRESSED...maybe because I went there full of high expectations... I mean, this place is SOOOOO good, right?  So that's what everyone tells me.  

Line is out the door when we arrived.  Apparently, this is the norm. We got #62 and they were only on #48.  The good news is that the numbers do go very fast, so don't get impatient.  I ordered the Mango ice cream on a sugar cone.  OKay.....doesn't suck, but doesn't wow either.  It had bits of mango in it, but it doesn't taste like Mango.  Creamy...yes, but Mango, no.  Maybe I just got the wrong flavor??!   

Perhaps I will give this place another try if I'm in the neighborhood (which is rarely).  Otherwise, I rather stick to Rite Aid ice cream!
author: Jannie Q.

description: Best coconut pineapple ice cream i've ever had! So delicious, it is a must go if you're visiting San Francisco.
author: Adree A.

description: The ice cream is wonderfully flavorful and creamy!! They have great regular and seasonal flavors. I love to buy a carton to go whenever i'm around since I live in the east bay. They are not skimpy on cartons or scoops. It's well worth the price!!
author: Carrie Q.

description: Almond ice cream topped with hot fudge simply the BEST.
author: Alison F.

description:
pretty decent ice-cream at a high price. I applaud their attempt at trying to be a bit environmentally sensitive, slowly moving to corn based plastic-ware.

downsides: forced use of bleached paper bag to get  their pre-packaged ice-cream. This policy is so 1970's when folks did not realize the value of not using raw, virgin trees to make bags that most folks throw away. 

MAJOR COMPLAINT: NOT HAVING FOLKS LINE UP ALONGSIDE THEIR BUILDING AND PERPETUATING THE CONSTANT BLOCKING OF SIDEWALKS TO THE NEIGHBORS!! So self centered are the customers that they NEVER NOTICE folks lugging their groceries or laundry down the sidewalk. At Bi-Rite they are kind enough to respect their neighborhood and popularity and therefore announce to LINE UP and NOT BLOCK THE SIDEWALKS. can't you do the same, hell it's been more than 30 years! 
thanks!!
author: shanestar h.

description: I had almost forgotten how decadent this ice cream is! I picked up a couple different flavors to sample with the family and was amazed by how creamy and smooth the blueberry crumble and strawberry swirl flavors are.
author: Gloria D.

description:
How good is it? Quite rich!

Well it must've been good if I drove 45 minutes, spent 10 minutes looking for parking, waited about 25 minutes to be served and I'm willing to do it again. 

I tried their sweet coconut, young coconut, mango, jackfruit, and banana. I am really not ready to stray away from their tropical flavors. I find them so unique. In my opinion, their tropical flavors are what makes them stand out. Their flavors taste so fresh, natural, and clean. You can tell they put a lot of thought and care into making the ice cream. It's worth all the travel time and $2.50? for a scoop. Next time, I'm going to bring a cooler and dried ice to bring home one of their pre-packed buckets.

The only seating they have is a bench in front of their small shop. Also, a minimum 9 dollar credit card charge. P. S. grab a number by the door once you arrive and don't miss your number being called. They move on pretty fast.



Edit 02/26/2012

I LOVE LOVE LOVE THEIR MANGO TOPPING! YOU HAVE TO GET IT WITH THEIR BUKO OR MACAPUNO ICE CREAM, ESPECIALLY IF YOU LOVE THAI MANGO AND STICKY RICE DESSERT! 

The quality and flavors of their ice cream is always top notch and fresh.
author: Ashley T.

description: Been coming here since I was a kid, and it never fails. Love the butterscotch marble, it is sooo creamy and the butterscotch is the right blend of butter and brown sugar (not the syrupy, overly sweet excuse others call butterscotch). Try the milkshakes too. They also know how to keep the line moving, so it is never too long of a wait.
author: Gabby M.

description:
Delish. I only wish it was easier for me to get to.

Came here on one of the first sunny days post-rainy/windy spell and it was packed. Take a number as soon as you get there and don't get discouraged by the hoards of people. The line moves pretty quickly.

Ube (purple yam) seemed like a popular choice. I sometimes like ube flavored things, but I'm still not convinced about ube ice cream. I sampled the langka (jackfruit) because I LOOOVE jackfruit, but was disappointed. Not enough jackfruit so it tastes like nothing. Sad.

Also, halo halo (filipino shaved ice dessert made with sweetened milk, sweet beans and other fun tropical treats) ice cream sounds like a delicious idea, but no. No no. Something gets lost in the translation when you turn it into ice cream. Go get a heaping bowl of actual halo halo instead.

Since my two samples were a fail, I went with my backup - Espresso Toffee Crunch. YUM. Just the right amount of coffee and chocolate taste. loved the crunch of the toffee. Probably not wise before bedtime.
author: Karena Q.

description: omg they have the mexican chocolate ice cream here! i'm sold!! my friends love getting the halo halo here! my second fav is the white pistachio. but the good news is sometimes they have all the ice cream pre-packaged right near the register so you can grab it to go. they have parking right next to the store so you don't even have to worry!
author: Belinda C.

description:
Update review: 

The holiday season is truly upon us... now that Mitchell's pumpkin ice cream is back! I wait all year for this stuff. 

It tastes as if pumpkin pie and well... heavy cream had a baby. I don't waste time or calories on a cone; I get a giant scoop of this stuff in a cup and savor it with the little sampling spoon. Tastes like the holidays.
author: Wing Y.

description:
If ice cream were money, Mitchell's would be THE bank. This place is the quintessential San Franciscian Ice Cream Shop due to its ridiculous variety of flavors. Of course they have the basics like vanilla, chocolate, and strawberry, but they also have tropical flavors like Ube (Purple Yam), Macapuno (Young Coconut) and Halo Halo. Variety aside, the flavor and the consistency of the ice cream is PERFECT. There is absolutely no other adjective to use.

If you want something on the "healthier" side, then try their pear sorbet. OMFG. It tastes like you are biting into a pear but better.

Yes, the line can get very long, but the service is efficient so the wait is not too bad. If you want to skip the line, buy the prepackaged Ice Cream and/or Ice Cream Cake and have yourself a night.

All in all, Mitchell's would win in a knife fight  between Bi-rite and Fenton's hands down.
author: Joann A.

description:
Hands down my all time favorite ice-cream shop in the world.....so far =)
I intensely love this place --- winter, spring, summer, or fall --- Mitchell's ice-cream all day, everyday. I love it.

They have so many amazing flavors! Maybe it's cause I'm filipino and I love their filipino flavors the best, but no joke, it really is THAT good. Hah! My top three favorites are mango, ube (purple yam), and macapuno (white coconut?) They are all to die for! I'm sure the other flavors are just as awesome, but when I saw this place on the travel channel (which is why I decided to try it out) it is known for their tropical flavors, so I had to try those out (something new and different), and ended up loving the crap out off their tropical flavors!

Even though there's always crazy lines going on in there (all the way outside), I don't mind the wait (even when it's a bajillion degrees outside). Besides, they have a "pick your number" machine and about four windows helping people, so the wait doesn't take too much time, unless people order a butt load of ice-cream (guilty, I'm one of those people..).

I swear, I'm not just exaggerating.... it's an awesome happy place to be, so BE THERE =) You're going to want to take pints home to fulfill your craving for seconds and thirds and so on (I know I do!). 

PS: I heard that if you accidentally drop your ice-cream on the ground, they'll give you a new one for free =)
author: Jorgess M.

description:
I tried their pumpkin ice cream last night.  It was good.

Last time I came I had a really delicious Cherry Milkshake which was one of the best milkshakes I've ever had.

+ Stars for their parking lot
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
What to do? Humphrey's is closed (tears) and Bi-Rite has an insanely long outdoor line (gross).

No car? Go home and grab a pint of Häagen-Dazs from the liquor store next door. 

Car? Drive to Mitchell's, park in the lot in the back, take a number, and try one of their exotic ice cream flavors! The ube is delicious as is the tropical sorbet. I liked my jackfruit ice cream too but will probably have to go with halo halo or ube next time.
author: Krystle S.

description: Quality ice cream. *A-ok hand gesture. So fresh. Is their flavor that isn't good here? My favorite is white pistachio and macapuno. All their tropical favors are yumsters as well. Been lucky so far about the rush times. My mouth waters just thinking about their ice cream. *gulps
author: Glessie C.

description:
Solid.
But not life changing, mind altering or taste bud-blowing.

Even with a lengthy line, the wait isn't painful.
Overwhelming number of flavors from light and fruity to decadent and rich beyond your wildest dairy dreams.

Strawberry. Just right.
Mexican chocolate. Super creamy, a tad much. Lick it quick, this baby wants to drip all over. Heavy on the cinnamon.
Chocolate chip. A classic that I expected more out of.

Kids/junior cone is just the right size for pint-size me and it's super cheap ($1.80), especially compared to the competition.

Downside, it's not near much (neighborhood-wise) and there's nowhere take your cone and enjoy it besides a random bench. Maybe walk up 29th towards Dolores/Church and cruise. Ambiance is part of the experience and I want 110% satisfaction out of my cold-creamy licking.
Additionally, the inside is always jammed up with people. If you're claustrophobic, just forget it.
author: Alissa A.

description: I love this place.  I had a Mexican Chocolate Dipped Cone and i loved every bit of it.
author: jack l.

description:
I've lived in SF all my life and I just had Mitchell's the other day and finally thought to myself...wow, this IS good ;) it's extra creamy goodness was just what I needed to put a smile on.

Be prepared to stand in line as there usually is one no matter what the weather. 

Mitchell's is a must try.
author: Jocelyn J.

description: We like birite ice cream better. Ice cream flavor selection and holder options are cool (cup, cone, waffle, sandwich). I got the itsit - grasshopper pie on a double cookie sandwich. She got a dulce de leche. Both were good but nothing special
author: Sun K.

description:
Mitchell's got a new look and I LOVE IT!! The place has really opened up, making it look bigger. I'm so glad they got rid of those tall plastic barriers. Mitchell's you get 6 stars for that!! :D 

Tonight for the first time, I order one of their ice cream sandwiches with Mocha Fudge ice cream. You can pick any flavor ice cream you want and they'll wedge it between two delicious chocolate chip cookies. I loved the sandwich, it's just a little hard to eat when the ice cream starts to melt. Basically it's messy and delicious. The cookies are pretty sweet, so it's best to pair them with an ice cream that's not super sweet (unless that's what you're craving). I couldn't finish my sandwich, so it's awaiting me in the freeze for later :D
author: Holly L.

description:
with 6+ people serving customers from the time they open til they close, you'll know why this place is always cracking rain or shine!

I've only been here twice and each time i waited at least 20 minutes or so to get my ice cream fix!  Kinda forgot what i had my first time there, maybe it's because my mind is so stuck on the Mexican Chocolate and Dulce de Leche combo i had on a waffle cone.  

I can't describe in words how wonderful, creamy, tasty, indulgent and addicting their ice cream is.  I honestly can't continue this review because you really do have to experience it to know what this SF landmark is all about!
author: Max-Adam A.

description:
Mitchell's and I have a long history, a love story that began during my childhood growing up in San Francisco and has continued to this day whenever I come home to the Bay.  Im proud to say I love taking people to this spot for the first time and seeing their eyes light up with the amazing selection of flavors.  The worst thing about Mitchell's is having to choose your flavors, sometimes it can be quite difficult!!  Be adventurous or go with the classic Mitchell's flavors you love, like grasshopper pie.... luckily you can try a few flavors out while making up your mind.

The lines can be crazy and the parking may be a bit difficult, so if you dont care for that go during the day and not late at night
author: Christopher C.

description:
Recent results of an ice-cream taste-off between Mitchell's and Bi-Rite that one of my friends organized. Disclosure, I was unable to participate in the taste-off as I had a prior commitment. Consider this a guest review! It's just too damn good not to post. The writer gives Mitchells 5 stars, without hesitation. 

"Last night we threw a surprise birthday party and decided to conduct a little bit of an experiment. The birthday-ee has long debated the merits of Bi-Rite versus Mitchell's. We decided to settle, once-and-for-all, which reigns supreme by having a head-to-head taste off. Naturally, we dubbed it The 2009 Alan Richard ****** Ice Cream Taste Off. I intend for their to be another in 2010.

Not surprisingly, it didn't take long for the participants in this taste off to voice their allegiances, which brought the divisive nature of the debate to the fore. One participant declared Mitchells, "the people's ice cream," perhaps in reference to its more affordable price tag or what some perceive to be laid-back counterpoint to the alleged snootiness of Bi-Rite. Others defended Bi-Rite, lauding its natural ingredients and widespread popularity. The room was ripe with conflict, and it was time to dish out the ice cream.

The methodology: We started by analyzing the flavors offered by both establishments, looking for an overlap in flavors. We discovered ten:Vanilla
Chocolate
Minty
Cinnamon Snap
Banana
Pumpkin
Tea
Ginger
Sorbet
Cookies and Cream
In the end, we offered four for the taste-off: ricanelas/cinnamon snap, pumpkin, cookies and cream, and mint chocolate chip. One obvious flaw with this experiment is that these aren't even close to either establishment's best flavors, nor does they account for the fun, off-the-wall, creative flavors that both places thrive in, but they do provide a sample that allows us to objectively compare.

We had eleven participants. Each was offered two spoonfuls of each sample - labeled either A or B.  We took care to ensure that each flavor was served so that it was virtually impossible to discern its maker (with one flawed exception you will see below). We had four rounds (one for each flavor) and each participant filled in a score card by circling their preference for the round: either A or B. Participants were prohibited from voicing their preference throughout the entire process so as not to influence the opinions of others. They were offered either water or beer to cleanse their palate between rounds.

Whichever ice cream received more votes for each round (out of eleven), received one point. Whichever maker received more points overall was the victor.

The results are as follows:

Round 1 (Cinnamon)
Bi-Rite: 10
Mitchells: 1

Point Bi-Rite.

This, notably, was the most decisive preference in the entire experiment. Bi-Rite's Ricanelas is damn good, and far superior to Mitchells.

Round 2 (Thin Mint)
Bi-Rite: 4
Mitchells: 7

Point Mitchells.

It should be noted that there is a potentially confounding variable with this round in that the color of both selections is different (one green, one white), which could have potentially revealed its maker to the trained ice-cream-ophile. That is, I think a few people (some of whom had strong allegiances to Mitchells) knew which they were eating in this round.

Round 3 (Pumkin)
Bi-Rite: 5
Mitchells: 6

Point Mitchells.

As the results show, this was hands down the closest decision of the entire taste-off. Both were very similar, and both were very delicious.

Round 4 (Cookies and Cream)
Bi-Rite: 4
Mitchell's: 7

Point, Set, Match, Mitchells.

Here, again, it was a close call, but Mitchells decisively prevails once more and thus solidifies its place as the superior ice cream, 3 to 1.

A couple of points of clarification. I acknowledge that we ran the risk of ending up with a tie having offered four flavors, but it fortunately didnt become a problem. Perhaps the most contentious part of my methodology here was that head-to-head nature of this competition. Some participants voiced a frustration with the experiment as overly simplified. They would have preferred a more nuanced criteria based on texture, taste, creativity, and so forth. While I agree that it should be done in the future, it was simply too much number crunching for one night."
author: Andrew K.

description: It was very packed and took awhile to order I ordered the Cookie Monster shake and it's the best I have ever had. It was very creamy and yet very easy to drink from a straw.
author: Maria S.

description:
Yep, I'll wait an hour for ice-cream if it's coming from Mitchell's. And I did - this past Sunday! Took me a little while to figure out their # system. Take a number from 1 of those deli-style ticket machines & wait till they call it out. #s go from 0-100 (they actually call out "zero!" I wouldn't want to be that person!) in alpha-order. 

I ordered the mango as it seemed to be the "way to go for a 1st-timer" according to a few random people & the mag reviews. Also tried Ube (purple yam) yummy! Macapuno (sweet coconut) very yummy! Their tropical flavors are pretty amazing and I've heard the traditional are pretty good too. At $1.80 for a decent-sized scoop, it's pretty affordable (but be careful, it's $1.80 PER scoop...not per cone w/ 2 flavors!)
author: Marissa H.

description:
WOW, this must be the best ice cream in San Francisco, if not the WORLD!!

Located in the heart of Spanish influenced Mission District - in a majority residential area - lies a must visit attraction during your journey around the Bay Area. 

Mitchell's has a variety of special ice cream - ice cream you never heard of - including Filipino ice cream. 

You MUST try the Halo Halo - which is a purple(yam based)ice cream with mini-chunks of nuts and fruit. I must have had this 3x during my one week stint in SF. It's hard to describe - I mean the ice cream is just perfect, the taste, the texture. WOW 

Their coconut ice cream is also very delicious. The Mexican ice cream is very unique. But I believe their Halo Halo is just ultra fantastic. 

This place is a must visit for tourists and the locals love Mitchell's as well. There's always a huge line during the evening and night time(the afternoon can get busy too)and there's usually a 15-30 minute wait. There is no seating except for two benches outside, and the parking lot is a cramped L shaped one that fits about 8 cars. There is street parking but it can be hard to find at night.
author: Mr. Met s.

description:
Last destination: Mitchells!!! (See reviews for 1st stop: Bi-Rite and 2nd stop: Humphry)

So I had the infamous Ube and it was definitely different and yummy! I usually get Spumoni (Italian version of Neapolitan: Cherry, Pistachio, and Chocolate ice cream), but being a chocoholic, I went for Kahlua Mocha Cream! Mitchell's definitely helped me end the day with a nice chocolate ice cream. What more can I ask for!?
author: Cindy C.

description: I recently moved even farther from San Francisco and whenever I head into the city I have to make sure I stop by Mitchell's and get some ice cream to take home. My favorites are the mango and the dulce de leche. Definitely the best ice cream I have tasted thus far!
author: Kristy L.

description:
Mitchells Ice Cream is my favorite San Francisco treat! The wait can get a little long on weekends, but it is worth it. My favorite flavors are the espresso toffee and the grasshopper pie!

a definite must try if you are ever in SF!
author: Susana M.

description:
My Ratings:
Quantity - 5 Stars
Quality - 5 Stars
Price - 5 Stars 
Location - 3 Stars 
Service - 4 Stars 
Speed - 1 Stars

My Opinion/Story:
Soooo good!!! So worth the wait. Love the different exotic flavors of Mitchell's.  Make sure you have your patience hat on when coming here because the wait is long. No place to sit down but they call your number when it's your turn. You get to pick from the different flavors and toppings which they pour generously.  My sister dropped her ice cream as she's trying to get in the car. She went back inside and told them about it and they were nice enough to give her another order.  Definitely worth going to SF for.
author: Cherryl D.

description:
As if there wasn't enough to love about San Francisco already, I had to stumble upon this hidden gem of a calorie-busting joint. Thanks to a good friend at the gym who told me about this place prior to my last trip to the City by the Bay. 
If you are an ice cream aficionado, you must stop in at Mitchell's anytime you are in San Francisco. I've only been here once, but I plan on going back many times over. 
There's nothing fancy about this place or about its location. It's a small, well-lit, and clean storefront located in a decent/so-so part of town; not an upscale area, but not an absolute ghetto, either. The main issue was the parking; we had to circle the block a few times before deciding to park at the grocery store across the street (where we spotted a forlorn-looking guy staring blankly at his car window that had just been shattered) - welcome to the neighborhood!!
And, if you come on a weekend, be prepared to wait. We took a number and were in line for probably 40-45 minutes before being served.
But, in all honesty, it was worth the wait. 
I ordered a double-scoop: one scoop of Mexican chocolate, one scoop of chocolate peanut butter. The scoops are large, the waffle cones are fresh and tasty, and the ice cream itself is AMAZING! It was just about the best tasting ice cream that I have ever had. 
My flavors were very rich and creamy, with big chunks of chocolate and peanut butter and just the right amount of cinnamon to give it a little extra kick.
Other than stressing over the astronomical calorie content that I was ingesting, eating my double scoop from Mitchell's was pure heaven!
author: Jason M.

description:
Avoid the lines and buy the half gallons instead; you'll be wanting more after anyway.  Personal favorite flavors are ube and mango.  Cookies and cream is a new favorite after trying it there recently.  It has nice big chunks of cookies in there and it's like you can really taste the cream of the cookies.  I've tried alot of their other flavors but these seem to always be the safer way to go.  After reading other reviews on the grasshopper flavor, I'll be looking forward to tasting that as I'm a newfound mint ice-cream lover.

Parking sucks---period.  You can also get Mitchell's Ice Cream in Asian/Oriental stores, but maybe getting it at the actual store makes it taste better...hahaha
author: beverly r.

description:
Setting:  9:30 pm on a San Francisco chilly Friday mid spring night and 40+ people shivering and waiting patiently with green numbers in hand.  Fiesta like atmosphere despite the chilly air.

Those who know (and frequent) send a person earlier to snatch up an all prized number while the rest hunt for parking.

A very good friend & her family treated me to some ice cream.  Serious brain freeze upon freezing outside.  Laughed when friend suggested this might be a place "to meet people."  Ha ha.  Just there to try some beloved sweets!
author: Jen L.

description: Great Ice Cream.  Lots of simple flavors and old standbys, plus some good tropical ice cream. Loooove the Macapuno!  I'd much rather have this ice cream than the imaginative but usually pointless "hip" ice creams at the trendier places. Not that this place isn't popular. There's always a line!
author: Mara S.

description: Ube was amazing!  Service was quick and they had a number system to help keep things orderly.  I can't wait to come again and try more flavors!
author: Alissa Y.

description: A classic San Francisco treat and San Franciscans sure love their ice cream rain or shine. Make sure to grab a ticket by the door and listen for your number so you can order, otherwise you'll be waiting around aimlessly. They have your classic flavors but this is definitely a place to try something new like ube or tropical four. You can also pick up pre-packaged ice cream to go. Parking can be a bit rough even though they do have a small lot out back but don't let that deter you from giving this place a try!
author: Sarah L.

description:
Rain, wind or fog...which can happen at any moment in our schizophrenic city you will find me at Mitchell's.

I've taken mediocre dates here just to get some ice cream and "test" them. The long wait tells me how patient you are for yummy things. And lets keep it real, the way a person eats their ice cream says A LOT about them!  Even what they order ::cough cough:: vanilla. Now if you go hardcore, like me, and get your self some grasshopper pie dipped in chocolate we just might fall in love.
author: Jade W.

description: We've been going here for years and it's always fantastic. I LOVE ice cream and have tried all of the top yelp spots... in most major cities in the USA. I don't think one can easily pick "the best ice cream" anymore as there are sooo many good places with standout flavors (best chocolates - Dr. Bobs, best salted caramel - Jeni's, etc.) The tropical flavors at Mitchell's like ube, buko, mango, etc. just can't be beat + awesome Mexican Chocolate.
author: Michael S.

description:
BEST ICE CREAM EVER!!!

do i really need to explain why its so good. all the awards hanging on the door/walls, the long lines (even on the coldest winter days) speak for itself. 

from their decadent flavors, to their tropical flavors, even their unique flavors like their old mais y queo (corn & cheese)... you can never go wrong with Mitchells!!
author: Bernadette B.

description: Tried the avocado flavor today as a dare to myself.  I actually thought it was pretty good.  Not my favorite flavor but definitely worth eating it all up.  I think my favorite flavor is ube right now.  It could change the next time I'm there.  There are too many good flavors to choose from so there are always big decisions on what to get.
author: Brent T.

description:
The halo halo ice cream is on point. And by that I mean spot on.  I can't believe it actually tastes like halo halo. Someone knew exactly what they were doing and how to execute.

This is the best ice cream I've ever had thus far. I've only had the ube, baby coconut, halo halo and langka flavors. All amazing, especially the ube and the baby coconut. Can't wait to go back for more!
author: Liz V.

description:
Am I the only person that likes eating ice cream on a cold day?  Really?  Then I guess I'm just a weirdo.

Sorry folks, I hate to burst your bubble, but the Bay Area has ice cream on lock.  The best ice cream in the country is at Mitchell's in San Francisco, California.  That's right, I SAID IT!

Where else can you have freshly made in-house ice cream?  Where else can you find an assortmant of flavors from Vanilla to Avocado, from Chocolate to Mango?  Where else can you find an ice cream shop that represents Filipinos and actually makes Halo Halo in the Spring and Summer time?  As my friend Paul McGuire would say, "What's Halo Halo ice cream dude?"  If you don't know, you better learn to swim.  'Nuff said.

As I mentioned above, their selection is pretty diverse, but I'd say the two best flavors they offer are Mango and Avocado.  For all of you n00bs hitting up Mitchell's, you better make sure and get one of these two awesome flavors.  Trust me, it's aces.

Seriously, the ice cream here is the best I have ever had.  In other words, their ice cream is like a left hook from Manny Pacquiao...IT'S A KNOCKOUT! So unless your name is Floyd Mayweather, then you have no reason to be scared of this awesome ice cream shop.  LOLz..

Best. Ice Cream. EVER.
author: Ray-Ray B.

description:
How Good is this Ice Cream? It was so good that when I walked back to my car spooning the perfectly scrumptious and creamy mango flavored goo into my mouth that I DID NOT CARE SOMEONE HAD JUST SMASHED THE WINDOW OF MY CAR WINDOW and RAVISHED MY CAR... that's how good. Don't believe me? HA! Prove me wrong! 

For starters the ice cream here seems to be kept at a perfect temperature where the plastic spoon just easily sinks into the ice cream and picks up a gooey goodness. ALSO ... the flavors...PsHHhHHH you get exactly what the flavor says it is and you can definitely taste the mango, coconut, and everything else. Here's the LOWDOWN:

1) They have every flavor that you probably never thought of. Some are
     Ube (purple yam-I HIGHLY RECOMMEND), Mango (EVEN 
     RECOMMEND MORE), Buko (young coconut), Grasshopper, Sweet
     coconut, some Peruvian fruit flavor, Halo Halo and they used to 
     have avocado. There are sooooo much more flavors!
2) There's a line. So remember to grab a number.
3) They also have pints and larger tubs for take home. 
4) 2 scoops was around $6
5) They can dip your ice cream in chocolate for a hard chocolate 
     covering
6) They also have milkshakes, sundaes, and waffle bowls.

Personally, I would get the UBE and MANGO ICE CREAM and get the 
MANGO TOPPING. THIS .... IS THE BOMB.
author: Shanna K.

description:
I heart you, Mitchell's Ice Cream. 

There's a line at almost all hours, but don't let that turn you away. It's absolutely worth the wait! You'll need that waiting time to decide what flavor you want to get anyway. 

I haven't tried any of the other popular ice cream joints in SF like Bi-Rite Creamery, but why bother? My heart belongs to this place. My absolute favorite is grasshopper pie. It's the BEST!
author: Jane H.

description: Love Mitchell's! The ice cream never disappoints. Grasshopper Pie is my favorite. Get ready to grab a number and start that waiting game though. Although the staff is quick and efficient it can still take a long time to get your treat. Well worth it though!!!
author: Tiffany R.

description: Good sf made ice cream with lots of flavors down side on most days no parking but overall good icecream a good treat try pastacio
author: Sal L.

description:
What else is there to say that hasn't been said... If you haven't gone, what are you waiting for..go..run..hurry...

Classic creamery..an establishment.. Can we get one in LA please??

A must stop for us when in SF... we've been here in the middle of bitter cold winters, warm summers, foggy days..basically, it doesn't matter how cold or hot - we will stop by for ice cream... 

We're in love with the Filipino tropical flavors - mango, langka (jackfruit), halo-halo, buko (baby coconut)... I also love the ice cream cake...mango with chocolate cake... insane! 

ahhh the small pleasures in life.. like Mitchell's icre cream.
author: Mich Q.

description:
SO GOOD!

Tried a billion flavors and loved them all before I settled on a scoop of Grasshopper Pie in a waffle cone.  For someone who usually doesn't like ice cream all that much, I scarfed this one down, and wanted more!  

Chocolate Orange Infusion was their new flavor - aaaabsolutely LOVED this one, too.  

This is the best ice cream shop in SF.  HANDS DOWN.
author: Christine Y.

description: I love the ice cream cake at Mitchell's! I don't usually crave ice cream cake or ice cream ever-- but I crave their oreo ice cream cake all the time. I would definitely get one every week if I had the money; the cakes are around $30 (but so worth it). The cake has just the right amount of cake, and the right amount of ice cream. It's so creamy and just simply delicious. I can't wait to get my next Mitchell's ice cream cake-- maybe for Valentine's day? I haven't tried the actual ice cream but I definitely plan to.
author: Julie H.

description:
This place gets PACKED on the weekends but it's well worth the wait! You have to take this little number like you're at the butchers or something and wait for them to call your number. I always get the Grasshopper Pie (mint ice cream with chunks of oreo....like mint choc chip on steroids) and it's so rich and creamy and absolutely perfect. Definitely one of the best ice creams I've ever had even though it's not as hip as humphrey slocombe or bi rite. Their texture, consistency, and overall quality just doesn't really compare to mitchell's.

Also I like that they have a mini parking lot in the back which is great in a city like sf where you spend like 15 min looking for parking.
author: Caroline L.

description: It's always fun to stop by Mitchell's. the grasshopper pie flavor hits the spot. :)
author: Jin S.

description:
Dear Mitchell's Ice Cream, 

What can I say, you are a beautiful thing. 

Last night I had a double scoop of Ube and Claire's Pie ice cream in a waffle cone. First of all, if I may say, that Ube ice cream was a blast from my past. I'm sure most Filipinos are familiar with having to eat this ice cream when growing up. If anything, Mitchell's was a staple in the freezer. Yes to the Ube flavor if you want to try something new or relive the past. As for the Claire's Pie, that flavor is genius. Composed of caramel, almonds, toffee, and other sweets, this flavor has everything. I definitely recommend it!

The only downside to you is the wait and parking. The parking is very limited, seeing that it is on a busy street and that the wait can pile out. Thankfully, it's pretty organized since you have to pick up a number and wait. But hey, waiting is the best part. There are so many choices that you need some time to think about what you really want. 

- Patrick

Post Script
Too bad I live in SoCal
author: Patrick S.

description:
Hands down the best ice cream in SF! 

The grasshoppper pie is amazing! Go now and buy a scoop for instant gratification, and take another quart to drool over in the car on the way home. 

I'm still waiting for them to bring back the chocolate bomb sundae. Look for some great specials they post on the outside of the store.

All their Ice cream is nice and creamy. Easy to scoop even when it's super frozen, and slowly melts.

I also have to mention that they make custom ice cream cakes. It made my wifes birthday last year.

TIP: Buy a premade carton of ice cream and skip waiting in line.
author: Asa S.

description:
Oh man! My family has been coming here for years and years.  We come all the way from Union City with a big cooler in the trunk to stock up on at least 3 of the half gallons for the rest of the clan and then have a cone each.

Good memories! My mom worked in SF for many years but I forget what relative told us about the place. I'll always remember my mom asking me to hold her cone while she drives back.

The flavors here are one of a kind.  My favorites are Ube, French Vanilla, Lemon Chiffon, Raspberry Sorbet, Rum Raisin, Egg Nog, Green Tea and Pumpkin.  I know I'm missing some but those are the usuals and they'll switch 'em with season.  I would continuously eat ice cream when we had these.  Very rich and creamy in flavor-flavor very close to what you'd expect it to be.

Parking is always a beotch, but my mom is such a pro.  It's gets expensive with how much ice cream we buy, and it is kinda far...but it is worth it!  

I'm crazy for ice cream. Always have been, always will be!
author: Tara A.

description:
This is probably really good American ice cream. . Lots of flavors and really creamy.

I liked the thin mint and strawberry flavors. The mocha (I think thats what it was) was mediocre. All of their ice creams are really creamy though and not super sweet that make your teeth hurt so thats good. 

It's also cheap! A small is only $2.14!
author: Veronica S.

description:
On any day of the week, you'll find lines of people waiting for ice cream.  They may not be screaming, but they love it enough to stand and choose from the assorted flavors.  Some exotic ones include pumpkin, buko, and halo halo.  One of the best homemade ice cream shops to make it an institution in SF!  

Beware that there is barely any seating inside and outside.  Fortunately, there is some parking in the back lot.  It may be expensive in terms of time and money, but it's well worth every penny!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Although different from Poly Ann's, Mitchell's is just another great place to go for a nice sweet tooth moment. 

I've been going here since I moved to SF for college and never found another place as great and simple outside of the city. 

Go if you're temporarily here in the city, go if  you've just moved here, or please for goodness sakes go here if you've lived here all your life and haven't gone for some reason :)
author: Quinallison D.

description:
You can taste the quality of the ice cream at Mitchell's, but I think it's a bit overrated. I had the grasshopper something, it's unique, has mint chocolate, and oreos, it's really good. Also taste the toasted almond ice cream. You can really taste the quality. It has good selection. I just don't see what the big deal is about this place. I think Ben & Jerry's is a little better.

This was place #3 on our SF visit progressive food run.
author: Arnold W.

description:
A local took us to Michell's while we were in town last weekend. I had the New York Cherry with a chocolate dip. The chocolate dip was my very favorite part!!

I wish it had been a little cooler...my ice cream melted a lot and ran down my hands. I hate that.
author: Becki B.

description:
I LOVE MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM!!!  It's my favorite ice cream brand, and I could get just about any flavor (even the ones that make you may be skeptical to try) and love it!  The place always has a line, and parking can be a huge pain, but sometimes you gotta suck it up for some good eats.  

If you like the ice cream, but can't stand the wait, then another alternative would be to buy a 1/2 gallon from asian markets like Ranch, Pacific Super, etc... Usually I don't see many of the "normal" flavors, but if you're a fan of the tropical flavors like Ube, Buko, Avocado, Halo-Halo, Mango, etc... you may save some time by getting it at the supermarket.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
UBE ice cream! Mmmm, iceeee creammmmm!

I went on a Monday night @ 7pm. NO WAIT! YESSSSS! I don't know about the other flavors, but UBE was a definite winner! OM NOM NOM NOM.

Next time? HALO-HALO flavor!
author: Jeanette Y.

description:
Avocado ice cream!!!

it is as good as it sounds people. my friends and i came here for their famous halo halo, but sadly, it was not in season. instead i went bold with the avocado ice cream and it was heavenly. their calamansit sorbet is also quite tasty, if youre into the sour thing. but i would hands down recommend their avocado by  itself. creamy and not too sweet, i was in love.

it was pretty packed and we had to take a number. but its all worth the wait!
author: Ngan T.

description:
Look up "Bomb-diggity" in the dictionary and you'll find listed under it, Mitchell's Ice Cream. I actually liked this place better than that other Ice Cream shop in the Mission. And don't be fooled by the line. It's a good sign that business is boomin'. 

The Ube flavored ice cream is no joke. I'm Filipino but I'm not being biased. It's truly tasty, better than some other Ube ice cream competitors I've sampled. A (non-filipino) lady next to me in line mentioned that the "Tropical" flavors were great here, including the Ube. So it is a favorite among many. I also love it here because everything is decently priced. I bought a half gallon of ice cream for  around $10. Good deal.

The ice cream sandwiches are an excellent choice too, if you're hankering to try something else. They only use chocolate chip cookies for the sandwiches but you can choose any ice cream flavor to stick in between. But if they sold the cookies on their own, they would make serious money. Those things are like crack! I chose to go with the peanut butter indulgence ice cream sandwich, which wasn't all too bad. Think about it: peanut butter + chocolate chip. YUM-MAY! 

It's a small place.There's no where to sit. But who cares because it's faster to grab and go. Well actually, you gotta take a number if it's busy. So, as long as you're patient (and I hope you are) then you'll get called in no time. And soon after you can stuff your face with all that awesome ice cream. MMMmmm.

I'm not usually a big fan of ice cream. Gelato? Sure. Frozen yogurt? Mos def. But Mitchell's has that effect where it has you coming back for more. It may seem like just ice cream, but here at Mitchell's it's special. See for yourself.
author: Will S.

description:
What am I missing? I have heard so much about Mitchell's and was excited to try it but now I am so disappointed. The shop itself looks like any other generic ice cream store chain and the ice cream tasted the same. And not a good ice cream store chain, either. 

The folks that work there are friendly and did offer to let me sample any flavor. But the ice cream was terrible. TERRIBLE! I tried 2 flavors: chocolate chip (how hard is it to screw up chocolate chip?) and chocolate with candied orange, which sounded interesting but was so bad I threw it away after one bite. It tasted like someone dumped crappy cheap candy leftover from Valentine's day into chocolate ice cream. Gross. 

Maybe everyone raves about Mitchell's because it is a neighborhood institution but they need to get out more and try ice cream from other establishments. If you are seeking the best ice cream in SF then cross Mitchell's off your list.
author: Nan C.

description: Mitchell's has the best ice cream ever! I wish they would offer to ship their ice cream to Los Angeles! They offer the best and exotic selection of ice creams! My personal favorites were White Pistachio and Claire's Pie. My family would still come here if its raining! My family has gotten Avocado, Buko, Lucuma, Ube and they are always surprised how it tastes exactly what it's suppose to be! The staff is really helpful and great! Parking is in the rear!
author: Charles T.

description: Not much more that I can say that hasn't already been said many times over. Parking can be tough especially on the weekends and when it's hot. When it's a warm night the lines will be long until they close, you just have to suck it up and deal with it, stop whining. I love their mango topping on top of buko ice cream. Been coming here and eating their ice cream for decades....
author: William S.

description: Finally I got to try the young coconut ice cream here after happy hour at Broken Record.  Sadly, I still don't know how that thing got onto the 7x7 list.  It's good, but nothing out of the ordinary.  I can see why people like Mitchells, but having a line out the door like how Bi Rite does it......I just don't understand.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Love the ice cream here!

A message to the owner:  PLEASE BRING BACK THE CORN AND CHEESE FLAVOR!!!!
author: Andrew L.

description:
FINALLY!!!! I got to try out Mitchells, and I have to say, I regret not going here sooner. The place was PACKED, but it was fine cuz we grabbed a number and the employees were quick in moving the line along. During the time that I waited, I looked over what was offered and my mouth just SALIVATED. Everything just looked SO GOOD! When it was my turn I was eager to try a couple flavors out and the worker was more than happy to be patient with me. I settled on a single scoop of Caramel Praline in a cup- BEST DECISION OF MY DAY. It was so creamy and decadent. I enjoyed every bite, I shared some with my daughter and she ended up taking over the entire cup! *SIDE NOTE- Next time i'm buying one for me and one for her, we are both capable of finishing our own scoops especially if it is from MITCHELLS.

I Will be returning here more frequently to try out the other flavors. Gosh, I'm still dreaming about that Caramel Praline. *drool
author: Elisa T.

description: Best Ube ice cream I've ever had in my life thus far. Not too sweet. It was perfect.
author: Krystal A.

description:
Date/Time:   Friday, 11:00pm
Occasion:    After dinner dessert
Party of:   Three
Ordered:   Small pineapple & coconut ice cream with a waffle cone
Location:   Hole in the wall
Total incl gratuity:   ~9.00

Well, i'm not really the dessert kind of gal so to me, ice cream is ice cream. Although I have to say they have some really unique flavors here (ube, baby coconut, thai iced tea, etc) and the ice cream doesn't taste overly sweet like some other places.  Some caveats.  It's extremely crowded and you'll probably take a number and wait at least a good 25 minutes for your dessert.  Parking can be a headache, too.  They have a small lot in the back that houses about 8 cars but you have to be a bit patient for that.  Worth checking out.
author: Jess C.

description:
Dear Mitchell's, 

I feel that we have grown apart. For years, I have driven 35 minutes, just to taste you. Every time I come over, I need to take a number. I do not like being at the bottom of your list. It's not your fault that you are so popular. After all, you are terribly sweet, creamy, and delicious, but  I am impatient and needed to find something more. Treat Ice Cream has all the goods I will ever need to satisfy my sweet cravings. Treat has been making my sundae afternoon- oh so delightful.  I have been rolling out of bed, and over to Treat for months now. I realize that you are busy, and have probably not even noticed. While I am in love with Treat,  I can't promise that I won't be back for a taste. It sure was fun while it lasted.  

Ciao Baby,

xoxo *chocolate covered*
Yvonne C.
author: Yvonne C.

description:
In conspicuous tiny little ice cream shop in San Francisco. You won't get the flashiness of Bi-Rite. Instead you get your neighborhood ice cream shop feel. Pretty much any day you come into the shop it will be crowded with an eclectic group of families, couples, and gaggle of friends. Take a number and be prepared to wait. 

If you're impatient, and you know what you want, you can cut your wait time by purchasing a pre-packed half gallon in your favorite flavor. In our household, we are partial to their mango and almond ice cream. The coconut is also very refreshing. Mitchell's is definitely another one of those ice cream staples in the city!
author: Angela L.

description:
Holy cow, this place is unreal!  What more can I say about this classic ice cream establishment that hasn't already been said?!  Navigating our way through the city to find Mitchell's, we knew we reached our destination by loads of people (on a Tuesday night no less) spilling out of this quaint creamery.  

As a first-timer to Mitchell's, I was excited and overwhelmed by the plethora of creative, off-the-wall flavors.  As I waited my turn to approach the counter, my head was spinning trying to figure out those select few flavors I wanted to sample.  If I didn't risk getting glared at by the people in line behind me, I would have tasted every flavor because they all sounded so awesome.  We had no idea what to order and I loved hearing workers' and customers' recommendations.  Everybody has their own personal favorite, and I can see why; there wasn't a single flavor I tried that I didn't like.  

Service was amazing, especially considering they deal with consistently long lines day in and day out.  All the workers were friendly and enthusiastic.  They were patient as they dished out my samples and I never felt rushed into making a decision. 

A few notable fun flavors: thin mint, mexican chocolate, rum raisin, white pistachio, kahlua mocha cream, caramel praline, chocolate caramel crackle, grasshopper pie

This creamy smooth treat packs a serious burst of flavor and left our tummies full and taste buds satisfied.  I can't wait to come back to enjoy more of this frozen delight.  Mitchell, you know how ice cream is done right.
author: Ashley O.

description:
Love this place! The ice cream is so yummy! Their eggnog is also to die for.  The staff is pretty friendly and almost encourages people to try different flavors to pick the one of they really enjoy!

If you like ice cream - you will love this place!
author: Priya B.

description:
I would have left a 2.5, so decided on a 3 for nostalgia (of other people). I don't want to hate because I know why people like it (fat, sugar, childhood reminiscence, the Bay Area's obsession with long lines), but it's just not for me. It's good, creamy ice-cream, but give me Bi Rite any day.

The ambiance makes me feel like I'm in a Safeway franchise in a low income school or something. Why the need to sell Pepperidge Farm cookies as well as other odds and ends? I tried several, all were super sweet, ended up getting mango swirl, which I didn't try beforehand, but was pretty good because it reminded me of this ice cream bar I used to buy in South Africa (Magnum brand). 

I like it when places do 2 smaller scoops of different flavors (like with most gelaterias), but here two scoops is just too much ice cream and also twice as much money as one scoop (which doesn't make sense for ice cream store economics, but does in other areas). Felt a little ice-creamed out afterward. I'm sure I'll have to go here again because people love it and I'll go to be a good sport, would just rather go other places.
author: Kristen R.

description: You might have to roam the streets for parking if you don't find any at their 5-slot private parking lot.  But it's worth it.  Please enjoy the "Mexican Chocolate" for me or my favorite "Kahlua Mocha Cream."
author: Jay M.

description:
I'd go here over any of the chain shops anyday.  Bomb ass ice cream anywhere. Anytime we head up north from the south bay it's a must stop for my fiance.
I'd give em extra stars if I could because they have halo-halo and ube flavor!!! OHHH YAH!
author: Wil E.

description:
Three best words I can ever hear: peanut butter indulgence. 

Now, I'm minorly obsessed with ice cream. I eat ice cream every night (sometimes  two times a day on weekends) - hey it's okay, I run a lot. I consider myself somewhat of a connoisseur of ice cream. This ice cream is beyond amazing. The peanut butter indulgence is a perfect  mix of creamy chocolate ice cream, peanut butter cups and actual peanut butter running through the ice cream.

They just started pre-packaging the peanut butter indulgence in the 1/2 quarts one week ago...and it changed my life for the better.
author: Ashley L.

description: Maybe some people really like this place for its special ethnic flavors.  I stuck to normal stuff and was disappointed that it seemed like kind of fake grocery store crap. Not sure why this place is so popular, but i did get a huge ice cream cone at what i think is a cheaper price than other places.  That's a plus, for sure :)
author: M C.

description:
Yummmm! This place has a line out the door even if it's 50 degrees outside at night. And trust me, it's usually 50 degrees at night in SF.

We got the half gallon size of the green tea ice cream. Let me tell you. It was creamy, flavorful, absolutely delightful. Love this place.
author: Jenny T.

description: There is not much more I can add to everyone's 4-5 star reviews, except boy, was this a great destination after Sunday Streets! Their halo-halo ice cream hits the spot on a sunny afternoon, especially after a 10 mile bike ride. I am hard pressed to think of other ice cream places that serve uniquely Pilipino flavors like langka, ube, buko, and other flavors I would only otherwise find in a Magnolia container at Ranch 99. It's way out there, but if it's your gold at the end of a long bike ride, it's well worth it. :)
author: Angeline P.

description: Ube + macapuno = mouthgasm. ^_^
author: Eduardo R.

description:
When we we went there, there was a long line, prob 15 people ahead of us...but then it went by really fast with 3-4 people working....

Friends go the ice cream....I got the sherbet because im lactose intolerant...so its good they have a small selection that i can still eat...

I got the mandarin orange sherbet with the waffle cone..It was a huge scoop that went to nearly the bottom of the cone...well worth the money....the flavor was not spectacular where i would be craving it because it wasn't super sweet nor sour...

there is a small parking lot but suggestion is to just park a block or two away...burn a few extra calories walking to and back
author: Brendan L.

description:
I walked a mile up-hill (exaggeration but it felt like it!) to get to Mitchell's after gorging on sushi and sake. And the ice cream was decent. My pistachio was alright, not as pistachio-y as I'd prefer and sweeter than I'd like as well. My Baekfriend also was just content with his biscotti-flavored ice cream. I enjoyed it, but it didn't feel as extraordinary as the reviews made it out to be. I'd still come again, I don't know if I'd walk a mile specifically for it though.

And the employees seemed overworked and grump.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
First thing first ... if it's your first time at Mitchell's...grab a number. Always. Grab. A. Number....

Okay, now down to the point. My mom had been talking about this place on and off for about a week, and we finally went a few days ago. It is so busy. (Hence, the always grab a number bit....) We waited for quite a while, and I just thought, "This better be good for the wait..."
