I didn't know what to get, and for some reason, I felt like it was too busy to ask for sampling the flavours, so I just decided on the Thin Mint, which is, essentially, Mint Chocolate Chip. It's a good default flavour. 
The ice cream was really creamy and it is quite heavy. Mitchell's is definitely better than your average ice cream parlor. My mom seemed to enjoy the place a lot, especially their more different flavours of tropical fruits and such. 

The price isn't anything to complain about. They give you quite a big scoop for a single scoop, and like I said, the ice cream does feel pretty heavy. The only thing that seems odd is that they'll charge $0.20 for a sugar cone. Usually, most places only charge for waffle... but, hey, I'm not complaining. (: I would definitely come back to this place.
author: Bianca W.

description: Mitchell's is my favorite ice cream store in the city!  Despite the lines (even on cold days!) it is worth the wait for their delicious ice cream.  In addition to cones/cups/sundaes/shakes you can get for right away, you can also get ice cream to take home for your freezer OR ice cream cakes!  One of my roommates is an even bigger Mitchell's fan than I am so we get one of their cakes at least once a year :)
author: Liz H.

description: I love Mitchells !!! :)))))) Customer service is good and ice creams are the best! I love thin mint especially. I will come here whenever I wanna make myself feel good by ice cream haha
author: Kimberly K.

description: I've been waiting to take care of my Mitchell's Ice Cream craving since March when I was in the bay area last... I had a Coco Banana sundae, the featured sundae of the month that was posted on Facebook. It was good, but I will try to go back and have me some Ube, Avocado and Macapuno ice cream before I leave.
author: Dave M.

description:
I love the ube flavor like no other.


Feels like an auction house with the numbered tickets and how busy it is(even at the dead of night on a weekday). But you gotta go at least once!
author: Susan K.

description:
Linda Mitchell replied me regarding my unsatisfied ladyfingers...they are a 5 stars ice cream joint.  I am a happy customer and will return again soon. Next time, I am bring my gang of friends to enjoy their ice cream, I am bound to try all of their flavors.  

:)
author: S S.

description:
Stumbled upon this place while parking across the street on our way to Mi Lindo Peru. I heart ice cream, and seeing a line out the door at 5pm could only mean whatever they are serving inside is worth the wait. So we opted to check this place out after dinner for our dessert. 

I got one scoop banana and one scoop pumpkin. TO DIE FOR. Not many places offer banana (my favorite). Totally amazing, and so was the pumpkin. The gf raved about her raspberry sorbet. 

I will definitely be back!! Service was also fast and all employees were very nice.
author: Karen E.

description:
Thanks a lot Mitchell. You've reminded me why good Yogurt can never be as good as good Ice Cream. I..might not be able to go back again....once you go Mitchell's , you never go to....uh, yogurt. Yeah I'm so damn witty right? 

This is my favorite Ice Cream place in California!

1) Instead of waiting in line, you take a number!
2) Cheap prices. What, like 2.00 per scoop? Very good.
3) SUPER tasty ice cream
4) HUGE variety in flavors. purple yam flavor = heaven
5) Workers are verrry nice and patient.
6) Nice area, friendly people around.

As a whole it's just a perfect experience, I wish I had this place close by...my god, this is soooo good. I miss it already.
author: Edrees H.

description:
I'm a cookies 'n cream ice cream snob.

Mitchell's makes THE BEST cookies 'n cream ice cream.  They call it Oreo cookie because it actually has HUGE chunks of real Oreo cookies.  Imagine that.......

That is all.
author: Tysen C.

description:
Incredible. For years, I've been a Bi-rite Creamery type of man, but after much pestering (mostly shit talking) from my friend, I gave them a shot. 

While their ice cream for the household is fantastic (I brought home the chocolate fudge) the real treasure at Mitchell's is their egg nog. 

Buy lots in one fell swoop, as the line/wait here is long sometimes.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
You can call me Double Scoop. 

This ice cream is so good. If you are ever craving some good old fashioned comfort ice cream, this is your place. BiRite is good, I love it, but it's just not the same. If you want a heaping cone... Mitchells hits the spot oh so good.

Last night I double scooped with the peanut butter something and Claire's Pie in a waffle cone. mmm.
author: Abbey S.

description:
This place has a line out the door no matter what time you go. Even at 9:30pm on a Sunday night. 

But snag a number and ogle the selection they have up on the walls or through the glass if you're already squished up against the counter. The numbers give you some time to figure out what you want to get, which is a good thing because, man oh man, they have quite a selection. 

When it came to my turn, the BF and I got our ice cream on cones. Mmmmm. Then we went outside to enjoy it as we casually strolled back to our car. 

A great place if this is the closest one to wherever you had dinner.
author: Julia W.

description:
Pumpkin ice cream is like eating frozen pumpkin pie.  Delish. 

Thank you for the reco on Mexican Chocolate yelpers! 

I asked whether I could split an order into 2 Flavors and I ended up getting 2 scoops and charged 2 of the junior sizes.  It was plenty of ice cream, let me tell you... 

Yum yum.
author: Alias A.

description:
Go here at anytime of day, even 11 at night and there are people waiting. The wait system is great here though, much better than the congested line at Bi-Rite. Here you grab a number and wait with your friends to be called. 

The service here is great, they will let you try as many flavors as possible...but to save you time, it's all amazing! So creamy and rich....ahhh their ice cream sandwiches are great!

-Mango
-Grasshopper Pie
-Mexican Chocolate

THANK GOD Sweet Dish in the Marina has started to carry Mitchell's
author: Meredith M.

description:
From the shop's website: "We make super-premium ice cream, starting with 16% butterfat cream.  This makes our ice cream richer and creamier than most of our competitors."  It's true.  If you're not lactose intolerant before visiting, you will be after having a scoop of their amazing ice cream.  

THE ICE-CREAM:  Consistently creamy, cold, and delicious.  My favorite flavor is Mexican Chocolate, but I've never been disappointed with any of their flavors -- fruity, minty, salty, chocolatey.  

THE SERVICE:  They have a number system.  You go in, grab a number (like at the butcher's), and wait 'til your number is called.  You can ask for as many tastes as you like.  Some scoopers are super nice and friendly, and others are kinda indifferent to you but do their job.  

THE WAIT:  Is LONG on warm days.  But, if you go with friends, you can just chat with them while you wait.  OR ... you can all agree on one flavor and dig into a pre-packed half-gallon.  There is virtually no wait for the pre-packed stuff.  

THE PARKING:  Is sucky.  There is a small parking lot in the back (which actually turns over faster than you'd think).  If you wanna wait you can just cue up for the parking lot.  Or you wanna move around, you can circle the neighborhood for parking.  Do NOT block any driveways; the neighbors sometimes get fussy.  My usual plan is to drop off the passengers and tell them my order.  By the time I find parking in the neighborhood and get to the store, my friends usually have my ice-cream waiting for me.  

PUBLIC TRANSIT:  The shop is 0.8 miles from the 24th St and Mission St BART Station.  Also, if you don't want to walk that far, there are a handful of MUNI lines near the shop: http://www.mitchellsicecream.com/mitchells_directions.html
author: thao n.

description:
Reunited with Mitchell's (its been too long! 3 years!? Never again).

They have the smallest parking lot ever, so if you get a spot there you'll be pretty lucky. Since Mitchell's is located away from all those touristy areas you should be able to find parking in the neighborhood. As you enter dont be confused at the people lingering outside. 

Go in grab a number and stay near to hear that number (yes, they will call it once and twice if your lucky). As you wait you can decide what flavors to consider (and they will give you samples!). I recommend the Baby Coconut and Toasted Almond. :)

Grab a pre pack from the freezer off to the side if you feel like getting your fix without the wait. 

THANK YOU FOR OPENING til 11pm because it saved my butt because my friend and I missed Bi-Rite and they were closed. Ah, not gonna compare Bi-Rite and Mitchell's, but ah, Mitchells makes me happy.

Oh yeah, if you are near Pier 39 I hear theres a shop there, near Guradelli Square? that serves Mitchells. Less flavors, but you can get your fix there too.
author: Anne T.

description:
The wait here is RIDICULOUS. My boyfriend kept telling me this place was great and I don't know any place that's really worth the 30-45min wait (since EVERYONE tries EVERY damn flavor there is). But he was totally right.

Whatever flavor he got (it was a new one, sorry I don't remember the name) made the wait TOTALLY worth it. I don't know the name but it had chocolate & coffee flavor to it (ok not the best description). Should've just ordered my own instead of taking it from the bf

All I know is, I would come back and wait 45 minutes just to find out what flavor made this place worth 5 stars to me.
author: Diana Y.

description:
1.16.10 10:00pm

Line out the door. Had to grab a number left of the entrance on the wall of the door. Fun to look at the flavors and plot with your friends who's gonna try which ones while you wait. The workers there are so patient and kind even when things get hectic in there. Mitchell's is definitely more the creamy, melty, gooey kind of ice cream vs. the the creamy, chewy, hard kind.

1.70 junior sized scoop
2.65 1 scoop in a cup
add 10 cents for cone

Sure, it's no Rite Aid, but for the quality and the amount you get in a scoop, it's perfect. Besides, check out the flavors:

+ Ginger: chunks of candied ginger. Spicy!
- Mango: didn't taste much like mango. Not much like anything, really.
+ Peruvian Lucuma: I swear this tastes like Thai Tea. 
+ White Pistachio: on the sweet side, but the roasted pistachios offset

Avocado, Ube/Taro, Halo Halo, Green Tea, Lychee, Macapuno, Toasted Almond, Rum Raisin, Spumoni...really, check out their site for more awesome flavors.
author: Diana D.

description: Grasshopper Pie is incredible!!! I love ice cream, and this shop does ice cream right! I haven't tried bi-rite, but best ice cream I've had in SF so far, hands down
author: David N.

description: Classic ice cream place with so many flavors. Recommend!
author: Ben U.

description: I was craving banana ice cream so I headed down to Mitchell's because I wanted nothing but the best.  Being born and raised in SF I have been going to Mitchell's since I was a wee tot. I didn't mind the wait because I knew that I would be enjoying the most amazing banana ice cream on the planet. WRONG! I was mortified! Something had changed! The ice cream barely had that perfect creamy banana flavor I had always enjoyed. To make matters worse I didn't even get the usual pieces of fresh banana!!!! Did I get a bad batch or what?  I was so disappointed! What happened Mitchell's?????
author: Review L.

description: There's something special about Mitchell's. Maybe it's because this is the type of place your grandparents would get ice cream. Or maybe it's because Mitchell's continues to go against the trend by churning out gallons of ube flavored ice cream! (My favorite!) There's usually available parking in the back, but if it's a warm day, you may have to park a block away. Other than that, there's not much to dislike about this place. Their ice cream is excellent. Unpretentious. Yes, unpretentious ice cream.
author: Misfit M.

description:
this review is long overdue.  i was just reminded of this place when my bff said she wanted to go out and get some ice cream.  so i said why don't you go to mitchell's?  where else would you go in san francisco besides mitchell's?  baskin robbins?  polly anne?  noooooooo way...mitchell's ice cream is the best!  accept no imitations!!!

i stick to the 3 core filipino flavors...ube, macupuno, and mango.  there is just something about the yummy creaminess and freshness and something elseness about the ice cream here that is so unforgettable.  what ice cream place has a freakin half hour wait???  this place is special...the real san francisco treat.  100 stars, if possible.
author: Jen W.

description: I like that their ice cream is not so sweet like Mr.&Mrs... White pistachio, junior size, plain cone- YUMMM~! Ice cream is not at the top of my dessert list, but when I am in the mood for ice cream, I like to go to Mitchell's... Not a fan of kids getting up on the counter... I've seen a parent put his two kids on the counter with their shoes on... For sanitary reasons parents shouldn't allow kids to stand on chairs/tables/counters... Also, for safety reasons... If a kid fell, I wouldn't be surprised if the parent(s) blamed the establishment.
author: K M.

description:
Mmmmm!!! I tried the unique flavor that everyone recommends: Halo Halo and Ube. Thanks Yelpers! I think it's worth it to get two scoops with two different flavors since there is so many good ones. 

Rushed here on a Monday night a month ago at 10:30. Glad this place is opened late. Still bustling outside even on a Monday! They have parking in the back!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Macapuno ice cream (coconut flavored with actual strips of sweetened coconut) dipped in chocolate on a cone will always have a place in my heart (and tummy). 

Yummy!
author: Jay C.

description: Always a great experience at Mitchell's! Actually walked in and got #37 and then another customer " payed it forward" by giving my friend and I #25 due to them taking 2 numbers. It was a nice treat on top of the delicious ice cream! My usual flavor is Coffee, but have had the Black Walnut. Both rich, creamy and delicious!
author: Charmaine T.

description:
Come here for the ice cream only. This place is super busy, take a number or buy a half gallon or a cake. Everything ice cream related is very good if not the best. Call it hype or brain washing or what ever you want. Try and find Ube ice cream better than this place. 

Get the Ube. Don't bother getting anything else.
author: Sean T.

description: I can't say anything new that I'm sure hasn't already been said in the other thousands of reviews! So I'll keep this short and sweet...Go here, get at least 3 scoops, be HAPPY! Oh so creamy and yummay!
author: Vi D.

description: A San Francisco favorite!  Love the ice cream.  Often has a line- you have to take a number- but the line moves quickly.  Always a yummy treat!
author: L C.

description: Strawberry Lemonade sorbet.  Amazing.  Makes every other strawberry sorbet taste like sawdust.  Sooo sooo good.
author: Ginger w.

description:
i have fond memories of mitchell's. 
i used to come here with my parents&my lola for ube&macapuno ice cream. id get langka once in a while. i had it again last nite and it is still delicious&creamy as it was when i was 4 (and im 22 now, 18 years!) 

this is a sf favorite&i recommend this place to anyone with a sweet tooth for ice cream. they also sell filipino cookies 
and snacks. 

i had a mexican chocolate&ube hot fudge sundae. the mexican chocolate is sweet and creamy. the ube has small pieces of ube in the ice cream. it was good but too filling. 

they do take credit card but it is a $9.00 minimum. that is why the minus 1 star. :( 

but otherwise it is amazing!
author: Kristina P.

description:
Ohhh, Mitchell's... One of those places where you don't go enough, and  if you do, you probably shouldn't be.

Try the ube.
author: Melissa S.

description:
5 Solid stars for the quality and flavor that is Mitchell's Ice Cream. I cannot decide, even after two decades of coming here, between Mango and Strawberry ice cream. Service is consistently good, too. 

Reason I don't visit as much as I'd like to? Parking. I'm sorry, but it's not fun trying to find a parking spot for med. size SUV here, especially on the weekends when the kids are clamoring for ice cream. 

Tip: Make a visit to Mitchell's worth by taking some of their half gallon flavors to go. Or ask to have your faves packed in quarts to take with you.
author: Tea C.

description:
A definite ice cream institute of San Francisco!! But expect to be waiting for some time because whether its a cold or hot days, there will be a lot of people getting ice cream.  So you have to pick a number and wait till your number get called.

The parking lot is very small (which is located behind the store), so be expected to park on the streets.  They have so many flavors, it is so hard to choose.  I got a scoop of almond and a scoop of ube (a tarot root type - purple in color) and it was just so good!
author: Ken Y.

description:
Best ice cream in the city BY FAR.

With over 40 flavors - a great mix of traditional and nouveau - creamy deliciousness, and gorgeous colors, I will wait in line every time for a pint of Mitchell's ice cream (because I like to take it home with me so I can keep on enjoying it).

It beats Bi-Rite Creamery on my list. And it's been here for years!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Wowzers. 

I'm a sucker for ice cream, and I'll scream any day for it. So naturally, after a full stomach in the city, I wanted to top it off with some sweet ice cream and found Mitchell's to be our final destination. After circling around for parking, we stood in line waiting our turn. Unbeknownst to us, the line was actually a pseudoline of people looking at what to order when their number is called. Be sure to grab a number next to the door as thats the way they handle business there. 

I sampled a number of flavors: coffee, white pistachio, caramel praline, run raisin, mango, and toasted almond. And let me tell you, each sample spoon had at least one nut on it if the flavor contained it. They want you to get the full effect of their product. Werd! Each flavor had a distinct taste that resounded its title, but had a consistent smooth texture that really could almost turn you on. 

The service was fast and friendly, and they were more than willing to provide any number of samples your heart desires. I ended up buying a half gallon of the coffee ($9.25), which is a great deal if you have a favorite you want to bring home with you. Mitchell's adds to the great culinary experience the city provides, so be sure to come with your ice cream craving on full blast.
author: Dale C.

description:
Their numbering system is chaotic and a bit dumb. Someone will take a number and all of a sudden they and their fifteen friends are ordering and sampling EVERY ice cream for the next thirty minutes. Bi-Rite's system of ordering is a lot better than Mitchell's..maybe they should look into it.

Plus, when it was very crowded (and I waited thirty minutes for my ice cream), they only call ONE number at a time. That means they wait until the person is finished before they start again. Why not do two at once, it would speed up time. They also go SOOO slow.. I swear I watched the people behind the counter move like sloths when scooping out ice cream and walking around, they obviously don't care.

In the end was it worth the wait? Nope.
author: Natalie M.

description:
Living close to Mitchell's is one of my favorite joys of my address!  After dining out in the Lower Mission or Bernal, getting a vanilla custard cone (chocolate dipped of course) is the perfect end to a night!  I love the other flavors as well.

During the Holidays, our household consumes so much of their amazing eggnog which is perfect served with brandy or rum, then topped with fresh grated nutmeg.  My Christmas party wouldn't be the same without it-- it could even cause a mutiny.

Also, I don't mind the wait.  The people are usually nice, and especially as the Giants have been having such a great season, it's easy to strike up a conversation with your fellow San Franciscans making the experience that much more pleasant.

Savor this Bay Area treasure :)  I do!
author: Tracy B.

description:
:-)

One word:  UBE

Its purple, its tasty, and its made from Taro. I can't even describe its flavor.. Its mild and unique.. Not too sweet, and not at all fruity.

If your a pacific islander you'll know what I'm talking about. If your not.... well, you'll just have to experience it yourself. 

Not many places serve "exotic" and unique flavors of ice cream, but Mitchell's does. It's been around for years, and you'll find the lines out the door on evenings and weekends. 

Give yourself a break, and get over to Mitchell's! It's worth the drive, the wait, and the money. One lick and its like a mini vacation to some faraway land. I guarantee you'll be back for more. And don't forget to take a ticket as you enter... or you'll be bummed waiting... and waiting.. as numbers are rattled off, and your not served.

Remember the "UBE."

pronounced:  "OOOOOOOOOOO BEH"

mmmmmmmmmmm.....

4 Woofs!  I've always been a fan.....
author: JöHnNy A.

description: been here twice and never disappointed. most recent time, V got the two scoops of the avocado (we shoulda bought a whole pint to go) and it was delicious. i got something chocolatey with a funny name...forgot the name, but it had nuts and swirls and stuff. it was delicious too. i want to eat everything there. i think i prefer mitchell's over humphrey slocombe
author: Sherilyn T.

description:
I was shamed by my friends. How can a native San Franciscan live here for so long and not have been at Mitchell's? Blame it overzealous parents, distance and the long lines, but I have finally made the plunge and went to discover this San Francisco treat.

Pluses all around for the parking lot in the back...anything free for my car is love for me. Going inside, you're almost overwhelmed by so many different flavors (Filipino, Asian, Classic flavors were all represented). I tried samples of Halo Halo, Avocado *my friend liked this but it tasted like frozen vegetables, Mango, Mocha, Ube....when I finally found my new favorite: Kahlua Mocha Cream...OMG...it's so creamy and full of mocha goodness with a touch of liquor.  

I suggest going there early in the morning instead of hitting this place at night. The lines are short and plenty of parking. Plus you get a chance to sample lots of flavors with the workers when they're not scrambling to help everyone.
author: Pauline L.

description: Mitchell's ice cream is my favorite ice cream place! If I lived closer it would be my go-to ice cream choice. I grew up on Mitchell's always getting a rocky road on a cone, but I have tried my friends and families flavors even though I continue to be a traditionalist . I would recommend this place to anyone who loves ice cream, and take trips out here just to take my friends to this ice cream place. They have ice cream flavors for everyone ranging from rocky road, mango and avocado (though I have never tried the  latter) Go to Mitchell's!!!!
author: Natalie G.

description: All the flavours I've tried have been so good! The wait is definitely worth it. We drive all the way to the city just for Mitchell's! I love that they have other Filipino delicacies (aside from the Filipino ice cream flavours), too! When there's hardly any people, they give a little extra.
author: Fran A.

description: The corn syrup used to sweeten the ice cream leaves and after taste I don't find with regular sugar.  The ice cream is pretty average, but the late hours are nice and the variety of flavors is fun.
author: D M.

description:
How did I miss this gem all those years I lived on Dolores?
Oh well, no matter, because I'm now in the know and a very very very happy customer.

Mitchells is one of those places where you walk in the door & you're immediately wrapped in nostalgia  - even if it's your first visit.  The anticipation on each person's face is enough to make even the most cynical person's stomach growl.  And then, you get your cone, or shake, or sundae - and you get to experience the pure bliss of incredible flavors - many Asian in origin.  

 Excellent ice cream with a guaranteed smile in every slurp of creamy goodness - get there as fast as you can.
author: Lxs S.

description: One of the best treat in San Francisco, you can always look forward to a great time here. There are numerous flavors, so there is no worry to not be able to get something good.
author: Gordon H.

description: I've been to Mitchell's several times and it's always worth the wait. But, I also highly recommend their custom ice cream cakes for parties. I ordered one for a Mexico-themed birthday fiesta and it was a huge hit. The staff was really helpful and attentive in making and decorating the cake just as I wanted. It was so much better than the overly-sugary sheet cake you typically find at parties.
author: Daniel A.

description: I really enjoyed their grasshopper ice cream (mint and oreo). They do have unique flavors such as young coconut and halo halo. There's a small parking lot, but you can do residential street parking. =)
author: Jenna L.

description: If you come to S.F. this is a must have, in order to have the full experince. My family has been going here since the early 90's. I just wish they had non dairy choices too.
author: Carlos G.

description: what better than ice cream on a hot day. they always have a line here but it is worth the wait. there is nothing like Mitchell Ice Creme. if you come here be prepared to wait unless it is a cold day or raining but that just mean the line won't be as long. maybe
author: Kien L.

description:
Long has my love affair with Mitchell's been! Through boyfriends and break ups your Toasted Almond has been there to sooth my hurts and be a creamy balm to my soul. So far reaching is your magic that when friends visit they do not want to see the sights it's straight to Mitchell's for ice cream delight!  

Shout out to Koudos and Nestor the best Ice cream slingers around!!
author: Shannon H.

description:
MACUPUNO OR BUKO PLEASE!

basically, my faves at mitchells...aka..Coconut flavor.

I love coconut flavored ice cream and the place that i go to for my fix is mitchells. PLUS  there are real coconut pieces.  yummm 

oh, and their milkshares are the bomb-digitty!
author: Cali L.

description: Busy location, little parking, yummy ice cream. Is the wait worth it? I thought so. I had the sundae of the month. I can't recall it's name but it was really good had banana slices all up in it, some kinda of mango ice cream and came in a coconut shell. I enjoyed every single bite. It was donezo halfway to the house- lol. I wish it were bigger but then again my rolls do not. Yummy nummy ice cream, they close late- always a plus. They sell these butter cookies in the wall to the left as well as other assorted sweets.  I wanna say -1 star for the parking but hey that's not the creamery's fault.
author: Julie N.

description:
ICE CREAM HEAVEN

tons of flavors including all the classics, sorbets, tropicals, and even seasonal ice cream. 

DONT BE AFRAID TO ASK , you can sample a flavor before ordering. I sampled the Thai Tea, honey-something flavor, and french custard before making my choice. wahaha

expect to wait a couple minutes in line, theres very few parking spaces in the back, and dont forget to take a number
author: David D.

description:
i am an old school San Francisco native. My parents took me here on either opening day or opening weekend when I was a child. I have gone here over the years. Other than the old Bud's on 24th and Church, this was THE ice cream. It is still THE ice cream. 
The only trouble with Mitchell's is that I live a few blocks away, and I have to use strong will not to go there every day.
All the flavors are to die for ..
author: Eugenia P.

description:
I showed up at Mitchell's at 11:10pm on a Saturday night and low and behold they were closed!  The doors were locked and my face turned into the pout that tends to get me what I want.  Luckily, there were patrons finishing up their ice cream transactions and the Mitchell's crew were nice enough to let us, and only us (HA!), sneak in and order the most amaZING ice cream in todo el mundo!  

Top flavors:
Cookies & Cream
Ube
Chocolate Carmel Crackle
Buko
author: Justine D.

description:
AAAAMAZING

Best ice cream ever

Avoid coming here on hot days.  You will wait for hours.  I only give 4 stars because sometimes the workers seem so overwhelmed they come off a little rude

even days Ive been in there with maybe only 3 or 4 people in the whole store I've still felt a little rushed to get in and out.  Its a little confusing if you've never been there before.

The ice cream is well worth the wait if you have the patience.  I recently tried the mexican chocolate and I think I litterally died when I tried it.  Definately my new favorite
author: Kelly N.

description:
At about 10:45 pm on a Friday night, after a huge dinner at Shabu House, Rob and I pondered what to do.
Just going home without stopping by anywhere else felt wrong.  It felt like we should DO something even though our full stomachs were begging us to just go home and vegetate.
 
We considered drinks but didn't feel it.
We considered movies, but didn't feel that either.
I suggested ice cream and he agreed immediately - - he loves ice cream.
 
I, on the other hand, do not - and I have no idea why I suggested it.
 
We called Mitchells, and they said they would be closing at 11 pm, and we were exactly 2.5 minutes away.
 
At this time of night, there was a crowd inside and outside of Mitchells on this cold evening.  Parking is behind the building, praise God!
 
Being so full, did we get one kiddie scoop each or share one cup?
No.  We both ordered double scoops.
 
Rob got the coffee and some other flavor I can't recall.
I got the "young coconut" and Mint Chip.
 
Coffee was truly excellent.
The coconut was just OK to me, the mint chip was just OK too, though Rob loved both.  Like I said, I am not a big ice cream fan - I should have stuck to vanilla, which I like.   I did note that Mitchells has a very expansive selection of unusual flavors with an exotic twist.  They also had avocado ice cream.   
 
Rob finished his cone but I had about 20% of the double scoop and we rushed home so I could stick it in the freezer.  
 
The next evening, Rob finished it and said it tasted just as good as the night before.  I'm going to guess it's good ice cream, but it's just a bit too sweet and too creamy for my taste.

Don't get me wrong - I'm not some sherbert or a big believer in diets - but there IS such a thing as too heavy for my tastebuds.  I much prefer Icebee frozen yogurt!  Yum!
author: Grace K.

description: Oh common creamy thick icecream, NO I HATE IT! at least that's what I try to tell myself. There is this chocolate one with krispy stuff in it, yum! I had the eggnog icecream during the holidays, yum, ohh and a weird one avacado! it was yum too! I think if they mix dog poop with cream and sugar it will also be yum! You can't go wrong with Mitchell's. Oh let me tell you what I do, I want 2 flavors but don't want to pay an arm and a leg so I would get 2 Junior scoops! I'm sure I'm not the 1st to think of that, but I thought I was a genius.
author: Karen T.

description:
I'm a sucker for good ice cream.  And I'm a sucker for Mitchell's.  If you're thinking about going to this place on a warm San Francisco day, be prepared to stay a while.  I remember walking in with a friend on one of those San Francisco days where you could actually wear shorts out; grabbed a number...#19...cool.  But as I looked up, they were on #75!  WTF?! Seriously?! You tellin me I gotta wait for that thing to go back to zero?! Luckily, there are those who give up the wait, and the numbers go through fairly quickly.  Just be patient...ice cream will come.  

Three good tips about Mitchell's.  Number one: avoid going on hot days.  Go on a regular weekday just as the fog starts rolling in...I guarantee you'll have your ice cream quick.  Number two: if you are stuck in the wait, and find your ice cream desire in one of those tubs...grab it.  There's no need to wait for your number to be called to purchase the tubs.  Number three: if you are waiting to order, LISTEN for your number! They call it once, twice if you're lucky.  They really practice the art of "You snooze you lose".  

My favorite flavors: chocolate caramel crackle (taste like a CRUNCH bar in ice cream form), mocha fudge, Claire's Pie (no questions, just get it), Butterscotch Marble, Kalamansi, Lychee, and Macapuno.
author: Maybelline C.

description: This place is tits. I've been coming here ever since I was a wee lad and other ice cream parlors be damned, this is by far my favorite place to go for ice cream. I'm sure I ain't the only one either. I mean I got bi rite way closer but when I think about it there isn't anything going down on San Jose avenue. If Mitchell's can bring in people like me from far and wide on a rainy cold night and STILL be packed, well hell man, more power to them. I just wish it wasn't so packed most of the time but if you buy a tub of ice cream you get to the front of the line so that's always awesome.
author: Dan B.

description: Personally this is my favorite spot for ice cream in SF.  When it comes down to ice cream, flavors offered to decide which place you like.  I ordered the sweet coconut, jackfruit, and purple yam.  All delicious.  Just looking at the menu, I knew I was going to like this place (based on the flavors offered).  Huge fan of their sweet coconut here.
author: Steven U.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream..........................ROCKS!!!!!!!!
Wow theres a lot to say about it.The ice cream is MAGICAL!!!!!!!!
The staff members are so peaceful when theres long lines.
Once I went there on a freezing,rainy day with one of my best friends,there was a longer line then we expected (I mean yes ice cream is awesome and tons of people like it ,but on a rainy day ,really)?Me and my friend got the exact same thing,cone and everything (cookies and cream on a cake cone).When we went outside I was afraid that my ice cream would get soggy.(I know its probably not gonna get soggy but what if it does).The flavors get crazy avacodo,fig?Totally.
author: Nikki Y.

description:
Its official. 

Its ice cream week for me! I mean.. amazing February weather.. I need a cone.. or two ;)

Mitchell is amazing.. the multitude of flavors, the old school style, and the fact that you can get jugggggs of ice cream. I mean, c'mon, delish!
author: Art A.

description:
You know you're doing something right when it's a cold, rainy night and you have tons of people waiting in line.
I've been here a couple times but hadn't tried the Ube (on the top 100 Big Eat list). We got a number and waited in line for ~15 minutes before we sampled a couple. I ended up with ube and young coconut. Ube was a little less flavorful than I would've hoped (after a few licks it tasted like vanilla, but less), but coconut was deliciouss.
A solid option for dessert in SF. (:
author: Jen T.

description:
There was a place I interned at and they were all about Mitchell's ice cream. Everyone tried Mitchell's and I felt the odd one out having not try this confectionery treat. My old coworkers thought so highly of this place until one day, one of the boss' had a birthday party for his daughter. They had a leftover brand-new gallon container of vanilla ice cream, and I swore to god that container went empty within 10 minutes. All I remember was, "Holy wow, this ice cream is so creamy, dense, and indulgent." My mind was blown. It was the best vanilla ice cream I had ever tasted, and possibly in my life. 

It was then, that I realized, I needed to take a trip over to Mitchell's. And I did. 

One of the things I don't like about this place is the crowd. I got annoyed at those who were in the store taking up space where their numbers hadn't been called. Hello, get out of the way, inconsiderate people! 

I went to Mitchell's a few years ago and got Grasshopper Pie. Being incredibly indecisive and knowing there were a lot of people waiting, didn't want to waste time. I figured that was the last time I was going to come back since I rarely come this way. Frankly, I was okay with that.

I came back in celebration of a friend's birthday recently. It was still as crowded as ever which mildly annoyed me. I wished this place had a bigger space. I wished these inconsiderate people wouldn't stand in the store when their numbers won't be called in say, ten minutes or so. 

I ended up getting the Chocolate Caramel Crackle, because I couldn't decide. Typical me. I didn't know what was in it but I didn't want to take up other peoples' time by asking the workers, but I'm sure they wouldn't have minded. Still yet. 

The ice cream was SO good, oh my god, but incredibly messy. The minute you get it, the caramel starts melting and dripping all over your hand. It was like a game--who will win--me or the ice cream? I had to start eating it immediately after I paid or else the caramel would've gotten even more on my hand, and I did not want that. 

I was on a mission. I kept licking around the cone. Round and round. Oh god I must've looked hideous licking non-stop. My friends kept laughing at me while they were leisurely eating their ice cream and talking. I had no time to talk nor could I eat my ice cream in a leisurely fashion. Once I ate majority of the ice cream and had the cone left, I felt I could finally relax. I proudly announced, "All right, I finally got it under control!" My friends laughed. 

I would probably come back more often if I lived closer and if the crowds died down a bit. Until next time...
author: K. E.

description: The best oreo ice cream that I have encountered in the U.S. and I am an ice cream monster!
author: Meg H.

description:
Black out Friday = Ice cream! I will have ice cream any time of the year, so it didn't matter that it was cold outside - sooo many flavors to choose from! I settled for Oreo Mint, and I was not disappointed - only that my bowl disappeared so quickly. That didn't stop me from trying French Custard, Spumoni, and a root beer float (served with the A&W can) that the rest of my group had.
I like the fun tradition; one of my friends has gone there since child hood and I can see why!
author: Adriana K.

description:
An SF staple. I've been coming here since I was a little girl and other than a little remodeling here and there this place is the same. The ice cream is as good as and adult as it was when I was 4. 

Sunny, Rainy, Foggy, Hot, Cold...expect a line. Grab a number and wait, but the workers are awesome and know how to keep it moving so the wait is never too bad. 

Ube, Macapuno, Mango, Halo Halo, Langka....mMmm. Yes, everyone knows their tropical ice creams are to die for. BUT their other flavors are good as well Grasshopper Pie, Kahlua Mocha cream, Chocolate Caramel Crackle...*daydreaming now*...as I was saying...yes, they're ALL good. Their milkshakes and sundaes are good too. 

Quick tip (mainly for tourists, cause any local should already know): Pre-packed gallons. Grab, go to the pre-packed window, pay and go!!! Lets be honest here 1/2 gallon is not too much. I bet if you love it so does your family...it won't go to waste. Trust, families DO love it...matter of fact, I've got a family party coming up this weekend in the East Bay...and the only help they're asking of me is to bring the Mitchell's. :)
author: Heather P.

description:
Yum!  So glad we finally tried it!  We had pineapple coconut and grasshopper pie (mint chip, fudge and oreos).  Both were amazing!  We brought home some buko (young coconut) to enjoy later.  

Service is fast and there is a small parking lot!  Now we'll just have to think of an excuse to come back...
author: Chris K.

description:
Mango ice cream.
Enough said. 
Ps: parkings a drag , but that's not surprising in SF.
author: Natalie B.

description:
Personally I feel like Mitchell's is a bit overrated. 
First I start with the ice cream texture in itself. It is very AIR-y. Very LIGHT. I guess this is personal preference, but I like mine dense and thick. Take for example Mitchell's mango flavor --- its just too airy and almost melt-y ... and almost TOO creamy as well. I have to give the one up to bi-rite for the ice cream texture. 
I do give Mitchell props for having such a wide variety of flavors that are available at one time. They have very interesting flavors like Ube, baby coconut, avocado, some peruvian fruit flavor. Lots of tropical flavors that you can't find anywhere else. I like the grasshopper pie too. 
Another gripe I have with Mitchells is that you can only get one flavor in a single =( I want to be able to try more flavors in my cone!!11 =( But at least the scoops are one of the BIGGEST in the city =) 
Lastly, the waiting system for getting service is ridic. I know it SEEMS orderly with the whole take a number system ... but it just gets claustrophobic in there, people take too many numbers and don't listen ... OMG i hate it. I'd rather have a LINE (like at bi-rite...) 
They do have togo half gallons that cost a little shy of $10 and some interesting ice cream cakes. They seem pretty pricey though. meh. 

Bottom line, its some decent ice cream. If you're in the area I would stop by and try it. It's nothing to get so excited about and to wait hella days for though. I want to like mitchell's more because of its whole long standing institution in sf... but I just have to admit that bi-rite, mr. and mrs. miscellaneous, and three twins are just one step above.
author: Tim B.

description:
As a recent SF transplant I knew I had a nice selection of ice cream shoppes to choose from.  I already tasted Bi-Rite and knew that was pretty good ice cream.  However, it wasn't until I tried Mitchell's that I felt I finally tasted divine richness.

I had the rum raisin and this was the creamiest most delectable combination of flavors I've tasted in a while.  My partner tried Grasshopper Pie.  That too was good, but it was way to minty for my tastes.  I did enjoy the nice chunks of oreo cookies though.
author: Khristian B.

description:
come during off peak hours and if it's your first time, you get lots of tastings, tons of attention and customer service, and NO lines! didn't even know it was so popular til my friend told me and i saw all the yelp reviews, since it wasn't busy! it closes at 11pm and came at 10pm on a weekday - definitely a great time to come! 

some of my favorites
- tropical 4 - SO GOOD (banana, guava, pineapple, mango) - let the ice cream linger on your palette and you can taste each fruit
- mango - if you love mango, you'll LOVE this
- ube (taro) - interesting at first, but then really good! 
- pumpkin - tastes just like pumpkin pie
- grasshopper pie - decent to me 
- cantalope - very cantalope-y

my friend will try a new flavor every time he visits. good idea! not too expensive and they definitely give you a great size scoop!
author: Jen S.

description:
I really wished I lived near here, because I'd get ice cream EVERYDAY!

The service and staff are friendly, and they have a nice organization. Take a number, Wait in line, Order, and Eat! :] DELISHHHH. 

I love that their tub sizes are at a reasonable price and they have cakes here too. They have really unique flavors as well.

Think it's about time that I go back because I'm forgetting what the ice cream tastes like as I type!!!!

happy eating! :)
author: Liberty C.

description: Another goodie ice cream shop. is it better than bi-rite? ehhhhh. i like them both, and they're different, and both are good quality. get the lemon chiffon!
author: Aletheia W.

description:
I grew up on Mitchell's, but oddly enough, I've never been to the actual ice cream parlor. I have driven by it a million and two times, but finally had the opportunity to experience it first hand. It was raining, and there was a line. That says something right there. Even though I got two hand packed pints to take home, I still count that as an experience. 

I could have easily went to any Asian grocery and got twice the amount of the same exact ice cream for half the amount, but I wanted to experience it. So after a gut busting dinner at The Front Porch, some friends and I decided to brave the wait at Mitchell's so we can take some ice cream home.

My all time favorite is Ube. It reminds me of my childhood and my grandma's house. Mango is also very good. So creamy and delicious. I've never had any of their "normal" flavors because I'm a sucker for the tropical (Asian) flavors like Ube, Mango, Halo Halo, Macapuno, etc. 

Oh, and by the way, I'm seriously lactose intolerant. So that says a lot that I would put myself through a potential torture all for a taste of Mitchell's. T.G.F.L. (Thank God For Lactaid).
author: Joshua C.

description: Much better than Bi-Rite and it doesn't take waiting in a long line to get the yummy.
author: Jim D.

description: Amazingly creamy and rich! So I do like the fun flavors at Humphrey's, but the texture of the ice cream here is perfect. Super creamy and delicious! They have all the classics plus a few interesting ones, like ube (purple yam) and Mexican chocolate. Definitely will come back for more!
author: Euna K.

description: Always packed, always chaos and honestly I've found some of their flavors hit and miss, especially when compared to Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe. That said, their PEANUT BUTTER INDULGENCE is to die for (it gets 4 stars easy) and when it comes down to it, so far, it's the only flavor worth returning for... so far, I have to try some more :-).
author: G C.

description:
You truly have never tried ice cream until you have tried Mitchell's. 

The first spoon I tried felt like butter on my lips. So rich, creamy, delicious! I had asked for one scoop, which to be honest was more than enough. The line is long, normally out the door but I felt it moved pretty quickly and for sure worth the wait!
author: monica s.

description:
So after nearly five decades and 1200 + reviews this place is still going pretty strong. For a weekend outing with the family, I figured an ice cream parlor would be a perfect getaway from the stress of real life and to reacquaint with the kid at heart. Mitchell's apparently holds some stellar awards annually at a couple of state fairs and even with the touch of Filipino influence it was enough to convince me to give it a shot.

Driving across the impacted Bay Bridge and into Noe Valley, finding parking was like playing hot wheels cars in a lego house, no bueno or space at all. Arriving at the entrance many people wanted to chill within the relaxing atmosphere with a scoop or two. I sampled a few orders and got a few scoops for myself and the family:

Samples

-The Mexican Chocolate
-The Mango (their most popular)

Orders

-1 small order of the Kahlua Mocha Cream
-1 regular order of the Halo Halo

The Mexican Chocolate was like a bitter dark chocolate version of its rich American Milk Chocolate Counterpart. Imagine Montezuma gone black and bitter like Flavor Flav with the added corny viking hat. The Mango was pretty sweet and rich and it reminded me of a half White and half Mexcan girl I crushed on back during freshman year of college.

The Halo Halo flavor was decent, and a different approach to the typical Magnolia Ice Cream brand I was accommodated to growing up. It almost look like a hybrid of Ube and Black Bean but much different in texture. Didn't really taste half of the halo halo flavors, but it satisfied the family sharing. The Kahlua flavor was decent, sweet with a hint of the coffee liquor as an after taste. Nothing really surprising here (guess I'm becoming quite picky).

Overall, spent about $7.00 with tax and tip. The line could be managed better but with the ticket servicing it made things much easier to deal with. As for the rating well time gave it a solidified foundation of support over the years and they're making efforts to provide new flavors so kudos in that department. It was great to see the city but now I need to head off to Humphry Slocombe and see what's with all the hype over there!
author: Ryan M.

description: I am a huge huge ice cream fan. I can't get enough of Mitchell's grasshopper pie! If you absolutely love ice cream, you will absolutely fall head over heels with this one!! It is guaranteed.
author: Kara Y.

description:
I can't believe I never reviewed Mitchell's ice cream!  Yet again, I don't think to add another review coz it's the BEST ever!  It's a San Francisco treat!  
I've been going to this place for a loooooong time.  I remember when the gallon was cheaper than it is now, yet again, I know they use great ingredients so I still keep buying.  
Tropical flavors are the best ever.  Quality is awesome!  It's actually better than other Filipino ice cream makers like Magnolia.  Flavors are just really there and it's not oily like others.  Now that's real ice cream!
I always love trying their seasonal flavors, cantaloupe, thai tea, etc.  Love it!  
Today, my husband and I recently discovered their hazelnut ice cream.  I think it's called some italian sounding name, but wow!!  Sooo good. So much better than gelato places with their hazelnut.  
I know people try to compare this place to Bi-Rite, but I think parking is so much  better here than Bi-Rite.  Sorry Bi-Rite you got good salted caramel, but Mitchell's ice cream is easier to get to.
author: Claire J.

description:
Everyone in SF knows about Mitchell's Ice Cream...first couple times I had ice cream here I thought it was just A-OKAY...nothing to rave about. But, after coming here for the third time I am impressed. It looks like they re-modeled the place a little bit, and tried some of their coconut flavor's + white pistachio...GOOD STUFF! 

If you came here before and it didn't rock your socks or leave you with a better than average feeling...give them another chance. They have improved.
author: Nick C.

description:
If you're not giving Mitchell's five stars, you're completely crazy. I've never taken someone here who doesn't like it. They have every ice cream flavor you can imagine, and some you probably can't. I think their flavor selection stops just short of Parrot...

Anyway, if you like Ice Cream and you're in the area, it's worth it. I make it out here once every couple months just to see what I'm missing, and it's totally worth it.
author: Devin K.

description: I love the ube ice cream here. I've never heard of such a flavor but the purple color made me think of taro and I love taro. The ube ice cream is not overly sweet and it has an interesting texture that you may find on smooth mashed potatoes, which might not sound appealing to you but trust me, this is a must-have if this is your first time at Mitchell's. I also thought the mango was quite good. I just wish they had more homemade ice cream parlors in San Diego.
author: Jessica T.

description: Grew up eating their ice cream. Even tho the line is long it goes by quicker than you think it would. All ice cream from here is amazing, thats why you see restaurants throughout the city even showing that they sell mitchells ice cream. Simply amazing
author: Fernando H.

description: Chocolate dip thin mint on a waffle cone.  SO GOOD!  I wanted to try the other flavors but was in a minty mood, the horchata seems interesting, and lots of people around were getting it.  Next time I'm in the city, definitely gotta try that one! It was pretty packed, but it was quick for my number to get called, totally worth the wait :)
author: Tanya T.

description: I LOVE Mitchell's. When I was a little girl my Mom would take me to Mitchell's and she would get the Macapuno (baby coconut) ice cream and I would get the Mexican Chocolate. They have so many awesomely unique flavors that cannot be found anywhere else. The parking can be somewhat difficult- it is SF, so that shouldn't be that surprising! Many times they will have a line out of the building and around the corner.
author: Grace G.

description:
I was part of Clifford C.'s group of 8 and I agree with him:  Mitchell's is awesome! There is always a line for good reason.  The last time I went our friends decided to taste test even with the line behind us.  I personally would have pulled an "ice cream nazi" on them and said no samples, the line is too long; but the Michell's guy actually grabbed a bunch of samples for everyone.  5 stars for the great ice cream and customer service!  I wish I had some Mitchell's ice cream now.

Update: I still wish I had some Mitchell's ice cream right now.
author: Tabitha S.

description:
Man, Im from tha bay.  An been around a lil while.  An if you still refer to our city as "Frisco", then a review isnt really needed for Mitchell's.  This place is The best ice cream joint here, hands down.  They always of different flavors to choose from, some of which cant be found at your wack consumer chains (BR, Coldstone...).  They're made in-house, and the flavors are rotated in and out every few months... hell its the only place I can get an awsome milkshake mix of avacado/thai tea/ubo (purple yam), they have an excellent ratio of ice cream and milk which makes the drink creamy and VERY tasty.  Word of caution, the Halo-halo is good, but very messy, the cup its served in is way too small, so as soon as you put your spoon in, niagara falls! But its bomb! Thai tea was recently put out of the selection and melon/cantalope was brought in, so act now to get some of that ice cream...

Also, the place is almost always packed, so be ready to pick a number (literally) and wait 10-20 minutes.  And thats on a typical overcast chilly frisco weather.
author: Jo R.

description:
I had their oreo cookie ice cream and it was yummy-licious!  The ice cream was packed w/ oreos, big and small chunks.  I felt as though I was actually eating the oreos dunked in milk.  

I love this place.
author: Tram N.

description:
Mitchell's is like San Fran's better answer to Di Di Reise. Only with a little Scoops thrown in.  The Mexican chocolate and the chocolate peanut butter are amazing.  So are the avocado and calamansi (kudos to them for HAVING calamansi).  I thought I could hande a 2 scoop cone after stuffing my  face with Vietnamese food, but I was wrong.  Luckliy I had a friend there to pick it up.

The wait here can be long, but rather than a crazy line they give out numbers.  Like a Jewish bakery.  Gotta love that they serve cream all day and night but don't make the customers feel like cattle.
author: Sara L.

description:
Very creamy and rich good ole ice cream with a gamut of flavors. I sampled thin mint, coconut, halo halo, cantaloupe and avocado. Avocado was a bit interesting. We got the halo halo (combo of 4 diff tropical flavors and mung beans) and cantaloupe. Very delicious, even on a cold SF day.

$9 credit card minimum.
author: Natalie S.

description:
When I heard Ube Ice Cream my mind went straight to "WTF?!"

However still against my better judgment i tried it, and it was DELICIOUS!!! definitely awesome. The portions were big for how cheap it was too!  I loved it! There are so many different and unique flavors here that you won't find in many other stores. 

Though I only tried this one flavor, from what I saw all the flavors are equally as orgasmic!
author: Jess G.

description:
This is a wonderful ice cream shop that doesn't disappoint. Despite the long line and tight crowd, it is absolutely worth waiting for. They have an amazing selection of flavors, but I always get the ube ice cream no matter what.

I would love to find a place like this in the San Jose area!
author: Zha L.

description:
For my 666th review I decided to choose a sinful destination.

A few of my SF buddies highly recommended Mitchell's as it is their favorite ice cream spot. I can definitely see why. A varied menu of super creamy ice cream make this an easy spot to love.

When approaching the address I began to think that I had entered the wrong neighborhood. My mistake, it just turns out that Mitchell's is situated by itself on the road. It was easy to spot because of the line trailing out of the establishment.

I was really shocked to find that they use a number taking system similar to the ones found at meat shops. I suppose they learned their lesson a long time ago. This system works well. My number was 45 yet they were only on number 20. I estimate it was a 15 minute wait.

I had a double scoop of mexican chocolate and a new flavor called "salty n' sweet peanut" in a waffle cone. The peanut ice cream lived up to the salty and sweet title, I didn't expect there to be whole nuts in the ice cream. I would have preferred chopped peanuts or no peanuts. It was too much for my mouth: salty, sweet, super crunchy. The mexican chocolate is good.

The ice cream is super creamy. I tend to bite my ice cream but this demanded a licking. It melts really fast too. I'd advise going the single scoop route. After eating my cone I felt like I had eaten a bar of cookie dough. And what's with waffle cones always having a tiny hole at the bottom? Be weary of drips.

I see the hype and now understand it. It hasn't entirely won me over yet I wouldn't deny a return.
author: Michael H.

description: Really over-hyped. Between us, tried 5 flavors-none were great.
author: Arasch L.

description: The BEST ice cream ever!!! I have been a customer almost my whole life. Great variety of creative flavors. This ice cream can stand up to any homemade ice ceream.  This place had been in business for over 50 years. You can also purchase it by the gallon at the Jamaican grocery store on the corner of 41st and Broadway.
author: Elyse R.

description:
Mmmmmm......1 scoop of rum raisin on a waffle cone please!!!!

Must try: rum raisin, pineapple coconut, mango, Mex chocolate and just try all of them...you can sample as many flavors. You won't be disappointed. 

The wait is not that bad just grab a number wait around until you here your number being called through their intercom..parking does suck at times..ice cream is totally worth it yummmo
author: arlene d.

description:
1 word.  Grasshopper.  It's simply the best.  A mixture of all the great flavors in history: Mint, Chocolate Chips, Oreos, Brownie, Fudge.  I had to take a pint to go or else I knew I would have regretted it for life.  

I really like the ice cream here.  Its super creamy, which is a different texture than bi-rite, but the richness of the flavor is everlasting.  I tried a few flavors before ultimately choosing toasted coconut and cantelope.  The taro was overwhelming.  Many of the flavors here are exquisite like jackfruit, mexican chocolate, avocado, toasted pistachio.  There wasn't a flavor that I sampled I didn't enjoy.  

The only thing sucky about this place is the long wait during peak hours.  Yes, its that good!  If you're really G, slip the guy at the counter a Benji and the yummy goodness will be yours!

*nom nom*
author: Steve H.

description: My family have been going here for over 30yrs. My mom would get me ice cream from here as a kid and now I'm taking my son. Best flavors are pistachio, coconut pineapple, mango and New York cherry. The half gallon is $10 but it's worth it. The staff is PATIENT and let you try anything you want no matter if there is 2 people or a line of 20. Word of advice there are two lines. The one on the right is for half gallons and the left line is for small orders like cups and cones
author: Max H.

description: My friend said this place was in the book of one of the places you must visit before you die and damn it was right! I ordered the young coconut and OH MY it  was heaven! I swear it was soo good. If you ever visit SF you have got to check this place out. I've been to many ice cream joints before and by far this is the best one I've been too. They have a wide selection of flavors to entice your taste buds. I only wish they had more locations but I guess that is what makes Mitchells unique.
author: Matthew L.

description:
Uhm, I think I'm going to get thrown out of the bay area for only giving this landmark only 2 stars.  Okay fine, I'll give it 3.  Now can I stay?

After going to a party in Lemos Farm in Half Moon Bay, we decided to make the extra half-hour trip up here to FINALLY try Mitchell's.  We've heard numerous people recommend this place to us and because of it's far proximity to Campbell, we never were able to try it.  The 30-minute drive was too long.  The anticipation was killing me!  Mitchell's supposedly had the best ice cream north of....... that stinky patch of freeway on the 5 (Kinda turned you off of food now, huh?).  Anyway, as I turn from Valley Drive onto San Jose Ave, I see tons of people outside the shop.  Great.  Just great.  After circling the block 3 times, I finally find a spot right in front of the shop.  This has to be an omen.  God wants me to get this ice cream.  I don't care how long I have to wait in line.  Only thing, there's no line.  Why?  Because they have a number system.  I feel like I'm in 99 Ranch.  They're at #19.... next number has to be 30 max.  Pull ticket to reveal....... 60!!  Huh?  No way there's 41 people ahead of me.  Oh well.  If God wants me to get ice cream, I guess I can wait an hour.  Luckily, most of the numbers between 19 and 61, left.  Wait time: 25 minutes.  Score!  There were about 7 or 8 "ice cream scooper uper persons" behind the counter.  All of them were friendly.  I pick out 4 scoops, 2 for me, 2 for my lovely wife and go on my merry way.  The 4 scoops:  Oreo Cookies, Macapuno, Halo Halo, and Ube.  

The Verdict?  
Oreo Cookies - My favorite.  Better than any store bought version of this flavor.
Macapuno - Too heavy on the coconut taste.  Almost like oil was used.
Halo Halo - Decent.  Tasted like the dessert.  On the other hand, my favorite part of Halo Halo is the leche flan.
Ube - Got this for Karen.  I'm not a fan usually, so I didn't like it.

Bottom line is that I don't think it's worth the drive.  I'm known for driving hours for good food and this doesn't make the list.  In my opinion, Marianne's in Santa Cruz is 3 times better.  They won't have as many of the tropical flavors, but their ice cream is superior.

Side notes:  They have different take home sizes and ice cream cakes, too.  They also sell cookies like pepperidge farm.  I wonder if anyone buys these here?!?!
author: Jamie J.

description: Good ice cream, and it's close to my house (which helps). Although I prefer bi-rite. Some of the flavors at Mitchell's are a bit too much for me so I end up sticking with the sorbets.
author: T S.

description:
I really like this place.

Coconut pineapple ice cream was delicious.  Although there was a long wait, I think it was worth it at the end.

The price is good for the big portion they give!
author: Ty P.

description:
the only place in town worth standing in line for ice cream

if ya dont know now ya do

if ya dont go less line for me
author: Scotty B.

description:
With my double scoops of avocado and halo-halo at Mitchell's today, I have successfully tried all the SF ice cream shops on this invisible list of mine. Unfortunately, while the ube wasn't totally amazing, the rest of Mitchell's offerings definitely didn't disappoint!

Good things
- Tropical flavors: This is the first thing I noticed when I stepped inside the shop. There is an entire section of ice cream flavors dedicated to their tropical flavors, including the aforementioned avocado (really creamy and delicious, but too much for an entire full scoop), halo-halo (a combination of ube, sugar palm dried fruit, pineapples, beans, and this greenish jelly called buko, it was really unique and a great creamy consistency that the ube flavor was missing by itself). The coconut pineapple was awesome and much, much better than the scoops I had at Rite-Aid growing up :) Mango was just okay. The bright hue made me feel like there were tons of artificial coloring in it.
- Horchata: Their horchata flavor is one of the best I've had, so good that it deserves its own bullet point! There are caramel ribbons in it, which probably doesn't make it super authentic, but caramel anything is amazing. 
- Size/price ratio: A single scoop is $3.20 (not in a fancier cone though, that's extra) but its a really large scoop. A double scoop is $5.20 but it's seriously enough for a meal.
- Ticketing system: Why don't all ice cream shops do this?? It's so much more effective than having a massive line. You go in, pull a number from the machine near the door and wait until they call your number over the loud speaker.

Other notes
- Ice cream has a really creamy consistency. If you're from the Bay Area, this ice cream would be more like Fenton's vs. Bi-Rite or Ici. I'm not as big of a fan of the creaminess, so it wasn't as amazing to me.
- A single scoop is limited to a single flavor :(





- Credit cards require $10 minimum so bring cash if you're not going for an ice cream overload
- There's a parking lot in the back, but you're better off finding parking on the streets during busy weekends
author: Shira C.

description:
Delicious icecreams, interesting flavors, and a tiny location.  What else do you want?

Went here on a rainy day and had to wait in line -- always a promising sign.  Nice assortment of flavors, not just the normal selection you'll see everywhere.  I went with peanut butter indulgence in a chocolate dipped wafflecone.  Delicious.  The gf went with a scoop of the grasshopper, which was also quite good -- a nice mellow mint flavor, not as strong (or as toothpaste-y) as the others.   I liked that they grouped the flavors into 'tropical' and 'Standard,' the menu was easy to read quickly.

Good consistency, but not very far down the creamy, buttery path some icecreams go; I'd peg it as a bit lighter than most other premium icecreams because of that.  

No seating is a downer, but not a deal breaker by any means; they actually have their own parking lot (in SF!  amazing) but good luck finding an empty spot in it.  Just park and walk a few blocks.  

It's healthier that way.
author: Aaron L.

description: This is probably the only ice cream spot I would go to on the coldest SF nights. To be honest, I only get a double scoop of coffee ice cream in a waffle cone and I will never get tired of it. The ice cream is perfectly blended where it's not too heavy, but you know that you're eating legit ice cream and not some soft serve from a machine. It's definitely been my favorite ice cream shop since I first tried it back when I was 6. Now I'm 21 going on 22 and I still believe that no ice cream shop can compare.
author: Daryl A.

description:
Oh such yummy ice cream.  This is the first creamery I went to in SF.  It is delicious.  I got the macapuno (coconut) and tried a lick or two off my 2 other friends'.  I just love coconut ice cream, especially if they put shreds in.  Yum.

It is just too bad this location is all the way on the other side of where I live.  However, Mitchell started selling their ice cream in gallons.  I found the gallons at an Asian supermarket.  Super-psyched and got to try their halo halo ice cream.  That was the flavor I was recommended to try the first time, but they didn't have it when I went.

I was extremely excited to try the halo halo.  I fell in love with it, and so did the people I shared it with.
author: Linda C.

description: Whoa!  Whoa!  Whoa!  Whoa!  I wish I could get this at the grocery store behind my apartment in Brooklyn.  This is the best ice cream in the universe.  I'm moving to San Francisco.
author: Kristin P.

description:
I've discovered 2 times to visit Mitchell's and not have to endure the lines out the door:  before noon on a Saturday or Sunday, and after 9:30pm on a weeknight.  Caveat:  this won't apply if the weather is above 65 degrees.  

They hand-pack half-gallons of ice cream, if they don't already have your favorite flavor in the freezer.  You're crazy to leave without one.

Noe dwellers, you can also get about a dozen flavors of Mitchell's ice cream at Subs Inc on 24th and Castro.
author: Kelli R.

description: No space age liquid nitrogen machine here.  No hip recipe mixing in bourbon with corn flakes.  Just great quality ingredients with a creamy texture.  Mitchell's vanilla ice cream is just called "Vanilla".  But if you look at the ingredients, it will list genuine Madagascar bourbon vanilla.  The heavy gooey chocolate is a perennial award winner.  I also like the cinnamon ginger snap.  The décor is plain jane, but it works.
author: Hugh Y.

description:
Five starts just because they have some unique flavors!!!

Mitchells is a San Francisco Institution where generations have been coming to this creamery for a cool treat.  I came here with my wife after dinner and when we pulled up we saw the massive line (and this was at 10pm!!!)  We were able to park right in front of the store and got a number.  When we got our number they were serving number 11 and our number was 46!!!  There were people outside enjoying their scoops and we were so torn about what to get.  So many great flavors and not enough stomach space!  

About 25 minutes later, our number was called!  I went with a scoop of Strawberry's and Cream and a scoop of roasted almonds.  My wife got the Mexican Hot Chocolate and we loved it.  

Definitely will be back for more Mitchell's!
author: Henry S.

description:
Good golly miss molly they make rich and creamy ice cream. I've driven by this place and there's always a lot of people waiting. I can understand why. This is probably some of the best ice cream I've ever tasted. No way did I ever expect to have ice cream taste exactly like pumpkin pie, it was like having a religious experience. 

Tis the season for festive flavors, apart from the pumpkin there was eggnog and peppermint candy. If it were up to me I'd have ice cream every day and spoon it by the truckload, it is that good. Despite the fact that it is cold outside it is worth having a mouthful of deliciousness. There's so many flavors that I want to go back and try like  coconut, mexican chocolate and spumoni. 

This is way better than any Baskin Robbins or other shop, it's like walking into an American past time favorite. Very enjoyable parlor!
author: Morgan M.

description:
"Hurrrr-rry".   That's what I told hubby.  Trying to nudge him faster, like poking an elephant with a fly swatter where its hide is impervious to the soft plastic. 

I wanted to rush over to Mitchell's before the crowds got there.  It had just gotten a write-up in the newspaper and I've been meaning to actually visit the store, the original store, not all the other stores which carries their ice cream.  Now that it's in print, I realize I've forgotten to make the trek and we'd better get over there before the crowds got out of Sunday church. 

Hubby moaned and groaned, then sighed.  Humor me, OK?  Foodies do that, they read about it in the paper and they have try it.  It's a sickness, OK?  

He doesn't like the neighborhood because he got a ticket in the past for parking just 1 inch over, into the red painted DMV curb of someone's driveway and they called the DMV to give him a ticket at 6:45PM.  It's parking ticket PTSD.

When we got to Mitchell's and found out they have parking in the rear for at least 6 cars, he was beside himself, "I like this place!"  OK, Mr. Elephant. 
No crowds. I think to myself,  What time?  They're all still in church.  Hurry.... get the ice cream and run before the crowds arrive.  The store must've been alerted about the publication because they were overrunned with ice cream scoopers behind the counter.  I tasted the coconut and young coconut and Halo Halo.  Got a scoop of the young coconut and a pint of chocolate and a 1/2 gal of oreo cookie.  Hubby got the chocolate and started licking like a fiend.  By the time we got back to the car with our treasures, his lip was all encircled with choc ice cream and he looked like one of those milk moustache commercials gone crazy.  The freezers are filled with 1/2 gal containers of their ice cream, so you need to ask for a taste of the ice cream before you buy the whole thing, under $10,  which is cheaper than a couple of pints of their ice cream. Scoops are about $2.80. 

The oreo ice cream was OK, a tad too sweet for me but had huge chucks of oreos in it.  Jr. Yelpers went insane over it.  I liked the young coconut but would pick Polly Anne's coconut over this one.  The chocolate?   To die for.  It was good, and I'm not a chocolate ice cream fan.  Spoonful after spoonful of this choc ice cream will put a smile on your face and a happy sigh of contentment.
author: Ry T.

description:
Best ice cream I've ever had. They have so many flavors you can't even imagine, fruits you have never heard of, combinations of flavors you'd never imagined would be good. They also have the good ol' standbys, like vanilla, chocolate, Mexican chocolate, pumpkin, cookies and cream, grasshopper, mint chip...okay, those aren't the most common standbys, but I swear by them. Oh, and around the holidays their eggnog is to die for!

The negative: they are always packed and if you go on a weekend night the wait is crazy, parking can be a complete pain, and there is no where to sit and enjoy your scoop - you have to take it and eat it on the sidewalk, in your car in the parking lot, or on the drive home.
author: Natasha Anna A.

description:
This place is great!

I've become an avid fan because it's so close to wear I live.

The place is very clean and the customer service is rather friendly. To make things fast and efficient, they use a numbering system. You walk in, pull your tag and wait to be called. This place can get pretty packed after school and work hours, but they seem to handle it pretty well.

One of my recent discoveries & favorite flavors is Grasshopper pie. It's so amazing!! It combines there of my favorite ingredients: Oreos, Fudge and Mint Ice Cream! Great for those who love cookies-n-cream or chocolate flavors in general. My girlfriend ordered the cantaloupe and it was delicious. Very fresh, creamy and authentic tasting.

You can even buy ice cream tubs their flavors to take home, as well as ice cream cakes and pies (I have yet to try one).

The only downside to this place is the parking (they have a very small lot in the back, but that fills up fast, unless you go before 4pm). You'll have to stick to street parking, take public transit or have one of your buddies on stand by in the car.
author: Andrew C.

description: I'll love this place every time I come sf, I'm thinking how am I going to get some mitchell's ice cream today.  The only downfall is all the flavors are wonderful and I just can't decide which one, White pistachio, baby coconut, ube, halo halo, etc. I also see that they make their own ice cream cake there too, I think for my birthday this year I'm going order one. There usually is a little wait if you grab a number by the door you will be called shortly. The staff is very friendly and quick!  Definitely a place to stop by when you're in San Francisco. Oh and there's also parking!!!! That deserves a extra star in it's self!!
author: Whitney N.

description: Best Ice Cream EVER!  I don't smoke weed, sorry---but if I did, I would buy a quart of black Walnut and walk across the street to Safeway.  Buy a white sheet cake, say Happy Birthday to whatever and just enjoy myself!  Too bad I have a real life with kids and a wife...someone please enjoy that for me!
author: Ty A.

description: I scream for Mitchell's Ice Cream!!! It is truly just that great!!!  The selections of ice cream flavors are just mind blowing.  They have a range of exotic and yummy flavors that you just cant buy in te grocery stores.  I loved the coconut ice cream with actual bits and shreds of coconut meat.  The mexican chocolate was rich and creamy. Yummm.  There usually is a wait out the door, but if you go early enough, you won't need to wait as long :p
author: wisdom m.

description:
It's amazing to walk into a place and like everything, especially if you're me, since I am one picky mofo. Don't get me wrong, I only walk out with chocolate, but I've tasted almost all they have to offer over the years and hot damn that's some yum. 
Once I almost ordered the yam. If you knew me that would be enough to have you racing over to Mitchell's right now, even though it's probably 3am and you're in jammies.
author: Rhubarb M.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!

ok the parking does suck and the lines are hella long but its WORTH it!!! I try to get a new flavor each time and they never disappoint me! But i have to say Ube is my favorite! I never thought I would like a purple ice cream that had the description "purple yam" but its delicious!
author: Andrea C.

description:
EAT HERE, MAKE YOUR BELLY SMILE.
I grew up coming to Mitchell's whenever my parents were in the area.  I loved it as a child, and i especially love it now.  It's been about five years since i last went and i thought maybe my memory had over-hyped how good it is.  Nope, its so damn good.  My favorite has always been the Rum Raisin, its just awesome.  Tasty treats bring back great childhood memories, and everyone in line is usually pretty cool.  You should make it a personal mission to attempt to eat every single flavor they offer.
author: Eric M.

description:
Okay so I underestimated this place.  I thought it was only known for the Filipino ice cream.  Because I am Filipino, I've tried the mango, the ube, the coconut etc.  I wanted something different that day and preferred going to Bi-Rite Creamery.  But this guy I'm currently dating said that Mitchell's was to die for...their ice cream was "bomb".  I must admit he was right!  It turned out that Mitchell's  wasn't just known for their Filipino ice cream but for other American flavors as well.  I got a Biscotti flavored ice cream.  I cannot recall it's exact name but it was DELISSSSHHHH!  I decided to add another scoop of ice cream which was mango.  I topped it off with hot fudge.   OH.  MY. GOSH.  It was like heaven!

I secretly have been wanting to try this place ever since I saw it on the Travel Channel.  It was jam packed with no Asians except for me and my boy.  It was cool though.  It was nice to see different cultures taste a piece of the Philippines.  

I wonder how their HOT MANGO topping taste like.  Can't wait to come back!
author: Kanani N.

description:
I got the "Halo Halo" here the first time I went here. It's got more things in it than I can name but there are purple things, beans, and candied fruits. I had to order it because it's not like you can get it from the supermarket. It's like a little treasure chest for your mouth. I loved it. 

The second time I went here, I got the Spumoni. Loved it. 

The third time, I got young coconut. How do they pack so much flavor into a tiny bite?

Not sure what I will try next time but I've got the feeling I will not be disappointed.
author: Jin I.

description: This is my favorite spot to visit after I visit my grandma in SF. Their ice cream is definitely worth the wait in those long lines. The lines actually move fairly quickly. They have a wide range of ice cream flavors to choose from. They have your classics to various tropical flavors, like Ube and Halo Halo. The waffle cones a crisp and made fresh.
