I like how they add cinnamon to the batter. Who doesn't love the smell of fresh waffle cones off the waffle maker! My favorite flavor is their Toasted Almond. I love love love it! The employees there are so nice. They are so sweet and definitely hook up your ice cream scoops. Their single scoop is HUGE lol Don't feel rushed when you're trying to select your flavor, especially if it's you're first time here. The employees give you their undivided attention and let you sample any flavor you like! Hmm..I think it's time to pay my grandma a visit lol.
author: Ashley S.

description: My favorite flavor of ice cream is grasshopper pie. Mitchell's has super awesome grasshopper pie with huge chunks of oreos, minty mint and creaminess.  Therefore I think Michell's is super awesome. Transitive property, people. This flavor alone is worth the massive wait and pain in the ass parking situation (that is, if you don't snag a spot in the lot). Also, there's an express line for those buying items in the freezers like cakes (someone please get me one for my birthday, thanks), chocolate covered bananas, half gallons or any of the assorted cookies/toppings they have for sale.
author: Sara P.

description:
AS GOOD AS IT GETS!
I adore all the more exotic flavors. And the basics. Ok ok, I love it all.

I'm from the peninsula, so a visit to Mitchell's is definitely a treat. Whether it's spontaneous with a friend or a bunch of us on a group outing, Mitchell's never ceases to please, no matter the weather, no matter the wait.

Yum.
author: Chantal D.

description: Not really a fan of Mitchell's Ice Cream, but let me tell you... I discovered that they sell frozen banana covered in chocolate with nuts. It was soo yummy... Their price for it is reasonable. It is freshly made, because they put in a zip lock bag. So for now on, whenever I crave for frozen bananas I'm definitely coming back to this place. Unless you'll can recommend a different place around San Francisco that sells them. I would give it a five star but customer service needs improvement and a faster service. But over all this place is fairly decent, just wish they had a place to sit down inside instead of sitting outside. And yes they do have a private parking lot.
author: Donna S.

description:
Mitchell's Ice cream is the go to when I am looking for something a little more then the norm. The staff is always quick and ready to help the next customer. Parking can get a bit difficult on a busy night, but its worth the wait.

This visit I had a hard time deciding between their banana and strawberry ice cream. So, I ended up getting a double scoop. I enjoy all of their fruit ice creams and sorbets.
author: Kristina S.

description: Sorry Bi-Rite, but I think Mitchell's wins my heart for best ice cream EVER. So many flavors to choose from! My current favorite is the Oreos.. yummy, delicious, and jam-packed with oreo cookies in every. single. bite!
author: Vivian H.

description:
Meh.  

The line is quite long, and it's a "take a number" affair.  As such it's processed rather in order like the DMV or the Passport Office, which is to say in spurts, and with an interminable wait.  Still, for good product, it's understandable, and Bi-Rite Creamery does make us suffer more dearly ...

But the product -- well, the ice cream's texture is almost as if there's gum arabic in there somewhere.  You can almost chew it.  The chocolate ice cream isn't bitter at all, it's rather like a Hershey's bar.  Mexican chocolate is quite nice but it's not really all that interesting after a few bites.  The mint flavor tastes like those little Andes mints you get in diners.  

What irks me the most about Mitchell's, though, and mostly gets me to three stars, is their boasting about their "local" credentials on signs in their windows -- while having stacks and stacks of Pepperidge Farms cookies, Smucker's Jam, etc. -- basically crap from the Safeway next door.  We're supposed to believe they are SO wholesome, serving home-made ice cream since 1957, a beacon of the community, but they can't get fresh cookies from a bakery down the street, or home-made jam in an area known for the very best.

Basically they're a part of the community when it's convenient for them.  That's fine, they're a business.  But don't feed me a load of horse dung about your virtuous presence when I'm waiting in a long line for your gummy ice cream.  That's what chain restaurants do.
author: J W.

description: So awesome and woth the wait.  My favorite is the pumpkin ice cream (seasonal).  Get a quart and take it to a holiday party to enjoy with friends.  Plus, if you get a quart you don't have to wait in line!
author: Mel H.

description:
am i going to be shamed for giving this place three stars?

a friend and i came here a few nights ago... i think it was a random tuesday at about 9:30p or something and the place was PACKED.  we pulled our number and hung out outside and waited.

and then we waited a little bit more.

and then some more.

did i mention that we waited?

yeah, because we did.  we waited.

then our number was called, hooray!

we basically already knew what we wanted.  my friend got a black walnut ice cream sundae with hot fudge and whipped cream.  i got a scoop of toasted almond ice cream with whipped cream and hot fudge and even though i didn't say "no nuts," the dude gave me nuts.  peanuts, no less.  GROSS!  i almost sent it back and had him make it again but i wasn't in the mood.

but for the record, the peanuts ruined the sundae.

also, the toasted almond ice cream was bland as all get out.  oh and also, the sundae was crafted terribly -- there were basically 8 inches of hot fudge at the bottom of the cup.  alright, i'm exaggerating.  but seriously, a ton of hot fudge was at the bottom.  seriously, man?  i don't know why they put a one scoop sundae in a tall cup like that but whatever.  it's not like i ever worked at an ice cream shop before... YES I HAVE.

anyways.  whatever.  there's way better ice cream out there, with better service, with tastier flavors.

excuse me for a minute, Mitchell's, im'ma let you finish but Fenton's in Oakland has the best toasted almond ice cream ever.
author: Lauren P.

description: Yummy in the tummy!  Best ice cream in SF!
author: Stephanie D.

description:
UBE-BABY!! I'm in lala love with their Ube Ice Cream! :) 

Keepin' it short and simple :)
author: Lianne D.

description:
How can I decide what flavor I'm gonna get?!
Close my eyes and pick a flavor at random.

Where do I begin? This place is so classy. I love it. I love how small it is. They don't want to move to a really fancy location or anything. Feels so down to earth. Their Peanut Butter Indulgence was probably to die for. So creamy, not too peanut buttery by any means. It's not until the point your tongue is covered with peanut butter. You get a little bit of that, but that's how I personally like peanut butter ice cream. They also packed on a ton of other stuff. They are by no means stingy. Their ube is SO GOOD. Tropical ice cream done right. So creamy, rich, everything you could ever want in a tropical ice cream. Their service was terrific, too. Nice and friendly. Down to earth, too. Though the lines are long (exactly what you would expect for terrific ice cream), the wait is absolutely worth it.
author: Alex L.

description:
During my first trip to Mitchell's there was a slight breeze in the air yet a line winding outside the door.  The by number system and hard working staff really speed things along however.  You will have a wait, if you don't have the extra time there are plenty of sub-par ice cream parlors with drive thrus.  You might even save a little pocket change at another store, but don't expect the variety and great flavor. 

The variety, not long wait or cost...or even lack of eating space, is the worst thing about this place.  Everything looks so good it really can be hard to pick.  I normally am not one to try anything too exotic and have rather bland taste but stepped outside the box once I saw the Halo-halo.  Yum!  The best decision I made during my whole day in SF.

Take the extra time and give it a try, they have something to satisfy the whole family.
author: SJ B.

description: Fiiinally tried Mitchell's last night...delish! Although it was pretty late on a Thursday it was actually packed but they moved through the line really quickly. Cool spot because they have a lot of flavors that I would never even imagine being made into ice cream... like avocado. I had a scoop of grasshopper on a cone and it was amazing! If you like tropical ice cream then this is your place, they have a bunch!
author: Gina C.

description:
I love ice cream and I love Mitchell's. Drove here from Mountain View just to try it -- great decision. Drove back with a tub filled with 6.65 lbs. of ice cream -- even better.

Everyone who works there is friendly and the selection is great. Our scooper had a fun attitude, force-fed us lots of samples (YAY), and gave us huge servings. Got there around 10pm on a Saturday and waited about 15 minutes in line, but it takes about that long to look over the extensive flavors list.

My favorites are the ube (purple yam) and both coconut flavors. Creamy, flavorful, not too sweet, great consistency. Haven't yet found ice cream to even compete anywhere else in the Bay.
author: Fonda C.

description:
This is my favorite Ice Cream shop in the City. I am a creature of habit: I always get chocolate chip in a waffle cone with the chocolate dip here, and it is a bring-me-back-to-childhood experience every time, even though that's not what I would eat as a kid.

They have the most amazing variety of flavors that I never seem to try, but my wife is often impressed by them. My kids, who are color-centric, go wild for purple (Ube) and orange (pumpkin) ice cream. My wife thinks the Mexican Chocolate is the bomb. 

Part of the experience is the wait. You get there, take a number, and schmooze with other waiting patrons. You take note of the amazing concoctions other people get as they squeeze out of the store. You assure first-timers that yes, this is worth the wait.

Bottom line: really good ice cream, great, old-time ice-cream shop feel, and a clearly popular place.
author: Brent D.

description: Various flavors.  Allowed sampling.  Delicious ice cream; heavy.  Might require to wait in a queue; obtain a ticket and wait for number to be called.  An ice cream stand; no indoor seating.  In between BART stations (closest to 24th St Mission).  Worth the walk.  Would recommend to friends.
author: Dwayne G.

description:
Want to show someone they're awesome? Get them an ice cream cake from these guys!
I called on a Wednesday to order a cake for that Sunday. I got their 7" round with a seasonal flavor (egg nog). It tasted nothing short of amaaahhhzing!
Larry was comfortable with my "special" request, which was that I wanted the cake to say "You're f****ing awesome."
Minus the censoring.
Yup.

-1 star because I ordered a cake that said "You're f***ing awesome" but got a cake that said "Your f***ing awesome." Unfortunately it was for a grammar perfectionist who noticed the error immediately. 
Note: It took an hour to thaw their smallest cake enough to cut. Make sure you don't schedule a pick-up time too close to your event or you'll be stuck waiting.
author: C S.

description: A friend came to visit us a few weeks back and brought us a 1/2 gallon of Mitchell's Ice Cream.  I had one serving their Oreo ice cream which was delicious and my family ate the rest leaving with a craving for more! Tonight,  after my husband's business dinner I asked home to stop by thinking because it was a crisp 64 degrees no one would be there... boy was I wrong! There was a line out the door. You know it is good when it's cold and people are waiting in line for ice cream! That one serving left me wanting more and tonight I got 1/2 of the Oreo & 1/2 gallon of their Coconut Pineapple... can't wait to try it. The Oreo is delicious.  Big pieces of Oreo. Simply delicious!! Although there was a line, the line was moving fast. I got what I wanted and simply walked up to the register and was out the door. I spent more time trying to make up my mind than I did checking out. 1/2 gallon was $10.35 and I was happy to spend that much per. You won't be disappointed. One serving and I became a fan so will you! Only issue,  if I wanted ice cream there it would be too small,  no where to sit.   It's a to go spot!
author: Elizabeth T.

description: I always thought Mitchell's was going to taste like dryers.  I was dead wrong.  The ice cream scooper fatty was nice.  He let us sample every single flavor in the shop.  It was awesome.  The ice cream was pretty freaking good.  Its probably my second favorite behind Bi rite.  Bi rite and this place has different textured ice cream.  I like them both because its not very buttery.  Humphrey's and smitten are too fatty.  I can grease a pan with my lips after eating their ice cream.  I will definitely be back.  I need to bring my fatty parents some day.  Fat asses.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Yes this is it.
Some of the best ice cream in frisco, great flavor, creamy, all different kinds of delicious ice cream and sundays, yummmmm.
If you haven't already tried it, then do so SOON.
One negative, long, long, long, looooooong lines at times, but DON'T BE TURNED OFF! Just remember, if you're new to Mitchell's to take a number and WAIT! 
By the way, try the Mocha Fudge and the Mexican Chocolate. yum!
author: Asher G.

description: They didn't have the Thai iced tea ice cream we initially went there for but their ube ice cream was a pretty damn good substitute.
author: Louie S.

description:
I've been going here for years and hands down...this is my favorite ice cream place and definitely worth the 5 stars.  I don't have a favorite flavor, but I like a bunch of the tropical ones.  I pass by the store on my way home from work and it never seems to amaze me that there's always a long line outside...year round.  
Eventhough it's hard to find parking and there's always a wait, it's worth it.
Enjoy!  Yum.
author: Ricky M.

description:
Yummy!  I'm impressed with Mithcells' halo halo ice cream.  I like how there are little bits in it like macapuno and mung beans but not to the point where it's too much chewing.

The texture of their ice cream is smooth and creamy.  Gotta go back for more soon.
author: Kandi K.

description:
I was worried that I would not find a great ice cream place in San Francisco compared to Boston. Was I wrong!!! Mitchell was absolutely amazing. I had a sundae with Claire's Pie... It was off the scale good. The place was packed at 8 o'clock on a cold night..
I am looking forward to the next time I get to go back!!!!!
author: Robert O.

description: I'm an ice cream junkie, and I just found heaven at this ice cream shop.  Everything I sampled and bought was good, creamy, flavor filled! Great customer service. Will come back again.
author: Serita M.

description:
I came here for at least two reasons: one being that this parlor generates as much hype as Bi-Rite has, and let's not kid ourselves Bi-Rite f**king is delicious. The other reason being that they sell ube ice cream. Sure I could have easily gone to my local Seafood City or Island Pacific to cop some in the frozen section, but where's the fun in that? Beside, Mitchell's actually make it on site. How can I say no to fresh ube ice cream?

So a huge plus for this place is that they have a mini parking lot in the back, hence reducing the amount of time to look for parking on the street should you get lucky. It has the authentic ice cream parlor feel to it, and you can see the rows of pepperidge farms cookie bags on the window to take home and enjoy with your ice cream. EDIT: the owner emailed in regard to my review. Thanks for the clarification that they use fresh Otis Spunkemeyer cookies to make your precious ice cream sandwich ($2.95), should you decide to cop one of these bad boys. Yes, they sell cakes too. 

As opposed to Bi-Rite where you wait in line as though you're going to the club, you just pick a number from that oh so common red ticket device and just huddle around the counter to see what flavors you want. Sorta unorganized but the number calling justifies it. 

Anyway, I got to try the ube on a waffle cone and it was everything I hoped it would be, and then some. The portion is just as generous as Bi-Rite gives, but they don't allow you to have an extra flavor per size as Bi-Rite does in order to give the customer more flexibility. Still delicious nonetheless. I also got to sample the grasshopper and it was pretty flavorful as well. The hints of mint and fudge complemented each other real well, and its something I'd consider trying next time since almost everyone else I was with decided to get it.

Worth the hype to me. Next up is Humphry Slocombe... whenever that day will be.
author: Loren John B.

description:
I've sampled a few of their flavors and my favorites are the ones I always take home: Macupuno (coconut) and the Kahlua Mocha. YUM! Ice cream here is SO much better than your regular store bought kind or most other ice cream shops. I knew I wouldn't be back for a while so I bought a half gallon (YIKES says my waistline) of the Macupuno, a pint of the Kahlua, and even a pint of this great chocolate one with peanut butter swirls with the peanut butter cups mixed in for the bf, which he LOVED. YUM.

Mitchells just tastes so much richer with bolder flavors partying with your taste buds. If you've never had it, GOOOOOO!

Awesome flavors, great service, and a brighter, newly remodeled shop is like changing that new light bulb and we're the bugs moving towards that light... 

Note: Just remember to walk in and grab that number from that machine to the left so you're serviced!
author: Ling H.

description: On our last night in Daly City/SF before moving back to the east bay, we finally had the chance to try Mitchell's Ice Cream. Not knowing what to get, I wanted to try the Mexican Chocolate however the they were completely out of Mexican Chocolate behind the counter however they had the quart sizes available. While waiting in line,  I noticed  some kids frantically looking for Mexican Chocolate in the freezer and finally found it and boy were they happy. I was thinking about snatching the last one but remembered we were moving the next day and was concerned the ice cream wasn't going to hold well during our move. So our number was called, I decided to get Rocky Road Ice Cream and my fiancé got something with chocolate and peanuts. One thing is for certain, Rocky Road Ice Cream from Mitchell's is soooooo much better than store bought Rocky Road. I usually have a little bit of ice cream because I have this paranoia that I'm lactose intolerant but after almost finishing the entire cup, I come to learn I'm immune to dairy. I hear that Ube is one of the most popular ice creams in Mitchell however I have this phobia of Ube since I was a little girl. When my sisters and I had birthdays, we would wish for chocolate cake for our birthdays but seems to never fail we would end up with ube and utter dissapointment. If I was going to give Ube a try, someone would need to hold me down and shoove a spoonful of Ube ice cream into my mouth and tell me it taste good. Ugh. So next time when I'm in the city, I'll pick up some Mexican Chocolate.
author: Jocelyn T.

description: Stop reading this and go to Mitchell's already.  Best. Ice Cream. Ever.
author: Ben K.

description:
True, you will likely encounter a long wait...make sure to grab a ticket on the left right as you enter the doorway...the number system keeps the crowd in check.

Parking is a b*tch, but maybe parking a few blocks away is a good way to burn off those extra calories.

Mitchell's ice cream is great.  They have a great selection of flavors for any taste.  Prices are very fair.  About $3 for a single scoop in a sugar cone.  The are generous with the scoops, which is a pleasant surprise.  Equally surprising is the courteous staff.  Considering the constant crowds, the staff manages to keep a smile.
author: M L.

description: Best Ice Cream shop to go to if you're ever in SF. The only thing is the place is real small, but with the variety of flavors available just evens that out. Great place to satisfy your ice cream or (halohalo) cravings! Crowds suck, but the foods good.
author: Monica G.

description: Mitchells has been around forever.  Being Filipino I had check this place out early on.  This place creates regular flavors but what I come here for is their unique flavors of ice cream that I am use to having at Filipino parties and ordering at restaurants.  They make ube ice cream, halo-halo, macapuno (with coconut), mango, and so many more flavors.  I sometimes buy a half a gallon to go cause its just that good.  Its great memories as a childhood for me when I see all the flavors they have.
author: Emmy D.

description:
I may have tried them all... Humphrey Slocumbs, Birite, Mrs & Mrs Misc, Polly Ann's...

This place still might be the best!  The young coconut is awesome.

Can't really go wrong with any of these awesome SF creameries but Mitchell's seems to be the smoothest and creamiest.
author: Andy W.

description: I am still dreaming about the Ube and Young coconut ice cream combo I had last weekend. Too bad I live 4 hours away from this place, or I would just go there every day!
author: Christine R.

description: Mango ice cream is soooo good!!! There is always a line out the door (even on cold sf days) but the wait is not that long.  There is parking at the back, but sometimes you have to circle the blocks for street parking
author: Cheryl M.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is hands down the BEST Ice Cream in San Francisco. I love coming to Mitchells! They got great flavors. Its a small tiny shop, but it gets packed especially at night, after dinner (well duh thats when everyone gets dessert haha)

if your in The City you got to try Mitchell's Ice Cream! You wont be disappointed at all!
author: Daniel S.

description: Super cute place. I went with a friend on a Monday night, around 9pm and there was barely a line, which I heard was amazing. The service was really great, they were super nice! Their choices were great. They had your usual flavors on top of exotic mixes and such. I had a triple on a cone (he gave me two cones, not sure if that's usual or if he was being nice). Ube on bottom, butterscotch caramel in the middle, and mocha fudge on top. All three were freakin' amazing, although if I had to choose, Ube would be first place, and butterscotch would be last.  I really look forward to bringing my friends there and trying more flavors! A must go to place! :D
author: Wendy Y.

description:
I kept hearing about this place so finally got around to trying it. We went during the week and arrived around 10pm. We were lucky enough to snag a parking spot in the back. 

At 10pm at night i was surprised to see how many people were there. The line wasn't quite out the door but the inside was pretty cramped. It was hard to move around and then always had to make sure that I wouldn't get backed into or my foot stepped on. 

I was debating on getting the 2 scoop sundae until i saw just how much ice cream was in one so I decided on the waffle bowl 1 scoop sundae. Ice cream of choice was kualua mocha cream. I chose hot fudge. This was like heaven to eat. I was very surprised it wasn't overly sweet.

Hubby got a scoop of the new york cherry in a waffle cone with chocolate and nuts around the top of the cone. the ice cream had good sized cherries in it and it wasn't overly rich. 

Prices are good for the amount and quality of the ice cream. 

It's going to be hard to go back to Baskin robbins now.
author: Jenniffer T.

description:
What more can be said about a San Francisco landmark that hasn't already been said? I mean the Mexican Chocolate ice cream was heaven. The strawberry creme was amazing. And now I must go back and try the other 30 choices and then on to the sundaes and shakes.  

This place is worth the wait, if the number you have is 78 and they are on number 3....wait. It's worth it.

I love you Mitchell's...don't tell my husband.
author: Donna S.

description:
Unbelievably great Ice cream to try out!
I never forget the times I tried new flavors of ice cream when I was a kid at this place! 
Every time my mom drove by it,  we couldn't pass up on delicious smooth Mitchell's ice cream. Sometimes we would even buy a half gallon tub of ice cream.
author: Liz T.

description:
This was my first time at Mitchell's, and i have to say it was DAMN GOOD. I was overwhelmed by so many different traditional and tropical flavors, and after tasting a few, I decided on trying out pumpkin in spirit of the season ( fyi i'm a pumpkin pie lover.. but trust me there was no bias involved ;)) ; twas delicious. Ohhh...always get the waffle cone!!!

Pricing: Could be cheaper, but high quality and taste left me without any complaints

Staff: Nice and helpful, tolerant to lots of sampling requests. My group had a handful of people.

Final Verdict: I would recommend this place to ice cream lovers who happen to be living in or visiting SF.  I see myself coming to Mitchell's every time I visit the city.
author: Wilson T.

description: They have some good ice cream, I like the Ube flavor. I've heard that this is one of the best ice cream shop in the world, but honestly, i personally like Bi-Rite Creamery in san francisco  better than this one. Worth to try both though!
author: Nancy P.

description:
I regularly buy a gallon of Halo-Halo ice cream (filipino chewy drink turned ice cream) and sometimes I try one other flavor. Last time it was Macapuno (coconut). I also buy ice cream cones. Although the line gets long it's worth the wait but it's really fast if you know what you want and you buy the pre-pack ice cream because there is an express line for that. That way, you can get dropped off while your driver waits in the car, pick up and pay and be on your way.

Since I live in the East Bay and if I plan on going, I bring a cooler and some ice packs, however, if you go later at night on a week day when Bay Bridge traffic isn't bad at all, you really don't need the cooler or ice packs. I haven't tried the Peruvian ice cream yet but I plan to on my next visit.
author: Racheljoy R.

description: About 8 flavors are sold at Progressive Grounds Cafe in the Mission.  I tried the Mexican Chocolate (see my photo).  It was good, but not worth a trip.
author: Scott F.

description:
This is now my new favorite ice cream spot!  Boyfriend and I stopped by here for dessert on our date night after eating at HOPR.  At first i thought we were lost because the area did not seem like a place for an ice cream shop.  Thanks to GPS we were able to find this place with no trouble at all.  Parking was ridiculous however.  Minus 1 star for parking.  We drove around a couple of times until someone left in their small lot in the back.  It didn't help that my boyfriend drives a big truck either... haha, but we managed.

It was our first time here and didn't really know how the line works, then i saw someone taking a number from the number wheel.   The line goes pretty fast.  

I was excited to see that they had tropical flavors.  I ordered two scoops on a waffle come, ube and jackfruit.  After i saw how big the scoops were, i wished i only ordered a one scoop, haha.   They are very generous with the servings.  The ice cream was very creamy and not too sweet.  It was perfect.  yum-o!
author: Anna Liza P.

description:
When I arrived at Mitchell's, there was a line out the door.  They have a number system like at the deli counter, and the line went pretty quickly.  I tasted the Ube (Purple Yam) and it was pretty good.  I got the Chocolate Caramel Crackle and it was awesome!  The chocolate, soft caramel, and crunchy candies meshed together perfectly.  

I saw someone order the Halo Halo (the dessert not just the ice cream) and it looked great.  I'll have to try that next time!
author: Aurora L.

description: Ice cream sundae in a waffle bowl = PERFECTION!!!! BF had the mango and ube in a waffle cone...again PERFECTION!! Get ready to grab a number and wait for this oh so well worth treat!! Will be back to try the MExican Chocolate....hhhhmmmm i can already taste the goodness =)
author: Charlene D.

description:
Being located in a residential area, "Mitchell's" can be difficult for newcomers to find without prior knowledge through Yelp, etc.  Their ice cream are homemade, and due to the Filipino style of their ice cream, customers can discover flavors unique to this place alone, including the popular ube ice cream.  Although "7x7 Magazine's Big Eat 2010" highly recommended this flavor, I was worried that the flavor of purple yam in the ube might be too overbearing, but luckily, this wasn't the case.  In fact, it tasted more like vanilla.  Still, I prefer Tropical Four (banana, guava, mango & pineapple) only because I love fruits.

Their staff are friendly and approachable, making it the perfect place for families and childrens.  Unfortunately, seating is limited to two small benches outside, but they are great for couples.  "Mitchell's" have their own parking lot around the corner, but if you are in a hurry, they have 10-minute street parking right outside their establishment during store hours for two cars, which is just enough time to eat your ice cream and go.
author: Fook W.

description:
There are a ton of creameries around in SF, but only Mitchell's gets my full 5-star rating. Other contending shops like Bi Rite just don't cut it. Don't get me wrong, I think Bi Rite is plenty tasty, but you know what? It's frou-frou ice cream. Consider me a purist. Flavors like strawberry balsamic may be novel, but flavors like rocky road and thin mint are the ones I crave at 2am on a Sunday night. Mitchell's has the basics down and that's all there is to it.

Of all the creameries I've visited, I think Mitchell's has the richest ice cream out there. A lot of other places may excel in flavor and lack in texture or vice versa, but Mitchell's is right on the nose with both. I usually am not a fan of nuts in ice cream, but I will devour tubs of Mitchell's black walnut and pistachio flavors. There's something magical in the base vanilla ice cream they use. Probably LSD. 

I haven't tried many of their tropical/Filipino inspired flavors, although admittedly I enjoy the mango from Polly Ann better.

The bottom line: Go to Mitchell's for some damn solid classic ice cream flavors.
author: Amy C.

description:
GRASS HOPPER PIE!!!!.  
When it comes to sweets I'm more of a candy fan, but when I go for some Ice cream it has to be Mitchells Grass hopper pie.  Mint chocolate chip with oreos.  

The wait for a scoop is sometimes ridiculous but you can buy quarts or gallons.
author: gareth l.

description: Been here before but never had a chance to yelp it.  Went here this past weekend recently during my visit to the bay area.  Had to hit up Mitchell's!  Luckily, when we got here, there weren't too many people yet, and when I mean not too many people, I mean that only the inside was packed, not the outside.  They have various flavors and their ice cream is nice and creamy.  My personal favorites are the espresso toffee and mexican chocolate.  Had I brought a cooler with me, I would've bought the pre-packed mexican chocolate they have in their freezers ready to buy.  I heart Mitchell's!  There's a reason why it could be 50 degrees outside and people are waiting in the cold just to buy ice cream.
author: Gem S.

description:
Grasshopper Pie + Claire's Pie (stuffed in Waffle Cone) = mouth orgasm.

Can't wait to go back.
author: Jen F.

description:
This is the best Ice Cream out there.  This place has been out there since I could remember.  I've been going here since I was 3 or 4 years old and I still come here.  I live in Mountain View and whenever I'm in San Francisco I try to make a little trip to Mitchell's Ice Cream simply because there's nothing better out there.

It doesn't matter what flavor you get cause they're all good.  But nothing beats Mango!!!!  

The only complaint I have about this place is the parking and the long lines outside of this place.  Parking in the back is small and its always packed and good luck trying to find street parking.  Also, during the summer months don't be surprised to see a long line outside.  Believe it or not you actually have to get a number and stand in line.  Yeah its that busy but who doesn't want ice cream from this place!
author: Glenn P.

description:
This is another childhood favourite place for me. The hour long lines, are the only downside. Their creative flavours, and the fact that the ice cream is fresh and home made, has won state fair awards for years, and the portions make the alps look like mole hills, all combine to equal one simple word:

FOODGASIM!!!!!!!!!!
author: Sugar V.

description: Well worth the wait!!!  Take a number and wait your turn.  There's usually 50 people ahead of you but don't worry, they move pretty fast.  Alot of flavors, the family's favorite is ube.  During the summer they have halo-halo and honestly they make it better than most Filipino restaurants.
author: Chris R.

description:
Avocado Ice Cream

It sounds crazy.

It sounds weird.

It might make you think of icy Guacamole.

But my friends, we have a winner.  It sounds strange but really the avocado ice cream is amazing stuff.

If you aren't seeking such exotic flavors as I am, Mitchell's is still a solid choice for ice cream.  Yeah it can be kind of a hike and their small parking lot can be unhelpful on a busy day but if you're looking for a delicious ice cream fix, this is a good place to come.  Don't get me wrong, they definitely don't have the same flavor concentrations as Bi-Rite, but the fact that they dole out big scoops and have a great variety of flavors should keep this place on any SF'er's shortlist of ice cream shops.

The service is outstanding too.  My server was practically pushing samples on me.  The number taking is kind of old school but hey, it's pretty damn efficient.
author: Steven R.

description:
Y-U-M!!

This ice cream is the "real deal." They offer tons of flavor, so there is sure to be something to wet your appetite. 

I am a fan of buko (sweet coconut) and thai tea. 

Remember to take a number, so you aren't waiting in the line like a chump.
author: Misha F.

description:
We arrived around 10:15 on a friday night, we were ready for a line, but wow the crowd was huge! We pulled a number and got 42, they were only on #9. The wait only ended up being about 15/20 minutes so that was great. It was a very tough decision because everything looks sooo tempting! We went because of the Ube so we each tried it. It was much better than I thought it'd be, but, really it tasted like vanilla to me. ? Am I crazy? The hubbs got the peanut butter and almond - both sooo good! 
I got banana and grasshopper pie. I don't know what was best, we loved them all.
Very good, patient service, awesome menu, kinda pricey but worth it, and really good, really sweet rich ice cream. 
Perfect end to an evening. I wouldn't do it during the day cause the sugar crash is kinda painful.
author: Audrey V.

description:
I didn't know what ice cream was supposed to taste like until I had Mitchell's. How some people can go their whole lives without even KNOWING that what they think is ICE CREAM is just a sad, sad attempt to recreate something special with cheap ingredients, makes me cry a little on the inside. 

Now I know. I didn't always know. How can Ben & Jerry look at themselves in the mirror, knowing that Mitchell's exists? How can anyone else even sell ice cream? Why BOTHER if you can't make it taste this good? 

My favorite flavors are pumpkin, egg nogg, and dulce de leche.

* This 5-star review comes with an asterisk: 

They need to switch back to the original chocolate chips for the chocolate chip ice cream. I know the supplier apparently raised the price and they had no choice, but are you really helping profit margins when people don't buy chocolate chip ice cream anymore because they don't like the new chocolate chips? Please figure something out.
author: Larf P.

description:
I don't even really like ice cream that much, but this stuff is out of control!!
Try:
Mexican Hot Chocolate
Baby Coconut 
Cantaloupe 
Pumpkin 
Peanut butter Indulgence (my boyfriend's fave)
Thai Ice Tea
author: Liz A.

description:
I've been patronizing Mitchell's since I was a kid and the excitement of coming here has never died.  They have a variety of ice cream to choose from and all flavors are available in half gallons.  They even have seasonal flavors as well!  With Thanksgiving approaching, they currently have Pumpkin ice cream and Cinnamon Snap ice cream.  I purchased a half gallon of each and they are to die for!  

If you're in the area, be sure to stop by Mitchells, for an ice cream cone, sundae, or banana split.  You won't be disappointed!

Note:  They do accept credit cards, but only if your purchase is $9 or more.
author: Sarah B.

description:
What is the only thing that will get old Tom out of his warm room, give up the good parking space, and stand in line on a cold and rainy night.

Answer: A sudden craving for Mitchell's New York Cherry Ice Cream.
author: Manny F.

description:
Am I the only person who thinks that Mitchell's isn't all that great?

Okay, ice cream is good.  Mitchell's ice cream is better than, say, Coldstone or Baskin Robbins.  But really, waiting forever to get a scoop?  No thank you.  It also doesn't help that other places sell Mitchell's, so I will be getting my ice cream elsewhere.
author: Tori S.

description:
It's Monday...I've seen less people at a David Bowie concert.  People joked that they ran out of numbers (actually, those characters just couldn't figure out the numbered tickets), but on to what we scream for:  

They have interesting flavors such as, Lucama, a Peruvian fruit, but interesting isn't what you slather yourself in.  It's the old-school ice cream decadence and it's what Mitchell's seems to excel at.  The caramel praline was thick, sweet, rich, and sticky.  It got all over the beard and I liked it.  You may feel gross, but A., there's napkins and B., gross is the only way to live.  Go here, get something buttery.  Ohh yeah, and they're cool about giving samples.
author: Jake H.

description: Best ice cream in the city. If you want more creative flavors, try Bi-Rite, but if you are craving the solid ice cream flavors you grew up with, MItchell's is the place to go.
author: E P.

description:
I couldn't help but be compelled to stop for ice cream that has people lining up around the block, is featured on food network and has great word-of-mouth.  The wait - well, clearly not the place to go when in a hurry.  It's a kicking around the city day kind of place.

I had the Mango: creamy and delicious.  I wanted to sample a couple others but didn't want to be "that girl" in front of a huge-ass line.  Did I just read Mexican Chocolate in someone's review?  Yeah, I'll be back.

*Make sure to grab a number right away!
author: s p.

description:
Oh yeaaa!  What a gorgeous day for ice cream!

There were so many yummy flavors I wanted to try and you know I had to ask for samplings of everything.  I was debating between the Lilikoi mango swirl and Claire's pie - coffee ice cream with like a mixture of nuts, caramel, toffee, the works.

I was feeling more tropical today, so I finally opted for the Lilikoi mango swirl and boy was I pleased!  Mmm mmmm good! :)

The prices are cheap compared to the rest of the ice cream spots in the city, yummy flavors, plus awesome options such as toppings (peanuts, anyone?) and variations of sugar and waffle cones.  A sugar cone is like 15 cents!

Love it!
author: Carmen Y.

description: I always get some tropical flavor ice cream.  This time I got ube (taro) on a waffle cone.  I gave 4 stars for the flavor of the ube. Loard's ube is far better than Mitchells. I'm pretty sure a lot of their flavors taste yummy. I might try a different flavor next time.
author: roderick s.

description:
After a crappy week I wanted some ice cream to make myself feel better. One of the reasons why I love my bf is because he will drive anywhere to get me whatever I want just to make me feel better. 

After reading all the reviews I knew I wanted to try the Thai tea flavor and Kahlua Mocha Cream. We came here 2 days ago and they didn't have the thai tea flavor =(. The Kahlua Mocha cream made up for it though. It was so good! It made my week so much better and boy let me tell you...it was a BAD week. Someone did a hit and run on my car but I won't get into that.

BF got the caramel praline and that was AWESOME too! Believe it or not I had never stepped foot in here until recently. Isn't that sad? I'll be coming back more often to try Mitchell's other delicious ice cream flavors. 

BTW...We saw Mr. Mitchell! Two thumbs up Mr.Mitchell!
author: Tracy A.

description: Amazing ice cream! Variety of yummy and unique flavors. Bought two tubs to bring back to Southern California! Tried the strawberries and cream, mango, Mexican chocolate, and ube! Took home ube and halo halo for our Filipino friends down south. Mitchell's ice cream is our family tradition when we're visiting the city.
author: Kat A.

description: I'm not an ice cream person, and I haven't been here in quite some time.  If I lived close, there is a distinct possibility I'd weigh substantially more than I presently do.  This ice cream rocks.  It's delicious.  I understand why there's always a line.  I understand why people rave about these ice cream delicacies.  It's among the best, and deserves the accolades it receives.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description: Only wish I lived closer so I could try more flavors, had the mango and macapuno. Tried the halo halo, too. Decadent treat!
author: Susan C.

description:
Many things offend me.
None of which pertain to the case in hand.
Whats the "Charm" of Mitchell's? Is it because they are a famously local Ice cream shop in S.F.? Is that why we are forced in saying that if Jesus was to come back again, it would not just be because of Judgment, but for Mitchell's Ice Cream? 

Seriously, calm down people, i've NEVER had to wait 30 min. for a damned double scoop of ice cream....EVER! the shop is tiny, street parking equals NO PARKING (this is S.F. were talking about) unless if you really want to give the city of S.F. $50 extra so that you can enjoy the greatness of a $4 Ice Cream fix.  No thanks Mitchell's.... O and by the way... the whole "OOoo and AAaahhh's" thing.... i was faking it the whole time!
author: Riko H.

description:
No where to park

Big long lines

Average ice cream

What is so great about this place?

Alright guys, someone had to say it.  I'm sure I'm going to get a lot of hate mail, but hey, at least this is one less person in line preventing you from getting your over-rated ube mango float.
author: Jin D.

description:
THIS is the place to be if you want rich, creamy, fattening ice cream. Delicious. When looking at the menu, you'd think there are a million flavors - and you want to try ALL of them.

The coconut is sooo good. Something I could sit and eat an entire pint of.

Whats great is they have a freezer filled with their most popular flavors in pint and gallon size for you to take home.

The prices are amazing and theres always a lot of people there. Don't forget to pull a number
author: Jenny A.

description:
One evening after dinner, on a spontaneous moment on a freezing cold night, my bf suggested swinging by Mitchell's for desserts. When we got there, the line was at least 30 people deep. We took our number and waited patiently. When we our number was called: my bf yelled out "Bingo!" and the crowd laugh. I guess we earned our ice-cream treat. 

He had the Mexican Chocolate and young baby coconut flavors are the best combination I've ever had. The Mexican Chocolate is so thick and rich that went it goes down, it coats my throat. Fabulous! Any chocolate lovers heaven.

I got a generous sample of the mango tasted like frozen mango pureed. Not overly sweet, you can still taste the mango flavors and yet creamy. That is what I will get on my next visit. That and a tub of young coconut ice-cream. 

I got: Rum Raisin and white pistachio in a waffle cups. Rum Raisin was creasy, with lots of raisins and tasted like rum with cream, but not overwhelming with alcohol taste. OMG! The white pistachios ice-cream was great, but it didn't wow me. I had better pistachios gelato else where. But not dissapointing, there was a lot of pistachio in the ice-cream and I could taste the pistachio flavors that was so distingue. Good! 

Overall, if you are in the neighborhood and don't mind standing in line (trust me, is worth the wait and it will take you that long to decide on the flavors anyway considering the ginormous amount of choices to choose from). Go there! You haven't had ice-cream until you had Mitchell's. OMG!
author: Gourmet Princessa L.

description:
Food:  Some of the best ice cream I've had.  Horchata, Thin Mint and Grasshopper Pie are my favorites.

Service:  The downside to great food is that this place is always packed and the service is slow so getting ice cream turns into a minimum 20 min ordeal.  You have to get a number and wait outside.  It gets 1 star subtracted because I never waited less than 20 min to get a scoop of ice cream.

Value:  A bit expensive but the quality is very good.  

Atmosphere:  Nothing to really say here--it's just a normal ice cream shop.

Conclusion:  Excellent ice cream but expect to wait a while to get it.
author: Nick P.

description:
Avocado ice cream!  Enough said.  

Work up the nerve to have a taste and you will not be disappointed.
author: F. P.

description:
I LOOOOOOOVVVEEEE Mitchell's.  It's gotta tell you something about a person AND the place when you have to wait 45 min to get your ice cream (even in the freezing SF weather), and when there's a line out the door!  They have a number system, so when you go, make sure you take a ticket! otherwise you'll just never get your icecream!

Mitchell's is great because they have all sorts of ice cream flavors: mango, taro, pineapple, coconut, jackfruit, and a bunch of other flavors.  I always get the jackfruit and mango.  They actually have real bits of fruit in them too!  I would get a whole gallon of ice cream for my apt, but 1) its $9 for the huge thing, and 2) I have no room in my freezer for it =(  What a shame.... 

Mitchell's is something you should definitely try if you're in the city. =)
author: Diane L.

description:
So luckily we get this served at our school for certain events.  Lychee and Green tea are pretty damn good.  Yet, Mitchell's ice cream just doesn't strike that fiening that some other places do.  Maybe I need a new flavor.

Ive been meaning to go to the actual store, but haven't really had the opportunity.  We passed here one night after dinner and unfortunately a few minutes passed closing.  Toasted Almond will just have to wait for another sunny summer day.
author: Bert N.

description:
All I gotta say is COT DAYAM!!!!! this ice cream is good.

I'm talking about the creamiest ice cream i've ever tried.  NO this isn't for the health conscious.  We're talking about super creamy really flavorful ice cream.

I sampled about 4 flavors from the guy at the counter.  I went with chocolate caramel crunch which is as you can guess (think chocolate ice cream with wide thick trails of caramel and big chunks of Nestle crunch chocolate) and then I had a scoop of grasshopper ice cream.

For those who don't know...grasshopper ice cream blew my socks off b/c when I was a kid I used to get chocolate chip mint AND cookies and cream ice cream and MIX them together.  That's what grasshopper is but even BETTER!!!!

Apparently when I had my first taste I was talking to myself because  while i'm smiling looking at my cone thinking i've just tasted heaven the guy at the counter repeats what I thought I said in my head..he says, "proper huh?"  I'm like YES...this ice cream is PROPER  :)
author: William D.

description: I personally was not an ice cream person before Mitchell's; however, no one can only go to Mitchell's once.  Some of the flavors are hit or miss and depend on personal taste, while others seem like they are universally popular.  Some excellent flavors there include the Tropical 4 (the flavor I almost always have), Mango, Mexican Chocolate, Grasshopper Pie, and the Kahlua Mocha Cream.  Downsides to Mitchell's include the long wait time, even on a cold day in San Francisco, and the small parking lot.  The ice cream is completely worth the wait, however.  I think this might be the best ice cream place in San Francisco.
author: Marvin P.

description: I'm pretty sure no matter where I go, this will always and forever be my absolute favorite ice cream place. It has the best of ALL worlds. And it's my childhood, seriously. I used to come here during EVERY hot day of the year when I went to school in the mission and lived in daly city like I do now. I love their avocado, kahlua coffee cream, mango, ube, halo halo, grasshopper ice, caramel praline, and french vanilla, any of those on the waffle cone. Yum. I love Mitchells and always will. I don't think any place could compare to going down to Mitchells shop like I did when I was a kid in my heart. Nowhere.
author: Kai S.

description: Love Mitchells Pistachio, Mexican Chocolate, Ube, Praline! Halo Halo etc!! :D  All delicious, if you review this below a 4, stop killing your taste buds with cigarettes :p
author: Marissa E.

description:
I fall in love with Mitchell's Ice Cream all over again every time I visit. This place takes me back to when I was a kid, taking a number and waiting for a super long time. But the waiting is worth the wild. 

My favorite flavors have to be Ube, Rum Raisin, Claire's Pie, the Pear Sorbet, among others :)
author: Claudia G.

description:
Holy hell this made my day! 

I've seen this place on food specials etc, but I finally had the chance to check this joint out for myself. 

Luckily, there wasn't much of a line which I guess is rare especially on a gorgeously sunny day like today. I was so overwhelmed by the array of traditional flavors and tropical ones but narrowed it down after a few samples. Delightfully, I ended up with a double of ube (purple yam) and macapuno (sweet coconut). If I didn't have SOME self-restraint the mango lilikoi would have topped a triple. 

To sum it up:  this was the dankest ice cream cone that I had enjoyed in a LONG time if not EVER.
author: Nikki B.

description: So... I'm a big fan of sweets and this place has perhaps the best ice cream you can get. They have a variety of flavors but the two most popular are mango and praline's and cream I believe. I had both and, though I'm not a mango fan in general, the ice cream was quite delicious. The pralines and cream was wonderful as well!
author: Ammar R.

description:
We pick up half gallons of ice cream here all the time. We must have tied 20-30 different flavors and all have been great.  I have checked here several times to verify that almost all of their flavors are Gluten Free (except obvious cookie containing ice creams and such).  
This time I could see people walking away with ice cream cones, people in cars in front with cones and a full store. I picked up number 18, but then they called out 15, 16 and I got my ice cream within 3 min.  And three new yummy flavors!
author: Bo D.

description:
After hearing incessant raves from people about this place, I decided I wanted to see what the hype was all about. I mean, it's ice cream people...not much to it, right? WRONG! This place has the most creamiest ice cream. Imagine any flavor and they have it...yes even avocado...not my fav...but moving on.....
You walk in and take a number, because believe you me, you need a number. This place is always packed, but well worth the wait. When your magical number is finally called you are greeted by the nicest staff. The pricing is great, the staff is friendly, and the ice cream made me leave a new woman! I have never been a vanilla ice cream person, but they have a VANILLA CUSTARD flavor....OMFG i am salivating as i type....
author: Nancy M.

description: Zoolike atmosphere on a hot weekend afternoon.  Flavors are unique.  As long as you come prepared for the crowd experience, and remember to breathe, and don't rush for the door, and don't expect to ice cream within half an hour, you'll be happy you came.
author: Mandy H.

description:
I thought to myself I thought "Self, I wonder if maybe I should go try that baby coconut ice cream at Mitchell's before I head back out of the city?" And then myself and I discussed that I'd cruise by and make my final decision based on how easy parking was. 

Well let us tell you something, Yelp: The ice cream and parking Gods must have been shining down on me and myself because HOT DAMN -- not only do they have a PARKING LOT, but there was a SPOT in said parking lot AND when I pulled my paper number I was #76 and they were currently serving #74!

I was about to win the ice cream lottery!

Assuming the ice cream was all it was cracked up to be, of course.

So: Baby coconut ice cream is on the Big Eats SF list and therefore MUST be ordered.

Problem: There were a BILLION flavors that I would have loved to try (yam? non-baby coconut? strange fruits I'd ever even heard of?) but I had to limit myself so I had a junior scoop of the baby coconut and (OINK) two-scoop cup of some sort of coffee-ish, cookie-ish pie flavor and the Mexican chocolate.

Report: The baby coconut was perfectly tasty but it paled in comparison to my other flavor selections. I took a few bites and tossed it even before I had paid for my two-scoop bonanza because A) I sure as hell don't need the calories and B) I was going to be driving-while-eating and that's a maneuver I wouldn't be able to do "safely" with an ice cream in my hand and another one in my lap.

The other two flavors were KICK ASS. Especially the Mexican chocolate. Highly recommended.

Bottom Line: I'm glad I didn't know the glory of Mitchell's while I still lived in San Francisco because otherwise I think I might have developed an obsession. I'm officially adding it to the list of things I want to eat when I DO make it back within the 7x7.
author: Elizabeth H.

description:
I PERSONALLY LOVE MITCHELLS ICE CREAM. I'd eat it everyday if i wont turn fat ! Vanilla from mitchell's is very good. i believe this may be the best ice cream place in town. so far. Better than coldstones in my opinion.

the got some weird flavors too ! be sure to check this place out if you go by this area.
author: Andrew H.

description: Four and a half stars for the ice cream, plus 1/2 star for letting me taste 5 or 6 different flavors. I'm not going to leave a detailed review, because this place has so many reviews, one more isn't going to make a difference (kind of like voting for president). In the words of our ex-govenor "I'll be back".
author: Kayte B.

description: Mitchell's does ice cream solid.  Their flavors are pretty standard like at a Polly Ann's with a few twists and turns but nothing really that grabbed my attention.  Guess I was expecting something like Bi-Rite and it fell short of that.
author: Derrick C.

description: I'm a San Franciscan Native and proud of it!  I love it when I come to the city and I get to go to Mitchell's.  Even on a cold Sunday afternoon with my favorite!  I give Mitchell's 20 STARs!!!!!!
author: Sunshyn 4 U C.

description:
The negative reviews are funny ... and will never deter me from visiting Mitchell's when I'm in town (as I no longer live in the city) and want excellent ice cream.  Yes, I support Mitchell's for all the reasons you naysayers speak of, but also because the ish is delicious.

I love that it's cream-y and melt-y.  I don't mind taking a number and standing outside to wait in line (especially if it's a rare, warm evening).  I have never seen customers in line block the sidewalk with malicious intent.  Lastly, I have yet to visit Bi-Rite, and doubt that I ever will.  ¿Por lo que?
author: Felicia P.

description:
Always a line and always worth the wait.

I took my ex boyfriend here once and then almost every time he was up in the city he wanted to go to Mitchell's. 

Even when it's freezing outside, it's perfect. If I'm not doing the usual cookies n cream, then I like to get the Ube. It's really sweet, but really good.
author: Jaime S.

description:
Ube ice cream? Alright, I'm game.

At what I first thought was Taro because of the intense purple color, I was told it was like Taro, but a bit sweeter. So, I tried it, and yes, was great. I wish that I wasn't full from lunch, otherwise I'd have grabbed a couple of scoops of other flavors, but my stomach can only hold so much.

At 4pm there was a line out the door with people clamoring for their dairy allotment, even though it was probably 55 degrees, at best, outside. That is an indicator of a good place to grub! With traditional flavors and more exotic ones (the "Tropical" category), they had a good selection. And people love 'em, seeing as how I witnessed at least four people grab a few of the 1/2 gallon containers to take home. If I was in town longer I'd have considered getting one, but alas, too much ice cream to eat in a couple days.
author: Kenny H.

description: Avocado flavor is sooo good, but if you don't like rich and creamy this isn't the right one for you :).
author: Quyen L.

description:
I am a huge ice cream lover and Mitchell's is by far my top favorite ice cream shop next to Ben and Jerry's. They don't really need anymore raving reviews, so I'll make this quick.

Many people may wonder what makes this place worth the wait? You can't come into an ice cream shop with raving reviews and order a typical familiar flavor like mint chocolate ice cream or rocky road. How more of a variety can you get with those flavors? This place is known for it's creamy, thick and exotic Asian flavors, such as Buko, Ube, or Halo Halo. My ultimate pick is the chocolate dipped Buko ice cream and I never stray away.
author: Stacey P.

description:
7x7 list - http://www.7x7.com/content/eat-drink/big-eat-sf-100-things-try-you-die

# 96 - Baby-coconut ice cream -- very refreshing....reminds me of my other favorite, macapuno = young coconut

also tried jackfruit, orange sherbet, and pineapple coconut....all good, especially the jackfruit.
author: Katie K.

description: Mitchells, best ice cream in San Francisco hands down. Prices are very reasonable and flavors are outstanding. I highly recommend this place!!
author: Brian W.

description:
Oh yeah! Mitchell's is definitely my "go-to" ice cream joint! Where else can I find all the crazy Filipino flavors like ube, lanka, buko, and halo-halo? There are even tasty flavors like peanut butter indulgence and Mexican chocolate.
And what was even better was getting an actual halo-halo with the shaved ice, pinipig, sweet beans, and tasty sweet gels! YUM!!! 
Sure, there is parking lot (although there may be a wait), and there is always a wait (that's what the number tickets are for), but it is totally worth it! Check out Mitchell's ice cream now!
author: Jan Z.

description:
I really don't get all the hype.  

I'm in no means a high-maintenance customer, but I couldn't help but be sorely disappointed by this place, especially after reading many glowing reviews here on Yelp.  You could say I came here with high hopes, which may be true, but I'm certain that even if I just walked in without hearing anything about this place, I'd still leave feeling dissatisfied.  Here's why:

Ice cream: C+ |  My ice cream sandwich (chocolate chip ice cream between chocolate chip cookies) was mediocre.  Even the prepackaged ice cream sandwiches you buy at the gas station taste better.  The cookies were frozen solid, and the ice cream was just like any generic brand supermarket ice cream.  Seriously, what's the hype?  Why is this place so popular?

Customer service: A+ | The guy behind the counter was really nice, despite working in a busy and hectic environment.  I'll have to give them that.  Their workers are great.

What earned this place 2 stars is the lack of communication between the shop and the customers.

Communication between shop & customers: F | When I walked in, I saw all these people standing around.  I had no idea what was going on, so I just assumed that the guy in front of me was in a some sort of scattered line, so I stood behind him for a good 5 minutes until I saw another confused lady find a "take-a-number" machine next to the entrance (but it was in a strange location -- you'd have to turn around and look for it upon entering).   

As I took my number and waited, I noticed that everyone else paid with cash.  I became a bit nervous because I only had my debit card on me.  I looked all over the place for a "Cash only" sign but didn't find anything, so I figured that they took debit cards.  So I they finally called my number and when I asked them if they took debit cards, the guy said, "Ahhh.. yes, but there's a $10 minimum."  So I had to scramble all over the store for something else to buy to exceed the minimum.  I ended up grabbing a $7 box of processed cookies (which turned out stale and awful, by the way), thinking that the ice cream had better be worth the damn 10 bucks.

It wasn't.

So can someone please tell me.... what's the damn hype?
author: Chiara H.

description:
One of the best places to go in San Francisco... delicious ice cream... love the variety of flavors... Mexican Chocolate is my favorite too, but always look forward to summer when they have the Cantaloupe.  So yummy with real fruit in every bite!

Like that they have parking int he back, but when its packed, you gotta look on the street.  Make sure to get a ticket when you walk through the door so you don't get passed up.

Will always choose Mitchell's first over any other place too delicious! i always take my friends here that are not from San Francisco and they have all loved it.  Always one of the places to go when during a food tour of San Francisco =)
author: Nikkie M.

description: What can I say that's not been said already.. Just that I've been fortunate and spoiled enough to have had Mitchell's ice cream since I was in kindergarten. I remember taking field trips here when a single scoop used to costs 50 cents. Grasshopper pie is good. Butterscotch marble is good. Rocky road is good. But ube is the bomb! Sure do miss my old faves Thai tea and avocado but meh.. Ube will do.
author: Patrick L.

description:
Came here randomly after circling the city for ice cream.  Yes, I would go great lengths to get ice cream.

I got a banana fudge sundae with pistachio and strawberry ice cream. Mmm Real pistachios that were nice and crispy when I bit into them!  Yum.  

Pretty plain ice cream place but really good service and a nice crowd of friendly folk.
author: Margaret S.

description: Suuuper yum! I love the selection and many flavors of their ice cream.  It's a tough place for you if you're indecisive and have to choose from multiple flavors.  If that happens you could sample some flavors before you get one.  Though the lines could be horrible at times.  It could take forever to eat one but it's all the worth waiting for.
author: Ai I.

description: MOCHA FUDGE or UBE. That's it. That's all you have to get. Now hurry up and take a number before the line gets any bigger!
author: Rosavida C.

description: The ice cream is alright. I prefer bi-rite still. I had their Ube and grasshopper. It was good, don't get me wrong, but for some reason it tasted really typical to me. The texture wasn't as smooth as I expected. Line was also really long.
author: Jasmine W.

description: SO GOOD. Friendly staff, and AMAZING ice cream! I had the black walnut and also the coconut. The black walnut was a wonderfully rich and creamy and caramely ice cream with chopped walnuts mixed throughout. The coconut was okay. I've had better, but it was definitely pretty good. There were chunks of chewy coconut pieces in it and that made it even better!
author: JB W.

description:
very very very disappointed...

this was so hyped up...my friend said that Mitchell's was the best ice cream he ever had....FAIL!!!

i tried 6 different flavors.....lack of flavor and too creamy...
we asked what the most popular flavor was? he said hands down Mango.... Uck....it tasted like milky air...

Bi-Rite is definitely the winner....
author: Jenn P.

description:
Dropped by here after having an Italian dinner at the relatively nearby La Ciccia.  On a Saturday evening at 10:15pm, this place was packed, with a line out the door.  Take a number as soon as you get there, as you've got a wait ahead of you.  Fortunately, some nice soul gave us their number and we didn't have to wait very long.

The list of flavors here was extensive, and it's one of the only ice cream shops I've been that has had a non-liquored cherry ice cream.  I admit it, I'm a cherry whore.  I had that, and it was absurdly good.  It was thick and creamy and not all full of air.  My girlfriend had the chocolate orange ice cream, which was actually better, if that's even possible.  The prices were extremely reasonable as well.

This was definitely some of the best ice cream I've ever had, and I would return if I was in the neighborhood without a second thought.
author: Alex P.

description: Good just like any other ice cream place nothing special. Coldstone is so much better.
author: Anna F.

description:
I'm not sure why but this place didn't really knock my socks off.  We came here after a long day in SF in search for some yummy ice cream in my tummy.  Mitchell's had some impressive reviews on yelp, so my boyfriend and I decided to give this place a shot, since we've already tried Bi-rite.

Mitchell's has a SMALL private parking lot in the rear, which we were thankful to even find a spot!  When we walked up to the store front, we were a little confused because we weren't sure if there was a line or not.  We came on a busy Sunday in the late afternoon.  I finally overheard a lady saying she already grabbed a number, and noticed she had one of those pull out number thingys.  As soon as we got our number, we waited a few moments and took advantage of that time to look at our options.  There were plenty, and there were more than just filipino flavors.  

My boyfriend and I decided to share Ube and Mexcian Chocolate.  Okay, so here is why I gave this place just three stars.  When I tasted the Ube, I was like okay nice and creamy and then I tasted the Mexican Chocolate and felt the same.  Tell me why I couldn't really tell the flavors apart much?  It was such a huge disappointment.  Mitchell's ice cream is super creamy and sugary, but what it's missing is the distinctive flavor of the flavor of ice cream you chose!  I think I'm better off at Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe Ice Cream.
author: Meryl P.

description:
i go here whenever visiting a friend in the neighborhood.  And thats more than enough, cause the ice cream is like crack.  And I'm not even a big sweet tooth.

Like the reviews say in excess its good.  why, cause its got creative flavors that can't be beat.  Yes, the grasshopper is better than Mint chip.  

There is a whole section for different Chocolates.

And now I'm getting into the Coconuts, which there are 3 types.  THREE!

And a pint is only $5.50.  So much cheaper than bi-rite.
author: J S.

description: Mitchell's is a San Francisco institution.  Although I've been going here since high school, I have always resisted the urge to purchase ice cream to bring home.  After DH and I stopped by one night, we finally decided to buy a half gallon.  Bad decision!  Now we can never go back to buying ice cream at the supermarket.  The ice cream is so creamy and full of flavor that you really notice the difference compared to the national brands.  Although a half gallon is $9.85, it's actually not as expensive as it might seem since Mitchell's ice cream has much less air compared to the stuff sold in supermarkets.  And compared to price of a pint of ice cream at Bi-Rite, Mitchell's is a deal!
author: Stephanie B.

description: WOW server rolls eye and looks over it... not the thing I expect after waiting for 40 mins in line!!!! And to top it off the ice-cream isn't worth it. I've had better picking ice cream from a supermarket freezer.  What a waste of time and money.
author: Rus M.

description:
OK, so it's not like Mitchell's needs another review, or even another 5 star review, but I went there yesterday, unexpectedly, and I just can't help myself.  First off, Mitchell's totally kicks Bi-Rite's trendy ass.  I mean, I actually really love Bi-Rite ice cream but Mitchell's is just so much more REAL.  I mean, all sorts of REAL people go there to enjoy their ice cream.  And there's no stodgy LINE, but you pick a number and then mill about with all the other folks waiting for their ice cream.  I drove by Bi-Rite on my way home, and saw that line full of white hipsters pouring out of the place and just wanted to yell, "go to Mitchell's" out the window.  

Perhaps I am a wanna be white hipster.  Or perhaps I am now an old, former wanna be white hipster, and I have sour grapes.  I'll own it.  But still, Mitchell's represents an out for ice cream experience that Bi-Rite just never will.

So one last comment, which is about the new flavor "sweet and salty peanut".  This is perhaps the best ice cream I have ever tasted.  Carmel ice cream, which is a very subtle taste because the overall flavor is so salty.  Yet sweet.  (Hence the name I guess)  And it is simple.  No chocolate chunks or swirls to distract.  Just the perfect amount of Spanish peanuts.  Really just so incredible.  Much as I love the seasonal cantaloupe flavor, I am so glad I went with this one.
author: Judith S.

description:
Ok, there is absolutely NO ICE CREAM made like Mitchell's!  I love Ben N Jerry's too.  BUT Mitchell's, I love you so!  Your chocolate chip ice cream and your mango ice cream is to die.  Your rum raison is perfect and your avocado is beyond yummy!  

This place is always busy, you have to take a number in order to be helped.  It's totally worth all the hassle you might feel is needed in order to get some of their "famous SF ice cream".  Yes I said famous, b/c here in San Francisco, it IS famous:)

Definitely worth a stop in and I personally recommend buying a few pints of the stuff, not just a scoop or two!
author: Kat M.

description:
After a yummy dinner at Burma Super Star on Saturday night, I was craving some sweets before we went "home" (read my friend Liz & Dan's place in Noe) to watch a movie (which turned into Guitar Hero - and me learning for the 1st time). We decided Mitchell's would be shorter line than Bi-Rite's, but I don't think that was true in the end. :) Also, we were going to put the two ice-creameries to the test!

I still haven't had Bi-Rite's yet, but I loved Mitchell's! Creamy yummy goodness. I sampled Mexican chocolate and Halo Halo (a Filipino fruity tropical flavor), and liked both. Though, I decided to order us a combo pint of Grasshopper Pie (mint chocolatey goodness) and Mocha Fudge, and both were delicious. I preferred the Mocha Fudge, however.

I definitely recommend Mitchell's, and there are some really intriguing flavors that I want to return to try. What other ice creamery do you know that has flavors using taro?
author: Sally M.

description:
After being in southern California for the past 6 years I have longed for the day I would return to Mitchell's. I remember going here about twice a week during my elementary and high school days in the city. The perfect day was yesterday, when the Giants clinched the 2010 NL West division title.

MItchell's  has the normal strawberry and chocolate flavors but what stands out are the tropical flavors on their menu. A couple of my favorites are mango and ube (purple yams). I love mango ice cream and mitchell's has the perfect recipe. You can taste the rich flavoring and how fresh their ice cream ice. The ube is awesome too. The purple coloring might look weird but do not be discouraged. This flavor is not bitter and not too sweet at all.

Since I moved out of the city I can not always make it to mitchell's. Luckily mitchells vendors to bay area asian markets. They have the tropical flavors you find at the shop but it is not the same due to the freshness.

I love mitchell's and will continute to eat their ice cream. My friends from all over california and the united states have tried this place and instantly fell in love.
author: Justin M.

description:
Overrated. There is no difference between this shop and any other ice-cream shop. This ice-cream is not special in any way, same fat, same chemicals and calories. You can buy the same or better tasted ice-cream in a grocery store. The only thing is that they have a lot of flavors, some of which are very unusual and a long line of people to get in.  I think it took us probably 30 minutes to get in. My friend liked the avocado flavor. If you REALLY like ice-cream, then I think you will have fun because of the number of flavors, but other than that the line and the wait is not worth it.
I have to mention that they have a very small parking lot and most likely you will have to park in the street.
author: Sophie N.

description:
Despite being number 77, with the current number 40ish, mouth parched, taste buds dry, staring at every melting creation that walked past me was all I needed to keep me in that line. 

It was well worth the wait being able to try out several new flavors.  Here they are below:

Thai Tea:  I merely sampled this one, but as a frequent drinker of thai tea, the coldness of this dampened the sweet bitter taste that I'm used to when drinking this as a beverage. 

Taro: Typical of most taro flavors I've had when buying Magnolia ice cream or Polly Ann's from the ice cream.  Probably not worth the wait in line if you're going to be ordering this.  Better bought at a grocery store :). 

Halo Halo: I ended up deciding on this one, eager for something a little different.  The purple color matches taro ice cream, but is sweeter and has less of a coconut flavor.  The halo halo is sugary, and not fruity, and managed to be relatively creamy.  Dispersed within the the ice cream, there were bits and pieces of jelly and sweet beans that my taste buds found as little surprises. I liked how these added to vary the consistency of the ice cream. 

Overall the ice cream was good, but in terms of price and quantity, but I probably won't be going back here unless they offered a really hard to find/new flavor.  I'd rather pay for a creation that I couldn't quickly walk out with from a convenience store (ex. Ici's, Buyrite)
author: C L.

description:
The first time I came here was many man years ago when I was a kid, and a family friend who lives in the area took us there. I recently went back for ice cream and it's just as phenomenal as I remember as a kid. 

Yes, the wait IS ridiculous, but it is WORTH IT! Some places are just a hype and the line is ridiculous but the food isn't phenomenal. Well, this place IS. Bring some friends, grab a number and just hang for a lil bit. You'll be called soon enough. The workers there are really fast so the line can be deceiving. 

I love the UBE and MACAPUNO ice cream! They have a ton of other funky flavors too like Thai Iced Tea and I think when I was a kid my favorite was Lychi but I didn't see it this last time I went. Anyway, regardless, I settled for other flavors. 

What makes their ice cream good is it's all freshly made. The texture of the ice cream is a bit chewy but very smooth and not overly sweet. Some people like the really creamy Dreyers texture but this isn't any of that. It's almost refreshing and light. Not like the creamy sweet gooey stuff that weighs you down. It's how I like it.

Anyway, if you've never been, you must go at least once in your life!
author: Stephy Y.

description: The choices of ice cream here are amazing. There must be at least 40 to choose from. The ice cream is homemade so it is soft and fluffy. It is sweet, but not too sweet. Just right. There was a bit of a wait (about 25 min) before we got to the front of the line but it was worth the wait. If you are anywhere on the peninsula and have a sweet tooth, make the trip to Mitchell's.
author: Matt A.

description:
SO GOOOOOD! I moved from the Bay to Portland and this is one of the places that I miss the most.  I am back in town for a few days and I just couldn't stay away.

They have a ton of flavors and a very clean store. Walk in and take a number. IT IS WORTH THE WAIT! 

One more thing... the 45 cents it cost to dip the cone in chocolate is worth it.
author: Gina H.

description: Somewhere between my teenage year and now, I lost my love for ice cream. I guess God is sick of hearing "I'm so fat" from me that he decide to put an end to it. Anyway back to the story, the bf has never been to Mitchell ( he loves ice cream, so image my surprise) and he has the fat kid syndrome, where only chocolate and peanut butter ice cream can satisfy his ice cream craving. We arrived and long line as usual, we waited patiently until our number was called, then all hell broke lose. I must have tried 10+ flavor before picking the purivian fruit. It tasted like a mix between butterscotch and taro ice cream, yummy! The bf default to his chocolate and peanut butter, and according to him, the chocolate is WAY better than Bi-rite, Pollyanna, Marco Pollo and a few other place around the bay.
author: jasmin t.

description:
Highlight of my foodie visit to SF!!!

Loved it! I wish I could've ordered more flavors. I really wanted to sample everything, but my hubby stopped me and reminded me that there were about 20 people after me waiting so I had to settle for only a couple tastes. 

Got avocado, mango and some caramel flavor M. chose. the caramelly flavor was way too sweet for me but i loveloveloved the avocado and mango.
this place is definitely on my list to come back and check out when i'm back in SF!
author: Kat Q.

description:
I came here once a few years ago. I didn't really understand what was so good about the ice cream. I see many flavors but also see them at other places too. I waited for half an hour to have them scoop up my ice cream. 

I guess it is just a neighborhood thing. For me it was like eating at Polly Ann's but with a hugh line.  I would rather get gelato for all that trouble.
author: M C.

description:
Wonderful selection, always at Mitchell's! I have a hard time deciding between the flavors, but in the past, it's always either avocado, coffee or ube. 

This place is always PACKED even when it's cold and/or raining. I don't even go here when it's hot, just because I know what kind of crazy wait it is. 

Well it's hell to park here. But well worth the rounding of the block. I do it everytime I go. Although, I must say, the hype doesn't get to me all that much. If parking becomes impossible, I'll just buy a gallon of coffee ice cream at Safeway. No biggie. It's just that I don't know where else to get avocado or ube.
author: Anio D.

description: I want to take back the 5 stars I have given to any other creamery because Mitchell's stands on its own. I came here last night and had one junior scoop of the cinnamon snap (cinnamon ice cream with ginger snap cookies in it) with hot fudge. I am still thinking about it.
