I might continue to think about it until I go back and buy a pint (or a gallon...) of it.  Really friendly staff as well.
author: Richa A.

description: Horchata ice cream was so good and unique, they have a lot of cool flavors. My girlfriend got a sorbet that tasted horrible, it was like straight up soap, but I guess that is what she gets for getting ice cream made of flowers lol.
author: Dakota F.

description:
I came here yesterday after a filling lunch at Phat Philly.  My boyfriend and I were full, but we did not care since he told me that I had to try their ice cream.

When we got there, the line was rather short (compared to the line out the door as I've seen in some reviews), we pulled our number, and ordered.  Not really craving some of the tropical flavors, I decided to order the Grasshopper and Mexican Chocolate.  The grasshopper was good and tasted great.  However, it was the Mexican Chocolate that completely blew me away.  It's rich, creamy, and has this cinnamon-y taste that I didn't expect from any kind of chocolate ice cream.  It was fantastic.  

The only downside was that the ice cream seemed a bit pricey, but I feel that it was worth it considering the quality.  Also, finding parking can be a pain.  As mentioned in previous reviews, there is a small lot in the back, but it was full when we got there and we ended up parking in the residential area around the corner.
author: Kristen D.

description:
INTEGRITY:  When you do the right thing even though no one is watching. -- Anon

I sometimes keep a half-gallon of Mitchell's ice cream in my freezer. I'm TEMPTED to eat it all if no one is watching. 

The other day, I bought a half-gallon along with a single scoop for $13. I paid with a twenty. If you're purchasing a half-gallon you can skip the long line and pay at the counter on the far right. I always feel like a Mitchell's ELITE when I do that. Have you noticed that people are always happy at Mitchell's despite the long line? So unlike the long lines at the post office, DMV or upcoming Yelp Holiday Party.

Exiting the store, I noticed--whoaa--dude gave me back TOO MUCH change. He gave me $27 dollars back instead of $7.  **Integrity Moment**  Do you return the money or pocket the profit? 

Whilst licking my single scoop of yummy mango I considered my conundrum, and concluded that:

Mitchell's Ice Cream parlor is too small. I'd like if they expand a bit. Not Fenton's big, but just more room with tables and chairs for the non-counting-calories-lactose-tolerant to enjoy their ice cream time. Eating ice cream on the sidewalk with cars whizzing by gets kind of old (I said whiz ;-)  I don't think they should give up their parking lot to expand, but maybe buy out that bottom floor of the building they are in.

Back to my earlier conundrum. I think a person's TRUE character is revealed in what they would do if they knew no one was watching. And I would DEFINITELY devour an entire half-gallon of Mitchell's ice cream all by my lonesome. And enjoy it. It's that good!
author: Teddy B.

description:
One of my favorite ice cream shops in SF. A ton of flavors to choose from. Plus you can get your ice cream dipped in chocolate. Not many shops do that any more. How awesome is that!

Crowded on sunny days, difficult to find a parking space.
-- They DO take credit cards with min. $9 purchase. --
author: George M.

description:
I have always loved going to Mitchell's for ice cream. The chocolate caramel crackle and thin mint is usually my go-to move. I don't mind the lines because that adds to the excitement. Especially when it's cold b/c that shows the true die-hard loyalists. 

But recently, I started hanging wit some peeps that kept pushing bi-rite ice creamery. And I gotta say the quality and texture of the salted caramel is pretty special. But between the two, I've got to give it up for Mitchell's. Maybe I'm old school but Mitchell's has my heart. What can I say.
author: Brian C.

description:
3 words: "Chocolate Orange Infusion" ... that flavor alone sold me! Mitchell's is the only ice cream spot I know that requires customers to take a number and wait for it to be called... IT'S ALWAYS PACKED like the DMV! But yo... I've never had a flavor that I didn't like here. That  "Chocolate Orange Infusion" has me feenin' to come back! Who woulda' thought?! Chocolate and Orange blended in one? INCREDIBLE! That's all I gotta say... oh and they ain't stingy on the scoops ya' heard!

Read the reviews for yourself- People love Mitchell's!
author: Tony R.

description: This place is great!  The only thing I don't like is the crowd and crazy line that's always there, but then what do you expect when a place is actually this good!  I love their tropical flavors, the scoop sizes are large, and the staff is always very friendly.
author: Debbie S.

description:
My boyfriend says 2 stars, but unfortunately i am knocking it down for the 9 dollar min. for credit cards. Our sundae was underwhelming, but the flavor was very strong. "Claires Pie," which is coffee flavored was really weird tasting with a hint of coffee, and although the caramel crunch ice cream was OK, it wasn't great. Also they ran out of numbers, and i swear i saw 20 people come up and tell them and none of the employees did anything.

-Bad parking (understandable for sf...)
-So crowded i was only able to see 2 of the (either 3 or 4) dipping cabinets.
-Ridiculously crowded
- 25 cents extra for hot fudge on your sundae?!?!?!? 

Sorry, I'm sticking to Polly's.
author: A. H.

description:
Any place that can convince me coconut is a good flavor automatically gets five stars. I really dislike coconut, but the buko here is actually pretty good - creamy, light, dainty coconut flavor that doesn't overwhelm. I didn't dare get an entire cone though, I just got a heaping spoon taste test. I also got a taste of the peppermint candy - light and minty, cute with the red, pink, and white swirls. Yum!

For my actual cone, I got a sugar cone of the grasshopper - thick cream mint ice cream filled with big chunks of oreo cookies, thick but not hard gooey fudge, and chocolate chips. So amazing! I loved the wide variety of flavors here too. It's definitely a place worth coming to all the way from San Jose - I understand the hype!
author: Katherine P.

description: Normally I'm a chocolate guy, but the Dulce Du Leche here was brilliant!
author: Paul K.

description:
Finished brunch a block away on a cold SF day but wanted to try Mitchell's since I've read so many reviews on it thanks to Yelp.

I guess the whole purpose of coming to Mitchell's was to try one of their own flavors like avocado or something BUT instead I settled for the oreo cookie icecream since I was having a huge craving for it. Not bad, although it tastes like any other oreo icrecream i've tried in the past. Maybe next time around I'll try something special instead of settling for the usual! 

The staff was friendly, there was no wait (thank god!) and they had a ton of different flavors.
author: M W.

description:
best ice cream in town. 

don't really need to say much. it gets crowded. go at obscure times like..3-4pm to get in and get out quickstyle. they have ice cream to go but honestly, it's not the same experience. 

fave: egg nog (seasonal)! but the creamiest ice cream. nothing tops this place.
author: Jason W.

description: It's not the best ice cream I've had (Check out Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous for the best ice cream, ever) but I have to give credit for Mitchell's for having a vast amount of ice cream flavors to choose from. They also have tubs readily available at your local Asian Supermarket and their prices are pretty cheap. Also, you can get your ice cream WITHIN 15 minutes which is always a plus. There's parking in the back too!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Ive been coming here since i was a kid.  I remember specifically making my dad take me here whenever i had an ice cream fix.  Which, mind you, was all the time.  Im a glutton for the cold stuff.  Almost all their flavors are delicious.  I tried for the first time their chocolate crunch flavor (cant remember the exact name)  and it was really yummy.  Flavor that sounded good but tricked me?....avocado.  Yuck.   

Shakes, floats, sundaes, tropical flavors, Mitchell's has it all.  Rain or shine, the line is always always out the door.  More confirmation of their popularity.  

I say this with complete confidence, Mitchell's has the best ice cream in SF.
author: Juv C.

description:
OH MR. MITCHELL... how i love thee.  Let me count the ways...
Pistachio: REAL pistachio..not that green crap but almond flavored ice cream with a mouth full of salty pistachios in each bite.
Halo-Halo: a sweet purple melding of ube, red bean, young coconut meat, jackfruit, and tapioca.
Grasshopper Pie: oreo cookies in mint ice cream with a heaven of swirled chocolate.
New York Cheesecake: rich cheesecake flavored ice cream with CHUNKS of graham cracker crust
Very Cherry: Marichino (sp?) cherries surrounded by a sweet cherry vanilla favored cream
Mango:  REAL MANGO BITS !!!!
Khalua:  i think i got a little tipsy after this one =) 

All in all, we never spend less than a good 5 min tasting before making the final choice.  The staff is always patient with our indecisivness and give the best chunks to taste!  
The only sucky part is the wait ....morning, noon, night, rain, sleet, snow, heat wave...the lines are always long when ever i go (and it is A LOT).  Best way to deal -- get a number, cruise the gallon tubs (you'll probably leave with one anyway), enjoy their newly remodeled shop/knicknacks, and stare at the menu to narrow down the list of tasting you want.
author: Tammy H.

description: A childhood favorite! Whenever I come back to my hometown, I haaaaave to stop by MItchell's. Forget Baskin and froyo, this is the spot! Lines out the door, sometimes it can take a while or go a bit fast, regardless, it is well worth the wait. Since I am half Filipino, they have some pretty good Filipino ice cream, I am partial to the mango :) Great texture, the feel of the building is old fashion, which it also is! They also have pre packed ice creams and cakes. And good people who work hard to get me my ice cream quickly! HIGHLY recommended!!!!!
author: Crystal V.

description:
My parents had their first date here and I'm pretty sure a pint of Macapuno has saved their marriage from crumbling on multiple occasions.  Do I blame the Macapuno for keeping together a couple that probably should have broken up after the 3rd date?  No.  But I'm the forgiving type.  Anyway, my parent's love is born from Mitchell's ice cream.  And possibly mutual hatred.  Check it out!

i was fucked from the beginning.  I never had a fighting chance.

-1 star because i wish they had some vegan flavors...there are only 3 sorbet flavors!  YES, i know they are old school so I'm only docking one star, lay off.  For every complaint I receive, one additional star will be removed...let the games begin!
author: Laura B.

description:
Here's a riddle: how does an ice cream store maintain a permanent line out the door in a city that is colder than Barbara Bush at an orphanage??  

First and foremost, they have a parking lot.  The importance of this feature cannot be overstated.  

Second, the ice cream is so rich and fresh and buttery that you will never put any of that freezer-burned, carrageegnan-laden, socially-irresponsible supermarket ASS CREAM in your mouth ever again.  At our house, it's all about the kahlua, the strawberries and cream, the Mexican chocolate....  We're purists.  But if you're more adventurous there are also lots of nifty Asian fruit varieties you can try.

Pssst... if you don't want to wait in line behind entire soccer teams or gignormous families, go to the Express window inside, get a prepacked quart or an ice cream cake and get the hell out of there.
author: Rosie W.

description:
Two noteworthy incidents from tonight's Mitchell's trip:

1. no joke, tonight there were ticket scalpers at Mitchell's. They snagged a bunch of numbers, came back 20 minutes later and tried to sell them to newcomers.. presumably for ice cream money.

2. The paramedics double parked their fired/medic truck right on San Jose Ave so they could wait for 40 minutes and then buy some avocado ice cream.. presumably while on shift.

Basically, the people love Mitchell's and I know why. The ice cream is not only banging but also cheap (in San Francisco terms). And the staff is typically pretty friendly and accommodating despite the insane conditions. But don't go if you don't like watching teens make out; and, come to think of it, don't go if you specifically do like watching teens make out -- we don't need your type at a family establishment like Mitchell's.
author: Beah B.

description:
I hate Mango.

Dried mango, mango chunks, mango salad, the SNL character Mango...anything related to the fruit.

But Pops used to buy Mitchell's Mango flovor by the 5 Gal. No Seriousy...a 5 Gal. Plenty to you plae colored folks, but to a Samoan fam of 8? Child's play. HAHAH. But I instantly fell in love with the flavor. I still remember chilling with my pops and brothers on a June night in Sunnydale. We'd chill in the kitchen, some of us outside, with the back door open, eating ice cream out of a bowl or in a cantalope cut i half.

[sighs]

I haven't eaten Mitchell's in what...10 years? I think I'm due back for a walk down memory lane.
author: Elijah W.

description:
This ice cream is so rich and creamy! Even after a night of eating until my stomach is about to burst, I was able to make room after one taste of their mint chip.  Everything looked amazing, and all the ice cream seemed to be chocked full of delicious ingredients.

Keep in mind I don't like ice cream.
author: Brandon K.

description:
Some of the most exotic ice cream choices I've seen since the infamous Finochio's in Nice, France!

At the end of countless back and forths- I went for the bright purple yam ice cream- fortunately, the flavor ended up being just as awesome as the color! 

Can't wait to return to sample some other crazy flavors!
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
This is hands down the best Ice cream joint in the Bay Area.  That's pretty big to say considering the amazing desert joints in the Bay.  They have a wide array of flavors from all the tropical flavors(Mango, Macapuno, Ube, Jake Fruit and more).  They also have Mexican chocolate which is slammin! 

**($3--6 price range for good portions)
*(Taste is off the hinges)
*Diverse patrons and workers
*Service is great. 

Make sure you are ready to wait because the lines are always out the door.  Even on cold ass days people still go to Michell's.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Armael M.

description: My puppy Meatball was super duper excited when I said we're going for ice cream! We had a White Pistachio sundae (nice fresh whole pistachios) with caramel, whipped cream, nuts and a cherry. Yummie. We tried a spoon of the my friend Malou's avocado ice cream. Ehh...Not for us. It was our first time. Service is not all that great, but who cares when you're getting ice cream. Just as long as they wash their hands and the ice creams was good I'm happy.
author: Gessa C.

description: I don't know who Claire is, I don't know what her pie tastes like, but the Claire's Pie flavor of ice cream at Mitchell's requires that she and her pie be placed on a pedestal.
author: Joe K.

description:
the hubby used to work here and this was his fave job. so a few years ago he took me here and i have to say their ice cream rocks! i am a SUPER FAN of their tropical flavors - the ube, buko and langka flavors are really good (better than the other brands). their other flavors are also good. everything is done locally, so you can tell the difference.

my only gripe is that the prices have increased considerably over the years - now i get inflation, but it's pretty pricey! also the scoops can be a bit skimpy - they actually 'weigh' your milkshakes too. =( oh well. the lines can also get crazy especially in the summer time. some groceries in the area sell the pre-packed ice cream in case you need a quick fix.
author: Joy A.

description:
Three stars for taste and an extra one for the unique flavors.

My friend and I came on Sunday at 9PM, and there were 19 people in line. Doesn't anyone have work on Mondays anymore? I happily report that the 15-minute wait or so was worth it, though.

In order from good to great, I tried the Thai Tea, Coconut Pineapple, Jackfruit, and Ube (purple yam). All were creamy, dense, and subtly sweet. The jackfruit really tasted like jackfruit--no artificial or syrup fruit flavor. I'm just in love with the ube, though--I could eat half a gallon of it in one sitting by myself. And I'm getting a tummyache just thinking about it. Hahaha.

While I still prefer gelato over ice cream, this one's still a winner.
author: Liz T.

description:
I don't know why I feel like I need to add another review to a place that's already got close to 900 reviews, but oh well, here goes:
  Mitchell's is a local LEGEND.  Some of the best ice cream you will ever get.  When family moves away from SF, they know that they are loved when you pack a half gallon of mango ice cream to take to them!!
  I feel bad, but I have to knock off one star because of how long it takes; how long it takes to drive there (it's never convenient!), how long it takes to find parking, and the longest of all, how long it takes for them to call your number (can be over 30 minutes on a weeknight!).  Still, I like coming here with out-of-town friends to impress them.  Even East Bay and peninsula people don't really know about Mitchell's ... it really is just a LOCAL legend (surprising, with how many yelp reviews there are!)
author: Chris Y.

description:
Oh man!  Mitchell's Ice Cream has some of the best ice cream ever!  Ever! (Of course, I have a friend who will tell you that Magnolia [a Filipino company] has the best ever seeing that he has done commercials for them.  I will say that he has points and I do like Magnolia's ice cream also.)

After going to Lovejoy's, my sister led my siblings and I to this place.  I don't know what it is about the ice cream that makes it so good.  The mango one: delicious!  There's also a parking lot, an item a good amount of places in San Francisco don't have.

However, I need to subtract a star.  The wait is ridiculously long in some cases. (It is a legendary place after all.) It would have been better to get the ice cream in a container and we did that.  We wish we were give a spoon though.

So, yeah, Mitchell's Ice Cream is really good.  If you go here, get mango.  Thank me later.  If only there's a way to reduce the waiting period.

+:  This place carries some of the best ice cream ever!

-:  Like I said, if only there's a way to reduce the waiting period.
author: Don U.

description: Growing up in the city, I have fond memories of coming to this shop every chance my family and I could get. THEY HAVE NOT CHANGED AN OUNCE since I was a wee lad. As others have noted, Ube and Macapuno are musts, as are their shakes. If you have the pleasure of going during the summer months, IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT YOU ORDER THEIR HALO-HALO. By this I don't mean said ice cream flavor (tho it is a hell of a simulation), I mean the actual legit desert in a tall cup. PURE EPICNESS on a cool night.
author: CHRISTIAN P.

description: GIANT ass scoops of ice cream! Mitchell's wins over the other local and popular ice cream spots in the size category for sure. Almost too much! I had to get a cup due to the massiveness of the cone. This is because you MUST get two scoops. One scoop is enough but there are so many flavors (and parking is a gamble) that you have to make it worthwhile. The Mexican chocolate was amazing as was the banana.
author: Nicole O.

description:
I think I must have been lucidly dreaming that day! The sun was brightly shining, even the crisp air didn't give reason  to flat iron my bed head... and oh wait...no nagging worries of bills and chores?...Yup I must have been walking on cloud nine to shore! :-) 

Then an angel whispered in my ear- "I'm going to take you to a place and taste a little bit of heaven." But then an instant rebuttal even before I could entertain the idea,  the cynical angel nudged on the other ear, 
" How many times have you heard that before and of course, we all know where those disappointments  lead to--uhuh!" 

Then as just like a magic pouf and the clouds parted ways- I found myself  blinking my eyes to see if it was really there-- a neat pristine white washed room filled with vibrant colors that seemed to call out my name and those many ice cream flavors each beckoned , "Pick me! Pick me!"

Oh but how could I resist the taste of summer days from years past- like ube,  halo halo, mango and makapuno!  I believe I must have arrived at heaven's gate and where an Ice cream dispensary ensured a happy wait! 

Oh those edible colors of the rainbow: Gummies, Sprinkles, Candies and More! I couldn't believe the many Ice cream flavors oh what galore! They even had  my favorites: Buko and Macapuno and HALO HALO of course! 

There they were, angels who catered to every whim with smiles so big even the taster portions were a hit!  Though busily talking each made-to-order sundaes and milkshakes-- they still found time to eagerly hint  on their  pleasureable mint!

I must have inhaled one so fast -- evaporated it did in a flash!   I  wanted more --a double order on the next -- TRULY I pleaded for my last encore! 

I realized I wasn't lucidly dreaming at heaven's gate - for lust and guilt took over me even for just a sec!  Oh what the Hell opps I meant  Heck! (I guess you don't say that in Heaven as well)--

Oh Well Soooooo--another encore will just have to wait;-) When in the meantime I can work out the weight to pursue this pleasure again on another date ;-)

PS- Icecream Satisfaction as close to heaven on earth :-) Buko (Baby Coconut) Halo Halo (Buko, Langka, Ube, Pineapple, Mongo and Sweet Beans in shaved ice and condense milk) Macapuno (Sweet Coconut) and I'll take that added skip to my stride :-)
author: Arissa C.

description: I've been here before but it was years ago. This was for my most recent visit. I went on a Thursday afternoon around 2 o'clock. The place wasn't that busy compared to other days where there would be a huge crowd out the door. I took my ticket and I was helped in 5 minutes. I ordered a junior grasshopper in a cup. Sooo good.
author: Kayla V.

description:
The parking gods love me, seriously.

So I'm doing dinner with Jenn N. and Mia K. in the Mission (shudder) and Mia's like, "Ohmigod, you will so not find parking in _that_ neighborhood at eight pee em... I know, I used to live here..."

Yeah, mmm hmm... I smoothly pull into a spot right across the corner from the restaurant, and immediately in front of Mitchell's. Keep the faith, yo.

After a lackluster din-din, we go for Mitchell's -- hell, we're already there, no?

Mitchell's serves ice cream in jail, by the looks... Inside, it's like night court -- a swarm of dirty Twentynothings grab numbers, waiting by the big iron grates for their turn. My gawd, if this is an ice cream parlor, I'm effing Pollyanna. I long for my Inner Richmond Toy Boat and its quarter horsey ride.

The ice cream prices make  sense to only Missionites: for the price of two small cups of ice cream, you can buy half a gallon. But no one would ever be caught buying a half a gallon to go. The ice cream is "good," but apparently "too good to eat [more than just a scoop]." Is this like eating Jesus? One bloody crumb a week, that's all we ask...

Two stars. It's edible, but the $2 half-gallons from Safeway taste better, seriously. Who the hell cares that it's hand made? So are Louis Vuitton knockoffs. Grenades are packed by hand as well, pro'ly.  As for the cool factor... no thanks, I take my ice cream without handcuffs.
author: Perci N.

description:
I was at work last week and we had just finished eating a meal when one of my co-workers' boyfriends showed up with a 1/2 gallon of Mitchell's pumpkin ice cream. Absolutely PERFECT timing! It's nicely spiced (sometimes people get carried away by the holiday spirit and "spiced" things can end up tasting like you're eating a bowl of potpourri) with lots of pumpkin flavor. Check it out before it goes out of season.

I like that when you go to Mitchell's they have the ice cream dudes  behind a wall of glass like people are going to rush them like The Beatles or something. Actually, on a hot day, it CAN get a little hairy in there. Take a number, bitch!


They're known for their tropical flavors and I've never had a flavor at Michell's that I didn't like, but the buko (baby coconut), GODDAMN! Those poor little motherfuckers never had a chance. They'll never feel the warm embrace of a lover. They'll never know what love is. So sad. So sad... 


OK, seriously, I'm switching to Sanka...tomorrow.
author: Josua P.

description:
While trying to find parking before dinner at Emmy's we happened upon an open space right across the street from Mitchell's.  Dessert had been decided on the spot.

After dinner we made the short walk back to Mitchell's where there was no line!  We even overheard some people at the corner across from Mitchell's exclaim "Look there is no line!" to which Anne Marie responded "the line starts behind us!" as we rushed to the entrance as fast as we could.

We took a number and waited for them to call us up but we were seriously struggling to decide what we wanted.  I knew I was going to get a scoop of the avocado ice cream but I wanted to try something else too.  There were so many tasty options!  I settled for the Macapuno to accompany my scoop of Avocado.

The macapuno was so good my company said it was almost better than sex.  It was pretty damn good with the chunks of macapuno mixed in with the super creamy and rich ice cream.  I tried some of the tropical 4 (I think that is what it was called) which was a blend of tropical ice cream flavors.  That was also super yummy!

I'm going to have to dedicate a half hour on the elliptical at the gym just for this treat!
author: Luis M.

description:
+so many awesome flavors. I bought a gallon of tropical 4. It was gone in a week or so...
+parking lot
+lucuma is pretty tasty
author: Jen Y.

description:
staff: "number 66...66!"........"number 67....67~!!~!!!"......."number 68.....68~!....serving 68~!~!!!..."........."number 69~!"....running up to bullet proof window counter with number 69...peanut butter indulgence..oh yeah...smoothest chocolate ice cream smothered with peanut butter and chocolate peanut butter chips....mr. burn's e~g~g~c~e~l~l~e~n~t~~~~~~~~

tropical four seems to be other's favorite...halo halo!
author: Hen A.

description:
Legal crack on a cone. Damned creamy. So good it's sold from behind heavy glass. Mitchell's -- porn of ice cream world.

Pura vida!
author: Lotion M.

description: Filled with adults, and drugged out dudes. After 10 minutes waiting, our number was called. Tried the Grasshopper ice cream before settling on the Macapuno. The Grasshopper flavor was very good. I tried their also Buko (young coconut)  and I felt like I was in South Pacific.Mover over naked guy.
author: J-Pierre E.

description: This is a review I had pending for this guys, the please is neat and you can choice the flavor that you want. I strongly recommend you this place, come over with your family, kids, friends or alone just to experience this. Great service.
author: John A.

description:
Nobody goes here, it's too crowded.

(Goodnight everybody, I'll be here all week)
author: Nicholas B.

description: i only give four and not five stars because it is so tiny in there and it is usually super packed with people. on the other hand, it is super packed all the time because this place is crazy good!!! i remember growing up in the city coming here many times. it brings back childhood memories of coming here with my parents. i have always loved the way it smells in here..yummy waffle cones!! it can be the middle of winter and raining and people will still be waiting in line to get some of that ice cream. last time i was a little bummed though because they didn't have cookie dough, so i got cookies 'n cream instead. next time i go there, i want to try something totally different because i am always getting 'safe' flavors, and there are so many ones to choose from!!
author: Rebecca O.

description:
YUMMY!!!

I always order my usual...one scoop of Ube and one scoop of their Mango ice cream.... simply DELICIOUS!!!  Bf likes their Halo Halo ice cream...that's delicious also. Can't go wrong with any flavor though.

This place is ALWAYS packed but soooo worth the wait. =)
author: Angela W.

description:
Overrated, Overpriced, Crowded (for no reason,) Hyped-up, Gummy, Stale, old, hardly "homemade" ice cream. 

I used to live a few blocks from here. And EVERYONE would always croon, "OMG, you live near Mitchell's... they are SOO good! I love that place!!"--- So I kept trying the place. Fought the crowds, dealt with the rows of SUVs double-parked and blocking the driveway- and gave it a few tries.  I never figured out the appeal. Their ice cream is made in some random factory in South City, the service (usually underpaid kids) is pretty awful, and you're lucky if you get a smile, much less good service. 

I had such high expectations for this place, and they failed on so many counts (they sell random cookies and crap at the front of the store, if anything just to distract from the fact that you're waiting 20 minutes plus to get an ice cream cone..) that I was soooo glad that I was introduced to JOE'S ICE CREAM on Geary, which actually has REALLY homemade ice cream. 

Oh, and their Pumpkin ice cream? It's seasonal, so if you want it any time other than October/November, you're SOL. I guess they are the only ice creamery in the neighborhood, but if you're in the Mission, I'd go to the Bombay Ice Creamery, if you can't take the trip out to Joe's.

(Btw, not sure who it was who decided to PM me with personal commentary about how they didn't agree with my comments- I think I read a few sentences and deleted, so please do not waste your time.)
author: M'ia K.

description:
The ice cream experience compared (where I live now vs. where I grew up): 

San Francisco: The ice cream is very good. The best and most interesting flavors are fruit-based.

Berks County, PA: The ice cream is very good. The best and most interesting flavors involve some combination of baked goods and chocolate. Why would you screw up a perfectly unhealthy food like ice cream by adding fruit? 

Winner: Berks County, PA

--

San Francisco: There is one real ice cream place in the whole damn city. The wait is atrocious.

Berks County, PA: Every farm, candy store, or mini golf course sells ice cream. There is never any wait, except maybe on high traffic mini golf nights.

Winner: Berks County, PA

--

San Francisco: You can make the wait go faster by taking a number, going across the street to Safeway with your friends, purchasing 40's, brown bagging 'em, and wandering back into line. 

Berks County, PA: You can't drink on the street OR buy alcohol in the supermarket.

Winner: San Francisco
author: Liz G.

description:
when is my number going to come up!! ding ding ding!!!!.... best concept that I have ever seen, and is pretty common within the sf dining scene. What I am talking about is you grab a number located at the door, and you wait till your number lights up above the check out counter!!!!!!! brilliant idea, and this causes people from doing cutsy's, and getting into a fight!!!! 

no cutsy's for you!!!!!!!! muahhaha

BABY COCONUT!!!!!! a plus

mango and cantaloupe were a little too sweet for me but great for the people with the love for sweeter ice cream... thank god Mitchell's does not exist in Seattle because my belly would be enormous, and I would have their ice cream in my refrigerator.
author: Nina M.

description:
Dieters beware!  The ice cream is delicious, smooth and so creamy.  Packed with tons of calories I'm sure, but definitely worth the splurge :)

The single scoops are huge!  I recommend getting a kid's scoop, that way you can enjoy multiple flavors.  You can also buy prepackaged tubs of ice cream to enjoy at home!  Their buko (baby coconut) flavor is amazing and not overly sweet.  

This place is always crowded, even when it's cold and rainy so you know it's a good spot.  Must try!
author: Jenny N.

description:
Mitchell's Ice cream is fantastic.

Makes me feel so damn nostalgic.

Dream of it while stuck in traffic.

Sad when I'm done with my last lick.

What in line after I get my ticket.

Depressed but ice cream always fix it.

Have too much but just can't quit it.

It's ok cause I'll just $hit it.... out
author: Jen A.

description:
Pauley Pavilion, UCLA.  The Bruins are expected to lose against a top-5 ranked opponent, but somehow gut out a win by waking up and putting on a clinic in the final minutes.  The raucous student section is jumping up and down, and the upset chant starts. *clap-clap* *clap-clap-clap* OVER-RATED! *clap-clap* *clap-clap-clap* OVER-RATED!

Those college memories are reactivated every time someone mentions Mitchell's ice cream. It's good stuff, it's got a helluva lot of tradition behind it, and the flavor palette is awesomely creative. But I just can't buy into the adoration of the number-taking masses this San Francisco institution seems to inspire.

If I want to be bad, I want to be bad. Give me thick, gooey, gloppy, ridiculously rich ice ~cream~ with a zillion grams of fat and even more calories. Mitchell's could take their amazing variety of flavors and inject them into a rich, decadent, heart-threatening melange of heavenly indulgence. Instead, they give us about 400 different colors of flat, texture-free ice milk, served up from a bullet-proof booth.
author: Omid T.

description:
Who doesn't love ice cream?? 

My favorite flavors in no particular order @Mitchell's:

Mango
Ginger
Halo Halo
Avocado
Orange Sherbet
Thin Mint

Warning: This stuff will get ya fat, but it's oh so good. 
Note to self: Fat asserage is NOT a handicap.
author: rm c.

description:
I don't really like ice cream.  But this review is NOT based on the fact the I really don't care for it much.  Ice cream is ice cream to me.  I don't even think they make it in house anymore.  And to top it off, the founder of Mitchell's passed away recently, along with all his knowledge.

Unless it's made with quadruple cream, sugar, and fresh Madagascar Vanilla Beans ... if there is such a thing, and spun in front of my face.

I don't get that you have to get a number, and they will call you when your turn is up next Tuesday.  There always seems to be a line, even when it's pouring rain, and cold outside.  Parking is near impossible, and don't try to get your Yukon Denali around that hard sharp right turn.  Trust me.

I do like that they have some unusual flavors, like Maize con Queso, Buko, Ube, and the like.  And they have the best Chocolate ice cream I've ever had.  And having your ice cream dipped is nice.

But on the whole, I don't get the hype.  Don't hate, K?
author: Michael M.

description:
i love love love their ice cream

Mango ice cream is amazing.  And so is ube, avocado..heck all the exotic flavors!

I'm quite partial to new york cheesecake...which they no longer had.  they had actual chunks of cheesecake in it!  I also am a fan of the butterscotch marble...mm..

It's super rich and super creamy.  Just lovely in flavors.  I'm a huge ice cream fan.

I miss this place now that I'm in L.A....I barely even got to visit it when I was local just because it's quite a ways from where i live just to have a scoop.
author: Hazel A.

description:
Here in San Francisco, "ice cream" is usually synonymous with "Bi-Rite" and "Mitchell's" - and for good reason.  Mitchell's has some of the best ice cream I've ever tasted.  The texture and consistency is second to none - definitely the creamiest out there.

The flavors aren't as artistic and creative as those at Bi-Rite or Humphry Slocombe's, but they do have some interesting flavors of their own such as Thai Tea and Ube.

The only downside is that it's located on the outskirts of SF.   Having to get in a car and drive down or hop on the J-Church isn't too fun, but the trip is worth it.  Technically they're in Noe Valley, but I consider anything south of Cesar Chavez as being questionable.  It's like people who live in Glen Park that claim they live in San Francisco =X
author: Allen L.

description:
Here's some stuff you should know: 

*Get a number and wait for them to call you
*ALL kinds of flavors
*Flavors of the month
*Waffle cone sundaes are good to share
*Parking lot can be crowded
*Benches outside for eating and waiting
*Prepacked ice cream
*Freeze dried ice cream treats for your doggie!
*Get ready to wait in line
author: Caroline C.

description:
OMG I have been going to Mitchell's since I was like 13 and I haven't reviewed this place yet?!?!?! 

So this is the type of place where my parents went to back in the day and it's THAT GOOD of a place to still be around to this day. They're the ones who introduced me to Mitchell's.

Fresh ice cream made daily. And it's not like the typical Baskin Robbin's/Coldstone chains - this place is totally homemade, filipino style! I'm a sucker for keepin' it simple - vanilla with rainbow sprinkles please.

Even when it's pouring rain and like -200 degrees inside, I'll still manage to swing by and pick up a bucket of ice cream. YUM.

You can't go wrong when the place has almost 1000 reviews pushing 5 stars!!!
author: Britney C.

description: You know Mitchell's is doing something right when it's freezing outside and you drive by to see tons of people waiting on at 10 PM on a Thursday night. Waited about 20 minutes for our number to be called (82!!!!!) and it was well worth it. Ice cream was amazing! Staff were very friendly and attentive. And maybe because we had to wait a bit, we didn't feel so guilty asking for one, two, or three samples. Decided on a double of Kahlua mocha and a seasonal Irish coffee flavor. Can't wait to go back and try more.
author: Tracee W.

description:
Everyone's right about the mango ice cream...it's really, really, really good.  I'm told that I shouldn't have any milk products, but since I'm writing a review for an ice cream shop, you can see I'm a subversive milk-a-holic.  

I indulge in ice cream once in a blue moon, and when I do it's this place that gets my business.  Everything is good.  They use the freshest ingredients, and you can taste it in every yummy lick.  (The durian ice cream is a little scary.)
author: Kristina R.

description:
Ok so you can't live in sf and not hear about Mitchell...so this is a must stop for sf and another interesting sweet stop to take out of towners.
take a number and wait outside, then squeeze your ass thru the door and elbow your way to the counter. you'll probably wont have a chance to check out all the flavor so hopefully you'll land yourself a spot with a good view. after a quick glance at the rich ice cream colors. i decided on orange...oh jackfruit...sounds exoctic sounds different sounds new.
1 scoop jack fruit
+ some elbowing 
_______________
= daggnabbit.... I HAD THIS BEFORE! way didn't i take my time!!!!!

yes jackfruit is not unique... i forgot i had this flavor like 10 years ago! from my local asian supermarket!!!! ergggggh! all that ice cream hurt brain.... too many people..should of got avocado!
author: Lynn T.

description:
I'm ashamed to admit it but there was a time I came here so much that I was able to list off at least half the flavors available at Mitchell's. I too am ashamed at that. It probably has about 30 flavors. Before you think that it's like Baskin Robbins, which is known for having 31 flavors, let me help you out with that. Mitchell's is the legitimate ice cream maker whereas BR is the corporate hack. 

I love all except for three of their flavors: ginger, fruit cake (seasonal), and halo halo. Halo halo used to be one of my favorites until they put gummy candy in it; I ended up picking them out. If Mitchell's has 35 flavors and 3 are not my type, that leaves 32 that are and that equals 91.4%, which is still an A grade. You need to come here more than once - unless you plan to get 5 cones and eat them all - so that you can have their classic American flavors (e.g., dulce de leche, strawberries and cream), their tropical flavors (e.g., ube, lucuma, coconut pineapple), and their seasonal options (e.g., ginger snap, egg nog). The best seasonal items come out during the winter. IThis place has PLENTY of business during the winter time. There is no bad season to eat good ice cream after all.

So, grab your cash (used to be cash only but now there's a minimum amount), your dinner appetite (you'll be glad that you are going against mom's rules of no ice cream before dinner since you'll be eating ice cream as dinner), and your prayers to the parking gods (parking here is a huge pain during peak times) and head on over. 

P.S. I don't know how the workers stay so thin. I'd be ready for gastric bypass if I worked there.
P.P.S. On hot summer days, the wait gets very long. If you're willing to loosen your belt a few notches, get the gallon ice cream that's pre-packed so you can bypass the line.
author: Gwen L.

description:
MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM!

I had the cinnamon snap. What a delicious treat! It wasn't too sweet, but it wasn't boring either. It was full of flavor--strong cinnamon and mild ginger and veeery creeeamy--and I was really sad when I finished my cone.

I will be back here. There are so many more flavors for me to try....yum.
author: Molly N.

description:
You know, as a person of Filipino descent, I used to always look in my history books for any reference of the Philippines...this went on for years before I figured out that we weren't really all that much to America other than yet another conquered country. Picture the little kid walking down the street head down. That sad, people.

Then I discovered Mitchell's and saw things only buried in my own freezer: buco. mango. langka. jackfruit. excuse me? Can it be? There are other Filipino things other than Serramonte? *pause for a moment of reverence*

Yes, Mitchells reaffirms my Filipino-ness. Makes me want to do tinikling right then and there. Hot damn those sundaes are worth the wait too.

TIPs for Mitchells Newbs: walk in and grab a number by the inside of the doorway. Don't just stand in line, bright eyes.
author: Charlene L.

description: Ice cream here is just simply amazing.
author: Anthony V.

description:
Last night was my second time coming to Mitchell's. For my first time, I just bought a tub of ube for my family so it was quick, easy, and painless. I knew I wanted to come back to try their flavors on an ice cream cone though. And yesterday night, I did just that! After dinner, my person and I decided to get some ice cream. When we drove past Mitchell's, we saw a whole mass of people standing outside and were a bit hesitant of whether or not we wanted to wait in line. My person clearly wanted some ice cream because he said that I could even wait in the car and he would wait in line by himself. Oh what a sweetie but of course my conscious wouldn't let that happen. We parked in the small lot behind the store and by then, our stomachs were super super ready for some ice cream. Grabbed a number (27)..ehh not too bad since they were at 13 already. It turned out pretty well since it gave me enough time to look through the whole menu and all the colorful tubs of ice cream to decide which one I wanted with my waffle cone. In the end I decided white pistachio. I tried the chocolate with fudge (something along those lines), it was good but a little too sweet for my taste. The white pistachio was light and just right for me. My person got "young coconut" (I will never understand the difference of "young" and regular coconut....) and he kept getting excited whenever he ate a big piece of coconut. Delicious I'm guessing. 

I'll definitely be back to try more of their flavors! :3
author: Judith L.

description: I would wait in line for 30 minutes again for a scoop of grasshopper pie....mmMmmmM definitely hits the spot ;)
author: Emma N.

description:
I really don't think the ice cream here is that spectacular. It certainly isn't bad, but it's nothing special. The tropical flavors are a rarity, so that's worth something. Also, there's something to be said for supporting a local business. Given the choice between going to Mitchell's or someplace like Cold Stone Creamery or Baskin Robbins, I'd go with Mitchell's. But my choice would be based on principle, not quality or taste.

In my opinion, it's not worth the wait.
author: A A.

description:
Long lines you say? Too expensive? Step aside, let me take my freaking number and wait for the best ice cream around. Daydreaming about the rich creamy texture is the only thing that keeps me at bay until my number's called. 

What to pick this time?hmmm..Macapuno, ube, pumpkin, mexican chocolate, Kahlua mocha cream, mocha fudge, strawberry...can't decide..why pick one, pick two...on a cone...and hand it over I can't wait anymore...
author: Irene D.

description:
First, the disclaimer:  We didn't make it to its location in the Mission District but walking around Hayes Valley had one big surprise.  We chanced upon a corner store that sells Mitchell's ice cream. Yes, Mitchell's Ice Cream and without the line! 

Unfortunately, they didn't have the ube (pronounced oo-bay, that's purple yam) so I ordered the next best thing: AVOCADO ICE CREAM! Yes, you got that right, ladies, AVOCADO ICE CREAM!

Have you had that out-of-body experience taking you 20 or 30 years back into your childhood (I admit it, I'm old)?  I did after downing that first spoonful of AVOCADO ICE CREAM.  This is what summer's all about back in the days.  I can see you guys twitching by the mere mention of this frozen concoction. Before you die twitching, why don't you head to Mitchell's, try it and experience heaven.
author: Marco d.

description:
I love the fact that they are open until late.

I love their huge collection of different flavors. If I live in SF, I will probably try one everyday and it will not repeat until like a month later.

Among all of the flavors, I love the "tropical 4" the most. It is nothing similar to any other kind of ice cream that I have tried in my entire life. A truly unique and sophisticated taste. More bonus stars for it being not too loaded with sugar.

Oh, and I love their unassuming price. 

Be aware: there is always a long line no matter what time you go.
author: vivian l.

description: Mitchell's serves up some classic ice cream flavors.  They're not like Bi-rite or Humphrey Slocombe in that they're not gonna give you lavender or olive oil infused desserts.  They tend to be creamier so for those poor lactose intolerant folks (myself included) the sorbets have always satiated my cravings.  I have sampled a few non-sorbets and the peanut butter chocolate mix is delish.
author: Karen N.

description:
My former boss introduced me to Mitchell's eight years ago and have been coming back ever since! They have all the classic flavors from chocolate, mint chocolate chip, to caramel praline. But get this, they also have all these different tropical flavors from around the world that are YUMMY! There aren't any real seating areas, but there is a bench out side. 

These are the flavors that I've tried and loved:
* Tropical Four - Tropical Four (Banana, Guava, Mango & Pineapple)
* Buko (Baby Coconut)
* Coconut Pineapple
* Langka (also known as Jackfruit, a relative of the Fig)
* Lucuma
* Thai Tea
* Ube (Purple Yam)
* Caramel Praline
* Rocky Road
* Chicago cheesecake

 Go GO GO GO!!!
author: Fried Rice B.

description:
This is the best ice cream place in San Francisco. Hands down. Funny enough, my dad use to work at Mitchell's back in the '60s.

Nothing else compares to this piece of heaven. I have all kinds of childhood memories from this place. After I had my first cone, there was no doubt in my mind that I'd never go anywhere else.

Milkshakes, banana splits, sundaes, cones. You name it, they do it perfectly. My favorite is the Thin Mint, but try them all. They're all fan-fucking-tastic.

This place is usually semi busy all the time (even in the winter), but in the summer, be prepared to wait. and wait. Take a number and go for a walk. But believe me, it's definitely worth it.

They close promptly at 11PM, so don't be late. If they lock you out, flash them a $20 and they might let you in. Just don't tell them I said that. If the parking lot is full, parking is kind of a pain, yet do-able.

I want some Mitchell's now, dammit!
author: Alexis C.

description:
My sweetie and I decided to take a Field trip and get some ice cream. We ended up here. This place has some great memories and some great ice cream. I tryed the lucuma flavor its a tropical fruit from Peru.

Ice cream is even better on cold and rainy days..
author: Der Maibaum L.

description: I always make a point to stop here if I have not yet had dessert on the way home.  Too bad they don't have the lychee flavor to order unless you go and buy yourself a pint.  So I tend to order green tea and mango.  I think Mitchell's has the best mango ice-cream flavor since Mango tastes different depending on the brand.
author: Wendy T.

description:
I'm an iced cream fiend. I love it, I could eat it on the coldest day of the year and still be blissfully happy.
I am a huge fan of Bi-Rite, Swensen's, Toy Boat, Joe's, you name it, I love it. But I have to say, I give the crown to Mitchell's! Best ice cream in the city. There's just something so deliciously creamy about their ice cream, it's not gimmicks, no fancy, trendy flavors, just the best ice cream you've ever had that brings you right back to your childhood when an ice cream cone could solve every problem in the world
author: Cathy T.

description:
I agree with Kevin S that this is *almost* as good as Graeter's.  But I question whether or not I hold Graeter's in higher esteem because it actually gets hot in Ohio.   You know, the kind of hot where your sometimes wavy hair turns into a poof of frizz with curly bangs, and you are visiting from San Francisco, so you don't have the requisite hair products to do anything about it, and the only comfort that can be had is found at the bottom of a cone of peanut butter chip.  

I promise I will go to Mitchell's on my next seriously lame hair day that happens to coincide with 90-plus degrees in San Francisco to test this.
author: L W.

description:
Insanity in a cone.  The gooey love-gasm of the chocolate caramel crackle will make you want to spontaneously jump up and down.  Then hug people.

Seriously.  This place is ridiculous.  And worth every minute of your wait.
author: Scott W.

description:
I try to stop here every chance I get...not that it's often. But now I have an arrangement with some friends of mine who go up to the city often enough to pick me up a tub or 5 of the stuff. Hmmmmm Mango....Ube.....Macapuno........OMG!!! Tastes great.....almost good like home.....hmmmmm Manila......anyways, where was I? 

Uhm.....yeah, now only if they could make it 0 calories so my workout would suffer so much. :P

Oh well...that's why I work out right?
author: John-Michael C.

description:
Mitchell's is the stuff  of local legend, and it's all well-deserved. The ice cream itself is creamy and perfect, and each flavor is a taste sensation. I'm even happy with my trusty old vanilla.

Half the fun is going on a hot summer night and waiting in line, the anticipation of it all just adds to the Mitchell's experience. I guess it's one of the few things in San Francisco that reminds me of being forever young. I mean, I scream, you scream, we all scream for ice cream, right?
author: Nish N.

description:
THE ABSOLUTE BEST ICE CREAM SHOPPE IN SAN FRANCISCO AND THE WORLD!!!!!!!!!!!!

Mitchell's satisfies every ice cream craving you will ever have and it has been satisfying me since I was a kid. I will wait as long as it takes to get my ice cream but if you really really really can't stand being in a crowd of other ice cream lovers, then go for the pre-packed ice cream - and don't ever be ashamed of buying the gallon!
author: Kathy E.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream serves the best ice cream in San Francisco!!!  I first had Mitchell's when a former company I worked for had a companywide ice cream social.   Two flavors were served:  I dunno why only 2 flavors and I can't remember them since it was 10 years ago.  This was the start of a beautiful long-term relationship.

I don't think there is a bad flavor in this place.  Their list of flavors is quite extensive.  Some on my favorite flavors are toasted almond, coffee & vanilla.  I also like the tropical flavors such as green tea, thai tea, macapuno (sweet coconut), ube (taro root), and langka (jackfruit).

I decide to order 2 small birthday cakes from Mitchell's.  There is a booklet of cake designs to help with your selection.  The staff was friendly and helpful in selecting the icing, cake type and script color with your ice cream.  We ordered an Oreo Cookie ice cream w/ vanilla cake and a Coffee ice cream w/ vanilla cake.  Both were delicious and out of this world!

Ahh Mitchells, you will always hold a special place in my heart.  Always.
author: Janet H.

description:
They have the best tropical flavors in the Bay Area. 

The lines are always long, even on a cold day. That should tell you that this place is good. 

I love their shakes, it's simply the best.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Ice cream is a must-have. Although  just like Bi-rite. There's no space, and kind of hard to park. But it is definitely worth it. I'm going to try everything on the menu at least once.
author: Victoria L.

description: My last meal on earth includes Mitchell's mango ice cream for dessert.  I'd die happy.  Avocado ain't too bad either.
author: Carol P.

description:
Sorry, I don't see what all the fuss is about.  It's okay, but doesn't seem all that special to me (I think Hagen Daaz makes better quality ice cream).

The only exciting thing to me is when I've found special flavors (might be available only around winter solstice, not sure!) that I know my husband will love, like cinnamon ice cream (his all-time favorite flavor, which is surprisingly hard to come by) and peppermint candy.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Young coconut icecream... bits of chewy coconut...

f*ck ya

Um, and ya it's worth the wait even in the middle of friggin WINTER.
author: Angela H.

description: I finally went in the other day; Creamy but not so creamy like some brands you find in the supermarket. Strong flavoring but doesn't taste artificial and not too sweet. Oh and the cone is so so crispy. Mitchell's makes it easy to love them.
author: Shum S.

description: Ah, their "Thin Mint" is to die for. Mmmmmm. After renovation, their store looks even greater! :)
author: Jessica R.

description:
Coldstone? Please lick my balls. Mitchell's is the only place I want to eat ice cream. Grasshopper flavor is legit. Best ice cream in the city. Have gone here several times and tried different flavors. Never been disappointed.

This place is right around the corner from The Front Porch if you find yourself eating there. 

Make sure you come in and pick up a number on the inside of the left door. Noobs come in trying to get in line only to figure that out after 5 other people come in and get a number before you. Bitches...I didn't know there was a numbering system!

I've always come here for the scoops but next time I'll make sure I pick up a bucket to take home.
author: Trung V.

description: Mitchell's is a classssic! If you haven't had some Mitchell's ice cream I don't know where you've been hiding! LOL this place is sooo good and always packed! Even at night time you'll find yourself lined up.  My only complaint would be the parking, but that's why you should come with someone else so you can send them in to do the dirty work.  My favorite ice cream flavors are Ube, Pralines & Cream, Mexican Chocolate (never had it anywhere else and it's F-ING DELICIOUS!), and Pumpkin.  I guess Pumpkin will always be a fav of mine because I can only have it seasonally lol.
author: Christina O.

description:
i know i will come here eventually if i can figure out how to transport their ice cream back to oaktown. why? anchalee's in berkeley uses their ice cream and it's hella good!

they use real fruit products from the phillipines, etc.
author: Victor G.

description:
Their ice cream is so thick and creamy, it is almost a workout to spoon!  (Don't ruin my fantasy that I am actually burning calories while eating it.)  They have an impressive selection of flavors, so you're sure to find something you like, whether you prefer to stick to traditional flavors or are into trying exotic flavors like avocado or even stuff you've never heard of before like makapuno (tastes kind of like butterscotch... but different).  I got the Thai Iced Tea, which was great and made me wonder why it isn't more common - the flavor is just dying to be turned into ice cream!

Bonus points for the ordering system they have in place.  You (or your party) take a number.  While you're waiting for your number to be called, you get to survey the extensive selection.  This is vastly superior to the line system, where you can't see the selection in the cases until you get to the front of the line, then have to make a selection on short notice, and feel all this pressure to keep the line moving when you are trying to taste some of the flavors.  Every ice cream place should use this system.  It is simple and so much better.

Oh, and did I mention they have parking??  And are open till 11?  If I could give 6 stars, I would.
author: Leslie L.

description:
Yum. Mexican chocolate. The way chocolate was meant to be. fabulous-o

Eggnog, now, here's what ya do...that is if you really wanna delve into a calorie laden bliss extravaganza. 1 pint glass, scoop of eggnog ice cream, sprinkle of nutmeg, repeat till glass is full, pour eggnog (the liquid) over to fill in the gaps. Give it a minute so it freezes up (the way a root beer float does) now sit back relax, grab a spoon, and dig in! forget whatever's been on your mind. pure bliss. and if what's been on your mind is really horrid, feel free to add a dash or so of rum or brandy :)

avocado, who'd a thunk it, it works.

okay, ya get the picture, they're good, they're local. Support local commerce. You'll be happy you did!
author: Piper D.

description: Maybe I need to give this place another shot because everyone gushes about Mitchell's, but I wasn't blown away by the quality of the ice cream here.  It just didn't taste as fresh or high quality as places like Bi-Rite or Smitten.  It wasn't bad, but I wouldn't have been able to tell apart the scoop of strawberry I got from Mitchell's from a scoop of Breyers.
author: David C.

description:
TAKE A NUMBER AND WAIT YOUR TURN...

The people behind the counter are really nice and don't try to rush you--they may seem overwhelmed themselves--and let you try as many samples as you like. 

This place is great if you don't want typical flavors, most of which are "tropical" flavors. My favorites are Mexican Chocolate and Pumpkin (yeah I know, these ARE NOT "tropical" flavors). I always get a Junior scoop since the regular scoops are way too much ice cream. 

I would avoid this place during hot days since there is always a really long line--even at 9:30-10:00PM which is insane!

Remember to bring cash because there is a minimum for debit cards.
author: Lola L.

description:
5 stars folks

san franciscan ice cream staple

exuberant amount of flavors, my favorite is the halo halo offered only during the summer time, this is the real deal made rite this aint no jolibee halo halo which is shameful if you ask me, they should not even be on the menu at jolibee.. they offer 1 scoop, 2 scoops, 3 scoops, dipped in chocolate or white chocolate, banana splits offered, toppings of almost every cereal, or sugar goodness is offered, they got tropical taste and regular taste you can't go wrong at Mitchell's

food ***** 5 or more friggin stars
service *** long lines u got to wait for perfection rainy or not there is always a line
price $ dirt cheap
author: Clarence A.

description:
After spending a nice day on the coastside, how could I pass up stopping at Mitchell's?

While walking up to the store front, my friend decided to give me a really rough hug, and ended up cutting my ear with her finger nail. My ear started bleeding; like blood dripping down my lobe. I cupped my ear and continued to the front door, cause I wanted my Mitchell's! Folks were looking at me like I was a weirdo, and I said, "not to worry, I am Van Gogh!"

Ok, I know, this may be gross for an ice cream review...ANNYway...

I said to my friend, "the only thing you can do to make me feel better is get me a Caramel Dazzle Sundae while I go back to the car; I'm scaring the kids."  I wasn't trying to make her feel guilty, mind you.

A layer of Hot fudge, a scoop of Dulce de Leche ice cream, a layer of caramel, another scoop of Dulce, more caramel and hot fudge, whip cream, a cherry with chocolate sprinkles. mmmmmmm! My ear felt better instantly :)
author: Michelle S.

description:
Mmm.....Kahlua Mocha Cream (drool)

Mmm...Butterscotch Marble

Eh...gingersnap and Dulce de Leche. Not so great.

But the best combo ever is Peach and Mexican Chocolate! You can only get it during the summertime when they have peach! Blast!

Overall, Mitchell's will always be a favorite in my book! Doesn't hurt that my sweet angel lover baby lives right around the corner either!
author: Audrey K.

description:
The place is almost always a zoo, but they've got the best ice cream in the city (and possibly beyond), hands down.
Favorite flavors:
Grasshopper Pie
Peanut Butter Indulgence
Mexican Chocolate
author: James P.

description:
Last stop on the weekend crusade in search of the best creative ice cream spots that SF has to offer (was at Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocomb earlier). Having been sold on the wondrous glory that is Bi-Rite and being overwhelmingly unimpressed by Humphrey Slocomb, I walked into Mitchell's a little weary and hesitant. Would it betray my loyalty for Bi-Rite or would it be a bigger disappointment than Humprhey? My emotions are not to be toyed with, especially when ice-cream is at play.

Had a sample of the coffee ice cream. Oh, yum. Tried the Mexican chocolate as well. Things were looking good. The peanut butter indulgence was quite impressive. Finally settle on the chocolate caramel crackle and...all of a sudden, there was peace on earth again. The stars were aligned and the angels were once again playing show tunes on harps (haha). The flavor was intense, but not overwhelming and not too sweet (like Humphrey Slocomb). The texture was definitely creamier than Bi-Rite (I didn't think it was possible). The offerings weren't as creative as Bi-Rite, but overall, Mitchell's has gained another fan.
author: Blenda L.

description: OMG! Delicious! A Must when in the area, try the Chocolate caramel crackle... so awesome and creamy!
author: Marie D.

description:
The last two times I was at Mitchell's with G, eating ice cream, sharing stories, reflecting, people watching.... I felt like I had this crazy body high.  The intense, ekchotik, and joyful flavors that Mitchell's offer--especially my tropical Pilipino plabor persuashen....ube....macapuno... buko.... mangga.... halo halo..... in addition to their seasonal offerings like avocado, cantaloupe, and lucuma fruits.... just fills my heart with so mats happiness.  I can't believe how good food and great friends can just make you feel so.... talagang... WOW!

I was straight up feeling euphoric today.  It was a gorgeous day, G and I just finished delicious lunch at the Ferry Building devouring delectables from 4505 Meats, and finished walking up and down the hills of Union Square.  We worked up our appetites for dessert! Mitchell's was just the perfect spot to go to.... we had 2 hours to kill before my connection bus leaves from Embarcadero.  We drive to Mitchell's... we get our samples.... The DUDE behind the counter.... you know who you are.... you served us.... #48... was mad chill.  He let me taste 4 flavors and I ended up getting a double junior (two junior scoops for $3.50) of the cantaloupe and the lucuma ice cream flavors.  Both were very creamy and delicious.  The cantaloupe had bits of fruit in it.  I've never had lucuma before--it had very mats of a maply-caramel flavor.  Just like how home-made cookies made you feel, I got super giggly and happy just enjoying all the flavors of my ice cream choices.  

I told G that the last time I was at Mitchell's was with him, during my spring break this year.  I vividly remember getting a few flavors from the store, going back to my rental car in the parking lot out in the back, and popping some of his newly rented gay p0rn DVDs in my laptop.  We just watched a few scenes, critiquing stuff, in broad daylight, enjoying Mitchell's ice cream.  It was one of those San Francisco moments that I will cherish forever.  

I like the friendlier atmosphere of the newly remodeled Mitchell's, but I do miss the charm of their old bullet-proof partitions and high counters.

=8)
author: Grace M.

description:
Damn you, Mitchell's. Damn you for making my favorite damn ice cream ever (Mexican chocolate) and damn me for moving out of San Francisco and into the damn desert where I've been scorched all summer without any slip to pull out of the little number machine and wait in line on a breezy outer Mission sidewalk along with three dozen other people. 

Damn! Damn! Damn!

I'm coming home to visit for the first time in 9 months in 2 weeks. And you know my ass is going to barge in and eat a half-gallon of Mexican chocolate in 5 minutes. And you'll be ok with that. Because we have that kind of relationship.
author: Mr K.

description:
Macapuno and lychee ice cream, mmmmmmmmmm!

Some flavors are seasonal, no mmmmm!
author: Aaron I.

description:
"ICE CREAM YOU SCREAM WE ALL SCREAM FOR ICE CREAM!".....

Yahhhhhhhhhhh....

THIS IS MY FAVORITE ICE CREAM SHOP IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD. Wow strong statement  I know but it is so true. The flavors they have and the amazing taste can't compare. I'll admit I haven't tried everything there. I think most people find their favorite and are instant addicts. 

I remember coming here ever since I was a young girl with my family just to pick up a gallon of ice cream for a Sunday afternoon treat or gallons of ice cream for family parties. My favorite thing about this place that is has alot of non traditional ice cream shop flavors....I'd actually consider them kind of exotic (but they are listed under tropical)....ehhh I guess the same thing. My favorite flavors are Macapuno (young coconut), Buco (coconut), and Ube (the purple ice cream in many of the pics shown). Many other of my family's favorites are the Mango and Avacado.

Once you find the flavor/flavors you like, I'd suggest to go for the GALLONS since it is more cost effective and you get to enjoy their yummy ice cream alot more times. Man....A gallon of ice cream can last months. ALRIGHT!!!

This place is always packed, even when it's not even sunny or hot in Frisco. For all those that don't want to deal with the crowds...they have some Mitchell's Ice Cream flavors at Asian Groceries such as Ranch 99. So if I can't make it all the way down here, I'm glad I have an alternative.
author: Cathy D.

description:
If you want to give a birthday girl a real treat- get a Mitchell's ice cream cake. It will leave you saying "bask in who??"
Try the coconut flavor: OMG
Good report cards? Take the kid to Mitchells!
 Cavity free check up? Mitchells.
Pregnant?
Mitchells again and again. By the number of pregnant women you find there, one would think they had the cure for morning sickness.
Actually if you need help with coming up for a reason to go to Mitchells, let me know. I seem to come up with new ones all the time :P
author: Melissa B.

description: 3.5 stars. There was surprisingly not a long line on the Saturday I visited here with my brother.  They have a variety of unique flavors, and they let you sample the flavors.  We tried the avocado, ube, halo halo and tropical.  Each of them tasted unique, although I didn't like the avocado that much. The favorite was halo halo.   If I could split it down, it would be 4 stars for the unique and creative flavors they have, and 3 stars for the actual taste and MMMMMM factor.  Overall, I think I was more WOWed when I had Humphrey Slucombe.
author: Tiff K.

description: The Mitchell's ice cream cake that I ordered for our party came with sheets of plastic imbedded within the layers. Our guests were eating and choking on plastic. Mitchell's customer service was extremely dismissive about this.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream brings back so many fond memories.  When I was about 7 years old, I used to live across the street and so I would roller skate to Mitchell's and eat their Ube (purple yam) ice cream.  Then I would roller skate in their small parking lot until my ice cream was all gone.  

And what a small world!!!!! I found out that my husband used to be a manager at Mitchell's when he was 16 years old!!!  Too bad we hadn't met earlier! =0)
author: Gina S.

description:
I stepped out of my neighborhood for some ice cream. It was a long way for some halo halo.  

Me:  One scoop of halo halo ice cream on a sugar cone.
Worker:  We don't have halo halo right now.
Me:  Oh. (I looked at my bf hoping he could tell me what I should get.  I randomly picked one since the worker was waiting).  
Me:  I'll have the banana nut on a sugar cone.

I walked out in disappointment.  I looked at my banana nut ice cream.    

Me: What the hell?!  The ice cream is not even a yellow color.  It looks like vanilla bean ice cream. 

I took one bite and for the love of god, it was the best banana ice cream I've ever eaten.  

I will be back!!!!
author: hello k.

description:
After some Good Frikin Chicken, we wandered over to Mitchell's. We were really stuffed but we figured we'll just "take a look!" But somehow, we ended getting a number each and waited in line! WTF, we were suppoed to be full and the walk over there was exercise. DAMN it....
We waited quite a while at 9pm on a week night and it wasn't even that warm of a night! 
This place was bustling and everyone squeeled when their number were called! 
I sampled the banana nut and the black walnut, it was a tough choice and since I was only allowed a scoop, I settled for the banana nut. It was creamy, nutty and just pure delicious! Great to cap off the evening after a yummy chicken dinner.
author: Yan M.

description:
Love to stop by here after an SF Giants game to satisfy the sweet tooth.

This place isn't fancy but the flavors are unique and very homemade tasting.  There is usually a long line outside of families, kids, cute tattooed couples with their dogs and a sprinkling of elderly folks.  It's a diverse crowd that comes here and it seems to harken back to another time which adds to the charm.

I feel like it is a place I could have taken my late grandmother to, with her scrappy little dog in tow, and that she would have absolutely loved it.  It has an old, classic feeling about it.

Favorite flavors:

Peach
Baby Coconut
White Pistachio
Avocado - sounds disgusting but it's quite yummy

This place just puts a smile on my face!
author: Roxanne B.

description:
Grab a ticket and line up for delightful treats at this San Francisco trademark ice cream parlor. From your traditional flavors to the season favorites, this place will take your taste buds on a wild ride of delicious-ness. As a first timer I was skeptical of the rumors I'd heard, but upon entering I realized that this place was no myth. Pacing up and down the row of flavors I found myself salivating over flavors like Mexican chocolate, grasshopper pie (mint chocolate chip, fudge, and oreo cookies), white pistachio, pumpkin, and avocado? Intriguing flavors that beg you to sample them. You can have it in a sundae, a banana split, milkshake, in a chocolate waffle cone, or just a plain and simple scoop. 
They also offer cookie sandwiches, with freshly made cookies, tailored with your favorite flavor of ice-cream. In addition, you can get a hand packed 1/2 pint, pint, 1/2 gallon or more to take home with you. I'm definitely getting my next birthday ice-cream cake from here! 
This place does get packed with sweet treat lovers, but well worth your patience. If you haven't checked this place out, it is a must try! I guarantee it'll be some of the best ice-cream you've ever tasted.
author: Valerie C.

description:
Heaven in frozen form. My favorites:

- Thai Tea: Imagine frozen Thai iced tea. Yeah, it's that good.

- Peach: Close your eyes, and you'll think you're eating fresh peaches and butter. Seriously. (Note: may only be available in summer.)

- Chocolate Caramel Crackle: chocolate ice cream with crushed Nestle Crunch bars and a real caramel swirl (not the flavored-sugar-posing-as-caramel swirl so common in commercial ice cream). Chocolate ice creams usually disappoint me; this one dazzles.

- Avocado: (Words would sound like bliss-induced, senseless babbling, so I won't bother.)

I don't understand people who don't like Mitchell's. Maybe they've had isolated bad experiences? Or maybe they're just not of this earth.

P.S. The line sometimes IS ridiculously long. But who cares? Stop your bitching and eat some ice cream, damn it.
author: The Other Jeff A.

description:
some of the best ice cream in the city. 

they've always got a flavor for my mood.  some of the flavors are your basic no frills down to business flavors (perfect for the little ones) and some take you to an island far, far away.

the menu includes milk shakes, sundaes, chocolate dipped banana, ice cream cookies and they even make halo halo (traditional filipino desert). basically, if it's make with ice cream, they serve it! 

the lines can get crazy (even on cold rainy days) but it's worth the wait. 

the service is always fast and friendly and they let you try every flavor.

some  of my fav flavors:
tropical four (banana, guava, pineapple and mango)
butterscotch marble
mexican chocolate (hint of cinnamon)
chocolate caramel crackle
thin mints
mango
ube
author: Lola L.

description:
Simply the BEST ice cream in the Bay Area and 2nd best, IMHO, that I've tried in the country  ( sorry guys but Cones in NYC is better ).

New York Cherry  ( with bit half-cherry pieces )  and  Buko  ( with definite coconut shavings )  are my all-time favorites but also try  ( you get 3 tastes for each trip there if you wish )  all of what they offer and make your own determinations.

If you are in a rush and are heading home shortly there-after, bypass the long lines and simply get a half-gallon  ( or 2 )  out of their in-store freezers and just pay them right away without having to  " take a number "  ( may save you 20-30 minutes ).
author: Mike J.

description: Even though it was raining awhile ago and it is freezing during the night time, I would still come here for their delicious ice cream. Their different flavors and how delicious they are just make me want to eat more and more. The avocado flavor is my favorite here. (:
author: Claudia M.

description:
update. 

i love the new facelift of the place. very clean and more friendlier. gosh, one thing i love about SF are my weekends to myself and enjoying mango icecream from mitchell's (rain, shine, or as of late bayarea monsoon weather). it just puts a smile on my face.
author: Jane A.

description: How can you say no to 15 different flavors of ice cream? They can even dip it for u just like a drumstick. It can get really messy, so I always ask for a cup and a spoon. YUM! Hot day? Mitchell's! Cold day? Mitchell's! The line is usually pretty quick and you can buy a pint to go. :D
author: Wendy L.

description:
Yay Mitchell's!

1. open late
2. exotic Filipino flavors...gotta bring my parents here
3. the woman who helped us was very friendly and patient and accomodating
4. I didn't feel bad about getting sorbet instead of ice cream...I thought I would be wasting my trip by not getting actual ice cream, but the peach-lavendar sorbet was nicely exotic, and tasted wonderful.
author: Kerrie L.

description:
Earlier this morning, I donated some old clothes to the Salvation Army.  As I was pulling out of their parking lot on 26th St and San Jose Ave, I thought about Mitchell's, which was just around the corner.  "I haven't been there in a while . . . I should check it out."  And later today, I did!

After our dinner at Bangkok 900 (http://www.yelp.com/biz/bangkok-900-san-francisco#hrid:v7oBTuNhoO1a9BXzOsGGlQ), we decided to drive to Mitchell's.  Our number was 38, and they were serving number 97.  Only 41 more to go.

My Fremont friend was skeptical.  "It'd better be as good as you say it is," he said.  After all, waiting in line for 30 minutes in the middle of a residential neighborhood is not as exciting as you might think.  We talked, texted our friends and talked some more.  Finally, our number was up.  "Thirty Eight!" yelled the clerk.  "That's us!" I said enthusiastically.

I had a waffle bowl with 2 scoops of ice cream and almonds.  I opted for 1 scoop of Strawberries 'n' Cream and 1 scoop of Cantaloupe, flavor of the month.  My friend devoured a pint--yes, a pint!--of Oreo Cookie and Mint Chocolate Chip ice cream

O...M...G!  With YoCup this and SoGreen that, I almost forgot what real ice cream is supposed to taste like.  It was unbelievable, like the ice cream I had as a kid.  Mitchell's is still the best ice cream for my money.  It made me forget the long wait, the absence of tables or chairs and the saturated fat content.  My ice cream tasted creamy and light, and my waffle bowl was crunchy and sugary.

The lines outside are atrocious, the store is a monument to inefficiency, the parking lot is small and always full, and the amenities are non-existent.  Still, people come from all over the City for some Mitchell's.  There's got to be something to it.  

If ice cream helped people lose weight, I'd come here every day.  I hear ice cream isn't good for my diet, so I won't be back as soon as I would want to.  That's what I call "willpower."
author: Yan G.

description:
I should give Mitchell's five stars, but I'm bitter that is has a better rating than Polly Ann's, which is slightly superior, so I'm dinging Mitchell's a star.

OK, I'm actually dinging them a star because of the price of their half gallons of ice cream.  I can understand paying through the nose when you're getting a cone--it's an event--but when you're eating the ice cream at home?  Come on now.

It's really fun to go all the way across town just for Mitchell's.  It's worth the long 24-Divisadero or J-Church ride (the J-Church being an otherwise useless streetcar line).

Make sure you grab a ticket right when you arrive.  Don't worry about the crowd of people waiting inside.  (What are they doing there anyway?)  Grab a ticket and wait for one of the employees to call your number in the most laid back, trying-too-hard-to-be-cool voice.  I think they actually base who calls out the numbers on their style.
