You'll hear the overeager call-out every once in a while, but this person, usually a girl, will quickly be replaced by a breathier, more experienced coworker.  Maybe it's how these guys practice to talk on the phone to the girls they have crushes on?

Anyway, the ice cream is really delicious, and there's a certain community spirit in waiting outside with a bunch of other people for ice cream even though it's really too cold to wait outside for ice cream.
author: John S.

description:
Filipino-owned and operated, a neighbourhood fave with those long lines on warm nights.

As a US-born Pinay I have ill memories of some badly manufactured Filipino ice-cream.  Now, you can buy Magnolia filipino ice cream in most specialty shops, but you must definitely patron your local Flips at Mitchell's.

Not just Filipino flavours-- Macapuno and Ube rock-- but tasty Americaine flavours, too.  Seasonal PEACH is amazing, really very tasty peach with peach pieces, and the MANGO, is essentially orgasmic.

My one criticism is the Halo-halo, a very traditional shaved ice concoction mixed with syrup and sweet red beans, jellies, young coconut balls, etc, topped with a scoop of your favourite ice cream.  But, the ratio of shaved ice chips to tasty ingredients is too low.  It needs more creaminess, less water (the ice melts and dilultes everything in a bad way). 

Overall, Mitchell's is worth trekking to San Jo Ave and buying several pints at once (they pack a pint ABOVE the rim with special oversized lids to accommodate their generosity and the prices are very reasonable unlike the gelato robber barons!).  Definitely get in line for the Peach, venture into the Ube, and I cannot wait to try the Eggnog this winter!  I never had a bad scoop at Mitchell's and I probably never will...
author: E L.

description: the biggest problem i have with this place: too many flavors to choose from!!! i always tell myself to try a new flavor, but being the boring self that i am, i always opt to go for the grasshopper pie. mMmm mMmm. i want to get the ube with it, but unfortunately, i dont like mixing my ice creams together.
author: Tina S.

description:
I finally tried Mitchell's after 4+ years of living in SF.  They have a good variety of flavors including some hard-to-find flavors like buko and ube, and the ice cream has a nice creamy texture.  While I have no complaints about the quality of the ice-cream, I have to unfortunately give Mitchell's only 3 stars for the following reasons:

Minus 0.8 stars for the long wait (30+ minutes)
Minus 0.4 stars for not having any seating.
Minus 0.3 stars for the lack of cleanliness
Minus 0.3 stars for not having a well-organized menu with pictures
Minus 0.2 stars for being a tad pricey (over $5 for two scoops in a waffle cone)
author: Dinesh M.

description:
Not that I need to write anything more about this place, TODAY was my first time, after hearing so many great things about Mitchells Mitchells Mitchells!!!

What I tried on this very very hot San Francisco Day:
Ube
Avocado
Young Coconut
halo halo
strawberry cream
and something peanut butter

My fave from those was the Ube, then coconut, then avocado!

I would DEF come back.

I had to minus a star because of the wait!!!!!!!!! :[  "that was sooooo the sat man".

Good thing they had a take a number system, so when you finally get there you try to get your waiting time's worth to buy more ice cream! I bought a tub to take home!!

Its not such a bad wait when youre with friends :D
author: kim w.

description: i think i was mesmerized by this place because of the variety of ice cream choices! there were so many but i only fit one kind of ice cream... ube! i ordered an ube milkshake for really cheap (considering that most of san francisco restaurants have inflated prices)! if you're visiting san fran then you HAVE to go there and try the ice cream you normally dont have in your area (socal) :D
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Do you like ice cream? Yes? So do 50 other people: grab a ticket and get in line. If possible don't line stand around in the store because it's small inside and people need to get in and out to keep things efficient.

Ice cream is one of those treats that you shouldn't be in a rush for. Wait for it. Let the anticipation build. Have patience and you will be richly rewarded with ice cream goodness.

If you don't have to wait for Mitchell's you're missing half the experience.
author: Jeff L.

description:
I would actually give this place 2.5 stars.
I was really forward to trying Mitchell's ice cream but I was really not satisfied with my choice of ice cream (toasted almond). I came here with my bf and waited for about 15 minutes. To all the first timers, please take a number!! You won't be able to order unless you get a number near the door to your left. Anyways, once I got my ice cream, I immediately had to  get a taste of the toasted almond flavor.  To my surprise, it sucked!  I thought I had vanilla for a second because the almond flavor wasn't really there unless you eat a couple of the almond bits. Then, I couldn't  wait to eat my sugar cone and then there it was again, another disappointment. My sugar cone doesn't taste like sugar cone at all. It tasted like a watered down crispy cone. My bf had the mocha fudge and he didn't like it either. We are both ice cream lovers but we have to give it up for Swensen's ice cream because we both love that place to death! The best toasted almond and mocha fudge ice cream in the city.
author: Irene L.

description:
My girlfriend likes to come to this ice-cream store, so yesterday, we stopped to get ice-cream, but the parking was full, and there was a big line going out the store. 

Honestly the ice-cream is good, but not the greatest. But I guess I am not a good ice-cream taster, or I just don't like waiting on line, or having not a place to park!! 

They have many ice-cream flavors, and they also sell ice-cream by the gallon. I think is their selection that attract people to this store, most of which are tropical flavors. Ice-cream by itself doesn't catch my appetite, unless I could have it with something else, something warm to go together with the ice-cream.
author: Branny J.

description:
Hands down, the best ice cream I've ever had in the Bay Area, if not ever!

They've got all the classic Filipino ice cream flavors (Ube, Mango, Macapuno, etc.), except they Americanized them in the best possible way (16% butterfat!).  The result is wonderful tropical flavors in the richest, creamiest ice cream you could possibly have.  As much as I like the tropical stuff, my all-time favorite is still their Coffee ice cream...the flavor reminds me of Magnolia "Super Mocha" ice cream from the Philippines, but the consistency is much much better (again, probably due to that 16% butterfat thing).  Even better is their "Irish Coffee" flavor which they only have around St. Patrick's day.

If you have trouble with the lines/parking at the store, they sometimes sell the half-gallons at many asian grocery stores in the SF/Daly City area (such as Pacific Super in Alemany).  Now that I live in the East Bay, I hardly get it anymore, but I try to whenever I'm in the area.  I even once brought a cooler the last time I was in SF so I can take home some yummy Mitchell's ice cream!
author: Arlene M.

description:
Updated 7/16/07
3 Stars
After having super premium ice cream like Straus brand and Bi-Rite Creamery, this place just doesn't hold up.... You can taste the gums and fillers they put in the ice cream that cause the flavors to see rather artificial. They have a nice selection of flavors and are much more affordable, but I'd rather save those calories for something ultra premium. 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
4 Stars
So yummie. I went on a raining gloomy day and there was a line out the door! That's when you know an ice cream shop is that good. Definately check out the Lucuma (sp?), a peruvian fruit. 

I wish they would venture into some more innovative flavors, but I know not everyone is as experimental as I am.
author: Karen C.

description:
Last night at about 8:30pm, I got a hair up my ass and decided that we needed to go for ice cream.  It seemed like a perfectly reasonable thing to do on a July evening.  I got so excited that I put on a Very Cute Dress (TM) and even lipstick!

I posted to my Tribe blog that my friends should meet us at Mitchell's at 9pm.  Then, my boyfriend and I got in the car.

We are not a "fighty" couple.  We seriously almost never fight.  On the way over there, we fought.  I still cannot clearly tell you what the hell we were fighting about.  Don't you hate that?  By the time we got to Mitchell's, I was mad and couldn't find a parking spot so I very bitchily turned the car around and went home.  (It's only like a mile away.)

We went back in the house, slammed some cupboard doors, and gave eachother the cold shoulder for like five minutes.  Then we realized that we were being sorta stupid and started making-out, instead.

That's when my phone rang.  Our best friends, Juicy and Steve23, wanted to know if we were still at Mitchell's and if they could meet us there.  Oh yeah, I blogged it!

I reapplied my lipstick, which was now all over my boyfriend, and back to Mitchell's we went.  This time, I found parking right in front.  The place was a complete zoo, though.  We took #007 from the number dispenser thingy and they were serving #080.

When our friends finally showed up, all they could talk about was their new iPhones.  I love them dearly but nothing is more obnoxious than bragging to me about gadgets that I don't have, yet.  I feigned complete disinterest and talked instead about gadgets that *they* didn't have, yet.  Hahaha!!

We finally got our ice cream and I immediately dripped some all down the front of Juicy and then more all over my Very Cute Dress(TM).  Serves me right!  Then, it started to rain.

Oh yeah, the ice cream was not nearly as interesting as this story.
author: Amy A.

description:
This is probably the best ice cream place in San Francisco. 

My favorite flavor is the thai ice tea. It tastes just like it. They have tons of selection and many fruity flavors as well.

For good ice cream, one should be able to discern a very succinct flavor- can't be overtly sugar nor could it be totally bland. At Mitchell's, I get that. It's not the type of ice cream I can buy at the store. There is something very fresh, very intoxicating yet addicting about it. 

Last time I went, there was a huge line (not surprised) and I had to pull a number and wait for it. It's like a cue service for ice cream- standing room only alas.
author: Tina C.

description:
You could find fault with this place, but you'd have to look pretty carefully.  I like the fact that you basically go in and order ice cream and leave when you get it.  It keeps the crowd down quite a bit.

Very busy on a warm day.
author: Lester W.

description:
My parents took me here when I was a kid. I loved their Thai Tea ice cream. Got it every single time. I came here over the summer. Parking was relatively easy. There's a small lot, so don't expect to be able to park there during the busy hours (I went near closing, and it was busy). The store is relatively clean, you grab a ticket number and wait.

I loved the Thai Tea. In fact, I go home to find a half gallon my brother bought earlier. I never got to eat any now that I think about it.

The LAST time I went, I found out they discontinued Thai Tea ice cream. What the hell. Since then, I've been to Polly Ann's. I might be back to try new flavors if I'm too lazy to go too far.

Mitchell's isn't a bad place, they just took away the flavor I loved. I cannot find it anywhere else now. The blame has to be put somewhere.
author: Glen H.

description: I'm a Bi-rite, and overall ice cream fan, so I heard about Mitchell's. Perhaps I've tried a lot of ice cream in the area, because I really wasn't impressed with Mitchell's. It definitely does the trick if you need ice cream, but I was expecting flavors I had never seen before and the taste and texture to be delicious. I've actually many of these flavors at John's Dollar Scoop in Berkeley (Ube, Avocado, Mocha flavors), and they tasted similar. I guess it's good to know that Mitchell's is here for if I really want ice cream and I'm in the area, but I'll be sticking to Bi-rite for my SF ice cream cravings.
author: Grace S.

description:
Ok, so here is a SF ice cream place worth writing about (unlike Swenson's in Russian Hill). 

They have delicious ice cream in many flavors that cover both the standards and unique, fun flavors. (Try the new one that is vanilla bean with swirls of passionfruit and mango sorbet, it is AMAZING!)

The prices are reasonable, and the staff is personable and accommadating (tried a couple of flavors before making a decision). 

Do yourself a flavor and head to Mitchell's!
author: Meghan D.

description: My MO for most ice cream shops is a hand-packed pint with two flavors.  Mitchell's has so many good rich, creamy, complementary flavors that I had a hard time choosing.  After a bunch of suggestions and tastings I finally pulled the trigger and my only regret is that I didn't get a quart.
author: Job E.

description:
Seriously. I had to stop eating here for a while.

Too much of a good thing ain't good, afterall.

I'm only going to comment our three favorites (for now): Mexican Chocolate, Strawberries and Cream, and Bhuko (baby coconut).

Seriously great flavors that taste great together or just by themselves. Always wished that they left the coconut meat out of the bhuko -- texture isn't right for me.

Also, they do Shakes/Malts. My recommendation is the Black & White -- Vanilla Ice Cream, Chocolate Syrup -- add Malt! This is what did me in.

I will be back. They'll have to share my mouth with By-Rite Creamery, but I will be back -- and you should too!
author: Ryan F.

description:
I absolutely love this place. Just visited after the recent remodel, and although I nostalgically miss the old timeless décor, the place does look great enough to last for the next 30 years. One of my favorite tricks has been to leave Front Porch 15 minutes before asking for the check to grab my ticket at Mitchell's which can cut the wait time by a significant amount. It's amazing, rain or shine, this place is always packed, although the patrons are mostly locals who are used to it and do so with a smile. Another way to cut the wait line is to jump straight to the pre-packed line. 
The light but creamy flavor of their coconut ice cream is something you must try if you haven't already.
When I have more time, since they have so many different flavors, you can order take away sizes in pints versus half gallons to save freezer space (and calories). I've also served their ice cream cake at a few of my birthday parties and it's been a big hit each and every time.
author: Mark Y.

description: I've only been here once and I know a lot of people love it.. but I got the Thai Tea ice cream here and it was disgusting.  It tasted like alcohol, and it was pretty strong.  I eventually traded my thai tea for my boyfriend's ube, which wasn't bad.  He also agreed with me about the alcohol taste.. but I will definitely give this place another try.
author: Vivian H.

description: A traditional joint with creamy ice cream in many flavor choices - including various tropical fruit.  Can't compare to Bi-Rite since they are playing in 2 different arenas.  There is a tiny parking lot & usually a wait (be sure to take a #).  A nostalgic treat.
author: Kim S.

description:
I love ice cream. Like seriously. I love it. 

Mitchell's gets 4 stars for being so tasty and having the awesomest seasonal flavors. Yay pumpkin, egg nog, peppermint chip. hmmm. I just realized that I love winter seasonal flavors better than summer ones. But I eat more ice cream in the summer. hmmm.. what to do, what to do. 

They lost one star because I'm loving the new craze of making your own ice cream flavor. I love having complete control of my ice cream. If they made the flavors I wanted without needing to add stuff, I would be happier. Like coffee with heath bars/toffee, caramel, brownies, hot fudge. 

I also love their waffle cones. Dipped in chocolate. Plus they shove ice cream all the way down the cone. Fantastic!
author: Ali R.

description:
It's a place for dating, a place for family with kids, a place for friends' gathering.....

My hubby took me to Mitchell's when we were dating and he told me that it's the best ice-cream in SF.  I wondered.  But, when I arrived acorss the street and saw the crowd outside, I thought that there must be something magical.  Then, I found out that there's a ticket machine right at the entrance and customer will be called to the counter for ordering.  Is it rare?  Yes but it's necessary because Mitchell's just has too many fans.  I felt dizzy to read the menu sticked on the wall.  How can these substances be used to make ice cream?????  There're so many different choices that I wanted to try to see how it turns out to be.  Of course, I could stuck only a little into my stomach after a filling dinner.

Another surprising thing is that it's really close by my previous workplace.  After my hubby took me to Mitchell's, I told my co-workers and they just shot to the place during lunch time on the same day.  And, they kept going back later on.  When we're in a good mood, we went there.  When we really needed a break, we went there.  Then, one day when we were layoff at the same time, we went there for a treat to ourselves.  Now, we all work in different companies and none of our offices is close by.  But, we still go back sometimes after our dinner gathering and still find that exciting and fun to just read the menu but cannot make up our minds what to order.

P.S. You can order ice-cream cake for birthday party there and my friends love it.  They keep going back.  When my friend comes to SF to visit me from other cities, I would bring him or her there.
author: Roserrele W.

description:
I adore Mitchell's.  I adore all the fruit flavors and have tried each and every one of them.  I adore all the different chocolates, with Mexican being my favorite.  The baby coconut is soooooo good, and almost illegal if you put fudge syrup on it.   They have great ice cream cakes and pies - wonderful for birthdays.

I just can't figure out the corn and cheese ice cream though.
author: .Hon H.

description:
Stopped in a weekday early evening and it was already bumping.  When entering, don't forget to look to the left and grab a number.

Though we read about the delicious non standard flavors, the set up confused us, we got order anxiety, and went with our standard favorites. Mocha fudge for wife and mango for me. Nice and creamy, but not the holy sh!t I need to run back tomorrow for some more feeling.  That said, we are committed to go back, step out of our shells, and try some of the more interesting flavors.
author: Paige D.

description:
im spoiled, so much delicious ice cream in SF

but I don't think any other place beats Mitchell's selection, its ridonkulos. and for an ice cream lover like me its hard to decide on just one flavor ( ok maybe two) .. ive never been here without a swarming crowd so be quick and snag a number! you'll have just enough time to ponder over the menu.. and you'll need it

ps. they have a $9 debit card minimum!
author: isabelle g.

description:
I grew up on this stuff because my dad bought ice cream here since they had the filipino flavors: ube, macapuno, buko, langka, halo halo. And it's fresh and creamy. For a while, that's all I ordered but recently I have branched out into other flavors such as cantaloupe, peach, and this peruvian thing I can't remember at the moment.

Long lines when it's sunny and long lines when it's foggy. :) I try to bring out of town guests here when I can since you can't get it anywhere else (or at least outside of Asia or Latin America).
author: Glenn G.

description:
OK, I can make it to Mitchell's in 100 steps from my house if a take big strides, but you get the picture: that shit is close and I have no control. When I first moved to SF, a friend had Thanksgiving at her house and served pumpkin ice cream for dessert. I thought "what the hell," but then, after one bite I understood. She knew something that was only known to locals--Mitchell's rocks.

Now I live oh so close and indulge when I want. my only advise: when the lines are long go score 1/2 gallon--the pre-packed line is way shorter and you have left overs.
author: Deborah S.

description:
So much of San Francisco feels nostalgic to me now that I no longer live there, but I know my love for Mitchell's Ice Cream isn't clouded by my homesickness. I grew up eating ice cream from this place because it's literally down the hill from my house.

The ice cream from Mitchell's is creamy, but not overly sweet. The flavors can be as simple as chocolate or as exotic as avocado, my personal favorite being mango. 

If you plan on visiting Mitchell's on a hot day, be prepared to wait in line. The shop is small and there isn't much standing room. The fastest way to have your ice cream and eat it too is to pick up a half gallon of your favorite flavor and check out in the express line.

Keep in mind how to get to this little neighborhood shop because you'll definitely be back to try all the different flavors.
author: Jon T.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream is my crack.  

I always wondered why there was a line outside of the joint, because DQ or Baskin Robbins never gets that kind of play.  Sooner or later, I had my ice cream epiphany upon tasting their bittersweet Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream. Um... yeah... it's basically pure sex in a cone.  Or Cup.  Or what the heck, just get a sundae.  

I took away a star, because, well, there's a line outside, and they make me wait.  :)
author: Maulie D.

description:
Long wait but definitely worth it!!

Twice I've gone on a Sat night, and both times it was super packed.  Wait would be at least over 30 min, but once they call your number, and you get to try some samples, you tend to forget how long you've waited.

Last time I tried the cantelope, delicious!! this time I tried the pumpkin and WOW!!! was I suprised at how yummy it was!!! I LOVED it!! My fiance had the rocky road dipped in chocolate on a waffle cone...YUMMM!!! and their rum raisin......is to die for as well! I don't think there is a single flavor they have that we did not like.

They are pretty generous with their scoops...I usually order one scoop on a regular cone and it was huge!

Definitely a must try.
author: Jenny T.

description: I love ube, green tea, mango, lychee( too bad they don't serve lychee any more). To me, it's the best ice cream.
author: Helen Y.

description: I Loooove home made ice cream and Mitchell's has been amazing since I was a kid. Coffee is one of my favorite flavors and waffle cones are every bodies friend. If you love ice cream you need to stop by. And yes they do have ice cream to go in pints and gallons.
author: Kameelah R.

description:
Ube: you've eluded me all my life.  I finally met you after moving to SF and making friends with my fellow foodie.  I thank her silently every time I enjoy it's wonder.  

After living 5 minutes from here for two years and not even knowing it was there, I feel a little guilty I haven't been here.  I had a double scoop, one ube the other mango...in a cup.  I can't do cones, I get stressed keeping up with the drips.  Both great, and I can't wait to come back and try more flavors!
author: Mary H.

description: Mitchell's Ice Cream is as much nostalgia for me as it is just enjoying their ice cream.  Having grown up in San Francisco, I've been going there since I was a little kid.  My parents would take my sister and I there for nothing more than just to grab a few scoops and enjoy.  I know there are plenty of reviews stating the same sentiment as I am, but it's so true.  I've had Bi-Rite Creamery and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I've been to Humprey Slocombe and think they're doing an excellent job with their ice cream.  I've tried tons of other places, but there's just something about Mitchell's that keeps me coming back.  My all time fave has got to be a scoop of mango with a chocolate dip.  Awesome!
author: Jon C.

description:
What is there not to like about Mitchell's? This place has been a San Francisco landmark for years. It doesn't matter what time of the day or year you go, this place is always crackin. 

The hardest part about going to Mitchell's is deciding which flavor to try and snagging a parking spot.

I am guilty of visiting this place multiple times a week. It's that good!! I recommend trying the Chicago Cheesecake while you can. Vanilla ice cream with big chunks of cheesecake. Delicious goodness!
author: Kathleen N.

description:
French vanilla custard and banana two scoop sundae drizzled with Hot Fudge-EXTRA hot fudge with Whip Cream-EXTRA WHIP CREAM with nuts--UMM MORE NUTS PLEASE!  

Two spoons to share with my boyfriend?  HELL NO!  But thanks for paying honey...get your own buster!  Don't forget to pay for the gallon of mango  for our midnight snack....
author: Abby E.

description:
I came here on a scorching hot day for their ice cream and I have to say I enjoyed it quite a bit.

They have a wide assortment of flavors to choose from---the classics (chocolate, vanilla, strawberry) as well as some unique ones (ube--a sweetish purple yam, coconut, mango, durian, taro, etc.). Prices range from I think 3 and up. They also have milkshakes, cookies, quarts ($9) and sundaes.

I got their vanilla bean and ube. I thought it was really creamy and the flavor was missing a bit due to it's consistency being so thick but I enjoyed it none-the-less. 

The wait here is not that bad when I was there. 

FYI: When you enter, directly to your left is a ticket dispenser where you take a ticket and wait for them to call out your number to serve you. My buddy and I stood there a bit wondering wth was goin on with the numbers being yelled out.
author: Van D.

description:
Everyone knows Mitchell's has great ice cream.  Why else would there be 98 people in line ahead of me on a recent hot day? (grr @#$!)  
I just wanted to point out that they make an AMAZING ice cream cake.  I got the thin mint with chocolate cake for my husband's birthday and he said it was the best cake he's EVER had.
author: Sarah W.

description: The ice cream here is pretty good but the wait is way too long. The parking lot is always packed so good luck in finding parking.
author: C B.

description:
After all the rave reviews and driving by this place multiple times, I finally made the stop at this place and tried out their ice cream.

First of all ... they have their own small parking lot!!!

There are a LOT of flavors to choose from!  I wish they give a little more description for their exotic flavors so I wouldn't waste their time by asking about them all. 

Their ice cream's not bad, but I put it on par with Bryers  Not the worst, but far from being the best.  Their interesting flavors is what will bring me back, not the long lines.
author: Winnie C.

description: I had the ube purple yam and this coffee caramel chocolate ice cream.  Really smooth and creamy.  The staff is really friendly.  I must of tried 4-5 different flavors.  Mango was good too.
author: Matthew P.

description: Never heard of this place before tonite so obviously I was missing out! Definitely a reason for why there's a long line even when it's not hot outside. I came here around 10:30pm and I was #79 (they were only at #56) but luckily the service was relatively fast. While I was waiting for my number to be called, I befriended this lady who had been coming here ever since she was her daughter's age (probably around 6 years old). She recommended the mango flavor so I got a scoop of that and coffee (since I love coffee ice cream). Both were absolutely delicious! Both flavors are strong but not too intense. Two large scoops for $4.10 -- trust me, it's worth it!
author: Helen Y.

description:
100% worth the wait.

The ice cream is made every day from fresh ingredients.  While it isn't a Filipino owned store, they feature many Filipino, exotic fruit flavors and import their fruit from the Philippines.  They even have halo halo!

Their ice cream is enough to make me happy on the worst days.  They have a sign up for a full time ice cream maker position.  I'm tempted to apply for the job.  But, my bills wouldn't like the pay cut.  And my wardrobe would probably hate me due to my expanding waistline.  But could you imagine all the ice cream if you worked there???
author: Jasmine D.

description:
When fruit ice cream tastes like fresh, ripe fruit, and has chunks of fresh, ripe fruit IN IT...

Boy howdy, it's good.
author: diana s.

description:
I think I just consumed an 8,000 calorie ice cream sundae.

Holy shiznit this place is amazing. 

And it's open til 11pm every night?  Niiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiice.

So many amazing flavors.. 

GO HERE.
author: Derek B.

description: On a scale of 1-10, i'd give mitchell's an 8. Their selection is pretty good (the focus on tropical flavors, including avocado, is alright), though purple yam was the only flavor I hadn't yet come across in my ice cream adventures. Service was quick, though maybe not the most friendly or excited about their product (I love places where the staff love what they're selling). The churning is superb, the place very clean, the take-a-number feature is handy for the line. Also, I liked that I didn't have to pay for a double when I really just wanted to try two flavors but in a small amount. Though they wouldn't split a single, they did offer 2 junior scoops, which came to $4.30. Not too shabby. I'll definitely be back!
author: Susan M.

description:
Best. Ice. Cream. Ever. 
Try the langka - great on a hot day.
author: Anika K.

description:
There will be a line outside of this place when it reaches 32 degrees but by golly it sure is worth it.  
The Hallo Hallo ice cream is a great treat.
I never thought I'd cheat on chocolate or double chocolate but there are times, especially on our warmer nights in SF, where I'll find myself saying, hmm Hallo Hallo ice cream sounds good right about now and then its 20 blocks through the mission, a half hour long line and a very satisified me with hallo hallo all over my face.
author: Sean S.

description:
Once upon a time on a cold rainy san francisco day in 2005 my roommates and I were watching the food network when they aired a segment on Mitchells. After watching them describe the flavors we climbed into the car and set off for our ice cream adventure!

We tried all sorts of flavors and I ended up getting a gallon (yes gallon) of the mocha fudge. 

My old roomie chad got the most awkward mix (1 scoop peppermint 1 scoop guava)

I have returned several times, the workers are always friendly and they give out  free samples!
author: Amanda M.

description:
I love MITCHELL's!

Cheap ice cream that tastes GOOD. Ice cream was creamy & the portions were right. 

I'd definitely recommend this place, but I'll warn you now....you may have to wait a few minutes to get your ice cream since there's usually a long line outside - even in cold weather.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Two words: Creaminess & Deliciousness!!!! 

Forget Rice-a-roni! Mitchell's is totally the new San Francisco treat!

Mitchell's is like the neighborhood drug dealer and everyone and they mama come here for a hit.  Prices are cheap and ice cream is the best you will get in San Francisco. There was a crowd of mom's with their bratty kids so I thought I would have to wait, but the girl at the counter helped me right away and she was super friendly! 

You can drive by here around 10 at night and you will probably see this place packed.  There are no seats so basically you take a number and wait to be called. Beware...there are a lot of little bratty whiny kids running around waiting for their ice cream. 

Last time I went here I got a scoop of the Honeybee Ice Cream...it was such a treat. I even found parking in the back. I think I paid a total of $2.60. Totally worth it and now I feel like a pig. Mission accomplished!!!!
author: Cellina B.

description: I came here a few times, and it has been phenomenal each time. It's a pain to wait your turn, but when you're up, you get what you wait for ;) this ice cream is so amazing. My favorite is the coconut pineapple and the strawberries n cream....yummmm
author: Sheeva G.

description:
On a hot day, I do half gallons.  On cold days, its time for an ice cream sundae!!!  Mitchell's ice cream is the bomb!  When you start with quality ice cream and add toppings, you can't go wrong.

My favorite flavors are peanut butter chocolate, cookies and cream, chocolate, and coconut.
author: Peter S.

description:
Honestly, I cannot believe that there is anyone who doesn't like this place.  I've been going to Mitchell's since i was young (which I'm not really anymore) and it's ALWAYS been my favorite. 

I avoid it on hot days unless I plan on buying a pre-packed container because the lines are insane - always - but moreso on hot days.  Outside of its popularity, I have absolutely NO complaints.  

The ice cream is the right amount of creamy and sweet.  Yeah, it may melt a little fast, but that's why you get it in a cup and eat it fast.  :-)

I love their traditional flavors just as much as their tropical flavors.  Try them all.  BUT..   remember these three words - kahlua mocha cream.  They'll change your life.
author: erica c.

description: The last time I came here, I got their Langka (jackfruit) flavor and it was deeelicious. Ever since vitamin water introduced their jackfruit flavor, I've been in love with it, so when I saw that they had the jackfruit ice cream flavor, I got really excited!! :) you've got to try it!
author: Rosie W.

description:
I had the doubble scoop ice scream sunday it was soooo goooood. i've been to Ghiradeli's thinking it was it! well.... their high pricess and so so taste really doesn't compare to Mitchell's. i cant wait to visit mario so i can go for more!
:)
author: Erika A.

description: More like 4.5 stars.  Really great selection of flavors, probably the creamiest ice cream I ever had.  Really, really good.
author: Organix F.

description: Let's say we came right on time before the flood of people started coming in. Ice cream was to die for. Ube all the way and halo-halo. Service was quick and friendly. Downside was parking we just got lucky an old couple left the sweet parking spot at front.
author: Diane D.

description:
Not that I really NEED to ad another review talking about how great this place is. 
But I wanted to highlight a tropical treat, Halo-Halo. I love the sweet beans, coconut jelly cubes, shaved ice and sweetened condensed milk all under a generous scoop of purple yam ice cream. If you like tapioca jelly drinks you may like this dessert.
author: Helen J.

description:
Honestly, I've been coming here since the tender age of three (from what I remember) and its been the same shop at the same place... Old faithful.  

Their ice cream is honestly second to none.  It's always freshly made and it just always seems to taste good, no matter what you order.  There's a reason for the ridiculous lines, even on a randomly cold Friday night.  

I usually get flavors based on my mood, but the stand outs are definately their Ube and their Avocado.  The strawberry ice cream is ridiculous as well, as is their chocolate w/ peanut butter, mexican chocolate, etc. etc.  All I know is if you can't get any after taking a girl here for ice cream, you can't get none anywhere.
author: Ray P.

description: My favorite is peach but seasonal and it wasn't out last week. I will try again next week. Second best is mango...
author: Chuck J.

description: A great little widely renown ice cream parlor.  This place gets packed even during the evening and late night hours regardless if the ambient temperature is teeth chattering 45 degrees Fahrenheit on a San Francisco night in Spring.  My favorite so far is the grasshopper pie - mint chocolate chip mixed with fudge and oreo cookies.  Their ube and coffee ice cream (on par with Hagen Dazs) are also very good as well.  Since this ice cream parlor has a ton of interesting flavors to choose from, I know I'll be back plenty more times.
author: Erich D.

description: Don't let the line deter you, this ice cream is amazing! Go for the yummy classic flavors (grasshopper pie), return for the exotic island flavors (baby coconut, yam, avocado). Their ice cream sandwiches are also unbelievable, the cookies are fresh made too.
author: Shannon B.

description:
It took me a while to discover Mitchell's.  The Kahlua Mocha Cream --- damn!  Are all the flavors this creamy, or is it because this one has "cream" in the name?  No, don't answer...I think it best if I undertake some additional research myself.

A single scoop on a waffle cone is a relative bargain --- and is more than enough ice cream.
author: DD B.

description: Once in a awhile you owe it to yourself.  This ice cream literally stops time, everything is great after visiting here.  Not much parking to speak of unfortunately.  I wish I lived within walking distance.
author: Scotty 7.

description:
AWESOME Ice cream.  But what's up with the ridiculous lines?  When the line's that long, that means there's room for improvement in how you sell ice cream....

I still like Rick's better, in Palo Alto, for better quality of ice cream, and much shorter lines.
author: Fong L.

description:
Okay this is review 410 for this place so I won't reiterate all the stuff about the variety, the awesomeness of all their flavors, or the wait.  

I will say that my friend Nacho had another one of his spontaneous and specific snack attacks and was all excited to go home and make some root beer floats.  So we picked up a 2 liter of A&W at Safeway but he insisted that we get the vanilla ice cream from Mitchell's.  I was like... are you kidding me?  You won't even notice the flavor of the ice cream when it's soaked in root beer...is it really worth heading down there and waiting in line?  (To be fair, I found out shortly thereafter that there is a separate express line for prepacked ice cream)

Anyway, we have our homemade root beer floats and I couldn't get over the flavor of the ice cream....it had an unworldly deliciousness to it....and it was just regular old vanilla ice cream for God's sakes, not french vanilla, not dulce de leche, not vanilla swirl... this ish was v-a-n-i-l-l-a-s as Gwen would say... and it blew my freakin mind. 

Now I'm kind of scared to go back to one of the more flavorful ice-creams because what if my head asplodes?
author: Neej M.

description: 5 stars for service! N freaking yummy tasting ice cream! The dude that was helping me bombarded me with samples! I ended up getting the eggnog ice cream. So delifreakinglicious. Okaaaaaayyyy!? Peace.
author: Lynn K.

description:
Mitchell's Frozen Desert Bunker rules.

I have never been there when they had to use the bullet-proof plexiglass. Wait, what if it's not to there to protect the employees from gunmen? What if it's the employees who are armed and dangerous?

You must obey the Mexican Chocolate. Dark and spicy with a delicious cinnamon bump to it. And there's an exotic bean flavor here that is such a beautiful purple color that we should all send Prince a gallon on his birthday.

Note: I recall that bringing a Mitchell's ice cream cake or pie to dining activities usually nets me more love from fellow diners than is shown those who brought something delicious AND homemade. I'm not saying it's fair, but Mitchell's is here if you need to score the points. Plus, you can just grab it, get in the express line and Bob's your uncle.
author: Jeremy W.

description:
Tip of the day:
Mitchell's Express window!

I hate waiting. I definitely hate waiting for 26 people ahead of me in line to get me some Macapuno ice cream!

Grab a half gallon from the freezer case by the door (they don't have every flavor available--but most of them). The half gallon allows you to walk right up to the express window and you're in and out of Mitchell's ready to enjoy the sweet, creamy  goodness within 5 minutes.
author: Wendy G.

description:
Try their MANGO ice cream. there's just no competition. 

yes, Magnolias is good, but it doesn't even come close to Mitchells. the first time I came here was a cold ass night AND there was still a line out the door. that's whats up.
author: Jennie L.

description:
Mitchell's definitely lives up to it's name. It's quite nummie! Next time, I'll come back when I'm around the corner. =) I don't like too many sweet things either, and I have to say that normally when I eat ice cream I have a cup/bottle of water waiting to help me wash all the sweetness away; however,  this is not the case with Mitchell's. (at least with white pistachio, not too sure about the others) =)

Ambiance: It's a really tiny shop where you have to get a ticket and wait your turn. It has nice white walls covered with ice cream pictures. I went there at about 10pm and there was a mad crowd of people waiting inside and outside of the place. Crazinesss!!! Wow! Goes to show you, how much people lub this place...especially in the winter time. =)

Food: Ice cream galore with many many options. I also saw some specials like halo halo, avacado, ube and many more selections. You name it, they got it. If I had to compare the texture of the ice cream, it would have to be between a creamy dryers/haagen daaz to gelato in Italy! It's not too sweet, and I happen to like it. I had samples of the white pistacio, toasted almond, peppermint candy and coffee. 

Service: Workers here are nice and friendly (at least the one I had). I had two tastings and one of them dripped on the counter. Another worker saw from behind the counter and offered me a napkin. You only communicate with the one that calls your number.

** be aware of the parking, it could be quite challenging. **
author: Jennie N.

description: This is a nice little neighborhood spot if you'd like to take a stroll with your pretty little sweetheart to curb your evening sweet tooth. The staff is friendly and considering how busy it can be (please take a number) the line moves smoothly. I'd never heard of Avocado flavored ice cream before this. I may have to try that with the white pistachio. Yum! Whip cream! Sprinkles. Waffle cones. Squirrel!
author: Thomas Nathan S.

description: Sunday night and it was super packed! We waited for our numbers to be called, and it went by fairly quick. I had no clue what to get, since it was my first time there. I tried a few flavors and ended up getting a double scoop, new york cherry and rum raisin, in a waffle cone. It was delicious! You can definitely taste that rummy feel in the rum raisin, and the new york cherry was even more flavorful. We had other flavors like: caramel praline,  dulce de leche, mocha fudge, vanilla, and a few others. Overall, I'd definitely come back and try other flavors, if I ever get the chance to go here.
author: Sylvia b.

description: I love going here. the wait outside in the cold for the yummy ice cream is definitely worth it. I don't think i've ever had a bad flavor here.
author: Vicky L.

description: I give this place a 5 star! This place is always packed with tasty flavors. I always get the UBE here. They have one of the best purple yam ice cream i ever had! There's always a lot of people here waiting in line. Once you enter in you have to get a ticket and they call you by numbers. It doesn't really take that long but on a hot summer days the wait is about 30 min to an hour. BUT it's TOTALLY WORTH IT! I heard that this place have the best green tea but they haven't made any lately. I'm not too sure if they stopped making it or if it's seasonal flavor but i hope they make it soon so i can try it! Yums
author: Sora K.

description:
My in-a-nutshell review: Sweet-delicious-cool!!!

Okay, so I kinda got bought off by Mitchell's time-machine-flash-back inducing lemon chiffon ice cream. 

MMMMMMMMMMMmmmmm...Lemon Chiffon....!!! ((short black out))

Any and all faults were forgiven the moment that indescribable overwhelming of the senses took me back 40 some odd years. DAMN! No word for that. But beyond that, while I'm not so brave as to try some of their more exotic flavors, they have my favorites and once when I, in a huff cuz they didn't have orange sherbet, demanded to know WHY? I got a good explanation: they make their own and orange is a seasonal deal. A former peeve has been turned into delicious anticipation of the return of orange sherbet season. 

Also, Mitchell's can be people-watching heaven. Time spent waiting in line (doesn't always happen, but hot days, count on it) I think Mitchell's has got  fair claim to being one hub of SF's most eclectic mixes of human beings, all indulging in a common love: sweet-delicious-cool.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
Best ice cream ever! When I don't want too much shit in my ice cream (*ahem* Cold Stone Creamery!), I want simple, flavored ice cream. Mitchell's has a variety of flavors to choose from! Although they are a bit small and there is almost always a line out the door, their ice cream is worth it! If you go on a weekday, there shouldn't be too much people to deal with. My favorites here are Ube, Mango, Macapuno, and Chocolate. MMMMM!

P.S. They will reopen on January 25th.
author: Rosanne C.

description: Really creamy old fashioned ice cream. I chose a coconut flavor which was good - my only gripe is that you can't have two flavors in the single serving! boo.
author: Leily P.

description:
once youve had their grasshopper pie you will NEVER be able to eat any other mint ice cream and have it taste good
nothing compares
nothing
author: beth m.

description:
===============
PHENOMENAL!!!!!!
===============

This place is unbelievable.

I ordered a banana split with the Avocado ice cream and Cantaloupe ice cream. The ice cream ws DELICIOUS. the hot fudge was incredible.

I cannot believe a place this great exists! Its a dream come true.
author: Zeel J.

description: I went to get my ice cream for over 20 years and they stopped serving my favorite LEMOM CUSTARD.  It was the best, since they don't carry it I stopped going here nothing else is special to me.
author: Debra V.

description:
Sunny, freezing, raining - whatever this city will throw at you weatherwise, there is always a line at Mitchell's and for good reason. I have yet to try a new flavour and been disappointed.

Veterans have discovered the "express" line and quickly snag that half gallon of Mango from the freezer - darting out of there way before the rest of us coneheads get served. Having a half gallon of Mitchell's ice cream in my freezer would be about as dangerous as a garbage bag full of cashews in my pantry.

If you get the chance (and I'm certain it's already been mentioned) make sure to at least test out eveything they have that is seasonal. The Pumpkin ice cream of autumn certainly has the most glowing reputation.
author: Miroslav W.

description:
EXCELLENT
EXCELLENT
EXCELLENT

More graduation speeches should feature ice cream - excellence, quality, value, etc etc.

Anyway, I have yet to move on from Grasshopper Pie here - a combination of minty cookies and cream but will let you know when I've made it to other cones.
I have tasted plenty of flavors & look forward to that day when I get a cone of Mexican Chocolate - but it isn't here.  Yet.

Mitchell's is served at the sub shop on 24th & Castro for all you Noe Valley denizens.  Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya other neighborhoods with no Mitchell's offerings!  Something that makes the rent worth it!
author: laura g.

description:
What is there to say, really?

Best ice cream in town.  Super duper service.

Mexican chocolate on a waffle cone.  

Tears of joy.
author: Miss Information X.

description:
I scream!

You scream!

We all scream for ice cream!

And that's exactly what I did after my first bite of Mitchell's chocolate ice cream.

 OOHH...so creamy, so smooth, so refreshing, and OH SO sinfully delicious..mmm.

My mouth is beginning to salivate as I write this..

Thank goodness I was wearing my elastic shorts.

I finished my cone in the blink of an eye, then proceeded to eat my friend's ice cream cone ( she gave up after I kept staring at hers)

Thought of going back for seconds, but waiting for your number to be called is pretty painful when everyone is standing around you slurping on their ice cream cones.

Thank you, Mr. Mitchell for ending my day a little better and for  making me a little fatter. 

And THANK goodness for elastic band waistlines..
author: First C.

description: When I was prego with my first daughter, this was my craving!  Even though we lived in the Sunset, my hubby and I would come here to satisfy my Mitchell's craving!  Everything is BOMB!!  Juss went there recently and they updated the place, but there was still a long line...  Wish there was a place in SD like this.
author: Kat D.

description:
I think if you have a craving for specialty/cultural/tropical flavors, this is probably a rare opportunity to get those flavors. Otherwise save yourself the head ache and buy a pint of ice cream at your favorite store and forget it.  

I tried Mitchell's and stood in line with a bunch of hyper active, misbehaving kids and really could not believe the insane mania over this place. The line was long, the parking lot was full, and people were hauling huge 5 gallon cartons out of this place like the world was coming to an end.

The ice cream (White Pistachio) was nothing special and borderline flavorless.  

But,  if you have a hyper active misbehaving child that you want to reward with ice cream, you will have plenty of company --this might be a good choice and leave Bi-Rite Creamery to the big kids.
author: Gem J.

description:
I was different for once and tried the mocha fudge.  And then I poured more fudge over it.  Kind of overkill, but who cares.

I treated myself, Joshua, and Jack.  Joshua got some mango sorbet.  Jack got the ube.  We were freezing cold with smiles on our faces all the way home.
author: Anne Marie P.

description: GREAT as always have been going there for many many years the service is great the ICE CREAM IS THE BEST!!!!! I highly recommended the bomb!!!! I had Ice Cream in many many Ice Cream Parlors... but Mitchell's is the Best!!!   was there last night.........with the family :)
author: Star K.

description:
I got some ice cream, and you don't got none, cause you on the welfare!

what is there to say bout Mitchell's that hasn't been said over 900 times?

story:  

one day, @ CCSF, we decided to go to mitchell's after our political science class.  my notes for that class are usually about 2 pages tightly packed with info.  On this day there is about half a page of stuff that doesn't make sense and many drawings of ice cream cones with the words "Mitchell's...MMMMM" under them.  go, eat, be happy.
author: Garrett C.

description: Love their ice cream. The coconut one is my fav. Their ice cream is very creamy tasting.
author: Mylinh P.

description:
There's ice cream.  And then there's Mitchell's.

Rich, creamy, and decadent, every scoop is like a miraculous, little ball of happiness that, when you eat it, makes any day (no matter how bad) just a little bit better.  I know...it's ridiculous.  But I swear to you, it is that good.  In fact, I dare you to try and find another ice cream maker whose flavors are bigger, more genuine, and more delicious than the ones they serve here.

Try the Mango - it's won several awards.  
Or the White Pistachio, which is my personal favorite - tastes great, more filling!
Or the Avocado if that's your bag.  I asked one of the workers for his honest opinion about this flavor.  He said he couldn't have it without feeling like he needed the chips and salsa to go along with it.... 

Better yet, try them all!!  They let you sample the merchandise before you commit.  But it might be a little obnoxious to do all 20+ flavors in one visit.   Again, just trust me on this.  Because as good as the ice cream is, it's not worth the dirty looks and snarls from the dozens of other customers waiting patiently behind you.
author: Karlo A.

description:
Kahlua Mocha Cream.  Oh, my precioussss!

I want to swim in you, bathe in you and eat you at the same time.  I hate you!  Hate you for tasting so good!

No, no.  I don't hate you...I didn't mean that.  

[The mind of a mitchell's addict...clutching onto her half gallon of Kahlua Mocha Cream, rocking side to side together.  Always together.]
author: Stella K.

description:
the best ice cream ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!   worth the drive from san bruno to sfo!!!!!!   but zens god i found out they sell mitchell at the pacific super market $9.00 the pint but its always good to drive to the real place so i get get more variety of flavors, my faave is macapuno w/ pineapple toping!!! & the mexican chocolate w/ hot chocolate toping!!! this place is worth it!!
 HEY MR. MITCHELL, YOU SHOULD OPEN MORE LOCATIONS AROUND THE BAY!!!!
PS: Mr. MITCHELL CAN I GET A JOB THERE?? I PROMISE I WON'T EAT ANY ICE-CREAM!!! HEHEHEH .. PLSSSS!!!
author: Alexandra D.

description: Mitchell's Ice Cream has so many wonderful flavors to try. The ice cream is not excessive. I always get excited about the flavors they offer. The staff is friendly. Located in Noe Valley, it's worth the visit!
author: Denise C.

description: ube,mango,macapuno and halo-halo (specials for summers only )my fav ice cream flavors yeah buddy my spot forever.I craved this when I was pregnant with my twin boys and i always get the scoop of ube and seat out front in the bench so yeah now a days my twins demands ube ice cream to be stocked in our fridge.Oh so yummy Ube..
author: Nina B.

description: French custard vanilla was delicious, delicious ice cream and even better in a waffle cone. The store however needs to provide extra napkins for their customers because there was a lot of ice cream dripping on floors...
author: Angie C.

description: mitchell's..  i'm sure they've ruined alot of diets b/c there is no friggin way you can drive by the store and not stop in for some Pear Sorbet..  or any of their fruit based ice creams/sorbets. I'm sure that if it was 40 below zero and I had just been shot in the leg, I'd still limp in for some Pear Sorbet!!
author: Henry W.

description: When you think about ice cream in San Francisco, do you think Cold Stone Creamery? No. Haagen Daaz? No. Baskin Robbins? Please, save those 31 flavors for someone who cares. Ghirardelli? Keep your day job and just make chocolates. The answer is Mitchell's Ice Cream of course. Why do you think there's a line outside whether it's cold or a hot, summer day? That's because they make the ice cream in the city.
author: Gerard Y.

description: My mom is picky about ice cream - especially coconut ice cream. (She is Puerto Rican). She tried the two types here: Buko (Young Coco), and Makapuno (Sweet and Meaty) and ADORED BOTH. FYI: That never happens. She was also against trying the Ube (Pilipino Yam), and ended up ordering it and scarfing that bad boy down. Overall, a great success. Next: Halo Halo.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Convenient parking behind the store and a nice selection of flavors (surprised to see they had macapuno and ube).  Usually crowded so either go early in the day or when it's raining. 
Especially liked the coconut-pineapple shake!!
author: Mike M.

description: Extremely long lines on a nice day.  Street parking only.  Go inside and grab a ticket and wait for your number to be called.  The only downside is that it can get so crowded, it can be difficult to get in as people crowd near the entrance and won't get out of the way.  Good selection of flavor.  Tastes more creamy, more traditional ice cream making with exotic flavors.  Would recommend if you happen to be in the area.
author: C S.

description:
I scream, you scream, we all scream for MITCHELL'S!  AAAAAHHHHHH

There is always a line at this place, but the variety of flavors and the taste is worth it!  Their ice cream cakes are also good!  You don't even have to order in advance because they have an express lane but just for cake and take-home boxes of ice cream.  

I've never seen Filipino ice cream served at an ice cream shop, so that's another reason this place is one of my favorites! ;)  I wish they would bring one to the south bay.
author: Jeannette S.

description:
First off, I have to say that Haagen Dazs is my favorite ice cream.  With that said, Mitchell's comes in a strong number two.  My ultimate favorite is their Macapuno ice cream.  I guess it's a kind of coconut?  Whatever it is, my parents used to buy bins of that and the mango flavor - and we'd have ourselves a little tropical dessert feast at home.  Their Lychee is pretty tasty too, but I prefer the Macapuno.  Oh how I love their ice cream!

They do come up with some flavors that I can't bring myself to even try though... avocado?  Corn with cheese?  Sigh... I'm usually up for trying anything, but with ice cream in flavors like these, I can't.  I just can't.
author: Denise M.

description:
Best ice cream EVER!
Go for the Grasshopper Pie, it's my childhood favorite.  
The only downside to Mitchell's is the high price of the ice cream...but whatever because it's totally worth it.
author: Jordan D.

description:
Why do I have to live on a hill where you have to drive around for an hour before you can find parking?  Why does my favorite ice cream place have to be on the other side of town?  Maybe it's for the better otheriwse I would be twenty pounds heavier because is Micthell's was in my neighborhood, I would go there every day.

P.S.  I love strawberry ice cream.  But don't get Mitchell's strawberry ice cream.  Try their chocolate or something else.  Their strawberry ice cream is average.  Makes me sad to say that.  But it's true.
author: Tangerine L.

description:
Every time I'm near my old 'hood close to Mitchell's, I have to stop by and get a gallon of their Mexican Hot Chocolate ice cream.  It probably should be listed as a controlled substance since I  have to hide it when I get home or it will be devoured by kids and hubby.  

Definitely worth waiting in line for!
author: Susan S.

description:
This place is a San Francisco icon... no matter what time, there is a line out the door. I have waited for as long as 20 minutes for some ice cream at this place. However, it is so totally worthy of the hype and the wait, I don't even question it. 
My two favorite flavors are the cookies 'n cream, and the baby coconut. However, there is a flavor for everybody here. There are even some novelty ones (... avocado, anybody?) 
Hit this place up whenever you can. There is a small parking lot behind the place, but since it's usually full, there is almost always parking within a couple of feet.
author: Samantha W.

description:
"I have some ice cream, I have some ice cream
and I'm gonna eat it all, I'm gonna eat it all.
You don't have no ice cream, you didn't get none, 
you can't afford it, 'cos you are on the welfare,
and Your Dad's An Alcoholic!!"

Eddie Murphy, Delirious (1983)

Mitchell's is some kick ass ice cream.
author: Jay H.

description: Soooooooooooo good!  Delicious ice cream and great service. It's quiet during the week but super busy on the weekend.
author: Claire R.

description: Mitchell's ice cream is awesome! If you have not had a Mitchell's ice cream...plan to go as soon as possible. When you get there, remember to pull a number (left side of the front entrance). While you are waiting, don't get overwhelmed with their menu list, it's pretty extensive for an ice cream shop.  They have all of the all time favorite ice cream flavors along with exotic flavors. It doesn't matter what the weather is in SF, they will not disappoint. Oh, don't be shy to ask for samples.
author: Maria D.

description:
I don't get it.

I really don't.

Yam flavored ice cream?  I'm all for interesting ice cream flavors but not off putting ones.

It's good.  Don't get me wrong.

But not trek from the WA to deep Mission and then wait in line for a half hour good. 

Thank god we had a car.  That 10 min drive was the funniest and most cramped shit I've endured lately.  I fucking love my roommates.
author: Alexis B.

description:
This place is SO SO busy that you pick a number, wait on a crowded corner and then wait for your name to be called...at 9PM on a Sunday, our number was 45- they were only on customer #4!  And let me just tell you that most customers do NOT order just 1 cone...most are getting a cone and packing a whole bunch of pints for home.  After 15 minutes, my little guy frowned and then whispered to me that he would go back to the machine and pick out a smaller number.  Fat chance, right?  Funny how their little minds work!

The Butterscotch was my favorite- awesome with it's big swirls of butterscotch in super creamy vanilla ice cream.
author: Judy K.

description:
They're right on....every time!

Each time I go in, I never know what to get because it all looks so good!  They are always patient with me when I sample 4 or 5 different kinds, too!  My favorites are the Grasshopper Pie, Halo Halo and Prailenes and Cream.  

The egg nog (seasonal) is the best there is as well!!!  

LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Claudia M.

description: Wow! I sure have a sweet tooth for this stuff! Best ice cream around. I split a banana split with two of my friends and we all came out full. There's so many different flavors so you're bound to find something you like or be pleased with something new.
author: Christy N.

description: You must be a fool to believe there is any ice cream or ice cream shop greater than Mitchell's. I dare anyone to prove me wrong! For the price and quality, this place deserves more than 5 stars. I would say 7. I have heard some say bi-rite is better, but those people probably smoke crack. Or wear skinny jeans and live in gentrified neighborhoods where they did the gentrifying. "hipsters." I think I've said enough. But before I leave, here's a list of my favorite flavors: avocado, grasshopper pie, oreo cooki, lucuma, mango and everything else!
author: Aldrich S.

description:
I thank my friend since I was five years old, and her boyfriend, for introducing me to this place. I am indebted to them for bringing to me, the love of my dessert filled life.

You know you are in business when you have to wait in line on a WEDNESDAY night at 10:55pm that goes out the store doors for some ice cream. 

To further that thought, if you are waiting in line that late, you know the ice cream HAS to be good.

Yes my friends, both of those thoughts are true. Welcome to the world of Mitchell's Ice Cream - home of the BEST ice cream in the Bay Area. Baskin Robbins (it feels adulterous to even mention that chain in the review of Mitchell's) has NOTHING on this place. NOTHING I SAY!

My favorite memory of this place is the day I ran the San Francisco Marathon. After finishing, my friend drove us here to get ice cream. Let me tell you, after you run a race, nothing beats ice cream from here - well okay maybe a beer at the finish line, but thats besides the point. 

All of the flavors here are great - but my absolute favorite is Mexican Chocolate, which tastes like a chocolate dipped churro! You want to take it up a step, have that ice cream with some banana ice cream and you will be satisfied.

This place is the gem of the Mission District. Its been such a long time since I've been here. Perhaps I will go tomorrow for some ice cream, because now, I want some Mexican Chocolate and Banana ice cream in a sugar cone.

PS - the ice cream is so good, that sometimes, on the street corner, I bust out doing the running man to memories of Every Little Step I Take and Ice Ice Baby, because the ice cream is so good, it takes me back to my youth! You can ask any of my close friends about this. They will validate that.
author: Brian D.

description:
i love the flavors. mango? SO good. (best mango ice cream ever.) tropical 4?? even better.  and it's cheap! 

BIG cons? NO parking. yes there's a lot. too bad it fits like 1/2 a car. maybe it's a lego car lot. i don't know. all i know is I NEVER CAN FIND PARKING! 

wait is pretty long.. you probably won't want to come here every day. so.. get the gallon.
author: Mel L.

description:
Mitchell's is the best ice cream in town.  They put Bi-Rite to shame and all of you scenester, Dolores Park, Mission slubs can quote me on that.

Incredible shakes and malts, a wide spectrum of flavors and quarts pre-packed to go!  You can't beat that.  Additionally it's not as pricey as the said standard--Bi-Rite Creamery.

Viva la Mitchell's!
author: Jamaal C.

description: yummmmmmm best, ice cream....... EVER!! its no suprise to me why there's ALWAYS a long line out the door. my son always asks for the purple one, aka UBE!! our fave ;)
author: Belle V.

description: Best ice cream in SF. Don't bother going to Bi-Rite or any others. So many flavors. Great taste. Friendly staff. But be prepared to wait on line!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I don't have much of a sweet tooth. I will take a bag of barbecue chips over candy every day of the week and twice on Sunday. That policy does not apply to Mitchell's Ice Cream though. Have you ever heard of people standing out in the cold to wait for ice cream? ICE cream. Yeah, that's how good it is. 

My favorite flavor is pumpkin, and I'm not even into pumpkin pie. I also love Mexican chocolate. And if you go for the classics, you can't beat their strawberries and cream. Their ice cream pies, though pricey, are the best. I recommend the Mud Pie. 

Don't let the hungry looking mob scare you off. It is worth the wait.
author: Maura B.

description:
I don't believe there is a better Ice Cream place or Ice Cream.

They serve the best Ice Cream, Sundae's, and Shakes.

Places with shakes made with Mitchell's Ice Cream are worth the extra charges...

Love it, love it, love it.

No place better...and if there is, please let me know...LOL
author: Mike V.

description:
LOVE MITCHELL'S ICECREAM!!!    this is local flavor -- a must!!!!  

there's always a line rain or shine........ no seating inside, just a little bench right outside the store.  standing room only especially on those hot days....you  take a number........  and wait.....and wait.....and wait......  waiting for an eternity............until they finally reach my number.... i get sooooo excited when its my turn.............

love the filipino tropical flavors..........i usually get:
ube,        ube & mango combo,          or        ube & langka combo.  used to love mexican chocolate.  have  ordered the mango sorbet (great on a really hot day),    &  thai tea is good too!
author: Cindi N.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said already?  The selection at Mitchell's is awesome.  I love the ube and you can't go wrong at a place that serves avocado ice cream.  The only reason I'm docking a point is because everyone and their brother knows the place and is waiting in line for a cone at this very minute.

Tonight I went with 7 friends and when we got our numbers (B12-B18) we looked up to find that they were on #A46!!  How, pray tell, did we get our ice cream before they closed you might ask?  Well, if you buy pre-packed quarts, there's a separate (and much quicker line), but you have to share with your friends.  

I guess sometimes I can share my Mitchells...
author: Tempe M.

description:
In the days of January, I was lethargic, simply because I was on freaking vacation.  My days went like this: woke up after noon, went out usually at night and till my eyelids gave out, slept.  I was living the life of a vampire, and once I was used to this lifestyle, I was bored.  I needed something to wake me up.  Nearing to sunset, I got ready to hearing, "let's go Mitchells."

I triple dog dared myself to order the hot apple crust pie sundae, and so I did.  Bottom layer is the apple pie crust, followed by your choice of ice cream, sauce, applepie crust, your choice of ice cream, sauce, and finally topped with whipped cream and a cherry.  And it weighs quite a bit.  As I made my way out, I noticed heads turning," ooo I think I'll order that." 

Near the end, I barely finished. My eyes felt the most alive! I felt the sugar traveling and energizing my body.  No more lazy days ahead.  I felt like I could do a marathon.  But instead, I went for a nearby park to let loose.
author: Glu C.

description:
Still the best.  The wait is worth it.

Sure other fancy "gourmet" ice cream places have opened shop.  Sure salted caramel from "those other guys" is delicious.  But there is still no one who even comes close to Mitchell's.  The intensity of the flavors, the creaminess of the ice cream, plus a smattering of je ne sais quoi.  Mmm.  

Mitchell's is old school and old school rules.
author: John L.

description:
Cmon? Best Ice Cream EVER!

I tried the Lucuma Ice Cream. BTW the Tropical Menu is Boss. Lucuma is a Peruvian Fruit and shit it tasted like a sweet maple syrup! All the other flavors are boss too. I went there on a Monday NIght at 10:00pm. HAH. Got my ticket since Mitchel's is always crackin' MUST TRY
author: Ian Jerome C.

description: Wow-by far, Mitchell's has THE BEST grasshopper pie ice cream I've ever tasted. The fudge ribbons and oreo chunks combined with minty green ice cream inside a waffle cone totally made my afternoon. The line was a bit long, but it was worth the wait.
author: C A.

description:
I thought that since there was a long line outside at 10pm, this place would have amazing ice cream.

I had the coffee and bf had the peach. Very so-so, no signature taste. The flavors weren't very strong and trust, my taste buds are very much alive and working. I think even Polly Ann's is better.
author: Cristal G.

description:
Oh Orange Sherbet, let me count the ways that you keep me crawling back... 
It is the best Orange Sherbet ever!!! It tastes so fresh and has the perfect balance of sweet goodness and burst of flavor when it touches your tongue... 
It's funny that you can go to Mitchell's any time of the year, no matter how cold it is and still expect a little wait. That's how many people (like myself) are Mitchell's addicts!
author: Christina D.

description: Mitchell's is to die for! My family used to come every time we were in the city throughout my childhood, rain or shine because it was just that yummy! On nice days you can wait for quite some time, which can be a little frustrating, but it gives you plenty of time to make the right choice and once you get your goods any remaining frustration melts away as you savor the goodness. It's always fun to see Mr. Mitchell in there too. =]
author: Caroline M.

description:
Too good for words.

I recommend the Halo Halo or the Ube. One taste and you'll be hooked!
author: Jason L.

description: This is the only ice cream place that i love and that i would be sad if they did close. My fave is coconut pineapple and Mango. Its amazing.
author: Bessy M.

description:
CREAMY DELICIOUSNESS!  I came here for my first time last week at 9pm, and it was so packed.  We had to wait a good thirty minutes or so, but it was worth the wait.

I'm so glad we had to wait though, because I'm an extremely indecisive person.  (Their extensive choice of flavors doesn't help much.)  So I took the whole wait thinking of what I wanted, and decided on a double scoop of Thai Tea and Ube.

The Thai Tea flavor took a while to sink in.  Spoon it in your mouth...  then you wait for it.  Ube, however, was just absolutely yummy right away!!

I really hope I get to come back again soon *_*.  Best ice cream I've ever had, hands down.
author: Winnie B.

description: Yum the Pear flavor. Love it how they pack the cone for you :)
author: James V.

description:
Tried this based on all the raves I've gotten. Glad I read about the express line to avoid the DMV like lines. The raves are founded on sound evidence. The Rum Raisin rocked me like no ice cream has. 

If you have seen Ben Stiller during the credits of Dodgeball, then you have also seen my fate. :(
author: Gabe M.

description:
On a first try, simply excellent! My friends took me there even as it was cold and rainy outside - typically the last weather anyone would want ice cream in - and suggested that I try a scoop of Grasshopper Pie, which is very akin (yet much tastier) than the Mint Chocolate Chip scoops I usually like. It was absolutely delicious! Even though there's barely any room to stand inside once you've received your ice cream, just being huddled inside from the cold with a cone of any ice cream you get from Mitchell's is definitely an experience everyone has to do while in SF. 

Definitely worth the distance; the Grasshopper Pie was great and I can't wait to try the mango and various coconut flavors.
author: Justin L.

description:
Don't ever disrespect Mitchell's.

You gotta get the grasshopper pie.  Mint ice cream, chocolate chips, brownies, fudge, oreo cookies, and yumminess.

The other flavors are good too, but grasshopper pie is my favorite.  There's always a line, thats how good it is!  A line even when it's cold and windy outside.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
I'm a bit of an ice cream snob... OK, well, at least whenever I see a Dreyer's box I cringe. And while I do enjoy Ben and Jerry's from time to time, or a scoop of Breyers, nothing comes close to the magnificence that is Mitchell's.

I can make two recommendations: a wafflecone containing butterscotch marble and peach icecream, dipped in chocolate, and a French custard vanilla milk shake with malt added in. Maybe it was the combination of the two, and the company shared to devour said items certainly played a big part for me, but I am sure that those two confections alone will improve infinitely your spirits even after a lousy day. After a good day, and you'll be floating on cloud nine.

Just remember to walk in and grab a ticket, don't make the mistake of waiting like me. The lines can get long, but it's worth it. So. Very. Worth. It.
author: Adam A.

description:
After visiting my grandama in Noe Valley Saturday evening.
I asked my son if he wanted Mitchell's Ice Cream. 
" Mom, I don't remember that place." 
 " You will." I said grinning.

I took a number and stood in front of Mitchell's door way watching people walk out with these huge creamy waffle cone and chocolate drizzled sundaes with whipped cream piled high. 

My son asked " Why do we have to wait? I never waited for ice cream."
" Darling, waiting makes you appreciate it more." 

 20 min later... I had my kahalua sugar cone and my son got his chocolate chip mint. 

Tom cooed "mmm! That was worth the wait mom."

 Heck yah baby!!
author: linda l.

description: I keep hearing & reading the howls & yelps for all the fancy ice cream joints in SF but they STILL can't hold Mitchell's jockstrap with TWO waffle cones and bucket o' ice, bitches!  your designer ice cream ain't got nothing, NADA on 'em, no matter how hard you try to spit out flavors even the folks at Cafe Gratitude would laugh at--what, you gonna come at me with some honeysuckle spearmint baba ghanoush?!??
author: Chris C.

description: I've been going to Mitchell's since I was a kid...and all I have to say is at I LOVE, LOVE this place.  MANGO ice cream is my favorite!
author: Jennifer H.

description: I love it and if you don't then no one cares. Just write a simple review people. Either you like it or you don't. Everyone is different.
author: Masterself K.

description:
AMAZING!

Knowing my soft spot for ice cream (AKA: my belly), my sister introduced to this San Francisco institution and I been a fan ever since.

Where else can you find flavors like Taro and Cheesecake made to such delicious creamy perfection?  If there is another place, I have yet to find it.  The variety of unique flavors would allow you to come back every week and try something new.  My parents have made this a regular stop before leaving San Francisco since being introduced to the ice cream mecca.

If you make your way to this spot deep in the outer mission be prepared to wait in line, but believe me you'll be glad you did.
author: Drew W.

description:
The best ice cream in the city, hands down.

Does anything else really need to be said?

I think not.
author: Erika W.

description:
I love this place, get the Ube ( the purple ice cream )  It's the best.
Always wondered why there are no nutritional charts available :)
The Judith review mentioned she looked at the list of ingredients, wish I could see that too!
author: Pug P.

description: Best ice cream EVER. Literally go here everytime I get into the city and cannot leave without it. Line is very long, but goes by fast enough. Make sure you expect to eat at in the car though, or outside. Definitely worth a visit. SO many flavors, sure anyone can find at least a few they would find delicious :)
author: Danielle L.

description:
BAY AREA I scream, you scream, we all scream for Ice cream! Mitchell's that is! 

Growing up in the city and loving the tropical ice cream that they didn't carry in the "normal" grocery stores such as Cala - do you remember that grocery store, I think it is just like a Safeway kind of store. Anyways, yes, Michell's has great flavors- MANGO is the bomb! And being happa I also enjoy the super tasty flavors of - Macapuno (coconut bits with creamy cream, hmmmm..) and Ube (the purple yam- yaah maaunh, crazy like :) ) ice cream. 

I haven't seen other companies like Breyers or Dryers make these flavors. This is where Mitchell's Ice Cream succeeds, because of the various flavors they have. 

Dang, I want ice cream now. gotta run :)
author: mali b.

description: Easily the best ice cream I've ever had, anywhere. We go there every time we're in the bay area.
author: Joe H.

description:
No doubt about it: the best ice cream I've ever had.  So rich, so creamy, so many flavors.  It's just delicious.  I go here all the time.  Sure, you have to deal with a long wait sometimes, but it's totally worth it.

My absolute favorite flavor is the oreo cookie, which has huge chunks of oreos in it.  I also recommend the pumpkin, butterscotch, cinnamon snap, strawberry - even their vanilla is delicious.  If you go, stick with a cone (1 scoop is plenty).  The milkshakes are good but a little too expensive and the ice cream is delicious enough on its own.

One thing to remember is they only take plastic if it's more than $9 or so.  So bring cash.

Best ice cream in the Bay, if not the country.
author: Chad H.

description:
Great creamy ice cream, interesting and unique flavors, and only $2 for a scoop. Oh Mitchell's, how I wish I still lived two blocks away from you.

Try the tropical flavors, some you've probably never seen before: lacuma especially. No idea what this fruit looks like, but it makes a tasty ice cream.  Passion fruit sorbet is tart and bursts on the tongue. Yum.

Seriously, just go here. Brave the line if it's a warm day (even if it's not), grab a number, and anticipate the moment when you too will be scarfing down your cone on the sidewalk.
author: Kim J.

description:
If even the tiniest bit of sunlike  breaks through the clouds over San Francisco, the crowds go a-flocking to Mitchells. It's a fact. It could be sunny and cold as heck, there will some sort of congregation outside of Mitchells waiting to devour some of the yummiest, creamiest, and most inventive flavors around. and it's so worth it.
