You can't go wrong with the flavors here, halo halo, avocado, rum raisin, toasted almond, ube. They're all so goood. Just grab an annoying pick number ticket and keep your eye rolls to yourselves my friends, because it's worth the wait on San Jose Avenue. 

Mitchell's is better than Swensons. It's a great debate, are you a mitchells or a swensons? MITCHELLS IF YOU ARE AWESOME.
author: Stephanie C.

description: We always make sure we visit this place every time we are in San Francisco.  My favorite flavors are Young Coconut, Mango and Ube.  Yum!
author: Richel A.

description: As a general rule, I stop by Mitchell's whenever I'm in the neighborhood for a scoop of banana ice cream...on a cone....dipped in chocolate. Then I grab a quart of Mexican Chocolate for the folks at home.  On each visit, I try a different sample and you really can't go wrong with any flavor here.
author: M J.

description: Man you just can't go wrong here.  I've been coming here since I was a baby for a reason..the Mexican Chocolate ice cream.  All of the flavors are great, but that one flavor is reason enough to wait in the long a$$ line!
author: Jeff M.

description: Banana Nut,  Chocolate Indulgence, Pumpkin, & Mexican Chocolate are my TOP FLAVORS!!! Enjoy
author: Justin P.

description: Thai tea ice cream on a chocolate dipped sugar cone, plzkthx. Great ice cream cakes too! Sometimes I'll just buy a cake to beat the line (be prepared!), but Mitchell's offers a very well-rounded menu, from around the world, literally! Where else are you going to find Ube, Mexican chocolate and French vanilla ice cream all in the same place? I'll take all three on my sundae, yes thank you.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Don't forget to grab a number inside the front door on the left! That should be the first thing you do. 

Then, wait...unless you are lucky enough to live close enough so you can grab a pre-packed quart or pint and head home. 

I always get some caramel crackle chocolate flavor. It's really yummy. Other people like the fruity stuff and I'm sure it's delicious, just not for me. I love the texture and again, it doesn't melt too fast so I can take my time eating it. Oh, they also have chocolate dip! That was a major draw for me initially.

I try to go if I'm in the city and driving and don't mind the hassle of parking, etc.
author: Kat H.

description:
I have been going here for years and just stopped in the other night after a length hiatus. 

Great-quality ice cream and sundaes

Good-service with knowledgable helpful staff-for an ice cream shop

OK-selection of ice cream flavors. I do know however that "you can't please them all." 

I call B.S. the person who Yelped that she got food poisoning. 

This is a very good spot and deserves support.
author: J C.

description:
My first time here was, gosh, like 2005 or something when a local told me I shouldn't go to Ghirardhelli to get ice cream!

Since then, I've gone off the 101 and travelled all the way to inner SF to get a scooping of this ice cream, but I have to say, I've been a bit disappointed lately.  I think the 'long' drive heightens my expectations.  But, I still do remember my first time here and it was cool.  I remember how their flavors really tasted like the flavors listed- I distinctly remembered the canteloupe wowing me.  When did you ever get canteloupe ice cream and if you did, would it really taste like canteloupe?  It does here!

The flavors:
Ube ice cream is interesting.  Purple yammy ice cream with a texture that even tastes kinda like yam and did I taste small hints of yam chunks in there?
Lilikoi Mango Swirl.  Mango was definitely sticky and mango-y like Hagan Daza sorbet.  Super sweet and swirled nicely.
Grasshopper Pie.  Nothing special
Vanilla.  My friend liked it and he's pretty picky about ice cream.
Coffee, Mocha Fudge, mint chocolate.  Eh.  OK.

The negs:
The line!  I remember I went there not knowing you had to take a number and waited a long time before I realized it.

I've bought the gallons of mocha fudge and coffee from SF to SJ for a party, in the middle of winter, leaving my windows down to make sure the inside of my car was freezing cold for an hour to keep the ice cream from melting.  But no one was really that impressed, and I have to say, it's not my go to place for my regular fav flavors like coffee, mocha fudge, mint chocolate (Starbucks Frap, Hagan Dazs, ice cream at your local Safeway freezer works just great or dare I say Coldstone even!))

btw.. a 5 star to me would be the Vaccharin dessert at Coco500.  Best mocha fudge concoction ever.
author: Cathy U.

description:
Start message.. 

Five stars. Good icecream. Lines are sometime long on hot days. I prefer pollyann still, but ice cream is ice cream. Ube rocks.

End message..
author: Wilson L.

description: Mitchell's ice cream is delicious.  I had some scoops of the Mexican chocolate and ube.  The delciousness definitely has to do with the percentage of milk fat and/or cream that they use.  The percentage is high.  I'd say that my body is selectively lactose intolerance and when confronted with Mitchell's delectable treats, it let me know that Mitchell's ice cream did not agree with me.  If you love ice cream and share the same unfortunate situation, pack a bunch of Lactase and maybe consider wearing some DPants (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CefajJzKpKA).  Mitchell's is totally worth it.
author: Darren S.

description:
Damn the neverending line at Mitchell's... Damn! Damn! Damn!

Driving to this place from San Jose is only HALF the battle. Waiting in line is the other half. The Ice Cream and all the insane flavours they have are worth it though. But damn! Why your line gotta take so long! Oh and parking is pure hell. It's like parking at an Nsync concert in a ToysRus parking lot... basically non-existent.

5 stars though - it's that good.
author: Richard T.

description:
So much has been said and written about Mitchell's that it's difficult to review it without restating cliches that have already been digested (literally) by tens of thousands of ice cream fans.

Let's just say that Mitchell's influence on the SF dessert scene is...incalculable.  Going here is so obligatory that it would be hip *not* to go, except that then you'd be missing out on the sweet sweet ice cream.
author: Wes M.

description:
Tasty ice cream that you have to wait a little while to order.  I ordered the Rocky Road ice cream tonight and thought it was super tasty.

It was pretty cold outside which didn't make it incredibly conducive to ice cream eating.  It was also pretty crowded for 10:15 or so at night.

Oh, well.  I had heard about this place forever so it was nice to finally have San Francisco's famous Mitchell's Ice Cream!
author: Lauren S.

description:
oh mitchell, where did we go wrong?  you were my favorite as a child, but it seems as if i have grown up but you have not.  since finding bi-rite and humphry slocombe, i cannot seem to bring myself to stand in your long lines and receive mediocre icecream flavors.  i am quite saddened by this, but we all grow up some time.

i still come for your exotic fruit flavors as they still taste great, but polly ann has excellent exotic fruit flavors also but with a smaller line.  the experience just isn't worth it anymore.  i still love you, just cannot give you 5 stars if i do not mean it
author: Wayne L.

description:
OMG! Pumpkin ice cream, yo! It's that time of the year again! Haha!

I love Mitchell's Ice Cream! Everytime I go here, there's a long ass line but the wait is always worth it! It has Filipino flavors! YAY! Halo-halo, macapuno, ube = Love! I love their sorbet flavors too! Props to their passion fruit sorbet!
author: Michelle B.

description: Been going here since I was a kid! For all of us that grew up in the City especially in this area....WE ALL KNOW Mitchell's is a MUST!
author: Justin W.

description: Luv dis place!! Mexican chocolate, grasshopper pie, khalua mocha soo many flavors and they are all soo good!! Def recommend this place to EVERYONE!!
author: claudia a.

description: You already know that Mitchell's Ice Cream is the best in the city -- so what's my favorite? It depends on the time of year -- there is nothing quite like their pumpkin ice cream in the fall, but you can never go wrong with Mexican Chocolate. If you think you don't like chocolate, you have to try this amazing blend of savory, sweet flavors. I swear that it releases endorphins and lowers the BP simultaneously.
author: Gary F.

description:
This place is pretty grubbin!!  They make the ice creams daily in the store.  
Love the 
Sweet and Salty Peanut Ice cream
Grasshopper Ice Cream-Mix of Mint ice cream, oreo cookies, choc chips
Claire's pie-Coffee ice cream, caramel, graham crackers  
Baby Coconut-Amazing and on the 7by7 top 100
Mexican Chocolate ice cream- Has a hint of cinnamon 
Ice Cream Sandwich- They'll put any ice cream in between the cookie

Size and Prices- 
Junior-Tiny serving, just about bubbles out of the cone- $1.65
Single-Normal large scoop- $2.65
Double-pretty big size, not for the gals usually. 

The Sundaes are bomb digity and the shakes are to die for.  

Parking- Not to many spots, but they do have a lot, unlike the city city.  

Line- Always a line, but usually goes pretty fast.  Don't forget to grab a number, otherwise you'll be sitting and waitin forever.
author: Chase F.

description: Love it here! Growing up in SF ... if im thinking of ice cream... I think of this place! There's always a wait but parking isn't as bad as Bi-Rite Creamry. Always expect a line during hot and Mon-Sun. Also you can pretty much buy reg flavors from this brand at Asian Markets. But I love going here when I don't want to eat ice cream from a tub.
author: Cat T.

description:
Maybe it's just my taste in ice cream... or the less than spectacular dinner I had prior to this trip, but the ice cream here just didn't do much for me. I drove out there because of all the good reviews I've heard and got one of the standard flavors - i think it was strawberry - to test it out. I mean, if you can't get the standard flavors right, no point in trying the others, right? 

I just was not impressed by it. I know it's the old school, American style of ice cream, but it just didn't do it for me. I'm willing to give it another try, but I'm not in the area much. Oh well. Back to Sketch it is...
author: Seri T.

description:
Lines out the door.... awesome buko (baby coconut) ice cream.  Lots of other fun, exotic Filipino flavors (where else will you see ube or halo halo).  Overall, all the flavors tend to be too sweet for me.   But if I'm having the craving, nothing but buko ice cream from Mitchell's will satisfy it.  

Too bad Mitchell's is not closer to a park or somewhere that is nice to take a stroll or more scenic.  I guess it is true testament to the yummy ice cream that people will wait 1/2 hour just to get a scoop, and then devour it while looking at the oncoming San Jose Ave traffic.
author: Jane A.

description:
I know, I know.  The 220th review. What's the point, right? Well, the point is I love Mitchell's and my Yelp profile would not be complete without making that crystal clear!  

Their ice cream is amazing.  I get the anxious sweats stading in line trying to decide what to order, even when I know I have a good 20 minutes before my number is called! There is a reason why people stand on line outside on cold San Francisco nights. It's worth it!
author: Abby W.

description:
Cuz you can't get Ube and Chocolate caramel crackle anywhere else!

As weird and sad as it is, I'm a Bay Area native, but my friend from LA introduced me to Mitchell's and I've been taking new people back ever since. I love their ice cream! They have such interesting flavors and new flavors every now and then (i liked the Thai tea). And of course they have the festive flavors when those times come around (ie. pumpkin and peppermint). They also have a sundae of the week/month...though I've never tried them, they always look so good!

I usually just get a scoop or two (if i'm goin all out! haha) on a cone or in a cup...but one time, i wanted to try the chocolate dipped ice cream...man, was it worth the mess! It's not that anyone who gets their ice cream chocolate dipped would end up being such a mess...it's just me, so don't let that note discourage you from getting it. It's delicious!

The ice cream is so good that there's always a line out the door and there are always people eating there...no matter what time of day it is or what the weather is like. The line is longer at night, on weekends and hot days/nights, of course. One time i brought my cousin there for her first time..and when we got there, they were on number 11 and we were number 52....but it's worth the wait! and the staff is efficient at moving people in and out without being rude.

They also sell cakes and pre-packed pints and gallons...and freeze dried ice cream for doggies!

Update: I recently went back to Mitchell's after they remodeled the inside of the store and i gotta say...wow, it's really white in there! haha, but in a clean and not so hospitally way...you know what i mean?

So the set up is different now, no, you still order with a number but you can actually see the ice cream flavors in their bins now. The wall is gone, so it's all open. It's more set up like BR, where you can see into the freezer and on the window is the ice cream flavor name and description.

I did think it was weird that they gave me my two junior scoops in a plastic cap for a cup...Maybe they were running low on supplies? but they never do that...so maybe they're changing their ways? but i gotta say, i liked the paper cups better...i dunno, just personal preference.

The staff, as always, is friendly yet knows how to move crowds in and out quickly without being rude (it really is a well defined skill).

And the ice cream of course, is the same 'ol goodness. I love when they have seasonal flavors. One time, I had Thai Iced Tea flavored ice cream...it was SO good. yum!

Can't wait to go back!
author: N C.

description:
Pumpkin ice cream is back and oh so very delish!

I order a mitchell's ice cream cake for just about every occassion and it's always a big hit at the parties.  The big hit flavors have been mexican chocolate, mango, ube and avocado.  My son loves the french custard vanilla but you really can't go wrong wtih any of the flavors from mitchell's.
author: Michelle D.

description:
one word...ORGASMIC! 

u wont regret coming here. dont be intimated by the crowd waiting for their numbers to be called. whats 10 mins wait for an orgasmic scoop of ice cream? the numbers come fast, u'd forget how long u have waited when u taste the ice cream!
author: Elly G.

description: Very solid place. The lines are crazy long and there's no seating whatsoever, but the flavors make up for it. The flavors we got were the Mexican chocolate, pear, toasted almond, and white pistachio. While all the flavors were delicious, the highlights were the Mexican chocolate with the hint of cinnamon and the pear (tasted like a crushed pear). Mmm.
author: Seila K.

description: I finally had my first Mitchell's ice cream today! I didn't know what to order so I got the typical rocky road. To my surprise, the rocky road was really delicious! The marshmellow was soft and the ice cream melted in my mouth. I can't wait to try the other flavors as this will be the spot for some ice cream in San Francisco.
author: Edgar G.

description:
Yummy yummers!

My favs are pumpkin (seasonal) and Mexican chocolate

Quite the treat!!!
author: Abby W.

description: I love the creamy texture of their ice cream - so heavenly - like a dream.
author: Ryan Y.

description: Best traditional ice cream in town! Must try the grasshopper pie, it's my favorite! Love his place!
author: Jordan B.

description:
BUKO BUKO...I love the young coconut ice cream at Mitchell's.  I can eat gallons...ok...maybe pints...of this stuff.   Besides the classic flavors, they have many exotic tropical varieties...such as Ube (Purple Yam), Halo Halo, Mango and Thai Tea.

This place is always packed with a large crowd of people.  There's a small parking lot in the back.  

Tip: Take a number, wait your turn and sample some flavors before you choose.  Buy pints to take home.

Enjoy!
author: Lis A.

description:
another hole in the wall while visiting the bay area!

Filipinos will love the variety!  UBE flavor is the purple ice cream that's awesome!  Mango flavor is the best selling!  

long lines, small parking lot.............but WELL worth it!
author: Richard d.

description:
Nice Ice Cream place.

I wouldn't come here everyday.

I have many memories here.

Very good and I tell other people who have some sort of ice cream crave to check this place out.
author: Dani D.

description:
What's with all the ice cream? It's been hot. I deserve it. 'Nuff said.

I've been going to Mitchell's since I was but a wee lass. We would have dinner at my grandparents' house, and when that was through, all of the kids would pile into the car and we would head to get ice cream.

Now that I'm older, Mitchell's is just as amazing as I remembered it to be. The ice cream is still creamy, the flavors are still spectacular, and the line is a monster on a hot day. They've dealt with this popularity well, and they have a little number dispenser. However, on a hot night after dinnertime, it's a long wait, but it's entirely worth it. The chocolate is rich and amazing. It's a bit chewy, and heaven knows I like to chew my ice cream. I also sometimes chew my orange juice, but that's for special occasions. Try something different! Try the specials! Try a classic! Just try it!
author: Amy L.

description:
Despite the fact that it's almost always disgustingly crowded to the point where there are people standing around outside waiting for their ice cream, it's completely understandable - as they make the best ice cream in the city; in my opinion. They've got a multitude of flavors, and even have carts carrying ones that you can take home. Perfect place to go when you're carrying a sweet tooth, but I wouldn't recommend going here when there's a heat wave going on. I guarantee you will be stuck waiting for quite some time. 

But it's worth it.
author: Thea G.

description:
I absolutely love Mitchell's Ice Cream. I use to be a former fan of Polly Ann's but ever since my sister brought me to Mitchell's, I've made a 180. This place is great! The people are always friendly and ready to serve! The scoops are so ridiculously generous that the money is worth it. And so are the lines!

Sometimes, the lines can be ridiculously long and you can wait at least an hour before getting a whiff of that ice cream. But really, soo worth it. The ice cream is so rich, you won't believe it.

I've only tried two flavors at Mitchell's so far: Chocolate Caramel Crackle, and Thai Tea. The Chocolate Caramel Crackle is soooo rich and creamy but hella hella good. It's so sweet! Caramel oozes out of the chocolate and you have to keep up licking that ice cream. There are also bits and pieces of crispy chunks of chocolate (I think)--hence, the "Crackle". You'll find yourself at a loss for words eating this monster. The Thai Tea is pretty good too, can't complain. While the ice cream is just as rich, the flavor is light but not too light to not taste anything at all. It's perfection at its best. Waffle cones aren't too bad either.
author: Victoria N.

description: Amazing ice cream for sure.  I had the white pistachio and the Mexican chocolate.  Both were to die for and so rich.  Just what I needed.
author: Kameron H.

description: I was really going to give it 3 stars... but because I also had Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe the same day, Mitchell's was my favorite of the three. I'm not saying Mitchell's was bad or anything. The ube flavored ice cream tasted great. The thing is... it tastes like the  ube ice cream at John's in Berkeley. The only difference is that Mitchell's is 80 cents more, and John's gives you more and doesn't charge extra for a sugar cone. That is why I wanted to give Mitchell's 3 stars.
author: Vera W.

description:
I came here without any prior knowledge of this place with a friend who is more familiar of this place since she lives in San Francisco area herself.  I thought this is just gonna be any other ice cream places I had been to like Baskins-Robbins or Cold Stone. I went inside and I quickly looked and my thoughts were:

"Wow this place looks boring."

"Why is there only a bunch of guys working the counter? WER DEM LADIEZ  AT!?" (note this was shouted in my mind)

So, I was a bit disappointed after just first minute of stepping in. Luckily, it seems to be a slow day/hour as there's barely any people in there.
I proceeded then to survey the flavors. Yeah, I saw interesting names for their ice creams like Mexican chocolate or something. Then I saw the flavor UBE (taro, purple yam) then my eyes nearly popped out. This flavor is like my kryptonite. It's presence alone makes my tongue hang out, my mouth drool and my hands going for my wallet to pay tribute to its awesome flavor. I looked up from their freezer section and looked up at the menu board to see the prices. LO AND BEHOLD, my eyes just so happened to rest upon a picture of a Filipino dessert (I'm Filipino) called HALO-HALO.
My eyes almost popped out of their respective sockets.
I nearly collapsed there and then. My mental state quickly became like a fast train on a railroad track with a mindset to purchasing that dessert. $5 plus taxes later, I got my Halo-halo. It's HUGE! That's what she said.
I mean my friend, she said that about my dessert portion.

Though technically they used Ube ice cream instead of the usual ube mashed style, it was made of awesomeness nonetheless.
It's even way better than the Filipino stores like Chow King and Goldilocks that I'd been to in the SF Bay Area.
For sure, I'm definitely coming back here.
author: Cy C.

description: Love this ice cream store. Its really good, the flavor is just...the best you can ask in San Francisco. Love the service, even though they should add more seatings so we can enjoy the scenery. Plus, i live only 2 blocks away so it is very awesome that i can just swing by anytime to get some ice cream!!
author: Cavin T.

description:
Wowwww--- why is this like the best ice cream place ever?! I usually go to Bi-Rite but last Saturday the line was wayyy too ridicuously long; seriously a block long. I've been wanting to try Mitchell's and that night was my first night and I'm SO glad I went!

I was number 101 and they were on number 58 when I got there...so i waited for 30 mins for ice cream. :) They had all sorts of flavors- tropical and swweet decadent ones, and even treats like halo-halo and ice cream sandwiches! I tried a bunch of flavors and I ended up going with the Buco ice cream on a cone with an oreo.. the BF had the Cookies and Cream and Peanut Butter Induldence. Everything was AMAZING. The cookies and cream had like 10 full oreos in it and the PB had super chunky pb in it..loved everything. 

Will definitely be back here for more treats and it is totally worth the wait!!
author: Joy A.

description:
I love the ice cream but I had a terrible experience here last night. My party of 6 arrived at 10:50pm after painting our friend's new apartment and we knew they closed at 11pm so we were not entirely sure we would get served. However, a manager or some worker with clout came out and told us that as long as we had a number before they locked the doors, we'd get served...

We had #52 and when we got there they were serving #15, so we waited patiently, and waited some more. So 11:35 rolls around and they stop calling numbers and eventually there were no more customers inside. Only the 6 of us, another party of 6 and a third party of 2. 

So the 14 of us went without ice cream. If the worker who came out at 11 and told everyone that people with numbers would be served had instead told us to go home, we could have saved 35 minutes of standing on their sidewalk, expecting a sweet treat. I can empathize with workers who want to go home on the closing shift, but you have to be honest and forthright with your customers. 

I had a conversation through the locked door with an employee who said they had called numbers and people stopped responding. That was a flat out lie.  I was holding ticket #52 and the "NOW SERVING" board said 44. Another check on this is to see what the next ticket in the ticket dispenser would be and to call all numbers up to this number. I am really disappointed in my experience and wanted to post this to let the customer beware. Next time, I'll probably go to Maggie Mudd's instead.
author: aaron f.

description:
With so many reviews there isn't much that needs to be said: Fantastic ice cream with great flavors. 

I will point out that I always get away with more than three samples. Plus, my trick is that instead of ordering a cone, for $5.10 I buy a pint split with two flavors and take it home. The employees put forth an incredible effort packing the ice cream into each pint... they must have a thing against air pockets in their pints... makes me happy!
author: David L.

description:
I'm not a big fan of ice cream.  I'm not one of those girls that has a tub in their freezer all the time, but Mitchell's is a whole different place -their level of ice cream is hard to compare to any other creamery!!

Couple tips I tell everyone when I recommend this place:
1) Bring cash
2) Get a number when you first walk up and then debate what you will get (the line normally moves pretty fast)
3) Always taste test something different and new when you go, even if you always end up getting the same thing
4) There is never a bad day to go to Mitchell's, just go! 

My current favorite is pumpkin.  I do love these flavors too: mint chip! buko! macapuno! and mango sorbet!!
author: Leslie U.

description:
Not your typical Ice cream parlor!!  No where to sit (except for a bench outside the door) & it's ALWAYS busy!  That doesn't stop folks from coming through.

I was born & raised in SF and always had Mithcell's in my life!!  Ice cream is the best I have (and ever will have) in my life!  My favorite is the Mango!
author: B N.

description:
Okay, Mitchell's is good. But it's not THAT good that I feel like standing in line for 25 minutes just for a scoop.  By the time I get it, the fog has rolled back in, and I'm cold. Gotta run to the car and turn the heater on just to enjoy my treat.

One of a kind, though, that's for sure, and I hope it never closes.
author: Holly B.

description:
i love ice cream! but i hate no parking and long lines. 
i've been here a couple of times and i enjoy their ice cream so much that i'll park blocks away and wait 30 minutes. 
staff is very friendly and i love how they give me as many samples as i want.. i tried the mexican chocolate the last time i was in and it was very tasty.. i suggest getting it with scoop of plain vanilla or something cause its very rich! my BF got the halo halo which im not so fond of.. but i actually tried the ice cream and it was delish! my birthday is coming up and i would actually enjoy an ice cream cake from them.. so if anyone down to get me one.. yay it'll be the best cake yet! suprise me with a flavor! LOL! :)
author: Jenn T.

description: Worth the drive and wait! I have been coming since I can remember, the taste is like no other, some complain about the wait (after all we are living in the me and now no wait society), but you for me it's worth the drive from San Jose and well worth the wait! No flavor recommendations here for they have different flavors for different tastes!
author: Veronica S.

description:
Discovered this amazing ice cream recently when someone brought a pint of the Buko (baby coconut) to a dinner party. I was craving more of it for days, and finally just drove out there and bought a half gallon (wish I bought more as it lasted only a few days).

I've since gone back a few times and tried various other flavors such as Pumpkin, Dulce de Leche, and Pistachio.

The parking lot in back I've found is always full, but street parking is not too hard to come by.
author: Naveen N.

description:
This place has been around forever and it only gets better with time ....

i remember growing up walking distance to this place and holy cow what a dream for a kid ;)
author: Moises M.

description:
Mexican Chocolate...

I love chocolate, but the added twist of cinnamon is to die for.

I've been going here since I was a little girl (I'm 28 now) with my dad.  They were the only ones who sold filipino flavors at the time--mango, ube, macapuno, halo halo... My dad has a discriminating palette for filipino flavors, so the fact that he still desires the same ice cream for almost twenty years says a lot.
author: rachel r.

description:
Forget Disneyland. This is the happiest place on earth.

I'm an extremely fortunate girl that I live in walking distance of one of the greatest ice cream shops in the country (no joke, they've been rated in several national reviews). It's really the perfect spot to go to on that foggy San Francisco in July afternoon. There's always a line out the door, no matter what the weather. 

You will be satisfied with any flavor you choose, but the mango ice cream is to die for. No really, it is!
author: Rachel K.

description:
Ok, so I'm not a big ice cream fan...fine, I love it, but isn't it so much easier to "hate" foods that are bad for you?!

After eating a delicious juicy taco, what's a better way than to finish off the evening with some delicious creamy ice cream from Mitchell's? After asking a few people, we finally found someone who knew where Mitchell's was & we could tell we were close, when we could see people eating ice cream outside from a block away.

Walk into the little store & grab a number, similar to a deli or meat counter at a grocery store. They have a ton of different flavors, the normal ones and some pretty unique ones (like avocado) as well as some dairy free sorbets (although they did not have any soy options). They had a lot of different topping options; sprinkles, gummy candy, waffle cones, dip cones, hot fudge, caramel sauce, strawberry sauce, and many more things to choose from. If you can't decide, you can order the special sundae of the month (this month had a fourth of July, red, white & blue theme), I'm sure you will be happy with whatever it is. 

I ordered rocky road (which had a lot of marshmallows in it) & avocado, which went surprisingly well with the rocky road. Both flavors were extremely creamy and melted in your mouth (literally!). My friend ordered a sundae, with rocky road & rum/raisin ice cream, hot fudge, whipped cream, Oreos, caramel sauce, nuts & a cherry on top. Wow, it was delicious!!

If I ever get a craving for ice cream (which I hope I never do), I am definitely going back to Mitchell's, it was amazing! 


P.S. I am not eating tomorrow & I am going to run like 10 miles!
author: Elaine S.

description:
My childhood Ice cream spot!!!

I will always remember my parents bringing me and my sisters here to get some ice cream especially mango and ube ice cream!!! My #1 spot to go to for dessert!!! I will never stop going here and now I take my family there and they can remember this shop!!! 

The Ice cream there is soooooooooo DELICIOUS!!!! Yummy for my tummy!!!!

They have also long lines out the dorr but it is really worth the wait!  It use to be 5-10 minutes away from us now its 45 to a hour but we will always come back for more!
author: Joce B.

description: Wow.  I was surprised at the long line on a Sunday afternoon when I got there.  After parking 2 blocks away and waiting 10-20 minutes until they call my number, I was starting to get impatient with all of the suspense.  I'll have to say, the wait was worth it.  I sampled several tropical flavors (ube, halo halo, and peruvian fruit) before finally settling down on sweet coconut even though I haven't sampled that one.  Sweet coconuts had actual coconut chunks in it which made me feel less guilty as I gorged the ice cream and the waffle cone down my throat.
author: Ronald L.

description:
there's still a line that overcrowds to the outside, even when it's cold outside, but I'm going to have to lower my rating because this place has seemed to have lost their touch of something special.  I hope it's not because I was fighting off seasonal allergies, but even all my friends who are locals and tried several different flavors agreed that their ice cream is starting to taste just like regular ice cream.  

And it's not like I've had anything special while out in Afghanistan, although it is something special to have a dude sitting there scooping the ice cream for you that makes you want to have ice cream more... I just realized that you have to be here to know what I mean about that.  But anyways, I'll give Mitchell's another try before deciding to ditch them for Ghiradelli's again, so Mitchell's had better step it up if they hope to keep up their legendary status.
author: Christopher E.

description:
Sometimes, I just don't know what all the fuss is about.  Here I am, standing 30 minutes in line out in the cold during a foggy day waiting for some gosh darn good ice cream.  Then, I wait inside a little more where I am getting pushed around by little youngins screaming and running because they are all sugar high and want a third scoop of ice cream.

Okay, yeah, Mitchell's is supposed to be the BEST ice cream place in the city. So, maybe it is worth the wait and pain while my hearing slowly diminishes from the screaming in the tiny store.

Finally, ages later, my number gets called and I am up in the front of the register ordering my delicious ice cream! How I've waited for this moment for so long.  I save my ice cream and run into the car to enjoy every moment, but to my disappointment, it was just not as good as I had hoped it to be.  Maybe all the waiting made me expect something out of this world, but it just tasted like another scoop of ice cream to me.

Three stars for some decent yummy ice cream, but to be honest, I probably would not go through the wait again.  I'll be heading to Bi-rite to satisfy my ice cream cravings.
author: Sarah T.

description:
I already love ice cream as it is. So, when I was told I needed to go to Mitchell's I practically begged my friend to take me! 
I love this place! It's a little small, but it's like an SF-landmark. 
I suggest the avocado ( I know, but it tastes nothing like an actual avocado) and mango flavor. I didn't know which one to get, so I got a scoop of both and they were both amazing.
author: Christine S.

description: Great tasting ice cream and the number system for serving customers makes a lot of sense for a high-volume ice cream store.
author: Forest S.

description: ube, macapuno, mango, halo halo. so good. so creamy. nuff said.
author: Roy N.

description: All I can say is...Kahlua Mocha Cream! Yummmy! Eating this reminds me of eating ice cream in the Philippines. Going to Mitchell's and most of their flavors brings me back to my roots and is comforting to me. I just wish they have a better way to deal with the crowds.
author: Eunice M.

description: Mitchell's was a staple of my childhood.  Nothing can rival a huge scoop of peppermint ice cream towering on a cone.  This is what happiness tastes like.
author: Tamara N.

description:
I have been coming here since I was a little kid.  Home-made ice cream with hundreds of flavors.

Come here for the unique flavor choices like lychee and taro.

This is a true San Francisco treat!!!
author: Raider J.

description: Lines might me log but the ice cream is worth it- hand spun and super creamy. I will never buy store bought again. The mexican chocolate is devine- as is the Pistachio.
author: Alex Z.

description:
It's the funniest thing... even on the coldest winter night, I'll roll up to Mitchell's and there's always a line. A LINE. 

What's that all about? 

Oh I know... it's the Pear Sorbet, yep. That's it. And it's not always in stock. So don't go with your heart set on it. Make sure you have a back up ready so your eyes don't well with tears when the guy behind the counter says "sorry charlie".

OK, so a nice second to that? How about their Lychee, or a nice standard like Pralines and Cream. mmm - damn. I think I just put on a couple of pounds just thinking about Mitchell's.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
I do wish they'd start a mail order service like Ben and Jerry's and Moxley's Ice Cream. Some days I could really use my Mitchell's fix.

Now that I live on the East Coast (and now that global warming has made even the winters freaky-warm), I often crave Mitchell's mango, buko, macapuno, ube, and/or avocado ice creams.  I grew up on this stuff -- My parents loved it because it reminded them of home, and I loved it for the unique flavors you usually can't find elsewhere. Lordy how I miss this place.
author: angela n.

description:
Definitely worth the wait.. We stopped by on Sunday evening and there were 40! (Yes, 40) people ahead of us in queue. We took our token number and were eagerly waiting for our number to be called. 

While we were waiting, a nice old lady came up to us and gave us her number, and our wait was shortened from 40 people to 25 people. 

We spent a good 15 mins before our number was called trying to identify the flavor. My wife likes Cantaloupe (It was their "Flavor of the month") and I am a chocolate fan. 

We tried a few and ended up getting Cantaloupe. It was different but excellent! And probably how Cantaloupe ice cream should taste. Their Mango is very good as well (We got a pint home) and we also tasted their Mojito Sorbet.

Its a regular stop for us whenever we go to the city, and is superb!
author: Manish P.

description:
First tip, if you're here on the weekend, expect at least 20 min wait.  I came here on Sunday late afternoon, and waited about 25 minutes.  It's like going to Dim Sum, where you get a number and just wait endlessly.  This little place was packed with people, and all Halo-Halo dessert were made by order (that guy was using a measuring cup for the ingredients on my order, running around to get different things).

Mitchell's ice-cream was definitely worth waiting for.  It tends to be a bit too creamy and very rich in taste.  Here're my recommended flavors:
1.  Tropical 4 (all the fresh fruity taste will fire up all your taste buds on your first bite, so deliciously addictive)
2.  Halo Halo (Need I say more? mixed flavored and fun beans mixed with coconut and purple yam ice-cream)
3. Ube (Don't be intimidated by its bright purple color, it's not radioactive like I used to thought..  It's the famous purple yam tropical flavor)
4. Kuala Mocha (THE BEST coffee/mocha ice-cream, hands down!)

After we got our ice-creams, we walked out triumphantly with a lot of envy stare from others who were still waiting. hehehheheh....
author: Carina N.

description: The ice cream at Mitchell's is to die for!!! They have a nice variety of ice creams. I got grasshopper. Although there was a longer wait when I was there it was well worth the wait! I wish that I still lived in the area. The only issue is that there is not much space inside of the building. Be sure to take a number and walk back outside if needed. I was not aware that I needed a number, so I waited in the line only to find out that I needed a number. But still a fantastic place!
author: Simone C.

description:
mMMmm perfect place to go after dinner at the Front Porch!

# 96 on the 7x7 100 things to eat before you die: Baby-coconut ice cream 
CHECK!!!

Be sure to grab a number and try a dallop of avocado. The only word for it is: "interesting..." YUM. Now if only it wasn't so far...
author: Christina L.

description:
Until a few weeks ago, I had only tried Mitchell's from a tub; mostly at Asian supermarkets.  But as far as ice cream goes in the city, Mitchell's is pretty iconic.  I came here to start a feasting adventure after an intense craving for ice cream.  All of the flavors here are reliably good, but what I enjoy the most are the selection of tropical flavors which you don't see often at other shops.  Most of my favorite flavors are those tropical flavors like lychee, ube, green tea, avocado and halo halo.  The ice cream is rich with great texture and good flavor.  On this particular occasion, I got the halo halo sundae with the ube ice cream and the entire mixture of fruits, ice and jelly thingies (it's a technical term).   The whole thing really sweetened up my day and absolutely hit the spot.  

The line here can get pretty long from what I've heard but when I went it wasn't too bad.  It was maybe a 10 minute wait, which is well worth the ice cream that lies within.
author: Gary L.

description: I finally made it down there this week, we waited in line for at least a half hour, there was no where to sit and we were knee deep in after school kids elbowing their way to the counter, but it was ALL WORTH IT.  YUM.  I tested the ube since everyone was raving about it on here, and did not feel like it was for me.  So I stuck with a classic and a seasonal must haves: chocolate, pumpkin, waffle cone.  WOW that was really good, I mean really good.  I did not mind having to stand on the smelly sidewalk licking my cone shamelessly  it was so good.  We got some to take home too, the sweet coconut.  It is by far some of the best ice cream I have ever had, and let me tell you I am an ice cream connoisseur.
author: M M.

description:
Dear makers of Mitchell's Ice Cream,

I would like to thank you.  Thank you for the oh so devine and delicious electric purple colored ube ice cream that I love to eat on a tasty sugar cone.  Thank you yummy ube for making my ass the size of a Mac truck grill.

Yes, I would also like to thank you for Halo Halo ice cream...with your tasty adzuki beans and other various sugary treats contained inside your oh so wonderful ube/macapuno flavored ice cream.  Thank you for my belly the size of high performance sports car rear tire.

And while I'm at it, thank you for your chocolate caramel crackle, mango, toasted almond, banana nut and decadent peanut butter heavenly goodness.  Because your delicious flavors come in handy prepackaged half gallons, I can eat them to my chubby, not so little heart's content in the comfort of my own home.  

Thank you Mitchell's Ice Cream, for making me a bigger person!
author: Christy L.

description:
I dunno... I wasn't blown away by this place. I'm a chocolate ice cream lover and, to be frank, the chocolate sucked. It was way too dark, not very creamy... just not the kind of chocolate ice cream that really makes you go "wow!". I took a bite and I was severely disappointed. I'm basically only giving it 3 stars because my fiance loved his vanilla custard, and it was pretty good when I took a bite of it. Other than that... I'd definitely prefer another ice cream shop. 

I also couldn't understand what the hell the employee was saying. I first asked him if I could try a sample of the Mexican Chocolate, because I had no idea what the difference between Mexican Chocolate and regular chocolate is (Mexican has cinnamon in it). And he said something, and I said "what??" and he repeated it... and I still didn't understand him, so I was having one of those moments like "I know he's not speaking clearly but I don't want to sound like a moron by asking him again", so I go "Never mind, I'll just have a double scoop of regular chocolate in a waffle cone". He comes back w/ a sample of Mexican Chocolate. So I try it, and kind of stare at him for a few seconds... like... remember? I just gave you my order? and then I say "I'll just have a double scoop of regular chocolate". And he asks what kind of cone.  *awkward* 

I don't ding them on the long wait because they really do have a good system where you pick a number then stand around til it gets called out, so it's not like someone can cut in front of you or anything. 

3 Stars. I just didn't like it!
author: Meghan K.

description:
If I could have Mitchell's ice cream everyday, I would! Unfortunately, there exists 420 miles between my love and I. Sad panda. Anyway, I've had the luxury of visiting Mitchell's twice during trips up north; both times have left me filled to the rim and still craving for more. 

Two summers ago was the first visit, after taking a number and waiting in line for about thirty minutes (it was very crowded, I assume we came around peak hours - 6pm), I requested to taste test about 5 flavors even though I wanted to try just about every single flavor. I felt bad for the employee scooping for me, she was so patient about my indecisive-ness.  After much debating about which flavors to get (if they weren't all delectable, I wouldn't have had such a difficult time, gosh Mitchell's. I joke, please continue serving delicious ice cream), I decided on three scoops in a cup; peach, mango and halo halo. The tropical flavors are amazing, actually, their ice cream in general is amazing, smooth, buttery and very refreshing.

The second visit was last Christmas, my sisters and I had been raving about Mitchell's and always complained about our constant craving for it; so my parents naturally were very intrigued. This time, my sister (an avid yelper) made sure to read up on when the place would be least populated and we arrived at Mitchell's on a Tuesday around 4:30pm. There were only one or two people, which meant we could taste test any and all the flavors we wanted without having to worry about the customers behind us. My family and I wanted everything... So we compromised, each of us would get the three different scoops in a cup and we'd share. Not a good idea when you absolutely love a particular flavor (Pear Sorbet) and everyone else ends up loving it just as much; needless to say, my scoop of Pear was completely demolished after a few bites. Which left me with the Kahlua Mocha Cream and Jackfruit scoops, not that I dislike them or anything, those flavors taste wonderful. There is just something about that Pear sorbet though...I can't shake the taste off my tongue, so savory, it was like biting into a real pear but better. Ever since then, eating ice cream in So Cal just hasn't been the same; like my taste-buds are missing something from their little lives.
author: Chriss P.

description:
Halo halo and Ube bring back childhood memories of going to "Coco Banana" in Westborough. 

Rum Raisin is GOOD. Creamy, but I wish there were more rum soaked raisins. Almost better than Haagen Daaz. Almost.
author: Derrick L.

description:
The guy that helped me was wonderfully patient.  I sampled 7 flavors and made  my own 1/2 gallon to take home.  

Make sure to take a number off to the left.  Wait in the crowd and turn your listening ears on.  When your number gets called push your way up and begin sampling and deciding.
author: Anon P.

description: it looks good   i wish i could go to San Francisco for Mitchel's ice cream wow amazing
author: Cool Robbie H.

description: Man this place is crowded, and on a late night around 9pm it gets even worst. Remember, parking is scarce and please, please remember to take a number other wise you'll be standing there looking like a newby or standing in line forever and left pondering as to why they are calling numbers. Then you turn to the next person and ask, "...did you get a number?" Can you tell that's happened to me because I know so much about it? Yeah, Guilty first name Dumb last name A--! Ok now for the cream. Call me weird but I tried the avocado and loved it. Loved it so much I almost wanted to head to a safeway to pick up a guacamole mix and chopped tomatoes to make a guac ice cream. Guacamole by the way I can eat without chips because I love it so damn much. The next best thing, the Newy York Maraschino Cherry with a choco dip shell and gotta say it's my favorite right now. Awesome
author: graham c.

description:
We used to live down the street from Mitchell's when I was a kid.  At least 3x a week I'd scrape together the change (money was tight!) and my friends and I would saunter down there in our little school girl outfits to stand in front of the cases and drive the guy behind the counter nuts...what flavor to pick? to dip or not to dip? sugar cone or regular?  Each time I'd look longing at all the other flavors, do the taste test, then order the same thing I alwasy did, scoop of coffee on a sugar cone, never dipped.  I always wanted to dip, but was afraid the chocolate would somehow overwhelm the coffee goodness.  Yes, they have a million flavors and I'm sure they're all good - but no one can beat their coffee ice cream, all creamy and rich.  

Yes, sometimes it's crazy crowded, and it's not the most convenient location, plus that parking lot is a bitch to maneuver around in - so that long ass line winding around the building is just confirmation that it MUST be good.  And once you've wrapped your tongue around it's cold creamy goodness you'll agree, 

So five stars to Mitchell's because aside from have great ice cream it's one of the few things/places in life that remain as good today as I remember it was in my childhood.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
Seriously every time I drive by this place there is a long ass line of people.  I think and ponder and decide it is not worth parking and standing in line for an hour for.  

Today though at 5pm when I was driving by, there was no line outside.  So I parked and went inside and got some ice cream.  Service was fine, the staff is young but they are used to people demanding lots from them.  There were plenty of flavors to choose from, and we got several to take home.

The one comment I have to make is that the cookies n cream lacked enough cookie.  I ended up buying some Oreos and adding it to my ice cream.............

Other than that, everything else was worth it.  As good as I remembered.  

Really should be 4 stars but because it's been 4 months of me driving by waiting for no line, I had to dock a star.  

Maybe with time, as i get it more often and love it again as much as I did in previous years I can move it up to 4 stars again.
author: Denise B.

description: Have you ever woken up at 3 a.m. to find your friend standing at the kitchen counter, shoveling ice cream into his gullet directly from the container?  He's not crying, this isn't an emotional thing.  He's just going at it like a madman, a euphoric look on his face. He is ashamed when you happen upon him in the middle of this act but does not stop.  Mitchell's Oreo ice cream will do that to you.  Its sad really.
author: Christopher R.

description:
Great place to go on a date or to take an out of town guest.  Otherwise, I'm more about quantity over quality and would rather run to the Safeway down the street and buy a gallon of ice cream.  Mitchell's is not expensive by any means (especially compared to Baskin Robbins or Ben and Jerry's)...but sometimes you just want to open the freezer door and have a gallon of love waiting for you in the middle of the night.

**If you like mint and chocolate, try the Grasshopper Pie (it's mint, oreo and fudge!).
author: Tabatha Y.

description:
I was really hoping to give Mitchell's more stars, but I really can't. I went there on a Sunday night, and we had to wait forever, but that part of was ok. They have numbers like at a deli, so it isn't bad. The flavors were so facinating that I had trouble deciding what I wanted. 

I went for the halo-halo ice cream because it was a combination of coconuts, sweet purple yam, tropical beans, and some other stuff. But it really wasn't that great. It tasted sweet, but didn't really have a distinctive flavor. Plus there were big ice chunks in it. Maybe I just picked a bad flavor.

I didn't get any toppings or anything because they just use smuckers stuff like you buy at the grocery store. How boring is that?
author: Lauren H.

description:
YES PLEASE!

The line is a little annoying, but it's totally worth it.  The dulce de leche was creamy and sweet, while the halo halo ice cream was a decent approximation of actual halo halo...though I don't remember giant green and red chewy things from my child hood.

But the base ice cream is clearly excellent, so I'll have to make my way down here again and again to try some other flavors.
author: Mark C.

description:
A tasty home style ice cream shop in the city.

It's always packed especially around closing which speaks to its amazing reputation to locals and visitors alike. I've been here 5-6 times and haven't been disappointed yet. The ice cream is great and the flavors are novel.

If you are vegan - you may be out of luck as all of the items do have milk (no sorbets)
author: Sachin T.

description:
yumyumyum. this place is pretty awesome for a number of reasons:
 
1. parking lot in the back. brownie points since we all know parking in sf is a nightmare. 
2. well organized. come in, pull a number and wait to be served. no confusion. you get your own server who takes their time to offer samples :D
3. cool employees, nice, fast and efficient
4. goood ice cream with a great variety
5. CHEAP!! we got two huge scoops on sugar cones for less than $6
6. made my friend happy after a bad day.
author: Serena L.

description:
Wow, I'm surprised I never wrote a review for this place yet. I've been going here much more recently and its really all about the ice cream. The line sucks and the parking is OK at best (hey, at least they provide some parking instead of making us rely on the street right?).

I've tried most of their ice cream already and I highly suggest doing the same. You can't really go wrong with any flavor. After hearing about how they make their Halo halo (not the ice cream, the actual mix of food, ice, milk,etc) I had to try it and yes, it was the best halo halo i've had in america. You still can't beat the fresh stuff in the Philippines (Boracay) but yea, pretty amazing. 
Minus 1 star for location, parking and long line.
author: Mike B.

description:
I think compared to other SF ice cream places this has been around the longest so I think for the most part its popular by default. I've been several times and although I like it, I am not a big fan of the whole milk/butter/slow churned ice cream taste. The ice cream tastes too much like milk for my taste and EXTREMELY rich. Last time I had some kind of chocolate caramel vanilla and it was so rich I didnt even finish it.  I feel like it tastes like a home made dreyers ice cream. 
I am sure other flavors are delicious, but I am more into the non traditional ice cream flavors like they have a slocume or bi rite.....but for everyone else i am sure this will be a hit!
author: Petri Y.

description:
I don't get it.  After hearing over and over how great this place was, my roomie and I finally swung by with my mom and little brother who were visiting from out of town.  It was a summer evening--the wait was FORTY-FIVE minutes to get an ice cream cone.  Seriously, take a number.  

We thought we'd be smart and skip the line by just buying a whole gallon, 'cause we're all big ice cream fans.  We didn't go for anything exotic (something with chocolate and caramel).  We took it home, dug in . . . and the ice cream tasted like freezerburn.  And not even like good ice cream that had been freezerburned--you could tell it had never been rich and creamy and delicious in its life, just cold and stale.  Sigh . . . The uneaten gallon was still in our freezer when we moved out months later, which given our devotion to sweets was completely tragic.
author: Elisabeth D.

description:
Mitchell's...after all these years, still at the top of your game!!! 
5 STARS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Popped by here a few evenings ago...on a surprisingly balmy pre-Spring eve in SF...of course the line was out the door....no worries, it was a line for ice cream, we weren't being drafted...and besides, Mitchells is sooooo worth the wait!

I selected the Tropical Four (mangoes/pineapple, et all) in a waffle cone  **5 STARS
My comrades had, respectively Oreo Cookie and Strawberry in sugar cones!!!  ** 5 STARS each

They have a wonderful selection, always, of ice creams///ice cream cakes/pies....some I adore and some I just like...but I have never came away from Mitchell's going "oh, that was terrible or average" it's always very good to EXcellent!!!!   Very friendly staff...and considering how many people are streaming in and outta there, they are very pleasant net efficient at making the lines move!!! Gotta love that!!

Celebrity sighting flashback....so, back in 2004, I was moseying into Mitchell's on a Sunday evening...and the line wasn't out the door but there were people attempting to exit and enter Mitchell's at the same time...fortunately, a very tall, handsome man with dark skin and beautiful smile (sparking white/perfect "Chiclet" like teeth) in a brown bomber jacket and jeans, from inside Mitchell's, held the door out/open so people could exit and then enter...while he waited, the he stepped out....As if his gallant/charming behavior and striking features weren't enough, the lady who I got in line behind said "OH MY GOD...did you just see that guy?  Was BENJAMIN BRATT!!!!!!!!!!!"   Yes, even gorgeous Benny B enjoys the offereings of Mitchell's!! It was revealed later in the media that his wife, actress/model Talilsa Soto, was expecting a baby...so perhaps Mitchell's was a craving for the mom to be??    Anyway, I always think of that when I go to Mitchell's... but even with no celebrities about, it's STILL so worth a visit!!  With the warm weather expected this weekend, I'm sure you will not be alone!
author: Karen S.

description: yummmy ice cream!!! I wish it was march every month so i can have my Irish coffee flavor back! But other than that i love avocado, ube, dulce de leche,  white pistachio and the list goes on! There's always a little line over here or longer on warm SF days but other than that its all good! If you havent tried any tropical flavors, DO IT! you wont regret it!
author: Nikka L.

description: YUM!!  Halo halo, coconut pineapple, espresso toffee crunch.  All delicious flavors.  Very creamy and thick but not too sweet.   My husband got me a ice cream cake for my birthday it was coffee with chocolate syrup/cake.. and it was extremely heavenly!!  Be prepared for long lines though...
author: Margie C.

description:
San Francisco Institution.

On a warm day the line will be out the door. I love this place. Super yummy ice cream and you get to sample the goods before deciding on a flavor(s). 

Creamy ice cream and lots of flavors from traditional vanilla, chocolate, rocky road to avocado and Mexican hot chocolate.
author: M O.

description:
How is it I have not reviewed you yet? I would give you ten stars if I could. There is no ice cream like Mitchell's Ice Cream. None. The texture is smooth, creamy, and downright dense. The flavors are insane, and though I love to taste crazy wacky flavors like the green grasshopper, I usually don't stray far from my four favorites: mexican chocolate, white pistachio, cookies and cream, and toasted almond. Perfection. 

Would I love them even MORE if they used organic dairy products? Absolutely.
author: Lisa L.

description:
No effin' way that this ice cream is for real! Mitchell's was the creamiest, flavorful-est, and straight up happening ice cream explosion in my mouth.  Sorry for the eroticism, but this was sex on my taste buds... Okay, enough of that.  The 1000+ 5 star ratings is right on.  Waffle cone + single scoop comes out around $3.  

Parking is a matter of luck if you can grab one of the half dozen spots behind the store.  Otherwise, expect to circle around the block a half million times  =( .  At 9 pm, I waited about 30 minutes for my number to be called.  The service is quick, but it doesn't come quick enough for something this good.  There's no seating inside or out, so you're sort of relegated to standing around outside or sitting in your car.

It's a matter of opinion if the ice cream is worth the wait, but on a lazy Sunday (or any day for that matter) when you have time, make some more to enjoy some 5 star food.
author: Bobby K.

description:
Damn, this place got as huge a following as Bob's, who knew.  I guess I shouldve, I lived right around the corner from this motherfucker for the first 10 years of my life.  I remember riding my bike there and helping em decorate for halloween or easter or something, they used to always let me take decorations home after the holiday was over too.   I dont even remember what my favorite flavor was.

This is one shitty review for a great place, hahaha.
author: Hen A.

description:
Damn good.  Love the Waffle Bowl Sundae.  Worth the wait.

I once made a pact with my friend Michele that we would go here every Valentine's Day while we were both single.  Michele & I are no longer friends.  She moved to Italy to be with the ugliest man I have ever met.  And, I now live with my boyfriend less than 10 minutes from Mitchell's.  So, I ask you . . .  Who won?
author: Jeff P.

description:
Go to get ice cream at 11:30 on a freezing cold, drizzly morning, and you have to wait 20 minutes.  What more can you say?

The ice cream is the best, and very reasonably priced.  And they have lucuma ice cream.  Wow!

I'd love to see the nutrition info, which is conveniently omitted from the half gallons.  Not sure whether the ice cream or the nutrition info would be more likely to give you a heart attack.
author: Tim J.

description:
Oh I, I just died in your arms tonight
It must've been some kind of kiss
I should've walked away, I should've walked away
author: Liver W.

description:
This is the best ice cream in the city.  If you think otherwise, you are wrong.

My favorite is the "Peanut Butter Indulgence".  Rich chocolate ice cream laced with real peanut butter and what tastes like homemade peanut butter cups.  Score!

Don't get me wrong, I love Bi-Rite.  However, if you want real ice cream like you can make at home, go to Mitchell's.
author: Tim C.

description:
You haven't been to Mitchell's?  The best ice cream in San Francisco?  You've been meaning to try it but... WHAT'S WRONG WITH YOU?!?

Pumpkin, ginger, Mexican chocolate, baby coconut, chocolate bomb, thai iced tea, and, my mom's all time favorite: jack fruit.  Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum and...wha??

Oh, give my mom a break.  She lived in Bangladesh for two years before I was born and so she's got fond memories of jack fruit.  And I've got really fond memories of watching my mom eat two scoops of this flavor, chocolate dipped, on a cone.  It was as big as her head.  Seriously.   And she ate it ALL.
author: Susannah M.

description: If you've never had Mitchell's icecream, I feel bad for you.  Grew up coming here as a child and it one of my favorite memories!  Best ube, lanka, mango, that you can get.  Sure you can get Mitchell's in a huge tub at the local Asian market, but nothing beats actually going there.   Totally an SF CLASSIC.
author: L V.

description:
awesome ice cream here. home made and so many unique flavors and some of your classic favorites. i've been here 3 times and i never once left unsatisfied. i've gotten the butterscotch marble where theres butterscotch oozing out of the ice cream. the sweet coconut (macapuno) which is so sweet and coconut. loved it.

the wait always looks insane cuz theres a crowd outside but most of them arent waiting and are just eating outside. go in grab a number and the wait is like 20 mins on a friday night.
author: edward k.

description: You really need my two cents about this joint from all these reviews here and ratings and the years they've been serving the bay and the non-stop line out the door into the wee ice-cream hours?!
author: Simone F.

description: My friend love this place, so the only time I go is when she suggest it. Considering I can't tell the difference between this and store bought ice cream I find the long line that plagues this place extremely annoying.
author: Corvette M.

description:
My gf found out about this place because of the overwhelming number of great reviews it has received on Yelp.

CHEESE AND RICE, THIS PLACE IS AMAZING. GOT A WAFFLE CONE WITH MANGO SORBET. IT WAS DDEEVVVVIIIIIINNE. GF GOT PURPLE YAM. SHE LET ME HAVE A TASTE. SHOULDA HAD THAT. WE GOT A PINT OF THAT NY CHERRY FLAVOR TO GO.

It was so good.
author: Brian S.

description: Stopped in for a chocolate malt and was disappointed.  The person helping didn't seem to know what to do and forgot the malt mix....had to send it back.  The ice cream is pretty average.  The malt was lacking chocolate flavor.  At $5.90 I will not be going back anytime soon.
author: Doug B.

description: I like this place although I have't been there many times. (easier access to bi-rite) However, they did ICE CREAM right =)
author: Tiff W.

description: I'm glad I visited this place while I was in San Francisco. I will always have room in my stomach for ice cream. They have so many flavors in this shop. I decided to go with a scoop of banana ice cream in a cone, which did not disappoint. The prices are fair and the workers are nice. Be sure to arrive early to avoid the long wait because this place is popular.
author: Tim N.

description:
WOW... Mitchell's Thin Mint is better than Ghiradelli's!!!

I am officially HOOKED.
author: Nenette Y.

description:
So creammmy!
Love this stuff. So Many flavors and its reallll creammmm!
Slurp!

Love this stuff and they have cool new flavors like tropical fruits flavors.

Its and old San Francisco Favorite. Low Key. On a hot day you will see crowds until late in the night,

Its a great place to go for ice cream and impress your date that you know all the out of the way places in SF.

My grandmother ate ice cream here, my mom and dad have, and now me , thats 3 generations of ice cream licking!
author: Joe R.

description:
Chocolate Peanut Butter is my inner fat mans fantasy come to life, but the Mexican Chocolate...oh the Mexican Chocolate, no words, only intensely strong cravings for it now.   I'm almost upset that my friend got me hooked on it because that is all I can think about.  

I don't know what else to say.  Really, I don't.  That ice cream has swept me off my feet.  I am in love with Mexican Chocolate and I don't care who knows!!
author: Helen B.

description:
It's ok. I would rather get supermarket ice cream than this. 

The thai tea ice cream was a disappointment. I was expecting something more flavorful. I think their ice cream overall is decent but nothing to go out of your way for.
author: Cat D.

description:
I was modestly excited to try Mitchell's since I had heard generally good things about it, as well as an enthusiastic endorsement by our dinner host. 

It's a tiny place (as are many great shops), and quite crowded, but operated quite efficiently. I knew I would be trying the Mexican chocolate, but I struggled to choose between avocado, mango, and a bevy of other exotic fruits. ("ube," anyone?)

I tried a spoon of avocado and I hardly tasted any avocado - I could only taste sugar and a vague flavor of chemicals. I chose to play it safe with a mango scoop on top of my Mexican chocolate.

Disappointment all around. The mango looked like orange and tasted like nothing (except, again, of sugar and chemicals). The Mexican chocolate was decent, but not really that great, and unworthy of any specific plaudits.

Star breakdown:

+1.00: Yelp minimum
+0.25: Palatable Mexican chocolate
-0.50: Heinous mango
+0.50: Efficient service given crowds
+0.50: Recommending party was cute
+0.25: Required integer rounding
author: Amal D.

description:
Buko, Langka, Macapuno, Ube, and Halo Halo.....

No, this is not the starting lineup of some foreign basketball team, but rather 5 of the many wild flavors of ice cream that you can get at Mitchell's.

If you think the ice cream at your local Baskin Robbins is good, try this place out and see what top notch ice cream is supposed to taste like.  

The last time I went, I had the Mexican Chocolate, which was super rich and had a lot bigger cinnamon profile to it than "normal" chocolate.  I think I had 2 scoops in a chocolate dipped waffle cone.  

Sure the thing was probably 2000 calories, but it was oh so good.   Now I've come to the realization that Mitchell's is only 5 miles away from my work....uh oh!!  =-)

Be prepared to wait in line.  Trust me it is worth it.
author: Wade Y.

description:
My family has been eating this ice cream well before I was born because it was the only place to get mango, ube and macapuno ice cream anywhere in the 70s!  My poor dad had to go crosstown from the Sunset to get this ice cream for my mom while she was pregnant with me:)

Mitchell's is consistently delicious and has mastered ethnic flavored ice cream.  My all time favorite is buko (baby coconut) and I remember my mom brought it to school with a chocolate cake for my 6th birthday in kindergarten.  The dumb@$$ haole kids in my class thought it was vanilla and then bitched about how gross it was.  Good - more for me!!  A character-defining moment brought to you by Mitchells!
author: Marce J.

description:
Simply the best ice cream in the city. Don't go to Ghiradelli--too trendy, and well boring in comparison. Personally, I can't live without Mitchell's pumpkin ice cream. Oh man. Really, I'm starting to crave it now.

They have such an eclectic assortment of ice creams. The owners are Phillipino, and accordingly, they have some really unique flavors you've probably never heard of. Just go, try anything, they'll let you sample.

Be weary, lines are not uncommon. Also, try a chocolate dipped cone. It's like your own personalized Drumstick.

SFCritic
author: David J.

description: Thick, creamy, full of flavor, refreshing.. I think I'm gonna have to get some today. My favorite icecream I've had. Ever.  When the line is really long, you take a ticket and they call your number so there's no confusion about who got there first. When we went, the line was out the door and packed inside, but we were served in less than 15 minutes. Love this place!
author: Misty M.

description:
Being from Wisconsin, I think I know good ice cream. Mitchell's is good, but it is hardly exceptional. It's not as creamy as Bi-Rite and its its flavors lack the intensity of Humphrey Slocombe's concoctions.

I think folks just get worked up into a fever having to wait in line for it!

Bi-Rite is best with Humphrey Slocombe a close second, and Mitchell's is a distant third.
author: Adam Z.

description:
My parent's first introduced me to Mitchell's when I was much younger and I have been going here ever since.  I will forever be grateful for this Mom and Dad!  I live down the peninsula and have taken may trips to the city, just to get Mitchell's and nothing else!

Mitchell's just recently remodeled, but the quality and experience are still the same!  The ice cream is perfectly flavored and creamy!  The customer service is pretty good, considering they have to wait on what seems to be a billion people an hour.

What to expect:

1. No parking.  There is a very small lot behind Mitchell's, that, to be honest, usually has a spot open or you can wait a few minutes and there should be someone leaving.  But don't be fooled, many people eat in there car because there are few places to eat outside.  Just be forewarned, don't go on an empty tank of gas, because you might have to circle the block or double park!

2. There will be a mob outside!  This only means that the ice cream is that good.  I have only been a few times where I just walked right in.  The line is actually very helpful for those who don't know what they are getting, it gives you some time to determine what you want.

3.  Take a number!  There is a number dispenser to the left of the doorway when you enter.  They do go strictly by the number system.  If you don't grab one, you don't get Mitchell's.  If you are grabbing one of their pre-made ice cream cakes or a pre-packed gallon of ice cream, you do not have to grab a number, there is a special window just for you!

4. You will be overwhelmed.  It's true.  There are many, many, many choices ranging from tropical to traditional to seasonal.  But remember #2: the line will help you buy time to decided.  The workers are very generous to let you sample flavors.  There will be flavors you never even thought they could make, so naturally you will have to sample.  My personal favorites are coconut pineapple, orange sherbet and grasshopper pie.  They also have millions of different ways to eat your ice cream: cookie sandwich, milkshake, cone, sundae and so on!

5. There are no places to sit.  There are a couple benches outside and that's it.

6. There might be a lady soliciting money.  She usually sits right outside when I've seen her.  No big deal, but I always end up feeling bad.

7.  Bring cash.  They do take card, for minimum orders of I believe $10.  So, anything less than requires cold hard cash.

8. It's small.  Mitchell's is not for the claustrophobic.  You will have to slither through the crowd to get your number then to get to the counter then to leave.  There is a lot of shifting around.  Be prepared to get cozy with your neighbor.

I think now you are fully prepared to make your trek to the best ice cream in the city!
author: Michelle V.

description: I always tell people there is only 1 place to get ice cream in san francisco.
author: Lisa M.

description:
My favorite flavors...

1. Mexican Chocolate
2. Toasted Almond
3. Thai Tea

Any time and weather... Sunny... or... Freezing... I love going to Mitchell's for Ice Cream!!!
author: J V.

description: It doesn't matter how long the line for Mitchell's is it is definitely worth it especially on a warm day in San Francisco.  Plus the line tends to move very fast so you're not keep waiting too long.  I had the coconut-pineapple the other day and it was awesome.
author: Blake B.

description:
Let it be known, my family and I have been getting ice cream from Mitchell's since I was a wee little girl when we used to live on Dolores.  Back when a half gallon was $5.75 or something like that.

Anyway, I'm not that bold when it comes to ice cream flavors, but my favorite has always been coffee, and while other brands have good coffee flavors, none don't really come close to the smoothness and creaminess of Mitchell's.  My family likes to get halo halo, ube, mango, and avocado.

Usually when we go, it's a lot more packed than when it was when I was little.  We don't ever bother picking a number.  We go to the freezers, get our half gallons, pay, and are out in under five minutes.  That's how it's done rookies.
author: Connie M.

description:
Okay, I'm going to be telling a pretty personal story about myself in relation to this store. Well it's not that personal but it's personal.. anyways! I had jaw surgery just a few months back, and I was basically wired shut for bout  1 week and wasn't able to eat solid food for another 2-3 weeks. I lost tons of weight and felt like crap for a long long time. What made me get through the tough time fast was this place. God, their ice cream is freaken wonderful. It's like medicine, I swear! 

You come here, sick, with friends, for a birthday, on a lonely Friday night, whatever! It doesn't matter if it's cold out or scorching hot, there will be customers. This place is that good. ALL THEIR FLAVORS WORK IF YOU'RE WILLING TO GIVE THEM A TRY. IT'S THAT GOOD SON! fohsoh. don't live near here? better get a ride, cause it's definitely worth it 5stars.... x100000000
author: Stanley C.

description:
I finally went.  I mean, I've had Mitchell's ice cream before because someone was awesome enough to purchase a take home but this was my first visit last Friday to Mitchell's.  

The visit was almost perfect - parking spot right in front and waited less than 5 minutes for my turn.  Oh boy, was it good.  I normally get their green tea - love the real matcha flavor and color but this time I tried the Halo Halo (Buko, Langka, Ube, Pineapple, Mango & Sweet) in a waffle cup.  It was so tasty and hit the spot!  The ice cream was not overly sweet but just so many flavors bursting in your mouth and the waffle cup was fresh and crunchy.   :9
author: Michelle S.

description: Nothing says "San Francisco" like eating a chocolate-dipped Mitchell's cone on a freezing summer evening. Ya heard?
author: Guillermo K.

description:
My favorite thing to order is an ice cream sandwich (ice cream between two chocolate chip cookies) and I ask for it to be dipped in chocolate. Yummy!

Also my other favorite mix is the Mexican Chocolate with Black Currant. 

You can't go wrong with Mitchell's that's for sure!
author: Josie C.

description:
No, no, no - please disregard crazy mad reviews stating that Mitchell's has changed ownership - absolutely not true.  For years, we worked with Brian Mitchell, when we had our own grocery store and used to buy gallons, in bulk - Anything insulting re. Mitchell's, their ownership and/or staffing practices is just bogus - I'm so protective of these guys.  

They are one of the oldest SF businesses around with an extremely loyal following.  You can't possibly get the crowds they get, regularly, with that small storefront layout without having great quality products, with good, fair business minds behind it.  And, just consider, that they have never really been aggressive in their advertising campaigns - they have their reputation based on word-of-mouth throughout the years.

They go through great lengths to create their products.  They import avocado, young coconut, jackfruit, sweet coconut, mango, pineapple and ube (purple yam) fruit from the Philippines for their ice cream and that's simply why they have such a crazy loyal following.  

I've never had a bad experience with their staff and I totally appreciate their "express" line for people, like myself, for whom a single or double scoop just won't do - Give me the half-gallon baby!
author: Olma M.

description:
With a gazillion reviews already, Mitchell's doesn't really need my five stars to convince anyone to visit.  It is unarguably the best homemade ice cream in San Francisco.  Definitely worth the visit.  Plus stars for the parking... Hallelujah!  

Over the years I've been making my way through the extensive and creative menu.  I would be hard pressed to name a favorite -- my advice is to watch what's coming out the door, and when you see something that looks good, ask the happy eater what they're trying.  Then order it yourself.  I've found so many new favorites that way, things I'd otherwise never even consider trying.  

Go.  Enjoy.  Then go spend one hour at the playground on the swings, recapturing your childhood while you consider what you're going to order next time.
author: Bevy M.

description:
What can I say about Mitchell's ice cream? 
It's a childhood treasure that I have passed down to my own children.
Who cares if it's raining or foggy in the city.....if I'm in town we're going!
My flavor of choice is Rocky Road....they have walnuts instead of almonds :)
author: Raquel K.

description:
Unfortunately the one time I decided to go to Mitchell's it was practically freezing temperatures, but the drive was still worth it, the ice cream still good.  A plethera of flavors, patient servers who let us taste more than our share of samples and delicious ice creams.

Added 4/5/07:  Got the Mexican Chocolate (ummy richness), sis got jackfruit and avocado (subtle flavors, avocado didn't really taste of anything), broinlaw got a banana split, and judging by the how happy he sounded from the backseat, I'll assume it was awesome.
