Great guy serving us, very patient and friendly, despite the growing crowd.
author: Asha H.

description:
I wish I could have GRASSHOPPPER PIE at each accomplishment, milestone, and happy moment for the rest of my life. It adds that extra boost of positive chemicals into my body, something no pharmacy will ever be able to replicate in a laboratory EVERRRR.

I LOVE YOU, MITCHELL'S GRASSHOPPER PIE.
author: kate r.

description:
This place has the best mango ice cream on the planet. Most of their ice creams are just as good. They have a ton of exotic flavors and the ice cream is made by hand on the premises. You can't miss. 

Tip: Grab a number as soon as you get in. This place is take a number and newbies often don't realize it.  Also the lines are also out the door and they have a very small parking lot, so look on the street for parking.
author: Pamela R.

description:
My first visit here wasn't so memorable. My memory escapes me but I know I ordered something I could get elsewhere. Yes, I'm ashamed I didn't like this at first. My 2nd visit here and all the visits thereafter, I have realized in order to love this place, you have to know what you like here. And once you know what you like, you'll be here often despite the wait and parking. 

My fruity favorites: Tropical 4, Mango (only when getting a sundae with mango topping), the Cantalope taste just like cantalope, Peach Sorbet (doesn't taste like peach. it's very subtle and good), Pear Sorbet (seriously so good- a must try), Calamansi Sorbet (a bit tarty but good when you want calamansi).

My other favorites: Cinnamon Snap, Mexican Chocolate, Lucuma, and the oh so smooth Kahlua Mocha Cream.

After this review, it's time to make a trip to Mitchell's. Dang, what's my number?? *tick tock tick tock*
author: Audrey B.

description:
Don't mind the line.... this place is worth the wait. I always walk out with 1/2 gallons under my arm and an ice cream cone.

Try the lemon chiffon, mexican chocolate, tropical 4, avocado, pistachio, french vanilla custard.... Oh my god! It's all soooo good!

The walkaway sundae is decadent but you've got to do it at least once... a month!

Oh and the Maize con Queso is deceiving. It's cheese and CANDIED corn!
author: Allison J.

description:
How do I introduce tourists to San Francisco? 

A trip on the J-line to Delores Park and scoop (or two) from Mitchell's.
author: Kathryn T.

description:
I actually managed to come here when there was parking and almost no line, so I guess I haven't had the true "Mitchell's experience" (thankfully!). It was shocking considering the reviews. However, it was late at night on a cold Tuesday, so that may be the time to go.

Because of the unbusiness, I got to try the halo-halo flavored ice cream and my friends tasted about 4 flavors each (they aren't from here, don't quite get that you can't taste every flavor). While the halo-halo was good, I was in a more classic mood, so I opted for white pistachio and new york cherry. Both were good, but New York cherry was a bit too sweet for me. And it melted all over the pistachio, so I didn't get as much of the flavor I liked.

My friends got rocky road and toasted almond and enjoyed them both, however we wanted to try an actual halo-halo and at the last minute backed out. As much as I wanted to know what it tasted like, I wasn't sure I wanted to down a huge container of beans and ube ice cream.

We took home the peach and cantaloupe ice cream (since cantaloupe is seasonal, we wanted to try it before it was gone). Both are good, however the cantaloupe was my favorite. As much as I love all the flavors of ice cream, I'd like Mitchell's a lot more if it were an ice cream parlor. But that might be crazy considering how busy it already is!

-1 star because I noticed they use Smuckers hot fudge/chocolate sauce/caramel toppings. Somewhat unforgivable... even if you only specialize in ice cream, can't you find a company that makes better toppings than Smuckers?!?
author: Amanda C.

description: Another yummy ice cream parlor in mission..although further out of town. The ube stood out for its vibrant purple color. Taste was pretty good. Next stop is to try Humphrey's.
author: Felecia W.

description:
Overheard while receiving our Mitchell's bounty:

Male #1(dreamlike):  "So creamy.  So good."

Male #2 (whiny):  "It's got too much sugar!"

Male #1 (annoyed): " You're a dentist. Deal with it."
author: Karsten P.

description:
2 words: Grasshopper Pie.

It's awesome!

I used to work at St. Luke's and on my lunch, my coworker and I would stop here really quick for dessert.  We'd scarf it up as we only had a 45 minute lunch and we were always happy little piggies!  If our other coworkers saw us finishing up the cone, they'd say "Oh my god did you go to Mitchell's?  Why didn't you call me???"  I miss the fact that it's on the other side of the City.  But it's well worth the trip and waiting in line!!!!
author: imelda j.

description:
On a hot summer Saturday I went to Mitchell's to try the hype.  There were sixty people outside and I waited an hour.  It was definitely worth it!  I tried the Mexican Chocolate which was very good, but a little too cinnamony on first taste and the peanut butter which overwhelmed with peanut  butteryness, but for my actual purchase I got chocolate caramel crackle.  Wow!  It was creamier than any ice cream I've ever tasted and definitely had all the indescribable qualities necessary to make it seem worth waiting an hour.

The people outside were very chatty, so the long waits can also be a good way to meet people.
author: Tom W.

description:
Like too many beers in a crowded pub; forced to wait but near ecstasy once you start*.

* breaking the seal or the first lick/spoonful.
author: Mike C.

description: Their mango ice cream is heavenly.  Dare I say my favorite ice-cream in SF and even better than Bi-Rite's Salted Caramel? This off-the-beaten-path also has a cult-like following, but is not as insane as the lines around the block you often see at Bi-Rite.  So sssshhhh, don't tell anyone about it.  But go try the mango, it's to die for.
author: Chet K.

description:
definitely a local favorite.  even on the coldest san francisco nights, there is always a line out the door.

i've been eating mitchell's even before i was born, and it's still my favorite ice cream place in the world!  when i was in elementary school, every friday night after my piano lessons, my daddy would treat me to Mitchelle's Ice Cream.  my mommy says this is the reason i was a chubby kid.  it was well worth it!

now my three year old nephew asks grandpa if we can get Mitchell's ice cream (specifically!)... he already knows the good stuff.

they have the craziest yummiest flavors.  be courageous and try... halo-halo (a filipino delight), mango, coconut-pineapple, ube, and AVACADO!
author: Elsie S.

description:
Mitchell's how I have missed you!!  

I don't care what anyone else says...you have and always will be my favorite ice cream.   I'll deal with the lines and other crazy SFers standing in line in the wind and cold just for a taste.

Tropical flavors I adore, Cantaloupe I'll miss you when you are gone, and Pumpkin I'll wait patiently for every year. 

Buko Ice Cream Cake you are still my fav...but I may need to venture out and explore with the others, before I commit to you...
author: Bella P.

description:
I grew up two blocks from this place. When I discovered I was lactose intolerant in college I thought my life was over. Then I remembered the Mexican Chocolate and Ube, and thought, suck it up and just take it. A good choice in the greater scheme of things.


I need to add, that no matter how cold it is, regulars will say f-it and get in line for their ice cream anyway.
author: Niki M.

description:
Vanilla Cream? Mango? Vanilla Cream? Mango? I couldn't decide what kind of cone to get. The line today was moderate... they have a paper-number system and we pulled 93, while the current customer being called to the counter was number 79. Not a bad line at all for a warm Saturday summer afternoon at Mitchell's.

Vanilla Cream? Mango? Vanilla Cream? Mango?

Finally -- 92! We were next! Just then, one of the guys behind the counter went up to the flavor-board, and added a new listing for a freshly-made ice cream: Raspberry. 

PERFECT! And it was. Vividly bright red with seeds of actual raspberries. Delightfully tangy, sweet and delicious. I can't imagine that a better ice cream has ever been made, in the history of ice cream.

And so just as expected -- yet again, Mitchell's came through with flying colors. It's great to be able to support such a charming little place that's been making folks happy for over 50 years.
author: Zoe H.

description: I love this place. Try the hot fudge sundae w/ macapuno ice cream or get a scoop of UBE, make it a double
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: Best homemade family creamery! The Macapuno and Halo Halo ice cream is the best. So popular it's always crowded in there.
author: Joni J.

description:
i used to enjoy mitchell's ice cream served at the now defunct Scoop in Potrero Hill but never went to the Mitchell's shop until last weekend. 
DANG! it is sooooo awesome!
it's a good thing i don't live nearby or i'd be in an ice cream coma by the end of the week. DROOOOL!
author: Jennifer E.

description:
OH . . . .sooo goood! Mitchell's Ice Cream is a scoop of heaven. During the summer time, you must get the fresh peach. Parking can be a pain, but the patience is worth it. You know it's good when there are lines outside in the middle of winter (ok . . .a California winter . . but it's still cold). 

I recently had the ginger ice cream and that was delicious. An employee mentioned that they recently reformulated the ginger ice cream so it wasn't as spicy as before. I tried it and it was - DELICIOUS. Not too strong and more subtle. Another flavor fave of mine is the Kahlua n' Cream flavor. 

One of THE best ICE CREAMS in California. A must for any visitor in San Francisco.
author: Jen L.

description:
Yes, It's freakin 5 star good. 
I'll take the abdominal pain and intestinal squeals from my lactose intolerance. I DON'T CARE, give me that creamy goodness called Mitchell's.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Smooth, creamy, homemade, locally instituted, and cheap ($2.10 for a giant single scoop in a cone?).  

What's not to like?
author: Momo R.

description:
5 Stars times 20

Is there anything here that isn't good?

I love this place.  I'd go here every single day and wait in line if it wasn't so fattening.
author: Debbie M.

description:
This place is great.  A pretty good selection of ice cream flavors, frozen yogurt, and a variety of other sweet (pun intended) treats.

I'm something of an ice cream traditionalist I suppose in that I usually go for good ol' plain chocolate, but I love it.  

I've tried mexican chocolate, pistachio, strawberry, ube, peanut butter, and a couple others, not a bad one in the bunch.  But of those, I especially liked pistachio and peanut butter.  I'm living in LA now, but whenever I go up I hit this place, and have turned a few out-of-towners onto it as well.

Pretty much every time I've gone there, there is some sort of line.  No matter the weather of time of day.  On a warm day in summer, even until closing time, you will have a wait.  But the line moves fairly fast, and is worth it.
author: Charles R.

description:
I'm still trying to forgive my parents for letting go of renting a VICTORIAN FLAT 2 blocks away from Mitchell's to buy a CONDO in the suburbs!!! (Ahhh! ... Deep breath)

I grew up on this stuff, I walked there often as a kid, and I still can't drive by without stopping for a scoop of Rocky Road (see profile pic) or my newest addiction Kahlua Mocha Cream with a squirt of whipped cream!

Grab a number and be prepared to wait (especially on really cold nights)! Once u finally have your ice cream- fight for a seat on the benches for the full Mitchell's experience! ;)
author: Valerie A.

description:
San Francisco is ice cream heaven. I swear.

I'm a long-time champion of Double Rainbow , but lately I've been dying to branch out and go to Mitchell's. I've had their ice cream before, but never from the location. 

No one ever wants to go with me, so I went on a Monday when I was off work. No wait. And WOW, what a lot of ice cream on the single scoop cone for under $3. 

Mexican Chocolate. Holy crap good.
author: anne s.

description:
I have been coming here for a long time and wanted to let everybody know that Mitchell's updated their menu.  It's clean and easy to read.  My husband and I took our boys on a Saturday afternoon after lunch and there was no wait.  We easily found parking, got our ice cream, and even had a bench to sit on in front of the shop.  

Although the crowds are hit and miss, the ice cream is always great!  

Mitchell's truly is a San Francisco classic.  If you're coming to this area of SF, you have to stop by and get a scoop.
author: Aura J.

description:
SO, came here with my bf recently. I actually been here once before, but did not remember what i ordered. Probably something boring since I am scared to go out of the circle and order something new. Anyways, my bf immediately knew what he wanted since he cheated and went on yelp on his iphone to see what others recommended. He got the halo halo and tropical 4. Seeing that my bf was going to get two scoops, I did the same! 

I ordered the purple yam and I was stuck on picking my second flavor, so I went for the mango. Wow..i LOVE their purple yam. I think I will go back to get a bucket of it so that I can eat it whenever I want at home. 

Also, I really wanted to try their coconut, but I didn't want to make everyone behind me to wait even longer, so I didn't ask to try different flavors. I guess next time!
author: Willa L.

description:
I was born and raised in the city, but this is my first time at Mitchell's.  I rarely venture into this part of the city, but it's worth the drive for some good ice cream.  Mitchell's is a family-owned establishment that's been around for decades, like Joe's Ice Cream, Swensen's, and Polly Ann.  Mitchell's strong suit is their extensive tropical flavors, like Tropical Four (banana, guava, mango, pineapple), Mango, Buko (baby coconut), and Macapuno (sweet coconut). 

The place is busy even on a foggy weekday afternoon, so take a number and take your time perusing the menu.
author: Naomi N.

description:
Of the ice cream places in San Francisco, this place was really really really popular!  It was so hectic on a Sunday afternoon that we had to take a number and wait 10-20 minutes before we could even taste flavors!  I wish they would provide more seating/standing room as there are a good 30-40 flavors to see and drool over while we wait.
When I came here with my group, I tired the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with cookies, fudge and nuts...think mud pie with grasshoppers...but without the grasshoppers) and Mocha Chocolate.  I felt that this place, although above average, definitely was not the best ice cream I have ever tasted.
So far Marianne's (Santa Cruz) is easily the best ice cream I've ever had with Penny's coming in as a distant second.  Micthell's fits in as 3rd, so I would come back only if it was off hours with no wait and I was in the area.  Aside from that, wouldn't go out of my way to come here
author: Roger T.

description:
Cliffs: Great ice cream always, Hot days/weekends = long lines. 

Great place, been around forever, I can't count the number of times I've went.

My favorite flavors: French Custard Vanilla, Cookies and Cream, Banana Nut ice cream.

Everything is pretty much good here you can't go wrong.

Only problem is the long lines on nice days, and long lines on weekends. Be careful in  the tiny parking lot or your car might get hit.
author: Steven C.

description:
I remember back in 8th grade, my bio teacher took us here after we left this museum in San Jose. And boy am I glad she did! Some of us were without money so we sort of whined and the teacher said she was willing to buy us each a single scoop of ice cream! Thank you, Mrs. B!  :) 

She introduced me to this place and boy, am I happy! Their ice cream is super creamy and my gosh, i just fell in love with this place! 

Although I only been here once, I'm planning to make a trip here soon with my boyfriend. :) If he's willing to drive that is, lol.
author: Jessica T.

description:
i've been going to mitchell's since i was a kid. yes, that was a long time ago. and it still rocks my socks. ok, my fave flavor back then was bubblegum. but hey, gum and blue ice cream, what more could you ask for?

the flavors that keep me coming back that no one else can rival:
mexican chocolate
buko
macapuno
avocado
ube
and now they have flavors like lilikoi mango swirl!

thanks mitchell's for all the years of deliciousness!
author: Wanda D.

description:
I think Mitchell's rocks. Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream!!!! Que Rico! i still need to try the avocado which actually sounds really good despite my initial misgivings
+plus they have been there for sooo long which makes them a sf. institution. i love that.
author: sarah C.

description:
Well, as reviewer #205, there's not a damn original thing I could say about this place.

So just go.  Take a number, wait your turn, and then enjoy!  If you like ice cream and you've never been before, try something "wacky" -- avocado, mexican chocolate, halo-halo, mango, etc...
author: hillary h.

description:
I have posited that they're secret ingredient just might be illegal because people are absolutely rabid for their ice cream.  The joint is hopping on summer days and late into the evenings.  That's why I suggest you be gentle on yourself and go late on a Monday or Tuesday when you stand a chance of having a shorter wait and ability to park.

Thankfully, my addiction is now somewhat curbed since I have been shying away from dairy.  As you can imagine, the pouinds have just been melting off since I no longer devour vast gallons of Mitchell nirvana anymore, LOL!  Although I went last night and discovered they make a few sorbet flavors of which the pear sorbet is just outstanding.  I can only hope I'll grown tired of pear soon!
author: Femita J.

description:
God, I really hate almost any place with a line out the door, just by default. So, I guess the number-taking system is better than having an actual, physical line, but still, I'm also not a fan of big clumps of people either. At least the ice cream is good. I can't say whether it's 20-minutes-waiting-outside-on-a-windy-night good, but it's good. I had the kahlua mocha whatever, and I was not complaining.

The best part of going to Mitchell's? Standing outside eating your ice cream in front of all the people who are still waiting for their numbers to be called. Mwahahahahahaha!!!!
author: Julia L.

description:
Three words available around late October: Pumpkin Ice Cream! 

This is the BEST ice cream in San Francisco. 

They also offer a good number of authentic Filipino-style flavors like ube (purple yam), mais (corn), halo halo, buko (coconut), avocado, lanka (jackfruit), macapuno (sweet coconut), etc.
author: Miles G.

description:
I came in right at opening time on a Tuesday morning -- the parking lot was deserted and there was just one other customer ahead of me.  I couldn't complain, with so many flavors to choose from, I needed an extra minute or two.  

Hmmm... ube?  Langka?  The one with the Kahlua?  Rocky Road?  

Now they don't come cheap -- a half gallon costs $8.50 a pop.  But they are deliciously creamy and yummy -- I think I'm going to have a bowl of strawberries n cream now.

PS.  Have cash on hand -- they do have an atm on site but would you really want another 2 bucks in fees to add to the total cost of your ice cream?
author: Rhea S.

description:
Overrated ice cream place. Sure they have many different, interesting flavors, but who wants to wait 10 minutes minimum to get a scoop of ice.
I rather have Rite-Aid for my mint choco chip for $1! 
You can't beat that!
author: Mauling W.

description:
Totslly forgot to write a review about this place. I guess its a childhood fav if your from SF or DC. I kinda hated on the place since it wasnt part of my personal childhood growing up in Oakland. Hahaha... 

All I gotta say is... Mango, Macapuno, or Ube... 

nuff said!!!!
author: Marlon O.

description: Someone was talking about ice-cream at work the other day and I thought of Mitchell's..... they have lots of flavour to choose from and I love Rocky Road, Coconut, Mango.... there are more I will like to try and when the summer time comes with the increase of temperature I will definitely stop by and get myself a nice big scoup of ice-cream!
author: Bella A.

description: Still the best.  Nobody else even comes close.  If I could choose a last meal, it'd be a giant bowl of Mitchells' Espresso Toffee Crunch, Pistachio and Thin Mint.
author: Lucie B.

description: MmmMMmM... I love their Mexican hot chocolate! I'm craving it right now and I would make the drive out there if I wasn't sick. Everytime I come here there is always a line, but it does move pretty fast so don't let it turn you away from stopping by. I have tried their Filipino flavors such as ube and buko which by the way are also very good, but the mexican hot chocolate will always be my favorite. P.S. there's no pico de gallo in the ice cream sorry for the disappointment.
author: katie M.

description:
To update my last review:

Ok so I been here a bunch of times now and DAYUM! I think it might be the best ice cream in SF. I spent $30 on those gallon tubs and had them stocked in my freezer for almost 3 weeks. 3 tubs: Oreo, Coconut Pineappe, Strawberry, all gone. People helped me in the beginning, but I eventually killed all of them haha.
author: Adrian S.

description:
Sometimes people try to tell me Mitchell's is NOT the best ice cream in San Francisco and I laugh and laugh.  There may be other ice cream parlours you like to go to, another place may even be your favorite.  But that is for your own idiosyncratic reasons.
Mitchell's is hands down the best ice cream in San Francisco without a doubt for all eternity.  Doesn't mean you can't go anywhere else (its awful far out there and all) but don't get confused.
author: Flemm F.

description:
I"ve been going here since I was a kid.   I don't think it's going anywhere anytime soon.  But if they do, I'll chain myself to the front door. 

I usually stick to the tropical flavors.  Ube, Mango, Macapuno....Probably as good as Magnolia Ice Cream in the Philippines.  $8.50 for a half gallon bucket.  Well worth the wait.  

Went here with a friend a few years back and he ordered scoop of Vanilla on a sugar cone.  He hasn't heard the last of it, ever since. 

I guess that's why he's not my friend anymore.
author: Joel N.

description:
Yummy Yummy Yummy!!!! My fiance is super picky about sweets, not snobby, but just opposed to stuff that's too sweet. But both of us have nothing but delicious dreams when we fantasize about going to Mitchell's. Try the banana and peanut butter in a waffle cone topped with chocolate magic shell!!! 
Don't ever die, Mitchell's. Don't ever die.
author: Sunny A.

description:
I just moved in the neighborhood and heard about this place. Probably the best ice cream ever! The mexican hot chocolate is my favorite and my boyfriend ate a 1/2 gallon of avocado ice cream in 2 freakin' days! 
There is always a line and you have to get a number to order.
author: nedina g.

description:
I divorced this place when they took their Thai Tea flavor off the menu. 

But then a few nights ago, I relapsed and came back to learned that they did a remodel.. it's way way nicer, brighter and cleaner looking. And guess what? They put Thai Tea back on the menu. Reunited and it feels so good.

However, I'm not sure if the staff had a little get together earlier on with the chronic or perhaps they just didn't get naptime?? But they are really really ...really .... slow. This place gets slammed all the time so the slow pace doesn't help much. I overheard the manager say "You guys.... go... a little.... fas... ter... 'kay..... hurry.... it up".

The ice cream is well well well worth the wait but I have to minus one star for them making the wait time even longer. The bottom line is, I will be back for more Thai Tea. I love Thai Tea.
author: Natalie N.

description:
SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOD!



I've been going here since I was a snot nose kid.
author: Emmy d.

description:
Even though this review is sure to draw the wrath of Mission hipsters and Marina girls everywhere, it has to be done.

Mitchell's Ice Cream is overrated. Describing ice cream is a bit tricky, but I think the adjective that best sums up what is wrong with Mitchell's Ice Cream is: chewy. There is an almost artificial gumminess that is impossible to get over once you've noticed it. I dare you to try (or re-try) their ice cream and tell me I'm wrong.

Add to that the intolerable lines filled with skinny women for whom an ice cream treat seems like it's a little *too* big of a deal, and I just can't be bothered.
author: Keith C.

description:
Amazing ice cream @ reasonable prices but with a wait.  My wife and I take everyone who visits us and loves ice cream, and no one has yet to walk away disappointed.  Seems like a Noe-Mission area institution.  

Take your time when you get your turn and try a new flavor, there are so many.  Remember to bring cash as the place does NOT accept credit cards.  If you can, try to time your visit at off hours to avoid long lines that can soar to 45-60 minute waits!?
author: John A.

description:
rain or shine, always a line.
got vanilla? sounds just fine.
Raspberry Sorbet? A-OK.
Whether you're feeling mild or just a little bit wild,
Always a flavor to match the ice cream craver.
author: Glenn F.

description:
Mitchell's, I still love you. But I have two minor complaints that have forced me to dock a star. First, I don't love the new look - which has nothing to do with the quality of the ice cream, but still detracts from my experience. I miss your old school look; the new colors are too bright!

Second, my 30th birthday celebration was centered around one of your ice cream cakes. When my husband picked up the cake, en route to my party, one of your staff told him to simply let it sit out for 20 minutes and it would be fine to cut. Sadly, this method left the outside ice cream frosting slightly runny, and the inside hard as a rock. It tasted great, but as my plastic fork broke off into my slice of cake I realized that perhaps we'd gotten some bad advice on how to let it soften properly.
author: Beth T.

description:
I once overheard two girls talking after getting their ice cream. 
Girl one: "So how it is?"
Girl two: "oh you know...pretty much amazing"

There you have it folks, Mitchell's is PRETTY MUCH AMAZING!
author: Christine M.

description:
Mitchell's..Mitchell's..Mitchell's.  I've missed you.  I absolutely, LOVE this ice cream, nothing compares to this, its simply irresistable (isn't that a song??)  

My favorite flavor, UBE and Mango of coarse!! Soo good & yummmy... get in ma belly....
author: Betsy N.

description:
forget Dreyers, breyers, and even ben and jerry's! Mitchells rocks my panties off!

I don't ever eat ice-cream...at all...really..It's very rare...

My sister who lives in SF lives around this area and she recommended that I try this place out before I head back to LA....I was pretty resistant, especially since it was already night time and freezing outside, I mean 45 degrees cold outside!  Surprisingly there was a line and quite a lot of people outside eating ice-cream in the damn cold! I didn't get any scoops of ice cream but I got the strawberries and cream bucket to go, just in case it was THAT GOOD.....it was about $10 bucks so it better be worth it!

Got home and tried my $10 bucket of ice cream.....
.
.
.
.
.DAMN...it was excellent! It was sooo creamy, smooth, and the strawberry swirls ratio to the vanilla ice cream was excellent...It was not overwhelmingly sweet either...
.
Oh how I love thee Mitchells...
author: Thi Le L.

description: thick and rich in flavor with a decent variety of unique flavors along with the classics makes mitchell's a place to be on a hot summer day. Ive seen this place packed with customers lining up and double parking in order to get some of this sweet goodness. Although its a little too sweet for my taste, I can see why so many people love this place. Personally I would rather go to Bi-rite but this place is a little easier to find parking since they have a mini parking lot for customers and their prices are slightly cheaper compared to Bi-rite. Worth trying if you are in the neighborhood.
author: Robert Y.

description: Definitely one of my favorite dessert spots in the city.  Every time I come here, I try a new flavor.  Must say that my favorites so far are the toasted almond, cantaloupe, white pistachio, and lychee.  Be aware that you'll be waiting a while since it gets crowded but it's worth the wait!
author: I W.

description:
I am writing this review for my father, who is not a Yelper but extremely picky about ice cream. His first job when he came to the U.S. was making ice cream for a cafe, before becoming a chemist. He loves mixing up stuff. 

Anyway, since we heard so much about this place, we decided to head over one afternoon, hoping to avoid the insane lines everybody talks about.  Line was reasonable, so we took a number and waited about 10 min. to get 4 hand-packed pints of ice cream in different flavors. Then I took him home and we had a taste test.  

Strawberry: nice aroma, but utterly average strawberry flavor
Vanilla: not vanilla-y enough, they use cheap extract instead of the real thing ("where are the seeds?")
Dulce de Leche: lacks the slightly "baked" flavor of real Dulce de Leche, otherwise good
Rocky Road: very good concentrated chocolate flavor, but there were about 5 nuts and marshmallows in the entire pint ("where are the rocks")

Consistency was very smooth for all flavors. His verdict was "fine if it's down the street", but not worth driving for it to the other side of town.
author: Ksenya Z.

description:
It's a city ice cream place!   Kids behind the counter.  No reservations.  You're supposed to walk there, not drive. 
The avocado is OK.  Cantelope shakes with guava sherbet in a cup on the side are what do it for me, tho'   
I mean, some folks just hafta have rocky road or some such, and they can go anywhere else and not take up all the parking or get a number that's lower than mine, so what the ** are they doing here?  Get some ube halaya, dude...
author: Jombo J.

description:
Was a fan of here even before they remodeled.

Flavors that are worth the calorie:
Buko
Halo Halo
Ube

Quite exotic indeed.
I don't think I've ever seen these flavors of ice cream anywhere else.
Maybe in Asia. Other than that, nope.

Good times.
author: Jimmy N.

description: Hands Down one of the greatest ice cream places on earth... next to Cold Stone.. so many varieties of coconut ice cream 1st time I came here w/ friends I've had samples of almost each flavor.... even the avacado one which sounded weird but it tasted hella good!  and it's a lot of ice cream they give you.. I was lame and got French Vanilla... but I shouldve gotten the coconut one! Its crowded there but who cares, SF is supposed to be crowded.. its a city, at least its usually a friendly crowd for the most part! too bad it's only in SF though!
author: Sunny E.

description: Great ice cream in every flavor you can imagine -- and even some you can't. The only downside is the long wait. At least they do the most sensible thing and serve deli-style, i.e., you take a number.
author: Paul L.

description:
I love this place!

Just kickin' it in front of the place with friends & all the guests who come in for the best ice cream in the City is enough to make any day.

There's always a line of people & it's because their wide variety of ice cream never disappoints! When I say variety, I mean the vast amount of choices between the typical, standard ice cream parlor shop ones to more daring flavors like Kahlua Mocha to the tropical items like Lychee, Buko or Ube to name a few.

And they have seasonal flavors they only make during specific times of the year! The reason I would have ice cream all year round!

** They revamped the place in early January, & this place looks much more clean cut. Different venue, same great experience.
author: Mike M.

description:
I used to punish my lactose intolerant self with regular trips to Mitchell's.

I always stuck to old skool flavors and never once regretted my discomfort later.

This place has been around forever and there's a reason you see people eating ice cream year-round ... and sometimes braving foggy chilly weather to stand in line.

It's f*ckin great ice cream.  It's on my Gotta Do It list for friends who visit.
author: Diego S.

description:
I live really close to mitchells and see the lines snaking around the corner every evening. I only go in when there is not a big crowd though -- 
Favorite flavors - pumpkin and the young coconut :)
author: Shipra K.

description:
This is my hands-down favorite ice cream place. Yes, fancy ice cream parlors are currently en vogue, but sometimes I don't want some crazy ass flavor that sounds and tastes like its creator was on acid.

Every fruit from the rainbow is represented here from buko to ube, but the standards are always there for when you just need that strawberry fix.  And if you didn't pick what you wanted before you got there, the wait time will certainly be long enough for you to make up your mind. (But once your number is called, order! I want my ice cream!)
author: Alicia C.

description: YUM!  You can't go wrong with any flavors here.  If you're intersted in one of their flavors just ask them for a try.  I stopped in on a rainy day last week and just hit it right and beat the rush. I grabbed a number and only waited about 5 minutes.  There was a new flavor lilikoi, mango mixed in with french vanilla.  I could eat this everyday!!  Too bad I live on the opposite side of the city.    Definitely better than bi-rite. There's also a parking lot around the back, if the front is all filled up.
author: Stacey L.

description: What else can I really add to the reviews here?  I think it's all been said... Personally, I think Mitchell's has the best ice cream in town.  It's all about quality not the exotic combinations of flavors.  I came here with Daniel L, Maybelline C, Brendan H, Cassie J. and Amy C.  That evening I had the Ube, purple yam which was fantastic.  I ended up back at Mitchell's last night with a half gallon of the Chocolate Caramel Crackle to bring to a party which was a huge hit.  That was possibly the best ice cream I've ever had...Wow.
author: Paul K.

description: I don't know who Claire is, but I'll eat her pie any day.
author: Trav W.

description: Recently headed here after dinner with a friend and ordered a single scoop of the Macapuno Ice Cream on a sugar cone. Oh my gawd it was so good that I inadvertently moaned out loud, which my friend laughingly pointed out to me. But she did a "Oh my gawd, you have to taste this. Seriously!," when she dug into her banana ice cream.  hehehe. v. good ice cream.
author: Theresa D.

description:
so after our jaunt at Eric's we decided to walk off our brown and fried rice and headed over to Mitchell's. my friend said, "OOH, we should go get ice cream at Mitchell's!!!" with much enthusiasm... hmm, i thought, isn't that the place with the line ALWAYS out the door???

well yes, it was, and that Saturday night was no exception. we were number 73. they were calling out some number in the low 50's. :(  me want ice cream now!!  but alas, it was worth the wait. with a good friend to pass the time, and a wait of about 20 minutes to ponder over ALL the flavors this ice cream parlour has to offer-I was ready to go, knew what i wanted. or so i thought.  I was torn between the Butterscotch Marble and the Coconut-Ginger (sorbet). so i did what any good little ice cream go-er would do waiting in the line...i tasted both. and ordered both, (coconut-ginger sorbet to go). hey, you do what you gotta do. i live in san jose, i needed that little half pint to keep me company on my way back home!

Butterscotch- sooo yummy. and Mitchell's doesn't skimp on portion size. mine was huge, and for $2.10 (oh, plus an extra 0.10 since I splurged on a sugar cone), my tasty little treats ran me only $6.50 for both items.  hmm, i'm suddenly having a Rachel Ray $40 dollars a day moment....
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Apparently they were originally made famous because of their tropical ice cream flavors so make sure to sample a few when you go.

Being Korean, I grew up eating baked asian yams (gogomah) as a snack. So when I tried the Ube (purple yam), I was surprised because I expected something similar in taste. I can't say that I liked it, but it wasn't unpleasant either. It had a slightly starchy texture from the yams and it wasn't too sweet. My parents would probably love it. And did I mention it was very very purple?

The avocado was surprisingly good. It was creamy, almost buttery, and you couldn't really taste the avocado until the aftertaste. 

My favs were probably the mango and the tropical 4.

They have plenty of more "traditional" flavors for the less adventurous.

PS. The Grassshopper Pie isn't made from grasshoppers ;-)   It's actually a very tasty mix of mint chocolate chip and oreos.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
Pumpkin ice cream - yum!
You better run in and grab a number on hot sunny days, well, actually even on cold San Francisco nights because this place is always crowded and for good reason. Many flavors to choose from and they have cakes, shakes, sorbet too!
author: Linda C.

description:
After eating some homemade tacos with a few of my friends, we were talking about how yummy they were and then one of my friends said "Omg, Mitchell's would be perfect right now!"
I have never had Mitchell's so I said "Um, okay...but I have never had Mitchell's." They looked at me like I was crazy.
So we went at like 7pm and the parking and the line was intense.  I didn't understand what the deal was...its just ice cream people. Jeez.
Well, now I understand the crazy line/parking.
That ice cream has like drugs in it or something...it was AMAZING.
author: Ashley R.

description: Grasshopper Pie, you are my guilty pleasure here. The ube is a stand out as well. The chilly SF weather doesn't stop this place from having shivering patrons waiting or inside just gawking at the goodies. As sweet as this ice cream is, I end up quite thirsty not long after. A must if you have guests from out of town.
author: Joe L.

description: Definitely a fan, my favorite is the mango in a waffle cone. You can actually taste real mango in it and also their workers always top you off with a giant scoop ! Once you had this ice cream you will never want to have anything else again !
author: Jasmine L.

description: Seriously good ice cream. My cousin said it was even better a few years back (supposedly the store changed ownership?). Well, if it was better, I can't imagine it. They have every flavor you can think of and it's not just the traditional marshmallows and rocky road, but interesting tropical flavors like jackfruit and ginger and halo halo (no idea what that is).  It's kind of out in the middle of nowhere, but worth the trek.
author: Manesh P.

description:
This place is legendary. 

Literally.

I was watching a TV special the other day, and there was Mitchell's Ice Cream doing a walk through, directly followed by Ben & Jerry's.

I've been coming here since I was a kid. And let me tell you - you think Ben & Jerry's has funky fun flavors? HA! Get you're butt in here on a hot summer day and tell me it wasn't worth the 40 minute wait. 

If you buy a tub of ice cream, you can skip the line! ;-)
author: Mindy L.

description:
honestly, don't know what fuss is about here.  Maybe a line attracts more of a crowd? Not sure.

To me the taste was just mediocre, run-of-the-mill ice cream, the kind you can get at any grocery store across America, albeit with a few original flavors.  Also, had a look at their label- they don't use organic anything, but way worse than that there was corn sweetener and random weird soy extracts in all of their ice cream.  What? Gross! This is the bay area, get with the times and use better quality ingredients! There is way better tasting ice cream with way healthier ingredients in several places in this city.  Don't waste your time here.
author: Carlin S.

description: We've ordered a few ice cream cakes here before for birthdays and graduation. Maybe it's just me, but ice cream is ice cream--they all taste the same to me unless it's melted or watery? This place is too hyped up but good ice cream...I guess?
author: Lily W.

description:
Mitchell's has been around since I was a wee little lad, and the product continues to impress! Here are your objectives, In chronological order:
1. Find parking in teeny tiny back parking lot. If unable to find, search elsewhere on street. 2. Enter Mitchell's, grab a ticket for a number. 3. Go over menu on wall and select about 3. 4. Ask to sample 1 or 2 flavors. 5. Order the flavor you want. 6. Pay the cashier. 7. Eat the ice cream. 8. Brace yourself for orgasm. 9. Grab napkins as needed.

Even on colder days the line can be seen out the door and to the corner intersection. For more adventurous types I recommend mango, or my favorite----Avocado!!!

No real place to sit down, so most folks order up a cone or two, and take home a couple buckets for the fridge. The staff has always been friendly every time I've gone.
author: Danny H.

description:
I have been coming to Mitchell's for as long as I can remember and more.. I am never disappointed with their ice cream. Every time I go I try to taste a different flavor and I am always satisfied.

I came here last night with the BF and I had the toasted almond (very good! the almonds were nice and crunchy!) and he had mexican chocolate and cookies n cream. We were both in ice cream heaven. Mitchell's ice cream is the BEST ice cream shop you can ever go to. BEWARE: on hot summer days and nights (if they ever happen in the city) and just in general on any day, expect a LOOOOONG line. But it is definitely worth waiting. This is one of my all-time favorite places to come eat ice cream. Prices are great, but the minimum on credit/debit cards is $9 which sucks when you only come with two people. But they have plenty of different treats to choose from & they sell half-gallons of ice cream that you can enjoy in the comfort of your own home! Parking is limited, they do have their parking lot but only fits about 7 cars, so be prepared to go around blocks and blocks to find parking. But believe it is worth the wait!
author: Jessica H.

description: Mitchell's ice cream always has the perfect balance of creaminess, sweetness, and flavor.  It's thick and creamy, not icy, and never has that artificial sweetness that leaves a nasty taste in your mouth.  Perfect even on the foggiest day in July.
author: Jaclyn W.

description:
Mmm.. I heart ice cream.  And mitchell's is soooo good.  My favorite is the macapuno (coconut), although all of the tropical flavors are super tasty..  Yes, there's lines sometimes, but it's civil, and you get to get a little number from the number machine.  One thing that puzzles me is that the "queso" flavor is only available in half gallons...  I mean, how do you know if you like it enough to get a half gallon?  Crazy.

And try to resist making the joke that you're going to the Mitchell Brother's place for ice cream... c'mon.. I love that joke..  (hmm.. is this thing on?)
author: Dennis Y.

description:
This ice cream is amazing. Totally worth going out of your way for. The tropical flavors are best. I'm a choc-o-holic like no other, but when I go here it's all about the fruity flavors. Best ice cream outside of Graeter's in Ohio.

It would be nice if there were more places to sit, though. Lament, lament.
author: Lea B.

description:
This place has ube, mango, and macapuno. Where else aside from a moving cart in the Philippines can you get these flavors in such a rich iteration?

This place is a zoo most nights and for good reason. Their ice cream is rich, flavorful, and the available flavors make Baskin Robbins (or any other chain) look like a cheap ice cream truck. It's almost on par with gelato. Also, the fact that they have tropical flavors is a plus unto itself, but the fact that they execute it so well is what gets me to make the drive each and every time.

Bring cash, and make sure you have a driver to circle around while you order since there's a 99% chance you won't get any parking nearby.
author: Chris S.

description:
oh mitchell, what you do to me...

magnolia type ice cream?? you don't say! ube, macapuno, mango, jackfruit, maiz con queso, coconut, pineapple... ahh, you scoop so close to home.

but thank jah you're not selling durian anytime soon, right?

oh mitchell, i love your frozen yogurt as well. nothing says loving like guiltless heffing. thank you for not being tainted by overweening hipsterdom. thanks for not singing after i put something in the tip jar. thanks for being a quiet force of nature. thanks for looking just how i remember you back in 1994-1998, whether it was after school or after late catholic mass on sundays when my lazy ass didn't wanna get up at 7am.

oh mitchell, you're my knight in shining sprinkles. there is really no one else that can compare.
author: Vanessa D.

description: I like this place for the wide array of flavors, some familiar, some creative, some just straight up exotic (Japanese grapefruit comes to mind) and then they had lucuma, a Peruvian fruit! I've only found this back east and didn't think I'd be eating lucuma in California!  Ube is good too!  Everyone in line was excited to get this ice cream.  Overall, delicious experience!
author: Melanie M.

description:
The be all, end all of ice cream in San Francisco.

Do not pass go, do not collect $200, just go immediately to Mitchell's and get a scoop of grasshopper pie, chocolate dipped, of course. I know what you're thinking: is it really THAT good? Yes, it is. Worth waiting in line? You bet. Better than Swensen's or Bi-Rite? No contest.

Every time I go, I like to taste the avocado flavor (not order, just taste) because it tastes EXACTLY like avocado. If you put an avocado in the freezer for a day, took it out and took a bite, it would be just like the ice cream at Mitchell's. It's not actually good, just totally blows my mind. Don't worry, there are plenty of "normal" flavors, too, that are equally mind-blowing, but in a delicious way.
author: Derek S.

description:
C'mon.  Who doesn't love good ice cream?!?  Especially when it's a hole-in-the-wall spot.  You feel special going there; you feel great downing the ice cream; you feel fat after.  What could be better!

Put it this way, if I ate this same ice cream at Baskin-Robbins, I'd give it 4-stars.  But the 5th star is for its SF roots and ambiance.
author: Robby T.

description:
Chocolate dipped Caramel Rice Ice Cream thing. I forgot what its called. But it was chocolate ice cream with rice krispies and caramel sauce in it. I got it on a sugar cone with my cone dipped in dark chocolate. HELLA BOMB! OMG! It tasted so good. Hit the spot definitely on a hot day.

My hubby got the Mint chocolate chipped dipped in dark chocolate. TOO MUCH. Don't overdue it with the dark dipped chocolate cone. It ruins the ice cream. =[

Parking seriously sucks.
Its really hard to find parking. 
So if your desperate for an ice cream cone better be patient.
author: Nathalie N.

description:
The ice cream here is very good.  Better than your average ice cream shop.  Lot's of exotic flavors to choose from.

Parking is a hassle and the lines are generally long.  But it's worth the wait.  Plan on going w/ a buddy so you can chat as you wait for your # to be called.
author: Delilah B.

description:
The flavors at this classic SF spot are amazing and the butterfat is 16% which means it's fattening and good! 

My favorite regular flavor is the Mexican chocolate and my seasonal favorites are pumpkin in the fall and cantelope in the summer.
author: Lee H.

description:
I'm not a really big fan of ice cream in general, mostly cuz I grew up with that Dreyer's shit.  We all know THAT'S not homemade/natural as much as they market it to be.  Mitchell's on the other hand--this stuff makes me wish I lived close enough to try a different flavor everyday.  Rich, creamy, and creative flavors piled high in a big cone.  (Sounds sexual doesn't it?)  Everything from pistachio to omg, MANGO.  LOVE the stuff.  And it IS homemade, everyday, in the back of the place.  There's always a line, which MUST be a good sign!  Cash only, but who cares.  

Way to go Mitchell's!
author: Chanel F.

description:
Yum, yum! I have to say that Mitchell's has one of the best green tea ice cream I've ever had. They also feature many tasty, tropical flavors like ube (purple yam), langka (jackfruit), halo halo (for all you Filipinos out there), buco (coconut), mais queso (corn and cheese), etc. They even have flavors like mexican chocolate and white pistachio (If you're a pistachio lover, you have to try it!). I love every single ice cream I've had there!

I love that they have the ice cream available in half and full gallons for you to purchase! You can even ask for the ice cream behind the counter to be placed in gallons for you to purchase too, which is even nicer! 

If you're ever in San Francisco and craving for ice cream other than the famed Ghiradelli, go to Mitchell's!

If you're a local, you can also buy Mitchell's at Asian supermarkets like Ranch 99 stores (only a few do).
author: Rachel C.

description:
Grab a ticket, wait a few numbers...and get the best ice cream in the city!!
Because of their Ube, Mango, Macapuno, GREEN TEA & other exotic island flavors...I am even more proud to be Filipino.
author: Alexa M.

description:
I'd skip the dessert and come down to Mitchell's for ice cream! 

This place can get really rowdy in the evening but the line is moving very fast. You need to get a number and they will call you from the speaker. I love their thin mint and grasshopper with chocolate ice cream. Those are the ones to die for! 

Oh yeah, there are parking behind the building but it's limited. street parking if you find any.
author: Michael K.

description: Along with Bi-Rite, Mitchell's is the best ice cream in the city.  Everything is delicious.
author: Juan R.

description:
In the dead of SF winter, at 8pm on a Tuesday ... there will be a crowd here. Nuff said. 

Mmmmm.... ice cream goodness!
author: Mel H.

description:
If I could give this place all the stars in the world, I would.  There's only one Mitchell's Ice Cream in the world, and it's in the beautiful city of San Francisco!  :)  Nothing is more reminiscent of my childhood and home.

My personal favorite flavors are almond, cookies and cream, strawberry, dulce de leche, and of course the typical ube and mango; but of course, they aren't the only good flavors on the menu!  There is a wide variety of flavors.  As the Mitchell's Ice Cream website states, there are standard flavors, tropical flavors, sorbets, and seasonal flavors. Don't forget the sundaes and shakes too!  

I highly recommend this place to people who have not been to Mitchell's Ice Cream or San Francisco.  Mitchell's Ice Cream is a MUST for the complete San Francisco experience.
author: H. C.

description: My first visit to Mitchell's was a fantastic one. I the Coconut Pineapple ice cream in a waffle cone. It was sooooo good! Also, tasted the Halo Halo flavor, which was very tasty too if you are in the mood for tropical goodness. My great company had a Grasshopper Pie shake, which was delicious too. The wait to get your favorite scope is kind of long, but I thought it moved relatively fast. Regardless, I think it was well worth it--for a scope of scrumptious ice cream.
author: Nichole P.

description:
They offer a wealth of delectable flavor options, including things like ube and meaty coconut.  My personal fave is the pistachio.  

Be prepared to take a number and stand outside in line for 10-15 mins before ordering.  Mitchell's is worth it.
author: Sid D.

description:
As Janice from Friends might say.....OH MY GAWDD!!!!!!! 
This was the best ice cream I have ever had.  Although I am lactose intolerant...I ate a scoop of Kahlua and cream something ice cream, and I thought OMG i have died and gone to heaven.  Then when I got home, thank god I was home alone that night, because, omg, no one would have wanted to be in the same house as me.
Definately worth the stomachache, and i would definately wait in line again.  But next time I will remember to take my lactaid, aciphex, and peptobismol with me.
author: Janet R.

description:
i love eating ice cream when its cold outside!!  unfortunately it wasn't cold the day we came here, but the ice cream was still delicious!  

the girl that helped us was really really cool about letting us sample cantalope, mango, coconut, coconut-ginger, new york cherry (i think) mandarin orange, and tropical.  there was probably more but those flavors stick out.  the tropical/exotic flavors are awesome!!  anyway, i like grabbing a ticket and waiting, because there's less drama to deal with (who got where first) and most of the numbers end up being skipped... maybe the people couldn't wait and decided to buy a tub.. who knows.     

i felt like a happy fat kid walking around with my ice cream.
author: chelley L.

description:
OK, no one likes ice cream more than me. My dad used to work for an ice cream company and I used to work for a chocolate company, so that pretty much sums it up.

I think Mitchell's is totally overrated. I went there on a very busy Friday night, which I had expected. Here are the rules.

1. Unless you want pre-packed, grab a number immediately, before you even look inhale the ice cream parlor air.
2. Be warned, the exotic flavors don't really taste like anything. I tried purple yam and baby coconut and they had no flavor. Try everything you want to try, the people are nice. And you waited 20 minutes to get to that spot in line, so make the most of it. Everyone does. They specialize in more exotic flavors like you find in Hawaii and you can get red bean.

The ice cream tastes like Swensen's or slightly better than Baskin Robbins or Cold Stone. High butterfat, good quality. Not earth shattering.

If you like chunks and mix-ins, nobody does it like Ben & Jerrys. And its nothing unusual, no tang like frozen custard. 

Overall, stop by and support local, fresh made ice cream if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Alissa S.

description:
I scream for ice cream!!
Mitchell's opened in the 1950's and this place is still as popular and awesome as it can be. I believe they make some of the best ice cream in town and it worth the wait if there's a line outside the store. There's a wide variety of flavors from the traditional to a mix of tropical flavors to satisfy anyone palate. 

3 cheers for ice cream..... hrm I'm craving a scoop of mango right now =)
author: Nicole L.

description:
the parking and wait in line can be pretty overwhelming, but it really is worth the time if you have it to begin with. just know that your "quick trip to get ice cream" will turn into a minimum of a 20 min trip.

that's okay though because the ice cream is yum yum yummy! my favorites are grasshopper pie and ube. i've tried the buko, halo halo, avocado, macapuno, ube, grasshopper pie, and strawberries 'n cream and they have all been really great. 

the customer service can be hit or miss. they always seem to be moving at such a slow pace for such a huge line, but maybe they're just relaxed and calm about it all. my sister and i did receive great service one particular day last week from one of the guys there. he was more than happy to sample out a few of the flavors with a smile on his face and even opinions on which we'd probably like. he was just really pleasant, which made our trip really enjoyable. 

as long as i live thisclose to the shop, i will continue to frequent it as often as i can.
author: Tina N.

description:
i LOVE mitchell's!! 

great ice cream and friendly staff :)
author: Jackie S.

description:
This is probably one of the things I miss most about SF. I lived there for 7 years and worked in Bernal Heights. On particularly poopy days I would go down for the BEST icecream on the planet and it always made me feel better.

It's a little mom/pop shop that looks like it hasn't changed in years - this is a compliment. It's so NOT chain which is how the rest of the country seems to be these days. The ice cream is fantastic and the portions are generous. 

Be ware....regardless of what the weather is: rain, shine, cold, whatever - there's always a line. 

Worth a trip to SF just to go to Mitchell's.
author: Carina O.

description: The only part of me that doesn't like this place is my waist line and we have been at odds for years anyway! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE. Always great service even though its ALWAYS busy! They have the process down and you really can get in and get out. PLUS PARKING!!! what mother could ask for more!!! Never a dull moment at Mitchell's.
author: Carrie P.

description:
Great stuff.  I sampled the Grasshopper Pie and Black Walnut and they were both great.  The peanut butter flavor was also really good.

Some of the best in the city.  Only Bi-Rite and Joe's compare.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Yup, it's the best ice cream available in the bay area. In fact it's probably the best I've had other than Purity Ice Cream in Ithaca, NY. Go, enjoy hanging out in line for a while, and then enjoy some really spectacular ice cream!

Try getting a flavor with some caramel in it --- mmmmm! They lay it on thick!
author: Phil K.

description:
I'm pretty much an ice cream purist. I've never been into all the cutesy bullshit that you can find in every Ben & Jerry's and Haagen Dasz container. I like vanilla. And chocolate. But its never really that easy. Good, rich vanilla, and smooth, creamy chocolate are truly hard to come by. Mitchell's succeeds with 33 flying colors. Sure the wait sucks, but Mitchell's was the first double scoop of ice cream I've enjoyed in a long damn time. 

They have a ton of crazy flavors I would probably never try, but hey, I love the options. I can't believe I've lived in SF for almost 3 years and waited until tonight to experience the magic that is Mitchell's.
author: Brandon B.

description:
There are even lines in the rain

The Best  Ice Cream in San Francisco...My Dad started taking me here when I was a kid and I have been coming here ever since

Try The ube Ice cream ...(they have all the Filipino Flavors)
author: Kim R.

description:
so many reviews!
oh, how i miss my high school days when i would go after school EVERY DAY.. 
GREAT halo halo/ube/macapuno
my last dying wish would be to swim in a large tub of mitchell's ube.
author: Josie A.

description:
You won't need my review to decide whether or not you go to Mitchell's.  The line of people stretching behind the building will tell the story all itself.  Not to mention the 500+ reviews on this gem of a find.  

I was introduced to Mitchell's by my better half and she really got it right with this place.  Mithcell's has that X factor in ice cream and a horde of other desserts that simply can't be beat by Baskin Robbins and my old time favorite Thrifty ice cream.  Even though Thrifty's used to have that cool cylindrical scoop, Mitchell's far surpasses them.  

I will use the line that I've so come to hate which is, "you've just got to try this, you'll see why."  I'm a big fan of the Grasshopper which is mint and cookies and cream in one ice cream.  Those are my two favorite flavors and the fact they had them together ... lets just say I wish I was a cow and had three stomachs.
author: Bill P.

description:
Good, not great. I don't really know what the hubub is about.  Maybe there aren't more good ice cream places in the city?  I'm not much of an connossieur -- ice cream just makes me fatter -- so I don't know what the competition is.

Oh, and I feel sorry for the people that live upstairs from this place...the noise situation would have made me throw pails of excrement out the window by now.
author: Eugene F.

description:
My baby took me here when we first started dating.  What a safe and good choice for your new gf!  HAHAH

We split the banana split with cantaloup flavor, young coconut, and melon?  Rich, flavorful, fresh, light, all blended together.  

Awww and I still remember that date....  how sweet... literally....
author: Gigi T.

description:
OMFG Mitchell's ice cream is the bomb.  The ice cream is so creamy.  

-1 star for long lines sometimes.  Nobody, but NOBODY makes me wait for my ice cream.  

Parking lot is a +.
author: Dong T.

description:
Awesome ice cream - but be prepared to wait...a really, really long time. We went on a Sunday afternoon around 4 and had to wait for almost an hour to get our turn. Once we got our turn e'thing seemed to be so hurried that we hardly gotta taste test anything at all. 

Anyway, love their ice cream - nice eclectic flavors.
author: Sid A.

description: My favorite ice-cream spot and must-go-to stop for any SF visitors! It's crazy busy from open to close at this place, but it's worth the wait! I definitely recommend sampling the flavors before you get the one you want. Don't forget to buy extra to-go tubs, you'll definitely regret if you don't!
author: Kristina T.

description: Line was kind of long when I arrived. It was way hott tho...... Although my gurl's triple skoop was decent, mine was a monster!!!!
author: freaky r.

description:
What can I say that hasn't already been said? Mitchell's is outstanding and worth the wait. Goodbye Fenton's. Why travel over the bridge to Oakland when Mitchell's is so much better and closer for me. 
I think this is my new favorite ice cream. Can't wait to go back :)
author: eileen b.

description:
This is one of those reviews where I feel guilty because I have not tried everything they have to offer in order to give a proper review, nevertheless I give it 5 stars. First of all get there and grab a number because there is no line, just a mass of people trying to get ice cream. 

Second, dont get scared by the ube "purple yam" flavor. sounds terrible, but it is very tasty. 

Third, standby for your number to be called because you will get skipped if you dont pay attention. 

Oh and dont be the guy/girl who asks to try a bunch of flavors and doesnt tip, uncouth bro!

Ok, so I ordered the grasshopper pie which was mint chip ice cream with fudge and oreo bits mixed in. awesome! 

This is a great place to take a date. They have been making ice cream and winning awards for it since the 50's so they probably have something right. I need to try some other crazy flavors soon. I am a fan.
author: Ben H.

description:
There are simply no words to convey just how ridiculously wonderful, how wonderfully ridiculously Amazingly FREAKING *AWESOME* this place is, so I'll leave it at that.

Just a word to the wise for any n00b who might read this - if you arrive at Mitchell's and there's a line out the door (which there will be), walk past said line into the store and grab a number right away.  I've seen too many "first-timers" stand around outside for 5-10 minutes before they realize the line isn't getting any shorter - just different people in it - and that they failed to get a number.
author: Aaron J.

description: Mitchell's is the best Ice Cream in the city. It has been there for decades and they make their own ice cream on site. The flavors are rich and creamy and some of the flavors are quite amazing ranging from the traditional flavors such as strawberry to the tropical fruits of Latin America and the Pacific islands. There is always a wait since it is a popular spot.
author: Carlos C.

description:
I came here after I was craving something sweet after eating a Little Lucca's Sandwich. Hahaha for those who know...how could I eat anymore after that sandwich, well You know that feeling you get when you crave something amazingly sweet to satisfy the taste buds? Well this is definitely the spot. 

Mitchell's has a fun atmosphere, I heard it was newly remodeled and it looks so cute with it's 50's esque look. Anyways the line was incredibly long, but we stayed anyways. 

I love all the different flavors they have especially the tropical ones as well as creative creamy ones. The workers are so friendly even though they are corraled behind the counter with a million ice cream craving people telling them their orders of delicious ice cream choices.

I had the grasshopper pie ice cream and it was delicious! if you're into minty as chocolaty feel than definitely get that, and maybe don't go overboard with the chocolate crusted waffle cone, like I did b/c that was a bit much. Either way it was really good and satisfying. I loved the chunks of Oreo as well as the caramel that was mixed in there. I'm craving for it again....My friend had the Ube and it was to DIE FOR!! I so want to go back for their tropical flavors because that's what everyone seems to be saying. 

So if you're ever in the area...you guys should try this!!
author: Julie A.

description: i thought their ice cream was pretty much just ice cream. Maybe they have a special flavor thats out of this world or something but the chocolate tasted like chocolate and the vanilla tasted like vanilla. consistency was similar to other places i have tried. My boyfriend did get the young coconut flavor though and said it was really good. next time i pass by, ill try some and see if i should up my rating or not.
author: Minerva l.

description: NOM NOM NOM! This is the best ice cream out there! I love all their tropical Filipino Flavors lol like Halo Halo ohh and strawberry! Delicious!
author: Ms.s F.

description: Um.  Parking was kind of a bitch.  Long-ass wait.  So-so ice cream.  Not sure what all the fuss is about.  I left with my socks still firmly on my feet.  Bummer.
author: .caroline. ..

description:
The ice cream is goooooood~

My family loves the ube (purple yam) flavor.

Cantoplupe is yummy and I love when they have pumkin during fall/halloween season. It's really really good, but very very crowded with a small parking lot. If you buy the ice cream cones and stuff like that and it's crowded, you have to grab a number. We usually grab the half gallon and go straight to the counter to pay. It's all worth it!
author: Jen Q.

description:
I'm strictly a Mexican Chocolate girl. Unless it's fall, when they have Pumpkin. Then I start debating: mex-choc or pumpkin...? 
And wouldn't you know it? I end up getting both. 

I've also enjoyed rum raisin and cantaloupe. Would try mango if I could, but I'm deathly allergic! I'm long-wait-phobic, but Mitchell's is worth it--especially for treating out of town guests.
author: Dora A.

description:
It's ok, not the best I've had (i.e. Sketch in Berkeley, Marianne's in Santa Cruz, or anywhere in Italy or France) It's pretty basic ice cream, didn't taste like home-made to me. Maybe I just prefer the gelato style, which this is not.

By the way, what the hell is a Jackfruit?
author: Elissa D.

description:
It was like 50 degrees (which I guess is warm for SF cuz the place was packed) but Mitchell's creamy, dripping-with-the-fattiest-of-the-fat ice cream left me nice and warm on the inside (and freezing, oh so freezing on the outside).  

The mango tasted kinda artificial but that sweet coconut flavor was delicious!
author: Shyam P.

description:
LOVE=ICECREAM.

long lines, but completely worth it. i had my first date here! :)
author: Coco C.

description:
Oh boy, easily the best I've had except for back in New England where we invented it ;-)

Rich and creamy, and all those crazy flavors!  Beware if you order a banana split...skip lunch first and go right for dessert!  Go on a cold, rainy day and you won't have to wait so long.
author: Ken B.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said already? THIS ICE CREAM ROCKS! I can never limit myself to one scoop anymore because once I finish one I just want more.  My favorites are flavors Buko, Ube, Mexican Chocolate, Toasted Almond...Oh wait a minute...I love them all!!

There is always a line here, but it usually moves pretty quickly.  I was even surprised when on a cold, rainy night there was still a line.  I guess everyone loves Mitchell's -- except maybe the lactose intolerant...
author: Katie M.

description:
We walked up to the place and there were people all over outside.  Once we figured out we had to take a number, we walked inside and grabbed one that said 79.  We look up, and they are serving 33.  Um.....

An hour and a half later, I get some really good banana ice cream.  It was good, but not good enough to freeze my butt off waiting outside for an hour and a half.  I'll go to Bi-Rite and be in and out in 15 minutes (and I thought that place was crowded).  Plus, Mitchell's wouldn't let us combine flavors in a one-scoop cone like Bi-Rite does.  It's great ice cream, just not worth it to me.
author: Michelle K.

description:
Yum...Yum...Yum...Yum...Yum...Yum..

On a diet?  DO NOT GO!  You can't be on a diet here.

This place is worth SCREAMING for ICE CREAM!

It's worth the wati!
author: Juliana T.

description:
Some of, if not, the best ice cream flavors I have ever had. I love this place, and its super fucking cheap and I soooo p-o-o-r (imagine this in sign language). I like Tropical 4 personally but pretty much any of the flaors are good. I love the concept of the seasonal and the holiday special flavors and it's awesome. 

It's always really packed even at like 10 at night, so yeah, prepare to wait in line, and take a number! I totally didn't know that the first time and I waited in long for a hella long time and I realized how much of a dumbass I was so I had to wait longer...not a good move. But this place is amazing and only Bay Area exclusive yo!
author: Dustin H.

description:
Any ice cream shop that has a line out the door, even in the freezing rain late at night, has to got to be kick-ass. Mitchell's never disappoints.  I've tried their many ice cream flavors in cones & cups, HUGE pre-packed containers as well as ice cream cakes, and they all rule.  I make it a point to take all of my out of town friends here even after we've eaten gargantuan-sized meals.  Everyone so far has noticed and been enamored with the creamy goodness that is unique to Mitchell's.  

My favorite are their fruit-based ice creams.  I love the understated richness of the Macapuno.  The only "eh" flavor I've tried is the Avacado.  It's texture is unmatched by anything you'll find from Dreyer's for instance, but based on the amount of time it lasted in the freezer, it was by far the least exciting flavor I've sampled at Mitchell's.   Their seasonal ice cream flavors for Halloween, Thanksgiving (Pumpkin Pie) and Christmas (Egg Nog) also are winners.  The Chocolate Peanut Butter Indulgence should be illegal, it's so damn good.  My favorite by far has to be the Thai Tea Ice Cream.  YUM.

If any one has ever hated eating Mitchell's Ice Cream to the point of not finishing what they ordered, I will personally refund your money and drive you to the nearest mental health facility.  IT'S THAT GOOD.
author: Michael W.

description:
DAM this place is EVIL!!!!  Every time I go its always packed and for good reason.  My goal is to try every flavor.  

I really LOVE the mexican chocolate.  I even dream about it.  The grasshopper is amazing.  My daughter LOVES the strawberry.
author: Natacha M.

description:
Many exotic and interesting flavors. Try the ones on the separate board. They are very fun and unique. 

Decent ice-cream with amazingly cheap price. None of the flavors really stood out though....the purple yam has way too much food coloring....

I still come back because they have SO MANY flavors. But everytime I come back here, I can't help but think "Bi-rite is better..." 

Bi-rite's Salted Caramel and Honey Lavender are just unbeatable, at least in the city.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
It's a SF institution so I wanted to check it out. It was packed at 9pm with people all waiting inside and outside the little shop. We picked up a number and stared at the menu with all the different choices. 

I thought the inside was funny because they have a big glass divider between the customers and the staff so it's almost like a bank. You can also buy big to-go gallon of ice cream from the freezer. 

The ice cream was decent, i didn't get a crazy flavor, it was more like a Baskin Robbins to me. It absolutely does NOT beat the creaminess and melting goodness of Bi-Rite creamery. Not a place I HAVE to come back to again.
author: Gladys C.

description:
I've been coming here since I was in diapers.  And I'll probably still be coming here when I end up in diapers again, later in life.  If you're not used to the place or have never been here before, you'll probably hate the fact that there is no parking and that there is a long ass "line", and that you have to take a number to get service.  But screw all of that, just be patient and prepare yourself for some artery-clogging, indulgent, well-deserved ice cream.  

I gotta give Mitchell's a special shout-out for serving up Pilipino fruit ice cream and for serving their version of halo-halo.  It may seem exotic and questionable to others, but to me it's comfort food.

But as much as I love me some pinoy ice cream, my absolute favorite, since I was kid, is Toasted Almond.  And this is coming from someone who hates plain vanilla ice cream.  But there's something about the toasted almond mixed in there that just makes it taste oh so good.
author: Em C.

description:
I think I have to come back another time when I wasn't so full from dinner beforehand. I got the Thai tea flavor in a waffle cone. Not sure why but the ice cream was very soft and it tasted like there was alcohol in the ice cream. Thai iced tea doesn't have alcohol. hmmm. 

My friend had the best flavor though, I totally had ice cream envy. She got the pear sorbet it it so tasted like a burst of summer and so peary!!!! I wished I had gotten that instead.
author: Vivian L.

description:
I see a lot of "best ice cream in the city" reviews, and it's true! I thought it was kind of funny how this father brought his son to the place and said the same thing, but once he saw the line he hella left! How could you leave a place that has the best ice cream in the city? Hahaha.

Anyway, that's the thing about this place:  you have to wait in line, which is usually out the door, but that's fine if you think about the payoff. Such good ice cream, homemade and all that junk. They have a lot of the traditional flavors, as well as my family favorites like Ube and Mango. And I saw now that they have Halo-Halo, which combines everything (which is what it means) and I love it, too. 

This place is really, really great. I have nothing else to say, really. Hmm...how odd.
author: Caroline L.

description:
Favorite flavors: avocodo, buko (young coconut), black walnut.

Beware that it's a long walk from the rest of the Mission, though (but so worth it!).
author: Jimbo T.

description:
I'm not a big fan of tropical flavors or sorbets so maybe Mitchell's was the wrong place for me to satisfy my ice cream craving. But I had to see what the hype was all about. 

The place was packed inside and out. Thank goodness for their number system. The wait was approximately 20 minutes. 

We got two junior scoops (chocolate and vanilla) on a cone for the kid, a triple scoop (chocolate, cookies & cream, and coffee) for the man, and a grasshopper pie & Mexican chocolate hot fudge sundae for myself. The Mexican chocolate was too rich for me, but I had a taste of the bf's chocolate and it was just right. 

The regular scoops are pretty big. I recommend getting the junior scoops if you want to get a variety of flavors. 

Bottom line: Mitchell's is just okay. The location is a bit out of the way for us and the ice cream flavors were nothing spectacular. Bi-Rite has better flavors (coffee toffee!!) and a more convenient location.
author: Kim V.

description:
Thank you for having Ube Ice Cream

Dear Mitchel's,

Thank you for having Ube Ice cream!  You save me from having to bring back melted Ice Cream from the Filipino store when I visit my parents.  Your Banana and Malcapulco are very good as well.  Also, your number system keeps all of the ice cream fiends from cutting to the front of the line.

If Ice Cream were a health food, I would live here.

Yours,
Shea G.
author: Shea G.

description:
I won't be able to eat here until Easter since I gave up Ice Cream for lent so I can't wait to go back.
Despite the long line out the door even in the coldest of days, this place is great. I tried their Macapuno flavor and I've got to say, yummie... tastes just like it would in the Philippines.
I can't wait to try more flavors out!
author: Grace P.

description: Mexican chocolate ice cream was the bomb! Line is long with people crowding around to browse the flavors but you have to take a number and everyone works pretty quickly and efficient. I want more!
author: Bay M.

description:
Love the ice-cream
Love the crowd our front
Love that you get a # that seems 20-30 people away and yet 10 minutes later have your ice-cream.
Love the new, updated decor.

Only negative-  Major pet peeve of mine; I don't' ever want to see my waiter, counter help, cook etc. smoking outside the facility.
author: Michael M.

description: Hands down, the single best ice cream shop ever created. Mango, buko, grasshopper pie, butterscotch marble, banana, coconut pineapple, ube, chocolate caramel crackle and on and on and on.  Everything i taste i love. Waiting is not a problem, the staff moves quick anyway.  And grab a package of the cigar style cookies from the Philippines, they are addictive.
author: april p.

description: If you havent been there you havent lived a full life.  Mexican chocalte ice cream.  Just go.  Worth the wait
author: Sheriff D.

description: I would like to be buried in a sarcophagus filled to the brim with Mitchell's Grasshopper Pie. For that flavor alone I will gladly pick a number and wait patiently along with the thirty or so people in front of me on a drizzly winter evening.
author: George N.

description:
For as long as this place has been here, yesterday was my FIRST time here with some friends.  Friends even couldn't believe I've never been here before...

First, DON'T forget to grab a number as this place is very busy don't matter what time of the day it is.

Second, gonna be hard deciding what flavors to choose since there's quite a few and they all sound good.  Be ready.   

Went with the UBE (Purple Yam) and Coconut/Pineapple -  2 scoop in a cup combo.  SO ONO!  (GOOD)  Ube has just the right sweetness and you can really taste that pineapple in the Coconut/pineapple scoop.  

I've yet to try that Halo Halo (not the ice cream) but the mix and top it off with some UBE ice cream.  Save that for the next trip here.

Would've been 5 stars if parking was a little more convenient, but theres only so much in the back and since this place gets very busy...  Nevertheless, once you finally find parking, "time to GRIND some ice cream"
author: Jose D.
