description: Delicious Ice Cream . Rich Texture and tasty. Recommend
author: Gruber T.

description: I have been going to Mitchell's all my life, and it is definitely my favorite ice cream. Soooo much better than BiRite or Humphrey Slocombe's, because it is nice and creamy, as ice cream should be, while the others tend to have ice crystals in their ice cream--not my fave. Mitchell's has some wonderfully creative flavors, though their menu did used to be much longer and more diverse before they remodeled. Still love it though! Hands down best ice cream in the city!
author: Sheigla A.

description: So delicious!! I have been going to Mitchell's for so many years!! I absolutely love their Chocolate Chip! Perfect for any day of the week.
author: Shannyn W.

description: Mitchell's has pretty good ice cream with tons (i mean tons) of flavors.  The taste is similar to Baskins (not a bad thing), except that it's local.  Very typical and familiar flavors (not a bad thing).  Not worth the drive for me though.  Also no place to sit on the inside =(; saw a couple benches outside and took a seat.  Of the SF ice cream places I've been to this was the most packed.  Would definitely stop by if I was wanting ice cream and was in the area.  But who knows when that will ever be again...
author: j h.

description: Ice Cream in January, use of Filipino ingredients with butterfat cream, 2 scoops of the Halo-Halo flavor in a fresh semi-warm waffle cone...did i just die and go to heaven for 5 mins? oh well, glad im back!
author: Nick V.

description: lots of flavors to choose from. its extremely crowded so don't plan on just stopping by... expect to wait, even if its freezing cold... which is what my friends and I did.
author: Jenn C.

description: So like way over 5 yrs ago I moved away from the Bay Area to Stockton & I would drive to SF just to get some of Mitchell's Ice Cream.... CRAZY but it is just soooo good.  I'm glad that now I am back in the Bay & don't need to drive 2+ hrs to get some of my favorite ice cream (1 scoop of rum raisin & 1 scoop of pistachio).  Yummm!!
author: Angel Q.

description: Mango dipped in choc., grasshopper pie, cantalope, all the ice cream there is amazing! Worth the waiting in line! It's a childhood must! If u haven't been, u gotta go! There's always room 4 ice cream! Screw the Jello =)
author: Ladyreyes R.

description: Going to Mitchell's definitely brings me back to my childhood, before Noe Valley became home to the stroller mafia. I'm really finicky about ice cream, in fact, it makes ill (lactose intolerance)so it has to be really good or a unique flavor to be worth the stomach cramps and inevitable gas. My favorites are the pumpkin pie ice cream; which is better than pumpkin pie, and mexican chocolate; which is really intense - dark chocolate and cinnamon, mmmm. Yes, please. On rare hot days, there is ALWAYS a line out the door.  Only once in my life (once) have I been able to park in their little parking lot. It's that popular.
author: Jennifer C.

description: There are legions of fans for this standard bearer. Not many can claim having had their ice cream since the 80's, or readily admit it. Love their Philippine influenced flavors e.g. halo halo, ube, buko etc... Kudos to learning the neighbors who settled in the outer mish who have become loyal fans and employees. In a pinch, an ice cream birthday cake is worth its prize.
author: One P.

description:
Great flavors.  I had the ube and halo-halo.  The ube (made from taro root) was very creamy and the halo-halo was delicious though it could have had more bits of the things that are in halo-halo.  My mom had the avocado and it was sweet and smooth - like a real avocado!  The Mexican chocolate is also very unique.

My only complaint is the crazy wait!  This place is so popular you have to get a number.  They were on 50 and our number was 85!  It took about 30 minutes on the Sunday afternoon.
author: CM P.

description: we love the ice cream, staff are great. hate the freaking wait.  serve people faster and get them out!  keep the line moving and keep people from crowding constantly!  you can move them quicker.  create better outdoor seating or SOMETHING that helps keep the crowd contained in a space efficient place so others can come in and order peacefully.  you cant even make it to the counter for gods sake.
author: Aza T.

description:
HOOORAY!

mitchell's is fantastic.  it is worth the trip and the wait.

it's amazing.

and the staff is SO DANG FRIENDLY.  they must pay them in ice cream.
author: Liz S.

description: This is the best ice cream in the world.  If only they had more parking, I'd be there every weekend.  Favorite flavor: Kahlua Mocha Cream.
author: Michelle M.

description: My favorite ice cream place.  It is definitely the best ice cream!!  I like to get a whole gallon of of Acupoco flavor the one with coconut gel.  I love it and I am not into ice cream until I ate at Mitchell.
author: Ngan T.

description:
the tourists have taken over mitchell's!

i think it was the shorts clad families, blinding camera flashes, and excitement conveyed in non-english languages that gave them away.  

that and the fact that there was a 20+ minute wait on a Wednesday night at 10pm.

luckily we scored parking in the back and were able to nosh on our salted peanut and white pistachio sundae in satisfactory silence.

in theory the sundae should have been amazing but was reminded too late that i always appreciate ice cream in its unadulterated purest form - naked on a cone.
author: Josie M.

description:
Get it dipped in chocolate!

Mitchell's is worth the wait, the wacky parking lot and the guy outside trying to sell you a ticket for 2 bucks.
author: bianca francesca o.

description:
I sometimes skip dinner and go straight for dessert. So many choices from the decadent ice creams swimming with chocolate, or the traditional filipino desserts with red beans sometimes my eyes are bigger than my stomach!
It's even more fun to take someone who's never been there before. The look of astonishment on their face is almost as delicious as the treat itself.
Totally worth the line
author: Rachel R.

description:
If you haven't had Mitchell's, you have not lived.

My favorite ice creamery EVER. The variety of classic and exotic flavors are enough to give you a brain freeze! It's so hard to choose that pretty much everything i've tried here has become a favorite. Never does the ice cream taste overbearing or sugary like most brands.  In fact, I've got about 4 buckets of their frozen goodness in my fridge right now! Despite my strictest dieting attempts, I just have to have my Mitchells!

Their cakes are a definite as well! ;)
author: Ikeb I.

description:
I'd heard about a great ice cream place near the Chavez side of the mission.  I'd wanted to check it out, but I wasn't quite sure where it was and hadn't gotten around to it.

After eating a ton of food at My Tofu House a buddy of mine and I decided it was time to go on a quest for some ice cream.

It was a dark, cold and fog-drizzeled evening by the time we found it after.  When I saw that there was a line out the door and cars pulling up like it was an In-N-Out drive through, in spite of this, I knew it had to be the place.

It was definitely tasty and they have some exotic flavors beyond your standard Shrek and Rose Cardamom flavors, er chocolate and vanilla.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
This place is rated to be one of the top 10 ice cream places in the country, and my husband couldn't stop raving about it after he went there.  So my expectations were high as we drove through Christmas rain in the cold, windy Bay area to get to this place.  I said to my husband, "If there is a line at the ice cream parlor despite this weather, you KNOW it's good."

And YES, there was a line, for good reason.

We had the mango, avocado, and ube (purple yam) ice creams, and all were unlike any attempts by any other ice cream place that I've tried.  Full of flavor, very creamy, and little bits of the mango and ube, respectively, mixed in.     I wanted to try the coconut, pumpkin, dulce de leche, jackfruit and of course the gazillion versions of chocolate, but my post-holiday waistline screamed no even though my taste buds screamed yes.

We have a cooler ready to be packed with dry ice so that we can take a couple gallons home with us to LA.  It's THAT good.
author: Alina S.

description:
Mileu:
An Ice Cream Parlor with paper tags like you are getting meat from a deli.

Service:
An Ice Cream Parlor

Food:
WOW,  yummy yummy yummy.  They have any flavor you want.  Pumpkin one is so good.  I love pumpkin.  They have avocado, mango, kumquat, guava, and things i haven't even heard of ice cream.  Dude, you can taste as much as you want.  I totally think this is the hands down best ice cream place I have been to in the sense of flavor choices and the creaminess of the ice cream.  I love it.
author: M L.

description:
The only ice cream place you'll see a line out the door on a rainy day late at night! Make sure you take a number as soon as you get in-- or else someone else will be able to get in front of you in line!

I LOVE THE PEAR SORBET!!!!!!
author: Jess D.

description:
I've been going to Mitchell's since I was a kid. 

They have the best ice cream....ever!! 

My favorite flavors are Chocolate and Mango!!
author: Bianca B.

description:
You can never go wrong with Mitchell's Ice Cream. I don't care how cold it is, there will always be a line. DON"T FORGET TO GET A NUMBER AS SOON AS YOU GET THERE... . else you will be sorry when 15 people have already gotten ahead of you, while you were too busy drooling overr the flavors and eyeing the ice cream cakes.

Tonight I sampled the avocado ice cream, as I had never had it before, and it had been recommended to me. It wasn't bad. My friend got the mango, but I think she always gets the mango. 

i've had the lucumpa and the halo-halo : both of which were delicious. 

I think next time I'm getting the Ube, and/or Thai Tea.

Bomb-@$$ ice cream .. that's all i have to say
author: j d.

description:
I love Mitchell's! So much so that despite having relocated from the outer mission to the far east bay, I will often make a special trip when in the city to get ice cream here. the velvety smooth ice cream just melts in your mouth! they have a great flavors, and their rotating seasonal flavors are also very fun! (Pumpkin is my FAVORITE!) 

Yes, be prepared to wait pretty much any time you go (unless you get a pre-packed 1/2 gallon) for anywhere from 15 minutes to closer to an hour.. but it is worth the wait. And yeah, it is kinda one of those hip places, but it is a San Francisco institution. My grandfather used to bring my mom here as a child. There is a reason they have been around as long as they have!
author: tina p.

description:
Sometimes in life you have to spend a moment appreciating the simple things...
and delicious ice cream is one of life's simple pleasures...
I had never been to a Mitchell's until last night.... I have enjoyed the ice cream (store bought) many times before...
The Mexican Chocolate I tried was yummy (honestly, i dont know what "mexican chocolate is supposed to taste like, but it was good...so oh well...).. I will be back to try the seasonal Cantoulope...(I do know what that should taste like)
All I can say is that you know a place has good ice cream when its cold outside and there is a line out the door... Im from San Diego... you just dont eat ice cream when its cold... this must be an SF thing...
i can learn though.
enough said...
author: Florio M.

description:
Mitchell's gives me warm fuzzy feelings inside. Ice cream is  pretty much my favorite thing ever...and on a sunny day, I like to head on over to Mitchell's to make the day that much more enjoyable. The flavors are really good.
I recommend the Chicago Cheesecake and Cookies and Cream.
Also, the people that work here are really nice and enjoyable.
author: Yvonne Q.

description:
My favorite ice cream place ever! 

True you have to wait in line by taking a number as if you were waiting to buy fish at a Chinese supermarket, but it's definitely worth the wait.

Creamier than most places, the fruit-made ice cream is the best. Even strange flavors like avocado and yam are surprisingly delicious. One of the best things about the place is that the staff are patient and accomodating and will let you sample as many flavors as you like. I remember one of my friends sampling at least 10 different flavors (though you might want to give a tip if you go overboard like he did). 

Overall, one of the best places for ice cream I've been to. A must for when my friends visit me in the city.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Showed up on a Sunday afternoon and pulled number 50, then heard the girl behind the counter call out "11."

Sigh.

Yes, the wait was long. But the crowd outside (there isn't room to wait inside, and you wouldn't want to anyways- hot!) was mostly friendly and good natured. Though they are supposed to specialise in "exotic" flavors I had to try the Grasshopper Pie (mint ice cream, fudge, oreos). It was good enough to challenge my usual favorite Fenton's. Quite impressive.

Bonus: they have dipped cones. My friend got banana ice cream dipped in chocolate- amazing! Also, their "blasts" are made with all kinds of fruit, so mango tastes like mango (instead of flavorless which happens when you make fruit ice cream into regular milk shakes).
author: Katie D.

description:
Mitchell's is special. I can't even compare it to anything else. It makes me sad that it is so far. 

This place definitely keeps it classy.
author: Lee M.

description:
It's good, with unusual flavors, and it's fresh, and the staff is nice and the prices are good.

But I don't think its like crack cocaine really. So four stars is enough to describe it. I wouldn't go craving it, driving across the bridge or even really out of another neighborhood in the city to seek it out.
author: Caroline C.

description:
I don't even need to write much. This place is great. Everyone knows it as well.

I love their pumpkin ice cream.

Great place to toward the end of an evening on a date.
author: Joe B.

description:
My friends and I ate our ice cream outside in the cold weather and it still tasted good. I tried a little bit of everyone's and the best flavor was strawberry.

The pear sorbert tastes like you're eating an actual pear! There's also little chunks of pear in it. So freshing!

Also, there's no seating so most people just stand outside and enjoy their ice cream.
author: Jenn S.

description:
Mitchell's is some seriously tasty ice cream.  It's cheap, super good, and it's local.  There's always a line.  I like the way that they have "windows" you walk up to and order.  The people behind the counters are pro.

Serious plus for you drivers: they have a parking lot in back.
author: Jon A.

description:
Best Ice Cream ever. 

Current Fave: Cookie's and Cream

I know what you're thinking, just TRUST me.............

Parking can be a little difficult, but all of the flavors are totally worth it. It's the creamiest I've ever had. It's Butterlicious.
author: Jake R.

description:
Hamanasasa....  This may be some of the best ice cream i have had in a long time.  God how i love thee, creamy seductress of the night!!!

The praline caramel is amazing!!! And I am from the south, so the ice cream man grinned as I said praaaaaaaaaline and carrramel...  God it is the little things.  Joseph my wonderful friend had the coconut and this other seductive flavor chocolate coco crumble or crunch?  I tried it, OMG i was so torn being a die hard choco fan and all!!

Plus they are open till 11, oh yes i have found a new haven!!!
author: Nicole F.

description:
Mitchell's... Bi-Rite...Mitchell's...Bi-Rite...

Duuude you can't ask someone who loves ice cream to choose between the two!

OK so there was no line at Mitchell's when we got there. Amazing! Well i guess it was kinda late...2:30 pm on a cold saturday afternoon.  We had just finished stuffing our faces with tacos from La Taqueria  and still made sure we left enough room for Mitchell's.

I got a pint of Grasshopper Pie so I could take it home and enjoy every single bite. Good lordy was it good. Mint ice cream with fudge and oreos mixed in. Hellooooooo! I've died and gone to ice cream heaven. 

I stole a bite of my neice's Lemon sorbet...it was very tart and lemon-y...good sorbet!

Can't go wrong at Mitchell's!
author: Mary L.

description:
I pass this place everytime i commute to work and instantly come up with memories of when I was a kid on a hot day eating ice cream with my family on the sidewalk!
This place is worth the long lines and waits that await you when you get there. 
Grab your number quickly and wait patiently and you will be rewarded. Their Macapuno Milkshake is THE BOMB!! 
Their sundae's are great, the ice cream is creamy and smooth, and the flavors come second to none in the city! I love coming here and getting any flavor!
Favs are Mango, Macapuno, Ube, and just plain ole vanilla.
author: Eric A.

description: This place was recommended to me by a family member who lives in the area. Street parking was a pain, we had to circle for awhile before finding parking 3 blocks away. We went on a Sunday evening around 7pm and there was just a small line. If you're not a local make sure to grab a ticket from the left side of the entrance door, I would've figured this out if the guy behind me didn't excused himself to grab one. We waited about 10 minutes in line before being helped. There were so many flavors and people in the shop that we didn't want to waste anyone's time by tasting multiple flavors. I got ube, bf got chocolate. The ice cream was nice and unique, but a little thicker and creamier than I expected. It was nice to try this place out, but I probably wouldn't go back unless I was in the neighborhood and got store front parking.
author: Marilyn V.

description: Ice Cream at its finest. If your from San Francisco you know about Mitchell's Ice Cream . Enough said .
author: Ron B.

description: Yes, we waited for 45 mins to taste the crazy hype for ourselves. Was it worth the wait? NO! We tried 3 of their popular flavors...ehhh. It's decent, definitely not worth the hype. I prefer Lappert's Gourmet Ice Cream in Sausalito.
author: linh d.

description: I love Mitchell's. Mitchell's is a San Francisco institution. Baby Coconut  or Buko as they call it is my favorite. I have a hard time not ordering that every time I come. I also love Pumpkin Pie and Peppermint Stick, their seasonal flavors. I also love Dulce de Leche, Peanut Butter Indulgence, and Thai Tea. Come in the dead of winter to avoid the lines. Otherwise be prepared to wait because the secret is out. Mitchell's is great. Yes, yes, Bi-Rite is great too. But Mitchell's is old school San Francisco and that is something very rare.
author: David S.

description: The dark chocolate "fudgeismylife" sauce is the perfect complement to Mitchell's vanilla ice cream.  Skip to the express line, get a half gallon of vanilla and a jar of "fudgeismylife" which is so good, it doesn't have to be heated.  Favorite combo on a cone if the line is short, "Tropical Four" and "Mocha Fudge".  The key to Mitchell's ice cream is the freshness.  Thank goodness no conglomerate has attempted a buyout.  Evil corporations stay away!
author: Catherine A.

description: I sampled two flavors that caught my eye while I was there: Ube and Halo Halo since I found them intriguing. Ube was a no no but Halo Halo which has ube in it along with a couple of other flavors had an interesting taste but it was not what I wanted. When I sampled their oreo cookie I knew I had to have it. OMG it's amazing! The vanilla they use is mind blowing and I love that it comes with large chucks of oreo cookies. It really is the best oreo ice cream I've ever had to date. I can't stop thinking about it and I even want some now! Move over Ben & Jerry's cookies n cream, I've got a new oreo cookie favorite!
author: Helen L.

description: Love, love, love! It was my first time there after living in the city for almost 3 years and all I could think was why?!?!?! Very good ice cream, probably the best i have ever had. The selection is huge and the pre-packed tubs are genius. So why only 4 stars? Because the customer service was terrible. Every single one of the employees were very unfriendly and acted like it was blaspheme to ask for assistance. It was as if their lives were so terrible why would they want to help you?! Good thing the ice cream was bangin because that's the only thing keepin me there.
author: C D.

description:
This review is long overdue. I've been dropping by this place for ice cream for a few years now. 

Always great. Always crowded. But always great.
author: Patrick L.

description: Please don't stone me!!  I was not too impressed with the ice cream here at Mitchell's.  I came here early in the week when there was an enormous heat wave and decided to try the Ube ice cream to check it off my 7x7 list.  Yes, I checked off 4 things in 2 days!  Being the fatass I am, I decided to upgrade it to the Halo Halo dessert.  The dessert was quite refreshing but nothing too special.  I was super excited for the ube ice cream because I love anything that has those three letters, U-B-E on their packaging but I was extremely disappointed! It tasted like nothing at all!  Maybe I need to try a different flavor but for something on the Best 100 Things to Try in SF list, it should have been pretty damn good.
author: Nicole G.

description: I grew up on Mitchell's Banana.  Still my all-time favorite! Just pure, straight-up Banana.
author: Kacie O.

description: stop creating a neighborhood eyesore. people are constantly dumping your ice cream in our garage door area. there is ice cream all over our garage entry right now. send someone to clean it up. not very cool. bad neighbors.
author: George R.

description:
BOMB Ice cream! To die for.... I drove across the bay for this place... would do it again in a heartbeat. YUMMMS all the way.

Delicious!
author: Patrícia R.

description: Amazing ice cream. Used to live 2 blocks from. Coincidentally was also the heaviest I had ever been. Hmmmmm.
author: John K.

description:
In all this hype over the recent popularity of frozen yogurt, I'm craving for some real old school dessert. I lost myself in that hype over frozen yogurt but reading these reviews brings back memories of Mitchell's.

Here's to the one flavour that I started out with and have been loyal to: Mint Chip. It's worth waiting in the crowd for. I think I'm going to pay a visit real soon.
author: Courtney L.

description:
It doesn't get any better than Mitchell's - the only Ice Cream store that will have a line out the door on a cold rain day in SF.  Friendly service, fresh ingredients, great flavors, yes your favorites, but try something out of the box and you'll be adding it to your favorite list.

I have been going to Mitchell's for 20+ years and the quality has never changed - nothing but the best!
author: Trish G.

description: Buko and ube are to die for!  I'd die for ice cream here.....
author: Hallie S.

description:
"..its great.." aka my girlfriend...

Reminiscent of my old childhood days...i remember coming here with my dad after school getting the chocolate chip ice cream.  Ive grown up over the years trying new flavors yet still getting that joyful feeling of me being a little kid.  They have a vareity of flavors for every taste bud..

Get the mango ice cream its simply divine...
author: Bernardo C.

description:
Mitchell's is testament to my belief that NYC does not have "everything", as people would like you to believe.  I've heard about Mitchell's before, so when I visited SF this past May with my friends, I made sure to visit it.

We made three damn trips--and it was all worth it.  Mitchell's is smallish, and the parking in the back is kinda small, but never mind that.  There is always a crowd of people waiting in the front, and it's cool to overhear other people making their decisions out loud, and a cool way to strike up a conversation with locals.  The flavours are extensive, but I have to say what really attracted me was the Filipino flavours of ice cream-ube, langka (jackfruit), buko, macapuno, and tropical four.  

Chinatown Ice Cream Factory in NYC doesn't even come close in my book.

Definitely make Mitchell's a "must do" when you come to SF.
author: anna m.

description:
I used to live around the corner from Mitchell's (literally) and it was a weekly treat. Their Thai Tea ice cream is one of my all time favorite flavors. I've never seen it anywhere else and despite always wanting to branch out I consistently came back to it. Not surprisingly, their other offerings are equally delicious. Mexican chocolate is a nice spin on the original plain chocolate and Chocolate Caramel Crackle should be illegal. Perfectly creamy chocolate with soft caramel ripples and pieces of nestle crunch bars. Ooohh! Kahlua Mocha cream makes for a good Kahlua Mocha Cream milkshake (but you'll have to take it home to try that one!). 

I should mention that I am lactose intolerant and ice cream makes me deathly ill, so for me to be willing to go through that pain to eat their ice cream should be some indication of how amazing it is. 

When I feel like I should be good to my digestive system I'll go for their mango or pear sorbet, but it isn't too often I want to be good when they've got great staples and seasonal winners (Pumpkin and Eggnog).
The line is always long and I wish there was somewhere to sit but that's  hardly a deterrent from their shop. Go for the original location and not the other shops around town that carry Mitchell's. There's something better about going to the source.
author: Patrice S.

description:
Today was probably the hottest day I've experienced since moving to SF, and a perfect time for my first visit to Mitchell's.  When we got there, some nice guy was just leaving and gave us his ticket. That turned out to be quite fortuitous, since there were at least fifty people waiting!

The selection was incredible-- I had the avacado and my wife had the mango. Both were delicious and refreshing. The flavors were subtle compared to the overwhelming chunkiness of say, a Ben and Jerry's, but that's what made the ice cream go down so easily.  Next time, the purple yam is calling me!
author: Kelvin L.

description:
Been going here for years as a kid.. Never lost it's charm..
Or flavor..

Always been a favorite for my family for the exotic flavors, like Ube, and.. well, That's generally the flavor they get by the gallon..

as for me, I now usually get the Chocolate Caramel Crackle, kinda self explanitory, and really good.. 'n Sinful (though, not as sinful and bad as cold stone creamery.. mitchell's can be tollerated any time)..

Just pray you don't go at a busy time.. still, The line can still be Ok when busy..

Nymo's 100% Approval for making everyone feel like a kid with their wonderful hand-made ice cream..

Nymo's quick tip: If your little kid was being too-much like a litte kid and dropped his ice cream cone, Mitchell's will happily give a replacement..
author: Nicolo T.

description:
If you haven't been to Mitchell's yet, you've either just moved to SF or hate ice cream. Either way go give it a try. Walk up. Take a number. Stare at the board. Hang out by the benches. Prepare for yum.

Caramel praline in a waffle cone is my number one favorite. Other standouts are macapuno and Mexican chocolate.

If you're out late at say El Rio or The Knock Out remember Mitchell's is open everyday till 11:00 pm.
author: Angela K.

description:
Mitchell's ice cream is the cold creamy manifestation of happy bits of my childhood.

Almost every Friday during the summer, my mom would take my two siblings and I into the city to pick up my dad's paycheck.  She would drive to 'BofA' as she called it, deposit the check and take out $20.  Then, we would go to Mitchell's to get ice cream.

I remember salivating as we turned onto Guerrero off of the street formerly known as Army, busting at the seams with excitement.

We would all rush out of the car so we could get one of those paper numbers.  When it was empty (which was rarely) we would burst with joy, and when it was busy we would pace impatiently, looking at the menu, deciding if we would go with the regular or branch out and try something new.

Back in the day, I always had internal dialogs concerning whether to choose the Oreo Cookie or the Milk Chocolate (which is sadly no longer offered.)  Milk chocolate usually won, as my 12 year old self rationalized that Oreo Cookie could be acquired almost anywhere, but Milk Chocolate was a rare treasure.

I recently meandered into Mitchell's for the first time in quite a while with a friend of mine and ordered the Oreo Cookie.  And my adult self, which has become much more picky about food, agrees wholeheartedly with my child self that there is no better ice cream than what's offered at Mitchell's.
author: Becca B.

description:
Deeee-light.  No gurgling stomach brewing trouble even after slurping a generous amount of Pumpkin, Mocha Fudge, Thai Tea, Oreo and White Pistachio (not all my own order).  Beats 31 Flavors to a cream-y pulp.  My stomach does not lie, this stuff has to be made with real ingredients.

Tip:  ya gotta take a number (like at a deli), so don't waste your time standing around in what you think is the line outside like .... um, me.
author: X E.

description:
What can I say about this place???!!!!!!

This is my all time favorite place!!!!!!!!
I have been going here since I was a little kid... I grew up in the neighborhood, after school, we would just get as much ice cream as i can afford.  I love the Filipino flavored ice cream, just takes me back when I was in the Philippines... just pure tropical paradise.

I love their Kahlua Mocha, Mocha fudge, Langka, Buko, Spumoni, Chocolate Chip, etc... 

The best ice cream...
author: Surfer S.

description:
This isn't  a review.  Its more like an homage to the best ice cream in town.

I have always loved the rain.  But I love it better when its raining on me and I have Mitchell's ice cream in hand.

If you haven't been there, then shut the laptop and go gets you some.
author: Pete M.

description:
Great ice cream here, but no frozen yogurt. 

No seating inside and no credit cards. Bollocks.
author: G J J.

description:
A must try!! If you live in SF and haven't tried this place, you're missing out. If you're visiting the area, be sure to check this joint out. It's absolutely fabulous.

Where else can you get tropical flavors like Ube, Macapuno and Buko?! YUMMM...
author: Anne K.

description:
I looooooooovvvvvvvveeeeee ice cream!

Although I chickened out and got a "safe" flavor (kahlua coffee or something) it was still good.  I'm not brave enough to try to "prider flavors" as we dubbed it but one day I will.  They have filipino flavors like...ube and halo halo flavors as well as your normal run of the mill mint chip, pralines and cream etc flavors.  Prices are very reasonable especially since I come from the Coldstone's generation where you have to bring your savings for ice cream.  The parking sucks since the lot is tiny so you're left circling for parking or playing leap frog across San Jose Ave.  Once parked you then have to stand in line.  GET A TICKET INSIDE!!  It's the red thing to the left of you right when you walk in.  I must have asked 4 people where to get a ticket I swear they hide that thing.

Ice cream in 50 degree weather?  Why yes please!
author: Anna H.

description:
awesome creamy ice cream that, in my opinion, is worth the wait if you really want some ice cream.

SO YUMMY. i want some now.

it's short cause everyone has raved already.

also if you happen to like magic shell, you can order scoops in a cup and they'll drench it for you OR if you're really health conscious just order a cone and have them dip it once or twice...i guesss!!
author: Clarisse C.

description:
Best damn ice cream in town!!!!

I only wish that there was room enough to sit down and really dig into a sundae there.  As it is, I mainly go for a cone... sometimes dipped, but usually just a pure, unadulterated, delicious scoop of heaven on a sugar cone.  I can't pick a favorite flavor because I haven't tried them all yet.  But I can say this... I haven't met a flavor there that I didn't like!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Been to Mitchells too many times to count...don't care what time of the year it is...there is going to be a line...but count on it moving fast! I've tried a number of flavors but my all time favorite, bar none is the combo of Mexican Chocolate with Peanut butter indulgence...H E A V E N!!
And you know what else...people are always happy at Mitchell's...they're either about to get some ice cream and the anticipation is making them giddy or they're already eating their ice cream and beside themselves with delight! It's a San Francisco Institution!
author: Simms B.

description:
Good, but not as good as Bi-Rite.

Its like a Filipino Baskin Robbins/Paskin Lobbeeeens.

I'm surprised there isn't a store in Daly City or Serramonte.
author: Rocky K.

description:
The ice cream here is pretty good... the selection is great for tropical flavors.  But somehow the huge line always puts me out of the mood =_=. That's probably why I've never stopped after driving by it every week for years... 

Maybe I should try biking over one day... the ice cream might taste even better.
author: Daven D.

description:
There is NEVER a bad time to be eating mitchell's ice cream!!!!! This place is absolutely wonderful.  The skies might be cloudy, but a lick of that ube and avocado flavored ice cream calls out a dreamy sunshine and an automatic blissful smile on my face.  Happiness is a double scoop of that  purple and green yumminess.  

And I can even leave the store with a tub of ube ice cream as well.  When I have brunches at home, there is nothing better than a scoop of floating ube ice cream in black coffee (I call this my ube afogato served in a cafe glass).  The purple and deep black coffee swirl to make one of the most beautiful colors you will ever see.  And the creaminess, ube-taro rootiness, and coffee flavors make quite a treat!  Bring a Mitchell's tub to any potluck party or sunday brunch... you will have friends inviting you to parties for LIFE!

Okay, so there is a line almost always out front.  But look, observe, and watch people transform as they take a lick of thai tea ice cream or rum raisin or any of the tropical delights (mango, macapuno, buko, avocado, ube).  Mitchell's serves up bliss!  How can anyone resist?!?!  Take an number... and be part of one of San Francisco's amazing treasures!
author: Alex D.

description:
HOMYGAD.

i would really love a mango blast right now.
as a friend said, "its like drinking real mangoes out of a straw".

mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm
makes me want to road trip all the way back to sf for one!!

halo halo ice cream was yummy too!

and of course i also had to love this place for its tropical filipino flavors.
REPRESENT! hahahahahah
author: Jessica r.

description: This place is amazing. Compared to bi rite, I think its much better. Larger portions, creamier and just perfect. Got the grasshopper pie and the dulce de leche. Some of the best ice cream I've ever had. Went really late at night and there was still at least 25 people waiting for ice cream. Go try this place out and even if their is a wait, it's totally worth it
author: Thomas D.

description: Great spot. Ice Cream was so good when I came to visit SF.  Wish the wait was shorter but well worth it
author: Nadeem H.

description:
Best Ice Cream in the Bay!!!  I've been to many ice cream joints around the Bay, but none of them compare.  Where can you find people willing to wait long lines on hella cold days and nights for a one or two scooper?

No parking?  Don't care.  I guess that is what makes Mitchell's...Mitchell's.  
It's not about the convenience of getting there, but more of the enjoyment you get digging into what is Yummy.
author: j f.

description: OMG You can't go wrong with anything from their menu! Mitchell's ice cream serves incredibly unique flavors, and probably the best classic flavors! My absolute favorite from their menu are their ice cream sandwiches.......pick out a flavor of your choice and they'll put that in between two soft chewy fresh chocolate chip cookies.....to die for! It's no wonder why they are always soooooo packed in that little store.......EVEN ON COLD WINTER DAYS!
author: Irene N.

description: I've been trying forever to come here and have just never made it out until tonight.  Service was good, but a bit slow at times.  Flavor selection was  a bit over whelming.  I ended up with a chocolate peanut butter number that was a rich and creamy.  Definitely want to come back and try something else, like their purple yam.
author: Eric M.

description: The ice cream here is great! They have halo-halo and ube flavored ice cream which is hard to find. I recommend the Grasshopper pie or the White Pistachio ice cream! On a Saturday late afternoon it was pretty busy and I would've given this place 5 stars if the server was a littler friendlier. But I definitely recommend this place!
author: Sarah S.

description:
-Updated Update-

I have a new favorite flavor. Macapuno (sweet coconut). Oh. My. Golly. It's strange because I used to hate coconut-flavored things (and I still largely do) but Macapuno makes me want to climb a coconut tree and shout for joy. It's delicately sweet and oh-so-creamy and I like the occasional soft, small coconut chunks rather than Buko's (young coconut) strips of coconut. 

-End of Updated Update-

-Update-

Did I mention that I like cake? Did I mention that my favorite kind of cake is ice cream cake? I grew up on good ol' Baskin Robbins so I didn't know that things like Mitchell's ice cream cake existed. Hands down, the best ice cream. Ever. 

So here's the skinny. You have two choices for ice cream cake: 

1) Head to the right when you enter the store. Do not pass Go. Do not collect $200. Do not grab a ticket - you don't need to! Mitchell's has a special place for those who are grabbing ready-to-go items like pre-packed half gallons (to the right and left of the store entrance in long freezers) and birthday pies/cakes. There is a tall freezer immediately to your right with a disappointing selection of ice cream cakes and pies. By disappointing, I mean the flavors I don't like as much like Mocha and Kahlua. You can grab your cake/pie and head straight to the counter near the little door at the right (there's a sign that says Express Items or something), wave your cake/pie about 'til you catch someone's eye and pay up. You CANNOT try to order a cone while you're here. Don't cheat the ice cream gods. By the way, feel free to ask what other flavors they might have in the back. I've walked away with Strawberry and Mexican Chocolate before.

2) By far my favorite method, this way requires more time and planning. You can call ahead or walk in and plan your own birthday cake (http://mitchellsicecream.com/html/order.htm if you want to check out the info online) but it has to be at least TWO DAYS IN ADVANCE for 7" - 1/4-sheet cakes and all pies and FOUR DAYS IN ADVANCE for 1/2-sheet and full-sheet cakes. Sorry, I wasn't yelling, just warning y'all. You get to choose your ice cream flavor, your cake and the ice cream flavor that covers the cake.

Yes. Ice cream covers the cake instead of cream. Ingenious!!! 

-End of Update-

Do you know anyone who doesn't like ice cream? I don't think I do but if you do, take 'em to Mitchell's. Oh, Mitchell's, with your ridiculously long line and awesome flavors like ube (purple yams - which, by the by, are freaking delicious if you just bake them in the oven at 425 for about 45 minutes. I digress.). Good luck finding parking. You may have to walk for a bit, but I assure you that the sweet goodness is worth it. It's more than likely that you'll find a crowd gathered around the front and inside the place. Wrestle your way to the ticket machine (right to the left when you enter) and grab a number and hang around until you hear your number called. I'm one of those folks who gets awfully apologetic and self-conscious when there are a lot of people waiting behind me but I still ask to try flavors if I can't make up my mind. The ice cream is really creamy and delicious. It's a nice compromise between the liquid gold of Bi-Rite and the more solid but still delicious Joe's. Even plain-Jane vanilla and chocolate are flavorful and rich and creamy. Do yourself a favor, stop reading this review and go buy some Mitchell's. 

Flavor recommendations, you ask? My favorite is Pralines 'N' Cream. But Mexican Chocolate, Strawberry, Grasshopper Pie, Cookies 'N' Cream and anything, really, are a good bet. Don't be shy about asking to taste flavors!
author: Christine P.

description: Going to make this short and sweet - I've been eating this ice cream since I was a little girl and it's just as good then as it is now.  I recommend Ube!
author: M W.

description: I always drive by Mitchell's and there is always a line out of the door. The reason why I love this ice cream place is because of the unique flavors.  I love fruit and the way they make their fruit flavored ice cream is delicious.  I've tried their honeydew and their mango, both which tasted so refreshing- not too sweet and you can taste the real fruit inside.
author: Rachel L.

description:
I grew up going to Mitchell's with my family since I was a kid. That kid in me still thinks of Mitchell's as the best ice cream in the entire world. The grownup at least agrees that it's the best in the Bay Area and wouldn't be surprised if it was indeed the world's best. You can go to Mitchell's on at 9:30pm on a cold, rainy January night in San Francisco, and there's still a huge line! The wait is always worth it. 

Mitchell's is a great slice of the Bay Area. On one hand, it's a great slice of old time Americana. It's a family owned business, the ice cream excels at what you traditionally think ice cream should be, it's incredibly creamy and wonderful. However, they take that great old school ice cream and incorporate the flavors of the surrounding multicultural area (their traditional flavors are awesome too). 

Mitchell's is a place for people who like good ice cream. They're dedicated to making simply the best, most tastiest ice cream possible. It's not about bells and whistles, or making flavors simply for the sake of being interesting or having novelty value. Unlike Bi-Rite and Humphrey Slocombe's, with their hordes of hipsters, I always see a variety of people at Mitchell's, lots of families, etc.. I think kids are a great indicator of how good an ice cream place is.
author: Anh-Thu N.

description: 4 star- why? i've only been there ONCE, my brothers girlfriend took me on a nice, hot sunny day and the line went OUTSIDE the building ( not to mention its pretty small). Anyway, after about 10 minutes of waiting and debating as to which flavor to try (note: never liked/tried any flavors besides vanilla, mint, and strawberry) i was convinced to try the Mango flavor. Ohmygod, one word: BOMB. It was very flavorful, creamy, thick and absolutely DELISH. The staff was pretty BORING, simply asked what i wanted but then again they had no time to chit-chat since the line was getting bigger and bigger. Also, parking SUCKS. We had to park like 2 blocks away. I hope to return soon since spring is right around, maybe then i'll give it 5 stars.
author: Isabel C.

description: I tried the Choc. Caramel Crackle, my boyfriend tried the Grasshopper Pie, my sister had the Ube, so on my first visit I was able to try all 3 flavor. The chocolate caramel crackle was good but I got sick of it very fast because it got really really sweet as I ate more of it and I only had a scoop but I guess...it is chocolate + caramel, as for the Grasshopper Pie...oh man one spoonful was good for me, it was definitely not for me because it was OVERLY sweet because of the fudge, but if you're a chocolate fudge lover, the Grasshopper Pie would be your favorite flavor. Of the 3 flavor, I liked the Ube the most, not too sweet and it was delish, it's also funny because I expected Ube [sweet potato] to taste kind of nasty...well at least the thought of it in my head. On my second visit with my friend, I decided to try the Avocado and I found it to be really good, it wasn't too sweet to the point where I can easily get tired of it. So I guess overall, I think Mitchell's Ice Cream is an OKAY place because so far, I went there twice, nothing really special pops out to me.
author: Helen T.

description: Went to Mitchell's for the first time last night with much anticipation and was not let down. I got a scoop of the Cinnamon Snap, which had cinnamon ice cream with almost raw in texture Gingersnap bits. Delicious!! I think Bi-rite might be just a tad better (richer), but I will definitely be back to Mitchell's to try more flavors and to wait inside with an organized number system instead of outside in the cold like Bi-rite.
author: paula m.

description:
I've heard a lot about this place so I decided to give it a try.  

Grasshopper pie was perfect!!

Will definitely be coming back to try the other yummy flavors!
author: Yolanda B.

description: Okay, so first let me tell you that I've been coming to Mitchell's for over almost 40 years.  Every time I come to SF I make sure we stop and have a treat.  This was my last time.  What others have said is all true.  Great flavors for the most part, but very crowded and very expensive scoops.  I've always come for the mango ice cream.  This past time I could not barely make out what flavor the ice cream was.  It was the creamy orange color of mango, but I think these folks have gone too far to make a buck and decided to eliminate even the fake flavoring along with any real mango in their ice cream for the sake of making more money.  The ube as usual just tastes like purple ice cream.  No flavor to it.  The Buko (coconut) was good but not enough to bring me back here any longer and spend a small fortune just to get a small scoop.  $3.20 for single scoop?  Really people?  Really!?!  NO...........................
author: Saul V.

description: Love this place! So close to home and fabulous ice cream. My kids love the chocolate and caramel while I almost always get the french vanilla custard. The staff is always friendly even with a line out the door on a hot day.
author: CityGirl C.

description:
another yummy ice cream place! love it! if only it wasn't so crazy! the last time we went (it was night time), cars were double-parked on the street, circling around for spots, the line was all over the sidewalk, etc...

but i loved the taste and selection of flavors...=)
author: Esther D.

description: Just delicious.  It was rich and creamy.  The peanut / fudge was delicious.
author: Ankur P.

description:
You know how they say good things are worth the wait? Well, this saying would definitely apply to Mitchell's. In my opinion, Mitchell's is hands down the best place to get ice cream in SF. Don't let the long lines discourage you, especially if you come during the evening or weekends. Nowhere else will you find a wider variety of flavors, ranging from the mundane (but good nonetheless) vanilla and rocky road to the exotic buko (aka baby coconut) and mango (my personal fave!!). For those who are health conscious and/or lactose intolerant, Mitchell's has plenty of great sorbets as well.

Helpful tip: if there seems to be a wait, grab a number ticket from the dispenser near the entrance. They'll call your number when they're ready to get your order.
author: Christine T.

description: Listen - I'm an ice cream freak and snob. You must go here. Everything is good. EVERYTHING. It's worth whatever wait you have to endure.
author: Christine H.

description:
My co-worker brought in a half gallon of Rocky Road. I had 3 scoops and wanted more. The ice cream is unlike any other that I've had in the past. The texture is creamy and milky with a strong chocolate flavor. They didn't skimp on the marshmallow and nuts. I had a chunk in almost every bite. It was a sweet treat that I wouldn't mind indulging in again. *hint hint*

I have been to the actual location and there always seems to be a line to order. They have so much selection that it's hard for me to make a choice. I end up ordering my default mint chocolate chip or cookies 'n cream - and it's always good! If your adventurous there are more exotic flavors.
author: Candace F.

description: Great place, great service and wonderful ice cream, love the grasshopper!! Beware of the line outside the door when it is a beautiful day out and not great parking but it is worth it!
author: julie q.

description: Great ice cream place! I love ube, and something with pralines, I forgot what it was called. You can even take home a tub of ice cream if you want! This place is so good!
author: Laura D.

description:
I was a bit disappointed. After just having been in Cape Cod and having ice cream from Somerset Creamery, which has to be the most divine ice cream on the planet, I found Mitchell's a bit grainy and not as smooth and creamy as I would have expected. That having been said, it was still very, very good and for a place that's been around for over 50 years, they still have lots of enthusiasm and are capable of 
experimenting with new flavors.
author: Carla B.

description:
I am by no means an ice cream expert, but Mitchell's really made an impression from its old school decor/feel to the creamy but not too rich ice cream. 
I had their coconut and pineapple ice cream and it was so good I ended up getting a half gallon of it.. for 8.50. Well worth the price if you ask me.
author: Victor H.

description:
I can't get enough of this place! I'm from San Jose and I drive here for their ice cream! I lived in Sacramento and I still came here! I now live in central valley and I still come here every chance I get! I found this place thanks to a mention on the Food Network! But those who say this palce is over-rated are WRONG! Yeah, it's a hassle to find parking and to wait your turn, but people do it anyway because the ice cream is good and worth it! 

I have strong nostalgic memories of when I was a little girl eating UBE ice cream that came in the Magnolia plastic tubs from the asian supermarket! Years later, I buy the same brand from the market and not only does it taste artificial, it looks artificial! The purple is too bright! Almost highlighter purple! I know they added food coloring! The ube ice cream from the grocery store is just not the same as when they used to make it when I was little! 

I was so excited to find pure authentic ube ice cream at Mitchell's! I've tried their macapuno and buko, which are good, but ube is still my favorite! Mitchell's is the only place I know that has it (the good kind, not the fake one from the asian store)! The one at Mitchell's tastes just like how it was when I was little! Not even Marianne's in Santa Cruz has it! I'm Filipino, so I know my ube! If it weren't for Mitchell's, I'd probably have to go to the Philippines myself to find good ube ice cream! REAL ube ice cream! 

I don't like the long lines and having to get a number to get your ice cream though! If I lived down the street, I'd buy one of the pre-made ice creams from the freezer and take it home! But since I don't, it would melt in the car during my ride home! The first time I came here, it was on a Friday night and there was a long line! A ton of people waiting inside and outside! I didn't realize there was a numbering system, so by the time I figured it out, I had to wait even longer! It was just too long of a wait! But kind of worth it I guess! 

I also don't like the fact that you can't find parking! The little lot in the back is always packed, so you're forced to hunt for something on the streets....and be careful you don't get a ticket! 

Not only that, it's a tiny parlor with no seats or tables inside! There just one bench outside. I took my nieces and nephews here one time and since I didn't want them to make a mess inside my car, we had to eat our ice cream in the parking lot in the breeze and cold! They were dripping all over the place and made a big mess on their clothes and hands! I wish they expanded the place, remodeled it, or moved to a new bigger location where people can actually sit down and enjoy the product!

UBE = purple yam or taro
author: Sabrina D.

description:
The best ice cream parlor in the city.  

There is always a line outside during rain, sleet, wind, snow, cold, and anything else nature can throw at you...

...and there is a reason why this place always has a line (during the day or night).

My favorite is chocolate caramel crackle and grasshopper pie... mmmm.

I took my family when they came out to visit (more for my 12 yr old nephew) but, I think his memory would be that of my older brother accidentally closing the truck door on his hand... ouch.  Good thing I recommended to stick his fingers into the ice cream to keep them on something cold and delicious - which would make it better... hehehe

Don't listen to me on this one, you should just go taste it for yourself.  Make sure you get a number when you walk in the door (yes, taking a number is needed because of the crowd size!!!) - but, all worth the wait.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
It started with a love of STRAWBERRY (not strawberry shortcake), but strawberry ice cream and all knowing dairy cows...then in 1953 their baby opened its lungs and said "Let the SF'ers see and taste the de-LIGHT of the true San Fran treat!!"

June 16, 2007..His obituary...John "Jack" Mitchell, co-founder of one of San Francisco's most storied ice cream companies, died last week at a nursing home in Millbrae at age 89. 

In 1953, Mr. Mitchell and his younger brother, Larry, turned an old liquor store in the Mission District into Mitchell's Ice Cream parlor, which would become a Bay Area tradition. 

Mr. Mitchell's grandfather had owned a dairy farm in San Francisco in the late 1800s, but the only experience the younger Mitchell boys had with ice cream was eating it. 

Mr. Mitchell's favorite flavor was plain old strawberry -- funny for a guy who would later import exotic fruits from the Philippines to make gourmet-flavored ice cream and sorbet. When he was a kid, he and Larry would cap a good day of fishing by stopping at the soda fountain in Half Moon Bay, where they would get themselves a bowl or cone of strawberry ice cream. 

"Just one scoop," recalled Larry Mitchell, whose big brother was buying and he didn't want to push his luck for a double. 

Mr. Mitchell was a native of San Francisco, where he attended Saint Paul's Elementary School and graduated from Saint James High School. When he and Larry grew up, they decided they wanted to go into business. The Mitchell brothers and their brother-in-law Bob Davis leased a building owned by the family at San Jose Avenue and 29th Street and opened an ice cream store. 

They approached a local dairy about buying cream and hired an expert to teach them everything about making quality ice cream. They filled their shop with equipment and within a week were serving up their homemade recipe. 

The store became popular as word of their delicious ice cream spread. Soon, local restaurant owners were asking to buy the ice cream to serve for dessert. Some would put signs in their window that read "We sell Mitchell's Ice Cream." 

A few years later, Davis decided that the business wasn't big enough to support all three partners, so he pulled out. The brothers persevered and began getting a reputation for their unusual flavors such as baby coconut, guava, jackfruit, purple yam, mango and pineapple. 

"It was especially popular with the influx of immigrants who had moved into the Mission," Larry Mitchell recalled. 

Over the years, Mitchell's Ice Cream won lots of awards -- more than 50 gold, silver and bronze ribbons and two gold medallions -- at California state fairs. 

In 1982, Mr. Mitchell retired from the business and moved with his wife, Lottie, to Santa Rosa. Lottie Mitchell died in 2003, and Mr. Mitchell went to live in a rest home in Millbrae to be closer to his brother. 

In addition to his brother, Mr. Mitchell is survived by sisters Frances Davis and Alice Mitchell, both of the Bay Area.
author: miriam b.

description:
Three words:  dulce de leche.

The scene:  It's 80 degrees in SF.  You're dying.  You want something creamy, cool, refreshing.  Only Mitchell's ice cream will do.

The plan:  Grab a friend, debate on a choice of flavor and a back up flavor.  Drive down to Mitchell's, but don't bother looking for parking.  One of you circles the block with the car, while the other runs in and buys the pre-packed 1/2 gallon for $8.50.  Pay for it at the first cashier window on the right.  NO WAITING IN LINE!

The reward:  Almost instant gratification, and your choice of toppings without any extra charge.  Eating in a quieter, cooler environment at home.

But if you want to hang with the crowd, and grab a cone... run in, grab a ticket and try not to drool on other people's ice cream while you wait.  That will make it yucky.
author: Lily C.

description:
After living over 30 in San Francisco, I finally came to Mitchell's ice cream and wasn't disappointed. Where have I been all these years?!
The ice cream has some wonderful varieties that is just good fresh ice cream. We came here on a Sunday night and it was crowded! and not on a hot night. Just think of the line on a hot day or night in SF. Must come here again!
author: Leon C.

description:
Excellent ice cream. You can definitely taste the difference from their ice cream and other commercialized brands. 

Only annoyance is it's in a small store with hardly any parking around back. Always lines out the door but well worth it.
author: Eric C.

description:
I've been numerous times and I'm lactose deficient. . .

A few years ago, I had some college friends come in from out of town.  We tried a handful of restaurants and bars on a summer day.  After dinner, I suggested we hit up Mitchell's.  Pure bliss, with side effects.
author: E L.

description:
You need slap the s!@#t out of your taste buds if you don't think Mitchell's ice cream is the best in the City....Bay Area...better yet....Nation Wide. 

Proud cutomer since 1989.

The Lucuma ice cream is slamming!!!
author: Angelisimo G.

description:
Mitchell's is second in ice cream only to Handel's in Youngstown, Ohio.

I've never had anything quite like Mitchell's Grasshopper Pie.  Thai Tea, Chocolate Caramel Crunch, Mexican Chocolate, Macapuno, and Toasted Almond are also quite standout.

Just take a number and enjoy the balmy Lower Mission weather while you wait to be called.  It's worth it.
author: Megan D.

description: This is the last of its kind, in San Francisco. The best Ice cream and its freshly  made in the same joint. I cant get enough of this place. The parking and wait is sign of just how popular this place is but I'll tell you one thing. Its worth the wait and driving around looking for parking.
author: Nael M.

description:
It seems I best love the busy crowded overly invaded place that make me want to pull my hair out. 

I've been on a mitchell's kick since as far back as I can remember. my Grandma lives just up a couple of blocks and since I was old enough to talk I've been begging for mitchells.

They have a lot of "tropical" flavors, or what i'll outright call filipino flavors: buko, langka, ube, and the like.

My fav is the seasonal thai Tea... yummmm.

Always a little softer / meltier than I prefer given that I prefer ice cream that's hard and cold with little ice shards in it. oh well.

Go prepared for a line and with a little bit of parking karma it could be perfect.

Oh, and they totally do accept credit cards. At least they did when I went last week!
author: Sydney T.

description:
I love this place.  If it were a man I'd marry it, though the competition for his hand would be fierce.  The ice cream is creamy and delicious, the flavors are unique and tasty.  They have a parking lot behind the building but its usually so busy that its full.  I drove by the other day and it looked to be at least a 30 minute wait.

I'd wait 30 minutes for Mitchell's Ice Cream, I've waited longer than that, that's how good this place is..
author: Landy G.

description:
Memories....
I have come here FOREVER! So good. Parking will always suck and there will always be a line but the product is consistently wonderful.
All I need is chocolate chip ice cream on a regular cone. 
Try some of the unusual flavors like Macapuno or Avacado. Also they have seasonal flavors like pumpkin in the fall and candy cane in the winter.
Get a number when you get there or you will not get a turn.
author: Edi B.

description:
PUMPKIN ice cream.  It's there NOW!!!  It's heavenly.  It kicks Fenton's PUMPKIN ice cream outta the competition.  I'm tempted to say it's even BETTER than Emack & Bolio's in NYC.  Yeah... and add NYC's Chinatown Ice Cream Factory into the mix.  OMG. 

Next time I'm trying Halo Halo ice cream.  Yep.  They've just started that.
author: BrasilPo P.

description: Love the lucuma ice cream.  There is a line and its for a reason - worth the wait.
author: Joshua W.

description:
Only one thing needs to be said.

Mitchell's Ice Cream is much much much much much better than  Bi-rite Ice Cream.  I am in love with their Coconut Pineapple ice cream.
author: joanna l.

description: The best ice cream ever! I mean, there's a lot of great ice cream out there (Old SF Creamery, Rite Aid) but the flavors at Mitchell's are the best. I had the Mexican Chocolate and the Biscotti Nocciole (hazelnut & biscotti) and am dieing to try Italian Fig and Pineapple/Coconut next time around. Follow Mitchell's on twitter for their daily flavors http://twitter.com/mitchice.
author: Angelica C.

description:
First ice cream shop where I've had to take a number.  It makes it more organized though, so I like it.  Went at night and there were tons of people there already.  Parking was kinda hard to find but where is it not in SF.  We had like 20 numbers ahead of us, but the wait wasn't too bad.
I went boring and got the orange sherbert because I didn't feel like tasting a bunch of flavors.  I just tried the flavors my friends got. 
My orange sherbert as not a disappointment, it was very good.  My friends got the french vanilla custard which was very good, sweet but not too sweet, just right.  They also got the Ube which was really good.  Not a huge Ube fan but Ube ice cream, yes please.  I also got to try the grasshopper pie which was good.  Nice and minty and I like the chocolate syrup in it.  It was a bit sweet for my taste but still delicious.  Would have loved to try the Mexican Chocolate that people keep talking about but it was sold out when we got there.  oh well next time.

Overall, really good ice cream, would love to go back and be more daring and try something less boring.
author: Yvonne W.

description: The ice cream here is so delicious.  I love that they offer very exotic ice cream flavors and ingredients.  The line is long, but it is worth the wait.  Make sure to order a cone to eat instantly and one to take home with you. =)
author: Yralla L.

description: I love ice cream and Mitchell's is the best!  It has tons of different flavors like ube or rum raisin but I always go for the Chocolate, Mocha Fudge, or the Kahlua Mocha Cream.  The scoops are generous and the servers are so friendly.  There's always a crowd so be prepared to wait.  The ice cream is definitely worth the wait!
author: Rose C.

description: I don't understand the appeal of Mitchell's Ice Cream.  I think it's too sweet, too artificial, and the line is too long.  Not worth it to me.  Very underwhelming.  Plus, when you take tubs of it home it gets freezer burn very easily.  Yuck.
author: Amy D.

description: Grasshopper pie was sublime!  Bf's mexican chocolate was very delicious.
author: Emily W.

description:
Wow, a thousand reviews! My first visit here was April 1983. My friend Jun stopped by to get his ice cream fix. I was surprised to see Filipino plabors: Buko, Ube, Macapuno, Langka on the menu in San Francisco.  Shocked to find out that they've been doing it since the 50's!  Rich and heavy ice cream, it reminded of the "original" Magnolia ice cream I used to have in the P.I. with thick heavy cream poured on top, but Mitchell's is better.

Ever since then, this place has been a regular stop for me, and then for my family. My son has his buddies hooked. They make trips from West CoCoCo into SF just for the ice cream.  As with so many, I've spent many a times waiting outside on a cold night for 15 to 20 minutes for ice cream.  It's that good.

Nice to see that the Buko Ube combo has caught on.  It was my first cone and I like it with Ube on the bottom.
author: Jose S.

description:
if you love ice cream and want to choose between lots and lots of flavors.  come straight here to mitchell's.

if you want to buy a half gallon and want to go IN AND OUT QUICKLY...come straight to mitchell's.  In any line you can go straight up to the front ONLY IF YOU'RE BUYING A HALF GALLON ONLY.

if you want some halo-halo(filipino dessert) or a scoop of lychee.  or a sundae.  get in line and hope that whomever is in front of you isn't hoping to try each and every flavor before they decide.

this place is all about tropical flavors.  my favorite which most of you don't even know what it is...LYCHEE.  if mango is sold out give fresh langka a try you'll love it.  in fact, they should sell their own garlic ice cream here but they don't.  they just do what they do and they make it right.
author: Bing D.

description: The hubby and I were craving ice cream after many epic fails in trying to find parking at Fisherman's Wharf on the 4th of July. We decided to try Mitchell's after reading the reviews on Yelp. There were a quite a few people waiting to get their orders. when we got there. Instead of lining up, you pick a number and wait until your number is called. I found that this was very organized and efficient. The staff were also quick in getting the orders which meant we didn't wait very long. I was very pleased with the variety of ice cream offered. I had the banana and toasted almond ice cream in a chocolate sprinkled covered waffle cone. It was delicious. It was rich and flavorful. My husband had the avocado and mango. The avocado was good but the mango was his favorite. Overall, it was very yummy! We will definitely be coming back when we are in the Bay Area!!
author: Azalea C.

description: Wow. I went here for the first time tonight. It's been on "the list" for years now. I can't believe I've waited this long. Best ice cream I've had in a long time. Creamy, wonderful flavors. I got the Mexican Chocolate, which was rich chocolaty ice cream with hints of cinnamon and spice, delish! And the Peanut Butter Lover's, which was chocolate ice cream with a peanut butter ribbon and little mini peanut butter cups in it. I was full after one scoop, but couldn't stop eating because it was so good! Hubby got Dulce de Leche and Grasshopper Pie and shared a bite of each with me. Those were both excellent as well. I love that they are open until 11pm, so this will definitely be a place I'll go back to again and again. Simply awesome!
author: Goldi J.

description: I have been a Mitchell fan since I was a little girl.  My all time favorites are pistachio & Mexican chocolate.  Mitchell's ice cream always brings me back to my childhood days.  My kids are big fans from the first time my parents turned them on to it.  The lines aren't too bad during the week and the employees are pleasant.  I did end up getting a couple of 1/2 gallons.
author: M N.

description: A friend brought over a couple tubs from Frisco all the way to a Sunday football party in Stockton and it was still the best ice cream I have ever had .Coconut was top notch. Next time i am in Frisco i will be there.
author: california b.

description: Yummy unique flavors. The ice cream is loaded with goodies, like the grasshopper pie and huge chunks of Oreo.  Since we couldn't decide on flavors, the 3 of us each got 4 junior scoops and shared. The junior scoops are $1.80 each and plenty large enough.
author: Lenni V.

description: Seriously, no wonder this nation has the greatest number of type II Diabetes! I'm an ice cream lover and being the first time customer and after one hour wait and anticipation I wondered why these people are crawling on top of each other to get something. I've tasted at least 5 flavors, the tastes weren't distinct from each other and they were bland sweet! I guess it's just the owner's luck in the business or the people who don't know any better. I want my Gelato, the best ice cream so far I've tasted....
author: Adi K.

description:
Going to Mitchell's was a special treat for me when I was a little child, I had absolutely no idea where it was located, only that it was a drive down the freeway from home, but then sometimes it was a drive over the giant and exciting Clipper Street hill.  I always ordered weird things --- or what I thought were weird things, mostly mango on a cake cone chocolate dipped.

22 odd years later I ended up living a block away, and wanting to go to Mitchell's all the time, but feeling like a fool if I had to wait in line (I mean I could just come back later right?), so I went to Mitchell's less than I should've.

There was that one time, on the hottest Saturday of the year, when I woke up and while stumbling to brunch found myself in front of an improbably disserted Mitchell's.  They also had a pear sorbet on the special board, and a great heaping, dripping double-scope of this managed to both cure my hangover and keep me cool and fresh all the way to the brunch spot.

Really other than recounting stories I can't add much, the place is a beautiful institution and worth a visit.
author: Gustie L.

description:
THE best dairy of my life!

macapuno
pumpkin
banana
ube

Perfection.
author: Em-and-en F.

description:
This is the only place I know with Mexican Chocolate ice cream, and really, any place with anything Mexican Chocolate related gets 4 stars in my book!  (Ube is good too!  Oh and cantaloupe!)

Aside from the wait, there's no other reason not to come.  And really, the wait isn't too bad.  It gives you time to decide (ok, it really just gives indecisive people like me time), and time to dance around like you've got ants in your pants in anticipation of the creamy goodness that's about to melt on your tongue.
author: Karen L.

description:
They make the best ALMOND ice cream here.  They put tons of almonds in it and the ice cream is rich and creamy.  

Parking is a pain, and it's not a place to sit down and enjoy.  I waited almost 1/2 hour just for an ice cream!!!
author: Mimay W.

description:
See that line around the block outside this place?
that is a feeding frenzy for ube ice cream!
get your ube on!
author: Danny D.

description:
I finally made my way there yesterday...
So many choices, only TWO per cone :(

I ended with the guava and the lychee flavor. Both were bursting with fresh fruitness... the guava did get a bit cloying halfway through the scoop. But I think that was on account of the fruit itself and not the ice cream making process. I could've had another scoop of the lychee though... SO YUM!
author: Alice C.

description:
I love Mitchell's. Love it. Love it. Love it.

My favorites are a) mexican chocolate, b) mocha fudge (or something like that - coffee ice cream with loads of fudge in it?), c) praline pecan, d) carmel-butterscotch deliciousness (okay, I forget the flavor names), grasshopper pie, and... lemon chiffon (yum!). My friends also REALLY like chocolate carmel crackle, but it's too much for me. But they love it.

Mmmm... think I need to go get me some Mitchell's ice cream right now. YUM.
author: Jen B.

description:
I have only 3 words to say about MItchells at christmas time...

Best Eggnog Ever!
author: Amy F.

description:
Best in the SF, bar none.
It's expensive but good.  I like the fact that it's not overly sweet.

But if you crave gelato, try Marco Polo on Taravel.
author: yohs m.

description:
I am not the biggest sweets person and will be first to admit that I didnt even know Mitchell's icecream was so famous in the city.  However, I noticed this place as I walked by the ice cream parlor this weekend only to see the line in front of the shop.  Curious to why there were so many people waiting for ice cream on a cold day, i came to realize how famous this place was.  So, our group decided to wait and try it out.  

The result was absolute awesomeness.  Really, no joke, the ice cream here is absoultely amazing.  Well made, great balance, extremely creamy and the flavors were spot on.  Its not a surprise this place is so famous.  Definitely worth the wait to try its ice cream
author: Charles C.

description:
Ice cream from the heavens!!!
Anyplace that has a line on the coldest day in winter
must be damn good and that is Mitchell's ice cream. 
My only complaint is why do they not have open another parlor???

Come on go universal 
And what happened to the Lemon Chiffon????
Bring it back
author: Dwayne A.

description: Best ice cream ever! White pistachio and cookies and cream was amazing!
author: Ken P.

description:
this place is sooooo yummy. i love the look and names of all the flavors. i've only been a handful of times but am never disappointed. their ice cream is homemade, so very creamy with the perfect sweetness - even the ones that sound super sweet are perfectly sweet!

downsides - small place, busy!!! so gotta wait (but worth it!), no place to sit (but who cares? just enjoy the cone and sit on the sidewalk or back in your car...)

i wanna try the ube next time!
author: Chi L.

description:
my fav icecream in the city! 
full of classy mouthwatering flavors, as well as creative funky flavors, avocado, and all other funny stuff lol

my fav is coconut pineapple, and strawberry cream, 

my bf's fav is peanut butter indulgence!

all of our friends love mitchells too!
author: Danielle A.

description: This homemade ice cream has really good Green Tea and Mango! They aren't too sweet or too bland. My family usually buys the huge gallon-sized ice cream to take home. YUM!
author: Courtney P.

description: Great tasting ice cream. I ordered sweet coconut, purple yams, and thai iced tea. Tastes heavy, not good for diet! Would have given five stars, but it's so crowded.. other than that, i totally recommend this place.. Delicious!
author: Neek W.

description: My fondest memory of the Mission is walking with my grandma as a little kid to get ice cream. So even nowadays, even if I'm on a diet, and I'm in the area,  I'm there. Not only does Mitchell's have the best ice cream and ice cream cakes anywhere, going there is always something special. Mitchell's is a one of a kind institution in the area that I hope will always be there.
author: Jeannie A.

description: One of my favorite ice cream spots in the city. Best flavor in my opinion, is Ube, the purple yam. Mango is a close second though. The ice cream here has a beautiful texture and a nice variety of tropical flavors.
author: Faye P.

description: Everyone loves their ice cream, but here's a little secret, the sorbet is screaming good.....particularly their pear sorbet, when they have it GET IT!!!!
author: jonathan b.

description:
my favorite ice cream stop in the city. liked it so much, i got a gallon of their coconut ice cream to bring home. worth every penny.

i hear the hawaiian inspired flavored ice creams are their best. ive only 
had coconut to i can only semi-attest to that.

minus 1 star for making me wait 40 minutes for ice cream. some women bear children in less time.
author: James W.

description: I am giving this a 4 only instead of a 5 cuz we had a hard time finding any parking.  The ice cream is awesome.  I had a 2 scoop ice cream sundae and boy was it yummy.  The fudge topping is amazing and the banana ice cream was delicious.  A must try when in San Francisco.
author: Malu B.

description:
#96 of 100 on 7x7's The Big Eat SF 2009: Baby-coconut ice cream from Mitchell's
http://bit.ly/1VmqYA

#96 of 100 on 7x7's The Big Eat SF 2010: Ube ice cream from Mitchell's
http://bit.ly/a1POhh

Mitchell's was the perfect stop after a tremendous meal at Range (see #2 on the top 100 list) and the ice cream did not disappoint! Baby-coconut and ube (which is a purple yam) are not two flavors I would normally pick, but I'm glad I did! The coconut was sweet and the ube had a subtle, sweet aftertaste. It's not overpowering, like a chocolate or orange, but something to try nonetheless.

5-stars since Mitchell's is that good, but I do think I'll honestly try another flavor next time I go. There's enough variety (and free samples) to do so!
author: Reid Y.

description: I am from SoCal & my cousin introduced me to Mitchell's Ice Cream! YUMMMMYY!! I got myself the Kahlua Mocha Ice Cream. mMmm! Then there's the Ube, Macapuno, Dulce de Leche.. It's a "you just got to have it" kind of dessert. For some reason they have legit ice cream for a hot day, actually, for ANY weather! Next trip up NorCal, I'm going back!
author: Michelle L.

description:
This place makes some delicious ice cream.  I love it.  I wanna eat it all even if I end up in some reality show crying and trying to lose weight and talking about getting my life back in control.  It is that good.
     A friend and I ate ice cream there last night around 10PM, and there was a hater standing outside with a teeny cup of Haagen Dazs mango sorbet, and she proceeded to hate on Mitchell's raspberry sorbet and say it's too sweet.  She was waiting for a friend who was inside getting herself some real ice cream, but she apparently preferred to go to a store and buy a cup of Haagen Dazs.  Note to this hater: don't hate, appreciate.  My friend had a whole cup of raspberry sorbet and it was delicious and fabulous and I wanted to eat more than the single try she gave me but she walks with a cane and she would probably beat me up with it.  
      The Mexican Chocolate is scrumptious, and the baby coconut is deelishis!  So go there and get yourself some nutrition, or get outta my way!  Definitely a San Francisco favorite for me.  Mhmm.
author: Mister M.

description: Best ice cream in the city!! Maybe even in the whole Bay Area. Definitely worth the wait...because there is almost always a big crowd outside but, that's only because everyone wants some of that delicious ice cream!
author: Jennifer H.

description: funny thing only time i come out here to get ice cream is when its cold and never on a hot day. one thing that kinda throw me off are the long lines and parking space which is limited in this area. but its fun when you grab a couple of friends come out here to kick it to kill time.
author: JessePanda C.

description:
The best ice cream in SF.

For those who complain about the lines...there is a reason for the lines (duh).

The locals know better though:  just get a quart or half gallong and you don't have to wait.  Best flavor: mexican chocolate.
author: sam p.

description:
If you're a native San Franciscan, you know Mitchell's Ice Cream.  Can you say UBE? Or Halo Halo? or might I suggest the Macapuno. Taste it before you buy it's an acquired taste.
