Parking is scarce but what do you expect from a city that has parking issues anyway? Circle around till you find one. Stay Calm and Get Ice Cream
author: Nerdy G.

description:
YUM! YUM! YUM!
chocolate-dipped pistachio ice cream. 
wow.
The only downside is the location---here's nothing really around it, so I often forget that its there!
author: C A.

description:
It's hands down the best ice-cream there is! Fresh ingredients, interesting flavors beyond the "traditional" and the taste is outstanding!

Yep, it's a little pricey...but you are paying for absolutely fresh ingredients made to perfection. They have a decent sized selection of non-dairy sorbets as well, and these offerings frequently change, much to the delight of my son who has a dairy allergy!

Credit cards accepted for sales totalling $9 or more.

The parking can be a challenge, and there is often a wait, but it's totally worth it. Mitchell's is a San Francisco institution!
author: Marie S.

description:
One of my favorite Filipino desserts is Halo-Halo which is a mixture of sweet preserved beans, coconut meat (macapuno), jackfruit (langka), pounded dried rice (pinipig), sweet yam (ube), leche flan, filled with crushed ice, milk (or coconut milk) and topped with ice cream. 

Mitchell's version is very close to the traditional Filipino version. This is definitely a must try especially on hot days or for comfort food. 

They also have Buko ( Baby Coconut), Macapuno (Sweet Coconut), Langka (Jackfruit) and Ube (Sweet Purple Yam) Ice Cream.
author: Dizzy D.

description:
I took a bus just to go to Mitchell's while on vacation in San Francisco after hearing about it from a couple in another ice cream shop. Not just the best ice cream in town but among the best in the USA. I used to work for a small, premium ice cream company, so I know ice cream. They boast 16% butterfat, which is extremely decadent in the ice cream world, and I suspect mine might have even been a percentage point higher.

I had the caramel praline ice cream. A huge portion was stuffed into a chocolate dipped cone, all for about $3.50 or something ridiculously low considering the portion, flavour and quality. They had some fun and different flavours without getting too wacky.

I just wish I had found out about it before my last night.
author: John Divine M.

description:
Heat wave rolled through sf and the line was out the door. Grabbed a number...#76...then i heard "34!"....i was unsure if she meant #34... but there it was in bright red "34"... We were about ready to leave... But after attempting Bi-rite and then driving all they way out here with another 15minutes trying to find parking...it was decided...after seeing those before us with scoops of orange, purple, green...banana splits and sundaes...it was confirmed that we were going to stay until we heard #76. The crowd was just as excited as we were...they were great to be with as they were all waiting patiently and excitingly for their turn to pick their flavor. 
Tropical flavors are quite popular: Halo Halo, Ube, Coconut...then you also have your traditional flavors like French Custard Vanilla and finally there are Mitchell's special mixes like Claire's Pie, Grasshopper Pie, and Mexican Chocolate. All looked delicious!
You may also skip the long lines if you buy by the container to go. I couldn't decide on a flavor but eventually ended up with a Jr.Scoop of Mango and 1/2 pint of Ube to go....Mitchell's Ube is like no other ube ice cream.
author: Oanh N.

description: The ice cream is good, but I hardly think its worth the trek out to this random neighborhood nor the long wait.  I like the mexican chocolate flavor....mmm nice, rich, and spicy!  I really doubt I would go back any time soon though just cause there's not really anything else around that place to justify my heading out that way.
author: Neety P.

description:
needed something to cool down the habenero from earlier...  got here @ 10pm.  place was packed.  my buddy got mint chocolate, while i got the rum raisin.  found out that ATM/credit card minimums are $9.

ice cream was tasty.   so i don't know which i like better...bi-rite, humphreys, or mitchell's.  but mitchell's is open late.  so thats a big plus there.
author: Nick N.

description: Had the Chocolate Caramel Crackle.  It was a mountain of ooey, gooey, chocolatey, caramelly, crackley goodness!  So yummy!!
author: Paula A.

description: I consider myself a bit of an ice cream connoisseur and let me tell you, these people have ice cream down!  If you want good old fashioned ice cream, this is the place to go.  They have very normal flavors to flavors that you wouldn't see at other places, like grasshopper pie.  Everything about this ice cream is perfect.  The ice cream had a perfect consistency and the right amount of creaminess.  Most importantly, to me at least, it was the perfect temperature.  It wasn't so cold that it was hard and you had to wait a while for it to soften and it was too warm where you had to speed it to finish it before it ended up all over your shirt.  Basically, it's some of the best ice cream I've found and you must go there.
author: Aaron L.

description: A bit crowded sometimes but worth the wait. This place is a must.. 4 stars automatically.. Try their lanka flavored Ice cream. The Mango and the pumpkin.. deeeelish. yummy.
author: Jorydude r.

description: After one particularly long night of moving (into an apartment 3 blocks from here), my man gave me the incentive "let's just finish putting away this one load of stuff and then we can get ice cream at Mitchell's." Excitedly, I unpacked and unpacked and unpacked. 10:45 p.m. rolls around and I'm near tears because I figure the shop will be closed. Nope. A mess of maybe 20 people are standing around, waiting for their number to get called. Delicious caramel praline dipped in chocolate. The next day I went again. Yes, again. This time I got "Claire's Pie." Also dipped in chocolate (a mere $.40 extra) and also delicious. I have a feeling this shop will quickly become my vice.
author: Carissa R.

description: This is one of my spots that I stop for all of my family/friends who come visit me in the Bay.  They are recognized as one of the top ice cream spots nationally and there is reason.  They have unique tropical flavors like Buko and Ube.  They serve Halo Halo for all you Filipino dessert lovers (never tried it).  I always get the chocolate caramel crackle, chocolate dipped (ice cream dipped in hot fudge chocolate!!!mmmmmmmmmmm).  Waffle cones are a must.  Stop by Mitchell's when you're in the mission.
author: Jeffrey B.

description: My BFF's BDay strawberry ice cream with white cake was seriously the best ice cream cake that I have ever had! The cake part was soft and fluffy despite being in the freezer for its shelf life and the icing was sprinkled with chocolate cookie crumbs all over. I am going to demand that my BDay cake come from Mitchell's!
author: Madelyn Y.

description: Absolutely the best ice cream in the bay area. No shop competes with this place. I have been here 15 or more times. Each time the ice cream is consistently great! I highly recommend this place.
author: Genaro R.

description: i can't really write a proper review. the ice cream here, at least the texture of it, is just different. a little gooey-er compared to the others. what differentiates this place is the unique tropical fruity flavors.
author: Ann B.

description:
So many flavors to choose from and so little time!

I love this lil' shack...

The Ube Ice cream is the best hands down! 

Time to go back and bathe myself in it...
author: Marc E.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco hands down!
author: Enrique R.

description: God, it was good, but god, are their labels misleading.  Boyfriend ordered thin mint. Translate that as mint chocolate chip.  I ordered grasshopper pie. Translate that as mint oreo.  They were good.  Really good. But honestly, why lie about your flavor?  I'd have ordered it anyway.
author: Adam T.

description: I recently went to Bi-Rite (not by choice), as i was waiting in the long line i over heard someone saying "Mitchell's is still the best". Not once have i ever heard someone talk or mention anything about Bi-Rite at MITCHELL'S. ha ha! take that bi-rite!
author: Rommel P.

description: Ahhhh Mitchells....glorious memories of ice cream filled SF days...I currently live in Portland, OR, but used to live right up the street from Mitchells, at 29th and Mission.  Me and my housemates were regulars at Mitchells, and my personal faves were the Kalamansi sherbet and the guava sherbet.  On the creamy side: mocha fudge and vanilla fudge.  Huge portions, friendly staff an delicious, homemade ice cream.
author: Willus W.

description: We were going to Bi-Rite when we discovered that it was closed for reconstruction or something. Glad that it did, so then we got to try Mitchell's. It had a long line in a chilly night, but we waited.. hoping that it would worth wait. IT DID!! Loved it! They are so goooodd and very very inexpensive. Had the caramel and pralines... YUMMMooo!!!
author: Daisy S.

description: it sucks to find parking for this place and theres always a line but beside that this place is the best! there are so many different choices and unique flavor ice cream. make sure you take a # ticket when youre waiting in line.
author: Jenny H.

description: I love this place! My favorite ice cream place in the city! It is packed full of people almost every night especially if it's warm out. They have all of the standards that you would expect from a good ice cream shop but they also have flavors that are made for a more refined adult palette. Flavors like Ube(purple yam) and Lucuma(A subtropical fruit of Andean origin mostly from Peru). They have a fun group of young adults working there and the people watching is almost as fun as eating the delicious ice cream!
author: Eric H.

description:
Dude. Worth the wait in line. An SF institution.
Cold Stone,who????
author: SF N.

description:
Dear!

GOD!

The!

Best!

Ice cream!

In!

The!

World!

.....ggggggggggggggaaaaaaaaaaaaaa......
author: Manuel H.

description:
First of all, I love ice cream and am very easy to please so I would have given 4 and a half stars. The half star reduction is only because I found ice crystals in my ice cream once. 

Yes the wait is crazy. Yes it doesn't matter if it is summer or winter. The ice cream is hella good and the wait almost makes it better. It's almost like a reward at the end of the wait. I always get a scoop of mango and coffee. I haven't tried anything else since I love this combination so much.  My wife and I go there usually around 10:30 at night. Get our number and then talk in the car till our turn comes up. Get the ice cream and sit in the car for more conversation till the ice cream is done. Nothing like it.
author: Ashwin K.

description:
I have been eating Mitchell's for as long as I can remember, and for me, nothing comes close to touching it. the wait may be a little crazy, but it's well worth it. Mitchell's has a certain kind of smooth, creamy texture that I haven't been able to find anywhere else. their collection of flavors is an eclectic mix of classic favorites to exotic tropicals. 
My favorite is and has always been kaluha mocha. Also, their strawberry ice cream is the best i've ever tasted. and wait for their pumpkin flavor! i think it only comes out during the fall...

Needless to say, if you like ice cream...then you have not lived until you have had Mitchell's.
author: MB M.

description:
If you havent been here then you are missing the boat its packed to the gills and need to expand but the mango ice cream or rum raisin is some of the best in its catagory.
Its been in the neighborhood for many many years.
So I am very glad its made it and then some.
author: richard c.

description:
Simply the best ice cream in all of sf.  The specialty ice cream shops that have been sprouting around town the last few years exist only because Mitchell's already set the standard for the simple goodness that is ice cream.  But unlike Bi-rite or slocombe, or even swensen's, mitchell's is unpretentious, reasonably priced, and tastes perfect.   Their strawberries and cream is enchanted.  Staff are friendly and courteous. The line moves quickly, and they have a parking lot, which is especially nice when there's actually a spot free.  Not a whole lot more you could ask for.  They are open late, although many neighboring restaurants include mitchell's concoctions on their dessert lists.  Last night at Emmy's we had the option of ordering their signature vanilla ice cream with strawberries and whipped cream to wash down our meatball bomb dinners.  That gave us the idea to walk over to the source instead afterwards.  Come to think of it, not  sure what would happen to this part of town if this place ever closed shop.  It's that much of an institution. 

I'm always tempted to try one of the specialized 'tropical flavors' - haven't seen them anywhere else in the city, but I've yet to commit and actually get one.  They seem better to look at - bright purple yam, green avocado, among others.  But that's just me, you wouldn't know it from the hordes of really happy people who seem to come here just for the phillipino?  hawaiian? sounding stuff.
author: Nikki F.

description: There's a reason everybody in the city loves this place, it's because it's awesome! If you've never been, Go! Because the Ice Cream here is delicious & offers way more than your average Baskin Robbins.
author: Sean V.

description: There is always a long line and it is always worth waiting in it. The ice cream texture is rich and creamy.  I love the peppermint holiday ice cream.
author: Mary H.

description: Oh, Mexican Chocolate...I dream about your creamy dreaminess.  SO delicious.  Wish I worked closer to this place, but then again maybe the fact that I can't have their delicious offerings whenever I want it is a good thing.... ;)
author: Jayne G.

description: This has to be my all time favorite place for icecream.  My brother introduced this place to me years ago.  I didn't know a place like that existed!  The place is kind of.. old and raggedy but oh man the ice cream is so GOOD! I've never had anything like it!  Forget 31 flavors I'd drive back to SF just for Mitchells!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I love this place! Wish I live across the street, hehe :) This place was pack when I came in. I came in on a weekday so I assume on weekends would be crazier. I got the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream with chocolate chips and oreo cookies) and the boyfriend got the toasted almonds. Both were delicious! I will for sure come back when I'm back in the city.
author: Christine E.

description: One of the best ice cream places...probably my 2nd best favorite to Bi-Rite (Is that blasphemy here?). I love places that have fresh delicious waffle cones and Mitchells has just that. On top of that, the ice cream was delicious! I had strawberry and oooooh baby (I be stuck to you like glue baby!) it was delicious! The gf had something with nuts in it, and she said that was bomb too. I'm not usually a cone guy but when i bit into this one I couldn't stop! I can't say that it is better than Bi-Rite, but I will say the two are different. Both have their really strong powerhouse flavors and both are quite satisfying. I came here on accident (I came here when Bi-Rite was closed for construction) but what a beautiful accident it was!
author: David Y.

description:
Seasonal Recommendation:  Pumpkin ice cream + Mexican chocolate ice cream.

You're welcome.
author: S S.

description: Came here after my disasterous dinner at Cafe Arguello.  I'm not a big ice cream fan...I got the buko ice cream which was definitely good.  But honestly...I would not wait for ice cream again.  Its not worth it for me at least.
author: Allison T.

description: I love mitchells's. sorry Ici in berkeley... something about fancy smancy upscale ice cream doesn't rep who I am. Especially since Mitchell's got the homeland flavors of ube, halo halo, and mango! It is still my fav in the bay. PS- I love you mexican chocolate. =)
author: Heather B.

description: whats with the long lines for ice cream??? This place is great despite the long lines. All the good flavors are sold at grocery stores so i end up going there instead!
author: Trisha C.

description: i've never been much of an ice cream person. i prefer some frozen yogurt with fruit and other toppings, but mitchell's ice cream shop has converted me into a true ice cream lover. it's a bit of a long line and finding parking is somewhat challenging, but the high quality and richness of the ice cream is totally worth it it. they have so many different and unique flavors, that it's just too hard to decide on a flavor. my favorite, by far, has to be the cookies and cream. what makes the ice cream even more decadent is you can have them dip it in fudge! definitely a great treat for someone who's got a sweet tooth like me.
author: Tara S.

description: Mitchell's ice cream is the best ice cream shop in San Francisco! My dad and I were walking around town and decided to stop in and get something to eat. I ordered the #5 smoothie which has chocolate milk, honey, coffee, yogurt, and ice all blended together. It was the best! My dad ordered a chocolate milkshake. He loved his also! The servers were also so friendly! They have so much on there menu and so many different flavors of ice cream. Once you have tasted Mitchell's ice cream, you will want to keep going back.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Oh my god, you guys?
Baby coconut; choc'late.
Seriously, yum.
author: Alana D.

description:
I just came here for the first time tonight and was slightly amused that at 10 PM -- there was a steady stream of people waiting in line. 

I got the grasshopper flavor and found it to be sweet. The sweetness of it  almost overwhelmed my enjoyment, but after a gallon of water at home, I felt much better.

Would probably come back purely for the nostalgic feel of the place.
author: Jean T.

description:
OK so hands down the best place EVER.

What is so amazing about this place is 1: they make their own ice cream on site, even all their crazy flavors, and 2: they have been at the same location since FOREVER. It is amazing that with all of their success, they remain where it all began. My mom used to go here "in her day" -as she says it, and she says nothing has changed.

OK so back to the ice cream. My mom and my brother swear by the coconut pineapple and the mango flavored ice cream. I go for a banana split with MEXICAN CHOCOLATE (OMG it is like eating the bar of Abuelita's...super good!!) and Caramel praline- all topped with warm caramel (can you tell that I am a fan of caramel?) whipped cream, and amazing roasted peanuts (swear, they must do something to those peanuts because they are the best at Mitchell's). That is my usual... and it is SOOOO good.

There is usually always a long line, rain or shine- no kidding. It is definitely worth the wait for the heavenly experience that is Mitchell's ice cream.
author: Noemi A.

description:
Very good ice cream. The purple yam was really different, I think I would get it again. 
The line was out the door but went quick. 
A huge variety of ice cream to choose from. Good luck choosing.
author: John c.

description: I'm kinda on a diet but this was worth EVERY LAST CALORIE! they have so many flavors to choose from (including flavors like halo halo and purple yam).  I ended up getting the claire's pie (?? forgot the exact name) and it was absolutely delicious (it was between that and the grasshopper).  This place is great and I think they make ice cream cakes too!  I'm definitely coming back when I have a sweet tooth!
author: Ann H.

description: Ive been coming here with my family since I was a little kid. They totally updated recently so hopefully they dont change anything but the decor. I love that they are not tooo sweet. Try the Lucuma its great I also like to order banana ice cream on a cone dipped in chocolate for a hard shell. Mmmm so tasty
author: Alyssa S.

description:
I LOVE Mitchell's.  Mitchells and buy rite are definetly the best ice cream places in the city.  
The Pro's:
Mtchells has generous portions reasonable prices and a huge assortment of delectable flavors.  My favoirtes are the halo halo mocha and peanut butter indulgence.
The Cons:
theres very little parking and I've waited over an hour on san francisco's hot days
author: Sesily M.

description:
#96 on The Big Eat SF list

been there in the past, but never adventurous. always got standards...

baby coconut totally deserves to be on this list....even my friend who doesnt really like coconut likes it =) also put it with peach, which though might sound odd, tasted pretty good (peach isn't strong, so both went well together!)

note: take a number when you get in. otherwise you'll stand around waiting, thinking you're in line, but there isn't one! if you're ordering for someone, kick 'em out to wait outside, it's crowded!... also, don't bank on the teeny parking lot behind being open!
author: S V.

description: vanilla ice cream with whipped cream and hot fudge yummmmmmmmmmm no nuts and no cherry
author: Denise E.

description: S.F. and Ice Cream...where else but Mitchell's  Open late and always a line of good folks.
author: Reuben R.

description: I'm a vanilla kinda gal.  Plain jane.  So imagine my surprise when I sampled the Ube (purple yam) and walked away with a single scoop of the purply goodness along with a 1/2 gallon to go.  Yum!
author: Julia C.

description:
After coming to terms with the fact that aging doesn't stop at 30, I am embracing my 31st year as an ice cream themed adventure.  So inspires my quest to order every flavor of ice cream before the next birthday.

Progress report: 
DONE!  Finished with a sundae, complete with commemorative coconut shell...  Here's the full scoop, pun intended.

7/30 banana & chocolate caramel crackle (fantastic combination!)
8/10 banana nut & black walnut (meh.  but I don't really like nuts)
8/13 caramel praline & toasted almond 
9/5 chocolate 
9/6 chocolate chip 
9/7 coffee & kahlua mocha cream 
9/21 chicago cheesecake & dulce de leche 
10/9 mocha fudge 
10/16 ginger spice 
10/21 pumpkin, in ice cream pie form! 
10/29 cinnamon snap (mmm... like mexican choc, my favorite, w/o the chocolate)
11/11 egg nog 
11/17 french vanilla custard & grasshopper pie 
12/6 mocha fudge & peanut butter indulgence 
12/17 new york cherry & oreo cookie (I'd prefer fresh cherry to maraschino, but still tasty)
12/18 rocky road
1/28 butterscotch marble & peanut butter indulgence (uh oh, repeat!)
2/2 peppermint candy 
2/9 rum raisin (rummy and raisiny, as expected.  pretty good!)
2/17 spumoni (apparently vanilla with nuts, fudge, and cherries) 
2/22 strawberry & mango (oooh, good combo)
2/26 strawberries&cream (actually, I like this strawberry better - it has chunks of fruit)
3/11 mexican chocolate & pear sorbet (my all-time favorite combo)
3/20 irish coffee
4/8 thai tea & white pistachio
4/22 "creamsicle" - vanilla & orange sherbet
4/30 peach & ube (purple yam which i now know is not taro)
5/13 thin mint & claire's pie (some delicious mixture of coffee and chips)
5/22 halo-halo (hallo!)
5/27 "coconut showdown" - buko & macapuno (very subtle difference, both winners) 
6/8 avocado & tropical four (mango, guava, pinapple, banana)
6/15 coconut pineapple & langka (like being on a beach in malaysia)
6/22 sweet&salty peanut & lucuma ("fruit from peru" is hard to otherwise describe, but tasty)
7/14 tropical ginger sorbet
7/18 cantaloupe & macapuno sundae
author: Amy H.

description: Mitchell's Ice Cream has been a part of my life for a long as I can remember. You can find places around the city that sells their ice cream, but nothing is as good as the real thing. I will never get tired of Mitchell's. They are just newly remodeled, and look great. The kids that work there, work hard and are awesome. The biggest problem about them is the wait. But it is very worth while. If you want to go and not wait in long lines, try the day and avoid weekends. Although the wait isnt that bad, sometimes the store is packed and spilling on to the street. But if you are a hard core fan, we dont mind. Its what you have to do to taste the delicious ice cream form Mitchells.
author: Michelle V.

description:
This is a great place to take your out of town friends - there's always a line if the weather is nice on the weekend. They have a variety of unusual flavors that they make in the back like avocado and tropical fruits. My sister loves their pumpkin pie or candy cane flavors at holiday time.

Their vegan options begin and end at sorbet which they don't always have in stock but it's such an "only in San Francisco" type of place that I don't mind sharing the experience with friends even if I can't eat any of the desserts...
author: Quartknee K.

description:
like crack on ice.  mitchell's is deadly wicked tasty.  i had to move out of town to get away because i began to outgrow my pants.  i know the secret behind mitchell's but i will take it to the grave.  

taste the flavor rainbow here, you cannot go wrong.  the avocado is boomin' and the coconuts(all 4 of 'em) will twist your cap back.  mexican chocolate is, indeed, heaven sent.  i had to buy two gallons of ginger ice cream load 'em into a cooler and drive them to my grandma's house in LA.  she treats them like buried treasure, hidden away in her freezer.  she learned the hard way when she caught her friend who was 'taking a bathroom break' eating the goods right out of the container with a spoon.  not-so-smooth criminal.

believe all the hype and then go do your tongue a favor.

hot tip: scoop on potrero hill is an ice cream shop that sells mitchell's.  not all flavors but never a wait.
author: W G.

description: Had the baby coconut ice cream. Its Ice Cream that is made from poor baby coconuts. How sad? Not very sad really, pretty tasty though. Nothing super special.
author: Oliver L.

description: As if there is a need for another review for this awesome establishment, right? I've been meaning to go try Mitchell's for years and I finally was able to go! Surprisingly, despite the 40-50 degree Sunday night weather, loyal local consumers & curious ones alike (including me!) managed to create a commotion & around a 20-30 minute wait. But it was all worth it!!! Had UBE & MANGO & I must say the UBE tasted like real ube which reminded me of my grandma's homemade version! Creamy & not too sweet either. I tasted my friends' IRISH COFFEE, PISTACHIO, & LANGKA flavors & every one of them was delectable! This place is definitely a must-do when in SF :)
author: Judy F.

description:
My parents rocked! 

They knew where the good stuff was. I grew up on Mitchell's.

I give my parents 5 stars too!
author: Sheila S.

description: I guess this was ice-cream taken to another level.  Just not a very memorable level.  My girlfriend wanted to come here after seeing it on TV, and we went on and random spring day.  My girlfriend seemed to like it more then I did.  I felt it was... Ice Cream.  Ice Cream is usually good.  This I guess better then good but not "GREAT."  I thought the price was fair, being it's a landmark establishment and a must stop spot for those Food Network tourists.  Because Ice Cream in a sugar cone is always good, I'd suggest trying It for yourself.  On my next random day out in the city, I wouldn't mind going back.
author: Dan P.

description:
i struggle between 3-4 stars... it's a competitive ice cream market out there. i can't say mitchell's is my favorite.

the place was packed on a week day night and there were almost 30 parties in front of us when we got there. they have a great selection of classic and interesting ice cream flavors and there are definitely a few outstanding ones. however, to me, the overall experience was just ok. 

we got really good service from behind the counter. but i thought he could have been a little shorter with the chitchat since there were probably 50 people waiting for their icecream behind me!

we were offered samples so i got to try buko, mango, cantalupe, ube, avocado and lucuma between the 3 of us. i liked my buko dipped in chocolate. the flavors worked really well in my opinion. the cantalupe was tasty too. the rest wasn't exactly working as well for me. overall, i find them a little too creamy for my taste.
author: Amy W.

description: Mitchell's is pretty good and the line outside the door speaks volumes:-) It definitely hits the spot on a hot summer day.  Definitely worth the wait.
author: Ros S.

description:
With over 800 reviews, there's not much else to say that hasn't already been said, but I'll try just for you Yelp...

Mitchell's makes one serious scoop of ice cream.  And I would know.  Cause during the summer before my junior year in high school, a couple friends and I got really chill jobs at a local creamery.  [Get it?  Chill like ice cream :) Hilarious, I know. ]  But we would totally kick back, make waffle cones in the morning and just relax until people would come in for their sugar fix.  Having this job primed me for a life long appreciation and obsession with ice cream.  And let me tell you, Mitchell's is by far one of the best creameries I have experienced.  

So here's what an ice cream aficionado like me should expect from Mitchell's:
- Parking is limited, we scored rockstar parking right outside, but expect to circle the block a couple times during rushes. 
- First thing you should do is take a number right near the door and be patient.   
- There are at least 30+ flavors to choose from, but you have plenty time to decide. 
- If you're just buying half gallons or cakes and such, you can use the Express Window to save time. 
- Once your number is called, ask for samples of what you want so you'll be happy with your decision.  I got halo-halo on a sugar cone, but ube and mango were both good.  Avocado was also yummy, but too rich for a whole scoop.  
- Make an effort to have your money ready.  Cash is easier, but if you want to use your credit card, the minimum is $9.  I don't know why it's $9, kinda random but that's what the sign said. 
- And lastly, make sure to add an additional hour to your cardio workout the next day.  Mitchell's is soo ridiculously creamy, I swear it must be at least 15% butterfat.  But it's really worth every single luscious lick,.. I promise :)
author: Joan T.

description:
Ah, Mitchell's.  You make me sing! 

                      DAY-O
                 Day-ay-ay-o
Daylight come and me wan' go home
DAY, me say day, me say day, me say day
Me say day, me say day-ay-ay-o
Daylight come and me wan' go home

Work all night on a drink a' RUM
Daylight come and me wan' go home
Stack banana till the mornin' COME
Daylight come and me wan' go home

Come, Mister tally man, tally me banana
Daylight come and me wan' go home
Come, Mister tally man, tally me banana
Daylight come and me wan' go home

It's six foot, seven foot, eight foot BUNCH!
Daylight come and me wan' go home
Six foot, seven foot, eight foot BUNCH!
Daylight come and me wan' go home......

(Ah geez, I'll just give you the video link so you can sing along too.  I know you want to.)

http://youtube.com/watch?v=MYzTZQFnB9k

Or rather, this one b/c the ice cream makes me do it.
http://youtube.com/watch?v=joa3WiXDuEg
And that is the exact dance that I do.

There.  

Oh, and I know this review is supposed to be about ice cream so...

I LOVE Mitchell's.  So many flavors, so little time.  
I loooooove the UBE, but I am a die hard devotee of the bliss that is CHOCOLATE CHIP, oh and mint chip too.  
I know, I know, so plain jane of me when there are so many other incredible flavors such as, dare I say... AVOCADO and MAGIC CRACKLE-DUST!
I was kidding about the magic crackle-dust flavor and actually, there is nothing plain about the chocolate chip, it's quite heavenly as a matter of fact. Great consistency and flavor, not all mush ala "Cold Stone."  
Why would you mush my ice cream Cold Stone? 
Why?
author: Natalie D.

description:
On a recent visit to Mitchell's we grabbed a number like the good little lemmings that we are. Looking at the number we were fifty-nine and they were serving twenty-three. That's right, thirty-six people were ahead of us for ice-cream. That's how good the ice-cream is here. Not enough to convince you...here's a little history. The Mitchell Brothers started this ice cream shop in 1953 as a spin-off from their family's dairy business. This ice cream shop has been open in San Francisco for over FIFTY years. Do you known of any other establishment in a city like San Francisco, where turn over is so high?? It is a true institution. 
Even though there was a lot of people ahead of us, the time it took for us to get served was relatively short because they have four open stations servicing the masses. One window is typically reserved for carry-out items such as quarts or gallons of their ice-cream. Mitchell's is known for their tropical flavored ice-cream but they have oh so much more. If I had to guess there is about forty flavors available for a cone, sundae, or milkshake. Forty flavors... I guess having that many people in front of you is a good thing, just so can make the perfect ice cream choice.
author: Bucky K.

description:
a melty, ice creamy treat seemed like a perfect end to the day after fighting the, unfortunately scantily clad, crowds at the nearby Carnaval (my eyes are forever scarred).   i had been craving a chocolate dipped ice cream cone for god knows how long, so my first visit to mitchell's commenced...  

the crowd was thick and the number we were given seemed far to high to be true.  thank goodness my boyfriend was there to entertain me with his humorous commentary on the mass of people, we contributed to as well.  after 40 minutes we began to grow weary and the drool was pooling under the many flavors to choose from.  finally our number was called and my hand shot up in the air with an eagerness rivaled only by a five year old in desperate need of a potty break.  

of course we tried some strangely named flavors, but among them Avocado was the only flavor that surprised and delighted us.  in the end i got a chocolate dipped cone and the boy got an avocado milkshake.  if it werent for the obscenely long wait allowing the anticipation to grow endlessly, my dipped cone may have been more appreciated, but for now the hype supersedes the product.
author: elizabeth r.

description: PLEEEEEEEASE go for the mexican chocolate ice cream! Damn it  is soooooooo goood! When me and my husband go I always get the double scoop(I know, fatty) and my husband gets a mexican chocolate shake. Just push past the crowd and grab a number on your left. Trust me the wait is worth it plus they're open pretty late when most other ice cream shops are closed....so yeah GO..NOW!
author: Vanessa M.

description:
With an assortment of awards on the wall that would make a WW2 Vet cringe, my girlfriend and I stopped by Memorial Day weekend as a tribute. We drew a number as the scene dictated. 78! And on the intercom we hear 19. But we held faith, as less courageous people quickly bailed. The wait wasn't bad I guess; I'll skip the boring moments. 
After 30-45 min our number was called and we rushed to the counter with drool dripping from our lips. The ice cream barista didn't take our number... Making me regret that I didn't pull a Beetlejuice style switch. We tried a few samples to make sure we didn't make a mistake in the process. Thankfully I tried the Avocado. It was good. Really good. So... Avocado milkshake it is! This process also took a while, but upon tasting the sweet, buttery nectar of life I turned to my gf and exclaimed "Babe, I love you, but I want this avocado milkshake to have my babies."
So on we went on our merry way, lips to straw. Unfortunately, 5 min after confessing my love to this wonderful concoction she was gone, like so many gf's before her. So... In the end, like all relationships, this was a drawn out process with a couple short magical moments that were just enough to leave my longing for another sip and a bitter taste in my mouth and checkbook.. I will miss you Avocado Milkshake, but Mitchell's, you get a Meh-Ok.
author: Bryce W.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said before?

Want ice cream?  Are you within a 25-mile radius of Mitchell's?  Then don't waste your time, taste-buds and waist-line on anything else, just make your way over to Mitchell's.  Try flavors that don't appeal to you, and my guess is that -- most of the time at least -- you'll be pleasantly surprised.  The tropical fruit flavors are out-of-this-world.  

High-end ice creameries have been popping up all over the city, but none of them comes close to Mitchell's.
author: John M.

description: best ice cream in San Francisco, and that's a fact. I live for the Mexican Chocolate. There are so many flavors, I've been coming here my whole life and I still haven't tried them all. Anyone who doesn't love Mitchell's is an idiot.
author: Bobby P.

description: If you want ice cream and are anywhere near Mitchell's go there NOW! the line can be long but it is definitely worth the wait. I recommend the Banana Split!
author: Angelo C.

description: Ice cream in this place is isane!!! You should try mango and ube ice cream, just the best! Never go wrong when eating a ice cream.
author: Marv B.

description: By no means does Mitchell's need another review, but it's really, really important for everyone to know that you can get custard here. Real custard. Vanilla CUSTARD! To put in your mouth! Just like my Midwestern brothers do!  Custard is one of the few reasons why I can still get sentimental about the Homeland,  (summertime,  my mom and some select pals comprise the additional reasons), so when I tell you to go eat some motherfucking custard, you should know I mean serious biz.
author: Chloe S.

description: VERY tasty ice cream, with an abundance of flavors. There are so many different combinations to choose from, it will leave your head spinning!
author: Joseph F.

description: I ate an entire pint of mango after 2 slices of pizza.  After waiting in line for a good 15 minutes.  Stuff is good.
author: Jenny K.

description: I have been going to Mitchell's for over 30 years and I am a huge fan.  My favorite flavor is Ube, but I have a feeling they altered the recipe a bit.  It used to have more of an Ube flavor, with tiny Ube specs and more of a purple color.  It now seems to have a chocolate flavor, for some odd reason.  It just doesn't seem to be the fresh Ube I came to enjoy and remember.  This is very disappointing.  I will still go to Mitchell's but will not order the Ube...very sad to say.
author: Chris B.

description: Tasty old-fashioned ice cream with classic an interesting flavors. There can be a long wait on a summer day or weekend, but worth it if you are craving a rich and delicious cold treat.
author: Nicole L.

description: Love this place.  The yam flavour is soooo good.
author: Moko R.

description: ok - its 52 degrees outside...and the line is out the door!  Peaople are complaining of the cold while they grip their cones for dear life..."mmmmmm, this is so good!"  I hear from every corner...any questions?  ; )
author: Derik P.

description: Yummy! I love ice cream, and Mitchell's doesn't fail. We found a parking spot behind the shop, but be aware that the parking lot is super teeny. We went around noon on a Saturday and there was a fair amount of people waiting in line but not too bad. We tried the mexican chocolate and mango flavors. Both were good, but I really liked how the mango flavor tasted so mango-ey. As we ate our ice cream outside, we saw lots of people come and go so it's definitely a popular place. Very delish; I can't wait to come back and try all the other flavors!
author: Cat H.

description: This place never disappoints. The dulce di leche and banana are wonderful! A random Wednesday evening in February with temperatures dipping into the low 50's, my husband, father in law and I were greeted with a gaping crowd of 20 standing around waiting for our numbers to be called. Despite the cold weather and growing numbers in and out of the little shop, everyone stood around with a smile waiting for our little cones of happiness to be handed over the renovated counter top. Man, Mitchell's you are happiness!
author: elizabeth c.

description: First of all, Mitchell's Ice Cream used to be made on location and owned by a family that really took care of it's customers'.  The fact is that the place has changed ownerships and if you don't believe me look next door to the lingerie shop that used to house the ice cream room.  Instead of paying for fresh ice cream you now are paying for some white kids' salary.  Did you notice how the new owners employ white kids instead of the neighborhood latino kids? And that the prices have gone up and the quality been compromised?  Sorry, but I just don't think that the service was really worth the extra cost, especially when it's not even home made.  Not to mention that I don't like judgemental comments about the flavor I order.  I left a tip out of charity.
author: fuck you p.

description: Yes, best ice cream in the world - but how to resist getting the Mexican Chocolate and delve into the other flavors?  One way is to get two scoops and throw some rum raisin on top.  This is the anchor around which Pierre Valley is booming!
author: Todd B.

description: Love it!  Avocado Ice cream...my favorite!  Rich & creamy...the texture of their ice cream is superb.  Fast & friendly service!
author: Deborah W.

description:
picture a spot. 

now picture it being hit over and over again.

"grasshopper pie" (i think that's what it's called) hits the spot multiple times when i crave icecream. mint oreo fudgy yum.


the effing long wait on hot days with the old call-your-number thing bites but nonetheless i wait.
author: Regina C.

description:
Mitchell's has it going on!  Any place that can sell Avocado ice cream and have a line out the door in the dead of winter, in the dark must be "da bomb"....and they really are!

Kickin' a lil' Native Knowledge:  There use to be another location on Alemany....remember?  It smelled like burnt pizza crust.  It closed many, many, many years ago.
author: Karla F.

description: My 7 year old daughter saved up the money she got from the tooth fairy from her last 3 teeth to take her 4 year old sister to Mitchell's!  Can't think of a better endorsement!
author: Cathy H.

description: Mitchell's has AMAZING ice cream and many exotic flavors, but the following list of things it lacks knocks 1 star off of my rating: 1) The ability to accept credit/debit cards (having an ATM in the store even ups the shadiness factor a bit), 2) An easy way to tell what flavors are sold out, which would reduce the wait for the 30 people behind each person that has to be told, "I'm sorry, we're out of [insert AMAZING exotic flavor here] at this time," 3) No expanded location. Until someone can prove to me that Mitchell's nets more money in a year by making 30 people wait 20+ minutes (some giving up in frustration and leaving with their money) for an ice cream cone than it would by opening a 2nd store or relocating to a more efficient location, I will count the long lines against them.
author: Ben D.

description: WOWerz!  The 501st review...now that's impressive. Excellent service and the wait for our Macapuno and Grasshopper Pie was sOOooO worth it!! We each got single scoops, but our single scoops were HUGE on a tiny little sugar cone. Oh, the prices are amazingly cheap, too --- only $4.40 for two big single scoops...now that's a deal!. Definitely coming back again even if it means waiting for 30+ minutes!
author: Lisa C.

description: ube and strawberry all day! i dont even know how to describe how good this place is other than just saying that
author: Marc A.

description: I personally feel they have the best ice cream in town. Their competitors have good flavors as well, but Mitchell's has a dense and smooth consistency. Their holiday flavors rock.
author: Eric S.

description:
the place to go for ice cream. period.

glad they have the flip flavors. i got two scoops of ube. was fantastic.

hubby got the pumpkin. said it was a bit gritty during a few bites, but that overall flavor was good.

will revisit time and time again.

the staff is attentive, quick, and personable. gotta love the Mission!
author: Vanessa B.

description:
best ice cream in the city! i remember first coming here back in the days when my dad used to work at st. luke's hospital. good times...

they have the best flavors you won't find anywhere else. the ice cream is so rich and creamy. nomnomnommmmmm
author: Marisol T.

description: The joy of again enjoying my beloved Halo-Halo is indescribable. I haven't had it since my summer in the Philippines two years ago. Finding Mitchell's has saved me from my misery. That ube ice cream with those red beans, banana, coconut, evaporated milk and shaved ice gets me every time.
author: Jen O.

description: IF YOU WANT ICE CREAM, GO HERE! ITS AMAZINGLY YUMMyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i cant even describe! its soo YUMMY! i mean, nothing fancy, its like a regular hole in the wall tiny ice cream store and regular waffle cones and the usual toppings and what not.. you know.. like a baskin robbins or whatever.. but the FLAVOR and quality of the ice cream! i dont know how they do it! its so delicious!!!!!!!!!!!! MMMMMMMMMMMMM its just amazing!! LOVE IT! =)
author: Sofia M.

description: Whenever a place has a line going out the door, it's a good thing.  Like many other people have said, the Mexican chocolate flavor is the bomb.  Also, try some flavors (ie. peanut butter) dipped in chocolate.  It's a little messy, but delicious!
author: Kevin L.

description:
when i was at berkeley compaining about not eating pilipino food for over a year, my mom sweated blood to send me her specialty homemade adobo. 

that is, specialty homemade adobo which she vacuum sealed and froze in a tupperware and decided to send via a fed ex box filled with dry ice. DRY ICE. Who sends food packed in fucking dry ice? my mom, that's who. 

so fed ex calls me to pick up my melting package at their shattuck location. the lady says hurry, its steaming dry ice and smells like chicken gravy!!! a 20 minute bus ride later,  i sadly picked up the soggy remains of my mother's hard labored concotion and dumped them in the trash.

it was one of those times that you had better convince yourself its the thought that counts. then go home and eat another can of beans and toast. 

so what were we talking about? oh yeah. mitchell's ice cream?

they are amazing b/c they have every flavor of pilipino ice cream ever concieved. (except for cheese ice cream which you can only buy from a manila street vendor, die of happiness, then hover over a toilet for the rest of your trip - its that good) 

and so i bought my mom halo halo ice cream, her favorite. its waiting in my freezer.... now to find a store that sells dry ice.
author: diana m.

description: Ok...only in San Francisco, will people wait in the freezing cold for ice cream....yes..they do have a wide and weird array of flavors, but to tell you the truth...didn't see much difference between them and Baskins.  I don't think a 30 min wait is worth a cone of ice cream.  The service is always good however and they seem to care for what they do...so I gotta respect that.  If you do try it...make sure you get your cone chocolate dipped!
author: Naji E.

description: When I was growing up as a kid, my dad would bring home Mitchell's ice cream a couple times a month. Its my favorite ice cream, Macapuno ice cream is the best ice cream ever invented, its a fact... you can look it up and research it. Id say just take my word for it, and go down there and nom nom until you get that familiar pain in the brain. Im excited to move to SF later this month, so I can get Mitchell's all the time, and gain at least 34 lbs.
author: Chris P.

description: How REAL ice cream should taste.  Creamy & smooth.  I will definitely be back.
author: Christie X.

description: Rain or shine, there's always a line, a big line, a big crowd surrounding this place. Their ice creams are amazingly good. I love their pumpkin, buko (young coconut), avocado, Mexican chocolate, and ube (taro). They always have seasonal flavors so whenever you get a chance, ask them for spoon samples of their seasonal flavors.
author: Juliane N.

description: Best ice cream. I was born in the city and live in the east bay. When I need ice cream, I drive to the city for the best.  I can wait out the lines.
author: David A.

description: I love Mitchell's Ice cream! They have so much varieties, and it's really good. BUT! And this is why I'm giving it three stars. I can never get my ass into the store because it's so crowded. The wait is too long, and people go crazy for ice cream on a hot day!  Please, please, please create more locations, or a bigger store. The owners of Mitchell's are sitting on a gold mine that can become more profitable!!!
author: Gabriel T.

description:
okay. okay. okay. the wait here is the worst, they even have tickets like butcher shops in Chinatown. Parking is about the biggest b*tch in the world here and 75% of the time you will be waiting outside... IN THE COLD. 

turned off yet? probably. I was ready to round up my friends, drive over to safeway, grab a gallon of dryer's ice cream, and PIG OUT!... 

I'M SO GLAD I DIDN'T!!!

I've been back about three time ever since my first time there. I always get their tropical fruit flavors and haven't encountered anything bad yet! Lychee, Mango, Thai Tea, Green Tea.. all so tasty... For me, two scoops in a cake cone please and i'll be a happy camper! By far the best ice cream in san francisco! 

if you're a san fran native and haven't had the mitchell's experience, i recommend that you do it quick cause' those tickets fly fast! 

-default eats list!
author: Alex C.

description:
Yep....

best goddamn ice cream in the world.

-fin.
author: Hung T.

description: I like ice cream. Mitchell's has some of the best ice cream in the world. It's home made. Great variety of flavors from ube to pumpkin. One problem is the lack of parking in the back, and limited parking around the neighborhood. But the trek is worth it. My favorite is the pumpkin milkshake.
author: Matt L.

description:
Want to know the 5 scoops of success?

1. Macapuno
2. Mango
3. Taro / Ube
4. Having local paper articles on your front window, show casing your awesomeness
5. Creating a fictional fight with your significant other, just so you can divulge in the "comfort food" of Mitchell's.

Mitchell's Ice Cream is sooo good that I might suggest they go all the way into the "filipino" taste and give the option to serve ice cream between a hamburger bun!
author: Sid F.

description:
Mitchell's is a small but intense ice cream shop in Noe Valley. Hands down the best ice cream place in the city. I am going to compare it to the cheeseboard in Berkeley. Same idea, you get a number, and you wait in line. On the board you've got tons of choices of ice creams and sorbets (cheeseboard analogy, you've got ~200 cheeses to chose from). Once the call your number, which could take quite a while depending on what time you come, you can sample as many flavors as you'd like before deciding on your final choice. I've had the roasted almond ice cream which was amazing, so buttery and rich. Completely almondy goodness.  I also one had the mango lime sorbet which was very refreshing, especially after a rather heavy meal at the Front Porch, which is right down the street. I will definitely be returning to this gold mine, and will be trying their more exotic flavors such as taro, red bean, and young coconut (the difference between this and old coconut is something I would love to do a serious comparison on).
Okay, time for an update. The purple yam ice cream is AMAZING. I don't even know what purple yam is supposed to taste like but the ice cream version is damn good.  And so is the avocado. And the mexican chocolate. Oh and the apricot sorbet. Geez  I've been coming to Mitchell's rather often these days haven't I. Might be time to go on a diet.
author: Kate A.

description: They've been around for 55 years and there's a good reason for that.  I took my cousin who came up from Palo Alto to Mitchell's this afternoon, and she said it was the best ice cream she's every had.  I was like yeah, this is why I made us walk 35 minutes, so we could atleast burn a fraction of the calories we were about to pack on!  She had a waffle cone of the grasshopper pie and I had a cup of the mocha fudge and we both gobbled everything up with nothing to spare.  I love Marianne's in Santa Cruz and I'd say if it had a sister, Michell's would hands done be the SF sibling.
author: Swetha G.

description: We go out of our way to go to Mitchell's. We live in San Jose but try to leave room for dessert at Mitchell's every time to go to San Francisco. I love the wide range of homemade flavors. Right now the summer flavors - peach and cantelope - are outstanding. And speaking of standing, when you get there, make sure you take a number. They are on the left-hand side right inside the door. And don't let your number scare you away - I pulled 02 when they were on 73 but it didn't take long before I was enjoying one of the top ice cream cones in the Bay area.
author: MaryFran L.

description: You got to give it up to Mitchell's for showing love to the Filipino people.  First by offer all the Pinoy favorites like Buko, Avocado, Halo Halo, Ube, etc. and two for hiring a lot of Filipinos!  Try a avocado milk shake, it's like my boy Aaron I. would say, mmmmmmm!  When the sun is out whether its cold or hot, you will have get in line for a 10-15 minute wait.
author: Jason A.

description: Mmmm..... Toasted Almond ice cream. Drrrrooooooollll...... saliva is dripping down the side of my mouth.
author: Teresa Y.

description: Best ice cream ever! Grew up in SF and nothing like it anywhere. Very fresh. My fav flavor: Macapuno.
author: Pancho G.

description: Most of my 5-star reviews will probably end up being for desserts. OH WELL! That being said, I love Mitchell's! I really wish I lived closer.  Sooo many flavors to choose from but I always find myself ordering Mexican Chocolate (why is called "Mexican" chocolate, hmm?).  Anyhoo, it's also cool how they have exotic flavors like Ube (purple yam) which is also good.
author: Jillian J.

description:
a favorite place where it can be ridicoulsy crowded, but it will not stop me to get my usual single scoop of ube dipped in chocolate or my 1/2 gallon of mocha kahlua cream.

they have an express window for those who are purchasing items that doesn't need assistance, such as the 1/2 gallons, cookies, toppings, etc. that are within reach of the customer.

awesome selections of tropical ice cream delights and common flavor. they definitely churned their fresh cream with other heavenly ingredients with love.
author: Nelle A.

description:
The first time I tried to find this place I passed by the unassuming store front.  I had a general idea where it was but forgot the cross street in my delirium for lychee ice cream.  I may not have gotten my fix for the night but I did find out San Jose sooner or later connects to El Camino?  Yes, it was small compensation.
I finally found this place by the mass of people swarming the tiny entrance.  Them and the huge sign above the modest store.  I stopped short right in the middle of the street and ran to get in line.  My passenger was a bit taken aback by my sudden departure but eventually gathered his wits enough to go park the car.  
It took me a few minutes to figure out the "take a number" system, despite the people behind the counter calling out sequential numbers.  Once I figured it out there was no stopping me.  Macapuno? Cantaloupe? Red white & blue sundae?  What's a girl to do?  Ube and Thai tea please.  
You know how people are attracted to good-looking people?  I'm attracted to good-looking food and that deep purple ube got my attention.  The flavor was somehow familiar.  Not exactly exotic but still unusual.  I liked it.  I commend the Mitchell's flavor inventors for their creativity with the Thai tea ice cream but it could use some work.  The tea flavor was a bit overpowering, almost bitter.  But that will not deter me from returning to sample all the flavors.  Maybe even bring home a gallon of lankga.
author: Shelley H.

description: I love how even though there are a gillion people waiting the guys behind the counter still patiently let you try every darn flavor you want.  Love the waffle cup with 2 scoops of any flavor and a generous topping of whipped cream.
author: Jen C.

description: I live by this joint and it is ALWAYS crowded. They've got an overwhelming variety of ice cream flavors and other treats, but the place definitely doesn't have the ice cream parlor charm. With the glass windows in front of the cashier and the four separate lines, this place reminds me more of a bank. Anyway, I recommend any of the ice cream flavors with cookies in them. They pretty much just dump whole cookies in there, which is pretty awesome because it's like two desserts for the price of one. Go America.
author: Natalie T.

description:
take a number, and then head out cuz there isn't really an ambiance or place worth sitting.  good thing they call out the numbers on a loud speaker
small parking lot in back
the outside line can be deceiving since people are just congregated
good ice cream, but I come for the Halo Halo
Buko (coconut), Langka (jackfruit), Ube (purple yam), Pineapple, Mongo & Sweet Beans
coffee was a little overpowering, i always get ube
truly part of the holy trinity of ice cream Mitchell's, Bi Rite, Humphry Slocombe
author: Rob C.

description: Don't get it.  Just don't get it.  I "heart" ice cream very much and I was very excited to try authentic ice cream that is local to SF.  Plus my friends told me it was awesome.  Had to be good, right?!  Okay, so I tried it and I was underwhelmed.  Its icy folks.  I like my ice cream CREAMY.  I would much rather have Haagen Dazs or Italian Gelato.  Plus I thought their flavor choices were just strange.  Give me peanut butter and chocolate from Baskin Robbins anyday.
author: Lindsay P.

description: Whoa whoa.  I knew I was in for a delicious treat when I saw two large groups of fat women (5-6 in each group) devouring the stuff out front.  I took a number and waited about 15 minutes to order my ube ice cream cone.  SO YUMMY!!  My guy had the mango, and it was great as well.  Mmmm.
author: Poker B.

description:
In San Francisco warm or cold, expect to take a number and wait to get that Mitchell's Ice Cream.

It's nice that they have their own private lot in the back because street parking can be a pain. If you happen to visit at night, be sure you're bundled up because you'll probably end up waiting outside in the cold.

Once you get in and look at what they have to offer, they have soo many flavors to choose from. I personally enjoy their Ube and Toasted Almond ice cream. Mmmm, sounds good right now. May get some tonight :0)

Too bad they're cash only.
author: JP R.

description: 5 stars for me, best Ice cream in San Francisco, I had there mocha ice cream. The Halo Halo was really good to, they have a large selection. They use fruits imported from the Philippines and make ice cream fresh everyday.  The line can get long but its worth the wait, go when you are not in a rush and just enjoying San Francisco.
author: madi b.

description: I don't think there's any argument that Mitchell's Mexican Chocolate isn't the best ice cream ever made.
author: Megan W.

description: This place is off the hook in San Francisco. A myriad of flavors, such as my all time favorite Ube (Purple Yam), and halo-halo flavor, and I may add that is what I got. The old world flavor was on the dot with the authenticity of Philippine island flavors. It's always hard to replicate authentic old world flavors, but this place did it. It is as good as the store bought Magnolia Ice Cream (Filipino-US brand) from local Asian markets. This place is so popular that there was a line on a cold November day. 5 stars for my first time in this parlor. I recommend out of town guest to go here and divulge Mitchell's Ice Cream to your stomach.
author: Alvin M.

description: This is basically a walk-up window type joint that makes the best local ice cream around, including milk shakes, sheet cakes and other frozen novelties.  They offer some unique ice cream flavors including cantaloupe, mango, peach, mexican chocolate, pineapple, guava, passionfruit, purple yam and baby coconut!  Its extremely popular and busy to the point where you have to take a number for service.  They make some irresistable cakes there, including the one I ordered for a friend's birthday a couple of years ago that consisted of a layer of mocha ice cream with chocolate swirls. The cakes are expensive, but memorably rich and creamy.
author: Rick H.

description: MY Mitchell's. You've been a family favorite since forever. I remember the days when my dad and I would be in our coats huddled in line to get our favorite Ube and Mango ice cream in the middle of a 45 degree day in November. Or the times when there would be fighting on who gets the last "scoop" of Ube from the freezer. Ahh, so many fond memories. Naturally, I grew up LOVING the tropical flavors that they have and 4 years in the East Coast for college was hard without it! You don't know what real ice cream is like until you've had Mitchell's. I'm not sure whether it's just the ice cream, or the entire Mitchell's experience, but whatever it is, I'll never get tired of coming back here. So here's 5 million stars for the best and simply most divine ice cream in all of San Francisco, who's had a special place in my heart since I was a little girl. :-)
author: Erika I.

description: If you want all the best traditional and tropical flavors all wrapped up in one ice cream shop MItchell's is a classic, From avocado to lychee to mango and halo-halo, you will find more than a few of your favorites. if you havent already been here you will fall in love with this place, I fall in love over and over again.
author: Sha'de d.

description: My fav spot hands down! Any tropical flavor is a sure winner!
author: Andre B.

description:
This is the most amazing ice cream outside of Wisconsin.  I was blown away by all the people.  Lines to get in, lines to park.  Crazy.  Most of the people working there were pretty nice, but my guy didn't get my order exactly right.  The whole while I was there, they seemed to get everyone else's right, so don't know what happened with mine.  The flavors were clean and sweet and delicious.  
I'm going back.
author: Mary B.

description: Well I think this place rocks. Is a bit over priced but it is worth the extra $. I have been here a couple of times and no matter what the weather is like, there is always a line which always means there's something good about it that people like. I really think they have so many flavors that whatever your looking for to soothe those taste buds, you'll get it. I really like there banana,cantaloupe, and grasshopper something flavors. This place is a great place to go after dinner and have a dessert. I still haven't tried every good ice cream shop but this is definitely top notch ice cream.
author: Travis G.

description:
best ice cream in SF!
- grew up in the Mission district (25th & San Jose Ave) & have been coming here since 1979

my favorite Ice Cream: Avocado!

-favorites when i was growing up: Ube (so bright & purple), mango, black walnut, halo halo, & peach, & coconut sport (macapuno)

-one of the OG owners married a filipino woman...& she brought all the wonder ful tastes of the islands
\
Update: 1/14/08
had the avocado ice cream again,  I think I overdid it with two scoops, my eyes were hungry, me and my riends drove from Santana Row, SJ all the way to SF just to get ice cream, and then back to Santana Row, how crazy are we, we are major fans of this ice cream
Nostalgic bits: the parking in the back hasn't changed, they still sell pepperidge farm cookies (shortbread to be exact) since 1979
CASH ONLY?
Need a tropical Mitchell's Fix without the drive? go too any bay area asian supermarket and they sell all the tropical island flavors

2/21/08
Had the halo halo ice cream....step to the side avocado...halo halo is my new favorite mitchell's flavor
author: Michelle E.

description: I've been coming to Mitchell's to enjoy ice cream on their bench on a sunny day since I was still wearing my Holy Angel's school uniform... I am 28 now, fitted in Nursing scrubs... and nothing has changed.. I LOVE YOU MITCHELL'S ICE CREAM!
author: Chrysantha C.

description: Soooooooo many awesome flavors.  I can't even control my smiles when I go there.  Cantaloupe?  Don't skip it.  Sweet coconut?  Mmmmm.  Avocado?  DUH.  This place rules.  Worth the wait, so get in line and start smiling.
author: Emily T.

description: There are 3 places I go for ice cream in the City... Mitchell's, Polly Ann's, and Marco Polo respectively. This is the San Francisco staple where I swear you'll find everyone and their moms... locals and tourists galore! The sundaes and smoothies are incredible. Props to their "Island flava" selection of Mango (voted the best), Langka, Durian, and even Halo-Halo.
author: Leroid D.

description: The best ice cream in SF. I love the mango, but all the other flavors I've tried are good, too.  Wish they'd open another one closer to my 'hood!
author: Eileen H.

description: I can't really add anything more than what's already been said by other yelpers.  The Claire's Pie is frickin amazing.  Coffee ice cream with chocolate chips and nuts.  Not overly sweet but still very creamy.  The perfect storm of ice cream.  Tried it and liked it so much we ventured to the ghetto area near Candlestick Park (damn that place is a dump) just to buy 30 pounds of dry ice for the 8 hour drive home back to LA.  We ended up buying 4 different flavors and enjoyed them all once we were home after the trip.  I've tried Fosselman's down here in Alhambra and Mitchell's still is the tops.  Thanks for the experience Mitchell's.
author: Jon B.

description: Corn ice cream? Kids, I've had great ice cream, and this place ain't it.
author: Rene D.

description: Words fail me.  I love going here year-round.  Recommend the 3-scoop banana splits.  Worth the extra charge for hot fudge.  The seasonal flavors like pumpkin, cantaloupe, peach, etc are terrific as are the specialty tropical ones like taro etc.  Here's a hint for crowded days -- send a local ahead to get you a number so as to minimize the wait.  I sometimes run over to get a number and then walk a half-block to Muddy Waters for coffee and then return.  My record was waiting from 73 (the number they were on when I arrived to get my number) all the way to 37 (aka 64 people ahead of me!).
author: Xander S.

description:
awesomepossum icecream!  i'm blessed to live pretty close to this place.  i love the mexican chocolate, grasshopper pie, pumpkin, thin mint... i probably love all the flavors they have... :D
mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm...
i love ice cream!!!
author: charlotte s.

description: The funny thing is that I've lived in San Francisco my whole life, also knew about Mitchell's for most of my life, since my parents would buy half gallons all the time at the Asian supermarkets, but my ass has never stepped foot in one. So I went here a couple of days ago, and was surprised at how long the wait was. People really love Mitchell's like really really love it, because I've never seen an ice cream parlour so filled up, that it required "taking a number". And me and my cousin waited about 20 minutes, but it was like no big deal. When our number came up, I decided to be really Filipino and order a scoop of ube/taro. It was okay, but it wasn't as good as the ube with macapuno/coconut pieces combination , which they only serve in the half gallon containers.  I actually wish that I just went with the grasshopper pie, because the sample I tried was quite amazing. And I think it would have been so much better if I had it coated with that chocolate hard shell thing. Ohh my god. Droool. Why didn't I?
author: April D.

description:
mitchell's ice cream... it's one of those places you associate with your childhood. if you were lucky enough to grow up near by. i may be a bit biased though as i'm half flip and many of their flavors are native to my tongue. with that said, i've tried many of what they have to offer and have never been disappointed. my favorite is a chocolate dipped macapuno (coconut''s mongoloid brother) in a sugar cone. that always seems to raise an eyebrow or two  behind the counter. i'm not sure why because coconut and chocolate have always been the best of friends in my book. 
at any rate, the place rocks and i'm glad to see all the beat up housing around the joint has been upgraded. making it that much nicer to sit outside and enjoy your cone. just remember to grab a number on your way in and try to avoid all the sticky spots on the sidewalk from the poor kids that couldn't control their tongue.
author: Jeremiah J.

description: Five stars for the ice cream, minus one for the ambiance of a check-cashing parlor.
author: Hugh B.

description: Awww man so damn good!! The sad part is....it's ALWAYS packed so you'll have to go in there and grab a number. They have their famous pumpkin ice cream there, but it's only available in October and November. Free samples is given if you ask for it and on the right side of the shop they see ice cream, pepperidge farm cookies, and freeze dried ice cream for dogs. It's $10 for a 1/2 gallon ice cream. They have flavors like ube, cantaloupe, pear, rum, oreo cookie, creamy vanilla custard, blackberry, other originals, and some tropical and sherbert flavors. This place has been here since 1953 and still packed! Service is very friendly. They open at 11AM and close at 11pm. If you don't mind waiting for an hour then it's worth the wait. THe pumpkin ice cream tastes like pumpkin pie. MMMMM so good!
author: Jessica T.

description: I don't think it's the best ice cream on earth - but I go every time I'm in San Francisco. Good stuff - I like that I can get some unique, exotic flavors here. Lucuma, Purple Yam...yum!
author: yoko m.

description: I love Mitchell's! Every flavor is delicious and they always let me sample as many as I want (and I sample a few even when I know I'm going to order a scoop of Peanut Butter Indulgence). It's worth waiting in the insane line.
author: Melanie A.

description: At first I thought I was getting a beer gut... but now I think it might be a Mitchell's gut. I guess it's probably worth getting fat. No really.... mmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!
author: katharine s.

description: Having lived near Mitchell's for six years now, I can come out of the closet and say, I don't think it's anything all that great. But is is fun to pile into the little shop, number in hand, on a cold winter night, with a room full of stoners. On hot summer nights it's a mad house with lots of kids and dogs and waiting around, anxiety and what not. I have to tell you, I went the other night and had the pear sorbet. It was, to my surprise, superb. Well done Mitchell's! I suggest you get whatever fruit flavor is in season if you want something special from Mitchell's. But that's just me. Go see for yourself
author: Jennifer C.

description: Amazing place for icecream. :) mostly everything here is good. always bz, even closer to closing time. my suggestion, buy the tub and go home and enjoy.
author: Vi H.

description:
I always go in with the thought of trying something new but once i get there i stick to mango and ube. hay that is the reason why i went there. 

Its the best ever!!! to bad they don't have any in the east bay or i would be there every day. Yea it may be a bit crowded but once you have your ice cream its all forgotten. LOVE IT
author: michelle D.

description: They offer lots of flavors and compared to many other places, the price for the portion is great here!  It's actually even a better deal when you get a pint of your chosen flavor and split it with a friend than getting two separate cups.  Oh, to indulge!  Some flavors can taste a bit "not home made" (as compared to bi-rite's), but where else can you get macapuno,  taro, halo halo and langka flavored ice cream??  They also sell gallons at great prices (~10$) and make cakes to order.  I've mostly come during off hours, thus the lack of waiting.  However, during rush hour, get a number and expect to wait.
author: Cameron W.

description: The ice cream was delicious! Bought a chocolate chip ice cream sandwich with vanilla and it was BOMb! The cookie and ice cream was perfect together! The mango shake was wonderful as well. Customer service was superb!
author: Kelly N.

description: I think Mitchell's is overrated. Maybe it is the years of eating Ben and Jerry's, but I just prefer ice cream with chunks of stuff in it. Pros: smooth, creamy texture; tropical fruit flavors you won't see elsewhere; crispy waffle cone; reasonable price ($2.10 for a single, which appeared to be the same size as a double $4.10). Cons: long wait; non-tropical flavors aren't that exciting; thin mint is a fake out! It is really green mint chip.
author: Amy E.

description: Let's put it this way, I would trade my girlfriend for a black walnut waffle cone with sprinkles. I go every Sunday. I used to go every day but I started having chest pains at work.
author: Jason W.

description: So, I recently had jaw surgery and have been restricted to a diet of blended mush (TMI?).  Let me assure you, it has not been fun.  Thankfully, Mitchell's Mexican chocolate milkshake has given me reason to go on.
author: Christina D.

description:
omg. i CRAVE mitchell's ice cream.
as a lactose intolerant, i try to avoid dairy as much as possible.
cheese and mitchell's. two things i will eat without hesitation.
try their rum raisin. the best i've had. anywhere.
their caramel pecan is also very very tasty.
coffee, white pistachio, mocha, and ooooh their sorbets!

sample away and buy a pint to take home.
just go. you'll fall in love.
author: Sharon O.

description: Mitchell's probably doesn't need another review. I just wanted to be one of of the many who agrees that this is by far the BEST ICE CREAM EVER!!! I gained 10 pounds from eating Mitchell's ice cream everyday for two months prior to moving from SF. Those 10 pounds are a testament to the addictive properties of Mitchell's. (Starved of Mitchell's I lost those 10 pounds over another period of two months) I miss you Mitchell's :'(
author: Dharti A.

description: I've been going here since I was a kid!! Was great then is even better now and I love the new look! It's always worth the wait, and now that I don't live in the city anymore it's a real treat to get it! LOVES IT!!!!
author: Tori M.

description: I am by no means a patient girl. If there's a line to be waited in, you will not find me in it. One exception to that rule: Mitchell's. If Canteloupe Ice Cream is on the menu I'd wait a lifetime in line. And chocolate dipped canteloupe in a sugar cone? I may have died and gone to heaven.
author: Karla G.

description: Mitchell's is so cool.  I took a photo to them and they used it to create a cake that looked even better than the photo!  The staff is friendly and competent.  It's a family-run business where quality and service rule.  It has every flavor under the rainbow and more.
author: Tak O.

description: Mango Ice Cream + Ube Ice Cream + Waffle Cone = PARADISE
author: Chris M.

description:
Good stuff.   They have a great variety of flavors.  The line is pretty long here though.  

2 stars because this place is good but I've definitely had better.  I wouldn't come here as a first choice but if a group of friends wanted to come, I wouldn't say no either.  I'm not the best person to ask what to have here as everything is decent.  I'd go with some of the fruit flavors though because they are refreshing and creamy.  That's a hard combination to make.
author: Scott L.

description: HANDS DOWN THE BEST ICE CREAM IN THE CITY.  I find myself in that place even on cold a$$ days. I am partial to the Mexican Chocolate cuz of the rich flavor rather than sweetness. Different Strokes (was bad a$$ show) for Different Folks. Grip of flavors there so wait the line, make up yer mind, and order some of the good sh!t.
author: santiago g.

description: I LOVE this ice cream, especially the baby coconut and Mexican chocolate.  However, I hate how they run the place on a busy weekend day.  They just seem to have made their money, and don't care enough to make things more efficient for the customer.
author: Anthony Z.

description: Best Ice Cream in the city. I've been going here since I was a little kid. Gotta try the tropical flavors. Shout out to Armond.
author: Derek P.

description:
there's almost always a wait here - even if it is freezing outside. and it is totally worth the wait. 

why is it so good? they use more butterfat in their ice cream than most places. enough said. 

my faves are - mango, thai iced tea, pumpkin, cinnamon and strawberries and cream. i always sample even if i know what i'm getting.
author: julia t.

description: been coming here since i was little best ice cream in the city on a hot day.
author: Emmanuel O.

description: Mitchell's is so so wonderful.  I'm so happy it exists.  I love my grasshopper pie dipped in chocolate.  I love it so much, I sometimes have to change my underwear.  On rainy days... no line!  OH OH OREOS!! uhhhh... satisfaction every time.
author: Christina C.

description: Yes, it's crowded. Yes, it's not as cheap as it could be. But the ice cream is great, the service is as fast as they can manage and it's right on the J. If you like ice cream, even as just a concept, there are few places I've been that do it better. The Peanutbutter Indulgence and Grasshopper are especially wonderful.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: I swear by their buco and toasted almond. Yeah there's always a line, but it's kind of fun to line up for dessert any day. Plus they stay open pretty late!
author: Faffy L.

description: If I can't make it out to Maggie Mudd's, I'll stop in here for a treat.  What's nice about Mitchell's is that they have a variety of flavors you don't typically see at other ice cream parlors.  I've always been partial to ube (purple yam), myself.  I also like going to Filipino-employed establishments such as this one to bust out my Tagalog skillz (what little I have).
author: Marsha Z.

description: I scream, you scream, we all scream for Mitchell's ice cream. Too bad I live so far away. Man, what a taste that is so smooth you want to melt with it or freak it like you freaked someone at a junior high dance. Sexy sweet. -Matt
author: Matthew C.

description: I'm happy to say that I'm a proud resident of the Mitchell's neighborhood. I live only a few blocks away from this paradise. Even the lines dont' bother me much because you can eagerly peer over people's shoulders to find out which delectable flavor they chose...you can tell a lot about a person from their Mitchell's choice. The Mango Sorbet did a little happy dance on my tongue...try it.
author: Jen G.

description:
