the hubby took me here today since we happened to be in the city AND it just happened to be a nice, sunny afternoon.  it was the least he could do since he knocked me up :p

we pulled #41 while they were serving #25 but the wait wasn't all that long.  it was actually a little bit of a relief because it took me that long to figure out what i wanted:  a waffle sundae w/ french custard vanilla ice cream.  YUM!  oh-so-creamy and delicious that i inhaled most of it by the time we walked back to the car.  if that hadn't triggered the start of a massive food coma, i might've turned around and grabbed another number.
author: Carol O.

description:
loveit.loveit.loveit.

ube and lychee love!!!!!! thai tea tastes just like the real thang. 

nice and quick workers 

halo halo hollllllllaaaaa
author: Kelley N.

description: Always a line outside, even in freezing winter. 5 stars for the ice cream. The rum raisin is unbelievable. Would be nice to actually improve on the facility, like expanded seating.Otherwise would give 5 stars.
author: Walter R.

description: I've heard that Mitchell's was the ice cream I MUST try in San Francisco. And I so happen to bump into a store that sells Mitchell's ice cream and it is delicious! I ordered Cookies and Creme and it is everything ice cream should be. Sweet, Creamy, and Tasty!
author: Jessica Y.

description: Mitchell's is greater than Bi-Rite.
author: Mercutio k.

description: Mission ice cream crawl stop 1 of 4. Sunday afternoon, line was about ten minutes. Had big scoops of each of macapuno and cantaloupe for $4.10. (Not on the menu, but if you're not that gluttonous, you can ask for two small scoops and it's slightly cheaper.) Quite creamy, though with a supermarket mouthfeel, which probably means it's too heavy on the emulsifiers. The macapuno, however, transcends any doubts: really nice coconut taste. (Same with the buko.) The cantaloupe isn't bad, but there are many better places around here for fruit ice creams. The one bad flavour I tasted was, of all things, vanilla. You have to come here at least once; along with It's-It, it's the classic SF ice cream, and unlike It's-It, it's good.
author: Brad L.

description: Great on the taste buds and oh so smoooooth.  Thanks to Dita C for introducing the crew to this place on Saturday. Cant wait for the next visit....
author: Virgo M.

description:
this is one of the ice cream shops i was taken to as a little girl. as i've grown older, i still love mitchell's. something about it is sweet and creamy, not only the ice cream but also the familiar feeling i have when i am there.
there are many flavors (they are unique for their tropical flavors) and all sorts of variances to ice cream service (splits, shakes, sundaes, cones, sammies, etc).
park behind the parlor in the tiny lot.
author: rachel b.

description: I love Mitchell's!  It's one of those places that takes me back to my childhood.  Although it was a popular place to visit for ice cream before, it's name has grown tremendously and parking as well as long lines are have grown with them.  I have a sweet tooth (it's a disorder I tell you) and a Mitchell's ice cream cone will almost always due the trick.  When I visit, I usually get the Toasted Almond and the Pistachio Nut.  If I'm feeling tropical, I usually get the Mango or Ube.
author: Christine D.

description:
Besides having to fight for a decent parking spot this ice cream store is the best. Rich and creamy w/ lines out the door all year round regardless of the weather -  for a reason. 

Don't miss out on the Banana or Cookies n' Cream. Also very good are all the tropical flavors. Avocado sounds weird but tastes so so nice. Manga, Langka,  and of course Ube.
author: Elizabeth A.

description: The shortest waiting period I've EVER experienced here is 1/2 hour so be prepared to wait part of your life away...for the BESTEST ice cream ever!  (Their wall is full of ribbons!)  Yes, I said "BESTEST"!  Like Mitchell's purple colored Ube ice cream, it's so wrong that it's so right!
author: Caitlyn K.

description: I'm so glad I came across this place again. I used to go there as a kid so nostalgia plays a part, but this is the best Ice Cream on the peninsula.
author: dermot c.

description: Go experience the rare pleasure of a place delivering on the hype. It was POURING on the Sunday of President's Day, and yet from the line you would have thought it was a heat wave in Arizona.  I can't do this place justice.
author: Beth V.

description: I used to think I wasn't that into ice cream. This place sorta changed that. The ice cream here is not only creative, but amazingly tasty, and certainly the best in SF. Worth an occasional trip into the mish.
author: Sven S.

description: The long lines say it all about the popularity of this ice cream parlor.  Definitely, the perfect place to go for any occasion.  When you need a little a mental or emotional pick-me-up, go to Michell's for some ice creamy dreamy.   What I love most about Mitchell's are the *exotic* flavors.  I was sooo excited to try Halo Halo, but it was a little disappointing for me since I love the Halo Halo dessert, but their version is mostly ice cream which makes sense now I think about it ;).  I purchased one of their ice cream cakes (mexican chocolate) and I was also a little disappointed that it was mostly about the ice cream and not the cake.  Gosh, I guess this isn't a raving review, but the ice cream is creamy, dreamy, and oh so decadent.
author: Walter C.

description: Holy crap!  The macapuno and ube are still as good as it gets- I've been enjoying this ice cream shop for the past decade- it was great to finally be able to bring my 2 year old daughter.  Her strawberries in cream ice cream was amazing.
author: Knathan R.

description: Probably the best ice cream in the city.  You'll truly enjoy buying half-gallons of Mango and Ube (my personal favorites).
author: Melvin D.

description:
you can keep your brite rite hipsters, and your tattooed creamery folk with their bourbon corn flakes.  give me mitchell's.  everytime.  

straight up the best ice cream.  not to rich, not too lean.  just right.  i like coffee, and chocolate, and vanilla.   that's the test of an ice cream joint, IMHO.  get a half gallon, and cut the line.

it says something about a place when people will line up at 9:45 p.m. on a grey, windy, brutal san francisco wednesday night for a scoop of the good stuff.  yum.
author: Matt G.

description: Overrated! Maybe I expected too much but I wasn't impressed. Had the mocha almond fudge and tried the mango... not worth a wait in line.
author: E T.

description: Every time I come here I am always stuffed from lunch or dinner but I ALWAYS make room for Mitchell's. And I mean ALWAYS.
author: Robin M.

description: This place is an oasis for true-blue San Francisco Ice cream afficcionados. I love love love the Filipino flavors, and have been a believer in the cult of Mitchell's Ice cream ever since I was aware of my taste buds. During the summer months, nothing beats Cantelope ice cream. Don't forget to get your ice cream cone dipped in chocolate.  Oh, the humanity that only one Mitchell's Ice Cream exists!  It's always worth the wait, and had I not lived in the East Bay, I would be at Mitchell's 4 days a week.  Bring company, the lines go faster that way, 'coz even at 10pm on a weekday, this place is packed
author: brenda b.

description:
Went here after dinner around 9ish and the line was out the door. My friends and I grabbed a number and we waited for 30 minutes. The wait wasn't too bad as I was still deciding what flavor I was craving from the multitude of choices. I narrowed it down to  tropical 4, lychee, or strawberry sorbet. I was obviously craving a fruity dessert. After sampling the tropical 4 (did not like the banana taste) and the lychee sorbet (not something i could eat a lot of) I went for the flavor that would never disappoint - strawberry sorbet. It was really good...I can tell the quality of the strawberry sorbet was superior to that of other ice cream places. 

I probably would never drive all the way to SF and wait that long for ice cream unless I just happen to be in the area. But over all it was a good experience and the staff was really friendly.
author: Gabrielle V.

description: For the record crackers, the joint is not located in Noe Valley. Show some respect for the Latin community, as many of us still associate this area with the Mission District. Back to the matter at hand: the ice cream. Next to Old World Gelato in Rome, Italy, this is the best cream I have ever been associated with. I would make recommendations, but as any Mitchell's junkie would tell you, every last flavor on the grid is off the freekin' chart. Settle for Bi-Rite while basking in the sun at Dolores, but come here for the real get-down. Why do I have to live less then five blocks away though....
author: Kenny G.

description: The ice cream here is real yummy! I remember getting the banana split here and sharing with my boyfriend and the ice cream is very good. Was difficult to find, but definitely worth the drive. The only downside is they only accept cash which was a total bummer cause a lot of people don't like to carry cash.
author: Hannah L.

description: Best Ice cream, hands down! Super creamy!!!
author: Phil L.

description: They stole my name!!! But, I can forgive that because the ice cream here is fan-fricken-tastic!  The sheer number of flavors is sure to please even the most sensitive and demanding palette. Oh god do I like ice cream, and Mitchell's has never let me down.
author: Mitchell W.

description: OMG!!! This is thee BEST ice cream place ever!! I only wished there was a Mitchell's Ice Cream near me!! *sob*
author: Cheryl S.

description: It was a beautiful sunny day and I decided to try this place out for the first time. The line was sooo loooong.  Finally it was my turn, I decided to thin outside the box.  So i ordered the cheese corn ice cream which was suprisingly yummy.  There were so many different flavors, I would definatley go back.
author: Aileen D.

description: The wait is always ridiculous but the Ube and Macapuno Ice Cream is well worth the wait!!  Plus the Thai Iced tea tastes like Thai Iced tea.  Avoid the avocado it actually tasted a little greasy..
author: Anel M.

description: This place makes me laugh since I lived around it. I've seen people in the coldest nights, poring rain. Waiting, Waiting and Waiting in a huge line just to get a ice cream??? What gives? Is there crack in the ice-cream? Its good ice cream but not that good. If you don't want a quart... which you can get fast I suggest another strategy. Good right before they close like 5 minutes. No line... works most of the time....
author: Dave H.

description: Mitchell's is damn good ice cream! My friends introduced me to this place when I use to come up and visit when they were going to SFSU. Being a southern california native, you would think we had good ice cream joints like this, but I have yet to find one! The long lines are worth the wait, I've visited all seasons of the year, and every time there are long lines (even close to closing hours!). Prepare to head on over with a good group of friends so you can chat while you wait. I've had over 5 of their flavors and each are good. I say try their unique flavors that you aren't likely to find at other ice cream joints, because those are always the ones that are worth going for. If you get the regular flavors you probably wont be as excited just because you can get those anywhere, its all about the new flavors that will always excite you and leave you wanting more. I suggest getting things like Ube (taro), it's something rare and you'll enjoy. The hand dipped ice cream is good too, it gives a twist to the regular ice cream which makes it all the more better. The atmosphere alone is enough to go, its rare to find an ice cream joint pouring with lines of people. This place is only for people who like to wait in lines and enjoy the company of others. So find a group of people and head on over to enjoy some unique flavors or opt for hand dipped classics, the ice cream becomes better with great company.
author: Jen A.

description: I had to go with what my inner filipino was telling me and pick the halo halo flavor. It was pretty damn good. I've never had actual halo halo before but if its as good as the ice cream, then I've missed out on a lot. The ice cream itself wasn't as creamy and smooth as, let's say, Marianne's in Santa Cruz, but their mix of exotic and familiar flavors will satisfy even the strangest, pickiest, and even unoriginal people out there!
author: Kevin P.

description: My friends and I were really looking forward to trying Mitchell's Ice Cream after hearing that it is one of the best in the nation.  Mitchell's serves normal flavored ice cream and some Asian ones as well.  Overall, we think the ice cream was alright.  I'm giving it four stars because I think they nailed down the basic flavors, but I was looking for either super delicious ordinary ice cream or gourmet.
author: Cindy H.

description: Came back again, yup just can't resist this place! It was really warm here in San Jose so I thought it'd be a nice day to get some ice cream. Wrong. Up in San Francisco it was freezing cold with fog. Surprisingly, the line was still very long. You would think no one would want ice cream on a cold day, but that's not the case because it's so good here. I had the Macapuno again and tried the Pineapple Coconut. So rich and creamy, yum!
author: Karen L.

description: $2.20 for a generous scoop of Grasshopper Pie (mint ice cream with chocolate chips, rich fudge & Oreos) on a sugar cone. You won't find a cheaper (or more delicious) treat in town!
author: Nathalie L.

description: I didn't believe the hype at first but OH MY GOD. BEST ICE CREAM IN THE CITY! It has a gelato-like thick texture with the most interesting flavors! I had the peanut butter indulgence and can't wait to try some others. It's a bit of a trek from where I live, but a day of biking is way better when you have delicious ice cream at the destination.
author: Lauren C.

description: that is what I call a real ice cream ! I love the Chocolate Caramel Crackle & the Chocolate Chip also I like the Butterscotch Marble !
author: Shadi K.

description: Get the Buko (baby coconut) ice cream here and you'll be quivering with delight for days. I actually left an empty bowl of Mitchell's Buko in my room for a day or two to use as air freshner it smells so good. Fantastic.
author: David W.

description: Kaluha ice cream is AMAZING. They are not skimpy on the banana splits or ice cream scoops. They pile it on. Each scoop is the size of a large tennis ball. I loved it. Our Ice cream specialist was helpful and knowledgeable. He was great. It was an all around great experience. They were busy and our service was fast.
author: Ruka H.

description: Waiting in the ridiculous lines is a part of the experience.  This was the first ice cream cone I had in SF and it almost matches Graeter's, the Valhalla of ice cream back in the Old Country (Cincinnati). You'll see many unusual Filipino flavors as well as old standbys.  They make a great cantaloupe ice cream but by far my favorite is the banana, which tastes like real, sweet, fresh bananas.  A scoop of banana with a scoop of the medium-dark chocolate is perfectioin.  The BF loves the halo-halo, but I'm a little ascared of that flavor.
author: Kevin S.

description: LOVE this place!  Well worth the line.  Just grab a number and wait for the delicious ice cream.  They have unconventional flavors and are always coming out with new seasonal flavors.  Try them all!
author: Megan V.

description:
It's hard not to love Mitchell's.

It's low-key, unpretentious and totally delicious. You probably won't even mind the outrageously long lines on a warm evening because it gives you the necessary time you'll need to review the long list of flavors and try to figure out whether to go with something unusual like Avocado or something classic and delicious like Chocolate Chip (my personal favorite). I love the hardening chocolate shell and the fact that they're open late.
author: Brooke J.

description: Their secret to the creamy-ness of their ice cream is 16% of butter fat! I ignore it when I eat their ice cream though because it is soo good! I got my sweet sixteen birthday cake here! Their ice cream cakes are not that fresh, but may be I should try ordering a fresh one. LOADS of people come and get their ice cream here, even though some days it is not really quite a day for ice cream, there is always a line.
author: Janet Z.

description: GREAT ice cream.  Tons of flavors.  I like how it's local and that they make it here.  A perfect ending to any date.  You just wait outside for your number to be called.  I tried jackfruit and mango.  Love IT!!  I will go back for more, but I will have to try their strawberry and see if they can beat Haagen Daaz's strawberry ice cream b/c right now that is my favorite.
author: AhLin C.

description: Long wait and difficult parking but superlative ice cream. My new favorite is a scoop of the chocolate chip with a scoop of Chicago cheesecake. Believe me: it's heaven in a bowl.
author: Jenny K.

description: I think I had the Grasshopper ice cream (mint chip ice cream, chocolate cookie chunks, fudge?)...and it was so good I was quite speechless. I think that's all I'm ever going to get whenever I go there. No use in wasting time trying other flavors! It's perfect!
author: yeana j.

description: Their ice cream is on point. They got tons of flavors. I specifically like the cantalope seasonal ice cream. Some may find it pricey but its worth the money. Only negative thing about this location is the parking. Don't be surprised if the lines go out the door at night.
author: John R.

description: This has to be the best place to enjoy  homemade ice cream. Mitchell's expanded their flavors and now you can enjoy fruit flavors from Peru and the Philippines.  Very creative flavors but the traditional homemade strawberry and chocolate flavors are still the best as well!!  The long lines during nice weather is worth the wait.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Yesterday I convinced my dad to buy the gallon of Mexican Dark Chocolate ice cream. It is now half gone, thanks to our very large spoons.
author: Mairead J.

description: Not very impressed.  The selection was OK and the quality of the ice cream was OK.  I am partial in that I am not a huge ice cream fan.  I think I got cookie dough or something.
author: Justin F.

description: There is a reason people line up at this place even on a rainy day.  The ice cream. Its no fuss no muss and they have a huge selection including seasonal flavors.  I have not yet tried a flavor that I love here.  The ice cream is very creamy and not too sweet.  Hands down the best ice cream joint in SF easily beats the hyped up bi-rite!
author: foo d.

description: I grew up eating this ice cream, particularly the tropical flavors, such as Ube, Langka, Halo-Halo, Mango, and Makapuno.There is always lines out the door, but the wait is totally worth it. If you are ever driving down San Jose Ave, try and keep a look out for it.
author: stacy k.

description: Even when it's 60 degrees out,  there's a line outside the little shop for a scoop or two of ice cream. Doesn't that say enough? ;) .
author: Giselle U.

description: The tropical flavors are very unique! (Avocado, Ube/Taro, Macapuno, Lychee, Mango, Passion Fruit, Halo halo, Kahlua mocha cream)
author: Elizabeth T.

description: ice cream is a bit soft, but still very tasty. line is not as long as bi rite
author: Jenny B.

description: The cool thing is you don't have to go all the way down to Bernal Heights to enjoy their ice cream! Micaheli's deli carries Mitchell's... including their Pumpkin Ice Cream which they make available until February! Their Pumpkin Ice Cream is the best I've ever tasted. http://ilovepumpkins.com/2008/11/13/mitchell%e2%80%99s-pumpkin-ice-cream-gets-around/
author: Heirloom Z.

description:
First time visit tonight, the line was out the door but moved very quickly.  
Enjoyed carmel marble and ny cherry.
author: Matt W.

description: This place tends to become a little overhyped in my opinion, but overall it is still a good place.  Ice cream is good, albeit a tad to creamy.  Prices are decent.  On a hot day there will always be a huge wait.  Don't forget to get your number.  Plus is that they have a parking lot in the back, but parking is still bad, especially on a warm day.  They also have some unique flavors to try.  overall good old school san francisco classic.
author: Ferdinand B.

description: I got to meet some rugged looking people while waiting in line and one of them gave my friend and me a number. Twas only the beginning of a wonderful Mitchellian experience. Sampled the buko (baby coconut) and macapuno (sweet, meaty coconut). Decided to get the buko in a sugar cone (only 10 cents extra!) because WHO CAN RESIST "BABY" COCONUT??? so cute!!!!! Plus.. one scoop in a cone - more than enough ice cream trust me - is only $2.10. YAYHOO!!! I want to try avocado!
author: O K.

description: They make the BEST fresh mango ice cream in the Bay Area!  Get the gallon because you'll finish the quart right away and wish you had more.
author: Sara A.

description:
like everyone else has said... best ice cream EVER. if you don't like it something is seriously wrong with you.  sure there's a wait.  especially when its hot.  but there's a wait for a reason. mitchell's ice cream is tha shit!  if you don't feel like waiting in a hella long line, just grab a gallon tub and wait in the shorter but still long gallon purchases only line and eat it at home. if you pull a number and leave because of the wait you are seriously missing out. 

my fav is grasshopper pie ice cream - mint choc chip ice cream with fudge, oreos and whipped cream. it is like heaven on a cone.
author: Ms. M.

description:
i eat ice cream all year round -- yes, even in the winter.  i make my own ice cream.  i am even willing to drive 25+ miles to eat ice cream.  need i say more?

mitchell's is a classic when the fads of frozen yogurt and over-complicated pairings of other flavors have come and gone.  i do wish it was closer but what can you do -- maybe get a hybrid.
author: thb t.

description:
super creamy ice cream. tons and tons of choices from traditional flvaors (butter pecan, mint, rocky road), seasonal (pumpkin) and the tropical (ube, avocado, jackfruit) You can get banana splits, sundaes, waffle cones, you name it!

But two words; Sweet macupuno. go get some now!
author: Tom L.

description: I can always count on Mitchell's for some good old fashioned ice cream. They have a great selection of ice cream that will satisfy anyone's sweet tooth. 5 stars for Mitchell's!
author: H. A.

description:
good geez!

i loooooooove your rum raisin!

what do you put in there?
author: Mai G.

description: I'm still a fan, but the wait is a big pain.  Also, I'd pass on the halo-halo and go for an ice cream cone next time.  The halo-halo isn't the greatest here.
author: Christine B.

description: Be prepared to wait in line cause whole families walk up to this spizot. Grandmothers an all. Brings back childhood memories.
author: David P.

description: My absolute favorite since childhood! 34 years and counting!! So good people stand in line in the RAIN to get sum ice cream!! LOL
author: Raquel Q.

description: All the flavors are good, fun, fresh, and creamy.  I usually get the macapuno and you can really taste the pieces of young coconut that whisks you away to a tropical island.  Mexican chocolate is like eating a hot cup of chocolate.  Ube is purple color and is yam, popular in the Philippines and tastes like creamy vanilla.  Discover your own favorite.  Yes, they rock!
author: Peachie Y.

description:
This is hands down the best ice cream I have EVER had!  (and I like to think I know my ice cream)  Seriously, every flavor I've tried here is amazing....real ice cream you know?  You just can't beat it......

The main store has such a great old school vibe.  I moved here in the middle of the summer and there were several perfect evenings my boyfriend brought me here for a treat after dinner.  I think the experience proves its the simple things in life that really matter.....Treat yourself.....Enjoy Mitchells....good old fashioned ice cream is an under-rated pleasure.
author: Amanda M.

description:
if you like ice cream with tons of nasty arteficials and chemicals added (seriously, look on the label of a tub)...this is your place.

huge line of people, hype for nothing.

go to the health food store, buy a tub of coconut bliss (comes in many flavors) and you will never go back.
author: jasmine h.

description: I've been coming here since I was a toddler.  Yummy yummy yummy I never buy any other ice cream unless it an emergency.  Kudos for staying original
author: Joely L.

description:
Yeah, remember that one* run of like two straight hot summer nights a few Junes back? Pretty sure it was 2009. Anyway, when I got home from work I decided not only to look this meteorologically gifted horse in the mouth, but to slobber all over its shiny beautiful face. That is, I put on a yes v-neck shirt (because it was actually summer!) and walked from my apartment on Laguna Street into the deep Mission, stopping first at Bi-Rite, next at Mitchell's. 

To recap: I was wearing a flimsy t-shirt and pants, and was neither wearing nor carrying for later: a sweater, a scarf, a jacket, a hat. Clearly, if you don't stop for at least two (2) ice creams on a night like that you have either a dead soul or are just not up to the task of living.

Because this is not a review for Bi-Rite I will let it suffice to say that I am glad someone waited in 84% of the line for me, and while I do think their ice cream is quite good I don't think it's quite good enough to warrant the ceaseless queue for their victuals, a phenomenon I attribute, now that you bring it up, to either laziness (ie, Mitchell's is sooo farrr from Dolores Park) or that curious hipster predilection that makes one want, perhaps even more than the experience of eating the ice cream itself, the experience of waiting in line for the ice cream with all the other beautiful, denimed denizens of the Mission.** "Dude that line tonight at Bi-Rite was soooo long." "I know, right!" 

So there was nighttime heat, Bi-Rite, and roughly forty-one gorgeous blocks, all told, and wouldn't you know it when we got there the place was mobbed. Clearly. Why would my now four friends and I be the only quintuplet with something like this idea. So we took a number and--OH MY GOD there are 89 numbers between the next number and ours. So okay fine; we take a walk and [redacted], maybe head to a bar for a drink jesus there's so much time. You can see where this is going. 

Yeah so we get back like 40 minutes later and dutifully take another number that this time is something like 60 numbers away. Wars have been fought over less than this, obviously, but it's okay. It's warm out and there are all these nice citizens milling around on the sidewalk like moths to 16% butterfat. The second wait wasn't bad, in part because at that hour people were giving up left and right, and we (finally!) ordered at what was it like 11:10***? At this point, I remember two things about my ice cream: that it was delicious and creamy and indisputably better than Bi-Rite's, and that it was NOT Macapuno chocolate-dipped, as the only one to order Macapuno chocolate-dipped was my short friend Adelina, making her one more in a long line of women shorter than I am who despite this obvious handicap manage to out-order me at Mitchell's, for the simple reason that they ordered Macapuno chocolate-dipped while I, once again, ordered something wan and fruity and easily trounced by the chocolate dip on the outside, thereby irretrievably mitigating my enjoyment of the actual ice cream. I desperately coveted her cone for twenty consecutive seconds before turning to other matters. My life is a series of mistakes from which I continually relearn valuable lessons.



*Ed. Note: It makes this reviewer just desperately unhappy that this is the number attributed to that which it describes, so unhappy that despite his near belligerent love of this town he will probably eventually, sadly, leave.

**Ed. Note: Sorry to keep interrupting, but it bears noting, and this reviewer would be loathe I'm sure to mention such a thing, that he did in fact email to various friends last winter a picture of that chalked square of almost certainly Mission sidewalk that read, Dear Snowed in [sic] friends, If it is any consolation, the park is *too* crowded and we are running out of ice cream. Love, San Francisco XOX. That is, this reviewer has few compunctions about reaping the benefits of living near hipsterism when it suits his needs.

***They stayed open late that night, I think, due to unprecedented demand. And this says something, I think actually, that a food service business would stay open really late on a random weeknight, just because there are people waiting to eat their ice cream. I mean, people usually don't care that much nowadays.
author: T U.

description: There are very few places where I'm willing to wait in line for more than 10 minutes for food. This is one of them. Nothing says summer to me like waiting outside of Mitchell's at twilight for your number to be called, partaking in a couple samples, and ordering the sunday of the month, or a giant waffle cone sunday, or one of the plethora of amazing flavors (though nothing compares to their long-retired double chocolate truffle). And, of course, no one can forget their famous pumpkin flavor in the fall.
author: Sam D.

description: Although I'm lactose-intolerant, this is the place where I go for my ice cream cravings. Love their mango and ube. I also like their avocado. Yes! Avocado =).
author: Neni E.

description: um. i don't get the long line and the slow service. however, i've only tried one flavor, coconut-pineapple, so maybe i just didn't choose wisely? the coconut-pineapple ice cream was mediocre at best. i guess i need to come back and try more flavors perhaps! bi-rite stood out more for me...
author: Caroline L.

description:
i only like a couple blocks away and i love coming here on those warm days in the city.  especially on hot days, expect to wait a good 45 min. before you're number is called.  this place is packed all day everyday.

the ice cream is creamy and very flavorful. best ice cream in the city.
author: Cedric F.

description: guess it isn't filipino owned. oh rumor mill. still have good ice cream.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
I give Larry and Jack Mitchell 5 stars each for opening up Mitchell's Ice Cream. It's no wonder that they've received so many awards and have been featured in shows and magazines. 
Going to Mitchell's is like going to ice cream heaven. Just thinking about it makes me want some asap, maybe I'll stop by later after work and get a couple of half gallons. 
Some of my favorites are the grasshopper (mint ice cream with, chocolate fudge, oreo cookies and chocolate chips), ube (purple yam) and mango. Oh wait I can't forget about their banana nut ice cream with rocky road. Aaahh. Never mind, I can't decide which ones are my favorite, they're just all soooo good. I especially love that they carry freeze dried ice cream for dogs and two flavors if I may add. I always have to buy one or two whenever I'm there, it's my dog's favorite treat. Well favorite sweet treat that is. 
I will see you later Mitchell's... Now I have something to look forward to after work.
author: Anna P.

description: If you love ice cream and live in San Francisco than you are either a Mitchell's person or a Bi-Rite person, or so it seems. I however cannot choose. I love them both. Both have amazing, interesting flavors made with the highest quality ingredients and both have equally long lines. I refuse to take sides. The thing I love about Mitchell's is that it seems more like a mom & pops type of place... a little hole-in-the-wall.
author: Juls M.

description: MMMMMMMM - it doesn't get much better than this.  Try the Thai Iced Tea or the New York Cherry.  The wait can be crazy long, especially on a warm Sunday afternoon (worst wait time: 54min).  But if you grab their pre-packed 1/2 gallon tubs, you can cruise through the Express Lane and be outta there in no time.
author: CINDY K.

description: Ben and Jerry just don't know! I triple dog dare you to try every flavor. Bring any flavor of their pre-packed half gallons and box of sugar cones to your next dinner party or barbeque and you're guaranteed hero/heroine status.
author: Mingus R.

description: Best ice cream in the Bay Area and possibly beyond.  Take a number and wait in line year round for great ice cream at good prices.  Mexican chocolate is a fav.
author: Jill D.

description: I especially love Mitchell's during the holidays... best peppermint ice cream EVER!  the pumpkin's not too shabby, either.
author: Nat K.

description: This ice cream is tops for me.  The variety of flavors and the quality of the ice cream... oh momma.  I love that they have Mexican Chocolate Ice Cream, and the flavor of the month thing is always a good reason to go see what is new.  I'm all about chocolate, but the seasonal Peach and Cantalope ice cream are always a must... and the occasional Ube rounds it out nicely.  If you are so inclined, I highly recommend a shake with two scoops Mexican Chocolate and 1 Scoop Macapuno (the meaty coconut I believe).  It's too good.
author: Dan M.

description: This place has everything you could want from an ice cream joint. Unique flavors, exotic twists, and yes it does match Graeter's (Cincy-based but in Louisville too).
author: Jim G.

description: OOOOOOOOkay, I admit this place makes pretty GREAT ice cream. But, I still choose Polly Ann's over it, COME ON! I grew up on that stuff from MY neighborhood. But Mitchell's is really good too. One time, I came here to get a birthday cake for my aunt and even though the place was bustling, the man took his time and even drew the heart for me that I requested that he frost on my cake. And he showed me multiple times to make sure that the heart looked exactly the way I wanted it to. Now that's customer service. Sucks that there are such long waits sometimes though.
author: Audrey T.

description: WHOOOOOOA NELLY, thats some damn good ice cream! the tropcial four, the thai iced tea, the strawberry, the rocky road, the purple yam (forget the name), it's all the best ice cream ive ever had. its like airy and super creamy. LOOOOVE it!!!
author: Kristen L.

description: You've never had it like this before. AND you can try up to 3 samplers. You'll be addicted. Trust me.
author: Judy L.

description: Other reviews have said it all. Mitchell's is where the locals go for ice cream.
author: Philip M.

description: This place is way over-rated. I was living in the Marina and everyone kept raving about Mitchell's so finally hiked out there only to be severely disappointed. Nothing distinctive about the ice cream - just felt so laden. Frankly you should go check out the ice creams and sorbets at Citizen Cake. We had a black raspberry nonfat yoghurt that had the most incredible flavor!
author: Mariangela S.

description: 5*'s for the ice cream and an extra bonus star for the small parking lot in the back. Great ice cream.
author: Bart C.

description: One of the reasons I live in San Francisco. It's funny how much socializing goes on within a 4 square meter space on the sidewalk and doorway. Some people have a system down where they drop someone off and get a number or they get a number then get gas and come back. It's funny making bets on how long it takes someone to lick their ice cream once it lands in their hand.
author: James T.

description: Best place to try exotic ice creams!  It's always packed and the lines are out the door.  Have you had avocado ice cream before?  It's the bomb!
author: Victoria R.

description: Hmm...it dont want to seem like im going against the grain but this place was just ok. I do like the exotic flavors that are not typical of ice cream parlors but outside of that I would say the actual ice cream is just okay. I ordered the Ube (my favorite flavor) and the vanilla bean and I thought it was good but I was not blown away. The ube I felt lacked a bit of flavor, though.
author: Richard C.

description: Unusual flavors, with a variety of Asian/Filipino flavors like Coconut, Halo Halo, Taro, and Red Bean. The melon flavors are also very good (canteloupe, honeydew).
author: Meredith G.

description: I grew up on Mitchell's Ice Cream.  Before all the big Asian markets came to town, Mitchell's was the place to go if you needed your Ube or Mango flavored ice cream. I will go nowhere else for Mango Ice Cream but Mitchell's. I also love the Peppermint Candy Ice Cream.. Too bad it's a seasonal flavor. Nevertheless, Mitchell's is a San Francisco institution...
author: Trish P.

description: Great ice cream but I don't like waitng for it when the line gets too long! My favorite was this special this had called Oreo Blast ( I think?) It was a layer of chocolate and oreos, more oreos and more chocolate! Yummy! Whatever you decide, you won't be disappointed!
author: Mel P.

description: The best ice cream in SF. I wouldn't give their sundaes five stars though. Their ice cream is too rich for more toppings.
author: Sean Q.

description:
ive heard about the legacy of mitchells ice cream for a while now but never really knew where it was and happened upon here one night after having dinner at front porch right around the corner. the first thing one must notice is the huge crowds outside patiently waiting for their number to be called. what is this? a deli? ive never been to an ice cream shop where you have actual number orders and once i figured out the system, i nearly died seeing that the number i pulled was 99 and they had just called 68.

but the line moved pretty fast the wait took about 30 minutes and thank goodness it wasnt one of those normal windy nights otherwise it might of been unbearable. i got the rocky road dipped in chocolate and i have to say the best part is the dipped chocolate that hardens into a shell. i watched them and they actually take the entire scoop of ice cream and dip the whole thing into chocolate...can we say heaven? 

while the ice cream was good and theres lots of variety, i give the place three stars as i didnt think it was that amazing that i would regularly wait 30 minutes but next time im back, ill have to try it with the waffle bowl. they looked delicious!
author: georgette y.

description: One of the best ice cream parlor might I mention. The Mango flavor is intense and I just love it. The place is well known for it unqiue flavor.
author: Rose G.

description:
Went to Mitchell's tonight. It was good but I wasn't blown away.

We tried:
-Grasshopper (Mint ice cream, fudge, and Oreos. Good but heavy)
-Strawberry Cream (too many frozen strawberries)
-Eggnog (Lots of flavor. Seasonal)

By all means it was good. It wasn't as unique and flavorful as Bi-Rite. 

Fun to try but not worth it if you're near Bi-Rite.
author: Vanessa V.

description: Good ice cream.  Tons of different flavors.  When I am in the area again I will come back.
author: Christopher D.

description: they have some really weird flavor options that actually turn out to be superdooper awesome! The line is retarded , but hey ... its worth the wait.
author: Lauren V.

description: If you're going to indulge, do it here. The variety of flavors is amazing and there's always something new to try. Give the pineapple-coconut a go - especially dipped in chocolate, it's surprisingly addictive. Take cash and prep yourself for a wait, even when you think it's too cold for IC.
author: Bridget W.

description: OMG! This is my FAVORITE ice cream place of all time.  Every flavor rocks my boat.  Love the thin mint (think mint chip), rocky road, pumpkin (seasonal but worth the wait!!), among many others.  Try the unusual asian fruit flavors for something new - they are great too.  When you're really celebrating, get one of their many diverse sundaes!  Hope you brought your appetite!
author: laura g.

description:
five freakin stars, okay!!?!??!

[my favorite is the avocado and ube and mango and macapuno and langka.]
author: Rosalee C.

description:
i love charming, old, local establishments, and mitchell's does not disappoint on that front.  this are why i give mitchell's five stars, and not the ice cream.  frankly there is better local ice cream elsewhere in sf.

that being said, mitchell's does make good ice cream and is totally worth the trip.  it's not the ice cream i'd choose for my last meal, but it's still worth grabbing a number, queuing up, and waiting for a scoop.  :)
author: Sarah B.

description: Ok not much to say that other people havent' said, I'm almost the 1200 review.  Not only is the ice cream the best I have ever had but Mitchells has the most unique flavors and they actually taste good.  My personal favorite is Mexican chocolate. Don't come here if your in a hurry you have to take a number and the wait usually is around 30 minutes.
author: Dean P.

description: Yummy - but not extraordinary as the quintessential SF ice cream spot with a lot, if not too much hype. Lots and lots of choices - for the indecisive person, you'll have plenty of time to choose, as there's always a wait out the door, but those employees work their deltoids - to scoop ice cream with relative speed, just enough time for you to finally decide on something. IMO, I'd probably go somewhere else to indulge in a 600+ calorie ice cream; otherwise, I'd opt for the 'healthier' choice of Sweet Coconut (with good amount of chunks of fruit). Don't get me wrong - this is good - but I never say, "I am craving for Mitchell's"
author: Audrey L.

description: Oh.Em.Gee..... A piece of heaven! The lines are looong and they close at 11 pm. Tells you what kind of following they have, eh? Expensive at $9.50 for a quart, where as we can plop down $5 for a HUGE 2-gallon tub at the local grocery store, but Mitchell's is soooooo worth it. The creamy ice cream is just the right consistency... My kids are spoiled especially with Mitchell's Rocky Road Ice Cream. The marshmallows are still amazingly soft while the nuts are still crunchy! How do you guys do it?! Haagen-Daaz won't even do for our family now... We bow down to you, All Mighty Mitchell's Ice Cream... Delish!
author: Anne T.

description: The best ice cream ever!!!!  I've been a Mitchell's ice cream lover for 30+ years now.  Every time I go I fall in love with Mitchell's all over again.
author: Christina C.

description: Be prepared to wait and wait and wait for the best ice cream in San Francisco.  I went once and I was almost 50 numbers behind the person being served.  Since the ice cream is so delicious and innovative I waited anyway because it's worth it everytime.  I have yet to try a bad flavor, which is surprising since there are so many flavors to try... and not your usualy collection of flavors either.  There's always something new and delicious to try whether you're the sorbet type of the rich creamy choclate type.
author: Patrick C.

description:
I was so excited to live around a few blocks from Mitchell's this summer, after all I had heard about its fabulous flavors. Imagine my surprise when, expecting a high-end ice cream shop, I looked at the list of ingredients to find the ice cream loaded with preservatives and stabilizers--supermarket ice cream is higher quality than this! I ended up buying some Mexican chocolate to take home (the lines were terrible), and although I love Mexican chocolate as a flavor (indeed, I often add chilis and/or pepper to my own chocolate things at home), the ice cream lingered in our freezer until we left it for the people we subletted from. The flavor was decent (although not great), but the ice cream left a coating behind in my mouth that was kind of gross. After a few spoonfuls, I just didn't want anymore.

I'm told the coconut flavors are what we should've gone for, but I never found out: the lines were too long for a cup, and, after the Mexican chocolate experience, I wasn't up for buying a gallon to eat at home.
author: Judith M.

description: I absolutely love this local ice creamery for the simple fact that I remember when it WASN'T busy. When I was a kid my parents and grandparents would take me here for yummy ice cream and we never had to wait in a line. I'll never forget the childhood memories of having the best chocolate ice cream inside the red brick building. Forget Rice A Ronni, Mitchell's is the real San Francisco treat.
author: Jenny B.

description: I've eaten this ice cream since I was a kid and when I found out that they had a store in San Francisco off the 280 I just about died and went to ice cream heaven! No place to eat inside,...but no matter how cold it is, people are eating ice cream outside on a bench, standing around waiting for this rich delicious ice cream. My favorite since I'm Filipina are the tropical flavors like langka(jackfruit), macapuno(coconut), buko(young coconut), avocado(yes that's right! we use it like a fruit, not a vegetable), ube(purple ice cream, like a sweet potato, but purple), my coconut husband(he's such a hottie=D) likes all the American flavors, his fav is the strawberry. They always let you sample, almost always have to take a number and wait, but always always worth it!!
author: christine s.

description: what else is there to day that hasb't been said in the last 333 reviews? this place is amazing and it's definitely not just the nostalgia. My favorite flavors are ube, jackfruit, and chocolate. The staff is great, I always ask for my hot fudge in a separate bowl and they're cool about that. Only thing is the parking, but even then I've never waited for more than 5 minutes to get a space in the lot or on san jose. I make the 45 minute drive just for the ice cream when the cravings get that bad. The number system is fun!
author: Ryan C.

description: huge line.  ok ice cream was't worth it for me.  bi-rite creamy is head a shoulders better and is next to a great park.  so enjoy your cone while taking a nice stroll in the park
author: brian l.

description:
best pistachio ice cream by far.
ube is de-li-cious.
anything dipped in chocolate is heavenly. 
yes there is a looooong wait if you go at the wrong time (eg. when san franciscans can't stand the 80 degree weather, week AND weekend nights) 
BUT it is soooo worth it.
wish they had a cookie dough option though. 
love that they have seasonal flavors.
can't get enough of this place and their huge scoops (unlike other pricey places)
so stop complaining and wait for #99 to be called.
take something with you to keep you busy during your wait. 
it's well worth it. 
oh and p.s. #0 is actually a number, so don't trow it away! i speak from experience.
author: Brenda S.

description: Who thought that ice cream can be such an event?  There are some pretty yummy flavors, but the wait is often a bit, but worth it.
author: Princess P.

description: Decent ice cream, but way overhyped, overrated and expensive. They do have flavors you might have difficulty finding elsewhere, but judge for yourself the bang for your buck.
author: Gaven Y.

description: Mitchell's is the best place to go for ice cream in San Francisco period. I strongly recommend the tropical flavors with Mango and Buko (baby coconut) being my own personal favorites. They will satisfy any ice cream craving and leave you wanting more. My dad has been taking my whole family there since we were little itty bitty kids and it only gets better. This place has been rated over 900 times. Enough said.
author: Esmeralda M.

description:
Yes, it's worth the wait.  Can you believe anyone would wait for ice cream on a windy San Francisco night?  I thought for sure there'd be no line, but great minds think alike.  There were still 30 people ahead of me in line when I arrived.  

By far the best ice cream in SF, be sure to bring any out of town guests here to show them what they are missing.
author: Eleanor H.

description: Ice Cream!!! You can't go wrong here, it's been a while since i've been back from their remodeling and it's a tad better since you get to see what they're serving up. They also have reserves in the back with different flavors so you might just have to ask if they have it. Ice cream made there, what more can you ask for? I always come here for Ube, half gallon tub or a scoop. YUM! I tried their pumpkin and cheese cake ice cream, what a great combo to have together! It's like having thanksgiving dessert again. They even do ice cream cookie sandwiches with any flavor ice cream in between just for you! Oh, and it's even better now cause they take credit card/ATM for a minimum purchase of $9 so no more cash only worries or well unless you don't spend up to the min. Don't forget to take a number!
author: Annie D.

description:
update: just had the white pistachio ice cream and its sooo good. they have real pistachio nuts in them. you gotta try this!



yum-my! i love, love, love this place. they have "exotic" flavors where you can't really find elsewhere. i even go there on rainy, cold nights. go for mango however even the normal, everyday flavors are worth a try. 

the only drawback is the parking...
author: Mei N.

description: Nothing like a scoop of Avocado backed with a Mexican Chocolate chaser. I heart Mitchell's with all the clogging of my arteries! Can you say, "Macapuno?" mmmm...Macapuno...
author: Delilah P.

description: Quit your whining about the wait on warm summer nights and the lack of parking.  Ride your bike out, make some friends after you get your number, and just appreciate the fact that you'll get the best damn Mexican chocolate ice cream there is.
author: Alfonso E.

description: My friend from Virginia insisted that we visit here because her mom had seen it on the travel channel.  With great trepidation we set out to find this place... Mitchells what? Amazing flavors, so many options, and just crazy things you would never think of... I tried something called Lacuma and loved it!  At one point, we counted 40 people outside the store waiting on icecream, and 20 people inside... also waiting!  And yet everyone seemed happy.  My friend ordered mango, which they are apparently famous for.  She loved it, and really, everyone loved theirs.  Its a legit hit, my friends!
author: Ananda Z.

description:
For the San Francisco challenged..one might think.
"hey..so the strip club bros who died..also had ice cream?"

NO maam..that's MITCHELL BROS...
this is MITCHELL'S Ice cream.   VERY different and you don't
want to confuse yourself into going to the other when you have
a cold milk fix.  hehe

ANYHOW...

Are two scoops of ice cream worth 6 bucks?
Answer below.

This is the original location for Mitchell's Ice Cream and yes..it's Norteno gang territory and pretty scarey to get to a night..and to me it's whimpier to go to the other location in Noe Valley.  I mean what's the adventure in that??

Apparently many others think so too..People from all demographics from the city..rich, poor, old, white, black, asian, fat, skinny, etc..come to this place. On hot summer days/nights..the line can stretch down the block.  

There's only 6 parking spots in the back..so it's a mad dash to get your cones. 

So is this ice cream worth 6 bucks for 2 scoops?

Absofreakinlutely!

Okay..I've had cherry ice cream all over the place...
but for some reason..the cherry ice cream at Mitchell's is
SO RICH..so creamy and you can taste the real milk used.

Most other ice creams..especially store bought.don't use real milk.

Tasting ice cream that uses real milk makes ALL the diff in the world.

I go there for the mocha fudge and the cherry ice cream.

They also have exotic filipino flavors like Avocado(YES.avocado..it's the BEST..and ube(sweet potato that's purple) and yam.

U gotta taste test these and see for yourself.

I was introduced to this place on a date..and brought
many a date here since.  Buy a girl really good ice cream, and drive to the marina to eat it...u can't beat that.
author: Michael L.

description:
freezing december night, slightly drizzling...time for mexican chocolate ice cream at Mitchell's? hell yeah! (and yes, even in these conditions, 20 other ppl also had my idea. line took 45 min to get through).

i'm guessing someone else probably already wrote about this, but mitchell's is like the soup Nazi of ice cream shops. have your number ready in your hot little hand, the second they yell your number...snap to it son! hustle the f up there. elbow your way past kids, knock down old people...it's okay, they'll understand. and for the love of god. know what you want. spit out your order, slam down your money, enjoy your cone.
author: Amy L.

description:
My dog Buddha loves ice cream.  Whenever we take him out for a walk around the neighborhood, somehow he finds his way to the cold stone creamery near Union Square.  However for the last few weeks, they have been closed due to construction.  You don't understand how obsessed this dog is with ice cream, if he does not get it, he does not want to walk home.  
Sunday afternoon, we went to Mission Dolores Park and as we were leaving we promised the the get him a fix ( I mean a scoop) of ice cream.   We never saw him move quicker in the  9 1/2 years we've had him.  
Mitchell's was great  despite  the long line and the anticipation the ice cream was well worth it.  We drove there, circled the block several times, double parked at times. Until someone parked up front happened to leave as I was returning from a quick drive around the block.  By then you would have thought the line would have subsided but it was growing steady the whole time I was there.
author: Javier O.

description: There is a reason why majority of the reviews of this place are given five stars. This place is amazing and always full. No matter the weather outside, there will always be a wait, and the reason is simple, great prices, great flavors. Don't get me wrong, parking is a b....., but the wait, finding the parking is all worth it. Greatly recommended.
author: Cesar F.

description: Can be crowded but staff is always friendly and helpful. Take a number and enjoy the chaos. When you get to the counter say these four words: Grasshopper. Pie. Ice. Cream.
author: geoffrey e.

description:
first star...they had a bunch of interesting flavors to choose from.

second star...people there are pretty nice and they let me sample the ones that i wasn't sure of.

third star...they icecream seemed to be freshly made and was soft...unlike rite aid and a certain baskin robbins where they have rock ass hard icecream that has frost on it. oh yeh, n they don't only have icecream, but other goodies as well.

fourth star...i first found out about this place when i saw it on the food network channel, but i didn't realize that it was in sf. i guess i didn't pay attention too well. soo..food network = cool factor.

fifth star...i luv ube. forrealz.
author: Big Poppa N.

description: This is the best ice cream i have ever had.  I always crave their seasonal flavor of cantaloupe.  Mexican chocolate is also a great choice or try one of the Filipino tropical flavors, they are all great.  The fat content of this ice cream is so high that it is addicting.  I used to live near here and frequented this place until my pants no longer fit me :(.
author: Travis H.

description: As you can fathom from the near 1,000 reviews, this place has good ice cream.  I came here on a beautiful late Saturday night to find the place overflowing with eager ice cream eaters.  The line was long, but the wait seemed short.  They have the system down where you take a number and order when it's called.  I'm no ice cream expert so I can't tell you why this place is so much better than all the other ice cream stands... but I can tell you my New York Cherry ice cream was delicious.  Not too sweet, not too strong on the cherry, juuuuust right.
author: Daniel L.

description: This place is yummilicious.  That is all I have to say....if someone cool like me made up that retarded ass word to describe a place it must be off the chain....kind of like a diamond necklace those rappers be wearin to freeze their necks with ice.  If you are into creamy, home-made style ice cream and exotic flavors then this is the spot to hit that sweet spot.  Man, I got a toothache just thinkin about it.....better go get a scoop later to fix it...fix it...fix it....damage...damage....see wut I am sayin the ice cream just makes you lose your mind.
author: Te R.

description:
Amazing Ice Cream = Mitchell's

Grasshopper Pie = 5 stars
Oreo = 4.5 stars
Avocado = 1.5 stars ( had to at least try it)
Purple Yam = 3 stars
Sweet Coconut = 4 stars
author: Tim S.

description: Worth the long drive and wait in the cold. This place ROCKS! Love the variety. Generous portions.  Wish they would open one near home. Parking kinda suck but worth the driving around the building until one is free. hahah! I would definitely come back.
author: Bernie C.

description: The best and the waits are much less painful since they remodeled the counter.  They have several unique tropical flavors but I still just go for the hot fudge sundae with Thin Mint and Peanut Butter Indulgance.  We're somewhat spoiled since we live right around the corner.
author: Doug H.

description: Had the Mexican Chocolate with Cinnamon in a waffle cone, which was delicious.  Tasted a couple others - Avocado and Ube.  The Avocado was interesting, worth checking out.  The Ube (purple yam) was a little too subtle for my taste.  Overall, nice spot.
author: Lisa M.

description: Pretty good ice cream.  You can buy the gallon at local supermarkets such as Oriental or Pacific Supermarkets.  Parking is tough, although they do have a small, private lot.  I got to try Bi-Rite next and see what all the hype is all about.  But am I a fan?  You bet your Cookies 'n Cream bottom I am.
author: Restaurant C.

description: hands down best ice cream ever!!!  yah so there is a line out the door at all hours of the day, even in the rain but thats because its sooo damn good! i love all the crazy flavors.... mexican chocolate, baby coconut and avocado are my fav. I miss you mitchell's! i wish you would open a chain in socal!
author: Natalia J.

description: They need to add more flavor. The yam (purple) ice cream lacks alot of flavor.. tastes like plain vanilla. The yam ice cream I get at the asian market tastes better.
author: Beach L.

description: OMG, how did it take me so long to go here!!! Growing up in the Midwest I was basically raised on custard and have found it difficult to find something comparable out here. But, I have finally done so...Mitchell's home made ice cream rocks!!!! They have I don't know how many different flavors from chocolate and vanilla blends to fruit flavors with real fruit chunks to sorbet to sundaes and the list goes on-and-on! It is well worth trying to find a place to park and taking a number and waiting! The service was excellent and the prices are definitely reasonable! I will definitely be heading back here very, very soon!!!
author: Kristin D.

description: Can someone please tell me why any one would give Mitchell's anything less than 5 stars? I've been going to Michell;s since I was a kid. BEST ICE CREAM in SF! I love the peppermint ice cream they have during Xmas, with big chunks of peppermint candy.. During Thanksgiving my fav is the Pumpkin Ice Cream.. when they don't have a holiday special I typically order the marble fudge..Occasionally i'm adventurous and I'm never let down.. thanks fir the great ice cream mitchell's
author: Monica S.

description: It was cold and windy as hell on Saturday night but the place was full and brimming with people. I've lived in Daly City for almost all of my life but I've never been to Mitchell's until last Saturday. The flavors aren't fancy Coldstone Birthday Cake Remix style but they have a good variety of the favorites. I got the French Custard Vanilla with sprinkles. Yessss! It was hella good! And the best part, they give you a separate cup with extra sprinkles! Because they know how it is when you run out of sprinkles and you still have plenty more ice cream left. The staff is young and efficient. It's so poppin, you have to take a number and make sure you do other wise, you won't get served.
author: Tatiana D.

description: This place has you take a frickn number! That's because their Ice Cream is "i think" slow churned! It's extremely creamy, and orgasmic. You can get flavors like "Nutella" Halo-Halo, to plain 'ol Mint Chip...and still....it's that slow cream texture on your tongue that makes it worth waiting 30 frickn minutes for! In the summer, I get multiple numbers and start slanging them,....I'M PLAYING! This is my favorite ice creamery!
author: Lei L.

description:
turn any night into a psychological game of extended-choosing-of-what-to-order...  

in fact, the experience of mitchell's may be less about the ice cream (consistently good, no worries) and more about freezing your arse off and people watching (is that a mail-order bride with that dude?  wait, what flavor do you think he ordered?); oh, and don't forget the infinite doubting of what you think you want to order.  "can you see what it says up there, below mocha?"
author: Kris P.

description: Ice cream is creamy not rock hard.  Macapuno (Sweet Coconut) is worth trying if you are into new flavors.  Mango was o.k.  Small seating area on outside benches.
author: Atif Q.

description:
i've got mitchell's number saved on my phone... why, you ask? so i can call and ask what exciting mouth-watering flavors they have any time i have an ice cream craving... which is pretty often. the summer seasonal flavors are awesome! they seem to have a new sorbet flavor every time i go there. some don't quite work, like the prickly pear and ginger that i tried last night which didn't taste so good. but others such as the strawberry and basil, are really quite tasty. then there are the classic sorbet flavors that rotate through the seasons, such as pear and mango sorbet that taste like mashed up frozen fruit. so good!!! 

on a sad note... they discontinued my favorite ice cream of all time a few years back: the pinapple sherbet... damn, that was a really good ice cream... and i'll never be able to eat it again... sniffle...

but even with that travesty, mitchell's is still awesome. and their ice cream still makes me happy. :)
author: Steven L.

description: My mouth had an orgasm when I had the white pistacio and butterscotch.
author: Bill K.

description:
Mexican Chocolate.  sigh.  Perfection in a cone.

There's also a certain joy in seeing some little kid propped up on his dad's shoulders, little paper ticket number in hand, waiting, just waiting to go inside where it's fresh and cool, where he'll whisper his flavor to the angel across the counter who will dig in and scoop up a little bit of heaven - making that little toddler's tongue so happy.

it is one of my favorite things about life in San Francisco.  We are so lucky to live here.

Thank you Mitchell's!
author: renae o.

description:
Great ice cream. Surely you were waiting for the 932nd review to confirm that.

Closeby. Its a wonder Im not 300 pounds yet.

Mexican chocolate is great, Ube was sorta disappointing for something so purple. I still have many to try.

Came here once at 1030pm, in a light rain, and there will still some 15 people ahead of me. Ugh.

Oh and because of those lines, I feel really guilty when I ask for more than 2 free samples. If I was the only one there, oh sampling I'd be doing.
author: travis w.

description: If you love ice cream, you MUST try Mitchell's at least once in your life.  Caution - expect a line there (always one) but the line goes fast.  They have an amazing selection of flavors, so take a chance and try something new.
author: Annabel G.

description: "We're not worthy! We're not worthy!" Supplicating in honor at their front door .....unless standing in a long line on a hot SF summer (October) day.
author: Johnny C.

description: I grew up on mitchell's and have always had fond memories of my folks picking us up from school and then dropping by Mitchell's for a half gallon of mango or buko ice cream....mmmmmm. Their halo-halo is the bomb!!!  Although they do sell pre-packs at safeway and asian markets and it can get busy at times (esp. in the evening) it's so much more satisfying taking a number and waiting to be called...it's definitely worth the wait!
author: Pippi L.

description: This staple of the San Francisco Ice Cream scene sure could make someone scream. The long lines on the weekend could provoke some shouting but equal to the yelps for Macapuno ice cream because it is delicious and well worth the wait.
author: Jessica D.

description: I have been coming here since i was 5 and it is still delicious and creamy as always.  Apparently, when my sister was a chubby baby and couldn't speak yet, she always knew when we'd drive by Mitchell's and point out the window and make grunting sounds, wanting my parents to pull over and get some ice cream.  The other consistent thing are the lines, so expect at least 20-25minutes btwn getting in lineand getting your cone.
author: Marina F.

description: This place is sooo good!!! My sweetie took me here for the first time last weekend and we went back this weekend cause it was just that good. I ordered the toasted almond on a chocolate dipped cone, he had vanilla and banana also chocolate dipped. It has the old fashioned hand made ice cream store flavor from when I was a kid and the prices aren't bad. You can sample as many flavors as you like, it's hard to make up your mind with such a great selection! The lines are long but they move pretty fast, and this stuff is definitely worth it!!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Correct me if i'm wrong but i think they sprinkle a little crack in their ice cream!  j/k j/k nah but foreal it gave me a break from froyo.  I visited their newly renovated store this past weekend and tried a buko and ube combo...delish!  My favorite is their white pistachio...mmmmm, i brought home a half gallon.  Back in high school, i use to work in a ice cream parlor in hawaii and i thought Dave's ice cream concocted ice cream that was rich and creamy but Mitchell's just takes the cake!  I also tried fenton's in Oakland but i still prefer Mitchell's Ice Cream!  Keep doing what your doin!
author: Michael Y.

description:
People come by the truck loads, literally.
This is probably one of the few places where people line up even in the cold at 11 pm to get ice cream.  And, like penguins, they all huddle around enjoying the creamy deliciousness while getting goosebumps.  It's that good.  The last time I was there, a moving truck pulled up, which is not extremely atypical.  But, the driver then went to open the back and people kept coming out like a clown car.  All in all, probably like 20 people.
I love strawberry so I always get that with the waffle cone, but the other flavors are equally great.
author: Curtis I.

description: MMMMM....ice cream! With tropical flavors! Love the mango, ube, green tea ice creams!
author: Jennifer K.

description: Yo-hooo! Now this is spankin' good ice cream! The Mexican Chocolate is what all chocolate ice creams wish to be. Eat some there, then buy some for home. Locally owned and operated too! What's not to like? Oh yeah, the lines on hot days and sweltery nights. Heck, the lines can be long in the middle of winter too! We're a crazy bunch, are we not?
author: Michael L.

description: Oh my! We sat outside in the freezing cold to eat this. It was sooo good, we almost went back in for our 3rd scoop. Only complaint is there needs to be more seating inside. When its cold and you have a craving for ice cream its slightly painful to eat it outside.
author: Misty D.

description: Mitchell's is fabulous...I love the lychee ice cream, the mango, well, to be absolutely truthful, I don't think there are any of those tasty frozen treats that I don't like...and, when fall rolls around and I know pumpkin will be on hand, I detour on the way home from work, and pray I'll find a parking place in front.  Last night, with a friend from MN visiting, we drove by after our great Thai dinner.  However, with the line out front snaking into the distance, I shed a few tears and drove on by.  At 62, even for a taste treat like Mitchell's, I'm not standing in line for an hour!!!
author: Carmen H.

description: ive been coming to Mitchell's before i can remember. my dad worked at Mitchell's when he was in high school and college. Mitchell's is tradition every summer we come here at least a gazillion times. my favorite thing to get at Mitchell's is two scoops of mint chip ice cream on a waffle cone dipped in chocolate. its awesome! my dad and brothers always get ube or lumpa (im not sure if that right) its Filipino ice cream, i think. anyway mitchells is the best ice cream place in the city no country!!!!!!!
author: bridge A.

description: God, I love you, Mitchell's. We haven't spent much time together lately, but it's springtime, so I'll come a-runnin' back to your sweet sweeeeet arms soon. I've missed you so!
author: Elle B.

description:
One of my fondness memories as a child was when my parents use to take me to Mitchell's Ice Cream. I remember it clearly, because it was the first place I'd ever been to that served exotic and tropical ice cream. Flavors such as Ube and Mango that I loved as a child. Since I haven't been there in over 17+ years, I decided to go back to rekindle my childhood memories.
     What a mission trying to find this place, but that wasn't gonna stop us from eating some good ice cream. Once we found it, I noticed the line out the door. It was also semi-hard to find parking. Two immediate signs that it was gonna be a good place!
     They had a numbering system there. So I grabbed our ticket and looked at the many flavors of Ice Cream they had. When it was our turn, I decided on three scoops. I chose Avocado, Mango and Ube (for those of you who don't know, Ube is a purple yam which is usually found in the Philippines.). I debated back and forth whether to just get three plain scoops or in a banana split. I decided to get the three scoops so I could savor the flavor rather than drowning it all.
     The Avocado was good. It had a taste which was unusual. I really can't explain it? It wasn't really sweet, had close to a guacamole taste, but then not really. The Mango was good also. I expected some fruit in it, but there wasn't any. I've had better Mango Ice Cream. The Ube was FANTASTIC! I've bought the store brand ones from the Asian Markets before, but they don't come close to the flavor of the one at Mitchell's. Definitely the best Ube Ice Cream I've ever had!
     My cousin, Smelly Mary got a scoop of Macapuno and I tasted it. It was pretty good. The ice cream was sweet with pieces of coconut. She pointed out to me these Ube flavored Wafer Sticks that they sold in a prepacked tub. I had to buy them. They were fantastic.
     My overall experience at Mitchell's was great. I will most definitely be back there. If I didn't live so far from there, I would've bought some 1/2 gallon prepacked ice creams to go. Oh well, until next time...
author: Che G.

description: Good spot... great selection, even some exotic options which is rare. First place I hit when I moved into Noe. Good choice. Long line almost at all times but hey why not enjoy SF and wait for 10 minutes amongst the people for some great ice cream.
author: Nelson C.

description: I just took a deep breath. Even thinking of Mitchell's Ice Cream makes my mouth water but now I have to recall my experiences? Oh my. Many wonderful memories here. I have tried many of their wonderful flavors. Choc. Caramel Crackle. Mexican Chocolate. Butterscotch Marble. Even their Grasshopper Pie Sundae. But I always wait for winter to come around for my most favorite flavor. Pumpkin. The quality of this ice cream is remarkable and is definitely worth the sometimes long, okay, really long, lines. I miss you Mitchell's....
author: Alexa L.

description: my grandparents started taking my sister and me to mitchell's when we were small children, and it's been my favorite place to get ice cream for my entire lifetime. i love the tropical flavors (langka and avocado are particularly good) but somehow i always come back to thin mint. it's better here than anywhere else, and definitely worth the sometimes long wait. my mom always gets the chocolate shell around her cone. it's a classic. there is nowhere better to get ice cream than mitchell's.
author: Whitney G.

description: Their seasonal specialties are hella bomb! Lychee ice cream AND halo halo?!?!?! I must've died & gone to Mitchell's..... I wish they added a Bart station between 24th & Glen Park.... or underground parking.
author: Eugene G.

description: Mitchell's is the only place I know of where I can get my Thai tea ice cream! It's so yummy! Oh and they also have a rad Mexican chocolate flavor that's no slouch either.  Whenever you're up in the city and have a hankering for good ice cream, check out Mitchell's.
author: Devon P.

description: I am the luckiest girl in the world (although my hips are suffering for it) because we moved in right across the street from Mitchell's. OOOOEEEE. this is truly the best ice cream ever, their list of flavors is incredible, although I can never get past their Oreo Cookie, which is the best Oreo Cookie ice cream ever. and then they must have listened to me whining in line one night about the lack of peanut butter on the menu because behold! we have peanut butter explosion, my new favorite treat. and if you buy an ice cream cake they inscribe it on the spot for you. I can't say enough but it's all been said already. make it a point to go here!
author: Phoebe H.

description:
Mitchell's Ice Cream had been nothing to me but a mere whisper overheard as I passed through crowds, until recently.  After dropping my buddy off from a Giants game, I happened to drive by the subtle store.  It was more the line of people out the door that caught my attention, than the place itself.  When I realized what I was seeing, I decided to experience this place I had heard so much about for myself.  After parking my car and inspecting the place a little more, I was surprised by its small size.  There's not a lot of places for customers to sit except for two benches outside the main door.  But I was there for ice cream, not a social event.  I made my way to the front of the line with ease as there were three windows quickly helping customers.   I ordered what most would consider a staple of any ice cream parlor, the traditional sundae.  Vanilla ice cream, hot fudge, and whipped cream with a cherry on top.  I opted for a waffle cone bowl because I was craving something crunchy as well as sweet.   I was impressed by the wide varieties of ice cream to choose from, including the traditional flavors and concoctions.  Next time I'll try something a little more adventurous.
I decided to get the "two scoop" sundae because I was pretty hungry.
I didn't see the scoop the pleasant server was using, but it must have been pretty large!!   When he handed me the dish it looked more like a 4 scoop sundae... and ultimately my stomach agreed.
Every ingredient was delicious!   And I was pleased with the amount of each.  Some places skimp on the hot fudge, but apparently not Mitchell's!  I couldn't even finish it all, which I know, to chocolate lovers, is a mortal sin!
In the end, I was very satisfied with my sundae.  I also enjoyed the service, the intimate atmosphere despite the lack of seating.
I also enjoyed the other customers.  Everyone was polite and very excited to be eating ice cream!  Thanks Mitchell's!  I can't wait to go back.
author: Greg H.

description: My friend just took me to Mitchell's and it was delicious.  I wish the scoops were as big as my head.  They had so many interesting flavors and i was afraid to pick a bad one my first try but I loved my choice.  Cinnamon snap is a must try.  They have ginger snaps in the ice cream which gives it an interesting punch and a nice crunchy texture.  The only thing that sucked was the long wait but it did make me crave it more.
author: Victor T.

description: Aaaaaaahhhh Mitchell's Ice Cream how I love you. The only down side is the line but rain or shine its worth the wait. I've made a few friends over the years battling the elements only to taste the delicious flavors that Mitchell's ice cream puts out. The staff is always friendly, ready to answer any questions you might have only to present you with a generous cone topped with one or more of the flavors you picked out. Then before they hand it to you,  if you dare, chocolate dipped? I suggest if you had a tough week, why not, go ahead, you deserve it. Even if you don't just pretend, they don't know.
author: Christian H.

description:
Mitchell's is the only place I'll order my ice cream on a cone! Can't miss with the chocolate dip! I especially like it with their peppermint stick flavor!
Other flavors include ube, avocado and buko, but I can't tear myself away from my old standby to try them.
Lines can be out the door, but the servers are quick and it's worth the wait!
author: Lauren K.

description: Favorite spot and worth the wait. Try macapuno (sweet coconut) with the chocolate shell.
author: Peter H.

description:
I give this place a 4 1/2! 1/2 because you have to wait at least 30-35mins to get ice cream on weekends! geez! but i guess thats a good sign because that shows their ice creams are yummy! 

My bf and I came here because I've seen it on the food channel and wanted to check it out! when we first got there, it was jam packed, just like i saw in pictures and on tv! we werent sure if we were suppose to get in a line or what. My bf asked someone and they said we needed to get a ticket number. we were number 87 and they were only on number 63! as we waited, we looked at what flavors they had and tried to figure out what to try. i wanted to try so manY! but i always feel bad asking... they had tropical flavors, which you rarely see at ice cream parlors. tropical flavors such as jackfruit, ube, macapuca, etc. 

finally, after 30mins of waiting, we were finally next to get our ice cream! I tried to ube because it seem like everyone was getting that. it was good, but i expected more. next i tried the thai tea and that was yummy! so i decided to get a scoop of white pistacio and thai tea in a cup, while my bf got the kahlua mocha cream and roasted almond on a cone. the white pistacio was soo good! but the roasted almost was even better! soo good that i kept eating off from my bfs cone! he liked it a lot too! next time when i come back, i want to try to grasshopper pie, thin mint and french vanille custard! the total came out to be $9ish, which is kinda pricey but tastey! they also sell boxes of their creation that you can bring home! i wanted one, but i live 45mins away and it would melt by the time i get home. I love the their creation here and would totally come back when i am in SF. they need to open one in san jose so i dont have to drive so farr! :(
author: Van K.

description: Mitchell's rules for having so many flavors to choose from, especially exotic fruit ones!
