I went here two nights in a row with my family, the first time I got the mocha fudge in a waffle cone (yummy), second time we took home a half gallon of buko (baby coconut) and I have to say it's now my favorite! It's soooo good!! I love how it has pieces of real coconut in it. Both times we went later in the evening so there wasn't much of a line, in fact there were more people in the express line buying half gallons instead of folks getting scoops. I wish there was a Mitchell's in Southern California, but it's probably for the best... I'd be even more overweight. Can't wait to go back!
author: S. D.

description: Really Good, this is as good as it's gonna get.  Best time to go is work week not too many people. Really good!! I think I need to run there right now! I need another hit..I think every flavor is good.
author: marlon m.

description: Wah, the wait is so long and always will be. Get over it. I tried the avocado. It was weird, but a good weird. Next time with chocolate? The purple yam was great, and one of my favorite flavors as a little Nadine when I was living in the Philipines- that and purple being my favorite color at the time. Purple ice cream? Like Twin Stars uniting.
author: Nadine S.

description:
I hate this place. Not because it's always crowded. Or because it's tasty. But for the purely selfish reason that it's around the corner from my house and I am constantly dealing with the terrible double parkers and the people who actually try to wait for a parking space with their rear ends hanging out to the street so that nobody can get by. It makes me *crazy*!!!

You think I'm bitchy now, you should see me on the road. ;)

By the way, don't wait an hour for ice cream here. Go to your neighborhood shop and get a pint and put on your biggest pair of sweatpants and turn on Sex and the City and enjoy your time spent peacefully there instead of on San Jose Avenue with me honking at you. Please?
author: Tracy Y.

description: So the city is usally 50 to 60 degrees, depending on which part of the city you are in. On a cold and roughly 50 degree night, you wouldn't think there would be many people at a ice cream shop. San Francisco people are retarded, myself included. I went here the other night 10 minutes before closing. It was windy and cold and still there were a ton of people inside.
author: Andy C.

description: WOW !! I have always been a huge ice cream fan, and I consider myself to be an expert. Mitchell's is THE BEST ice cream I have EVER had in MY ENTIRE LIFE !!! The banana and the oreo are so YUMMY!!! I can't wait to go back and try them all !!
author: Kara E.

description: I know, I'm probably the only one who doesn't give this spot 5 stars and a raving review...maybe after another visit, I will do an update.  My husband and I finally made it here after talking about doing it for almost a year.  It was Valentine's Day, a Saturday night, and packed.  The ice cream was good, not great, but I think it's because we weren't adventurous in our flavor choices--shocking, but true.  Another visit is warranted, but 3 stars for now is honest...
author: Laura Noël S.

description: I'm not much into ice cream, but Mitchell's is an exception. My favorite is the Spumani available only in winter I think.
author: Ricardo O.

description: I don't care if I end up with number 102 and they are only on 29, I'll wait it out. Mitchell's rocks. They are what ice cream shops used to be like with kids and dogs and hot fudge sundaes.
author: Janet C.

description: There ice cream is good.  Very smooth, not icy, and flavorful.  I had a bite of my friends Mint Chip and was impressed.
author: Po L.

description: Mitchell's Ice cream is OK.  I find it way to heart clogging and thick but I guess some people like that - so it's not a place I'll be back to anytime soon.  I guess the reason why I give it three stars is that the ambiance is anything but friendly.  The cashier people are fine, but the setup of the store looks like a check cashing place.  I think a full remodel with places to sit would improve the taste of the ice cream ;)
author: M K.

description: They offer a great variety of unique flavors and they are open late.  I would recommend it to friends.
author: Erin S.

description: My favorite Mitchell's ice cream is anything with peanut butter and chocolate. Mitchells ice cream is a San Francisco treat.
author: John R.

description: I am the most impatient person you'll ever meet, i need constant satisfaction and mitchell meet's that, except for those long lines. I love Mitchell's because they have such a great variety of flavors and yeah they are lil more expensive then your dollar scoop ice cream at your local baskin robbins (cough cough Concord, CA) but what you pay for you get in quality. And ooh they are verrry nice and they have macapuno yummm.
author: Cristelle J.

description: worth the weight a popular place to take guests and family and friends different and unique and rare favorites from many cultures of ice cream try it u won't be dissapointed!!!! BEST choice to try different cultures popular ice cream you will know why its always jammed packed its that good!!!
author: Michael C.

description: It's difficult to have an awful ice cream experience and shocking when it's at a celebrated creamery such as Mitchells. However, I just had the worst ice cream experience of my life. The place was packed with kids eating their cones in front of the glass cases, so no chance of peeking at the vats. No big whoop, kids like ice cream and have no etiquette, however a good manager would have asked those with creams to step away from the counter, so those ordering could eyeball the tubs.  The experience was 1 star worthy when our stoned scooper gave me a junior scoop that was barely a quarter inch above the cone. Worse than a thrifty ice cream cone. I was so shocked, I took the skimpy "scoop" and paid without thinking. 2 ridiculously tiny scoops were over $5. Took 5 bite/licks to complete. I was apppalled at the service and scoop; so much so I was frozen with inaction. If i was ever served such a tiny treat for so much money again, I would walk away. Mitchell's days are over in my weighty ice-cream book. Not only was it overpriced and outrageously tiny, but the flavor was generically, cloyingly sweet and  and they hire loser stoners to scoop.  I prefer to spend a little more at Bi-Rite and get a giant cone heaping full of flavorful magic.  Fuck you Mitchells.
author: T L.

description: Just went back for more pear sorbet.  The new remodel looks good.  Not having those high, wall-to-wall Plexiglas barriers between customers and the people behind the counter makes it look less like a check-cashing business where they're afraid you'll pull a gun on them.
author: moosedog i.

description: omg yum! the butterscotch swirl was rich and creamy and totally delish! we also sampled the thai tea and toasted almond which were also good. next time i'll sample some of the tropical flavors! oh and my friend got two "mini" scoops for the price of 1 regular scoop, which is a good tip for those of us who are indecisive. ;)
author: Clara K.

description: I finally went here to get some ice cream with my family.  I've only really tasted Mitchell's ice cream in restaurants and the tubs of ice cream I gorged on during those days...you know...those days when you need to gorge yourself.  Anyhoo, I decided since it's ice cream and the good fatty premium kind, I'd try something new...a new flavor.  No not any of the filipino flavors like halo-halo or macupuno since well, I'm filipino and know those flavors well.  I decided to try Lucuma, a Peruvian fruit.  Having no clue what it was, I was being a bit adventurous.  Let me tell you, it was the best adventure my taste buds could ever go on.  I will definitely definitely only get this here since it's the only place I've ever seen this flavor at.  I only wish we weren't going to go shopping afterwards, since I really wanted to bring a tub of Lucuma home.  Oh well I think it's all for the best since I think I would be liable to eat the whole thing.  I don't even know how to describe the flavor except as GREAT.  Very creamy and just what I needed.  I will definitely be back and next time I'll make sure I have no where else to go afterwards so that I can bring some home =)
author: Carolen M.

description: wow! great ice cream!!! i just got to say the ube and the langka was sooo yummy!!!! we had dessert after dinner and the ice cream here hit the spot! big scoops as well!!! get ready to wait in line!
author: Rita L.

description: Mitchell's is the only ice cream you will find in my freezer! So smooth, rich  and creamy.  When I am in the city during the day, I usually drive by Mitchell's and pick up some Rum Raisin to take home.  Love the Mango too and the Mexican chocolate. Oooh and the White Pistachio. Last month I picked up the Coconut pineapple and it did not disappoint !
author: Ara M.

description: Love the assortment of delicious choices they have.  There is usually a line, but it is well worth the wait.
author: Danny M.

description: This used to be my favorite ice cream spot in the city. That is until I discovered Bi-Rite. The ice cream here is solid if you want more traditional flavors. The Peppermint they have during the holidays is delish. I also love Ube (Purple Yam), and the Halo Halo. The fruit "smoothies" are really good but they're more like milkshakes since they're made with ice cream. I feel guilty that I haven't been in such a long time but I guess my taste buds have evolved.
author: Holly E.

description:
first time going to Mitchell today.
had to say it was goood. when we passed the place, it was pretty crowded but since I was eyeing what to get, i was already being helped. 

i should say to feel free to ask for as much samples! i asked for only two but for sure I will be asking for more! 
I got the avocado with the sugar waffle cone, the one who helped me was patient and she gave me enough to fill the whole cone.
author: Kristin L.

description: I love this little ice cream shop.  Not only are there a lot of great, interesting flavors (what did they do with maiz y queso?) but the rich, creamy texture really make this ice cream stand out.  Plus, this is the only place I've ever seen Thai Tea Ice Cream, and man, it's delicious.  Can  you compare this place to Polly Ann's?  I think so.  In fact, I think Mitchell's ice cream tastes better when compared with the same flavors, but Polly Ann's definitely wins out when it comes to variety.
author: Tony L.

description:
small joint, big results. 

some of the best local ice cream. 
check out the pilapino flavoritas (avacado and macapuno (baby coconut)... omgggg). 

the lines are long, so make sure you grab your number right away. sometimes some goofy fools will sit around playing the "i'm indecisive game" and forget to grab one...

but you know this place is open little bit on the later side because they KNOW you'll be craving it. don't miss out~
author: Samantha R.

description:
Mango, buko, halo-halo ice cream, they're like crack.  I'm hooked for life.  This SF staple is worth the lines and the drive.  I feel like I'm on a pilgrimage every time we make the occasional visit.  Although, on my last one, Friday 1PM, 75 degrees outside (rare for SF) NO LINES!  Definitely a first.  

No frills ice cream store...take a number, have some patience, it's worth the wait.  

Tip:  Don't wanna wait, pick up a half-gallon (less than $10-I think) and you can enjoy it at home instead.
author: Mel R.

description: I have always wanted to go here. We came and my husband loved his coconut (not their name for it)  I had a flavor named after the owners wife - coffee, chocolate, etc.  I do not like soft ice cream / half melted and that is what I got.  Melted ice cream is awful, so hence my review.  IF I went back and the ice cream was soft I would not get any. Very disappointing.
author: mary m.

description: The best ice cream!  You'll find lines there even when it's cold, that's how great it is!  Be prepared to take a number and wait...
author: Art D.

description: Stopped by here on a lovely Saturday afternoon. I had heard about the lines, but we breezed in and out with a tasty ice cream cake (so we got to use the express lane.) I was tempted to order a carmel dazzler sundae, but it was hard to justify getting a sundae right before eating an ice cream cake.
author: Timothy O.

description: Nothing better than Mitchells Ice Cream.  Definitely the best icecream ive ever had.  really.... and, i dont mind the drive either.  Mango, Macapuco, Ube.. yum yum.  Well, theres a crap load of comments, but once you try this place i doubt any other icecream will fill the void!
author: Jennifer M.

description: yummmmm. buttery, fatty, melt in your mouth ice cream.  It's the best damn ice cream in the city, but wait up to 30 minutes to get my IC craving on? - I don't think so.  This place is crazeee busy - lines out the door and around the corner -  making me think my trip to Baskin Robbins or Ben and Jerry's in 5 minutes might be better to satisfy my craving.
author: Audra E.

description: First ingredient listed - CREAM, which to me, is the best ingredient!  Whether you walk in for a tub of ice cream or a cone, it's always good. Totally worth the wait! Grab a number and wonder if anyone really orders avacado ice cream...
author: Valarie A.

description: Best tropical, fruity ice creams ever!! I heart the buko and the avocado, try it.
author: Amber L.

description: I stumbled upon this place while waiting to meet up wih friends. They were late and it was hot and I was tired from walking all day. So I roamed around and found this place. To my surprise it was owned by Filipinos and they even had filipino flavors like ube and mango ice cream! I was like wow so cool! They had so many flavors to choose from!!
author: Sarina A.

description: Not that Mitchell's Ice Cream needs yet another raving review, but I had to pipe in 'cos no one's mentioned the MEXICAN CHOCOLATE ice cream. It's the bomb. Nowhere, ever have I had better ice cream and that's no exageration, my friend.
author: Katie B.

description: Often a big line, but it moves quickly, and the mexican chocolate is fantastic! They also do all the cone details - chocolate dipping, etc. Yum!
author: Don H.

description: Was never inclined to go until I saw the show 'Ice Cream Palaces' and Mitchell's was one of the shops featured...wow! it's good!  and so many unique flavors!   I went with the Tropical 4 (mango, guava, pineapple, banana I think) and it was delicious!
author: Debbie Y.

description: I guess I don't like ice cream?  I had Mitchell's the first time last weekend and for some reason, I wasn't blown away.  Did I get the wrong flavors?  Since their Mango flavor is everyone's favorite, I figured I would go with that.  Maybe my taste buds were numbed by the greasy chinese food I had earlier that night.  It just didn't do it for me.  My boyfriend got the cantalope flavor -- he said there were bits of cantalope in it, although the flavor seemed a little artificial.  He also got the tropical four (or something like that).  It reminded me of those japanese candies I used to have as a kid.  Overall, we weren't impressed.  But I will definitely give it a try again -- maybe if I didn't have to line up for a half hour for it I'd be a happier camper.
author: Winnie L.

description: My friends are native San Franciscans (one from Bernal Heights, and one from the Sunset), and when they found out that I love me some ice cream, they took me to Mitchell's.  They told me "OMG, you're gonna love this place."  I trust my friends.  A lot.  You know what?  They were totally right!   Their Filipino/Asian-inspired flavors are the only ones that I've had before.  They've got a killer ube, a tasty macapuno, and ok, maiz con hielo ... we like our corn with ice, alright?  Lines can be hellish, so as the other 359 reviewers may have said a few times, get a quart to go, and scoop away from home.
author: Eugene F.

description: Mitchell's has a ton of varieties in flavors, and a lot of original ideas.  Ice cream sandwiches in any flavor, the maltiest milkshakes...  A good place for an after dinner snack.  Just be prepared to wait in line.  Well worth it though.
author: Jess R.

description:
Hands down one of the best ice cream shops in AMERICA.  Here are "must haves" even for the very picky... Macapuno, Mint Chip, Toasted Almond, Mango, Kahlua Mocha Cream, Cinnamon Snap (when available) and Chocolate Raspberry (in season).  In addition, to great ice cream I have always gotten great customer service for the past 25 years.  Their quality has always been consistent and i cant wait to have kids so I can take them here for their first scoop.  Seriously, this is one of the best ice creams in America, I have gone to cities all around the country just to compare to Mitchells (only one comes damn close... Mariannes in Santa Cruz).  

And just to show that I am a honest reviewer... Here are flavors that I feel that Mitchells needs to improve upon... 
- Chocolate Chip (always amazes me how this is the only flavor I dislike since their Mint Chip is one of the best in the country and their vanilla ice creams are off the hook.  Its a head scratcher.)
- Peach(in season)  Hit or miss sometimes... Im going to chalk this one up to how good the peaches are in a particular season
- Pumpkin(in season) I always look forward to it...and I am always disappointed - too much pumpkin spice or something - kinda tastes like a safeway pumpkin pie
- Tropical 4 (Just looking at the ingredient list makes my mouth water but every time it just ends up tasting only like Mango (which mind you is a great) but not when your expecting 3 other flavors with it - I never taste the banana or the pineapple 

I hope this helps someone make a very wise decision.  

And remember, always tip the staff. They work really hard and deal with kids all day long!

FYI - Please dont use credit cards - It holds up the line...pay with cash.

Love,

This review was made by an actual San Francisco local.  Only true San Franciscans have lead poisoning from playing on the rusty airplane on 19th avenue, used a piece of cardboard to go down the concrete slide at Children's Playground, freezed their A$$ off at Crissy Field on July 4th, used to play video games at the Cliff House, wish terrorists would destroy the Rincon Tower(while no one is inside), saw a Giants game at Candlestick, and remember exactly what you were doing on October 17th, 1989 at 5:04 pm.
author: C D.

description: If you've lived in San Francisco, then you know Mitchell's is the place to be when you want yummy ice cream in exotic flavors, in addition to the regular flavors such as coffee and vanilla. If you're filipino, then you know all about the ube and mango =) And what about their green tea ice cream!  Parking is often tough, and if you opt to make a stop in the evening it may get a little crowded. But you'll definitely feel like a kid again when you make a stop at Mitchell's!
author: Ju S.

description: So many words can describe Mitchell's Ice Cream. Some can say it's been around for 50 years. Some say it's great favored ice cream. Even some can "if you live in SF and you crave ice cream then Mitchell's is the place go." Haha. I made that last one up. But's all the above. I mean there are folks who have been coming here for years. For me, about 12 years since attending SFSU. I remembered my time arriving there, I saw they have Halo Halo, a Pilipino dessert which is comprised of crushed ice, condensed milk, rice crispy, and Ube ice cream. I was impressed they had my ethnic background dessert here. From there, I had sampled different flavors for the next 12 years. Some of my favorite flavors is the Macapuno flavor and the grasshopper ice cream which is mint ice cream w/ fudge and oreo's. I cannot begin to tell folks about this place even when I talk to tourists. For me personally, it doesn't matter what season of the year I want some Mitchell's. If I have the craving, I'm already here.
author: Matt B.

description: BEST ice cream place ever!! I've been buying Mitchell's ice cream from specialty grocery stores since I've been a kid. Exotic flavors like mango, coconut, taro, and etc... Last night, I finally decided to stop by the actual shop after dinner for dessert! Boy was I in heaven!!!!!!!! I never knew about all the other flavors that they had that wasn't sold in stores!!! There were tropical fruit flavors from the Phillipines that I've never heard of!!! They also had seasonal and other unique flavors. My bf and I got the cinnamon snap and thin mint! Cinnamon snap was AMAZING!!! Cinnamon ice cream with bits of crushed ginger snap cookies... There were SO many flavors.. I have to go back and try all of them... this place is dangerous!!! We went at 930 and the line was out the door! Quality homemade ice cream... move over Haagan Daaz and Ben and Jerry's!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Denise L.

description: Whatever your flavor, it will ROCK!  The best ice cream around!
author: Julia W.

description: YUM!  Being filipina, this is my destination for "tropical" flavors, but I always get the grasshopper when I go here...I love that it's open late year-round!
author: Vera D.

description: I'm fortunate enough to live within a few blocks of this place that so many people love, but unfortunately, don't love it as much as they do. I'd rather buy a 1/2 gallon of lucerne peppermint icecream from Safeway than spend the same amount on 2 scoops of icecream. That said, I DO have a soft spot for the green tea icecream. But if you like strawberry - warning - don't get it there - it's the fake kind!
author: beth l.

description: Excellent ice cream. Very rich - maybe a bit too rich, but that's an individual decision. I was impressed by the selection, and by how quickly the long line moved. The perfect place to go when you need to pig out (although you might not want to walk there at night).
author: Dana L.

description:
now this is an orginal San Franciso treat.  each and every ice cream they feature is amazing-- i am stuck and can't get to their exotic fruit selection.  the exotics are so exotic i have not heard of them.  i will break out of my mold and report back-- give this a try!  you will love it!

Buen Provecho!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: The only reason why I didn't give this place 5 stars is because my husband ordered strawberry (after i TOLD him not to!) and it wasn't that great.  I on the other hand, took a ride on the wild side and ordered purple yam (ube) and was in heaven the next 10 minutes.  The only downside to Mitchell's is it's location (it's not really in a central, easily accessible location) and the line.  You'll have to get a ticket number and wait for your number to be called.  But I still can't get over how good that purple yam ice cream was....
author: Marina T.

description: My Mom, told me that she used to go there when she was a teenager and it was a really good ice cream place. So I headed to see what this ice cream place my Mom was speaking of and damn it was good. The Ice cream were creamy as F---. Good stuff I tell you, Just sucks that theline can get pretty long and that parking was biatch but theres always safeway and you can park at safeway and then walk.
author: Justin G.

description: Winner of many ice cream contests at the California State Fair, this place is an icon. It has been in the same building since the 50's and to their credit, they have kept the character intact. They have the best, creamiest ice cream I have ever eaten. It is open till 11pm in the summer and there are long lines. Some unusual flavors include avocado, 3 kinds of coconut, mango rinds of tropical fruits, and of course the standards such as coffee and rum raisin are out of the stratosphere. During the holidays they make excellent pumpkin ice cream. Don't try and diet here. You won't be sorry, ever.
author: Barbara S.

description:
a san francisco institution.  

i am known for not "knowing how" to eat ice cream.  i always lick and end up looking like a 5 year old boy with stuff dripping everywhere.  i suppose this adds to my boyish charm... 

... especially when i'm having the purple yam ice cream.  this stuff really hit the spot last week after i went for my run in 90 degree temps.  even if it's not the 5 days of heat we get in the city, it's a nice spot for a no pressure ice cream date complete with cone swapping.
author: Steven C.

description: I have not had Bi-Rite ice cream.  Until I do, and ONLY if it's better than Mitchell's, I will not rob Mitchell's of its FIVE well-deserved stars.  It gets crowded on hot days and in the summer.  There's an express line if you buy prepacked tubs.  There are flavors of fruit I've never heard of.  Sundaes, shakes, sorbets.  Take a number, shut the hell up, and WAIT for the best ice cream in SF (except possibly Bi-Rite).
author: Eric S.

description: Not completely crazy about ice cream these days but this is one of those small old ice cream store that you must go. Great variety of selection on flavors. I tired out their Kahlúa Mocha Cream and the flavor was wonderful. It wasnt too sweet, smooth texture unlike Polly Ann's, and the price was cheap for the size compare to Ben and Jerry's. The only catch about this place was you'll need to grab a ticket and wait in line. Oh yea, the place is pretty small so get ready to hang around outside of the store. Definitly a must go place if its your first time.
author: Derrick L.

description: Great ice cream.  Probably my second favorite place in the city.  They have a great selection of tropical flavors.  Parking is tough, but definitely worth it.
author: Christopher D.

description:
really?!!? is there anything better?!!? this place is classic!!!

yes, the line is always long, but hey they're open late and you can allllways find the after dinner crowd here.  there's so many flavors to choose from! luckily i was here with three other people so we all agreed to choose two different flavors each so we could all sample - that's how we roll.

i just remember having the grasshopper (mint+chocolate), oooommmg i wish i could have some now. the caramel praline is also really good.
the macapuno has chunks of coconut in it - i didn't think i was going to like it but it was soo yummy.

some of the best ice cream i've ever had.. seriously.
author: Kim-van T.

description: They make their own ice cream.  They always work in new flavors.  This place is an institution.  The only downside is the parking.  I am a big fan of the Toasted Almond Ice Cream in a Hot Fudge Sundae.
author: Moe J.

description: Great ice cream. Every flavor is perfect. The pumpkin ice cream is my favorite. I love this place.
author: Sachin A.

description:
Mitchell's lives up to all the hype.  Jackfruit was delicious and so was the Ube.

You'll probably have to wait awhile but the servers go as fast as they can.
author: Sarah B.

description: Best Ice Cream in San Francisco. i'm no food critic, however i know good food, desserts and ice cream. Mitchell's has awesome Ice Cream. I think that anyone can make exotic flavors tast good to everyone, because it's new and tastes different. The true test is to order classic flavors like vanilla, chocolate or mint chip... these guys make classic and exotic flavors taste great... and the service is the best.
author: Henry V.

description:
this place has a really homemade atmosphere; the night i went, it felt like it was the hottest spot for high school kids to be at. 

the ice cream is pretty good; i got the ube and my friend got the grasshopper combo or something. the ube was pretty delicious; i hadn't had anything like it before, and my friend's grasshopper mint chocolate chip whatever was pretty good too. i felt it was pretty comparable to other ice cream joints minus the fact that mitchell's was a little creamier. 

this place was maybe a notch above average to me, and what was worse was my friend and i waited 45 minutes to get some mediocre ice cream. if you want something REALLY tasty, i suggest you go to bi-rite in the mission.
author: stacy c.

description:
ice cream ( out of 3 stars) = 3 - excellent, peach was great, we got there when they opened and ice cream was frozen, but after it thawed out a little bit it was great

location/vibe = 1 (parking!!)

service = 0 - maybe too early in the morning! but would not stop me from returning

Would definitely return
author: Ben P.

description: I like the ice cream but I kind of feel like it is over hyped.
author: Tara T.

description: WOW!  Be polite, smile, tip, and they will not disappoint.  Friendly high school staff with amazing ice cream.  It will brighten anyone's day.
author: Koa K.

description: The other night, feeling a generosity of spirit, I walked four blocks and treated myself to some delicious sushi (to be reviewed at a later date when I've eaten there at least twice). After stuffing my face, I somehow spaced out on the walk home and realized that I had walked one block too far. Well, by that time, I got the idea into my head that I needed some dessert and, being only two blocks away from Mitchell's, I hauled my skinny-soon-to-be-fat ass over.   Read more on The Ballyhoo: http://www.ballyhoo.us/restaurants/review.cfm?review=90
author: Baochi N.

description:
now let's talk about some ice cream!!!!!!!!!!!  first off, huge round of applause to the man who helped out me and my friend.  neither one of us had experienced Mitchell's before and, upon request, we experienced more Mitchell's than we could have hoped for...it began with a simple, "is it possible to taste all of your crazy flavors?".  the answer was yes and followed by their top 5 most ordered!  and we're not talking a small little sample smidge either.  big hunks of yumminess!  thank you mitchell's.  my ass won't be the same now.  
TOP FLAVOR'S:  Avocado, Mango, and some Chocolate Toffee extravaganza
author: Tracy E.

description: Mitchell's is an institution, and they have some wacky-cool flavors, but the sad fact is, their ice cream is junk food, yo. It's fulla junk! Chemicals, milk paste, whatever. My personal SF classic ice cream is Swiss Orange Chip at Swensens on Hyde Street. Or the new-fangled Ciao Bella Blood Orange Sorbet - that's amazing stuff. Anyhow, I still go to Mitchells sometimes, but it usually leaves my tummy feeling a little funky.
author: Bowen D.

description: Every time we would come to SF for vacation as a child, it was guaranteed that we would stop by Mitchell's to pick up some Filipino flavors like: macapuno, ube or mango.  They are so yummy!  Good times!
author: Marie E.

description: Mmm... the ice cream here is so smoooth.  Ever since I converted to gelato, Mitchell's made me want to convert back to ice cream again!  I loved the Avocado.  And I want to come back and try more flavors!  I think that if you smile enough at the workers (you go girl!), they'll let you sample alot of the flavors despite the long lines. :)  Yeah so in regards to those long lines, it will make you feel like you are at the DMV waiting for your # to be called! But it's totally worth it.
author: Joellene B.

description: I like this place for the different varieties of ice ceam it serves. Though there is a line they always get people in and out quickly. Mitchell's is definitely a tourist attraction but who wouldn't want to travel across the world to eat delicious ice cream. Two stars taken away for the asshole who wouldn't let us it when we got there two minutes after closing. He does not have a heart!
author: Han L.

description: Chocolate ice cream is my thing and this place has the best. I can't help but think that every bite or lick is worth 5000 calories! And, unfortunately it is only a couple of blocks away from us which makes it very difficult to avoid.
author: Reza E.

description: I crave Mitchell's ice cream even on a cold, rainy/foggy day.  My favorite flavors are the mango, peach (summer only), deep dish apple pie, ginger snap and the mexican chocolate.  It is worth standing in line no matter how cold and foggy it is outside.  There ice cream cakes are also really good and cheaper than other ice cream establishments.
author: Belle M.

description: Good ice cream but I can't believe the long lines even when it's freezing outside! Come for the tropical flavors but the 17% butterfat content makes any flavor taste even better :p I remember them having a cheese and corn flavor and also marble fudge but those aren't there anymore :(
author: Nina R.

description: Mmmm...a true SF classic! It's right up on the top of my list for favorite ice cream (next to Citizen Cake). Though cantaloupe is my favorite by far, the ube, avocado, and (oddly enough) pumpkin pie are also worth a try.
author: Jonathan M.

description: My most favorite ice cream shop in the Bay Area.  Fond memories of this place, for sure!  My summer time favorite is CANTALOUPE!  My regulars are peach, avocado, mango, lychee, or ube.  The thai tea is tasty too, but don't have the nerve to get a scoop of it for myself... I just get a taste or two from my boyfriend.
author: Theresa M.

description:
How good is Mitchell's ice cream? It is so good that I have waited 40 minutes on a COLD night to get my ice cream. That is how good it is. Mitchell's serves a number of flavors that you will not find elsewhere, and if you do find them somewhere else, chances are... it won't be as good. I have been a fan of the Macapuno, Rum Raisin (you get drunk off eating the rum soaked raisins... YUMMMY... forget jello shots... it is all about the raisin shot with this little number. And of course, you can get all sorts of ice cream creations like sundae's, banana splits, shakes, cakes, and even quarts to go. All this fanatical talk is coming from someone that actually doesn't even care much for ice cream.... no other ice cream had ever been worthy of my desire... So, if you have not made it out to Mitchell's yet (I actually know a SF native that has yet to do so... shame on him!) it is truly worth the wait. And if you are impatient or have to run... grab a tub of the pre packed ice cream... you won't be disappointed! Good things come to those who wait!!!  Well, that is what grandma used to say! ;-)

"oooohhh... they just called number 2!!!! I got number 99... yes, only 97to go!!!! "
author: Amelia M.

description: This is the best ice cream in the SF area. It's so good I will go here when it's 40 degrees out and pouring just to get some.
author: Deepak J.

description:
has always been around, at least, to me.

earliest memories of mitchell's: going in to buy gallons of mango ice cream, after picking up my mom's paycheck or getting her prescriptions filled at st. luke's.

flavors to try:
-mango, of course
-ube
-macapuno
-rum raisin (it's good, even though it's not tropical, which is what mitchell's is known for)

mitchell's blows magnolia or those other brands out of the water.  

the only thing i dislike is the parking situation.  once you find a spot, get your blinker on and fight to the death for it.  i've had to sometimes give up looking for parking on hot days, and leave very unhappy.  :(  meep
author: jen a.

description: Ube, avocado and mango ice cream!! Enough said --- you really don't know what you're missing!!
author: La C.

description: I've heard so much about this place and I am finally here.  And we parked right in front, babe~  The wait was pretty long, our number was 83 when they were calling 61.  All the flavors looked like it was worth a try, thank god my friend stopped me from ordering that huge sundae!  I finally settled with mango and ube (purple yam) in a waffle cone.  Hmm, yum, fresh and creamy home made ice cream!
author: Amanda L.

description: I've been coming here my whole life...we drove from Lafayette, Fremont, Oakland, anywhere to come here at all times of the night because, well, my immigrant parents were sold on the exotic flavors reminiscent of their childhood abroad.  So drivers, throw out a passenger to grab a number while you park. Parking is limited in the back.
author: S. P.

description: So we were supposed to go here after Tartine but due to line we decided to pass.  I was a little sad we didn't stop but it's okay.  There's always next time.  I'll have to dig deep into the recesses of my mind and pick the best visits.  To tell you the truth, I've never been disappointed.  I've had the Chocolate Caramel Crunch, Avocado, Ube (Taro), Halo Halo, Cantaloupe, Lychee... even the basics are good.  Plain ol chocolate and vanilla.   All were great, but the one flavor that stood out had to be the Mexican Chocolate.  Chocolate with a hint of cinamon.  This paired with a peanut butter based ice cream would be the perfect combination.   I can taste it now...  yummmmmmmm.....
author: Norm P.

description: Always a long wait when it's hot. But it's worth it. White Pistachio is my favorite. Prices are reasonable and the service is good. There is an express line for those who want to buy the half gallons to take home.
author: Gail K.

description: OMG! I love this ice cream soo much! Very smooth and great tasting ice cream. I take all my out of town friends and family members here and they all love it! I am a sucker for their Grasshopper flavor but love their pumpkin and egg nog flavors as well. AND they use biodegradable cups! I don't understand why anyone wouldn't like Mitchell's Ice Cream.
author: David George J.

description: I just tried the Mocha Fudge...Mitchell's, you never fail.  I heart you!
author: Anne A.

description: I'm completely nostalgic about this place.  My parents used to take me here as a child... No matter what happens, a scoop of Mitchell's ice cream will always make it better no matter how old you are.  :)
author: J T.

description: Oh Mitchell's... I want to love you. Your ice cream is delicious, hands-down. So much so that I don't mind waiting in line. It's actually kind of nice waiting in anticipation of the smooth and creamy delights. But I must deduct points for the ingredients list on your ice cream. They're really no better than Safeway brand, though as you note, there is a much higher percentage of butterfat. And all these ingredients do make a tasty treat with great mouthfeel -- which is probably why ice cream science created them. And I'm not a health nut, but I feel better going to the Haagen Dazs store and getting one of their 5 ingredient flavors.
author: Kely G.

description: Best ice cream parlor ever! Been going here since the 80's, tons of flavors to choose from. Lines maybe long especially on the weekends but it's all worth it!
author: M D R 1.

description: Macapuna ice cream and ube ice cream.... done deal! do i really have to write a review? i mean c'mon you should already know. if you havent been there this should be on top of your list. mitchells ice cream first before family.
author: Alex R.

description: Mitchell's is one of its kind....the mango is superb and their seasonal ice creams are wonderful too. If you get a chance to try the Boysenbery then you just got lucky (its seasonal).
author: Vik L.

description:
Ok, one start docked for the ridiculously long lines that await you if you happen to go on ANY day in SF that makes you think "hey, I'd love a cup of frozen goodness".  We generally walk down to Mitchells on the foggiest, coldest, most miserable days so we don't have wait for 85 to be called (when the number showing is 12) and STILL there is a line.

Must be good, right?  Indeedy.  Particular fan of the caramel prailine but really, you can't go wrong.
author: Kate W.

description: So I really love Mitchell's.... on a Tuesday....at 6pm. But you could not pay me to go on a sunny Saturday at noon. The ice cream is good, but not good enough to wait in line for an hour for one scoop. Especially when you could go over to subs, inc. on 24th and get a scoop with no waiting! Yeah, they don't have as many flavors, but its the same ice cream without the wait!
author: Tara T.

description: Everyone always talks about Mitchell's Ice Cream. I live 5 blocks away from Mitchells and pretty much only go when I have friends over who live far from Mitchells. It's a good ice cream place, and taking a number and waiting in line just makes the experience. Kind of amazing how you still have to take a number when it's raining outside. My favorite flavors are Kalhua Mocha Cream, and for the holiday season, Cinnamon Snap.
author: Stefanie Y.

description: Man, I can't believe it's taking me this long to write a review for this place! My family has been going here for years!!!!! And even though my hubby and I moved out of the area, we always ask a family member to bring some down for us! I think we have tried every flavor they make. Our favorites are Ube, Mango, and Macapuno!  Soo good and creamy! They don't have a powdery after taste like some other grocery stores brands do. Lines can be long. Parking can be tough at times. My suggestion is, get a half gallon and pay at the express window and take that baby home and eat it! :)
author: Amy M.

description: great selection of flavors, affordable price, good service, what more could you ask for from a neighborhood ice cream parlour?
author: Sofia T.

description: This is the real deal.  Mexican Chocolate is fantastic - hint of cinnamon.  This is what all ice cream should taste like.
author: Max C.

description: Best ice cream. It's like heaven melting in your mouth. Favorites are Chicago Cheesecake, Ube-Macapuno, Chocolate Caramel Crackle.. Actually, I've tried so many flavors there and haven't been disappointed once. Yum! If you can't handle lines, take home a 1/2 gallon (express lane!) or stop by on a rainy day.
author: Zell C.

description: I came here after a long day of volunteering at the local school in their afterschool mentoring program. It was hot, and I needed something to cool me down. With a short walk down I think four blocks, I came upon this place, and walked in. It was so good! And because it was towards the end of the day, it was rather quiet, and the ice cream was the perfect sorta liquidy, but still solid consistency that I love. Or maybe it was because it was hot outside that it was like that. But any way, I still loved it.
author: Michael C.

description: Hunh...not sure why I wasn't as impressed with this place as the rest of the Yelpers. No doubt the ice cream was good, but not as thick and dense as The Olde San Francisco Creamery in Walnut Creek. Probably Mitchell's deserves four stars, but I am only gonna give it three since I was so dissapointed after reading all the other reviews. Again, not bad. For me, I've had better, though. Try it at least once, and judge for yourself. Let the hate mail flow.
author: Johnny O.

description: I know I'm one of the throng of worshipers (why do you think the line's so long?!) but this place used to be a special treat every once in a while on the drive home from school. My faves for years were the mango and rum raisin. But I've also had the pumpkin during halloween and the thai tea (I still have dreams about it). Get any and all of them chocolate dipped. You will not be disappointed.
author: Rosana M.

description: Mmmm fantastic! Rich, smooth & creamy. Such a fun place to take a date on a walk or bike ride on a nice day and then end up here. The seasonal ice creams like pumpkin and egg nod are ta die-for!
author: JJ C.

description: Not much to add here except for this place is really really yummy (yes I am an adult and I use the word yummy) and thus the lines are long.
author: Tom C.

description: Ever since i was a kid, my family would go here to get ice cream! it rocks!!! I love the cookies and cream here. Very creamy. One taste of the ice cream here, and I bet you'll be back!! The lines are crazy on warm days, but it's totally worth it in the end..i swear!
author: Bernadette B.

description: (5.5 stars) I love this place.  The macapuno ice cream is great, as is the mango and ube.  If you like strawberry and chocolate, it is great too.  I have not met an ice cream from Mitchell's I have not liked.
author: Kapeli M.

description:
i like mitchells. i don't like most icecream - too rich, or bland flavor, but mitchell's is really yummy.  a sundae is HUGE (enough for 2!) and the flavors of the month are usually scrumptious.  
taste flavors ur unsure of...
yay for homemade ice cream, reasonably priced... AND OPEN LATE!
author: Erika Y.

description: Mitchell's Ice Cream... The ONLY place to get ice cream if you want the very best. It only takes second place to the ice cream parlor of my childhood, Kirby's Ice Cream, which unfortunately no longer exists. I miss Kirby's *so* much but, Mitchell's has first place honors at present.
author: Now V.

description: San Francisco ice cream institution. I've never waited too  long in line here. Worth the wait.
author: Chris S.

description:
ridiculously busy
ridiculous lines
i never been to an ice cream parlor where i need to take a number.
who they think they are? the famous Mitchell's ice cream ? * grumble grumble..
once the person behind the counter called us, i jumped and got all excited thinking about my avocado shake.
this place deserve 5 starts !! *grumble grumble
author: sherly A.

description: Huge line even on a cold night in December... in my book, that's a sign of a great ice cream place! I finally got a chance to taste their ice cream, and it was heavenly! Really worth the long wait! I had the Mexican Chocolate (delish!), and tried the Ube, Mango and Avocado. Definitely will be back for more!
author: Joy C.

description:
what can i say about mitchell's ice cream? it's the greatest invention ever!! as a little girl, i remember going with my parents for this delicious treat.  nothing beats the mango ice cream. like they say, often imitated but never duplicated.   

as a native san franciscan..ice cream always taste better on a foggy san francisco summer day!!
author: rosemarie l.

description:
Legendary. 

Been in this City for 7 years, but having Mitchell's Love makes me feel like a true blue local.

I have too much of a sweet tooth to regularly sample the tropical flavors, but the ube is wonderful. As a Filipino, it always amuses me to overhear others say, "I wonder what the purple yam is like", or some variant of that comment. Well, the purple yam is yummy. So is the halo-halo: it tastes like the real thing, probably even better. But like I said, I obey my sweet tooth like a Georgie straddling a Dicky. Get the grasshopper. Rich and creamy, this will gleefully ruin any diet. One disappointment was the peanut butter ice cream, which didn't taste very peanut buttery. But I won't be docking any stars. How can I? Not even for the wait.


07/08/07 UPDATE:
I completely musjudged the peanut butter indulgence. I must have ordered something different that day or maybe I just got an aberrant scoop, but since that time, I've repeatedly enjoyed the PB indulgence and lemme tell you: that flavor is heaven in an ice cream store. The perfect fix for peanut butter junkies.
author: Joseph R.

description: Besides the decadent scoops of Grasshopper that is so much more than just mint chocolate chip ice cream, I love watching the people lounging outside, waiting impatiently with their number (at least 30 digits away from what's being called) crumpled in sweaty palms, anxious and salivating like a child.
author: Candice B.

description:
i know there's been a ton of reviews already for this place but i can't help it, it's a favorite stop of mine when i'm in town. of course, it's directly across the street from a friend's house so i know they like it when i come over because it gives them the excuse to go, too. i think it's a lot more the Mission than it is Noe Valley. 

this place is crazy - it doesn't matter how cold it is or if it's raining and miserable - there is ALWAYS a line to get in this place! it's pretty well worth it though, they got some really great flavors! mexican chocolate is my friend's favorite and i like trying the exotic flavors but getting a good old malt is my favorite. my friend always takes his ticket, takes a walk around the block with his 3 year old or does some other quick errand at Safeway across the street and then comes back at about the time his number gets called.
author: tafkam c.

description: Forget Double Rainbow, Mitchell's is THE San Francisco ice cream. Because of the long list of flavors, you'll be back many, many times. Good luck with parking though. Bonus points for the several Filipino ice cream flavors; try "buko" which is coconut when it was younger and softer. Hmmm, that sounded weird.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I used to think that I had eaten the best ice cream in the city, but I was wrong. I don't know how i lived in this city for 18 years and never heard of it until last month, but this place has the best ice cream. Many imaginative flavors, but they also do the classics extremely well. The one issue I have with them is I think that people cut the line, but  I could be wrong about this and I won't mark them down on account of it.
author: Erik S.

description: Best ice cream in San Francisco.  In the summer, I like the homemade peach - light, creamy, refreshing.  Most of the time, I stay with the coconut-pineapple - surprisingly light as well, yet rich.  Macapuno is a popular choice with some friends, but definitely try one of the exotic, freshly made flavors.  Beware of the closing doors!  The closing time is pretty firm, and I've seen many a person get turned away one minute past closing so be sure to sneak through those doors and grab a number in time!
author: Melinda C.

description:
hands down, one of the best ice cream shops in SF.  to tell you the truth, i've only been here at night for dessert, so i don't know what the wait's like during the day, but i could only imagine.  definitely worth checking out if you've never been.

WORD OF ADVICE: tell arman, mike d. says wassup!!
author: Mike D.

description: It was probably not the best idea to get ice cream on a rainy night, but dessert was necessary after dinner! After trying a handful of flavors, I settled (quite happily) with banana nut on sugar cone and my date got the peppermint pie on waffle cone. The total was only $4.70! Take that Coldstone!!!
author: Sheena C.

description: This place is ridiculous. Not only will it take you back to the old-fashioned ice cream parlors of yesteryear but they have the best ice cream in the Bay Area hands down, no arguments. The wait is crazy and the parking is "creative" at best in the back lot. However the wait is well worth it. In order to take care of the waiting problem I choose to be proactive now. I usually grab three numbers from the ticket machine and after about ten minutes of waiting I hand two of them to people just coming in. It usually makes their day. Try my signature treat; two cookies with vanilla ice cream between them (sandwich style) half dipped in chocolate!
author: Ryan M.

description: i didn't think i would stumble away from salsa dancing at the Rio to an ice cream stand deep in the mission but when i found myself standing in line after dancing up a real appetite i just went with it.  I ordered the Mexican chocolate which i still regret to this day since I wanted the strawberry and being that i told the ice cream attendee that strawberry was my achilles heel i really wish they encouraged me to trust my instinct and go with what i know and love. Not impressed with the staff but the spicy cream soothed my wounded soul.
author: Kyle B.

description: I know you all love this place so much, and I really, really want to.  I just find the ice cream to be a bit ordinary, or maybe it's just not my style.  However, I'm dying to try the fresh peach when it's in season.  The lines can be horrible here on a nice day, but the staff is excellent, and after a long wait, let's you taste as many flavors as you like!
author: Jenn K.

description: Huge props for Mitchells and their avocado ice cream. It is the best, oddest, green thing you'll eat all year. When you can't  eat due to dental work and a friend brings you Mitchell's, you'll know you are loved.
author: Danielle D.

description: I have been wanting to try this place for years and we finally got the chance.  Now, with the crowds and the long long long wait it's hard not to expect too much from this place.  We both got double cones plus two pints to take home so we tried six flavors.  (If I am going to wait for 30 minutes I am going to get extras!)  It really is creamy goodness and all the flavors were great.  One needs to try this place at least once as it is a San Francisco tradition.
author: Sean O.

description: Absolutely the best ice ream I've ever had. I take all my visitors here.
author: Kay By The Bay -.

description: Excellent, rich Ice cream from this local joint.  I had tasted some of their take-away selections in the past, but just recently went in for a milkshake.  I ordered the Coffee flavor. Tasty stuff, with good respect to a smooth/dark flavor.  My girlfriend ordered a two-scoop of the Chocolate Caramel Crunch, which she was happy with.  My only complaints are that the items are really pricey for Ice Cream, and we had to wait a fairly long time via the deli-style ticketing system.  I've had better, in an overall sense didn't really live up to the hype.  I'd go in if I was in the neighborhood, but won't make a special trip for the wares.
author: TJ D.

description: Mitchell's has the BEST ice cream EVER....hands down!!! As a child my parents would always bring home the tropical flavors...ube (my favorite!), mango, halo-halo, langka, etc. I just started coming back to this place with the hubby and there is still always a bit of a line. Right now we're both stuck on the Chocolate Caramel Crackle.....sooooooo yummy! Their Rum Raisin is off the hook too...if you're into that flavor.
author: BrElla4eva H.

description: Went here at 10:30 on a Sunday night, it was freezing and the line was out the door! Take a number ladies and gents. Their ice cream is so delicious! You can only use a credit/debit card if your purchase is over 9 bucks. Half gallons are 9.50 and you might as well get one! A special bonus for the city is that there is parking in the back! Cheers people.
author: M M.

description: I'm becoming quite the ice cream snob and I have to say, this place sure enables my vice.  With soooooo many tropical flavors to choose from, you can be quite stumped, at first.  That's ok, get your number and wait in line first so you can take your time to ponder.  Serious, they make you take a number.  This place is very busy at any given time of the day so be ready to wait.  Know that it is very worth it.  Rich and creamy, my fave is for sure the Boku (baby coconut).  Mmmmm-mmmmm, good!
author: Lily S.

description: MMMM.... Black Cherry Ice Cream... thats all I need to say!!!!
author: Angela B.

description: This place is known for using asian fruits in their ice creams because of the diversity of San Francisco. The Mitchell's family came up w/the idea of bringing those flavors here to San Francisco since the asian community missed the flavors of their homeland. Now they're a popular ice cream destination you HAVE to visit. They have the BEST mango ice cream I've ever had! I definitely recommend it to anyone who's never tried it before. I've also had their white pistachio and avocado ice creams too. They're both really good. I'd like to try some more flavors the next time I stop by.
author: Jan And Daph S.

description:
I'm a fan for sure! my very first time there.. I've never seen an ice cream place that you need a number to get your ice cream! so, you know it's gotta be good..I had the white pistachio..boy, it's must try! actual pistachio nuts in it! 

gotta warn you..parking is hard, although they do have a parking lot..very tiny..
author: Linda Y.

description: Mitchell's is the old school Mission love.  That's why my love for their Mexican Chocolate cannot be displaced by my affections for yuppie upstarts like Bi-Rite Salted Caramel.  Unlike pinche yuppies, Mitchell's is not trying to put chiles in the chocolate to make it "Aztec." Look, I can appreciate a sophisticated flavor profile, but sometimes I want my Mexican chocolate the way it is in Mexico, you know, con canela.  It don't matter if I had a bad minute, hour, day, week, or year, Mexican Chocolate always makes it right.  If I have a scoop of Mexican chocolate, maybe doubled up with some Macapuno on a sugar cone, at that moment it doesn't matter that I got gentrified right outta my own hood.  Shoot, I'm ready to travel across town on a cold night just for some right now!
author: Shona M.

description: It's pretty good old school ice cream even for someone that doesn't like sweets too much.  Excellent flavor choices and friendly services.
author: Ed Q.

description: I've only had ice cream at places such as Cold Stone &  Baskin Robbins. After visiting Mitchell's, i'll prob never go back to those ice cream places. I had the Mocha Kalua Cream & Vanilla Custard. The first the you notice when you first take a bite was the texture. It was so creamy/smooth. Almost taffy-like stretchy (if you know what i'm talking about) Unlike other ice cream places which metls and gets watery, Mitchell's ice cream stays in its solid-state yet creamy for quite a while. The french custard vanilla was awesome! not too sweet, with a hint of custard taste. The mocha kalua was pretty good also. Will definetly come back for other flavors.
author: brad w.

description: The best traditional SF ice cream hands down.If you like chocolate, definitely try the Mexican chocolate. My Fav is the pineapple coconut. Lots of tropical flavors, there pistachio is full of nuts and yummy. Something for everyone here.
author: Kathy A.

description: Best homemade ice cream in San Francisco.  Been coming here for years
author: Lori K.

description: Awsome place to get Ice Cream in the City. Their variety of flavor and the quality of the Ice cream is a good enough reason to drive here even if your across the bay! Just like any good spots I've been it's worth waiting in line to try a classic Chocolate, vanilla or to try something new and good like the Ube or Halo-Halo flavored Ice cream!!
author: Noel M.

description:
please, people, just head on over across town to polly ann's, try their ice cream, and honestly ask yourself if mitchell's is really all that?

i too was a faithful mitchell's fan. i would blindly designate it as my default ice cream destination. one day, i stopped going. i decided to try it the other day, and man, it was not so good (i got grasshopper pie and thai tea)! i know everyone likes their ice cream differently. i like mine hard and ripply, with emphasis on flavor, not sweetness. mitchell's ice cream is way too soft and melts in mere seconds. though it's really dense, it feels like it has lots of air. and i always feel a bit awful after consuming mitchell's, whereas after polly ann's, i feel nice. 

the thai tea scoop was particularly sad. it tasted nothing like thai tea, and the color, quite honestly, is a nauseating circus peanut candy orange.
author: jennifer y.

description: Halo halo, next to avocado, next to macapuno, next to buko, next to guava, next to jackfruit?! Why are there so many people waiting for jackfruit at 9:30pm?!
author: Peter S.

description: Mmmmmm....this is some tasty ice cream.  I particularly enjoyed the grasshopper ice cream and the chocolate chip crunch.
author: Joanna S.

description: Call me a curmedgon, but I can't stand Mitchell's. It's not the flavors. Buko is delicious. I love that I can get Purple Yam. Great. But what's the point if the ice cream itself sucks? I'm just not a fan of their fluffy Philadelphia-style confection. Forget standing in line forever as you freeze on a street  in the Mission. Get thee to your corner store, and buy a pint of Hagen-Dazs or Ben and Jerry's, two far superior products.
author: Jon L.

description: Exotic flavors such as 'young coconut', taro, mango...etc...but of course it is all under cooler names that I can't recall right now. Don't forget the mango topping for only 25 cents more....it's not that sugary kind of syrup, but real mango in syrup! It's best to get a different flavor for each scoop, so you can try more. (yes, greedy me)
author: Lala L.

description: baby coconut, ginger snap...great unique flavors.  Best IC in SF!
author: Gucci M.

description: I must know crap about ice cream.   Dont get me wrong, it was delicious ice cream, but its in bfe
author: Porfirio R.

description:
four generations of my family LOVE this place.  filipino ice-cream flavors: ube! mango! macapuno!  they even offer halo-halo.  

but i stick to my old favorite: "kahlua mocha creme, dipped in chocolate on a plain cone." yum.
author: Aya I.

description: Amazing hole in the wall ice cream shop across the street from Safeway, tucked away in a fairly residential area.  Lots of interesting and unusual flavors-- avocado, thai tea (on the sweet side), lucuma, among others-- as well as more traditional/typical flavors.  $2.10 for a single scoop on your choice of plain or sugar cone.  You have to get a ticket and wait for your number to be called.  If you're (un)lucky, a hardcore Bible-waving Christian will appear from one of the nearby apartments and preach for a long ten minutes.
author: Lynn O.

description: The only place you will find such exotic flavors like Macapuno, Ube, Lychee, Halo Halo. I like the Mango, Mexican Chocolate and Coffee flavors, but get Ube for my friends who have more eclectic tastes. You will have to stand in line, even on a cold day, but it's worth it. It's the best ice cream in town.
author: Arlene C.

description: wooh! Despite of the long wait and line whenever I crave for 2 scoops of UBE ice cream [it's the purple ice cream by the way], I'll always give it 5 stars. Seriously, what ice cream place in the United States sells a delectable, purple-colored ice cream flavor? Only in Mitchell's. Gah, it's the Asian in me. Nevertheless, they have the usual ice cream flavors, a variety of them to choose from. It'll make you fickle-minded, I assure you.
author: Eunice B.

description:
I've lost track of the different flavors I've tried at Mitchell's.. I've tried the halo-halo.. I've had sundaes.. I've had scoops chocolate dipped on a waffle cone.  They all rock!  They don't need gimmicks, like mixing in stuff to their ice cream.  They just have awesome varieties that keeps their customers coming back time and time again.  

On a nice day in SF, there's always going to be a long wait at Mitchell's.. Just take a number, chill out, and wait to get your hands on some of the most delish ice cream SF has to offer.  Oh heck, can't wait?  Just get a half-gallon tub of your faves and get out faster.
author: A. H.

description: I went here today after all the great reviews and, while the ice cream was good, it didn't blow my mind like I was expecting.  I have to give them props for the chocolate ice cream because I'm not a huge chocolate fan, but I definitely enjoyed theirs.
author: Jenna M.

description: YUM! rich and creamy; totally reminds me of fossilmans in LA.  Mitch's texture is so similar to fossilmans- they use 16% butter fat in their ice creams.  i love old fashion ice cream parlors and i do know my shit about ice cream desserts.  i cant settle for air infused cheap ice cream/ gelato and this place is completely awesome!  big props for the exotic flavors, im excited that i can get rare flavors in SF.  I MISS ANGELATO and fossilmans in soCal.
author: Hana ..

description: I'm a little bored of Mitchell's Ice Cream, however, I can't resist the eggnog, so damn good! and the ice cream pies are simply the best.
author: Anabelle B.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Every time I make my visit back to the bay I ALWAYS come here. Fell in love with this place. Try the  Kahlua Mocha Cream
author: Oh So Fresh B.

description: Oh gosh!  Talk about orgasmic ice cream.  Try their Ube Ice Cream. Uhhh...it will hit the spot!
author: N A.

description:
so i've been going to this place ever since i moved to the bay area four years ago. the ice cream is always of the freshest quality. the only downside to this place is on a hot sunny day, san franciscans are thinking the same thing i'm thinking. ice cream. and what better place then mitchell's on san jose avenue. 

it's definitely worth the long wait. but they do have a large selection of pre-packed ice creams. my favorites or peanut butter indulgence and white pistachio..the tropical flavors like ube (taro) and  macapuno (coconut) are good too!
author: crystal e.

description: I have to say that this place is worth the wait.  Their ice cream is one of the best in the city.  What's also great is that they have seasonal flavors as well.  One year, my sister decided to get a whole box of lychee sorbet.  When I mean the whole box, I mean what the business uses in their freezers to keep the ice cream in.  They only had one left, and since lychee wasn't really in season, they didn't raise the price at all.  They just sold it to us...no questions asked.  Let's just say that that was one of the "coolest" gifts, you could get someone.
author: Philip L.

description: The wait for this place on any evening is out the door.  Part of the fun I think is the waiting.  You stand in line thinking about all the wonderful flavors you can choose from.  Then the closer you get to the counter the more urgency there is to narrow down your choices to one, no maybe two scoops on your crunchy waffle cone.  This is a treat so the price isn't the cheapest, but their creamy ice cream is definitely worth it.  AND if you can't make up your mind as to which flavor you should choose, just ask for a sample.  But don't ask for too many or you'll start getting nasty looks from the people waiting in line!
author: Jonathan T.

description: I've been visiting the Bay Area since I was in diapers as I have family there but my cousins never took me to Mitchell's, until June 12th.  How dare!  It took a good 29 years for me to taste what might be the best ice cream ever (been to Farrell's and Fentons--good but so different).  I had a scoop of macapuno in a sugar cone and it was the best--texture, flavor, and real coconut.  Scarfed that down and kept eyeing the menu.  MMM cantaloupe.  Sounded good and it was.  It's great they live nearby.
author: Lalaine V.

description: I've been going here since I was a kid and it's still a wonderful treat. I recommend all the tropical flavors (ube, macapuno, halo-halo, langka, and mango). It's utter delight!
author: Fil L.

description: We arrived at 9:30 last night and got the winning ticket: #34; they were on #13.  My pouting subsided as I realized... holy crap, there are tons of delicious choices.  Should I do tropical or rich & creamy? Sugar or waffle cone OR cup?  Ice cream sandwich or sundae?  As the counter guys slowly called the numbers, my mind raced between halo-halo, grasshopper, or mango ice cream.  My companions were equally perturbed through their poker faces of calm.  #34 came up.  I asked how the halo halo was.  I only got a mere..."it's good. I like it."  Good enough for me!  I got it on a regular cone.  Wow, it really did taste like halo halo with chunks of coconut, beans, palm seeds, and other colorful goodies.  My accomplices in indulgence had peach and french custard vanilla.  Like freezing bums, we ate our dessert in the back parking lot.  800+ reviews...you can't go wrong here.
author: Kristen N.

description: Get a number, take a walk, then come back in 15 minutes.   Unless its a hot day, then plan for 30-40 minutes.  Well worth the wait, by far the best Ice Cream in the Bay Area.
author: Jason M.

description: Not much more to say about this place. It's probably been around since before I was born.  This is a place I've been to a million times with great ice cream.  They have a huge variety of flavors, not so mainstream.  Mango, macapuno, ube etc.  Tried the choc caramel crackel and it was delicious.  One of my favorites is the banana, so yummy.  You can't go wrong here, good ice cream, a nice portion for the price.  Be sure to take a number as soon as you walk in and expect to wait a bit.  Parking is scarce so grab the first place you see near by.
author: La C.

description: Mitchell's is good ice cream, but it does not seem that spectacular that I need to wait in a 20 minute line.
author: Adrienne G.

description: I love this place!! My dad took me here when I was like 6-years-old and we have been going back ever since. The ice cream is really rich in flavor and they offer every type of ice cream you could think of. The one thing that I really like about it is that it is a very basic mom and pop shop and that has never changed even after all of these years. One thing is that the prices have continued to increase consistently but I guess that just comes with time. The parking can be hectic especially if you go on a Friday or Saturday night but other than that it is conveniently located right off 280.
author: Javier G.

description:
long line, people waiting outside, just to buy ice cream on a cold night! i was like "the ice cream must be that good"

2 scoops in a waffle cone after. "yup, worth the wait and calories"
author: kathy c.

description: How do you know an ice cream parlor is the best in the city?  When it's in the middle of winter, it's raining outside, it's 9pm on a week night AND there's still a line out the door.  From the early 60's when my dad brought me into Mitchell's for milkshake, to the 80's when I craved ice cream daily during my pregnancy, till today, the quality and flavor has maintained it high standard.  Favorites are New York Cherry and Thai Tea.
author: theresa k.

description: Mitchell's is the best ice cream in the City.  The lines can be long especially on a hot day so I always opt for the half gallon that comes out of the case and can be paid for at the express window.  It's the only way to go.  Banana ice cream is my all-time favorite!
author: John The Best M.

description: Legendary. The line is worth the wait. I am so glad it is near my house.
author: Nick S.

description: What happened to this place? anybody knows? I went there today to get an ice cream, but the place was closed. I hope they are remodeling... I really hope they didn't closed down forever! This place is the best in san francisco for ice cream, for real!!!
author: Sunny K.

description: the best icecream on the planet, my favorite: caramel-pralinee, if ever I commit suicide, I will do it by Mitchel-Caramel pralinee sugar overdose....
author: Jef C.

description: I didn't really think ice cream could be differentiated from one another. You see, I've always been the store bought Haagen Dazs type of girl. I have always been satisfied with all their different flavors and having the convenience of popping into the local Lucky's and grabbing me a personal pint. But I must say, the day I waited a good fifteen minutes to try Mitchell's Mexican Chocolate ice cream was the day I realized patience triumphs all. Mitchell's ice cream is definitely worth the wait, even on a cold rainy day. There's just something so satisfying and amazing about their soft, smooth, sweet ice creamy goodness. I say for those that are curious what heaven tastes like, try the Mexican Chocolate. While your at it, gives those skinny thighs a break and get more than a single scoop. Get a double, maybe a triple, heck why not do the whole shabang and get a Sundae? I'm sure it'll all be worth it.
author: Ally C.

description: The line here is really long when the temperatures are over 80 degrees.  Great place to grab a scoop of ice cream, as every flavor tastes awesome.
author: James C.

description: I have been going to this place since I was a kid. My mom said I was made of this stuff when I was in her Belly. Try the Rum Rasin..or anything. It is an SF Landmark.
author: Pink G.

description:
in case the economy continues to crash and 957 reviews is not enough to keep this place in business, i will write another, because mitchell's is my favorite ice cream in the city. 

since the unveiling of the edible ice cream cone at the 1904 world's fair in st. louis, there has been an evolution of what constitutes good ice cream.  is it the topping?  is it because they make it fat free?  at mitchell's, it is all about flavor..... avocado, pineapple, mint chip, coffee....there is no end to how many flavors can be incorporated into sugar and cream.  in alaska, they even have fish ice cream.  

wear that wait in line like a badge of honor.   your reward is an old time favorite, made just the way you like it.
author: regina k.

description: While I am still a Swensen's man first and foremost, my second trip to Mitchell's is pushing my rating up to five stars. The grasshopper pie was delicious, and I am going to have a hard time trying any new flavors on subsequent trips. Also, our scooper dude was pretty funny, egging my friend on to get her own rather than sharing with me. She was quite enamored by this place and seems to want to come back over and over until she has tried every flavor.
author: Stu M.

description: Had to go there because of all the hype; disappointed.  Waited a long time to get my order.  The single scoop was smaller than expected and the ice cream was way too soft.  SWENSONS is better by far.
author: tony w.

description: I don't even like ice cream, but as a rule of thumb I have to try anything with a line as there must be some reason people are willing to wait.    Well there is definitely a reason to wait for a scoop of this stuff.  Mitchell's quality is high enough to run Ben and Jerry out of town in a VW bus if they were inclined to expand.
author: matthew w.

description: Mitchell's is super suave but what's with the glass window barrier.
author: Jon P.

description: The only place where you can get cantaloupe ice cream!  Mmmm.... cantaloupe!
author: David S.

description: The lines are usually too long, so we get ourselves a half gallon and a box of cones and head home.  If you do it this way, there is a special line for you, and you will be in your ice cream bliss long before all those people waiting for their number to be called.
author: Pele N.

description: Good ice cream.  My favorite flavors are the mango and the coffee.  I hate the wait though but at least they are open late.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Sorry, Ben and Jerry, it's not you, it's me. I've found true love at Mitchell's. I love the pumpkin. I love the dulce de leche. I love the Mexican chocolate and the rum raisin and the mango sorbet. But most of all I love, love, love the buko. Sweet creamy meaty coconutty goodness on a sugar cone. So you have to take a number -- so what? It's worth the wait.
author: Fawn F.

description: There's the special time of year when the weather gets a little colder and the days get a little shorter. That time is Pumpkin Ice Cream time. Mitchell's Pumpkin Ice Cream is the best thing ever made from cream and pumpkins. Last year they even put an ad in the Bay Guardian announcing the return of Pumpkin Ice Cream. I shrieked and promptly went to Mitchell's to get my seasonal fix.
author: Jackie I.

description: Best Mango ice cream anywhere.   I remember going here as a little kid.  Yummy
author: Mabelle A.

description:
What's with the wait? Seriously. Singles (huge) are like 2 bucks

Ok
- banana nut
- oreo

To try
- halo halo 
- strawberries & cream
- peach
- pumpkin

I'm partial to Bi-Rite
author: xo x.

description: There is probably only one long line in the city that I do not have a problem waiting in, and this is it!!!  Mitchell's MEXICAN CHOCOLATE is too die for!!!  You can make an ice cream sandwhich with any flavor too.  Yummy :) After you are done eating this heavenly ice cream, you will be soo happy and content that people will seriously think that you are high.  This stuff will put you into a trance and momentarily make you think that this world we live in is not such a bad place after all.  Enough said?
author: Micaela M.

description: Mitchell's is the best for classic ice cream flavors.  Plus, they have grrrreat Filipino flavors.  The best Ube ice cream I've ever had.  Definitely blows Magnolia ice cream away.  My favorite is still the Grasshopper pie.  Also worth the wait.
author: a g.

description:
the line was super long at 1030pm on a saturday night. it was my first time last weekend (introduced to me by a friend) and wasnt so sure of the idea of eating ICE CREAM in REALLY COLD weather... but there were 6 of us and i got outvoted. mmmm, truly IS the best icecream ever made. and i forgot ALL about the weather. i was told that i HAD to get the mango.... so i did (stupid peer pressure!!) and i was SO glad that i did.  ive never been a HUGE fan of ice cream (much less mango ice cream) but mitchell's mango ice cream is SO good. you MUST try it. they have GREAT amounts of flavors for you to choose from. 

the only problem i had was with one of the female workers who was there. she rolled her eyes and gave us attitude because we stepped over the "red tape" (you'll have to go there to know what im talking about)... but i guess i'd be mad too if i had to scoop icecream all night long on a saturday :)
author: PauLine R.

description: After years of watching long lines at any time of day (I think I've come home from a bar at close to midnight with a long line out there), and any weather, I finally decided I would waste a few minutes waiting for ice cream. I have a heard time ever believing that many things are worth waiting for. I like their queueing system. Well, I guess it is just grabbing a number. Very organized. It lowered the stress of having to wait in an unorganized line with other humans. Sometimes they become to chaotic. I like the stations for ordering food. Very throwback to a time that I do not remember I think. The pumpkin ice cream was very good.
author: doug d.

description:
hella good ice cream, even tho its almost always way too crowded.  i like this place because they make a point to hire people of color to work there.  also, they have pilipino ice cream!

gotta love mitchells.  its a cool place to bring people visiting sf or that hot date you wanna impress.   get that grasshopper pie flavor...its like everything i love combined.

oh and don't get played--grab that number from the number dispenser as soon as you get there.  lots of folks think that youre just supposed to wait in line, but REALLY they call you by the number you have.  kinda like at a deli counter or something.  so then people wait for a while and then realize that while they were waiting a whole bunch of people that came after them grabbed numbers and now get served before them.
author: Lorie D.

description: My childhood ice cream shop. Great ice cream and vast amount of different flavors. I would have given this place 5 stars but gave it 4 because the parking can suck really bad and can be really crowded; even on cold days!
author: Conrad C.

description: Hands down the best ice cream and I love ice cream. Try the Mango.
author: Lam N.

description: Only reason I give a 4 is because they don't serve single green tea ice cream. Otherwise, my love is in the Ube flavor!!! Yum!
author: Kerry W.

description:
