my sister and i were craving some ice cream the other day, so what better place to go than Mitchell's? i've never been there before, but i've heard so many great things about the place, so i finally decided to check it out.  it wasn't that busy when we got there so i was able to park right in front of the store. scooooore! we were actually standing there for about 5 minutes looking at the menu until we realized that we had to take a number. rookie mistake. we finally decided on a single scoop ube, chocolate dipped, in a sugar cone. that shit was bomb. i ate mine hella fast cuz the ice cream started dripping down onto my hand. i love that shit. 

when i first moved to daly city over a year ago, i saw a job ad on craigslist for an ice cream maker at Mitchell's. but by the time i called, i was told the job had been filled.. fail.  damn, that would have been the dream job right there. makin the best ice cream all day every day. 

to anybody that comes to visit the bay, you must go to Mitchell's!
author: JD D.

description: THE best ice cream in the city. You'll only wish you could try everything. I had the mango, which is ultra delish. All I can say is stop reading Yelp reviews and just go already. You'll be running back again and again.
author: Jessica S.

description: Mitchell's. Everybody talks about this place. Reason being is because it is WELL DESERVED to be TALKED about. This place has barely any parking because it is ALWAYS packed with a line outside, summer is just ridiculous. Their ice cream is so rich and creamy, I can have endless amounts of it. I just love their Mango ice cream. It's awesome! Why are you reading this review, instead of wasting time here, go to Mitchell's, NOW!
author: Sean E.

description: Not sure what amazing ice is supposed to taste like, but I really enjoyed the coffee flavor. I ended up buying a bucket of the grashopper mud pie and didn't like it so much. I would ask for samples before buying anything at this place. It definitely hits the spot if you are looking to cool down and take a stroll down to Delores Park!
author: Dave Y.

description: Best Ice Cream in Town. I'm a native San Franciscan I've been going to Mitchell's since I was a kid. Try Strawberry & Cream. Yummmmm!
author: Claudia B.

description: What can I say that others haven't said already? This place has a line even when it's dark and cold and rainy and I can't imagine wanting ice cream. The green tea ice cream is to die for, and if they ever make Thai tea ice cream again, be sure to try it. Wonderful sweet, smoky flavor.
author: Nicolette T.

description:
Cold and Sunny, it's still time for Mitchell's
 Forget picking the ideal warm sunny day perfect for munching on ice cream.  When you are accustomed to highs in the 40s, such a day in San Francisco is a mere rarity.  Yet there is a place where people flock to devour their favorite sub-zero treat.  You'll find this oasis of flavor on 29th and San Jose at a place called Mitchell's.

  Serving locals and customers from around the Bay Area since 1953, Mitchell's has won the hearts of ice cream connoisseurs young and old along with recognition from a number of publications.  Mitchell's tantalizing flavors have been featured in Travel Magazine, The Food Network, San Francisco Weekly and the San Francisco Bay Guardian. 
  
"It's the best.  People from all over come here for it's old neighborhood feel.  There's lots of places in the city and lot's of change, and this is one of the few icons left in the city," said Cristian Flores, at Mitchell's for an after-work snack. "Plus the parking is a plus, plus!"
 Whether its during its peak hours of the day, in the late afternoon when school gets out, or on a Saturday night as families go out for a late night treat, or a pit stop for a couple after a date, Mitchell's packs the people in as well as the ice cream. 
  
"I've been coming here for over 20 years and I've been bringing him here since he was 3," said city resident Wendy Storch as she huddled out on the front bench with her son Nigel, 9.
  
"We come here when it's hot or cold," said Nigel when asked if he and his mom had a tradition when coming to Mitchell's.
  
Not only through its consistency with its service, hours, and a pleasant experience, Mitchell's has maintained its success in becoming as dynamic as the neighborhood it is located in. It features traditional flavors such as vanilla and chocolate, but its array of exotic flavors such as buko, ube, mango, and avocado have kept the loyal and faithful of all backgrounds coming back for more.
 
 "We've served special flavors since the sixties," explains current manager Linda Mitchell, daughter of founder and owner Larry Mitchell. "A Filipino fruit importer sampled our ice cream and talked with my dad about using imported mango to create a new flavor.  He took a chance, and with a changing neighborhood, we found ourselves with a positive turnout."
author: Andrés R.

description: avocado ice cream... mmmm. really really refreshing especially after  a big dinner. fantastic little place although it does get quite crowded. don't forget to grab a number and know what you want by the time you get up there!
author: laura f.

description: Jumping on the bandwagon but I've been madly in love w/ this place for over 10 years. Great interesting seasonal flavors in a joint w/ real staying power. Avocado, Apple Pie, Baby Coconut and ... Purple Thing. When I worked closeby, I used to take my after work tips here and go "Yay!"
author: T V.

description:
You've never had Mitchell's Ice Cream?  What, are you crazy?

I'm going to go ahead and throw it out here... Mitchell's is the best ice cream EVER.  It's so rich and CREAMY and full of flavor.  I've been going there for over 20 years and it just seems to get better and better.

My favorite flavors are:
Thin Mint
Banana
Ube
Mango
Coffee

The only downside is that it gets pretty crowded and the prices are on the high side.  But I'd wait in line and pay more any day.
author: Moon S.

description: Me and the Boyfriend have yet to find another place that makes us oh so very happy! There was definitely a contest between Mitchell's and McConnell's in Santa Barbara. Mitchell's won by a landslide, how can you beat 65 regular season flavors and 9 seasonal ones?! I felt true love when I had their coffee and Mexican chocolate flavors...The Best! The Macapuno is a delicious tropical flavor and the cantalope is seasonal but wicked good. There are other ice creams in this world but none as good by comparison to Mitchell's.
author: Sugey G.

description:
Great place to go for Ice Cream. On a sunny day (week) where the line gets long, I usually buy the quart (jug) to avoid that line and go to the other line and just leave it at home in the freezer for everybody to eat.  There are many flavors to choose from, i haven't tried many since i stick to the ones i like.
I brought friends that have never heard or tried Mitchell's Ice Cream before and they loved it.
author: Jason C.

description: If only they would bring the triple cone back.  Save yourself the long lines and get a quart to go.  If you must wait for hand scooped love,  the waffle cone bowls are excellent!!
author: E P.

description: Mithcell's Ice Cream is by far the best I have tasted...except for gelato.   I love their tropical flavors, so much better than Magnolia or Selecta brands.  Each flavor is creamy and has bits of the actual fruit/nut in them.  My favorites right now are white pistachio and langka.  So good...the cantaloupe, buko, halo halo, and ube are delicious also.  Just go there and sample everything.  haha.  Or be like my family who came all the way from Vallejo:  Buy one of each flavor in the pre-packed 1/2 gallon size and put them in your cooler (yes, we brought coolers and ice with us) for the trip home.  Our freezer in the garage is all Mitchell's Ice Cream.  Now how Filipino can you get.  =0)
author: JulieAnne L.

description:
omg...i'm obsessed. whether you're looking for a creamy chunky chocolatey treat or a tropical sorbet, this place is the shit. they have the most exotic flavors i've ever heard of. i even tried the ube flavor last time, it's a purple yam...

i love this place cause i'll walk in wanting one thing, the grasshopper (mint ice cream with chunks of stuff) and end up getting something totally different like the blood orange sorbet...just talking about it is making my mouth is water .
author: selma s.

description:
mitchell's mitchell's. there is a reason everyone loves mitchell's.
and i mean everyone. big people, little people, old people, middle people, purple people, all the people. 
am i going into you scream i scream we all scream for mitchells ice cream? .... well, we do. i live just up the street and yes it's really true that there is always a line there. going out the door and down the sidewalk. but it moves really fast and stays pretty constant. plebian and exotic flavors. taste them first. or taste something then get something else. 
it's one of those great little pleasures that mean so much.
author: Suzanne J.

description:
YUM-YUM!!!!

Great ice cream.  Just pick a number and mingle with the fellow binge eaters....  

Great ice cream....friendly staff.
author: Mike O.

description:
Does this place even need a review?  :)

LOVE LOVE LOVE the ice cream here.  I am trying to work my way through every flavor, but always seem to get caught up on ordering favorite repeats.  

Everything here is great!  Just tried the chocolate shake for the first time and it is yummy!
author: Ling L.

description: This place is just a good time.  Tons of flavors, ways they can be served, and a line of happy people.  This is how ice cream should be!
author: e w.

description: All I can say is try the macapuno - it's as good as it gets outside of the Caribbean.
author: J D.

description: i LOVE Mitchell's ice cream!! i always go here during my break from work cause i work really close to it. The people are SO nice, and when i ask them what they think i should get, they never fail to let me down. =] I LOVE THIS PLACE!! and its really cheap too!! haha
author: Melissa G.

description: Hands down...the best ice cream in SF! I was told that my mom ate a lot of Mitchell's Ice Cream when she was pregnant with me back in the 70's. That explains my obession with this place. I could probably...no... I could eat a cone everyday of my life if it was from Mitchell's! I remember when I was a kid after dinner, once a week we would drive down to Mitchell's and get cones! My all time favorite flavor is Ube...it's a purple yam.  It's delicious and a cool color of ice cream to look at! Trust me...you'll love it too!
author: Suzette R.

description: This is the best place in the city!  I've been going here since I was a kid and now I bring my hubby here.  They have tons of flavors, but I LOVE all the tropical stuff: ube, macapuno (sweet coconut), tropical 4. YUM!  Parking can be a little tough and there is quite a wait, but it's all worth it.
author: Janet E.

description: It is the BEST Ice Cream in the whole wide world. They have every flavor under the sun...you really need to try it.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Really delish ice cream! Very creamy! But I deducted one star because of service, very rude, esp Lisa, I had come in with a group of friends and was ordering 4 things. When we ordered the 1st thing she gave us a blank look, then we ordered another thing and she shrugged and said uhhh ok.. Then my friend and I wanted to get chocolate and coffee milkshakes, and she said were not able to do that, WHY NOT?! You use the same amount of ice cream just two different flavors? And I have gone here before and ordered this milkshake, and all of a sudden you can't do that?! Then she said you can only do it for the large size, we were like "ok can we get one and put them in two cups", IT WOULD BE THE SAME THING AS ORDERING TWO SMALLS, just a cheaper price, then she walked away, then said well I'll do it this time but next time we won't be able to do that, and I knew they would have done it cos they would've lost money.. VERY delicious ice cream, HORRIBLE customer service..
author: Jan R.

description: I was taken to Mitchell's by some local friends who raved about the quality and uniqueness of the place - I was not disappointed at all.  The banana flavor is awesome - often ice-cream makers tend to get their banana flavor wrong - Mitchell's hit it right on the spot.  My only complaint - it was cold the night we went and would have been nice to have more indoor space to enjoy our ice cream.
author: Ralph C.

description: Lucuma and dulce de leche. Yum.  I love Mitchell's everytime.
author: Diego V.

description: the wait was definitely worth it but I totally had to go diarrhea after I ate my half pint of mocha and strawberries and cream
author: kathleen d.

description:
i love mitchell's and i miss it terribly.  it's the first thing i mention that i want when i visit san francisco.  even when it's cold and rainy.  especially when it's cold and rainy because there isn't a line... usually.
they know they have too many intriguing flavors and have a 3 flavor limit to tastings.  ice cream is rich and creamy.  flavors are delicious and true.  the thai tea flavor tastes exactly like frozen creamy thai iced tea.  chocolate flavors are awesome and the cantaloupe  flavor is a great balance of fruit and cream.  they are also very sweet and understanding.  my friend's scoop once rolled off her cone and went splat right onto the sidewalk.  they came out immediately to clean up and replaced her scoop of ice cream right away.
i think i may be addicted to mitchell's.  sometimes there is withdrawal symptoms of sadness, longing, fiending...  i wish i had some mitchell's ice cream today.
author: Karen Y.

description: I have lived near Mitchell's for 16 years.  Five stars?  Yes.  Perfection?  No.  Let me explain.  Mitchell's consistency is the basis for my rating. It has been really great for a long time.  And I say this even though they don't do the traditional fruit flavors all that well.  But anything coffee, chocolate, or coconut based, etc. is pretty great.  A couple of highlights?  Mexican chocolate, toasted almond, pistachio, and any mocha flavor.  But the real killer is buko (coconut).  It is to die for.  Try in a cup, a scoop of buko, chocolate dipped, with roasted almonds on it.  Yes, the lines are ridiculous, but if you are not in a hurry, it is a pretty festive atmosphere.  Or, take a number and go back to the car and listen to the radio.  The folks who work there all seem very nice, and the price is still right.
author: Mokje K.

description: Been going here nightly in the past two weeks. Rum raisin and sorbet are favorites. Tropical flavors are always good, too. I highly recommend the Lucuma when it's there.
author: R E.

description: A cool-assed ice cream shop. On a hot day the line is long, you pull the number 79 and they are serving 38, but you hang out in the street and talk with your friends and it's all good. They have a chocolate dip which is bomb-ass. The only thing goofy is ordering an ice cream cake. They need like 48 hours to put a personal message on it. Ya can't be last minute about it.
author: Stephen S.

description: Oh my God, thank you ice cream Gods.  So many flavors, all so good.  This is a happy smiley place.
author: Lauren H.

description: I don't see what is so special about this place. I mean to me, it tastes like dreyers ice cream but with a huge wait. I must say though, it is a fun expierience to go with a bunch of friends (becasue then the wait isnt so bad).
author: Pasta G.

description: Halo Halo and Banana were amazing. The service was really quick and it was easy to get our order. The Buko is a must! Would recommend to ANYONE!
author: Tina S.

description: I love their ice cream and they're the only place I know that has Thai Iced Tea!
author: Tara B.

description: Just can't go wrong with their chocolate, mango and avocado flavors. Grab a couple of cones and you are ready to scoop those luscious flavors.  The chocolate is just velvety, mango is just exotictly yummy and the avocado...yes the avocadoes are sooo creamy. If you combine both chocolate and avocado...it's pure heaven.
author: girl e.

description: Hands down, the best ice cream ever.  Nuff said.
author: Jessica C.

description: The ice cream that I got was tasty, super rich and delicious.  I only tried one other flavor, and it was funky but fine.  Not feeling the same dedication that others are feeling, but I will write more if I am wow-ed by a next experience.
author: Mira B.

description: This is best ice cream in San Francisco -- so many yummy tropical flavors!!!!
author: Zoe P.

description: mitchell's ice cream yummylichuz, i love the coconut ice cream, the purple yam , the mango, and the pistacio so good and really worth the wait. i give it 5 stars for the great service and the ice cream is so good...
author: Junel L.

description: i once stood in line for 45 minutes, baring the cold san francisco night, just to get some lilikoi pie and grasshopper pie... THAT'S how much i like mitchell's. by far the best variety of locally-made ice cream, with exotic flavors that even the staff can't quite get a grasp of (friend: "what's the difference between sweet coconut and baby coconut?" / staff: "one's sweet and the other one's a baby."), and fun flavor combos like the "pie" flavors they have, mitchell's is an sf institution!
author: Andrey C.

description: Best ice-cream in San Francisco. There really is no argument on this. Its the best! Flavors and richness above and beyond anything out there....and believe me, I've tried them all.... Only downside is the wait....
author: Audrey L.

description: u get a number to wait in line.  30 minute wait. yuck. however, i did get a generous portion for the icecream.  that made up for the long long wait.
author: con c.

description:
try the buko, seriously!

lots of exotic fruit flavours

and the sundae of the month is always amazing

especially this month,
pumpkin pie sundae
you are in my dreams eleven months of the year!!
author: Eva S.

description: Try the tropical flavors that you can't pronounce and then try to describe them to other people. I just had the lucuma, which is a Peruvian fruit that sorta tastes like caramelized toasted wheat bread with butter to me. Totally bizarre.
author: Liboo K.

description: Mitchell's has bomb ice cream.  I buy 1/2 gallons to avoid lines.    My favorite flavors are Chocolate Chip and Strawberries and Cream.   Try their tropical flavors, too.
author: Cliff B.

description: It's not about Ghirarhdelli ice cream or Rice-a-Roni, for a true San Francisco treat, grab a scoop or three at Mitchell's. Along with the usual chocolate, strawberry and vanilla...take an adventure and try out Mango, Thai Tea, Ube(Taro), and Macapuno (Young Coconut). They also have seasonal flavors that come out at various times of the year...Irish Coffee around March for St. Patty's day. YUM.
author: Ammo Marketing ..

description: The other day I was made fun of by an SF Police officer for going back into line after I finished my cone. Then she admitted that she had done the same thing. Mitchells is so good you wonder why they havent expanded and dominated the world ice cream market. But its probably just because they like being the best kept secret in San Francisco.
author: Sushi K.

description:
Hey! Guess what! This place is good!

If you're into holiday flavors [or just like gingerbread], don't miss the cinnamon snap ice cream. So friggin tasty.

Grasshopper pie and Pumpkin pie are tried and true [and tasty, too].
author: Sara R.

description: SOOOOOOOOO EFFIN GOOD !!!! i cant eat any other icecream other than this place now! lines are always long but def. worth it. the mocha, pineapple,bannana nut, mango, and mexican chocolate is DELISH! mmmhmmmmm ok imma go there now
author: Alicia L.

description: The ice cream is Tip-top, but I have to say they have been dethroned by Bi-Rite. Sorry, Mitchell's I just don't have an hour to get a non-organic ice cream cone any more.
author: Ryan C.

description: ok this place is amazing the only other place that tops it is in New Mexico where they serve chili ice cream ... sounds gross i know , but even the garlic one is good, yum yum , although i still keep it simple with a French vanilla most of the time. I will keep coming back and bring my freinds with.
author: Leah F.

description: This is my favorite place for ice cream in San Francisco! The best! The flavors I suggest are buko and the chocolate peanut butter cup. Make sure you take a number when you get in! You don't want to miss out because the people that came after you are getting such a great treat and passing you up. Eat and enjoy!
author: Mary D.

description: Best icecream in SFO. Possibly the best icecream in the world. Homemade. They have parking behind the store.
author: Gabriel A.

description: Love this place! Love it! Love it! Love it! Becasue of Mitchell's Ube ice cream...I can never have another brand of Ube ice cream ever again. It's either Mitchell's Ube or no ube at all! Love it!
author: Ela G.

description: i loved their ice cream, specially the french vanilla and the coffee! my hubby loved the chocolate! another great thing about this place, they close at 11 pm everyday!
author: Maram S.

description: I live in Bernal Heights and always keep a half gallon of mitchells ice cream in my freezer. It's been a staple in my life for years now. Try the grasshopper pie (mint ice cream, oreos and fudge) how can you go wrong with that combination. Many, many  types of assorted flavors. Expect a line, but it's worth it.
author: jasen i.

description: wow, i dont know why i never got around to trying this place until recently.  they have the best flavors, and the creamiest ice cream.  the texture and flavors were perfect on all of the flavors i got to try.  i much prefer mitchells over bi rite and swensens, even though i love all of them.  i also wish i could give more stars for the parking they have in the back!
author: Molly C.

description: It is always very crowded, but you know why once you taste it.... their ice cream is heavenly.  "Thin Mint" is my daughter's favorite.  I am NOT a mint person, but .... yes, I enjoy that too.  Tropical taste is very nice.  All the flavors are just the greatest!
author: Miinno N.

description: I love Mitchell's. I've been here at least 5 times in the last week and will continue coming til I try all the flavors. Nothing in the city really compares.
author: Diem V.

description: This is one of the reasons i dreamed of living in San Francisco.. I am an ice cream addict and have been since birth. Mitchells is the best you'll get and these brothers deserve my greatest admiration for running such a legit little spot for so many years. The ice cream is to die for and I'll probably die if i don't stop eating so much of it.
author: Christopher A.

description:
I got all excited when I saw all the exotic Asian flavors Mitchell's has. But when I tried them, they were just not that good. Trust me, I know how they are supposed to taste :) I ended up getting some chocolate flavor which was not very impressive either.

Final verdict: I will go to a Haagen-Dazs or Ben & Jerry's instead.
author: Elin K.

description:
Food: It took me two scoops of the butterscotch and praline to dislike Mitchells. I love creamy ice creams, but not THAT creamy.
Service: It was quite a line there... It was about 5 or 6 numbers before us, and when we got out of the place, the line was worse.
Ambiance: Just enough room to order and get away from the place. No tables or chairs to enjoy your ice creams.
author: Jessica W.

description: Anyone who knows me, knows that the way to my heart is a long, sick and twisted road.  Mitchell's Ice Cream is the most direct route.
author: Jerome W.

description: Everything here is soooo good, I've been coming here for YEARS and every single time I come, I fall in love all over again, no joke! Fresh great ice cream. Michell's will always be #1 in my eyes.
author: S A.

description: One of the best ice cream I ever ate...pina colada flavor is my favorite...
author: Ringo L.

description: The toasted almond on our first trip was incredible, and overshadowed the very good mocha ice cream. This last trip, we went for the $8.50 half-gallon and got the Lychee. H thought it was good and not super-good. But, then again, part of the Mitchell's experience is to get subtle flavors, not the sickly sweet stuff you get in little plastic lychee cups. G thought it was good. She does not use superlatives.
author: Huynh C.

description:
yum!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
we live a block away.
since we would like to continue to be able to fit out the doorway, and down the stairs, we only go once a month.
this requires MUCH discipline-some mornings, especially on the weekends, if you stand in our driveway you can smell the fresh cones baking.
seriously.
uh huh.
there's a reason it's five deep on the outside sidewalk in the rain and freezing wind...
author: brittany r.

description:
So if the number you pick is about 40 away from the number they're serving.... don't worry.... it's normally like that on nice hot days in the city. It'll move fast as long as the people ahead of you who've been waiting can process their damn order and stop trying to taste all 100 flavors.

If I wait more than 15 minutes minutes for ice cream.... I can guarantee that I will be walking out of there with no less than a 2-scoop sundae. 

**My choice: buko and macapuno (both coconut) ice creams) with mango and fresh banana topping, whip cream, extra nuts, no cherry please

I don't understand people who wait a while and walk out of there with a 1-scoop ice cream on a sugar cone. Please explain what you were waiting for. Forget watching your damn diet.... it's ice cream for crying out loud. Splurge!!!
author: Emma N.

description: great ice cream worth the drive to san francisco
author: Adrian L.

description: Im not sure what the big commotion is all about... after waiting for over an hour i expected more
author: Alex M.

description:
delicious & rather cheap local made ice cream!

on sunny days they are usually pretty busy but the get the job done fast!

love it!
author: Kate R.

description: can't believe i've lived so close to this place and have never been here to get ice cream until now! i love all the different flavors and the fact that you can make ice cream sandwiches should give mitchell's 5 stars alone. loved the ube, my mom got the avocado which was alright, my sister got the white pistachio which was really good. this place is always busy so just take a number and be patient because its totally worth it. =)
author: Linda N.

description: When it's a cold and rainy night in the city and there's a line out the door for ice cream, you know it's gotta be good.  The one good thing about the wait was that it gave you plenty of time to try to figure out what you wanted to get because there were so many things that looked really good!  In the end, I got myself the peanut butter indulgence, a name that seemed so fitting seeing as how I was already full from dinner but couldn't resist the idea.  If it means a visit to this place, I will never turn down ice cream on a cold night.
author: Joel J.

description: great fruity flavors! my sf opera co-workers always wanted to go on ice cream runs here, & it's way outta the way. one of the simplest pleasures on earth is getting a cheap, yummy ice cream cone. i remember the mango...good for when u want a fruity flavor, but sometimes i crave a plain vanilla, u know? (psst...haagen dazs vanilla is da bestest!)
author: miss b.

description: I LOVE their Lemon Chiffon ice cream. It's so good. I have been getting ice cream from here since I was a little girl. It gets really crowded when it's a hot day, and they have a number system. Also, parking is tough when it's crowded.
author: April S.

description: Once  you try Mitchells, you can never go back. Ice cream as a desert has never done it for me until I tried the peanut butter indulgence from Mitchells ice cream. Everyone talks about the tropical flavors such as ube and buko but anyone seeking the greatest desert in the world ought to try peanut butter indulgence dipped in chocolate. Of course the line is often out of hand, but thats what happens when something is so great right? If you pull your number and you're within 30, Mitchells Ice Cream is a must.
author: Kerry C.

description: love this place...you gotta have the ube ice cream!   and their ice cream cakes are da bomb!
author: A P.

description: Very nice employees and a great selection of ice cream. I got their banana ice cream with hot fudge and it was very good.
author: Zak M.

description: Great ice cream and lots of flavors. In the summertime, expect a wait. You can get a good scoop at this joint !!!
author: RED L.

description: I discovered this gem 20 years ago and rediscovered it with a longtime friend who I hadn't seen in 10 years yesterday.  Wow, it has been remodeled and they have a number system now as lines form out the door; my how it has grown.!  The service is friendly and I love how they let you sample flavors and really take the time with you to make sure you get what you want.  All the ice cream is homemade and smooth, buttery, nutty, (covering all the different flavors) like it should be.  They have all the expected like the ones mentioned and exhotic ones like purple yam, coconut, and so forth.  We sampled caramel crackle with smooth caramel and wonderful rice crispy like pieces, grasshopper pie which is essentially mint chocolate chip ice cream with Oreo Cookie bits, and black walnut which was nutty and tasted like rum a bit.  We chose Mexican chocolate with its smooth chocolaty cinimany goodness; we each got two scoops plus a half a gallon.  Uuuuhhhhmmm.!  I love how they have half gallons as I will pick one up next time I am in the area.  They are a little more than the chains and perhaps some other indipendents, but it is well worth it, getting what you pay for.  Be for warned, you may have to circle around multiple times to find parking as spots fill up fast needless to say, and their parking lot only accommodates eight vehicles, but it is so worth it.  So, for top quality homemade ice cream for a  little more than other palaces, with friendly service in a clean atmosphere, Mitchell's cannot be beat..  Keep up the good work guys.!
author: Brian S.

description: the pumpkin ice cream they had in october, dipped in chocolate was like a party in my mouth (and you know everyone's coming).  I'm hella getting mitchell's today.
author: Caleb D.

description: Mitchell's ice cream is the nommiest ice cream, ever. It is my hope to someday try all of the flavors...everything so far has been delicious! Om nom nom nom.
author: Stefan V.

description: wohooo ice cream at its best...weee....they have my flavors too pure awesomeness..
author: anung u.

description: we tried to go to bi rite last night, but the line out the door was horrendous and decided to try mitchell's.  the line was not as bad, but the service was pretty slow.  i was trying to be healthy and got a scoop of the guava sorbet on a sugar cone.  they hand run out of the passion fruit sorbet, but guava was a good substitute.  scoops are pretty generous and can't be beat at $2.65.  they have a TON of tropical fruit flavors like ube, mango, halo halo, etc.
author: Helen T.

description: you know ice cream is good when you're willing to go despite it being sub-50 degree weather outside.  i'm from NH, and not even the farms up there trump mitchell's.  get the chocolate caramel crunch, and you will not regret it.  trust me, i'm a chocolate fiend.
author: Rohit G.

description: rain or shine this place always has a line.  people of all ages flock to this ice cream  nook. if a gas station is to cars, Mitchell's is to San Francisco locals and tourist alike.
author: m e.

description: i always get a scoop of peppermint on a sugar cone and pint of ube to go.  i love it!!!
author: Jennifer D.

description: I get the hype of the ice cream and it being a local institution but the lines are insane and the number system is impossible to understand. When we got there on a Saturday at 5 PM, I grabbed number 77 and there were just serving number 43. It took nearly 30 minutes of waiting in the wind for a scoop of lilikoi mango which was good. Not sure I would wait another 30 minutes for a future scoop as you really want to have ice cream to wait that long. Yes, parking sucks but wait for someone to leave the lot in the back.
author: Ronnie W.

description: oh my god! this place is so amazing! sure there are long lines sometimes, but I totally feel like it is worth it. I am always adventurous and go for their weekly or monthly special. I love the KINDS of ice cream they have, and the freshness of the flavors are unmatched. Abuelita hot chocolate lovers totally try their Mexican chocolate flavor, it is uber yummy. This place is f*ing great,and I have to question people who give it less than three stars and their judgement....*drool* i want some now=(
author: Gr R.

description: Hands down the best ice cream in the city!!! The ice cream is soooo good.The parking sucks but you will be happy you parked far,it gives you time to eat your ice cream! I like to get ,ube or mango or strawberries n cream..
author: ren M.

description: this places was a bit overrated to me. there are so many good ice cream places in the city. i had tried two samples and didn't care for them so i just picked vanilla because i feel bad when i ask for too many samples. my favorite ice cream places are three twins, mr. and mrs. miscellaneous and smitten so far. i like the flavor profile better
author: Josephine S.

description: If it wasn't for this place, my childhood in the great Noe Valley would have been extremely boring and lame. Now all these yuppified ice cream places that seem to be popping up with there hippie tofu organic flavors better back da fuk up. I can attest that Mitchells is the best ice cream parlor one will ever visit. I heard that people have driven over our bridges for this place and doesn't surprise me in the least bit. Let's start with there selection. Mitchy's, as my oldest sister Stephanie called it back in the 70's, has the most vast selection of flavors, when your sampling like 6 of them, your totally pissing off the people in back of you for taking so long. The pacific rim flavors just rule too like Ube-which is made from a root from the south pacific and mainly the Philipines is one of my personal faves. Then there's N.Y. Cherry, when you dip this sucker into the hot pool of chocolate coating, it tastes just like a see's candy that was bit into by your sister and avoided because she wanted a bordeaux instead. Mitchells by far has created a following bigger than most bars here. In the 70's, you didn't have to take a number either....So quite having babies people, and enjoy it with shorter lines....!!!!! Thumbs up high..!
author: Sven S.

description: i love their ice creams i love their ice creams! my boyfriend introduced me to this place and he would bring me here when i'm mad at him or just when we're in the neighborhood. they have so much flavors and damn their ice creams just melts my heart! lol good places are usually packed and this place is packed even on a cold day, i am freal. the line is very long and don't forget to get your number because they go by number not by whose in line first! so don't forget don't forget! this place is my favorite in san francisco! yay mitchell's.
author: Valerie N.

description: Oh Nelly! Mitchell's did the unthinkable. Their newest flavor gave my favorite flavor of 8 years the boot... Lilikoi and mango swirl in a vanilla bean ice cream. It was reminiscent of the passion fruit mousse I selected for my wedding cake  and my days of youth in Hawaii nei.
author: PK H.

description: the ice cream is awesome and there are so many unique flavors to choose from, but i honestly don't know if its worth the wait...i like it just as much as i like ben and jerry's, but you don't have to wait an hour for the latter...even so, its a good place to take tourists, but if you really just want some ice cream, there are lots of other places that are much less stressful
author: Mo M.

description: holy ube, batman, they have avocado ice cream.  seriously delish flavors and delightfully exotic (well, exotic to someone who thought baskin robbins was the best place for ice cream ever as a kid- so consider the source).  this is a great place to come for something sweet.   though... i'll be honest, if it wasn't around the corner, i'd probably not make the extra effort to visit- but if you are in the neighborhood- it is the perfect way to end an outing!
author: Samantha W.

description: i give it four stars cuz my buddy armand works here and when i would go in, he would give it to me for free. awesomeness!!!!!!!! one star down just cuz well, it still isn't polly-ann's, ice cream place of my childhood.
author: Melanie C.

description: This is the absolute best spot in San Francisco. As a kid my father would take me here and I would always get a one scoop sundae in a little San Francisco Giants Helmet -- I just hope this place is around when I have a kid and treat him or her for ice cream. They have some weird flavors in addition to your standard Chocolate, Vanilla and Strawberry all of it is excellent. Worth the wait, after experiencing Mitchell's you WILL wait.
author: Arnold S.

description: Mitchells is my favorite ice cream place not only in San Francisco.  It's my favorite in the world!  The best thing about it is the creamy taste and texture.  My favorite flavor is buko.  The only thing that I don't like is that it's a little too sweet.
author: Matthew N.

description: Great ice cream. SF institution. Parking is practically non-existent, and the wait to place an order is ridiculous. One would think they'd come up with a better (i.e. more efficient) way to service the customers. Waits of 45min to 1hr are not unheard of. I'm not sure any ice cream is worth that much wasted time.
author: Joe C.

description: sublime.  bring a book for the wait.  if its a wam & sunny Sunday afternoon, bring War and Peace.
author: Jason M.

description: Love the ice cream flavors. Hate the wait and tends to be overcrowded. My favorite is Mexican Chocolate and Mango (not together though).
author: Jenny A.

description: mitchell's is definitely as good as it gets!  they have the best mango (as well as all their other tropical flavors) ice cream!  another favorite that i recently discovered is their rocky road.  WOW.  the marshmallows and walnuts are so good and fresh and the chocolate is so creamy.  mitchells is a true san francisco gem in my eyes.  no other ice cream shop can compare.  when i'm away for school in socal, i always crave for them when its a warm sunny day (which is almost everyday)!  aah mitchells is the best!
author: Francia T.

description: holy crap!! a single scoop is freaking huge! after seeing a sign that said something about the most anticipated/popular/award winning/something along those lines flavor (pumpkin) i just had to try it... plus im having a pumpkin phase (pumpkin pancakes, pumpkin pie, pumpkin cheesecake...etc) the flavor of the pumpkin ice cream was really rich and creamy.. maybe a little bit too rich because i couldnt even get to the cone!  dont get me wrong, i do like the flavor.. i just wish they had kid sizes.. so i could have savored it more.. but dont worry mitchells, i will be back!
author: JUDY L.

description: I mentioned to my boyfriend that I wanted to come here.  Last night we were in the city, looking for gas after dinner...and guess what we passed by? Mitchell's! Although he thinks I plotted the whole thing.  We tasted the ube, grasshopper pie, avocado and mexican chocolate and left with a pint of mexican chocolate and ube for only $5.75.  I'll be getting the grasshopper pie next time, yum!  The ice cream was so good that I dreamt about it.
author: Lindsay K.

description: So much better than Bi-Rite. Delicious and creamy. I love the young coconut
author: Phillys R.

description: From island flavors like halo halo and ube to interesting concoctions like ginger snap and mexican chocolate to the usual vanilla and strawberry, there are a lifetime of options to try. I haven't found anything but delicious frozen delights at Mitchell's, and can't wait to continue exploring their menu of creations!
author: Michael H.

description: simply the best ice cream in san francisco
author: spiritsf a.

description: basically, the fenton's of the west bay, without the large premises.  excellent ice cream and a must-try of san francisco!
author: Jill k.

description: I would kill or maybe pillage a small village for some Mitchelle's Ice Cream. You can't really go wrong with any flavor. I miss the Rocky Mountain Berry, which only comes out every blue moon. Worth the drive no matter where yo live.Don't forget to get a # or you're just standing around outside for no reason. Best Ice cream in the City.
author: Rafael M.

description: I always forget how to get here (my dad has received numerous phone calls from my sibs and I on how to get here - and he doesn't even live in CA anymore) but once I get here I forget the whole travel ordeal.  I'd guess their parking lot has maybe 10 spots, but I've never had a problem if I wait a few minutes.  Grab a number when you walk in the door, wait for them to call you and stuff your face. Their ice cream is amazing - my fave is the banana nut.  mmmm.
author: Margie N.

description: can't go wrong with such tropical flavors as ube (purple yam), langka (jackfruit), avocado and buko (baby coconut), in addition to extensive choices from standard flavors.
author: Bennet A.

description: Love the tropical flavors but there is no nostalgia here for me so I'm not absolutely head over heels in love with it.
author: Nic W.

description: pumpkin + egg nog.  you know you want it.
author: Sheila W.

description: This shop is hands down the best ice shop in town if u want quality and variety,go to Mitchell's.
author: Diana R.

description: 4.5 stars for nearly 1,000 reviews pretty much says it all. the pumpkin ice cream is like heaven in a spoonful. oh god it's good. i also like gingersnap. too bad both of these are seasonal. your waistline will pay for this love affair, as the extra butterfat is what makes it good, but damn. pumpkin ice cream. i guess it's good that it only comes once a year.
author: Mary V.

description: my friends totally hyped this place up, but it still gets 5 stars from me. there are plenty of delicious flavors to choose from and the workers are more than happy to let you sample as many as you want. the ice cream is really creamy, so if you don't like that you might prefer bi rite. the crazy thing is that you have to take a number cuz the lines are crazy. flavors i recommend: tropical four; coconut; tropical ginger...YUMM
author: Rosa K.

description: mitchell's is delish and i love the buko ice cream. buko is baby coconut for those of you who are unfamiliar with vegetative vocabulary. it's worth it to put up with the long lines and the stupid people who want their ice cream and apparently do not know what a line is.
author: Samantha G.

description: Best ice cream in SF!  I love the Banana......so fresh and creamy!
author: Kristi s.

description: ice cream is very creamy here.  strawberry and cream, ube, baby coconut and the chocolate crunches are our favorites here.
author: Luxuriouskin L.

description: They need 50 stars, the mocha fudge, the pumpkin oh it's all sooooo good.  They've been doing it right for so long and never disappoint.  I want some NOW and ALWAYS!!!!
author: Sheila B.

description: the halo halo ice cream and banana ice cream are very good. the halo halo has chunks of chewy stuff in it and is super good. we tasted the thai tea and this salty peanut one which i thought was gross. the consistancy of both was mushy and not great and had the guy not already scooped my order i would have left but im glad he did bc the flavors i got were good.
author: chloe w.

description: i like Mitchell's ice cream, specially when they have pumkin ice ream. its always busy in a hot day. the line can take almost 15 mins.
author: Christian P.

description: As a previous reviewer wrote, the ice cream here is extremely creamy... almost more cream than ice... haha... anyways... lame joke aside, Mitchell's either has really good or really yucky ice cream depending on the flavors.  For example, their macapuno (young coconut) ice cream kicks any other coconut wannabe ice cream's ass ten times over, but that's because most people associate coconut-flavored foods to be creamy.  That being said, their Thai Ice Tea favor, chocolate and vanilla are not bad.  What wasn't so good was their green tea (green tea should NOT be too creamy, in my opinion), grasshopper (mint ice cream that was just looked too suspiciously bright green, with soggy oreos and an overly goopy fudge ribbon), ube (but that's because I'm fond of the slight pastiness of ube... shut up you Filipino food haters!)  Anyway, not bad ice cream, but not my favorite place to get it in SF... wow did I just write THREE reviews on ice cream places?  Hmm... impressive for an Asian chick who's lactose intolerant AND not fond of sweets.
author: Catherine C.

description: A family favorite for as long as I can remember. I've been coming here since I was about 3, maybe even before that. My all-time favorite flavors are: avocado, macapuno, ube and langka (the tropical/Filipino flavors). I enjoy coming to Mitchell's any time of the year. During the summers, the lines get really long and the wait can be over 30 mins. But being a true Mitchell's fan, it is definitely worth the wait!
author: Eina L.

description: They just remodeled...and while the space looks much cleaner and ice creamier...some of the nostalgia is gone. The ice cream though is still super yummy! They're pretty adventurous with the asian fruit flavors (which all asian parents love)...but my faves are the norms. Their rocky road is the most chocolatiest, walnutist, marshmallowist...and all their ice creams are just super creamy and delicious. I always pick up a 1/2 gallon of the prepacked on the way home every couple weeks...for $9.25 it's pretty reasonable..today I got grasshopper pie (mint with fudge and oreos!)...And they have a PARKING LOT! (in SF!!!!)
author: Emily W.

description: Mitchell's is a great place for ice cream.....what is missing here is the respect for the neighborhood by those who visit. Please, keep in mind that this is a neighborhood of people wanting the same things you want from your little piece of the world-peace and quiet. Please be mindful of the fact that the residents would like to turn down your music and slow down as you circle the block. I don't live in the hood anymore and this is the reason; all the cruising and noise.
author: Betty B.

description: mmmmm did not expect this explosion of creamy goodness!! yeah yeah we've all seen the local mitchelle's ice cream packed away in our grocery shops, but this is homemade stuff! many crazy flavors such as ube (purple yam), buko (baby coconut), and mexican chocolate. people were lined up outside, double parking, grabbing numbers to be called, and takling excitedly about what they wanted. I got the tropical 4, a tropical blend of banana, guava, mango, and pineapple. i liked it, but my cousin got the flavor of the month: irish coffee. oh man i liked that one! im a BIG coffee fan and this was GOOD COFFEE! too bad its gone at the end of the month...so get it quick!
author: Janelle H.

description: the oreo ice cream is the best i tell you... the best!  so is the mexican chocolate and the have lovely magic shell!
author: Swarup B.

description: The have a HUGE selection of flavors, that alone is a major plus!  They havge everything from vanilla to funky tropical flavors. There is usually a line, but worth the wait.  I have been coming here since I was a kid and I still looove it!
author: Bri L.

description: the mango ice cream is great. i love the funky flavors, although i admit i stick to my favorites. i don't mind the lines, makes everyone equal. just use that time to scope out your flavors so you don't hold everyone up.
author: Shinn Z.

description: the canteloupe ice cream will reaffirm your faith in god.  it's a summer flavor only, so get while the getting is good.  don't be afraid of the long lines--the employees work fast and i've never waited more than 20 minutes and it is WELL WORTH IT.
author: calamity d.

description: all i can say about mitchell's is yummy. they have some of the coolest ice cream flavors there and i plan to try each and every one of them someday.  however to date my favorite is the yam( i think its called ube but it's still yam), i know it's sounds crazy and the purple color can be a bit strange but it taste great.  their ice cream is very smooth and is a great treat.  a little on the expensive side for ice cream but well worth it.  just beware tht it can get pretty packed a night and on the weekends so be prepared to take a number and wait. take a gallon home and all your friends will be tres impressed
author: Marie B.

description: OK i know that yelpers have reviewed the shit out of this place but i have been literally going here since i was a kid  and i am really fuckin old now.  What can i say about this place that hasnt already been rhapsodized about?   There is always a long wait here so pull your number and wait your sweet ass because it is totally worth it.   I always order the same thing a Double Scoop: 1-  Banana on the top and 2 - Ube on the bottom.  Why? Because my body craves it and it has to be the banana on the  top and ube on the bottom.   OK people  i will just explain this one last time because i have not gotten ice cream here once without someone stopping and asking me what the fuck it is.  It is  PURPLE YAM ice cream it is an acquired taste some people think it tastes bland,  but what the fuck do they know?  Dont judge me until you try it for yourself  take a chance life is about putting yourself out there and taking risks.  And hot damn it hits the fucking spot when its sweltering in the concrete jungle.
author: Ellie A.

description: just another yes vote to this place... stand in line to get ice cream, enjoy conversations, get fed the best of the best ice cream in town... Kahlua and cream is my favorite... Dulce DE leche a second... bi rite has a few flavors competing for favorites but they are not available late at night near me... OMG just a jump away and hang out with friends... better than a coffee shop on any night... as Eddie Murphy said Ice Creeeaaammmmm. oh heck gotta got there now... Mexican chocolate? maybe yeas... but the Kahlua... we'll see
author: Jennifer H.

description:
this place, this place...i don't think i have the words to describe the amazing creamy delight that is mitchell's ice cream. i have driven from rwc to sf just to get the yummy on a whim. worth every minute of time spent driving and standing in line. worth every cent for gas.  this place has an amazing selection of flavors and even flavors you might not expect--like avocado--are a taste treat. i love that everyone in line knows that they are in line for something delicious and happy making, so it is a very social, fun atmosphere. and when you get to the front and still need to sample 2 or 3 or 4 flavors to be sure that what you decided you wanted 5 minutes ago in line is still what you wanted, no one gets cranky. the service is friendly and efficient. all in all, totally worth time and money!
oh and cantaloupe is The. Flavor. in the summer. and this stuff lasts for quite awhile in the freezer, so you can stock up!
parking can be a pain, but again, worth it!
author: zoe w.

description: whether it's raining or sunny--- there's usuallllly a line & for good reason.  that reason is that delicious UBE ICE CREAM!  haha, yummO
author: Aubrey M.

description: Great ice cream! The peppermint is some of the best I've had.  Their eggnog is a holiday tradition.  They do have parking if you aren't within walking distance, but the lot is limited.
author: B B.

description: i passed by here on the way to a party and i had to leave the party to go and get mitchell's. i got this wonderful flavor with mint and cookie pieces. i don't remember the name because i didn't exactly  make it there sober. but oh, was it delicious! it is worth the wait and i will be back to try 20 more flavors.
author: Oleya P.

description: LOVE IT!  their Kahlua Mocha Cream is my favorite! so delicious. only thing bad about this place is the parking and the wait for the ice cream!
author: Beck S.

description: i mean ... what??  chocolate-orange ice cream in a sugar cone, with a chocolate dip.  first of all, i have never seen chocolate dip-cones with regular ice cream, only at dairy queen, and second of all, i couldn't even call this regular ice cream, it was so amazingly good.  and as long as we're counting, thirdly, the staff at mitchell's were so great and didn't bat an eyelash when our large group with one number all bombarded the window and absolutely had to try a taste of every single flavor.  heavenly.
author: ali l.

description: it's better then Swensons, Fentons, and any other "sons....tons...ons...".  masarap
author: Jac T.

description: the ice cream is on par with store-bought lucerne ice cream.  i like mine more creamy.  4- or 5-star ice cream?  really?  they get an extra star for the more unique flavors.  i'd hit bi-rite or marco polo or the freezer isle at my local grocery store (more parking) before i'd hit this place....
author: Miss P.

description: I am craving this right now! I just bought ice cream and it was not satisfying because I want Mitchell's so badly. I don't think this place could make anything gross. This is the best ice cream I've ever had. I have to stop typing because I need to stop thinking about this place.
author: Aileen P.

description: My favorite place for ice cream!  So cheap and delicious!  Nothing beats my grasshopper!
author: Mrs. T.

description: Halo Halo....what more do I need to say? So worth the trip out to Noe Valley!
author: Joy Y.

description: I love it! And, we were not the only ones having an ice cream cone at 10 p.m. in 53 degree foggy weather. The line was crazy long but well worth the wait!!!
author: vernice l.

description: their pumpkin ice cream tastes just like really delicious pumpkin pie.  i also love the buko, or baby coconut.  little chunks of chewy bits in the ice cream add interesting texture way better than coconut flakes.  both flavors are not overly sweet, which i really like.  i'm looking forward to try the ube even though the bright purple color is a bit scary.
author: youssarian w.

description: The BEST ice cream, EVER, EVER, EVER!!!  My all time favorite is the mango ice cream.  The cantaloupe is soooo refreshing.  Try having the mango ice cream dipped in chocolate.  YUMMMMM... that crunchy shell...I  want some now.  Been coming here since I was little.  Have brought my own kids here too.  It's ALWAYS crowded and parking is bad, but I will wait.
author: Jere D.

description: i had it today and i loved it!!!! i ordered my usual which is Tropical 4 and its soooo good and refreshing. i also had cantaloupe which tasted so good, there was pieces of fresh catalopes in it. if i can eat this everyday and not gain weight i would! hehe...the only downside is the wait, it's often packed outside and the wait can take long, so be patient because the ice cream there is worth waiting for!
author: Ruchell F.

description: I almost had my baby here. I had a big meal, I craved for ice cream but it was too busy. I went home and went into labor. The price is reasonble, the ice cream is yummy, parking sucks.
author: Ravenous T.

description: they've remodelled! but the parking situation is unchanged. all good.
author: foodi e.

description: my rating is for one product and one product only: the Mexican chocolate ice cream. it's the only thing I've tried and it's absolutely delicious. if you love chocolate ice cream, you'll dig it.
author: leyla m.

description: Grasshopper Pie!!!!! Best ice cream in SF!
author: Monica t.

description: Wow to the baby cocunut ice cream.  Not sure what else is good because I get this every time I go.  It's your typical standing room only ice cream shop, not a parlor.  And expect long lines going out the door and sometimes around the corner.
author: Chris C.

description: holy shit. for the love of all things sacred try the ube. it needs to be in your life. now.
author: Lauren C.

description: Really good!!! always packed even in cold san francisco nights, and that explains enough!
author: Matthew R.

description: best ice cream in the city. better than polly anns in the  sunset. happy to wait in line (worse on the weekends) for my chocolate carmel crackle.
author: SF Native M.

description: yummmm ice cream! mitchell's is a great place to go, especially if you're craving some exotic flavor of ice cream such as ube or coconut pineapple, or macapuno, or mango, or other tropical fruit flavors.  i'd have to say though, i like the thrifty brand coconut pineapple better, which you can find at a Rite Aid.
author: Fran H.

description: I consider myself an ice cream whore and I have to say that I absolutely loved Michell's ice cream! I can't believe how packed it was when I first got there because it was freezing outside but after finishing my cone I completely understood.  A long wait but it's worth every second.
author: Sheetal S.

description: I've always loved this place since I was a kid. It's always packed and always as good as I expect it to be. The best!
author: Rachel P.

description: Nice selection of flavors, but for me, does not come cloes to Bi-Rite.  I prefer a smoother, creamier, richer flavor.
author: Cali G.

description: Chocolate caramel crunch, how I adore you! Being with walking distance of this place is a blessing and a curse. Make sure you get a number (right inside the door) as soon as you get there otherwise you will be waiting a while.
author: Alison R.

description: Been here many times and it is the best place for ice cream.  It has many different flavors from the boring to the exotic.   I'm isure its fattening  but we all haveto go sometimes and this is a good way.
author: kenny l.

description: So after our big Chinese dinner at R&G, we head over to Mitchell's for some dessert.  Being this is my first time and all... I was amazed with the crowd waiting outside for their lucky number to be called to order ice cream.  You figure the ice cream would be TO DIE FOR, if there is a wait in excess of 5-10 mins...  So we wait...and while waiting I stare at the menu at the all the flavors and ponder what to get...low & behold I see LYCHEE! I HEART LYCHEE!  So, we wait for lucky number 63 (at the time, they were only at 51), once our number was called (20 mins later), we asked for our flavor(s) of choice, and I wait in anticipation for my lychee ice cream.  My bf's cousin turns his head to me (with a little frown on his face) & tells me they are out of lychee... URRRRGGGGHHHH! ( minus a star for that)... so I decide to order the fresh cantalope.  Tasty, not bad, but not TO DIE FOR!  But I would go back, hopefully for the lychee, if they don't run out again...
author: Cathy P.

description: there were plenty of flavors to choose from.  the ones i chose tasted mediocre.  the thai ice tea tasted off.  i liked the jackfruit though.  the ube was tasty but the purple color was frightening.  the texture of the ice cream was weird, i found ice crystals sprinkled throughout.  i'm sticking with bi-rite.
author: Big e.

description: This is the real deal.  The best ice cream in the city.  I'm a huge fan of the toasted almond, grasshopper pie, and mexican chocolate flavors.  They also have some flavors of crazy exotic Filipino fruits that I've never heard of.  FYI, there's a free parking lot in back for customers.  Don't miss this place.
author: Molly C.

description: I scooped ice cream @ Mitchell's when I was a high school student :). This was my very first job!  This family-run SF tradition is not only a good place to work (owners are super nice)... they make the BEST ice cream. Forget about the commercial brands, if you want to experience REAL exotic fruit favor ice creams, Mitchell delivers the very BEST!  Since I used to work there, I can tell you they use REAL stuff to make their ice cream. It's been almost 20 years...I moved out of the city, but still go there for my ice cream cravings, so does my extended family... Mango is my family's favor!!!
author: Sophia X.

description: that chocolate caramel shit is the bomb man. and the halo halo is the shit.
author: otto p.

description: YUMMMMY!!! I can eat ice cream every day and night so I am very picky with my ice cream. I can not say enough about Mitchel's Ice Cream in Noe Valley. Always a line out the door first of all, but they are fairly quick with their service. Been around for years and it shows by all the awards on the walls. All this writing is making me want to go get some mint chocolate chip. Put this place on your must go to on a hot or cold day!
author: BOB M.

description: yes there is always a line, and yes that line is longer when the sun happens to poke through the fog. BUT, GO! the icecream is awesome. Love the mexican chocolate, get the browne sundae. Don't forget to grab a gallon when you order, just in case you anticipate sun and crave excellent icecream but don't have the tolerance to wait in line.
author: ELEANOR K.

description: Hands down the best ice cream I have ever tasted. Don't mind taking a long trip just to get this delicious treat! If you haven't been, you  must try....its worth a trip no matter where you live in the city!!!! Perfect for after spending the day at Dolores.
author: Diana D.

description: OMG, I waited way too long for ice cream on a warm night earlier this year.  The ice cream was fine, but not worth the wait.  I'd much prefer Swensen's in Russian Hill.
author: Brian L.

description: Hands down, the best ice cream I've ever had. My virgin experience overwhelmed me....ordered 2 scoops in a cup....rocky road and grasshopper pie....my husband, who had been before didn't tell me how gi-normous a scoop is....thank goodness the grasshopper scoop was on top because I couldn't finish the rocky road....felt guilty for throwing it away!  The grasshopper pie was orgasmic. Enough said.
author: EStar M.

description: Name the flavor, they have it.  Definitely one of the largest selection of flavors, from tropical fruits to traditional strawberry and neapolitan.  Parking is difficult, but overall the quality of ice cream is very good,
author: Alex K.

description: this is a great place to get great ice cream. too bad the workers don't know what they are doing. sloppy dipped with chocolate cones and watery milkshakes sometimes and the guys are not very friendly. icecream is getting soooo expensive these days!!!!!!!
author: RODGER B.

description: even when its raining, this place is packed!  take a number and now that you can see the actual ice cream, instead of just the flavors on a giant board,  the service goes faster!  i love the mocha almond fudge and pumpkin.  you can even get it dipped in chocolate!  =P
author: Rene V.

description: great ice cream, also got ice cream cakes and pies. can't wait to try that.if you are in the area have to check it out.
author: mike m.
